pthe preface sir iohan bourchier knyght lorde berners sythe hystorie haue preface vpon fyrst volume cronycles declared wytnesse tymes lyght trouthe lyfe remembrauce maistres lyfe ye messanger olde season wherof innumerable comodyties growen ne thynke labour myspente highe co maundement moost redoughted soueraygne lorde henry cyght kyng englande frauce highe defender christen faythe c haue e ployed aboute translacyon nowe foure volume sir iohan froissa frenche englysshe tong certainly nat bou tie cronycles conteyg warres party whiche warres sc yued frenche sir iohan froyssa ryght nately many haue great vnderstandynge dyuers tonges whome warres written plainly saye knyghtly feate manhode humanyte passe ryght moche warres farre countreis great pleasure thy noble countrey menne englande toke redynge ye worthy knightly dedes valyaunt auncestours encorageth halfe moche princely exhorte whiche erthely kynges worshyppe ou foresaid gracyous soueraygne gaue forthe manyfolde royall vertues highnesse foude nat two thre small realmes worthy reygne kyng ouer vnyuersall worlde elyteth nothyng sayd moost famous subict ou ought appere euery mannes ight ouer howe worthy people nowe lyaunt contende vigorous vertue manhode folowe yea passe maye truely ymages vsed olde tyme erecte worshyp remembraunce discended noble blode beare halfe wytnesse noble dedes sette hystorye done whiche well appereth wordes prudent kyng agesilaus dying comaunded neyther ymage picture resemblauce shulde made haue sayd noble thyng famously done shall beare wytnesse ynough haue nought done certainly ymages lytell aueylen saythe suche thynges inought made mynde dastardes neuer dyde worthy dede lyfe wherfore loue honour beare moost puissaunt soueraygne pleasure subie te bothe noble comons haue endeuored translate freche sayd englysshe four volume sir iohan froissart reduced twayne wherin haue erred praye shall defaute fynde cosyder greatnesse hystorie good wyll aske nothyng elles great labour curtesy amende nede shalbe yet doynge shall praye god finally sende blysse heuen amen pthus endeth preface sir iohan bourchier knight lord berners deputie calais traslatour present cronycle foloweth table chapter stande boke order c pherafter foloweth table present volume first howe syr iohan bourchyer gouernour gaunt durynge truse newe vitayled towne gaut howe maner people called comporselles dyd moche hurte countrey capitulo primo phowe ye bridge taylbourcke frenche men howe englisshmen fortyfied selfe agaynst comyng frenchman howe admyrall frauce rout aryued nborowe scotlande capi ii phowe frenche men found wylde countrey scotlade yuell content admyrall howe pacyfied fayre wordes howe fraunces atreman company nerehande taken ardenbourke flaunders cap iii phowe lorde saint albyne enguerante zendequyn saued ardenbourke fro takynge howe quene hungery sent ambassadours fraunce marry thetle valoyes eldest doughter cap iiii phowe duchesse brabant wrote duke frederyke bauyere maryage yonge frenche kyng nese isabell bauyer howe duke lady came quesnoy capi v phowe fraunces atreman toke towne dan howe frenche kynge wedded lady isabell bauyere wente layde siege dan fo vi phowe dyuers burgess sluse behe ded howe sluse chaunged lande bethune howe siege dan contynewed longe cap vii phowe gauntoyse fledde dan nyght howe frenche men toke towne destroyed also howe kynge dystroyed countrey foure craftes capi viii phowe frenche kynge departed oute flaunders gaue leaue men departe howe came parys treate ambassadours hungry howe marque blanqueforte toke streght wyfe lady cap ix phowe duke burbone toke bertuell poictou also great assemble kynge scottes made entre englande cap x phowe frenche men scottes castell vatley dystroyed dyuers townes northumberlande howe withdrewe agayne scotlande whan knewe kynge englande comynge great puyssaunce capi xi phowe syr iohan hollande slewe syr rycharde stafforde howe erle stafforde came kynge demaunde iustyce capi xii phowe kynge englande caused dystroyed churche mewreus scotlande howe barones scotlande aunswered admyrall fraunce deuysed leaue scotlande lette englysshe men alone cap xiii phowe kynge englande toke edenborowe chiefe tytle scotlande howe duke lancastre purpose retourne wale close frenche men scottes frenche men scottes dyd sayd countrey cap xiiii phowe erle oxenforde brake pursute kynge englande thought haue made wale frenchman scottes howe kyng retourned way came howe frenche men scottes determyned retourne againe scotlande cap xv phowe frenche lordes great paryll scotlande coude nat fynde meanes passe ouer thesee shewed erles duglas morette hardnesse founde countrey answere made cap xvi phowe admyrall enfourmed frenche kynge counsayle state scotlande howe duke burgoyne great desyre cause ye frenche kynge make iourney englande cap xvii phowe grace god two burgess gaunt entred ye duke bu goyne peace howe gaue charge therof knight flaunders answere duke gaue vnto ca xviii phowe two burgess assembled frendes acomply enterprise sent syr iohan delle letter peace cap ii phowe syr iohan delle came gaunt markette place roger iaques alderman eytie howe delyuered letter fro duke burgoyne howe gaunt sente turney confyrmacion peace charter made therof capi xx phowe sir iohan froissart auctour cronycle departed fraunce went erle foyzland maner voyage cap xxi phowe prince wale princesse came tarbe request yt countesse armynake mad prince princesse howe countrey gascoyne newly agayne warre cap xxii pof warres ye duke niou made agaynst englysshe men howe recouered castell maluoysyn bygore whiche afterwarde gyuen erle foize cap xxiii phowe garyson castell lourde caste downe discomfyted great dylygence yt erle foiz made ca xxiiii phowe peace made bytwene ye duke berrey erle foyz begynnynge warre bytwene erle foiz erle armynake ca xxv pof great vertuousnesse large erle foize maner pytuous dethe gascone erles sonne capi xxvi phowe syr peter byerne stronge dysease countesse bysquay wyfe cap xxvii pof great solepnyte erle foiz made fyest saynte nycholas tale stot manlyon shewed sir iohan fro rt cap xxviii phowe dyuers capytayns englysshe dyscomfyted towne saxere frenche men cap xxix phowe squyer called lymosyn tourned frenche howe caused loyes rambalt copany armes taken ca xxx pof state ordynauce erle foiz howe towne yran rebelled great traueyle dommage outrage done therto cap xxxi phowe kynge castyle left siege bone howe saynt prayne selfe cap xxxii p batayle kinge castyle kynge portugale cap xxxiii pof spanyardes howe ordred selfe batayle cap xxxiiii phowe frenche knyghtes gascons suche taken prisoner iuberoth portugaloyes slayne maysters none escaped cap xxxv phowe kynge castyle great batayle discomfyted kyng portugale vyllage called iuberothe capi xxxvi phowe spiryte called orthone serued lorde corasse longe tyme brought euer tidynges partes worlde cap xxxvii phowe siege layde breste bretayne howe dyuers englyssh es aboute countrey tholous recouered tourned frenche cap xxxviii phowe castelles conuall bygor nesuyll taken taken slayne hanged cap xx phowe kinge cypre slayn murthered bedde owne bro exortacyon corruptyon bountye hardynesse hym cap phowe kynge armony wa howe lxm turkes distroyed realme hungry ca phowe pope vrbane pope clement gret discorde togyder howe cristen kynges varyaunce lectyons warres bytwene cap xlii phowe portugale sent messangers englande shewe tydynges countrey kynge englande great lordes cap xliii phowe laurens fongase ambassadour fro kynge portugale englande shewed duke lancastre maner discorde bytwene realmes castyle portyngale cap xliiii phowe laurence fongase shewed duke lancastre maner batayle iuberothe bytwene kynges castyle portyngale cap xlv phowe ambassadours portyngale aunswere kynge englande great gyftes howe tooke leaue went countreys cap xlvi phowe duke lancastre assayled lordes knightes squyers bastydes brest bretayne howe defended selfe cap xlvii phowe duke lancastre hoost whasie soiourned moneth colongne departed rode towarde saynt iames galyce cap xlviii pof great apparell prouyson generally made realme fraunce kynge counsayle iourney made englande also deth fraunces atreman cap lii phowe kyng portyngale wrote amyably duke lancastre whan knewe arryued saynt iames galyce socours kynge castyle sent frauce howe towne ruelles galyce taken englysshe men cap liii phowe duke lacastres marshall men assayled towne vieclope galyce whiche yelded coposycion ambassadours duke sent kynge portyngale cap li phowe bayon yelded theym duke lancastre howe marshall hoost entred towne ke possessyon therof cap liii phowe duke lancastre duchesse helde saynte iames galyce comforte frenche knyghtes gaue kynge castyle cap lxii pof great apparell shyppes galeys frenche men made see passe englande cap liii phowe frenche kinge vncles arryued sluse flaunders cap liiii phowe frenche kynge taryed sluse great hoost entent entre englande cap lv phowe syr symon burle wolde haue counsayle saynt thomas caunterburyes shryne remoued ye castell douer wherby atchyued great hate cap lv phowe kynge armonye passed englande truste fynde meanes peace good appoyntment bytwene ye kynge englande frenche kyng cap lvi phowe kinge armony retourned englande aunswere made hym cap lvii phowe duke berrey departed fro parys come sluse howe constable fraunce toke see wynde contrary hym cap lviii phowe voyage englande broken reason wyndes wynter counsayle duke berrey ca lix phowe kynge charles fraunce frenche lordes returned yuell content fro sluse flaunders prouysyons made haue gone englande feest made london cap lx phowe squier called iaques le grise acused parlyament howse parys lordes present knyght called iohan carongne iudgement gyuen vpon howe iusted vttraunce paris place called saynt katheryne behynde temple howe iaques le grise confounded cap lxi phowe kyng aragon dyed howe archebysshoppe burdeaux set prisone barcelona cap lxi phow batayle armes done burdeaux seneschall dyuers cap lxii phowe iohan bretaygne sonne syr charles bloyes delyuered prison meanes syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce cap lxxii phowe duke burbone chosen go castyle dyuers howe syr iohan bucke admyrall flauders token prisoner englysshmen ca lxxii phowe englysshe men aryued brent dyuers village cap lxxiii phowe duke lacasters marshall toke towne rybadane whiche strongly kept cap xliii phowe duke lancastre sent admyrall marshall offycers come weddynge doughter kynge portyngale cap lxxiiii phowe duke lancastre men rode towardes cytie besances howe towne made composycion capi lxxv phowe duchesse doughter went se kynge portyngale quene howe towne basances submytted vnder obeysaunce duke lancastre cap lxxvi phowe basances ben sente kynge castyle came home towne rendred vp duke lancastre cap lxxvii phowe syr iohan hollande syr raynolde de roy fought togyder lystes duke lancastre towne besances cap lxxviii phowe kynge portyngale duke lancastre determyned entre realme castyle cap lxxix phowe syr wyllm lygnac sir gaultyer passac came ayde kynge iohan castyle cap lxxx phowe great myschiefe fell englande bytwene gentylmen comons accompte suche money reysed comons cap lxxxi pof great dyscordes englande breakynge vp frenche armye howe gouernours kynge constrayned comons good townes make acomptes suche money come handes season ruled cap lxxxii phowe constable frauce dyuers lordes knyghtes realme apparelled great prouysions go englande wyn townes castels cap lxxxiii phowe duke bretayne sent lordes kynghtes come counsayle vnto wannes counsayle desyred constable go se castell ermyne howe toke hym prisoner lorde beaumanoyre hym ca lxxxiii phowe constable frauce delyuered request lorde de la vale parenge certayne raunsome howe constable delyuered duke thre castelles towne payed hudred thousande frankes cap lxxxv phowe writinges made duke bretayns deuyse constable rendre towne castelles duke heyres euer delyuered duke cap lxxxvi phowe tydynges came frenche kynge fro partyes almayne whiche hym ryght displeasaunt vnto vncles cap lxxxvii phowe duke lacasters men assayled towne aurence toke gaue vp dyd cap lxxxviii phowe kynge portyngale brente towne whan departed fro porte besieged two castle cap lxxxix phowe kynge portyngale host came feroule assauted brought vnder obeysauce duke lancastre cap lxxxx phowe frenche ambassadours came duke bretayne vpon takyng constable fraunce answere made cap xci phowe kyng englandes vncles one acorde alyaunce agaynst kynge counsayle murmurynge people agaynst duke irelande aunswere londoner duke gloucestre cap xcii phowe day accompte came offycers appered presens kynges vncles comons englande howe syr symon burle prisoner towre lodon howe syr thomas tryuet dyed cap xciii phowe kyng englande departed fro london howe syr symon burle beheeded london nephewe also howe duke lancastre dyspleased cap xciiii phowe counsayle drewe togyder reformacyon kynge realme howe counsayle duke irelande kynge accorde make warre agaynst vncles agaynst cyties townes cap xcv phowe kynge englande made mon drawe towardes london howe syr roberte tryuylyen taken westmynster beheeded comaundement kynges vncles cap xcvi phowe tydynges came kynge dethe knyght demanunded counsayle theron howe ordayned duke irelande soueraygne menne warre capi xcvii phowe ye duke irelande sent thre kynghtes london knowe tydynges howe kynges vncles london went feldes fyght duke irelande affinyte cap xcviii phowe kynges vncles wan iourney agaynst duke irelande howe fledde dyuers company cap xcix phowe duke irelande company fled howe kynges vncles oxenforde howe syr nycholas bramble beheeded howe kynge sent bysshoppe cannterbury capi c phowe kynge vncles lordes englande sente come westmynster generall counsayle holden cap c phowe kynge portyngale puyssaunce assembled duke lancastre puissaunce howe coulde nat passe ryuer dierne howe squyer castyle shewed theym passage capi c ii phowe tydynges spred abrode kynge portyngale duke lancastre passed ryuer dierne howe came kynge castylles knowledge howe certayne englysshe knyghtes came tode vyle arpent howe kynge portugale duke lancastre determyned tary comynge duke burbon cap c iii phowe duke lancastre gaue lycence men howe haraulde sent kynge castyle howe thre knyghtes englande wente speake kynge castyle saue conducte duke men passe thoroughe countrey capi ciiii phowe three knyghtes optayned saue conducte kynge castyle people passe howe dyuers englysshe men dyed castyle howe duke lancastre fell great syckenesse capi cv phowe syr iohan hollande duke lancaster constable tooke leaue duke wyfe retourned kynge castyle made hym good chere howe syr iohan dambrity court went parys accomplysshe dede armes bytwene hym syr boucyquant cap c vi phowe duke burbone departed fro auignon go castyle hoost came burgus spaygne founde kynge castyle howe duke lancastre herde tydynge howe duke burbone departed fro kyng went streyght agayne fraunce capi c vii phowe erle foiz receyued honourably duke burbon great gyftes gaue hym howe syr willyam lygnac syr gaultyer passackes company departed spayne incydent fortuned towne saynte phagon capi c viii phowe kynge castyle counsayle yuell content syr willyam lygnac syr gaultier passackes company howe duke lancastre departed fro saynt iaques bayon cap c ix phowe erle armynake tooke great payne treate companyons departe realme fraunce cap c x phowe erle reynolde guerles layde landes guage wystenat came refuge archcbysshoppe coloygne vncle blamed hym howe ambassadours went berthaulte malygnes cap c xi phowe erle reynolde guerles maryed mary doughter berthalte malygnes whome hadde doughter maryed agayne englande hadde issue two sonnes doughter howe syr iohan bloyes wedded eldest doughter erle guerles howe countie guerles remayned erle guerles yongest doughter capi c xii phowe castelles gauleche buthe null came duke brabant howe duke iulyers sustayned lynfars countre robbed maner people great assemble duke brabante made go iulyers howe dyscomfyced cap c xiii phowe duke brabant dyed howe duke guillyam guerles treated duchesse brabante haue agayne thre castelles aunswere howe made alyaunce kynge englande cap c xiiii phowe duchesse brabante sent messangers frenche kynge complaynynge duke guerles howe kynge counsayle sore busyed incydentes fell realme fraunce well defyaunces guerles busynesse bretayne cap c xv phowe straunge fortune kynge nauer dyed cytie pampylona howe charles sonne crowned howe vanchadore besieged duke berrey howe duke burgoyne sente duchesse brabante cap c xvi phowe frenche men brent ryfled towne seaull retourned garyson ioye duke burgoyne duchesse brabant made dede howe syr iohan boesme launce dyscomfyted englysshe men capi c xvii phowe syr iohan boesme launce ledde prisoner mount ferante howe countrey gladde whan herde entreprise howe geronet company sette raunsome delyuered money perot bierne lent hym cap c xviii phowe geronet mandurat twelue company retourned mount ferant howe perot bernoys four hundred speares wente mount ferante wolde nat entre towne none way gate cap c xix phowe geronet lette perot le bernoys company towne mount ferant wherof countrey frayde howe kynge vncles beynge parys therwith sore dyspleased also erle dolphyn auuergne cap c xx phowe perotte le bernoys company tooke counsayle determyned nat kepe towne mount ferant howe sayd perot company departed then nyght withall pyllage prisoner wente refresshed towne ousac cap c xxi phowe towne cleremounte made skrimysshe pyllers taken robbed towne mout ferant gate towne cap c xxii phowe duke berrey marryed lady mary doughter erle bloyes sonne howe yere sonne duke berrey marryed lady mary fraunce suster yonge kynge charles fraunce cap c xxiii phowe departynge duke lancastre euer wonne galyce frenche men recouered lesse fyftene dayes howe englysshe men ben warre defamed spake yuell coutrey galyce howe frenche kynge sente duke irelande cap c xxiiii phowe constable fraunce wolde nat accorde kynge shulde goo almaygne bycause incydentes realme howe duke bretaygne fournysshed garysons made alyauce kynge englande kynge nauerre army made englysshe men cap c xxv phowe brabansoyes layde siege towne graue howe constable fraunce tooke saynt malo saynte mathewes sette men garysone howe duke lancastre bayon greatly dyscomfyted coulde get maner ayde cap c xxvi phowe duke berrey sente letter duke lancastre bayon howe duke sente copye letter foyze nauerre entent haue publysshed spayne howe duke bretaygne demaunded counsayle men busynesse capi c xxvii phowe duke bretayne delyuered vp thre castelles syr olyuer clyssons howe receyued ioyously lorde coucy company ambassadours fro frenche kynge howe duke lancastre made great chere syr helyon lignacke seneschall xaynton abmassadoure fro duke berrey cap c xxviii pnowe kynge castyle sente ambassadours duke lancastre treate maryage hadde bytwene sonne duke doughter howe request duke berrey truse made duke lancastre countreys tholousyn rouergne cap c xxix phowe duke berrey burgoyne departed go bloyes howe duke bretayne came thyder howe duke dyd moche hym parys maner agaynst wyll capi c xxx phowe lewes kynge cycyle entred parys estate royall howe duke bretayne entred nyght saint johan baptyst yere grace thousande thre hundred fourscore seuyn dede armes done kynge moutereau fault yon bytwene knyght englande called syr thomas harpyngham frenche knyght named syr johan de barres capi c xxxi phowe duke bretaygne entred parys came castell loure frenche kynge cap c xxxii phowe erle arundell beynge see moneth came hauen maraunt lytell fro rochell howe sent messanger perot le bernoys capytayns shulde kepe feldes capi c xxxiii phowe marroys rochelloys sore afrayde englysshe men lande howe rochell made ask rymysshe theym howe englysshe men pylled countrey maraunt drewe agayne see pyllage whiche great capi c xxxiiii phowe perot le bernoys companyons resorted agayne holdes great pyllage howe duke guerles coulde haue ayde englysshe men reyse siege graue howe brabansois made brige ouer ryuer meuse whiche guerles dyd breake bryn dystroy ye shall capi c xxxv phowe brabansoys passed ryuer towne rauesten ouer ye bridge entred guerles duke departed fro nymay thre hundred speares came agaynst dyscomfyted bytwene rauesten towne graue cap c xxxvi phowe duke guerles discomfyted brabansoys went agayne nymay howe tydynges came frenche kynge howe kynge sent ambassadours kynge almayne capi c xxxvii phowe frenche kynge gaue leaue duke bretaygne retourne countrey howe coutrey brabant wolde nat consent kynges passage army howe ambassadours fraunce spedde capi c xxxviii phowe erle bloys sent frenche kinge two hundred speares howe duke lorayne lorde henry bare came kynge howe duke julyers guerles knewe frenche kynge came capi c xxxix phowe syr hellyon lygnacke made reporte duke berrey howe lordes scotlande assembled toguyder cytie berdane determyned reyse vp armye entre englande englyssh squyer taken scottes knewe secretes bothe realmes englande scotlande capi c xl phowe kyng richarde yelded hym selfe erle derby go london cap fo ccc xi phowe erle duglas wan penon sir henry percy barryers vpon newe castell vpon tyne howe scottes brent castell pondlen howe syr henry percy syr rafe brother tooke aduyse folowe scottes conquere agayne penon lost skrymysshe capi c xli pof state quene isabell englande howe newe sone apoynted wayte vpon howe kynge richarde sette towre london capi cc xlii phowe sir henry percy brother good nombre men armes archer went scottes wyn agayne penon erle duglas newcastell vpotyne howe assayled scottes moutberke lodgynges cap c xlii phowe erle james duglas valyantnesse encoraged men reculed maner disconfited doynge wounded dethe capi c xliii phowe bataile sir rafe percy sore hurte taken prisoner scottiss knyght cap c xliiii phowe scottes wanne batayle agayust englysshe men besyde ottebridge taken prisoner sir hery sir rafe percy howe englisshe squier wolde nat yelde hym wolde scottysshe squyer slayne bothe howe bysshoppe durham co pany disconfyted amonge selfe capi c xiv phowe sir mathewe reedman deparred fro batayle saue hym selfe howe sir james lymsey taken prisoner ye bysshoppe durham howe batayle scurrers sent forthe discouer countrey cap c xlvi phowe scottes departed caryed erle duglas deed buryed hym abbey nimayes howe sir archambault duglas company departed fro carlyle retourned scotlande cap c xlvii phowe duke jullyers came excused hym selfe defyaunce son duke guerles made frenche kyng became subiette dyuers reates armes done bitwene fre che men almaygnes rencongne cap c xlviii phowe duke julyers archebysshop coloygne departed fro frenche kyng wente nimaye duke guerles howe meanes reconsyled brought peace frenche kynge duchesse brabant cap c xlix phowe erle arundell knyghtes englande beyng see fortune wynde came palyce besyde rochell whose beynge signifyed sir loyes xancere departyng erle arundell cap c l phowe admyrall fraunce ordayned frenche kynge counsayle ambassadour go kynge castile howe duke berrey sent erle foize treate maryage bytwene duke berrey erles doughter bolonge cap c li phowe geffray tete noyre dyde chose capitayne ouer company howe made testament dyed howe duke guerles departed fro countrey go pruce incydence fell hym lande duke stulpe taken prisoner disconfyted cap c lii phowe sir johan vyen dyde message kyng johan castyle fro frenkynge counsayle answer kynge castyle made hym capi c liii phowe sir loyes xancere went se erle foize orthays howe duke lacastre burdeux dedes armes done bytwene fyue frenche men fyue englysshe men howe duchesse lancastre went doughter castyle kyng john cap c liiii phowe duchesse lancastre departed fro kyng castyle wente mantuell bring father bone ciuyle howe frenche kyng sent ambassadours erle foize treate mariage duke berrey vncle therie boloyns doughter cap c lv phowe certaygne wyse men treated peace endure thre yere bytwene frau ce englande alyes aswell one parte lade see cap c lvi pof ordynaunce entre quene isabell towne paris ca c lvii phowe lorde castell morant therle saynt poule lefte behynde englande retourned fraunce charter truse sealed kynge richarde vncles endure thre yere see lande cap c lviii pthe maryage kynge loyes sonne duke aniou doughter kynge peter arragone howe went quene naples mother auignon se pope clement cap c lix phowe frenche kyng desyre go visyte ye farre partes realme howe went fyrste burgoyne auignone se pope clement cap clx phowe sir peter courtney cae frau ce armes sir guye tremoyle howe lorde clary conueyed hym occasyon dyde armes hym marchesse cali cap clxi phowe iustes saynt inguelyert otherwyse called sandyngfelde enterprised sir raynolde roye yonge sir bouciquaut lorde saynt pye capi c lxii pof complayntes made frenche kynge people languedocke towne besyers agaynst beusache treasourer duke berrey great extorcyons made contessyon cruell dethe hadde sayd towne cap clxiii phowe frenche kyng beynge tholous sent erle foize came thyder dyd homage kyng cou tie foize cap clxiiii pof feate couynaut done bytwene kynge duke thoutayne brother whiche shulde sonest come parys fro mountpellyer whiche hundred fyftie leages sonder eche one knight capi c lxv pof dethe pope vrbayne rome called antepape howe pope clement wrote frenche kyng vncles vnyuersite electyon pope bonyface cardynals rome capi c lxvi pof yeldynge vp takynge stronge castell vanchadore lymosyn olde parteyninge sir geffray teate noyre cap clxvii pof dedes armes saynt ingylbertes continewyng thyrtie dayes agaynst comer realme englande countreis euery manne thre course capi c lxviii pof enterprise voyage ye knyghtes fraunce englande duke burbone chiefe armye request genouoys go barbary besiege stronge towne affryke cap clxix pof capitayne robber pyller countre called aymergot marcell helde strong castell marchesse rouergne called roche vandoys howe besieged vicount meauix takyng therof howe aymergot taken brought parys capi c lxx phowe christen lordes geno y beyng ysle conymbres ancre departed then go lay siege strong cytie affryke barbary howe maynteyned siege cap clxxi phowe aduenture domage fell christen men reason assaute towne affryke many knyghtes squyers deed maynteygned selfe wiselyer dyde contynued siege longe season cap clxxii pof feest iustes made kyng englande london whyle christen knyghtes squyers siege towne affryke agaynst sarasyns howe feest publisshed dyuers countreis landes cap clxxiii phowe indydent ye siege reysed towne affryke occasyon howe euery man recourned owne countreis cap clxxiiii pof thenglyss knyghtes sente parys frenche kyng fro kyng englande vncles treate peace capi clxxv pof dethe kynge iohan castyle crownynge kynge henry sonne cap clxxvi pof army yonge erle iohan armynake voyege made lombardy howe dyed siege towne alexadre cap clxxvii phowe sir peter craon fell frenche kynges displeasure duke thourayns receyued duke bretayne cap clxxviii pof dethe yonge erle loyes chastellon sonne therle guye bloys cap clxxix pof sodayne dethe erle gascone foize howe erle chastellon cae enherytaunce cap clxxx phowe treatie peace renewed tower thourayne bytwene frenche kynge duke bretayne maryage doughter fraunce sonne bretayne iohan bretayne erle ponthieur doughter duke bretayne cap clxxxi phowe erle bloyes mary namure wyfe solde countie bloyes landes ye duke thourayn frenche kynges brother capi c lxxxii phowe sir roger spayne sir espaygne du lyon spedde frenche kynge counsayle vycount chastellons busynesse howe set possessyon countie foize money payde cap clxxxiii pof great assemble made amyence frenche kynge cou sayle kyng englandes vncles treatie peace cap clxxxiiii phowe sir peter craon throughe yuell wyll subtile crafte beate downe sir olyuer clysson wherwith kynge counsayle sore displeased cap clxxxv phowe great dilygence prouost parys pursued sir peter craon capi c lxxxvi pof great armye voyage frenche kyng purposed make bretayngne agaynst duke bycause susteyned sir peter craonne howe voyage kyng fell sicke wherby voyage brake cap clxxxvii phowe duke thourayne brother frenche kynge resigned duchy thouraynge kynges handes howe exchaunge kynge gaue hym duchy orlyauce euer called duke orlyaunce cap clxxxvii viii fo ccxxxiii phowe duke burgoyn berrey vncles frenche kynge gouernaunce realme howe chased toke suche gouerned kyng b fore cap clxxxix phowe sir olyuer clysson constable fraunce departed parys answere duke burgoyne made hym went mount le henry then bretayne cap cxc phowe treatise whiche accorded bytwene englande fraunce thre yeres renewed cap cxci pof aduenture daunce made parys lykenesse wodhouses wherin frenche kynge paryll dethe cap cxcii phowe pope bonyface cardynals rome sente frere wyse clerke frenche kyng cap cxciii phowe mariage treased ye lorde philyppe arthoyes erle ewel lady mary berrey wydowe doughter duke berrey howe admytted costable fraunce cap cxciiii pof forme peace made bytwene frenche kyng kyng englade meanes four duke vncles bothe kynges cap cxcv pof dethe pope clemet au gnon electyon pope benedic capi cxcvi pof clerke named maister iohan warennes cap cxcvii phowe kyng englande gaue duke lancastre heyres euer duchy acquitayner howe kynge prepared go irelande duke acouitayne cap cxcviii pof dethe quene anne englande wyfe kynge richarde doughter ye kynge boesme emperour almayne cap cxcix phowe sir iohn froissart arryued englande gyfte boke gaue kyng capi cc pof refuce acquitayne made duke lancastre howe sente englade kynge cou sayle shewyng hym wyll hole cou trey aequitayne cap cci pthe deuyse conquest kynge richarde made irelande howe brought obeysaunce foure kynges countray cap ccii pof ambassade kynge englande sent frauce treate ryage bytwene lady isabell frenche kynges eldest doughter hym selfe louynge aunswere hadde cap cciii pof souper named robert howe sent treaty peace holden balyngham howe sente englande kynge rycharde vncles cap cciiii pof delyueraunce lorde de la riuer sir iohn le mercier howe putte prisone capi ccv pof peace bytwene duke bretaynge syr olyuer clysson cap ccvi phowe kynge hungery worte frenche kynge state great turke howe iohan burgoyne eldest sonne duke burgoyne chiefe heed armye went thyder fo cclxiii phowe erle ostrenaunt enterprised go fryse cap ccvii pof iudgement made parlyament quene naples agaynste sir peter craon cap ccix pof conclusyon maryage taken parys bytwene kynge englande isabell eldest doughter frenche kynge howe duke lancastre remaryed cap ccx phowe great turke desyred soudan many kynges sarasyns ayde hym men warre resyst agaynst christen men howe many valyaunt sarasyns came hym farre countreis cap ccxi phowe lorde eoucy lordes christen men xv hundred speares disconfyted fyue thousande turkes durynge siege nicopoly cap ccxii phowe peace bytwene englande fraunce contynewed maryage kyng englande doughter fraunce cap ccxiii phowe erle heynaulte erle ostrenaunt sonne made great armye men armes knightes squyets go fryse cap ccxiiii pof armye frenche kyng sent fryse ayde cosyns lorde valeran erle saynt poule lorde charles de la brethe capitayns cap ccxv phowe maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce ordred howe frenche kyng delyuered doughter kynge englande tent bytwene arde calais cap ccxvi phowe siege nicopoly turkey reysed lamorabaquy frenche men discofyted howe hungaryons fledde cap ccxvii pof pouertie misery christen knightes fraunce nacions endured comynge home countreis cap ccxviii phowe trewe tidynges batayle turkey knowen frenche kynges house cap ccxix phowe duchesse orlyaunce doughter duke myllayne hadde suspecte frenche kynges syckenesse capi ccxx phowe duke burgoyn duches wyfe tooke great dilygence fynde meanes redeme prisone erle neuers nne prisoner beyng turkey cap ccxxi phowe duke gloucestre subtelly sought meanes howe distroy kynge richarde englande nephewe cap ccxxii phowe duke gloucestre taken erle marshall comaundement kynge cap ccxxiii phowe lordes frauce retourned see venyce ysles founde waye capi ccxxiiii phowe retourne lordes fraunce frenche kynge entended myght sette concorde peace churche cap ccxxv pof dethe ye duke gloucestre erle arundell howe kynges vncles londoner tooke mater cap ccxxvi pof great armye made cytie reynes well emperoure realme fraunce state holy churche cap ccxxvii phowe erle marshall englande apealed guage vttraunce therle derby sonne duke lancastre presence kynge counsayle cap ccxxviii phowe kyng richarde gaue sentece wherby banysshed englande erle derby forten yere therle marshall euer cap ccxxix phowe erle derby departed fro lo go fraunce erle marshall went flauders lombardy cap ccxxx phowe lorde guyllyam erle ostrenaunt sent cosyn erle derby certayne messangers howe erle came parys howe receyued capi ccxxxi phowe treatie reynes bytwene frenche kynge kyng almaygne concernyng vnyte ye churche folowed howe bysshoppe cambrey sent sayd kynges rome auignon wrote selfe pope thentent shuld depose themselfe fro papalytees submytte order two kynges cap ccxxxii phowe freche kyng assembled prelate noble realme vnyuersyte parys take counsayle howe shulde order pope benedic auignon cap ccxxxiii pof answere duke lancastre knight sent hym fro sonne therle derby howe duke lancastre dyed capi ccxxxiiii phowe dethe duke lancastre knowen fraunce kynge englande wrote maner ioye frenche kynge therof wrote nothyng therof therle derby duke son capi ccxxxv pof treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berreys doughter howe kyng richarde englande dyde lette erle salisbury cap ccxxxvi phowe kynge richarde ordayned go marchesse irelande cap ccxxxvii phowe archebysshoppe caunterbury sente fraunce therle derby fro londoner counsayls englande haue hym retourne englande cap ccxxxviii phowe erle derby toke leaue frenche kyng went cosyn duke bretayne cap ccxxxix phowe erle derby arryued englande howe receyued ye lo doners capi ccxl phowe tidynges cae kynges rycharde comyng therle derby great puissaunce capi ccxli phowe kyng richarde englande resined crowne realme handes erle derby duke lancastre cap ccxliiii pof coronacyon kynge henry duke lancastre consent realme maner feest cap ccxlv phowe newes takyng kyng rycharde knowen fraunce commynge thyder lady coucy howe frenche kynge displeased cap ccxlvi phowe frenche kyng reysed vp armye sende vpon tronters englade cap ccxlviii pof dethe kynge richarde englande howe reuse bytwene englande fraunce renewed also deposycion pope benedic auignon cap ccxlix pfinis phowe sir iohn bourchier gouernour gaunt truse newe vitayled towne gaunt howe maner people called comporsels dyde moche hurte countre capitulo primo sir iohn bourchier ye gouernyng gaut vnder kynge rycharde englande capiteyns comontie towne peter de boyes fra ce atreman peterle myttre prouyded surely warre duryng truse greatly vitayled refresshed towne prouision parteyning warre also castell gauure place vnder rule season copany rutters gadered togyder wode respayle fortifyed house coude nat lightly wonne people chased alos grantmount place flauders lost euer wyst nat lyue robbyng pillyng wheresoeuer coude gete spekynge pygges respayle woode bytwene reguays grauntmount anghien lysen dyde moche hurt lordship athe lande floberge lyssues lande danghien pyllers borne gaunt vnder coloure dyde moche hurt robbynge sleynge wolde go heynalte take men woman beddes leade forteresse raunsome pleasure made warre euery man capitayne athe called baudrius dela mocte layde often tymes awayte coude neuer trappe knewe many shyftes feared froters heynalte brabant none durst go waye countre duke burgoyne parte war loked garnysshed prouided townes fla ders capitayne bruges lorde guystelles courtrey sir iohan ieumount sir willyam namure sir willm guystels lorde dan courtray sir iohan ieumount sir peter neyper lykewise townes fronter fraunce men warre set duke burgoyne towne ardenbourcke garyson sir guy pontaillyer marshall burgoyn sir ryflarte flaunders sir iohan ieumont sir henry coynge lorde montigny ostrenant lorde longueuall sir iohan barnet sir peter baylleull philpot gany raoleyn dela foley dyuers men armes two hundred toke aduyse toguyder wyll ryde foure craftes distroy countre moche vitayle came fro then gau day departed toke way day frenche men rydden forthe rydden forthe gaunt two thousande men mete warre frauces arreman capitayne sodainly mette frenchman village whan eche knewe sawe well shuld haue batayle frenchman valiantly set fote erthe approched ennemyes gauntoyse lykewise set beganne shole fight eche suche place gauntoyse coude nat passe aduautage sore batayle many feates armes done bothe partes dyuers caste grounde sir riflart flaunders good knight dyd valiantly knightes squyers fought valiantly gau toyse behoued raunsome finally gauntoyse suche nombre obteyned place frenchman constrayned lepe horse el lost gauntoyse surmounted slayne sir iohn varlet sir peter bailleule bell forrier philyppe gancy raolen dela foley dyuers whiche great domage fayne flye entre ardcbourcke el ben deed without recouerie aduenture vycount meaulx sent garyson ardenbourcke certayne nombre men armes newly repayred towne hym hudred soeares good men armes sir iohan ieumont great baylye flaunders ben two yere greatly douted countre flaunders bycause valyantnesse whan might get gauntoyse went raunsome outher putte dethe el cutte handes fete putte oute eyen sende home gyue ensa ple gauntoyse renoumed flaunders iustyce without pytie correctyng gauntoyse spekyng flaunders hym thus euery realme worlde trouble well bitwene frauce englande castell portyngale warre newly renewed lady auiowe wrote selfe quene af naples hierusalem come iuygnon pope kepte house son loyes called kynge cecyle whiche father hadde conquered quenes entencyon make warre prouence without countre wolde take lady become vnder obeysauce sir bernarde de la salle entred pronence made warre quarell season ye lorde coucy also auygnon layen xv wekes bedde hurte hadde legge rennyng horse whan hole oftentymes dyde vyset quene recoforted whiche coulde rightwell quene taryed therefor abyde duke berrey also comynge auignon speke pope ayde suster quene frenche kyng vncles hadde sente prouence sir loyes sanxere marshall fraunce fyue hudred men armes warre cou tre without wolde come obeysaunce vnder quene submytted themselfe nat howe cytie marcell grettest parte countre yelded quene cytie ayes prouence tarraston dyuers knyghtes countre wolde nat yelde quene sayeng howe ryght demaunde countie prouence tyll peasably receyued lady sonne kynge pulle calabre naples cecile whan hath possession prouece shall obeye reason requyreth matchesse made warre erle sir charles dela pa e erle conuersaunt sir iohan luzenbourge sonne quene auignon chefe counsayle sir iohan baylleule season fell lombardye marueylous insydence moche spoken throughe worlde erle vertu called sir galea brother sir barnabo grettest lombardy raygned longe gouerned lobardy lyke two bretherne one ruled nyne cyties otehr tenne cyte millayne gouerned one yet one thother yere whan sir galea dyed left behynde hym sonne erle vertu named like father sir galea swaged loue bitwene sir barnabo vncle sir galea doughted hym sir barnabo vncle leest wolde take away lades fro lyke dyde fro father vncle olde tyme toke awaye lande fro brother sir mauffe caused dye thus therle vertu douted hym greatly vncle howe wrought subtelly bringe hym selfe insuretie shall shewe howe sir barnabo vsage suche landes rule raunsomed greuously wolde taxe men two thre tymes yere paye halfe thirde parte goodes none durst saye agaynst hym feare sir galea erle vertu dyde otherwyse entent gete loue toke none ayde men lyued onely reuenewes rule kept fyue yere dethe father loue lombardy euery man said wolde gladde lyue vnder hym euery man spake yuell ser barnabo priuely durst bycause toke excessyuely finally erle vertu thought execute entent doughted greatly vncle sayde sawe lykelyhode day sente secretely suche trusted best shewed entent nat feare purpose shulde knowen fortuned sir barnabo daye rode forthe fro one castell another sporte hym erle vertu nephewe knewe therof layde hym thre busshemeutes entent vncle shulde nat scape must nedes least passe one erle comauded take hym nat slee without made great defece sir barnabo roode forthe thought none yuell feare nephewe fell daunger one busshmentes whiche opyned approched hym speres couched rest sir barnabo hym squyer almaygne came hym sayd sir saue selfe yonder company maketh yuell countenaunce agaynst parteyning youre nephewe sir galea sir barnabo aunswered knowe nat howe saue selfe owe yuell wyll haue done trespasse nephue wherby ought flye awaye alwayes busshement drewe nerer nerer streight vpon hym knight almaygne sir barnabo whan sawe company approche towarde maister sir barnabos swerde hade drewe oute sheth tooke maister sayd sir defende selfe knight drewe owne swerde lyke valyant man stande defence aueyled hym thyng incotynent enuyroned mayster also ennemyes sayd knight slayne bycause putte hym selfe defence wherof sir galea afterwarde ryght sore displeased sir barnabo taken made defence none men brought castell whe nephue gladde comynge day ser barnabos wyfe chyldren taken mary kepte myllayne prison sir galea toke seignories townes castels parteyned sir barnabo lombardy possessyon vncle dyed nat saye howe thynke lette blode necke accordynge blode lettyng lombardy whan wyll auauce mannes ende anone tidynges sprang abrode glad therof sorte sir barnabo hadde done tyme many cruell horryble dedes pytuous iustyce withoute reason fewe people complayned trouble sayde hadde well deserued thus ended sir barnabo dayes raygned puissauntly lombardy pnowe lette v retourne duke burbons erle marchesse army dyde poictou lymosyn depted fro moleyns burbonoyse rode forthe great reuell duke company nephewe iohan harcourte specyall nombre army came berry auuergne poictou rouergue xaynton lymosyn met togider nyorte xii leages fro poicters meane season sir wyllm lynacke right valyant knyght seneschall xaynton gouernoure myllayne marchesse came angoulinoys certayne nombre men armes two hundred rested castell egle whiche englishemen wynter somer past greatly domaged countre sir wyllyam lyghted fote dyd copany valyantly assayled castell sore assaute well contynued within defeded selfe feare lyues sir wylliam hym selfe day dyde right nobly gaue ensample howe men shulde assayle withoute sparynge assaut well contynued castell taken byforce frenche men entred ladder within slayne taken thus sir wylliam lygnac dyde first enterprise season abydinge duke burbone route whan duke burbone come nyorte company founde great nombre men warre abydinge hym redy cosyn erle marche great bre also vycount tonnere sir henry thouars seneschall lymosyn lorde pons lorde parteney lorde thouars lorde puyssaunce dyuers baron poytou xaynton sir william lignacke came duke newly wonne castell egle wherfore duke gaue hym great thankes whan men warre assembled toguyder seuyn hundred speares besyde geneuoys varlettes nombre two thousande fightynge men thasie toke aduyse whyder shulde go outher vertuell taylboure mountlewe thynges consydered determyned go mountlewe cause castell standyng laundes burdeaur thought might get castell shulde easyer wynne also shulde man come burdeaur without knowledge rode thyderwarde passed angolesme came mountlewe layd siege chefe leader duke hoost sir iames pounsarte iohan bonne launce incontynent made redy assyle castell enuyroned castell aboute gaue assaulte great courage within defended selfe valiantly surely harde assaute well contynued many proper dede armes done frenchman dilygently mou ted vp ladder fought dagger hande hande walles moche dyde frenche men pure assaute wan castell within slayne fewe saued whan fre men possession moutlewe new lye furuysshed men warre prouisyon toke waye tayl bourcke whiche forteresse dynaudon perat capitayne proper man armes made lytell counte frenchman whyle duke laye siege castell company wanne two lytell fortress whiche sore harryed fronters poictou lymosyn reason englyss men two fortress called troucet archat within slayne castelles delyuered countre dyde beate downe grounde phowe bridge taylbourcke wonne frenche men howe englysshe men fortifyed themselfe comyng frenche men howe admyrall fraunce rout arryued edenborowe scotlande cap secundo thus siege layd tailbourcke four bastedes tail bourcke bridge ryuer charent englysshe men gascoyns well fortifyed season coude shyppe passe rochell xaynton without dauger truage frenche lordes aduysed wynne bridge haue lesse lye surer bastydes caused come rochellshippes ryuer charent theym certayne geneuoys crosbowes made scrymysshe bridge sore assaute englysshe men gascons ryght well fortifyed bridge valyantly dyde defende theselfe assayled lande ryuer piohan sonne erle harcourt made knight reysed baner duke burbone vncle made knight assault well cotinued many feate armes done geneuoys crosbowes shyppes shotte rudely hole toguyder bridge none durste scantely shewe defence shulde make longe tale force assault bridge ryuer wonne foude theron slayne drowned none scaped thus french men bridge taylbourc siege easyer thre leages fro faynt iohns dangle two leages fro xauntes best countre worlde losse tayllebourke within dynaudon sore dismayed good cause lost therby passage ryuer howe yet wolde nat yelde thought theselfe stronge place trusted rescue fro burdeaux shewed fronters englysshe forteresses duke lancastre elles erle buckyngham two thousande men armes four thousande archer shulde come burdeaux fyght frenche men reyse siege greatly trusted fortuned otherwyse shall shewe ordayned englande duke lancastre sit iohan hollande brother kynge sir thomas percy six thomas tryuet lorde fitz water six wylliam wyndesore sit iohn fitzwaren baron knightes squyers thousande speares thre thousande archer shulde haue gone burdeaux haue ben somer haue refresshed mortayne boutuyll fortress gascoyne la guedocke fight frenche men founde countrey taryed season haue gone fro then castell bayon nauarre treatie kyng nauer ymagined englade tourned nought whan knewe certaynte admyrall frau ce thousande speares chosen knightes squyers come scotlande chaunged purpose durst sende none men oute realme doughted greatly dedes frenche men scottes ioyned toguyder also tyme ranne voyce englande howe shulde somer assayled frenchman thre te one bretaygne duke become frenche another normandye whiche sayd constable fra ce made prouisyon harflewe depe longe scesyde saynt valeries crotoy thirde scottes dought wolde suffre knightes squyers go englande made prouisyon defende hauyns porte see season erle arundell richarde admyrall see see thre fourescore great shyppes furnysshed men armes archer hadde small shippes ranne oute viewed boundes yles normandy knowe tidynges pnowe lette v leaue speke duke burbone siege tayllebourcke laye nyne wekes let v shewe howe admyrall frauce toke lande realme scotlande chere made firste lodgynge frenche army went scotlande wynde wyll monethe maye whan water peaseable meke ayre softe swete first costed fladers holande zelande frise last aproched sight scotlande aryued fell harde aduenture yonge knyght fraunce proper man armes called sir aubert dagyers knyght yong haute courage shewe strength lyghtnesse body lepte vp clene armed walle shyppe lightynge fete slypped fell ouer borde see coulde nat holpen incotynent sanke downe bycause ye weight harnes also ship sayled euer forthe knightes aduenture barownes knyghtes sore dyspleased remedy longe sayled arryued edenborowe chiefe towne scotlande whe kyng tyme peace moost comenly laye soone erle duglas erle morette knewe comynge wente hauyn mette receyued swetely sayeng howe right welcome countrey baron scotlande knewe ryght well sir geffray de charney somer two monethes company sir geffray acquaynted admyrall knyghtes fraunce tyme kynge scottes nat wylde scottysshe shewed knight howe kyng wolde shortly wherwith well content lodged vyllages edenborough thoughe kynge kepte chefe resydence parys scotlade yet nat lyke tourney valencenes towne nat foure thousande house therfore behoued lordes knyghtes lodged vyllages donfer lyne castell dobare aluest suche anone tidynges sprange scotlande great nombre men armes frau ce come countre therat dyde murmure grudge sayde deuyll hath sente theym nat maynteyne warre englande well ynoughe withoute helpe shall good longe v let shewed vnto may retourne agayne stronge ynough scotlande maynteyne warre without theym therfore wyll none company vnderstande nat v therfore nat speke toguyder wyll anone ryffle eate vp euer haue countrey shall doo v dispytes domages thoughe englysshe men shulde fyght v thoughe englysshe men brinne house care lytell therfore shall make agayne chepe ynough axe thre dayes make agayne maye geate foure fyue stake bowes couer phowe frenche men founde wylde countrey scotlande yuell content thadmyrall howe pacifyed fayre wordes howe fraunces atreman company nere hande taken ardenbourcke flauders cap iii thus scottes sayde scotlande comynge frenchman thyder dyde sette nothynge hated courage diframed theym language moche myght lyke rude people without hououre thynges consydered great armye many noble men come scotlande knewe reason twentie thrittie knyghtes fraunce better nombre fyue hudred thousande cause pin scotlande ye shall fynde man light lye honoure gentylnesse lyke wylde sauage people wyll man acquaynted greatly enuyous honoure profyte man dought euer lese haue poore countre whan englysshe men maketh roode voyage cou trey haue done often tyme thynke lyue muste cause prouysion vitayle folowe theym backe shall fynde nothyng cou trey moche payne shall fynde none yron showe horse leddar make harnesse sadelles bridelles suche thynges cometh redy made oute flaunders whan prouisyon fayleth none gette countrey whan barownes knightes fraunce wonte fynde fayre hostryes halle hanged goodly castelles softe beddes reste sawe selfe necessite began smyle said admyrall sir pleasure hath brought v hyder neuer knewe pouertie ment tyll nowe fynde nowe olde sayeng father mother true whane wolde saye go waye ye lyue long ye shall fynde harde poore beddes whiche nowe fynde therfore lette v go oure voyage come lette v ryde engla de longe taryenge scotlande v nother honourable profytable admyrall apeased well myght sayde sir behoueth v suffre lytell speke fayre sithe daunger haue great longe waye yet passe englande nat retourne therfore lette v take gree fynde nat alwayes parys dygeon beautie chalous behoueth wyll lyue worlde thynkynge haue honoure suffre somtyme well pouertie welth thus sir iohan vien admyrall fraunce apeased companyons wordes suche whiche nat reherce acquaynted mothe might barownes scotlande visyted lytell haue sayde lytell honour people yuell aquaynted withall moost company frenche men erle duglas erle morette two lordes dyde theym solace resydue scotlande yet another thyng right harde frenchman whan scotlande wolde ryde foude horse dere nat worthe tenne florens coude nat bye vnder threscore hudred yet moche payne gette money yet whan horse hadde nother harnesse sadell bridell without brought flau ders trouble daunger frenchemen yea moreouer whane varlettes went forthe forragynge hadde charged horse suche coulde gette retouruynge home scottes selfe laye wayte theym taken well beten slayne none durste go forragynge feare slayne moneth frenche men loste varlettes mo hundred went forthe thre foure toguyder neuer returned agayne thus frenche men handeled besyde kynge scottes desyred comeforthe lordes knightes squyers realme aunswered sayd howe wolde make warre englande tyme sayd thentent frenche men shulde paye well comyng kyng wolde come wylde scottysshe edenboroughe demau ded haue great somme money hym people admyrall frau ce sayne promyse seale kynge shulde haue certayne somme money company auoyded realme nat done thus shulde haue hadde none ayde scottes fayne make marchaundise elles worse yet whan made best accorde oyntment coude make theym hadde lytell profyte helpe ye shall hystorie pbut nowe lytell wyll retourne tell aduentures flaunders maryage yonge frenche kyng howe ardenbourcke hadde nere taken stelthe vycont meaulx sir iohn ieumont laye garyson disconfyture sir ryflarte flaunders made lande foure craftes gaunt came arde bourcke thyder sente garyson sir robert bethune vycout meaulx foude sir iohan iumont company thyder sente xl speares knightes squiers suche desyred seke aduentures whane vycount come thider entended fortify repayre towne poyntes fraunces atreman gaunte subtelly ymagyned night day howe might anoye domage enemyes shewed rightwell neighbour warp teremode ardenbourcke bruges danne scluse euer ymagined howe wynne crafte say trouth suche copany mete execute suche dedes fortuned ende maye frauces atreman seuyn thousande hym departed fro gaunt thentent wynne ardenbourke stelth knight squyers therin specially desyred haue capitayne sir iohan iumont bycause done many great domages takyng sleyng puttyng cyen cuttyng handes fete eares men thus wednisdaye aboute dawnynge day came arde bourcke scalynge leddars redy vycounte meaulx sir iohan iumount sir ryflarte flaunders lorde damert sir tercelette montigny sir parducas pount saint marke lorde langueuall sir iohan sonne sir hewe desnell lorde de lalayne sir reynolde lomye dyuers lay slepyng beddes trust watche nowe beholde adueture watche watched nyght departed reliefe nat come season fraunces atreman gautoise ladder redy come dike cae walles dressed vp ladder began mount season adueture walkynge within wall lorde saynt albyne hym squyer picardy named enguerant zedequyn picarde morespike thynke ben watche night nat departed say trouthe nat ben ardenbourcke taken knightes beddes phowe lorde saynt albyne enouerant zendequyn saued ardenbourke fro takyng quene hungry sente ambassadours fraunce mary therle voloyes eldest doughter capi iiii whan sir gousseaux saynt martyne enguerant zendequen sawe howe gauntoyse mounted vp walles ladder saw wher ther one puttynge legge ouer wall haue entred towne tha sore abasshed yet nat moche toke conforte selfe sawe well fledde towne lost without recouery parceyued well theyr entryng bytwene departyng watche comynge reliefe enguerant sayd more pyke seppe forwarde beholde yonder gauntoyse entrynge helpe defende v elles towne loste thre went place sawe gauntoyse entrynge pycarde more pyke strake hym entrynge ouer wall suche stroke hare hym clene fro wall ladder fell downe dyke therwith watche arose sawe howe dyke aboute great batayle gauntoyse thane sowned trumpette treason treason therwith towne styrred euery man oute beddes harkened crye sawe howe gaunte wolde haue stollen towne armed fast might howe gauntoyse dyde best haue entred towne sayde thre persones valyantly defended walles space halfe hour agaynst comer whiche turned great prayse thane lordes knightes came thyder good array vycount meaulx bauer hym sir iohan ieumont penon hym sir ryflarte flaunders founde knight squyer more pyke fightynge defendynge walles thane cryed cryes rescue whan fraunces atreman gauntoyse parceyued matter howe hadde fayled entente withdrewe themselfe fayre casely reculed people departed retourned rule four craftes garyson ardenbourke toke hede kepyng towne dyde honoured greatly among foresaid thre persones nat towne ben loste throtes cutte ye haue herde howe duke aniou called hym selfe kynge naples cecyle hierusalem made warre thre yeres pule calabre naples agaynst sir charles dela paix makynge warre dyed lykewise dyde sir charles dela paix sayd slayne realme hungry consentment quene dethe kyng hungry bycause sir charles sonne kynges brother therfore maynteyned realme shulde fall hym vncle kynge hungry dethe lefte behynde hym doughters therfore quene feared leest wolde disheryte doughters therfore sayd caused sir charles dela paix slayne whose dethe ther great marueyle therby quene sore enforsed yonge sonne kyng beyng auignon made wary prouence kynge hungry lyuenge baron prelate hungry cousayled hym gyue margarete eldest doughter whiche likely great enheritour loyes fraunce erle valoyes sonne brother frenche kynge bycause thought shulde abyde among hu gry whan kynge deed sent ambassadours fraunce kynge vncles shewyng howe quene hungry wolde haue eldest doughter erle valoyes request semed kynge vncles baron fraunce right noble profitable excepte one thynge thought therby erle valoyes shulde farre fro owne nacion howe thynges consydred thought noble right profitable thyng erle valoyes kyng hungry whiche one grettest realmes crystendome ambassadours gretly feested nobly receyued gyuen many great gyftes agayne went hugry ambass frau ce bysshop maylleret sir iohn la parson curacyon generall whan come hugry wedded name erle valoyes lady margarete thanne bysshoppe retourned frauce also sir iohan parson wedded lady lyen bedde curtesly accordynge custome suche matter requyred whan came fraunce shewed letter patentes publyke instrumentes frauce well content longe erle valoys wrote hymselfe kyng hungry also ye haue herde duke burgoyne duke aubert bauier lorde heynalte hollande zelande frise maryed chyldren cambray toguyder maryage frenche kyng great tryumphe sayde howe tyme frenche kynge vncles duke burgoyne duke burbone duke aubert cambray lady burgoyne lady brabant lady heynalte howe procurement duchesse brabante secretely treatie maryage moued bytwene yonge kyng charles frau ce lady isabell doughter duke stephyn bauyer kyng charles fraunce laste dyed dethe bedde ordayned charles sonne shulde maryed almaygne sawe place co uenyent wherby almayns shulde alyed frauce sawe well howe kyng englande maryed kyng almaynes suster wherby spedde moche better duchesse brabant ryght sore ymaginatyue lady shewed many reason kynges vncles counsayle sayenge howe lady doughter great lorde almaygne greattest bauyers howe thereby shulde haue great alyaunce almaygne duke stephyn sayde great manne myght well breke purpose great lordes thempyre great greatter kynge almaygne whiche enclyned sonest counsayle frau ce parceyuer mater howe matter handeled right secretely fewe knewe therof tyll doone cause vsage fraunce lady doughter great lorde yf kynge shulde mary firste shulde sene viewed naked certayne ladyes therto admytted knowe proper mete brynge forthe chyldren also bycause lady farre countre shulde pleasaunt kyng nat elles broken cause matter kepte secrete lady feest penthecost brought brabant duchesse ioyfully receyued ordered accordynge vsage fraunce company duke frederyke bauyer vncle saye trouthe maryage firste procured suche wayes shall shewe phowe duchesse brabaunt wrote duke frederyke bauyer maryage yonge frenche kynge nese isabell bauyer howe duke lady came quesnoy cap v whan duke frederyke bauier cae first fra ce serue freche kyng iourney made flaunders came siege boutbourcke true feested receyued kynges vncles bycause come farre serue kynge coutre bauyer whiche two hundred leages reputed great seruyce alwayes loged nere kyng token good loue fauour whan departed bauyer thought surly shulde batayle bytwene frenche kyng kyng englande marchesse flauders frau ce ranne brute almaygne therfore kynge vncles gaue hym thanke thus kyng voyage burbourke bergues king vncles curtesly demauded day hym doughters mary sayeng howe lacked wyfe kyng howe rather kynge shulde mary bauyer rather thane place aunciently buyer counsayle fraunce duke aunswered sayd surely haue doughter mary myne elder brother duke stephyn bauyer hath right fayre lady doughter age quod lordes bytwene xiii fourtene quod duke desyre quod kynges vncles therfore sir whan ye retourne home bauyer speke brother mater bring nese pylgrimage saynt iohns amyence kyng shalbe please hym drynke wyll desyre loueth gladly se fayre thynges wysshe haue shall quene first procurement yt tyme done sayde kynge knewe thynge wordes whane duke federyke bauyer retourned home shewed mater duke stephyn bauyer brother studyed somewhat wordes last sayd fayre brother beleue well ye saye doughter shulde happy myght come highe honour frenche quene fraunce farre matter wisely regarded make quene shulde ryght soore displeased doughter shulde caryed frauce suche purpose sente home agayne yet rather mary myne ease nerer home aunswere duke stephyn gaue brother duke frederyke duke frederyke well content wrote aunswere fraunce kynges vncles vncle duke auberte duches brabant hadde went duke frederyke forgoten matter aboute maryages kynge place kynge nere agreed doughter duke lorayne fayre damosell age nere kyng age noble great generacyon house bloyes also spekyng doughter duke lancastre quene portyngale coclusion bycause warre therfore matter hanged styll suspence ye haue herde duches brabant wha camb ay maryages burgoyne heynalte frenche kyng duke burbone burgoyn moued forthe maryage bauyer kyng affirmynge moost profitable honorable kynge bycause alyaunce almaygne madame quod kynges vncles nothynge therof well quod duchesse warrant ye shall somwhat therof somer paste promyse well fulfylled dyde moche duke frederyke vncle damosell agreed brother duke stephyn shulde conuey lady fraunce shulde noysed waye went pylgrimage sait iohans amyence euery man supposed almayns go often pylgrimage vsage whan duke frederyke nese lady isabell bauyer ben thre dayes brusels toke leue duchesse intensyon soone amyence soner came heynaulte quesnoy founde duke duchesse sir wyllyam erle ostrenaunt wyfe thy nobly receyued duke aubert vncle great marueyle brought countre demau ded came thyder certaynlye quod duke frederyke haue moche payne bringe mater purpose shewed hym mater sayd haue brought brother mynde haue brought nese hyder ye saye whan departed brother sayd nowe frederike fayre brother ye leade isabell doughter without sure estate frenche kyng wyll refuse shamed euer therfore aduyse well matter come nat well passe ye shall haue enemy euer therfore fayre vncle ye maye se daunger haue putte selfe duke aubert sayd fayre nephue nat dismayde pleasure god shalbe frenche quene thane shall ye quyte haue loue duke stephyn brother thus taryed quesnoy space thre wekes ye duchesse sage endoctryned yonge damosell bauyer maner countenaunce chau ged appayrell simplye arrayed state fraunce thanne arrayed thoughe ben owne doughter whan euery thyng redy ye duches damoselle rode forthe tyll came amience tyme come thyder duches burgoyne brabant also frenche kynge counsayle lorde de la ryuer sit guy de la tremoyle barownes knight issued amyence mete receyue heynalte thus brought amyence moche honoure done lordes ladyes eche theym dyde vysite louyngly moche payne kynge might slepe inwarde desyre yt se shulde wyfe demau ded lorde de la ryuer whan shulde se wordes lady great sporte fridaye whan damosell redy thre duchess ledde damosell kynge kneled downe kynge toke vp hade behelde well whiche regarde loue entred herre constable fraunce sayd lorcoucy sir faythe ladye shall abyde v se well ye kyng eye gothe neuer whan ben kynge certayne space ladyes toke leaue kyng went lodgynges yet knewe nat kynges intencyon duke burgoyn charged lorde de la ryuer enquere kyng mynde dyde right dilygently sayeng sir lyke youre grace howe lyke yonge lady shall abyde v yea truely kynge right well pleaseth v therfore shew vnto myne vncle burgoyne maye delyucred v whan lorde de la ryuer herde hym saye incontynent shewed ye duke burgoyne streight waye went shewed ladyes wherof great ioye cryed well thus lordes ladyes great ioye kynges vncles mynde haue maryage arras pleased nat kyng go soo farre therfore desyred vncle might done ther well quod duke good hour let duke burgoyne constable lorde de la ryuer lorde de la tremoyle dyuers company went lady heynault foude nese shewed tidynges kyng broken purpose mariage ara sayeng howe matter touched kyng nere wherfore morowe next must heale sicknesse duches began smyle departed eche fro great ioye solce saturday night fraunces atreman gauntoyse seuyn thousande hym wente la de foure craftes fayled takynge ardenbourke promysed gaunt departynge wolde neuer retourne gaunt tyll good towne gauntoyse dyd might putte frenche men suche busynesse shulde sende companye scotlande admyrall make warre agaynst englysshmen ther comon brute constable dyuers men arme certayne cro bowes gene shulde entre see go scotlande reconforte men ther allredy makyng warre agaynst englande fra ce atreman proper man armes issued sayd saturday quarter called foure craftes night went costyng bruges trustyng haue wonne wolde nat whan sawe fayled wente danne spyes mette hym sayde sir good ye went danne sir roger guystelles capitayne nat nowe towne true goone bruges wenyng towne dan ben strong ynoughe defence disceyued phowe frauces atreman toke towne dan howe french king wedded lady isabell bauyer went layde siege danne whane fraunces atreman knewe espyes yt sir roger guystels nat dan deuyded company two tooke hym selfe lesse nombre sayd sir go yonder wayes suche gate whasie ye blowe go barryers backe downe copany shall bete downe gate wyll ouer long entre ladder towne shalbe put dout done ordayned wente lesse nobre first went ladder dyke founde withstandyng passed myre dressed vp ladder entred towne came gate sownynge horne without daunger good men ye towne beddes xvii day iuly thus came gate brake barrier without brake downe ye barrier euery man entred towne began styre late taken house many founde harnesse defence slayne mercy thus good towne dan taken wherein founde great richesse specially seller full maluesey wyne granade shewed howe great richesse bruges whiche brought thyder feare rebellyon comon people erauces atreman whan sawe lorde dan greatly reioysed sayd nowe haue well kept promyse gaunte towne shall serue v well maister bruges sluse ardenbourcke incontynent made crye man shulde hardy touche displeasure lady getylwoman towne tyme seuyn knightes wyues come thyder se lady guystelles redy lye downe chylde beed thus pilled towne slayne suche wolde nat take parte went repayre towne agayne whanne bruges herde therof werefore displeased nat without cause armed baner displayed came towne dan began scrimysshe assayle towne nought lost thei wan retourned agayne bruges whan tidynges came gaunt greatlye reioysed reputed enterprise noble dede frauces atreman valyant man pnowe let v returne frenche kynges weddyng whan duches margarete heynaulte yonge lady kepynge whan sawe day come apparelled lady honestly came duches burgoyne duches brabant accompanyed many ladyes damosel thre lady coueyed lady isabell bauiers chayre rychelye couered crowne heed worthe richesse realme whiche kynge sent bysshoppe place dyde wedde presens lordes ladyes masse solempnyte finysshed kyng went dyner whiche great sumptuous erles barownes serued kynge ryche array thus day cotynued great sporte tyll night kyng went bedde newe wyfe feest endured tyll wednisday tidynges came kynge counsayle howe fraunces atreman wonne towne danne also came haraude duke burbone brought letter kyng signifyeng hym howe taylbourcke wonne turned frenche howe duke burbone copany goyng ley siege vertuell howe poyctou xaynton limosyn recoquered sixe forteresses tidynges somwhat reioysed court sette nought lesyng danne sauyng cocluded kyng shulde thing tyll ben flaunders agayne danne entre farre four craftes whiche venym issued shulde leaue house standynge dystroy messangers sent ouer realme fraunce comaudynge men warre first day august ye marchesse picardy ley siege dan tidynges spredde abrode realme fraunce euery knight squyer made redy come kyng comaunded day duke federyke bauyer duke aubert barony toke leue kyng euery man retourned home owne lefte kyng lady isabell bauyer frenche quene frenche kyng made co maundement throughe realme sayd howe wolde neuer come parys tyll ben towne danne xxv day iuly departed fro amyence constable dyuers lordes house went arras taryed one night next day went lan atthoyse dayly men warre came hym fro te last came iprso ye firste day august dan laye nere gonne shot passed ouer heed thre dayes came kynge wylliam neynaulte ryght welcome kynge duke burgoyne layde goodly siege dan therin enclosed frau ce atreman bare selfe valiantly euery day outher scrimyshe assaut without truse lorde clary mayster ordynaunce lorde coucy striken quarell towne whiche stroke dyed whiche great domage noble knight siege danne came men oute good townes flaunders ipre bruges franke siege beyond hundred thousande men kyng laye bytwene dan gaunte capitayne flemmynges lorde saynt pye lorde guystels xxv speares laye myddes amonge feare discencion phowe dyuers burgess sluse beheeded howe sluse chaunged lande bethune howe siege danne contynewed longe cap vii assault made knyght kynge wylliam heynalte day reared vp baner quytte hym selfe lyke good knight assaute frenche men loste wanne fraunces atreman hym certayne archer englande greatly greued assaylantes also great plentie artillary whan towne wonne well furnyssed also caused moche brought fro gaut whan knewe shulde haue siege layde towne season whyle siege laye thus danne greattest towne sluse suche bare moost rule towne wrapped treason yt wolde haue deliuered towne kinges enemyes haue murdred capitayne company beddes haue set fyre kynges nauy lay ancre laded prouisyon kynge wente danne purpose haue gone scotlande admyrall also treators thought haue broken downe see bankes therby haue drowned greattest parte kyng hoost made marchaundise gaute treason shuld haue ben done one night ther good man towne hostry herde treason purposed incontynent went capitayne shewed hym mater named hym certayne thus conspyred treason whan ye capitayne herde sore marueyled toke threscore speares company wente fro house house treatours toke sette dyuers prison sure kepynge toke horse rode kyng came tente hym duke burgoyne shewed ye mater howe towne sluse likely haue ben lost kynges host likely haue water brestes wherof kyng lordes great marueyle capitayne comaunded shulde retourne sluse incontynent stryke heedes withoute respyte therby take ensample capitayne retourned incontynent strake heedes conclusion busynesse duke burgoyne cast aduyse fynde meanes entreat cosyn sir william namure haue hym towne sluse exchaunge landes ioyne towne countie flaunders moche thaduyse sir guy de la tremoyle sormer soiourned sluse certayne nombre men warre whane sir wylliam namure herde first spekynge matter marueylously displeased towne sluse apendauntes profytes see fayre profitable herytage fallen auncestours wherfore loued better howe duke burgoyne lay sore hym therfore remedy make exchaunge duke entensyon make stronge castell subdue come goer see entryng hauen sluse kepe warre none shulde entre see marchesse without daunger make towre highe se troetie leages see thus breuely sir wylliam namure sore desyred duke burgoyne counsayle contente exchaunge sluse landes bethune whiche fayre great herytage countrey haue hym heyres euer incontynent duke burgoyn sette worke men worke make castell sluse pnowe lette v speke siege danne nere euery daye assaute dyuers scrimysshes gate barrier dyuers hurt slayne day lye frenchman coude nat well come walles bycause dyke full myre ben rayny wether hoost shulde haue moche shulde haue ben fayne haue dislodged wheder wolde nat space moneth siege endured neuer rayned vitayle ynoughe howe bycause yuell ayre stynkynge deed beestes horse ayre corrupte dyuers knightes squyers therby sore sicke dyuers went refresshe bruges place forsake yuell ayre kynge hym selfe went laye marles howe tentes styll pight vp felde entent frauces atreman holde styll towne tyll socours came englande reyse siege surely gaunte sende englande rescue surely kyng englandes vncles come ouer see sufficiently garnysshed men warre tillarye haue reysed siege lette bycause admyralles beyng scotlande acertayne nombre men armes also sayde realme englande constable frauce shulde come scotlande great puissance make warre englande wherby gauntoyse nat resrued wher fore behoued within towne dan make yuell bargayne pnowe gauntoyse fledde dan night howe frenche men toke towne distroyed also howe kynge distroyed countre foure craftes cap viii xxvii day august towne dan whan fraunces atreman parceyued socour artillary began fayle som disconforted hymselfe sayd cousayle sir wyll gaunt go wayes lette v shewe one another secretely towne knewe detyng saue selfe wyues chyldren paraduenture wyll make shrewdemar chaundyse v yea delyuer v oure enemyes may rest peace shulde coste v oure lyues shall kepe theym well therfro wherfore let v kepe v toguyder let v go towne vysite watche lette v cause men woman towne go mynster makynge theym beleue morowe next shall haue great assaute bicause would yt shulde haue domage therfore wyll haue suretie churche waye shall saye watchemen wyll go make scrymysshe hoost whan feldes lette v ryde spurres gaunte counsayle sayd sir ye haue well sayd lette euery man ordayned selfe purposed euenyng trussed redy goodes suche might cary awaye put woman child prisoner mynster specially ladyes getyl woman sayeng fayre ladyes shall haue morowe mornyng great assaute wolde nat ye shulde abasshed take domage thus lefte churche first hour night gauntoise went dyde visyte watche walles none towne fraunces atreman sayde sir make night good watche depart nat fro walles thyng ye orse ye mornyng shall haue assaut yet first night wyll awake hoost wordes well beleued euery man went sayd trouthe whan ordayned euery thynge accordynge mynde caused gate opyned company issued nat halfe leage fro towne day light towne parceyued well fraunces atremen company gone thought selfe desceyued ye thefe towne began entreate men kynges prisoner sayeng theym howe slayne fraunces atreman night whan dyuers towne dan vnderstode howe frauces atreman copany gone howe gate opyn ran towne best might whan knowen thoost breton burgonyons desyring wyn mounted horse fell chase pursued gauntoise tyll cae within two leages gaunte chase many slayne taken mo fyue hundred fewe gautoise moost danne fledde towne meane season towne assayled made defence frenche men entred euery syde ladder passed dyke moche payne whan within wende haue gret rich foude nothyng poore people men woman chyldren great plentie good wynes dispyte displeasure sette fyre towne nighe brent wherof kynge duke burgone sore displeased coude nat amende howe ladyes gentyl woman moche payne saued fro hurt bodyes losse good takyng dan kyng counsayled dissodge king went lodged two leages fro gaunte towne called artulle whyles kyng lay men armes rode countrey four craftes distroyed countre bycause tyme past gauntoysehad chiefe co fort euer fro therefore brent downe towres church house chased men woman chyldren woodes whan frechmen done distruction ordayned go lay siege castell gaure gaunte tourned nothyng tidynges came kynge beyng artuelle fro quene hungry bysshop wasselure sayd quenes ambassadour dyuers knightes squyers company brought letter credence certifyeng said quene comyng fraunce fetche lewes fraunce erle valoys haue hym hu gry doughter sir iohan la parson wedded procuracion name erle valoyes tidynges pleased greatly kynge counsayle thought honoure yonge lewes erle valois shulde returne fraunce thought hadde done ynoughe season countre flau ders pnowe frenche kyng departed flaunders gaue leaue men departe howe cae parys treate ambassadours hungry howe marque blanquefort toke stregth wyfe lady enherytoure hungry cap ix frenche kyng departed fro artuell xii day septembre gaue leaue men warre retourne owne house whiche detynge gauntoyse ryght gladde kyng went craye quene wyfe whan went fro amyens flauders sent thyder kepe estate taried certen dayes kyng wente parys quene boyse de vyncens kyng counsayle entended ordring yong erle valoyes wolde shulde go nobly hugry toke hym kyng mater chaunged otherwyse mashorte season realme hungry ye shall trouthe yt quene hugry mother yonge lady whome erle valoys wedded euracion ye haue herde entet make god pleased wolde make suche voyage yt shulde honour fyte kyng sent comaundement assemble power day assigned redy xxx thousande men horse backe came lodged accordynge vsage countrey thynke nat ease sir iohan de vyen great desyre ryde enploye tyme englande great enterprise whan sawe scottes come sayd sir nowe tyme ryde haue lyen long styll settyng warde publysshed euery man tha toke waye rosebourcke iourney kyng nat abode styll edeborow sonnes army thou sande complete harnesse frenche men brought delyuered knightes scotlande norwiche yuell harnessed whiche harnesse great ioye rode towarde northumberlande longe rode came abbey mauues lodged ryuer tymbre nexte day cae morlane roseboucke kepar roseboure vnder lorde motagu knight called sir edwarde clyfforde admyrall fraunce scottes taryed behelde well castell thynges considred sawe well assayle shulde lytell aucyle castell stronge well furnysshed artillary passed drewe long ryuer syde aprochyng berwyke long rode came two towres right strong whiche kept two knightes father sonne bothe called sir iohan strande aboute towres fayre landes fayre place whiche incontynent brent two towres assayled ther many feates armes shewed dyuers scottes hurte shotte cast stone finally towres wonne knightes within playne assaut yet defended longe might endure phowe frenchemen scottes wanne castell varley distroyed diuers townes thumberlande howe drewe agayne scotlade whan knewe kyng engla de came great puyssaunce cap xi conquest thes two towres went another castel called varley parteyning herytage sir iohn montagu capitayne vnder hym sir iohan lussenborne hym wyfe chyldren good knewe well scottes wolde come thyder therfore purneyed castel best power abyde assaute castell taryed armye castell stode fayre countre fayre ryuer whiche cometh tymbre ronneth see day great assaut frenche men bare well day moche better scottes dyd entred dyke passed moche payne many feates armes done aboue beneth frenche men mouted vp ladder fought hande hande daggars walles sir iohan lusseborne dyd quyte hym selfe lyke valyant knight fought frenche men hande hande ladder assaute slayne knight almaygne called sir bleres gastelayne whiche great domage many hurt day finally moche people thassaute well contynued castell wonne knight wyfe chyldren taken xl prisoner castell brent rased downe sawe well nat kept seyng farr englande admyrall scottes rode towarde auwike ye lande lorde percy lodged brent certayne village came another castell therle northuberlandes standyng see syde assayled nat knew well shulde lese payne rode fronter halfwaye bytwene berwyke newcastell ryuer tyne vnderstode howe yt duke lacastre therle northuberlande erle notingham lorde neuell baron march northuberlande bysshoprikes yorke dyrham comynge great power whan thadmyrall fraunce knewe therof right ioy full baron frauce copany desyred haue batayle scottes cared iytell therfore counsayled returne againe towarde berwyke bycause prouisyon folowed also nere owne cou tre abyde ennemyes thadmyrall beleued returned towarde berwyke wherof sir thomas redman capitayne hym right good men armes french men scottes lay towne assayled nat passed next day toke waye burbourcke retourne owne countrees tidynges brought anon englade howe frechmen scottes northum berlade distroyed brent coutre kynge englande knewe rightwell comynge wherfore ye lordes redy felde toke way towarde scottes thenglysshmen made somer grettest prouisyon euer made go scotlande bothe lande water xxvi vessel fee charged uision costyng froters englande redy entre euery hauen scotland kyng cae selfe acopanyed vncles therle cabridge sir thoins holand ther also therle salisbury therle atudell yong erle penbroke yong lorde spesar therle stafforde therle mysien many baron knightes four speres besyde wt duke lacastre therle northuberlade therle therle notynghm lorde lucy lorde neuell lordes baron pursuyng scottes two speares xv archer kynge lordes fyftie archer besyde varlettes kyng folowed duke lancastre fast host came march yorke way tidynges cae kyng howe people likely fight scottes march northuberlande therfore made gretter hast kyng cae last sait iohns beuerley march dyrhin ther tidynges came kyng scottes returned owne countre men warre lodged march northuberland pnowe shall shewe adueture fell theglysshe hoost wherby voyage broken
