mortall warre bytwene certayne lordes phowe sir iohn hollande slewe sir rycharde stafforde howe therle stafforde came kyng demaunde iustyce cap xii march sait iohn beuerley ye dyoces yorke kynge england lodged great nombre erles baron knightes euery man lay nere kyng might specially two vncles ser thomas holande erle lien sir iohan holande brother kynges company knyght boesme come se quene englande loue ye quene kyng lordes made hym good chere name sir myles fresshe lustye knight vsage almaygne fortuned besyde vyllage nere sait iohans beuerley yt fell wordes bitwene knight two squyers sir iohan hollandes brother kynge wordes came two archer sir iohan staffordes wordes multiplyed two archer toke parte straunger blamed two squyers sayng sir yedo wro ge medyll knight ye knowe belongyng quene countre ye ought rather support otherwise one squyers sayd enuyous knaue hast thou thoughe blame hym folly haue quod archer haue right well therwith companyon mayster therfore wyll nat place suffre hym receyue villany yea quod squyer thought thou woldest ayde hym agaynste wolde put swerd thy body made coutnauce thoughe wolde haue stryken archer stepped backe bowe whiche redy bente sette arowe therin drewe vp shotte agaynst squyer arowe pearsed thoroughe body hart fell downe deed whan squyer sawe felowe deed fledde awaye sir myles retourned lodgynge two archer went maister shewed hym aduenture sir richarde stafforde sayde thou hast done right yuell sir quod archer coude none otherwise without wolde haue slayne selfe rather haue slayne hym tha shulde haue slayne well quod sir rycharde go thy waye thou nat founde shall entreate thy peace sir iohan holande father archer deted tidynges anone brought sir iohan holande archer sir richarde staffordes slayne squyer yt man loued best worlde shewed hym maner howe cause sir myles strau ger whan sir iohan holande well enfourmed aduenture ryght sore displeased sayd shall neuer eate drike tyll reuenged lepte horse toke certayne men hym departed fro owne lodgynge right late rode feldes enquered sir myles lodged shewed hym lodged reregarde erle deuurynters therle stafforde sir iohan hollande toke waye thyder warde sought fynde sir myles men rode vp downe amonge hedge busshes straite waye mette aduenture sir richarde stafforde bicause night demau ded quod rycharde stafforde hollande quod seke one thy seruauntes hath slayne best beloued squyer therwith drewe sworde strake richarde stafforde slewe hym fell downe deed whiche great pytie passed knewe nat well done sawe well one falle grounde sir richarde staffordes men sore dismayd whan sawe maister deed cryed holande holande ye haue slayne sonne therle stafforde wyll heuy tidynges father whane knoweth therof sir iohan holandes seruauntes herde well wordes sayde mayster sir ye haue slayne sir rycharde stafforde well quod sir iohan hollade leauer haue slayne worse better haue reuenged dethe squyer sir iohan hollande wente streyght saynt iohans beuerley tooke fraunchesse towne abode styll knewe well wolde moche hooste dethe knight wyst nat kynge wolde saye mater eschue paryllce tooke sentuarye towne saynt iohans beuerley tidynges anone came erle stafforde howe sonne slayne yuell aduenture thafie erle demaunded slayne hym suche hym whan slayne sayd sir kynges brother sir iohen holande dyd slee hym shewed hym cause howe ye maye well knowe loued entierly sonne hadde mo hym fayre yonge knyght coutagyous marueylously sore dyspleased sente incontynent frendes haue counsayle howe shulde vse hym selfe reuengynge dethe moost wysest man counsayle sayd sir morowe mornynge shewe matter kyng desyre hym haue lawe iustyce thus suaged som yre passed night nexte mornynge rycharde stafforde buryed churche vyllage therby buryeng lynage baron knightes squyers armye obsequy done erle stafforde thre score lygnage mounted horse came kynge well enformed yuell aduenture erle founde kyng vncles toguyder great nombre knightes whan erle came kyng kneled downe wepynge sayde soroufull harte sir ye kynge englande haue solemly sworne kepe englade right iustyce ser ye knowe brother wtout tytell reason hath slayne sonne ayre sir requyre right iustyce el ye shall haue worse enemy wyll sir wyll ye knowe dethe son toucheth nere nat brekynge voyage shulde bring host suche trouble honour shulde amended cou teruenged shulde spoken hudred yeres hereafter englande nowe wyll cease tyll voyage scotlande done ennemyes shall nat reioyse trouble erle stafforde kyng answered knowe trouthe shall iustyce reason fatforthe barones wyll iudge shall nat fayle therof brother haue erles lynage sayd sir ye haue sayd well thanke therof thus lynage sir richarde stafforde apeased helde iourney scotlande iourney erle stafforde made semblant dethe sonne wherin baron reputed hym right sage phowe kyng englande caused distroyed church meurous scotlande howe baron scotlande answered admyrall fraunce deuyied leaue scotlande let englesshe men alone cap xiii thus auaunsed forthe kyng englande seuyn thousande men armes threscore thousand archer strength realme englade sayd howe admyrall fraunce wolde fight dede great desyre wyll sayde baron scotlande came forthe sir make sommons gette moche strength ye englysshe men come scotlande wyll surely fight scottes sayd howe content therwith howe toke aduyse kynge englande passed forthe fary passed duresme newe castell ryuer tyne lande northumberlande laste came berwyke wherof sir mathue redman capitayne receyued kynge ioyfully kyng taryed nat ther long passed forthe ouer ryuer twede toke lodgynge abbey mewrous whiche warres bytwene englande scotlande neuer hurt domage clene brnet exiled thentent englyssh men nat retourne agayne englande tyll distroyed scotlande bycause fortifyed tyme frenche men whane admyrall fraunce knewe kynge englande passed ryuer twede entred morlane scotlande sayd baron scotlande sir sytte styll let v go forthe aduyse ennemyes fyght shewed v came ye fraunce one thousade good men armes ye shulde stronge ynoughe fyght englysshe men ensure ye haue mo thousade fyue hundred cror bowes surely knightes squyers company ar parfyte men armes floure chiualrye wyll nat flye abyde suche aduenture god wyll sende wordes answered barones scotlade knewe well puissaunce englysshe men hadde wyll fight wherfore said sir beleue well ye company chosen men great valure sir haue knowledge power englande neuer many englysshe men toguyder assembled nowe ye wyll shall bringe suche place ye shall well se aduyse theym thanne ye counsayle shall fought shall nat refused v surely sir suche wordes ye haue said dyde speke goddes name quod admyrall let one se anon therle dugles baron scotlade brought thadmyrall vnto highe mountayne vnder hyll passage wherby theglysshe host must passe hyll thadmyrall wt diuers knight frauce company clerely sawe englysshe men puissaunce ther nombred nere coude sire thousande men armes threscore thousande archer thynges co sydred sayd howe nat puyssaunce suffycient fight englysshemen passed nat thousande speares xxx thousande men yuell armed admyrall sayd etle duglas therle morette sir ye saye good reason thoughe ye haue wyll fight englisshe men therfore aduyse ye wyll stronge ynoughe ouer ryde countrey distroy sithe ye maye nat fight pray bring throughe countre priuye waye englande maye shall make warre parte v sir barones shall well knowe dyuers wayes thus admyrall barones scotlande determyned forsake scotlande lette englyssh men alone go entre wale go cytie carlyle reuenge lefte englysshe men toke forestes mountayns rode throughe scotlande distroyed wente brent townes vyllages maners caused men woman chyldren coutre driue catayle go yt wylde forestes knewe well englisshe men wolde nat folowe thyder kynge scottes wente wylde scottysshe bicause wes nat good poynt ryde warfare taryed warre durynge lette men alone frenche men scottes passed highe mountayns bytwene northumberlade scotlande entred lande wale began brenne village dyd moche hurte mombrayes landes erle notyngham erle stafforde barone grasoppe mosgr ues landes toke waye cytie carlyle phowe kyng englande toke edeborowe chefe cytie scotlande howe duke lancastre purpose retourne wale close frenchman scottes frenche men scottes dyde sayd countre cap xiiii admyrall frauce erle graunt pre lorde saynt croix sir geffray charney ser wyl lyam de brume sir iames boesme lorde pegny lorde hees lorde marnell sir valeran rauenall barone ery barone fountayns lorde croye sir brake braquemont lorde landury well thousande speres baron knightes fraunce lordes scotlande rode northu berlande bytwene mountayns fronters wale brennyng townes maners countrees kyng englande vncles baron knightes englade companyes entred scotlande brent exyled parte kyng came lodged edenborowe ye chefe towne scotlande taryed fyue dayes departyng set fyre brent vp clene castell hurt stronge ynough well kept whyle kyng lay edenborowe thenglysshmen rode abrode countre dyd moche hurt foude nother man beest abrode withdrawen forestes englysshe hoost mo hudred thousade men well many horse wherof nede great prouisyon foude none scotlande englande cae great plentie bothe lande see kyng departed fro edeborowe rode towarde estruleyn good towne wherin great abbey blacke monkes moost comenly kynges scotlande buryed kyng lay abbey detyng abbey brent passed ryuer taxe whiche ronneth saint iohns towne castell strulyn great assaute wolde nat wonne yet towne landes lorde vercy brent entent duke lancastre bretherne passe scotlande pursue scottes frenche men knew well gone waye wale go carlyle thought enclose bytwene englande scotlande fight aduauntage purpose thought veryly holde thenglysshe men spredde abrode scotlade resystence agaynst countre voyde men warre gone englande admyrall fraunce englysshmen brent towne saynt iohns ryuer taxe rynneth good hauen sayle then ouer worlde brent towne donde englyssh men spared nother abbey minster set fyre vowarde ran bredan whiche cytie see syde thentre wylde scottysshe dyd hurte therto howe countrey right sore afrayed cytie thought haue assaute feared leest ye kynge englande wolde haue come thyder haue ouer ron countre thus lykewise englysshemen dyde scotlande dyd frenche men scottes englande marchesse northumberlande wale brent great countre went northumberlande entred wale whiche otherwise called wynslande passed landes lordes graystocke clyfforde brent voyage dyuers great village men warre coutre kyng came cyte catlyle wale whiche well closed gat walles dyke place auncyent tyme kynge arthure loued rightwell bycause great woodes many dedes armes done laye carlyle garison sir lewes clyfforde brother sir wyllm neuell hym sir thoms mosgraue dauy holgraue sonne sir dongorsse dyuers marchesse fronters wale cytte carlyle chiefe cytie countre nede full good men warre whan admyrall fraunce came thyder assayled cytie great force whiche assaute cruell fierse thus cytie many noble dedes armes done phowe erle oxenforde brake pursute kyng englad thought haue made wale frenche men scottes howe kynge retourned waye came howe frenche men scottes determyned retourne agayne scotla de cap xv kyng englandes vncles knewe well waye admyrall frauce scottes helde said thought ye best folowe theym serche tyll myght fynde fight sayeng howe coude wyse escape purpose duke lancastre bretherne dyuers great baron englande moost parte comons hoost prouisyon come well lande see kynge also agreed purpose night erle oxenforde chiefe counsayle kynge bare rule kyng trusted man moche turned kyng cleue fro purpose nat shewe cause enformed kyng knowen said sir thynke ye wyll ye folowe way vncles hath counsayled sir knowe trouth ye ye shall neuer returne agayne sir duke lacastre desyreth none thynge ye deed might kyng howe durst cousayle yor grace go wynter season strange countrey sir wolde nat counsayle passe moutayns northumberlande mo xxx streightes passage ye closed ye shulde neuer come agayne without daunger scottes sir putte nat youre selfe daunger soeuer saye duke lancastre wyll go lette hym go haue charge therof counsayle ye shall nat go sir ye haue done ynough one tyme youre father neuer farre within scotlande yet kynge edwarde youre graunt father therfore sir oughte contente saue youre owne persone ye yonge lusty suche sheweth sayre semblant loueth l tell kynge gaue suche audyence sayeng erle went neuer mynde ye shall herafter next mornyng lordes englande people ordred selfe dete scotlade folowe ennemyes fight concluded night duke lancastre came king nephue nat knowyng trouble chaunge purpose kynge beyng malencoly assone sawe hym sayd great yre certesse vncle lacastre ye shall nat attayne yet entent thynke wordes yt wyll lese selfe folisshely wyll nat beleue yet cousayle se therby domage profyte v people ye wyll make voyage ye lyste wyll nat wyll retourne englande nexte waye suche loue v wyll folowe v duke lancastre sayd sir shall folowe ye haue neuer man company loueth well also bretherne man wyll saye except persone wolde thynge otherwyse well people guage cotrarie none wolde speke worde kynge helde peace spake seruauntes mater orderyng hymselfe returne englande way yt came duke lacastre departed fro kynge right sore troubled mynde returned copany made newe ordynauce morning thought haue folowed frenchman march wale dyde nat retourned next waye englande lo thus ye may se howe thetle oxeforde great kyng brake voyage dyuers great lordes sayd kyng yuell counsayled seynge prouisyon come sayd might well haue folowed scottes wale doyng shulde euer haue drawen englande warde son wery payne trauell said howe thynges cosidred better retourne go sayeng howe great uision must scrue suche host howe yuell passe mountayns wynter season wherby sayd might rather lese wynne thus season brake vp iorney army englande kynge lordes retourned englande way came hadde distroyed moost parte realme scotlande tidynges came admyrall frau ce scottes tooke counsayle best concluded retourne agayne scotlande vitails began fayle poore countrey distroyed march carlyle landes barone clyfforde lorde maubray bysshoprike carlyle cytie coude nat wynne frenche men sayd howe brent distroyed bysshorike dyrhame carlyle better worthe ye townes scotlande frenchman scottes retourned scotlande waye came whan came scotla de founde countrey distroyed people countre dyde sette lytell therby said howe thre four pole shortely wolde make agayne house saued moche catayle forestes frenche men tooke fayne paye truely therfore dere frenche men often great daunger scottes many debate vitayle scotes sayd howe frenche men dyde demage englysshe men done demaunded answered sayde howe frenche men rode abrode beate downe desoyled cornes whete barley otes wolde nat kepe highe wayes rather ryde throughe corne whiche demages said wolde haue trewe recopence departed scotlande sayde howe shulde nother haue shyppe maryner passe ouer see without leaue lycece dyuers knightes squyers complayned woodes cutte downe frenche men make lodgynges phowe frenche lordes great paryll scotlade coulde nat fynde meanes passe ouer see howe shewed therles duglas morette hardnesse foude countre answere made cap xvi whan admyrall company returned scotlande come edenborowe endured great payne coude fynde nothing bye money wynes lytell small ale bere bredde barley otes horse deed hunger fou dred pouertie whan wolde haue solde wyst nat ther none wolde gyue one peny nother horse harnesse soudyers shewed capitayns howe delte knewe right well experyence selfe men said howe coude nat long endure payne said realme scotlande suche countre nat kepe hoost wynter shulde abyde tyll somer shulde deed pouertie shulde departe sonder serche lyueng abrode coutre douted scottes wolde slee beddes admyrall consydred well thynges sawe clerely likely sayde howe purpose abyde wynter sende frenche kyng duke burgoyne certifyeng case haue newe prouisyon money vitayls make newe fresshe warre agayne nexte somer englande howe sawe well yuels scottes consydred yell people gaue leaue departe suche wolde departyng mischefe lordes coude fynde passage theselfe men scottes wolde knightes squyers poore shulde departe thentent might rule remnant ease sayd admyrall sir lette youre men departe whan wyll youre selfe ye shall nat departe coutre tyll full satisfied suche charge haue borne season army tidynges right harde admyrall baron frau ce shewed mater erle duglas erle morette besemynge right sore displeased hardely dalte said right sorie dealynge wyll cause neuer scottysshe knight shall come fraunce haue good two erles spake erles baron scotlande said howe loste well wherfore dissymule wyll recopensed two erles sayd admyrall lordes frauce howe coude nat rule lordes comons wherfore behoued purposed go realme satisfy comons restore agayne domages whan admyrall sawe wolde non otherwise thought wolde nat lese lesse consydred well howe without conforte closed see sawe howe scottes wylde opynion wherfore fayne agre scottes entent caused crye made maner person shulde come admyrall fraunce proue men done domage wolde recopence value therof whiche crye apeased scottes admyrall became de tour sayd howe wolde nat departe scotlade tyll complaynates fully satisfyed payed dyuers knightes squiers hadde passage retourned flauders wynde weder wolde briue without horse harnesse ryght poore feble cursyng day euer came scotlande sayeng howe neuer men harde voyage wysshing french kyng peace englande one yere two bothe kynges togider go scotlande vtterly distroy realm euer said neuer sawe yuell people false traytours folysshe people feates warre admyrall fraunce departed first wrote letter frenche kyng duke burgoyne certifyeng case scottes delte hym wolde haue hym come home must sende thyder suche me money become dettoure payed knightes squyers commens scotlande scottes sayd playnly warre made englande season fraunce nat selfe therfore suche domages haue taken iourney wolde fully recompesed agayne deted scotlande whiche sworne agreed frenche kyng counsayle boude redeme agayne admyrall sende hym thyder thane somes money ordayned money payed exchage towne bruges scott contente admyrall departed scotlande whan thynges payed toke leaue kynge wylde scottysshe erles duglas morette conueye seesyde toke shyppynge edenborowe wynde wyll arryued sluse flau ders knightes squyers company returned nat agayne hym thought wolde se countrees went dyuers partes moost parte retourned fraunce poore nat able get selfe horse bought horse specially burgonions ca penoise barroise lorayns phowe admyrall enformed frenche kyng cousayle state scotlande howe duke burgoyne gret desyre cause frenche kyng make iorney englande cap xvii whan admyrall retourned fraunce yonge kynge charles ye duke burgoyne made hym good chere reason demauded hym condycion kynge lordes scotlande sayd howe scottes somewhat resembled englysshe men bicause enuyous ouer stra gers moreouer sayd rather erle sauoy erle arthoyse kyng scottes sayd howe hadde sene power scotlande one daye gyder scottes sayd selfe yeche neuer sawe togyder past fyue hundred speares xxx thousande men warr whiche nombre agaynst englisshe archer agaynst thousande good men armes coude longe endure admyrall demaunded sene puyssaunce englande answered yea day quod whan sawe scottes flye awaye feare englysshmen desyred bring might se aduyse englysshe hoost dyde set straite passage must nedes passe demyng ix thousande men warre scottes sayd power england none abydinge behynde kyng counsayle studyed lytell laste sayd great thyng threscore thousande archer sixe seuyn thousande men armes maye well quod constable may make nombre yet rather fight theym home owne march halfe nombre herde maister saye often tymes whan yonge faithe quod admyrall ye ben great nombre men armes supposed ye shulde haue thynke hadde famysshed scotlande thus constable admyrall deuysed toguyder sette duke burgoyne great desyre make armye engla de pnowe let v leaue lytell speke retourne busynesse flaunders trouthe duke burgoyn ymagined mynde make nexte somer folowynge whiche shulde yere oure lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore fyue great army moue frenche kyng moche might go englande also constable frace expert knight well beloued realme frauce ben brought vp youthe realm englande lykewise gaue counsayle enterprise dyde lorde dela emoyle bycause yt duke berrey poictou lymosyn knewe nothynge counsayle duke burgoyne chiefe kynge dyuers ymaginacions thought well long warre contynued flauders voyage ouer see englande coude nat well done wherfore troubled gaunte enclyned rather desyres knewe well alyed thenglysshe men howe gaunte knight englande called sir iohan bourchier sent thyder kyng richarde gouerne towne counsayle theym howe gauntoyse desyred haue peace ouerlayd warre moost ryche notablest persones towne nat maisters owne good wylde soudyours gouerned wyse men sawe well length coude nat endure great parell whan toguyder dyuers ten tymes marueyled howe endured longe hadde done sawe well rather force loue peter de boyse alwayes parceyuered yuell opynions domages non durst speke hym peace knewe sone though neuer sage spake treatie peace incotynent slayne murthered without pytie remedy warre gaunte hadde maynteyned agaynst lorde therle loyes flaunders duke bourgoyne endured seuyn yere wherby ther suche hurte done great marueyle reherse turkes paynim sarasyns sorowed warre trouthe marchaundyses eightene realmes arryued lightely sluse delyueraunce danne bruges whiche let warre beholde cosydre farre tie sorowed warre moche ought sorie landes nexte adioynynge therto none coude fynde meane peace firste grace god diuyne inspyracion huble prayer good folkes god opened eares pytie poore people flaunders peace came shall shewe fro poynt poynt shewed begynning shall declare endynge begynnyng hatte iohn de bare iohan piet gylbert mathue iohan lion suche desyre herken thervnto phow grace god two burgess gaunt enteredde treate duke burgoyne peace howe gaue charge therof knight flaunders aunswere duke gaue vnto cap xviii season towne gaunt sir iohan bourchyer ruler vnder kynge englande peter de boyse dyd assyst hym susteygned yuell opinyons ther wysemen right sore displeased dyscecion bytwene naturall lorde towne durst nat shewe forth entente harte one another durst secretely peter de boyse knowen made blant peace shulde haue ben slayne wt mercy lyke maner philyppe dartuell slayne sir symon bec e sir gylbert brute kepe people gaut feare caused dyuers slayne season season afore fraunces atremau putte oute towne dan frenche kyng distroyed cou trey foure maysters kynge returned agayne fraunce ye haue herde gaut began dout notable men towne supposed yt nexte somer frenche kynge wolde retourne agayne besiege towne peter de boyse suche secte made lyght therof sayenge howe wolde gladly se kynge towne sayd suche alyaunce kyng englade shulde soone ayded conforted season towne two valyant men good lyfe good conuersacyon meane lygnage nat best worst whiche sone sore displeased se discorde bytwene towne naturall lorde howe durste nat speke therof feare peter de boyse one maryner bocher one called roger de creuyn iaques dardenbourke two persones matter first set warke wyse knight flaunders called sir iohan delle tooke great payne therin knyghtes flauders coude neuer haue brought passe nat ben meanes two person knight sir iohan delle welbeloued towne gaunt came wente pleasure without suspection two forsayd son great displeasure debate spake priuely togyder therof roger said iaques wyll remedy foude bytwene towne gaunte whiche borne nowe harde case duke burgoyn naturall lorde great almes dede make peace coude shulde haue thanke god great prayse worlde meanes ye trouble shulde ceased euer ye saye trouthe iaques harde thynge bringe peter de boyse paryllous man none dare speke peace feare hi well roger yet nat alwayes thus last must nedes haue ende shewe quod iaques meanes myght wyll gladly quod roger ye chefe bochery moost beloued dradde ye might secretely shewe corage entent fredes ye se howe enclyne ye maye speke lytell lytell syde maryner beloued maner men knowe corag howe warre displeaseth haue great domage therby shall shewe mynde shall drawe ye purpose maye gette two craftes accorde craftes good people suche desyreth peace wyllnsone euclyne v well quod iaques shall speke gladly crafte speke deuysed done ryght secretely wisely grace holygost iaques dardenboure foude tho bochery well enclyned wyll roger part meanes fayre language founde maryners ryght well agreed therto crafte nere loste lacke vsage hus two wyse men shewed eche howe founde people disposed haue peace said howe must haue sage persone shewe matter lorde last remembred knight called sir iohan dell went hym discouered hym entente secretly sayd sir haue laboured moche craftes well enclyned haue peace lorde duke burgoyn wolde pardon graunt v au cyent fraunchesses according tenours charter bulles sir iohan sayd shall gladly go entreate hym knight went towne ye duke frauce kyng shewed hym forsaid mater dyd moche fayre langage duke enclyned wolde saye desyre duke make voyage englande lightlyer condiscended haue peace gaunt also counsayle sir guy de la tremoyle sir iohan de vyen constable lorde coucy counsayled take peace duke answered sayd sir iohn delle content mater ye wyll deuyse retourne ye agayne sent hyder duke demaunded hym fraunces atreman counsayle treatie nat sir quod thynke knoweth nothynge therof kepeth castell gaure knowe nat sent hider wolde shulde knowe nat tell quod duke speke hardely mater thynke wyll nat agaynst vnderstade desireth gretly peace wt duke comaunded knyght dyd retourned gaunt brought good tidyng went castell gaure speke fraunces atreman discouered entent secretely whan fraunces lytell studyed merely said lorde duke wyll pardon gaunt vpholde frauncheses shall nat rebell agaynst hym right diligent haue peace knight departed fro hym went agayne fraunce duke shewed hym mater duke herde hym gladly wrot letter open close sealed seale gaute knyght letter retourned flaunders came gaut shewed nat letter mysed roger iaques accoplysshe entente beholde nowe ell knight sir iohan bourchier peter de boyse knowen mater worlde shulde nat haue saued lyues phowe two foresayd burgess assembled frendes accomplysshe enterprise sente sir iohan delle duke letter peace cap xix thane roger iaques said sir iohn dell sir ye shall come monday nexte comyng towne nyne clocke bringe duke letter shewe openly comons gaunte wherby shall gyue credence houre wyll lordes towne elles slayne quarell well quod sir iohan ye saye ended cousayle tyme sir iohan delle went towne accomplysshe purpose two wysemen studyed howe bringe aboute purpose spake frendes alderman craftes great nombre accorde determyned nexte monday nyne clocke shulde departe house banner flauders cryeng lyon flauders lorde countrey hath gyuen peace good towne gaunte hath pardoned clerely trespass mater sagely hadeled yet came knowlege peter de boise soone knewe therof went streight sir iohan bourchyer soueraygne capitayne vnder kyng englande sayd hym roger creuyn iaques dardebourke wyll morowe nyne clocke market place banner flaunders theym wyll crye towne lyon flau ders lorde countre hath gyuen peace towne gaunte hath doned trespass shall kynge englande shall nat thane obeyed without preuent putte iurysdyctions best quod sir iohan bourchier aunswered peter sayd behoueth morowe mornyng assemble harnes men house de la vale let v go throughe towne kynge englandes baner v lette v crye also lyon flaunders kynge englande lorde countrey towne gaunte whan come market place suche partie wyll drawe v lette v flee treatours well deuysed sir iohan bourchier lette done pnowe beholde god dyde nat moche two roger iaques enfourmed peter de boyse deuyse whan knewe nat abasshed late euenynge sente frendes shulde nexte daye market place eight cloke wyse desyred seuyn clocke dyde preuent peter de boyse poyntment euery man agreed monday mornyng sir iohan bourchyer company came house called de la vale hym threscore peter de boyse came thyder xl armed good ordynaunce sette selfe forwarde roger iaques assembled frendes togyder moost parte alderman burgess gaunt came toke erles baner went towne cryeng foresaid crye suche herde crye sawe alderman craftes baners erle folowed came copany seuyn clocke came market place set selfe good order therles baners euer came mo mo tidynges came anone sir iohn bourchier peter de boyse assemblynge people went forthe baners englade wente cryed cryes deuysed came said market place araynged selfe euer suche came moost parte went erles baners hundred came fourscore went thyder moche place full men armes stode eche regardyng whan peter de boyse sawe howe alderman craftes drewe roger iaques sore abasshed douted greatly lyfe sawe suche wont serue hym flye awaye fro hym priuely stale awaye oute prease hydde hym selfe feare dethe whan roger iaques sawe yt nighe people drewe parte right ioyouse well coforted nat without good cause sawe well people gaunt wolde peace wt lorde departed certayne company baners flaunders came sir iohan bourchyer englysshemen nat sure lyues whan sawe come towarde roger demauded sir iohan bourchier wher peter de boyse entent whyder frende enemy knight answered said thynke peter de boyse whan sawe gone sayd knowe nat wher become went company wyll seruaunt naturall lorde kyng englande sende hyder owne desyres ye well remembre true quod ye nat ben desyred come hyder towne gaunte ye shulde haue ben slayne honour kynge englande sende hyder request ye shall nat nede feare non yo ye shall haue hurte shall saue domages conducte towne calayes wherfore departe lodgynges peasably lyrre nat thynge ye se wyll vnder obeysauce oure naturall lorde duke burgoyne wyll make warre knyght ryght ioyouse aunswere quyte sayd sir sythe wyll none otherwyse thanke ye offre tyme phowe sir iohan dell came gaut markette place roger iaques alderman cytie howe delyuered letter fro duke burgoyne howe gaunt sent turney confyrmacion peace charter made therof cap xx sir iohan bourchier departed peasably fro place thenglissh men suche gauntoyse companye fledde awaye hydde selfe anone entred towne sir iohan delle came market place duke letter sende thyder duke opyned reed people whiche gretlye pleased theym fraunces atreman sent fro castell gaure inco tynent came agreed treatie sayd well thervpon sir iohan delle sente agayne duke arras shewed hym demeanour gauntoyse howe peter de boyse rule audyence towne howe ben fou de slayne howe frauces atreman dyde acquyte hym selfe valyatly confyrmable peace thynges pleased moche duke sealed charter peace truse endure vntyll firste day ianuarye meane season counsayle matter cytie tourney sir iohn delle brought agayne hym gaunte wherof people great ioye shewed howe great desyre haue peace season sir iohan bow ser englysshe men peter de boyse styll gaunte man wolde thynge peter de boyse lyued styll rest sware shulde nat procure moue thynge shulde cause warre bytwene towne naturall lorde thus done meanes fraunces atreman spake hym wherby peter lyued reste knewe well peter alwayes helde opynions true good capitayne truce durynge gaute apoynted theym shulde go tourney conclude treatie frauces atreman sent thyder chiefe bycause man reasonable well knowen lordes hym wente roger creuyn iaques dardebourke came turney vtas saynt andrewe fyftie horse lodged toguyder sygne samon strete saynt brise v day decembre thyder came duke burgoyne duchesse wyfe lady neuers doughter entred turney gate towarde lyle agaynst entrynge gautoyse issued mete theym whan sawe duke enclyned theym selfe horse bare heeded duke passed lightely theym made haste mere duchesse brabante comynge cytie gate malynes lodged bysshoppes palays thus began treatie bytwene duke towne gaunt sir iohan delle toke great payne go come bytwene tie desyre duches bourgoyne lady neuers duke forgaue yuell wyll peace made cryed accorded written sealed bytwene party maner foloweth phere ensueth tenoure letter charter peace philyppe sonne frauces duke burgoyn erle flaunders artoyse palatyne lorde selynes erle rethell malynes margarete duchesse countesse sayd cositreis heateth seyth present writynge sende gretynge wyll knowen oure welbeloued subiectes alderman common good towne gaunte hath right humbly requyred lorde kyng v shulde haue pytie mercy pardone offence theym theym done kynge v pytie compassyon said subiectes letter haue pardoned also haue confyrmed auncyent priuyleges frauncheses customes vsage case wyll playnly obey kynge v whiche pardone gaunte parte taker haue receyued right humbly suche letter messagers sent v great nombre turney haue clene tenounsed debate warres good harte returned true obeysauce kyng v promysyng hen forthe true frendes faith full kynge v king soueraygne lorde v naturall lorde reason margarete wyfe naturall lady heretour wherfore kynge haue receyued grace said subiectes haue gyuen letter pure remyssion restytucyon priuyleges customes vsages whiche large appereth content oure letter whiche pardon sayd subiectes haue made v dyuers supplycacions whiche haue receyued haue caused good delyberacyon sene vysited examyned counsayle whiche well sene comen fite coutre eschue discesions herafter might fall speciall grace conteplacion good subiectes haue ordred determined maner foloweth firste desyre shulde confyrme aucient priuileges tourney danduarde grauntmont meule teremounde ruplemount abste atharcle breuelies douse chateleyns playne countrey parteyning townes haue ordayned inhabytautes sayd townes shulde come v brigyng priuyleges shalbe sene cousayle done shall said subiectes gaut sayd good townes shall reason holde content sayde priuyleges lost case fortune otherwyse shall make good reformacion therof also haue desyred course marchaundyse haue cosented haue auncyent course payeng custome olde tyme contynewed also desyre inhabytauntes towne gaunt adherentes happe arrested tyme come countre countrey flaunders occasyon debate foresayd discensyons shulde cause theym released lyue reste case haue grau ted arrested yt cause shall ayde conforte defede power agaynst shulde trouble boude defende good true subiectes also requyre suche prisoner haue whiche tie shulde delyuered haue ordayned ordayne suche prisoner putte rausome pay raunsome delyuered payeng also reasonable expense prisoner frendes kynne haue hades fortress kepyng agaynst v first delyuer suche forteresses oure handes also lykewise delyuer suche prisoner haue handes moreouer habundant grace haue ordayned ordayne suche occasion debate discencyons laste oure countrey flauders haue ben banisshed good townes bruges ipre countre francke townes place also suche hath ben banysshed iustyce lawe gaunt put iudged without lawe absent suche restored maye retourne dwell sayd towne suche hath taken parte restored agayne pleasure suche place came fro whan entre agayne sayd townes swere offycers true v kepe peace suretie sayde townes beare yuell wyll priuely parte inhabytauntes sayd townes yuell domage suche entre towne shall swere obey kynge v suche absent tyme hereafter lymitted shalbe restored fee house rente herytages whersoeuer natwithstandyng forfayture done occasyon sayd discensyons enioye primer state also sayd inhabytauntes towne gaut adherentes towne countreis brabant holande zelande cambres bysshoprike liege come submytte selfe v suche shall appoynte wt space two monethes publycacion peace enioye pardone foresaid grace suche realme englande fryselade almayne syde great see come submytte theym selfe within foure monethes notifycacion peace suche beyonde great see rome saynt iames haue respyte submissyon hole yere knoledge peace thus sworne may enioye sayd pardone also suche hath ben banysshed iudged sayd towne sayde occasyon restored fee house rente herytages whan soeuer wyll pleasure mouable goodes hath ben taken eyther partie shalbe restytuicion made therof euery partie bequyte therof also oblygacions made mouable goodes taken said occasyons dyschargynge conscyence render agayne suche house shall delyuered agayne owner nothing taken theym nayled pynned yron leed fro then forthe reuenwes payable owner also though subiectes gaunt haue done homage suche landes holde lordes true owner wherby landes myght fortifyed natwithstandynge specyall grace wyll shall styll enioye suche landes doynge v homage holde v without meane holde also graunt disenherytaunces recognysauces done lawe bytwene partes stande subiectes gaut alderman counsaylours comens adherentes owne good wylles renounce alyaunces promise oblygacions made homage haue done made kyng englande deputy officer good wyllers ye kyng v frohens forwarde swere true kyng seueraygne lorde successours kynges fraunce v ryght lorde lady successours erles flaunders v seruyce true subiectes ought lorde lady defende person honour herytages rightes lette power suche wolde contrarye gyue knowledge therof v officer sauynge alwayes priuyleges fraunchesse also entent oure subiectes towne gaut shulde alwayes good peace true obeysaunce kyng v heyres erles flaunders eschewe discesyons debate myght fall wyll ordayne sayde artycles surely kepte without breakynge straitely comaunde subiectes payne lese maye lese v occasyon sayd debate discesyos nothing openly priuely worde dede shulde preiudicall gaunt rebuke gyue theym yuell language contrarye sayde artycles iniury domage theym gaunte alyes helde partie occasyon sayd debate discencyons suche offence suche knowledge lordes offycers lawes appertayneth dede cremenell doer ayders counsayle kepars withoute fraude punysshed bodyes goodes brekers peace well iustyce officer lordes officer lawes countrey apparteyneth reasonable satisfactyon made partie hurte goodes trespasar resudue v lordes soyle sauyng euer townes priuyleges burgess sayd towne gaut though nat banysshed lawe gyltie breakynge peace thynke reason priuyleg olde tyme therby saued nat lese goodes yet nowe wyll present treatie shall lese goodes tie hurte satisfyed therof said resydue come right heyres thoughe deed case sauyng priuyleges towne gaunte suche yuell doer nat taken thane banysshed depriued fro good also yt wordes otherwyse contrarye said ordynaunce coe knowledge offycers wyll suche punysshed make amendes suche maner maye ensample punysshment done offycers lawe right apparteyneth natwithstandynge priuyledge fraunchesse place also persone churche agaynst ordynasice delyuered ordynarie take suche vengeauce breaker peace case requireth also wyll sayd peace bytwene v oure subiectes cryed publysshed solempnely towne townes flauders herafter dout made sayd artycles cyrcumstaunces therof shall declare cause declared counsayle euery thynge party shall reason holde content alderman burgess comonties towne gaunt v oure adherentes receyue haue receyued hu bly sayd grace pardon benefytes v done kyng charles souerayne lorde said duke duchesse erle cou tesse flauders naturall lorde lady whiche grace pardon thanke hertes kyng souerayne lorde successours naturall lorde lady aforsayd erle countesse flaunders make shall make myse trewe faythfull subiectes ought shall kepe defede personage honour wytnesse whiche thynges sayde duke duchesse haue putte seales present letter shyriffes alderman burgess comons sayde towne gaunt haue also putte seale towne gaunte moreouer sayd duke duches praye requyre oure welbeloued aunte duchesse lusenbourcke brabant right welbeloued brother duke iubert bauyer also alderman comontie counsayle gaunt also duke duchesse burgoyne alderman counsayle comonties gaunt requyre praye barones noble countrey flaunders folowynge good townes bruges ipre ferrouer frake good townes malynes auuers ye well peace knowledge suretie foresaid thynges eche desyre sette seales iane grace god duchesse lusenbourcke brabaunt lancbourcke duke aubert bauyere baylye gouernour countrey heynaulte hollande zelande seignorie frise wyllyam eldest sonne erle namure lorde sluse hughe lorde da coyne chateleyne gaunt iohn lorde guystelles harues henry de bures lorde dysqueme haure iohan lorde gonuseberge ientoyse arnolde iouste lorde estornay philyppe lorde daxalle loyse halse bastarde flaunders gyrarde rasenhen lorde baserode gaultier lorde halme philyppe namure lorde eque iohn villayne lorde saynt iohans withoute chatcllayne ipre loyse lorde lambres knyght borowe maysters alderman bruges ipre philyppe redehen mountferant alderman moutfranke mountamare knight shyrife terrouer franke name sayd terrouer whiche hath seale common counsayls townes malynes auuers haue foresayd prayer request welth peace wytnes trouthe suretie sayd thynges eche haue putte seales sayd townes present treatie made tourney eyghtene day moneth decembre yere grace thousande thre hundred fourscore fyue makyng present letter charter peace engrosed sealed publysshed duke one parte towne gaunt parte frauces atreman comons towne gaut beyng toke leaue humbly duke duchesse also lady brabat thankyng thousande tymes ayde helpe makynge peace offred selfe euer redy seruyce good lady thanked right swetely exhorted euer kepe fermely peace styrre ye people neuer rebell agaynst lorde lady euery body departed went home owne duke duches retourned lyle gaunt returned towne whan peter de boise sawe sure confyrmacion peace people gaunt great ioye therof mynde wyll neuer rebell haue warr therof greatly abasshed dyuers ymaginacyons wheder shulde abyde stylle gaunte thynges pardoned duke charter sealed seale elles departe englande sir iohan bourchier englysshe men apparelled go thynges consydred thought hym selfe coude nat trust peace abyde gaunte whan fraunces atreman sawe wolde nat abyde sayd peter thynke ye ye feare ye knowe well treatie sealed ye duke thing past shall neuer chalenge made peter answered sayd yea letter written lyeth nat true don pardoneth well mouthe gyueth writyng therof yet hatered remayneth styll corages man towne gaunt small reputacion base lynage power haue susteyned rightes lyberties fracheses towne thynke wtin two thre yere people wyll remebre feare nay great lygnages towne gylbert mathewes bretherne wyll retourne enemyes mayster iohan leon gladly wolde neuer se theym parentes sir gylbert brute sir symon becte slayne wherfore case nat sure lyfe fraunces atreman wyll abyde amonge suche sorte treatours haue falsely broken othe promyse kynge englande swere truely ye wyll repente wyll coste youre lyfe nat saye quod fraunces truste well peace duke duchess promyse wyll ieoparde abyde peter de boyse made request alderman counsayle towne sayeng fayre lordes power haue truely serued towne gaut haue ben many harde aduenture halfe good seruyce haue done name rewarde aske none thynge maye sauely conducted sir iohan bourchier whome ye sende englande demaunde aunswered shulde done sir roger emeryne iaques dardenbourcke whome treatie firste moued ryght gladde departure dyuers notable persones gaunt suche loued peace thus peter de boyse departed frome gaunte company sir iohan bourchier toke hym substauce hadde well furnysshed golde syluer ieowelles sir iohan delle dyde conducte vnder duke salue conducte towne calais gauntoise retourned sir iohan bourchier peter de boyse soone might wente englande came kyng vncles shewed dedes theym gaunte kynge made peter de boyse good chere dyde duke lancastre bretherne gaue hym great thanke come abandoned theym gaunte come englande kyng incontynent retaygned hym gaue hym hundred marke sterlynge yerely payed staple wolles london thus peter de boyse abode styll englande good towne gaunt peace sir roger emeryn made chefe alder man flete gaunt whiche good offyce great profyte whan shyppes myght haue course marchaundyse sir iaques dardebourc made chefe ruler meane craftes towne gaunte whiche also great profytable offyce phowe sir iohn froyssart auctour cronycle departed fraunce wente erle foiz maner voyage cap xxi longe nowe sith made mencion busyness farre countreis busyness nerer home hath ben fresshe lafte mater write therof howe season valyant men desyring auauce selfe realme castell portyngale gascoyne rouergue quercy lymosyn bygore euery day ymagined subteltie coulde gette one another dedes armes stealyng townes castels fortress therfore iohn froyssart haue taken cronycle present hystorie reqst highe renomed prince sir guy chatellon erle bloyse lorde dauesnes beauuoys destonhon la guede souerayne mayster good lorde cosydring selfe howe great dedes armes likely towarde party picardy flauders seyng peace made bytwene duke gaunt greatly anoyed ydell knewe well deth noble highe hystorie shulde haue course wherin dyuers noble men shulde haue great pleasure delyte yet thake god haue vnderstandyng remembrauce thynges passed wyt quicke sharpe ynough conceyue thinges shewed vnto touchyng princypall mater body yet able endure suffre payne thynges cosydred thought wolde nat lette pursue sayde first purpose tent knowe trouthe dedes done countrie founde occasion go ghe mighty prince gascone erle foiz byerne knewe well yt might haue grace come house leysar coude nat well enformed purpose none place worlde thyder resorted maner knightes strage squyers great noblenes sayd erle ymagined dyd shewed redoubted lorde erle bloyes myne entent gaue letter recomendacions therle foiz rong tode without parell domage cae house called ortaise coutre berne saynt katheryns day yere grace thre hundred fourscore eight sayd erle soone sawe made good chere smylyng sayd howe knewe yet neuer sawe often herde spekyng reteyned house great ease helpe letter credence brought vnto hym might tary pleasure enfourmed busynesse realmes castyle portyngale nauar aragon yea realme englande cou tre burbonoyse galcoyne erle selfe dyd demaunde thyng dyde shewe knewe sayenge howe thy storie begon shulde hereafter praysed reason sayd howe l yere passed done marueylous dedes armes worlde thre hundred yere thus court erle foiz well cherysshed pleasure thyng moost desyred knewe newes touchyng mater wyll lordes knightes squiers euer enforme also gentle erle hym self shall nowe declare fayre langage enfourmed encrease therby mater gyue ensample lyste auaunce selfe haue recounted great dedes armes takynge sautynge townes castelles batayles harde encountrynges yet ye shall many mo whiche grace god shall make iust narracion ye haue herde whan lorde edmonde sonne kynge englande erle cambridge de er ted fro realme portingale take shypping lustbourke howe made c u nant iohan recouer herytage thus become byder paradueture nat many ye wrote suche haue suche good wylles dare well abyde aduenture batayle agaynst yt nowe present erle tryslmate surely shall nat content without haue batayle suche wordes lyke erle cambridge shewed kyng portingale departed whiche kyng herde well howe neuer durste gyue batayle playne saluence whafic spaynierdes countre wolde nat gyue hym counsayle therto sayde hym sir puyssaunce kyng castell nowe great fortune mysad enture ye lese elde ye lese youre realme euer wherfore better ye suffred thyng wherby ye shulde haue domage parell whan e erle cambridge sawe wolde none otherwyse tourned lusenborne aparelled shyppes toke leaue kyng portyngale toke see company wolde nat leaue iohan sonne portingale kyng lady shulde mary chylde yonge thus erle reteurned englande thus dealyng iourney portyngale erle cambridge retourned englande maner ye haue de shewed brother duke lancastre dealynge kynge ferant portyngale duke sorie therof sawe thereby conquest castell farre also kyng richarde englande abouth h c usayle nat apetyte specially le forde chefe kinges fauour erle dyd set great trouble bytwene kyng vncles might said oftentymes kyng sir fye wyll folowe myndes vncles duke lancastre crle cambridge shall well cost treasure englande warre spayne yet shall cequere nothyng better kepe owne people money spende abrode ye gette profyte kepe defende owne rytage wherin ye haue war e sydes well fraunce scotlande rather enploy tyme countreis yonge kynge enclyned lightely wordes loued hart bicause norisshed vp toguyder erle great alyaunces dyuers lordes knightes englande dyde mater counsayle sir symon burle sir robert treuelyen ser nicholas brambre sir iohan beauchampe sir iohan salisbury sir mychaell de la pole also sir thomas tryuet sir wylliam helmon named te dyffernes discorde bitwene kynge vncles noble common realme many yuels came therby englade ye shall hereafter hystorie nat longe erle cambridge departed portyngale kynge feraunt felle sicke contynued hole yere dyed mo chyldren quene spayne kynge iohan castell enformed deth howe realm portyngale fallen hades howe ryghtfull heyre thervnto reason dethe kynge sother dyuers cousayls kept mater sayd howe portingales harde harted people yt wold nat without conquest dede whan portyngales sawe howe without kyng determyned counsayle sende bastarde brother kynges sage valyant man called deuyse man relygton mayster hospytals realme sayd rather vnder rule maister denyse vnder rule kynge castell reputed hym bastarde hath good corage well whan mayster denyse vnderstode comens wyll foure chiefe cyties portyngale hadde great affectyon crowne hym kyng wherof great ioye wrote secretely frendes came lurbone whiche kay realme people towne receyued hym great ioye demauded hym crowned kyng wheder wolde good nat kepe lande fraunchese aunswered sayd wolde desyred neuer better kynge wolde luxbone wrote connubres pount de portugale dourke kayes realme determyned crowne kyng mayster denyse sage valyant man good gouernauce brother kyng ferant sawe well realme coude nat longe without kyng well feare spay mardes myscreates granado bongie marched sayde townes certayne lordes lande enclined ye lord sayd nat mete bastarde crowned kyng people good townes said shulde necessyte must sithe none seyng valyant sage man bothe wy te dedes armes toke ensample kynge henry crowned kyng castell electyon countrey comon profyte done kynge peter beynge lyue thus electyon abode maister denyse solemynely crowned cathedrall churche connubres accorde puyssaunce comons realme sware kepe iustyce ryght people kepe maynteyne frauncheses lyue dye wherof hadde great ioye whan tidynges came hearyng iohan kyng castell sore displeased therwith two cause one bycause wyfe enheryter bycause people election hadde crowned maister denyse kynge wherfore kyng iohan toke tytell make warr demaude luxbone two hundred thousande florens whiche ferant promysed hym whan toke doughter wyfe sende erle terme therle ribydea bysshoppe burges portyngale ambassadours luxbone whan saynt prayne laste towne castell towarde luxbone sent haraulde kyng luxbone haue saue conducte go come furnysshe voyage whiche graunted lightly came luxbone towne assembled counsayle toguyder ambassadours shewed come thyder finally sayde ye sir luxbone ye ought iustely nat marueyle kyng souerayne lorde demaundeth money ye bounde nat co tent ye haue gyuen ye noble crowne portyngale clerke man relygion bastarde thynge nat suffred rightfull election non nerer ye crowne tha also ye haue done without assent noble realme wherfore kyng maister saythe ye haue done yuell without ye shortely remedy make wyll make sharpe war whiche wordes feraunt gallopes de vyle fois notable burgesse cyte answered sayd sir ye reproche v greatly electyon owne election moche reprouable ye crowned spaygne bastarde sonne iewe clerely knowen ryghtfull election kynge hath right realem portyngale right resteth doughters kyng peter englande maryed bothe constauce isabell maryed duke castre therle cambridge wherfore ser ye may departe whan ye wyll retourne sent hyder say electyon good whiche wyll kepe kyng wyll haue none long lyste kyng ye money ye demaude v say nothyng bou de therto take boude therfore suche profyte therof answere kynge portyngall nat present howbeit knewe well shulde sayd wha ambassadours sawe coude haue non answere toke leaue departed retourned cyuell lafte kyng cousayle shewed said answere kyng spayne toke cousayle best mater determyned kyng portyngale shulde desied howe kyng spayne good quarell moue warre dyuers reason kyng denyse defyed helper portyngale kyng spayne made gret somons men war lay siege cytie luxbone kyng sayd wolde neuer departe then tyll answered hym proudely shuld derely repent might ouercoe thus king castell puissauce came saynt yrayne yt season knight chased ut court called sir nauret kyng myght haue gette hym shulde haue cost hym h ed knight knowledge therof hadde many good frendes auoyded realme castell came luxbone kyng portyngale great ioye comynge retayned hym made hym great capitayne dyde moche hurte spayniardes kynge castell departed fro saynt yrayne came layde siege cytie luxbone enclosed therin kynge portyngale siege endured hole yere constable host erle longueuyll marshall hoost sir raynolde lymosyn knight limosyn long came spaygne sir bertram clesquy firste warres made spaygne sir raynolde valiant knight well proued kynge well maryed hym fayre lady fayre herytage two sonnes raynolde henry greatly praysed realme castell prowes kynge castell dagheynes mandake sir dygo persement peter roseament maryche de versaulx portugaleys turned spaynisshe great mayster calestrane brother yong knyght called dighemeres pier goussart selme iohan radigo de hoyes great mayster saint iaques kyng well hym thyrtie thousande men dyuers assautes scrimysshes many feates armes done one parte spaygnierdes knewe well kynge portyngale shulde haue none ayde noble realme common made hym kyng agaynst wylles kyng castell intensyon coquere luxbone countre retourned sawe well shulde haue none ayde without englande wherof moost doute yet whan well ymagined sawe well englysshe men farr herde howe kynge englade vncles nat best acorde wherfore thought hym selfe sur tie siege whiche siege right plentyfull thynges market castell plentie ther kyng portyngale lay styll cytie luxbone case coude nat take see fro hym deimyned sende englade kyng duke lancastre trustie ambassadours renewe aliances made bytwene kyng kyng ferant brother also ambassadours charge shewe duke lancastre maryage wolde gladly haue doughter philyppe make quene portyngale swere seale petuall peace alyance bytwene also promysynge hym wolde come thyder two thre thousade men warre many archer helpe ayde hym coquere enherytaunce castell message apoynted two knightes sir iohan rade goe sir iohn tetedore archedeaken luxbone called marche de la fugyre made redy toke see good wynde sayled towarde fronters englande te kyng castell laye siege counsayled write fraunce gascoyne ayde knightes squyers spaynierdes supposed well kynge portyngale sende socoure englande reyse siege thought wolde nat taken puissauce might stronge ynoughe resyst englysshmen portugaleyse counsayled dyde sende letter messangers fraunce dyuers knyghtes squyers suche desyred dedes armes specially countrey rne countie foiz plentie good knight desyring dedes armes though ben brought vp erle foiz good peace bitwene hym therle armynake message two kyng nat sone brought howe warres place ceased neuerthelesse auuergne tholousyn rouergue lande bygore pnowe lette v leaue speke busynesse portyngale lytell speke mater phowe prince wale prince came tarbe request coutesse armynake made prince princesse howe countre gascoyne newly agayne warre cap xxii bitwene countie foiz countre bierne lyeth coutie bigore whiche countie teyned fraunce marchesed coutre tholousin one parte countie con uges bierne parte countie bygore lyeth strong castell lourde whiche englysshe euer sythe countie bigore yelded kyng england prince redempcion kynge iohan frauce treatie peace made bertigny charter confyrmed calais hath ben shewed ye hystorie whan prince wale come englande kyng father bad gyuen hym herytage lande duchy acqustayne wherin two archebisshoppes xxii bysshoppes come burdea x ryuer gyrone taken possessyos land lyen yere princesse desyred erle iohan armynake wolde come countre bigore cytie tarbe se cou tre whiche nat sene erle armynake thought prince princesse bygore erle foiz wolde come se wher dyd owe hym raunsome two hundred fyftie thousande frankes thought wolde desyre prince princesse requyre erle foiz forgyue hym parte therof moche dyd erle armynake instance prince prince cae cytie tarbe towne fayre standeth playne countre amonge fayre vynes towne cytie castell closed gate walles seperated eche fro fro mountayns byerne catheloyne cometh fayre ryuer lysse whiche ronneth throughe tarbe clere fountayne fyue leages then towne morlance parteyninge erle foiz entre countie bierne vnder mountayne site leages fro tarbe towne panne whiche also teyneth sayd erle tyme prince prince tarbe therle foiz panne bylding fayre castell ioyninge towne without ryuer grane assone knewe comynge prince princesse beyng tarbe ordayned go se theym great estate mo sixe hundred horse threscore knightes company comynge tarbe prince pri cesse right ioyouse made hym good chere erle armynake lorde dalbret desyred price requyre erle foiz forgyue therle armynake el parte somme florens ought haue prince wyse sage consyderynge thynges thought might nat sayde sir erle armynake ye taken armes yt iourney batayle ye dyde putte cosyn erle foiz aduenture agaynste thoughe fortune fauourable hym agaynst valure ought nat made lesse lyke dedes lorde father wolde nat contente shulde desyred leaue haue wonne good aduenture batayle poicters wherof thanke god whane erle armynake herde basshed fayled entente howe yet lefte nat red princesse good hert desyred therle foiz gyue gyfte madame quod le meane man therfore gyue great gyftes madame thyng ye desyre passe nat valure threscore thousande frankes wyll gyue gladde chere yet princesse assayed agayne coude cause hym graunt full desyre rle sage subtell thought verily desyre haue hym forgyue clerely erle armynake dette sayde agayne madame poore knight buyldeth townes castelles gyfte haue graunted ought suffyce princesse coude bringe hym farther whan sawe said gentyll erle foiz request desyre forgyue clerely erle armynake madame quod erle request ought well condiscend haue sayd desyre passe nat valure threscore thousande frankes wolde graunt madame erle armynake oweth two hundred fyftie thousande frankes request forgaue hym therof threscore thousande frankes thus mater stode case erle armynake request prince wan forgyueng threscore thousande frankes anone erle foiz returned owne countre sir iohan froissarde make narracion busynesse bycause whan countie foyz bierne passed coutie bygore demaunded enquered newes yt countrey suche knewe nat shewed howe prince wale aquitayne whyle tarbe great wyll go se castell lourde whiche thre leages nere entre mountayne whan well aduysed towne castell cou tre praysed greatly aswell stregth castell bycause stode fronter dyuers countreis garysone might ronne well realme arragon catellon barselon pri ce called hym knyght housholde great truste loued hym entierly serued hym truely called sir pyer ernalde countre bierne experte man armes cosyn erle foiz prince sayde hym sir ernalde instytue make chateleyn capitayne lourde gouernour countre bygore loke ye kepe castell se well ye make good accompte ther kyng father sir quod knyght thanke shall obserue comaundement dyde homage prince prince put hym possession knowen whan warre began renewe bytwene englande frauce hath ben shewed erle guy saynt poule sir hugh chatellon mayster crosbowes fraunce tyme beseged towne abuyle wan countre poitou tyme two great baron bigore thone called sir marnalte barbesan lorde danchyn tourned frenche toke towne cytie castell tarbe whiche easely kept kynge englande styll castell lourde handes sir pier ernalt bierne wolde wyse yelde vp castell made euer great warre agaynst realme frauce sent great company aduenturers bierne gascoyne helpe ayde hym make warre togyder many good men armes hym sixe capitayns euery man fyftie speares vnder hym first brother iohan bierne right expert squyer pier danchyne bygore brother germayne lorde danchyne wolde neuer tourne frenche nandon saynt colombe ermalton mount ague saynt basyll bourge carnela capitayns made dyuers iourneys bygore tholousyn carcassene albygoise euer assone lourde lande enemyes somtyme wolde aduenture thyrtie leages fro holde goynge wolde take nothyng retourne nothynge coulde scape somtyme brought home great plentie beestes prisoner wyst nat howe kepe thus rausomed cou trey excepte erle foiz landes landes durste nat take chekyn withoute payed truely therfore displeased erle coulde nat longe haue endured companyons lourde ranne ouer countre pleasure rode nat farre fro theym thus cytie tarbe great doute fayne make couynaunt bytwene tarbe lourde great vyllage good abbey called gynors lykewise fayne agre also ye parte ryuer lysse great towne called bagueres towne harde season haryed garyson maluoysen standynge hylle ryuer lysse rynnyng vnderneth vnto walled towne called turney whiche towne lourde maluoysen hadde euer recourse whiche towne dyde hurte bycause resorte thyder towne euer good market pyllage dissymuled euer whiche fayne elles coulde nat haue lyued ayde socoure persone capitayne maluoysen gascoyne name remonet de lespe experte man armes company lourde rausomed well marchauntes aragon catheloyne fraunce without agreed season enterprised go se erle foiz se dyuersities cou trey neuer ben whan departed fro carcassene lefte waye tholous wente monterorall fonges bell first towne therle foiz master castell sanredyn cae good cytie pauyers teyning erle foiz taryed abydinge company goyng countre byerne erle whan taryed thre dayes great pleasure yt cytie deleetable stadyng among fayre vynes enuyroned fayre ryuer large clere called liege day fortuned thyder came knyght erle foiz fro auignon warde called sir espaenge de lion valyant experte man armes age l yeres gate company greatly desyrous mater fraunce sixe dayes iourney came ortayse knyght euery day sayd prayer moost parte day toke pastyme demaundyng tidynges also whan demauded thyng hym wolde answere purpose whan departed fro pauyers past mout cesse whiche yuell passage came towne castell ortayse whiche frenche passed came dyner castell le foiz halfe leage then called carlat standynge highe mountayne dyner knight sayd sir let v ryde toguyder fayre easely haue two leages ryde lodgyng content knight said haue day passed castell ortayse dothe moche domage countre peter danchyn kepeth bath taken stollen realme fra ce threscore thousande frakes demauded might shall shewe quod knight lady day august euer great fayre cou tre resorteth thyder moche marcha dise day pier danchyn copanions lourde taken aduyse determyned get towne castell sent two simple varlett semyng sayd towne moneth maye get selfe seruyce towne dyde reteyned two maisters dyde right dilygent seruyce maysters went maisters busynesse without suspeciousnes lady day august ther many marchantes stranger foiz bierne frauce ye knowe well whan machantes mete sawe nat togyder long wyll make good chere togyder house two varlett seruice many marchantes drinkyng makyng good chere ostes apoyntment midnight pier dachin copany cae ortaise enbusshed selfe wode whiche passed throughe sent sixe varlett towne ii ladder passed dyke came walles reared vp ladder ii varlettes seruice towne dyd ayde maysts sat makyng good chere sayd varlettes dyde put selfe aduenture one said two varlettes brought sixe gate within wher two men kepyng key varlet said sixe sir kepe selfe priuy close styrre nat tyll ye whistle trust make porter open gate warde haue keyes great gate therfore assone haue opyned warde wyll whystle steppe forthe slee porter knowe well ynoughe keyes gate haue oft tymes helped kepe gate maister deuysed dyd varlet went gate sawe herde howe porter drikyng within warde called name said sir open yor dore haue brought best wyne euer dranke maister hath sent entent shulde kepe watche better knewe right well varlet beleued said trouthe opyned dore whistled thother sixe stept forthe entred dore slewe porter priuely none knewe therof tha toke keyes went opyned ye gate let downe bridge easely yt none knewe therof blewe blast horne yt enbusshed mouted horse came spurres entred bridge come towne toke men towne syttyng drikyng l beddes thus ortayse taken pier danchin bigore copanyons lourde demauded knight howe gat castell shall shewe tyme ortaise thus taken capiten castell yuell aduenture towne supped certayne marchauntes carcassen taken among ye next mornyng pier dachyn brought castell wher wyfe chyldren made beleue wolde strike heed wtout wife wolde delyuer vp castell wolde mised delyuer husbande quyte suffre hym dete bagge baggage wtout hurt lady sawe herselfe harde case sawe nat able make ware selfe sauyng husbades lyfe yelded vp castell husbade deted went pauiers thus pier dachin towne castell ortayse tyme entred copany wan aboue xxxm frakes marchandise prisoner frace suche coutie foiz b erne clene delyuered wtout domage pier danchyn kept ortaise space v yere copany oftymes wolde ron gat carcasson whiche sixe leages then dyde great domage countre well raunsomynge townes pyllage ouer countrey meane season pier dachin garison ortaise night certayne copany went came castel called paiel er good leage then wherof frenche knight called raymon du pailier owner ben ther often fayled purpose tha happe suche scaled castell toke knight lady beddes let lady child go fre kept styll knight owne castell space foure monethes last payed frakes rausome fi ally whan sore ouerryden coutre solde two castels ortaise paielier coutre viiim frankes went lourde pricipall garyson thus aduenture knightes dyd put selfe dayly also tyme ther expert man armes ye castell lourde gascone borne called le megeant saynt basyll tyme xxx deted fro lourde rode aduenturee tho ousyn thought haue gote castell penne allugois myst ent whan sawe fayled purpose cae gate made great scrymisshe proper hour seneshall tholous rode forthe hym sir hughe de froid wyll lx speares came aduenture pan sayd scrimysshe doyng incontynent sette fote erthe came barryers mengeant ouer matched ther fought valiantly hande hande wouded knight two thre place howe finally taken force men outher taken slayne ther fewe scaped megeant ledde tholous comons towne wolde haue slayne hym bitwene hand seneshall moche payne saue lyfe brought hym castell ryght yuell beloued tholous yet happed well hym duke berry cae thider knyght suche frendes delyuered seneshall thousande frankes rausome whan delyuered retourned lourde began agayne make newe enterprise tyme departed fro lourde fyue hym without armoure dyde abbyt monke lyke thre monkes hym shauen crownes euery man sawe wende surely ben monkes abbit gesture came well maner came mountpellyer toke vp lodgynge signe egle said howe abbot high gascon goyng parys certayne busynesse teyning house gate famylier aquayntauce ryche man towne called bareger also paris certayne busynesse abbot said howe wolde pay cost lyst go copany wherof good man right ioyouse shulde haue charge borne one varlet hym went forthe monke whan ryden thre leag couterfet monke sir megeant toke prisoner ledde secret wayes garison lourde dyd rausome vm frakes said ah saint mary megeant suche expert man arme ye truely sir war dyed place wher shall passe thre dayes coutre called layre bigore towne called lachmache well sir quod shall remebre therof whan come ther rode tyll came moste que good towne closed teyning therle foiz whiche armynagois labrisyece toke stelthe season kept nat thre dayes mornyng deted fro mostequen rode towne palamuche good towne closed ryuer garon teyning therle foiz whan almost ther thought haue passed bridge garon haue entred towne coulde nat ye day sore rayned fro moutayns chataloyne aragon wherby another ryuer encreased whiche called saluz ran fast reysed vp ryuer garon suche wise yt brake one arch bridge whiche tymbre wherfore returned agayne montestquen taryed day next day knight cousayle passe ryuer botes towne casseres rode thider dyd moche yt past ryuer garon great payne ell bote nat great coude nat take one tyme two horse kepars ruled bote whan ouer rode casseres bode daye meane tyme yt supper dressyng knight said sir iohan let v go se towne passed long towne cae gate towarde palamuche went therat came dyke knyght shewed pane wall said sir se yonder par e wall whiche newer remnant yea sir well shall shewe ten yere past sithe fortuned ye haue herde warre bytwene erle armynacke therle foiz howe nowe peace armynagoise labrisience wan lytell warre saynt nycholas euyn yere lorde thousande thre hudred threscore two therle foiz toke batayle therle armynake lorde dalbret nephue noble men ledde prisoner ortaise wherby erle foiz hath receyued ten tymes hundred thousande frankes fortuned father erle armynake nowe lyueng called sir iohan armynake made iourney toke towne casseres ii hundred men armes thought kepe towne strength tidynges whan came knowledge erle foiz beynge tha e panne lyke sage valyant knight called hym two bastard bretherne called arnalt guyllam sir pier de bierne sayd sir wyll ye ryde incontynent ca eres shall sende men euery syde within thre dayes shalbe selfe let none come towne ye fight ye shalbe stronge ynoughe whan ye come cause men countre bring thyder great plentie wode busshes fagott choke gate therwith wtout make stronge barryers wyll yt within enclosed issue nat gares shall cause take another way two knightes dyd comau dement wente palamuche men warre bierne folowed came towne casseres within sette lytell nat howe enclosed within towne coulde nat issue oute gate thirde day erle foiz came thider fyue hudred men armes sone came caused barryers made rounde towne also barrier roude host bycause shulde nat troubled night tyme case laye longe without assaut moche vitayle began fayle within thoughe wyne great plentie nothyng eate coulde nat flye awaye ryuer thane depe thought better yelde selfe prisoner dye shamefully famyne fell treaty therle foiz agreed treatie shulde nat issue oute gate make hole wall go therat come one one without armoure yelde prisoner behoued take waye made hole ye wall issued oute one one erle redy people order batayle receyue prisoner euer came erle sent dyuers castelles prisoner cosyn sir iohn armynake sir bernarde dalbret sir manalt barlabason sir raymode de benache sir benedicke de la corneyle twentie beste personage ledde hym ortaise departed two hundred thousande trake thus hole wall made wente supper nexte day rode longe ryuer garon passed palamuche entred lande erle comynges armynake syde ryuer garon lande therle foiz rode knight shewed stronge towne called marteras toussa teyninge therle comynges syde ryuer moutayne shewed two castelles parteyninge erle foiz one called mountarall mountclare rode bytwene townes castelles longe ryuer garon fayre medowe knight sayd sir iohan haue sene many fayre scrimysshes encountrynges bytwene foizois armynakes towne castell well furnysshed men warre warred eche vpon armynakes agaynst yonder two castelles made bastyde kept men warre dyde moche hurt erle foiz lande shall shewe howe fortuned erle foiz night sent brother peter de bierne two hudred speres four hundred villayns countre charged fagott moche wode busshes brought bastide sette fyre theron brent bastyde within without mercy sithe neuer made agayne suche deuyses rode day longe ryuer garon one syde sawe many fayre castelles fortress lyfte hande parteyned therle foiz syde parteyned therle armynake thus passed montpesac fayre castell stroge standyng highe rocke vnderneth towne highe way without towne lytell place called ala gardea towre bitwene rocke ryuer whiche towre gate portcolyse yron sixe men might well kepe passage agaynst worlde coulde man passe two front towre one syde ryuer syde sayd knyght sir stronge passage myghtie countre true quod knight though thentre stronge yet erle foiz dyde conquere one passed waye helpe archer englade company great desyre passe countre come ryde nere sir quod shall shewe howe rode iuste hym sayd sir tyme erle armynake lorde dalbret fyue hudred men warre cae countre foiz march pauyers begynnynge august whan men dyd gather cornes ye grape rype whiche tyme great habundaunce countre sir iohan armynake company lodged towne sauredun lytell leage fro cytie pauyers sente pauyers without wolde bye cornes wynes pay said el wolde brinne distroy togyder pauiers great feare erle lorde farre fro byerne fayne bye owne cornes payed fyue thousande frankes desyred fyftene dayes respyte whiche grauted erle foiz enformed busynesse hasted hym moche might assembled toguyder men came sodaynly cytie pauyers xii hundred speares fought sir iohan armynake taryed departed wente countie comynges money pauyers leysar tarye therfore therle foiz claymed sayd come saued money corne put awaye ennemyes paye men warre therewith taryed tyll inned corne vyntage passed foreby castell called bretytte also another castell called bacelles parteyninge erle comynges rode long ryuer sawe fayre castell great towne demaunded knight castell called said named montesplayne parteyninge cosyn erle foiz called sir roger despaygne great barone countre tholousyn seneshall carcassoney demaunded knight kynne sir charles spayne constable fraunce answered sayde nat blode sir loyes spaygne sir charles ye speke came bothe realme spayne lynially extraught spayne fraunce mother syde cosyn germayns kynge alphons spaygne serued youthe sir loyes spaygne warres bretaygne alwayes partie sir charles bloyes agaynst erle moutforde lefte spckynge matter rode saynte gouffens good towne erle foiz next day dyned monreyle good stronge towne frenche kynges sir roger de spaygne kepte dyner rode waye towardes lourde rode throughe great launde endurynge fyftene leages called laundes lann de vous wherin many daungerous passage theues yuell doer launde stode castell mesere parteyninge erle foiz good leage fro towne tourney whiche castell knyght shewed sayd sir beholde yonder maluoysen sir haue ye herde howe duke aniou whan countrey wente lourde dyde countre howe layde siege lourde wanne also castell gryngalet ryuer side ye se yonder v parteyneth lorde de la batte remembred selfe said sir trowe neuer herde therof yet therfore pray shewe mater sir praye shewe ryuer garon become se ye say trouthe quod knight departeth thentryng mountayns groweth cometh foutayne thre leages hen way chatelomy castell called saynt beart fronter realme fraunce towarde aragon nowe squyer called ermalton otherwyse called bourge de spaygne lorde therof hatelayne cou trey cosyn germayne sir roger de spayne se hym shall shewe goodly persone good man armes hath done domage theym lourde knyght squyer countre erle foiz loueth ryghtwell companyon armes pi wyll leaue speke hym thynke feest christmas ye shall se erle foiz house nowe shall shewe duke aniou howe came countre dyde rode forthe fayre easely began saye foloweth pof warr duke u made agaynst englysshmen howe recouered castell maluoysen bigore whiche afterwarde gyuen therle foiz cap xxiii begynnynge warres whane began wynne englysshe men helde acquitayne sir olyuer plesquyn become freche ledde ye duke aniou bretaygne landes sir robert canoll sege dyriuall ye haue herde thynke treatie six hughe br ce cosyn made duke antou redre castell delyuer good hostage duke aniou shulde nat coe reyse siege whan sir robert canoll within castell dyriuall wolde holde tretie true sir quod well quod haue herde scrimysshe castell sir ol uer de clesquyn wounded sir nat tell quod nat remembre wherfore sir praye shewe scrimysshe siege came therof paraduentureye knowe wayes ye shall retourne agayne well ynoughe purpose lourde maluoysen true quod knyght sir gar castella right valyaunt knight countre good frenche wente duke aniou cause hym come beauuosyn duke made sommons holde iourney dyriuall made sir gar valyantnesse marshall host true herde say yt wha sawe sir robert canoll wolde nat kepe tr atie made wolde nat delyuer castell dyriuall came duke sayd sir shall hostage faulte castell nat gyuen vp great pytie shulde dye ge tylmen haue deserued dethe duke said good delyuer yea truely sir quod knyght great ytie otherwyse well quod duke therin ye lyste sir gar went delyuer wente sir olyuer clesquyn mette demaunded wheder went fro whens came come fro lorde duke aniou goynge delyuer hostage delyuer quod sir olyuer abyde lytell retourne agayne duke cae duke lodgynge great study sir olyuer saluted hym said sir entent shall nat hostage suffre deth faythe shall dispyte ser robert canoll sir byrre hath falsed faithe wherfore ser wyll ye knowe wtout dye shall weare armure hole yere none yor watres shulde scape thus good chep siege hath coste threscore frankes newe wyll shewe grace enemy epeth nother faythe trouthe wordes duke began chafe sayd sir olyuer therin ye thynke best quod sir olyuer wyll lese lyues good cause sithe kepe nat myse sir olyuer departed fro duke came place castell sir gar durst nat speke one worde shulde haue lost labour sith sir olyuer taken hym enterprise called hangman made hym stryke heedes two knyghtes two squyers whiche great pytie mo two hundred ho st wepte incontynent sir robert canoll opyned posterne gate brimme dyke dispyte frenche men caused stryke heedes prisoner without respyte incentynent opyned castell gate lette downe bridge issued barryers scrymysshed frenche men sir gar shewed sore scrimysshe sir olyuer cl squyn hurt returned lodgyng thre good men armes two squyers countrey b erne bettram de baruge eualton de payne bothe sore hurt next day duke dislodged went fro dyryuall tholous entente distroye lourde tholous coplayned greatly garyson lourde pso duke went first layd siege maluoysen whiche maye se yonder v duke company vi thousande men warre besyde geneuoys comons good townes capitayne maluoysen squyer gascoyne called raymonde de lesp experte man armes euery day barrier scrimysshes goodly feates armes done duke laye yonder fayre medowes bytwene towne turney castell ryuer syde lysse siege enduryng sir gar marshall thoost went fyue hundred men armes two hundred archer crosbowes two thousande comons layd siege castell trygalet whiche haue lefte hynde v whiche castell squyer gascoyne kepte lorde de la barde cosyn called bastot manlyon within castella xl companyons dyd countre suche maystries none coude go waye taken prisoner without pylgrimes wente saynt iames ayde nother fortresse called nemeluz two garysons robber pyllers cou tre assembled euer agaynst erle foiz also agaynst erle army nake wherfore cared nat though duke aniou came coutre whan sir gar come castell trygalet coulde nat approche one parte ryuer gaue great assaute many men hurte bothe within without shot fyue dayes togyder sir gar made assautes laste artillary within began fayle freche men ceyued well gentylnesse sir gar caused capitayne come speke vnder saue conducte sayd hym bastot knowe well case ye ye haue artillary within nothyng defende fro sante speares knowe trouthe ye taken force nat saue lyfe none youre company comons countre wyll slee wolde lothe se ye cosyn therfore cou sayle yelde vp fortresse sythe yt desyre ye beare blame doyng departe hen wheder ye lyste ye haue kepte castell long ynough sir quod squyer wolde gladly folowe cousayle dedes armes dede cosyn sir nat yelde vp fortresse alone suche within haue good parte therof haue though holde capitayne sir shall go shewe ye haue said accorde rendre vp shall nat say nay wyll kepe styll whatsoeuer adueture fall shall take suche parte well said quod sir gar dete whan ye wyll knowe entent bastot manlyon retourned castell trygalet called company toguyder ther shewed sayeng sir gar demaunded thought best counsayled toguyder longe space wolde abyde aduenture sayd howe stronge ynough wolde departe said howe good tyme seynge artillary sawe well howe duke aniou cruell comons thoulous carcasson townes sore displeased great domages done thynges consydred concluded yelde vp castell might safely conducted castell culyer whiche kepte companyons fronter tholousin thus capitayne retourned agayne host speke sir gar agreed desyres sawe well castell wolde nat lightely wonne assaute without losse moche people prepared departe trussed baggage moche pyllage toke best lefte resydue sit gar conueyed culyer without daunger thus frenche men tyme gate castell trygalette sir gar dyd gyue castell co men countre dyd
