rase downe ye se neuer none sithe wolde reedify agayne fro then sit gar wente towarde castell nantylleur standyng laundes nere castell lameu wente thyderwarde one shewed hym yt castell nantylleur voyde departed kepte thane sir gar taryed selde deuysed best seneshall besen sayd sir castell nantylleur bayliwyke ought parteyne erle foiz praye let haue shall make kepte proper coste charge man wyll hurte contrarye shall neuer entre therin sir quod tholous sayeth well valyant man better another well quod sir gar content thus castell natylleur delyuered seneschall nobesen incontynent rode thyder founde clene voyde newly fortifyed broken heset therin capitayne squyer countre called fortefey saynt poule retourned siege maluoysen ye duke also thyder come sir gar company shewed duke done siege endured vi wekes nighe euery day scrimysshinge barryers laste withoute stopped water sesterns began drie sixe wekes fell nat droppe rayne season drie hote wt ease ynoughe reason fayre ryuer whan wtin sawe case sore abasshed sawe well coude nat long endure wyne hadde plentie fresshe water fayled thane aduysed fall treatie duke dyde raymonde de lespee purchased saue conduct go hoost speke duke dyd sayd sir ye wyll courtesse company shall render youre handes castell maluoysen curtesy wolde ye quod duke shulde shewe departe waye owne cou treis entre nat forteresse holdeth agaynst v ye get shall delyuer ioselyn shall make beerdes without rasoure sir quod raymonde shall dete shall haue v bagges baggage haue wonne armes great aduenture duke studyed lytell sayd content ye bere moche ye may beare male somers none otherwise ye haue prisoner ye delyuer v co tent raymonde thus within deted yelded vp castell duke anto raymonde de lespe tourned came frenche serued duke aniowe longe tyme went italy dyed ascrimysshe naples whan duke aniou duke sauoy made voyage howe garison castell lourde cast downe disconfyted great dilygence erle foiz made cap xxiiii thus quod knight duke aniou gatte castell maluoysen wherof great ioye made kepte knyght bygore called sir cyquart luperier gaue erle foiz kepeth yet wyll longe lyueth hath made capitayne knyght bygore one owne lynage called sir raymon de lane whan duke aniou possessyon maluoysen delyuered countrey fro englysshmen fro pyllers conntre wente layd seige castell lourde therle foiz douted greatly duke aniou bycause cam nere hym wyste nat entended therle foiz assembled togyder knightes squyers sent aboute dyuers garysons sette brother sir arnolde guyllame towne morlens two hundred speares towne panne sir peter cabeston cite lestrade two hundred speares sir monant nonalles went towne hart let hundred speares arnolde gehe rell towne montgeberell hu dred speares sit foulquant dortery towne sanetere hundred speares espaygne lyon sente mount marson two hundred speares castell bierne well prouyded men warre erle himselfe laye styll castell ortayse florens sir quod hath great plentie florens sir quod houre thynke hath well nobre xxx tymes hundred thousande lorde lyuenge large lyberall gyueng gyftes demaunded hym maner people lyberall answered said straungers knightes squyers comyng countre haraldes mynstrels euery man speketh hym none departeth fro without reward refuse gyfte nat content saynt mary sir entent kepeth moche money wher dothe get renenues great gader toguyder suche treasure sir wolde gladly knowe pleased well sir knight ye shall know ye haue demau ded metwo thynges first ye haue demau ded entent kepeth suche treasure shall shewe therle foiz alway douteth warre therle arminake also busynesse neighbour frenche kyng kynge englande wolde nat wyllingly displease hath alwayes dissymuled bytwene duryng wary season vnto present tyme neuer armed hym selfe party hath alwayes euer good case bothe party saye ye shall saye youreselfe whane ye haue one knowlege hym herde speke one knowe order state house ye shall se daye moost sage prince worlde none great lorde nother frenche kyng kyng englande yt wyll wyllingly haue yuell wyll neighbour kyng arragon kyng nauer estemeth lytell wyll fynde mo men armes reason suche frendes hath gote wt giftes money hath treasure bothe kynges haue herde hym saye whan kyng cyper countre byerne moued haue gone voiage holy sepulture hadde thought tyme haue made suche iourney frenche kyng kyng englande taken enterprise howe ther shulde haue ben lorde shulde haue brought suche company wolde haue done yet mynde parte one cause gadereth suche treasure prince wale season raigned countre acquitayne beyng burdeux ryuer geronde thought haue made hym warre prince manassyde coutre bierne wolde haue hym haue holde cou tre hym erle sayd wolde nat sayd howe countre bierne free lande ought homage man worlde prince tyme great sore feared said howe wolde compell hym force therle armynake lorde dalbret loued nat therle foiz bycause suche victory hadde tytled prince euer eare entysed hym haue made warre agaynst erle foiz voiage prince made spayne brake purpose also sir iohn chandos chefe cou sayle prince agaynst prince shulde make watre erle erle foiz loued right well sir iohan chandos hym erle douted prince bycause fierse coragious therfore gadered togyder moche treasure coude gette thentent therwith defende hym nede set great tayles tax coutre euery towne whiche yet endureth shall long lyueth euery fyre euery yere two fra kes ryche beare poore therby gadered yet dothe great rich people payeth marueylous good wyll reason therof nother englysshe frenche robber reyuers yt dothe hurte value one peny countre sauegarde iustice truely kepte doyng iustyce right cruell moost rightfull lorde yt nowe lyueng wordes came towne turney shulde rest night knight seased talkyng remembred well lefte agaynst next day lodged signe starre toke ease supper tyme capitayne maluoysin called sir raymonde lane came se v supped v brought hym four flaggons best wyne drake iourney two knightes talked long togider whan late knight departed retourned castell maluoysin next mornyng mounted horse departed fro tourney passed gyde ryuer lysse rode towarde cytie tarbe entred bigore lefte waye lourde bagueres castell mountgaylliard lyfte hande rode towarde vyllage called teracimytat dyd coost came wode lande lorde barbasan came nere castell called matheras entre countre layre knight said sir iohan beholde place layre beholde well aduyse cou tre semed right strage thought selfe lost ther nat ben company knight remebred wordes knight shewed ii thre dayes countre layre megeant lourde sayd hym sir ye shewed last daye whan shulde coutre layre ye wolde shewe maner megeant lourde howe dyed true sir knyght come ryde shall shewe rode nere hym wordes sayde sir season peter danchyne helde castell castell ortyngas haue shewed tyme garison lourde sotyme rode forthe aduenture farre fro garyson howe nat alwayes aduauntage ye maye beholde castell barbason castell martheras wherin alwayes many men warre garysons bagueces tourney mountgalyarde salenges benache gorre tarbe frenche townes garysons whan garysons knewe lourde rode outher towardes tholous carcassone tha wolde laye busshementes somtyme take fro lourde praye pyllage somtyme scaped without rencounter tyme fortuned eruaulton saynt colombe mengeant saynte cornyle nombre sixscore speares good men warre departed fro lourde moutayns bytwene two ryuers lysse lesse rode nere tholous retournyng founde medowes great nombre beestes ox keen hogges mottons lambes also toke dyuers good men countre prisoner droue pray shewed capitayne tarbe squyer gascoyne called erualton bysette experte man armes howe garyson lourde abrode comyng homewarde great praye sente lorde benache enguerose eldest sonne sir raymonde also lorde barbason certifyeng howe wolde ryde agaynst theym lourde knyghtes squyers countrey bigore agreed ryde forthe assembled guyder tourney ther bourcke spaygne came fro garyson saynt bearte nombre two hundred speares spyes abrode countrey knowe lourde dyde syde lourd abrode spy knowe men warre abrode lette enterprise moche dyde yt eyther partie knewe dyde whane lourde knewe howe frenche garysons abrode taryed tourney doute toke cousayle might best saue pray determyned departe company two one company driue praye varlett go couertly lane bourge passe waye bridge tourney passe ryuer lesse bytwene tourney lymosyn company ryde batayle mountayns make shewe go agayne countre layre martheras fall bytwene barbason mountgalyarde sayd mete toguyder mountgaylliarde shulde sauegarde shall soone lourde thus ordayned dyde bastarde caruyllacke guyllonet harmyes perot burcyer iohn calleuyn basile reed squier fourtie speares varlett pray toke waye lane burge passe ryuer bridge bitwene tourney maluoysin thynkynge mete togyder bytwene eynitat moutgaylyarde departed co pany erualton restue erualton sait colombe megeant saynt coruyle fourscore men armes nat x varlettes among made self redy rode close toguyder euer lokyng enemyes knewe well abrode watche lyke maner lourde taken aduise cou sayle howe retourne lykewise frenche men tooke counsayle howe might encounter enemyes sir monant barbasan erualton bysset sayd companye sir knowe well howe lourde abrode feldes driueth great praye many prisoner shulde great dyspleasure v shulde scape therfore lette v put selfe two busshementes company ynough ordayned erualton bourge spayne sir raymonde benache anguerot lane hundred speres shulde kepe passage tourney knewe well lourd praye must nedes passe ryuer lysse ordayned lorde barbasone erualton byset hundred speares shulde ryde aduentures deted lorde benache bourge spaygne put selfe busshment bytwene maluoysin turney company rode toke waye nowe called layre mette lourde whan eche sawe lyghted made redy fyght came eche agaynst cryeng cryes saynt george lourd lady bigore eche came hande stroke foyninge speares eche great space herde reported ther first brunt none ouerthrowen whan eche great space foyned eche caste downe speares toke ax gaue therwith eche great horrible stroke euery man matche maner fought toguyder two houres whan fought long lacked brethe wolde fayre easely departe go sytte downe dyke syde full water put bassenettes refresshe selfe whan well refresshed putte bassenetes retourned agayne fight beleue nat suche busynesse batayle well fought sithe batayle yt bretayne xxx agaynst many martheras bigore thus fought hande hande erualton saynt colombe poynt haue ben disconfyted asquyer countre called guyllonet salynges erualton saint colombe varlet stode sawe batayle fought nat ther none sayd thyng hym whan sawe maister almost vttraunce sorie came maister tooke axe handes sayd erualton go waye rest ye lengar fight axe wente squyer gaue suche stroke heed astonied nere hande fallen erthe whane guyllonet felte hym selfe stryken sore displeased came agaynst varlet haue stryken hym varlet stepte vnder stroke enbrased squyer sore traueyled long fightyng varlet ouerthrewe hym wrestlyng vnder hym tha varlet sayde shall slee without thou wylte yelde thy selfe maister thy mayster quod squyer erualton saynt colombe quod varlette whome thou haste fought season squyer sawe nat vauntage vnder varlette daggar redy stryke hym yelded hym rendre body prisoner lourde within fyftene dayes rescue rescue seruyce dyd varlet maister sir iohn assure ther many feates armes done many ouerthrowen taken prisoner yelde selfe certayne space tarbe come lourde fought day hande hande erualton set mengeant saynt basyll dyde many feate armes bytwene fought long till wery coude ayde selfe lengar ther slayne place two capitayns geant lourde parte erualton bysset ceased batayle agrement bothe party wery coude scante holde ax handes vnarmed refresshe selfe lefte armure place lourde bare awaye mengeant slayne frenche men bare erualton bysset tarbe thentent batayle shulde remembraunce wher two squyers fought set crosse stone beholde yonder crosse wordes came crosse sayd soules pater noster aue maria faythe sir quod gladde haue herde sharpe busynesse lytell people sir became wente praye shall shewe quod came te tourney besyde maluoysin haue passed ordayned ther founde busshment bourge spaygne brake busshment lourde coude nat recule backe remedy adueture selfe tell trouthe sore fight long endured lengar martheras erualton spayne dyde marueylous armes axe hande soeuer strake therwith went erth bygge well made nat ouer charged moche flesshe toke ther owne handes two capitayns burge coruyle perot palatyne bierne slayne squier nauar called ferado myrando expert man armes busynesse sayd bourge spaygne slewe hym sayd ouercome heat harnesse finally praye rescewed taken slayne wente therwith ther thre saued selfe varlettes departed wente ouer ryuer lysse thus became aduenture lourde neuer loste moche dyde courtesly raunsomed dyuers delyuered exchaunge one nother dyuers fought place layre taken lourd therfore euery parte courteyse one another raunsomyng companyons ah saynt mary sir quod bourge spaygne bygge man ye speke yea sir truely quod gascoyne none lyke hym strength body therfore erle foiz hath hym euer company paste nat thre yere dyde sporte great dede shall shewe christmas day erle foiz helde great feest plentifull knightes squyers vsage colde day erle dyned hall hym great company lordes dyner deted hall wente vp galarye xxiiii stayres heyght whiche galarye ther great chymney wherin made fyre whan therle ther tyme small fyre erle loued great fyre hadde woode ynoughe bierne wode ynoughe daye great frost colde whan erle galarye sawe fyre lytell sayde knightes squiers hym sir small fyre day colde erualton spayne went downe stayres beneth courte sawe great meny ass laden woode serue house wente toke one grettest ass woode layde hym backe went vp stayres galary dyde cast downe asse woode chymney ass fete vpwarde wherof erle foiz great ioye hadde marueyle strength howe alone came vp stayres asse woode necke toke great pleasure tale knyght sir espaygne de leon shewed wherby thought iourney moche shorter shewyng mater passed pase layre castell martheras batayle rode nere castell barbason whiche stronge fayre within leage tarbe whiche sawe v fayre waye costyng ryuer lysse comyng fro mountayns rode fayre easely leysar refresshe horse shewed ryuer castell towne mountgalyarde waye laye lourde thane came remembraunce demaunde knight howe duke aniou whan countrey castell maluoysin yelded hi came lourde dyd right good wyll shewed said whanne duke aniowe departed frome maluoysin withall host passed ouer ryuer lysse bridge tourney wente lodged baguiers good ryuer goynge tarbe ryuer tourney cometh nat thyder falleth ryuer garon besyde moutunllyon duke went layd siege lourde sir peter erualton bierne iohan brother peter danchyn erualton restue erualton saynt colombe mengeant lyueng ferando myrando olyuer barbe burge coruyllacke burge canuse certayne copanions beyng within lourde whan well enfourmed duke comynge thyder fortifyed garyson agaynst hym helde towne lourde saute duke made whiche fyftene dayes contynually endured many feates armes done duke ordayned many instrumentes warre saute finally towne wonne loste neyther man woman good withdrawen castell knewe well length towne wolde nat holde closed dyke pale whan towne lourde frenche men great ioye lodged towne roude castell whiche nat prignable without long siege duke taryed sixe wekes lost wanne without coulde hurte within castell standeth rounde rocke made suche maner man coude aproche scalynge wyse one entre barryers many scrimysshes many feates armes done dyuers knightes squyers fraunce hurte suche wolde prese nere whan duke sawe howe coude nat haue entent gette castell lourde fell treatie capitayne within offred moche money gyue vp garyson knight great valyantesse excused hymselfe said howe garyson nat parteyned herytage kynge englande sayd howe coude nat sell gyue putte awaye without shulde tray tour whiche wyse wolde trewe naturall lorde durynge lyfe moreouer sayd whan castell delyuered hym condycion whiche sware solempnely faythe prince wale hande yt shulde kepe castell lourde agaynst men durynge lyfe excepte agaynst kyng englande duke coude neuer haue answere hym gyfte promyse coulde make whan duke aniou cousaile sawe howe coude haue nothynge el sawe loste payne dislodged departynge clene brent towne duke aniowe drewe backe coostynge bierne rode towarde mount marsen knowledge howe erle foiz fortifyed garysons men warre wherof nothyng dyscontent displeased knyght squyers bierne helde lourde agaynst hym erle foyz haue shewed doughted greatly duke aniowe thoughe duke dyde hym hurte erle arminake lorde dalbret wolde haue duke haue made hym warre duke wyll whyle lodged bytwene mounte marsen boce dalbret sent erle ortaise sir peter beule erle receyued honorably lodged hym castell ortaise made hym good chere coude gaue hym mulettes courser men great gyftes sente hym duke aniowe foure courser two allans spaygne fayre good secrete treaty bytwene erle sir peter beule whiche treaty man knewe entent therof good space suche euydent token appered supposed somewhat mater shall shewe tyme shall come tarbe anone duke aniou made voyage tholous erle foiz sende letter certayne messangers lourde cosyn sir peter erualton bierne desyring hym come speke hym ortayse whan knyght reed therles letter sawe notable message dyuers ymaginacions wyst nat wheder might go abyde thynges consydred sayd wolde go bycause wyse wolde displease erle whan departed fro lourde sayd iohan bierne brother presens companyons garyson brother iohan erle foyz hath sente nat tell sythe pleasure speke wyll go hym feare greatly shalbe requyred gyue vp fortresse lourde duke aniou whan countrey costed bierne entred nat therin erle foyz hath longe entended haue castell maluoysin entent lorde lanede bourge fronters comynges bigore knowe nat treatie ther made bytwene hym duke aniou one thynge saye playnly longe lyue shall neuer yelde vp garyson myne owne naturall lorde kyng engla de wherfore brother iohan case stablysshe myne absence capitayne ye shall swere faythe gentylnesse ye shall kepe castell lyke maner fourme lyfe dethe ye fayle nat iohan byerne sware fulfyll desyre sir peter erualton wente ortayse lyghted signe moone whan thought tyme wente castell ortayse therle great ioye receyued hym made hym syt borde shewed great semblant loue coude dyner said cosyn peter haue speke wt dyuers thyng wherfore wyll ye departe nat without leaue knight swered sayd sir shall nat departe tyll pleasur thirde day erle foiz said vnto hym presens vycount gousserant brother lorde dachyn bigore dyuers knightes squyers erle sayd loude yt euery man might hym peter sende ye become wyll ye knowe duke aniou wolde moche yuell bycause garison lourde whiche ye kepe whiche cause lande nere hade ouerron good frendes nat opynion dyuers company hateth bicause say howe maynteyne sustayne yon bycause ye byerne nat mete haue yuell wyll great prince duke aniowe wherfore comaunde ye wyll eschewe displeasure faythe lignage ye owe ye yelde vp garyson lourde handes whan knyght herde wordes sore abasshed studyed lytell remembringe aunswere might make sawe well erle spake good faithe howe thynges consydred sayd sir true owne faythe homage poore knyght yo blode countrey castell lourde wyll nat delyuer ye haue sent ye lyst holde kyng englande sette none lyueng wyll delyuer whan erle foyz herde answere blode chafed yre sayd drawyng daggar treatour sayest thou nay heed thou hast nat sayd nought therwith strake knight wounded hym fyue place knyght barone yt durst steppe bytwene knyght sayd ah sit ye gentylnesse sende slee yet stroke daggar therle comauded cast prison downe depe dyke ther dyed wound yuell loked vnto ah saynt mary quod knyght nat great crueltie whatsoeuer knyght thus lette one aduyse hym well displease angry pardon helde one cosyn germayne vicout chateau bein heryter eight monethes towre ortaise prison rau somed fourtie thousande frankes sir quod hath erle foyz chyldren truely sir quod wyfe hath two yonge knightes yt bastardes ye shall se loueth well hym selfe called sir iohan sir gracyen demaunded yf euer maryed yea truely quod yet wyfe nat hym sir wher sir quod nauar kyng cosyn doughter kynge loyes nauar yet demaunded euer erle chyldren yes sir fayre sonne father harte countrey loued hym hym countre biern rest peace hath ben sith debate stryfe maryed suster therle armynake sir quod became sonne maye knowen sir shall shewe nat nowe mater ouer longe nere towne ye se therwith left knight peace came tarbe toke oure lodgynge starre taryed day towne great easement bothe man horse good hay otes fayre ryuer nexte day masse mounted horsbacke departed fro tarbe came towne called iorre whiche valyantlye alwayes helde agaynst lourde passed towne withoute entred countrey bierne knight stode styll sayd sir beholde bierne stode crosse waye knight aduysed bym whiche waye take outher morlens panne laste toke way morlens ridynge ouer laudes bierne whiche right playne thafie demaunded hym towne panne nere v sayde yes shewed steple howe distauce farther semed anyuel way ryde bycause myres knewe nat countre nat farre then castell lourde demaunded capitayne sayd seneschall bigore capitayne admytted kynge englande brother ser peter bierne ye haue herde trewe sir quod dyde neuer go se erle foiz answered sayd sithe dethe brother neuer came company hath ben often erle peter dauchyn erualton restue erualton saynt colome sir quod hath erle foiz made amendes dethe knight sorie dethe yes truely sir quod right sorie dethe amendes knowe none without secrete penau ce mass prayer hathe hym knightes sonne called iohan byerne gracyous squyer erle loueth hym right well ah sir quod duke aniowe wolde fayne haue castell lourde ought well content erle foyz whan slewe suche knight owne cosyn accomplysshe desyre faythe sir quod anone duke came frenche kyng kynge sent countre sir roger spaygne presydent parlyament chambre parys letter sealed makyng mencion howe kynge dyde gyue erle foiz cou tie bygore duryng lyfe holde ye crowne fraunce erle thanked greatly kyng great loue shewed great gyfte without request makynge sayd sir roger spaygne coude saye shewe erle wyse wolde take gyfte toke castell maluoysin bycause fre lande castell purteynauce holdeth man god also auncyently parteyneth enherytaunce frenche kyng meanes duke aniowe dyd gyue hym erle sware mysed take condycion shuld neuer sette man shulde yuell realme fraunce dyde suche ther feared moche thenglisshe men frenche garysons gascoyne bernoyse durst nat tonne countre foyz howe peace made bitwene duke berry therle foiz begynninge warre bitwene therle foiz erle armynake cap xxv mater sir espayne de leon shewed right well co tented euery nyght assoone lodgynges wrote euer al hat herde day better therby haue remebrau ce writyng best remebrauce may rode sayd mornyng morlens came said sir haue forget demaude whan ye shewed aduentures foiz dyde dissymule duke berrey wyues doughter suster therle armynake wheder duke berry made warre howe dyd howe dyd quod knight shall shewe tyme past duke berrey wolde moche yuell coude ymagyn nowe meanes whiche ye shall hereof whan ye come ortaise accorded sir cause duke shulde displeased hym helpe god knight non shal shewe cause whan charles frenche kyng father kyng charles nowe dyssessed realme frauce deuyded two partes gouernyng therof duke aniou entended go italy dyd gaue v rule two bretherne duke berry duke burgoyne ye rule duke berry gouernynge languedocke duke burgoyne ruled languedoyle picardy whan languedocke vnderstode yt duke berry gouernyng ouer sore abasshed specially tholous knewe well ye duke sore taker golde syluer sore oppressar people also ther carcassone rouergue breton tholousins whiche duke aniou left coutre robbed pylled brute ran yt duke berry maynteyned thetent ouer maister ye good townes season speke duke berrey nat coutre kyng flau ders tholous great puissant parceyued howe frenche kyng yonge greatly busyed flaunders ayde vncle duke burgoyn sawe well howe dayly robbed pilled briton wyste nat sent treated erle foiz desyring hym certayne money offred hym euery moneth payed wolde take gouernynge tholous coutre tholousin also desyred townes lykewise desyred hym bycause knewe hym iuste man rightwyse iustyce redouted enemyes fortunate businesse also tholous loued hym euer good neyghbour thus toke charge gouernynge sware maynteyne kepe countre ryght agaynst men wolde wrong therto reseruyng onely frenche kynges persone sette men warr watche wayes passage robber pyllars vsed passe daye toke slewe drowned robeston tholousin mo four hudred wherby gate great grace honoure tholous carcassone besyers mountpellyer good townes renome ran fraunce howe languedoke tourned taken lorde erle foyz duke berry souerayne toke therat great displeasure therle foiz great hate bycause medled farre busynesse fraunce wherby maynteyned tholous styll rebellyon agaynst sente men warre countre fiersly driuen backe agayne erles men wheder wolde fayne drawe backe orels loste shulde haue wonne duke berrey sore displeased wt erle foiz sayd howe therle foiz presumptuous proudest knight worlde duke coude suffre good spoken hym howe made hym warre erle foiz alwayes townes castelles well prouyded none durste entre lande whan duke berry came languedocke left rule wolde tha lengar exercyse agaynste duke displeasure rested styll certayne space nowe shall shewe meanes peace norisshed bytwene ten yere paste lady ellyanour comynges nowe coutesse bouloyne nere cosyn therle foiz right enherytour countie comynges thoughe erle armynake hadde possession came ortaise therle foiz brought yonge doughter thre yere age therle cosyn made good chere demaunded busynesse wheder goynge sir quod goynge arragon myne vncle aunte erle vrgell purpose abyde haue great displeasure abyde husbande sir iohan boloyne thought wolde haue recouered myne enherytaunce comynges fro erle armynake kepeth fro hath suster prisone wyll thyng mater softe knight wyll nothynge take ease eate drinke spende hath folysshlye thynke whan erle wyll take pleasure therfore wyll lengar abyde hym haue brought doughter wyll delyuer handes prayenge kepe norisshe vp trust reason lygnage ye wyll nat fayle thus haue hoope ye wyll kepe moche payne gette awaye countrey handes husbande father bycause take armynake myne aduersaries wolde gladly steale doughter awaye bycause enherytour comynges therfore haue brought vnto wherfore sir requyre fayle nat busynesse sure father husbande whan knoweth yt haue lefte wyll right ioyfull hath sayd often tymes doughter shulde put hym great doute whan erle well herde wordes lady elyanour cosyn right ioyfull ymagined selfe howe childe shuld hym pleasure meanes mother haue ferme peace wt enemyes el marry highe place ennemyes shulde doute hym therby answered lady said madame cosyn ye desyre shall right good wyl bounde therto lynage doughter cosyn shall kepe well though myne owne proper chylde sir quod thanke thus yong doughter bouloyne abode erle foiz ortaise neuer departed then sithe lady mother went arragon hath sithe one twyse tose doughter neuer desyred haue agayne therle kepte well owne chylde purpose meane peace shewed erle ymagined gette loue agayne duke berrey nowe present tyme duke berry hath gret desyre marryed thynke herde auygnon pope cosyn germayne ladyes father shewed howe duke berrey desyreth haue maryage ah saynt mary sir quod howe word right agreable hath done great pleasure euer ye haue shewed whiche shall nat loste shall putte remebraunce cronycled god wyll sende grace retourne towne valencenes borne sir sore displeased one thynge shall shewe faithe hyghe valyant prince erle foiz shulde without laufull issue sir quod knight one one shulde ioyouse prince worlde wolde coutre sir quod lande withoute heyre nay sir vycount castell bone cosyn germayne heyre valyant man armes quod nay faythe sir quod therfore erle loueth hym nat thynketh make two bastarde ne right valyant heyres thynketh marry highe lygnage hath golde syluer ynough wherby thynketh gette theym wyues suche shall ayde conforte sir quod maye well howe thyng nat reasonable bastardes shulde made herytours landes wherfore nat sir quod lacke good heyres se nat howe spaynierdes haue crowned henry bastarde kyng also portyngale crowned bastarde kynge hath sene worlde dyuers realmes bastardes force hathe reygned nat wyllyam conquerour bastarde sonne duke normandy conquered englande kynge kynges syth discended fro hym sir quod might well ther thyng may fall armynake right stronge therby countrey shalbe euer warre stryfe sir pray shewe iust cause warre first moued bytwene foiz armynake wyll shewe knight ensure marueylous warre saye eche haue cause sir aunciently hu dred yere past lorde byerne called gascone ryght valyant man armes buryed freres right solempnely ortaise ye may se persone stature body lyfe tyme pycture made latyn whiche yet gascone lorde bierne two doughters eldest maryed erle armynake thane yongest erle foiz nephue kyng aragon yet therle foiz beareth armes discended aragon armes palle golde goules fortuned lorde biern gret warre agaynst kynge spayne came bisquay wt gret nombre men warre entre bierne lorde gascone bierne whan enformed comyng assembled people sydes might get men warre wrote letter two sonnes lawe therle armynake therle foiz yt shulde come serue ayde hym defende herytage letter sene erle foiz sone myght assebled people prayed frendes moche fyue hu dred knight squiers armed two thousande varlettes speares dartes pauesses fote came countre bierne serue father hym great ioye passed bridge ortaise ouer ryuer lodged bytwene sanetere thospytall kyng spayne xxm men lodged nat far then ther lorde gascon bierne therle foiz taryed therle armynac thought euer yt wolde coe taried hi thre dayes iiii day therle armynac sent letter haraulde lorde gascoine bierne sente hym worde howe myght nat come howe hadde nothyng beare armes countre bierne whan lorde gascoyne herde tidynges excusacions sawe howe heshulde haue none ayde conforte erle armynake sore abasshed demaunded counsayle erle foiz barones bierue howe shulde maynteyne selfe sir quod erle foiz sithe assembled let v go fight enemyes counsayle taken ordayned people twelfe hudred men armes sixe thousande men fote erle foiz tooke first batayle came kyng spaygne sette lodgynges great batayle fierse slayne mo ten thousande spayniard therle foiz toke prisoner kynge spaygnes sonne brother sent father lawe lorde gascoyne bierne areregarde spaynyerdes disconfyted erle foiz chased porte saynt adrian bisquay kynge spayne toke abbey dyde vesture monke el ben taken erle foiz retourned lorde gascone bierne made hym good chere reason saued honour kepte countre bierne whiche el lykely haue ben loste bycause batayle disconfyture erle foiz made spaygnierdes takyng kynges sonne brother lorde bierne hadde peace spaygnierdes owne wyll whan lorde gascoyne retourned ortaise baron foiz bierne present hesayd sonne foiz fayre sonne ye true faithfull sonne ye haue saued myne honour cou trey erle armynake hath maryed myne eldest doughter hath ercused hym selfe fro busynesse wolde nat come defe de myne herytage wherin shulde haue part wherfore saye suche parte shulde haue reason doughter hath forfait lost clerely enheryte sonne foiz dyscease hoole lande heyres euer desyre wyll commaunde subiectes seale accorde agre answered howe well contente thus meanes haue shewed aunciently erles foiz lordes countre bierne bare crye armes name profyte therof howe arminake nat clay quyte cause warre twene foiz armynake faythe sir quod ye haue well declared mater neuer herde nowe yt knowe shall putte perpetuall memorie god gyue grace retourne countrey sir durste wolde fayne demaunde one thynge insydent erle foiz sonne dyed thafie knyght studyed lytell sayd sir maner dethe right pytuous wyll nat speke therof whan ye come ortaise ye shall fynde wyll shewe ye demaunde helde peace rode tyll came morlens great vertuousnesse largesse therle foiz maner pytuouse dethe gascone erles sonne cap xxvi next day departed roode dyner moutgarbell ercye dranke sonne setting came ortaise knight lighted owne lodgynge lyghted mone wher dwelte squier erles erualton de pyne well receyued bycause fraunce sir spayne leon wente castell therle founde hym galarye dyned lytell erles vsage alwayes hyghe noone arose bedde supped euer mydnight knight shewed hym howe come thider incontynent sente ladgynge lorde worlde yt moost desyred speke straugers tidynges whan erle sawe made good chere reteyned house wher bycause brought boke whiche made conteplacion vmslance boesme duke luzenbourge brabant whiche boke called melyader conteyninge songes baladdes rundeaux vyrelayes whiche gentyll duke made tyme whiche imagynacyon gadered toguyder whiche boke erle foiz gladde se euery night supper reed theron hym whyle reed none durst speke worde bycause wolde shulde well vnderstande wherin tooke great solace whan came mater questyon wolde speke nat gascoyne good fayre frenche estate house shall somewhat recorde taryed thereso long might well parceyue knowe moche erle gascone foiz yt tyme fyftie yere age nyne say haue tyme sene many knightes kynges prince neuer sawe none lyke hym personage fayre forme well made vysage fayre sanguyne smylyng eyen gray amorous lyst set regarde euery thyng parfite nat praised moche loued ought beloued hated ought hated wyse knyght highe enterprise good counsayle neuer myscreant hym sayd many orison euery daye nocturne psalter matyns lady holy goost crosse dirige euery day gaue fyue florens small money gate poore folkes loue god large courtesse gyftes coulde ryght well take parteyned hym delyuer agayne ought loued hou de beestes wynter somer loued huntyng neuer loued folly outrage foly large euery moneth wolde knowe spended tooke countre receyue reuenewes serue notable son saye xii receyuouts euer fro ii monethes two monethes two shulde serue receyte two monethes ende wolde change put two offyce one trusted best shulde comptroller hym shulde accompt comptroller shulde accopt hym rolles bokes written thaccoptes remayne styll therle certeyne cofers chambre whiche ofte tymes wolde take money gyue lord knyghtes squyers suche came hym none shulde departe fro without gift yet dayly multiplyed treasure resyst aduetures fortune douted good easy acquayntance euery man amorously wolde speke shorte counsayle answer four secretary risyng must euer redy hande without callynge whan letter delyuered reed wolde calle write agayne el thynge estate therle foiz lyued mydnight whan came chambre hall supper euer hym xii torch brennyng borne xii varlettes standyng table supper gaue gret light hall euer full knightes squyers many table dressed suppe wolde none shulde speke hym table called meate lightlye wylde soule legges wyng alonely day dyd lytell eate drike great pleasure armony instrume te coude right well hym selfe wolde haue songes song wolde gladlye se conseytes fantesies table whan sene wolde sende ye table bruely consydred aduised came court ben many courtes kynges duke prince erles great ladyes neuer none yt well liked ther none reioysed dedes armes erle dyde sene hall chabre court knightes squyers honour goyng vp downe talkyng armes amour honour ther founde maner tidyng euery realme countre ther might herde euery coutre resort valyantnesse erle ther enfourmed moost parte dedes armes yt done spayne portyngale aragon nauar englande scotlande fronters lymitacions lague docke sawe come thyder therle knightes squyers nacyons enformed erle selfe thynges demauded ther enqred howe gascon therles son died ser espayn leon wolde nat shewe thing therof somoch enqred yt aucient squyer notable mashewed ye mater began thus true quod erle foiz lady foiz wife agreeth nat well toguyder haue nat done long season discorde bytwene first moued kyng nauar brother lady kyng nauar pledged selfe lorde dalbret erle foiz prisone fyftie thousande frankes erle foiz knewe kyng nauarr craftie malycious beginnyng wolde nat trust hym wherwt countesse foiz great displeasur indignacyon agaynst erle husbande sayd hym sir ye repute small honour kyng nauar brother wha ye wyll nat trust hym fyftie frankes thoughe ye haue armynakes labrisyence ye haue ought suffyce also ser ye knowe well ye shulde assigne dower whiche mouteth fyftie thousande fra kes whiche ye shulde put hades brother kyng nauarr wherfore sir ye nat yuell payed dame quod ye saye trouthe thought kyng nauarr wolde stoppe payment cause lorde dalbret shulde neuer haue gone oute ortayse shulde haue ben payed last penny sithe ye desyre wyll nat loue loue sonne wordes kyng nauars oblygacion became dettoure erle foiz lorde dalbret delyuered quyte became frenche maryed frauce suffer duke burbone payed ease king nauar fyftie thousande frankes raunsome whiche kyng bou de therle foiz wolde nat sende erle erle foiz sayd wyfe dame ye must go nauarre kynge youre brother shewe hym howe nat well content hym wyll nat sende hath receyued myne lady answered howe redy go comau dement departed rode panpylone kynge brother receyued moche ioye lady dyd message fro poynt poynt kyng answered fayre suster money therle shulde gyue dowre shall neuer go realme nauarr sithe haue possessyon ah sir quod ye lady ye shall sette great hate bytwene therle husbande ye holde purpose dare nat retoure agayne countie foiz husbande wyll slee wyll saye haue disceyued nat tell quod kyng ye wyll outher tarye dete money wyll nat departe fro parteyneth kepe shal neuer go nauer countesse coude haue none answere kyng brother taryed styll nauar durst nat retourne agayne erle foiz whan sawe dealynge kynge nauar began hate wyfe yuell content howe faute returned nat agayne whan hadde done message durst nat knewe well therle husbade cruell toke displeasure thus mater standeth erles sonne called gascone grewe waxed goodly maryed doughter therle armynake fayre lady suster therle nowe lorde bertrande armynake contuctyon maryage ther shulde haue ben peace bytwene foiz armynake chylde fyftene sixtene yere age resembled rightwell father tyme desyred go nauar se mother vncle kynge nauarr whiche anyuell hour hym countre whan come nauarre good taryed mother certayne space toke leaue coude coude nat gette mother nauer haue gone hym foiz demannded erle comaunded hym answered whan departed therle spake nothyng therof therfore lady durst nat go thider taryed styll chylde wente panpylone take leaue kyng vncle kyng made hym great chere taryed hym ten dayes gaue great giftes men also last gyfte kyng gaue hym dethe shall shewe howe whan getylman shulde depte kyng drewe hym parte chambre gaue hym lytell purse full poudre poudre suche creature lyueng dyd ete therof shulde incotynent dye without remedye kynge sayd gascone fayre nephue ye shall shall shewe ye se howe erle foiz father wrongfully hath mother suster gret hate wher sore displeased ought ye howe performe mater father shulde loue agayne mother entent ye shall take lytell powder put meate father maye eate beware man se soone hath eaten shall entende nothynge haue agayne wyfe loue euer whiche ye ought greatly desyre shewe let man knowe kepe secrete el ye lese dede chylde thought kyng sayd hym ben true sayde sir shalbe done ye haue deuysed departed fro panpylone retourned ortayse erle father made hym good chere demaunded tidynges kyng nauar gyftes gyuen chylde shewed hym howe gyuen hym dyuers shewed hym excepte purse pouder ofte tymes yong gascone yuan bastarde brother laye toguyder loued toguyder lyke bretherne lyke arrayed apparelled nere greatnesse one age happened tyme clothes laye toguyder beddes yuan sawe purse gascons cote sayd thyng ye beare euer wherof gascoyne ioye sayd yuan gyue cote ye haue nothyng therwith day gascone pensyue fortuned thre dayes god wolde erle shulde saued gascone brother yuan fell toguyder playeng tennes gascone gaue hym blowe chylde wente father chambre wepte erle hadde herde masse whan erle sawe wepe said sonne yuan aylest thou sir quod gascone hath beaten worthy beaten quod therle incontynent suspected thyng faithe sir sithe retourned nauar beareth priuely brest purse full pouder wote nat wyll therwith hath sayde one twyse lady mother shulde shortely agayne grace better loued euer peace quod erle speke shewe man lyuenge sir quod shall erle entred ymaginacyon came houre dyner wasshed sat downe table hall gascone son vsed sette downe seruyce gyue sayes whan sette downe first course erle cast eyen hym sawe strynges purse hangyng bosome blode chauged said gascone coe byder wyll speke thyne eare chylde came erle toke hym bosome founde purse knyfe cut fro bosome chylde abasshed stode styll spake worde loked pale asshes feare began trymble erle foiz opyned purse toke pouder layde trenchour bredde called dogge gaue hym eate assoone dogge eaten first morsell tourned eyen heed dyed incontynent whane erle sawe sore displeased also good cause rose fro table toke knife wolde haue stryken son knightes squyers ran bytwene said sir goddes sake haue mercy nat hastye well enformed first mater ye yuell chylde first worde therle said gascone treatour encrease thyne herytage yt shulde come haue warre hatered frenche kyng kyng engla de kyng spayne kyng nauar kyng arragon yet haue borne male nowe yu woldest murther moueth yuell nature first thou shalt dye stroke stept forthe knife wolde haue slayne knightes squyers kneled downe hym wepynge sayd ah sir haue mercy goddes sake ee nat gascone sonne remebre ye haue chyldren sir cause hym kepte take good enformacion mater paradnenfure knewe nat bare paraduenture nothyng gyltie dede well quod erle incontynent put hym prisone let hym kepte may haue reconyng hym chylde put towre erle toke great many serued sonne departed yet bysshoppe lascalle pan countre suspect dyuers therle cansed put dethe fyftene right horribly cause erle layde sayde coulde none otherwyse knewe ye chyldes secretes wherfore ought haue shewed hym haue said sir gascone sonne beareth purse bosome bycause dyde nat thus dyed horribly wherof great pytie fresshe ioly squyers coutre euer erle serued good men thynge touched erle nere herte well shewed day assembled ortaise noble prelate foiz bierne notable person countrey whan assembled shewed theym wherfore sente howe foude sonne defaute whiche fayd entent putte hym dethe well deserued ye people answered case one voyce sayde sir sauynge grace wyll nat gascoyne shulde dye heyre ye haue mo whan erle herde people howe desyred sonne sowhat refrayned yre thought chastyce hym prisone moneth two sende hym voyage two thre yere tyll might somwhat forget yuell wyll chylde might greatter age knowledge gaue leaue people depart foiz wolde nat departe fro ortaise tyll erle shulde assure gascoyne shulde nat dye loued chylde well erle promysed sayd wolde kepe hym prisone certayne space chastice hym vpon promyse euery man departed gascone abode styll prisone tidynges spredde abrode dyuers place tyme pope gregorie xi auygnon sente cardynall amyens legacion byerne haue come therle foiz businesse tyme came besiers herde suche tidynges neded nat go mater herde howe gascon sonne erle foyz deed sythe haue shewed moche nowe shall shewe howe dyed erle foyz caused sonne kepte darke chambre towre ortayse tenne dayes lytell dyde eate drinke yet ynoughe brought hym euery daye whan sawe wolde go therfro sette lytell therby sayd meate brought hym stode hole entier day dethe wherfore great marueyle lyued longe dyuers reason erle caused hym kepte chambre alone withoute company outher cousayle conforte hym season chylde laye clothes came argued selfe full malencoly cursed tyme euer borne engendred come suche ende day dyed serued hym meate drinke whan came hym sayde gascone meate made care therof sayde sette downe serued hym regarded sawe prison meate stande hole brought hym departed closed chambre dore went erle sayd sir goddes sake haue mercy sonne gascone nere famysshed prisone lyeth thynke neuer dyde eate thynge sythe came prisone haue sene daye euer brought hym lyeng toguyder corner wordes erle sore dyspleased withoute worde spekyng went chambre came prisone anyuell houre tyme lytell knyfe hande pare withall nayles opyned prisone dore came sonne lytell knyfe hande nat ynche hande great dyspleasure thruste hande sonnes throte poynt knife lytell entred throte certayne vayne sayd ah treatour doest nat thou eate thy meate therwith erle departed without doynge sayeng went owne chambre chylde abasshed afrayed comynge father also feble fastynge poynt knyfe lytell entred vayne throte fell downe sodaynly dyed erle scante chambre kepar chylde came hym sayd sir gascone sonne deed deed quod erle yea truely sir quod erle wolde nat beleue sente thyder squyer went came agayne sayd sir surely deed erle sore displeased made great complaynt sonne sayd gascone poore aducnture yuell hour thou wentest nauar se thy mother shall neuer haue ye ioye therle caused barbour shaue hym clothed selfe blacke house moche sore wepyng childe borne freres ortaise buryed thus haue shewed erle foyz slewe gascoyne sonne kynge nauar gaue occasyon dethe phowe sir peter byerne stronge dysease countesse bisquay wyfe cap xxvii whan herde tale dethe gascone sonne erle foyz hadde great pytie therof loue therle father whome founde lorde hyghe recomendacyon noble lyberall curtesse also loue countrey shulde great stryfe tor lacke heyre thanked squyer departed fro hym sawe dyuers tymes erles house talked often tymes hym tyme demau ded hym sir peter byerne bastarde brother therle foyz bycause semed knyght great valure wheder riche maryed squyer aunswered sayd truely maryed wyfe chyldren nat company sir quod shall shewe quod squier pthis sir peter bierne hathe vsage night tyme whyle slepeth wyll ryse arme hym self drawe swerde fyght aboute house nat tell whome gothe bedde agayne whan wakynge seruautes shewe hym howe dyde wolde saye knewe nothymg therof howe lyed sotyme seruautes wolde leaue non armure swerde chabre whan wold thus ryse fynde non armour wolde make suche noyse rumoure though deuylles helle ben chambre demaunded yf great landes wyfe yes truely sir quod lady cometh lande ioyeth profytes therof sir peter bierne hath fourthe parte sir quod wyfe sir castell kynge cosyn father erle bisquay c syn germayne kyng dampeter slewe also wold haue lady haue put prisone toke possession lande long lyued lady nothynge sayd lady countesse bisquay dyssease father madame saue youre selfe kyng dampeter may gette wyll cause dye el put prisone sore displeased bycause sayth ye shulde report beare wytnesse yt caused quene wyfe dye bedde suster duke burbone suster frenche quene wordes sayth beleued rather thane another bycause ye preuy chambre cause lady florens countesse bisquay departed countre smalle company comon vsage flye fro dethe nere men went countrey bascles passed throughe came hyder ortayse erle shewed hym aduenture erle euer pyte ladyes damoselles reteyned abode lady carase great lady countre sir peter byerne brother yonge knyght nat thanne vsage ryse nyghtes dothe nowe erle loued hym well maryed hym lady recouered land sir peter lady sonne doughter mother castell yet yong therfore lady wolde nat leaue father ah saynt mary quod howe dyde sir peter bierne take fantasy first dare nat slepe alone chambre whan slepe ryseth thus maketh synesse thynges marueyled faithe quod squyer hath ben often demaunded therof saythe nat tell wherof cometh first tyme euer dyde night ben day huntynge wodes bisquay chased marueylous great beare ye beare slayne four houndes hurt dyuers none durst come nere sir peter toke swerde burdeanx came great yre bycause houndes assayles beare fought longe hym great parell tooke great payne coulde ouercome hym finally slewe beare retourned lodgyng castell laguedon bisquay made beare brought euery man marueyle greatnesse beest hardnesse ye knight howe durst assayle beare whane countesse bisquayes wyfe sawe ye beare fell sowne great dolour borne chambre day night nexte day sore disconforted wolde nat shewe ayled thirde dayeshe sayd husbande sir shall nat hoole tyll haue pylgrimage saynt iames sir praye gyue leaue go thyder haue sonne adrian doughter husbande agreed therto toke golde towel treasure thought neuer retourne agayne wher husbande toke hede lady dyde pylgrimage made errande go se kynge castell cosyn quene made good chere ther yet wyll nat retourne agayne sende chyldren thus next night sir peter thus chased beare slayne hym slept bedde fatasy toke hym said countesse wyfe knewe well sone sawe beare father dyde one chase chasyng herde voyce sawe nothynge sayd thou chasest wolde hurte therfore thou shalt dye yuell dethe lady remembraunce whan sawe beare herde father saye remembred well howe kynge dan peter strake father heed without cause lykewise feared husbande yet say maynteyneth yt shall dye yuell dethe dothe nothyng yet shall herafter nowe sir haue shewed sir peter byerue ye haue demanded true tale thus thus fell howe thynke quod therby mused great marueyle sayd sir beleue well ye haue sayde sir synde olde writyng auciently suche called goddes goddess pleasure wolde chaunge transforme men beestes foules lykewyse woman might ere knight chasyng forest bisquay paraduenture displeased yt tyme god goddes wherby transformed vnto beare penaunce aunciently acteon chauged vnto hart acteon quod squyer pray shewe storie wolde fayne sir quod accordyng auncyent writynges fynde howe acteon iolye expert knight loued sporte huntynge aboue game day chased wodes harte arose hym marueylous great fayre hunted hym daye lost company seruauntes houdes right desyrous folowe pray folowed fewe harttyll came lytell medowe closed rounde wodes highe tree medowe fayre fountayne whiche dyana goddesse chastyte bayninge selfe damoselles knight cae sodaynly ware farre forwarde coulde nat go backe damoselles abasshad se stra ger ran lady shewed shamed bycause naked whan sawe knyght sayde acteon sente hyder loued lytell wyll nat whan thou arte gone hen place thou shuldest reporte thou haste sene naked damoselles outrage thou hast done thou mayst haue penaunce therfore wyll thou tranformed lykenesse iame harte thou haste chased daye incotynent acteon tourned vnto harte naturally loueth water lykewise might beare bisquay howe lady knewe paraduenture wolde speke tyme therfore ought better excused squier answered sayd sir maye well lefte oure talkynge tyme pof great solemynetie erle foyz made feest faint nycholas tale mastot banlyon shewed sir iohn froyssart cap xxviii amonge solemynities erle foyz kepte hyghe feestes yere kept euer fest saynt nycholas great solemynytie lande great fest ester shewed squier house thirde day came hyder sawe selfe right well apparent day first clergie towne ortayse people men woman chyldren processyon came castell fetche erle fote departed fro castell went clergy processyon churche saynt nycholas clergy sange psalme psalter benedictus dominus deus meus qui docet manus meas ad praelium et digitos meos ad bel lum c whan psalme songe began syng dyde christmas day eester daye pope chapell frenche kynges hym many syngars bysshoppe pauyers sange masse herde good playeng organ euer herde place speke breuely accordyng reason erle foiz right parfyte thynges sage parceyuing hyghe prince dayes none coude co pare hym wytte honour large feest christmas whiche kept euer right solemyne came house many knightes squyers gascone euery man made good sawe burge spayne layde wodde asse fyre toguyder sir espayne de lion shewed force gladde se hym therle foiz made hym good se blant sawe also knightes aragon englande duke lacastres house laye burdeux erle made good chere gaue great gyftes acquaynted selfe knyghtes enformed many thyng fell castell nauar portyngale whiche shall speke whan tyme reth herafter day sawe asquyer gascone called bastot manlyon man fyftie yere age expert man armes hardy semynge lighted lodgynge ortaise signe moone erualton de pyns brought hym somers caryages thoughe ben great barone serued bothe seruautes syluer vessell whan herde name sawe therle foiz euery hym moche honour demauded sir espaygne de lion sayd sir nat squyer departed fro castell trygalet whan duke aniou laye siege maluoysin yes truely quod good man armes good capitayne fell aquayntaunce hym lodged cosyn called erualton capitayn carlate auuergne whome well acquaynted helped aquainted lykewise dyd burge compare tyme talkyng deuysinge armes sytting fyre abyding mydnight therle shulde go supper squiers cosyn began reken vp life dedes armes ben sayeng howe endured moche losse profite demaunded sayd sir iohn haue ye hystorie thyng mater speke answered said coude nat tell tyll shewe forthe mater wyll gladly paradueture haue herde som nat true quod squyer began saye thus first tyme bare armure vnder captall beufz ye batayle poyters happe daye thre prisoner knight two squiers whoe one another four e thousande fra kes next yere pruce erle foyz captall sonne vnder retourne meulx brye founde duchesse normandy duchesse orlyance great nombre ladyes damoselles closed besieged iaquery god nat helped ben enforsed defouled great puissance nobre mo ten thousande ladyes alone ye ayde ladyes dyd sette slayne iaquery mo sixe thousande rebelled neuer sythe yt tyme truse bytwene fraunce englande kyng nauar made warre owne quarell agaynst frenche kyng regent erle foiz retourned owne countre maister captall abode styll kyng nauar wage ayded v made great way frauce specially picardy toke many townes castelles bysshoprike beauuoise amyens lordes feldes ryuers conquered great fynance whan truse fayled bytwene englande fraunce nauarre seased warre toke peace bytwene regent hym kyng englande great puyssance passed see came layde siege towne remus kyng englade sent maister cleremont beamoysin made warre kynge agaynst countrey came kyng englande chyldren od squyer sir iohan thynke ye knowe redy mater howe kyng englande wedded wife howe came charter howe peace made bytwene two kynges true sir quod writyng haue contynue treaty bastot manlyon spake agayne sayde whan peace thus made bitwene two kynges ordayned men warre companyos shulde voyde leaue fortress castels helde maner men warre poore companyons drewe toguyder capitayns tooke counsayle shulde sayde thoughe two kynges haue taken peace toguyder yet muste lyue wente burgoyne capitayns nacyons englysshe gascons spany ardes naue se almayns scottes maner nacyons capitayne foude burgoyne ryuer loyre copany xii thousande one co pany ther thre four thousade good chosen men warre subtell dedes armes might apte aduise batayle take aduantage hardy scale assayle towne castell well sene ye bataile brinay wher ouerthrue costable frauce therle forestz two thousande speares knight squiers vataile dyd great profite copanyons poore riche reason good prisoner townes castels wan bisshoprike l ryuer rone whan ont saynt esprite departed warre made warr pope cardynalles coude nat quyte nat ben tyll founde another remedy pope sent lobardy marque moutferant right valyant knight warre lorde myllayne wha come auignon pope cardynals spake hym suche wyse entreted capitayns englysshe gascons almayns threscore thousande frakes pope cardynals shulde pay certayne capitayns co panyes sir iohan hastourde valyant englysshe knyght sir robert briquet carsnell nandon le bagerant bourge camus dyuers went lobardy gaue vp ye pout saynt esprite route toke vi parte taried hynde sir seguin bate oile sir john ioell sir james plachyn sir john aymery burge piergourt espiot loys rabalt lymosyn iaques tryturell dyuers kepte styll lay saynt clement barell terrare brinay pont saynt denys thospitall ortifart mo xl fortress house conutreis forestz velay base burgoyn ryuer loyre rausomed coutre coude nat quyte v nother payng well otherwise night toke fortresse charite abode yere halfe fro charite puy auuergne sir seguyn batefoile lefte garison anse helde bride auuerne wherby gret profite coutre value cm frankes ryuer loyre orlians ryuer dalyer archprest capitayne neuars good frenche coude nat remedy countre knewe many copanyos desyre sotyme lesse hurte done archprest dyd tyme moche good neuernoise caused ye cite neuers closed el ouerron robbed diuers tymes march townes castelles mo xxvi neyther knight squyer riche man agreed v durst loke house warre made tytell kyng nauar phowe dyuers capitayns englisshe discofited towne saxere frenchman season fell batayle cocherell captall beufz capitayne kyng nauar dyuers knightes squyers company went hym sir iaques planchyn sir iohan ioell went serue hym two hundred speares season kept castell called becke dalyer nere charyte goyng toward barbanoise vnder xl speares made countre mylles greatly profyte saynt purcyn saynt peter de moustier whan herde howe captall mayster constantyne assembled men warre great desyre se hym departed fro garyson xii speares fell company sir iohan ioell sir iaques planchyn without busynesse reencounter came captall thynke sir iohan ye haue redy knowlege became busynesse true quod taken captall beusz sir iohan ioell slayne sir iaques planchyn true quod b tefoyle manlyon also taken howe fortuned metely well ther cosyn myne called bernard terryde dyed portyngale batayle iuberot bernarde vnder sir aymenon pomyers toke rausomed felde thousande frankes gaue good sauecoducte retourne garyson bec dalyer assoone came castell sent seruaunt myne thousande frankes cosyn parys quytaunce season sir iohan aymery englysshe knight greattest capitayne rode forthe costyng ryuer loyre come charite encoutred abusshment lorde rugemot lorde wodnay archprestes men farre stronger taken ouerthrowen raunsomed xxx thousande frankes payed incontynent takyng losse sore displeased sware wold neuer entre owne garyson tyll agayne moche lost assembled togyder great nombre companyons came charyte loyre desyred capitayns ther lamyt carsnell burge piergourt sporte ther desyred v ryde forthe hym demaunded hym wheder wolde ryde faythe wyll passe ye ryuer loyre saint thybalte lette v scale assayle towne castell saxere quod haue sworne auowed wyll nat entre fortresse haue tyll haue sene chyldren sanxere maye gette garyson erles chyldren within iohn loys robert shall well reuenged therby shalbe lordes countre thynke shall lightly come oure entent take hede v lyeng styll dothe v maner fyte true sir quod promysed ryde hym incontynent made v redy fortuued ye oure purpose knowen towne sanxere tyme ther capitayn valyant squyer goyne lowe marchesse called guyssharte albygon toke great hede kepe well towne castell sanxer chyldren within sir guysshart moke brother abbey saynt thybalt whiche nere sanxere monke sent charyte ryuer loyre brother beare certayn rausome thider yt townes owed couynant toke hede knewe entente howe nat tell name capitaynes nombre houre shulde departe howe determyned passe ryuer porte saynt thybalte retourned went sanxere shewed brother oure myndes therle bretherne prouyded remedy sente knightes squyers berry burbonoyse capitayns garysons therabout foure hundred speares good men warre made abusshment two hundred speares without towne sanxere wode knewe nothyng sonne goynge downe departed fro charyte rode good pase tyll came penly porte hadde redy bootes barge passe v ouer oure horse paste ouer ryuer loyre ordayned ouer mydnight bycause ye daye came ordayned hundred speares abyde kepe oure horse bootes remynaunt v passed forthe frenche busshment whan paste quarter myle brake busshment rode lefte behynde v ryuer syde anone disconfyted slayne taken horse wonne botes arested mounted horse came v spurres soone towne cryed lady saxere erle hym selfe men bretherne sir loyes sir robert made busshement thus inclosed partes hors backe assoone cae v lighted afote assayled v fiersly thynge moost greued v coude nat enlarge selfe fight suche narowe waye closed bothe side hay hedge vyngardes also enemyes suche knewe coutre rydden gette vyngardes dyd hurt v sore castyng stone coude nat go backe moche payne gette towne stode hygh mou tayne sore traueyled sir iohn aymery hurt souerayne capitayn hades sir guysshart albygon toke hym prisoner moche saue lyfe put hym house ye towne made hym layde bedde sayd owner house kepe well prisoner se woundes staunched lyue shall paye xx thousande frankes sir guysshart lefte priso er retourned batayle quytte hymselfe lyke good man armes wt chyldren saxere come thider ayde countreis sir guysshart dalphyn lorde marney sir gerarde sir wylliam burbone lorde cousant lorde de la pier lorde de la palys lorde neutry lorde de la coise lorde syette dyuers say sir batayle right fell cruell defeded self long might bothe part slayne dyuers persones many hurte shewed rather haue taken v lyue slee v finally taken carsayle launt nandon le bourge de pyergourt espyot burge lespare angerot le mout gyse philyppe roe peter corthue pesat palyuiers bourge darusen capitayns selfe brought castell saxere neuer realme fraunce companyons lost moche dyde iourney howe guysshart albygon loste prisoner neglygence bledde sore dyed defaute lokyng vnto thus ended iohan aymery iourney thus done besyde sanxere charyte delyuered garysons therabout composycion shulde quyte prison saue conducte departe countre whider lyst fortuned v season sir bertram clesquy lorde beayne sir arnolde dandrehen erle marche toke voiage go spaygne ayde kyng dampeter first bretayne bataile alroy vnder sir hughe caurell recouered losse iourney te good prisoner two frankes went ten speares sir hugh caurell spayne helped put kyng dampeter realme whan ye alyances made bytwene kyng dampeter prince wale wolde abyde castell company sir hugh caurell retourned hym acquitayne warre renewed bytwene frenche kyng prince moche sore warre many capitayns englysshe gascoyns slayne yet thake god lyue ther dyed sir robert briquet bytwene lande duke orliance countre bloyse place called oliuet company ouerthrowen asquyer heynalt valyant man armes good capitayne called alar doustienes surnamed barbason lynage gouernoure bloys kepar countre sette lordes therof loys iohn guy fortune encoutre sir robert briquet sir robert cheney copany slayne ther non taken raunsome batayle nyorthe xayntaine carsnell slayne sir bertram clesquy seuyn c englyssh men slayne saint seuere slayne englysshe capitayns rychard elys richarde helyn knewe fewe expert selfe yt slayne haue hold fronter made warre kyng englade myne herytage lyeth burdelois somtyme haue ouerthrowen pulled downe nat wherwith lepe hors backe another tyme haue riche ynough whan good fortune came season raymonet de la pee companion togyder tholousyn fro ters bygore castell maluoysin castell trygalet castell vateulx whiche dyde v great profyte thane duke anion toke fro v byforce puyssaunce raymonet de pee tourned frenche abyde styll good englisshe shall whyle lyue true whan loste castell trygalet co ducted castell cuyllet duke gone backe agayne fraunce determyned somwhat outher gette profyte el lose dye payne caused spyall towne castell thury albygo well viewed whiche castell aueyled good fortune atesfyeng countrey hundred thousande frankes shall shewe howe wanne without towne fayre fou tayne vsage euery mornynge woman towne wolde come thyder pottes vesselles heedes fetche clere water ther toke fyftie copanyons garyson cuillet rode daye throughe wodes busshes nexte night mydnight sette busshment nere thury sixe onely dyde v woman aray pottes handes cae medowe right nere ye towne hydde ourselfe behynde great cockes hay standyng feest sait iohan whan make hay whan hour came gate opyned lette woman go water seuyn toke pott fylled fountayne wente towarde towne oure face wrapped kerchers coude nat knowen woman mette goyng water said v ah saynt mary gosseppes ye vp tymes aunswered lauguage faynt voyce true paste came gate founde body souter dressynge forthe baggage one v blewe horne drawe thyder copany busshment souter toke hede whan harde ye horne blowe demauded blewe horne one answered sayd preest wente feldes ah true quod souter sir frauces preest gladly gothe mornyng seke hare company came entred towne foude man drawe swerde make defence thus toke towne castell thury wherby haue great profite yerely castell trygalet appurtenauce worthe nowe wote nat treatie therle armynake dolphyn auuergne hath expresse authoritie frenche kyng bye townes fortress companyons holde handes whersoeuer outher auuergne rouerg e lymosyn quercy pyergourt albegois agen suche hath dothe make warre kyng englandes tytell many departed haue rendred fortress nat tell wyll rendre myne nat worde sayd burge compayne cosyn true carlat whiche holde auuergne coe hyder tidynges sir loys sanxere marshall fra ce wyll shortely nowe tarbe haue herde suche come then wt wordes called wyne dranke bastot sayd sir iohan ye well enformed lyfe yet haue aduetures whiche haue nat shewed wyll nat speke sir haue well herde phowe squyer called limosin turned frenche howe caused loys rambalt companyon armes taken cap xxx agayne demaunded hym rambalt expert squier great capitayne warr becoe bycause sawe one auignon great aray shall shewe quod bastot manlyon tyme past whan sir seguyn batefoyle helde bride velay ten myle fro puy auuergne made warre countre conquered moche retourned gascon gaue loyes rabalt another copanyon called lymosin bride anse water countre desolate full copanyons euery corner yt noue durst go house bitwene bride auuerne anse xxvi myle coutre full moutayns whan loyes rambalt wolde ryde pleasure fro bride anse rode without doute feare helde dyuers fortress countie forestes therabout wher refresshed hym tha gentylmen auuergne forestz velaye fronters sore traueyled ouer layde warre taken raunsomed doughted warre none great lordes frau ce sente men warre coutre frenche kynge yonge moche dyuers te realme euery parte companyos companyes rode dyd moche hurte realme coude nat quyte also dyuers lordes fraunce englande hostage meane season countreys men pylled robbed remedy men countre without corage defende themselfe rambalte lymosin companyons armes fell shall shewe howe loyes rambalte bride fayre woman louer whome loued parfitely whan rode fro bride anse comaunded lymosin take good hede lymosin companyon armes whome moost trusted toke good hede damosell pleasure whan lyste loyes rambalte enfourmed therof coude suffre lengar toke suche hate agaynst companyon caused hym taken seruauntes made hym driuen naked saue breche towne beaten scourge tru pett blowen certayne place dede openly cryed banisshed towne lyke treatour symple cote putte dispyte dyd loyes rambalte lymosin whiche dispyte lymosin toke greuously sayd howe wolde reueged euer laye power anone lymosin whyle prosperite ridyng bytwene bride anse euer forbare landes lorde voult dwellyng ryuer rone serued youthe thought go hym crye hym mercy desyre hym make peace frauce cote fote went voulte knewe ryght well way went house whan sawe tyme wente castell porter wolde nat suffre hym entre last spake fayre porter dyde lette comaunded hym go farther wt comaunded obeyed whan lorde vp went downe court sporte hym came gate lymosin felle downe knee sayde sir ye nat knowe faithe quod lorde thought lytell shulde haue lymosin whan well aduysed hym sayd thou resemblest well lymosin one seruaunt sir quod lymosyn seruaunt cryed mercy thynges paste shewed hym fro poynt poynt busynesse howe loyes rambalte dalte hym ende lorde sayd lymosyn tho sayest thou wylte becoe good frenche shall make thy peace faith sir quod neuer dyde moche hurte realme frauce shall agayne fyte therto wolde se gladly quod lorde voult lorde kept house tyll made peace euery place wha lymosin myght suretie ryde lorde voult armed hym brought hym seneshall velay acquaynted hym ther examyned state bride loyes rambalte whan rydeth waye taketh sayd whan loyes rydeth hath nat past xxx xl speares wayes kepeth knowe harte hym without hym haue rydden ofte tymes sir ye wyll sende forthe company men armes ieopardy heed ye shall haue within fyftene dayes capitayns ther toke hede sayeng sent spyes rambaulte spyed rydinge fro bride anse besyde lion ryuer rone whan lymosin knewe shewed ye lorde voult sayd sir loyes rabalte nowe anse retournyng shall bring streight wher must nedes passe lorde voult made assemble capitayne hymselfe sente bayly velay lorde mountelan sir gerarde salyers sonne sir pla seart vernet lorde newcastell men armes therabout thre c speares assembled nonnay cousaile lymosin made two busshmentes vicout polygnac lorde chalencon rule one lorde voulte lorde mount clan guydynge busshment sir loyes tornon lorde salyers hadde equally deuyded company firste company kepte pase nere saynt rambart forestes wher loyes rambalte shulde passe ryuer loyre el muste haue gone guyde pynne whan loyes rambalt done came anse departed xl speares thought nat haue rencounter douted nothynge lymosin leest thought lightely euer way rode outwarde wolde nat come homewarde came outwarde cae saynt rambalte retourne toke another waye toke mountayns aboue lyon aboue vyenne vnder burge darlentall rode streyght towarde mounastier thre lytell myle fro puye hadde passed bytwene castell monestrole mountfaucon came aboute countre towarde vyllage called batery bytwene nonnay saynt iulyane wode streyght passage whiche muste nedes passe el go nonnay whiche streight laye lorde voult two hundred speares loyes rambalt toke hede tyll among lorde voulte redy enterprise layde speare rest came cryinge la voulte dasshed among companyons rode abrode withoute good arraye first metyng many ouerthrowen erthe loyes ra baulte stryken fro horse squyer auuergne called amblardon toke hym prisoner taken slayne none scaped ther foude boiettes thre frankes whiche loyes rabalte receyued anse trybute certayne vyllages therabout wherof gladde euery man parte whan lymosin sawe rambalt trapped came hym sayd reproche loyes loyes fauteth company remembre ye blame shame ye dyde put bride maystres wolde haue thought lytell woman ye wolde haue put ye dyd ye done moche wolde nat haue angry two suche copanyos armes myght haue past tyme well ynoughe one woman wordes lord laughed loyes rabalt sporte herat takyng thus loyes rabalte bride delyuered seneshall auuergne lost capitayne chefe men wolde kepe le gar lykewise dyde anse fortress velay forestes parte within tress right ioyouse yelde vp holdes saue lyues loyes rabalte brought nonnay set prisone freche kyng great ioye takyng herde reported beheeded newcastell besyde auygnon thus loys rambalt dyed god haue mercy thus sir quod bastot manlyon haue holde talkyng passe awaye night sir haue said true sir quod herte thanke sir trust sayenges shall nat loste sir god suffre retourne myne owne countre haue herde saye haue sene founde voyage shall put remembraunce noble cronycle erle bloys hath set warke shall write cronycle grace god entent shalbe parpetuall remembraunce bourge compayne called erualton began speke wolde gladly shulde parceyue hym wolde shulde recorde lyfe bourge englysshe brother howe done auuergne place leysar watche castell sowned assemble towne come vp castell suppe erle foiz thanne two squyers made redy lyghted vp torch wente vp castell dyde knightes squyers lodged towne pof state ordynaunce erle foyz howe towne yran rebelled great traueyle domage outrage cap xxxi astate order erle foiz nat moche spoken praysed season yt ortaise foude hym suche moche speke whyle sawe herde many thynges turned great pleasure sawe christemas day sytting borde four bysshoppes countre two clementynes two vrbanystes bysshoppe pauyers bysshoppe lescalle clementynes satte highest bysshoppe dayre bysshop rone fronters burdeloys bayon vrbanestes satte therle foiz vycount roquebertyn gascone vycount brunyquell vycount iosseraut knight englad duke lancaster laye narbone duke sent hym thyder knight called sir wyllyam wylloughby another table satte fyue abbottes two knightes arragon called sir raymonde de mount florentyne sir marten de ruane another table satte knightes squyers gascone bigore first lorde daychin sir gaylari de la mote sir raymode newcastell lorde chamot gascone lorde compane lorde de la layne lorde mountferant sir wylliam bernarde sir peter corton lorde valenchyn sir aungalle named basell table knightes bierne great bre cheife stewardes halle sir espaygne leon sir siquart de boyes verdune sir nonnans nonnallys sir peter vaulx bierne two erles bastarde bretherne serued ye table sir erualton guyllame sir peter byerne erles two sonnes sir yuan leschell shewer sir gracyen bare cuppe many mynsttelles well owne straungers eche dyde deuoyre faculty day therle foiz gaue harauldes minstrelles fyue hundred frakes gaue duke tourayns mynstrelles gownes clothe golde furred ermyns valued two hundred frankes dyner endured foure houres thus gladde speke erle foyz house xii wekes well entreated thynges whyle might lerne tidynges countreis also gentyll knyght sir espaygne leon whose company entred countre caused acquaynted knyghtes squyers suche coude declare thyng roude demaunde enformed busynesse portingale castell maner warre made batayls rencounters bytwene two kynges assysters whiche busyness shall make iuste report ye haue herde howe kynge iohan castell hadde besieged castell luxbone king iohan portyngale therin good townes crowned kyng valyantnesse howe dede bastarde also ye haue herde kyng sende englande duke lancastre erle cambridge maryage cosyns haue socour messangers two knyghtes clerke sir iohan radyngos sir iohn dore clerke lycensiate lawe arche deaken lysbone messangers dyd moche see came hampton taryed daye gate horse none owne rode london moneth august kyng march wale huntyng pleasure vncles duke lacastre therle cabridge sir edmonde sir thomas erle buckyngham also owne countreis sportynge wherfore kyng portyngales messangers first spake duke lancastre hertforde twentie myle fro london duke receyued ioyously opyned ye letter brought duke reed thre tymes better vnderstande sayd sir ye right welcome countre ye come worst tyme yere haue spedy delyuerauce ambassade kyng bretherne sparcled abrode ye haue full answere tyll counsayle come toguyder london feest saynt mighaell sythe great parte message toucheth brother therfore write hym shalbe shortely london therabout shall take cou sayle toguyder wherfore nowe ye shall retourne london whan brother come nere ye shall haue tidynges fro v ambassadours portyngale content retourned london well lodged toke ease duke lancastre forgate nat sayd hym incontynent wrote brother therle cambridge busynesse whan therle reed brother letter prepared hym self rode hertforde besyde ware whe duke thre dayes togyder cou sayle ordayned go london duke promysed ambassadours came london two lord portyngale great cousayls bytwene erle cabridge ben portyngale nothyng cotent kyng ferant portyngale last deed sayd made warre slackely also agaynst wyll hym englyssh men toke peace spanyerdes wherfore erle sayd doute counsayle myghelmas comontie wolde nat agre lightly make another vyage portyngale iourney thyder cost greatly realme englande fyte therby ambassadours coceyned well erles wordes sayde sir nowe nowe kyng god pardon redouted greatly ye fortune worlde kyng mayster nowe hath another mynde ymaginacion fynde felde enemyes thoughe lesse power yet wyll gyue settyng whatso euer fall therby sir dare faythfully assure lordes besyde quarell clere ouerron conquere realme castell enherytaunce parteyneth wyues chyldren conquere ye nat haue good entre castell portyngale sythe ye haue realme according therto therfore sir one wyll come thyder suche suffycient nombre ayde ye shall haue ye shalbe able kepe felde duke lancastre answered sir lyeth nat v kyng realme shall oure good wylles ye maye sure therof thus ended counsayle portyngalo laye styll london abydyng mighelmas duke lancastre erle cambridge returned owne countreis march northe came myghelmas parlyament westmynster kynge approched came wyndesore chertsey quene hym stanes also chefe counsayle erle oxenforde euery thyng done without hym nothynge season flauders bytwene duke burgoyne gautoise great warre newly retourned flaunders englande bysshoppe norwiche sir hugh caurell sir wylliam helman sir thomas tryuet somer ben siege gauntoise ipre came frenche kyng closed burbonoise rehersed hystorie truse bytwene fraunce englande flaunders endure tyll mydsomer scottes moche also london counsayle gaut desyred haue gouernour helpe sustayne kepyng towne desyred one kynges vncles el erle salisbury counsayle london many counsayls well fle mynges portyngale scotlande made warre duke lancastre drewe parte might haue nobre men warre archer go portyngale shewed lordes prelat comons howe bounde faythe othe ayde hym brother wynne herytage castell sayde promysed whan kyng nephue crowned apered letter sealed moreouer duke complayned hym howe realme dyd hym brother wronge whan brother therle cambridge portyngale kepte smally couynaunt promysed sayd mysed sende hym thider two thousande speares many archer nothyng done wherby quarell right enherytaunce greatly hyndred duke wordes well harde reason moost notablest son yt counsayle said howe right speke dyd howe sayd busyness realme touched nere must first ferred wolde wyll shulde haue ben accomplysshed said shulde great outrage sende realme two thousande men warre four thousande archer long iourney portugale fortune see daugerous ayre portyngale marueylous hote sayeng realme englande shulde lese suche company shulde domage irrecuparable howe thynges alledged finally ordayned duke lancastre shulde passe see seuyn hudred speares four thousand archer euery man payed quarter yere howe reserued yf accydent touchynge realme englade meanes frau ce scotlande shulde happen falle departure portingale tary duke agreed therto sythe sawe wolde none otherwyse ye haue herde whane duke lancastre redy men hampton take voyage portyngale ambassadurs retourned brought worde portyngale howe duke lancastre comyng suche nombre men warre portyngalois great ioye fortuned lette fell englande whiche taryed duke lancastre season admyrall fraunce sir iohan vien thousande speares good men armes toke shippyng scluse sayled scotlande made warre englande realme came resyst shewed hystorie wherfore nede nat speke therof agayne wyll speke siege lixbone kynge spayne whome shall make true relacyon accordynge enformed kynge iohan castell beyng siege lixbone tidynges came hoost marchauntes countrey came fro flaunders howe duke lancastre great nombre men warre comynge thyderwarde reyse siege tidynges well beleued spanyardes knewe well howe duke lancastre wolde payne dilygence make warre realme castell bycause claymed part therof ryght wyfe howe kyng helde styll siege sent messangers letter haue ayde frauce specially sent coutre bierne lande erle foiz byerne issued four dayes respyte thre hundred speares chosen men armes come ortaise realme frauce go castell serue ye king sir iohan rue burgonyon sir geffray richon breton sir geffray de partenay eche company selfe bierne made redy lorde lynguasshe great barone companyon erle foiz sir peter lyer sir iohan de lespres lorde bordes sir bertrande baruge lorde moriage sir raymonde dansac sir iohn salagre sir monan saruen sir pyer robier sir stephyn valentyne sir raymonde rarasse sir peter hanefan sir ogert domesson dyuers sir espayngnolet spaygne eldest sonne sir roger spaygne cosyn lygnage armes erle foiz went company bierne lordes knightes bierne made assemble ortaise therabout shewed sawe dete fro ortaise howe best armed apoynted company wente byerne many daye whan erle foiz sawe surely howe wolde dete go spaygne thoughe begynnynge somwhat consented therto shulde receyue kyng castelles wage yet angry soroufull departyng sawe well countre sore febled therby sent sir espaygne de leon sir cabestan sayd lordes knightes squyers desyringe come toguyder castell ortaise entent gyue theym dyuer farewell knightes obeyed reason came ortaise se erle receyued gladde chere masse caused come secrete chambre maner counsayle said sir entente dete countre leaue handes warre erle armynake ye go make warre kyng spayne departure toucheth right nere sir quod muste nedes go entent haue receyued ye kyng castels wage sir warre bytwene spayne portyngale one atchyued shall retourne agayne sauegarde atchyued therle nay nat soone nowe dothe begyn newe kynge portyngale hath sent ayde englande therfore warre likely endure long
