season ye kepe felde ye shall nat fought tyll duke lancastre copany come thyder ye shall derely bye wage ye haue receyued sir sythe haue done moche must nedes parforme voyage well god spede quod erle let v go dyner tyme therle lordes knight went hall table great dyner great leaser serued euery thyng day teyned dyner therle ledde hym copany galarye entred comunyng sayd fayre lord frendes shall greue se departynge countre nat dyspleased auauncementes honour case wolde gladly augment exalte honour profyte haue great pytie ye chefe flour chiualry countre bierne ye thus go straunge countre wolde cousayle yet agayne leaue voyage let kynge castell kynge portyngale make warre bytwene theym selfe ye nat bounde none otherwyse sir sauynge displeasure nat thus sir ye knowe ye speke haue taken wage gyftes kyng castell wherfore must nedes deserue well quod therle yespeke well shall shewe shall come vyage outher ye shall retourne poore naked lyfe shall stragle el ye shalbe slayne taken knightes began laughe sayd sir must abyde aduenture therle fell talkyng lefte rest shewed maner communycasion nature spanyardes howe sluttysshe lousy enuyous mennes welthe wherfore quod reed take good counsayle demaunded wyne spyce made euery drinke toke euery man hande badde farewell departed fro went chambre fote castell knightes mouted horse rode sanetere lodged night nexte day departed entred lande baseles toke waye panpylone passed surely payed truely tooke season whyle kyng laye lixbone layen space yere towne saynt yrayne rebelled agaynst ye kyng castell closed gate sayde nother french spaynisshe shulde entre towne bycause domage done oppressyons sayd faute geffray rycous company sir parteney co pany breton toke euer might gette set nothyng peace cytezins toke two castelles sayd wolde kepe towne agaynst son wolde hurte day rebelled slewe mo threscore breton nere slayne sir geffray partenay saued hym selfe vnder ye walles towne yt nere lodgynge frenchman breton fiersly assauted saynt yrayne lost wonne dyd nothynge tidynges came hoost kyng castell howe saynt yrayn tourued portyngalois howe mynde delyuer towne castelles kyng portyngale whiche newes kynge nat content called hym marshall sir raynolde lymosin said take hundred two hundred speares go sait yrayne knowe men towne rebell occasion haue haue done marshall rode forthe hym two hundred speares came saynt yrayne sent hym haraulde shewe comyng howe wolde speke barryers dyde message answered hym towne sayeng sir haralde knowe right well sir raynolde lymosin gentylman valyant knight marshall kyng may rightwell come hyder please hym vnarmed towne el nat message haralde brought mayster thane sir raynolde sayd nat come hyder domage knowe entente one entre armed vnarmed knowe wylles sixe hym rode thyder vnarmed lefte copany behynde hym lyghted barryers whan within sawe estate opyned gate receyued towne made hym good chere assembled people market place sayde sir ye dwell towne take hede saye sente hyder kynge castell demaunde entecion ye rebell close gate haue slayne come hyder serue kynge knowe trouthe kyng sore displeased also enfourmed howe ye haue taken possessyon two castelles towne whiche parteyneth enherytaunce howe ye wyll delyuer aduersary kyng portyngale aunswered sayd sir raynolde sauynge kynges grace nat disposed rendre mannes handes kynge kynge castell whome holde gouerne v peace iustice yt haue done ye faut robber pyllers breton lodged towne yf sarazyns worse people coulde nat haue ben worse dalte withall rauysshinge wyues doughters breakynge vp coffer breakynge heedes vesselles wyne beatynge meamynge v whan speke worde therfore nat marueyled whan sawe outrage done v shulde defende v though displeased men wyll displeased lesse cause sir ye maye shewe please one accorde whosoeuer come wyll receyue towne nother frenche breton none kynges owne persone suche shall please hym nat traueyled putte vyolence whane sir raynolde herde saye peased semed hym dyd wronge putte towne enemyes sayde ye good people haue well herde well vnderstande ye shall abyde peace wyll retourne kynge shewe hym ye haue sayd good faythe shall moche possyble sir thanke quod trust kyng haue yuell informacyon v yt ye wyll oure good meane sir raynolde tooke leaue departed retourned company abode hym feldes rode tyll came hoost lixbone lyghted lodgynge went kynge shewed hym hadde harde founde yrayne whan kyng knewe trouthe sayd faythe haue done wisely man sure thes robbets whan sir geffray richone sir geffray partenay companyes sawe howe coulde haue none remedy saynt yrayne kynge castell dissymuled sore displeased sayd among selfe haue well lefte realme fraunce come hyder serue kyng spayne thus shamed domaged sorte villayns haue right trust shortly hyder wyll come sorte knightes gascone wyll suffre tyll come wyll agree togyder reueng companyons haue slayne yuell entreated tidynges came hoost kyng counsayle breton sore manasshed saynt yrayne maketh auaunte gascoyns one coe howe shulde derely paye done wherfore kyng counsayled departe fro siege go refresshe hym season saynt yrayns sette mater good waye tary comyng gascoyns whome foure hundred speares good men warre wherof kynge ioyfull wolde nat shulde fynde coutre trouble comynge also moche people desyred refresshe theym layen longe nothynge done commaunded euery man dislodge drawe towarde saynt yrayne spanyardes dyslodged came marchesse saynt yrayne whan saint yrayne knewe howe kynge castell comyng towarde towne ordayned twelfe men notablest person towne mount horse dyde rode tyll came kyng knowe pleasure kynge lighted vnder shadowe olyue tree refresshe hym great heate two leages fro saynt yrayne sir raynolde lymosin marshall hoost knewe comynge present kynge whan came kneled downe said foloweth phowe kyng castell lefte siege lixbone howe saynt yrayne excused selfe cap xxxii right redouted prince noble kynge castell come hyder youre presens sende fro poore comynaltie poore towne bayliwike saynt yrayne gyuen vnderstande howe ye greatly displeased sir wheder thus shalbe right redouted sir faute came nat reason iniuryes oppressyons breton hath done suche towne sir yuell dedes nat come knowledge sir blame nat maysters squiers knightes capitens onely dyded v hurte sir pyllers robber breton haue doone v suche dedes marueyle thynke recorde sir helde season subiectyon towne countre saynt yrayne herde theym many great complayntes sir dispyte v wolde breake vp oure cofers take vyolate wyues doughters face whan spake worde beten maymed slayne pouertie two monethes wherfore right redouted noble kynge besech grace haue displeased cause maye please may haue true iustyce laufull informacyon maynteygne v ryght ye promysed sware v kepe v lyberties first tyme sware kynge towne saynt yrayne sir ye shall great almesse v sir whan ye come thyder truste counsayle suche noblenesse towne saynt yrayne shalbe opyned agaynst comynge may please yor grace poore people cryeng mercy complaynynge iniuryes oppressyons done youre royall maiestie noble counsayle wyll graunt grace remyssyon paste remedy wronges kyng stode styll lytell sir raynolde lymosin kneled downe said dere sir ye haue herde people saynt yrayns complaynt shewyng hath ben wherfore may plase answere raynold quod kyng knowe well iuste cause dyde go bydde ryse go wayes saynt yrayne make redy comyng wyll lye night also shewe howe shalbe well maynteyned right sir raynolde rose went sayd sir ryse kyng hath well conceyued sayeng ye desyre right iustyce ye shall haue go wayes apparell ye ought towne saynte yrayns agaynst kynges comyng may gyue thake mater shall come well passe suche meanes ye shall haue ayde sir quod thanke toke leaue kyng retourned towne shewed herde kyng answere sir raynolde lymosin made kynges behalfe wherof towne gladde apparelled towne richely agaynst kyng comyng strawed stretes fresshe grene herbes kyng entred euenyng lodged castell called lyon men towne many might moost te feldes village therabout kyng well moneth ye mater stode done lost pof marueylous batayle iuberoth bytwene kynge castell kyng iohn portyngale cap xxxiii whyle kynge castell sait yrayns come hym gascons bierne fayre copany sir raynolde lymosin rode receyue welcomed ryght swetely coulde right well brought kyng great ioye comynge comaunded sir raynolde lymosin se well lodged ease dyde contented thus busyness rested kyng laye styll saynt yrayns people kynge castell hadde abrode lodged feldes therabout four thousande men armes xxx thousande daye called barones fraunce counsayle knowe myndes howe shulde metayne forthe warre layen great cost li bone done nothynge surely gascoins nat come encoraged kynge deted fro saynt yrayns gone outher bergus galice people sore anoyed lye longe ye feldes whan knyghtes fraunce bierne come kynge sayde fayre sir ye good men warre wherfore wolde haue cousayle howe may maynteyne warre agaynst lyxbonoyes portyngaloyes haue kepte felde yere yet haue done nothynge thought haue gotte lixbone haue fought wolde wyse issue wherfore people gyue counsayle gyue euery man leaue departe owne house wherfore pray gyue youre aduyse knyghtes fraunce byerne newely come desyred armes nothynge done thynking deserue wage receyued aunswered sayde sir ye puyssant man landes lytell costeth payne traueyle people specially sithe owne countrey wolde nat saye moche yf straunge countre clene without prouysion nowe saye ought nat gyue suche counsayle great ease se though home sir saye nat maner determynate cousayle ye wyse ynough thynke highe prudence best chuse yet kepe felde ye maye well kepe tyll feest saint michaell paradueture tyme enemyes wyll assemble togyder drawe felde whan ye take leest hede therto tha without fayle shalbe fought withall sir haue great desyre wyn sowhat iourney hath cost v moche great payne traueyle bothe self horse came coutre therfore sir shall nat opinyon company thus departe agayne faithe quod kyng ye speke well truely warre shall vse fro hen forthe counsayle kyng father also haue founde alwayes youre countreis great trouthe faythfulnesse god haue mercy sir bertram clesquyes soule true knyght whome tyme many recoueraunses good iourneys wordes counsails kyng fraunce bierne anone knowen among lordes knightes spaygne wherwith sore displeased two cause one bycause semed kyng trust co fydence straungers liege men crowned hym kyng seconde fraunce counsayled kyng kepe styll warre felyng selfe wery warre spake among selfe dyuers maners nat openlye priuely wolde saye kyng coude make warre frenchman lykewise coude father great enuy frenche men whiche well appered whan freche varlettes went forragyng spaynisshe forrengers stronger wolde take forage fro beate mayme complayntes came therof kynge blamed therfore marshall sir raynolde lymosyn sayde haue ye nat prouyded mater marshall excused hym sayde god might helpe hym knewe nothynge therof wolde prouyde remedy fro then forthe incontynent stablysshed men armes kepe feldes frenche forregers rode suretie also made crye comaundement euery man vitayle prouision sell shulde bringe felde sait yrayns shuld haue prise reasonable euery thyng straungers largely parte kyng ordayned shulde serued wherof spanyardes great dispyte weke kyng castell departed fro siege lixbone thre great shyppes men warre englysshe archer aryued lixbone bre fyue hundred one thirde parte copanyons aduenturers hauyng wage man calys chierburge brest bretayne mortaygne poytou herde warre bytwene castell portyngale came burdeux ther assembled sayd let v go aduenture portyngale shall fynde wyll receyue v sette v awarke sir iohan harpedan marshall burdeux counsayled greatly therto wolde nat shulde abyde burdeloys might ther haue done hurte good bycause companyons aduenturers nothyng lese arryued lixbon nat name thre squyers englysshe capitayns one called northbery another morbery thirde huguelyn harcerell none paste age fyftie yere good men armes well vsed feates war comyng englysshe men lixbone right gladde kyng portyngale wolde se went palays kyng made great chere demau ded duke lancastre sent thyder sir quod northbery longe season sythe knowledge v hym sir men dyuers sortes sekynge aduentures come serue fro towne calays faythe quod kynge bothe right hartely welcome comyng dothe great good ioye shortely shall sette warke haue ben inclosed gret season wery therof nowe wyll large felde well enemyes hath sir quod desyre nothynge el sir desyre shortely maye se youre enemyes kynge made dyner palays lixbone co maunded shulde lodged cytie ease payed wage thre monethes kyng set clerkes awarke made letter sente ouer realme comaundynge euery man able beare harnesse drawe lixbone suche letter came vnto obeyed nat many abode styll house thre partes realme dissymuled kynge theym lixbone bycause crowned kynge bastarde spake great word ther agaynst priuely bycause great trouble dyfferece kynge castell cou sayle sawe realme portyngale made hym auaunce hym selfe entent haue conquered countre sayenge howe shulde wonne one dayes iourney batayle yf lixbone might ouerthrowen resydue countrey wolde nat sorie put realme mayster denyce elles slee hym shulde lande conquest hym wyfe ryght enherytoure yet good wyll kynge iohan castell wolde haue lefte warre people wolde nat suffre euer gaue hym corage sayeng quarell cause iuste whan kynge portyngale sawe commaundement nat obserued moche people disobeyed ser ue hym right pensyue malencolyous called hym suche trusted best lixbone knyghtes house dyde payne crowne hym also serued kyng ferant sir iohan radygos sir iohn teatedore lorde siegere sir go tabeston ambrise condricho peter brother ser ouges nauaret knyght castell tourned portyngaloyes kynge iohan hadde chased hym realme kynge portyngale hadde reteyned hym made hym chiefe capitayne counsayle kyng shewed many thynges sayde sir ye knowe well ye fredes ye haue made kynge beholde nowe howe dyuers folkes realme excuseth selfe canne nat gette felde yf good wyll fight oure enemyes haue wolde right gladde therof nat dysposed se howe refrayne dyssymule mater wherfore haue nede counsayle mater howe maye order myselfe therfore praye lette haue aduise sir gome tabeston knight portyngale sayde sir counsayle youre honoure soone ye maye drawe selfe youre people felde aduenture also shall ayde dye quarell ye kynge portyngale rebelles disdaynfull serue saye saythe dyuers towne bycause ye haue nat issued oute shewe youre face agaynst enemyes ye haue grace yet reputed valyaunt man armes saye nowe nede valyantnesse fayleth hath set enemyes pride hath cooled subiectes sawe dedes valure prowes wolde obey dout wolde yo enemyes heed king ye say well wherfore sir wyll incontynent euery man make hym redy wyll ryde shortely loke enemyes outher wyll wyn tyme lese sir quod knyght shalbe done iourney god sende good fortune ye shall kynge portyngale euer ye shall praysed straunge realmes knowledge therof shall come parfyte herytage portyngale ye nat attayne batayle ye may take ensample kyng henry cosyn father kyng iohan nowe kyng castell spaygne tolle galyce corduane sibyle came herytag batayle otherwyse neuer ye knowe howe puissaunce prince wale acquitayne put kynge peter yo cosyn possession herytages landes closed within spayne afterwarde iourney batayle yt henry nauntuell agaynst peter loste agayne henry put possession whiche iourney aduentured hymselfe el nat ben kyng ther lykewise sir ye must aduenture ye thynke lyue honour sir quod kynge ye saye true wyll haue none counsayle profytable v thus departed counsayle ordayned yt within thre dayes euery man shulde drawe feld take grounde abyde enemyes thre dayes kepte gate close lixbone nother man woman coude issue wolde nat yt enemyes shulde preuy entensyon whan englysshmen vnderstode shulde issue oute drawe towardes saynt yrayns loke enemyes ioyfull euery man made hym redy archer dressed redy bowes arowes euery thynge neded thursdaye departed lixbone day lodged lytell riuer syde two leages fro lixbone face towarde saynt yrayns euery man sayde good herte wyll wolde neuer retourne lixbone tyll sene enemyes saye g howe better shulde go requyre batayle enemyes rather shulde come said sene herde dyuers ensamples requyrers nat requyrers euer fyue foure hath optayned maner vyctories englysshmen haue frauce euer requyrers naturally secars batayle strongar couragyous assaylinge defendars opynyon nere burgess lixbone sayde bruges flauders whan gauntoyse came towne requyred batayle agaynst erle flaunders puissaunce knowe well philyppe dartuell petre de boyse iohan clyquetiell frauces atreman peter le myttier capitayns gauntoyse brought oute gaunte mo seuyn thousande men yet requyred batayle enemyes ouer came disconfyted xi thousande true without treason clene fortune batayle done saturdaye leage fro bruges herde reported nexte day whan wonne towne bruges thus dyde putte aduenture outher wynne lese thus must thynke haue good spede thus lixbonoyse thursday spake one another whan kyng enformed wordes great confort great ioye friday mornynge sowned trumpettes made redy toke waye right hade folowyng ryuer playne countre caryage folowed rode daye four leages day tidynges cae kynge castell laye saynte yrayns portyngalois lixbonoyes comyng towardes hym tidynges anone spredde abrode host wherof spaygniardes frenche men gascoyns great ioye sayde beholde yonder lixbonoyes valyant men sithe come seke batayle shortely let v go feldes lette v close among v waye entent retourne nat agayne thane ordayned publysshed hoost euery man saturdaye mornynge foote horsebacke shuld issue saynt yrayns drawe towardes ennemyes fyght euery man made hym redy ioyfull iourney saturday mornynge sowned trumpettes kynge herde masse castell drake lepte horse euery man hym drewe felde good aray batayle sir raynolde limosin marshall hoost formast sente forthe scurrers aduyse dealynge ennemyes se nombre frenchman sente forthe two squyers one burgonion gascone burgonyon called wylliam motigny sir iohan rey gascoyne bierne sent forthe bertrande barge bothe day made knightes rode forth chatellayne castell good man armes called peter ferant medyne marueylous light genet whyle thre rode forthe aduyse enemyes ye resydue hoost rode softe pase nombre two thousande speares knyghtes squiers gascoyns burgonyons frenchman picardes breton well apoynted armed men might twetie thousande spanyardes horsbacke nat rydden forthe vowe shotte stode styll syde kynge portyngale lykewise sent forthe thre scurrers vieu iustely demeanyng spaniardes wherof two englysshe squyers expert men armes one called iaquyne dartebery philippe barqueston ferrant de la grosse portingale well horsed rode forthe tyll came lytell hyll might well se behauynge spanyardes retourned kynge portyngale counsayle ther made relacyon done sayd sir haue ben farre forwarde haue sene enemyes sir surely great nombre welle thyrtie thousade horse therfore sir take aduyse kyng demaunded rode one batayle nat sir quod sutelye two batayls kyng turned hym towarde people sayd loude sir nowe aduyse well nedeth nowe cowardnesse shall fight shortelye enemyes comyng hath gret desyre fynde v shall nat flye retourne issued lixbone great nombre people thynke sir well lette v selle lyues dere ye haue made kyng daye shall se yf crowne portyngale wyll abyde peasably nat sir one thyng yesure shall nat flye abyde aduenture answered good wyll shall abyde englysshe capitayns called forthe northbery hartefell moost experte armes kynge demaunded counsayle wolde gyue hym howe abyde aduenture batayle sayd knewe well must nedes fyght enemyes aproched faste nombre four agaynst one v englysshmen sayd sir sithe shall haue bataile greatter nombre wherfore harde tie nat coquere without take aduautage hedge busshes lette v take suche groude may fortify shall nat entre vpon v lightely shulde playne felde sir quod kynge ye speke wysely shalbe ye haue deuysed counsayle englysshmen kyng rested ther toke aduyse groude might take nat farre fro towne iuberothe great vyllage thyder lixbonoyes sent prouision somers caryages entension night lodge wheder batayle might scape honour without towne quarter leage therabout ther great abbey monkes whyder iuberothe vyllages wonte come masse churche standeth lytell oute waye moote enuyroned great tree hedge busshes stronge place lytell helpe englysshmen called counsayle kynge thoughe fewe yet kynge wolde folowe moche aduyse thane sayde sir knowe hereby place mynster without iuberoth among tree standeth stronge place lytell amendement helpe suche knewe countre sayd sir true kyng sayd let v drawe thyder let v order selfe men warr ought whan oure enemyes come let nat fynde v vn uided incotynet done came wher churche whan englysshe men sir monges naueret dyuers valyat men page duplicate page duplicate portugale lixbone well aduysed place roude sayd place stronge ynough lytell helpe maye abyde aduenture syde nexte feldes cutte downe tree layde one ouer another thentente horseman shulde nat come full course lafte one waye open nat large suche archer cro bowes sette euery syde waye men armes fote playne within way churche one syde ther kyng baners pight vp whan thus ordered euery thynge great ioye sayd pleased god well suche place kepe longe make good iourney kynge sayd fayre sir day euery man parte thynke nat flye nat aueyle v farr fro lixbone also chase ther recoueryng thre wyll slee beate downe xii flyenge therfore shewe daye ye men prowes selle derely lyues ymagyn selfe howe iourney shalbe shalbe god pleased shall moche honoured spoken strauge countreis tidynges shall come alwayes victours exalted disconfyted dispraysed sir thynke howe ye haue made kynge wherfore ye ought hardy coragyous one thyng ye sure long axe endureth hades shall fight fayle orbreke shall get another shewe selfe wyll mentayne defende crowne portyngale selfe right haue successyon brother whiche take soule myne enemyes traueyleth wrong fully quarell myne suche harde kynge sayd sir grace mercy ye admonest v wyselye sir shall helpe ayde maynteyne haue gyuen whiche owne sir shall abyde place shall nat departe without god departe v sir make crye youre people euery man hath nat herde speke comaundyng payne dethe man flye sir faynt harted abyde batayle let come forthe gyue leaue departe fro one faynt harte may dyscourage two dosyn good men el stryke heedes presens gyue ensample kyng answered wyll two knightes ordayned go sertche euery copany demaunde abasshed abyde batayle messangers reported kyng whan retourned coude fynde man redy abyde aduenture batayle moche better quod kyng kyng caused wolde made knightes come hym wolde gyue order knighthod name god saynt george vnderstade ther made threscore newe knight wherof kyng great ioye dyd sette front batayle sayd sir order knighthode noble highe herte thynke knight ought cowarde shamefull ought fierse hardy lyon wha helme heed seyth ennemyes bycause wolde ye shulde day shewe prowes wher ought shewed therfore ordayne first front bataile sir maye haue honour also otherwyse spurres yuell set euery knight answered tourne fell passed kynge sir pleasure god shall haue grace loue thus portyng alois ordred selfe fortifyed besyde churche iuberoth portyngale daye englisshman wolde made knight yet desyred kyng excused selfe day pof spanyardes howe ordered selfe batayle cap xxxiiii nowe let v retourne kynge iohan castell knyght squyers frauce gascone ther sent aduyse enemyes retourned agayne sayd sir kyng ye lordes knightes present haue rydded forwarde haue sene oure enemyes accordyng iuge nat paste ten thousande men one mynster iuberothe ther rested sette order batayle shall founde soeuer wyll seke kyng called hym counsayle specially baron knightes fraunce demauded best answered sayd sir thynke best let fought incontynent se nothyng elles reported frayed great doute bycause farre fro fortresse lixbone farre sixe leages nat ronne thyder ease shalbe ouertaken ye waye without take aduautage night therfore sir counsayle sithe ye knowe order batayls go fyght whyle people good wyll well kyng demaunded owne countre opinyons sir dangonyes mendant sir dygo parsement pier goussart moutdasque pier ferrant valesque great mayster caletrane answered kynge sayd sir haue well harde knightes fraunce howe wolde haue hotely sette enemyes sir wyll ye knowe also come wyll nyght ye se sonne draweth downe warde yet ye haue nat ordred youre batayls sir therfore thynke good ye taryed tyll mornynge lette v drawe nere laye good spyall dyuers place wolde dislodge aboute mydnight departe lette v also dyslodge nat flye scape v countre playne place hyde lixbone whiche nat gette ease sir counsayle gyne kyng stode styll lytell caste downe loke erthe tourned regarde straugers tha marshall sir raynolde lymosin sayd please frechmen langage spaygne entent might better vnderstande euery man turned hym spanyardes suche gyuen kyng counsayle sayeng callyng euery man name sir howe ye sage batayls vsed armes valyant knightes present howe ye deuyse thyng beyond shulde valure haue done nothyng el life dayes traueyll fro realme realme fynde dedes armes howe durst deuise thyng agaynst wordes whiche noble highe kepe honour kyng realme wherin ye haue greatter parte ye haue herytages bodyes haue nothyng nowe al onely bodyes whiche wyll firste formast put aduenture haue desyred kyng haue first batayle kyng hath graunted regarde great noble courage whan wyll first aduenture selfe shulde seme ye haue enuy ye wolde profyte honoure shulde come whiche ye ought nat one accorde wyll also youre counsayle kyng hath ben feldes longe great cost charge hym layne siege lixbone coude neuer haue aduenture batayle tyll nowe hym writeth hym selfe kyng portyngale wherin hath right bastarde nat dyspensed felde suche fredes hath whiche great nombre nowe crafte shulde agayne withdrawe hym selfe nat fought ye put selfe adue ture hole hoost shulde ryse slee el kyng shulde repute traytours strike heedes co fyske landes therfore se better way styll let alone hath sene suche busyness ye neuer sawe haue done neuer shall ye kynge loked vp semynge gladde wordes spanyard abasshed feared done gretter trespace dyd though marshall reproued spake agaynst yet well spoken truely cou sayled kyng valyantnesse please stranger desyred batayle marshall spake dyde euery man styll kynge sayd wyll name god saynt iames enemyes fought suche wyll made knyghtes coe forth wyll gyue thordre knight hode honour god saynt george ther came forthe many squyers frace byerne made knightes kyng hande sir roger spayne edmode son sir roger coutie foiz ser bertrand barroge sir peter salebere sir peter valentyne sir wylliam quere sir anger sollenayre sir peter vande sir wyllyam montigny one nobre hundred xl ther certayne baron bierne raysed vp ther first baners also dyuers castell also sir iohan rey might haue ben sene amonge newe knightes great noblenesse maynteyned selfe goodly pleasure beholde fayre batayle lorde loyngiache came kyng stranger soeuer nacyon spanyard named name stranger said kynge sir become fro farre partes serue sir requyre v grace let v haue first batayle content quod kyng name god sait iames saynt george ayde spanyardes sayd one another softely beholde goddessake beholde howe kynge putteth truste frechmen hath parfyte trust none shall haue first batayle prayse v nat moche yt wyll take v wyll dede selfe lette v selfe let v let alone enterprise haue made auaunt howe stronge ynough discomfyte portugaloys lette content good demaunded kynge wheder wyll abyde v el go frenchemen thervpon long murmuryng wheder shulde demaude el styll douted greatly wordes sir raynolde lymosin thynges consydred thought none yuell demaunde hym questyon sixe moost notablest wente kynge enclyned selfe sayd right noble kyng se vnderstand well aparent signes day ye shall haue batayle youre enemyes god sende grace honoure vyctorie greatly desyre sir wolde knowe wheder pleasure lyeth amonge fenechmen el v fayre sir kyng though haue graunted first batayle knightes squyers straugers come farre serue valyant expert men warres yet renounce nat wyll abyde amonge therfore sir helpe defende answere spanyerdes great ioy well contented sayd sir shall nat fayle dye quarell sir sworne haue promised faithe bodyes whan ye crowned sir loued well kyng father nat sayle wise trust quod kyng thus kyng spayne abode among owne men well twentie thousande horsmen couered stele sir raynolde lymosin first batayle right cause marshall saturday fayre daye sonne tourned towarde euynsong first batayle came iuberoth kyng portugale men redy receyue frenche knightes two thousade speares fresshe well ordred men coulde deuysed soone sawe enemyes ioyned toguyder lyke men warre aproched good order tyll came within bowe shotte first comyng ther harde countre suche desyred assayle wyn grace prayse entred strayte way englysshmen policy fortyfied bycause thentre narowe great prease great mischefe ye assaylates suche englysshe archer shot holly toguyder arowes pearsed men horse whan horse full arowes fell one vpon another englysshmen armes portugaloys lyxbonoyes came cryeng cryes lady portugale good speares sharpe heedes wherwith strake hurte many knightes squyers lorde lanache bierne beaten downe baner taken prisoner many men taken slayne also sir iohan ree sir geffray richon sir geffray parteney copanyes entred within strayte horse hurte tharchers fell maysters one vpon another frenchman great danger coulde nat helpe one another roume enlarge selfe fight wyll whan portugaloys sawe myschefe fall first assaylers gladde fresshe coragyous fyght men might kynge portugale baners hym mounted good horse trapped armes portugale great ioye se yt myschefe fall enemyes conforte people laughed sayd highe forthe good men defede fight good wyll ther mo nede nat feare knewe euer thynge batayle thus kyng portugale reconforted people fought valiatly enclosed streight first assaylers whome ther many slayne true first batayle whiche knightes frauce bierne ledde thought haue ben quickelyer ayded spaynerdes kyng castyle company twentie thousande men come another parte assayled portugaloys lykely iourney haue ben dyde nothynge wherfore blame receyued domage also dede frenchman sette soone dyde thentent haue honoure maynteyne wordes spoken kyng also enformed spaynierdes wolde nat sette soone loued nat frenchman said lette alone shall finde right well whoe speke frechmen ar great vantours highe mynded also kyng hath fite trust sith kyng wolde shulde haue honour iourney let v suffre take el shall haue entetes thus thse meanes spanynierdes stode styll great batayle wolde nat go forwarde whiche right displesant kyng coude nat amede spaynierdes sayd bycause ther none retourned fro batayle sir surely knightes frauce haue disconfyted enemyes thonour iourney god gyue grace quod kyng let v ryde somwhat forwarde rode crosbowe shotte forwarde agayne rested great beautie se well mouted armed mean season frenchman fought suche leysar light fought valiatly dyuers knightes squyers eyther partie dyd many feates armes one vpon another whan speares fayled toke ax gaue many great stroke helmes sleyng maymynge eche soeuer suche case armes frenchman portugaloys iuberoth must abyde aduenture dyde without wolde flye awaye flyeng paryll abyde batayle flyeng lightly moost slayne batayle whan one seith ouermatched yeldeth hym selfe prisoner nat said knightes fraunce bretayne burgoyne byerne right valiantly fought first encountre hardely handled counsayle englysshmen fortyfie place first batyle portugaloys stroger enemyes taken slayne fewe saued firste brunt thousande knightes squyers taken prisoner wherof portugaloys ioyfull thought day haue batayle made good chere prisoner euery man sayd prisoner sir nat abasshed ye clene feate armes shall kepe good company wolde ye shuld ye hadde v lyke case ye shall come lixbone refresshe shalbe ease thanked theym whan sawe none bote put fynaunce incotynent wolde abyde aduenture ymagined kynge spaygne great armye wolde shortely come delyuer phowe frenche knightes gascoyns suche taken prisoner iuberoth portugaloys slayne maysters none escaped cap xxxv tidynges came felde kyng castyle companye aprochynge iuberoth fledde cae cryeng great feare sayd sir kyng auaunce selfe ye vowarde outher taken slayne remedy delyueraunce without puyssaunce whan kyng castyle herde tidyng sore displeased good cause touched hym nere comau ded ryde sayd auauce baners name god saynt george lette v ryde rescue sithe men haue nede therof spaynierdes began ryde better pase cloose toguyder good order tyme sonne nere downe tha sayd best abyde tyll mornyng bycause nere night said coude make easy iourney kynge wolde shulde sette incontynent layde reason said shall leaue enemyes rest nowe wery gyue leysar te refresshe selfe whosoeuer gyue counsayle loueth nat myne honoure rode forthe makyng great noyse brunt wnyng trumpettes tabour abasshe therwith enemyes nowe shall shewe kyng portugale dyd company soone discofited vowarde taken prisoner sawe none batayle comyng wt sight yet wolde put trust first vyctorie therfore sent sixe notable person go aui cou trey se shulde haue rode forthe came sawe kynge castelles great batayle comyng warde fast approchynge iuberothe twentie thousande horsmen retourned fast might sayde highe people sir aduyse well yet haue done nothyng beholde yonder cometh kyng castyle great batayle mo twentie thousande men none taryed behynde wha herde tidynges toke shorte counsayle whiche necessyte incontynent ordayned pyteous dede euery man comaunded payne dethe slee prisoner without mercy noble gentyll ryche none except lordes knightes squyers prisoner harde case prayer auayled fro dethe slayne one place another spredde abrode vnarmed wenyng haue ben saued nat say trouth great pytie euery man slewe prisoner dyd nat men slewe th handes portugaloys englysshmen gyuen counsayle sayd better slee slayne kylle nat whyle fightynge wyll escape slee v trust mane enemy thus slayne great mischiefe lorde longnache sir peter byerne lorde lespres lorde rne lorde boordes sir bertrande bergues lorde morayne sir raymode douzanche sir iohan fologe sir manant sarenen sir peter salybers sir stephyn valentyne sir raymon courase sir peter hansame nombre thre hundred squyers byerne fraunce sir iohan rue sir geffray richon sir geffray partenay diuers lo beholde great yuell aduenture felle saturday slewe many good prisoner wolde well haue ben worthe one another foure hundred thousande frankes phowe kynge castell great batayle discofyted kyng portugale vyllage called iuberoth cap xxxvi whan lixbonoise englysshe portugaloyse delyuered place slayne prisoner neuer one scaped without conueyed vyllage iuberoth caryages drewe togyder feirse wyll place first assayled sonne goyng downe kyng castell puyssant array baners penons dysplayed mounted horse well couered came cryeng castell began entre ye place fortified receyued speres ax first comyng shotte arowes greued sore horse many therby slayne ouerthrowen season kyng castell men knewe nat myschiefe fallen vowarde nat slayne beleued ben styll prisoner thynkynge recouer agayne ye haue herde harde batayle fyerse many man caste erthe portugalois suche aduautage nat fought valiantly ben loste disco fyted saued enemyes coude nat come theym one narowe waye kyng portyngale lyghted fote toke axe hande dyd marueylous armes beate downe thre four owne handes feared none durst aproche nere shall shew parte codycions spaniardes trewe first settyng fierse coragyous great aduauntage hyghe mynded haue auauntage fight well hors backe soone haue caste two thre dartes gyuen stroke swerde se enemyes nat discofyted therwith feare turne horse flye awaye saue selfe best maye bataile iuberoth vsed playe foude enemyes harde strong fresshe batayle though done nothynge daye wherof marueyle also harde tidynges vowarde become spayniard euenyng harde fortune batayle perylous many entred strength valyantnesse feates armes slayne toke man rausom whatsoeuer noble lixbonoys ordayned wolde nat charged prisoner slayne castell suche foloweth sir dangonnes nendreche sir digo persement sir peter rosermont sir mare versaux great maister calestrane brother daye made knight called sir dygomor sir peter goussart mo desque peter goussart sonuyll iohan radigo rousell threscore baronnes knightes spaygne batayle naders prince wale disconfyted kyng henry castell nat slayne many noble men castell batayle iuberoth whiche yere grace thousande thre hu dred fourscore fyue saturday oure lady day august whan kyng castell vnderstode sawe howe menne thus disconfyted howe vowarde clene disconfyted without recouery sir raynalt lymosin deed marshall sawe howe noble chiualty lost well owne realme fraunce elles suche come thider serue good wylles sore displeased wyste nat counsayle take sawe began flye euery syde herde howe sayd hym sir dete hen tyme mater herde case ye nat alone disconfyte enemyes recouer domages people flyeth euery man intendeth saue hym selfe sir saue youre selfe ye wysely fortune day agaynst another tyme shall better kynge castyle beleued cousayle chaunged horse mounted fresshe courser strong light wheron man rydden daye kyng strake horse spurres tourned backe towarde enemyes toke waye towarde saynt yrayne whyder suche wolde saue themselfe fledde tyme kyng castell hadde knight house bare bassenet whervpon sercle golde stone valued twentie thousande frankes ordayned went saynt yrayne knight shulde beare tyll came busynesse delyuer kynge weare heed knight dyd nat whan came ioyninge batayle prease great knyght coude nat coe kynge also nat called wherfore aproched nat ye kyng whan sawe howe copany discomfyted portugaloys optayned vyctorie sawe howe euery man fledde euery syde feared lesyng riche iowell set bassenet owne heed fledde toke nat ye way saynt yrayne toke another waye towne arpent thus fledde way waye lyke people sore disconfyted abasshed moost parte fledde saynt yrayne euenynge thyder came kyng sore abasshed disconfyture spaynierdes iuberothe portugaloys lixbonoys optayned place great slaughter men ben gretter folowed chase thenglissh men whan sawe spaygniardes tourne backes sayd kyng portugale men sir demaunde yo horse folowe chase fledde shalbe outher taken slayne naye nat quod kynge suffyceth haue done oure men wery sore traueyled nere hande night shall nat knowe whyder go thoughe flye yet great nombre paraduenture drawe v strength haue v ease let v daye kepe deed morowe take counsayle faythe sir quod hartesell englysshman deed bodyes easy kept shall neuer v hurte shall haue profyte haue slayne many good prisoner straungers come farre serue therfore wolde fayne wynne somwhat calues flye without wynges banner wauyng wynde fayre brother quod kyng coueteth leseth better sure sythe honour vyctorie god hath sende v rather putte selfe paryll whan nedeth nat thake god haue ynowe make ryche thus case busynesse rested thus haue shewed felle busynesse iuberothe kynge portugale optayned vyctorie slayne fyue hundred knightes many squyers whiche great pytie domage sixe seuyn thousande men god haue mercy soules night tyll soday hour prime kyng portugale men remoued nat fro place neuer vnarmed eate lytell drake euery man stode whiche brought fro vyllage iuberothe sonday mornyng sonne rysinge kynge caused twelfe knightes mount horse ryde forthe sertche felde se newe assemble whan ydden retourned shewed founde body deed men well quod kyng nede nat doute publysshed departe then go vyllage iube rothe thereto abyde day night tyll monday mornynge thus departed lefte churche iuberothe went vyllage lodged taryed sondaye nexte nyght monday mornyng cou sayled drawe towarde lixbone sowned trumpettes dislodge gode order deted rode towarde lixbone tuesday kynge entred ye towne moche people glorie tryumphe receyued processyon brought palays ryding stretes people chyldren made feest reuerence cryed highe voice lyue noble kyng portugale whome god hath gyuen grace haue vyctorie puyssaunt kynge castyle hath disconfyted enemyes bi iourney kyng portugale kyng castyle felle suche grace loue countrey realme portugale suche batayle dyd dissimule hym came hym lixbone hym homage sayeng howe well worthy lyue howe god loued hym disconfyted puissaut kynge himselfe wherfore worthy beare crowne thus kynge gatte grace people specially common realme pnowe let v lytell speke kyng castyle thus disconfyted went saynt yrayn pynge lamentyng people cursyng harde fortune many noble owne countre fraunce slayne felde tyme entred saynt yrayne yet knewe nat domage daye knewe sende harald sertche deed bodyes thought moost parte suche harauldes foude deed bene prisoner saued lyue nat appered sore displeased sorie man coulde comforte hym whan herde reporte harauldes knewe certentie deed sayd sware shulde neuer haue ioye sythe many noble men deed quarell thirde daye kyng taryed saynt yrayne came knight bassenet called sir martyn haren delyuered bassenet kynge whiche valued ye haue herde ben herde wordes spoken hym said falsely ronne awaye fro kynge wolde neuer retourne agayne knight kneled downe kyng excused hym selfe largely kynge counsayle well content hym fyftene dayes kynge castyle retourned bergus spayne gaue euerye man leaue dete meanes treaty made bytwene kynge castyle kyng portugale truce taken fro feest saynt mychaell first day may bothe lande see deed bodyes slayne iuberothe buryed churche iuberoth mother church aboute bone dyuers caryed seruautes owne countreis phowe spyrite called orthone serued lorde corasse long tyme brought hym euer tidynges fro partes worlde cap xxxvii great marueyle consyder one thynge whiche shewed therle foiz house ortayse hym enfourmed busynesse iuberothe shewed one thyng haue oftentymes thought sithe shall longe lyue squyer tolde trouthe nexte daye bataile thus fought iuberoth erle foiz knewe wherof great marueyle sayd sonday monday tuesday therle pensyfe sadde chere man coulde worde hym thre dayes wolde nat issue chambre speke man thoughe neuer nere hym tuesday night called hym brother arnault guyllyam sayde hym softe voyce men hath wherof sorie come voyage sayd departed arnault guyllyam sage knyght knewe right well brother codicions stode styll gaue none answere therle thought declare mynde plainlye long borne trouble therof herte spake agayne hygher thane dyd sayd god sir arnault saye shortely ye shall tidynges therof countrey bierne hudred yere neuer loste suche losse iourney haue done nowe portugale dyuers knyghtes squyers present herde hym say stode styll durst nat speke remembred wordes within ten dayes knewe trouthe therof suche ben busynesse shewed euery thyng fortuned iuberothe therle renewed agayne dolour countrey sorowe loste parentes bretherne chyldren frendes saynt mary quod squyer shewed tale howe therle foiz coude knowe one day done within day two beynge farre faythe sir quod appered well knewe deuyner quod el hathe messangers flyeth wynde muste nedes haue crafte squyer began laughe sayd surely muste knowe arte nigromansye otherwyse saye trouthe nat tell howe oure ymaginacions sir quod suche ymaginacion ye haue therin please shewe wolde gladde therof thynge ought secrete shall nat publysshe long countre shall neuer speke worde thereof praye therof squyer wolde nat shulde knowen shulde speke therof shall shewe dyuers men speketh secretelye whan togyder frendes drewe parte corner chapell ortayse began tale sayd well twentie yeres paste countrey barone called raymon lorde corasse whiche seuyn leages fro towne ortaise lorde corasse yt tyme plee auygnon pope dysmes churche agaynst clerke curate whiche preest cateloygne great cleke claymed haue ryght dysmes towne corasse whiche valued hudred florens yere right shewed proued sentence diffynityue pope vrbane fyfte consistory generall condempned knight gaue iugement preest last iugement letter pope possession rode tyll came bierne shewed letter bulles pope possession dismes lorde corase great indignacion preest cae hym said mayster pe maister marten name thynkest yu reason thy letter wyll lese myne herytage nat hardy yt thou take thynge myne thou shall coste thy lyfe go thy waye place get benefyce myne herytage thou gettest parte one alwayes defende clerke douted knight cruell man therfore durste nat parceyuer thought retourne auygnon dyde whan departed came knight lorde corasse sayd sir force nat right ye take away fro right churche wherin ye greatly hurte coscience nat strong cou trey ye sir knowe trouthe soone maye shall sende suche champyon whome ye shall doute knight douted nothyng thretnynges sayd god thou mayst doute dethe lyfe thy wordes wyll nat lese myne herytage thus clerke departed fro lorde corasse went nat tell wheder auygnon cateloygne forgate nat promyse made lorde corasse departed afterwarde whan knyght thought leest hym thre monethes knyght laye nyght bedde castell corasse ladye wyfe came hym messangers visyble made marueylous tempest noise castell semed thoughe castell shulde haue fallen downe strake gret stroke chambre dore good ladye wyfe soore afrayde knyght herde spake worde therof bycause wolde shewe abasshed corage hardy abyde aduentures noyse tempest sondrie place castell dured longe space laste cessed nyght nexte mornynge seryautes house came lorde whan rysen sayd sir haue nat herde night haue done lorde dyssymuled sayd herde nothyng haue herde shewed noyse hadd herde howe vessell kechyn ouertourned lorde began laughe sayde yea sir ye dremed nothynge wynde name god quod ladye herde well nexte night great noyse greatter suche stroke gyuen chambre dore wyndowes shulde haue broken peces knyght starte vp bedde wolde nat lette demaunde chambre dore tyme ye night anone aunswered voyce sayde quod knyght sent hyder clerke catelloygne sent hyder quod voyce thou dost gret wronge thou hast taken fro hym ryghtes benefyce wyll nat leaue rest tyll thou haste made hym good accompte pleased quod knyght thy name arte good messangere ame called orthone orthone quod knyght seruyce clerke lytell profyte wyll putte moche payne thou beleue hym pray leaue hym come serue shall gyue good thanke orthone redy aunswere amouts knyght sayde woldest thou fayne haue seruyce yea truely quod knyght thou hurte persone house wyll quod orthon haue power yuel awake thy slepe well quod knyght tell shall soone agree leaue yuell clerke good thyng put payne therfore coe serue well orthon sythe thou wylte haue agreed spyrite orthone loued knight often tymes wolde coe vysite hym whyle laye bedde slepe outher pull hym care el stryke chambre dore wyndowe awake hym whan knyght awoke wolde saye orthon let slepe nay quod orthone wyll nat tyll haue shewed suche tidynges fallen late lady knyghtes wyfe wolde sore afrayed heer wolde stande vp hyde selfe vnder clothes thane knight wolde saye tidynges haste thou brought quod orthone come englande hungry place yesterdaye came then suche thynges fallen suche thus lorde corasse knewe orthon euery thynge done parte worlde case contynued fyue yere coude nat kepe owne counsayle laste discouered erle foiz shall shewe howe firste yere lorde corasse came daye orthayse erle foiz sayd hym sir suche thynges done engla de scotlande almaygne countrey euer erle foiz founde sayeng true great marueyle howe shulde knowe suche thyng shortly tyme therle foiz examyned hym straitly lorde corase shewed hym toguyder howe knewe howe came hym firste whan erle foiz herde ioyfull sayd sir corasse kepe hym well loue wolde hadd suche messangere costeth nothynge ye knowe hym euery thynge done worlde knight answered sayd sir true thus lorde corasse serued orthon long season nat saye orthone hadde mo maysters nat euery weke twyse thrise wolde come vysite lorde corasse wolde shewe hym suche tidynges thyng fallen fro whens came euer lorde corasse whan knewe thynge wrote therof euer erle foiz great ioy therof lorde worlde moost desyred newes straunge place tyme lorde corasse erle foiz erle demaunded hym said sir corasse dyd ye euer yet se messangere naye surely sir quod knyght neuer desyred marueyle quod erle well acquaynted hym ye wolde haue desyred haue sene hi wherfore praye desyre hym tell whet forme facyon haue herde say howe speketh good gascone outher truely sir quod knight speketh well fayre v bothe surely sir sithe ye counsayle shall payne se hym night lay bedde lady wyfe enured orthon afrayde hym came orthon pulled lord eare fast slepe therwith awoke asked quod orthon demauded fro whens comest yu nowe come orthon fro prage boesme howe farre hen quod knyght threscore dayes iourney quod orthone arte thou come then soone quod knight ye truely quod orthon came fast wynde faster hast thou wynges quod knight nay truely howe canste thou flye faste quod knyght ye haue nothyng knowe quod orthone quod knight wolde gladly se knowe forme thou arte well orthon ye haue nothing knowe sufficeth shewe tidyng faythe knyght wolde loue moche better myght se one well orthone sir sithe ye haue great desyre seme firste thynge ye se morowe whan yt ryse bedde shalbe sufficient quod lorde go thy way gyue leaue departe nyght next mornynge lorde rose lady wyfe afrayd durst nat ryse fayned selfe sicke sayd wolde nat ryse husbande wolde haue haue rysen sir quod shall se orthone wolde nat se good wyll well knight wolde gladly se hym arose fayre easely bedde sat downe bedde syde wenyng haue sene orthon owne performe sawe nothyng wherby might saye loyonder orthon daye passed nexte night came whan knyght bedde orthon came began speke accustomed go thy waye quod knight thou arte alyer thou promysest shulde haue sene nat quod shewed selfe nat lorde orthon wha ye rose bedde sawe nothynge lorde studyed lytell aduysed hymselfe well yes truely quod knyght nowe remembre satte beddes syde thynkynge sawe two strawes pauement tumblyng one vpon another orthone fourme dyde put selfe nat ynoughe quod lorde praye putte thy selfe fourme maye better se knowe well orthon ye wyll moche yt ye wyll lese go fro ye desyre moch naye quod knyght thou shalte nat go fro let se one wyll desyre well quod orthone ye shall se morowe take hede firste thynge ye se ye chabre shalbe well quod knight cotent go thy way lette slepe orthone departed nexte mornynge lorde rose yssued chambre went wyndowe loked downe courte castell caste eyen firste thynge sawe sowe greattest euer sawe semed leane yuell fauoured nothyng skynne bone long eares longe leane snout lorde corasse marueyle leane sowe wery ye sight comaunded men fetche houndes sayd lette dogges hunt dethe deuoure seruauntes opyned kenelles lette houndes dyde sette sowe laste sowe made great crye loked vp lorde corasse loked wyndowe sodaynely vanysshed awaye man wyste howe lorde corasse entred chambre right pensyue remembred hym orthon messangere sayd repent sette houdes hym aduenture euer hym sayd often tymes displeased hym shulde lese hym lorde said trouthe neuer came castell corasse also knight dyed yere next folowynge lo sir quod squyer thus haue shewed lyfe orthone howe season serued lorde corasse newe tidynges true sir nowe firste purpose erle foiz serued suche messangere surely quod squier ymaginacion many hath suche messagers nothynge done place sette mynde therto wyll knowe whan men thynke leest therof dyde whan good knightes squyers countrey slayne portugale iuberothe saythe knowledge suche thynges hath done hym moche profyte value spone loste house none wyll knowe whe thus toke leaue squyer went co pany bare well awaye tale pnowe wyll leaue speke busynes portugale spaygne speke busynesse languedocke frauce phowe siege layde breste bretaygne howe dyuers englysshe fortress countre tholous recouered turned frenche cap xxxviii season whyle aduentures thus felle castyle far marchesse ordayned sir olyuer clysson constable fraunce make bastyde strong castell brest bretaygne whiche englysshmen helde done longe wolde nat departe nother frenche kyng duke bretayne castell shulde partayne duke berrey duke burgoyne frenche kynges counsayle hadde oftentymes written duke bretayne desyring hym putte payne dilygence gette agayne enheritauce castell brest gretly preiudyce suffre englysshmen enioye duke prayer sayde lordes also bycause wolde gladly haue possession brest owne hades tyme layd siege therto nothyng wan departed then sayd howe coude nothyng wherat knightes squyers murmured sayde howe duke dyd dissimule suche tooke theym nat frendes wolde nat peace made castell brest shulde frenche kynges handes frenchman helde shulde nat lorde therof yet rather englysshe men handes englysshe men durst nat displease wherfore thynges cosydred constable frauce thought castell breest towne nat mete enemy realme fraunce thought nat honorable duke knyghtes bretaygne suffre dyde therfore ordayned laye siege therto great nombre knyghtes squyers bretaygne made chiefe capitaynes lorde molestroyt vycount barleere morfane lorde roche duraunt foure valyant men wente layde siege nere brest might made bastyde closed pale stone tooke fro brest issue excepte see whiche nat power close fro often tymes scrimysshes feates armes done ye barryers suche without desyringe dedes armes wolde coe valyantly barryers within receyued theym valyantly often dyuers hurt bothe tie fewe dayes dedes armes done season marchesse tholousyn valyant knyght frauce called sir galtier paschac good capitayne men warre nacyon berrey fronters lymosyn comynge seneschall tholous sir roger spaygne sir hugh frodeuyll seneschall carcassone hadde written fraunce constable state countre tholous robestan howe dyuers companyons aduenturers suche yssued lourde castell cuyllet made warre englysshmen helde handes fortress folowyng saynt forget bassere mesuylle purpuron couall roch fort th do iulyen naueret dyuers wherby enuyroned cytie tholous people coude nat yssue oute labour vynes landes go marchandyse great paryll without truce patesed castels chiefe capitayne expert man warre basque called espaigoullet dyd many marueylous dedes armes toke tyme scalynge castell armayle whyle lorde therof sir raymonde gone tholous kepte yere meane season whyle kepte caused made myne caue whiche went castell feldes whan caue made closed vp entre stone coulde nat parceyued waye vnder yerthe meane season lorde raymonde armayle treated espayguollet haue agayne castell money whan caue finysshed agreed lorde delyuer vp castell two thousande frankes dete lorde entred agayne castell repayred defaulte fyftene dayes espaiguollet co pany night came wode yssue caue entred hour mydnight toke castell lorde lyenge bedde raunsomed hym agayne two thousande frankes let hym go espayguollet kept styll castell good garison whiche sore traueyled countrey alyaunce company maner people robbed pylled thus march tholous rouergue vnder colour englysshmen therfore thyder sente sir gaultier paschac certayne nombre men armes delyuer countre fro enemyes came tholous sent knyghtes squyers therabout wrote sir roger spaygne seneschall carcassone came serue hym sir gaultier comissyon generall ouer offycers languedocke suche sent came suche nombres might make sir roger spayne came threscore speares hundred pauesses seneschall rouergue sir hugh frodeuyll came many mo whan togyder four c speares pauesses also sonne therle tereache fayre copany lorde barbason sir benedic faguell willm caudron breto copanyes one day departed fro tholous came saynt forgette rested capitayne man bierne great robber called bourge taylsacke whan lordes companyes come forget incontynent went assaut genowayes began sore shote yt scant within durste apere defence frenchman myst purpose first assaute lodged night toke ease ynoughe wherwith mornyng betymes armed throughe host sowned trumpettes assaute came good ordre fote dyke sene men armes entre dyke targettes ouer heedes tasted dyke speares passed ouer fote wall wolde haue taken great pleasur whan first passed ouer dyke shewed way folowed great wyll ben great blame taryed behynde copany suche folowed matockes pykes hades pearse withall walles couered heedes targettes receyue stone caste downe whiche great plentie genowayes shotte surely crosbowes non durste put heedes defence genoways crosbowes shotte surely lightly myst nat leuell ther many within sore hurte quarelles moche doughted sore shotte saute sore contynued mynours ouerthrewe pane walle within sore abasshed wolde haue yelded lyues saued enemyes luste therto felle good handes slayne sir galtier capitayne comauded shulde none taken mercye slayne nat one scaped thus lordes fraunce first comynge castell forget sir gaultier delyuered owner therof loste yere lacke good kepyng dyuers castelles bene fraunce takyng castell forge sir gaultier delyuered ye owner knight newe repayred nede frenche men sore dystroyed ye assayling therof went castell basse whiche erualton batefoyle capitayn greatly fortifyed thought frenche men wolde visyte hym dyde whan frenche men came thyder layde siege therto aduysed whiche te might best aduauntage gyue assaute determyned place day came saut parte thought moost feble genowayes crosbowes ordayned shote assauters behynde acquyted selfe truely doyng feate shot rudely within non durst shewe theselfe erualton batefoyle ye gate great assaute dyde marueylous armes moche enemyes sayd among selfe beholde yonder squyer great herte whome harnesse well enployed valyantly defended hym selfe well done bodye shewe hym best hym yelde vp castell departe elles shewe hym sir gaultier paschac wynne hym parforce ther man saue hym fro dethe hath sworne many wynneth parforce shall dye hanged seneschall tholous comaunded squyer gascoyne called wyllyam alyedell knewe ryght well erualton ben dyuers tymes hym armes companyon gladde go lothe erualton shulde haue hadd domage myght hym good came assaute made token wolde speke erualton great profyte answered content saut rested syde nat parte wylliam sayd erualton ye happy certayne yonder lordes haue sende haue pyte ye taken parforce remedy dethe oure soueraygne capitayne hath ordayned none shall scape dethe ser ued saynt forget therfore also wolde cou sayle yelde vp ye fortresse rather abyde thadueture one thyng ye may sure shall nat departe hen tyll ye taken erualton sayd william knowe well thoughe tyme ye agaynst ye wolde nat cousayle thyng dishonour knowe trouthe rendre vp holde shalbe myne may safely departe carye v moche maye safely conducted castell lourde condycion wyll ken elles nat sir quod wylliam haue nat farre charge commen gladly shal speke maisters retourned seneschall tholous shewed hym wordes sir hughe frodeuyll sayd lette v go speke sir gaultier nat tell wyll sithe haue gone farr mater wyll se came sir gaultier styll saute sir hughe frodeuyll sayd sir gaultier haue treated capitayne castel well wyllynge yelde vp castell v maye go quite maye cary safely conducted castell lourde therfore nowe sir loke ye wyll shulde lese one knightes squyers outher shotte cast stone perylous accident shulde gretter domage haue profyte puttyng dethe whan haue whiche nat yet wyll coste v people sir true quod seneschall carcassone suche assautes nat without dethe sore hurtyng wordes sir galtier paschac sayd well cotent cease assaut haue place thus lytell lytell shall wynne castelles pyllers holde though departe nowe good market paraduenture herafter maye fall agayne hades one tyme shall paye euer yuell dedes come yuell ende dayes haue hanged drowned suche robber fyue hundred hereafter shall come fame pricke went treatie came agayne barryers erualton batefoyle wylliam said faithe erualton maye thake god sir hughe frodeuyll hath made treatie ye demaunde ye may departe safely beare awaye moche ye ye shall safely brought lourde well quod erualton contente sythe wyll better knowe trouthe wylliam shall departe fro fortresse sore agaynst wyll haue great profite therby syth taken bridge turnay besyde maluoysin burge spaygne rausome two thousande frankes saye trouthe haue well recouered self euer haue ben fronters whiche loue well whan euer rode forthe lyghtely founde good aueture outher marchaut robeston tholous rodes moost parte euer gatte somwhat wylliam sayd sir beleue well ye wyll become frenche vndertake ye shalbe clene pardoned haue thousande frakes gyuen wyll become youre suretie ye shalbe euer good frenche ye wyll swere selfe sir erualton thanke wyll nat wyll still yet englysshe god helpe nat fynde herte good frenche returne company shewe daye wyll order oure busynesse morowe mornyng shall delyuer vp castell departe wherfore se oure conducte redy ceassed saute frenchemen went lodgyng passed night ease hadde well wherwith mornyng whan euery man redy hoost redy yt shulde conducte copanyons castell lourde sir hughe frodeuyll seneschall tholous went take possessyon castell whan came castell founde erualton batefoyle company redy departe trussed wolde cary knight lourde called sir monant salenges conueyed safely wheder wolde thus castell basse wonne squyer countrey kepynge therof gyuen hym countrey called bertram montesquyen frechmen went forthe came castell pulpuron wherof lytell mechyne souerayne capitayn done great domage countre therabout wherfore sir galter paschac sware father soule yt non ther shuld take rausome hanged might gette siege castell stode rocke goodly castell loke sir gaultier sware neuer departe then tyll hadde pleasure many assautes wan lytell castell well defended well quod sir galtier nat tell howe wyll frenche kynge ryche ynough kepe sege wyll nat departe one yere without haue castell pleasure suche hym beleued hym well ordred selfe therafter shall shewe howe fortued whan capitayns within sawe surely howe frenchman wolde nat dete then tyll castell soeuer cost douted aduysed departe then wheder frechmen wolde nat might well hadde caue went castell vnder groude wode halfe leage whan angerot capiteyne castell sawe dealyng frenchman knewe howe promised nat dete then tyll castell outher famyne otherwise douted sayd companye sir ise well sir gaultier paschac hath v greatly hatered feare longe siege shulde famysshe v nedeth nat make bastyde let kept hudred speares none v dare dete therfore shall shewe shall lette v take haue nyght wyll departe caue vnder erthe fayre great without faut shall bring v wode leage hen shall parell man host knoweth agreed counsayle night whan hadde trussed toke torch fagottes entred caue whiche fayre clere issued therof wode halfe leage fro castell ynowe knewe wayes forteresses lymosin rouergue whan oute parelles toke wayes sayd howe wolde folowe warres lengar angerot fyue hym wente towne castell piergourt called mountroyall lorde therof receyued hym swetely landes good englysshe wolde neuer tourne frenche whan dyd howbeit dyuers opynion thus garyson pulpuron saued selfe left persone hynde nere wolde frenchman knewe detynge thirde day departyng fre chemen ordayned gyue assaut made ingyn four stage euery stage might twentie cro bowes whan redy set forthe ingyn whiche named passe weykest syde castell geno way within ingyn whan wolde haue shotte agaynst castell body dyde appere anone parceyued castell voyde bycause body came defece ceassed shot bicause wolde nat lese quarelles came downe fro ingyn came ye capitayns marueyle ment sayd sir without fayle body within castell howe knowe quod sir gaultier sir quod knowe none appereth defence shot ordayned ladder sette vp agaynst walles mouted passed ouer walles entred castell founde creature therin wente gate founde great bundell kayes among founde kaye gate opyned barryers one another wherof lordes great marueyle specially sir gaultier paschac wende ben deted castell enchautment demauded hym howe might seneschall tholous sayd hym sir surely nat thus gone without haue secrete waye vnder erthe thynke thanne castell sought euery corner suche waye shulde founde cellar mouthe alley open lordes dyde beholde sir galtier great marueyle therof demaunded neschall tholous knewe sir haue herde therof thought nothyng wolde haue thus departed waye faythe quod sir gaultier begone waye haue castelles countre suche ordynaunce sir quod sir hughe dyuers suche castelles olde tyme teyned raynalt montabon hath suche coueyauce whan bretherne kepte warre agaynst kynge charlemayne frannce made maner counsayle aduyse maugis theyr cosyn ye kynge besyeged puyssaunce sawe coulde resyst hym wolde departe without ony leue takynge meanes passage vnder erthe surely sayd syr brew lawde gretly yt ordynaunce say yf euer shall haue ony warre agaynst kynge duke ony neyghboure haue sone retourned countrey shall cause suche myne made castell pasac thus toke possessyon castell set therin men warre kepe garyson wente towardes ye castell conuall espaygnolet papereaw basque capytayne hym good nombre pyllers robber lordes theyr company came garyson conuall robestan layde syege therto syr gaultyer demaunded seneshall tholous yf conuall auncyently perteyned raynalte monutalban sayd yes caue vnder grounde sayd syr gaultyer syr true sayd syr brew reason ther espaygnolet wanne seconde tyme owner within fyr gaultyer sente ye knyght owner therof sayd hym syr good ye enfourmed v myne yt castell yssue therof syr raymonde conuall sayd syr surely way vnder grounde ther taken lost castel longe tyme decayed destroyed robber newe repayred yt way came syr yssue therof wood farre hence wel sayd syr gaultyer well iiii dayes wente wood hym cc men wel armed sawe hole yssue caused erthe busshes auoyded lyghted vp many fagottes sayd yt ordeyned go caue syr folowe caue shal brynge hall conuall ye shal fynde dore breke vp ye stronge ynough fyght entred came ye grece nere hall dore ye castell grete ax strake dore yt tyme nere nyght within castell made good watche perceyued howe myne wolde haue entred castell espaygnolet goynge rest came thyder cast stone bench tymbre caue dore ye entente none sholde entre thoughe dore broken vp done shyfte none defence myne anone brake dore peces yet wer neuer nere whe sawe impossible entre retourned agayne oost tyme myduyght shewed founde howe conuall perceyued fortefyed caue dore possyble entre way castell phowe castelles conuall bygore mesnyll taken within taken slayne hanged ca xxxix syr gaultyer paschat sente basse grete engyne whiche taken downe brought thyther raysed vp wheles sholde also apparelled instrumentes ye assawre al redy syr gaultyer gretly desyred wynne castell caused trompettes sowne assawte seneshall tholouse company ye one syde syr roger spayne seneshal carcasso syde also lorde barbaran syr benedic lorde benoch lorde countye desterac syr raymonde lysle knyghtes squyers countrey began sawte within defende themselfe whiche nede sawe themselfe harde parte knewe wel syr gaultyer wolde take none mercy therfore thought defende themselfe longe myght sell theyr lyues derely geneways crosse bowes shot sore hurte many within none within doubted gretely syr gaultyer pasac dyd meruayles armes sayd company syr shall rascalles holde v hande daye thus yf agaynste good men armes wolde meruayle mo feaces warre rascalles within myne entent dyne within castell nowe shall sene yf ye wyll accomplysshe desyre wordes suche desyred good wyl aduau ced themselfe forthe toke many ladder set vp agaynst wall engyne stode crosse bowes shot fyersly none within durst shew themselfe thus clene assawte ye frensshe men entred ye castel conual theyr swordes theyr handes chasynge theyr enemyes many slayne taken euery entred ye gate demaunded syr gaultyer sholde done taken saynt george sayd wyll hanged incontynent commaundement done espaygnoy let began fyrst lordes dyned castel people towne taryed day syr gaultyer delyuered agayne ye lorde conuall towne castell ordeyned departe then thus takynge castell conuall ye haue herde frenssh men wente another holde called mastull whiche done grete domage ye countrey made assawte wtin defended themselfe yt longe clene assawte wonne castell also within slayne hanged vp ratchfort castelles knewe howe syr gaultyer wonne many castelles toke none mercy outher slayne hanged doubted moche comynge ende wherfore departed ye nyght tyme tell whether wente vnder grounde aboue bytwene ye castell rochefort castell royr caues vnder erthe auncyently perteyned raynolde mountalban frensshmen founde castelles clene voyde came thyder newely repeopled men warre prouysyon toke theyr way towarde tholous go bygore ye fronter tarbe two castelles one called thedos iulyan nauaret whiche gretely trauayled countrey ye good towne tarbe londes lorde dauchyn syr gaultyer pasac lordes fraunce languedoc well refresshed theym cyte tholous departed toke waye bygore came castell ledos iuly taryed sayd wolde goo tyll wonne thyder came syr gaultyer pasac ye seneshal nob san perteynynge erle foys syr gaultyer sente hym helpe dryue countrey pyllers robber renne well countrey nobessan place also ye erle foys consented sholde elles durst haue done do iulya xv dayes yt castell stronge good capytayne therin squyer gascoyn called bruer de brome phowbeit last hadde assawte treaty within departed theyr lyues goodes saued also falsely conuayed lowrde squyre called bertram mountdyghen lordes fraunce do iulyen toke aduyse whether myght kepe styll rase downe erthe counsayled bete downe bycause lowrde crafty subtyle fearynge yt whe sholde gone wolde wynne agayne better downe yet stone lye hepe lykely neuer buylded agayne thus became do iulyan wente nauaret wherin also companyons adueturers kepte yere knewe howe do iulya departed lyke wyse dyde saufconduyte wente lowrde whiche theyr chefe refuge knewe well man wolde seke wolde lese theyr payne ye castell lowrde impossyble taken force frensshe men rased castel do iulya wente nauaret founde voyde ordeyned beten downe wherof tarbe nothynge myscontent yt garyson done grete domage wente castell dauchen bygore standynge amonge mountaynes entre byerne xv dayes season made dyuers assawtes wanne base courte al theyr horse stronge towre rocke yt coulde wonne whe lordes sawe howe lost theyr payne yt wyllyam morenton kepte ye holde wolde yelde vp sell herke treatye departed retourned tarbe syr ganltyer passac gaue leue men warre departe payde theyr wage suffycyent sygnement yt pleased wente carcasson theraboute refresshed hym whyle lay tydynges came hym fraunce comaundement fro kynge sholde drawe garyson bounteuyll xainton march burdeloys poyctou whiche garyson kepte capytayne called saynt foy gascoyne sayd fraunce yt syr iohn harpedan seneshall burdeaus made grete assemble men warre lyborne rayse bastydes yt poictou xainton hadde layde bounteuyll kynges commaundement obeyed syr gaultyer reason toke hym lx speres c crosse bowes geneuoys departed fro carcasson passed rouergue agen costed pierregourt came bounteuyll founde seneshalles rochel poictou pierregourt dagen grete nombre men warre pin farre countres maye well meruayled noble royalme fraunce therin many cytees townes castelles whiche without nombre well farte partyes therof harte royalme ye shall fynde goynge cyte tholous cyte burdeaus stondynge ryuer garon fyrst langurant rions caldiac bangou saynt macayre castell dorthe candoch geronde larull myllant saynt basyll marmande comont tannus lemna dagenes montour agyllon thouars porte saynt mary clermont agen ambyllart castell sarasyne iehedo verdun vell mote takynge way ryuere dordone whiche falleth garon ye shall fynde castelles one syde ye brouech frousach liborne saynt milion chatellon mote saynt pesant montremell saynt foy bergerach mortquinormons castell oftene castels englysshe frensshe contynewed warre season gascoynes wolde haue none otherwyse haue chosen xx yere neuer made othe promyse ony man true ye gascoynes fyrst theyr meanes kynge edwarde chefe possessyon gascoyne also prynce sone put agayne fro clerely conteyned hystory good wyt aduyce kynge charles sone kynge iohn drewe loue fayre meanes grete gyftes ye grettest lordes gascoyne ye erle armynake lorde dalbret prynce lost pryde iohan froysarde wrote hystory season buroeaus yt prynce wente spayne ye englysshe prowde yt set nothyng ony nacyon theyr owne gentylmen gascoyne acquitayne suche lost theyr goodes ye warre yet coulde gete maner offyce theyr coun rees englysshemen sayd worthy able haue ony wherwith sore grudged theyr myndes myght shewed bycause hardnes ye erle armynacke lorde dalbret founde ye prince forsoke hym became frensshe dyde dyuers knyghtes squyers gascoyne kynge phylyp frau ce kynge iohn sone lost pryde hyghe mynde lyke wyse dyde ye prince kynge charles wynne fayrnes large humylyte wolde gascoynes delte withall kynge charles entente loue lordes sholde longer contynewe made maryage bytwene syster lady isabell burbon lorde dalbret bytwene fayre chyldren cause loue endured longer tyme paris herde lorde dalbret speke worde whiche well noted byleue spake sporte howbeit spake grete sadnes knyght brytayne serued hym knyght demaunded hym ye busynes countrey howe contente frensshe answered sayd thanke god metely well howbeit money also whe made war kynge englonde haue rode forthe aduenture fou de euer ryche merchaunt tholous condon bergerath lyghtely day gate cuer good pray fresshe ioly nowe deed knyght began laughe sayd truely lyfe gascoynes lyghtly wolde euer haue menes domage therfore harde wordes say thought yt lorde dalbret repented hym yt become frensshe ye lorde musydent gascoyne taken batayle anne sware handes duke aniow yt wolde come parys become frensshe euer came paris kynge charles made hym good chere yt euer kynge dyd ye lorde musydent departed agayne fro parys without ony leue wente coutrey became agayne englysshe brake ye promyses yt made duke aniow lykewyse dyde lorde rousen lorde dura lorde languerant suche nacyon gascoyne stable loue yet englysshe men better frenssheme theyr warre agaynst ye frensshe men profytabe agaynst englysshe men pryncypall incydent yt moost inclyneth therto phowe kynge cypre slayne murdred bedde owne broder exhortacyon corrupcyon infydelles bountye hardnes hym capitulum xl season came tydynges frau cefor th der came kyng lyo armony wt grete company man chased royalme wherof kynge turkes al royalme wonne excepte one castel standynge ye see called courthe whiche kepte gen uoys bycause castell key yssue entre see go alexandria sowdans londe geneuoys gothe marchaundyse meanes truage yt pay rude prester iohns londe euery place welcome bycause ye golde syluer yt brought thyder merchaudy se yt exchaunge alexandria cayr dama place amonge sara syns suche maner worlde gouerued yt one countrey another therby euery thynge knowen geneuoys yt furthest doth aduenture theyr merchaudyse lordes ye porte ye se aboue ye venisias feared doubted amonge sarasyns ony people see valyaunt men grete entrepryse galy well furnysshed ye geneuoys dare well assay iiii galeys sarasyns turke tartaryes sholde moche domage crystendome yf geneuoys bycause renomed chefe lordes see marchynge infydelles therfore haue euer l galeys grete shyppes rynnynge see defende iles ye ile cypre ile rodes ye ile dostye boundes see grece vnto turkye haue towne castel pere sto dynge see constantyne le noble whiche kepte theyr cost charge iii iiii tymes euery yere refresshed yt yt necessary tartaryes turkes haue dyuers tymes assayed gete coulde neuer attayne therto haue euer lost haue wonne ye castell pere stondeth rocke one entre whiche geneuoys gretely dyde fortefye also geneuoys haue towne castell iason whiche ryght noble grete profyte nere countres crystendome yf pere iason stycye rodes ayde geneuoys infydelles wolde soone come gaiet yea naples porte cornet rome ye sayd garysons whiche alwayes well prouyded men warre geneuoys shyppes galeys euer redy defende wherfore turkes dare aduenture partyes yt ye fronters constantyne le noble towarde hungery yf noble kynge cypre peter liesieguen noble valynnt prynce conquered ye grete cyte alexa drie satalye yf lyued longer wolde haue gyuen sowdan turkes moche syth godfrey boloyns dayes neuer moche yt ryght wel knewe turkes tartaryes infydelles suche knewe prowes hygh dedes therfore haue hym dystroyed made merchaundyse kynges broder called iaquet yt sholde slee kynge broder dyd slewe bed whiche fowle dede bloode slee valyaunt kynge cypre intended ymagened nyght day none thynge myght wynne holy londe haue handes ye infydelles syr phelyp maysyeres chauncellour peter liesiegnen kynge cypre wrote tombe foloweth copy wherof ye chapytre house freer celestynes paris peter liesiegnen ye vi kyng latyne iherusale godfrey boloyne kynge cypre grete prowes hyghe empryse toke batayle cost cytees alexandrie egypte triple surie layas armony sytalie turkye dyuers cytees castelles ye infydelles enemyes lawe ihesu cryst animaeius requiescat pace pand geneuoys loued hym gretely reason knewe dethe prepared vii galyes sente cypre toke perforce cyte samagose iaquet within ouer ranne best parte ye royalme wolde haue destroyed royalme bycause stronge townes fortress kepe fronter warre agaynst turkes therfore lefte styl mennes handes countre excepte cyte samagose whiche kepte styll fortefyed wanne fyrste grete ryches ledde gene iaquet murdred broder true kyng cypre fayre sone maryed crowned kynge put iaquet strayte pryson wolde put hym dethe kepte styll theyr ha de samagose knowe yf kepe yet within season ye yonge kynge cypre dyed bed wherof ye geneuoys sore dyspleased coulde amende ye lande without ony heyre tell gouerneth nowe yere yt erle foys house shewed knyght biern lorde valenchyn howe geneuoys grete parte lande helde styl samagose countrey crowned theyr kynge sayd iaquet lacke heyre tell meanes came pryson handes ye geneuoys sayd kynge lyon armony came fyrst fraunce ye kynge lordes made hym good chere reason come thyder farre countre hym knowen tydynges royalme grece empyre constantyne le noble examyned puyssaunce ye turkes tarcaries put hym royalme answered sayd yt grete taco tarcarie alway made hym warre yt put royalme demauded yf yt tacon tartarie puyssaunt ye truely sayd puyssaunce puyssaunce sowdan hath subdued emperoure constantyne le noble kepte lawes tartary kyng answered sayd nay tacon tactarie sowdan haue longe made warre agaynst emperour constantyne le noble last fayne make ende elles coulde haue pea whiche emperour co stantyne le noble sone lady mary burbon sone emperour hugues lesiegne whiche emperour fayne giue doughter maryage ye sone ye taco tarcarie howbeit emperour abydeth styll cry te lawe reason comyctyon maryage demau ded hym ye erle co er sauoy dyd yt countrey seyng valyaunt grete puyssaunce kynge answered sayd yt erle sauoy ye empyre hugry made warre agaynst turkes tartaryes valyauntnes conquered tartaryes sowdans lande two good townes calipole lobeme lefte men kepe retourne erle sauoy townes kepte styll cryste longe good kynge cypre lyued soone sowdan tacon tartarie knew dethe feared nothynge empeof constantyne le noble raysed army cm horseman came ranne costantyne le noble fro then wente besyeged calipole conquered perforce slewe crysten men yt within made grete warre agaynst emperour costantyne le noble yt puyssau ce coulde resyst forbare hym reason doughter sone ye grete tacon coueted haue maryage whiche harde case tyme come offycers tacon cyte constantyne le noble yt grekes lyue vnder truage yf kynges crysten put therto remedy lengthe matter shall go euyll yt turkes tartary shall conquere grece tourne theyr byleue make theyr auauntes mocke pope wherof one rome another auignyon say yt ii goddes crystendome warreth eche agaynst wherby afferme lawe feble lyghter dystroyed condempned lay therto reason yt sholde cxalte crysten fayth ye fyrst mynyssheth dystroy demau ded kynge armony whether sowdan tacon tartarie ii grettest prynces amonge infydelles yt knowen grekes kynge answered sayd nay surely ye gretest alwayes turkes noble greter sage redoubted warre longe haue good heed gouernour haue c yere thoughe ye tacon tartarie holde subieccyon emperoure constantyne le noble yet ye lorde turkey holdeth lykewyse ye taco lorde turkey called lamorabaqum say trouthe valyaunt armes wyse man lawe lamorabaquin coplayne neuer dyd hurte hath alwayes kepte warre agaynst emperoure hungery ye lordes fraunce demaunded hym yf lamorabaqum grete feared sayd ye truely sayd kynge armony speke emperour costantyne le noble emperoure hu gery
