feareth hym lykewyse doth sowdan babylon tacon tartarie haue herde say ye tartaryes yt tacon wolde tyme haue put vnder ye emperoure constantyne le noble doubte lamorabaqum ye tacon knoweth hym nature well sone knoweth one gretter hymselfe wyll neuer haue ioy tyl haue put hym vnder wherfore tacon wyll costantyne le noble yt myght well yf wolde demaunded yf lamorabaquin ony grete power men ye kynge sayd ye surely xxx yere soeuer wente euer company cm horse alwayes lodged ye feldes neuer entreth ony towne garde hath euer xxm turkes whereso euer goeth hath fader hym hymselfe lx yere age fader lxxx x loueth moche ye frenshe language suche cometh then desyreth se grete lordes ye worlde ye frensshe kynge estate ordre one speke hym fraunce well content ye kynge demauded ye lamorabaqum suffred ye tacon pea syth grete emperour bycause sayd ye kynge yt tacon feareth hym dare make hym warre also certayne townes porte tartarie yt yerely payeth trybute lamorabaquin also al one lawe wyl lyghtly dystroy theyr owne lawe meruayleth gretely ye warre amonge cryste howe eche dystroyeth wherfore often mynde come crystedome wyn hym wolde lade rather ye tacon ben better demauded answeswered sayd lamorabaquin lorde noble codycyon yf xxx yere yonger lykely make grete coquestes wolde employ warre hath wonne countrey towne sygnory desyreth nothynge truage leueth styll euery man owne byleue putteth neuer fro herytage desyreth nothynge souerayne domynacyon wherfore saye yf conquered ye royalme armony tartary haue suffered pea royalme styll owne byleue knowled gynge hym souerayne grete lordes yt marche nere hym grekes tracyens take hym theyr souerayne lorde wherby doubte soueraynte sowdan tacon tartarie lorde satalie lorde dela palice lorde hawlte lodge iii lordes theyr landes pea reason truage yt pay lamorabaquin ther turke tartarien yt dare ony wronge domage demauded ye kynge armony yf lande clerely lost myght recouered agayne truely sayd kynge without recouery without puyssaunce crystendome come thyder stronger turkes tartary haue sayd ferther come forwarde lykely coquere excepte one towne called courth whiche fyrst towne royalme armony yet crysten mennes handes al ye resydue ye royalme ye infydels handes ye chyrches wonte set vp theyr ydolles theyr mawmettes demaunded towne courth stronge ye truely sayd ye kynge wyll wonne without loge syege elles betrayed standeth nere see drye place bytwene ii rockes whiche ca approched yf yt turkes tartary theyr hades another good towne ferre then called adelphe grece dystroyed hungery sholde haue moche demaunded yf hungery marched nere tartarie turkes kynge sayd ye truely nerer turkes lamorabaquin ony lordes sayd grete meruayle ye lamorabaquin suffereth hym rest syth marcheth soo nere hungery beynge valyaunt man grete conquerour name god sayd kynge armony tyme hath studyed moche myght haue done domage royalme hungery yf incydent ben ben farre countrey hungery demaunded incydent kynge sayd shal shewe phowe kynge armony examyned howe xxxm turkes slayne dystroyed royalme hungery ca xli lamordbaquin saw yt ye lordes yt marched nere hym fered doubted hi co questes prowes yt al boudes ye see hugery obeyed hym also saw wel ye valyaunt kyng hungery frederycke deed royalme fallen woma wherfore aduysed hym conquere yt royalme made grete somons turkye suche sente came hym lamorabaquin went forthe lodged ye playnes satalie bytwene palice haulte lodge gyue feare enemyes entencyo entre ye royalme hugery bycause yt hungery royalme coutrey closed en yronned wt hygh rockes moutaynes wherby ye stronger sente hym ambassadours heraldes wt mulet charged wt wylle comaunded go hungery ye erle lazaran whose lades lyeth twene ye mountaynes melcabe robee whiche way purposed army sholde pa shewe hym comaunded hym yf thynke lyue rest haue lande pea yt obey v lykewyse lorde palice lorde satalie lorde haulte lodge hath done yt open gyue v fre passage thrughe landes yf say ay rebell agaynst v shewe hym behalfe yt shall brynge many men dystroy coutrey graynes mylle sacke ambassadours departed wel istructed yt sholde rode theyr iourneys tyll came hungery ye lande erle lazaran soude hym castell called archforme erle lyke sage lorde receyued ambassadours right swetely made good chere meruayle sawe entre courte mule charged sacke wyst thought ben golde precyous stone yt lamorabaquin sente hym drawe hym therby consente suffre hym haue fre passage thrugh coutrey howbeit sayd hymselfe yt wolde neuer corrupted maner ryches yt sholde presented hym messagers came erle sayd syr lazaran vnderstade sente fro hyghe redoubted lorde souerayne kynge lamorabaquin lorde turkye wt apertenauces say behalfe yt comaudeth come obey saunce lyke maner ye knowe yt neyghbours haue done lorde de la palice ye lorde haulte lodge lorde satalie haue done hym homage yt ye open hym passage countrey yf ye thynge lyue rest doynge ye shall deserue gretely grace loue yf ye rebell disobey charged say yt lorde lamorabaquin wyl brynge cou trey mo armes graynes mylle sacke therwt opened ye sa shewed hym wtin ye erle lazaran vnderstode ye ambassadoure lamorabaquin determyned hymselfe answere temporatly wolde dyscouer thought sodaynly sayd close vp ye sacke se ryght wel therin haue well harde thynge lamorabaquin demaundeth wtin iii dayes shall make aswere request demaudeth cousayl answered sayd syr ye speke wel trustyng haue swere taryed iii dayes shall shewe ye erle lazaran dyd ye space iii dayes sent uyded ye castell mo iim capo henes closed vp house wtout ony maner mete yt iii dayes etc thynge daye came wolde answere ambassadours sent galary lokynge downe courte sayd syrs come hyder leane shal shewe newe thynge answere knowynge wolde doo leaued downe wyndowe hym gate closed courte grete men redy doo ordeyned opened chambre dore ii pollayne yt eten mete ii dayes seruauntes toke grayne yt sacke cast aboute capon hennes yt within halfe houre al corne ete vp clene wolde haue eten yf erle sayd messagers syrs ye haue sene howe grayne whiche haue brought hyder mayster clene eten deuoured brought thynge pollayne yet wolde ere yf yt truesyr sayd wherby speke yt say sayd ye erle answere lyeth therin ensaple ye haue sene lamoraba quin sayth yt yf obey hym wyl brynge lande men armes without nombre wherfore say vnto hym fro wyl abyde shall brynge many shal al deuoured corne deuoured pollayne ambassadours harde swere ryght pensyue toke theyr leue departed dyde moche theyr iourneys yt came lamorabaquin shewed hym erle sayd saynge semynge set lytell manassyng wt answere lamorabaquin sore dyspleased sayd howe matter sholde rest whether erle wolde wolde entre coutre hugery wolde dystroy erles countrey cause answered hym presumptuously pnowe shall shewe crle dyd sawe well defyed lamorabaquin knew wel sholde shortely tydynges hym therfore made prouysyon defende hym wrote al knyghtes squyers come hym stoppe entre lamorabaquin hungery comaundynge euery man syght letter drawe hym certefyenge howe lamorabaquin ye playnes haulte loge suche erle sente obeyed wyllyngly came erle defende crysten dome dyuers came hym yt sente suche harde therof exalte crysten faythe dystroy ye infydelles also erle lazaran caused forestes hyghe tree hewe downe layde trauers one ouer another wherby turkes sholde fynde ony newe way power came certayne passage lamorabaquin sholde passe entre hungery erle hym xm men hungery x crosse bowes dyd set bothe side way also redy iim countre hauynge grete ax cut downe tree wolde haue al done sayd yt aboute hym syrs without doubte lamorabaquin wyl come syth sente worde wolde therfore syrs quyte yourselfe well valyauntly kepe defende passage yf yt turkes wynne al hungery grete peryll lost stronge place one v worth iiii also better dye honoure defendynge herytages fayth iesu cryst lyue inshame seruage vnder dogges infydels thoughe lamorabaquin noble wyse man lawe syr sayd shal abyde aduenture let turkes come wyll shall redy receyue ordenaunce passage turkes knewe nothyng erle lazaran doubte spyes set men suche trusted well hymselfe kepe ye passage yt sholde go turkes nother day nyght lamorabaquin forgate entrepryse sayd wolde go vysyte lande erle lazaran grete domage wolde reputed lyer yt promysed toke lxm set ouer iiii capytaynes house holde duke mansyon mecque ye keper dan et alphalor samarie ye prynce corde called brachyn theyr departynge sayd syrs go waye wt copany ye suffycyent open ye passage hugery entre ye lade ye erle lazaran dystroye soone may know ye ye shal come thyder ye resydue people wyl put hungery vnder subiectyon royalme almayne enchauntours countrey egypte saye desteny lorde kynge worlde place wolde moost gladlyest se rome auntyently enherytauce predecessours coquered gouerned dyuers tymes wyll crowned galafre landas racon tartarye sowdan babylone shal crowne hym theyr knee answered sayd syr shall accomplysshe desyre comaundement departed wt lxm turkes amonge xxm moost experte men warre best armed turkye ledde vowarde longe iourneyed yt came amonge mountaynes lazaryn founde let entrynge countrey ye vowarde entred duke mecque duke daniuet ledde vowarde passed erle lazaryus enbusshement erle hungeryons sawe theyr tyme set theyr worke worke cut downe tree stoppe ye wayes yt coulde mo entre comen recule closed yt possyble ony go ony thus enclosed xxxm turkes refyersly assayled hungaryons handeled bothe sydes way slayne one yt skaped ii duke also slayne thought haue saued themselfe woodes chased yt slayne areregarde tourned backe whe saw coulde entre tree yt stopped ye way retourned lamorabaqum shewed hym grete myschef yt falle people wherof meruayllous sory dyspleased called cousayle know best hym lost ye floure chyualry retourned dyd tyme ye kynge armony shewed owne estate frenshe kynge baron france counsayle hym grete pyte bycause come fro ferre coutre grece seke counsayle ayde bycause kynge chased royalme thynge lyue maynteyne estate pthe frensshekynge yonge sayd wyl yt kynge irmony come hyder se v hope haue coforte helpe ayde v kepe estate aperteyneth hym kyng wel whe may weshal ayde hym wt men warre helpe recouer herytauce wherto haue good wyl bounde exalte ye crysten faythe frensshe kynges wordes well harde vnderstande reason none yt sayd contrary kynges vncles counsayle desyrous accomplysshe entent kynge armony maynteyne estate assygned hym certayne rente reuenues chambre accomptes well truely payde euery moneth assygnement vim frankes yere delyuered hym fyrst vm frakes prouide lodgyng vessel thynges necessary lodgynge apoynted saynt andon besyde saynt denyce kepe house thus ye kynge armony reteyned ye frensshe kyng fyrst comynge dayly encreased apayred somtyme frensshe kynge specyally hyghe feestes phowe pope vrban pope clemet grete dyscorde togyder howe crysten kynges varyaunce theyr lectyons warres bytwene ca xlii season came au gnyon se pope clement syr othes bresnyl haue money ye warre made hym agaynst ye romayns bertram gles wrote hymselfe pope vrban ye vi coteyned hystory syr othes shewed dyuers thynges pope ye cardynalles wherin wel byleued harde money coulde gete none ye pope chambre clene voyded fro golde syluer yt ye cardynals coulde haue ye money yt perteyned theyr hattes syr othes bresnyll departed fro wel content auyg yon delyuered hym frankes set lytell therby wherby pope clementes warre sore weked syr othes wolde wyse medle ony pope warres margaret dura gaiecte aduersary agaynst quene naples wyfe sotyme kynge lewes duke aniow sente syr othes ayde warre yt made agaynst napolytanes syr othes certayne space exscused hymselfe dyssymuled foded forth tyme wyst counsayle dyde put hym mynde go margaret dura enherytoure naples cycyle helpe ayde defende heritage take wyfe contente mary hym bycause noble blood hyghe extraccyon lorde kynge countrey called daure cousayle counsayled hym contrary saynge myght therby come euyll ende chyldre kynge lewes naples crowned kynge cyte bare thoughe yonge yet grete frendes kynsmen specyally frenlshe kynge theyr cosyne germayne wyl ayde theyr moder iohan duches amowe mayneal doubtes counsayle shewed hym wherfore syr othes forbare longe season dyssymuled mater toke none bothe partyes season ye sowdyours pope clement enclosed ye cyte peras pope vrban besyeged lorde moctroy valiaunt knyght countye gene sauoy syr talebart knyght rodes syr bernarde de la sale pope vrban sore constrayned yt poynte haue ben taken enformed xxm frankes capytayne almayne grete company hym called erle courant wolde haue delyuered pope vrban ye handes pope clement whervpon syr bernarde de la sale sent auygnyon pope clement ye sayd money pope cardynalles coulde make money ye pope courte poore money syr bernarde de la sale retourned euyll content syege pruce dyssymuled matter prucyens lykewyse also erle courant pope vrban yssued pruce peryll wente rome abode knowe ryght well tyme come wolde moche thynges howe churche sholde fall suche trouble endure longe plage sent fro god clargy aduyse consydre well theyr grete estate superfluyte many dyde sette lytell therby blynded pryde eche one thought good another wherfore wente euyll yf fayth ben confyrmed ye handes grace ye holy goost nlumyned harte yt gone ryght way helde ferme vnyte elles fayth gretely defourmed grete lordes erthe begynnyng dyd nothynge laughe chyrche tyl cronycled cronycles yere lorde ihesu cryst mccclxxx x moche comon people meruayled howe grete lordes frensshe kynge kynge almayne kynges prynces crystendome dyd prouyde remedy case one thynge reasonable appease comon people escuse hyghe prynces kynges duke erles lordes ensample yolke egge without whyte whyte yolke maye clergy lordes one without another lordes gouerned ye clergy coulde lyue beestes clergy ye clergy counsayleth exhorteth lordes say surely haue ben tyme dyuers partyes worlde accomplysshe pleasure se noueltyes worlde haue knowledge conquestes aduentures wryten boke truely season yt wente thus aboute worlde coulde lyghtly se grete lorde marmoset ye clergy boy symple lygnage mounted vp honoure reason theyr iangelyng raylynge excepte erle foys neuer none suche naturally sage wysdome better ony yt coulde gyuen hym yet say suche lordes ruled suche marmosettes fooles rather fooles sore blynded yet haue two eyen whan knowledge came fyrst ye frensshe kynge charles dyfference bytwene two pope dyd put matter ye clergy whiche way sholde take clergy fraunce determyned toke pope clement moost surest parte frensshe opynyon acorded kynge castel kynge scottes bycause season scysme thus chyrche fraunce castell scotlande ioyned togyder alyaunce kynge englonde ye kynge portyngale contrary oppynyo agaynst theyr enemyes erle flaundres neuer inclined courage pope clemet yt sholde ryght pope bycause vrba fyrst chosen rome archebysshop bare clement beynge cardynall geane wrote lettres vnto noble erle flaunders howe pope chosen due electyon rome named vrban wherfore wolde byleue yt clement longe lyned opynyon kynge almayne empyre also ye kynge hungry thus put wrytynge state dyfferences yt sene dayes worlde ye chyrche meruayle thoughe ye lordes worlde suffered dyssymuled ye matter brought remembraunce howe yt yonge pope innocent caygned auygnyon helde pryson freer mynoure called freer iohn roche tayllad clerke sayd haue herde pryuely dyuers place shewed aledged dyuers auctorytes incydentes fortune yt fell dayes ye royalme fraunce also spake takynge kynge iohn shewed certayne thynges reasonable howe chyrche sholde suffre moche ye grete superfluytes yt sawe prison shewed sayd cardynall ostie called dearras ye cardynall auxere wente vysyte hym argue hym layde ensample hereafter ye shall lordes sayd freer one fowle appered worlde without ony fethers al fowles knew yt borne came se hym bicause fayre pleasaunt beholde ymagyned amonge myght byrde without fethers knewe well coulde lyue sayd wolde sholde lyue bycause fayre euery fowle gaue hym theyr fethers fayrer byrde mo fethers gaue hym fayre byrde well fethered began fle ye byrdes gyuen hym theyr fethers whe sawe hym flee toke grete pleasure whe byrde sawe hymselfe well fethered fowles honoured hym began ware prowde toke regarde made hym pycked spurred contrary byrdes drewe togyder demaunded eche best done byrde made vp nought dysdayneth pecocke sayd gretly beautyed reason fethers wyl take agayne fro hym name good sayd fawcon wyll haue myne sayd al byrdes began take agayne fro hym al fethers yt gyuen hym whe byrde saw humbled hymselfe knowledged ye welth honour hymselfe knewe came ye worlde naked bare ye fethers myght wel take fro hym agayne whe lyst cryed mercy sayd wolde amende hymselfe noo prowde agayne gentyll byrdes pyte hym fethered hym agayne sayd hym wolde gladly se ye f e amoge v thou wylte humble thou oughtest knowe surely thou ony prowde dysdaynous wyll take yu thy fethers set founde yu fyrst pthus sayd ye freer iohn ye cardynalles presence syrs thus shall fall chyrche emperour rome almayne kynges crystened hyghe prynces worlde haue gyuen goodes possessyons ryches entente serue god ye spende pryde superfluyte pye rede lyfe saynt syluester pope rome saynt peter ymagyne consyder howe emperour costantyne gaue hym fyrst ye dysmes ye chyrche condycyon saynt syluester rode nother cc ccc horse abrode worlde helde hymselfe symply closed rome lyued soberly chyrche aungell god shewed hym ye emperour cousta tyne infydell sholde fende hym lykewyse emperour reuelacyon aungell syluester sholde shewe hym ye way helthe syke lypper yt fless fell peces whe syluester came hym shewed hym way baptyme crystened hym incontynent hole whiche ye emperoure constantyne byleued god empyre gaue syluester chyrche dysmes emperoure rome helde besyde gaue hym many fayre gyftes grete sygnyoryes augmentynge fayth chyrche entencyon goodes syguyoryes gyue hym yt sholde gouerne humbly truely spe de pompe pryde nowe dayes chyrche contrary wherwith god dyspleased hereafter wyll dyspleased grete lordes erthe wyll ware colde theyr deuocyons lyberall gyuynge ony thynge ye chirche rather redy take fro yt gyuen thynke wyll longe besene pthus freer iohn roche tayllayd whome cardynalles helde pryson auignyon shewed wordes dyuers wherof cardynalles abasshed wolde gladly haue put hym dethe yf myght haue founde ony iust cause agaynst hym coulde fynde none suffred hym lyue durst let hym pryson shewed matter parfyte layde hym hyghe scryptures peraduenture myght haue made many worlde haue arred howbeit suche toke hede sayenge dyde sawe many thynges fall accordynge sayd wrote pryson yt sayd wolde proue apocalyps true prowes wherwith armed hymselfe saued hym fro brennynge also cardynalles pyte hym wolde theyr vttermoost hym nowe let v leue speke narracyons retourne pryncypall matter hystory spayne portyngale fraunce englonde recorde fortune fell season whiche forgotten pye haue herde howe kynge iohn otherwyse called mayster denyce portyngale bastarde broder kyng ferant possessyon royalme portyngale helpe onely iiii cytees portyngale noble knyghtes royalme portyngale begynnynge acquyted truely kynge peter kynge iohn castell wyfe lady beatryce yet thoughe helde opynyon lady neuerthelesse named bastarde doughter lady portyngale called elynoure fyrst husbande lyue knyght yt countre syr iohn laurence coygne ye kynge portyngale taken fro hym kynge maryed put husbande portyngale wente dwelled kynge castell durst dwell portyngale fere kynge helde wyse yet hyghe lygnage thynges meruaylled kynge ferant portyngale reputed doughter lawfully begotten dyspensacyon pope vrban vi ye pea made bytwene ii kynges castell portyngale knyght royalme portyngale called syr iohn ferant andere chefe counsayle kynge portyngale treated pea made ye mariage bytwene kynge ferant portyngalles doughter kynge iohn castell wyddower maryed ye doughter peter kynge aragon thoughe ye kynge castell counsayle dyd cast doubtes howe fered lest kynge portingales doughter sholde taken heyre portyngale faders dysseas put suretye therof ye kynge castell kynge portyngale caused dyuers chefe lordes portyngale swere kynges dysseas take theyr lady tourne royalme portyngale ye kynge castel also ye kynge portyngale bounde certayne good townes kynge castel take hym theyr kynge ye payne forfayture ii thousande frankes thoughe knyght iohan ferant andere dyde busynes good entente make pea concorde bytwene castell portyngale ye instaunce lorde yet ye comons lyrbone slewe hym chase theyr kynge mayster deuyce sayd wolde vnder subiectyon castell hated moche coulde neuer loue togyder also sayd yt crowne portyngale myght go woman quene castell true herytour bastarde worse bastarde kynge ferantes lyuynges dethe iohan ferant coygne lyued husbande ladyes moder therfore chase mayster denyce crowned iiii cytees lyrbone vyc eure porte portyngale sayd wolde haue kynge amonge one chefe incydentes moued ye comons agaynst kynge castell shall shewe spanyardes call castellyans maryage made bytwene portyngale ye kynge portyngale graunted dysseas royalme sholde go kyng castell euer spanyardes mette ony portyngales wolde mocke say syrs whether ye wyll nowe ye shall come daunger shall holde vnder subiectyon seruage kepe lyke slaues iues lyst wolde answere saye trusted sholde neuer neuer vnder subiectyon ony man lyuyng excepte god suche cause wordes reprouable spanyardes ye portyngales toke mayster denyce basterde broder kynge ferant made hym kynge broders dayes rekenynge made hym kynge comons wolde neuer haue chosen hym theyr kynge forsake doughter dyd howbeit often tymes sayd knyght syr iohn ferant andere sayd kynge mayster denyce basterde broder gretely grace comons royalme wherfore sayd ben good ben put dethe kynge ferant answered sayd howe comons sholde neuer haue puyssauce ony thynge agaynst wyll noble men countrey sone lawe kynge castell sholde euer puyssaunt ynough constrayne chastyce yf rebelled dyssease wherfore sayd noo cause put bastarde broder deth put hym pryson sayng broder man relygyon ynoughe lyue besyde crowne portyngale lefte alyue foresayd poyntes artycles true auctoure booke haue ben sufficyently enfourmed therof noble portyngale thynge meruayled make bastarde kynge portyngale saye yet sayth quene castel lady b autryce doughter ye lady elynour coygne bastarde therfore wolde take quene portyngale none heyre came opynyon erle foys layde ye knyghtes countrey wente spayne ayde kynge castel ben suffycyently infourmed matter bytwene portyngale castel wherfore sayd theyr departyng syrs ye haue nothynge busy yourselfe bytwene castell portyngale quene castell doughter kynge ferant portyngale warre euyll begon maye moche euyl come busye matter answered hym syth receyued wage suche man kynge castell must nedes go serue hym wente moost parte dyed ye haue herde nowe let v retourne busynes portyngale lefte grete aduentures hathe falle cronycle al thynges haue fallen entente tyme come sholde founde wryten regystred yf aduentures knowen grete domage clerkes yt auncyently haue wryten regystred hystoryes bookes therby ye hystories knowen perpetuall memory wrytynge truely saye wyll come sholde knowe knowe trouth hystory haue taken therin grete payne dayes haue serched many royalmes countreys knowe trouthe haue acquayntauce many valyaunt haue sene dyuers bothe fraunce englonde scotlande castell portyngale landes duchyes countyes suche theyr landes hath ben conioyned warres haue spoken ben instructed infourmed wolde ony enquest sholde passe vnknowen syth knewe true notable whyle byerne ye erle gaston foys enfourmed dyuers busyness suche fell bytwene castell portyngale retourned agayne countrey countye heynalte towne valencennes refresshed season determyned folowe hystory yt begon aduysed myne ymagynacyon howe coulde suffycyently instructed herynge susteyned opynyon kynge castell lykewyse ought portyngales well gascoynes spanyardes herde house erle foys waye goynge thyder retournynge toke noo regarde payne trauayle body wente bruges flaundres fynde yt royalme portyngale lyxbone euer countrey beholde myne aduenture good yf sought season vii yere coulde haue come better poynte dyd shewed wolde go meldeboure selande sholde fynde knyght portyngale valyaunt man sage kynge portyngales counsayle newly come thyder goynge then see pruce howe coulde iustly playnly shewe busynes aduentures portyngale knewe ben ouer countrey tydynges reioysynge wente fro bruges one portyngale company knewe ryght wel knyght came sluse toke see dyd moche grace god came meldeboure portyngales company aquaynted knyght founde hym ryght gracyous sage honourable courtoys amyable acquayntable hym vi dayes aboute knyght enfourmed ye busynes bytwene royalme castel portyngale syth dethe kynge ferant tyll departynge knyght countrey shewed euery thynge playnly gracyously toke grete pleasure hym wryte enfourmed hym desyred knowe toke leue hym conueyed shyp dyd dyuers ryche merchauntes countrey come fro bruges fro place se hym company sone nauarre portyngale dyuers knyghtes squyers royalme chefe honoure amonge certaynly coulde se ymagyne hym estate worthy haue honour noble porte goodly stature lykely valyaunt man whe retourne agayne fro rome myne owne countrey shall busy make relacyon wordes gentyll knyght called syr iohn ferant porteler shall cronycle hathe fallen portyngale castell vnto yere lorde mccclxxx x phowe portyngale sent messageres englonde shewe tydynges theyr coutrey kynge englonde grete lordes ca xliii howe sheweth hystory yt mayster denys kyng iohn portyngale dyscomfyted kynge iohn castell yt batayle iuberoth nere ye abbaye called ye cabbase many noble knyghtes squyers fraunce gascoyne byerne slayne kynge portyngale fayre vyctoryous iourney gretely doubted honoured portyngales receyued vyctory lyxbone grete glory al people grete tryumphe crowned lawrell auncyently kynges wonte crowned dyscomfyted ony kyng batayle lyxbone grete feest departure suche knyghtes squyers counsayles good townes cytees yt royalme parlyament counsayle holden howe might perceyuer theyr opinyon honourably certayne sage royalme sayd howe necessary se myght fortefye themselfe agaynst ye kyng castel puyssaunce yt myght honourably abyde theyr victory multiply exalte parlyament lyxbone holde cathedrall chyrche saynt dominicke many deuyses recyted whiche nede rehersed rest conclusyon parlyament sholde sende englonde duke lancastre claymed ryght enherytauce castell reason yt lady constaunce wyfe eldest doughter kynge peter castell wryte hym euer wolde clayme ony ryght royalme castell set forwarde busynes whiche longe hath hanged balaunce aduenture lost yt wolde come portyngale company men armes archer tyme conuenyent hym erle nauarre constable portyngale fayre language sayd syth agreed sende englonde duke lancastre whome thynke ayded whiche moost profytablest waye v cause enemyes feare v therfore let v aduyse royalme sage personage notable message enfourme ye duke lancastre counsayle come countrey stronge resyst enemyes suche ayde shall haue v may well suppose kynge castell wyll gete grete ayde frensshe kynge frensshe men warre wote better enploy theyr season haue pea wt englonde vnto feest saynt iohn also frensshe men haue ferme pea yt flemynges hath occupyed dyuers yeres erle nauerres wordes well accepted euery sayd howe spake well poynte yt wolde named sad dely beracyon counsayle grete mayster saynt iaques portyngale laurence fongasse ryght sage dyscrete squyer coulde ryght well speke ye language fraunce howe sholde goo message englonde coulde sende none counsayle portyngale better coulde doo message letter wryten good frensshe latyn kynge englonde yt duke lancastre bretherne ye erle cambrydge bokyngham letter wryten grosed vp frensshe latyn redde yt kyng counsayle well lyked sealed delyuered grete mayster saynt iaques laurence fongase toke ye charge bere englonde myght passe daungere see encouteryng ony enemyes robber ye see wel robber ye see ye lande toke shyp called ye lyn whiche wolde sayle maner wyndes surelyer ony shyp day toke theyr leue kyng archebysshop connymbres grete counsayle portyngale wente see sayled towarde englonde iii dayes ye see without syght lande fourthe day sawe cornewall sped well theyr iourneys ayde god good wynde yt costed cornewell yt boundes englonde aryued saufely without peryll hauen hampton cast ancre yssued theyr shyppe wente refresshed yt towne examyned baylyffe hampton suche kepers cost cou trey fro whens came whyther wolde answered theyr demaundes sayd howe royalme portyngale sente thyder fro theyr kynge counsayle welcome good chere refresshed prouyded horse theyr seruauntes rode london guydes knew countrey lodged sygne fawcon sente backe agayne theyr horse fortuned well ye kynge vncles westmynstre wherof ioyfull came londo fore noone dyned dyner toke theyr letter wente duke lancastre duches yt duke duches knewe theyr comynge ryght ioyfull desyred tydynges fro portyngale ben shewed dyuers tydynges gretely dyd byleue bycause letter therof countrey ye grete mayster saynt iaques laurence fongase entred duke chambre duches present yt laurence fongase coulde speke frensshe spake fyrst made reuerence duke duches delyuered letter fro portyngale ye duke toke duches red theyr letter duke sayd messageres syrs ye ryght welcome coutrey morowe ye shall go kynge shall ayde reason duches drewe laurence fongase parte demauded hym tydynges castell portyngale euery thynge laurence answered yt duke called wyne spyce dranke toke theyr leue retourned theyr lodgynge ye mornyng wente agayne ye duke herde masse entred barge wente water westmynstre ye kynge moost parte counsayle duke entred counsayle chambre sayd kynge syr ye grete mayster saynt iaques portyngale hath brought letter fro ye kynge wyl please se good wyll sayd ye kynge ii messagers kneled downe kynge laurence fongase delyuered letter kynge toke caused redde also delyuered letter erle cambrydge erle bokyngha eche redde theyr letter kyng answered ye messageres ryght swetely sayd psyrs ye welcome countrey comynge dothe v grete ioy ye shal departe without answere suche shall please busynes let myne vncles haue remembraunce thanked kynge departed counsayle chambre wente downe palays abydynge duke lancastre taryed tyll hyghe noone duke lancastre toke two bretherne hym dyner wente water messageres erle cambrydge knewe ryght well grete mayster saynt iames laurence fougase sene portyngale wherfore dyner comoned dyuers thynges presence two bretherne demaunded maryage castell sholde haue ben doughter lawe lady beautyce demaundes ambassadours answered wysely truely wherby lordes ryght well contente pleased trewe ambassadours comen englonde duke lancastre erle cambrydge broder dyuers counsayles togyder ryght claymed theyr wystes erle cambrydge ye haue herde well contente kynge ferant portyngale men warre lodged xv dayes feldes ye castellyans yet kynge ferant portyngales wolde neuer fyght yet erle tyme shewed ye kynge defaulte sayd syr haue company poore englysshe c speres archer al wyllyng fyght enemyes abyde aduenture god wyll sende v kynge ferant answered euer counsayled fyght wherfore erle saw departed then toke hym agayne sone portyngale departed kynge portyngale accorded kynge iohn castell maryed doughter hym make pea treatye made syr iohn audre knyght portyngale kynge trust hym kynge portyngale demaunded doughter whether rather haue kynge castel erle cambrydge sone answered sayd howe loued better iohn englonde iohn castel kynge demaunded sayd soo answered bycause iohn englonde goodly personage age cause wolde haue kynge castell howbeit fader haue pea spanyardes made maryage also erle sayd duke lancastre broder kynge ferant one deed doubted comons royalme portyngale wolde rebell agaynst lady beautryce moost parte royalme al yt theyr kynge maryed moder lady elyanoure coygne yet helde kynges doughter borne lawfull maryage reputed bastarde mermured theron whyle erle wherfore gladder take away sone then duke lancastre matter touched nerer erle cambrydge bycause maryed eldest syster heyre castell fayre chylde lady constaunce wyfe wherfore euer desyred truely iustly enfourmed yt busynes partyes dyd set mynde howe myght exalte tytle sawe clerely coulde haue good entre castell royalme portyngale specyally seynge howe desyred requyred kyng portyngale baron comons royalme also consyderynge howe kynge portyngale noble sage prynce valyaunt seynge howe dyscomfyted kynge castel playne batayle puyssaunce wherby duke ye soner enclyned go portyngale also kynge englonde counsayle agreed therto entente iustly enfourmed busynes state condycyon countrey castell ryght lady beautryce claymed crowne portyngale also ryght kynge iohn portyngale whome comons crowned theyr kynge entente daye duke made dyner ambassadours portyngale owne lodging dyner made euery man departe called ambassadours hym ryght amorously demaunded busynes portyngale bycause laurence fougase coulde speke frensshe duke addressed wordes vnto hym sayd laurence requyre shew poynte poynte conducyon maner londe portyngale hath fallen castell syth broder erle cambrydge kynge portyngale hath wryten man portyngale yt enforme iustly ye ye shall grete pleasure syr sayd squyer shall fulfyll pleasure began speke sayd maner syrsyth departure broder erle cambrydge portyngale hath fallen grete trouble dyscencyo royalme grete aduenture haue ben lost thanked god busyness nowe good poynte fermely stablysshed god wrought grace matter gone euyll thrughe defaulte kynge ferrant last dysseased oppynyon moost parte royalme kynge ferrant dayes loued sore lady wyfe knyght called syr iohn laurence coygne bycause beautye wolde haue force lady withstode kynges desyre longe myght laste sayd dame shall make quene portyngale thoughe loue hurte exalte wyl mary lady knee wepynge sayd syr sauynge dyspleasure haue none honour quene portyngale knowe doth worlde haue husbande redy haue hadde v yere elyanoure sayd kynge make none escuse wyll haue none wyfe shall quyte husbande mary lady coulde gete none wordes kynge shewed matter husbande yt knyght knewe therof sory maleneolyous regarded studyed best hym sayd hymselfe wyll thus leue wyfe howbeit doubted kynge wente royalme portyngale castell kynge henry receyued hym reteyned hym house longe lyued soo dothe kynge iohn nowe thus kynge portyngale accomplysshe folysshe pleasure sente knyght lady knyght goone kynge sente bysshophe connymbres chauncelloure portyngale kynges counsayle kynge shewed hym entent wolde wedde elyanoure coygne bysshop fered kynge bycause knewe hym hyghe fyerce condycyon therfore durst saye contrary kynges pleasure also syr iohn ferant audere chefe counsayle kynge please kynge ayd ye bysshop syr ye may wed wel ynoughe one ye kynge shal make recompence ye bysshop wedded lady crowned quene reputed al ye grete cytees portyngale moche honoure reuerence euer hadde ony quene royalme portyngale kynge doughter nowe quene castell true whyle kynge ferant lyued sente day lyxbone prelate noble men countrey counsayles cytees porte townes portyngale broder erle cambrydge came portyngale kynge made euery man swere promyse dyssease sholde take doughter lady beautryce fyue yeres aege herytoure ye royalme portyngale euery man sware whether wolde howbeit moost parte yt knewe ryght well bastarde borne aduoutrye moders husbande styll lyuynge called syr iohn laurence coygne lyued castell kynge longe kynge ferant portyngale lyued lenger bert syr thynke surely yf kynges doughter ben sone comonaltye portyngale wolde soner haue agreed hym doughter sayd wolde neuer agree rather dye vnder subiectyon royalme castell pfor yet royalme portyngale royalme castell neuer loued parfytely togyder hathe often tymes haryed made warre eche lykewyse royalme scotlande dothe yt royalme englonde duke lancastre demaunded laurence fongase kynge iohn nowe broder kynge ferrant kynge ferrantes dayes syr sayd squyer royalme portyngale house relygyon wherin knyghtes ordre whyte habytes reed crosse souerayne house called mayster deuyce kynge set lytell broder made hym ruler house denyce also kynge iohn nowe medled nothynge busynes royalme thought nothyng crowne therof yf kynge ferrant portyngale thought ony thynge fallen syth loued lady elyanoure lady beautryce doughter wolde haue slayne broder nowe kynge bycause sawe kepte house bretherne ordre mekely duely suspecte hym let hym lyue pea syr dyssencyon nowe bytweportyngale castell surely syr saye trouthe therin ye spanyardes cause ther sayd ye duke shall shewe sayd squyer castellyans sawe kynge ferrant maryed doughter theyr kynge began prowde began speke grete wordes whiche sore greueo portyngales spanyardes wolde say oye portyngales rude people lyke beestes tyme nowe come shall haue good market ye haue ben shall shall deuyde set companyes iues dwelleth truage vnder v ye shall subiectes venymous wordes often tymes sayd thus met portyngales whyle kynge ferrant lyued maryed doughter castell engendred suche hate murmured sayd better deed vnder daunger subieccyon ye castellyans kynge ferrant fell syke whiche endured hole yere deed buryed chyrche saynt fraunce relygyous house freers cyte lyxbone cytees good townes castelles portyngale closed theyr gate sente kynge nowe lyxbone knewe ryght well entente iii cytees connymbres porte eure sayd mayster deuyce called wyll make kynge royalme thoughe ye bastarde say cosyn lady beautryce quene castell borne rather basterde yet lyueth moders fyrst husbande syth crowne portyngale fallen two wayes wyll take v moost profytable also moost parte royalme enclyneth make kynge crowne portyngale shall go woman wyll vnder subieccyon kynge castell castellyans rather ye sholde take haue ayde maynteyne v fraunches castellyans sholde maysters ouer v wherfore syr receyue gyfte wyl shal thus mayster denyce nowe kynge wolde receyue theyr offre fyrst seconde request answered sayd good people knowe well good affeccyon entyer loue ye offre crowne portyngale whiche grete thynge ye saye haue grete ryght crowne co yn quene castell lykewyse thynke true basterde yet lyueth moders husbande castel one poynte ye alone matter behoueth al noble grete parte agre therto lyxbone answered sayd syr haue ynowe knowe redy courage dyuers also oppynyon iii chefe cytees royalme besyde v connymbres porte eure kyng sayd let ye wyl content ye know well lady elyanoure called quene royalme yet cyte counsaylloure syr iohn ferrant audere wyll kepe crowne portyngale herytage therof ye quene castell made fyrst maryage make pea bytwene castell portyngale peraduenture kynge castell wyll sende hym hastely helpe subdue rebelles wherfore nowe obsequye broder whiche shal shortely wherat parte noble royalme cytees wyl good prouyde remedy behalfe presente sayd syr ye saye true shall prouyde therfore shall syr iohn ferrant speke theyr counsayle ended longe obsequye kepte lyxbone freers kynge ferrant lyeth many noble portyngale desyred ye quene syr iohn ferrant audere gouerned quene kynge nowe grete nombre comons countrey specyally thre cytees connymbres eure ye porte portyngale agreed consented lyxbone obyte done syr iohn ferrant audere desyred quenes name noble presente sholde departe then daye nexte saynge howe quene wolde haue theyr counsayles sholde done sende castel kyng iohn wyfe lady beautryce theyr lady herytoure ryght royalme portyngale noble grete parte herde wordes made lytel ther doubted sore comons essembled herde dyuers murmure saynge wolde crowne theyr kynge mayster denyce also syr iohn ferrant audere herde lyke wordes therfore desyred noble royalme abyde hym ayde susteyne opynyon fayled hym sone kynges obyte done foresayd freers yt quene elyanour retourned lodgyng euery man cryed horse al moost parte mounted theyr horse departed fro lyxbone taryed ftyll suche kynges partye yt nowe wente theyr lodgynges kepte themselfe pryuely dyssymuled matter well ymagyned matter fall fell shall shewe howe kynges obyte done comons lyxbone thre cytees suche retourned shortely theyr lodgynges wente cathedral chyrche lyxbone called saynt domynycke assembled mayster denyce grete counsayle togyder whiche counsayle endured longe kynge nowe sayd vnto pall ye good people vnderstande ye wolde make kynge surely saye ryght yf ye wyll perceyuer purpose tyme sette worke shewe dede uyssaunce ye knowe ryght well syr iohn ferrant audere dothe procure noble royalme sende ye kynge castell sayth maynteyneth crowne portyngale perteyneth kynge castel ryght cosyne wyfe saye yf ye wyll ayde ryght rather ye knowe maner man broder kynge ferrat sone good kynge peter portyngale gouerned valyauntly true cosyne quene castell doughter kynge ferrant lawfull maryage lyxbone sayd vnto hym syr true wyll haue none kynge wyll make kynge loke theron wyll ye shall swere vnto v ye shall good v kepe iustyce ye shall flatter grete lordes small people ye shall kepe susteyne good herte ayde shall gyue ryght perteynynge portyngale kynge answered sayd syrs swere pryncypally requyre go ye lodgynge called ye monnoy syr iohn ferrant audere elyanoure coygne wyll slayne hath deserued agaynst agaynste susteyneth maynteyneth quarelles agaynst wylles enne one voyce answered wyll done surely disobeysaunt rebell agaynst wherfore lette hym put dethe rebellyons agaynst wherby royalme shall take ensample departed togyder mynstre saynt domynycke nombre xvc one oppynyon kynge nowe soo wente thrughe towne lodgynge called monnoy quene syr iohn ferrant audere came brake vp gate lodgynge entred therin perforce wente chambre quene ryght sore afrayde whe sawe moche people comynge vpon incontynent fell downe knee mayster denyce prayed hym haue pyte compassyon vpon saynge vnto hym knewe nothynge ony dyspleasure hadde done agaynst hym agaynst ony also sayd vnto hym howe touchynge crowne herytage portyngale claymed parte mayster denyce requyre people present consydre kynge ferrant made quene agaynst wyl mayster denyce sayd fayre lady doubte ye nothynge ye shall haue hurte come therfore traytoure iohn ferrant audere shall dye begyn withall lette kynge castell reuenge deth yf hath ben longe proctoure countrey worde auaunced forth suche ordeyned ther toke knyght put hym dethe hurte dyd persone retourned theyr lodgynge kynge yt nowe wente dethe iohn ferrant lady elyanoure ben quene portyngale toke counsayle determyned herselfe go portyngale castell kynge quene doughter suche fray dethe knyght syr iohn ferrant audere thought lenger abyde portyngale sawe coulde haue ther honoure rest caused mayster denyce kynge desyred suffre departe lyghtly agreed therto sayd howe pleased hym well yt sholde peparte sayd good cause soo lady departed fro lyxbone company rode longe iourneys came syuyll kynge castell quene laye season lady came thyder assembled nere noble castell grete counsayle busynes portyngale kynge iohn toke counsayle howe myght scynge royalme portyngale fallen hym successyon dethe kynge ferrant fader quene wyfe agreed dyed sholde countrey lyke wyse lady elyanoure receyued kynge quene doughter ryght honourably reason examyned busynes portyngale shewed trouthe hadde sene knowen also sayd howe well appered lykelyhede comons portyngale wolde crowne theyr kynge mayster denyce kynge castell agaynst made resystence defence cause hadde slayne knyght syr ihon ferrant audere bycause susteyned alwayes done kynge castelles quarell lady sayd wel byleued sawe well apparent also certayne baron knyghtes royalme portyngale suche hadde better affeccyon kynge castell thenne kynge nowe bycause kynge ferrantes doughter accomplysshe fulfyll theyr othes made kynge castell desyre theyr kynge iohn ferrant gaue doughter maryage kynge castell therfore acquyte theyr promyse departed royalme portyngale wente castell lefte theyr owne landes herytages aduenture recouer agayne erle alphons seroll ye grete pryour saynt ihns portyngale syr delagare broder ange syluaste geneull iohn aussall dyuers nombre xxv wherby ye royalme portyngale sore febled royalme castell enforced kynge castell made somons thrughe royalme noble men able bere armure bytwene xv xl sholde hast come hym felde sebyll sayd wolde puyssaunce entre royalme portyngale conquere owne herytage commaundement euery man obeyed reason suche helde hym came felde sebyll assembled nombre lxm men one syr laurence coygne husbande lady elyanoure whome kynge ferrant portyngale toke wyfe quene portyngale vnderstode come portyngale castell wente certayne kynge castelles counsayle sayd demaundynge counsayle lordes grete frendes howe shall wt elyamoure wyfe come portyngale countrey knowe ryght well kynge ferrant toke force agaynst wyll nowe kynge ferrant deed ye knowe well reason ought haue wyfe agayne counsayle wyll ye gyue therin suche spake vnto gaue hym counsayle sayd iohn counsayle make sc blaunt therof demaunde agayne take ye ye shall gretely abate honoure lady also blemyssheth honoure quene castell doughter ye sholde make worse basterde ye se howe ye kyng castell wyll demaunde thynke conquere royalme portyngale owne ryghtfull herytage ryght wyfe thus ye shode open clerely whiche nowe somwhat doubte trouble without ye take good hede wyll cost lyfe yf ye make ye quene castel bastarde countrey susteyne quarell say borne iust maryage dyspensacyon pope well sayd knyght best shall shewe sayd best thynke yt sone ye gete castell go agayne enherytaunce portyngale leue lady elyanoure doughter se none saufegarde fayth sayd ye knyght byleue well ye counsayle truely lyke good frendes syr iohn laurence coygne taryed longe castell departed wente lyxbone founde mayster denyce kynge sayd come serue hym wolde vnder obeysaunce wolde take hym kynge mayster denyce grete ioye sayd howe welcome hym gaue hym agayne herytage made hym capytayne lyxbone thus syr haue shewed fell busynes bytwene portyngale castell phowe laurence fongase ambassadoure fro kynge portyngale englonde shewed duke lancastre maner dyscorde bytwene royalmes castell portyngale ca xliiii duke lancastre toke grete pleasure laurence fongase spe spake attemperaci good frensshe bycause matter touch hym nere en e wolde come botom desy sayd laurence speke hardely harde straunger speke two yere tha rather speke ye go trouthe matter also letter haue brought fro kynge portyngale testefyeth howe nothynge th hath ben done bytwene portyngale castell ye iustly informe ther syr sayd squyer lytell thynge hath ben done dedes armes haue ben wherfore well speke syth pleasure volante yt shall pursewe wordes shall shewe euery thynge knowe thus shewed kynge iohn castel as bled people soone myght came grete puysaunce strength towardes lyxbone kynge portyngale nowe crowned put portyngales feare shewe howe hadde ryght herytage portyngale fyrst came saynt yrayne whiche entre portyngale rested two dayes towne gouernours therof grete feare comynge bycause ye grete nombre men warre yt hym soo yelded vp theyr towne hym taken theyr possessyon lefte men armes kepe towne feare rebellyon departed oost soo wente tyll came towne tuy whiche ryght stronge layde syege grete parte tuy helde quene castell lady elyanoure lymytted dowry wherfore lyghtely yelded kynge castell became subiectes vnder obeysaunce kynge castell hadde taken possessyon lefte men armes kepe hadde soo done passed ryuer wente towne valencennes portyngale thereto layde syege sente messagere vnto whithin sholde yelde theyr towne vnto hym valence answered sayd let kynge castell passe forth go lixbone soone myght knowe hath wonne cyte outher loue feare perforce incontynente wolde delyuer vp keyes theyr towne hym answere pleased ryght well kynge castell departed fro valence lykewise dyd another cyte called serpe whiche stronge fayre kyng thought haue gone thyder knewe theyr composycyon content came toke waye lyxbone knewe yf myght subdue cyte sholde haue resydue countrey case soeuer wente hym quene wyfe shewe therby ye portyngales ryght good iust cause wolde conquere wy e herytage thus kyng iohn castell came oost lyxbone layde grete syege shewed wel syege wolde departe then tyll ye cyte pleasure gretly thretened mayster denyce within ye cyte sayd howe yf myght gete hym sholde dye euyll dethe rebelles hym kynge castelles oost grete moche people spanyardes frensshe men closed ye cyte aboute none coulde yssue entre wt taken slayne somtyme fell skyrmysshes otherwyse spanyardes toke portyngales ye spanyardes wolde put theyr eyen stryke fote arme membre sente agayne cyte commau dynge saye dyd dyd dyspyte ye lyxbonoys theyr mayster denyce wolde make theyr kynge also shewe playnly shall holde syege longe shall haue perforce famyne otherwyse shall dye euyll dethe set fyre cyte without mercy pyre lyxbonoys toke ony dyd kynge nowe portyngale made well kepte theyr ease sent agayne oost without ony hurte domage theyr persones wherfore sayd ye oost done grete gentylnes rendred good euyll syr whyle syege endured whiche hole yere euery weke one two skyrmysshes dedes armes done hurte slayne one parte kynge castell helde well syege water lande plente vytaylles came oost partyes castell day happened skyrmysshe made one ye gate syr iohn laurence coygne capytayne cyte yssued barryers penon armes coygne hym hym good nombre propre men warre skirmysshe done many propre feate armes many darte cast fayth sayd duke lancastre feates armes castellyans countrey dothe vse castynge theyr dartes best pleaseth gladly wolde se say yf stryke one aryght without well armed darte wyll perce hym thrughe fayth syr sayd squyer ye saye trouthe haue sene many grete stroke gyuen wt whiche one tyme cost v derely v grete dyspleasure ye sayd skyrmysshe syr iohn laurence coygne stryken wt darte suche wyse heed perced plate cote mayle iacke stopped sylke passed thrughe body fel downe deed therwith seased skyrmysshe bycause ye dethe yt knyght lady elyanoure wydowe one yere bothe husbandes syr iohan laurence cygne made grete mone valyaut knyght full good counsayle dethe chosen capytayne lyxbone cosyne ryght valyaunt called pouuasse coyne made agaynst ye spanyardes thre foure yssues dyd grete domage pthus contynued syege lyxbone surely often tymes within towne sore abasshed coulde se comforte come frome ony parte sawe none came englonde wheron lay theyr trust kynge nowe counsayled haue taken shyp haue come hyder englonde syr iohn vadigothz passe syr iohn cete dore archedeacon lyxbone sent hyther englonde kynge erle cambrydge broder haue coforte ayde retourned lyxbone brought tydynges howe yt ye wolde haue comforted name god sayd duke trouthe done redy ye poynte haue departed warre flaundres gaunte dyd let gauntoys came hyder ayde helpe suche moost parte sholde haue gone wt portyngale wente flaundres ye bysshop norwyche syr henry percy letted iourney portyngale name god sayd ye squyer thought amonge v grete let englonde yt coulde come hyder howbeit dyd well myght maynteyned ourselfe valyauntly agaynst kyng castell puyssaunce whiche small thynge mo lxm see lande thretened byrne exyle v without mercy syr thus whyle syege endured erle countrey portyngale called erle angouse dyd v day grete socour wherby attayned grete honoure xx galeys aryued porte portyngale good nombre men armes prouysyon came saylynge ye see valence thrughe ye grace god came ye kynge castelles army lay ancre lixbone mo c grete vesselles howbeit dyd entrepryse gracyously wynde good poynte dyspyte enemyes entred saufely without peryll galeys hauen lyxbone comynge conquered iiii shyppes enemyes brought hym ye hauen whose comynge lyxbone ryght ioyous co forted gretely fayth sayd duke lancastre erle angouse yt tyme dyd fayre seruyce nowe fayre laurence shewe howe syege raysed maner wolde gladly speke therof syr sayd squyer shall shewe ryght good wyll haue shewed syege endured yere lyxbone kynge castell sworne auowed wolde departe frome syege tyll cyte vnder obeysaunce without puyssaunce gretter kynge raysed hym therfro force truly al thynges consydered kynge castel kepte wel auowe ye puyssaunce gretter kyng raysed hym caused hym departe shall shewe howe pestylence mortalyte meruaylous ferefull fell oost suche wyse dyed sodeynly spekyng one another dyed mo xxm persones wherof ye kyng sore afrayde wherfore counsayled hym departe then drawe saynt yrayne parte breke vp syege gyue leue people departe tyll pestylence seased whiche dyd sore agaynst wyll bycause sworne solemply kepe ye syege howbeit necessyte fayne departe therfore syr say hath ben sayd portyngale comon opynyon god dyd sende pestylence kyng castelles oost ayde v kynge nowe cyte wherin closed dyed nother man woma sykenes grace god dyd v kynge castell dyslodged fro lyxbone kynge portyngale nowe caused suche within cyte armed lepe theyr horse folowe trayne kynge castelles oost dyd grete domage dyslodged good aray wherby ost parte theyr men promocyon kyng portyngale made crye payne dethe take ony thynge yt founde felde brynge ony thyng therof cyte commaunded euery thynge brente entent sholde brynge infeccyon cyte prouysyon euery thynge conuerted flame fyre howbeit thynke suche founde golde syluer money place brent saued well myght thus kyng castel wente saynt prayne ye entre countrey taryed season sent socour frauce specyally gascoyne byerne ye lades ye erle foys sent thyder iii somers laden wt noble castel floreyns gyue prest knyghtes squyers knewe well otherwyse sholde haue come theyr house baron knyghtes ye royalme portyngale ye partye ye kyng nowe sawe howe kynge castell raysed syege whiche endured yere toke grete courage dyd comons countrey specyally porte ewre connymbres toke counsayle togyder shortely crowne theyr kynge mayster denyce chosen gyuen hym theyr loue sayd goddes wyll yt sholde theyr kynge shewed vertue agaynst spanyardes commaundement made thrughout portyngale euery come commbres certayne daye lymytted coronacyon mayster denyce suche toke parte came thyder accordynge puyssaunce royalme moche people kynge iohn portyngale crowned bysshoppes prelate royalme grete solempnyte aperteyned trynyte ondaye yere lorde god mccclxxx iiii cathedrall chyrche co nymbres called saynt mary whiche daye ye kyng made newe knyghtes owne countrey straungers ye nombre lx kepte grete feest ii iii dayes kynge renewed homage erles baron knyghtes squyers suche helde hym kyng sware kepe royalme ryght iustyce maynteyne al theyr iurysdyccyons euery man sware take hym theyr kynge heyres comynge hym male female dye payne neuer forsake thus kynge iohn portyngale crowned kynge kynge castell knewe comons portyngale crowned mayster denyce theyr kynge sworne hym faythe homage dyspleased thought wolde haue done sodeynly bycause many noble portyngale hym sayd se well behoueth perforce conquere yt myne yf wyll haue shall neuer peace bytwene castell portyngale tyll ye portyngales haue amended yt haue done kynge crowned came lyxbone taryed toke grete dylygence set good way ye busynes royalme gete therby grace good wyl loue people sent knyghtes men warre dyuers garysons townes castelles fronters spayne ye kynge castell lay sybyll kyng portyngale sent garyson trentouse syr iohn ferant perteler experte man armes valyaunt knyght hyghe entrepryse hym syr martyn va coygne broder syr wyllya va two experte knyghtes vnder cc speres good men warre well horsed ye castell lene towarde iuberoth sente syr iohn radygos l speres ye cyte valence portyngale sente syr iohn iames saulles lye garyson agaynst stronge towne tuy whiche yelden ye kynge castell whe came towarde lyxbone tuy lay garyson grete nombre men armes frensshe castellyans ye cyte serpe sente syr nondech radygo noble knyght l speres porte ewre connymbres sente men warre kynge thought stronge ynoughe themselfe true faythfull hym thus syr yere yt kyng thus crowned garysons well prouyded often tymes encountrynges skyrmysshes assawtes bothe partyes one tyme men wanne another tyme lost aduenture armes falleth specyally afore encountre garyson treucouse agaynst castellyans laurence sayd ye duke lanclastre passe matter breuely let knowe howe done mette feldes wolde gladly spekyng dedes armes syr sayd squyer shall shewe done renconntre present bare yt day ye baner syr iohn ferant perteler busynes began capytayne treutouse kynge castell prouyded warre ye fronters portyngale somtyme v domage assembled selfe togyder toke ye feldes somtyme lost somtyme wanne season vii capytaynes spanyardes good knyghtes hyghe lygnage assembled togyder nombre iiic speres well horsed hauynge grete desyre v domage well shewed came entred portyngale toke grete praye many prysoners yf wolde myght haue entred agayne castell ony encountrynge soo hyghe mynded prowde sayd wolde goo se garyson treutouse ye playne countrey fledde soo tydynges came treutouse syr iohn ferrant partelere knewe castellyans rode abrode called harneys caused trompettes besowned awoke knyghtes squyres towne euery man armed hym grete haste mounted theyr horse yssued treutouse ye feldes cc put selfe good ordre shewed howe grete affeccyon fynde theyr enemyes demaunded came flyenge ye towne theyr enemyes answered sayd howe farre then howe rode softe pace bycause grete praye caryed tydynges syr iohn ferrant partelere ryght ioyous sayd company syr iohn martyne va syr wyllyam va broder syrs requyre let v auaunce forwarde wyll entre ony towne castell portyngale tyll haue sene enemyes fyght put payne trauayle recouer praye prysoners leede sayd laurence dysplay baner tyme shall fynde shortely enemyes dyd co maunded rode forthe good pace last sawe dust rose horse enemyes toke vauntage sone came ye castellyans sawe v helde themselfe close togyder ordred themselfe set theyr prysoners pray theyr one syde approched nere togyder myght speke v sawe howe iii baners iiii penons iudgement ccc horse fyrst syr iohn radigos de castenans knyght baron castell syr sylue grefye albenes syr adioutall tolet cassell syr iohn radigo eure diostenses angouse lyghted foote lykewyse soo dyd delyuered theyr horse page varlettes began cast darces doo ony feate armes capytaynes spake eche present herde wordes spoken bothe partyes mayster syr iohn ferrant partelere whose baner bare one ye formest ye wordes spoken hym hym fyrst demaunded rode portyngale ledynge away suche prayes prysoners taken syr adioutall tolet answered sayd wolde ryde lyst punysshe dysobeysaunt kynge castel herytage portyngale perteyned rause founde rebelles therfore sayd ouer rynne countrey take prayes prysoners well syrs sayd syr iohn ferrant ye shall lede longe wyll rescue ye haue noo ryght come ouer rynne countrey ye knowe wel ynoughe haue kynge redy wyll kepe royalme ryght kepe iustyce punysshe theues robber therfore saye vnto behalfe ye haue taken royalme portyngale leue behynde departe hen elles ryght iust quarell wyll fyght spanyardes answered ye prysoners haue taken wyll delyuer agayne ye praye wyll take aduyse vii capytaynes castell drewe togyder shewed come se garyson treutouse yet wolde haue ben glad haue departed without batayle counsayled sayd howe wolde leue theyr pray behynde prysoners wolde lede nay sayd portyngales wyll ye leue elles ye shall haue batayle wente togyder sore batayle bothe partyes good men warre felde fought fayre playne cast eche dartes sore soo euer stryken without wel armed slayne sore hurte many propre feates armes done syr iohn ferrant partelere fought axe ryght valyauntly dyd ii companyons partye spanyardes fought ryght valyauntly thus fought space iii houres whiche meruayle coulde endure longe theyr armure fyghtynge grete dysyre eyther partye wynne honoure caused endure payne syr surely spanyardes portyngales harde men batayle specyally se necessyte thus fought longe knewe better theyr batayle egall syr thanked god nother baner penon syde day ouerthrowen fynally theyr syde began open beten downe euery syde dyscomfyture fell theyr page fled awaye saue themselfe vii capytaynes yt present scaped away one ye meanes page brought hym horse dyd mayster good seruyce day yt adyentall cassel vi slayne neuer man taken raunsome thus syr iohn ferrant partelere company obtayned vyctory theyr enemyes thre agaynst two tuysday moneth octobre nere treutouse yere lorde mccclxxx iiii phowe laurence fongase shewed duke lancastre maner batayle iuberoth bytwene kynge castel kynge portyngale caxlv dyscomfyture enemyes men mounted theyr horse delyuered suche prysoners castellyans taken also gaue suche pyllage theyr enemyes gotten excepte ye beestes whiche nombre viii hundreth draue garyson treutouse vatayllynge towne reason receyued grete ioye wyst chere make v bycause delyuered coutrey theyr enemyes rescued lost wherby grete prayse thrughe ye townes portyngale syr yere men another fayre iourney theyr enemyes ye felde sybylle syr fyrst shall shewe moost happyest iourney kynge portyngale ony kynge hym cc yere whiche done within iiii monethes yt kynge sente v hyther enemyes iiii agaynst one good men warre hyghe empryse wherfore iourney ought ye praysed syr thinke ye haue herde therof al redy wherfore thynke best speke therof nay sayd duke ye shall leue ye shall shewe hole processe wolde gladly speke therof yet trouthe haue heraulte called derby batayle sayth shewed suche englysshe men dyd meruaylles armes reporte bileue trouth grete nombre wherby ony grete feate sholde done broder ye erle cambrydge came portyngale brought agayne hym suche englysshmen wente thyder many heraultes suche lyers wyll exalte suche lyst beyonde measure noblenes good lost enpayred thoughe shewed therfore good knowe reporte knoweth psyr sayd laurence straungers batayle iuberoth ye kynge portyngale passed two hundred men englysshe gascoynes almaynes grettest capytaynes straungers two gascoynes one almayne duchy guerles gascoynes called syr wyllyam mountferrant bernardon ye almayne albert englysshme certayne archer herde none named ii squyers northbery hartecell called counsayle kynge lordes batayle well sayd duke prosede forthe tell iourney howe fought requyre syr sayd ye squyer ryght good wyl syr shewe howe sente hyther fro kynge mayster laurence fongase renewed tale spake busynes iuberoth sayd thus syr ye haue herde also coronacyon kynge portyngale connymbres yt kyng castell raysed syege fro lyxbone dethe pestylence fell ost wente yrayne sayd howe greued hym sore enfourmed coronacyon redoubted lorde kynge iohn portyngale kynge castell claymed yet dothe ryght herytage crowne portyngale tytle wyfe doughter kynge ferrant whiche denyed yet suche cause haue shewed thus kynge castell counsayled sende war myght gete specyally fraunce ye frensshmen alwayes ayded hym susteyned quarell ye kynge fader lykewyse sayd hym counsayle ye nede nothynge one iourney agaynst portyngale puyssaunce ye may kepe felde fyght ye shal come entente grete varyaunce redy portyngale ye se perceyue well noblest persones ye royalme haue submytted theselfe vnder obeysaunce whiche thynge gretely furdereth warre ye auaunce yourselfe puyssauce fyght bastarde portyngale yt comons haue crowned theyr kynge gete ayde englysshemen ye lyke ouerthrowe hym yf ye wynne iourney royalme grete matter wyn soo suche counsayle thynges iohn castell auaunced hym selfe sende letter messageres fraunce poictou bretayne normandy borgon dyuers place thought haue men armes knyghtes squyres money loue suche helde ony thynge hym specyally came many knyghtes squyres hym byerne daye saynt yrayne auewed people ye nombre vi viic speres xxxm spanyardes horsoacke hauynge desyre v domage tidynges came portyngale kynge ye lordes good townes cytees suche kynges partye shewed nombre puyssaunce kynge castell howe fully determyned come lay fyege agayne lyxbone kynge portyngale counsayle assembled togyder notablest persones royalme sayd yt kyng best go cyte mete enemyes rather enclosed ony cyte towne portyngale yf besyeged sholde haue moche busynes defende theyr cyte meane season ye castellyans myght ryde abrode theyr ease lyst conquere townes cytees castelles outher force loue dystroy ye playne countrey peraduenture lengthe within cyte wherfore sayd kynge syr yf go agaynst take place conuenyent fyght thynke best moost profytable syr knowe well ye shall peasybly enioy crowne portyngale wherwith haue crowned without batayle leest one twyse ouerthrowe aduersary kynge castell puyssaunce yf may dyscomfyte hym shal lordes country yf ouercome royalme aduenture better v seke batayle sought honourable v syr hathe ben often tymes sene setter hath auauntage defender therfore syr wyll counsayle sende forthe letter messagers suche ye thynke wyll serue ye kynge answered sayd syrs ye speke wel wyl ye haue ordeyned ye kynge set clarkes warke wryte letter wrote euery man sholde come porte portyngale nere aboute certayne day lymytted howbeit suche wryten vnto came thyder royalme toke full parte hym dyssmuled taryed se howe ye matter sholde frame lengthe gone theyr owne countrey kynge castell bycause sayd kynge castell ryght crowne portyngale kynge howbeit yt kynge souerayne lorde wente connymbres made assemble suche men warre coulde gete truely hym yt choyse men portyngale moost auctoryte erles baron knyghtes squyers also xxv hundred speres squyers xiim foote ordeyned constable marshall constable erle nauare ye marshall syr alne perriere bothe ryght sage knyghtes conduyte men warre departed fro connymbres toke waye cabase iuberoth rode fayre easely ease themselfe theyr horse yt theyr prouysyon myght folowe good ordre rore ryders one ewe demeanynge castellyans tyme syr iohn ferrant pertelere come kynge garyson dorech v legges fro iuberoth thynke knewe kynge sholde fyght enemyes suppose kynge castell wel enfourmed howe kynge portyngale comynge hym warde puyssaunce knewe therof grete ioy men shewed anone determyned come agaynst v tyght v specyally ye gascoynes byerne sore desyred fyght v desyred haue ye fyrst batayle syr wyllyam mounferrant gascoyne partye sayd surely howe sholde haue batayle bycause byerne agaynst v euer desyreth nothynge batayle pthen kynge castell batayle came nexte daye lodged castell lerre two legges fro iuberoth nexte day came cabase lodged yt nyght kynge castel lodged lytell legge fro iuberoth knewe well way toke howe lodged iuberoth syr portyngales hath alwayes gre e trust confydence god ye good ortune yt place iuberoth therfore tyme rested sayd ye duke haue good hope place rather another syr layd squyer auncyently ye grete charlemayne kyngge fraunce almayne emperoure rome tyme grete conqueroure place iuberoth dyscomfyted vii kynges ye mysereauntes slayned ye infydelles cm syr auncyently founde hystoryes cronycles reason batayle conquered coanymbres countrey portyngale brought crysten fayth bycause ye grete victore yt agaynst goddes enemyes founded abbaye blacke monkes gaue grete rente portyngale castell also syr aboute cc yere past place grete betayle fayre iourney acheued lorde tyme broder kyng castell tyme neuer kynge portyngale called countye portyngale ii bretherne ye kynge castell erle portyngale mortall warre togyder partycyon landes yt coulde founde pea bytwene mortall warre togyder matter touched soo moche erle portyngale portyngales yt rather haue ben deed haue ben vnder subieccyon kynge castel toke day batayle kynge castell puyssaut yt x agaynst one yt set nothynge portyngales cabase iuberoth theyr batayle ryght cruell fynally portyngales obteyned vyctory castellyans dyscomfyted kynge castell taken whose takynge erle portyngale pea lyst boundes set departyng castell portyngale bycause ye portyngales saw yt god sente vyctory smal nombre agaynst grete puyssaunce thought augment theyr lande make royalme ye prelate noble countrey crowned theyr fyrst kynge connymbres made hym ryde thrughout royalme crowne lawrell heed sygnyfyenge honoure vyctory aunently kynges wonte euer syth royalme hath kynge syr surely rather portyngales wolde vnder ye subieccyon castellyans wolde take one ferre fro blood ye kynge portyngale kynge deed without yssue male syr ye kynge portyngale nowe came place iuberoth matter shewed hym thus whyles constable marshall orderynge theyr batayles came kynge syr iohn ferrant partelere came morenynge fro garyson dorech brought hym lx speres ye kynge grete ioye comynge bataylles ordeyned abode nothynge enemyes fore ryders sente forth aspye theyr dealynge kynge souerayne lorde came amonge men caused fylence made sayd syrs ye haue crowned kynge shewe nowe trouth faythfulnes syth forwarde specyally place iuberoth shal neuer retourne agayne portyngale without fyght wt myne enemyes euery man answered sayd syr shall abyde wt knowe trouthe shall flye daye tthus batayles approched castellyans grete desyre fynde v fyght well shewed sente forthe fore ryders se knowe enemyes dyd taryed fro v iii houres herde tydynges thought lost howbeit ye last retourned brought v sure worde nombre lykelyhode shewed v howe theyr vowarde viim men armes armed capa pee fresshe well horsed coulde deuysed ye kynge castelles rerewarde xxxm horse good men armes kynge company knewe nombre theyr enemyes howe yt theyr vowarde ii legges ye kynge gascoynes straungers well accorde castellyans determyned kepe v close togyder strength make ii wynges batayle men armes wherof iim ccccc speres bytwene ii wynges syr myght well haue ben sene good ordre batayle people well recomforted comaunded kyng payne dethe yt man take daye prysoner determyned amonge v best ye lordes capytaynes sayd sholde entende take prysoners sholde deceyue v make v take hede yt sholde sayd better v fyght wel take hede takynge prysoners sel lyues derely good people ought worde vpholden obserued enemyes came v close togyder lyke good men warre alyghted foote trymmed theyr harneys let theyr horse go came approched v fyersly surely floure chyualry shewed well bytwene v lyt ell dyke gretter yt knyght armed myght well passe ouer howbeit v ly tell aduauntage ye passynge ther en yt bothe wynges wt theyr dartes yd hurte mayme dyuers dyd sore trouble ouer dyke assembled agaynst v thought yt kynge castell grete batayle folowed hande dyscomfyted slayne kynge castell came nere hande v shal shewe meanes closed bytwene v comons countrey layde behynde ax wepons without sparynge men armes fresshe came agaynst caused recule backe fall ye dyke one vpon another syr al done lesse halfe houre slayne felde men armes mo iiiim none taken rausome whe ony knyght spere wolde haue taken ony prysoner theyr copany wolde slee theyr hades thus clerely without recouery vowarde enemyes dyscomfyted came kynge castel batayle wherin xxxm men well horsed approched nere nyght knewe nothynge myschefe fallen theyr vowarde came mustred themselfe v ccccc lepte theyr horse ouer dike syr al suche passed ouer neuer repassed agayne slayne grete parte noble men suche desyred feates armes grete nombre baron knyghtes portyngale suche ye kynge castell agaynst v people sawe enemyes dyscomfyted passed ouer dyke xl place ye dyke stopped wt deed toke horse folowed ye chase yt ferre nyght wolde folysshly go ferre doubte busshme te also well horsed castellyans surely yf receyued domage dyd ye kynge castell taken slayne nyght came darke saued hym many syr shall shewe name ye moost parte noble men fraunce gascoynes portyngales dyed felde batayle iuberoth first erle iohn alphons serole portyngale grete pryour saynt iohns portyngale dilgaures broder ange saluace geneue iohn ausalle syr dangoues medrich dricho persement peter resermant lugares versaunt grete mayster calestrane broder called dygo dygares peter goussart seball iohn radigo herriers grete mayster saynt iaques fresshmen syr iohn rys syr ieffrey ricon syr godfrey pertenay syr espaynolet spayne syr reynolde solyere knyght called lymosyn marshall kynge castelles oost gascoyns bierne lorde bierne ye lorde mortan ye lorde bryngoles syr raymonde durach syr bertram varuge syr iohn asolgme syr raymonde valentyne syr adam mourase syr menuent sarement syr peter sarembiere dyuers mo xiic knyghtes squyers gentyll men nowe syr shall shewe ye name slayne party fyrst ye erle nauare costable portyngale galopes porteke peter porteke agalype ferrant porteke broder ponase coygne egeas toille podich dassue vasse martyne mielx sone vasse martyne stryken darte clene thrughe body also slayne goussalenas merlo alue porie marshall ye oost good knyght radigos perriere iohn iames salues iohn radigo cosyn ye kynge ammoudesque radigo radiges valero ceaux mendignes valconseaux duke lancastre began laughe laurence fongase demaunded sayd syr laughe sayd duke good cause neuer herde straunge name haue herde reherce syrsayd fayth name haue countrey straunger byleue well sayd duke laurence became kynge castell dyscomfyture made ony recouery dyd close hymselfe ony townes dyd ye kynge portyngale folowe hym nexte day nay surely syr sayd laurence folowed furder abode styl place yt felde nyght nexte daye tyll noone retourned castell alerne ii lytel legges fro iuberoth fro then connymbres ye kynge castel went saynt yrayne toke barge xiiii hym rowed greteshyp wente see sybyll ye quene men wente one way another lyke people dysmayde wt recouery lost moche theyr domage lyke recouer grete soason wtout ye puyssauce ye frensshe kynge bycause kynge portyngale counsayle knowe well yt castellyans wyll pourchace ayde fraunce bycause alyened togyder therfore sent countrey ye kynge englande ye duke sayd laurence ye shal departe hen tyl ye bere wt good tidinges pray shewe encountrynge yt men felde sybyll ye spake ryght nowe wolde gladly dedes armes thoughe good knyght myselfe syr sayd ye squyer ryght good wyll shall shewe fayre honourable iourney ye kynge iohn portyngale cabase iuberoth retourned grete tryumphe ye cyte lyxbone yt tydynges ony newe assembly ye castellyans frensshmen helde garysons kynge castel departed fro sybyl quene wyfe hym wente burgus castell men theyrs made warre togyder garysons tyme erle nauare constable portyngale entred castell feldes sybyl xl speres came towne called valewyde within whiche cc men armes castell ye erle nauare came baryeres shewed wel howe demaunded batayle within made semblaut yssue howbeit armed men ben longe pleased retourned ryden past legge yt coutrey yt saw ye garyson valewyde come galopyng capytaynes diogenes padillo experte man armes ye grete mayster saynt iaques galyce men saw comynge lyghted fote delyuered theyr horse theyr page spanyardes grete nombre wolde haue set ye page varlettes haue taken theyr horse fro sayd let v wyn theyr horse gretter dyspleasure put payne make retourne foote mayster saynt iaques sayd naye let v wyn maysters shal soone haue ye horse let v alyght fote fight shall endure agaynst v thus whyle ye castellyans arguynge passed oure lytell water yt behynde toke grete groude fortefyed made semblaunt though caryed nothyng theyr horse castellyans sawe yt passed water repented yt set soner dyd howbeit thought soone ouercome men came began cast dartes castellyans enployed al theyr artyllery mo dartes cast soo contynued theyr assaulte fro noone tyll nere nyght men sawe yt theyr enemyes spente theyr artyllery ye erle nauare made baner passe water company dasshed amonge castellyans anone bega open weresore trauayled weryed chased theyr harneys yt coulde helpe themselfe ouerthrowne dyscomfyted mayster oesaynt iaques slayne mo lx hym fled saued theyr horse wan many fro castellyans say syr yt day fayre aduenture yes faythe sayd duke lancastre phowe ambassadours portyngale answere kynge englande grete gyftes howe toke theyr leue wente theyr countreys ca xlvi syr bycause suche rencountres dedes armes yt men haue theyr enemyes syth ye eleceyon kyng iohn portyngale portyngales entred grete ioy comonly say ye god theyr ryght syr say moche amys say ye god wt euery thynge touchyng ony dede armes lytell moche euer syth dethe kynge ferrant haue vyctory ye erle foys yt nowe one ye gretest lordes worlde full hyghe prudence knowe countrey sayd yt fortune v portyngale yf knyghtes byerne byleued hym wha departed couutrey sholde haue armed themselfe agaynst kynge portyngale yt nowe wyse dyscrete man fereth god loueth holy chyrche exalteth moche may often tymes oratory knee herynge deuyne seruyce hath ordeyned yt euer busynes yt none speke hym tyll oratory grete clerke taketh lytell hede ony grete sermones specyally wyll haue iustyce kepte royalme poore men maynteyned theyr ryght thus syr request haue shewed maner countrey yt knowe kynge counsayle comaunded departyng fro shewe euery thynge yt knewe wherfore syr maye please myght haue answere laurence sayd duke tyme haue shewed yet agayne say comynge tydynges doth grete pleasure ye shall departe fro tyll ye satysfyed requestes well answered ye come syr sayd squyer thanke duke called wyne spyces toke theyr leue wente theyr lodgynge arcorch house ye fawcon london lodged thomelyn colebrunque longe duke lancastre erle cambrydge broder counsayle togyder yt busynes castell portyngale wherof ye erle cambrydge well contente ben yt countrey yere glad condycyons tytles kynge portyngale quene castell sayd broder syr kynge ferrant lyued chanon robsart syr wyllyam wyndesore dyuers knyghtes yt shewed nowe fallen sayd herde dyuers ye coutrey murmure quene castelles tytle portyngale therfore toke away sone grete affeccyon maryage name god sayd ye duke squyer portyngale hathe declared matter thynke haue fayre entre castell portyngale royalme aragon ferre also kynge chyldren haue alwayes ben fauourable frensshe partye thenne v therfore good syth kynge portyngale maketh v good refuse day matter parlyament holden westmynstre accorded yt duke lancastre sholde haue costes ye royalme bitwene xiic speres chosen men iim archer yomen paydein hande halfe yere therwith kynges vncles well contente specyally duke lancastre pryncypally ye matter touched yt sholde chefe ye armye dyspatche ambassadours portyngale kynge englande wrote kynge portyngale louynge letter conteynyng grete amyte yt wolde bere portyngale grete gyftes gyue ye mayster saynt iaques portyngale laurence fongase alwayes ye duke lancastre wt erle cambrydge day ambassadours toke theyr leue ye kyng cousayle dyned yt daye wt ye duke lancastre erle cambrydge nexte day delyuered vn derstode duke lancastre sente letter kynge portyngale also credence yt sholde sende vii galeys xviii xx vesselles porte brystowe fronters wale hym company passe portyngale ambassadoures departed wente hampton founde theyr shyp yt taryed entred see wynde theyr wyl entred ye hygh spaynysshe see within v dayes hauen porte portyngale whiche tyme kynge ryght ioyfull theyr comynge ye grete mayster saynt iaques portyngale laurence fongase shewed ye kynge counsayle al yt sene herde englande well ye kynge vncles delyuered theyr letter whiche certefyed al theyr saynges anone kynge portyngale gretely desyred ayde englande ye entente cause enemyes haue fere determyned wt cousayle yt mayster alphons v etat chefe patron mayster shyppes galeys portyngale yt sholde prepayre redy vii galeys xviii grete chyppes sayle englande fetche ye duke lancastre copany alphons comaunded thus incontynent dyd daye departed fro porte portyngale vi dayes arryued brystowe whiche season lordes englande ye moost parte aboute ye march wale kynge duke lancastre knewe comynge shyppes ryght ioyfull knyghtes squyers al suche sholde go hym sente porte brystowe cc vesselles flete portyngale redy apparelled ye duke company duke entencyon haue hym wyfe chyldre make good maryages castel portyngale retourne agayne englande thought shortely retourne saw busynes englande lykely harde sharpe kyng neuewe yonge aboute hym peryllous counsayle wherfore ye gladder gone departed presence bretherne ordeyned sone ye lorde henry erle darby lieutenaunt yt englande set aboute hym wyse sad counsayle lusty yonge knyght sone duches lancastre lady blaunche doughter quene phylyp englande neuer sawe ii better ladyes noble condycyon neuer shal thoughe sholde lyue thousande yeres whiche impossyble duke iohn lancastre ordred busynes englonde toke leue kyng bretherne wente brystowe taryed xv dayes shypped horse bagages mo iim hay lytter fresshe water duke entred galey well apparelled hym grete shyp yfnede hym duches constaunce wyfe wente iourney good courage trusted recouer herytage castell quene retourned agayne doughter called katheryne fyrst husbande ii doughters izabel phylyp whiche phylyp maryed syr iohn holande constable ye oost marshall syr thomas mor aur also maryage one doughters howbeit bastarde moder ye lady mercell damoysel mary saynt hyllary hauman
