admyral ye duke nauey syr thomas percy also syr yon fythwaren lorde lucy syr henry beaumond de poumins syr iohn nuell lorde talbot lorde basset syr wyllyam bea champ syr wyllyam wyndefore syr thomas tracon syr hughe spenser lorde wylloughby lorde braston syr wyllya fermiton sir iohn dambricourt syr hughe hastynges syr thomas wancestre syr mauburyn liniers syr loys rochestre syr iohn soustre syr phylyp tacyel syr iohn bouboufer syr robert clycon syr nycholas trenton hugyn caurele dauyd houlegiax thomas allerey hobequyn beaucestre dyuers penons besyde ye baron speres knyghtes squyers good men armes iim archer tawle yome fayre season ye moneth may whiche lyghtly pleasaunt peasyble sayled coostynge ile wyght gernsey tyll came open ye coost normandy cc sayles grete beautye se galeys glyde see approchynge lande full men armes arch sekynge aduentures sayd armye normandy see truely tyll englysshe flete appered ye boundes ouarentyne knewe theyr balengers armye englande comynge therfore withdrewe themselfe hauen harflewe lyghtely nothynge knowen specyally dedes armes lordes knyghtes squyers wyl gladly talke togyder therof dyscomfyture iuberoth kynge castell toke suche losse ye haue herde tydynges therof came franuce reason many lost ye batayle theyr frendes kynsmen warre lykely castell also herde true reporte howe ye duke lancastre claymed ryght enherytaunce herytage castell howe raysed englonde grete armye entente drawe castell portyngale knyghtes squyers ye low march auaunce theyr honoure drewe sente eche determyne howe myght best drawe castell cousayled go thyder lande eschewe ye perylles ye see also scape fro encountrynge ye englysshe nauye sayd nay therto sayd ye passage lande ouer longe also thought yt kynge nauare clerely fauourable ye frensshe partye frensshmen loued smally togyder sayd true frensshe men taken fro hym enherytauce normady howbeit tell yf quarel iust thus copanyos doubted gretely perylles yt myyght fall goynge lande well kynge nauare thought sholde neuer come way thrugh aragon last concluded go rochell dyd take rygged xviii vesselles toke fewe horse wt whe redy wynde theyr wyll entred theyr vesselles sayled towarde bayon yt waye nere therto must nedes passe yt company ye lorde coursey syr iohn handoy ye vycout verliere syr peter vellamines syr guy baueux syr iohn castell morant ye lorof saynt liger syr iames fougeres ye lorof bellannes syr trystram langurant ye lorde bartoys barres dyuers yt ccc knyghtes squyers chosen men desyrynge armes thus sayled see wynde wether wolde wysshe aryued without peryl domage porte saynt andrewe bysquay ye yere lorde miiiclxxx vi ye xiiii day moneth may knyghtes squyers frau aryued saynt andrewes refresshed ii dayes space drew theyr shyppes theyr horse bagages set forthe demaunded sholde fynde kynge castell shewed howe sholde fynde hym cyte burgus spayne grete counsayle ye busynes royalme knyghtes squyers toke theyr way burgus came thyder kynge castell ryght ioyfull theyr comynge demauded tydynges fraunce way came thyder answered howe came see fro rochel sayd frauce yt duke lancastre grete army armes archer come ye season castel elles portyngale also ye kynge portyngale sent nobre galeys shyppes englade hym tydynges ye kyng spayne pensyue made semblaunt well thought sholde haue sore warre season made good chere knyghtes squyers fraunce thanked gretely theyr comynge sayd syr robert braquemont syr iohn broder syrs ye departed fro yere past desyred soeuer ye retourned agayne hyder ye sholde brynge tenyse balles parys v play togyder ben better hadde charged haue brought good ba senetes good harneys thynke shall fynde season well enploye syr sayd knyght haue brought bothe syr alwayes armed alwayes play thus kynge castell made ryght good chere affeccyon god pylgrymage saynt iames syth ye countrey auowed rode togyder company trussed theyr harneys thought sholde haue gone batayle dyd wysely theyr doynge stode good stede retourned agayne ye shall nowe let v retourne ye duke lancastres armye coost normandy lyke maner coparyson fawcons pelegrynes haue stande ested longe perche hath grete desyre flye abrode lyke maner knyghtes squyers englonde desyred fynde dedes armes auaunce themselfe sayd eche ye aryue go se boundes porte normandy knyghtes squyers awake v fyght v wordes multyplyed came ye duke eyre duke departed englonde knewe syr iohn malestroyt lorde cambor morfonac grete nombre knyghtes squyers bretayne lay syege bastydes castell brest commaundement constable fraunce ye duke herde grete desyre yt men fynde dedes armes sayd admyrall syr thomas percy constable armye syr iohn holande commaundynge addresse theyr nauey towarde bretayne sayenge howe wolde goo se castell brest vysyte comforte ye companyons therin loke yt without bastyde tydynges ye englysshe men ioyful alphons vietat chefe patron nauey portyngale knew ryght well way entree bretayne whiche ryght peryllous daungerous made galey lede trace shewed ye way season sayre pleasaunt see peasyble soo sayled towarde hauen brest taryed tyde knewe well fludde sholde ye hauen brest grete pleasure trompettes claryons season syr iohn malestroyt vycount combor morfonac syttynge dyner whe tydynges came englysshe armye come rose armed knewe wel whe ye duke lancastre taken lande wolde fyght rayse theyr bastydes soo well armed good mynde defende yf assaylled ccc knyghtes squyers englysshe men ryght ioyful whe hauen brest vnderstode howe ye breton helde theyr bastydes sayd howe wolde go se fyght grete desyre doo dedes armes phowe duke lancastre assayled lordes knyghtes squyers bastydes brest bretayne howe defended themselfe ca lxvii thus duke lancastre company toke lande lytell besyde castell brest lefte theyr horse prouysyo styl theyr shyppes ladyes damoyselles toke lande refresshe ye fyrst day dyd thynge apparelled themselfe lodge ye erthe ii iii dayes pauylyons along ye see syde lay yt day nyght nexte mornyng ye constable marshall army sowned theyr trompettes cause euery armed dyd good ordre wente towarde ye castell ye bastydes whiche strongely made maner haue endured ix x yeres aboute ye bastides dyke gate towres good walles made grete tymbre knyghtes squyers englonde suche desyred dedes armes came barryers ye bastides bega skyrmysshe wt feruent wyl wyn ye bastydes breton knyghtes squyers within bastydes redy defende entente fyght large hande hande dyd put away barryers theyr defence wherin dyd grete foly trusted moche theyr owne chyualry doone many goodly feate armes herde rencountrynges sore foynynge speres dyd best best breth howbeit many ye englysshmen therfore gaue breton moche clene force armes englysshmen wanne baylles yt within closure ye towne mo c men armes ye breton poynte haue lost syr iohn malestroyte vycount combor sawe maner cryed crye sayd syrs shall lose thus forwarde fyghtynge sholde faynte outher dethe honoure breton closed togyder grete courage pytched theyr speres glayues erthe helde strongly theyr place fought couragyously many fayre dedes armes done force englysshe men fayne recule backe soo wel resysted coulde gete grounde clene beten ye baylles day coulde wyn agayne another corner theyr bastydes towre stone descendynge downe rocke whiche breton helde theyr aduautage kepynge theyr bastydes therat made grete assaulte archer meane season whyle men armes fyghtyng barryers englysshe men passed ouer lytell dyke came foote towre wt pycke ax mattockes theyr handes began myne sore ye towre suche defended themselfe theyr towre valyauntly englysshe archer shotte soo hooly togyder none durst appere theyr defence without sore pauessed ye englysshe men vndermyned sore foundacyon towre raue clene sondre one parte fel downe yt sawe wolde fall drewe parte stode ye englysshe men made grete showte tyme late sowned ye retrayte sayd done ynoughe daye englysshe men departed sayd breton syrs abyde al nyght make good watche morow wyll come loke agayne ye se well ynoughe case ye nothyng shadowe v entente englysshe men nexte daye retourne agayne assayle bastydes conquere suche within whiche ryght well theyr puyssaunce soo haue done thus englysshe men passed nyght often tymes sayd moche thynges sholde fall mennes thoughtes yf cou tre thoughtes agaynst say bycause thoughe englysshe oost subtyll wyse men warre yet breton yt within bastydes suffycyently prouyded wysdome welconsydered thynge myght auayle thynge theyr domage sawe well must nedes departe then elles taken slayne determyned truise myght departe leue theyr bastyde ordeyned dyd lepte theyr horse lefte theyr bastydes toke feldes toke way hambont iiii myle then dyd wysely therin feared pursute englysshe men bycause theyr horse lande thus syr iohn malestroyte company rode ye nyght hanybout founde ope feared lytell englysshe men nexte day trompettes blewe euery man oost armed hym drewe towarde assaulte bastyde herde tydynges breton departed lefte bastyde voyde ye englysshmen repented layde busshment wherby sholde haue lost theyr pray brake downe bastyde set fyre theron thus duke lancastre ye bastydes raysed brest day duke syr iohn holande certayne lordes wente se castell brest ladyes wt ete drake made chere wente agayne theyr lodgynges ye nexte day whiche ye iii day refresshed theyr shyppes wt fresshe water iiii daye toke shyppynge departed fourthe day duke company maryners toke counsayle togyder whiche waye sholde drawe whether sholde take lande lyxbone porte portyngale bysquay coulongne longe counsayle fully determyned alphons vietat patron galeys portyngale sente ye questyon demaunded hym answered sayd syrs cause sente portyngale fro kynge mayster syr knowe trouthe soeuer ye aryue countrey ye shall ryght welcome hym shall ryght ioyfull hym gretely desyreth comynge se thus space houre poynte haue landed porte portyngale xxx myle lyxbone howbeit chaunged theyr purpose sayd amonge ferre honourable lande march theyr enemyes lande theyr frendes saynge also yf theyr enemyes knowe yt landed shal feared rested take lande coulongne galyce ye maryners set theyr course way wynde wether wyll departed fro brest ye v daye came hauen coulongne taryed fludde wherfore sholde approche nere lande nowe shall shewe knyghtes fraunce lorde barroys syr iohn braquemont syr iohn castell morant syr peter bellames syr trystra come pylgrymage ye towne compostella lyeth body saynt iames whe done theyr pylgrymage offered theyr lodgynges tydynges came howe englysshe men coost lykelyhode aryue coulongne coulde vntrusse theyr harneys discharge theyr mule armed quyckely determyned go thyder defende porte castell towne suche knewe ye countrey sayd syrs auaunce forwarde shortely yf englysshe men happen wynne towne castell coulongne wyll lordes countrey aboute knyghtes dyd suche dylygence came nyght towne coulongne whiche xiiii longe myles then cou trey full wylde laboure came poynte entred ye towne castell season englysshmen came hauen theyr comynge towne castell ryght ioyfull nyght came theyr caryages somers mornyng grete beautye beholde entrynge hauen ye galeys shyppes charged men prouysyon trompettes claryons sounde trompettes claryons ye towne castell dyd sounde lykewyse agaynst ye englysshe men knew wel men warre towne castel yssued theyr galeys shyppes ye feldes approchynge towne sawe well ye towne stronge well prouyded men warre without towne certayne fissher house ye englysshe lordes made theyr lodgynges soo laye styll iiii dayes doynge none thynge dyschargynge theyr shyppes grete prouysyon theyr horse set lande whiche ben ye see xv dayes sore oppressed furoure see nombre people euery shyppe yet ben well kepte haye ootes fresshe water sufficyent wha euery thynge voyded galeys shyppes demau ded ye duke wolde haue done nauey answered sayd wyll al maryners payde theyr wage let euery man owne profyte gyue good leue wyll euery man knowe wyll neuer passe agayne see englonde tyll haue full pleasure royalme castell elles wyll dye quarell ye maryners payde euery man contente departed myght hauen coulongne wente portyngale lyxbone bayon albay bretaygne englande soo none abode behynde thus duke lancastre men lodged without coulongne suche lytell house founde abrode feldes bower made grene bowes lyke men warre aboute space moneth duke laye coulongne remeued without huntynge hawkynge ye duke lordes englande brought hawkes houndes theyr sporte sparowe hawkes ladyes also brought ye shyppes mylles grynde corne ouyns bake theyr forager wente dayly foragynge thought spede howbeit founde grete plenty forage lodged poore countrey deserte wherfore dryuen go ferre forage also garyson coulongne ye barroys barres ryght wel coulde take vauntage enemyes nede companyons sawe englysshe forager ryde forthe folysshly thought daye make pay daye armed cc rode guyde nyght aboute woodes mountaynes brekyng day came wood mountayne called espynet taryed shewed howe englysshe forager rode abrode true ye nombre iiic forager ben brode ii dayes gotten moche forage retourned towarde theyr oost theyr waye laye passe pace pynet busshment brake cryed barroys barres forager abasshed moost parte vnarmed syxe socore archer dyd put themselfe good ordre defence began shote dyd hurte wounde men horse theyr shot past cast away theyr bowes fell defence suche wepons hyd saue themselfe sholde make longe tale englysshe forager slayne c c saued themselfe wel myght busshes hedge horsmen coulde come suche fled came coulongne shewed ye barroys barres ouerthrowen oost began styre arme syr thomas moreaux marshal oost ccccc mounted theyr horse penon saynt george set forth grete desyre fynde frensshe men rode soo longe came espynet founde theyr men lyenge deed thynge elles frensshe men departed soo retourned without doynge ony thyng elles wtin halfe myle theyr oost sawe frensshmen entred theyr garyson coulongne wherwith sore dyspleased coulde amende day marshal sore blamed oost sente forthe suffered go forth ony forager without sure conduyte consyderynge theyr enemyes beynge lodged nere sure holde suche nombre able ouerthrowe v vic forager duke lancastre constable blamed hym sore ashamed therof excused hymselfe sayd howe ben forth x tymes hurte well sayd duke take better hede another tyme case may fall houre daye peraduenture shall fall agayne hundreth dayes phowe duke lancastre oost soiourned momoneth coulongne departed rode towarde saynt iames galyce ca xlviii duke lacastre soiourned coulongne ye space moneth cousayled dyslodge thes drawe towardes saynt iames galyce better countrey plentyfull men horse departed rode thre batayles fyrst marshal ccc speres vic archer duke cccc spere ladyes damoyselles company arrere garde constable syr iohn hollande wt cccc speres viic archer thus rode fayre easely iii batayles rydynge thre dayes bytwene coulongne saynt iames countrey galyce sore afrayde duke comynge thyder fered gretely puyssauce marshall vowarde came compostelia ye body saynt iames lyeth towne closed agaynst hym howbeit men warre garyson men ye towne yt kepte frensshmen wolde vndertake kepe vtteraunce stronge ynoughe kepte agaynst suche men warre duke brought thyder marshall oost sente thyder heraulde armes knowe theyr entente wolde heraulde came barryers foude ye capytayne ytwarde called alphons sene heraulde sayd syr capytayne lytel besyde duke lancastres marshall hath sent hyder wolde gladly speke wel sayd yt capytayne pleseth wel let hym come hyder shal speke wt hym ye heraulde retourned shewed marshall sayd ye marshall wt xx speres wt hym wente thyder foude barryers ye capytayne certayne ye chefe heedes towne ye marshal lyghted fote iii hym lorde basset syr wyllya fremyton ye marshall sayd ye capytayne men lorde duke la castre lady lady lancastre doughter kynge peter lorde kynge hath sent hyder speke know ye wyll say outher receyue ye showe souerayne lorde lady elles assayle take perforce surely knowe trouth ye taken perforce al ye within towne shall suffre dethe wt swerde gyue ensample syr sayd capytayne wyl vse v reason wolde gladly acquyte v yt belonge know ryght well yt lady costau ce lancastre doughter kynge petero castel yt kynge peter abyden peasybly styl kyng ben ryghtfull enherytoure castell matter chauged otherwyse al ye royalme castel abode peasybly kynge henry broder reason batayle yt natuel yt al countrey sware holde kynge henry kyng kepte longe lyued also haue sworne holde kyng iohn sone kyng syr shewe v haue coulongne done sayd maye syth ye haue lyne moneth yt haue made maner treaty yt true sayd marshal treaty wt elles scaped dyd yet towne coulongne twyse stronge towne shall shew treaty haue made v ye ye towne haue pryuely made composycyon v saynge wyll euery thyng accordynge ye though ye wyl suffre yourselfe assayled dystroyed yet soo wyll yf countrey galyce yelde lorde duke lady wyll lyke wyse haue good pledge suffycyent wel sayd sayd capytayne lykewyse wyll holde treatye royalme many mo good cytees townes ryde forth leue v pea wyll yt wyl delyuer good pledge ostages nay syr sayd marshall lorde ye duke lady wyl suffre yt wyl come lodge towne kepe theyr estate sholde theyr owne herytage therfore answere v shortely ye wyll outher yelde assayled taken force destroyed syr sayd capytayne gyue v lytell leysure yt may speke togyder shal answere shortely contente sayd marshall capytayne entred ye towne caused euery man come hym wysely shewed frome poynte poynte ye haue harde fynally agreed receyue duke ye duches peasybly theyr lorde lady abyde theyr towne longe pleased without puyssaunce kynge iohn dyd dryue then also whe taryed pleased yere ii longer shorter departed ye countrey without lefte suffycyent garyson defende fro theyr enemyes elles rendre agayne kynge iohn marshall yf soo commaunded quyte theyr fayth promyse made treatye ye marshall syr thomas moreaur accepted sayd sayd ought duke ye duches desyred nothynge elles marshall retourned men duke taryed hym feldes shewed ye duke trety wher wt duke content soo good ordre batayle duke rode towne saynt iames within ii lytell frensshe myles saynt iames galyce came processyon clergy towne cross relykes woman chyldren tomete duke duches men towne brought key whiche preseted duke duches theyr good wylles semblaunt say dyd theyr good harte kneled downe receyued theyr lorde lady entred ye towne saynt iames fyrst voyage made wente chyrche theyr chyldren made theyr prayer offrynge wt grete giftes shewed yt duke ye duches theyr ii doughters phylyp katheryn lodged abbay kept theyr house ye lordes syr iohn holade syr thomas moreaux theyr wyues lodged towne al baron knightes lodged abrode ye felde house bowres bowes ynowe coutrey foude flesshe strong wyne ynough whereof ye englysshe archer drake moche yt ofte tymes droken wherby ye feuers elles ye mornyng theyr hedes cuyl yt coulde helpe selfe day whe ye barroys barres iohn castel morant ye knyghtes squyers ye castel coulogne herde ye duke duches entred peasybly saynt iames yt receyued toke cousayle togyder best sayd foly tary ther ony lenger haue good adue ture let v go burgus ye kynge se wyl none otherwyse wyll go agaynst englysshmen yf suffre lodge thus rest lytell lytell shall coquere lordes castell wherfore honourable v go thyder abyde cousayle helde ye best made redy departe trussed yt yssued ye castell coulongne toke theyr leue yt foude entred fyrst toke gydes suche knew coutrey elles ben encoutred rode thrugh bysquay costyng galyce came lyon spayne ye kynge quene ye kynge welcomed frensshe knyghtes reason demaunded tydynges howbeit knew ynoughe al redy shewed hym entred coulongne ye tyme yt englysshmen entred hauen englysshmen foude hauen vii galeys vesselles bysquay laden wynes whiche englysshmen theyr profyte merchauntes sone solde ye sayd kynge goth warre wyse tary knew army englonde myght haue gone quarter syr sayd ye knyghtes come thyder trust saufegarde sayd wynes marchaundyse yt sholde go flaundres de wel ye maryners saynt andrewes yt englysshmen see boundes coost bysquay true kynge portyngale sent galeys gret shyppes thyn kynge wolde haue landed ye porte portyngale lyxbone dyd cotrary appered entred galyce coulongne well syrs sayd kynge among knyghtes frauce knoweth dedes armes coutrey ye haue haunted vsed warre haue thynke englysshme haue borne theselfe al season syr sayd haue borne themselfe lyke good warre close pryuy yt harde knowe entende supposyng thynke ye duke lacastre wyl abyde nexte wynter saynt iames towne people theraboute ouer rynne ye coutrey galyce wyn ye small holdes gete vytayles prouysyons tyl somer come lykelyhode shall treatye made bytwene hym kynge portyngale elles neuer one poynte yt causeth v byleue yt alyaunces shal cocluded bytwene yt ye duke hath brought englade hym al doughters maryed mary hath ii mary thynke ye kyng portyngale aduersary shal haue one wel sayd ye kyng thynge best syr sayd ye knyght shal shew cause al townes castels ye ron er galyce wel kepte suche stregth suche strength cause beten downe shewed v men ye coutrey fortefy minster chyrches steples bryng al theyr goodes syr surely shal losse confusyon royalme whe ye englysshmen ryde abrode small holdes chyrches steples shal holde agaynst shal refresshed nourysshed wt suche prouysyon shall fynde whiche shal helpe furteth wynne ye resydue therfore syr say yt ye wel cause al suche holdes beten downe le ye haue leysure make crye yt wtout euery thyng auoyded ye good townes stronge castelles bytwene feest sayntes elles let forfayte abando tt warre euer catche furchest feest saynt andrewe better owne profyte ther rather enemyes syr sende specyally certayne persones counsayle ye frensshe kyng certefyeng hym case countrey thus syr sende kyng vncles ye duke berrey ye duke borgoyne shewyng surely yt lykelyhode nexte somer ye shal haue ye grettest war yt euer made spayne ye prynce ony syr wryte pyteous letter desyrynge kynge vncles coforte grete nede wt good armes resyst enemyes kepe def de royalme grete alyaunces redy bytwene frensshe kynge lykewyse hym fader syr surely wyse ye frensshe kyng noble royalme frau ce whiche may dede englande portyngale ioyned togyder case wyll fayle whe ye fresshe kyng cou sayle iustly enfourmed euery thynge ye shal wel perceyue wyl take suche regarde therto yt ye shal take lytell domage war knightes squyers frauce desyring auaunce theyr dedes wt lytell worde co maudement wyll drawe partyes fynde dedes armes nowe wote employ theyr tyme better frau ce flauders accorded whiche hath ben war long season also truce bytwene frauce englade beyonde ye ryuer loyre endure ye feest saynt iohn baptyst therfore syr ye shal se knyghtes squyers frauce come hyder good nombres well fynde dedes armes se coutrey mete ye englysshme syr cousayle fyre yt al smal holdes chyrches mynsters steples abrode ye coutrey let de put downe ye thynke haue ioy ye resydue kyng castel sayd syrs ye cou sayle truely thus wyll fro hence forwarde without takyng ony cou sayle comaunded al suche holdes grete strength beten downe abandoned ye frensshe knyghtes al yt founde se yt done deuysed syrsayd yt wel sayd syr shal se accoplysshed shal helpe saue resydue worde yt kyng castel sayd frauce auctorite yt gaue wel worth ccm frankes profyte specyally yt came fyrst castell whe duke lacastre aryued coulongne thus thrughout al royalme castel al smal holdes chyrches steples suche sufficyent kepte put downe ye goodes abandoned warre people ye countrey atrapped begyled suche fortefyed suche place put theyr goodes wyne corn flesshe thi ge thynkyng haue kepte sure fell cotrary knyghtes squyers sente thyder theyr toke al brought suche prouysyon foude theyr maysters lodgynges golde syluer suche foude suche money made vylaynes pay theyr owne goodes yt money neuer came knowledge yt kepte styll theyr purse ye poore copanyons suche subtyl moost aduentured therby wan moost often tymes suche cometh fro theyr owne howses moost porest suche case sonest mouted good horse genettes v vi theyr stable gyrdelles chaynes golde syluer iim frankes theyr purse whe theyr owne coutrey fayne go fote nagge thus ye copanyons yt came fyrst castel wan moche ryches poore ye coutrey payde al robbed ryfled wt theyr owne wolde yt theyr enemyes sholde haue ony fyte therof tydynges came frauce copanyons ye pore knyghtes squyers yt gone castell made ryche eger go theyr house draw spayne cosideryng myght well pyll robbe theyr frendes theyr enemyes pof grete apparell prouysyon generally made royalme frauce kyng cousayle iourney made englande also dethe frauncis atreman ca lii frensshe kyng counsayle wel enfourmed ye voyage yt duke lacastre sholde make castel departed ye voyce flewe quyckely yt royalme castel sholde haue moche yt somer fynde remedy theragaynst duke burgoyne made lyghtly pea wt gau se ye entente ayde ye necessyte ye kyng castel wherto frensshe kyng royal frauce bounde dyuers reason ye kyng castel men shyppes ye see busynes ye royalme fraunce good state also besyde yt yonge kynge charles frauce grete affeccyon go wt army ye royalme englande knytes squyers frauce well agreed therto specyally vncle ye duke burgoyne constable fraunce al yt wyfe syster kyng rycharde englande also ye lorde coucy lordes parte ye chyualry frauce sayd sholde one go englande se countrey people teche way haue done fraunce ye yere lorde mccclxxxvi ye entente breke ye duke lancastres voyage cause hym retourne castel gyue feare ye englysshme grete ordenauuce yt voyage made trauce tax tallages set allysed cytees good townes ye playne countrey yt c yere none suche sene also grete apparel made see al somer tyll ye moneth septembre dyd thyng elles see coost grynde corne bake bysket tournay lysle doway arras amyas bethune saynt omers townes aboute sluse ye frensshe kynges entencyon counsayle take ye see sluse entre englande distroy ye countrey yt ryche men ye royalme frauce ye ayde voyage taxed tayled iii iii parte theyr goodes many payde worth besyde accoplysshe ye payment men warre fro spayne fro porte sybyll pruce grete shyp ye see yt ye frensshmen coulde lay theyr handes vnder theyr owne obeysaunce reteyned ye frensshe kynge men prouysyon came fro al partyes aryued flaunders wyne salte flesshe hay tonne otes ony ons bysket floure egges pypes al maner thynges yt coulde deuysed yt tyme come coulde byleued yt sawe lordes knyghtes squyers men war wryten vnto desyred come serue ye kyng iourney sauoy almayne fro sone goynge downe ye lande ye erle amynacke lordes farre countreys erle sauoy reteyned vc speres also ye erle armynacke ye dolphyn awuergne lordes thoughe farre coutreys knew ende warre sholde come yet made theyr uysyons grete costly yt gret meruayle thynke therof wonder consyder fro whens suche prouysyon came lande see flauders bruges dan sluse sent holade zelande meldebourge zerechyel dourdrest stonehone townes ye see coost ye ryuers entryng ye see al maner shyppes yt coulde ony seruyce al brought sluse ye holanders ye zelanders sayd yt reteyned yf ye wy haue seruyce pay v wage clerely elles wyl go parte payde wherin dyd wysely trowe syth god created ye worlde neuer sene many grete shyppes togyder yt yere sluse blanquerge ye moneth septebre ye sayd yere nobred xiiclxxxvii shyppes sluse mastes semed ye se lyke grete wood costable fraunce shyp apparelled lentregmer bretaygne also costable caused made bretaygne tymbre closure towne lyke parke yt whe take lande englade close theyr felde lodge theri theyr case wtout waking skries whesoeuer sholde remoue theyr felde closure made yt myght take sonder peces grete nombre carpeters receyned wage atende thereon herde yt ye duke bretaygne made ony prouysyo go iourney duke tourayne kynges yonger broder erle bloys al myght go must abyde behynde kepe ye royalme ben seaso bruges dan sluse sene ye busynes chargynge shyppes wt hay sackyng bysket ladyng onyons peson benes barley candelles hosen shoos spurres knyues dagger ax war ax hew wtal mattockes nayles beddes couch horseshoos pottes pane cadelstyckes al maner necessaryes kechyn botery al yces euery thyng yt coulde thought necessary serue horse al shyppes one thyng euer sene ben seke thynke wolde clene haue forgoten al ye payne ye copanyons frauce rekened none otherwyse amonge theselfe whe spake togyder yt royalme englade sholde clene haue ben lost exyled wtout recouery al ye men woman chyldre therin slayne taken caryed frauce seruytude grete apparel thus made come englande ye kyng englade cousayle wel enfourmed therof surely affyrmed fensshme wolde come thyder surely sworne meruayle though grete apparel somwhat ye begynnyng abasshed ye englysshme also matter shewed moche dede also yt englysshmen sure cer aynte whether preparacyon come englande elles lay syege caleys bothe lande see englysshme knewe wel yt townes worlde ye frensshmen desyred haue caleys wherfore kyng englande sent caleys grete prouisyon whete cornes salte flesshe fysshe wyne bere thynges thyder sent syr thomas holade erle kente syr hughe caurell syr wyllya helman syr dangouses syr water vurnes syr water paulle syr wyllya toucet syr loys mountalban syr colars dabrychcourte vc men armes vc archer ye erle rycharde aru del syr henry spenser ordeyned kepe see xl greteshyppes wel decked men armes archer ye nombre ccc men armes vic archer syde sayd dyuers place fraunce haynalte pycardy yt ye fresshe armye yt thus apparelled flauders nother go englande calays rather retourne al ye matter set ye towne gaunte enfourmed ye towne gaunte season doubted gretely yt ye apparell come wronge byleue ye duke borgoyne theyr lorde wolde nothyng good rest pea thoughe yt frauncis atreman slayne anone makyng pea tournay deth ye duke nothyng blame duke none euyll wyl hym though ye season war dyd many feates armes ye towne agayst duke hath ben declared playnly though came euyl ende owne defaulte byleued peter du boy ben otherwyse hym pea made bytwene ye duke borgoyne gaunt retourned fro tournay gaunt yt peter du boy made hym redy go englande syr iohn bourser peter sayd hym frau ci wyll ye wyl ye go englande v sayd wolde abyde styll gaunt sayd peter thynke abyde pea grete hatred agaynst wyll abyde nothynge tryst ye comontye ye haue herde gaunt slue murdred valyaunt iaques artuell done moche good towne bothe counsayle armes lytell cause vyllaynes slue hym honest men towne dyd saue hym rather dyssymuled glad dethe lykewyse frauncis wyll yf abyde wyll tary therfore adue pwhy sayd frauncis duke borgoyne hath pardoned thynges hath reteyned yf wyll go hym squyer stable iiii horse also syr guy tremoyll sheweth grete sygne loue name god sayd peter du boy speke lorde ye duke borgoyne knyghtes thynke wyll kepe well pea speke comons gaunt yt ye haue alwayes pleased remembre ye lorde sargelles ye made slayne knowe trouth yt passed hatredes wyl contynue theyr harte yf ye abyde amonge yet better go dwell ye duke borgoyne well sayd frauncis shal take aduyse englande wyl go thus frauncis atreman abode styll peterdu boy wente syr iohn bourser anone yt pea cryed publysshed partyes flaunders made crye none sholde bere ony armure sworde hym frauncis atrema styll gaunt kepte grete estate warre durynge thought contynue somwhat honestye euer went iii iiii seruauntes waytynge hym armed beryng swordes wepons crye made duke name thought sholde rynne hym none seruauntes thought hymselfe soo well fauoure towne deceyued within vii viii dayes cry proclamed ye duke baylyffe came personally hym sayd fraucis ye put lorde duke offycers grete suspecte go aboute ye towne harneys seruauntes beryng swordes wepons defence thoughe tyme war whiche pleaseth v wherfore comaunde duke name lay downe frauncis thought none euyll yt dyd maynteyne estate answered sayd syr baylyffe wyll obey reason thanke god hate persone wolde yt ony sholde haue ony hurte sake howbe thought haue aduautage ye towne gaunt yt myght haue seruautes theyr swordes nay sayd baylyffe suche towne ye haue done seruyce vnto speke theragaynste haue meruayle therof demaunde suffre saye semeth wolde renewe agayne olde warre whiche wyll suffre wherfore fraucis pray therof yf ye wyll obey must repute enemy lorde duke lady borgoyne baylyffe departed fro hym frauncis wente lodgynge caused seruauntes lay downe theyr armure entred suche fantasye moost parte wente ye towne alone one hy chylde seruaunt daye feest kepte without towne gaunt abbey saynt peter frauncis atre man wente thyder one seruaunt hym without armure wepyn spyed poursued bastarde sone lorde harzelles caused slayne fore wherfore sone thought reuenged faders deth bastarde prouyded matter poursued frauncis tyl came towne farre fro ony company cryed hym sayd thou frauncis atrema thou shalte dye thou caused fader slayne shall slee frau ci tourned hym bastarde strake hym ye heed sworde weyghty stroke claue heed tethe fell downe deed erthe bastarde wente way fayre easely man poursued hym frauncis atreman wel worthy dye wolde byleue peter du boy tydynges came englande peter du boy knew therof toke smal thought hym sayd departed fro graunt well aduysed hym let v se nowe wyll amende duryng warre dyd gretely honoure hym suche doubtes byleued syr iohn bourser came englande nowe let v retourne prouisyons made season dan sluse remembrauce wrytynge neuer none lyke sene herde golde syluer spared thoughe rayned clowdes scomed ye see grete lordes fraunce sent theyr seruauntes sluse apparell make redy theyr prouysyons shyppes furnysshe euery thynge nedefull kynge hymselfe yonge wyl iourney ony alwayed shewed ende therof euery helped make prouysyo garnysshe theyr shyppes paynte theyr armes paynters good season wan soeuer desyred yet coulde ynow gote money made baners penons standerdes sylke soo goodly yt meruayle beholde also paynted theyr mastes theyr shippes fro one ende glyteryng golde deuyses armes specyally shewed yt lorde guy tremoyle garnysshed shyp rychely payntynges yt made cost iim frankes whatsoeuer ony lorde coulde deuyse theyr pleasure made shyppes pore people royalme payde al tallages grete fournysshe voyage yt ryche sorewed poore fled yt euer done fraunce flau ders place voyage wel knowen englande made moche gretter dede wherof people dyuers place royalme sore abasshed made generall processyons euery good towne cyte prelate men chyrche iii tymes euery weke whiche made grete deuocyon harte holy prayer orysons god delyuer fro peryll howbeit englande cm desyred hartely ye frensshmen myght come aryue englande suche lyght companyons comfortynge themselfe abasshed sayd let frensshmen come shall one tayle retourne agayne fraunce suche persones det cared ye payment therof gretely reioysed ye comynge frensshmen wolde say theyr credytours demaunded theyr det syrs holde styll forge frauce new floreyns wherwith ye shall payde ye trust therof lyued spente largely whe myght trusted wolde say wolde ye haue v better sholde spende frely goodes royalme rather frensshmen sholde fynde haue meanes spente outrage englande pou de sterlynge season ye kyng englade ye march walles wt hym erle oxenforde euery thynge done englade wtout hym nothyng done chefe ye kynges cousayle syr symon burle syr nicholas braule syr robert tauylyon syr robert beauchamp syr iohn salwen syr mychel de la polle also named ye bysshop norwyche syr wyllya neuell broder ye lorde neuel al sayd dyd wt ye kyng lyst ye kynges vncles ye erle cambrydge erle buckyngha coulde nothyng wtout agreable ye sayd trouble differece amo ge theselfe well knowen frauce whiche gretly auaunced theyr iourney wolde haue ye duke lacastre haue withdrawe iourney castell toke hede therof let voyage whe ye lordes engla de prelate ye people ye good townes cytees comons royalme iustly credybly enfourmed ye frensshe kyng redy come englande dystroy drew togider cousayle ye kyng wryten vnto vncles yt sholde come londo certefyeng hym ye comons royalme cotent hy counsayle ye kyng counsayle wolde refuse ye goyng thyder departed ye march wale ben long quene also came wyndesore taryed certayne dayes ye kyng lefte ye quene went westmynstre palace taryed thyder came hym al suche toke cousayle sholde demeaned agaynst iourney ye frensshe kyng erle salysbury ryght valyaunt prudent knyght sayd ye kyng vncles al ye prelate lordes englande yt psent syr souerayn lorde al ye lordes ought meruayled aduersary ye frensshe kyng wyll come ryn vpo v syth ye deth last noble puyssaunt kyng edward noble memory royalme hath ben gret adueture haue ben lost dystroyed ye vyllaynes also well knowen fraunce al one accorde wherfore trouble appereth ye whiche lytel foole yt fereth enemyes longe royalme englande vnyte ye kyng people wt hym prospered reygned vyctoryously sawe founde none yt dyd v ony grete wronge wherfore nedeful neuer nede apperd englande yt coferme ourselfe rest loue vnyte thynke come ony honour yt ordeyne ye porte hauens englande suche prouysyon defence countrey receyue blame domage noble royalme englande hath ben lo g season tryuphaunt floure euery man knoweth well thynge yt floure hath nede wel kepte whe tourned parfyte fruyte therfore ought se cosyder royalme flourysshynge floure within xl yeres knyghtes squyers therof bothe within ye royalme wtout haue honoure ony nacyo therfore let v put paynes yt long lyue may kepe honour euery sayd yt good yt wereso erle salysburies wordes wel herde accepted wordes counsayle noble valyaunt sage knyght yt sayd hym deuysed among wyl long rest theron thynke know al know wel yt towne caleys kepte sayd ordeyned kepe ye hauyns porte supposed yt ye frensshme wolde aryue ye erle salysbury bycause parte lande marched nere ye yle wyght whiche ryght oueragaynst normandy coutrey aulx therfore set archer countrey erle deuynshyre hampton cc men armes vic archer kepe hauyn ye erle northubrelande rye cc armes vic archer ye erle ca brydge douer wt vc farmes xiic archer broder ye erle buckyngha sadwyche vic armes xiic archer ye erle stafforde ye erle penbroke sent wel hauyn vc armes xiic archer syr henry percy faulx percy yarmouth wt iiic armes vic archer syr symon burle capytayne douer ca el al ye hauyns porte bytwene ye ryuer humbre cornewal refresshed war archer ye mou taynes hylles costyng see fronters agaynst flauders frauce set watche watcher dyuers maners ca tel empty pypes fylled wt sade one set another hyght place syr whiche nyght day kepte watche lokynge see charged yt yf saw ye frensshe nauy aproche towarde lade make fyers alofte ye hylles styre ye coutrey drawe ye coost ye fyers apered ordeyned yt sholde suffre ye frensshe kyng peasybly take lande al suffre hym entre ye lade iii iiii dayes fyrst go ye see landed fyght wt shyppes wyn yf colde dystroy take al theyr prouysyon th folow ye frenssh e incotynet fyght wt hary kepe wakynge kepe fro goynge foragynge dystroy yt abrode ye countrey yt therby sholde famysshe ye opynyon cousayle englade rochestre brydge broken grete ryuer rynnynge fro arundel ye coutye essex entreth ye see tamyse agaynst ye yle tenet brydge londo bet downe ye surer tax tallages grete frauce ye men ye townes lykewyse grete season engla de yt ye royalme sorowed grete season glad pay ye sowdyours therby defeded redy englade c archer axm men armes besyde ye grete copany ye duke lancastre castel wyll speke somewhat shew ye aquayntauce yt bytwene hym ye kyng portyngale shal retourne speke agayne englande ye matter requyreth speke wel ye one phow kyng portyngale wrote amyably duke lancastre whe knew aryued saynt iames galyce socours kyng castel sent fraunce towne ruelles galyce taken englysshe men ca liii ye haue herde hystory ye duke lacastre fayre copany armes archer aryued coulongne galyce coposycyon ye towne ye castel yelden h thus sayd wolde townes galyce dyd therby assayled ye duke wyfe chyldren came towne saynt iames called copost lia laye purpose tyl herde tydynges fro ye kyng portyngale knewe surty yt duke saynt iames wherof grete ioy thynkyng yt bytwene sholde make goodly war castell wrote letter ryght amyably wt grete salutacyons sent certayne messagers ye duke duches receyued ye letter ryght ioyously ye duke knew wel sholde haue gretnede ye kynge portyngale wtout hym comforte saw well sholde make smal spede busynes portyngale castel ye duke gaue ye messagers grete gyftes wrote agayne letter wt grete salutacyons amytyes ye kyng portyngale certefyeng hym letter yt desyred gretely se speke wt hym thus meane season ye letter messagers wente bytwene ye kyng portyngale duke lacastre tyme passed kyng iohn castel fortefyed hym al yt myght sent e frauce letter messagers desyryng haue ayde war defende kepe royalme castel sayng yt ye somer folowyng thought sholde haue grete war bycause ye kynge portyngale englysshmen ioyned togyder alyaunce wherby sholde stronge ynoughe ouer ryn ye royalme castel wtout withstaded ye fresshe kyng cousayle wrote agayne ye kynge castel byddyng hym take thought doubte within moneth ianuary wolde gyue englade moche yt sholde know sayenge yt dystroyed al englande ye somer wolde take ye see agayne passe galyce portyngale yt ye englysshme ye portyngales kept ye felde wolde cause flee yt within yere wolde make ende al ye warres kyng castel coteted hyselfe aswere saw wel coulde haue none tyme came none frauce hy suche al knyghtes squyers farre nere wente parys pycardy lysle way tournay coutrey iii myle length ful warre nombre grete yt suche ye rule nauy sayd yt coulde passe ye fyrst passage xlm ordeyned aduysed yt sholde suffre passe without pre armes yt euery knyght sholde haue one varlet baron ii squyers horse sholde passe onely ye lordes execute meset sluse se yt none sholde passe howbeit nombre rascalles flaudres theraboute yt ete vp al countrey pore men coutrey payde theyr charge durst speke agaynst worse ye countrey yf englysshmen theyr enemyes lyen grete doubte yt kynge lordes one passed ouer englade suche people abyde behynde lest assebled togyder dystroy al surely done iourney done amysse let v retourne duke lancastre pin meane season whyle duke lancastre duches chyldren copany lay saynt iames knyghtes squyers copany lyued aduenture might catche day syr thomas moreaulr marshal oost hym syr mauburne luners syr iohn da brychsourte tyrry wyllya sonnayne cc speres vc archer rode forth galyce came walled towne vii myles fro saynt iames called ruelles vylaynes yt dwelte therin wolde tourne ye duke rebell often tymes ouerthrowen duke forager passed ye barryers theyr towne broken ye wayes yt coulde repasse none way theyr barryers sawe vautage wolde yssue lyke theues dystroy forager passed wherof ye coplayntes came marshal yt sholde prouyde remedy acordyng offyce wherfore came towne ruelles ye watche ye towne wel blowen theyr comyng wherby hey within closed fast theyr barryers gate yt none abode wtout mouted vpon walles marshal whe saw theyr demeanyng saw well wolde abyde saulte sayd syr iohn da brychcourte tyrry sonnayne syrs take horse ryde aboute towne holde wel may best assayle ye towne leest hurtynge men mounted theyr horse rode aboute towne grete crycute wherfore retourned agayne soner wel aduysed euery place came marshal sayd syr towne ii gate ye one fore ryght ouer agaynst syr thynke ii place easy v gyue ony assaulte rounde aboute ye towne elles grete dyke depe ryght euyll go downe worse mounte vp agayne hedge busshes thorne yt growe therin byleue well sayd marshal syr mauburne shal haue certayne copany wt go gate shall abyde let v giue assaulte one wote shal come v gladly wolde se yonder vyllaynes yt lenynge ye batylmentes walles theyr towne loke v se wyll lyke ape etynge peres chyldren wolde take fro ye marshalles wordes copany laughed loked vp ye walles beholde ye vyllaynes syr maulburyne wente forth wt peno hym c speres iiic archer wente ye gate taryed anone ye assaulte bega ii partes right sharpe fyers within towne ouer ye gate threwe downe dartes fyersly yt troubled ye archer crosbowes hurte many theyr shot bycause none barrier defende al closed wtin towne defended theselfe wt shot cast dartes englisshme brake vp ye barryers came ye gate bet russhed therat ye made gate trymble shake wtin saw theyr gate lykely broke vp went downe fro walles ye strete bare grete tymbre wood gate wome chyldren al maner people bare stone fylled empty tonne pypes set agaynst theyr gate set aboue fylled lykewyse one vpo another styll ouer gate dyd cast downe grete barres yron yt none durst aproche nere ye gate wtout wolde slayne thus vylaynes ruel kepte theyr towne agaynst ye englyssh men yt lost lytell yt day englysshme retourned backe aloge myle yt cou trey towne persone abydynge lodged tyll nexte mornyng yt nyght ruelles counsayled togyder know sholde sholde maynteyne theselfe agaynst ye englysshme sent theyr spyes se ye englyssh men suche sent forthe retourned agayne reported surely howe lodged bace towne senace yt al symylytude wolde retourne agayne ye assaulte nexte mornyng sayd among selfe foly begyn foly contynewe haue blame though yelde v duke lancastre marshall haue defended towne hole daye amonge ourselfe without counsayle comforte ony gentyll man ony man warre lengthe cannot endure agaynst syth know waye thyder better v yelde ony assayled take perforce shal lese bodyes goodes al opynyon yt yf englysshe men retourned ye next day wolde treate yelde vp theyr towne theyr lyues goodes saued englysshmen mornynge retourned anone vpon sone rysynge go saulte towne sawe yt sent iiii theyr men make theyr treaty marshal rode vnder penon saw felde iiii sayd yonder thynke men ruelles comynge speke v brynge hyder come yt marshal kneled downe sayd syr ye towne ruelles haue sent v hider speke wt pleaseth v yes sayd marshal say ye wyl syr sayd redy put possession ye towne ruelles wyl saue lyues goodes wyl accepte lorde duke lancastre lady duches lorde lady lyke maner coulongne saynt iames haue done wel sayd marshal cotent wyl assure prouysyon behoueth men lyue syr sayd yt ryght prouysyon ynough coutrey syr pleseth tary lytell shal retourne towne shewe haue sayd syr tryst ye wyll vpholde couenaunt ye truely sayd ye marshall therfore retourne agayne breuely retourned theyr towne shewed howe spoken yt duke marshal made hym suche treaty yt sholde saufegarde theyr bodyes goodes excepte vytayles towne sayd god graunt dyd rydde theyr gate tonne stone tymbre yt set opened gate wyde came barryers key theyr hades sayng syr know wel ye hider sent fro lorde duke lancastre fro lady wyfe syr rendre keyes towne put possyssyo therof suche codycyons men haue made reporte v condycyon sayd marshal receyue entred towne menlodged theyr pleasure taryed al day departed sayd syr maulburyn syr delyuer towne copany ye shal haue fayre garyson syr sayd yt true take wt good wyll garyson pleaseth well syr maulburyn luners abode garyson ruelles galyce vnder hym lx speres c archer syr thomas moreaulx retourned ye duke duches saynt iames phowe duke lancaster marshall men assayled towne vyeclope galyce whiche yelded coposycyon ambassadours duke sente kynge portyngale ca li anone yt marshal retourned fro towne ruelles daye rode forthe agayne iiic speres vic archer rode loge dayes iourney came towne called vyleclope whiche kepte suche villaynes dwelte yt marshal caused ye towne auewed se pregnable whe wel aduysed sayd myght wel assaulte lyghted fote set theyr horse backe theyr varlettes deuyded themselfe iiii partes made themselfe redy lyke men warre syr thomas moreaulx guydynge one company conde syr yon fythwaren thyrde syr iohn dambrychcourte fourthe another knyght euery partye foure score men armes vii score archer approched towne wente downe dyke therin water mounted vp agayne syde well pauessed archer stode syde dyke shot fyersly none durst appere theyr defence howbeit theyr shot within defended themselfe valyauntly grete nombre within cast dartes wt longe fethers sharpe heddes rudely yt euer fully stryken wt without well armed outher slayne sore hurte howbeit knyghtes squyres auaunce theselfe came ye fote ye walles al ye stone yt fel theyr basenettes theyr bodyes ii squyers haynalte tyrrye gyllya sonnayne dyd dyuers goodly fete armes made grete hole thrughe wall suche helpe hadde ought sore hande hande within ii bretherne wan vii dartes cast thrughe hole pulled theyr enemyes handes ii brotherne vnder standarde ye lorde fyth waren ye parte syr iohn dambrychcourte shewed valyauntnes lyke noble knyght foote walle penon pytched erthe hym pykeaxe hande myned therwith best power breke wall ought meruayled howe vylaynes abasshed se themsefe soo assayled al partes howbeit coulde longe endure many handes defende themselfe withal last aduysed sawe assaulte seased yelde themselfe ye baylyffe towne caused longe contynue came sayd marshall syr cause assaulte sease ye men towne wyll treate well sayd marshall contente caused heraulde ryde aboute ye towne sayd euery man syrs sease assaulte tyl ye marshalles trompet blowe agayne ye assaulte treaty ye towne wordes seased rested nede therof wery assaylynge towne entred theyr treaty sayd howe wolde yelde themselfe lyues goodes saued townes done galyce naye sayd marshall ye shall scape good chepe haue done ye haue put v moche payne hurte dyuers men se clerely ye longe endure agaynst v wherfore must houe bye pea loue elles wyll retourne agayne assaulte wynne perforce syr sayd ye baylyffe raunsome wyl ye aske v goddes name sayd marshall xm frankes ye aske grete syr sayd ye baylyffe shal yf please cause haue iim frankes syr towne poore hathe ben sore charged tax nay sayd ye marshal wyl yt wyl gyue respyte take cousayle togyder iii iiii frankes ye shall scape al yf lyst also blamed company make ony treaty therfore shortely determyne outher leue baylyffe wente towne called euery man hym sayd syrs wyll ye suffre ony mo assaultes englysshe men wyll conquere v perforce shall dye lese al goodes demaunded v xm frankes haue offred iim knowe well ouer lytell wyl neuer agree therto therfore must exalte ye raunsome ii iiim frankes ye towne doubted lose yt theyr lyues also sayd baylyffe forsake marchaundyse rather wyl ony assayled wyl pay iiiim frankes sayd baylyffe yt well sayd yet wyll treate came agayne marshall vnderstande theyr pea made paynge vim frankes gate set open euery man entred lodged lyst taryed ii dayes marshall delyuered towne yon fythwaren cc speres cccc archer lay garyson viii monethes raunsome towne wente duke lancaster profyte marshall frankes towne vyleclope yelden vp duke marshall retourned saynt iames duke duke wolde haue hym aboute hym sometyme rode fronters castell spayne gyue fere frensshe men longe englysshemen kepte felde galyce none came agaynst kynge castell counsayled ryde forth wt ony oost kepe warre garysons abyde forsocours fraunce ye duke lancastre cou sayled sayd hym yt good kynge portyngale myght speke togyder sayenge also syr wrytynge rynneth thus bytwene good ynoughe frensshe men subtyle se ferther theyr busynes ony people yf couertly happen make treaty kynge portyngale also kynge castell hathe aboute hym cousayle dyuers lordes portyngale infourmed peraduenture theyr meanes myght make pea mariage otherwyse yt hym ye sholde haue noo comforte sholde fall ye sholde worse case euer ye castellyans wolde set lytell v castellyans moost subtylest people worlde trowe yt kynge portyngale wolde contente rest busynes yf kynge castell wolde suffre hym kynge portyngale lyfe hym ye kyng castel syr doubted thoughe haue sente ye coulde tourne backe agayne myght ouerthrowen also syr ye know state englande whiche hath nowe ynoughe doo kepe theselfe agaynst theyr enemyes wel frensshmen skottes therfore make good war ye ca suche people ye haue trust comforte ayde englande outher men armes archer surely ye lyke haue ony ye two yeres aboute gete ye haue kynge nephewe seeth thynges yonge byleueth yong counsayle wherby royalme englande lyeth peryll grete aduenture wherfore syr approche soone ye kynge portyngale speke hym worde shall profyte letter ye wryte iiii monethes duke lancastre noted well wordes knew wel yt true truely counsayled duke sayd gaue hym counsayle wyll sholde answered sayd syr sende kynge portyngale v vi knyghtes leest baron let shewe kynge howe ye haue grete desyre se hym let wyse yt ye sende let fynde meanes ye maye speke togyder shortly content sayd ye duke sente portyngale fro duke ye lorde poynynges grete baron englande syr iohn abruell syr iohn dambrychcourte syr iohn souster bastarde bretheren syr iohn holande constable oost departed fro saynt iames c speres cc archer day al letter made sealed came duke fro kynge portyngale knyght squyer xii speres called syr vase martyne cougne squyer ferrant martyne merle kynges hous nere persone lodged theyr ease towne saynt iames brought duke duches presented theyr letter also presented duke duches theyr doughters fayre whyte mule well aumblynge wherof glad howbeit iourney englysshmen kynge portyngale broke stopped iiii dayes v daye departed knyght squyer togyder company duke sente kynge portyngale token loue ii fawcons pelegrynes good coulde deuysed vi englysshe greyhoundes good maner bee te portyngales englysshmen rode togyder ouer al lande galyce fere ye castellyans ferre ynoughe ofrro waye rode syr iohn dambrychcourre martyn ferrant merle fell talkynge togyder season squyer ben armes syr eustase dambrychcourte vncle sayd syr iohn hym dyed quarencyne talked togyder rode behynde theyr company met heraulde varlet comyng fro connymbres kynge laye rydynge towarde saynt iames duke lancastre heraulte perceyned ye kynge portyngale called connymbres heraulte spoken lordes shewed suche tydynges knewe ferrant martyn merle saw hym comynge sayd syr iohn dambrychcourte beholde yonder cometh heraulte ye kynge portyngales longe syth countrey wyl demaunde hym tydynges met togyder ye squyer sayd connymbres haue ben longe yere syth saw ye countrey syr sayd haue ben englande haue sene kynge lordes haue made ryche grete gyftes haue fro then retourned ye see bretayne ye maryage duke bretayne grete feest kepte cyte nauntes aboute ii monethes past hath wedded ye lady iahan nauare fro then see went irelande fro then porte portyngale talked togyder squyer behelde scochyn ye heraulte bare brest wherin graued inamyled ye kynge portyngales armes ye armes dyuers lordes squyer set fynger one armes perteynynge knyght portyngale sayd ase ye armes me gentyll knyght syr iohn partelere fayth glad se perteyne gentyll knyght tyme dyd grete profyte ought well remembre therwith toke iiii floreyns golde purse gaue heraulte thanked hym syr iohn dambrychcourte behelde well armes felde syluer endenture gooles ii chanders fable heraulte departed squyer sayd syr iohn saw neuer knyght bare ye sayd armes prayse moche tell sayd syr iohn leest praye shewe yt courtesy one dyd wolde glad haue nothynge elles talke contente sayd squyer shewe knyght well worthy spoken began tale thus fortuned lytell batayle iuberoth kynge portyngale wente fro connymbres thyderwarde ye kynge sente countrey warne certayne knyghtes come hym hy iourney rode forth one page rode happened mete xxv speres gascoynes ware tyl amonge toke demaunded whether wente shewed rydynge castell ronte demaunded sayd go seke syr iohn ferrant partelere come ye kyng portyngale iuberoth sayd syr iohn ferrant parteler capytayne castel ronte redy ye kyng portyngale surely syrs sayd shortely wyll yf one knowe kynges pleasure well sayd shall knowe wyll ryde thyder toke waye ye castell ronte within syght castell watche castell sayd saw men armes approchyng towarde castell syr iohn ferrant demaunded fro parte comynge ye watche sayd comyng towarde porte sayd castellyans rydeth aduenture towarde saynt irayne wyl go loke shall tell tydynges kynge lepte horse xx hym toke penon hym rode castell grete galop come ye castellyans drawen busshment made one theyr company ryde forthe genet syr iohn ferrant saw geneture sayd squyer galop forth thy genet assaye speke yonder geneture squyer galopped forth folowed hym nere euer lykely take hym fled softely hym ye entente brynge hym ye busshment nere busshment brake hym tourned quyckely backe chased hym cryed castell syr iohn ferrant beynge vnder penon seynge squyer retourned suche hast sayd chase squyer none company castellyans set crye portyngale wyll fyght toke spere ranne fyrst met withall wente erthe seconde also xxv castellyans yt x lay shortely grounde chased ouertaken slayne hurte glad se saw delyueraunce shorte season lefte alone came ye knyght saluted hym soone saw knewe demaunded fro whens came dyd shewed hym myne aduenture castellyans chased toke well sayd knowe kynge portyngale fayth syr sayd morowe shall haue batayle iuberoth agaynst kynge castel sente countrey gyue warnynge therof ye knyghtes squyers knoweth entente sholde resorte hym morow sayd ye truely syr sayd yf ye byleue demaunde castellyans ye haue taken demaunded tydynges sayd howe surely nexte day sholde batayle bytwene ii kynges whiche tydynges ryght glad sayd openly castellyans syrs good tydynges yt ye shewe quyte raunsomes departe ye wyl ye acquyte squyer thus caused quyted fro departed day retourned onte made hym redy departed then mydnyght company fro then cabase iuberoth whiche vi myles yt countrey eschewe encountrynges rode somwhat waye mornynge herde sholde batayle daye sawe batayles approched batayles raynged feldes kynge castell ye one partye kynge portyngale ye fyrst knewe whiche castellyans whiche portyngales tyll last syr iohn ferrant partelere sayd byleue surely gretter oost castellyans rode forth fayre easely tyl came nere sawe well castillyans trowe gascoynes brake agaynst v syr iohn ferrant sayd let v auaunce forthe se yonder enemyes comyng v strake horse ye spurres rode cryenge portyngale folowed v company portyngules sawe v came forth rescued v al batayles brake theyr aray syr iohn ferrant came ye kynge acquyted hym day ye best thus syr haue shewed howe dyd grete courtesye delyuered pryson ben ye batayle ben therfore syr dyd goodly pleasure yes truely sayd syr iohn dambrych courte also knew batayle yt true sayd squyer rode forth tyll ouertaken theyr companuy came day connymbres comynge englysshe knyghtes ye kynge portyngale ryght ioyfull comaunded sholde well lodged theyr ease redy martyn coygne ferrant martyn merle englysshe knyghtes wente kynge receyued ioyously englysshmen dyd theyr message presented kynge fawcons greyhou de whiche kynge grete ioy loued houndes hawkes thanked kynge duke parte goodly mule sente duke ye duches sayd small present another tyme wyll sende gretter gyftes aquayntaunce loue lordes ought one another nourysshe loue amyte wyne spyces brought knyghtes englande dranke toke theyr leue tyme retourned theyr lodgynges souper ye nexte day dyned kynges palace ye lorde poynynges syr iohn bancell sate ye kynges table syr iohn dambrychcourt syr iohn soultyer sate another table ye baron countrey suche laurence fongase squyer honoure kynges knewe ryght well knyghtes squyers englande sene englande made ye best chere coulde well serued dyner dyner brought counsayle chambre ye englysshe knyghtes began speke ye kynge ii erles present ye erle angose erle nauare sayd syr lyke grace besyde ye recommendacyons duke lancastre hath sente vnto gaue v charge say desyreth sore se kynge sayd glad se hym requyre shortely may se speke togyder syr sayd erles good tyll ye togyder ye shal loue parfytely ye may take aduyse togyder howe ye may maynteyne warres agaynst ye kynge castel syr true sayd knyghtes englande sayd kynge let done shortely duke desyre se lyke wyse desyre se hym fell talkynge ye kyng charged counsayle agre assygne certayne daye sholde mete togyder assure englysshe knyghtes therof dyd agreed kynge portyngale sholde come cyte countrey called porte duke lancastre sholde ryde alonge ye frontere galyce partyng bothe royalmes mete speke togyder conclusyon messagers departed retourned towarde galyce rode came tyll came saynt iames shewed duke duches howe sped whiche tydynges ye duke ioyfull cause busynes began approche ye season came yt duke lancastre sholde departe fro saynt iames lefte styll marshall al company excepte iiic speres vic archer syr iohn holande wedded eldest doughter hym many knyghtes squyers duke rode fronters galyce approched nere portyngale kynge laye porte knewe well comynge departed vi hundreth speres came fronters portyngale lodged towne called mouson last towne portyngale syde duke lancastre came another towne fyrst towne galyce ioynyng portyngale called margasse bytwene mouson margasse ryuer fayre medowes grete playne brydge called mor brydge thursday mornynge kyng portyngale ye duke lancastre theyr companyes met togyder goodly louyng metynge lodgynges made feldes kynges syde thyder went duke lancastre dyner whiche dyner well ordred sate ye kynges table ye bysshop connymbres ye bysshop porte archebysshop bargus portyngale duke lancastre lytell byneth late syr iohn holande syr henry beamonde englande plentye mynstrelles sporte tyll nyght daye kynge portyngale apparelled whyte reed crosse saynt george habyte ye house called mouson otherwyse called denyce portyngale whiche ordre kynge crowned called mayster therof euer bare styll deuyse honoure god saynt george men arayed whyte reed whe began late retourned theyr lodgynges tyll nexte daye kynge wente mouson duke margasse bytwene bothe ye medowe ryuer passe fryday whe herde masse toke theyr horse rode agayne mor brydge met agayne goodly lodgynge made kyng duke theyr chambres hanged tapyceryes curteynes well kynge ben lyxbone ye duke london dyner counsayled togyder state theyr busynes howe sholde maynteyne theyr war sholde set forth determyned wynter ye kynge sholde tary owne countrey duke saynt iames let theyr marshal dele marche kyng duke theyr men assemble togyder go fyght kyng castel soeuer sholde sayd sholde englysshe portyngales togyder xxx thousande al concluded kynges counsayle comoned amonge themselfe maryage theyr kynge tyme royalme wolde maryed honoure profyte haue good alyaunces tyme come sayd knewe sholde mary profyte welthe comons house lancastre shewed ye duke sawe kynges entencyon howe kynges daunger seynge come englande fronters portyngale demaunde herytage castell answered smylynge sayd kynge presente syr haue towne saynt iames two doughters wyll gyue one whome pleaseth chose syr sende thyder counsayle shal sende syr sayd kynge thanke ye offre desyre cosyn katheryne wyll leue styll phylyp doughter demaunde wyl wedde make quene portyngale brake vp theyr counsayle wente dyner sate dyd daye serued notably accordynge vsage ye countrey dyner duke retourned margasse kynge mouson saterday masse met agayne sayd place daye duke lancastre made dyner ye kynge portyngale company chambres halle hanged arras enbrowdery rychely thoughe ben london portyngales praysed moche englysshe maner dyner thre archebysshoppes vii bysshoppes syttynge hyghe table bysshop lyxbone bysshop porte bysshop connymbres archebysshop bargus kynge sate ye myddes table duke lytell bynethe hym bynethe duke ye erle nauare erle angosse another table sate fyrst mayster denyce grete mayster saynt iames portyngale pryour saynt iohns galopes percler iohn ferrant sone ponnayse congne va martyn congne ye podych senede va martyn merle albarons abbot cabase iuberoth ye abbot saynt mary eure syr alue perere marshall portyngale iohn radygosdesar dyuers knyghtes squyers portyngale sate daye englysshmen knyghtes squyers englande serued many mynstrelles duke gaue c noble herauldes moche dyner thynges accomplysshed toke leue amyably eche tyll another season kynge retourned porte ye duke marga se toke way galyce erle nauare conueyed duke c speres tyll daunger ye erle toke leue retourned portyngale duke rode saynt iames galyce moche desyred duches lancastre retourne ye duke husbande tydynges conclusyons take duke well welcomed home reason duches demaunded hym howe lyked kynge portyngale fayth sayd ye duke gracyous man body maners lyke valyaunt man thynke shall reygne grete puyssaunce well byloued say kynge c yere wel pleased age past xxxvi yere stronge knyght hardy accordynge nature portyngale well made body endure grete payne ye syr sayd yt lady sayth ony maryage haue agreed hym sayd duke shall haue one doughters dyd put hym choyse outher katheryne phylyp wherof gaue grete thake rested phylyp hath good reason sayd ye duches doughter katheryne yet yonge hym thus duke duches passed daye ye tyme passed wynter approched howbeit ye countreys galyce portyngale lytell wynter alwayes hote graynes fruytes groweth quyckely dyuers fruytes rype marche benes person cheryes al fresshe crbes groweth february place make wyne mydsoner yt tyme haruest past thoughe yt duke ye duches taryed towne saynt iames laye styll yet men styred abrode conquered countrey galyce townes castelles howe wonne shall shewe ye trouthe name iustely therof infourmed knyghtes squyers wel englande portyngale suche ben present theyr conquestes specyally ye gentyl knyght portyngale haue spoken ryght amyably myddelbourge zelande came fro voyage pruce enfourmed haue named knyght yet agayne name hym name syr iohn ferrant partelere syr thomas moreaulx marshall duke lancastres oost duke retourned fro fronters portyngale come agayne towne saynt iames sayd wolde sy te styll syth countrey conquest sayd wolde ryde forthe set company worke whiche sore desyred made assemble sayd wolde entre galyce brynge townes castelles vnder duke obeysaunce soo day departed fro saynt iames vic speres xiic archer toke way good towne galyce called poceueyed whiche rebell agaynst towne knowledge ye englysshmennes comyng comon people fled theyr countrey good townes toke cou sayle sholde doo outher yelde holde longe coulde endure one accorde comen people wolde haue yelded baylyffe kyng castel rychemen wolde yelde sone sayd sholde norher haue honoure profyte theyr doynge cousaylynge togyder whe ye watche ye towne sowned gaue knowledge ye englysshmens approchyng brake vp theyr counsayle euery man went defence ran ye walles bare barres stone dartes iauelyns shewed well howe wolde defende themselfe yelde lyghtly duke marshall company come towne ponceuayde lyghted sore delyuered theyr horse theyr varlettes deuyded theyr companyes gyue assaulte archer araynged theselfe aboute towne wt theyr bowes redy shote men armes well pauessed armed entrynge ye dyke marshalles trompettes sowned sowte men armes clame vp dyke pykeaxes mattockes wynne walles men towne wt cast downe stone thynges yt troubled mynours sore done archer ben shot hooly togyder none durst appere walles dyd hurte many within specyally baylyffe towne stryke arowe persed basenet entred heed yt fayne borne place lodgynge yet ye euyll people ye towne wolde yelde baylyffe sore hurte ye rather angry redy defende thus saulte endured tyl nyght sowned theyr retrayte men hurte bothe partyes englysshmen rotourned fro saulte wente thery lodgynges entency ye nexte mornynge retourne saulte leue tyll gotten nyght ponce voyde toke counsayle togyder sayd amonge themselfe folysshe people thus hurte troubled nothynge vylodes coulongne hath done yelded duke lancastre lady custaunce doughter kynge peter let v yelde lyke good townes haue done wherin wyse therby sate rest well sayd let v lyke wyse baylyffe hath counsayled v contrary therfore hath payment lykely dye sayd yet let v go hym wyll say certaynly morowe englysshmen wyl retourne wyl let v pea wyl outher haue v perforce loue counsayle agreed xii best towne wente baylyffes lodgynge whose name dyon table lyon founde hym bed newely dressed wounde made came hym semblaut good chere whatsoeuer felte demaunded assaulte perceyuered ther answered sayd dyd well thanked god excepte hurte haue taken small domage morowe lyeth doubte sure haue new assaulte defence symple people wote meaneth therfore come haue counsayle best v ye englysshmen sore threteneth v yf taken perforce shall put sworde lese lyues yt haue name god sayd baylyffe ye haue blame thoughe ye yelde make wyse treaty yt ruler towne ye may saye ye wyll gladly vnder obeysaunce duke lancastre duches lyke maner coulongne englysshmen come within ye towne sende prouysyon towne theyr money thus ye thy ke wyll glad obeysaunce haue many moo townes wynne galyce wherfore thynke wyll lyghtlyer go hous ye say well syrsayd shal thus syth counsayle v determyned purpose passed nyght well myght ye mornyng sone rysynge ordeyned certayne go towne instructed charged truce sholde make marshal yf coulde vii came marshall redy retourne saulte kneled downe salutynge hym sayd syr sente hyder fro towne ponce voyde haue commaunded v say theyr name yt gladly wyll put themselfe vnder ye obeysaunce duke lancastre lady duches maner fourme coulongne hath done prouysyon ye shall haue ynoughe towne payenge courteysly therfore syr entencyon hathe sente v hyder ye sholde enforce ony none entre towne ony army yf company wyll entre symply ye shall welcome marshall englysshman hym vnderstode speche galyce shewed marshall englysshe wordes spoken marshall answered sayd syrs shortely retourne agayne towne cause come barryers suche sente hyder speke wyl gyue assurauce day morowe sone rysyng without agreed departed wente theyr towne founde barryers moost parte towne made relacyon theyr message sayenge howe incontynent marshall wolde come ye barryers speke yf ye company ynowe sende suche mo ye wyl haue notablest men ye towne drewe togyder marshall xl speres came thyder alyghted came ye barryers sayd thus ye syrs ponce voyde ye sente v vii men byleue surely ye dyd put trust sayd howe ye wolde gladly knowledge lorde duke lady soueraynes maner fourme coulongne hath done ye wyl haue none gouernours selfe within towne pray soueraynte sholde haue ouer without men set towne vnder elles ye wyll ye wyll vnder hym ye lyst forsake hym surely myne entencyon al company ordeyne good capytayne true wyse gouer mynystre true iustyce put al offycers set kynge castel yf ye wyll thus answere determyned wyll desyred lytell take counsayle togyder dyd sayd syr haue good trust doubte pyllers robber haue ben sore beten wt suche people tyme past syr bettram clesquy breton came fyrst countrey lifte v nothynge therfore fere nay syrs fere sayd marshall shall noo pyllers robber entre towne ye shall lese nothynge v desyre noo thynge obeysaunce wordes accorded marshall certayne men entred towne oost abode without tentes pauylyous sent towne lordes iiii somers laded good wyne moche brede polayne grete plenty marshal abode yt day towne set offycers ye duke lacastre made capytayne galysyan alwayes ben englande ye lady custaunce towne well contented nexte day ye marshall retourned ye oost determined go another towne vi myles then galyce called dyghos rode forth thyderwarde wtin ii myles sent messagere ye towne know whether wolde rebel elles yelde ponce voyde haue done yf sholde saulted ye nexte daye dyghos made care message sayd care none assaulte haue assayled tyme lost nothynge whe answere sayd marshall sayd saynt george shall fyersly assayled vyllaynes proude gyue suche answere passed yt nyght toke theyr ease nexte mornynge ye sone rysyng dyslodged soo came towne lyghted foote set ordre go assaulte within made redy defende theyr towne towne grete stronge byleue yf ony good warre theyr towne englysshmen soone haue sone within towne saw assayled felte arrowes ye archer englande sawe howe dyuers sore hurte euyl harney sed began abasshed sayd doo suffre ourselfe thus slayne hurte kynge castell good v haue lorde duke lancastre syth hath maryed doughter kyng peter ye sone kyng henry know well yf taken perforce shall dye se comforte fro parte moneth syth sent kynge castel burgus spayne shewed counsayle peryl knewe wel englysshmen wolde come v kyng spake knyghtes frauce specyall cousayle gaue hym counsayle sende noo garyson hyder noo parte galyce semynge kynge leue galyce lost saued answered messagers syrs retourne towne ye best yourselfe wherby may well vnderstande nede suffre ourselfe slayne taken perforce therwith ye men towne came gate mounted vp wyndowe made sygne speke treate herde marshall came thyder demaunded wolde answered sayd syr marshall cause men sease assaulte wolde yelde v name ye duke lancastre lady custauce lyke maner townes galyce haue done shall yf ye well haue ony prouysyon towne ye shall haue ryght courteysly refresshe army shall none entre treaty wyll desyre marshall answered sayd agreed vpholde ye demaunde wyll ordeyne good capytayne defende counsayle busynes answered sayd wel syr content therwith assaulte seased marshall syr fythwaren lorde albot syr iohn aburnell ye lorde popnynges syr iohn dambrychcourre certayne knyghtes entred towne refresshe taryed al day yt without brede wyne vytayles ynoughe towne thus ye takynge towne dyghos galyce lordes well refresshed marshall set capytayne asquyer englande called thomas albery sage man valyaunt xii archer hym marshall departed entred cou trey galyce costynge spayne ye mountaynes castell come grete towne called bayon maroll ii myle then lodged ye nexte day good aye came nere towne deuyded two bataylles sent aulte armes towne knowe wolde whyder wolde come obeysaunce without assaylynge heraulte came barryers founde grete nombre vyllaynes euyll harneysed sayd theyr language heraulte portyngale called connymbres syrs among towne thynge thynke doo wyll ye assayled elles yelde vnder obey aunce lorde duke lancastre lady marshall hath sent hyder knowe ye wyll men ye towne drewe counsayle began murmure sayd one another shall yelde ourselfe symply defende v auncyent man sene moo many sayd syrs nedeful take shorte counsayle ye englysshmen v grete courtesy syth suffre v take counsayle ye se well appereth none ayde fro parte comforte v also kynge castell knoweth wel case stande hath done euer syth duke lancastre aryued fyrst coulongne prouydeth nothynge v aboute prouyde yf suffre assayled trouth towne grete cyrcute small defence wyl harde v attende euery place englysshmen subtyll warre wyll moche payne wyn v try pyllage couetous men warre towne reputed rycher deed wherfore wolde counsayle ye best put ourselfe towne vnder obeysaunce duke duches let v rebel cause selfe taken perforce syth maye come pea meane counsayle gyue al answered sayd wyl thus byleue ye towne grete parage may moche desyre make answere ye heraulte good wyll sayd reason ye gaue heraulte rewarde wyll v courtesye reporte good v lordes sente hym hyder phowe bayon yelded duke lancastre marshall hoost entred towne toke possessyon therof ca liii aucyent came heraulte sayd syr retourne maysters sente hyder saye fro v wyl amyably put v vnder obeysaunce lorde duke lancastre lady duches wyfe lyke maner fourme townes galyce haue done wyll pray frende wyll gyue xx moryskes golde ye heraulte herde hym say sayd ye floreyns dyd gyue hym retourned lordes marshal demau ded hym tydynges saye yonder vyllaynes wyll assayled nay truely syr sayd heraulte haue wyll therto haue sayd ye sholde come thyder wyll amyably receyue put themselfe clerely vnder obeysaunce lorde duke lady duches townes haue done well sayd marshall better v treaty saulte leest men shall hurte marshall company came ye towne lyghted foote barryers founde moche people towne theyr armure worth x frankes see engglysshmen auncyent man make theyr treatye soone heraulte sawe hym sayd vnto duke psyr speke vnto yonder auncyent man maketh courtesye hathe auctoryte towne handes marshall stepte forth sayd syr saye wyll ye wyll ye yelde lorde lancastre lady souerayne lorde lady ye syr sayd yelde v name put towne vnder theyr obeysaunce townes galyce haue done yf please entre towne ye shall welcome paynge prouysyon yf ye take ony wel sayd marshall suffyseth wyll nothyng obeysaunce loue countrey ye shall swere yt yf kyng castel come hyderor sende hyder yt ye kepe agaynst hy alyes answered sayd syr wyl swere wt good wyll yf come hyder wt puyssaunce sende shal close towne agaynst hym sende worde therof yf stronger wyll abyde styll vnder ye shall fynde v maner offrawde ynoughe sayd marshal aske better yere ende matter shal determyned herytage crowne castell spayne cordewayne galyce syuyll shal abyde hym strongest shall sene countreys ende august many dedes armes done grete armye appere castell hathe ben sene c yere past well sayd auncyent man let wyll let ryght go ryght countrey galyce dare well abyde aduenture ye rebelles brought forth towne sware gouerne theyr towne well truely subiectes sholde theyr souerayne lorde lady knowledge duke lancastre wyfe theyr lorde lady townes galyce done ye marshall theyr name receyued theyr othes sware agayne kepe maynteyne pea good iustyce whe al matter done sworne promyse opened theyr gate barryers euery man entred wolde lodged abrode towne iiii dayes refresshe theyr horse abyde fayre season iiii dayes neuer seased raynynge wherfore loth departe ye ryuers waxed grete yt man coulde passe without grete daunger also season aduysed selfe whyder wolde go bezanses rybadane another stronge towne wherin moost prowdest people moost traytours al ye countrey galyce fyrst day ye marshal departed fro ye towne bayon marol feldes founde ye ryuers withdrawen wherof ryght ioyful rode forth towardes rybadane grete caryage moche prouysyon rode pea none yt stopped theyr way lordes galyce yt styred rode tyll came nereto towne lodged vnder ye olyues fayre playne within halfe legge towne determyned sende theyr heraulte speke wt rybadane ye marshall well herde howe falsest people merueylest condycyons yt royalme grete royalme dyd neuer set ye kynge elles helde alonely selfe theyr towne strong ye heraulte sent knowe theyr entencyons came thyder barryers closed gate also began call knocke noo man wolde answere hym yet sawe men go vp downe garettes gate walles nothyng coulde creature wolde speke one worde hym stode callynge makynge sygnes houre sayd hymselfe sawe coulde haue nothynge elles trowe men rybadane haue spoken bayon dyspleased gaue xx floreynes dyd lytell therfore nowe wyll make bye dere fere wolde haue tary tyll late take hange therwith retourned marshall demaunded tydynges whyder wolde assayled yelde townes done syr sayd heraulte surely tell prowde ony cryenge callynge yt coulde make none yt wolde gyue ony answere syr iohn abaurell sayd sawest thou persone peraduenture fled awaye fere v fled away sayd ye heraulte syr sauynge grace thynke scorne therof ye haue towne wyll put payne townes galyce syr knowe trouthe therin men ynowe sawe grete nombre called hyghe sayd syrs heraulte sent speke wt therfore helde theyr pea loked laughed sayd ye marshall false vyllaynes shall well chastysed wyll departe then tyll haue brought obeysaunce wt lorde duke lancastre communde contrary let v ete drynke go assaulte wyll se lytell nerer syth ye vyllaynes prowde done ye marshall ordeyned eten dronken lepte theyr horse sownted theyr trompettes makynge grete noyes within whyle came towne knyghtes squyers ran barryers founde body ouer ye gate many crosse bowes began shote dyd hurte dyuers horse englysshe archer araynged ye barryers ye dyke began shote agaynst crosse bowes sore assaulte whiche longe endured true towne rybadane ryght stronge coulde wonne ye one syde standeth rocke yt man mounte therto syde ye saulte cotynued playne grou de grete dyke drye without ony water euyll mounte vpo knyghtes squyers auayled downe began mounte agayne targes pauaises ouer theyr heedes defence stone cast downe archer raynged alonge dyke shot hooly togyder defendauntes durst appere abrode daye grete assaulte dyuers hurte bothe within without nyght sowned retrayte saulte seased englysshmen drewe theyr lodgynges toke theyr case dressed hurte daye thyrty sonnayne stryken quarell arme yt moneth coulde ayde hymselfe yt arme bare towell phoowe duke lancastre duches helde saynt iames galyce comforte frensshe knyghtes gaue vnto kynge castell ca lii season yt duke laucastres marshal rode abrode ye coutrey galyce made ye coutrey tourne ye obeysaunce ye duke duches lay towne compostella otherwyse called saynt iames galyce ofte tymes herde tydynges fro ye kynge portyngale ye kynge fro sente wrote eche wekely party kyng iohn castell lay season valeolyue ye knyghtes fraunce hym spake often tymes busynes demauded counsayle somtyme sayd syrs haue grete meruayle yt cometh ayde frauce lese countrey lyke lose without fynde remedy englysshmen kepeth ye feldes knowe well duke lancastre kynge portyngale haue ben togyder myne aduersary kynge portyngale
