shall haue maryage one ye duke doughters sone wedded ye shal se bothe theyr puyssaunces ioyne togyder entre royalme gyue moche frensshe knyghtes answered comforte kynge sayd syr take thought therfore yf englysshmen wyn ye one syde lese ye know surely frensshe kynge mo cm men warre nowe royalme englande dystroyeth conquereth countrey haue done brought al englande subieccyon ye frensshe kynge wyl take agayne ye se somer past aryue coulogne galyce wyn agayne moneth ye haue lost hole yere duke lancastre shal inclosed yt shal fayne fle portyngale ye shal take vengeauce enemyes syr know surely yt busynes offrauce ben grete voyage englande ye sholde haue iii iiiim speres frensshmen ye frensshe kynge vncles cousayle haue grete affeccyon coforte ayde brynge warres ende syr care though ye englysshmen nowe kepe ye feldes wyn lytel countrey surely syr ye feest saynt iohn baptyst shal al dryuen away ye kyng toke wor good toke coforte ye frensshe knyghtes sayd nothyng thought true reputed surely ye frensshe kynge aryued englande brewted spayne galyce portyngale surely fourth parte tydynges yt englysshmen herde pylgrymes merchauntes comynge fro flaunders shewed duke lancastre also kynge portyngale al wrote often tymes duke yet somwhat dyssymuled ouer hasty sende lady phylyp wyfe counsayle sayd hym syr surely tydynges come fraunce flaunders yt royalme englande grete aduenture dystroyed yf yt sholde auayle comforte duke lancastre wedde doughter sholde nothyng auayle wherfore couertly delayed busynes entente se ende yt matter howbeit letter messagers reteyned styll duke loue fauoure nowe let v leue season speke busyness castell portyngale let v treate matter fraunce pof grete apparell shyppes galeys frensshmen made see passe englade ca liii apparel shyppes galeys vesselles ye frensshe kyng made passe englade grete sumptuous yt eldest man tha lyuyng neuer saw herde lyke ye knyghtes squyers reioysed departed fro theyr house go wt frensshe kynge englande sayd nowe let v go cursed englysshmen haue done many euylles persecucyons fraunce nowe shall reuenged faders bretherne kynsmen haue slayne dyscomfyted surely xii wekes doynge pourueynge suche prouysyons frensshe lordes made grete meruayle consyder sayd flaunders kynge cometh morowe also men came thyder gascoyne armynacke comynges tholowsyn fro al lymyttes fraunce came lodged flaunders artoys came myddes august ye voyage sholde approche entente make farre countreys make ye hast gyue ensample yt kynge toke voyage wt grete desyre kynge toke leue ye quene wyfe quene blaunche ye duches orlyaunce ye ladyes fraunce herde masse solemply ladyes chyrche paris entencyon neuer retourne agayne paris tyll ben fyrst englande kynge rode senlyse al yt season duke berrey styll cou trey berre howbeit prouysyon made flaunders sluse hym done also ye duke borgoyne countrey toke leue duches chyldren determyned take leue grete aunte duches brabant departed borgoyne rode grete estate admyrall fraunce company syr guy tremoyle came bruzelles founde duches ladyes receyued hym wt grete honour ii dayes taryed toke leue fro then rode mon heynalte founde doughter ye lady ostrenant duke aubert sone syr wyllyam heynalte erle oftrenant receyued duke grete ioy brought hym valencennes duke lodged erles palace duke aubert lodgynge vycongnet lady ostrenant fro then ye duke rode doway arras founde duches wyfe taryenge hym frensshe kynge came compaygne noyon fro then perone bapalmes arras dayly came downe people fro partes grete nombre ye coutrey clene eten vp nothyng lefte abrode countrey taken wtout payenge ony thynge yt poore comon people gadered togyder theyr cornes nothynge lefte strawe yf spake therof beten slayne theyr water fysshed theyr house beten downe fyer wood yf englysshemen aryued countrey coulde wolde haue done grete dystruccyon hurte frensshmen themselfe dyd sayd poore men syrs haue nowe syluer pay retourne shal haue ynoughe ye shall clerely payde poore people saw theyr goodes taken spente away durst speke theragaynst cursed bytwene theyr tethe sayenge go englande deuyll neuer retourne agayne phowe frensshe kynge vncles aryued sluse flaunders ca liiii frensshe kynge came lysle flaunders two vncles hym ye duke borgoyne duke borbon duke berrey behynde owne coutrey ordeyned busynes ye kynge lysle duke bare duke lorayne erle armynacke erle sauoy erle dalphyn awuergne erle geneue erle saynt poule erle ewe ye erle longueuyle grete lordes fraunce suche nombre neuer name sayd sholde passe englande xxm knyghtes squyers whiche say trouth fayre company also xxm crosse bowes geneways besyde xxm men warre syr olyuer clysson bretayne ordeyned therfore busynes nauye sholde brynge hym ye closure felde made tymbre whiche ordeyned set vp euery nyght one englande syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce sholde come bretayne best knyghtes squyers therin vycount rohan ye lorde ray lorde beawmanoyre ye lorde de la vale lorde rochforte lorde malestroyt syr iohn malestroyte vc speres brerons chosen men warre constable entencyon sholde entre englande without armes chosen gaue charge admyral sayng take hede ye charge shyppes varlettes boyes shall v domage profyte ii iii knyghtes without grete maysters thoughe hyred shyppes theyr money yet sholde haue one horse ouer one varlet say trouthe ordeyned al theyr busyness good ordre opynyon dyuers yf myght aryue togyder englande entended lande orwell hauen howe sholde sore abasshe countrey sholde without doubte grete lordes spyrytuall temporall people good townes grete doubte comons poore companyons cared nothynge therfore dyd pore knyghtes squyers desyred warre outher wynne lose sayd one another god hath sent v good season syth frensshe kynge wyll come coutrey valyaunt kyng thynke ccc yere passed fraunce kyng yt courage maketh men good warre blessyd maye syth wyll come vysyte v nowe shall dye elles ryche none otherwyse phowe frensshe kynge taryed sluse grete oost entente entre englande ca iv apparell voyage grete sumptuous flaunders sluse lykewyse englade haue shewed somwhat therof wherfore passe ouer breuely yf tax tallages grete fraunce lykewyse englande many man sorowed longe bycause comons sawe nedefull sayd agaynst reason thoughe taxed nowe gyue goodes knyghtes squyers defende theyr herytages raysed tyme englande defence countrey ii mylyons floreyns receyuours therof archebysshop yorke broder lorde neuell erle oxenforde syr nycholas branbre syr myghell polle syr symon burle syr peter gauloufer syr robert tryuylyen syr iohn beauchamp syr iohn salysbury kynges pryuy counsayle kynges vncles nothynge done wolde medle therwith brynge royalme trouble toke good hede maynteyne honoure ye royalme kepe ye passage porte byleued surely haue yere ye frensshe kyng wt puyssauce aryue englande sayd lordes knyghtes receyued tax dyd lyst chefe moost profyte ye erle oxenforde hym euery thynge done without hym nothyng done whe theyr busyness passed people made trouble knowe ye money became cytees good townes englande wolde haue accomptes therof ye ayde kynges vncles ye shal tyme shall speke therof shall forgotten hystory phowe syr symon burle wolde haue counsayle saynt thomas cauntorburyes shryne remoued castell douer wherby acheued grete hate ca lv sir symon burle capytayne castel douer herde often tymes newes calays fysshers kepte styll theyr custome fysshynge somtyme boloyne porte whytsande frensshe fysshers met wolde tel eche tydynges somtyme knewe fysshers see soo euer warre bytwene englande fraunce dyd hurte one another frendes aydynge eche bought solde eche fysshe one sped better another yf sholde haue made war one wt another durst none haue gone fysshynge wtout conduyte men warre thus syr symon burle vnderstode ye fysshers surely frensshe kynge wolde passe ouer englande take landyng douer sandwytche syr symon byleued wel wordes thought true dyd englande daye came cauntorbury wente abbaye demaunded hym tydynges shewed moche knewe wordes shewed saynt thomas shryne whiche goodly ryche surety bycause towne stronge sayd frensshemen sholde come thyder whiche lykelyhode wolde couetyse wynnynge robber pyllers wolde robbe towne abbey chyrche wyll cary awaye shryne yf fynde wherfore wolde counsayle aduyse cary ye castell douer shal suretye thoughe al englande lost abbot couent toke counsayle though ment well grete dyspyte dyspleasure sayenge syr symon wyll ye depose chyrche fro sygnory yt ye afrayde make yourselfe sure thoughe ye close yourselfe ye castell douer forfere yet frensshmen shall hardy come hyder v symon burle multyplyed moche inwardes maynteynynge request ye comons countrey sore displeased hym reputed hym profytable yt countrey ryght well shewed theyr dyspleasure ye shall story syr symon burley wente douer agayne frensshe kynge came lysle shewe ye iourney pleased hym approche soner passage kyng approched sayd flaunders actoys shall take shyppyng outher satterday monday tuysday euery day weke sayd sholde departe morowe ye nexte day broder duke tourayne bysshop beawuoys chauncellour fraunce dyuers grete lordes toke theyr leue ye kyng lysl retourned parys shewed howe kynge gyuen gouernyng royalme broder duke tourayne tyll retourne agayne ayde dyuers lordes fraunce suche ordeyned go englande ye erle bloys yet season ye duke berry behynde came fayre easely grete appetyte go englande longe taryeng dyspleasaut kynge duke burgoyne lordes wolde gladly ben come styll grete prouysyon made whiche costly dere thynge worth franke solde iiii howebeit money spared euery man desyred well stuffed euery thynge maner enuy euery better appoynted thoughe grete lordes well payde theyr wage poore companyons bought bergayne owynge monethes wage yet coulde gete nothynge treasourer warres clarkes ye chambre accomptes sayd syrs abyde tyll nexte weke ye shall payde soo answered wekely yf ony payment made viii dayes owynge viii wekes soo sawe maner dealynge howe soo euyll payde sore dyspleased sayd surely voyage shall small effecte lykelyhode money gadered ye tax wyl breke iourney retourne home agayne theyr owne countreys suche dyd cast suche doubtes prouided therafter wyse poore knyghtes companyons suche eyned ye grete lordes spente euery thynge dere flaunders harde gete outher brede drynke yf wolde sell theyr wage armure money gete yf ony bought dere soo moche people aboute dan bruges ardenbrughe specyally sluse kynge came thyder wyst lodge erle saynt poule lorde concy dolphyn auuergne lorde dantoygne dyuers lordes fraunce lye theyr case lodgynge bruges somtyme went sluse kynge know sholde departe euer sayd within iii iiii dayes duke berrey come yt haue wynde strue v euer tyme passed day shortened began foule colde nyghtes longe wherwith dyuers lordes contente tary longe also theyr prouysyons mynysshed phowe kyng armony passed englande trust fynde meane pea good appoyntment bytwene kyng englande kynge fraunce ca lvi thus abydynge duke berrey constable behynde kynge lyon armony frauce assygned hym ye kynge vim frankes ye yere maynteyne estate toke hym good entente go englande speke kyng counsayle se myght fynde ony maner pea bytwene two royalmes englande frauce departed fro lodgynge saynt albeyne besyde saynt denyee alonely wt owne company grete apparel soo rode boloyne toke shyp sayled forth tyll came douer founde erle cambrydge erle buckyngham mo c armes iim archer laye kepe passage brute ranne ye frensshmen sholde lande sandwyche kynge laye london parte counsayle hym dayly herde tydynges fro porte englande kynge armony aryued douer good chere bycause strau ger came kynges vncles swetely receyued hym tyme conuenyent demaunded hym fro whens came whether wolde kyng answered sayd trust goodnes come thyder se kynge englande counsayle treate pea bytwene englande fraunce sayd thought warre mete sayd reason warre bytwene ii royalmes whiche hath endured longe sarazyns iewes turkes waxed proude none maketh ony warre occasyon therof haue lost lande royalme lyke recouer agayne without ferme pea crystendome wolde gladly shewe matter toucheth crystendome kynge englande counsayle haue done frensshe kyng kynges vncles demaunded hym yf frensshe kynge sent hym thyder noo answered sayd nay noo man yt sent come hyder myne owne mocyon se yf kynge englande counsayle wolde ony thynge leane ony treatye pea demaunded frensshe kynge answered byleue sluse sawe hym syth toke leue hym senlyze demaunded howe coulde make ony treatye pea charge syr yf ye conuayed kynge nephewe counsayle frensshe kynge meane season entre puyssannce englande ye may happen therby receyue grete blame persone grete ieoperdy countrey kynge answered sayd suretye frensshe kynge haue sente hym desyrynge tyll retourne agayne remoue fro sluse repute hym noble soo well aduysed yt wyll graunt desyre wyll entre see tyl come agayne hym wherfore syrs praye instaunce loue yea conuey speke kynge desyre gretely se hym elles ye vncles yf ye haue auctoryte gyue answere demaundes erle buckyngham sayd syr kynge armony ordeyned kepe defende passage fronters englande kynge counsayle haue charge medle ony busynes ye royalme without otherwyse commaunded kyng syth ye come good entente countrey ye ryght welcome syr ony ferme answere ye haue none v nowe cou sayle shall conuey kynge wt peryll domage kynge thanked sayd desyre nothynge elles se kynge speke hym phowe kynge amony retourned englande answere made hym ca lvii kynge armony refresshed douer day spoken wt kynges vncles good leysure departed towarde london good conduyte lordes appoynted hym fere ony rencountres longe rode came london rydynge thrughe london well regarded bycause strauger good chere made hym soo brought kynge laye ryall quenes warderobe counsayle london theyr lodgynges londonners fore fortefyenge theyr cyte comynge kynge armony knowen kynges counsayle drewe kyng tydynges kyng brought troublous season kynge armony come kynges presence made salutacyon began processe state howe come fraunce pryncypally se kynge englande whome neuer sene sayd howe ryght ioyous presence trustynge goodnes sholde come therby shewed wordes withstande grete pestylence yt lykely englande therfore come owne good wyl good therin myght sent fro frensshe kynge wyllynge set accorde pea bytwene yeii royalmes englande fraunce many fayre plesaunt wordes kynge armony spake yt kynge englande counsayle shortly answered thus syr kyng ye welcome royalme kynge souerayne lorde glad se syr saye yt kynge hath counsayle shortely shall ye shall answered kynge armony contente therwith retourned lodgynge wt iiii dayes kynge counsayled thynke sente vncles knowe theyr entente present answere gyuynge go palays westmynstre counsayle hym suche aboute hym sende kynge armony come thyder come presence kynge englande counsayle kynge sate downe kynge armony hym prelate counsayle ye kynge armony rehersed agayne requeites yt made also shewed wysely howe cryste dome sore decayed feblysshed occasyon warres bytwene englande frau ce howe al knyghtes squyers bothe royalmes entended nothynge elles alwayes ye one parte ye wherby empyre constantynoble leseth lyke lese warre ye knyghtes squyers wonte aduenture themselfe also kynge armony shewed yt occasyon war lost royalme armony wherfore desyred goddes sake myght treatye pea bytwene ii royalmes englande fraunce wordes answered archebysshop cauntorbury charge sayd syr kynge armony maner neuer sene bytwene ii suche enemyes kynge englande frensshe kynge yt kynge souerayne lorde sholde requyred pea entre landes puyssaunt army wherfore syr say yt yf please ye maye retourne frensshe kynge cause hym puyssaunce retourne backe theyr owne countreys euery man home yf please ye maye retourne agayne hyder shall gladly entende treatye answere kynge armony coulde gete dyned kynge englande hadde grete honoure coulde deuysed kynge offered hym many grete gyftes golde syluer wolde take noone though nede therof alonely rynge value c frankes dyner toke leue retourned vnto lodgynge nexte daye departed two dayes douer toke leue suche lordes toke see passagere aryued calays fro then wente sluse spake frensshe kynge vncles shewed howe hadde ben englande answere frensshe kynge vncles toke regarde sayenge sente hym agayne backe fraunce theyr full entencyon entre englande soone myght haue wynde wether duke berre constable came wynde sore contrary therwith coulde neuer entre englande wynde good goo scotlande phowe duke berre departed parys come sluse howe constable fraunce toke see wynde cotrary hym ca lviii thus duke berre herde masse lady chyrche parys toke leue sayd wolde neuer entre agayne tyll hadde ben englande howbeit wordes thought contrary desyre therto wynter season sore come waye came letter fro kynge fro duke borgoyne hastynge hym certefyenge hym howe taryed noo thynge elles comynge soo duke berre rode alwayes forwarde small iourneys pand constable fraunce departed fro cyte lentryngyet standynge see syde bretayne grete nombre men armes prouyson lxxii shyppes hym hadde closure felde made tymbre constable company good wynde begynnynge approched nere englande wynde rose fyerse grete entre margate tames mouthe wynde soo grete whether wolde theyr shyppes departed soo xx abode togyder dryuen perforce tames taken englyssh men specyally taken iii iiii shyppes laden parte closure tymbre ordeyned close felde certayne maysters carpenter artficers brought london wherof kynge grete ioye hadde londonners vii constable shyppes dryuen wynde prouysyon taken zelande constable lordes grete payne came sluse frensshe kynge constable comynge company frensshe kynge ryght ioyfull kynge sayd hym psyr constable shall departe certaynly haue grete desyre se englande wherfore praye auaunce forth busynes hasty maner let v entre see shortely myne vncle duke berre wyll v within two dayes lysle syr sayd constable departe tyll wynde serue v ye wynde sore agaynst v soo straynable maryners saye haue herde none suche grete season constable sayd kynge haue ben vessell pleaseth gretely ayre see byleue shall good maryner see dyd hurte name god sayd constable hath done hurte syr grete peryll comynge fro brytayne hyder kynge demaunded hywe soo constable sayd fortune see grete wyndes rose agaynst v fronters englande syr haue lost shyppes men wherof ryght sory yf myght amende syr without remedy tyme thus kynge constable deuysed togyder wordes alwayes tyme passed wynter approched lordes laye grete colde peryll flemynges gladly wolde haue hadde retourne agayne thrughe theyr countrey sayd one another deuyll dothe frensshe kynge passe ouer englande taryeth longe countrey pouertye ynoughe thoughe frensshe men make v poorer thynke wyll passe englande yere royalme englande easy wonne englysshme condycyon frensshemen wyl englande ye englysshme fraunce ouer rode theyr countreys hyd themselfe theyr fortress fled larke dothe ye hawke towne bruges moost resorte frensshmen murmured redy waggyng rysshe make debate stryfe al began frensshe lakeys beten hurte flemynges yf honest men towne armed drawen market place appease ryot lorde knyght squyer fraunce haue scaped vnslayne comon people towne bare grudge theyr myndes batayle rosebeque theyr faders br ther ne frendes slayne frensshmen god sent thyder tyme frensshmen lorde guystell bruges vnderstode howe ye comons wente harneys fered sholde lost without remedy howbeit lepte hors v vi hym rode stretes met ony armed goynge marget place warde sayd syrs whether goo wyll lose yourselfe haue ye warre youghe ye haue moche gete lyuynge retourne house nothynge ye may put yourselfe towne suche ieoperdy shall lost knowe frenssh kynge puyssaunce armye countrey soo fayre wordes appeased theym caused theym retourne theyr house whiche hadde lyghtly haue ben done yf ben frensshmen suche fere closed themselfe theyr lodgynges abyde theyr aduenture phowe voyage englande broken reason wyndes wynter counsayle duke berre ca lix fynally duke berre came sluse kynge kynge sayd hym fayre vncle gretely haue desyred se haue taryed long ben nowe englande fought enemyes ye ben come duke began smyle exscuse hymselfe shewed incontynent laye harte fyrst thought wolde se prouysyon ordenaunce made se nauey named goodly soo vii dayes euery daye sayd shall departe morowe howbeit surely wynde soo contrary wyse coulde sayle englande wynter well past saynt andrewes tyde good season many noble men take see many theyr shyppes redy crossed redynes departe theyr shyppes formost sholde passe syr robert syr phylyp artoys syr henry bare syr peter nauare dyuers kynges cou tayle drewe togyder se howe sholde perceyuer theyr iourney duke berre brake shewed many reason reasonable suche moost desyre goo gretely dyscouraged sayd grete foly counsayle frensshe kynge maner chylde take see season yere go fyght suche people knowe theyr condycyon way thyder sayd euyll cou trey make warre thoughe al lande yet wolde fyght v lyst dare leue prouysyon behynde v yf wyl lost wyl make suche voyage ferre hath nede begyn harte ye yere wynter call maryners togyder loke yf wyl saye wordes good thoughe nowe thousande v hundred shyppes yet come shal iii hundred holde peryll sholde put ourselfe saye bycause wolde haue iourney lefte speke waye counsayle syth moost parte royalme enclyneth iourney therfore fayre broder borgoyne wolde sholde go wolde counsayle kynge sholde goo yf ony mysfortune sholde fall shal layde v well sayd ye frensshe kynge present wordes yf none wyll go wyll go lordes began smyle sayd kynge hath couragyous wyll howbeit toke counsayle deferre voyage tyll aprell may nexte theyr prouysyons bysquet powdred flesshe wyne sholde kepte saufely tyll ordeyned lordes theyr companyes sholde retourne thyder agayne moneth marche anone knowen brake voyage season ye whicost royalme fraunce cm frankes xxx tyme tolde phowe kynge charles fraunce frensshe lordes retourned euyll contente fro sluse flaunders theyr prouysyons made haue gone royalme englande feest made london ca lx ye haue herde made grete apparell fraunce kynge lordes grete cost charge shyppes galayes passe see englande make warre howe voyage broken wether bycause yt wynter nere hande ordeyned counsayle kynge lordes sholde retourne euery man owne home euery thynge abyde state vnto moneth marche aprell euery man redy kynges commaundement myght well haue ben seene lordes knyghtes soore dyspleased specyally suche farre coutreys sore trauayled theyr bodyes spente theyr money trust haue good season erle sauoy erle army ake erle daulphyn awuergne c grete lordes departed grete dyspleasure bycause ben englande lykewyse dyd frensshe kynge thenne coulde amende pso thus departed maner people mery gretely dyspleased angry offycers abode styll behynde make shyfte sell theyr prouysyons theyr maysters profyte take money yf myght wyst whome coste hundred frankes solde x frankes lesse money erle dalphyn awuergne sayd vnto faythe hadde prouysyons whiche coste hym ten thousande frankes retourned homewarde agayne lost togyther soo sayd many knyghtes squyers people fraunce pand tydynges knowen royme englande ryght ioyfull gladde therof suche people doubted frensshe mennes commynge angry dyspleased therwith whiche suche people thought haue promocyon profyte thenne made cyte london grete feest thyther came lordes suche hadde kepte porte passage royalme englande pand kynge helde also noble feest westmynstre crystmasse day thre duke made pfyrste erle cambrydge made duke yorke erle buckyngham broder made duke glocestre thyrde erle oxenforde made irelande feest endured grete reuelles tryumphes pso thus people royalme englande thought themselfe hadde escaped grete peryll thenne dyuers sayd amonge themselfe wolde neuer sette frensshe men thought assemble frensshe men made sluse fere englysshe men haue caused duke lancastre company retourne agayne spayne phowe squyer called iaques le grys accused parlyament house parys lordes present knyght called iohn carongne iugement gyuen vpon howe iusted vtteraunce parys place called saynt katheryne behynde temple howe iaques le grys confounded ca lxi tyme grete brute fraunce lowe march feate armes sholde done parys vtteraunce soo matter iudged parlyament chambre parys whiche plee hadde endured yere bytwene two partyes one asquyer called iaques le grys partye knyght called iohn carongne bothe lande housholde erle peter alanson welbyloued theyr lorde specyally squyer iaques le grys byloued trysted lorde aboue ony persone courte housholde bycause mortall batayle folowed bytwene beynge bothe one lordes housholde euery man hadde grete meruayle therof soo dyuers countreys grete multytude people came parys daye batayle se shall shewe hole matter enfourmed soo season knyght called iohn carongne toke entrepryse vpon hym goo ouer see auauncement honoure vnto hadde ben longe tyme accomplysshe psoo departed lorde erle alanson doo voyage also toke leue wyfe reputed fayre lady yonge lefte castell owne march perche otherwyse called argentuell entred voyage wyfe laye styll castell wyse sage maner psoo beganne matter deuylles temptacyon whiche entred body squyer iaques le grys erle alanson lorde one counsayle determyned mynde doo euyll dede whiche derely bought afterwarde howbeit euyll dyd coulde neuer proued hym wolde neuer confesse squyer iaques le grys sette mynde wyfe foresayd knyght iohn carongne absence husbande knewe well castell argentuell owne company housholde seruauntes pand soo mornynge toke good hors departed alanson rode spurres grete haste tyll came ladyes castell thyder come ladyes seruauntes made hym good chere bycause theyr mayster companyons felowes togyder serued bothe one lorde mayster lady thought none euyll hym knewe nothynge entente wherfore come thyther howbeit swetely receyued hym ledde hym chambre shewed hym parte busynes squyer faques le grys accomplysshe folysshe appetyte desyred lady myghte se dongeon sayd grete parte comynge thyder se lady lyghtly graunted hym desyre soo wente thyder alone nother chamberer varlet entred lady noo mystrust hym ony dyshonoure sone entred dongeon iaques le grys closed doore theym lady knewe therof wente thought wynde shotte dore togyder thus alone iaques toke lady armes enbraced dyscouered entent lady sore abasshed wolde gladly haue gone dore coulde bygge man layde downe carpe force dyd pleasure done lyst opened dore departed lady sore dyspleased abasshed yt aduecure alone donteonbut knyghtes departed sayd wypynge iaket iaket ye haue well done thus shame blame shall rest yf god suffre husbande one retourne home agayne soo iaket toke horse departed rode agayne mayster erle alanson rysynge aboute ix clocke iiii ye clocke mo e mornynge sene shall shewe speke wordes bycause grete plee folowed ye comyssaryes parly ament parys matter eramynacyon thus lady carongne abode styl castel sorowfull deed done dyscouered matter creature kepte sorowe secrete myght sawe wel speke therof myght haue blame honoure remembred well day houre tyme dede doone soo tyme came lorde caroagne came home voyage lady wyfe made hym good chere day passed nyght came knyght wente bedde lady wolde wherof knyght grete meruayle often desyred come bedde euer blessyd walked vp downe chambre studyenge musynge fynally seruauntes gone bedde came husbande fell downe knee lamentably shewed hym aduenture knyght coulde byleue howbeit lady soo moche agreed well sayd certaynly lady syth ye matter ye shewe pardon knyght shall dede aduyse counsayle frendes youres yf founde vntrue ye shall neuer come company lady euer true night passed nexte daye knyght wrote many letter sente wyffes frendes also owne soo shorte tyme come assembled togyder castell argentuell chambre began shewe cause hadde sent made wyfe shewe matter fro poynte poynte wherof hadde grete meruayle demaunded counsayle counsayled sholde drawe lorde erle alanson shewe hym matter soo dyd erle gretely loued foresayd iaques le grys wolde byleue hym soo gaue daye partyes hym day lymytted also commaunded lady hadde appeched iaques le grys sholde presente shewe playnly trouthe matter soo grete nombre lygnage soo pletynge grete longe erles presence iaques le grys accused dede knyght lorde carongne relacyon wyfe shewed case fallen iaques le grys exscused hymselfe sayenge howe gylty therin lady layde sore charge euer denyed hadde meruayle wordes lady dyd hate hym proued erle alansons house daye foure clocke mornynge sene maysters castell mayster sayd affyrmed ix clocke hym vp rysynge wherfore erle sayd possyble hym go come dede foure houres halfe ryde xxiii myles wherfore erle sayd lady howe dyd dreame wherfore wolde maynteyne squyer commaunded lady speke noo matter knyght grete courage well trusted leued wyfe wolde agree oppenyon soo wente parys shewed matter parlyament appeled iaques le grys appered answered appele layde pledge accomplysshe ordenaunce parlyament plee bytwene endured yere halfe coulde agreed foresayd knyght helde hymselfe sore informacyon wyfe bycause matter sore publysshed abrode sayd wolde maynteyne quarell dethe wherwith erle alanson sore dyspleased poore knyght often tymes wolde haue hym slayne matter parlyament longe theyr plee endured yt parlyament determyned bycause lady coulde make proffe agaynst iaques le grys owne wordes sholde batayle vtteraunce bytwene soo daye prefyxed knyght wyfe squyer beynge present iudgement gyuen nexte mondaye mortall batayle sholde done bytwene knyght squyer whiche yere oure lorde god mccc lxxx vii whiche tyme frensshe kynge lordes sluse entente passe ouer see englande kynge herde matter howe daye batayle taken parys kynge sayd wolde se batayle bytwene knyght squyer duke berre duke borgoyne duke borbone constable fraunce also grete desyre se batayle sayd kynge syr good reason ye done presence kynge sent parys comaundynge iourney batayle bytwene squyer ye knyght sholde relonged tyl comynge parys comaundement obeyed kynge retourned fro sluse helde feest crystmas arras duke borgoyne lysle meane season men warre passed retourned fraunce euery man place ordeyned marshalles grete lordes retourned parys se sayd batayle thus kynge vncles constable came parys lystes made place called saynt katheryne behynde temple soo moche people meruayle beholde one syde lystes made grete scaffoldes lordes myght better se batayle ii champyons bothe came felde armed peace eche set theyr chayre erle saynt poule gouerned iohn carongne erle alansons company iaques le grys knyght entred felde came wyfe syttynge chayre couered blacke sayd thus dame enformacyon quarell put lyfe aduenture fyght iaques le grys ye knowe cause iust true syr sayd lady haue sayd wherfore ye maye fyght surely cause good true wordes knyghte kyssed lady toke hande blessyd hym soo entred felde lady sate styll blacke chayre prayer god vyrgyne mary humbly prayenge theyr specyall grace sende husbande vyctory accordynge ryght lady grete heuynes sure lyfe yf husbande sholde haue ben dyscomfyted iudged without remedy brente husbande hanged say whether repented yt matter forwarde bothe husbande grete peryll howbeit fynally must abyde aduenture two champyons set one agaynst another mounted theyr horse behaued nobly knewe perteyned deades armes many lordes knyghtes fraunce come thyder se batayle ye two champyons iusted theyr fyrst metyng none dyd hurte iustes lyghted foote perfourme theyr batayle soo fought valyauntly fyrst iohn carongne hurte thyghe wherby al frendes grete fere fought valyauntly bette downe aduersary erthe threst swerde body soo slewe hym felde demaunded yf done deuoyre answered hadde valyauntly acheued batayle iaques le grys delyuered hangman parys drewe hym gybet mountfawcon hanged hym vp iohn carongne came kynge kneled downe ye kynge made hym stande vp hym daye kynge caused delyuered hym thousande frankes reteyned hym chambre pencyon ii hundred pounde yere durynge terme lyfe thanked kynge lordes went wyfe kyssed wente togyder chyrche lady parys made theyr offerynge retourned theyr lodgynges syr iohn carongue taryed longe fraunce wente syr iohn boucequant syr iohn bordes syr loys grat wente se vysyte holy sepulture se lamorabaquyn whome dayes moche spekynge wente robonet bolowne squyer honoure frensshe kynge dayes made many voyage aboute worlde phow kyng aragon dyed howe archebysshoppe burdeaus sette pryson barcelona ca lxi season aboute candelmas kynge peter aragon fell syke bed sawe yt sholde dye caused two sone come hy iohn elder martyne duke blasmont aragon sayd fayre sone leue good poynte busynes royalme standeth well clere kepe pea loue bytwene kepe fayth honoure eche ye shall doo better feates chyrche accordynge conscyence moost sure way haue alwayes holden new tralyte bytwene ye ii pope wolde ye sholde tyl determynacyon bytwene apere clerely two sone answered sayd syr gladly shall obey ye commaunde ordeyne reason thus case dyed kynge peter aragon ben ryght valyaunt prynce dayes gretely augmented crowne royalme aragon conquered royalme mayiorke anexed owne crowne buryed good cyte barcelona lyeth dethe knowen auygnyon pope clement cardynalles wrote incotynent ye frensshe kynge vncles duke barre duches theyr oppynyon fader moder yonge quene sholde aragon lady yolent also wrote sholde styre moue yonge kynge aragon theyr opynyon frensshe kynge duke berre duke borgoyne sente aragon legacyon cardynall preche styre yonge kynge broder people royalme aragon take oppynyon clement cardynall dydde soo moche ayde lady yolent barre quene aragon gladly enclyned way bycause instantly requyred therto fader moder frensshe kynge duke berre burgoyne cosyns soo brought kynge royalme oppynyon pope clement howbeit kynge wolde haue ben styl newter fader season kynge aragon thus dyed barcelona archebysshoppe burdeaus whome duke lancastre sente thyder ambassade shall shewe yon cause pthe prynce wale bycause duke lorde countrey acquytayne neyghbours doubted hym frensshe kynge kynge aragon kynge spayne kynge nauare yea also kynges sarazyns harde grete spekynge hym good fortune noble chyualrye hadde certayne alyaunce confyderacyon kynge peter aragon whiche leage sworne sealed bytwene confyrmed kynge englande fader prynce amonge thynges comprysed kynge englande duke lorde acquytayne sholde make ony warre consente make ony warre agaynst roayalme aragon whiche kynge aragon sware sealed hym ayres euery yere sholde serue prynce acquytayne nombre fyue hundred speres agaynst euer hadde doo withall elles sende vnto hym moche money sholde wag fyue hundreth speres pand soo x yeres rynne aterages kynge aragon payde nothyng done ony seruyce ye kynge englande deputyes duke lancastre wente englande hadde hym letter patentes sealed grete seale englande wherby stablysshed kynges lyeutenaunt march burdeaus bayon acquytayne kynge gaue hym fall puyssaunce auctoryroyall demaunde ryghtes due accyons well royalme aragon elles wolde duke sholde haue profyte without ony excepcyon soo euer dyd ferme stable thus whe duke lancastre ben season towne saynt iames galyce remembred hymselfe busynes aragon perceyued well reason commyssyon howe kynge aragon sore det grete money longe renne arerages whiche thought myght gete sholde gretely ayde hym warres castell soo sente archebysshop burdeaus syr iohn harpedan senesshall burdeloys commaundynge bothe leest one go aragon ye kynge shewe hym playnly howe grete arrerages kynge englande duke acquytayne archebysshoppe senesshall behelde well duke lancastres letter soo toke counsayle togyder theron determyned best yt senesshall sholde ry styll burdeaus bysshop take hym charge voyage soo dyd came aragon euyll season kynge relaye syke dyed kynges dethe archebysshop poursued cause folowed kynges chyldren ye counsayle royalme came kynges enterment ye cyte barcelona bysshop pursued ambassade affectuously set courtoyse pryson coulde departe wolde tydynges came burdeaus ye senesshall sayd thought neuer none wyse ye archebysshop hasty heedy thynke nowe ben better gone wolde haue spoken moore mekely maner thrughout worlde howe demaunde mannes ryght senesshall sente tydynges duke lancastre galyce therwith ryght sore dyspleased euyll contente kynge aragon counsayle put archebysshop pryson doynge ambassade duke lancastre wrote companyons garyson lourde sholde make warre agaynst barcellona archebysshoppe burdeaus pryson iohn byerne capytayne senesshall bygore pier dauchyn ernalton resten ernalton saynt colombe garyson lourde gretely reioysed herde tydynges began rynne royalme aragon porte barcelona merchaunt durst go abrode palso aragon another myschefe yonge kynge iohn aragon wolde haue ben crowned kynge aragon good townes wolde consente therto without sware fyrst solemply sholde neuer demaunde tayle taxe inposycyon ye countrey dyuers thynges sholde swere put wrytynge sealed yf wolde crowned kynge whiche thynge semed hym counsayle ryght preiudycyall wherfore thretened make warre specyally cyte barcelona kynge sayd ryche prowde season langue docke fronters auuergue rouergue warde pezanas ye cyte duzes maner men armes called ye rowtes dayly multyplyed euyll iiii men armes capytaynes demaunded warre agaynst euery man cared agaynst theyr name peter mount fawcon geffray chastelyer hamgue de forge goulent foure hundreth men vnder ryfled pylled countrey conuersaunt enfourmed ye archebysshop burdeaus pryson aragon duke lancastre contente aragonoys also kynge aragon euyll pleased good townes royalme countrey tydynges gretely reioysed suche people rather pleased euyll dedes good toke counsayle bytwene determyned approche aragon gete forterers fronters thynkynge duke aragon elles ye good townes wolde entreate theyr profyte rode costynge countrey set theyr myndes gete yf myght castell dulcen beynge ye archbysshopryche narbone bytwene royalme aragon fraunce departynge bothe royalmes came thyder suche poynte nyght founde symply watched kepte dyd soo moche yt wan lordes thereof wherby al countrey afrayde specyally parpygnen iiii legges then also lourde gate ye weke castell aragon iiii legges fro barcelona called olde castell rolbays perteynynge countesse castell boze cosyn germayne erle foys lady gretely abasshed castell taken sente cosyn erle foys desynge hym goddes sake rendre agayne sayd castell whiche coutrey berne taken fro ye erle sent yt sholde afrayde ony thynge certefyenge yt taken alonely make war agaynst bercelona helde pryson smal cause ye bysshop burdeaus sayenge howe sholde haue ryght well agayne without ony domage ye lady well peased answere dyssymuled matter went lay another castell nere roqueberton castell rolbays dulcen lourde made sore warre fronters aragon say trouth kynge dyssymuled ye matter chastyse therby ye good townes yt agaynst hy ye good townes sore dyspleased kynge barcelona perpygnen townes coulde exercyse theyr merchaudyse taken raunsomed barcelona aduysed delyuer archebysshop burdeaus pryson delyeraunce speke kynge reason soo pryuely meane treated kynges broder syr martyne duke blasemont gretly ye grace ye people desyrynge hym meane kynge broder yt myght pea wt lourde rolbays promysed best kepe fauoure dyd moche kynge broder archebysshop burdeaus delyuered pryson sente burdeloys alone erle foys dyd moche vycountesse recouered agayne castel suche helde departed seruyce dyd erle foys yere duke lancastre kynge aragon sawe countesse castell boze soo soone agayne recouered castell sent came hym kynge layde charge howe suffered ye englyssh men entre castell make warre royalme saynge done hym grete trespace lady truely excused sayd syr god knoweth fayth owe day houre tydynges came ye takynge castell lourde neuer treaty wt englyssh syr incotynent sent cosyn ye erle foys prayng hy goddes sake gete agayne castell seynge yt gotten countrey byerne yssued lourde erle sente bad doubte sayenge takyng make warre agaynst barcelona wel sayd ye kynge proue wordes cosyn erle foys ye shall enioy peasybly styll castell wt good wyl syr sayd ye lady sent cosyn erle foys ortays byerne prayng hym apease matter ye kynge aragon erle sent letter ye kynge knyght called syr cycarte saurelyn desyrynge kynge suffre cosyn vycountes pea lyue rest vnder hym elles surely wolde dysplease hym ye kynge aragon toke excusacyons gre made grete chere erles knyght sayd howe countesse wel donesyth cosyn erle foys dyd largely excuse thus lady lyued pea merchauntes barcelona ye fronters aboute rest lourde often tymes taken pylled without agreed patesed dyuers castellon aragon lyke wyse dyd ye garyson dulcen dyd worse dyd egre ouer ran ye countrey aragon lourde dyd bycause poore cared toke well offycers kynges squyers merchauntes soo kynges counsayle toke aduyse bycause good townes murmured sayd howe kynge dystroyed ought susteyne yonge kynge aragon vnderstode yt men murmured spake hym otherwyse sholde bycause garyson dulcen therwith sore dyspleased bycause newly fallen faders herytage well byloued royalme people spake cosyn grete baron aragon syr raymon baghes sayd syr raymon desyre ryde dulcen demaunde thyng desyre royalme trete may departe thes outher fayrnes otherwyse knyght departed sente dulcen heraulde hym shewynge howe wolde trete mountfawcon le goulus capytaynes vnderstode syr raymon baghes wolde trete thought leest gete money sayd heraulde syr saye mayster fro v maye come v surely wyll hurte hym heraulde retourned syr raymon vpon wordes departed fro paregant came dulcen demauded taryed ye fronters aragon answered sayd abyde army fraunce yt sholde go castel go copany syrs sayd syr raymon yf ye tary therfore ye shall abyde grete season kynge aragon wyll retayne longe yet countrey suffre longe well syr sayd wyll enterteyne v longe withall yet must lyue yf countrey wyll garyson wyll departe elles well sayd syr raymon wyll ye desyre departe answered lxm frankes iiii capytanes eche v xv frankes name god sayd syr raymon money ynoughe wyll speke kynge departed sayd better comon profyte ye countrey kynge payde money take greter domage sayd appease howbeit thought contrary thus departed fro gaue vnderstandynge sholde haue moche desyred rode kynge perpyghnen shewed hym pyllers desyred well sayd ye kynge behoueable ye countrey delyuered payde theues brybours sholde payde yf may gete shall hanged payment gete none dyffyculte gete theyr garyson syr sayd syr raymon yt shall done ryght well let alone well sayd kynge doo ye thynke best wyll medle therin wolde delyuered countrey day syr raymon gathered company togyder men armes v hundred speres secretly made squyer gascoyne capytayne valyaunt man armes called nandon seghen layde busshment within lytell myle dulcen sayd syrs garyson yssue may taken slayne countrey maye clene ryd syr raymon sente dulcen sholde lepe theyr horse yssue rynne ye towne perpyghnen put vyllaynes therof fere elles wolde obey gyue nothynge dulcen ryght ioyfull tydynges thynkynge ben trouth armed day busshment layde departed fro garyson rode towarde perpyghnen came barryers made theyr muster theyr retournynge thynknge haue passed surely pea myddes way sodaynly encountred nandon seghnen company nombre vc speres dasshed amonge saw wel howe dysceyued trapped drewe togyder fought longe myght endure whiche longe many euyll armed shortely dyscomfyted slyne geffray chastelyer hauge desorge guyot moresque iohn de guenlant many taken peter mountfawcon amlardan saynt iust xl brought prysoners perpyghnen passed thrughe stretes ye towne yssued theyr house halowed thoughe ben wolues set prysones season duke berre come carcassone ye fronters aragon came fro auygnyon fro pope herde howe dulcen slayne taken wrote kynge aragon cosyne yosant bare desyrynge sende peter mountfawcon company incontynent delyuered sente duke berre grace yt duke dyd elles dyed phowe batayle armes done burdeaus lene shall dyuers ca lxii season burdeaus feate armes done seneshall syr iohn harpedon bytwene lorde rochfoucaulte frensshma sone captall buze syr wyllyam mountferant englysshman rynne iii course iii speres iii stroke sworde iii dagger iii axe dede armes done ye lordes ladyes ye countrey beynge burdeaus erle foys sente thyder knyghtes house serue counsayle ye lorde rochfoucaulte sone cosyn germayne also sent hym good ho harneys spere heedes dagger wordes e howbeit ryght wel purueyed day ii knyghtes armed wel accompanyed grete cheualry eyther partye lorde rochfoncaulte company cc knyghtes squyers lyg age syr wyllyam mountferant many mo hym lorde rohen lorde lorde dura lorde curton languras lorde de la barde lorde mountcroy pyergourt lyguage pbycause feate sholde done bytwene suche ii noble knyghtes many came thyder farre nere two knyghtes mountedon theyr horse wt theyr targes redy apparelled theyr speres ranne togyder fyersly eche theyr helmes ye theyr helmes stryken theyr heedes felde passed forth theyr course bare heeded excepte theyr coyues lordes ladyes sayd euery man howe hadde nobly encountred theyr fyrst metynge theyr helmes newe set fastened ranne valyauntly theyr ii course also iii breuely al theyr feates nobly accomplysshed grete pleasure lordes ladyes regarders euery man sayd howe eche hadde valyauntly acheued theyr feates seneshall burdeaus syr iohn harpedon gaue daye supper al lordes ladyes yt presente nexte daye euery man wente theyr owne herytages lorde rochfoncaulte prepayred hymselfe go castell kynge iohn sente hym season drewe nere syr wyllyam mountferant ordeyned go portyn gale kynge also sent hym suche noble hystory whiche syr iohn froysart haue pursued hytherto god hath sent grace lyue longe se many thynges haue done noo reason sholde forgete ony thynge haue knowen done bycause ye warres brytayne ii sone charles bloys longe season called hymselfe duke bretayne maryage ye lady iahan bretayne ought haue ben ryghtful enherytour bretayne hath ben shewed hystory whose sone englande hostage theyr fader yet haue made mencyon became came pryson daunger kynge englande wherin theyr fader ye lorde charles bloys lefte ye knowe wel hath ben wryten howe kynge edwarde englande make warre frau ce fayrer stronger alyed hymselfe wt erle montforde alwayes dyd counsayle ayde hym power dyd soo moche erle monforde came entente duke bretayne otherwyse coulde neuer haue come therto bretayne ye lorde charles bloys vii euer v party hath ben shewed howe yere lorde mccc xlvii grete batayle bretayne ree doryent countesse mountfordes party syr iohn harcell dyscomfyted syr charles bloys taken prysoner led englande good chere quene englande ye good quene phylyp who seruaunt myne yongth ryghtfull gouernacyon cosyn germayne ye lorde charles bloys dyd put payne delyuerauce howbeit counsayle englande wolde sholde delyuered duke henry lancastre sayd lordes englande yf pryson hym myght made many grete recoueraunces royalme fraunce kynge phylyp frensshe kyng vncles affyrmed longe kepte pryson theyr warre fraunce sholde ye easyer howbeit wordes shewed kynge good meanes noble good quene set fynaunce paye ccm noble whiche grete payde lordes lyued another maner nowe nowe men may pay theyr predecessours myght haue done nowe tayle theyr people theyr pleasure lyued theyr rente reuenues nowe duchy bretayne wtin yere two able pay helpe theyr lorde iim noble lorde charles bloys layde kynge englande ii sone pledge ye sayd afterwarde lorde charles bloys moche pursuyng warre duchy bretayne pay souldyours kepe estate alwayes hopynge come good ende warre yt able quyte sone englande ye holy man pursuynge herytage dyed saynt batayle bretayne aulroy ayde englysshe men agaynst hym deed yet warre ended kynge charles fraunce lyfe doubted gretly fortune warres sawe erle mountforde englysshe men seased styll wente forwarde wanne townes fortress bretayne fered yt yf ye erle mountforde myght come entente duchy bretayne wolde holde homage hym promysed alleageaunce kynge englande ayded alwaye hadde done maynteyne warre treted wt erle mountforde counsayle hath ben shewed wherfore wyll speke therof ye erle moutforde abode duke bretayne sholde homage holde soueraynte crowne fraunce trety ye duke sholde ayde helpe gete delyuered pryson englande ii cosyns sone lorde charles bloys whiche artycle neuer dyd accomplysshe alwayes doubted yf retourned wolde put hym busynes ye duchy bretayne fered lest bretayne wolde receyue theyr lordes enclyned hym wherfore wolde speke theyr delyueraunce thus ii chyldren abode longe englande pryson somtyme ye kepynge lorde roger beawchamp lady sybyll wyfe somtyme syr thomas dambrychcourte tyme yonger guy bretayne dyed iohn bretayne abode styll pryson alone often tymes sad beynge pryson coulde amede often tymes remembred losse yonge dayes moost noble generacyon worlde lykely lese wolde often tymes wepe wysshed hymselfe rather deed lyue xxxv yeres theraboute ben daunger enemyes englande coulde se noo maner meanes delyueraunce frendes kynne drewe fro hym laye grete wyst sholde payde without god helped hym duke anioy puyssaunce prosperyte wedded syster germayne ii fayre sone loys charles dyd nothynge hym shall shew howe iohn bretayne delyuered phowe iohn bretayne sone syr charles bloys delyuered pryson meanes olyuer clysson constable fraunce ca lxxii hathe ben shewed hystory erle buckyngha made voyage thrughe royalme fraunce came bretayne duke bretayne desyred hym doo bycause parte countrey wolde vnder obeysaunce erle buckyngham company lay al wynter begynnyng somer grete pouerte nantes wennes tyll maye retourned englande erle thomas buckyngham company laye wennes lodgynges without dyuers skyrmysshes bytwene englysshment frensshmen thyder came olyuer clyuon constabable fraunce se warre yt made speke ye englysshe knyghtes knewe well yongth brought vp amonge englande soo made good company wt diuers maners noble men armes wyll eche frensshmen englysshme haue alwayes done good cause entended purpose whiche touched hym ryght nere wolde dyscouer entente noo man lyuynge alonely squyer alwayes serued ye lorde charles bloys yf constable dyscouered entente ouy man ben hope haue sped brought aboute purpose whiche grace god atteyned vnto constable coulde wyse loue ye duke bretayne hym longe tyme shewed sawe iohn bretayne pryson englande therof grete pyte whe sawe duke bretayne possessyon herytage bretayne thought moost loue ye duke sayd syr ye put payne cosyn iohn bretayne kyng englandes pryson syr ye bounde therto othe promyse syr countrey bretayne treaty ye prelate noble men good townes cyte nantes archebysshop reynes syr iohn craon syr boncequalte marshall fraunce reted wt pea compercorentync ye sware yt ye sholde full puyssaunce delyuer cosynes pryson syr ye haue done nothynge matter wherfore sure countrey bretayne loueth lesse oweth smaller fauoure ye duke demau de dyssymuled sayd holde pea syr olyuer shalde gete iii iiiim frankes demaunded theyr raunsomes syr sayd constable yf countrey bretayne sawe wel wyllynge matter wolde contente pay taxe fowage delyuer pryson er lyke dye prison without god helpe syolyuer sayd ye duke countrey bretayne shall taxed cosynes haue grete prynces theyr lygnage ye frenssh kynge duke anioy may helpe delyuer haue alwayes susteyned warre agaynst sware ayde theyr delyueraunce myne entencyon none otherwyse ye frensshe kynge theyr kynsmen sholde pay theyr raunsomes constable coulde gete ye duke none answere thus haue begon shewe constable sawe clerely howe ye erle bu kyngham baron knyghtes englande suche hadde ben hym voyage thrughe fraunce bretayne nothynge contente duke bretayne bycause wolde open townes lyke promysed departed englande whyles englysshmen lay wennes subbarbes nanibont endured grete pouerte hadde nothynge ete theyr horse dyed fawte foode englysshmen fayne gather thystelles feldes braye morter tempre water make ther paast bake ete suche pouerte endured sayd amonge themselfe duke doth acquyte hymselfe nobly agaynst v syth haue put hy possessyon ye sygnory bretayne yf sholde well sholde take fro hym agayne gete pryson iohn bretayne aduersary make hym duke countrey loueth hym better duke better reuenged hym soner cause hym lese duchy bretayne constable fraunce knewe ryght well wordes sore murmuracyons englysshmen amonge themselfe agaynst duke bretayne wherwith nothynge dyspleased euery euyll worde spake wolde ben xii howbeit made therof semblaunt dyd squyer bretayne whome broken mynde go englande message squyer called rollant syr iohn harleton capytayne chyerbourge constable castel iosselyn vnder saufconduyte constable made hym good chere company kepte englysshmen good company coulde rather therby gete theyr good wylles ye constable squyer auaunced forth spake syr iohn harleton constable sayd syr iohn ye sholde grete pleasure one thynge whiche shall cost nothynge syr sayd knyght loue constable though cost contente sholde syr sayd squyer yt myght assured go englande semyne olde mayster iohn bretayne grettest desyre haue worlde se hym fayth sayd syr iohn harlton shal let ye shal go soone retourned chyerbourge wyll go englande ye shal go shal bryng thyder request refused syr sayd squyer thanke repute grete curtoysy thus squyer wente syr iohn harlton chyerbourg made euery thyng redy departed entred see iohn rollant company came london brought squyer ye castell iohn bretayne knewe hym fyrst metynge ye last called hym remembraunce spake togyder shewed iohn bretayne howe constable fraunce dyd wolde payne delyueraunce howe yt sayd iohn bretayne syr sayd squyer shall shewe lorde constable hath doughter mary yf ye wyll swere promyse ye retourned bretayne take wyfe wyll delyuer englande hath founde well meanes syr howe say wyll ye thus ye truely sayd ye shall retourne constable say name howe nothynge may doo delyuered wyll doughter gladly wyll take wyfe thus squyer iohn bretayne departed passed englande retourned bretayne recorded constable yt sene harde costable desyred aduauncement doughter maried highly iohn bretayne neglygent busynes studyed meane englande brynge aboute purpose without founde meanes dyd sholde neuer haue come purpose whiche gete ye erle oxenforde parte pryuy ye kynge englande matter shortly brought passe longe ye duke lancastre englande iourney spayne dyscouerynge kynge tretye delyueraunce iohn bretayne ye erle buckyngham retourned bretayne renome ran thrughe al royalme ye duke bretayne falsely acquyted hym selfe englysshmen wherfore spoken ye euyll coulde deuysed iohn bretayne brought kynges presence vncles sayd hym iohn bretayne yf ye wyll releue holde duchy bretayne kynge englande ye shall delyuered pryson set possessyon sygnory bretayne shall ryght hyghly maryed countrey ye ought ye duke lancastre wo de haue gyuen hym doughter phylyp maryage quene portyngale iohn bretayne answered yt wolde neuer agree tretye neuer wolde enemye contrary crowne fraunce sayd contente take duke la castres doughter maryage soo myght delyuered pryson englande whe sawe wolde none otherwyse set agayne pryson erle oxenforde called duke irelande sawe duke lancastre gone englande castell tretye maryage doughter iohn bretayne passed ye duke lancastre doughter hym castell thought ratrete ye kyng englande gyue hym rewarde suche seruyce done entended iohn brtayne yf coulde gete hym kyng agreed constable fraunce haue raunsome two paymentes vi score fra kes ye fyrst lxm payde sone iohn bretayne sent delyuered ye towne boloyne ye lx payde parys whersoeuer wolde haue delyuered ye duke irelande coueted floreyns dyd moche kynge englande yt kynge gaue hym iohn bretayne clerely wherof many englande grete meruayle lyst speke wolde speke none thynge duke irelande caused hym delyuered boloyne constable made redy euery thynge hym dnd rode parys founde kynge lordes lygnage made hym good chere constable also brought hym bretayne iohan bretayne wedded doughter promysed ye duke bretayne knewe iohn bretayne retourned fraunce clene delyuered englande ayde purchase constable fraunce ye costable double hatred sayd weneth syr olyuer clesson put myne herytage sheweth wel token therof hath delyuered pryson iohn bretayne hath gyuen hym doughter marriage whiche thynges ryght dyspleasaunt surely shall well shewe one daye howe hath wel done peraduenture whe taketh leest hede therof sayd truely shewed quyckely ye yere passed ye shall story fyrst wyll speke busynes castell portyngale armye see yt englysshmen made come sluse ye haue herde ye frensshe kynges armye see haue gone englande broken vp season ye frensshe kynges good wyll alway shewed good courage haue passed englande sawe howe ye iourney brake dyspleased ony fawte layde vpon duke berre howbeit thought yt saw depelyer matter ony counsayllynge leue iourney honoure profyte royalme fraunce soo euer enterprysed doo thynge ought regarde ende may come therof duke berre ben longe englande hostage ye kyng fader ben couersaunt among ye englyssh men sene moche ye countrey knewe reason effecte goynge englande sholde haue come ye cause moost exscusable go bycause wynter farre ronne sayd yt constable fraunce nexte somer sholde goo englande vi men armes many crosse bowes thought hymselfe sayd howe nombre sufficy fyght englysshe men reason constable ought haue knowen ben nourysshed yonge dayes whe lordes retourned fraunce determyned sende socours castell ayde kynge agaynst kynge portyngale duke lancastre thought shortely sholde dedes armes englysshmen kepte felde consydered yt coulde sende noo men warre thyder without grete cost charge iourney ferre lytell money kynges treasoury treasourers handes money ben gadered people royalme spente wasted wherfore studyed howe gete soo newe tayle taxe deuysed ryn thrughout royalme fraunce payde incontynent without delay noysynge howe comfortynge ye kynge spayne dryue englysshmen royalme tayle publysshed euery place kynges commyssyoners sente euery good towne cyte sayd gouernours townes syrs thus moche towne taxed whiche ye must pay incontynent ruler sayd syrs shall gather sende parys nay syrs sayd commyssaryes wyl abyde longe wyll otherwyse commaunded kynges name x xii best towne goo pryson without payde without ony longer delay honest men fered pryson kynges dyspleasure wherfore drewe togyder payde money incontynente recouered agayne poore thus dyd euery good towne many tayles tax one ther fyrst scante payde another began thus season noble royal fraunce gouerned ye poore people ouer ledde many auoyded theyr townes forsoke theyr herytages house fayne sell wente dwell haynalte bysshopryche lyege ranne taxe tayllage phowe duke borbon chosen goo castell dyuers howe syr iohan bucke admyral flaunders taken prysoner englysshe men ca lxxii yt deuysed capytaynes sholde go spayne fyrst apoynted ye gentyll duke borbone yt sholde souerayne capytayne aboue departed apoynted ii capytaynes ye vowarde duke borbon rerewarde iim speres knyghtes squyers ii capytaynes yt sholde ye vowarde syr wellyam lygnac syr gaultyer hf passac ii lordes knewe yt sholde capytaynes certayne men armes go castel prepayred selfe yt iourney knyghtes squyers sente aboute royalme fraunce go castell passage opened well nauare aragon thenne knyghtes squyers departed fro bretayne poycton aniowe mayne torayne bloys orleaunce beause pycardy borgoyne berre awuergne fro boundes royal fraunce euery man toke theyr way go castell formest company syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac leders exalte theyr honoure departed good araye theyr companyes good ordre thus whyles knyghtes squyers royalme fraunce prepayred goo castell suche fyrst redy fyrst departed specyally yt farre countreys many yt desyred dedes armes season englysshmen ye see bytwene englande flaunders wherof rycharde erle arundell admyral copany ye erle deuonshyre ye erle notyngha bysshop norwyche vc men armes archer lyen ancre grete season abydyng adueture often tymes refresshed ye cost englande aboute ye yles cornewall bretayne normady sore dyspleased yt flete flaunders scaped fro gone rochell specyally yt costable fraunce gone fro lentrygner sluse passed calays met wt hym gladly wolde haue fought wt hym yet ye constable many shyppes passed reason ye wynde fludde yt ye nyght tyme ye englysshe nauy lay ancre mergate ye tames mouthe towarde sandwyche abydynge theyr aduenture specyally abydyng ye shyppes yt gone rochell thought wolde shortly retourne dyd ye merchauntes flaunders rochel haynalte place doubte ye englysshmen conioyned togyder departed flauders mysed eche go retourne togyder take eche others parte done theyr busynes rochel ye coutrey xainton charged theyr shyppes wt wynes soone good wynde dysancred departed ye hauen rochell toke theyr way ye see goo flaunders sluse fro whens departed sayled longe yt passed ye rase saynt mathewe bretayne without peryll domage costed base bretayne mandy came ryght ouer ye tames mouth ye englysshe nauy lay flemynges perceyued laye hyghe shyppes sayd theyr copany syrs aduyse wel shall met ye englysshe armye haue perceyued v wyl take ye aduau tage ye wynde tyde shal haue batayle nyght yt tydynges pleased well al partyes specyally ye merchauntes flauders haynalte countreys theyr merchaudyse abrode wolde gladly haue ben then yf myght howbeit syth sawe remedy fyght ordred selfe therto crosse bowes harneysed defensably arayed mo viic amonge valyaunt knyght flaunders theyr capytayne admyrall see set duke borbone called syr iohn bucke ryght sage hardy armes done grete domage see englyghmen syr iohn bucke set euery thyng good ordre decked shyppes wel wysely yt coulde ryght wel sayd syrs abasshed ynowe fyght wt ye englysshe army ye wynde wyl serue v yt euer fyghtyng shal aproche nerer nerer sluse shall coost flaundres toke good coforte wt wordes put theselfe good ordre defence made redy theyr crosse bowes gonues englysshe shyppes aproched certayne galays fournysshed wt archer came formest rowynge wt owers gaue fyrst assaulte archer shotte fyersly lost moche theyr shotte flemynges couered vnder ye deckes wold apere draue euer forth wynde whe ye englysshe archer shot dyd let fly theyr quarelles wher hurted many approched ye grete shyppes englande erle arundel wt company bysshop norwyche lordes russhed amonge flemynges shyppes rochell yet flemynges crosse bowes defended selfe ryght valyautly theyr patron syr iohn bucke dyd euer comforte gret strong shyp wherin iii gonne shotynso grete stone soeuer lyghted dyd grete domage euer fought drewe lytell lytell towarde flaunders lytell shyppes theyr merchauntes toke coostes flaunders lowe water therby saued ye grete shyppes coulde folow lacke water thus ye se harde batayle shyppes broken sunken bothe partyes toppes cast downe grete barres yron wente botom harde batayle well fought endured iii iiii houres day fayled withdrewe eche fro cast ancre rested nyght dressed theyr hurte men ye fludde came dysancred drewe vp sayles retourned agayne batayle wt englysshmen peter du boy gaunt certayne archer maryners made flemynges moche ben maryner wherfore knewe arte see fore dyspleased yt flemynges merchauntes endured longe alwayes ye englysshmen wanne aduauntage ye flemynges came bytwene blanqueberg sluse agaynst gagant ye dyscomfyture socoured creature also yt tyme noo shyppes sluse men warre true squyer man armes sluse called arnolde mayre harde howe batayle see bytwene armye englande flaunders toke barke owne entred therin hym certayne men sluse twenty crosse bowes rowed force tyll came batayle yt poynte dyscomfyture tyme englysshmen seased moost parte flemysshe shyppes taken syr iohn bucke theyr capytayne shyp within arnolde mayre sawe ye maner batayle made crosse bowes shote iii tymes retourned chased hauen sluse englysshmennes shyppes grete coulde approche nere ye lande barke dyd therby saued hymselfe company men towne sluse sore abasshed harde tydynges wyst gyue vp theyr towne forsake elles entre shyppes laye defende hauen surely yf englysshmen knowen case ben lordes towne castel yf byleued peter du boy sore counsayled sholde incontynent haue set towne sluse wonne yf soo done englysshmen courage therto sayd grete foly v entre ye towne sluse bruges dan ardenbourge shall come besyege v peraduenture shall lese al haue wonne better v kepe make wyse warre folysshly lese thus englysshmen kepte styll see determyned brenne nauye shyppes yt lay ancre hauen sluse suche shyppes hadde wonne toke parte suche olde drye lyghtest gresed wel bothe within without set fyer lete go wynde ye tyde hauen ye entente sholde haue fastened set fyer shyppes yt lay spayne place howbeit god wolde fyer dyd noo hurte domage none shyp phowe englysshmen aryued brente dyuers vyllages ca lxxiii englysshmen dyscomfyted syr iohn bucke came fro rochell wherby grete profyte specyally wyne ix tonne wyne wherby wyne derer yere flaunders holande brabande better chepe englande reason suche aduentures worlde one haue domage another hathe profyte thus styll ye englysshe men lay sluse r somtyme theyr barkes barge set lande syde agaynst sluse ryuer passe brente mynstre townes alonge see syde dygnes called torne hoque murdequer toke men prysoners countrey lyenge x dayes layde bysshmentes bytwene dan sluse way coceler taken iohn lannay man armes tourney come thyder lorde estrynay syr blanquart calomne came theues ye spurres fro tourney xl speres also syr robert merchaunt knyght flaunders wyfe bastarde doughter erle flaunders bruges tydynges spred abrode englysshmen departed came sluse entred ye castell whiche founde small defence yf englysshmen taken lande sluse dyd syde water taken theyr ease castell towne suche sholde haue defended towne abasshed yt man toke ony hede defence knyght gaue harte sayd ayesyrs good men sluse howe maynteyne yourselfe yt ye shewe yourselfe dyscomfyted without ony stroke strykynge men valure good defence ought sholde shewe forth good vysage longe coulde endure leest tyll slayne taken therby sholde attayne grace god prayse worlde thus sayd syr robert came sluse ye meane season whyle ye englysshmen sluse theraboute al ye cou trey bruges afrayde euery day abrode foragynge foote horse somtyme wolde entre far countrey day brente ye towne cocesy downes grete vyllage way towarde ardenbourge see syde called hosebourcke dyd lyst myght haue done yf knowen case countrey whe taryed theyr pleasure sawe man came agaynst toke theyr shyppes drewe vp sayles retourned englande ccm frankes profyte came tames streyght london receyued wt grete ioy good wynes poycton xamton determyned haue ben dronken flaunders haynalte brabant dyuers place pycardy englysshmen brought englande lorde departed london place englande wyne solde iiii pen galon certayne merchauntes zerecyell zelande lost parte wyne restytucyon agayne theyr loss zercyell wolde neuer agree go make warre englande wolde suffre none theyr shyppes goo ye iourney wherby atteyned grete loue englysshmen syr iohn bucke put pryson curioysly london myght go lyst euery nyght lodge ye cyte coulde neuer come raunsome yet duke borgoyne wolde gladly haue hym exchaunge bastarde broder ye kynge portyngalles breuelet taken see comynge meldeboure thus syr iohn bucke prysoner thre yeres englande dyed phowe duke lancastres marshal toke towne ribadane whiche strongly kepte ca lxxiiii howe yt y tyme retourne busynes castell portyngale speke duke lancastre beynge galyce suche busynes fall yt seaso whiche smal also shewe ayde comforte ye frensshe kynge sent yt tyme castell elles kynge iohn spaynes busynes easely gone forwarde say surely yere yt duke aryued countrey lost la de ye ayde frensshe kyng ben ye know wel yt tydynges spredeth euer farre kynge portyngale knewe soone ye duke lancastre ony ye frenssh kynges army yt lay ye see haue gone euglande brake theyr iourney kyng portyngale lay ye cyte porte stro ge towne haue wel vsed reason merchautes yt resorted thyder knew ye brekynge ye frensshe kynges army glad therof benshewed hym englande lykely haue ben lost wherfore som dyssymuled duke lancastre dryuynge takyng doughter maryage styll draue hym fayre wordes salutacyons iustly enfourmed departynge ye frensshe kynge fro sluse called counsayle sayd syr ye knowe well howe ye duke lancastre galyce duches cosyne hym vnknowen howe counsayle togyder howe agreed sholde haue doughter maryage wyll perceyuer ye estate wyll demaunde honourably reason apertenent suche prynce duke lancastre kynge portyngale wyll make lady quene portyngale syr sayd counsayle ye doo accordynge reason ye haue sworne promysed well sayd kynge let v sende duke appoynted archebysshop braschez syr iohn radyghen sar go ambassade sente kynge toke voyage cc speres pnowe let v speke ye syege syr thomas moreaus marshall duke lancastres cost layde towne rybadane shewe became theron byleue rybadane thought haue ben comforted kynge iohn castell knyghtes fraunce lay ye towne valcolyue elles wolde neuer haue endured soo longe haue meruayle howe suche sorte vyllaynes coulde endure agaynst suche sloure archer men armes abasshed euery day assaulte sayd syr thomas moreaus maner counsayle moost valyaunt knyghtes company syr leue towne euyl fyer may b enne let v go countrey maynes noye besances alwayes may retourne agayne lyst fayth sayd syr thomas shall neuer sayd vyllaynes haue dyscomfyted v wyll departe hen thoughe sholde tary ii monethes without duke sende thus marshalles mynde oppynyon kepe styll syege kynge castell laye valeolyue sente specyally ayde fraunce harde dayly howe rybadane defended themselfe valyauntly wolde yelde name god sayd barroys barrers gretely dyspeaseth yt sent thyder frenssh men wolde gretely haue recomforted men towne also contente syege leest sholde haue honoure vyllaynes haue nowe surely yf knowen trouthe strength towne wolde haue refresshed haue put myselfe aduenture therin well god sholde haue sente grace haue defended towne vyllaynes thus deuysed kynges presence frensshe knyghtes desyred dedes armes sayd kynge syr sende c speres townes noye calongne hath ii castelles hath ii sydes ye lande galyce go thyder dyuers dyd present selfe kynge syr trystram roy syr raynolde broder syr aulberte braquemont syr trystra galle syr iohn castell morant syr barroys barrers kynge herde well contente wt theyr offres sayd fayre syrs thanke good wylles howbeit ye maye go must abyde styll aduentures may fall presente tyme desyre barroys barrers take hym charge yf please hym ye knyght ryght glad yt iourney thought lyen longe sayd kynge syr thanke grace shall kepe defende power shall departe then tyll ye sende goodes name sayd kynge thynke shortely tydynges fraunce knyghtes knewe frensshe kynges departynge fro sluse kynge knewe well ynoughe duke borbon wryten hym busynes fraunce howe apoynted come castell wt iii speres hym open ye passage sholde come iiim speres vnder gydynge syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac frensshe knyghtes desyred ye kyng shewe tydynges fraunce good wyll sayd kynge kynge sayd syrs surely duke borbon chosen pryncypal capytayne come countrey ye frenssh kynge counsayle hath apoynted hym come vi thousande speres knyghtes squyers also two valyaunte knyghtes chosen capytaynes come hym syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac shall come fyrst iii speres voyage ye see englande broken vp season tyll constable fraunce erle saynt poule ye lorde concy iiii speres shall goo englande nexte maye howe saye syrs sayd kynge syr sayd ryche tydynges haue better nexte somer dedes armes shalbe wel shewed countrey yf vi apoynted wyll come ix shall surely fyght englysshmen kepe nowe felde shal close togyder mydsomer syr knyghtes come ryght valyaunt specyally duke borbon proued knyghtes worthy gouernours armes anone spred abrode ye towne valeolyue abrode castell grete comforte ayde sholde come fraunce fyrst daye maye wherof knyghtes squyers ryght ioyous thus barroys barres departed l speres rode castell noye tydynges came duke lancastres marshall howe frensshmen brode rydynge l speres come reyse syege rybadane marshal harde tydynges byleued lyghtly shewed hym therof affyrmed true saynge sene ryde ouer ryuer dorne toke theyr lodgyng ye towne arpent ye marshal doubte toke cousayle determyned sende worde therof duke lancastre lorde dyd sente syr iohn dambrecycourt heraulde knewe wayes galyce marshall made euer good watche spyal doubted ascryed nyght halfe dost watched euery nyght whyle slepte syr iohn dambretycourt heraulde came towne saynt iames duke duches ye duke knewe theyr comynge sayd surely shall tydynges soone came presence duke demaunded tydynge syr sayd none yt good marshall hath sente v hyder knowe pleasure sholde reported hym certayne frensshmen assembled togyder castel ryde fast passe ryuer come fyght men lyenge syege rybadane syr tydynges yt haue brought name god sayd duke none euyll tydynges shall shortely prouyde behelde syr iohn holande constable admyrall syr thomas percy sayd syrs take ccc speres ccccc archer go company rybadane doubte yt frensshmen sholde come assayle ii knyghtes made redy toke iii c speres v c archer departed fro duke rode soo longe came rybadane theyr copanyons lodged gretly reioysed theyr comyge syr iohn holand sayd marshall say rybadane wyll yelde fayth sayd marshal prowde people se countrey aboute doo yelde yet kepe styll theyr opynyons yet many vyllaynes amonge one gentylma name syr holde pea sayd syr iohn holande within iiii dayes shal brynge poynte shal glad yelde themselfe ony wyll take mercy syr praye ye frensshmen ryde abrode ye surely syr sayd haue ben well enfourmed howe ryde nombre v c speres one company whiche maye well dayely cometh men warre fraunce haue knowledge barroys barrers castell noye l speres knowe thus lodged togyder well myght made grete prouysyon came aboute iiii dayes iohn holande syr thomas percy men marshalles dost ordeyned make grete assaulte caused made grete engyne tymbre wheles remoued strenthe men whyther lyst within myght easely c knightes c archer fylled ye dyke engyne sholde passe began assaulte engyne approche strength men therin archer well prouyded wt arowes fyersly shotynge within towne within castynge dartes stone meruaylously byneth couered wt mantelles oxe hydes defende fro ye stone dartes vnder yt couerture men armes approched well pauessed wt pyke ax perse walle soo enpayred walle within coulde defende walle bycause archer shotte holy togyder none durste appere theyr defence hewynge reuersed dyke grete pane wall sawe themselfe soo grete myschefe gretely abasshed cryed lowde yelde ourselfe yelde v noone made ony answere englysshe men dyd laughe sayd vyllaynes haue put v moche payne nowe mocke v wolde haue v take mercy nowe ye towne owne englysshe men answered within sayd syrs knowe ye say speke spanysshe speke good frensshe englysshe yf ye wyll sholde vnderstande thus cu red passed forthe chased vyllaynes fledde slewe hepes daye slayne one iewes yt moo xv hundred thus towne rybadane taken force suche fyrst entred grete pyllage specyally founde golde syluer iewes howses ony place takynge rybadane whiche wonne pure assaulte englysshe men pylled theyr pleasure demaunded ye marshall sholde done towne yf sholde brente naye sayd marshall wyll kepe newe repayre nowe whether shall prepayre determyned drawe maures good towne galyce apoynted sholde abyde rybadane repayre lefte syr peter clynton ryght valyaunt knyght xx speres lx archer made grete prouysyon founde specyally yoke good wynes whiche stronge myghty englysshe men coulde drynke therof dranke moche case coulde helpe themselfe two dayes thus dyslodged fro rybadane rode towardes towne maures caryed peces grete engyne sawe well dyd good seruyce ferefull men townes maures vnderstode howe englysshmen comynge warde haue towne vnder duke duches lancastres obeysaunce knewe howe rybadane taken force brought deuyll stede engyne grete coulde dystroyed doubted gretly oost engyne wente counsayle se best doo outher yelde make defence well counsayled togyder coulde se none thynge yt farre better yelde defende consydered yf taken force sholde lese body goodes comforte appered fro ony parte sage sayd syrs beholde howe rybadane taken theyr defence yet stronge stronger besyeged moneth yet hadde nother ayde socoure vnderstande kynge castel accompteth season al ye countrey galyce lost ryuer dorne thynke yere cometh frensshe men ayde wherfore let v yelde ourselfe mekely without domage townes haue done euery man behelde oppynyon sayd howe maye done well ynoughe sayd sage shall go mete waye bere keyes ye towne v present englysshe men courtoys people wyll v hurte yf receyue curtoysly agreed yssued ye towne fyfty persones yt moost noble soone knewe yt englysshe men approched yssued aboute quarter legge taryed enghysshe men tidynges came englysshe men howe towne maures yssued fyght yelde keyes towne whiche brought wt ye lordes rode se matter caused archer oost tary behynde galycyens came forthe sayd syrs beholde lordes englande sente duke lancastre conquere countrey speke yf ye lyst kneled downe sayd syrs poore men maures wyllyngly wyll vnder obeysau ce duke lancastre lady duke lancastre lady duches wherfore desyre accepte v mercy haue iii lordes englande eche others aduyse answered sayd ye good people maures shall go wt towne parte ur oost al ye shal make promyse othe good people ought theyr lorde lady syrs sayd shall doo good wylles sayd lordes go wayes open gate ye shall receyued mercy wente theyr towne opened theyr gate barryers suffred constable lordes entre iiii c speres resydue oost lodged without feldes prouysyon towne suffycyent lordes lodged within towne toke othes towne maures sayd phowe duke lancastre sente admyrall mershal offycers come weddynge doughter kynge portyngale ca lxxiiii nexte daye towne maures gyuen vp euery man made redy go cyte besances came tydynges letter fro duke lancastre commau dynge syght letter euer estate repayre presence certefyenge loked shorte season archebysshop braghes syr iohn radyghes de sar ambassade fro kynge portyngale comynge wedde doughter procuracyon lede cyte porte kynge portyngale taryed lordes vnderstode tydyges retourned theyr waye sayd requysyte duke haue lordes counsayle aboute hym ye receyuynge ambassadours retourned lefte men warre ye garysons wonne came towne saynt iames duke commaunded within iii dayes thyder came ye bysshop braghes syr iohn radyghes de sar cc horse well lodged redy apparelled ye ambassadours lordes theyr company wente duke duches good aray receyued grete ioy declared cause theyr comynge duke herde well wel reioyced therwt bycause ye auauntement doughter alyaunce kynge portyngale whiche thought ryght behouable hym yf wolde entre conquere castell bysshop shewed duke duches theyr counsayle howe auctoryte procuracyon personally wed lady phylyp lancastre name kynge portyngale wherwith duke duches well contente thus syr iohn radyghes de sar vertue procuracyon wedded ye lady phylyp lancastre name kynge portyngale bysshop braghes wedded soo layde curtoysly bed husbande wyfe ought nexte day lady company redy departe toke leue fader moder systers ladyes damoyselles bastarde syster wyfe ye marshall went syr iohn holande syr thomas percy syr iohn dambrychcourte c speres cc archer rode cyte porte portyngale agaynst comynge yonge quene portyngale yssued cyte porte honoure reuerence prelate chyrche ye bysshops lyxbone deure connymbres porte temporall lordes erle dangose erle nouayre erle lescal galope ferant patryke pymasse martyne de marlo mo xl knyghtes grete nombre theyr people many ladyes damoyselles clergy reuested habytes processyon thus lady phylyp lancastre brought cyte porte portyngale kynges palace kynge toke hande kyssed ladyes damoyselles come brought chambre toke leue ye ladyes lordes englande lodged theyr ease theyr men cyte porte grete cyte yt nyght kepte vygyll feest nexte day ladyes daunsynge passynge theyr tyme nyght tuysdaye ye kynge portyngale prelate lordes countrey redy mornynge kepte theyr horse palays rode ye cathedrall chyrche called saynt maryes caryed quene came accompanyed ladyes damoyselles thoughe syr iohn radyghos de sar wedded kynges behalfe yet agayne openly ye kynge wedded retourned ye palays made grete feest solempne dyner iustes tournays kynge quene nyght pryse gyuen without syr iohn holande ye chalengers knyght kynges called syr iohn tet dore pryse day nyght perceyuered grete tryumphe ioye kynge lay quene reuome ranne countrey courte ye kynge clene mayde nexte daye feest renewed newe iustes pryse chalengers va martyne merlo without syr iohn dambretycourte ye nyght grete daunsyng syngynge sportynge euery day knyghtes squyers iusted suche tryumphes iustes sportes ye haue harde quene portyngale receyued fyrst comynge cyte porte feestes endured x dayes
