kynge gaue grete gyftes straungers well contente knyghtes englande toke theyr leue kynge quene retourned ye cyte saynt iames duke duches demaunded tydynges shewed yt sene harde howe kynge portyngale quene dyd commaunde sayd syr last worde yt kynge sayd v howe desyreth drawe ye felde please lykewyse wyl drawe castell good tydynges sayd duke thus aboute xv dayes constable admyral retourned fro ye kynge portyngales maryage ye duke lancastre prepayred iourney go conquere castells townes galyce duke lorde ye townes countrey ordeyned yt duke sholde departe fro saynt iames duches doughter katheryne sholde lykewyse departe goo cyte porte portyngale se kynge ye yonge quene theyr doughter towne saynt iames delyuered kepynge englysshe knyght called syr loys clyfforde xxx speres hym c archer phowe duke lancastre men rode towardes cyte besances howe towne made composycyon ca lxxv thus duke lancastre departed suche ordeyned abyde garyson abode duke duches rode towardes besances one ye last townes bytwene galyce portyngale ryght waye porte connymbres bycause ye duches lancastre doughter sholde go se kynge portyngale therfore helde way besances knewe yt ye duke comynge oost drewe counsayle many oppynyons fynally determyned ye best sent duke duches vi chefe towne desyre trete abstynence warre viii dayes ye meane seaseon sende kynge castell shewynge hym without came soo stronge fyght duke yelde vp theyr towne without ony meane departed fro besances vi men rode mete yt englysshmen fyrst encountred vowarde whiche marshall led stopped demaunded wolde answered besances appoyntemente towne charged goo speke duke marshall sayd syr iohn soustre syr go brynge men ye duke saufgarde fere lest archer slee sayd syrs goo wayes knyght shal guyde rode forthe last founde duke duches doughter syr iohn holande syr thomas percy dyuers sportynge vnder shadowe fayre olyue tree behelde wel syr iohn soustre comynge themwarde syr iohn holande demaunded hym sayd syr iohn prysoners nay syr sayd prysoners men besances sent mershall speke lorde ye duke thynke wyll make tretye duke duches herde al wordes syr iohn soustre sayd ye good men auaunce forth beholde lorde lady vi men kneled downe sayd ryght redoubted lorde lady comonaltye towne besances haue sente v presence syr vnderstande howe ye comynge sendynge armye agaynst desyre specyal grace forbere ix dayes meane season wyll sende kynge castell towne valcolyue shewe hym dau ger syr without come ix dayes suche socoure fyght wyll yelde vnto obeysaunce yf ye lacke ony prouysyon vytayles ony thynge meane season ye shall haue towne money pleasure men therwith duke stode styll spake noo worde suffred duches speke bycause countrey behelde duke sayd syr say madame sayd say ye herytoure haue therfore ye shall make answere wel syr sayd thynke good receyue haue demaunded byleue kynge castell hathe nowe noo grete desyre shortly fyght tell sayd duke wolde god wolde come shortely batayle sholde soner delyuered wolde sholde within vi dayes wherfore ye haue deuysed contente ye duches tourned towarde vi men sayd syrs departe ye lyst matter sped soo ye delyuer hostage marshall xii best towne suretye vpholde tretye well madame sayd contente syr iohn soustre commaunded shewe tretye marshal dyd wherwith mershall well contente vi men retourned besances shewed howe sped xii men moost notablest towne chosen sente marshall thus towne besances rest pea foresayd tretye towne sente vi men wente ye duke kynge castell counsayle kynge knewe nothynge composycyon howe englysshe men besances meane season syxe men goynge kynge castell duke ordeyned duches doughter katheryne sholde goo cyte porte se kynge portyngale yonge quene doughter theyr departynge duke sayd duches pmadame costaunce salute fro kynge quene daughter lordes portyngale shewe suche tydynges ye know howe besances composycyon yet knowe wheron grounde themselfe whether aduersary iohn trystmor haue made make tretye wyl come fyght v knowe well loke grete comforte come fraunce suche desyre dedes armes aduauncement honoure wyl come soone wherfore behoueth alwaye redy abyde batayle ye may shewe kynge portyngale counsayle yf se shall haue ony thynge shall shortely sende kynge worde therof wherfore saye desyre hym redy ayde defende ryght lyke maner haue promysed sworne togyder madame ye retourne agayne leue doughter katheryne styll quene syster better kepynge syr sayd lady shall doone duches doughter ladyes damoyselles toke theyr leue departed syr thomas percy admyral accompanyed syr non fythwaren ye lorde talbot lorde iohn dambretycourte syr namburyne lyuyers hundred speres two hundred archer soo came cyte porte portyngale phowe duches doughter wente se kynge portyngale quene howe towne besances submytted vnder obeysaunce duke lancastre ca lxxvi whenne kynge portyngale vnderstode duches lancastre doughter comynge hym warde therof ryght ioyfull sente receyue grettest courte erle angoses erle nouayre syr iohn radyghos de sar syr iohn ferrant perteke syr va martyne marlo syr egeas colle xx knyghtes mette duches two grete legges ioyfully receyued duches made frendly chere al lordes knyghtes bothe wordes countenaunce thus came cyte porte ye ladyes damoyselles lodged palays kynge came met ladyes kyssed came ye quene receyued duches mooer syster ryght honourably coulde ryght wel kynges courte ryght ioyfull comynge ladyes damoyselles wyll speke theyr acquayntau ce good chere present knowe nothynge reporte gently knyght syr iohn ferrant perteke present enfourmed know matter many duches deuysed kynge portyngale sawe tyme shewed hym wordes duke husbande gyuen charge shewe kynge answered ryght sagely sayd fayre lady cosyn redy yf kynge castell come forth feldes within iii dayes shal haue r dy iilm speres redy felde fronters castell also haue redy xx comons royal refused dydde good seruyce day batayle iuberoth syr sayd lady ye speke well thanke therof syr yf ony thyngs happen fall lorde husbande wyll incontynente sygnyfye therof wordes kynge duches deuysed togyder pnowe let v tourne besances shewe howe sped vi men besances kynge castel kneled downe sayd ryght redoubted lorde may please vnderstande sent hyder fro towne besances force composycyon duke lancastre ye duches hath obteyned sufferaunce warre ix dayes soo yf ye come sende suche strength able resyst duches puyssaunce ye towne abyde styll vnder obeysaunce elles bou de haue layde hostage delyuer vp towne duke lancastre wherfore maye please grace gyue v answere shall case kynge answered sayd syrs shall take aduyse gyue answere therwith kynge departed fro entred secret chambre cannot tell counsayle toke howe ye matter wente vi men viii dayes maner answere sawe kynge soo day came towne sholde gyuen vp theyr messagers retourned agayne ye duke lancastre sent besances marshall x day speke comaunde rendre vp theyr towne elles stryke heedes hostage ye marshall came besances barryers spake towne sayd ye syrs besances take hede saye lorde duke lancastre hath sente demaunde ye haue brought hym keyes towne submyt vnder obeysaunce ye ought ix dayes past ye knowe well yf ye wyll thus hostage shall lese theyr heedes shall assayle take perforce ye shall dye without mercy lyke rybadane whe ye men besances herde tydynges gretly doubted also fered lese theyr frendes hostage duke sayd marshall syr lorde ye duke hath good cause say ye haue reported syr yet tydynges fro men sente kynge castel cause wote become syrs sayd marshall peraduenture kepte styll tydynges haue brought kynge castell whiche plesaunt hym lorde duke wyl abyde longer wherfore aduyse make shorte answere elles shortely ye shall haue assaulte spake agayne sayd syr requyre let v assemble togyder towne take aduyse shal answere content sayd marshall retourned towne blastes trompettes euery strete assembled gather ye market place declared comonte foresayd wordes fynally accorded rendre vp theyr towne saue theyr estate yt pryson retourned marshall sayd syr al demaundes fynde nothynge reason requyreth content receyue lorde duke lady duches towne put possessyon therof syr keyes shall goo theyr lodgynge yf please brynge v thyder ryght good wyl sayd marshal yssued besances lx berynge keyes theyr towne marshall brought streyght duke shewed hym theyr entente duke receyued delyuered theyr hostage day entred cyte besances lodged company many myght phowe besances ben sente kynge castell came home theyr towne rendred vp duke lancastre ca lxxvii afoure dayes besances gyuen vp vi men sent valeolyue ye kynge castell retourned home theyr towne demauded taryed longe answered howe myght therwith amende saynge howe spoken kynge promysed take counsayle gyue answere whiche answere taryed viii dayes yet sayd retourned without answere asked moo questyons sayd howe kynge castell loked moche people come fraunce dyuers come lodged abrode countrey capytaynes syr wyllya lygnac syr gaultyer passac come suche knyghtes squyers spayne sholde vnder guydynge ii capytaynes redy apparelled suche reteyned apoynted vnder duke borbon styll theyr owne house vpon redynes thus ye haue herde syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac passed thrughe royalme fraunce came mo speres knyghtes squyers al countreys assembled carcassone narbonoys thoulousayne came soo lodged good countrey many payde lytell nothynge toke tyoynges came erle foyze beynge ortays men warre fraunce approched nere cou trey wolde passe thrughe go spayne sayd hym syr pay nothynge take wherfore comon people flyeth though englysshmen capytaynes carcassone theyr men theraboute passeth ryuer garon thoulouse wyl entre bygore incontynent countrey haue done way shall grete euyl cou trey byerne therfore syr take good hede ye wyll hehalfe ye erle foyze soone counsayled hymselfe sayd wyll townes castelles well foyze byerne prouyded men warre countrey redynes entre batayle yf nede wyll bye derely warre castell lanoes free yf frensshe men wyll passe thrughe shall pay truely euery thynge take elles passage countrey shal kepte close agaynst syrs ye syr arnalte wyllyam syr peter byerne charge defende kepe countrey ii knyghtes bastarde bretherne ryght valyaunt men armes toke charge erle foyze countrey ordeyned euery man sholde haue armure redy wonte haue better redy dayly whensoeuer commaunded byerne foyze thoulouse euery man redy entre batayle sente ye cyte palmes c speres good men armes syr espayne du lyon sent sanredun syr cycart saynt lygyer maryzes syr peter byerne c speres bellpount entre erldome foyze saynt thybaulte ye ryuer garon syr peter calestan syr peter meaus noyalles l speres polamnuche syr peter toce castell mesun bastarde esperung e morleus syr arnolde wyllyam c speres pan syr guyde de la mote mounte marsen syr raymon newe castel sauuetere syryuayne foyze erles bastardes sone mountesquyn syr doll neuosan syr iohn saynt marcell oron syr hector de la garde mounte garbell iohn nowe castell ertyell erle sente syr iohn lane beynge castell beawuoyson take good hede fronters sent saynt gaudes cosyn syr ernalton spayne breuely nother towne castel foyze byerne refresshed wt newe men war sayd men ynowe resyst double ye nombre armes ye nombre xxm men war chosen men tidynges came syr wyllyam lygnac beynge thoulouse syr gaultyer passa beynge carcassone howe ye erle foyze prouyded men armes furnysshed euery garyson renome ranne wolde suffre none passe thrughe countrey wherof ii capytaynes sore abasshed apoynted mete myd way speke togyder castell daurey howe sholde erle foyze syr wyllyam sayd syr gaultyer say truly grete meruayle frensshe kynge cousayle haue wryten hym open peasybly countrey well syr sayd syr gaultyer necessary ye go speke ye erle shewe hym curtoys maner sente frensshe kynge way passe peasybly pay take surely erle foyze grete myghty yf lyst gete noo passage thrughe countrey must passe thrughe aragon whiche farre tell erle maketh suche doubtes soo fortefyeth garysons whether haue made ony alyaunce ye duke lancastre desyre go hym knowe trouthe ye se howe men dayly passe bygore contente sayd syr gaultyer toke ii capytaynes leue eche syr wyllya lygnac retourned thoulouse syr gaultyer xl horse wente passed ye ryuer garon saynt thybaulte founde syr menalte nouayles made hym grete chere syr gaultyer demauded hym sholde fynde erle foyze answered hym ortays ii knyghtes season togyder comoned dyuers matter syr gaultyer departed came saynt gaudes good chere nexte day rode saynt iohn de ryuyer rode lawne bonc costed mauuoysyn lay tournay close towne ye nexte daye rode dyner tarbe taryed day founde lorde dauchyn syr menalte barbason two grete lordes bierne spake hym many thynges bycause lorde barbason partye erle armynacke coulde speke good worde erle foyze nexte daye departed wente morlaus byerne founde syr raynolde wyllya bastarde broder erle foyze receyned hym good chere shewed syr gaultyer howe sholde fynde erle ortays howe wolde ryght glad comynge god graunte sayd syr gaultyer speke hym come countrey soo dyned togyder dyner syr gaultyer wente lodgynge mounte gabryel nexte daye iii clocke came ortays coulde speke erle yt day tyll nexte daye noone erle accustomed come abrode nexte daye erle foyze knewe syr gaultyer passac come speke hym somwhat made hast yssue chambre syr gaultyer dyd salute hym erle knew moche honour ony knyght dyd saluted hym agayne toke syr gaultyer ye hande sayd syr ye right hartely welcome busynes hath brought countrey byerne syr sayd knyght syr wyllyam lygnac commytted frensshe kynge conduyte castell certayne men armes ye haue herde howe yt ye wyl let iourney close countrey byerne agaynst v company erle foyze sayd syr gaultyer soo wyll close kepe countrey agaynst agaynst ony man yt wyl peasybly passe pay people take whiche fredome haue sworne kepe maynteyne mynystre iustyce euery lorde bounde subiectes entente lordes haue theyr sygnoryes hath ben shewed ye brynge maner breton barroys loraynes borgonyons knowe payne meaneth agaynst suche people wyll close countrey wyll kepe people theyr fraunches ryghtes syr sayd knyght entente companyon none shall passe thrughe lande without pay peaseably agrement poore elles taken corrected accordynge vsage countrey make restytucyon euery domage done elles satysfye theyr trespass theyr bodyes may delyuered v without gentyll man shal make iustyce done body men shall take therby ensample yf gentyl shal cause hym rendre restore ony domage hym done elles shall doo hym crye shall make trompet euery mannes lodgynge also declare agayne entre ony parte lande none shall exscuse neglygence syr may suffyse content ye erle sayd syr gaultyer yf done well contente ye shall welcome countrey wyll glad see let v go dyner shall talke togyder syr sayd erle cursed ye warre bytwene portyngale castel ought gretly complayne neuer lost moche dyd one season ye warre bytwene two royalmes chefe men warre byerne slayne yet shewed wente sholde make theyr warre wysely sayd portyngales harde men mete withall cruell dedes yf haue ouer hande theyr enemyes haue mercy syr gaultyer speke ye companyon come castell syth ye two chefe capytaynes passed shall passe peraduenture ye shall requyred kynge castell gyue counsayle aduyse wel aduysed ye gyue hasty cousayle aduaunce fyght aduersaryes ye duke lancastre kynge portyngale englysshe men portyngales famylyer togyder one englysshe men desyre haue batayle ii reason one grete season haue noo profyte poore haue wonne nothynge longe tyme rather spende haue lost wherfore wyll redy auaunce themselfe hope gete newe profyte suche people aduenturers desyrynge mennes goodes wyll fyght hardy courage often tymes fortune serueth well reason duke lancastre knoweth surely come parfytely peasybly herytage castell whiche demaundeth haue ryght wyfe calleth ryghtfull enherytoure onely batayle knoweth well yf myght haue obteyne one iourney agaynst kynge castell countrey wolde yelde hym trymble hym entente come galyce hath gyuen one doughters maryage kynge portyngale entente sholde ayde quarell syrs saye matter sholde fall otherwyse well ye felowe shall bere blame ony syr sayd syr gaultyer thanke good aduertysement syr seruyce shall redy doo pleasure day ye amonge crysten prynces reputed one moost sagest happest aduentures syr companyon haue one aboue v chefe souerayne company duke borbon tyll come castell shall make hast fyght enemyes soeuer ony man saye entred talkynge tyll erle foyze demaunded wyne dranke soo toke leue erle entred chambre syr gaultyer retourned lodgynge well accompanyed erles knyghtes supped togyder nexte day dyner yr gaultyer toke leue erle foyze syde thynges erle gaue hyym fayre courser mule syr gaultyer thanked erle departed ortays lay nyght ercyell nexte nyght tarbe rode daye grete iourney determyned sende fro then syr wyllyam lygnac soo dyd aduertysynge hym howe spedde erle foyze desyrynge hym come forwarde theyr companyes shewynge hym howe countrey byerne good townes sholde open payenge trewely take elles pthis messagere dydde soo moche came thoulouse dydde message delyuered letter pand syr wyllyam hadde redde contynewe hereof made knowen company sholde set forwarde soo soone entred ony parte erle foyze lande pay euery thynge sholde take elles theyr capytaynes answere euery thynge cryed sounde trompet fro lodgynge lodgynge entente euery man sholde knowe euery man dyslodged ye march tholouse carcassone lymous marbon entred bygore syr wyllyam lygnac toke hors rode tarbe syr gaultyer companyon made good chere togyder theyr bandes row e passed assembled togyder bygore ryde company thrughe countrey byerne passe ortays ye ryuer gaure whiche renneth bayon yssuynge countrey byerne entre countrey b squey ye whiche countrey ye kyng englande helde grete landes ye bysshopryches burdeaus bayon lxxx townes steples helde kynge englande vnderstode ye passage frensshmen thrugh theyr countrey doubte ouer rynnynge brennynge exylynge men war theyr partye countrey defende theyr fronters sage men drewe togyder sente trete frensshe capytaynes bye theyr pea sent ortays iiii men hauynge auctoryte make theyr pea iiii men met way squyer erle foyze called ernalton du pyn shewed hym theyr matter desyrynge hym helpe speke syr gaultyer passac syr wyllyam lygnac came ortays whiche sholde within iii iiii dayes helpe ayde make theyr pea answered wolde good wyll nyght capytaynes came ortays lodged ye squyers house ayded bysquey make theyr apoyntment pay iim frankes theyr countrey saued fro brennynge robbynge erle foyze gaue dyuer capytaynes syr wyllyam lygnac fayre courser nexte daye passed sameterre entred countrey bysquey whiche redemed toke vytayles myght gete passed thrughe countrey without doyng ony domage came saynt iohns de pye porte entre nauare phowe syr iohn holande syr raynolde de roy fought togyder lystes duke lancastre towne besances ca lxxviii ye haue herde howe towne besa ce put composycyon ye duke lancastre howe yelden vp hym ye kynge castell dyd comforte nothynge howe ye duches lancastre doughter came ye cyte porte portyngale se kynge quene howe kynge ye lordes receyued ioyfully reason thus whyle duke lancastre soiourned towne besances tydynges came thyder fro valeolyue brought heraulde fraunce demaunded lodgynge syr iohn holande brought thyder kneled downe hym delyuered hym letter sayd syr offycer armes sent hyder fro syr raynolde du roy saluteth yf please rede letter syr iohn sayd wt ryght good wyll thou arte ryght welcome opened letter redde wherin conteyned howe syr raynolde du roy desyred hym way amour loue lady delyuer hym chalenge iii course spere iii stroke wt sworde iii dagger iii axe wolde please hym come valeolyue wolde prouyde hym lx horse sure saufco duyte yf wolde come besances xxx horse wolde gete hym saufcondyte duke lancanstre syr iohn holande red letter began smyle behelde heraulde sayd frende yu arte welcome thou hast brought tydynges yt pleaseth ryght wel accepte desyre yu shalte obyde house wt company morowe yu shalte haue answere armes shal accomplysshed outher galyce castell syr sayd ye heraulde pleaseth god pthe heraulde ease syr iohn wente duke founde hym talkynge marshall shewed tydynges letter well sayd duke haue ye accepted desyre ye truely syr sayd desyre nothynge moche dedes armes knyght hath desyred nowe syr shall pleasure doo armes duke studyed lytell sayd wyll done towne make saufconduyte hym shall please shall seale name god sayd syr iohn well sayd saufcondyte wryten hym xxx knyghtes squyers come saufe go saufe syr iohn holande delyuered heraulde gaue hym mantell furred myneuer xii aungell noble heraulde toke leue retourned valeolyue mayster shewed howe sped delyuered saufconduyte ye parte tydynges came cyte porte kynge portyngale ladyes howe dedes armes sholde done besances well sayd kynge wyll therat quene wyfe ladyes damoyselles duches lancastre thanked kynge sholde retourne accompanyed kynge ye quene longe tyme approched kynge portyngale quene duches doughter ladyes damoyselles rode orth grete aray towarde besances duke lancastre knew ye kynge came thyder toke hors many lordes yssued besances met kynge ye ladyes ye kynge duke made grete chere togyder entred togyder ye towne theyr lodgynge appoynted aperteyned accordynge maner ye countrey easye large thoughe ben parys aboute iii dayes kynge portyngale come besances thyder came syr reynolde du roy well accompanyed knyghtes squyers hadde vi score horse well lodged duke lancaste hadde prepayred redy theyr lodgynges ye nexte daye syr iohn holande syr raynolde roy armed mounted theyr horse soo came fayre place redy san ed sholde doo theyr armes scafoldes redy made kynge ladyes duke lordes englande come thyder se ye dedes armes ii knyghtes came felde well appoynted coulde deuysed brought theyr speres theyr ax theyr swordes well horsed eche good dystaunce fro made theyr tournes fryskes fresshly knewe well regarded euery thynge ordeyned theyr desyre theyr armes graunted excepte vtteraunce howbeit man knewe sholde fal theyr bodyes syth thyder come must nedes mete ye poynte theyr speres theyr swordes ax dagger loo daunger entente exhaulte theyr honoure theyr lyues lay mysaduenture one stroke thus ranne togyder met euen thoughe hadde rynne lyne strake eche vysoure theyr helmes syr raynolde du roy brake spere iiii peces ye sheuers flewe grete hyght ye ayre whiche course gretely praysed syr iohn holande strake syr raynolde lykewyse ye vysoure stroke force shall shewe syr raynolde vysoure helme made auautage tyed small lase lase rake stroke helme flewe heed knyght bare heeded passed forth theyr course syr iohn dyscharged bare staffe fresshely euery man sayd goodly course knyghtes retourned theyr owne place syr raynolde helmed agayne newe spere ranne togyder agayne bothe wel horsed coulde well guyde strake eche helmes fyer flewe ye speres brake syr raynoldes helme agayne flewe heed sayd englysshmen ye frenssheman hath auauntage helme fast bocled syr iohn holandes thynke dothe wronge let hym set helme lyke case companyon hathe done holde pea syrs sayd duke lancastre let dele armes let euery take aduauntage thynketh best yf syr iohn holande thynke yt knyght haue aduauntage let hym set helme lyke maner sayd duke lyke armes ii knyghtes wolde haue helme fast bocled coulde thynke many oppynyon englysshe men spake moo wordes ladyes damoyselles sayd howe knyghtes iusted well goodly kynge portyngale sayd spake syr iohn ferant sayd syr iohn countrey knyghtes iust goodly maner syr sayd knyghtes iust wel syr haue sene ye frensshmen iust ye kynge broder elyres agaynst kynge castell lyke iustes sawe bytwene syr wyllyam wyndsore another frensshe knyght theyr helmes faster tyed knyghtes helme kynge regarded agayne two knyghtes se theyr thyrde course thus ranne togyder ye thyrde course regarded eche wysely take theyr aduauntage myght well doo theyr horse serued theyr wysshyng strake eche agayne helme suche wyse yt theyr eyen trimbled theyr heedes theyr sta e brake agayne syr raynoldes helme flewe heed eche passed forth theyr course demeaned themselfe fresshly euery man sayd howe nobly iusted englysshmen blamed gretely syr raynolde du roy helme faster set heed duke lancastre blamed hym nothyng sayd thynke hym wyse feates armes seke lawfull aduauntage semeth well yt syr raynolde lerne iust knoweth therin syr iohn doth thoughe haue borne hymselfe ryght well thus theyr course theyr speres toke theyr ax dyd theyr armes gaue eche iii grete stroke theyr helmes fought theyr swordes theyr dagger done none hurte frensshmen brought syr raynolde lodgynge englysshmen syr iohn holande day duke lancastre made dyner frensshmen lodgynge duches set table duke syr raynolde du roy bynethe dyner wente counsayle chambre ye duches toke syr raynolde hande made hym entre sone herselfe comoned hym frensshe knyghtes tyll tyme call drynke ye duches sayd frensshe knyghtes syrs haue meruayle ye susteyne ye wronge oppynyon bastarde ye knowe well soo dothe worlde henry somtyme called kynge castel bastarde therfore iust cause haue susteyne quarell ayde power dysheryte ryght ayre castell knowe well soo dothe worlde syster doughters lawfull maryage kyng peter wherfore god knoweth ryght haue royalme castell good lady whe spake fader wepte syr raynolde du roy made obeysaunce sayd madame knowe ryght well trouth ye haue sayd howbeit ye kynge mayster contrary oppynyon agaynst subiectes must make warre pleasure go wyl sende v maye say nay duches departed duke ye frensshe knyghtes dranke toke theyr leues wente theyr lodgynge euery thynge redy departe mounted departed fro besances rode daye noy rested rode forth tyll came valeolyue phowe kynge portyngale duke lancastre determyned entre royalme castell ca lxxix dedes armes done haue recorded kynge portyngale duke laucastre toke counsayle togyder determyned ryde entre castell within shorte space kynge portyngale power sholde ryde fronters entre castell duke rowte entre boundes galyce conquere suche townes fortress agaynst hym yf iohn castell dyd assemble oost agaynst make batayle bothe theyr oostes drawe togyder thought moost necessary haue theyr oostes sondre tyll nede rather togyder exchewe sykenes yt myght fall haue easyer lodgynge foragynge exchewyng debate dyscordes englysshmen hasty prowde ye felde portyngales hote dysdaynful sustre thought yt grete iourney batayle sholde ryght wel agree togyder cousayle determyned kynge sayd duke syr soone haue knowledge ye set forwarde shall doo lyke case men redy desyre nothynge elles batayle syr sayd duke shall longe syr styll shewed howe yet certayne townes galyce yt rebell agaynst v wyll goo vysyte wyll seke enemyes whersoeuer fynde thus kynge portyngale toke leue duke duches lyke wyse dyd quene phelyp yonge syster katheryne ordeyned yonge lady sholde abyde al warre season syster quene cyte porte portyngale thought coulde ony better kepynge ye duches retourned saynt iaques galyce thus euery body departed thyder sholde doo kynge cyte porte duches towne saynt iaques well accompanyed knyghtes squyers duke taryed besances aboute prepayred shortly set forwarde desyrous departe bycause ioly lusty moneth aprell whiche season galyce grasse full growen theyr corne herbes floures fruytes redy rype countrey hote yt begynnynge iune haruest past duke thought season goodly set forwarde army pnowe let v somwhat speke orderynge frensshmen kynge iohn castell well haue done englysshe men phowe syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac came ayde kynge iohn castell ca lxxx ye haue herde howe syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac dyd moche theyr wyse entreatynge erle foyze yt suffred peasybly passe thrughe countrey byerne go castel besyde erle gaue grete rewardes noo knyghtes squyers straungers came se hym wolde largely rewarde accordynge theyr degree c floreynes cc floreynes xxx xl sayd fyrst passage frensshe men cost erle foyze owne treasourer shewed frankes besyde horse thynges gaue say trouth surely grete domage yt suche persone sholde olde dye mermosettes aboute hym say syr take gyue pynche pyl people surely none suche aboute hym dyd euery thynge owne mynde naturally grete wysdome coulde gyue nede take became hym best reasan large grete expences somtyme trauayled subiectes reuenewes suffycyent bere gyftes whiche yerely lxm frankes ye whiche lyke haue ben sene herde ony yet assembled treasoure doubte aduentures xxx yere xxx tymes cm frankes yet people alwayes prayde god longe lyfe herde reported howe dyed foyze byerne xm persones sayd yt wolde gladly haue dyed hym wherby thought sayd without ben grete loue yt theyr lorde surely loued hym dyd ryght accordynge reason alwayes maynteyned theyr ryght kepte euer true iustyce la de people therin grete lyberte fraunchesse lyued good pea thoughe ben paradyse terrestre say flattery fauour loue bere hym gyftes hath gyuen well proue haue sayd sure knyghtes squyers wyll saye nowe let v retourne syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac capytaynes souerayne leders frensshe armye passed countrey bysquey pase rounceuall whiche cost iii dayes passynge mountaynes full snowe moneth aprell yet theyr horse hadde moche payne passe thrughe came towardes panpylona founde royalme nauare redy open suffre passe thrughe kynge nauare wolde doo dyspleasure kynge castell bycause sone syr charles nauare wyfe kynge castelles syster pea made bytwene kynge henry fader kynge iohn nauare made promysed grete alyaunce togyder whiche longe kepte kynge nauare able resyst kynge castell without grete alyaunce comforte ye kynge aragon elles ye kynge englande capytaynes fraunce came pampylona kynge nauare receyued ioyfully made dyne hym palays dyner led chambre comoned wt dyuers thynges ye kynge wyse man subtell well langaged amonge thynges shewed howe ye frensshe kynge counsayle ben dyspleased hym without cause wrongfully taken fro hym herytage landes normandy whiche ought haue successyon predecessours kynges fraunce nauare whiche sayd coulde forgete seynge taken fro hym normandy languedoc barony mountpellyer lxm frankes yerely reuenues sayd wyst whome complayne haue ryght onely god syrs sayd kyng say bycause ye sholde addresse wronges knowe well lyeth power thynke frensshe kynge wyll lytell behalfe ye none counsayle ye knyghtes aduentures sowdyours go soeuer sende speke maner complaynte al knyghtes fraunce passe syr gaultyer passac sayd syr wordes true yf saye kynge v wyll nother gyue take surely syr counsayle redy go wyll sende v syr duke borbon souerayne capytayne vncle kynge cometh v waye outher goynge retournynge ye maye shewe hym busynes hym ye maye addressed complayntes syr praye god may rewarde honour ye haue done v syr shall shewe curtoysye kyng counsayle retourne fraunce also duke borbone chefe capytayne whome trust se se kyng wyne brought dranke toke theyr leue kynge ye kynge rewarded largely sente eche theyr lodgyng goodly horse wherof grete ioye thus men warre passed thrugh royalme nauare came groyne demaunded sholde fynde kynge castell shewed howe lyen valeolyue grete season sayd thought burgus spayne makynge prouysyon toke way burgus lefte way galyce waye sure englysshe men sore abrode countrey tydynges came kynge castell howe socoures came hym fraunce nombre iim speres wherof ryght glad departed fro valeolyue rode burgus vim hors thus frensshmen armes came burgus lodged theraboute abrode countrey dayly thyder came men warre syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac came kynge palays receyued swetely thanked payne grete trauayle taken sake come thyder serue hym knyghtes made theyr reuerence sayd syr yf maye ony seruyce please paynes shall soone forgoten syr please take aduyse howe shal outher ryde agaynst enemyes elles make warre garysons tyll suche season duke borbon come syr yf please ye maye sende syr olyuer clysquy knowe well countrey syr peter vyllaynes barroys barres chatell morant companyons haue haunted countrey haue done longe v let v al counsayle togyder goddes grace royalme shal haue honoure profyte syrs sayd kynge ye speke wysely thus shal done clerkes set worke letter made messagers sent forthe dyuers place knyghtes men warre spred abrode countrey knewe syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac burgus kynge gretely reioyced therof knyghtes companyons departed fro theyr garysons lefte sure kepynge rode burgus spayne soo grete nombre frensshe men warre kynge castel lordes knyghtes fraunce went cousayle togyder se sholde maynteyne theyr warre knewe well theyr enemyes rode abrode kepte ye feldes wherfore thought prouyde remedy honoure kynge profyte royalme castell many matter debated counsayle theyr people nombred sayd royalme selfe myght well brynge togyder xxxm horse men well armed vsage castell dartes iauelyns foote men castynge stone slynges xxxm frensshe knyghtes amonge themselfe consydered al sayd one another grete nombre people good men warre lytel worth haue sene suche slowfulnes haue grete trust appered well batayle marres prynce wale vyctory ye batayle iuberoth portyngales gascoynes alwaye spanyardes dyscomfyted erle lune susteynynge ye castellyans exscusynge sayd syrs batayle marres shall answere trouthe yt syr bertram clysquy grete nombre knyghtes fraunce fought valyauntly taken slayne ye haue herde ye know well agaynst floure chyualry worlde bothe wysdome valyauntnes prowes whiche nowe duke la castre prynce teh batayle marres xm speres vim archer suche men iiim euery man worth rowlande olyuere duke lancastre hathe none suche passeth xii xvc speres iiiim archer vi speres shall fyght agaynst rowlande olyuer syr iohn chandos syr thomas felton syr olyuer clysson syr hughe caurel syr rycharde pountchardon syr garsis lorde ryeux syr rycharde dangle coulde name vc suche deed shall fynde none suche nowe wherfore matter soo peryllous tyme past yf ye wyll byleue shall go fyght passe ryuer derne shall tourne v grete valyauntnes counsayle erle lune dyd gyue wel herde many helde ye oppynyon syr olyuer clysquy sayd syr erle lune knowe well ye haue sayd procedeth grete wysdome valyauntnes syr take goo fyght duke lancastre yf sholde well ynoughe syr ye leue ye grettest matter behynde kynge portyngale puyssauce enfourmed xxvc speres xxxm men war trust kynge portyngale ye duke lancastre entred galyce haue made grete alyaunce togyder kynge hath maryed duke doughter nowe syr saye name god sayd erle lune ye knyghtes fraunce suffycyent fyght duke lancastre kynge castell castellyans say xxm horse xxx foote may fyght kynge portyngale dare well abyde ye aduenture amonge frensshmen sawe erle lune layde sore theyr charge sayd syr ye ye ryght ye wronge syr sholde haue sayd ye syr let soo wyll none v shall saye agaynst wyll syrs sayd kynge requyre counsayle truely hast pryde sad aduyse humylyte let v take best waye wyll conclude accepte iourney wyl mete agayne togyder morowe chambre ye syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac sente hyder countrey frensshe kynge duke borbon requyre go togyder take aduyse counsayle shall thought moost best honourable royalme shall lye whether shall fyght enemyes made theyr reuerence sayd wolde obey commaundement departed thus euery man daye departed theyr lodgynges frensshmen togyder grete communycacyon sayd honourably fyght enemyes tyll duke borbon souerayne capytayne come tell yf wolde fyght soo fyght haue vyctory duke borbou wyll sore dyspleased v specyally v frensshe capytaynes yf fortune sholde fall agaynst v sholde bothe lose bodyes royalme yf ouerthrowen recouery castellyans kynge castell lyke lese royalme tyme sholde bere fawte ony sholde layde howe caused batayle gaue good counsayle also noo suretye yf royalme sure kynges partye whether haue couertly sente duke lancastre wyfe reputed heyre castell doughter kynge peter worlde knoweth people se duke wyfe ye englysshmen felde demaundynge crowne castell affyrmynge haue ryght therto kynge iohn kynge sone bastarde peraduenture may tourne theyr parte dyd ye grete batayle maures soo sholde abyde deed felde thinke double peryll bothe kynge v suche folysshe people gyue kynge counsayle batayle herde sholde speke well syrs sayd syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac morowe shall knowen euery mannes opynyon day nyght frensshmen dyuers communycacyons lyke wyse soo spanyardes suche loued kynge wolde counsayle hym fyght dyuers reason one fought lost batayle lost royalme without recouery kynge hymselfe thought good fyght fered sore fortune warre also knewe euery mannes mynde loued hym dyd thus matter rested tyll nexte daye euery man retourned palays kynge entred counsayle counsayle many opynyons euery man power wolde truely counsayle kynge dyuers counsayled hym sholde enclyne hastely batayle puttynge hym remembraunce harde iourney iuberoth kynge portyngale dyscomfyted hym wherby suche domage yf suche another chaunce sholde fall sholde lese royalme euer kynge demaunded euery man herde theyr oppynyons sayd syr wyllyam lygnacke syr gaultyer passac syrs let oppynyons shal ordeyned seynge ye chefe capytaynes frensshe men sente hyder frensshe kynge counsayle ii knyghtes regarded eche syr wyllyam sayd syr galtyer syr speke answered sayd nay wyll speke ye haue vsed armes haue done syr wyllyam aduysed hymselfe sayd syr lyke grace thynke ye ought gretely thanke noble chyualry fraunce come hyder serue soo farre syr hathe shewed well howe haue none affeccyon wyll closed ony cyte towne castell garyson ye haue haue ben desyrous kepe feldes fynde fyght enemyes whiche thynge nowe sauynge grace suffred dyuers reason pryncypall reason syr tary duke borbon onr souerayne capytayne wyll shortely shall gretely enforce v newe fresshe men many nowe v neuer countrey necessary lerned maner countrey two thre monethes proueth seldome well hastely fyght oure enemyes lette v make wyse warre garysons two thre monethes let englysshemen portyngales ryde abrode galyce lyst yf conquere certayne townes small matter soone departed countrey wyll soone wonne agayne also syr one poynte armes lyeth many aduentures syr let ryde abrode countrey whiche hoote stronge ayre maye take suche trauayle sykenes maye happen repente haue come soo forwarde shall fynde ayre soo attemperate englande frau ce wynes pleasaunt galyce ryuers troublous coolde bycause snowes dyscende downe frome mountaynes wherby theyr horse theyr trauayle daye hoote sone shall morfoundred ware made stele yet yron lengthe shall endure hote countrey castell men thus thynke better bete let go lyst shall fynde nothynge playne countreys delectable place refresshe vnderstande open countrey redy dystroyed owne men alowe well aduyse yf doo wolde counsayle syrs yf ony speke better let hym speke shall glad hym syr gaultyer desyre thus doo answered one voyce lette aduyse admytted consyder better profytable way kynge castel royalme concluded sholde make countenaunce warre tyll duke borbon theyr prouysyons come theyr men warre put dyuers garysons fronters theyr countrey suffre englysshmen portyngales go royalme castell theyr pleasure sayenge howe coulde bere awaye countrey euer retourned thus ended counsayle kynge castel daye dyner hym palays burgus spayne ryght plentyfull vsage spayne nexte daye none al men armes departed thyder appoynted theyr capytaynes syr olyuer clysquy erle longueuyle thousande speres wente stronge towne fronter galyce called vyllesaunte syr raynolde syr trystram roye sente another garyson x legges fro fronter galyce called agyllar felde thre hundred speres syr peter bellysme two hundred speres wente pouelles vycount lune wente towne marolle syr iohn barres thre hundred speres sente castell noye within galyce syr iohn castell morant syr trystram iayell dyuers sente cyte palance vycount belyer wente towne rybede hym syr iohn braquen syr robert braquen pthus men armes deuyded syr olyuer clysquy made theyr constable syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac abode styl kynge burgus case standynge busynes castell abydynge comynge duke borbon styll fraunce makynge prouysyon iourney pnowe wyll suffre rest season armye castell duke lancastre also kynge portyngale tyme requyreth shal retourne ther agayne nowe lette v speke aduentures fell season fraunce englande whiche troublous peryllous bothe royalmes sore dyspleasaunt vnto kynges bothe theyr counsayles phow grete myscheffe fell englande bytwene gentyll men comons accompte suche money hadde ben reysed comons ca lxxxi ye haue herde howe frensshe armye shyppes ye se assembled sluse haue gone englande dasshed broken vp yet shewe courage desyre goo another season englande sholde sayd frensshe men recreaunt haue made voyage therfore ordeyned incontynent entre may see myght fayre pleasaunt constable fraunce sholde make iourney englande iiii men armes iim crosse bowes sholde assemble togyder cyte agaynst fronter cornewall called lentrygnyer made theyr prouysyon ordeyned euery man haue horse easely yde abrode englande thought without horse coulde make noo warre sholde auayle soo assembled hauen lentygnyer goodly apparell shyppes barkes bagengers galeys wel fournysshed wynes salte flesshe bysquet thynges largely suffycyent lyue foure fyue monethes without takynge byenge ony thynge countrey ye constable company knewe well soone englysshe men knewe suche company men warre comynge wolde dystroye theyr owne goodes abrode playne countrey rather sholde haue ony case therof therfore constable made prouysyon redy syde see also ordeyned another flete shyppes hauen harflewe lorde coucy lorde saynt poule admyrall fraunce sholde take shyppynge two thousande speres lykewyse goo englande brute wente done drawe backe agayne duke lancastre duches castell season duke borbon parys thought surely duke lancastre sholde retourne home agayne englande wherfore thoughe sholde haue thynge doo go castell trauayle body farre forthe determyned constable armye sholde goo breton augenyms poyetenyns manceaus xayngrons knyghtes squyers lowe march lorde saynt poule lorde coucy sholde go frensshmen norman pycardes duke borbon sholde goo two thousande speres berrey auuernake lymosyn borgoyne bace march thus season matter concluded fraunce euery man knewe sholde outher go englande castell true royalme englande tyme grete peryll gretter ieoperdye vyllaynes essex kent rebelled agaynst kynge noble royalme whiche tyme came vnto london shall shewe reason season noble men royalme toke one parte togyder kynge agaynst comons nowe soo noble vary amonge themselfe kynge agaynst owne vncles duke yorke duke glocestre agaynst hym varyaunce dyd ryse meanes duke irelande bare chefe rule aboute kynge comons englande dyuers cytees knewe well dyscorde sage men reputed grete euyl fered moche trouble sholde growe therby suche lyght persones made noo rekenynge therof sayenge enuye kynges vncles hadde agaynst kynge theyr nephewe bycause sawe howe crowne englande began growe farre frome sayd kynge yonge byleued yonge counsayle howe better hym byleue hys vncles mente noo thynge hym al honoure pro yte royalme englande rather ruled prowde duke irelande neuer sawe ony thynge perteynynge honoure neuer ony batayle thus euery man dyffered royalme englande whiche trybulacyons well knowen fraunce wherfore made grete prouysyon goo thyder theyr puyssaunce thynkynge doo grete feate syde prelate englande hatred one another archebysshop cauntorbury neuelles blood archebysshop yorke yet countrey men borne hated mortally eche bycause lorde neuell hadde rule gouernaunce northumbrelande soo march skotlande aboue erle northumbrelande chyldren lorde henry lorde raffe percy whiche rule lorde neuelles broder gotten hym one chefe aboute kynge duke irelande pof grete dyscordes englande brekynge vp frensshe armye armye gouernours kynge constrayned comons good townes make accomptes suche money come theyr handes season ruled ca lxxxii sone englysshmen knewe voyage see frensshmen sholde haue made beynge sluse dasshed broken englande began dyuers murmuracyons sundry place suche loued euyll rule rather good sayd nowe grete entrepryses valyaunt men englande yt dayes kynge edwarde thyrde prynce sone wonte go fraunce put backe enemyes suche maner none durst make batayle v yf dydde soone dyscomfyted dede noble kynge edwarde aryued normandy constantyne passed thrugh royalme fraunce goodly entrepryse acheued waye cressy dyscomfyted kynge phylyp puyssaunce fraunce retourned wan towne calays nowe knyghtes men warre englande doo none suche feates palso prynce wale sone noble kynge dyd take frensshe kynge iohn dyscomfyted pyssaunce poycters smal nombre people agaynste people kynge iohn hadde dayes englande fered doubted spoken thrughe al worlde ye floure chyualry nowe man speketh v nowe noo warre made poore mennes purse therto euery man enclyned fraunce nowe kynge chylde yet hath done agaynst v ony predecessours also shewed grete courage haue come englande lette therof hym men tyme hath ben sene yf suche apparell shyppes ben made sluse sholde haue ben foughten withall theyr owne hauen nowe noble men englande ioyfull maye sytre rest suffre pea yet suffre poore men rest put busynes paye money tyme hath ben grete conquestes haue ben done fraunce without payenge ony money suche ryches hath ben gotten hath ben spred abrode royalme become ye grete fynaunces tayles hath ben gadered royalme kynges rente accostomed reuenues outher haue lost taken fro behouable knowen howe royalme englande gouerned howe kynge ledde good sholde longe knowen royalme englande soo ryche puyssaunt bere lyke charge royalme fraunce dothe palso appereth wel royalme englande febled wyttes grace wonte knowe euery thynge done fraunce thre foure monethes case fell wherby myght conuenyently make prouysyon resystence nowe knowe noo thynge frensshe men knoweth secretes counsayles cannot tell whome fawte wyll knowen vpon daye preuy traytours better knowen betymes late maye knowen soo la e wyll past remedy thus dyuersely men talked englande well knyghtes squyers comons soo royalme laye harde case grete peryll grete assembly kyng vncles counsayle hadde made grete expence dyuers maners resyst frensshe kynge beynge sluse redy entre englande suche knyghtes squyers redynes wolde payde theyr wage entente parlyamente somoned holden london noble prelate comons englonde pryncypally ordeyned sholde reysed grete tayle subsydye thrughe royalme englande ryche bere poore parlyament remoued westmynstre thyder came suche sente many moo tydynges pthere kynge two vncles edmunde thomas many noble royalme amonge thynges yt sayd kynges treasoure substaunce skante maynteyne kynges estate soberly wherfore counsayle sayd howe must leuyed subsydye thrughe royalme englande yf suche costes charge sholde payde hathe ben done defence royalme englande agaynst frensshe men agreed well bysshopryche norwyche also archebysshopryche cauntorbury countye essex countye hampton warwykeshyre lande ye erle salysbury agreed soner ferther countreys north march wale cornewall al rebelled sayd haue sene none enemyes come countrey sholde greued haue done fawte yes yes sayd let bysshop yorke spoken withall kynges counsayle duke irelande hathe lx thousande frankes constable fraunce redempcyon iohan bretayne money ought tourned comon profyte englande ye speke syr symon burle syr wyllyam helmen syr thomas branbe syr robert tryuylyen syr iohan beauchampe haue gouerned kynge royalme yf make good accompte haue receyued delyuer comons shall sytte rest euery thynge payde ought pwhen wordes came abrode herynge kynges vncles ryght gladde therof made well al named agaynste coulde bere noo rule courte wherfore ayded people theyr oppynyons sayd good men thus speketh well counsayled desyre haue accompte wyll paye ony money surely outher kynges treasure elles theyr purse gouerne hym must nedes grete treasure thus lytell lytell multyplyed wordes people beganne waxe bolde deny paye ony money reason sawe kynges vncles theyr accorde susteyned pand archebysshop cauntorbury erle salysbury erle northumbrelande dyuers lordes englande put taxe tyme deferred theyr counsayle myghelmasse whiche tyme promysed retourne agayne knyghtes squyers suche thought haue money arrerages theyr wage hadde noo thynge wherfore dyspleasure kynge counsayle apeased well myght euery man departed kynge toke leue vncles hym kynge counsayled drawe march wale tary tyll herde tydynges soo contente doo departed fro london without leue takynge ony man toke hym counsayle excepte archebysshop yorke wente backe ne countrey whiche happy hym thynke yf hadde ben sholde haue ben serued ye shall requysyte speke well fraunce englande matter requyreth phowe constable fraunce dyuers lordes squyers royalme apparelled grete prouysyons go englande wynne townes castelles ca lxxxiii season somer come ioly moneth maye yere lorde god mccc foure score vii season duke lancastre galyce conquered ye kynge portyngale grete puyssaunce rode abrode castell without ony withstandynge thenne ordeyned fraunce ye haue herde howe constable fraunce one army erle saynt poule lorde coucy syr iohan vyen another armye one lentrygnyer bretayne harflewe normandy sholde season make voyage englande vi thousande men armes two thousande crosse bowes vi thousande men warre ordeyned none sholde passe see goo englande without well armed prouysyon vytayles space thre monethes prouysyon hay ootes theyr horse daye prefyxed amonge capytaynes sholde departe determyned lande englande two hauens douer orwell thus daye approched theyr departure lentrygnyer prouysyon made put shyppes sholde passe then lyke wyse done harflewe euery man war payde theyr wage xv dayes iourney soo farre forwarde thought coulde haue ben broken pnor also brake noo cause capytaynes ordeyned goo voyage brake another incydent meruayllous matter fell bretayne wherwith frensshe kynge counsayle soore dyspleased coulde amende wherfore behoued wysely dyssymule ye matter tyme remedy palso tydynges came vnto frensshe kynge partyes almayne shall shewe hereafter tyme place shall requyre fyrst wyll speke matter bretayne almayne bretayne fell fyrste worste reputed thoughe cost yf sholde saye suche matter fell season open clerely mater whiche grete peryllous horryble myght cronycle n hystory myght let ouerpasse yf lyst wyll doo soo shall declare case syth god hathe gyuen knowledge therof tyme leysure cronycle matter lengthe pye haue herde dyuers place hystory howe syr iohn mountforde named duke bretayne surely conquest ryght lyne howbeit alwayes maynteyned warre oppynyon kynge englande chydren agaynst frensshe kynge also good cause soo doo partye without ayde englande hadde atteyned dyd nother alroy place also ye haue herde howe duke bretayne coulde haue entente noble countrey good townes specyally syr bertram clesquy longe lyued syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce lordes de la vale beawmanoyre lorde rase dygnant vycount rohan lorde rochforde whereas lordes enclyned nyghe bretayne folowed contente take parte theyr lorde duke agaynst maner men excepte agaynst crowne fraunce surely se ymagyne waye breton pryncypally regarded euer honoure fraunce maye well appere wrytten hystory saye noo corrupcyon fauoure haue erle guy bloys hath ben good lorde vnto haue hadde moche profyte hym nephewe nexte erle loys bloys broder germayne saynt charles bloys longe lyued duke bretayne truely saye cause onely declare trouthe also gentyll prynce erle hathe caused wryte story wolde wyse sholde swarue trouth nowe retourne purpose ye knowe well longe duke iohan bretayne lyued coulde neuer attayne haue men euery poynte agree oppynyons sore fered lest last sholde haue taken hym put hym pryson fraunce wherfore departed bretayne wente englande householde ye lady wyfe iahan holande doughter somtyme good knyght syr thomas holande thus season became seruaunt kynge rycharde englande afterwarde wente flaunders ye erle bloys cosyn germayne taryed yere halfe pfynally owne countrey sente hym soo good accorde thyder wente pand came countrey certayne townes closed styl agaynst hym rebelled specyally cyte nauntes lordes knyghtes prelate accorde excepte lordes rehersed haue sygnory gete fauoure good wyll good townes cytyes put frensshe kynge fere bycause wolde ouerpresse tax subsydyes dyd fraunce pycardye whiche wolde suffre bretayne therfore sente vnto kynge englande socoure ayde men warre archer promysynge yf kynge englande wolde come bretayne elles one vncles grete puyssaunce men armes archer howe countrey bretayne sholde opened redy receyue hym company pthe kynge englande counsayle gladde tydynges thought good concluded sende thyder prouysyon made thyder sente erle buckyngham iii men armes viii archer aryued calays passed throughe royalme fraunce without ony resystence hathe ben shewed demaundynge noo thynge batayle came bretayne trustynge haue founde countrey redy open receyue refresshe rely made longe voyage howbeit founde contrary dysposed duke bretayne soo ledde men wysely entreated made pea bytwene hym yonge charles kynge fraunce kynge charles fader coulde neuer haue pea hated hym soo sore duke borgoyne one chese gouernours royalme fraunce ayded gretely make pea desyred lady wyfe bycause duke bretayne nere theyr lygnage soo fayne breke promyses englysshmen coulde suffred accomplysshe couenaunt breton wolde consent yelde kynge englande make warre agaynst fraunce sayd neuer oppynyon neuer wolde behoued englysshmen take theyr lodgynges ye march wannes suffered moche pouerte euer dyd men one tyme specyally theyr horse dyed hungre pouerte soo tyme somer departed bretayne euyl contente duke bretayne myght without cause specyally erle buckyngham baron englande company retourned englande made grete complayntes kynge duke lancastre counsayle deuysed ordeyned iohn bretayne sholde delyuered brynge hym puyssaunce bretayne make warre agaynst duke bretayne englysshe men sayd howe syr iohn mountforde knewe well howe put hym possessyon sygnory bretayne without v hadde neuer come therto nowe play v tourne cause v trauayle bodyes spende kynges treasoure behoueth v shewe hym fawtes better reuenged delyuer aduersary brynge hym bretayne countrey wyll delyuer hym townes cytees fortress put duke clene thus hathe mocked dysceyued v pthus englysshe counsayle one accorde iohn bretayne brought kynges presence shewed hym howe wolde make hym duke bretayne recouer hym herytage bretayne sholde haue wyfe lady phylyp lancastre wolde holde duchy bretayne fayth homage kynge englande whiche poynte vtterly refused take duke doughter maryage contente swere agaynst crowne fraunce noo wyse wolde consente rather abyde pryson lyfe kynge counsayle sawe withdrewe grace hadde thought haue shewed hym thenne delyuered kepynge syr iohan dambretycourte ye haue herde haue made nowe relacyon matter bycause incydentes folowed appered duke bretayne duke knewe well howe gretely fauoure noble men royalme englande also comons ymagened hatred bare hym voyage erle buckyngham hadde made thrughe fraunce come bretayne wenynge haue founde duke countrey open agaynst duke bretayne hadde promysed whiche englysshe men founde contrary palso sawe well howe kynge englande hadde wryten vnto hym soo amyably hadde done often tymes specyally hadde done erle buckynghams voyage pand also doubted kynge englande sholde delyuer iohan bretayne entente make hym warre pthenne duke cast ymagynacyon myght fynde remedy matter brynge good poynte doo entente soo secretly englysshe men sholde well content pleased hym knewe well man worlde whome englysshmen hated moost syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce dede syr olyuer clysson euer studyed nyght daye howe myght doo dyspleasure englysshe men duke knewe ryght well armye made god englande bocke harflew lentrygnyer sayd vnto hymselfe entente please englysshe men shewe dyd set moche frensshe men founde meanes breke voyage commaundynge men bretayne payne lesynge theyr herytage go englande ayde frensshe partye dyd shewed outwardly warre hym dyd entrepryse couertly caste ymagynacyon myght doo honourably profyte take constable fraunce prysoner elles slee hym therby knewe well sholde please englysshe men hated hym thought yf waye cared resydue lygnage knewe well able make hym warre constable hadde two doughters one maryed vnto iohn bretayne doughter maryded vnto erle rohans sone thought withstande wel ynoughe lygnage yf hadde slayne hym sayd hadde slayne baron none wolde make hym ony warre sake phowe duke bretayne sente lordes knyghtes come counsayle vnto wannes counsayle desyred constable goo se castell ermyne howe toke hym prysoner lorde beaumanoyre hym ca lxxxiii foresayd ymagynacyon duke bretayne rested come entente somoned counsayle come wannes desyred lordes knyghtes bretayne effectuously come thyder dyd sende letter vnto specyally requyred syr olyuere clysson constable fraunce sholde fayle sayenge howe wolde gladlyer se hym ony constable wolde exscuse hymselfe bycause duke bretayne naturall lorde gladde haue good wyll soo came wannes soo dydde grete nombre lordes bretayne pthis counsayle longe many matter debated therin touchynge duke countrey without ony worde spekynge voyage purpose make englande duke dyssymuled matter counsayle cyte wannes castell called mote pthe duke made lordes grete dyner fedde fayre louynge wordes tyll nere nyght retourned theyr lodgynges subbarbes withoute cyte constable fraunce please knyghtes squyers bretayne desyred nexte daye dyne hym dyd soo departed theyr owne howses take leue theyr wyues parentes constable purposed soone h departed then strayght goo vnto nau e lentrygnyer duke bretayne knewe ryght well spake noo worde therof makynge semblaunte thoughe knewe noo thynge soo dyner ended moost parte baron bretayne sodaynly vnto came duke bretayne ryght amorously semynge thought otherwyse harte none knewe therof suche hadde dyscouered mynde vnto soone entred constable lodgynge sayd beholde cometh duke euery man rose reason swetely receyued hym ought doo theyr lorde delte ryght getylly sate downe amonge ete dranke kepte good company shewed token loue euer dydde sayd vnto fayre lordes louers frendes god sende well goo well come agayne sende ioye maye doo suche dedes armes maye please maye honourable vnto herde swere wordes duke answered sayd syr thanke god rewarde grete kyndnesse pleaseth come se v departynge season duke bretayne makynge castell nere wannes called castell ermyne whiche nere furnysshed entente attrappe constable sayd vnto hym vnto lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre lordes syrs requyre ye departe come se newe castell armyne ye shall se howe haue deuysed also howe purpose doo pthey agreed vnto hym bycause sawe hym come soo louyngly amonge thought none euyll soo moost parte mounted theyr horse rode forth duke castel armyne duke constable lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre dyuers lordes knyghtes alyghted theyr horse entred castell duke ledde constable ye hande fro chambre chambre euery house offyce made drynke seller duke brought chefe towre dore therof sayd constable syr olyuere knowe noo man syde see knoweth buyldynge ye doo wherfore praye mounte vp stayres beholde buyldynge towre yf well contente yf ony thynge amysse yt shall refourmed deuyse ye constable thynkynge none euyll sayd syr ryght good wyl please goo shall folowe naye syr sayd duke goo waye vp alone meane tyme wyll talke lorde de la vale constable wente vp stayres aboue paste fyrste stage chabre layde busshment opened dore wents downe dyd shote dore bynethe wente vp armed constable toke ledde hym chambre fetered hym iii boltes yron sayd hym syr pardon v must nedes thus commaunded lorde duke bretayne yf ye constable abasshed tyme meruayle costable ought haue grete meruayle ye chaunce dyspleasure fell bytwene duke hym ony letter duke coulde wryte hym ony desyre saufconduyte come goo saufely yet constable wolde neuer come duke presence durste trust hym nowe come mysfortune founde duke grete dyspleasure hym well shewed lorde de la vale beynge bynethe stayre foote sawe dore closed blood began trymble grete fere broder behelde duke waxed pale grene lefe knewe matter wente amysse sayd syr goddes sake haue mercy wyll take none euyll wyll agaynst constable syr sayd duke take ye horse departe ye maye goo ye wyll knowe well ynoughe haue syr sayd lorde de la vale wyll de parte hen without haue broder constable wordes came vnto lorde beawmanoyre whome duke also hated lyke wyse demau ded haue constable duke drewe dagger came vnto hym sayd beawmanoyre wylte thou poynte thy mayster syr sayd trust mayster good case well sayd duke demaunde yf thou wylte lyke case ye syr sayd thenne duke toke dagger poynte sayd yf thou wylte lyke case behoueth put one thyne eyen lorde beawmanoyre sawe well matter wente well sawe duke waxe pale angre kneled downe knee sayd syr repute soo grete noblenes trust god ye wyll doo v ryght mercy come hyder request trust ye wyll dyshonour e accomplysshe ony euyll wyll ye haue v sholde straunge nouelte well sayd duke come thy waye thou shalte haue noo lesse shall haue soo ledde another chambre fetered also thre payre yrons abasshed hadde grete cause perceyued well duke loued hym lytell constable also remedy one tydynges spredde ouer castell also towne howe constable fraunce lorde beawmanoyre also lorde de la vale taken prysoners howe lorde de la vale myght departe wolde duke demaunded thynge hym wherof people hadde grete meruayle also grete cause euery man sayd howe duke wolde put bothe dethe hated mortally duke gretely blamed knyghtes squyers herde therof sayd neuer gretter dyffamacyon ony prynce duke bretayne seynge desyred constable dyne hym se house make hym good chere soo take hym prysoner sayd neuer herde case lyke wherfore infamed neuer man dyshonoured therby noo man sholde trust ony prynce syth duke dysceyued noble men wyll frensshe kynge say knoweth voyage englande broken neuer soo grete shame ymagyned nowe duke sheweth laye harte tro neuer sene bretayne case lyke none place yf poore knyght done suche dede dyshonoured euer sholde man trust lorde ye lorde sholde maynteyne hym ryght doo hym iustyce shall make correccyon dede none frensshe kynge nowe ye duke sheweth playnly howe englysshe parte wyll susteyne holde oppynyon kynge englande syth hath thus broken voyage see sholde haue gone englande shall become nowe knyghtes squyers bretayne shall tydynges nothynge contynent come fro theyr house lay syege castell armyne close duke within tary tyll haue taken hym outher deed quycke lede hym lyke false prynce frensshe kynge thus knyghtes squyers aboute march wannes spake comoned togyder suche come thyder counsayle sayd lordes grete doubte duke wolde put dethe sayd lorde de la vale ieopardy soo wyse wyll tempre duke busynes truely dyd ben constable ben deed fyrst nyght lyues ought byleued syr olyuer clysson case saw hymselfe soo taken attrapped fetered kepte xxx persones hadde noo comforte knewe wyll theyr lorde soo rekened hymselfe deed man also hadde noo hope lyue tyll nexte daye surely grete daungere iii tymes vnfetered brought haue ben beheded elles drowned surely ben yf lorde de la vale ben lorde de la vale herde duke strayte comaundement put hym dethe kneled downe hym lyftynge vp handes sore wepynge sayd syr goddes sake take mercy aduyse shewe cruelte agaynst constable hath deserued dethe syr grace may please shewe cause dyspleasure agaynst hym syr swere vnto ony trespace hath done shall make suche amendes body goodes elles hym ye yourselfe shall demaunde iudge syr remembre howe yongth ye ii companyons togyder brought vp bothe one house duke lancastre soo gentyll prynce none lyke hym also syr remembre howe pea made frensshe kynge alwayes truely serued ayded recouer herytage ye haue alwayes founde hym good comforte cou sayle yf ye moued enfourmed agaynste hym otherwyse reason sholde requyre yet hathe deserued dethe syr de la vale sayd duke let haue wyll olyuer clysson hath soo often tymes dyspleased nowe houre come maye shewe hym dyspleasure wherfore departe hen let shewe cruelte wyll shall dye syr sayd lorde de la vale refrayne euyll wyll moderate courage regarde reason yf ye puth ym deth neuer prynce soo dyshonoured ye shall shall bretayne knyght squyer cyte castell good towne noo man shall hate dethe doo dysenheryte kynge englande counsayle shall gyue thanke therfore syr wyl lese selfe dethe one man syr tourne ymagynacyon thought noo thynge worth dyshonourable ye sholde cause suche honourable knyght syr olyuere clysson dye comynge vnto owne desyre psurely syr dede sholde treason grete reproche bothe god worlde desyre hym thus dyner comynge ye went hym towne desyrynge hym se newe buyldynges obeyed euery thynge dranke wyne ye grete loue ye shewed hym put hym dethe neuer soo grete blame layde ony lorde shall layde ye worlde shal reproche hate mortally glad make warre syr shall shewe ye shall syth ye soo sore hate hym put hym raunsome grete floreynes ye may well holde outher towne castell sholde demaunde agayne ye shall haue loke couenaunt ye make hym shall become pledge therfore duke herde lorde de la vale speke reasonably pressed sore hym maner nyght wolde departe hym duke studyed lytell somwhat refrayned euyll wyll last spake sayd syr de la vale ye good meane hym howbeit wyl ye knowe syr olyuer clysson man worlde moost hate ye sholde skape without dethe nyght wordes hath saued hym go hym demaunde yf wyll paye c frankes incontynente wyll nother haue hym pledge nothynge elles redy money besyde yelde iii castelles towne suche shall name castell breth castel iosselyn castel blancke towne iugon put possessyon deputyes done shall delyuer hym shal done sayd lorde de la vale syr thanke ye wyl thus desyre syr sure ye haue demaunded shall done castelles towne delyuered c frankes payde departe lorde de la vale gretely reioyced sawe constable peryll deth towre dore opened ye lorde de la vale mounted vp came ye constable syttyng sore abasshed loked nothynge dethe sawe lorde de la vale herte reuyued thought tretye hande lorde de la vale sayd syrs take yrons yt maye speke hym fro duke sayd hym syr howe say wyll shall shewe ye truely syr sayd constable yrons taken lorde de la vale drewe hym parte sayd fayre broder grete payne moche busynes haue saued lyfe made ende ye must pay ye departe hen redy money c frankes ouer yelde vp duke iii castelles ye towne iugon otherwyse ye haue delyueraunce constable sayd wyll refuse ye bargayne shall go clysson fetche money fayre broder sayd constable thynke ye must fayne go therfore naye syr sayd lorde de la vale haue promysed neuer departe castell tyll haue knowe wel duke ryght cruell peraduenture myne absence wyll repente hym lyght informacyon al lost shall go sayd constable syr sayd lorde beawmanoyre shall goo pryson wel ye shal make al prouysyon well sayd sayd constable go waye downe ordeyne euery thynge ye lyst phowe constable fraunce delyuered request lorde de la vale payenge certayne raunsome howe constable delyuered duke iii castelles towne payde c frankes ca lxxxv thus lorde de la vale wente downe towre ye duke goynge bed nyght slepte lorde de la vale kneled downe sayd syr ye shall haue al demaunde syr ye must delyuer lorde beawmanoyre maye speke ye constable must go fetche raunsome put men possessyon castelles ye desyre haue wel sayd duke delyuer pryson put chambre meane theyr tretye wyll se retourne agayne haue slepte wyll speke ye lorde de la vale yssued chambre went two knyghtes thyder lorde beawmanoyre pryson gretely abasshed doubted sore dethe fered herde dore open come haue put hym dethe sawe lorde de la vale entre harte reuyued herde hym speke sayenge syr beawmanoyre delyueraunce made wherfore ye maye gladde fetter taken wente another chambre constable also brought thyder mete wyne brought seruauntes howse gladde theyr delyueraunce sory case howbeit myght fynde remedy behoued obey theyr maysters commaundement ryght wronge soone castell gate shote brydge drawen entred yssued nother man woman keyes duke chambre slepte tyll iii clocke knyghtes squyers without abydynge theyr maysters sore abasshed sayd nowe season voyage see lost broken constable myshap fallen counsayle hath dysceyued counsayle ye made assembled wannes made none entente atrappe ye wonte oppynyon yf duke sente hadde made assuraunces yet ye wolde haue gone come commaundement ye doubted hym sore nowe ye wente symply desyre euery man thrughe duchy bretayne complayned constable wyst say knyghtes squyers sayd go enclose duke castel ermyne yf haue slayne constable serue hym lyke maner yf kepe hym pryson let v doo soo maye haue hym agayne fell neuer suche myschefe bretayne thus one sayd none styred forwarde taryed newes thus tydynges spred abrode soo within two dayes parys wherwith kynge vncles duke berrey duke borgoyne grete meruayle ye duke borbon gone aupgnyon go castell sene pope clement way tydynges came hym lyon sure le rone hym erle sauoy erle saynt poule lorde coucy admyrall fraunce beynge harflewe redy haue entred see towarde theyr voyage herde howe duke bretayne hadde taken constable fraunce prysoner castell ermyne lorde de la vale lorde beawmanoyre hym brought tydynges sayd howe bruyte ranne bretayne howe duke bretayne hadde putte dethe constable fraunce lorde beawmanoyre harde tydynges lordes sayd nowe voyage broken lette v gyue leue men warre departe let v goo parys kynge se wyll ye admyrall sayd good soo let men departe peraduenture kynge wyll sende parte may happen castell ye duke borbon goynge thyder elles peraduenture wyl sende bretayne make warre agaynst duke thynke yt ye frensshe kynge wyl suffre ye matter thus ouerpas nay surely ye kyng shal receyue bergayne domage ii c floreynes besyde ye losse hurte done constable yf scape lyfe euer case lyke thus ye kynge breke voyage good mynde haue done domage enemyes let v tary styll ii iii dayes peraduenture shall tydynges fraunce bretayne phowe wrytynges made duke bretaynes deuyse constable rendre towne castelles duke heyres euer howe delyuered duke ca lxxxvi howe let v speke lytell duke bretayne hadde slepte rose made hym redy sente lorde de la vale came hym togyder longe space fynally letter wryten accordynge duke wyll makynge mencyon yt constable syr olyuer clysson renounced clene tytle euer sayd towne castell yelded purely duke bretayne heyres euer wrytynges sholde permanent without ony repell ye lorde beawmanoyre ordeyned constable goo castelles cause rule departe then put possessyon ye duke men besyde leuy redy money cm frankes pay duke concluded gate castell opened lorde beawmanoyre yssued charged ordeyned ye constable accomplysshe ordeynaunces desyred make al dylygence myght hym wente seruauntes duke noysed wente howe constable sure lyfe put raunsome suche loued hym knyghtes squyers glad therof therby sate styll determyned haue gone layde syege castell ermyne haue closed duke therin neuer dyd thynge wolde haue ben gladder tydynges ranne abrode wynde lordes knyghtes beyng harflewe herde therof certayne knowledge constable ben deed lorde de la vale ben sayd delyueraunce towne castelles shall recouer agayne elles tyme leysure frensshe kynge hath ynowe hym yf nede nowe maye departe fro hen voyage broken let v gyue men leue departe let v goo parys lerne tydynges saye suche lentrygnyer countermaunded ye whiche sygne shal go season thus gaue lycence al theyr men warre departe themselfe departed towarde parys kynge lorde beawmanoyre dyd moche within iiii dayes set duke bretaynes seruauntes possessyon foresayd castelles towne iugon payde cm frankes constable raunsome duke commaunded done lorde de la vale sayd ye duke syre haue nowe demaunded cm frankes towne iugon castell boureke whyte castell iosselyn therfore syr nowe delyuer constable contente sayd duke let hym goo wyll gyue hym leue thus ye constable delyuered lorde de la vale departed fro castell ermyne abrode feldes ye constable made longe taryenge bretayne mounted good horse page another rode within two dayes came paris alyghted owne howse wente castel lowre kynge vncles duke berrey borgoyne men folowed hym theyr leysure kynge knewe delyueraunce knewe nere glad herde therof caused chambre dores set open agaynst hym came kynges presence kneled downe hym sayd ryght redoubted lorde fader whome god pardon made constable fraunce whiche offyce power haue well truely exercysed yf ony excepte grace lordes vncles wyll saye haue acquyted myselfe truely done ony thyng contrary crowne fraunce redy cast gage quarell kynge none made none answere wordes sayd ryght dere syr noble kynge fortuned bretayne doynge myne offyce duke bretayne toke helde castell ermyne wolde haue put deth without reason reason fyers courage god ben lorde de la vale constrayned wolde delyuered handes delyuer hym towne myne bretayne iii castelles cm frankes wherfore ryght dere syr noble kynge blame domage duke bretayne hath done gretely regardeth mageste royall voyage company sholde haue made see broken wherfore syr yelde vp offyce constableshyp syr prouyde another suche shall please wyll noo bere charge therof sholde haue none honoure constable sayd kynge knowe well ye haue hurte domage thynge gretely preiudyce royalme wyll incontynente sende peres fraunce se shall best done case therfore take ye thought ye shal haue ryght reason pthen kynge toke constable hande reysed hym vp sayd constable wyl ye departe offyce maner wyll ye vse tyll take counsayle constable kneled downe agayne sayd syr matter toucheth soo nere cannot vse offyce grete must speke answere euery man troubled answere man wherfore syr requyre grace prouyde another season shall alwayes redy commaundement syr sayd duke borgoyne offereth ynoughe ye shall take aduyse true sayd kynge constable arose wente duke berre duke borgoyne aduysed shewe busynes enforme iustely matter seynge case touched gretely gouernynge royalme spekynge herynge hole matter perceyued ye matter touched soo sore made soo fynally blamed hym goynge wannes sayenge hym syth nauy redy knyghtes squyers taryed lentrygnyer pand also ye wannes hadde dyned duke retourned agayne castell bourke ony thynge tary ony longer goo agayne duke castell ermyne syr sayd constable shewed soo fayre semblaunt durst refuse constable sayd duke borgoyne fayre semblauntes grete decepcyons repute subtel take nowe go way matter shall well ynoughe shall regarde leysure constable perceyued well lordes harder ruder hym kynge soo departed wente owne lodgynge thyder came hym certayne lordes parlyament se hym sayd hym matter sholde doo ryght well also came hym counsayle hym erle saynt poule lorde coucy admyrall fraunce sayd hym constable make noo doubte ye shall haue reason duke bretayne hath done agaynst crowne fraunce grete dyspleasure worthy shamed put countrey goo wayes passe tyme mount le herry ye shal owne let v alone matter peres fraunce wyll suffre matter rest thus constable byleued lordes departed fro parys rode mount le herry soo offyce constableshyp voyde season sayd syr guy tremoyle sholde constable soo soo well aduysed wolde take handes syr olyuer clysson phowe tydynges came frensshe kynge partyes almayne whiche hym ryght dyspleasaunt vnto vncles ca lxxxvii weke tydynges came parys takynge constable came also tydynges frome partyes almayne whiche ryght dyspleasaunt kynge vncles shall shewe wherfore duke guerles sone duke iulyers alyed kynge englande make warre agaynst fraunce hadde taken pencyon foure thousande frankes yere whiche pencyon duke iulyers fader hadde tyme past kynge englandes cofers dyed renounced sone yonge toke agayne kynge englandes desyre wolde defye frensshe kynge make warre agaynst hym enclyned take englysshe parte bycause warre lady brabant sawe well duchy brabant fauourable royalme fraunce sholde retourne duke borgoyne chyldren therfore duke guerles wolde shewe matter touched hym nere wolde doo domage myght royalme fraunce theyr alyes sente letter defyaunce ye frensshe kynge whiche thynge pleasaunt accepted kynge counsayle shall shewe hereafter hystory shall conuenyent speke therof shewynge warre bretayne guerles frensshe kynge made noo semblaunt therof made good chere squyer guerles hadde brought defpaunce howbeit afrayde came cyte tourney wolde haue gone f rther shewed defyaunce pro ost towne wolde haue agayne sayenge suffycyent declare message soo noble towne tourney towne arested squyer put hym sure pryson sente worde therof duke borgoyne know pleasure duke wrote prou st tourney sholde sende hym ye squyer defyauces brought parys fered lest sholde dye came parys kynge vncles lordes dyd noo thynge hym courtoysye frensshe kynge gaue hym goblet syluer weynge iiii marke l frankes within gaue hym sa f onduyte retourne countrey reason tydynges ye courte fraunce sore troubled frensshe counsayle sore troubled constable fraunce came made complaynte duke bretayne sawe well trouble expence began ryse euery syde sawe well howe must enploy theyr wyttes exchewe suche inconuenyentes thought constable serued kyng soo longe launders place sholde haue helpe duke bretayne hadde raunsomed hym taken castelles without tytle good reason specyally lorde coucy admyrall sore dyspleased pnowe let v retourne duke lancastre kynge portyngale galyce made sore warre agaynst kynge castell phowe duke lancastres men assayled towne aurene toke gaue vp dyd ca lxxxviii ye haue herde dedes armes done bytwene syr iohan holande syr raynolde roy presence kynge portyngale wyfe kynges departynge promysed duke soone retourned cyte porte wolde tary past vi dayes army sholde sette forthe thenne duke sente constaunce wyfe towne saynt iames vnder guydynge lorde fythwater grete baron englande hundred speres two hundred archer ye duke sayd madame ye shall kepe cyte compostella kynge portyngale sone people shall goo castell seke enemyes fyght wherso euer fynde nowe shall sene yf euer shall haue ony thynge royalme castell syr sayd lady god wyll thus departed present tyme syr thomas percy lorde fythwaren conueyed duches two hundred speres daungers thenne retourned duke departed fro besances towardes towne galyce named aurene whiche rebelled agaynst hym wolde obey bycause stronge therin garyson breton hadde theyr parelles vndertaken kepe well fortefyed bycause hadde knowledge duke wolde come thyder marshall duke oost hadde well herde howe aurene galyce wolde obey dayly fortefyed counsayled constable goo thyder soo euery man drewe parte soo came lodged nere season fayre aboute ascencyon tyme tentes pauylyons pyght vp fayre playnes vnder olyues soo laye al fyrst nyght nexte day without gyuyng ony assaulte thynkynge towne wolde haue gyuen vp dede men towne wolde gladly haue yelded lordes capytaynes wolde suffre breton companyons aduenturers two breton capytaynes called basto alroy bastarde peneforte good men warre well appered toke kepe yt towne farre socour agaynst duke lancastre iii daye englysshemen thus lodged aboute towne well regarded howe myght theyr aduauntage assayle towne thenne constable marshall admyrall caused theyr trompettes sounde assaulte euery man drewe forth felde deuyded iiii bandes assayle towne iii iiii partes goodly ordre approched towne taryed dyke wherin water well fortefyed pale hedge assaulte began iii iiii partes men armes wente downe dyke ax theyr handes therwith cutte downe hedge within cast downe dartes thynges yf hadde ben well pauessed hadde ben many sore hurte slayne also edge dyke archer shotte fyersly within durste appere duke lancastre came beholde assaulte whiche made ye fyerser sate horsbacke space thre houres suche pleasure regarde fyrst assaulte dyke clensed thycke hedge soo men myght goo pale retrayte sowned day duke sayd marshal syr thomas men haue done theyr deuoyre daye let withdrawe case themselfe syr shal done sayd marshall ye assaulte seased euery man wente lodgynge hurte dressed passed nyght wynes drynke plentye soo hoote myghty moche payne drynke suche dranke without water case yt coulde helpe themselfe nexte day nexte day aduysed sholde make none assaulte bycause daye soo hoote theyr men soo wery ouercome stronge wynes determyned nexte daye sholde begyn theyr assaulte sone rysynge endure tyll iii clocke noone euery man comaunded take theyr ease tyll herde sowne marshalles trompet daye ye duke lancastre herde tydynges kynge portyngale howe departed fro cyte porte drewe towardes porte saynt yrayne waye purposed entre castell bothe oostes mete ryuer derne besyde ye towne perpygnen elles towne arpent thus portyngales deuysed kynge castell frensshe men dyd encountre yf lykely doo drawe togyder soner tydynges duke ryght ioyous gaue messagere tydynges x noble mornynge whenne daye marshalles trompet began sowne ye
