lodgynges reyse vp euery man knyghtes squyers began make redy euery man vnder owne standerde marshall drewe felde suche ordeyned goo ye assaulte towne knowledge howe englysshemen wolde assayle theyr watche men herde mershalles trompet breton reysed vp euery man woman towne sayd syrs shewe yourselfe lyke good men abasshed nothynge ye se stronge ynoughe haue dartes speres stone artyllery suffycyent withstande enemyes worste fall tymes wyll take v mercy worse doo v haue ben dyuers place farre febler yet haue kepte without dau ger domage soo reason theyr wordes galycyens incouraged themselfe hadde rather haue yelded vp accordynge trouthe comons castell galyce lytell worth batayle euyll armed small courage gentyll men ryght good horse backe thus englysshemen redy apparelled assaulte aboute sone rysynge came dyke iuste vnto pale are wepons bet downe pale theyr feete yet walle thenne hadde another dyke passe large thenne moche payne passed dyke came walles within sawe come soo nere defended themselfe valyauntly pthenne galycyens cast dartes suche wyse whome soo euer strake soore hurte without well pauessed thenne reysed vp ladder mounte vp walles knyghtes squyers auaunced themselfe mounte targyes ouer theyr heedes swordes theyr handes came fought hande hande bretous defended themselfe ryght nobly repute grete valyauntues wol e abyde assaulte knewe well sholde haue thenne socoure determyned bytwene kynge castell frensshe men suffre englysshmen tyme lyft galyce elles passe without batayle englysshe men sayd yf townes castell gyue v moche doo doth shall longe wynne royalme thenne sayd moche pyllage within towne brought thyder countrey aboute therfore lothe yelde vp towne thenne demaunded capytaynes within ye towne suche knewe sayd two basterdes breton borne good men armes experte syeges one called bastarde pennefort basterde aulroy soeuer valyaunt men armes se none apparence socoure yet wyll yelde vp suche mounted vp beten downe agayne perforce duke lancastre vp redy herde bruyre assaulte sayd wolde goo beholde soo lepte courser vnarmed rode assaulte standerde hym hele armes englande fraunce comynge assaulte encreased thenne euery man auaunced hymselfe gete lawde prayse lyke wyse within whenne sawe duke enforced themselfe shewe theyr valyauntnes thus assaylynge defendynge contynued tyll thre clocke apparent sholde haue wonne ye towne assaulte thenne duke demaunded capytaynes within towne shewed hym thenne sayd wolde marshall sholde speke know yf wyll yelde thynke haue yet ben demauded wherfore byd marshall come speke knyght wente hym sayd syr lorde ye duke wolde ye sholde come speke hym came ye duke duke sayd marshall knowe ye yf breton wyl put themselfe vnder myne obeysaunce trauayle sore men dyuers sore hurte waste artyllery tell shall haue nede therof wherfore praye goo take treatye syr sayd shall done syth ye wyll take mercy reason herde speke marshall wente duke ye assaulte sayd heraulte go thy way fynde meanes speke ye capytaynes within towne shewe wolde speke heraulte departed wente dyke cote armure backe armes duke lancastre soo comoany made hym waye commaundement marshall bastarde alroy sawe wel heraulte came wall sayd heraulte wolde one capytaynes thynke ye sente trewe syr sayd heraulte called percy syr marshall desyreth come barryers speke hym contente sayd bastarde soo ye cause men leue assaulte otherwyse wyll come thynke shall soone done sayd heraulte soo retourned marshall shewed hym ye haue herde pthen marshall called trompet caused hym blowe retrayte soo dydde thenne assaulte seased partyes thenne capytaynes came barryers redy marshal syr iohn holande syr thomas moreaus dyuers englysshemen syrs sayd englysshemen wyll ye taken perforce vtterly lost slayne poore ryche knowe well comonte towne wolde gladly yelde lorde ye duke lady duches gyuen vp towne ye ben wherfore yf ye taken euyll one thynge ye maye sure wyll departe hence tyll haue outher fayre meanes otherwyse therfore speke ye togyder aduyse gyue answere knowe charge syr sayd basterde agreed redy togyder yf ye wyll cause v surely conduyted towne arpent without daunger peryll shall yelde vp towne soo men wom n within maye lyue pea surety vnder obeysaunce duke lyke maner townes galyce none otherwyse knowe well ye marshall oost treatyes perteyneth soeuer ye duke wyll agree trewe sayd syr thomas shall ye desyre soo ye bere nothynge owne robbe pyll towne ye haue wonne ye countrey may cause ryot made bytwene men syr sayd bastarde shall cary nothynge v owne yf ony company haue bought ony thynge ony towne euyll payde yet shall make noo ryot therfore thynke mete drynke syth came hyder garyson men haue payde thynge sayd marshall excepte take vytayle aduauntage soo wyl men say ye shall cary away mouables syr sayd barstarde soo wyse men company wyll take somwhat well sayd syr iohan holande let passe theyr owne theyr owne wyl go nere serche theyr male soo sayd marshall abstynence made daye nexte daye sholde departe ye englyssh men went theyr lodgyng vnarmed toke theyr ease ye breton daye trussed gad red togyder grete pyllage wonne ye countrey castell abandened soo therby suche came fyrste countrey wanne grete good trussynge theyr baggage toke many thynges men towne clothe fethers stuffe suche founde ony ye poore men spake sayenge syrs good ye take none good ye brought hyder ye breton wolde say agayne holde pea ye vyllaynes haue commyssyon kynge castell paye ourselfe wage ye wyll paye v thoughe ye hadde payde v well truely yet must haue newe wage agayne therfore take owne nexte daye marshall lepte horse lx speres company soo came barryers towne taryed space thenne capytaynes breton came thyder marshall sayd syrs ye redy depart ye syr sayd may haue conduyte guyde v whether wyll go sayd marshall towne arpent sayd well sayd quod marshall beholde shall conduyte thenne called forthe knyght englande called syr steuen stebery sayd hym take x speres brynge breton arpent retourne morowe dyd commaunded soo guyded forthe breton moche baggage whenne al departed thenne marshall company entred towne people towne made hym grete reuerence many thought ben ye duke hymselfe marshall sawe breton departe grete caryage demaunded towne yf hadde taken away ony theyr goodes ye syr truely sayd yt grete substaunce dyd sayd marshall shewe yt betymes sholde haue caused haue rendred agayne syr sayd durst thretened slee v yf spake therof syr cursed people none stronge thefe noo meruayle thoughe robbe v eche wyll robbe marshall smyled sente chefe men towne came hym made swere holde towne aurene duke lancastre euer lyke maner fourme townes galyce hadde doone pthen ordeyned newe offycers toke euery man theyr faythes othes dranke retourned duke felde vnder shadowe olyue tree hete sone whiche soo excessyue hoote man horse coulde abyde noo man durst ryde foragynge tyll houre iii hete gretest ymagynacyon duke hadde shewed hym howe kynge castell abrode grete armye comynge agaynst hym fyght sawe well coulde perfytely come chalenge castell force batayle soo sente oute spyes euery coost thenne surely enfourmed hym spyes pylgrymes kynge castell made none assembly come felde kepte hymselfe men garysons also duke borbon come castell tydynges comynge soo duke hadde taryed fyue dayes march auranches determyned goo noye assaye assaulte passe brydge ouer ryuer erne pthen knyght conduyted breton towne arpent retourned agayne demaunded hym company men warre garyson sayd howe syr olyuer clesquy thousande speres breton frensshemen constable marshall sayd duke syr well done wente scrymysshed peraduenture wyll yssue demaunde dedes armes hath grete desyre therto con ente sayd duke let v dyslodge take noo profyte ordeyned dyslodge nexte mornynge goo noye thenne arpent pnowe speke kyng portyngale waye toke entre royalme castell thenne shall retourne agayne duke lancastre phowe kynge portyngale brente towne departed fro porte besyeged ii castelles ca lxxxix kynge portyngale departed porte lefte ye quene wyfe syster doughter duke lancastre kepe cyte ordeyned ye erle nowar abyde hundred speres portyngales gascoynes suche come serue hym rode forthe fyrst nyght lodged thre legges cyte porte nexte daye departed thre batayles fayre softe pace bycause fote men wherof xii thousande caryage kynge folowed thousande speres hym galoys ferrant partecke ponnase de cougne va marten de cougne bare kynges baner also iohn radyghes de sar mayster denyce called ferrant radyghes grete baron knyghtes reregarde ledde constable portyntyngale erle angouse erle escall lytell dan de mondest radygo radyghes vale conseaulx auge saluage geneue iohan ansale popelan lordes knyghtes nombre fyue hundred speres thus rode forth tooke waye saynt yrayne small iourneyes toke theyr lodgynge euer thre clocke came cabase iuberoth taryed ii dayes then two iourneys rode aurach portyngale rested ii dayes came saynt yrayne lodged towne lefte voyde euer syth batayle iuberoth people drawen castel exepte castelles wherin breton poyctenyns garyson kynge portyngale determyned bothe castelles sholde assayled thought honoure myght passe without shewynge dedes armes castellyans hadde wonne castelles therfore thought assaye wynne agayne kynge hadde brought hym cyte porte certayne engynes knewe well sholde haue assaultes waye thus kynge portyngale men lodged match saynt yrayne whiche entre royalme castell longe ryuer pese rynnynge syuyll grete foresayd ryuer myght well brought oost maner thynges frome lyxbone frome porte soo thyrty thousande one constable rowte halfe comonte laye castell perrade eest parte aboute ye castell west parte called tayllydon lay ye marshall company castell perrade capytayne knyght bretayne called syr moreys fouchance experte man armes castell tayllydon syr iaques mountmellyer knyght poyctou eche hadde l speres syege thus lay xv dayes without doynge ony thynge sauynge engynes reysed vp dydde cast x xii tymes daye grete stone agaynst walles lytell hurte dyd couerynge house house within well vawted stone engynes spryngalles dyd men small domage kynge sawe castelles wolde wonne men began waxewery determyned dyslodge entre galyce approche nerer duke lancastres oost entente myght determyne togyder waye best take soo day dyslodged trussed departed fro saynt yrayne whiche tyme brente towne suche wyse place lefte vnbrente able lodge horse castell sawe departe ryght ioyous sowned theyr trompettes made grete chere melody tyll paste daye oost wente lodged pount ferraunt galyce nexte daye vale saynt katheryne iii day came feroull galyce stronge towne holdynge kynge castelles parte rested phowe kynge portyngale oost came feroull assaulted wonne brought vnder obeysaunce duke lancastre ca lxxxx kynge portyngale men feroull founde good countrey constable marshall sayd sholde assaulted affyrmynge howe preygnable two dayes without ony assaulte gyuynge trustynge wolde haue gyuen vp dyd within breton borgonyons sayd wolde defende thyrde daye engynes reysed vp marshall sowned trompettes assaulte euery man made hym redy approche towne within whe herde trompettes blowe assaulte drewe euery man theyr defence woman caryed brought stoones caste castell galyce woman grete defence grete courage maner grete men portyngales came dyke whiche depe water boldely entred dyke clymed vp agayne syde moche doo sauynge well pauessed walles caste downe stoones hurte many caused reeule also ther good castynge dartes bothe outwarde inwarde thus assaulte endured tyll thre clocke men fore chaced sone hoote dyke hadde none eyre wynde thought perysshed hete soo therby assaulte seased season engynes dydde caste towne aduenture thenne marshall counsayled noo moore assaulte towne styll let engynes caste scrymysshe barryers shewe dedes armes deuysed doone dayly scrymysshes made within often tymes closed gate bytwene barryers gate scrymysshe moore theyr ease pand whenne marshall portyngale sawe theyr maner deuysed theron sayd syr iohn ferrant se well sowdyours within season closed bytwene gate barryers let v take v vic men laye bysshment fewe persones let v scrymysshe whyle withdrawe lytell lytell shall se wyll yssue oute truste wynne v thenne let v tourne agayne sodaynely barryers busye somewhat thenne enbusshe horse men sodeynly come se wyll forsake theyr barryers open gate entre soo peraduenture may entre leest yf within open gate without shal al oures true syr sayd syr iohn ferrant well sayd marshall called syr alue perreer ye one feate shall doo goo syr martyne de marlo pomas de congne kepe enbusshe shall go make scrymysshe perteyneth myne offyce deuysed dyd appoynted v c horse men kepe enbusshe iii dayes made noo scrymysshe wherby within garyson hadde meruayle sayd galycyens within towne loye vnhappy people ye wolde haue gyuen vp towne theyr fyrste comynge ben haue gretely preserued honoure towne ye shal se kynge portangale oost shortely departe hen without doynge ony domage v fourthe daye marshall deuysed began scrymysshe small company horse men laye styll pryuely theyr busshment breton within sawe theyr enemyes trust gete good prysoner opened theyr gate lefte styll open entente sholde redyer theyr retourne trysted gretely galycyens within towne came barryers dyd apperteyned scrymysshe marshall sawe tyme made mblaunt thoughe men hadde ben wery halfe dyscomfyted reculed lytell lytell breton saw thought haue wonne opened theyr barryers one yssued came toke xxv prysoners hadde moche haste gete towne lefte theyr barryers styll open marshall made sygne busshement brake vc horse came galoppe entred barryers frenishemen breton sawe wolde haue reculed theyr barryers coulde portyngales entred soone towne thus towne wonne dyuers slayne sowdyours therein garyson taken prysoners excepte suche saued themselfe another gate soo yssued feldes rode arpente syr olyuer elysquy thou ande speres hym shewed howe towne feroull lost thus haue shewed fell towne feroull galyce portyngales wanne dydde put vnder obeysaunce duke lancastre whose tytle made warre kynge portyngale gretely reioyced men hadde done soo well incontynente sente worde therof duke lancastre shewynge hym howe hadde encreased herytage hadde wonne hym towne trusted wynne moo duke gretely reioyced tydynges come noy wherin barroys barreys syr iohn chatelet mouraunte syr trystram de la gayle syr raynolde du roy syr wyllyam mongteney dyuers knyghtes squyers fraunce duke marshall sawe castell noye sayd loke coulongne one keyes castell towarde see soo castell noye another keye towardes castell lorde castell without lorde coulongne noye lette v goo loke company shewed howe baroys barres experte man armes fraunce thynke entrey brydge shall haue scrymyssh syr sayd syr lamburyne luners syr iohn dambreticourte wolde gladly se vaungarde wherin vc speres good men armes rode forthe good ordre duke sente parte company thyder make gretter mustre knewe well marshall wolde shewe dedes armes watche castell sawe vowarde approche sowned alaram thenne capytaynes knewe incontynente englysshmen came thyder armed put themselfe good ordre hundred men armes came theyr barryers xii penons syr barroys barres moost reputacyon pand also hadde chefe charge also syr iohan chatell morant nexte syr thomas moreaus marshall oost sawe nere towne alyghted foote company delyuered theyr horse theyr page came togyder ye barryers theyr speres theyr handes euery vi pace rested kepe themselfe close togyder goodly syght beholde fronte came barryers receyued valy auntly thynke yf ben playne felde ben noo goodlyer dedes armes done done yet barryers bytwene marshall without matched wt syr iohn ye chateau morant within eche sore trauayled hurte eche theyr armure good noone toke domage syr thomas percy coped le barroys mauburyn lyuyers syr wyllyam mongteney syr iohn da bretycourte syr reynolde roy lorde talbot trystram de la gayle thus matched scrymysshed togyder wt theyr speres wery rested knyghtes squyers came scrymysshed theyr place scrymysshe endured tyll hyghe noone archer came ye place gentylmen departed set crosse bowes shote agaynst englysshe archer spanyarde dartes scrymysshed tyl past one clocke came yomen varlettes soo scrymysshed tyll nyght englysshemen retourned castell retourned theyr garyson made good watche aboute halfe legge frome castell noye alonge ryuers syde englysshe men laye whiche ryuer dydde grete ease theyr horse grete lacke water tyll came refresshed v vi dayes wente ye towne arpente se dealynge constable castell frensshmen herde tydynges kynge portyngale laye playnes feroull oost purpose come towne padron galyce whiche ye waye towarde duke englysshemen ordeyned kynge ye duke sholde mete togyder comon determyne howe sholde perceyuer theyr warre pthey ben moneth brode countrey hadde nere hande brought galyce theyr obeysaunce coulde tydynges ye kynge castel ye frensshe men wherfore hadde grete meruayle sayd yt kynge castel somoned people burgus fro partyes royalme castell syuell cordowayne collede spayne lyon struges vale olyue sury yt lxm men vi speres pure frensshe men howe thyder sholde come ye duke borbon sayd departed fraunce come thyder therfore portyngales englysshmen thought drawe togyder stronger redyer yf theyr enemyes come byleued tydynges trouthe wherfore ioyfull wolde gladly haue made ende batayle otherwyse sawe well coulde atteyne theyr desyred entrepryse syr wyllyam lygnac syr gaultyer passac alwayes aboute kynge castell euery weke tydynges fraunce busynes departynge duke borbon howe toke waye auygnyon se pope clement cardynalles euer counsayled kynge fyght tyll duke borbon come amonge tydynges herde duke bretayne howe taken castell ermyne ye constable frau ce raunsomed cm frankes iii castelles towne delyuered duke bretayne howe therby iourney boyage englande broken meruayle purpose duke bretayne dyd supposed counsayle therof came englande thus haue sayd royalme fraunce brought trouble specyally kynges vncles sore moued defyaunce came fro duke guerles fell rude course defyaunces shall shewe declare matter also frenssh kynge vncles sore dyspleased yt duke bretayne broken theyr voyage englande ye see chefe entrepryse taken constable fraunce raunsomed sayd cm frankes taken fro hym iii castelles towne whiche thynge gretely preiudycyall kynge royalme fraunce howbeit kynge sonne passed ouer matter yo ge wherfore regarded sore though ben perfyte age suche auncyent wyse sayd yt suche lyke matter royalme fraunce hath moche tyme past kynge nauare caused syr charles spayne constable fraunce slayne whiche cause kynge iohn neuer loued kynge nauare toke fro hym landes normandy wolde saye yf kynge charles fader kynge nowe lyue loued constable soo well surely wolde reuenged make warre duke bretayne take fro hym landes soo euer cost hym thus euery man spake dede sayd euyll done kynges vncles counsayle royalme somwhat satysfye people sore dyspleased ye duke bretayne determyned prelate iii baron sholde sente duke speke hym reason commau de hym come parys make exscuse yt done thyder sholde go bysshop beawuoys syr myles dornams sage ryght valyaunt man well langaged hym syr iohn bean syr iohn beuell lorde de la ryuer theyr charge sholde saye bysshoppe beaw oys toke waye mount le herry constable ye towne castell perteyned hym kynge charles gyuen hym heyres whyle bysshop sykenes toke hym lay feuer xv dayes dyed stede sente bysshop langers toke waye bretayne myght demaunded howe knewe matter speke proprely answere suche haue made grete dylygence dayes knowe haue serched many royalmes countreys come true knowledge ye matter conteyned hystory wryten wryten god gaue grace haue laysure se dayes haue acquayntaunce hyghe myghty prynces lordes well fraunce englande yere lorde god miiiciiii score x laboured xxxvii yeres age lvii yeres xxxvii yeres man beynge strength wel reteyned euery coost yonge dayes kynge englandes courte v yeres quene also welcome kynge iohn fraunce kynge charles sone myght well lerne many thynges surely alwayes chefe ymagynacyon pleasure enquyre retayne wrytynge howe enfourmed takynge constable fraunce shall shewe yere matter fell rode cyte angyers towres towrayne laye nyght beauforte ye vale nexte day met knyght bretayne called syr wyllyam daucemys rydynge se lady mayll towrayne cosyne chyldren newly wydowe fell aquayntaunce knyght founde hym ryght curtoys swete wordes demaunded hym tydynges specyally takynge constable whiche matter glad knowe trouth therof shewed sayd howe ben ye parlyament wannes ye lorde aucemys cosyne grete baron bretayne lyke maner syr espayne de lyon enfourmed thynges fallen foyze byerne gascoyne also syr iohn ferrant parteke shewed matter portyngale castell lyke maner knyght shewed many thynges wolde haue done ryden longer company thus bytwene mounte le herry premylly iiii grete leages rode softely way shewed many thynges ye whiche bare well remembraunce specyally aduentures bretayne thus rode came nere premylly entred medowe knyght rested sayd god haue mercy soule good constable fraunce dydde one goodly iourney profytable royalme vnder baner syr iohn de bewell constable newly come spayne demaunded hym howe shal shewe sayd whe horsebacke mounted rode forthe fayre easely rode sayde season haue shewed quod knight countre full englysshmen robber pyllers gascoyne breton almayns aduenturers nacions countre bothe sydes ryuer loyre replenysshed warre bytwene frauce englande newly renewed maner theues robber entred countrey assembled fortifyed selfe conquere castell beauforde valey ye sawe late handes countrey thus come purpose englysshmen gascoyns handes towne castell prinulley gretly fortifyed helde also smalle forteresses longe ryuer loyre whan euer wolde ryde nombre bytwene thousande eyght hundred fightynge men sir bertram sir iohan beull lorde mailly knyghtes countrey sette ymaginacions howe myght delyuer coutrey people gathered toguyder fyue hudred speares spyes knewe whan englysshe men wolde ryde purpose come samure capytayns fortress assembled guyder prinully whiche lytell v frenchman rode passed water ye se v layde theselfe busshment wode lytell besyde ryght hande mornynge sonne risynge englysshe men departed prinully nyne hundred men whanne oure men sawe knewe well must fyght comuned toguyder crye shulde call daye wolde haue cryed crye sir bertrame wolde wyse agre therto ouer sayd wolde displaye baner day wolde fyght vnder baner sir iohan de beull ennemyes came medowe lyghted right nowe soone entred brake busshement entred medowe soone sawe v lyghted fote lykewise entred eche within sore foynynge eche agaynst dyuers bothe party ouerthrowen thus batayle endured longe space without knowyng shulde haue vyctorie saye ye trouth chosen men armes many ennemyes yuell armed theues robber howbeit founde v worke ynoughe oure handes full sir moris cresiquede sir geffray richone sir geffray caresnell morsonase folowed sir bertam spurres came refresshed v threscore speares good men armes russhed horse brake oure ennemyes brode coude nat asse ble toguyder agayne whanne capytayus pyllers sawe iourney wente agaynst tooke horse nat abode felde thre hundred slayne taken chase endured saynt mors ryuer loyre entred bastell sir robert sem robert herne richarde gylle iacomyne clerke foure saued selfe passed ouer ryuer loyre entred foure fortress men helde syde ryuer taryed nat longe rode auuergne lymosyn thus iourney coutre aboute delyuered robber assembled nomore toguyder therfore saye ser bertram constable valyaunt man profitable realme fraunce sir quod trewe valyaunt man sir olyuer clesquyn whan named hym clesquyn knight smyled demaunded hym smyled sir quod shall shewe bycause ye name hym clesquyn nat right name neuer thoughe euery man call hym yet bretayne call hym ser bertram lyued wolde gladly haue hadde refourmed coude nat amende worde redyer falle mannes tonge right name desyred hym courtesy shewe great difference bytwene name nay sir quod great difference called clesquyn shulde named glaye aquyne shall shewe haue herde reported howe name came hym trouthe ye shall fynde written auncyent cronycles bretaygne wordes knight greatly pleased said hym sir ye shall great pleasure shewe mater shall neuer forgete sir bertram valyaunt knyght dedes ought put remembraunce true knyght shall shewe thus sir wyllyam aunsiens began tale season whan charles great raigned fraunce conquered augme ted faythe emperour rome kyng fraunce almaygne lyeth ayes chapell kynge charles rede fynde auncyent crony cles ye knowe well knowlege worlde knowen writyng haue nothyng sounde vpon trouthe aproue scripture kyng charles spayne diuers tymes one tyme styll ix yere without retournyng fraunce styll went forthe conquest season kyng sarazyn called aquyn kyng bougie barbary right ouer agaynst spaigne spaygne great countrey begynnyng saynt iohns pie du porte realme arragon nauer bisquay portugale conymbres lixbone ciuyle tollet cordwayne lyon inclosed within spayne great kyng charlemayne coquerid countreis season kyng taryed longe kyng aquyn bougy barbary assembled came see bretaygne arryued porte wannes hadde hym wyfe chyldren conquered went forwarde kynge charles well enfourmed viage howe kynge aquyn prospered bretayne wolde nat breke vyage sayd lette hym alone bretaygne shalbe small mater delyuer countrey hym whan haue one ubdued countrey brought holy faythe kynge aquyn buylded towre see syde nat farre fro wannes goodly fayre towre called glaye kynge aquyn lay moche whan kyng charles accomplisshed vyage acquyted galyce spaygne myscreantes kynges sarazyns deed slayne lande tourned christen faythe retourned bretaygne daye hadde great batayle agaynst kynge aquyne nyghe myscreantes slayne kynge aquyne fledde castell glaye hadde redy foote towre shyppe therin entred wyfe chyldren wyfe made suche haste nere chased hadde leysar take yong sonne laye slepte towre yere olde thus kynge wyfe departed see chylde founde towre glaye brought kynge charlemaygne right ioyouse hym said howe ye chylde shulde baptysed rouland olyuer helde hym ouer fonte named olyuer kyng gaue landes father aquyn conquered chylde whan came age man good knight men called hym sir olyuer de glaye aquyn bycause founde towre glaye kynge aquyn thus haue shewed firste fouudacyon sir bertram clesquyn shulde called glaye aquyne sir bertram dayes puttynge kynge dopeter castyle crowned kyng henry sayde howe wolde go bougy demaude herytage without fayle done kyng henry lent hym men shyppes go bougye great armye great lette nat broken voyage whane prince wale made warre vpon sayde kynge henry dyde put hym downe puissaunce dyde sette castyle agayne peter batayle marres sir bertram taken prisonner sir iohan chandos sette raunsome hu dred thousande frankes another tyme also taken batayle alroy raunsomed agayne hundred thousande frankes thus sir bertrams purpose brokenne warres bytwene englande fraunce renewed hadde ynoughe thus lynially discended fro kynge bougy named aquyne whose kyngdome barbarye thus haue shewed ryght discente sir bertram clesquyn thanked hym came towne prinulley phowe frenche ambassadours came duke bretayne vpon takyng costable frauce aunswere made cap xci ben longe copany knight sir guyllyam aunsens sir espayn de leon wha rode hym fro cyte pauyers ortayes byerne elles long ben sir iohn ferant pertelette portyngale wolde haue shewed many thyng nat dyner whan rydden ii leages came forked waye one way right towres towrayne whether supposed ryde waye maylle whether knyght determyned ryde waye brake company takyng leaue eche bytwene prinulley departynge shewed many thynges specially busynesse bretayne howe bysshoppe langers sent stede bysshoppe beawuoys dyed waye bysshoppe langers sir iohan de bowyll came duke bretayne answere informacyon knyght toke foundacion haue written foloweth ye haue herde fore howe ambassadours departed fro parys fro kyng counsaye well structed shulde saye long rode iourneys aryued nauntes demaunded duke shewed howe marchesse wane whe accustomably lay rode thyder came cytie wannes xx myles bytwene duke castell called le mote came duke semblant made good swete recule bysshoppe langers bycause prelate began speke make preposicyon well sagely sayde sir duke sente fro kynge maister fro vncles duke berrey burgoyne shewe vnto howe haue great marueyle voiage wolde haue made englande meanes broken haue taken raunsomed constable fraunce highe rausome ryght sorie therof moreouer ye wyll haue thre castelles bretaygne whiche shalbe great anoyauce resydue coutre shuloe holde agaynst ayde towne iugone whiche pertaynynge constable herytage therfore charged shewe saye vnto messangers fro kynge mayster vncles ye rendre agayne costable frau ce herytage ye holde hym sette hym agayne peasable possessyon accordyng vnto ryght lyke maner whan delyuered perforce none ryght tytell ye haue also ye restore agayne entierlye money ye haue hadde hym commaundement kynge counsayle ye come sonally parys shall please kyng assygne make excuse repute hym benygne pacyent ye blode royall wyll excuse nat reasonable duke berrey duke burgoyne wyll temper hym ye shalbe frendes cosyn kynge reason ye ought bysshopp tourned hym sir iohan beull said sir nat kynges pleasure sayde yes dyde sir iohan de vyen wordes mo present foure whan duke bretaine herde bysshoppe langers speke studyed lytell good cause great matter laste sayde sir haue well vnderstande wordes good reasone bycause ye sent kyng vncles wherfore behalfe wyll honour reuerence bounde therto demaude request requyreth counsayle wherfore shall take counsayle myne make suche answere ye shall contented sir ye saye well quod suffyceth v departed wente lodgynges nyght desyred dyne nexte daye duke nexte daye came duke well receyued wasshed went dyner satte downe firste bysshoppe langers bycause prelate duke admyrall fraunce thanne sir iohan de beulle hadde great dyner well serued dyner entred counsayle chambre talked dyuers mater herde mynstrelsy lordes fraunce thought surely haue hadde answere hadde none wyne spyces brought made collasyon toke leaue departed lodgynge nexte daye apoynted come duke dyde duke receyued swetely laste sayd sirr knowe well ye looke aunswered wordes haue herde saye ye charged kyng vncles bring answere wherfore say yt haue done nothynge sir olyuer clesquyne wherof shulde repente sauynge one thynge hadde good markette escape lyue saued lyfe loue offyce nat persone hath done soo many displeasure ought hate hym deedly sauynge displeasure kyng vncles cousayle takynge sir olyuer haue nat therby broken voyage see wyll well excuse selfe therin thought non yuell daye toke hym man ought take ennemy whersoeuer fynde hym deed wolde thynke realme fraunce well ruled better counsayle castelles holde whiche hath delyuered possessyon wyll withoute puyssaunce kynge take fro rendringe money aunswere haue moche tyme paste meanes sir olyuer clysquyn ranne dette gretlye therby nowe haue payde bounde vnto reason dette answere duke bretaygne made kynges ambassadours layde forthe reason enduce duke reasonable waye answeres tourned euer one conclusyon whan sawe none waye toke leaues departe ye duke gaue leaue thane retourned dyd moch iourneys came parys house beautie besyde wynsentes kyng quene thyder came duke berrey duke bourgoyne hauyng great desyre knowe answere duke bretaygne haddemade aunswere ye haue herde nede nat shewe agayne kyng counsayle nat content duke bretaygne ambassadours hadde made better exployte sayde howe duke proude man presumptuous mater shulde nat reste peace seynge matter preiudyciall crowne fraunce entensyon kyng counsayle make warre agaynste duke bretayne duke loked nothynge elles sawe knewe well howe greatly displeased kyng counsell hated mortally constable toke fro hym good order reason repented hym sore nat putte hym dethe whan hadde hym daunger thus mater contynued longe season duke bretayne laye wannes lytell lytell rode ouer countrey freared greatly embusshmentes kepte styll loue fauour cyties good townes made secrete treaty englysshmen made castelles forteresses well kepte thoughe opyn warre many imaginacions dede done somtyme wolde say wolde nat taken constable howe sayd euer stoppe mennes mouthes sir olyuer clesquyn sore dishleased hym many man sayd elles wolde neuer haue done therby brought coutre feare small signorie prince nat feared douted menne worste fall maye haue peace whan lyst pnowe lette v leaue speke duke bretaygne let v somwhat speke busynesse realme englade whiche season horryble marueylous phowe kyng englandes vncles one accorde aliauce agaynst kyng counsaile murmurynge people agaynst duke irelande aunswere londoner duke gloucestre cap xcii ye haue herde howe kyng englandes vncles duke yorke duke gloucestre therle salisbury erle arundell erle northumberlande erle notyngham archebysshoppe cauterbury one alyaunce accorde agaynst kynge counsayle lordes nat content wt kynges counsayle sayd among selfe duke irelande dothe kynge lyste realme kyng wyll nat counsayled vnhappy men base lynage taketh regarde great lordes realme longe hath suche counsayle hym busynesse englande nat well realme nat well gouerned kynge well counsayled suche vngracious people sene poore man mouted gret estate fauoure mayster often tymes corrupteth distroyeth people realme man base lynage canne nat knowe parteyneth honoure desyre euer enryche haue theselfe lyke otter water whiche coueteth haue fyndeth hath profyte duke irelande great kyng knowe full well fro whense came yet se realme ruled hym nat kynges vncles none blode ought nat suffred knowe well ynoughe erle oxenforde neuer ye grace valyaunt dede realme honour wysedome counsayle gentylnesse ryght well knowen well knowen one sir iohan chandos prince wale house saynt andrewes burdeaux another demauded mater shall shewe quod knyght present wyne brought day prince chambre many lordes englande hym whan prince dronke bicause sir iohn chandos constable acquitayne prince sente hym cuppe first drinke toke cuppe dranke made therof none offre firste erle oxenforde father duke irelade sir iohan chandos dronke squyer bare cuppe erle hadde suche dispyte sir iohan chandos hadde droke hym refused cuppe wolde nat drinke sayde squyer maner mocke go thy mayster chandos bydde hym drinke shall go said squyer hath dronke redy therfore drinke sythe hath offred ye wyll nat drinke saynt george shall cast drinke face therle whan herd douted squyer wolde sayde toke cuppe sette mouthe dranke leest made semblant drinke sir iohan chandos nat farre then sawe well mater helde hym styll tyll prince gone came erle sayde sir aubery ye displeased dranke constable countrey maye well drinke sythe lorde prince lordes co tente therwith trouthe ye batayle poycters suche knoweth nat well ye dyd shall declare pwhanne lorde prince hadde made voyage languedocke carcassone narbone retourned hyther towne bourdeaux ye toke go englande kynge sayde comynge knowe right well yet nat demaunded ye hadde furnysshed voyage ye done sonne prince ye aunswered howe ye lefte hym good helth bourdeaux kynge sayde howe durste ye bolde retourne without hym commauded whan ye departed ye shulde nat retourne without hym payne ye myght forfayte retourne straitly commaunde within four dayes ye auoyde realme retourne agayne hym fynde within realme fifth day ye shall lese lyfe herytage euer ye feared kynges wordes reason auoyded realme adue ture fortune good truely ye lorde prince foure dayes batayle poicters ye hadde day batayle fourtie speares vnder charge threfore nowe ye mayese wheder ought drinke nat syth constable equytaygne erle orenforde shamed wolde gladlye hadde ben then tyme fayne suffre wordes sir iohan chandos sayde hym opyn presence therfore nat marueyled thoughe duke irelande sonne sayd erle oxenforde disdaynfull folowynge steppe father taketh vpon hym rule englande aboue kynges vncles well quod shulde nat sythe kyng wyll haue thus people realme murmured dyuers place agaynst duke irelande dyde one thyng greatly abated honour firste wyfe doughter lorde coucy lady isabell fayre lady good noble blode fell loue another damosell quenes englande almaygne borne dyde moche pope vrbayne rome deuorsed fro doughter lorde coucy without tytell reason presumpcion synguler appetyte wedded quenes mayde kynge rycharde conseted blynded duke irelande sayd sir whyte tho ben blacke ye kyng wolde nat haue sayd contrarye duke mother greatly displeased dede toke copany first wyfe lady coucy duke dyde yuell therfore length yuell came hym first princypall cause behated englande euery thyng turneth yuell must haue begynning yuell duke irelande trusted moche grace fauour kyng beleued man shulde trouble hym comon renome englade shulde newe taxe raysed realme euery fyre shulde paye noble riche beare poore kynges vncles knewe well wolde harde mater bringe caused certayne wordes sowen abrode cyties good townes englande saye howe people englande sore greued tare talenges howe great rychesse raysed common people wolde haue accomptes gouernours therof archebysshop yorke duke irelande sir symon burle sir mychaell de la pole sir nycholas brable sir robert try lyen ser peter golouser sir iohan salisbury sir iohan beauchampe maisters staple wolles common sayd wolde make trewe accopte shulde founde golde syluer suffycient without raysing newe subsydies common vsage none gladde pay money opyn purse may lette brute noyse spredde brode englande specially cytie london whiche chyefe cytie realme comons rose sayde howe wolde knowe howe realme gouerned sayenge howe longe syth accompte made firste londoner drewe theym syr thomas woodstocke duke gloucestre thoughe yonger brother sir edmonde duke yorke common people reputed duke glocestre valyant sage discrete parson whan came hym sayde syr good cytie london recomaundeth people ingenerall requireth take vpon gouernynge realme knowe well nat vnknowen howe kynge realme gouerned comon people complayneth sore kynges counsayle demaundeth tayles vpon tayles aydes vpon aydes realme hath ben greued tayles subsydies nat accustomed sythe kynges coronacyon fyftie yere nat knowen richesse become wherfore sir maye please prouyde remedy elles mater wyll go yuell common cryeth theron duke answered sayde fayre sir haue herde well speke alone nat remedy mater howe se well ye haue cause coplayne hathe people though vncle kynge sonne kyng though shulde speke therof yet nothynge shalbe done kyng nephue hath suche cou sayle nowe hym whome beleueth better hym selfe whiche cousayle ledeth hym lyste ye wyll come effecte desyres must behoue haue youre accorde agrement cyties good townes englande also prelate noble sonages realme come toguyder kynges presens brother shalbe ye maye saye kynge ryght dere sir ye crowned yonge yuell ye haue ben counsayled yet hyther vnto ye haue nat takenne good regarde busynesse realme reason poore yonge counsayle ye haue aboute wherby matter realme hath hadde small yuell effectes ye haue sene knowen ryght well god haddenat shewed grace realme loste distroyed therfore sir prensens vncles requyre youre grace humble subiectes ought desyre prince grace wyll fynde remedy noble realme englande noble crowne therof whiche discended noble kyng edwarde thirde ye moost noble kynge euer sythe englande firste enhabyted maye susteyned sprosperyte honour people complayneth kepte maynteyned ryght whiche grace dyde swere daye youre coronacion maye please call togyther thre estate realme prelate barownes wysemen cyties good townes may regarde gouernyng realme past well nat sir parceyue hath well thanne suche offyce remaygne styll longe shall please grace founde contrarye thaue courtesse maner auoyded fro persone notable dyscrete persones sette offyce first noble aduyse consent lordes vncles noble prelate barones realme sir quod duke gloucester whan ye haue made supplycacion kynge wyll thanne make maner answere saye wyll take counsayle mater desyre haue ashorte day peyse mater hande putte kynge suche marmosettes hym feare saye hym boldely realme wyll lengar suffre marueyle howe haue suffred longe brother bysshoppe caunterburye erle salisbury erle arundell erle northumberlade wyll without present speke worde therof greatest sonages englande shall ayde susteyne wordes shall say howe desyre reasonable whan hereth v speke wyll agre el dothe amysse thervpon apoynt tyme best counsayle gyue londoner answered sayde sir ye counsayle v nobly sir wyll harde v fynde ye kyng lordes toguyder one place nay nay quod duke maye well done saynt george daye nowe within syre dayes kynge wyll wyndsore ye knowe well duke irelande wyll sir symon burle many brother therle salisbury shall therfore prouyde mater ayenst tyme sir quod shalbe done departed ryght well contente duke gloucester whan saynt george daye came kyng quene wyndsore made great feest predecessours hadde done next daye feest saynt george thyder came londoner nombre threscore horse yorke many many othes dyuers good townes englande lodged towne wyndsore kyng determyned departe place thre leages then whan knewe commyng people speke wt hym wolde sooner haue ben gone sayde wolde wyse speke vncles therle salisbury sayd sir ye may nat honour thus departe people youre good townes englande come hyder speke sir necessary ye knowe demaunde ye maye aunswere el take counsayle aunswere thus full sore agaynst kynges mynde fayne tarye came pres n great hall alowe kynge bothe vncles archebysshoppe caunterbury bysshop wynchester chaunceler erle salisbury erle northumber lande dyuers people made request kyng burges london spake named sir simeon subery sage man well langaged declared well boldely effecte thinformacyon duke glocester shewed ye haue herde whan kyng herde hym well sayd amonge comons realme requestes great long nat ouer soone spedde shall nat toguyder agayne long season also great parte counsayle nat present therfore saye vnto gette home agayne sytte reste come nat agayne tyll feest myghelmas without ye sente whiche tyme parlyament shalbe westmynster come bringe requestes shall shewe counsayle good shall accepte ought refused shall condempne sir thinke nat wyll rewled comon people shall neuer sene gouernynge gouernaunce yt rule vnder v se nothynge right iustyce seuyn one voyce answered sayde right redouted souerayne sayng gracyous displeasure iustyce realme right feble grace knoweth nat canne nat knowe grace nouther demaundeth enquereth therfore suche cousayle forbere shewe bycause owne profyte sir iustyce cutte heedes handes fete suche maner punysshmentes nat laudable sir good iustice kepe people ryght sette suche wayes order myght lyue peace shulde haue none occasyon grudge make commosyon sir saye ye sette v longe daye mighelmas sir may neuer well eased nowe wherfore sir saye one assente wyll haue accompte shortely hath gouerned realme sythe coronacyon wyll knowe youre reuenewes become tax tayles subsydies nyne yeres paste wheron haue bestowed suche treasourers make good accompte nere thervnto shall ryght ioyouse suffre gouerne styll nat acquyte selfe therin trewly shalbe refourmed youre deputyes establysshed purpose lordes vncles wordes kynge behelde vncles helde peace se wolde saye sir thomas duke gloucester sayde sir request prayer good people common realme se nothynge therin ryght reasone sir quod duke yorke trouthe sayde prelate baron present duke gloucester sayde agayne sir reason ye knowe good become kyng sawe well howe one accorde sawe howe chafe marmosettes durst speke worde many gret men agaynst well quod kyng content lette rydde awaye sommer season cometh huntynge tyme whervnto wyll nowe entende kynge sayd people sir wolde ye haue mater shortely dispatched yea sir quod humbly beseche grace also beseche lordes specyally lordes vncles content quod apeysyng party well kynge realme oure parte lyeth therin sayde agayne desyre also reuerende father god archebysshoppe caunterbury bysshoppe lyncolne bysshoppe wynchester aunswered sayde content agayn desyred lordes present erle salisbury erle northumberlande sir reynolde cobham sir guy brian sir iohn felton sir mathewe gourney moreouer sayd wolde ordayne euery good cytie towne englande shulde thre four notable person shulde determyne hole co montie englande mater determyned assemble vtas saint george westmynster ye treasourers collectours offycers kynges make accomptes sayd lordes kyng content therwith brought fayrenesse nat byfore desyre vncles lordes semed hym behouable knowe treasoure become thus amiably euery man deted fro wyndsore lordes went london treasourers offycers sende throughout realme come full accomptes payne dishonourynge losse lyfe phowe day accompte came officer appered presence kynges vncles commens englade howe sir simon burle prisoner toure london howe sir thomas tryuet dyed cap xciii day prefixed came te apered westmynster suche shulde make accomptes apered kynges vncles suche prelate lordes assigned accompte endured moneth made accomptes nother good honourable suche punisshed bothe bodyes goodes sir symon burle cast arerage iic lm frankes bycause one gouernours kynges youthe demaunded good bestowed excused hym selfe bysshop yorke sir wylliam neuell sayeng howe dyde nothyng counsayle kynges chamberleyns ser robert tryuilyen sir robert beauchampe sir iohn salisbury sir nycholas braule sir peter goufer whan demauded therof counsaile denyed mater layd faute hym duke irelande sayd hym priuely bytwene two sir symon vnderstande ye shalbe arested sette prison holde tyll ye haue payed demaunded nothyng shalbe abated go waye whether soeuer sende shall rightwell make peace thoughe sworne contrary ought receyue constable frauce threscore frankes raunsome iohan bretaygne sonne saynt charles bloys whiche ye knowe well owyng shall present counsayle therwith tyme fynally kyng soueraigne lorde shall pardon forgyue clerely ye profet ought mannes el syr sir symon burle thought nat ye shulde helpe agaynst kynge beare dedes wolde departe englande go almayne kyng beame thyder coulde welcome let mater rynne season tyll worlde better apeased duke sayde shall neuer fayle companyons one sect ye shall take day pay demaude knowe well ye maye pay ye lyste redy money hundred thousande frankes ye nede nat feare dethe ye shall nat brought poynte ye shall se mater otherwise chaunge feast saynt michell whan haue kyng one wyll wherof ame sure dothe tyme force agaynst wyll muste apease cursed londoner lay downe slaunder brute nowe raysed agaynst v sir symon burle lytell truste wordes duke irelande came lordes englande duke erles baron counsayle good townes sayde hym sir symon ye haue alwayes ben notable knight realme englade ye well beloued lorde prince ye duke irelande haue maner gouernynge kyng haue sene mater well examyned whiche nother good faire gretly displeaseth v owne sake clerely determynyd hole generall counsayle ye must go prison ye towre london remayne tyll ye haue brought chambre money kynges realmes ye haue gathered whiche apereth treasourers rolles draweth two hundred fyfty thousande frankes nowe loke ye wyll say syr symon halfe discomforted said sir shall good wyll also behoueth fulfyll yo comaundement shall go ye commaunde lordes require let haue clerke assigned maye write suche expense haue layde oute tyme past almayne beame procurynge kinges maryage reast beseche let haue kynges grace may haue reasonable dayes pay sir quod lordes content thus syr symon burle prison towre london constable spake ser willyam helmon sir thomas tryuet nat greatly ye fauour barones englande commontie realme vyage made flaunders sayd neuer englysshmen made shamefull vyage bysshoppe norwyche sir hughe caurell capitayne calais excused layde others charge howe hadde taken money gyueng vp burbourcke grauelyng sayd dede trayson sent sir wylliam helmon came sir thomas tryuer excused shall shewe howe pthe weke sente beyng owne house northe te rode feldes vpon yonge horse hadde spurred hym horse ranne awaye hym ouer busshes hedge laste fell dyke brake necke sir thomas triuet dyed whiche great domage dethe greatlye complayned many good menne realme yet heyres fayne paye certayne somme floreyns counsayle kynges behoue sayde chiefe encytyng mater came kynges vncles generall counsayle cou trey appered englande trouthe thoughe duke gloucestre yongest brother age yet moost auncyent busynesse realme drewe opinyon moost noble menne prelate common helde whan sir thems tryuettes coposicion made dethe maner ye haue herde therby penauce sir wylliam helmon greatly asswaged entred counsayle meanes valyantnesse body good seruyce done dyuers tymes englande well bourdeloyes guyen picardye alwayes proued good knight nothynge layde reproche takynge money delyuerauce burborcke grauelynge excused hymselfe fayre swete wordes made dyuers reasonable reason sayd lordes euer lyke case yt tyme garyson bourburke thynke wolde dyd haue herde sir iohn chandos sir gaultier manny say dyuers tymes right wyse gret valure howe man ought two iii wayes chose best waye wherby endomage enemyes thus sir thomas tryuet beyng garysons bourburke grauelyng sawe howe enclosed party conforte aperyng v parte parceyued well howe coulde nat endure many assautes laye v chosen men armes euer sawe trowe englysshemenne knewe iustely reporte harraude leest syxtene thousande men armes knyghtes squyers xl thousande nat paste thre hundred speares many archer also garysone suche cyrcuyte coude nat entede euery place well ceyued assaut made v daye whyle oure defence one parte caste fyre parte wherby gretly abasshed ennemyes right well parceyued therfore saye trouthe frenche kyng counsaile wrought great ge tylnesse seyng ye case gyue v trewse gyuen v another assaute nexte daye ordayned thynke hadde taken v pleasure yet courtesly treated v meanes duke bretayne tooke great payne mater shulde haue gyuen theym money raunsommes hadde ben taken lykely gaue v money wherby dyde dommage haue endomaged v thought conquered greatly whan money departed oure selfe safe withoute trouble hadde v warre tyme fronters flauders lordes besyde pourge blame sone englande without knight esquyer except son lordes duke lacastre yorke glocester wyll saye abyde therby haue done vntrouthe kynge naturall lorde accuse trayson redye receyue gauge putte body aduenture dedes armes proue co trarye iudge therto assigned shall ordayne wordes suche valyauntnesse knighte excused hym greatlye saued hym frome parell dethe afterwarde retourned agayne fourmer estate ryght valyaunt knyght auaunsed kynges counsayle tyme sir symon burle nat delyuered prisone kynges vncles hated hym gretlye soo dyde commontie englande ky ge dyde myght haue hadde hym delyuered seasone laye shene counsayle said myght nat rekenynges nat clere kynge departed ye duke irelande company rode towardes bristowe quene ladyes damoselles phowe kynge englande departed london howe syr symon burle beheded lo nephue also howe duke lancaster dyspleased cap xciiii kynge departed marchesse london yet kynges vncles counsayle departed nat taried styll london ye haue herde often tymes sayde heed sicke membres nat well malady must first pourged saye bicause duke irelande great kyng ruled hym lyste sir symon burle two princypall cou saylours kynge hadde longe season gouerned kynge realme suspecte hadde gadered richesse without nombre renoume ranne dyuers place duke irelande sir symon burle long season gathered toguyder money sente almayne come knowledge kynges vncles counsaylours good cyties townes englande helde partie howe sente castell douer see night tyme almayne certayne cofers chestes full money sayd falsely felonously done assemble rychesse realme sende strauge coutreys wherby realme greatly impouerysshed ye people soroufull sayde golde syluer dere gette marchandyse deed loste coulde nat ymagin meanes wordes multiplied suche wise ordayned ye kynges vncles counsayles good townes anne ed vnto ser symon burle de ser ued punisshment dethe also archbysshoppe caunterbury sayd season whan freche kyng shulde haue come armye englande sir symon burle gaue counsayle shrine saynt thoms cau terburye shulde haue taken downe brought douer castell noyse wolde haue thentent ben dager haue taken stollen conueyed englad mater layde charge yt none excuse coulde herde daye brought towre beheeded lyke traytour god haue mercy soule write shamefull dethe ryght sore displeaseth howe must nedes folowe hystorie greatly complayne dethe whane yonge founde hym gentyll knyght sage wyse enfortune dyed nephewe heyre sir richarde burle duke lancastre galyce sameseason case fell englande one ye renoumed hoost nexte constable souerayne marshall hoost chiefe cousayle duke ye may well beleue whan knewe dethe vncle sore displeased also getyll knight sir richarde burle dyed iourney bedde reason sickenesse many dyde ye shall place tyme conuenyent whan kynge rycharde knewe dethe knyght marchesse wale sore dyspleased sware howe mater shulde nat passe sithe put dethe knyght without good reason tytell right quene also sorie wepte dethe bycause fetched oute almaygne suche kynges cousayle douted greatly duke irelande sir nicholas bra ble sir thomas tryuilyen sir iohn beauchampe sir iohan salisbury sir mychaell de la poule also kyng vncles put offyce archebysshoppe yf yorke named wylliam neuell brother germayne lorde neuell northuberlande whiche bysshoppe longe ben treasourer englande duke gloucestre charged hym medell busynesse realme payne lyfe shulde go yorke therabout whe pleased hym benifyce dwell ther medell also shewed hym howe honoure lynage preest excused hym many great mater sore preiudiciall honour also shewed hym moost parte counsayle comontie wolde haue disgrated putte dethe lyke maner sir symon burle departed fro london wente northe dwell benifyce lynage sore dyspleased thought surely erle northombrelande brought mater passe lygnage neyghbours rome chosen right valyant wyse sage clerke ye archebysshop caunterbury gretely fauour kynges vncles come mountague salysburies vncle erle salysbury made kynges counsayle aduyse comons therle salysbury erle rycharde arundell erle northumberlande erle deuonshyre erle notyngham ye bysshop norwyche called sir henry spenser bysshop wynchestre chauncellour englande abode styll offyce kynges vncles renomed man ye counsayle nexte ye duke gloceste syr thomas mountague archbisshop cauterbury well worthy dyscrete prelate toke grete payne reforme royalme brynge ryght waye kynge shulde put hym marmosettes troubled royalme often tymes wolde speke duke yorke yt matter duke wolde saye hym syr bysshop trust matter shall otherwyse fall lytell lytell kynge nephewe ye duke irelade thinketh must done accordynge reason abyde tyme hasty good meane surely yf hadde nat perceyued tymes wolde haue brought kynge royal suche case shulde haue ben poynte lesynge frensshe kynge counsayle knewe ryght well dealyng case caused yt frensshe men auaunce themselfe haue come hyder puyssauntly wolde haue done haue dystroyed v phowe counsayle drewe togyder reformacyon kynge realme howe counsayle duke irelande kynge accorde make warre agaynst vncles agaynst cytees townes ca xcv lyke maner kinges vncles ye newe counsayle englande beynge london deuysed busynesse engla de reforme bring good estate syde duke irelande counsayle ymagined nyght daye howe myght contynue estate condepne kynges vncles ye shall hereafter whanne kyng richarde come bristowe quene hym kepte selfe castell men farre beleued ye kyng laye sauour duke irelande said wolde go irelande sayd kyng wolde se hym dispatched agreed generall cousaile wolde go irelande shulde haue coste realme fyue hudred men armes fyftene hundred archer shulde abide thre yere well trewly payde howe duke great wyll make vyage sawe well kyng yonge myght rule lyst therfore feared shulde go farre loue fauour kynge shulde asswage also besyde suche loue one quenes damoselles called lancegrone yt wyse coude leaue syght fayre pleasaunt vamosell come ye quene realme beame duke loued entierlye wolde gladly deuorsed fro owne wife doughter lorde coucy dyde sende entente rome pope vrbayne good people realme marueyle therof dispreysed hym greatly good lady dought doughter good kyng edwarde ye good quene philyppe duke yorke duke gloucestre toke dede great dispyte hate duke irelande set lytell therby blynded louynge damosell promysed deuorsed mary douted nat pope graunt myght gette kynges quenes good wyll reputed wyfe freche brought vp fraunce father ye lorde coucy made warre agaynst pope vrbayne tytell pope clemet wherfore pope vrbayne loued nat yt blode therfore sayde pope wolde enclyne lyghtlyer deuorse mater duke dyde putte forthe promysed la cegrone mary duke mother wydowe called olde countesse oxenforde agreed nat opynion sonne blamed hym greatly folye sayde howe god wolde sore displeased hym paye hym one day thane wolde late repente toke duchesse kept styll estate suche ought ladye good wyll gaue great thankes therfore thus haue shewed parte busynesse englande fell season yet shalle procede enfourmed ye haue herde howe duke irelande aboute kynge march wale nyght daye ymagyned none thynge howe myght bringe entent serued kynge quene fayre wordes please theym caused knyghtes squyers come bustowe se kyng ye quene made great sporte huntyng kynge suffred hym lyste season kynge laye bristowe ryuer syuerne march wale duke irelande tooke great payne ryde specially wale sayd suche wolde hym gentylmen howe kynges vncles haue soueraygntie realme hadde dismyssed kynges cousayle noble valyaunt sage personnages archebysshoppe yorke bysshoppe dyrhame bysshoppe london sir mychaell de la poule sir nicholas bramble sir iohan salisbury sir robert tryuilyen sir iohan beauchampe hym selfe hadde putte dethe valyaunt knyght sir symon burle multiplye estate wyll distroye englande duke irelande dyde moche preached people knyghtes squyers wale countreis aboute moost parte beleued hym daye came ingenerall kynge bristowe demau ded hym pleasure duke irelande hadde shewed theym kynge aunswered sayd yea truely prayed commaunded loued hym beleue hym sayd wolde auowe shulde affyrmyng thought vncles hygh mynded feared leste wolde surmounte hym take awaye realme hym march wale alwayes loued prince wale father ye kyng ye tidynges herde march london thought iustely kyng duke irelande good cause demaunded kynge pleasure kynge aunswered sayd howe wolde gladly lodoners hadde done hym great trespass corrected brought reason vncles lykewise wale sayd bounde obey kyng ought fayth homage man hym kynge soueraygne lorde wherfore sayde redy go whyder soeuer kyng dyd commaunde kynge well co tente aunswere lykewise duke irelande whan duke sawe kyng wolde shewe busynesse parteynynge hym selfe hadde good desyre distroye aduersaries bringe theym reason hadde therof great ioye sayde counsayle nat better retourne london shewe puissaunce outher fayre wordes otherwyse bring lodoners accorde obeysaunt kynges commaundement alwayes enfourmed kynge howe great losse realme whan many heedes chefe gouernours howe coude good come therby kynge affyrmed ye sayde howe wolde lenger suffre wolde fynde suche remedy realmes shulde take ensample realme nowe sir reporte haue nat good cause saye ye realme englande season great paryll aduenture haue ben lost without recouery kynge moued agaynst vncles agaynst great parte ye great lordes realme agaynst hym cytes good townes one another prelate hadde great indignacyon one agaynst another none coude remedy alonely god whan duke irelande sawe agrement kyng moost te coutrey wale came kyng sayd sir ye wyll instytute make lieutenaunt shall take xii fyftene thousade men go marchesse london oxenforde cyte myne wyll shewe puyssaunce agaynst londoner vncles haue great indignacyon agaynst haue putte dethe counsayle sir outher fayre wordes otherwyse shall bringe reason kynge sayde content sayeng wyll ordayne cheife souerayne realme reyse vp men ye gette theym leade wheder ye thynke best augment sygnorie realme entent euery man shall clerely se hoole realme parteyneth wyll ye beare banner standerdes abylmetes warre suche wolde beare selfe batayle thynke people se banner displayed shall take corage hardynesse susteyne quarell wyll ye punysshe suche rebelles wyll nat obey suche wyse maye take ensample beleue suche shall se banner waue wynde shall put selfe vnder shalbe afrayde disobey comau dement wordes greatly reioysed duke irelande pohwe kyng englande made somons drawe towardes london howe sir robert tryuylyen taken westmynster beheeded commaundement kynges vncles capi xcvi kyng made assemble countrey wale fro ters bristowe longe ryuer syuerne dyuers lordes knightes sende excused selfe laufully came kynges commaudement howe douted leste great yuell shulde come enterprice meane season kynge duke irelande secrete counsayle bytwene determyned sede men marchesse london se knowe howe kynges vncles dyd purposed studyed whome myght sende busynesse knowe trouthe knyght cosyn duke irelande cou sayle called sir robert tryuilyen sayd sir ye make doute whome sende trusty london loue shall take iourney wherof duke thanked hym lykewise dyde kyng therwith sir robert tryuilyen departed bristowe disguysed maner poore marchaunt vpon lytell nagge came london tooke lodgynge vnknowen taryed certayne space lerned coulde last vnderstode kynges vncles newe counsayle englande wolde kepe secrete parlyament westmynster wherfore thought go lye lerne shulde doone came lodged westmynster daye counsaile began lodged al house right ouer agaynst palys gate chambre lokyng wyndowe downe courte myght se went cousaile knewe nerehade euery man none knewe hym bycause apparel last day asquyer duke gloucester knewe hym often tymes ben copany assone sir robert triuylien sawe knewe well withdrewe hym selfe ye wyndowe squyer suspecious therof sayd hym selfe thynke se yonder sir robert triuylen thentent knowe trouthe entred lodgyng said wife dame aboue chambre alone copany sir quod nat shewe hath longe space therwith squier went vp better aduyse hym saluted hym sawe well true fayned hymselfe tourned tale sayde god saue good man pray nat myscontented toke farmour myne essere ye lyke hym sir quod kente farmour sir iohan hollandes men bysshop cauterburyes wolde wrong come hyther complayne cousayle well quod squier ye come ye palys wyll helpe make waye ye shall speke lordes counsayle sir thanke shall nat refuce ayde squyer called potte ale dranke payed badde hym farwell departed neuer seased tyll came cousayle chambre dore called vssher open dore vssher demauded wolde bycause lordes counsayle answered sayd wolde speke lorde mayster duke gloucester mater ryght nere toucheth hym counsayle thanne vssher let hym whan came mayster sayde sir haue brought great tidynges quod duke sir quod squyer wyll speke loude toucheth lordes present haue sene sir robert triuylyen disguysed vyllayns habytte alehouse without gate triuylien quod duke yea truely sir quod squier ye shall haue hym ye go dyner please contente quod duke shall shewe v newes mayster duke irelande go thy waye fetche hym loke thou stronge ynoughe thou fayle nat squier went forthe toke foure sergiauntes hym sayd sir folowe farre soone make sygne laye hande man go take hym lette hym nat escape therwith squyer entredde house tryuylien went vp chambre soone sawe hym sayd triuylien ye nat come countre goodnesse lorde duke gloucester comaudeth ye come speke hym knyght wolde haue excused hym selfe sayde nat triuylien fermour sir iohan hollandes nay naye quod squyer body triuylien habytte nat therwith made token sergiauntes shulde take went vp chambre toke hym brought hym palays ye may sure great prease se hym well knowen takyng duke gloucestre ryght ioyefull wolde se hym whan presens duke sayd triuylien thinge make countre kyng lefte hym triuylien wha saw well knowen none excusacion coude aueyle hym sayd sir kynge sente hyther lerne tidynges bristowe hunteth along ryuer syuerne quod duke ye nat coe lyke wyse man rather lyke spye yf ye wolde haue come haue lerned tidynges ye shulde haue come state knyght sir quod triuylien haue trespassed pardone caused well sir quod duke mayster duke irelande sir quod trouth kyng shewed v quod duke assembleth moche people kynge hym wheder wyll lede people sir quod go ireland irelande quod duke gloucester yea sir truely quod triuylien duke studyed lytell sayde triuylen triuylien youre busynesse nouther fayre good ye haue done great folly come countre ye nat beloued shall well sene suche affinyte haue done great displeasure brother ye haue troubled power youre yuell counsayle kyng dyuers noble ye realme also ye haue moued certayne good townes agaynst v nowe daye come ye shall haue payment dothe well reason shulde fynde thynke youre busynesse wyll nother eate drinke tyll ye deed worde greatlye abasshed triuylen gladlye man wolde ende wolde fayne haue excused hym selfe fayre language lowly humblyng hym self coude nothyng apease duke enfourmed hym duke irelandes secte nothyng aueyled hym shulde make lengar mater sir robert triuylien delyuered hangman ledde westmynster beheeded haged gibet thus ended sir robert triuylien phowe tidynges came kyng dethe knight demau ded counsayle theron howe ordayned duke irelande soueraygne men warre capi xcvii shortely tidyng came kynge richarde duke irelande beyng bristowe howe sir roberte tryuylyen shamefully putte dethe kyng toke mater great dispite sayd sware mater shulde nat rest case howe vncles done yuell without tytle reason put dethe men knyghtes suche truely serued hym father prince wherby sayde semed wolde take fro hym crown englande ye mater touched hym nere archbysshope yorke souerayne counsaile ben longe said sir ye demaunde cousayle shall gyue counsayle vncles suche ben accorde erreth greatly agaynst semeth wolde shewe howe ye cousailed traytors wolde haue none beate rule selfe great parell ye realme comons shulde ryse rebell gret myschefe shulde fall englande lordes great men nat frendes toguyder one wherfore sir counsayle fynde remedy puissauce ye countrey well peopled named sende comaundement suche boude serue gentylmen whan assembled sende marchesse london make generall capitayne duke irelade gladly wyll take hym ye charge let baner penon borne onely shewe therby matter toucheth man countrey goyng thyder wyll tourne take parte wt drawe baners parauenture landoners wyll take parte hate nat ye dyde neuer displeasure hurte ye haue vncles haue caused sir sir nicholas bramble hath ben mayre lodon ye made hym knyght suche seruyce dyde daye knoweth ought knowe maner lodon borne ther nat yt hath good fredes therfore sir desire cousail mater yt toucheth nere sir yuell enformacyon rumoure people ye maye lese signorye kynge spake sir nicholas bramble requyred hym speke kynges request sir nycholas sayd sir lyke grace lord present shall speke gladly lytell knowledge haue fyrst saye nat beleue moost te londoner oweth loue fauour kyng perfitely loued prince father well shewed whan villayns rebelled accordyng ye trouthe hadde taken parte villayns distroyed kyng realme moreouer kynges vncles haue nowe good tyme disport selfe among enforme people lyfte none saye agaynst haue put kynges fycers haue put affynite haue sente kynge hyder one border realme good ymagined nat knowen per rely entende herde mater shewe wolde putte kyng realme go puyssaunce kynge dothe gentylnesse haue put dethe gentyll knyght sir symon burle hath doone kyng moche fayre seruyce realme englade place layde great falsenesse hym shulde haue delyuered castell douer frenche men enformed people caused frenchman come flauders sluse whiche nothyng also dispyte kyng haue sha fully slayne sir robert triuylien wyll maye atteygne entente wherfore saye better kyng vse rygour puyssauce gentylnesse euery man knoweth thorough realme kyng howe westmynster ye noble kyng edwarde made euery man sworne bothe lordes prelate good townes dyscease shulde take kynge soueraygne lorde othe made thre vncles semeth many men dare speke holde nat state fourme kynge may nat owne lyst driue hym pensyon quene also whiche herde thyng kyng quene shulde seme wolde shewe wytte rule themselfe cousaylours traytours saye thynges nat suffred hadde rather dye longe lyue dauger peryll se kynge ledde vncles wolde haue hym kynge thanne sayd surely pleaseth nat v saye ye haue counsayled honourably maye honour v realme counsayle bristo ordayned duke irelande shulde soueraygne kynges men warre suche coude get go lo knowe perfyte entente londoner trustynge myght one speke ourne acorde reason suche proftes wolde make kynges name within shorte space duke irelande fyftene thousand men deted fro bristowe rode cytie oxenforde aboute lodged people baners displayed kynges armes none shewe dyde kynges tytell quarell tyding came kynges vncles duke irelande aproched towardes lodon xv thousande men kynges baners displayed daye lordes counsayle westmynst r chefe lodon suche trusted best shewed duke irelade comyng agaynst armye royall londoner enclyned partie sayde sir let come name god yf duke irelande demaude v batayle shall haue inco tynent close gate haue xv men nat xx duke right ioyfull answere inco tynent sent knyghtes squyers messangers assemble men warre togyder fro dyuers tie suche sent obeyed sworne promysed men came fro ye bysihaprike cau terbury norwiche couties arundell sussex salisbury southampton countreis therabout london great nombre people came lodon knewe nat shulde phowe duke irlande sente thre knyghtes london knowe tydynges howe kynges vncles london went feldes fyght duke irelande affinyte cap xcviii nowe let v sowhat speke duke irelande cousell oxford xvm men howbeit parte come thyder constraynt rather good corage ye duke irlande aduised knowe thentetes lodon sende sir nicholas bra ble sir peter golofer sir michaell de la pole towre london go thyder water set kynges baners hyght towre se londoner wolde thre knyghtes ye duke irlandes request deted fro oxeforde next day passed temes bridge stanes rode dyner shene ye kynges place taryed tyll late fro then rode another house kyng called kenyngton lefte horse toke botes went downe water ye tyde passed lodon bridge came towre nat knowen man ware comynge froude redy capitayne ye towre kynge sette hym knyghtes knewe moche dealyng lodon kynges vncles capitayne shewed howe come thyder lodge great dauger kynges seruautes may well lodge house nat quod capitayne cytie counsaile wolde gladly vnder obeysauce kyng wolde ruled vncles none shewe good wyll boude shew cousaile best power dout morowe whan day cometh knowen london seruauntes kynges become hyther ye shall se towre besieged bothe lande water londoner nat dete hen tyll se knowe lodged within ye founde ye shalbe incontynent presented kynges vncles ye may well ymagin ende ye shall come thynke sore displeased agaynst kynges cousayle agaynst duke irelade ye taken ye shall nat escape lyues study well vpon wordes assure true pthan thre knightes wende haue done marueyls fore abasshed determyned tary night secrete coulde feare spyeng capitayne promysed kepe sure nyght kept keyes hym mornynge kynghtes dyuers ymaginacions counsayles se howe shulde deale thynges cosydred durst nat abyde aduenture knowen feared greatly beseged day came whan fludde come tooke barge passed bridge went kenyngton whan daye toke horse rode wyndsore taryed nyght nexte day rode oxeforde founde duke irlande men shewed tidynges howe durst nat tary towre lodon duke pensyfe tidynges wyst nat say knewe well people yt assembled nat one corage wherfore wyst nat wheder better retourne ye kyng abide toke counsayle knyghtes fynally cousayle rested sythe ye kyng ordayned hym constable ouer people correcte punysshe rebelles shulde kepe felde shulde otherwyse shulde great blame rebuke bring indignacion kyng shewe quarell nother good right also said better dye honour abyde aduenture shewe false corage counsayled hym sende worde case kyng bristowe yet sayd blessed god kepte feldes none recoutre thus ye duke sent kyng desyring hym sende hym ayde kyng dyde daylye tidynges came kynges vncles lodon duke irlande company marchesse oxenforde toke counsayle best kynges vncles archebysshop cauterbury erle arundell erle salysbury erle northumberlande dyuers lordes knyghtes englande ruler london ordayned duke gloucester without delay shulde issue feldes mayre london shulde putte harnesse people euery warde suche wolde ayde sayeng surely howe wolde go fyght duke irlande whersoeuer coude fynde hym mayre london man armes toke chosen men bytwene age twentie yeres xl lordes thousande men armes departed fro london went lodged braynford nexte daye colebroke dayly nombre encreased toke waye redyng passe temmes aboute bridge bytwene wyndsore stanes broken comaundement duke irelande long iourneyed aproched nere oxenforde tidynges therof none came duke irelande beganne dout toke counsayle cou sayled take feldes put people order batayle display yt kynges baners sayeng grace god saynt george iourney shulde deuysed doone sowned trumpettes euery man armed hym issued oxenforde order batayle kynges baners displayed day fayre clere pleasaunt season phow kynges vncles wan iourney agaynst duke irelade howe fledde dyuers company cap xcix tidinges came duke gloucester beyng within thre leages oxenforde ryuer syde whiche falleth te me lytell besyde oxenforde howe duke irelande drawen feldes order batayle wherof duke gloucester great ioye sayde howe wolde fyght hym myght passe ryuer trumpettes sowned ye dislodging ordered selfe redy fyght within two leages ennemyes sertched passe ryuer sente oute people sertche depnesse water foude ryuer suche apoynt xxx yeres nat base ye scurers passed ease rode aduysed maner ennemyes retourned duke gloucester sayd sir god ryuer daye parte ryuer lowe nat horse bely sir haue sene maner duke irelade redy raynged felde good maner nat saye kyng kyng baners armes englande fraunce none well duke goddes name armes brother haue parte auauce forward name god saynt george let v gose nerer euery man rode forthe great courage whan knewe myght passe ryuer ease shortlye hoost passed ryuer tidynges came duke irelad howe kynges vncles passed ryuer temes shulde haue batayle brefely duke irelande abasshed knewe well taken ye duke glocester wolde cause hym dye shamefully nouther golde syluer shulde raunsome hym sayde sir peter golofer sir mychaell pole sir surely corage beareth yuell agaynst iourney dare nat abyde ye bataile agaynst kynges vncles take shall dye shamefully howe deuyll passed ryuer temes poore token v sir quod two knyghtes wyll ye wyll saue also quod duke rest saue well sir quod knyghtes lette v drawe selfe syde wynge shall haue two strynges bowe shall se howe men well shall abyde honour ye kyng hath sent v hither discofited shall take yt feldes take aduauntage flyeng saue selfe may cousayle holden good duke two knyghtes rode long batayle made good vysage sayd sir kepe batayls good order grace god saynt george shall haue daye fayre iourney ryght kynges quarell therfore shall spede better thus rode vp downe dissymulynge laste gette selfe prease came one corner batayle made wynge therwith came duke yorke duke gloucestre lordes baners displayed makyng great noyse trumpettes soone duke irelandes company sawe comynge good order fiersly aba shed helde none arraye tourned backes fledde ye noyse ran howe duke irelande cou sayle edde gone euerye man fledde hyther thyder wyste nat whyder without makynge defence duke irelande two knyghtes counsayle fledde biforce horse mynde returne towne oxenforde withdrewe then moche myght whan ye duke gloucester sawe demeanour enemyes sawe howe fledde hadde remorse consciece wolde nat ye yuell myght haue done knewe well many presente rather constraynt insytacion duke irelande good loue therfore sayd men sir iourney charge euery man payne dethe ye slee man without make defence ye gete knightes squyers bring comaundement done fewe slayne without prease rode one ouer another ye chase taken lytell sir iohan beauchampe sir iohan salisbury presented duke glocester right ioyous duke tooke waye oxenforde gaue leaue men warre retourne owne house thanked seruyce done hym brother sayd ye mayre london company sir departe home agayne wherof gladde thus departed armye phowe duke irelande company fledde howe kynges vncles oxenforde howe sir nycholas brable beheeded howe kynge sent bysshop caunterbury capi c howe shall shewe became ye duke irelande sir peter golofer sir michaell de la pole shewed saued theselfe nedefull hadde ben taken suffred dethe without mercy nat saye went kyng nat dyde taried nat long departed realme englade assone coude haue herde reported rode wale toke shypping carleon sayled scotlande came edenborowe toke another shyppe sayled costyng friselande yle theseley coutre hollande came arryued towne dondrest gladde enformed duke irelade long coueyed lobardes moche golde syluer brug feare casueltes though great kyng yet always douted ye kynges vncles comons realme wherfore made prouisyon hande money ayde hym whan nede shewed threscore thousande frankes receyued redempcyon chyldren bretayne specially iohn bretayne guy deed whiche money sayde founde redy co mynge shulde receyue thre yere threscore thousande frankes wherfore nat abasshed substauce suffycient longe space whan duke aubert bauyer haynalte holande zelande gouernaunce vnder erle willyam brother lyuynge whan vnderstode duke irelande come fugetyue englande towne dordrest studyed imagyned lytell thought shulde nat longe abyde seynge fledde englande yuell wyll cosyn germayns whome bare loue fauour also consydred howe duke irelande dalte yuell cosyn germayen lady isabell englande lady coucy wherfore commaunded duke irelande bycause hadde displeased cosyns englande broken laufull mariage wolde mary another wyfe shulde departe countrey gette hym another lodgynge shulde nat suffred abyde towne countrey whan duke herde douted shulde taken delyuered handes enemyes humyled hym selfe greatly sente hym sayde wolde gladly obey duke aubertes commaundement payed trussed entred vessell ryuer mornegue dyd moche water lande came berette whiche towne pertayned bysshoppe trece well receyued taryed tyll harde tydinges nowe let v leaue spekyng hym speke englande endynge iourney kynges vncles agaynste duke irelade besyde oxenforde euery man gone home bysshoppe caunterbury two duke taryed styll oxenforde nat tell howe long beheededde lytell beauchampe sir iohan salisbury iustyce two duke retourned lo taryed season tidynges fro kynge coulde none bristowe thanne lordes westmynster instigacion archebysshoppe caunterbury determyned shulde honourable sende kynge bristowe shewe hym amyably hath ben certayne spape agaynst moost parte realme loued hym better gladder kepe honour suche marmosettes hath beleued realme hath ben great trouble peryll meane season brought lodon sir nycholas bramble taken wale fledde iourney haue saued hym selfe whose takynge kynges vncles right ioyfull sayde howe wolde make stoore hym shulde go waye hadde done coude neuer excuse hymselfe must dye beheeded without london dethe sore complayned men london hadde mayre london well gouerned offyce dyde one day great honour kyng whan slewe owne handes lyster wherby rebelles disconfyted good seruyce kynge made hym knyght maner haue shewed beheeded reason ouermoche beleuynge duke irelande dethe sir nicholas bramble kynges vncles sawe suche hated wolde haue oute kynges counsayle deed fledde waye thought kynge realme shulde brought good order thoughe slayne kynges counsayle chased theym awaye yet coude nat take awaye signorie kyng thought rule realme good forme honour kynge realme sayd bysshop cau terbury sir ye shall go lyke selfe bristowe kyng shewe hym case busynesse realme recomaunde v hym shewe hym behalfe gyue credence lyght enformacion agaynst v hath beleued moche owne honour fyte realme saye also hym requyre hym good people london wolde come hyder shalbe welcome receyued wt gret ioye shall set cousaile hym yt shalbe well pleased charge retourne nat agayne withoute hym desyre hym nat displeased thoughe haue chased awaye meny traytours hym realme great paryll lesynge bysshop sayd shulde ryght well message departed rodde forthe lyke great prelate came bristowe kynge priuye copany suche wont haue ben counsayle deed fledde awaye ye haue herde bysshop towne two nightes day ye kyng wolde speke hym soore dyspleased vncles driuynge awaye duke irelande whome loued aboue men sleeynge knyghtes
