finally entysed consented archbysshop shulde come presens whan came hym humyled hym selfe greatlye kynge shewed kyng euery worde kynges vncles gyuen hym charge shewed hym pleasure come londou palys westmynster vncles mooste parte realme wolde ryght ioyeouse elles wyll ryght sorte yuell displeased sayde sir without comforte ayde accorde vncles lordes knyghtes prelate good cyties townes englade ye canne nat come youre entente spake wordes boldelye sayde moreouer sir ye canne nat reioyse moche youre ennemyes make warre youre frendes kepe youre realme warre myschiefe yonge kynge reasone bysshoppes wordes beganne enclyne howe beheedynge knyghtes counsaylours came sore courage dyuers ymaginacions finally refrayned displeasure good meanes quene ye lady boesme wise knightes hym sir rycharde stoner thanne kyng sayd bysshoppe well content go lo wherof bisshop right ioyous also hym great honoure hadde spedde iourney well within shorte space kyng departed lefce quene styll bristowe came towardes london ye archbysshoppe company came wyndsore kyng taryed thre dayes tidynges came london howe kynge commynge euery manne gladde ordayned mete hym honourablye daye departed fro wyndsore way fro braynforde london full people horse backe foote mete kynge two vncles duke yorke duke gloucester iohan sonne duke yorke erle arundell erle salisbury erle northumberlande dyuers lordes knyghtes prelate departed london mette kyng two myle fro braynforde receyued hym swetely ought soueraygne lorde kynge bare yet displeasure herte passed made small countenaunce waye talked moost bisshop lodon last came westmi ster kyng alyghted pali whiche redy apparelled ye kyng dranke toke spyces vncles also prelate lordes knyghtes tooke leaues kynges vncles archebysshoppe caunterburye counsayle taryed styll kyng palais abbey towne westminster kepe kynge company nere toguyder co commune busynesse determyned shulde done phowe kynge vncles lordes englande sente come westmynster generall counsayle holden cap ci generall parlyament ordeyned holden westmynstre prelate erles baron knyghtes ye counsayles good townes cytees englade sent suche helde kyng archebysshoppe cauntorbury shewed kynges vncles counsayle kynge rycharde crowned kynge englande euery man sworne made theyr releues hym wha receyued theyr faythes homage within age knyge ought nat gouerne royalme tyll xxi yeres age meane season gouerned vncles nexte kynne wyse men bysshop sayd bycause kynge newlye come age xxi yeres wherfore counsayled euery man shulde newe sworne renewe releues euery manne newe knowledge hym soueraygne lorde counsayle excepted kynges vncles cousayle entent prelate lordes counsayles good cyties townes sent come westminster daye assigned euery man came thyder none disobeyed moche people london westmister kyng richarde chapell palys rychely apareyled crowne heed archebysshoppe cauterbury sang masse masse ye bisshoppe made collasyon kyng vncles dyde homage kyng kyssed hym sware mysed hym faithe homage euer lordes sware prelate handes ioyned togyder dyde homage aparteyned kyst kynges cheke kyng kyst good wyll nat nat warde loue behoued hym wolde nat go fro counsayle vncles surely might haue entent wolde nat haue done dyde rather haue taken crewell vengeaunce deche sir symon burle knyght putte fro hym slayne without desert thought ordayned ye cou sayle archebysshop yorke shulde come pourge hym selfe hadde alwayes duke irelandes parte agaynst kynges vncles whan yt bysshop yorke herde douted hym selfe knewe well nat ye fauour kynges vncles therfore sente excuse nephue sonne lorde neuell came london came first kynge shewed hym vncles excuse dyde homage bysshoppes behalfe kyng toke well loued hym better bysshoppe caunterbury hym selfe excused bysshoppe elles ben yuell kynges loue forbare hym toke excuse taryed styll bysshoprike longe space durste nat lye yorke taryed new castell ryuer tyne nere brother lorde neuell cosyns estate tyme busynesse englande longe space ye kyng nat mayster ouer counsayle vncles bare rule nowe wyll leaue treat mater englade speke busynesse kyng castyle kynge portyngale warres phowe kynge portyngale puissance assembled duke lancastre puyssaunce howe coude nat passe ryuer derne howe squyer castyle shewed passage cap cii reason sythe mater requyreth retourne agayne ye duke lacastres iourney howe ceyuered al season galyce shall begyn lefte haue great desyre make ende storie whan duke lancastre conquered towne castell dauranche galyce brought vnder obeysaunce refresshed hym foure dayes founde well wherwith fyfthe day departed sayde wolde go castell noy dyde lay four dayes fayre medowe alonge ryuer syde grounde dried vp reason heate sonne water corrupted horse wolde nat drinke therof suche dyde dyed thanne ordayned dislodge then tourne agayne auranch sir richarde burle sir thomas morryaulx marshalles hoost sayd nat possyble get strong rastell noy longe siege great wysedome dispence moche artillary also tydinges came duke lancastre kynge portugale approched hoost nombre thousande speares tenne thousande able men two hoostes togyder lykely great dede duke lancastre hadde fyftene hundred speares knightes squiers sixe thousande archer tydinges reioysed greatly duke lancastre dislodged fro noy wente agayne auranche galyce duke sente duchesse wyfe ladyes damoselles duke sayd wolde abyde kynge portugale dyde ye shall knowe whan kyng iohan portugale marshalles take towne feroull rode aproched auranch come duke lacastre way founde towne padrone whiche rebelled first comyng yelded kynges obeysaunce kynge taryed march fyftene dayes wasted greatlye countrey vitayls yet great plentie comyng dayly fro portugale thus two great hoostes galyce greatly impouerysshed countre dayes waxed hote yt man coude styrre nyne clocke without wolde brent sonne duke lacastre duchesse aurache men abrode countrey great pouerie lacke vitayls selfe horse nothynge good swete coulde growe grounde drie brent sone grewe lytell worthe season hote brent englysshe men wolde haue thynge self horse behoued seruauntes go forragyng xii sixtene twentie myles great payne daunger englysshmen founde wynes stronge hoote brynning corrupted heedes dried bowelles brente lightes lyuers remedy coude fynde lytell good water temper wynes refresshe whiche co trary nature englysshe men owne coutreis swetely norisshed bret within endured great pouertie great lordes wanted accustomed vnto owne countreis whan knyghtes squyers englande sawe daunger myschefe likely lacke vytayle heate sonne whiche dayly encreased began murmure saye host dyuers place feare iourney wyll come smal effect ende lye long one place true sayd two thynges greatly contrarye v leade company woman wyues desyreth nothyng rest one dayes iourney wylles wolde reste fyftene distroyeth v wyll soone came coulongne gone forwarde spedde well brought countre good obeysaunce none wolde haue ben agaynst v longe taryeng hath enforced ennemyes nowe haue prouyded men warre fraunce townes cyties passage kepte closed agaynst v thus disconfyted v withoute batayle nede nat fyght v realme spayne nat pleasaunt lande traueyle fraunce englande wherin good village fayre coutreis swete ryuers faire medowes attemperate ayre menne warre contrarye ment oure lorde duke lancastre thought wynne countrey leade company woman chyldren great let without reason knowen spaygne el bretherne true enherytours countrey leest wyfes doughters kyng peter doyng conquest tournyng townes woman lytell therin thus haue shewed people langled duke lancaster hoost one another tidynges came duke kyng portugale aproched nere wherof ioyfull whan kynge within two leages duke knyghtes mounted horse rode mete hym mette amiably companyes kynges hole hoost nat taryed behynde guydyng sixe great lordes portugale ponnase congne vase martyn de merlo posdiche de asne degouse salnase de merlo sir anlne perrier marshall iohan radighes desar dyuers kyng thre hundred speares aurache kynge duke togyder fyue dayes toke counsayle toguyder fynall conclusyon shulde ryde togyder enter countrey campe go towne arpent sir olyuer clesquyne constable spaygne wyst nat passe ye ryuer derne whiche fell orgulous certayne tymes specially rather somer wynter whan snowe froste melteth moutayns reason sonne ryuer moost depest dangerous passe wynter frosyn ryuers base lowe yet yt concluded ryde coutre campe trustyng place fynde passage conclusyon publysshed throughe hoostes wherof euery man ioyfull lyen along space sore oppressed great daunger auranche ther many sore diseased thus kyng portugale yt duke lacastre departed fro auranche rode toguyder hostes seperated two partes bycause none vnderstode maner aqueyntace toguyder also eschewe riottes debate myght haue fallen bytwene portugales hote hastye lykewise englysshmen dispytefull fierse thus apoynted man hals bothe hostes lodge forrage diuers partes nat toguyder thus rode forthe chat puyssaunce able fyght iourney kynge iohan castell adhenrentes longe iourneyed came ryuer derne whiche nat easy passe depe highe bankes full great broken stone certayne bridge whiche broken elles well kepte yt maner impossyble passe might nat gette ouer two hostes great ymaginacios might passe fell sir iohn holande constable englysshe hoost marshalles sir richarde butle sir thomas moreaulx forragers rode encountred squier castell called donnage bangher knewe well passage countrey knewe one passage bothe horsmen fote men might easelye passe riuer came ouer passage taken brought sayd lordes ryght glad streitly examyned also wordes constable sayde hym howe wolde quyte rausome gyue hym good rewarde wolde shewe myght passe surely ryuer sayde herde howe one sure passage ouer ryuer squyer toke lyght aduysement couetous constable offre gladde delyuered handes sayd sir knowe well passage shall shewe shalbe guyde ye youre menne maye passe without daunger constable marshalles great ioye rode forthe toguyder sent worde tydinges duke lancastre folowed vowarde constable marshalles came passage spanysshe squyer entred firste ryuer shewed way whan sawe passage pleasaunt ryght ioyfull euery man passed ouer whan vowarde ouer lodged gyue knowledge folowed constable kepte promyse squyer gyde departed fro rode medena del campo kynge castyle lay good towne countrey campe kynge portugale duke lancastre came passage called plasce ferarde bycause grauell sande firme stable without parell hoostes passed ouer next day rerewarde lay coutrey campe tydinges came ruelles cateseris medena vyle arpente saynt phagon cyties townes castels countrey campe spayne howe englysshemen portugaloyse passed ouer ryuer derne founde passed wherof euery man maruayle sayd nat done without trayson shulde neuer haue founde passage countre shewed kynge castelles lordes knewe squier castyle shewed guyde thervpon taken knowledged trouth hadde done thanne iuged dye brought vyle arpent beheeded phowe tydinges spred abrode kynge portugale duke lancastre passed ryuer derne howe came kyng castels knowlege howe certayne englysshe knyghtes came rode vyle arpente king portugale duke lancastre determyned tary comyng duke burbone cap ciii whan kynge castyle knewe howe kyng portugale duke lancastre yt feldes great puyssance daily aproched wherof sore abasshyd called hym syr gaultyer passac syr willyam lignac sayde haue great maruayle duke borbon commeth nat enemyes aproche kepe feldes none encoutreth waste countrey people realme yuell contente fyght nat theym wherfore sir requyre gyue counsayle best two knyghtes knewe dedes armes kyng dyd vsed therfore thyder sente oute fraunce sayde syr surely duke borbon cometh without fayle whan cometh shall take counsayle shall tyll come let v make countenaunce batayle let enemyes go come whyder lyst lette kepe feldes shall kepe townes stronge well prouyded bothe men vytayles shall sonne great heate shall shadowe fresshe ayre shall fynde ye countrey wasted pylled forewarde go lesse sustynauce shall fynde therfore syr begynnynge eschewe inconuenyentes lytell hooldes beaten downe maners church suche men coutrey wold haue put goodes wysely done el nowe enemyes shuld haue founde place haue rested nowe shall fynde nothyng without brynge theym heate sonne heedes whiche shall burne slee sir townes cyties castelles well garnysshed prouyded good men armes artyllery vytayles thynke shalbe skrymysshed withall lyfe norysshynge men warre passe tyme ryde aboute worlde seke aduentures therfore sir nothynge abasshed truste besynes shall haue great domage kynge reason knyghtes wordes greatly recoforted perceyued well shewed trouth reason nowe let v speke duke lancastre kyng portugale feldes countrey campe wolde gladly haue bene towne haue refresshed theym forager whe euer went coude fynde thing feare encountrynges rode nat great companyes somtyme whan sawe village hyll playne reioysed wolde say go thyder shalbe ryche well prouyded thyder wolde ryde great haste whan founde thynge bare walles howses broken downe nother catte dogge cocke hen man woman childe wasted frenchemen thus loste tyme horse leane feble reason poore norisshyng happy whan founde pasture feble coulde go dyed great heate pouertie ye also great men dyed sore dyspleased hoote feuers nat wherwith refresshe tyme sodeyn coldee toke sleping ye nyght case specyally duke lancastres hoost englisshmen febler complexion portugaloys coulde well endure payne harde accustomed ayre castyle case haue shewed englisshmen many dyed namely suche smale prouisyon selfe sir richarde burle ser thomas moreaulr sir thomas percy lorde fitzwater syr mabetyne linyers sir iohn dam breticourt thyrrey guyllyam souuayne theym two hundred horse men knyghtes squyers suche wolde auaunce theym selfe desyringe dedes armes tyme mounted horse beste hadde entente ryde vyle arpente awake frechmen therin herde surely howe sir dlyuer clysson within towne constable castyle hym great nombre good men armes lord company rode forthe morenynge came lytell ryuer ranne towne passed ouer larome rose towne brute englysshe men come barryers thanne knyghtes squiers armed quickely came costables lodginge varlettes sadled horse brought maisters constable wolde nat wyll haue suffered haue issued agaynste englysshmen coulde nat let corages fierse issued well horsed good ordre firste issued sir iohan barres vicounte barlier sir iohan brakemout sir pyer wyllannes sir tristam de la gayll dyuers great desyre fyght agaynst englisshmen whan englysshmen made course towne passed agayne ryuer paste drewe gyther ye sandes fayre easely drewe fro ryuer thre bowshottes frenche knightes came cryeng cryes euery manne speare thyghe whan englysshmen sawe sodeynly tourned speares restes sore rencoutre dyuers ouer throwen sandes bothe party whan course done lefte nat skrymysshed gyther powder subtyle sandes rose vp thycke one coulde natse nother knowe eche themselfe horse could skant drawe brethes mouthes full dust therby eche party fayne withdrawe cry thus departed manne slayne greatly hurte bycause course englysshe knyghtes made paste daye one leage fro towne arpente retourned lodgynges sycknesse toke heate colde feuers duke lancastre wyste nat saye sawe well howe men fell sicke dayly lay beddes hymselfe soo wery heuy gladly wolde haue layen bedde nat ben discoragynge people day spake kynge portugale demaunded counsayle hym desyringe hym gyue beste aduyse beste feared great mortalyte fall host kyng sayd syr semeth well howe spaynyardes frechmen wyll nat fyght v time purpose suffre v waste selfes prouysions sir quod duke wyll ye cou sayle v shall shewe kyng portugale season whyle sonne hoote ye people drawe againe galyce let euery man refressh selfe marche aprill come felde agayne moch newe ayde comfortemaye come oute englande one bretherne realme nat soone wonne specyally agree ayre nat acustomed let men go passe tyme suche townes forteresses ye haue galyce vnder obeysaunce may well quod duke maye fortune fall shall shewe whan enemyes seeth departed one fro another portugale galyce saynt iaques colongne kynge spayne wyll ryde great puyssaunce haue herde hathe foure thousande speares frenchman breton shall fynde many mo owne countrey also duke burbon vncle frenche kyng cometh two speares assone cometh wyll set forwarde home oure countreys assemble togyder agayne nowe enemyes shall v great domage thanne kynge sayde well lette v kepe styll feldes name god men fresshe ynough good mynde abyde aduenture thus determyned abyde comynge duke burbon se shulde fought withall thanne nat demauded nothinge batayle tyme went euer forwarde sonne mounted dayes chafed meruaylously aboute mydsomer whan sonne strength specially spayne granade farre countreyes septentryon aprell fell rayne swetnes fro heuyn wherby euery thynge brente erthe englissh men eate grape whan myght get dranke hote wynes dranke set fyre therby brente lyuers longes dyete contrary nature englyssh men norisshed good mete ale kepeth bodyes temper nyghtes hoote bycause great heate day mornyng meruaylously colde whiche dysceyued nyght coulde suffre thynge slepte naked mornynge colde toke waxe caste feuers flyxes without remedy well dyed great men meane people phowe duke lancastre gaue lycence men howe haraulte sente kinge castyle howe thre knightes englande went speke king castyle saueconduct duke men passe cou trey cap ciiii beholde nowe se howe fortune tourned ye maye well beleue duke lancastre beynge realme castyle coulde neuer haue loste batayle men dyscomfetted loste men dyd voyage reason sycknes hym selfe also nygh deed sir iohan holande constable hoost whan sawe frendes men thus infected malady without remedy herynge complaynt one sayeng eche ah duke lancastre hath brought v dye spaygne cursed voyage wyll neuer haue englysshman come englande serue hym spurneth agaynst ye pricke wolde men shulde kepe countrey whan wonne whan men deed shall thanne kepe sheweth nat skyll warre sythe seeth none cometh agaynst v fight batayle dothe nat drawe portugale place shulde nat haue domage losse heth thus shall dye without stroke whan sir iohan holande herde vnderstode wordes honoure loue lorde duke lancastre whose doughter maryed came duke sayd quickly sir must behoue take newe shorte counsayle people harde case lykely dye syckenesse nede shulde fortune nat able ayde wery harde case horse deed noble men discoraged nat lyke good seruyce tyme sayd duke beste wyll beleue counsaile reason syr quod constable thynke beste ye gaue lycence euery man departe thynke beste selfe drawe outher portugale galice ye nat case ryde forewarde trewe quod duke wyll saye howe gyue leaue departe whyder please outher castyle fraunce make false treaty enemyes se well season warre paste paye euery man wage rewarde theym costes syr quod constable shall done sir iohan holande made knowen trumpet euery lodgyng entencion duke lancastre howe dyd gyue lycence euery man departe whyder lyst euery capytayne shulde speke constable shulde payed shulde content tydynges reioysed suche desyred departe chaunge ayre barones knyghtes englande toke counsayle howe myght retourne englande thought impossyble retourne see shyppes redy farre fro porte also men sicke feuers flixes many deed sicke coude nat endure ye trauayle see thynges consydered thought best repayre home thorough realme fraunce sayde howe maye enemyes realmes muste passe first spayne haue made theym open warre kynge nauer lykewyse ioyned warre kynge castyle also kynge aragone alyed frenche kynge also hath done v great dyspite hath take layd prison barselona archebyhop burdeaux wente thyder demaunde arerages realme aragonoweth kynge englande soueraygne lorde sende frenche kyng harde v farre peraduenture whan oure messanger cometh kynge yonge peraduenture counsayle wyll nothynge v sir olyuer clysson constable fraunce hateth v mortally wyll say duke bretayn great aduersary wyll become englissh great wysdome imaginacyon said thinges consydred thinke best assay kyng castyle thynke wyll lyghtly condyscende suffre v passe countrey peasably gette saueconduete fro kynges fraunce aragon nauer counsayle taken kepte herde haraulde called derby sente forthe kynge castyle letter haraulde rode forthe came medena de campo founde kynge castyle kneled downe delyuered letter kynge opened redde written frenche whan hadde well vnderstande turned hym smyled sayde knyght go make haraulde good chere shall answered nyght departe morowe kynge entred secrete chambre sent sir wyllyam lygnac sir gaultyer passac red letter demaunded beste pi shall shewe substaunce matter syr iohan holande constable duke lancastres hoost wrote kynge castyle desyring hym sende herault letter safecoducte ii thre englysshe knightes go come safe speke treat hym knightes answered sayd sir good ye dyde shall knowe demaude well quod kyng thynke good asafecoducte written coteyninge sixe knightes might safely go come poyntyng constable sealed kynges great seale sygned hande deliuered heralt xx frankes rewarde returned aurache duke ye constable herault deliuered safecoduct costable knyghtes chosen yt shulde go sir mauberyn linyere sir thoms morell sir iohan dambreticourt thre knyghtes charged go message ye kynge castile deted assone might thought long many sicke lacked phisicions medicins also fresshe vitaylles englysshe ambassadours passed towne arpent constable castyle sir olyuer clesquy made good chere made supper next daye sent knyght tyntemache breton bring surelyer kyng encoutryng ye breton many sprede abrode long rode came medenade campo founde kynge gret desire know wolde whan lyghted lodgyng chauged refreshed went king made gode semblaunt brought hiby ye knight house delyuered kyng letter fro duke constable none fro hym selfe wolde nat write kynge sayd sir kyng sent hyder fro erle huntyngdon constable duke lancastre certaynynge great mortalyte sickenesse amonge men therfore constable desyreth ye wolde suche desyreth haue helthe opyn cyties good townes suffre entre refresshe recouer helth maye also suche haue desyre passe englande lande maye passe without daunger kyng nauer frenche kyng pesably retourne owne coutreis sir desyre request make vnto tyme kyng answered said soberly sir shall take cousayle aduise good v ye shalbe answered knyghtes sayd sir suffyceth v phowe thre knyghtes obteyned saueconduct kyng castyle people passe howe dyuers theglysshmen dyed castyle howe duke lancastre fell great syckenesse cap c v thus departed fro kynge tyme went lodgynges taryed yt day next day tyll none went ye kyng shall shewe answere ye king cousaile request gretly reioysed kyng sawe well enemy wolde dete realme thought hymselfe wolde agre therto yet cousayled cotrary sent ii freche capitayns sir gaultier passacke sir willm lignac whan come right sagely shewed desire reqst ye costable englysshe host hervpon demauded haue cou sayle first desyred sir water passacke speke lothe speke kynges cousayle fayne kyng sore desyred hym kynges comaundement spake sayde sir ye come ende haue alwayes said yt enemy shulde wast selfe nowe disconfyted without stroke strikyng sir ye said folkes desyre haue comforte refresshyng countre gentylnesse ye maye well graut whasoeuer recouer helthe retourne nat agayne duke kynge portugale dete streight way owne countreys terme sixe yere arme nat agaynst agaynst realme castyle thynke ye shall gette rightwell safeconducte kynge fraunce kynge nauerre passe peasably realmes answere kynge ryght ioyfull counsayled hym accordynge pleasure nat cared bargeyn made myght haue benquyte englysshmen sayd sir water passacke sir ye haue well truely counsayled thanke shall accordyng aduise thre englysshe knyghtes sent whan come entred counsayle chabre bysshop burges chaunceller spayne well langaged sayd sir ye knyghtes englad perteyning duke lacastre sent hyder fro constable vnderstande kyng pytie gentylnesse wyll shewe enemyes grace maye sir ye shall retourne costable shewe hym fro kyng castyle shall make knowen al hoost sowne trumpet realme shalbe open redy receyue englysshmen hole sicke thentre euery cyte towne laye downe armure weapon shall fynde men redy bring lodgiges name written delyuered capitayne towne thentent shulde nat retourne agayne galyce portugale maner busynesse dete countreis assone may assone kyng castyle souerayne lorde hath optayned safecoducte passe realmes nauer fraunce go cali porte hauen pleasure outher bretaygne xaynton rochell normady picardy also ye kynges pleasure suche knight squiers nacyon soeuer entred vyage wyse arme nat selfe ye space sixe yere agaynst realme castyle swere thus whan take safecoducte coposycion ye shall haue letter open beare constable suche copanyons sent hyder knyght thanked kynge counsayle answere sayd sir certayne artycles answere ca nat tell accepted nat nat shall sende agayne heraulte come nat shall accept sayeng well sir kyng content quod counsayle kyng went chambre sir water passacke sir wyllm lignacke kepte styll company englysshe knyghtes brought fayre chabre dyner redy apparelled dyned dyner wyne spyces kynges chambre toke leaue letter redy toke horse departed rode vyle cloppes next day came towne arpent dyned night lay noy galyce next daye came auranche founde ye constable fortuned mean season one duke lancaster great baron died right valyant man called lorde fitz water greatly bemooned agaynst dethe none maye stryue enterment honorably done kyng portugale duke lacastre present whan thre knyghtes come duke lodgyng shewed done shewed letter confyrmacion sayd herde couenaunt sayde nay holdyng opinyon right courtesse perfitely consyderyng danger tidynges anone sprede abrode host duke gyuen lycence euery man departe lyst suche sycke feble desyring fresshe ayre deted soone might toke leaue duke costable truely payd wag curtesly might content fayre wordes departed copanyes went arpent ruelles vilcloppes noy soe medena de ca po place euery place welcome brought lodgynges name presented capitayne greattest parte gentylmen went arpent bycause towne many straungers breton frenchman normayns poicteuyns ouer whome sir olyuer de clesquyn capitayne englysshemen trusted better dyde spaynyerdes good cause thus haue shewed duke lancastres army brake vp tyme castyle euery man sought best hym selfe ye maye well beleue dyde greatly trouble duke lancastre great cause sawe enterprise ore putte backe brought herde case howe lyke valyaunt sage price coforted hym selfe aswell myght sawe well coulde none otherwyse whan kyng portugale sawe howe matter went yt army broken gaue lycence maner men except thre hundred speares come serue hym retaygned styll departed fro aurache duke lacastre wyfe rode saynt iaques called copostella whan kyng duke kynge taryed four dayes departed men retourned countrey wyfe laye porte good cytie portugale nowe shall shewe befell dyuers knyghtes squyers suche departed fro duke gone castile dyuers entecte sickenesse chaungynge newe ayre newe medycins yet coulde nat scape peryll dethe dyuers dyed arpent meane season king castyle sent kynge nauerre frenche kyng sauecoductes passe pesably whiche nat soone optaygned dyuers lordes knyghtes squyers englade dyed beddes whiche gret domage great losse countrey arpent dyed thre great barones englande ryche men first sir richarde burle ben marshall ye duke hoost another lorde ponynges thyrde lorde percy cosyn germayne erle northumberlande towne noy dyed sir mauberyn lymers poyteuyn ryght noble expert knyght towne ruelles dyed great baron called lorde talbot died xii gret lordes fourscore knightes two hu dred squyers great dysconfetture without stroke stryken dyed meane men mo fyue hundred herde reported knyght englande retourned frauce name sir thoms quynbery fyftene hundred men armes foure thousande archer duke lancastre hadde brought realme englande neuer returned agayn halfe parte duke lancastre fyll perylous sickenesse towne saynt iaques often tymes brute ranne castyle fraunce howe deed surely great adueture lyfe thyrrey souuayne squyer honour squyer ye duke body taken sickenesse dyed besances naturally borne countie heynaulte brother wyllyam souuayn hym tyll dyed like wyse great aduenture lyfe trouthe none hardy ryche tolye feare selfe euery day loked none thyng deth sickenesse none infected alonely duke lancaster copany among ye frechmen none sicke wherby dyuers murmuracyons among spanyerdes sayeng ye kyng castyle hath done great grace englysshmen suffre lye rest countie good townes feare wyll cost v greatly haue lyke bring countrey great mortalyte wolde saye ah christenmen ought copassion pyte taken one another comunyng among true yt season knyght frauce dyed castile gret sorowe made gracyous courtesse hardy armes brother sir iohan sir raynolde sir launcelotte voy called sir iohn voy howe dyed shall tell towne castyle called seghome laye garyson impostume body yonge lusty tooke hede therof day lept great horse rode feldes spurred horse gambaldyng horse impostume brake body whan retourned lodgynge layde bedde sicke semed well fourthe daye dyed wherof frendes right soroufull phowe sir iohan holade duke lancastres constable toke leue duke wyfe retourned king castyle made hym good chere howe sir iohan dambreticourt wente parys acomplysshe dede armes bytwene hym bouciqualt cap cvi ye maye well knowe euery man eschewed sickenesse amonge englysshmen fledde therfro asmoche myght season sir iohan holande duke constable still duke certayne knightes squyers seynge season warre paste thynkynge eschewe peryll sickenesse sayd constable sir let v retourne wyll go bayone burdeux take fresshe ayre esche sickenes whan euer duke lancastre wyll haue v agayne lette hym write v shall soone hym whiche better kepe v daunger parell called often hym day shewed duke murmuraryons duke sayde syr iohan wyll ye retourne take men recomende lorde kyng bretherne englande right good wyll sir quod constable syr though sycke men haue great curtesy constable castyle suffering entre byde case tyll recouer helthes yet maye nat retourne agayne castyle portugale outher take waye calays throughe fraunce must bounde beare none armure syxe yere realme frauce without kynge souerayne lorde present propre persone duke sayd syr iohan ye knowe well frenchemen take men case se daunger vautage therfore shall shewe whiche way ye shall passe curtesly realme castyle whan ye come entre nauarre sende kynge cosyn tyme past hadde great alyaunce guyder whiche nat yet broken sith warre began bytwene ye kyng castyle haue amiably written eche cosyns frendes warre hath ben made see bitwene v frechmen haue wherfore thynke wyll lightly suffre passe realme whan ye saynt iohan pie de porte take waye bisquay bayon ye herytage fro then ye may go cytie burdeux without daunger frenche men refresshe ease whan ye haue wynde weder wyll ye maye take see lande cornwall hampton wynde wyll serue sir iohan said counsayle shalbe fulfylled without faute nat long constable company departed taryed ye duke duches mo owne housholde seruauntes sir iohan holande wyfe hym came cytie camores founde kynge castyle sir gaultier passacke sir wyllm lignacke made hym good chere lordes knyghtes whan mete eche truely kyng castyle gladde tose departyng englysshmen semed hym yt warre ende thought wolde neuer issue agayne englande many good men warre duke lancaster tytell make warre castyle also knewe well howe great trouble dyscorde within realme englande whan tidynges sprede abrode castile good cyties townes englysshe men lay sicke seke helthe howe sir iohan hollande ome thyder retourne agayne engla de ryght gladde therof drewe hym entent retourne hym lorde chameulx sir thomas percy lorde lelynton lorde braseton dyuers nombre thousade horse suche sicke thought selfe halfe hole whan knewe shulde retourne voyage paste paynfull whan sir iohan hollande toke leaue ye kyng castyle kyng gaue hym copany great giftes mule mulettes spaygne payde costes rode saynt phagons refresshed thre dayes euery place welcome well receyued knyghtes kynges dyde conducte theym payde alwayes costes longe code passed spaygne came naueret batayle ben pauyers groyne rested nat certayne kynge nauerre wolde suffre passe throughe realme nat sent hym ii knightes sir peter bysset sir wylliam norwiche founde kynge tudela nauer spake hym spedde well graut passe nauer payeng shulde take way soone knyght retourned departed fro groyne came pampylona passed mountain rouceaux lefte way bierne entred bisquay go bayon last thyder came sir iohan holande taryed long space wyfe englysshmen rode burdeaux thus armye brake vp season whyle warres endured castile yt englisshmen kepte feldes lorde bouciqualt elder ii bretherne sent herault sir iohan dabreticourt desyring hym dedes armes thre course thre axe thre dagger knight agreed therto sir iohan dambreticourt sent dyuers tymes accoplysshe feate bouciqualt came nat forwarde tell ye cause wyll nat say tight good knight mete haue done greatter feate armes whan sir iohan dabreticourt come bayone company sir iohan holade dyuers ymaginacions chalege thought honorably might nat departe partes seyng chalenged dedes armes graunted therto without fulfylled returned england wtout doyng thyng thought frenchman wolde saye deted feare toke cousayle sir iohn holade best counsayled take waye frauce safeconducte yt duke burbon gotte hym go parys demaunde sir bouciqualt el way therby lest honour shulde excused counsayle knight beleued folowed deted fro bayon entred biern came artoys founde therle foiz made hym good chere detyng erle gaue hym iic florens good horse rode forthe byern entred coutre bigore tholousin carcassynois copany wylliam souuayne squiers heynault retournyng countreis longe rode came parys tyme kyng normandy sir boucikalt shewed hym aragon sir iohn dambreticourt acquyte enterprice preseted hym selfe certayne great baron fraunce beyng parys shewed howe come thyder acquite hymself chalenge whan hadde taryed viii dayes deted came calais heynault owne countreis thus lytell litell army yt went spayne portugale brake vp phowe duke burbone deted fro auygnon go castyle host came burgus spayne foude kyng castyle howe duke lancastre herde tidynges howe duke burbone departed fro kyng went streyght agayne fraunce cap cvii ought supposed duke loys burbon begynnyng enterprise armye castyle ordaynedde chefe well enformed howe mater went knowen yt shuld haue ben wolde haue made haste long entred spaygne toke longe waye auignon se hym wrote hymself pope clement taryed long space whan departed rode mountpelyer taryed fyue dayes also besyers carcassone narbone parpinyon entred realme aragon tose yonge kynge cosyn ye quene yolant bare rode baselona founde kyng quene cosyn great nombre lordes countrey come thyder sest hym dyde whan ben sixe dayes went valecensia great herde sure tidynges howe ye englysshe armye withdrawen passed homewarde howe sir iohan hollande nauer goyng howarde great parte copany howe ben great dethe among also herde howe cosyn duke lancastre laye sicke compostella galyce dyuers place sayde howe deed howe though thanne lytell spaygne yet thought passe sende worde comyng kyng castile ryght gladde therof mete hym came burgus spayne prouyded greatly receyuynge suche hym frauce ryght gladde se duke burbone thus duke passed valencensia saragosa porte entred spayne came burgus well receyued sir olyuer clesquyn constable castyle sir wylliam lignacke sir gaultier passacke sir iohan barres sir iohan sir raynolde roy dyuers knyghtes fraunce lefte garysons come se duke burbone doute englysshmen portugalois withdrawen englysshmen forsoke garysons galyce knewe well coude nat resyst army fraunce seyng compaignyons departed dyuers wayes ye haue herde tidinges came galyce howe duke burbon coe spaigne brought hym great nobre knyghtes frauce brute noyse thanne dede one halfe comons great dout ye duke burbon wolde haue entred wt great force puissaunce duke la castre amonge greatly conforted tidynges came duke lancastre howe cosyn duke burbone come spayne burgus kynge incontynent sent worde therof kynge portugale desyring hym gather agayne toguyder people knewe nat ye frenche men wolde seyng englysshe men auoyded coutrey kyng portugale reason suche alyaunce bytwene consented departed fro lirbone came conymbres made somons realme euery man redy came cytie porte drawe nere countrey galyce father lawe duke lancastre nat good poynte ryde sickenesse howe beit began amende nowe let v speke duke burbon kyng castyle made hym good chere coude prelate lordes realme many counsayles bytwene determyne shulde outher ryde galyce el returne kyng castyle counsayle sawe clerely howe mater shulde beste profyte sayd eche whan togyder reason frenchman landes wasted dystroyed though come kepe haue taken great domage wherfore thinke shulde good thake duke borbon payne trauayle hathe endured cominge hyder lette v desyre hym louyngly drawe men warre seynge henedeth nat tary warre apatente galice recouery therof shall small mater v thus kynges counsayle comuned eche said one receyue people must payed wage nat pyll robbe realme comon people redy begynneth complayne therfore thynke best gyue honest congy departe counsayle vpholden kynge well consented sawe well proftye people realme coulde take hurte shulde domage preiudice one daye kynges presence archebysshop burgus duke burbon many knightes fraunce shewed declared theym entente ye haue herde duke burbon dyuers knyghtes fraunce rather retourne byde countrey nat mete complerions well contente retourne prepared themselfe thervpon bycause duke burbone laste came retourned first toke leaue kynge said howe wolde returne realme nauerre great gyftes gyuen departed might haue wolde haue taken refused euery thynge except mule mul tte dogges spayne publisshed frenchman might pleasure departe spayne retourne fraunce taryed styll sir olyuer clesquyn constable spayne marshal thre hundred speares breton poicteuyns xayngtons thus duke burbone returned whan taken congy kynge quene lordes castyle conueyed groyne nauarre euer came welcome well receyued duke burbone gracyous curteyse honorable well renomed kynge nauer receyued louyngly neuer shewed maner yuell wyll towardes frenche kynge taken way fro enherytauce countye eureur normandy sawe well frenche kyng nephewe duke burbon defaute therof wha done yonge swetely shewed duke busynesse desyringe hym good meane bytwene hym cosyn frenche kynge duke promysed hym duke departed passed thorough realme nauer peasably suche wolde passe thus passed mountayns rouseaulx alonge countrey bastelles entred bierne saluaterra phowe therle foize receyued honourably duke burbon great giftes gaue sir willyam lygnac sir gaultier passackes copany departed spayne incydent fortuned towne saynt phagon cap cviii whan erle foyz beynge ortays vnderstode duke burbon saluaterra glad therof sente knight aboute day great araye rode fyue hundred knyghtes squyers two leages ortays mette duke burbon lykewyse rode great rout knyghtes squiers met amyably great prynces ought whan comuned togyther certayne space shewed whan ortays erle foize drewe hym parte felde company duke abode styll nother parte erle sente duke thre knyghtes named syr espayne de lyon sir peter capestan sir menaunt nowalles whan came duke sayd sir present lorde erle foiz hath sent returnynge spayne knoweth well ye haue great dyspence therfore syr dothe gyue entring countrey bierne eyght thousande frankes mulette two courser two palfrey syrs quod duke thanke erle foyze floreyns wyll take none presente wyll receyue good wyll thus florens refused mule horse receyued erle foyz came duke brought hym towne ortays lodged owne place lodged towne duke thre dayes ortays great dyners supper erle foize shewed ye duke great parte estate fourthe daye duke departed erle gaue ye knightes squiers great gyftes shewed comynge thyder duke burbon coste erle foize ten thousande frankes thus duke departed went fraunce rode mountpelyer cytie puy countye forestes wherof lorde lady wyfe departyng ye duke burben ye haue herde spayne sir willyam lignac sir gaultier passac departed nat soone companyes nombre thre thousande speares syre thousande men warre lytell lytell euer departed many wage wery warres retourned yuell horsed yuell aparelled torne ragged metynge suche people nothynge profytable vnhorsed whome soeuer met made warre marchautes men churche poore people countre thinge gette rutters sayde howe warre vndone howe kynge castyle hadde yuell payed theym wage wherfore sayde wolde pay themselfe surely suche cyties castels good townes nat stronge castyle douted greatly agaynst townes cyties closed gate feare parels hauocke without well defended suche knightes squyers came erle foyze se hym well receyued gyftes rewardes gyuen ryght largely shewed comyng retournynge men warre passed therle foize sayd iourney coste hym xl thousande frankes season fell incydent towne saynt phagon spaygne departynge duke burbone whiche coste fyue hundred mennes lyues whan sir gaultier passar sir willyam lignac entred firste spayne companyes spredde abrode dyuerse place countrey aboute towne saynte phagon whiche good plentuous countrey many breton poicteuyns augenyns rainton men lowe countreys whan entred fyrste saynt phagon entred syxe ten fyftene twenty laste mo fyue hundred one maysters seruauntes euer came lodged selfe pilled robbed hostes brake vp cofers cupbordes wolde take foude whan citezyns sawe demeanoure entent shulde mo entre whan straungers reste cryed alarum towne spanyardes redy day entred lodginges straungers founde slayne without pytie mercye happy saued nyght slayne mo thanne fyue hundred nexte mornyng tydinges came capytayns comynge towne warde drewe togyder take counsayle capitayns determyned tyme reuenged dyde shulde fynde townes cyties wherof enemyes woldbe right ioyous sayde whan voyage shulde haue ende yt retourning wolde thanke accordynge desertes passed forwarde spake nothynge therof thought nowe happend whan euery man returned except suche styll abydinge constable sir olyuer clysson specially ye lowe countreys whan came togyder sayd eche nowe lette v paye welcome saynt phagon lette v quyte departyng agreed gathered togyder thousande fightynge men aproched saynt phagon entred towne without mystruste cytie trusted thynges ben forgoten straungers cryed alarum hudred place cryed slee villayns towne take haue haue well deserued thanne breton entred howses thought wyn moste brake vp cofers slewe downe euery place slewe day mo foure hundred towne robbed spoyled halfe brente whiche great domage thus rutters reuenged dethe companyons departed fro saynte phagon phowe kyng castell counsayle yuell contente sir willyam lignac syr gaultier passackes copany howe duke lancastre departed fro saynt iaques bayon cap cix tidynges came king castyle howe companyons robbed pylled good towne saynt phagon slayne cytezyns nobre four hudred nigh brent towne sayd englysshe men wonne assaute wolde nat haue daulte cruelly dyd tyme two knyghtes present kynge greatly reproued kyng counsayle excused sayd god might helpes knewe nothynge therof sayd herde howe nat contente towne bycause whan entred firste realme came saynte phagon certayne company slayne grudge lyklyhode haue borne euer sythe hertes behoued kyng castyle let mater passe wolde haue coste hym ouer moche haue hadde amended bare nat good wyll capytayns dyd well sene whan departed toke leaue kyng retourne frauce ben pleased ought supposed shulde haue better payed wage duke burbone came laste firste departed company chere well rewarded thus people issued castyle dyuerse wayes bisquay aragon suche noble honeste knyghtes squyers lyued well kepte good rule departed pore yuell horsed suche hardy aduentured robbe pylle well horsed well furnisshed gold syluer male full baggage thus falleth suche aduentures wyn lese kyng castyle ioyfull whan sawe clene delyuered suche people nowe let v somwhat speke duke lancastre laye sicke bed towne saynt iames duches wyfe hym doughter katheryn thought duke day nyght nat without anoyauce sawe busynes harde parte many good knyghtes deed suche moche payne brought englade none wolde treate composicyon bytwene hym kynge castyle wolde take duches wyfe enheritour castell gyue parte herde men saye enfourmed pylgrymes came saynt iaques oute flaunders brabant heynaulte countreis came throughe realme spaygne herde men warre saye sir ye shall go saynt iaques ye shall fynde duke la castre kepeth chambre feare ye lyght sonne recomaunde v hym demaunde hym oure behalfe haue made hym fayre warre co tent v nat englisshmen wont say coude better dauce make warre nowe ye tyme come rest synge kepe feldes fronters suche wyse lese nothing take domage suche tale tolde duke toke worthe none remedy soone myght ryde departed ye duches doughter fro saynt iaques kyng portugale sente hym erle noware constable fyue hu dred speares hym sir iohn ferant ponase congue ageas coylle venase martyn de malo galope ferrant sir aulde perre nedighes de fay gannes de falues baron thus departed fro compostella rode tyll came cytie porte kynge quene portugale made good chere anone kyng quene deted wente conymbres dayes iourney fro then duke taryed aii monethes meane season ordayned busynesse hadde galyes kyng apparelled hym mayster patrone portungale named alphons brecart whan sawe good tyme take see ye duke entred vesselles disacred toke see within day halfe bayon whiche threscore leages duke toke la dynge founde nat sir iohan hollande englysshe men departed gone burdeux toke shippyng englande duke taryed bayon longe space lyued reuenewes bayon burdeux lande acquitayne vnder obeysaunce kyng richarde englande commissyon suffycient receyue profytes landes called duke gouernour pnowe lette v leaue speke season duke lancastre ye englysshmen let v treat mater phowe erle armynake toke great payne treate copanyons departe realme fraunce cap cx reason erle armynake auuergne intreatyng companyons suche laye fortress garyson auuergne quersy lymosen erle hadde great desyre cause capitayns departe realme fraunce leaue suche holdes lades sore oppressed greatly impouerisshed comunycacion except geffray teate noyre helde wenchadore agaynst erle armynake sayd capitayns shulde receyue one payment two hundred l thousande fra kes paye sayde landes bounde glad delyuered people otherwise coude nat labour erthe occupy feate marchaundise thyng feare pyllers without patesed ye charge patesyng drewe well yerely shulde pay haue delyuered thoughe countreis warre englysshmen yet amonge fewe nacyon englande gascoyns breton almayns foyzons men dyuers countreis gathered toguyder yuell dedes whan co posycions redempcion made agreed excepted geffray teate noyre forterers wolde nothynge erle armynake prayed erle dolphyn auuergne great capitayne shulde treate ye sayd geffray wolde moche go fraunce kyng cou sayle duke berrey burgoyn gouernyng ye realme haue counsayle assystence without aduyse agrement durst reyse vp tayle countrey erle dolphyn auuergne request erle armynake toke iourney paris kynge nat roane thyder rode erle shewed mater kynge counsayle nat shortely dispatched douted treatie people said sir erle dolphyn knowe well erle armynake wolde right gladlye honour profyte realme partes lyeth therin ye haue fayre landes doute greatly whan capitayns gascoyns bernoyes payed suche somes money composicyon requyreth wherby countre shulde enpouerisshed yt within thre four monethes shulde retourne againe make worse warre dyd entre agayne fortress erle dolphyn answered sayd sir entente tayle cessed gadered money shall nat passe cleremonde ryon tyll certifyed suretie people well quod duke content money leuyed put sure kepyng place countre leest shall serue make warre wyll nat come amyable treatie erle armynake bysshoppe cleremonde bisshoppe puy take ye charge mater may honour profite coutre right good wyll sir quod erle deted fro kyng vncles fro roane founde erle armynake brother cleremont auuergne many lordes countre taryenge vpon commyng shewed worde worde freche kyng vncles doutes made ye mater howe entente tayle shulde gadered money ther gadered toguyder putte suretie certayne place tyll entente pyllers might knowen kepeth castels garisons agaynst realme entencion quod erle armynake sithe pleaseth kynge counsayle shall go mater suretie must behoue v haue good sure truse countrey tyll tayle cessed gadered ambassadours assigned erle armynake go speke perot le bernoys amergot marcell two souerayns fortresse helde syde ryuer durdone also speke borge compaigne bernarde ye isle olyuer barbe abton seghewe lorde laenplayre dyuers capitayns acorded nat togyder one wolde ye wolde nat shal shewe reason dyuers opinyons dyuers countreis armynake suche vnder obeysaunce erle armynake soone agreed wolde nat ruled hym chefe company suche renomed vse grete robbery pillery bierne countie foiz howbeit saye nat erle foiz wolde honour realme fraunce whan herde first howe erle armynake dyde treate suche fortress helde auuergne quercy lymosyn desyred knowe hole substauce mater demaunded enfourmed hym therof erle armynake mynded ye men garysons whan departed holdes whyder wolde set busynesse nat answered said hym sir erle armynake wolde kepe wage occupy lombardy ye knowe well suster maryed gascone sone thought shalbe moche lombardy whervnto erle foiz gaue none answere fell talkyng howbe thought neuerthelesse apered af hadled mater couertly shall shewe howe erle armynake treatie coude countre bierne teneurs therle foiz suche owed hym fauour coude neuer cause agree departe garisons wolde nat go nother erle armynake bernarde brother lawe therle foiz full great prudence consydred two lordes armynake cosyns labriciens puissaunt men sawe howe gate frendes euery parte thought shulde nat renforsed ought serue hym one thynge reasonable erle foiz ymagined sir espaygne de leon shewed whan ortays lykewise dyde erle compane capitayne carlot auuergne also dyde bourge englande sayd howe erle foiz regarded howe open warre armynake thoughe peace bytwene whiche truese whiche dyuers tymes renewed bytwene theym therfore thought hat erle armynake companyons vnder gouernaunce warres shulde fayrer armynakes labricience alyes myght hym great displeasure cause suche owed fauour therle foiz wolde nat agte erle armynake howe made beleue wolde dyd dissemble brake apoyntmetes howe rode nat abrode moche dyde wherby alwayes erle armynake thought haue come purpose agreed hym perotte de bernoys helde stronge castell salucette whiche chefe soueraygne auuergne lymosyne patesyng endured rochell also guyllyam saynt foye helde castell bonteuyll also margote marcell helde loysse saynt flour auuergne bourge compaygne englysshe bourge helde carlotte margote marcell sayde contente myght haue lykewise perotte bernoys geffray teate noyre helde vadachore souerayne aboue dyde mocke dissemble mater disdayned fall treatie erle armynakes thought castell imprignable well prouyded seuyn eyght yeres passage two coude nat taken fro hym myght issue whan lyste refresshe hym selfe company geffray wrote hym selfe saueconductes geffray teate noyre duke vandachore erle lymosyn lorde soueraygne capitayns auuergne rouergue lymosyn let v leaue speke mater farre coutreis tyll haue cause returne therto agayne nowe wyll speke matter nerer home myne owne nacyon hath ben shewed whan treated ende warre flaunders charter peace duke burgoyne duchesse dyde gyue graunt sealed gaunt good towne noble cytie tourney therfore nowe enforce mater history wyll speke nowe warres guerles brabant quickened bycause frenche kyng duke burgoyne mater greatly touched insydentes gendred therby fayne set hades warre come bottom therof contynue length true hystorie mater saye thus foloweth phowe erle reynolde guerles layde landes guage wyst nat cae refuge archebysshoppe coleygne vncle blamed hym howe ambassadours wente berthaulte malygnes cap cxi alonge season guerles brabant grete hatered toguyder dyd countreis adioyninge reason certayne bondes one agaynst another moost hatered brabanders duke guerles heyres towne graue whiche duke guerles holden per force longe season agaynst brabansoys sayd bycause yt towne grane stode syde ryuer muese towardes brabant duke guerles helde wrongfully yt tyme dyuers comunycacions poyntmentes taken howbeit alwayes guerloys stacke hert also ye guerloys hated brabasoys bycause thre fayre castels yt syde ryuer gaulech buthe nulle whiche castelles duke brabat helde also peforce reasone redynge shall begynne duke guerles hatereddes often tymes renewed bytwene guerles brabant supposed dyuers knightes squyers knewe dedes armes sir edwarde guerles slayne marueylous incydent batayle iulyers ye shote archer duke vyncelant boem duke lusenbourge brabante lyued men vyctorie hadde come entente gettyng agayne thre castelles lo valiant man hardy wolde haue conquered agayne pnowe wyll declare haue promysed maner foresayd castelles came signorie brabansoys first wyll begyn duke guerles tyme whan wrote ordayned hystorie erle guerles called raynolde bycause guerles riche countre great duchy brabant erle came lande yonge man frewyll dispende largely thought full lytell ende myght come cared nothynge accomplysshe pleasure haunted iustes tourney gret cost gette hym renome euery yere spended four tymes moche value reuenewes landes borowed lombardes dyuers place lyberall outragious ran dette coulde nat ayde hym selfe thynge parentes frendes greatly blamed hym speciallye vncle mother syde came house orcle archebysshop coleygne sayd hym maner gyueng hym counsayle fayre nephewe raynolde ye haue demeaned youre selfe nowe ye become poore manne lades lyeth pledge dyuers place throughe worlde lytell accompte made poore lordes thynke suche haue hadde great giftes profite wyll rendre againe god ayde whan se poore case haue gyue wyll flye fro youre company mocke youre foule large ye shall fynde frendes thynke nat though bysshoppe coleyne ought breke mynisshe myne estate helpe gyue patrimony churche surely wyll nat conscyence shall neuer agre therto also ye pope cardynals wyll nat suffre therle heynalt hath nat behaued hym self ye haue done hath gyuen margarett eldest doughter maryage kynge almayne loys bauyers yet hath thre wyll marry highly yf ye hadde well borne selfe nat haue layde heritage pledge put hades none castels townes ye might ryytwell haue fortuned haue one doughters maryage case ye ye shall neuer come therto ye haue nowe nother townes castels ye maye endowe woman nat moche poore lordshyppe erle guerles sore abasshed wordes bysshop vncle knew well shewed hym trouthe loue kyndred desyredde counsayle counsayle fayre nephue quod bysshop late ye wyll close faste stable whan horse loste howe se busynesse one remedy remedy quod erle shall shewe bysshoppe berthaulte malygnes nowe renomed rychest man syluer golde knowen place reason course marchaundise vseth bothe lande see occupyeth dama cayre alexadre galyes marchaudyse worthe hundred thousande floreyns hath pledge parte herytage berthault hath fayre doughter mary hath mo chyldren great high baron almaygne march haue desyred maryage selues sonnes knowe well yet coude neuer come entetes refused thought nat worthy wherfore wolde counsayle yt ye shulde treate berthault desyring haue doughter maryage yt wyll redeme landes paye dettes bring agayne hades townes castelles lordshippes perteyning vnto herytaunce suppose bycause ye high lynage great signorie haue many townes cyties castels bytwene ye ryuers meuse ryne wyll enclyne request sir therle guerles ye counsayle truely shall therle guerles assembled togider cousayle frendes suche loued hym best discouered entent desyred go name ye sayd berthault malignes treate honorably hym mater whan knightes clerkes came berthalt sent fro erle guerles made good chere made curtesse answere said wolde take aduysement riche beyond measure worthe v sixe hudred florens desyred aduau cement doughter thynkynge wyst nat mary highly tha therle guerles thought accepte maryage fullye assented therto hymselfe dyuers ymaginacions cast many doutes sayd hymselfe yf mary doughter erle haue chyldren happen dye thynges fall dayly shalbe made riche goodes put againe possessyon townes castelles happe mary agayne secondly high blode haue child agayne chyldren comynge noble lynage mother syde shall made ye chyldren issued doughter yea moreouer lyke dysenheryted wherfore without artycled wyll neuer consent therto wyll answere messanges comyng pleaseth greatlye doughter shulde happy myght coe great perfection conioyned maryage erle guerles thoughe shulde cost right derely ye mater clere nowe euery man knoweth well nat clere sore trouble also hath forfayted herytage bytwene ryuers muese ryne wherfore quyte euery man maye se clerely demaundeth doughter maryage gyue hym wyll knowe howe shall also case doughter haue sonne dough hym wyll know shalbe heyres guerles maryage erle may happe haue alyauce wyll haue good suretie hym next blode suche haue ryght demaunde successyon countrie guerles also promyse noble men good townes countre thus berthaulte malygnes determyned hym selfe make answere therle guerlrs comyssyoners next daye hour assigned erles messanges came berthaldes lodgynge shewed well ryche man berthault mette hall swetely recyued spake merilye ledde fayre chambre apparelled dressed benfor kyng hym frendes whan assembled doore closed berthaulte desyred shewe cause comynge whervpon wolde make fynall answere dyd deane coleygne ryght sage clerke cosyn erle guerles spake shewed theffecte ambassade suche wyse ioye hym wordes requestes nede nat speke haue ben shewed touched length berthaulte answered deuysed hym selfe day sayd fayre lordes repute selfe gretly honored dough also might come hygh en prise erle guerles desyreth whan mater begon wolde nat prologed saye bycause alyaunce maryage made bytwene hyghe prince redouted lorde erle guerles mary doughter pleaseth rightwell ye make request landes whiche presente tyme sore charged layde pledge handes certayne lombardes reason maryage shulde quyt shulde rydde hym dette thynges nowe darke shulde make clere thanke god puissauce lyeth thus good wyll first couenaunt fully agreed written sealed maye suretie without trouble debate ye chyldren comyng doughter maye enherytours erldome guerles lymites therof stretche lorde therle guerles fortune dye doughter wtout issue bytwene doughter may enioye herytage guerles duryng lyfe af dyscease returne ye rightfull heyre also saye doughter haue heyre heyres lorde therle fortune dye thoughe erle remacy againe seconde tyme haue issue seconde wyfe yet doughters heyre heyres shall nat disheryted please erle remary agayne contente make seconde wyfe dower suche landes hath beyond ryuer muse marchyng bysshoprike liege duchy brabant nat charge princypall signorie guerles thus erles frendes parentes suche next blode haue chalenge signory guerles good townes countrey wyll seale vpholde deuyses couenau te cotent wyll assent maryage ye may nowe answere ye haue charge knyght answered whan lytell counsayled toguyder one sayd sir haue well herde answere haue none auctorite confyrme graunt farforthe ye demaunde shall retourne lorde therle cousaile shewe hym answere demaude shortely ye shall fro hym agayne berthalte said sir god wyll thus deted chambre phowe erle raynolde guerles maryed mary doughter berthault malignes doughter maried agayne englande issue two sonnes doughter howe sir iohn bloyes wedded theldest doughter erle guerles howe coutie guerles remayned therle guerles yongest doughter cap c xii ye haue well herde answer demaundes bytwene foresaid party wherfore speke therof ye haue herde whan therle guerles messangers returned home agayn erle hoote mater sawe well coude better tha mary berthalt malygnes doughter riche man erle counsaile made deuysed writynges sufficient therle set seale next fredes paretes lykewise dyd knightes guerles good townes whan confyrmed done berthaulte content ye maryage made erles dettes payde landes clerely quytte daunger erle toke newe counsayle began newe lyfe state called good named better well wherwith lacked nothyng berthault malygnes myght ayde hym erle bare hym wyfe ryght honourably fayre lady good sage deuout prudent nat toguyder past four yeres lady dyed doughter called isabell whan therle guerles wydower yong maryed agayne ryght highly kynge edwarde englande father good kyng edwarde beseged tourney wanne ealis gaue erle raynolde doughter named isabell erle thre chyldren two sonnes one doughter sir raynolde sir edwarde iane afterwarde duches guerlers lykewise bertram malignes ymagined begynnyng whan doughter maryed erle guerles euyn fell trouthe kepte hym whan kynge edwarde englande vncle erle guerles chyldren came first almayne emperour loyes bauyers whiche emperour instytuted kynge edwarde vycar generall throughe march empyre conteyned begynnyng boke coutie guerles made duchy countie iulyers made marque iulyers augment dignity come mater duke raynolde guerles nephue kynge edwarde dyed without issue sir edward guerles maryed heynault wyfe yongest doughter duke aubert lady yonge sir edwarde neuer touched carnallye sir edwarde also dyed withoute issue ryght valyaunt knight slayne batayle yt bytwene duke brabant duke wincelant iulyers suster iane maryed duke guylliam iulyers chyldren successyon bretherne said toke vpon heyre duchy guerles lykewyse dyde eldest suster firste maryage two bretherne seconde maryage bothe deed withoute laufull issue wherfore sayde enherytoure thus fell difference bytwene two susters countrey wolde haue one eldest suster counsayled mary high lygnage myght ayde chalenge defende herytage treatie made bysshoppe coloygne lorde sir iohan bloyes therle loyes brother lyued bysshoppe sayd shulde therby duke guerles successyon two bretherne deed withoute issue male therfore right mariage ye right shuld retourne none coude chalege right sir iohan bloyes alwayes ben nourisshed brought vp party hollande zelande fayre herytage language countre neuer wyll mary frauce layde eare glad lye treatie sawe well myght therby haue great possessios march loued beste also knyghtes hollande counsayle counsayled hym therto accepted maryage first wolde conclude sayd wolde ryde heynault quesnoy speke cosyn duke auberte se counsayle wolde gyue hym saye trouthe duke aubert wyst nat counsayle hym dyd made semblaunt therof dissymuled mater lytell sir iohn bloyes wolde lengar tarye haue counsayle toke horse retourned soone coude guerles wedded lady dyd put possession countre wolde nat receyue hym lorde lady moost parte knyghtes squiers good townes countre helde duchesse iulyers lady hadde fayre chyldren wherfore guerles loued better thus sir iohn bloys wyfe possessyons whiche cost hym moche erle loys brother dyed erle bloyes lorde dauenes heynault landes hollande zelande sayd cou tie great herytage alwayes cousayle counsayled hym pursue ryght ought haue wife guerles dyde power almayns couetous wolde make warre hym lengar money endured chalenge yt made duchy guerles dyd neuer fyte great domage dyed gentyll knight sir iohan bloyes castell towne eslone houe yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore one ye moneth iune buryed freres valencenes besyde sir iohan heynault brother sir guy bloyes erle helde landes ryght successyon yt two bretherne helde aswell fraunce picardy heynalt hollande zelande countie bloyes knowe nat howe many yeres lady dyed ben wyfe therle iohn bloys suster duches iuliers abode pesably duches guerles ordayned thaccorde countre request knightes good townes duchy guerles yt shulde take lorde sir willm iuliers eldest son duke iuliers lade came hym rightfully succession vncles reason therof duke aubert ye duches wyfe gaue hym doughter maryage ben maried sir edward guerles thus lady doughter heynault duches guerles whan maried duke guerles sonne duke iulyers bothe one age wherfore maryage agreable yong duke guerles helde hym owne countrey thelder waxed loued dedes armes iustes tourney alwayes duke rather englysshe treche shewed well long lyued alwayes bare mynde yuell wyll predecessours duchy brabant alwayes sought occasion might make warre two reasos one bycause alyed faythe homage kyng richarde englande bycause wyncelant boesme duke luse burge brabant bought therle mors great lorde almayne thre foresaid castelles whiche shall name agayne quicken mater gaulech buch nulle othersyde ryuer muse lande falquemount whiche castels aunciently teyned ye duke guerles enherytour therfore yog duke willm iuliers duke guerles sore displeased might nat recouer herytage long duke wyncelant brabat lyued spake worde therof nowe shall shewe howe fortuned thentent mater shulde ye clerer vnderstanded phowe castelles gaulech b th null came duke brabant howe duke iuliers susteyned linfars cou tre robbed maner people great assemble duke brabant made go iulyers howe discofyted cap cxiii duke reynolde guerles cosyn germayne prince guerles brother enguaged threfor said castels florens high baron almayn called therle mors erle helde castels season whan saw yt coude nat get money lende sore displeased sent suffycient monynge duke raynolde guerles duke made compte therof nat wherwith redeme agayne erle mors sawe came ye duke brabant treated hym haue agayn money sayde castelles duke herde hym well bycause castels marched lande faulquemout whiche lade lorde ye duke glad encrese enheritauce thought wel ouer lyue ye lady iane duches brabant wife soe gate possession ye said thre castelles first set lorde kalle chefe souerayne whan duke guerles deed sir edwarde guerles toke hym herytage sent ye duke brabant ambassador desyring hym might haue agayne thre castelles money payde duke wolde make suche bargayne denyed whiche answere sir edwarde guerles nat content dalte hardely wydowe lady isabell brabant yonger suster duches whiche lady wedded duke raynolde guerles thus troubled dowrie lady wente brabant complayned duke brabant brother duchesse howe sir edwarde guerles dyde great wronge iniury bycause grudge bytwene brabansoys guerloys lande towne grance whiche brabant syde ryuer muese therfore duke brabansoys enclyned ayde lady day assembled togyder callyng duke brabant great nobre men warre xii hundred speares sir edwarde guerles made assemble parte case likely haue batayle bytwene duke aubert duke mours duke iullyers mette togyder treatie assemble departed sondre wt thyng doyng yere ye duke wyncelant brabant ouerthrewe companyons coutrey lusenburge greatly wasted lande putte many exyle towre castell lusenburge dyed souerayne capitayne called lytell meslyn also ye yere sir charles boesme raigned kynge almaygne emperour rome instytuted duke wyncelat boesme made hym souerayne regarder instytucion ordynaunce called almayne le langue fride say holding couert sure wayes maner people myght go come ryde fro towne towne surely sauegarde emperour gaue hym great parte lande countrey dauffay bothe sydes ryuer ryne defende hym therin agaynst lynfars maner people ryght peryllous great robber without pytie also emperour gaue hym souerayntie good riche cytie straubourcke made marque holy empyre augment therby estate surely coulde nat gyue hym moche duke wyncelant lyberall swete courtesse amyable noble armes likely atchyue many thynges hadde lyued long dyed floure youthe wherof haue written hystorie make great complaynt hym lyued lengar tyll xxiiii yere age thescisme churche greatly displeased hym shewed often tymes priue acquayntauce dayes traueyled great parte worlde two great prince knewe non huble tretable noble prince one good mayster lorde guy bloys comaunded make hystorie two prince dayes wereful humilyte large bountie without malyce lyued lyberally owne without oppressynge people reysing vp yuell customes la de pnowe let v retourne pythe mater haue begone whan ye duke iulyers sir edwarde guerles called theselfe bretherne hertes good englisshe ben long alyed ye kyng englande loue fauour alwayes ayded warres whan sawe duke brabant hadde hygh signory lorde souerayne regarder emperonr chiefe correctour mysdoers robber founde lyueng highe wayes almaygne therat indygnacion enuy nat dyde well helde iustyce corrected yuell doer souerayne regarde signory ouer lague fride whiche parte lande whiche offyce first instytued yt marchautes might pesably passe fro brabant heynault flaunders frauce fro liege coleyne cyties townes fortress almayne nother marchauntes coulde nat passe entre almayne landes daungers duke iulyers ye duke guerles soo certayne robber wayes linfars done vyolence passynge landes duke iuliers shewed duke lente horse castels great complayntes came duke wyncelant brabant luzenbourge bruselles howe languefryde wherof souerayne regarder keper broken violated howe dyde vyolence robbed countrey soiourned euer retourned duchy iulyers duke brabante yonge lusty puyssaunte lynage landes toke great dispyte offence people complayned said wolde fynde remedy seynge charge kepe defende languefride wolde nat neclygence shulde take reproche blame conclude dede sette reason demaunde counsayle aduyse sente duke iulyers notable persones lorde vrquon lorde bourguenall syr scelar archedecon heynalt geffrey de la towre great rowter brabante shewyng wyse swete maner offence whiche greatly toucheth preiudyciall duke brabante keper souerayne regarder languefride duke iulyers fayntely excused hym selfe shewed lefe haue warre peace duke brabantes messangers nat well cotent toke leaue duke iuliers reiourned shewed duke brabant herde sene whan duke herde demauded best aunswered cousayle sayenge sir ye knowe best selfe well quod duke saye yt entensyon wyll nat slepe blame shall said slouth faynte hert shulde suffre vnder sauegarde robber vilaynes robories vnpunysshed shewe wyll shewe cosyn iuliers aydes mater toucheth nere duke cooled nat entent contynent set clerkes warke sent thought wolde ayde hym prayed commaunded sente sufficyent knoledge mynde duke iuliers alies bothe lordes made great preparacion duke iulyers lytell ayde brother syr edwarde guerles greatly coforted men frendes two lordes sent priuely men farre almayne bycause almayns couetous desyring wynne bene longe place myght get good aduenture wolde haue come habundaunce nat knowen shulde haue agaynste duke brabante duke brabante great aray departed fro bruselles went louayne fro thence treete ryuer muese founde thousande speares abydinge hym always came menne hym fro partyes fro fraunce fro flauders fro haynalt fro namure fro lorayne countreys two thousande fyue hundred speares good men warre also came hym burgoyne lorde graunt hym foure hundred speares came late knewe nat daye busynesse shall shewe wherwith sore dyspleased whanne herde mater done without duke brabant beinge trect herde lytell newes enemyes departed fro trect wednysdaye wente lodged lande enemyes lay nyght thursday tyll herde certayne tydynges shewed hym corours enemyes abrode rode forwarde comaunded burne duke iuliers landand thursday toke lodginge betymes vowarde kept erle guy ligney erle saynt pole sir valeran sonne yong sixtene yere age made knyght duke iuliers came thursday lay nere one another lyklyhode ye almaynes knewe demeanour brabansoys better dyd fridaye betymes whan duke brabant herd masse felde thought nat haue fought soone came redy duke iuliers sir edwarde guerles well mounted great batayle one sayd duke brabante syr beholde yoder enemy put helmes heedes name god saynt george worde duke great ioye day four squiers great price worthy serue hyghe prince aboute hym sene many dedes armes called iohan de valcon baudwyn beauforde gyrarde bye roulande colongne aboute duke bruselloys horsebacke varlettes behynde botelles wyne trussed sadelles pastyes samonde troutes elys wraped towel horseman greatly combred place prease man coude styrre gyrarde bi said ye duke si comaunde horse voyde place shall greatly let v nat se aboute v haue knoledge reregarde vowarde marshall sir roberte namure let quod duke commaunde gyrarde toke glayue handes dyd companyons began stryke helmes horse none place voyded man glad haue horse slaine hurte duke iuliers edwarde guerles company came theym founde erle saynt poule sonne vowarde dasshed fersely amonge anone broken discomfited many slayne taken hurte batayle moste slayne guy erle saynte poule sir valeran sonne taken batayle tourned herde parte duke brabante men honour fewe saued outher slayne taken duke brabante taken syr roberte namure syr loys namure brother sir willyam namure sonne erle namure many also duke iulyers parte slaine hurte ye know well generall rule great losse euer resteth disconfyted howe domage duke brabante iourney yet hadde one great poynte remedy comforte sir edwarde guerles wounded dethe saye bycause opinyon dyuerse lyued wolde haue rydden forwarde puyssauce wolde haue come bruselles conquered cou treye none wolde haue resysted hym hardy fierse hated brabansoys bycause thre castels helde agaynst hym iourney victory duke iulyers ye yere lorde god thousande thre hudred leuen saynt bartylmewes euyn fridaye duches brabant purchased frendes counsayle charles frenche kyng nephue duke brabat bretherne chyldren suster counsayled kynge go kynge almayne emperoure brother duke brabante whose sake duke husbande taken domage lady dyd came conualence ryuer ryne founde emperoure wysely made complaynte emperoure herde well whiche boude vnto dyuerse reason one bycause duke brother another bycause institude hym vycare souerayne regarder languefryde comforted lady sayd next somer wolde fynde remedy lady retourned brabante well comforted emperour sir charles boesme slept nat busynes waked mater ye shall soone wynter past aproched noble cytie coloyne made prouysion suche wyse though wolde go conquere realme defence wrote duke erles helde hym commaunded thyrde day iune shulde hym ayes fyfty horse pece payne lesyng landes specially comaunded thre duke auberte erle haynalte shulde come ayes fyfty horse dyd whanne lordes come moche people syr charles sonne sayde wolde go entre ye landes duke iulyers destroy bycause great outrage done enteryng felde army emperours vycaire brother sentece gyuen playne iudgement emperours chambre mater regarded archebysshoppe treues archbysshoppe coloyne byssop marauce bysshoppe liege duke aubert bauier duke oste brother diuerse baron almayne thought dystroy landes valyaunt knyght duke iulyers shulde yuell done also nere kynne sayde better fyrste sende hym myght come obeysaunce apoyntment holden best loue bothe partyes duke auberte brother came iuliers found duke abasshed wyste nat counsayle beleue ben shewed assemble emperour made come hym without frendes dyd stoppe whan lordes come duke gladd specyally comynge two cosyns germayns duke aubert bauiers duke oste brother knewe well wolde nat dyshonoure rather gyue hym good cousayle dyd counsayle shewe breuely shulde sende honorable persones duke lusenburge brabant whome helde curtoyse prison castell nideque dyd whan come lordes dyd hym great honour reason departed togyder came ayes toke lodgynges duke auberte brother foresayd prelate meanes treatye sore entreated emperour counsayle shewed emperoure howe ye duke iuliers cosyn owne free wyll come se hym put hym selfe poorely reseruacyon obeysaunce commaundement knowledge hym soueraygne liege lorde swete amyable wordes molefyed greatly emperours ire emperoure sayd lette duke come dyde kneled downe emperoure sayde ryght redoubted souerayne beleue well ye dyspleased bycause brother lawe duke brabante whome haue helde longe prison cause submytte selfe abyde ordre counsayles worde themperour gaue none aunswere sonne sir charles called kynge boesme aunswered sayde duke iulyers ye haue ben outragyous kepe vncle longe prisone nat desyre well loued cosyns duke auberte duke oste bauyers busynesse wolde haue ben soer layd charge ye haue well deserued hyghly punysshed chaunge copye haue cause renew yuell wylles agaynste ye wyll costly duke iulyers beynge kne emperoure sate chayre imperiall sayde ryght redoughted souerayne lorde puyssaunt hyghnes knowledge selfe haue trespassed youre maieste army came cosyn vycaire empyre haue helde hym prisoner delyuer hym vnto freely quyte requyre grace beare yuell wyll fro hence forthe prelate prince beynge presente helpe forwarde wordes sayde ryght noble prince suffyseth cosyn iulyers hath sayd well quod emperour content toke hym vp hande shewed confyrmacion loue kyst duke mouth also sonne kynge boesme duke brabante delyuered prison suche prisoner vnder duke iulyers nat raunsomed delyuered quyte reason composycion treatie done euery manne retourned owne emperour wente prage almayne duke brabant brabante whanne duke brabante retourned reysed newe tayle coutrey restore knightes parte domages phowe duke brabante dyed howe duke guylliam guerles treated duches brabante haue agayne thre castels aunswere made alyauce kynge englande cap cxiiii yet wyllynge treate matter lengthe renforce hystorye brynge poynte wolde come vnto declare trouthe charles frenche kyng came great puyssaunce almayne might haue shewed haue prolonged thing though date season paste yet ought shewed hystory whan knowe frenche kynge kynge england began besy began wake procede hystory dyd therfore saye thus whan duke wyncelant returned countrey clerely delyuered person ye haue herde wyll vysyte landes castels well duchy luzenbourge else toke iourney good cytie strawesbourge throughe lande fauquemount behelde ye thre castels whiche occasion duke guerles yuell wyll founde theym stronge fayre loued loued moche better caused newly fortyfied set workemen worke mason carpeters dykemakers amende euery place departynge set valyaunt knyght soueraygne keper thre casteles knyght called sir iohan grosset duke commaundemente toke hym charge parell duke passed vysited cou trey pleasure retourned agayne brabante abydynge season syr iohan blo wedded olde lady duches guerles herytage right came hym deth sir edwarde guerles brother slayne ye haue herde batayle iulyers suster duches iulyers stroue hym made chalenge moste parte knightes good townes inclyned ladyes parte bycause fayre sonne able ryde well sene always warres sir iohn de bloyse wyfe coulde neuer haue peasable possessyon chalenge ryght wyfe pursute therof coste hym aboue hundred thousade frankes sonne duke wyllyam iuliers shewed well youth noble hardy loued dedes armes came noble ertractyon duke guerles mariage eldest doughter duke auberte ben wedded sir edward guerles neuer carnally coupyled yonge thus maryed lorde willyam iulyers moche one age soo styll duches yonge duke increased honour wytte prowes great wyll haute dedes armes augment herytage e rather englysshe frenche sayd always yong wolde ayde insteyne kynge englandes quarell nerer blode hym frenche kyng shewed hym dyuerse tymes howe brabansoys dyd great wronge kepe fro hym thre castels aunswered sayd let v suffre senson euery thynge muste haue turne season yet awake cosyn brabante hathe many great frendes sage knight tyme may come yt shall wake thus mater stode season tyll god toke oute lyfe duke wyncelante dyed duke boesme duke lusenbourge brabante hath ben conteyned hystory dethe duke duches brabant loste moche yonge duke guerles ryght valyaunt lykely dysplease enemyes thought get recouer agayne thre castelles bycause debate ben bytwene brabante vncle lorde edwarde guerles sente treate duches brabant delyuer castelles somme money laye pledge always affyrmynge howe laye guage lady answered messangers possessyon helde owne ryght enherytaunce bycause wolde duke shulde good neyghbour brabaunte shulde leaue gyue vp towne graue whiche helde duchy brabant whan ye duke guerles herde aunswere nothynge well contente thought great dispyte therof thought ymagined many thynges couertly treated knyght called sir iohan grosselotte chiefe capitayne sayde castelles assaye coude gette hym byeng money otherwyse knyght trewe sage wolde wyse harken therto sente duke desyringe hym speke therof dye therfore shuld neuer faut founde hym wolde consente trayson naturall lady whan duke guerles sawe enfourmed dyde moche sir raynolde dyscouorte toke small occasyon displeasure agaynst knyght daye mette feldes slayne wherwith duchesse brabante sore displeased countre castelles putte kepynge agrement duches counsayle brabant thus matter stode certayne yeres euer norisshed couert hate towne graue one parte
