thre castelles parte bytwene duke guerles duches brabant countreis fronter guerles bare alwayes yuell wyll couerlly brabant suche marched nere dyd euer moche dyspleasure coude specially suche towne graue bytwene duke woode towne graue four leages playne countrey fayre feldes ryde guerles dyde alwayes great dispyte brabansoys myght mater went forwarde ye duke guerles passed see went englande sekyng rycharde cosyn cosins duke lancastre duke yorke ye duke glocestre great baron englande good chere desyred se hym haue acquayntaunce englysshe men knewe well duke herte corage ymaginacion affection rather englysshe frenche vyage made great alyaunce kynge englande bycause tyme helde nothynge kynge englande wherby shulde beare hym faythe homage seruyce therfore kyng richarde gaue hym pencyon coffer thousande marke yere counsayled assaye gette right fro duches brabant promysed haue aide englysshe men suche wyse shulde take domage meanes sware true faithfull kyng realme englande whan alyaunce made tooke leaue kynge cosyns baron englande retourned owne countrey guerles shewed duke iulyers hadde done howe shulde haue ayde helpe englysshe men duke iulyers experyence age knewe farther duke sonne dyde made countynaunce great ioye sayd sonne wyllyam ye haue done moche bothe maye fortune repent youre goyng englade ye nat knowe howe puyssaunt duke burgoyne duke myghtie loketh herytage brabant howe maye ye resyst agaynst puyssaut lorde howe may resyst quod duke guerles ye duke iulyers father rychee myghtier better make warre agaynste hym hadde rather haue ryche man hath great possessios herytage hym hath nothynge lese nothynge co quered one buffet shall receyue wyll gyue sire also kynge almayne alyed kyng englande nede shalle haue ayde hym well quod duke iuliers wylliam fayre sonne feare ye wyll playe fole wysshes enterprise lyke vnacomplysshed atchyued shall shewe duke iulyers spake somwhat agaynste wyll sonne duke guerles made dout enterprise kynge charles fraunce laste discessed season yt speke dyde moche coulde alwayes gette hym frendes partes stode hym hande coude nat moche make resystece ennemyes howe dyde moche coude gyftes fayre promyses sytte rest haue ayde gate hym selfe many frendes empyre place whan duke iulyers quyte delyuered oute prisone come duke brabant kynge great frendes toguyder ordynauce emperour rome dyde sette duke iulyers wente parys se kynge nobly receyued great gyftes gyuen hym knyghtes made relefe kynge signorie vyerson whiche parteyned coutie bloys whiche lande laye bytwene bloys berrey worthe yere fyue hundred pounde money curraunt fraunce duke iulyers sware yt shulde neuer beare armure agaynst crowne fraunce longe kyng lyued kept othe surely long kyng charles lyued dyde hym maner domage consented none done crowne fraunce whan kyng charles deed charles sonne kynge reason warres flaunders hath shewed hystorie tooke creacyon parys hadde moche coude nat take hede euery place duof iulyers came nat fraunce made relyefe landes viersone wherfore duke berrey toke hym selfe soueraygne sayde howe relefes parteyned hym ceased landes toke ye profytes therof puyssauce putte fro ryght erle bloyes howe tyme sawe bothe oftentymes togyder neuer debate made bytwene sayd landes yuell wyll shewed good cause theym frendes toguyder loyes sonne erle bloyes maryage lady mary doughter duke berrey duke iuliers wolde gladlye haue entred herytage regarded sonne shulde heyre therfore made lytell counte alyaunce sonne duke guerles hadde made englande reason spake wordes ye haue herde duke guerles whan retourned englande howe duke guerles yonge coragyous toke lytell regarde father wordes sayde sir haue done wyll vpholde rather haue warr frenche kynge peace rather hym poore man phowe duchesse brabante sent messangers freche kyng complaynyng duke guerles howe kynge counsayle sore busyed insydentes fell realme frauce well defyances guerles busynesse bretaygne capi cxv duchesse brabant beynge bruselles well enformed trouble howe duke guerles thretned theym brabante make theym warre duchesse feared sayde ah god assoyle soule lorde husbande hadde lyued duke guerles durst nat haue spoken suche matter nowe bycause woman aged wyll make warre agaynst lady called toguyder counsaile knowe best knewe well duke hote hasty coragyous seasone whyle ladye takynge counsayle frendes frenche kynge defyed duke guerles wherof ranne great brute throughe realme realmes therto adioynyng marueyle newes bycause duke guerles small prince regarde smalle landes men spake therof dyuers maners euery man opynion thane duchesse counsayle sayde madame ye haue nede counsayle shall counsayle sende frenche kynge duke burgoyne tymes ye haue herde howe duke guerles hathe defyed frenche kynge alyes purpose make warre realme fraunce brute ronneth wyll bycause englysshemen almaygnes alyaunce haue better entre realme frauce throughe youre countrey wherfore good kynge duke burgoyne aduertysed therof youre castels fronters well fortifyed garnysshed nat small ennemye doubted saye nat ye shulde haue great nede seke ayde confore onely guerles good regarde alyaunces maye lightlye gette well englysshe men almaygnes alwayes couetous desyreth make warre realme fraunce trust wynnyng duchesse sayd cousayle sir ye saye trouthe shalbe ye haue deuised suche shulde go message apoynted lorde bourguenall cheife stewarde house sir iohan opeyn gracyous knyght clerke squyer honoure clerke called sir iohan grane squyer nycholas de la monoy four preuy cou sayle duchesse brabant departed fro bruselles letter credece rode parys tyme nother kynge duke burgoyne natte rohane normandye went fro parys roane kynge whan ambassadoures came rohane firste treated duke burgoyne made good chere knewe well delyuered letter hym receyued reed wha tyme brought kynge loue lady receyued louyngly kyng reed letter herde speke aunswered sayde sir wordes requestes demaundeth counsayle resorte alwayes vncle burgoyne shall dispatche youre busynesse shortely maye wordes contented greatly ambassadours went lodgynges kynge vncles counsayle dayly toguyder counsaile dyuers cause insydentes newe fallen defyance duke guerles nothyng pleasaunt also knewe nat duke bretayne purposed bycause taken constable fraunce prisoner set hym rausome cm frankes taken fro thre castelles good towne greatly fortifyed men vitayls artyllary garysons townes sent dyuers tymes letter messangers englande kyng vncles duke lancastre tyme galyce cousayle frauce moche prouyde euery busynesse wherby lengar ye duches brabantes ambassade answere finally ye duke burgoyn made answere sayd sir ye shall retourne lady aunte salute fro v delyuer kynges letter shewe yt businesse let nat abasshed thyng shalbe coforted suche wyse shall well ceyue countre brabant shall take domage reproch fayre answere contented greatly ambassadours brabant thus departed returned parys fro thes brusels made relacion aunswere ye haue herde wherwith duches well content season newes sprede abrode holy saynt peter lusenbourge cardynall whose body dyde myracles cytie auygnon holy cardynall sonne erle guye sant poule dyed batayle iulyers holy cardynall tyme good man noble holy deuoute lyfe dyde many dedes pleasaut god swete courtesse meke mayde body great almesse man gyaynge poore people kept nothynge hym selfe goodes churche bare lyueng moost parte day nyght prayer allwayes fledde fro vanyties superfluyties worlde yonge dayes god called hym company anone discesse dyde great myracles ordayned buryed amonge poore people dayes vsed humylyte buryed chapell saynt mychaell pope cardynalles whan sawe myracles body dyde daylye encrease multiplye wrote frenche kynge speciallye brother erle valeranne saynt poule desyringe hym come auygnon erle wolde nat excuse hym wente thyder gaue goodlye lampes syluer hange aulter hadde great marueyle great beleue visytacion people made dayly se hym wente thyder fro countie foize daylye workes encreased sayde shulde canonised nat tell fell pnowe yt haue shewed dethe shall shewe dethe another haue nat spoken dethe kyng whome great mencyon hath made hystorie howe dyde many dedes vnresonable hym meanes realme frauce moche tyme kyng nauer phowe straunge fortune kynge nauer dyed cytie pampilona howe charles sonne crowned howe va chadore beseged duke berrey howe duke burgoyne sente duchesse brabant capi cxvi sayd trouthe nothyng certayne dethe saye bycause yt kynge nauer whan dyed thought full lytell nere ende knowen therof paraduenture wolde haue taken better hede dyde cytie pa pylona nauerre ymagined howe wolde reyse great taylage realme two hundred thousande florens sente counsayle said howe wolde haue money reysed counsayle durste nat saye nay cruell prynce moste notable persones cyties townes realme sente come panpylona came thyder durst nat disobey whan come togyther kynges palays kynge hym selfe declared forthe mater sent king ryght subtyle sage well langaged conclusion sayde howe towardes nedes must haue ccm florens reysed subiectes maner riche pay x frankes meane cessed fyue frankes one franke request abasshed greatly people yere ben batayle nauer reason wherof tayle raysed somme hundred thousande floreyns besyde maryed doughter lady iane duke iohan bretaygne great parte money tha nat payde vngadered whan kynge hadde made demaunde desyred haue answere requyred take counsayle speke toguyder king gaue respite xv dayes chefe make answere brute taylage spredde abrode nauerre euery man basshed therof xv dayes ende moste notable persones good cyties townes returned panpilona nombre threscore persones charge aunswere hole realme kynge present answere makyng whiche done fayre garden farre fro people closed aboute hygh walles aunswered one accorde shewed pouerte realme alleged howe former tayle nat leuyed gadred wherfore besought goddessake haue pytie sayd surely realme nat able beare whan king sawe coude nat easely attayne purpose sore dyspleased departed fro sayd sir ye yuell counsayled take counsayle agayne speke yet agayne togyder went chambre counsayle hym good persones togyder garden faste closed hygh walles kynge commaunded wyse suffer issue haue lytell meate drinke great doute lyues none durste speke supposed constreynt desyre strake thre heedes suche moste contrary entente gyue feare ensample fell straunge insydence marueylous sodayne adueture whiche god sent lyke myracle shall shewe enfourmed countie foize ortays erles house men panpylona past nat thre four dayes iourney thence shewed howe kynge nauer dayes loued well woman tyme fayre damosell louer wydower longe season nyght laye space retourned chambre feuer sayd seruauntes dresse bedde wyll rest season went bed trymbled colde coulde take heate aged man aboute threscore yere age vsage bedde wont chased bason hote cole make hym swete whiche often tymes vsed dyd hym hurte tyme seruautes dyd outher god wolde deuyll burnynge flame toke shetes suche maner coulde reskewed brente bowel wrapped bytwene shetes lyued fyftene dayes great payne mysery inso moche physyke surgery coulde helpe hym dyed ende kynge nauerre poore men countrey quyte taylage delyuered fro payenge charles sonne noble good knyght yonge kynge nauerre crowned kynge seasone wrote hystory anone obsequy done father cytie paupylona ye haue well herde treatyes hadde ben made county armynake dolphenty auuergne lymozyn enemyes neyghbours many well content departe thought warred trauelled realme fraunce longe ynoughe thynkynge goo robbe pyll place duke armynake promysed theym leade lumbardy erle foyze wolde nat lyghtly dysceyued thought contrary helde hym selfe styll se ende busynesse euer dylygentely enquyred howe treatyes wente forwarde party whan men warre shulde departe whyder shuld drawe men countrey sayde renome howe wolde go rynne bowfe robbynge pyllynge thanne erle caste downe heed sayde alwayes newes rynne amonge warre erle armynake bernarde brother yonge knowe well loue nat countrey men warre may happe meanes rynne countrey howe wyll prouyde fore suche wyse truste shall take domage sayd longe prouysion maketh sure possessyon thus erle foyze sayde counsayle folysshe imagynacyon apered maye atteygne tretynge therof ye haue herde rehersed geffrey tete noyr breton hadde longe kepte garyson stronge castell vandachor lymozyn fronter auuergne burbonoys wolde wyse departe ye castell helde owne propre enherytaunce patysed countrey aboute vnder patesyng people labored pea reste thus geffrey kepte estate greate lorde cruell man dyspleasure hadde pytye slee man beest nowe come purpose whan tydinges spred abrode auuergne lymozyn tayle gathered countreys entente voyde countrey men warre brewted men warre fortresse vandachor shulde departe gyue vp fortresse duke berrey reason tydynges people contente pay tayle whan sawe contrary hurte garyson vandachor thought money payed first gatherynge loste sayd howe wolde paye crosse mayle without vandachor constreyned departe countrey tydynges came yng duke berrey soueraygne charge countrey auuerge lymozyn gelnadan duke counsayle sayde surely poore men haue good cause saye lothe pay money nothinge ouer sayde howe hym selfe counsayle blame layde nat siege aboute fortresse kepe garyson fro issuyng thanne duke berrey ordeyned cost charge countrey foure hundred speares good men armes besiege vandachor bastydes soueraigne capytaynes company syr willyam lygnac syr iohan boesme launce valyaunt knyght burbonoyse men armes knyghtes nere myght layde siege vandochor made ba tydes foure place men countrey made great trench defence vpon straytes stoppe issuinge capytayne geffrey set lytell therby knewe well garison well furnysshed maner thynges thoughe came newe vytayle seuen yere also castell stode strong place vpon rocke coude take domage assawte siege bastydes within wold often tymes issue preuy posterne whiche opened bytwene two rockes wolde issue vnder couerte ryde abrod countrey toke prisoner thynge wolde bringe none fortresse coulde nat bycause strayte wayes stronge mountaynes must passe issue coulde nat stopped fro aley vnder couert endured fro garyson seuen eight leages came feldes whanne retourned agayne tyme entered thre leages sure within castell maner vsed longe season siege laye yere castell pnowe let v leaue spekynge vandachor tyll nother season speke newe mater duke burgoyne forgate nat promise made aunte duches brabante ordayned foure hudred men armes burgonyons made two knyghtes capytayns one sir guylliam tremoyle burgonyon sir geruays merande almayne duke sayd sir ye shall go charge fronters brabant guerles duches brabante wyll apoynt make enemyes good warre ye canne knyghtes sayde shulde beste fulfyll commaundemente made redy gadred men wente forthe soone myght drewe brabante sente worde comynge duches brabante passed lande lusenburge ordynaunce marshall brabant sente thre castels duke guerles chaleged wolde haue againe bycause ben layde pledge say buth gaulyth nulle helde garyson made good fronter warre somtyme rode abrode encountre enemyes duke guerles fortefyed hym selfe agaynste furnysshed townes castels agaynst sawe well warre open fortuned syr willyam tremoyle desyringe auaunce hym selfe thynge myght sownde honoure set imagyncion day towne guerles foure leages fro fortresse towne called seaulle shewed secretely entensyon syr geruays merande companyon lightly accorded mynde gathered company togyder departed aboute mydnyght rode rounde pase towne guydes brought seaule tyme daylight rested apoynted wolde shewed syr geruays xxx speares went wyne gate sir willyam tremoyle folowe bycause feared shulde haue rydden togyder haue spyed thought towne shulde thynke none shulde certayne nombre men armes sent thyder duke guerles refresshe garyson thus knyght sir geruays xxx speares rode towne seaulle mornynge founde men woman goynge towne markette day saluted theym langage almayne rode forthe poore men went surely men countrey perteynynge duke guerles rydynge garyson syr geruays company rode forthe tyll came gate founde open small warde erly moste parte people beddes rested lordes gate incontynent sir willyam tremoyle route came galopynge thyder faste myght entred towne cryed cryes thus towne wonne without defece men towne thought full lytle frechmen wolde haue done enterprise ye moste parte beddes phowe frenche men brente ryfeled towne seaulle retourned garyson ioy duke burgoyne duches brabante made dede howe sir iohn boesme launce discomfyted englysshmen cap cxvii enterprise done nyght saynt marten wynter thre dayes came thyder knyght engla de ten speares xxx archer sente kynge englande knyght called syr guylliam fykaole whan larum began rysinge bed herde towne wonne demauded whome aunswered done breton ah knight breton yuell people wyll burne pyll towne departe crye crye syr crye tremoyle englysshe knyght closed castell helde hym selfe company within se reskewe came euery man abasshed fled hyther thyder poore people fledde ye mynster auoyded ye towne another gate frenchman sette fyre towne dyuerse place howe many howses stone bricke ye fyre coulde nat lighty burne moste parte towne brent pylled robbed nothyng lefte good rychest men towne taken prisoner englysshe knyght taken laste whan sawe lost opened howse douted fyre whan sawe flame smoke euery corner ye towne came penon hym company archer valiauntly defended selfes longe season fynally taken yelden prisoner sir guylliam tremoyle company taken fewe slayne whan frenchemen done wylles towne seaulle guerles varlettes driuing pyllage departed thought foly byde went garison fro whece came thus duke guerles first buffet domage wherwith sore dyspleased whan knewe therof came thyder great nombre menne warre thought well haue founde frenche men gone newe renpayred towne furnished newe men warre dilyget kepe towne thanne thus daily aduetures warre fell loste one daye another duches brabante tho countrey gretly reioysed aduenture sir gillyam tremoyle syr geruais merande atchyued great grace countrey sayde nexte sommer folowyng wolde wynne agayne whan duke burgoyne herde tydinges howe men yt garyson brabant dyd well valyauntly gladde therof incorage theym wrote pleasaunt letter often tymes syr guylliam knyght thus taryed wynter kepinge well fronters defendynge selfe fro domage castelles forteresses guerles better taken hede vnto nowe shall shewe another enterprise perote bernois dyde auuergne gate gret profite meanes dyd shall shewe lenght fortuned yere season aboute tyme myddes maye xl companyons aduenturers issued caluset whiche perot bernoys helde fortresse stode lymozyn companyons rode forthe aduenture auuergne gascoyne squyer capytayne called geronet durante experte man armes bycause countrey alwayes doute ye men warre fronters burbonoys knyght duke burgoyne called syr iohan boesme launce gracyouse amorous knyght hauynge great corage auaunce hymselfe whyle englysshe men rode brode demanded nombre shewed hym howe aboute xl speares quod lytell regarde xl speares wyll set many departe fro thence went chefe charge vandachor gate togyder xl fifty speares lymozyn auuergne burbonoyse hym knyght called sir loys dambter also sir loys dabton lorde saynte obyse toke feldes without kepyng high way knewe countrey came passage enemyes muste nedes passe reasone mountaynes ryuers whiche greate depe occasion snowe fallyng fro mountayns nat ben halfe hour thenglysshment came thyder nat ware rencountre boesme launce copany cauched speares came agaynst enemyes cryed cryes whan englisshment sawe howe must nedes fight turned face enemyes defended selfe sore rencountre certayne ouer throwen bothe partyes say trouth frenchman better expert men armes auenturers semed well none aduenturers returned agayne without varlettes fledde saued selfe whyle dyd fyght xxii taken syxtene slayne place capitayne taken prisoner thus departed phowe syr iohan boesme launceled prisoner moute ferant howe countrey glad whan herde enterprise howe generot company sette raunsome delyuered money perot bitrne lente hym cap cxviii rydyng ledynge prysoners boesme lauce aduysed remembred hymselfe howe moneth ben towne mount ferante auuergne sportyng amonge ladyes damosel howe hadde desyred hym tyme sayeng fayre brother boesme launce ye ryde often tymes abrode feldes may nat fortune yt somtyme ye myght rencounter enemyes shall shewe quod one damosel one great fauoure boesme launce syr quod wolde fayne se englysshman asquyer countrey called gurdines hathe shewed often tymes howe englysshmen experte men armes whiche semeth ryght well betrewe ryde often tymes abrode many propre deades armes taketh dyuerse castels kepeth whiche tyme getleman boesme launce answered sayd dame euer fortune take ye shall se hym syr thanke quod damosell thus foresayde enterprise whan promyse came mynd forsoke way cleremonte whiche nat farre tourned way mountferant nat farre thence comyng mountferant iourney yt atchyued agaynst aduenturers sore troubled countrey people moutferant right ioyfull made hym good chere toke lodgynge vnarmed hym ladyes damosel came make hym chere receyued ryght swetly sage knyght thanked sayde desyred hym se englysse man dame wyll acquyte made promyse nat past moneth go myght fortune take englysshe man shewe hym day god hath gyuen ye grace mete ryght valyant armes haue gyuen v ynoughe howe hadde victory englysshe men naturally borne gascoyns make warre englysshmen byerne hyghe gascoyne ye shall se good leyser loue haue brought towne shall remayne tyll rausomes payed ladyes damoselles laughed tourned mater great sporte sayd hym sir thanke taryed thre dayes amonge kept good company prisoner put raunsome sawe well poore companyons aduenturers thought better hange drowne raunsome rather thanne suffre many abyde styll towne whan departed thence sayd geronet syr ye shall abyde certayne reste company shall departe go seche raunsome ye shall paye shall apoynte shall receyue whanne money payed ye shall departe therfore remembre well nowe herafter hap lyke case lykewyse syr quod geronet bounde thus boesme launce departed retourned agayne syege vandachor twelue prysoners taryed styll mounteferante departed went galuset perot bernois haue hym xxii hundred frankes taryed styll moutferant lay made good great watche layde went vp downe towne plesure fyftene dayes season lerned moche state towne whiche cost hudred thousande frankes whan capytayne galuset infourmed aduenture gere mandurant company ouer throwen sir iohan boesme launce made lytell therof said theym came hym money rausomes syrs ye come money delyueraunce howe saye ye nat yes truely sir quod trust shall nat alwayes losse haue gage well sir quod nother care pledge yet loss shall haue nothynge made nat go rode owne adueture therfore ye may shewe let aduenture delyuer thynke wyll enploye money sorte nay surely canne haue alwayes copanyons ynowe ryde sagely dyd forme wyll quyte man without taken company fynall answere coulde gette geronet sayde amonge themselfe best two thre v retourne agayne geronet shewe case thre retourned mountferante rode passed cleremout sawe well walles nat great heyght sayd one another towne prignable come hyder nyght maye gette great watche kepte muste one tyme bargayne another tyme bye nat bargayne bye one daye thus rode forthe rode mountferante founde geronet companyons shewed answere perot bernoys wherof basshed wyste nat howe gette raunsome thus daye nyght great dyspleasure next daye geronet sayde brought newes syrs requyre retourne agayne capytayne shewe hym fro yt haue power whyle hym serued truely wyll yet pleasure shewe hym tourne become frenche delyuer selfe shall wyn lytell therby god knoweth shall full sore agaynst wyll shall forbeare longe canne shewe hym wyll nowe delyuer v fro hence within moneth shal bring hym suche botye company shall wynne hundred thousande frankes message thre companyons retourned agayne galuset shewed perot message thanne studyed lytell sayd maye well sayeth aduenture shall delyuer incontyuent opened cofer wherin threscore thousande frankes nat gathered rente hadde byerne moste parte pyllage towne dwelte fore warres twelue house erle foiz chefe lorde therof towne called dadam within thre leages ortays tolde oute xxii hundred frankes pynch frende knowen shall put aduenture well able wyn agayne mo wyll thus departed fro galuset retourned mount ferante xiiii great leages bytwene good sauecoduct wherby passed without daunger whan geronet knewe howe company shuld delyuered right ioyfull sente shulde receyue money sayde syrs holde tell money owe tolde xxii hundred frankes rekened expense lodgynges payed euery thynge largeste euery man contente whan payed gerenot hyred men horse bringe theym galuset whan syr iohan boesme launce certifyed receyte money thynke dyd sende el lefte styll trust strength garyson season sir peter gyache chauncellour fraunce left treasoure whiche lost yere parte whan geronet retourned galuset companyons made hym good chere thre foure dayes perot le bernoys called hym sayde geronet promyse ye made seruantes cause delyueraunce nothyng el nat boude paye raunsome seynge ye departed without leaue ye rode forthe aduenture therfore nowe holde promyse el shall displeasure bytwene wold ye knowe haue nat lerned lese rather wynne capytayne quod geronet ye haue reason say ye sir saye thus ye lyste shall set towne mount ferant within xv dayes whiche towne great treasure pyllage ryche marchaundyse ryche villaynes therin great plenty chauncellour fraunce syr peter giache infourmed hathe great ryches within towne knowe well towne symplest kept leste taken hede towne realme syr saye promyse haue made name god quod perot le bernoys well sayd consente therto ye knowe well maner towne howe kepte fortifyed enterprise dothe requyre great nombre syr quod geronette thre four hundred speares shall well accomplysshe feate within towne men great defence well quod perot contente shall singnyfye capytayns fortress aboute mater shall assemble gyder go thyder phowe geronet mandurante twelue company retourned mountferant howe perot bernoys foure hundred speares went mount ferant wolde nat entre towne none waye gate cap cxix determynacion perot sent capytaynes nexte aboute hym apoynted euery man mete ousac castell bysshopriche cleremount nat farre thence wherof somtyme barbe great pyller gascoyne capytayne companyons seuen fortress assembled togyder ousac englysshe men four hundred speares well mounted sixe leages ryde first came ousac perote bernoys shewe enterprise take cousayle capytayns aduyse geronet accordyng informacyon gyuen hym geronet twelue hym arayed theym lyke rude vyllayne marchauntes cote fryse ledde horse tyed one another baggage accordynge custome countrey thus departed fro ousac brekynge daye rode towardes mountferant lyke marchauntes entred towne noone none toke hede men thought full lytell hadde ben men warre towne demed surely ben marchautes come thyder fayre haue bought cloth dyaper said came fro mounte pellier bye marchaudyse fayre come thyder moche marchaundyse fro cyties townes realme geronet company wente lodgynge syne crowne sette vp horse toke vp fayre chambre kepte theym styll therein without goynge aboute towne feare spyenge sate made mery thought well wolde pay nothynge expense nyght besy dresse horse said host ostes horse hadde sore trauayled day wherfore nede rest prouyded plenty candels went chambre dranke made mery wolde nat go bed host hostes wente beddes lette alone suspecte shall shewe perot company dyd sayd day hym seuen capytayns firste perot le bernoys chefe bourge compaygne called arnaldon bourge anglois ye bourge carlat apthon seguyn olyue barbe bernadon isle great routter byerne lorde launce playne hym bourge compayne afterwarde enfourmed enterprise whiche done aboute candelmas whan nightes long colde nyght rayned wynde blewe stormy season wherfore capytayne watche mountferant issued nat nyght lodgynge sent sonne forthe yonge syxtene yere age wente fro one gate foude four poore men watchinge nygh deed colde sayd yonge man syr take eche v blanke let v go home warme v paste leuen clocke yonge man coueted money toke departed fro watche wente owne house geronet company watched hostes dore se whan watch men shulde retourne sawe whan yonge man came fro watche watche men hym geronet sayde mater goeth well lyke good nyght v euery manne towne nowe gone bedde watche paste nede take care parte sure perotte le bernoys company rydynge hyder warde fast may dede ye tyme comynge came nere cleremounte mette aymergotte marcell hundred speres capytayne fortresse alose besyde saint floure whan eche knewe made good chere demaunded eche whyder wolde sought countrey amergot aunswered said come fro fortresse alose ame goynge carlate name god sayd two capytaynes bourge angloys bourge compaigne sir wolde ye thynge speke wyth v yea quod amerigot ye haue certayne prysoners countre dolphyn auuergne ye knowe well treatynge togyther meanes erle armynake wherfore wold gladly make exchaunge certayne prisoner haue garyson sore desyred thus cou te dolphyn right good lady well worthy done pleasure vnto bourge compaigne sayd aymergotte ye greatly bounde pleasure lady within thre yere ye hadde syluer thre hundred frankes redemynge castell mercyer syr pray therle dolphyn season syr quod shewed fraunce comunynge vpon treatie ye know hande erle armynake erle dolphyn perot le bernoys sayde sir leaue thir comunynge come v shall profyte ye shall haue parte botye sir quod aymergot whyder go fayth sir quod perot go streyght mount ferante nyght towne shall yelden aymerygot sayd syr yuell done ye go aboute ye knowe well treatie erle armynake coutrey wherfore townes castels rekeneth themselfe halfe assured wherfore shall greatly blamed thus ye shall breke treatye faythe quod perot wyll agre treatye longe maye kepe feldes behoueth companyons lyue come way v ye shall haue nothynge carlat companyons fortresse suche left behynd wyll nat suffre entre till company come home well ser quod aymerigot wyll nat go wyll returne agayne fortresse syth mater thus thus de parted one fro nother perot helde waye mountferant whan vnder cleremount rested imagyned newe enterprise specially certayne gascoyns knewe nat enterprise geronet sayd capytayns sir beholde cytie cleremonte whiche ryche cytie rather prignable mount ferant haue ladder let v scale shall haue profyte mount ferante poynte nere greed thanne chefe capytayns sayd sir cleremonte puissant towne well peopled men well harnessed one moued wyl assemble togyther put theym selfe defece doute shulde haue great aduaunatage shulde reculed perforce horse taken loste shulde yuell escape farre fro home coutrey shulde ryse pursue v shulde great daunger thynke better go forthe folowe fyrst enterprise sekynge newe enterprise per aduenture myght cost v dere counsayle taken rode forthe without makynge noyse aboute xi clocke nere mount ferant whan sawe towne stode styll thre bowe shot fro ye towne perotte sayde beholde mount ferant company went towne kepe styll close gyder wyll go downe valaye se may se newes geronet hathe brought v enterpryse departe nat tyll come agayne sir quod go waye shall abyde therwith perot departed four hym wether darke man coulde se acre brede fro hym also rayned blewe snewe meruaylouse yuell wether geronet walles taryed newes loked dowe ouer walles thought sawe shadowe men goynge long dyke syde began lytle stell softely wha without herde came nerer wall dyke syde hadde water geronet demauded without perot knew voyce sayd perot le bernoys geronet art thou yea sir quod make redy aproche men shall lette towne tho within towne slepe beddes quod perot shulde entre ye stande god kepe fro wyll nat entre entre wyll entre gate none place wyll quod geronette assure lyeth nat power syr bring ladder hyder spare nat sckale assure none shall let well quod perot thou haste promysed lette towne surely wyll nat entre without gate well quod geronet nat mende nat lette gate faste shytte kepers within slepe whyle stryfe certayne geronettes copany within went vp downe vpon walles se myght noyse lytell poore house foote wall howse stode alone farre fro house poore man dwelte therin taylour watched nyght tyll tyme thanne goynge bedde wynde caryeth noyse farre herde thought men spekynge walles nyght tyme man shall farre therwith wente howse wente vpon walles met men soone sawe began crye one stept forthe toke throte sayd vyllayne thou arte deed thou speke one worde soo helde peace feared dethe geronet herde noyse sayde sir slee hym nat shall v good seruyce god hath sent v hym shall furnysshe enterprise geronet sayde perotte le bernoys syr retourne company whan ye fyrst gate open come forthe youre ax breke downe gate next shewed aduenture man taken walles thanne perot departed wente company shewed mater ye haue herde phowe geronet lette perot le bernoys company towne mountferant wherof countrey frayde howe kynge vncles beynge parys therwith sore dyspleased also erle dolphyn auuergene cap cxx geronet sayd man yt taken without thou fulfyll oure desyre thou arte deed incontynente wolde shulde quod wyll quod geronet thou go gate wake porter say howe capytayne wolde haue gate opened el let delyuer key lette certayne marchauntes mounte pellyer without fardelles marchandyse come fayre sir quod man wyll nat byleue yes warante quod geronet tell theym token nat watche last night sent sonne without thou message well wysely shall slee dagger thy faute lese nat myne enterprise whan poore man sawe howe manassed perceyued howe redy slee sore abasshed sayd sir shall ye comaunde vttermest power came gate knocked longe tyll woke porter sayd arte thou wakest v tyme nyght suche one quod named name haue ben nyght busy makyng certayne geare capytayns haue borne home whyle worde came hym howe certayne marchauntes mount pellier without gate marchandyse sore trauayled weate fowle wether wherfore capitayne commaundes open gate let come el gyue keyes shall let token nat watche selfe nyght sent sonne trewe porter abyde lytell thou shalt haue keyes incontynent one rose toke key hanginge pyn opened lytell wyndowe delyuered keyes man toke theym incontynente geronet toke aduenture put right key locke opened ye gate went vtter gate wyse coulde open perot company without taryenge openynge gate geronet sayd sir helpe selfe auaunce forth wyse open seconde gate breke vp ax otherwyse ye nat entre towne without redy ax wedge hewed ye gate lyke carpenter soone coulde gette hole put ax wedge geronet company shuld hewe sonder barres gate dyuerse men herynge noyse arose beddes meruayle myght thought full lytell englysshe men shuld haue reysed beddes tyme night kepers gate yuell kept warde herynge men speke horse braye crye knewe well dysceyued rose came wyndowes gate beganne cry hygh voyce trayson tray towne began ryse great feare many thought saue goodes selfe fledde castell fewe entred chatelyn within castell whanne vnderstode englysshe men wonne towne feare lesynge wolde nat lette downe bridge frendes came first lette come meanes planke whanne herde great brewte towne drewe gayne planke wolde put forthe wente aboute se defence shulde make castell assayled thus haue shewed howe fyrste gate opened second broken ax wedge entred fayre easely capytayns companyons entred house rode streates towne togyther se assemble make defence whan sertched euery place founde man make resistence certayne suche gone haue entred castell made lytell defence soone taken slayne shulde make longe processe thus towne mounte ferante auuergne taken thursday nyght thyrtenth day february perot le bernoys company whan sawe howe lordes towne toke vp lodgynges ease without settynge house fyre doynge vyolence perot le bernois charged payne dethe man vyolate maner woman mayden sette house fyre take good prisoner lytell greate tyll fyrste knowledge therof also man shulde hardy hurte churche trouble man churche take thynge therof maner euer perot vsed whan euer wanne towne fortresse geffary tele noyre dyd always contrarye neuer cared churche nothynge el myght haue get good cared nat howe mornynge whanne tydinges dede came knowledge cleremounte whiche small leage then sore abasshed good cause enemyes nere wyste nat saye toke good bede defende towne newes spredde brode castell neuffe thyon vyc issoire ryon fro thence auige perse castell mounte pencyer townes countreys haue named moste parte pertayned duke berrey farre countreys tydynges spred brode howe englysshe men gascoyns wonne taken good towne mount ferante auuergne many herde therof meruayled greatly doute countreys adioyning halfe frayde auuergne burbonoys forestes berrey whan newes came parys kyng vncles sore displeased whiche good reason tyme erle dolphyn parys orderynge countrey hadde soueraygne charge kepynge therof erle armynake therfore dede greatly displeasure thought shulde beare blame dede bycause vnder rule excuse reasonable well knowen howe treatie companion wherfore thought countre tyme hadde ben good suretie incontynent erle dolphyn departed fro parys go auuergne sette order countre lefte trayne behynde hym rode alonely page toke waye moulyns burbonoyes go auuergne chaunged euery daye fresshe horse rode haste saynt pier mynster herde tidynges yt hadde nat herde shall shewe phowe perot le bernoys company toke cousaile determyned nat kepe towne mountferante howe sayde perot copany deted then night pyllage prisoner went refresshed towne ousac cap cxxi whan fridaye mornynge towne wonne thursdaye nyght ye haue herde capitayns lordes towne bou de faste men coude dommage sertched aboute trussed fardelles clothe naprye gownes furres thynges suche thought haue profite tha toke cousayle whether shulde kepe styll towne opynion kepe styll fortifye moost parte sayde abyde great follye shulde enclosed rounde shulde farre fro socours fortress shulde besieged shulde nat able withstande ennemyes lykely haue socours longe siege shulde famysshedde aboute many great gentylmen cyties good townes also whan duke berrey shulde knowe enterprice wyll sede hyther mareshall fraunce sir loyes sanxere also erle dolphyn auuergne erle armynake wyll come sende besiege v many great lordes lorde towre lorde dapthon lorde dapthyer lorde reuell lorde de la palayes dyuers yea specially hyther shall come sir iohan boesme launce great nobre doutes sage perot le bernoyes olyue barbe dyde cast coiecte sayde taken shulde lese haue fayne delyuer vp fortress capitayns concluded nyght departe take botye prisoner mo thane two hundred set sure garde gate thentent none shulde issue bewray entreprice pnowe shall shewe scrymysshe cleremount made phowe towne cleremont made scrimysshe pyllers taken robbed towne mountferante gate towne cap cxxii whane tydynges knowen cleremot englysshe menne takenne moutferant soore abasshed nere neyghbours cleremont toke counsayle toguyder without towne cleremounte waye towardes mountferant churche frier fayre stronge well buylded realme fraunce whervnto parteyned great close enuyroned stronge hyghe walles close full vynes one yere another frier therof sixscore vesselles wyne sayde within towne shulde best beate downe frier bycause ioyned nere gate elles might distruction sayde naye affyrmynge howe shulde great pytie dommage distroye goodly house sayde sir lette v go mount ferant sermyss ennemyes let v besiege shall neuer scape v knyghtes squyers countrey burbonoys forestes wyll drawe hyther within foure dayes surelye shalbe besieged whyle thus debatynge matter threscore compaygnions made selfe redy departe towne go se ennemyes serimysshe theym man dyde lette theym best towne company desyringe wynne honoure toke xxx crosbowes rode towardes mount feraunt thanne issued cleremounte mo two hundred men fore folowed thanne horseman rode streyght barryers mount feraunte tidynges came towne capitayns howe cleremount come vysette barryers whiche tidyng greatlye reioysed hundred armed mouted horse opyned gate issued fronte cryed saynt george whan cleremo toy sawe comyng fiersely afrayed vanquysshed within selfe beganne recule without shewynge face defence fledde hyther thyder best horsed co mynge cleremount formast sayeng howe wolde fyrste shulde make assaute fyrst retourned agayne towne gascoyns gascons horse go cleremontoys hadde fewe entred agayn towne howe beit chased tyll mette fote men lykewise fledde kepte none order lepte vynes dyke saue themselfe crosbowes came cleremount kepte better array company dyde close toguyder toke vyne yarde bent bowes made vysage defence kepte selfe tyll englysshe menne withdrawen backe agayne mountferant cleremont lost twetie men sixe slayne fourtene taken thus fell enterprice day euery trussed made redy departe nyght sixe clocke euery man hadde trussed vp baggage laded horse sette selte foote past nat threscore horsebacke sette forwarde stretes somers caryages hadde well foure hundred horse charged clothes naprie furres thynges necessary founde towne cofes press full stuffe lafte clene voyde bounde prisoner two two toguyder whan redy nyght opyned gate issued taryed mount feraunt eyghtene houres sette cariage tha prisoner foote men capitayns horsebacke came nyght darke countrey nat aduysed departynge wherfore nat pursued mydnight came ousacke fro whens came seconde day rested shewed wanne voyage hundred thousande frankes besyde prisoner sir peter gyache chauncelloure fraunce loste parte redy money thyrtie thousande frankes aboue companyons well counsayled leaue mount feraunt auuergne soone dyde taryed two dayes lengar dyde hadde nat departed without great daunger paraduenture losse lyues knyghtes squiers countrey gathered toguyder came thyder puyssaunce haue layde siege towne lordes cou trey ye haue herde named none taryed behynde erle dolphyn come within two dayes iourney herde tidynges howe englysshmen gascoyns departed owne forteresses trouthe hole mater shewed hym whane knewe trouthe rode ease came saynt pursayne fro then moulyns burbonoyes foude duches burbone doughter sore frayde aduenture howe whan knewe aduentures gone gladde therof thanne thought countrey surer faythe quod erle wolde coste greatly taryed styll mount ferant tyll come thyder nowe shulde haue yuell ende coulde nat haue better enterprise auuergne wherby haue recouered fortress holde semeth well skylfull men warre taryed lengar gone owne holdes pyllage prisoner thus erle duchesse doughter comuned toguyder perot le bernoys olyue barbe bourge copayne bourg angloys apthon seguyn capitayns fortress whan coe ousacke departed botye pyllage prisoner raunsomed ledde fortress carlat gaslucet countre auuergne toke better hede holdes hadde done howe erle armynake erle dolphyn sente perotte le bernoys sayeng howe falsely traytourously taken stollen towne mountferant robbed ledde away prisoner counsaylynge hym make therof amendes consydringe howe treatie toguyder peace perotte aunswered sayde sauyng grace selfe seuyn capitayns takynge mountferant neuer maner treatie erles toke nat towne fraudulently stale entred gate whiche opyned redy receyue company hadde sworne treatie wolde haue kepte surely neuer entencyon wyll case mater stoode lordes coude haue none answere sir peter gyache sore displeased losse hadde mounte ferant recouered selfe well myght thus aduentures fell phowe duke berrey maryed lady mary doughter erle bloys sonne howe yere sonne duke berrey marryed lady mary fraunce suster yong kyng charles fraunce cap cxxiii yere lorde god thousande thre hudred fourscore sixe moneth august guye erle bloyes lady mary wyfe departed fro ye towne bloyes well acompanyed knightes squyes ladyes damoselles go berrey theym yonge sonne hadde fyaunced yere mary doughter duke berrey entencyon erle bloyes coutesse wyfe whan shulde come burgus berrey cede ye sayd maryage lykewise entencyon duke berrey duches wyfe thus wha tie come togyder two chyldren ioyned togider mariage churche saynt stephyn burgus cardynall chauncellour berrey bysshoppe poyters yere ensured theym toguyder maryage loyes bloyes lady mary berrey cytie burgus made great feest tryumphes iustes turneyes feest endured eight dayes wha accomplysshed erle bloyes countesse tooke leaue duke berrey duchesse returned bloyes hadde yonge doughter also yere iohn berrey sonne duke berrey called erle mountpensier maryed lady mary fraunce suster yonge kynge frau ce yere maryages thus made tyme lente duchesse berrey mary fraunce doughter sonne rode towne bloyes se erle bloyes countesse chyldren receyued castell bloyes great ioye mater sir iohan froissarte present whan great feest thre dayes departed toke way poyters went water ryuer loyre amboyse fro then chares horsebacke tyll came poytou duchesse helde house moost comonly good castell good towne called chynon yere dyed mary fraunce beyng yonge wyfe erle mountpenlier lykewise soone dyed lady iane armynake duchesse berrey thus duke berrey sonne marry agayne dyd nat ouer soone whiche maryages specyallye duke shall shewe whan mater shall requyre haue declared ye haue well herde howe duke guerles defyed french kyng dispyte fully whiche spoken sar nere brute nat done curtesse maner style vsage defyances trouthe sawe selfe certayne writynges paper whiche sayde true copy bycause sawe nat vnderseale aproued mater ought touche great prince suche frenche kyng therfore gaue greatcredence therto howe semed well defyaunce displeasaunt realme wolde haue amended duke guerles shulde excuse hym spytefull wordes defyaunce kynges cousayle wolde wyse mater shulde rest great lordes fraunce sayde without kyng founde remedy realme shulde greatly blame sayd howe kynge yonge forwarde yt well sene iourney flaunders go nat forwarde nowe reuenge dede men wolde speke dyuerslye noble realme fraunce shulde counsayle kynge sworne kepe defende honour refourme mysordred entent kynge realme shulde beare blame lorde coucy toke payne mater shewed well howe mater touchedde hym nere knewe almayns better tha dyde hadde often copanyes well chalenge made duchy austryche insydentes hadde amonge kynges vncles sawe well howe noble realme well enclyned haue mater redressed specially duke burgoyne hadde great affectyon therto duke guerles haryed pylled duchesse brabantes countrey whiche enherytaunce shulde retourne hym ye dethe two ladyes right aged duches sustre wherfore wolde outher warre meanes duke guerles apeased howe fyrst requisyte make membres fraunce one one opinyon shulde farre iourney kynge go fraunce almaygne conquere landes countreis whiche kynge coulde nat without hole puyssaunce hym nat knowen whyder almaygnes couetous people wolde helpe assyst duke guerles nat also furthermore duke burgoyne noble men fraunce sawe well howe duke bretayne great differece realme fraunce began marueylously shewed dedes lyue haue warre ye realme frauce peace lordes knewe well howe prouyded townes castels cyties great prouisyon men vitayls artillary defende siege besydes often tymes wrote englande louynge treatable wordes make alyaunce euer englysshmen wyllyng therto entent warre fraunce myght better thanne counsayle frauce wolde nat shulde lefte behynde suche myst bretaygne first myght putte waye good meanes condute thought wolde nat putte realme doute kynge shulde go almaygne leaue realme destytute kynges vncles ymagined wyste nat howe stoppe duke bretayne suche sent thyder retourned bysshoppe la gers sir iohan vyen sir iohan de beull shewed kyng vncles howe done nothyng purpose tha duke berry aduysed sende bretayne entreat duke cosyn erle stampes sage persone treatable duke desyred hym sayde fayre cosyn behoueth ye go bretaygne speke cosyn duke ye fynde hym harde highe wordes chafe nat hym treate hym swetely good maner speke sagely hym bring hym good reason may shewe hym howe kynge brother burgoyne wolde nothing hym good loue peace wyll abyde holde v shall alwayes redy hym pleasure also shewe hym castels holdeth costables small occasion hath ceased wolde please hym rendre agayne shulde greatly honour howe kynge shall gyue hym fayre good place wyll chose realme good cosyn moche bringe v good tydinges tarieng departe nat fro tyll ye bring mater passe haue well remembrauce busynesse answere order estate erle stampes answered sayde sir shalbe done right gladly erle stapes charge fro duke berey go bretayne duke cosyn taried nat long made hymselfe redy passed chartres good countre mayne came anger founde quene naples hadde ben wyfe duke aniou called kyng naples cicyle hierusalem duke pole calabre erle prouence company two fayre sonnes loyes charles lady receyued cosyn erle stampes ioyfully iohn bretayne loued nat duke bretayne nat power shewe forthe yuell wyll amende whan therle stampes ben daye night tooke leaue departed rode chasteaulx iourneyed long came cite nau te refresshed hym demauded duke shewed hym howe march ne therefoude duke receyued ioyously nere cosyns togider erle stampes right well coude acquyte hymselfe amonge great prince ladyes brought vp amonge theym youthe acquytedde hym selfe right sagely duke shewed nat princypall affectyon corage fyrste commynge dissymuled two thre dayes whan sawe tyme humyled hym selfe greatlye duke rather therby drawe hym entent sayd sir right dere cosyn ye ought nat marueyle thoughe come farre se greatlye haue desyred notably shewed hym charge hadde saye hym behalfe duke berrey whiche wordes duke made light resolucion answere tyme duke sayde cosyn knowe well ye haue sayde trewe shall remembre ye shall abyde v long shall please comyng dothe v great pleasure aunswere erle coulde nat haue tyme erle taryed fyftene dayes duke shewed hym gret loue shewed hym fayre castell ermyn whiche nere wannes whiche duke newely made toke parte pastauce alwayes whanne sawe conuenyente tyme shewed swetely sagely cause comyng euer duke aunswered hym couertly erle coulde haue suretie aunswere make restytucion hundred thousand frankes castels helde constable whiche yet ende dyd without request persone whan leste loked shall shewe hereafter enfourmed whan ye erle stampes sawe laye vayne thought take leaue retourne fraunce dyd duke gaue hym leaue departynge gaue hym fayre whyte palfrey aparelled ben kynge gaue hym fayre rynge stone well worthe thousande frankes thus erle departed retourned anger founde quene napoles iohan bretayne greatly desyred tydynges sayd fayre cosyn thynke ye haue sped well ye haue taryed longe erle shewed parte busynesse fynally howe spedde nothynge whan taryed day departed went towrs last came berrey founde duke mehyn castell whiche newly made workemen dayly theron whan duke berrey sawe erle stampes made hym good chere demaunded tydinges bretayne declared fro poynt poynte sente herde sayde howe wyse coulde breke duke bretayne fro purpose duke berrey passed mater lyghtly whan sawe wolde none otherwyse retourned fraunce king duke burgoyne brother shewed theym howe sente bretaygne duke cosyn erle stampes declared euery poynt howe spedde thus mater rested whan sawe none remedy phowe departynge duke lacastre euer wonne galyce frenchman recouered lesse fyftene dayes howe englisshmen ben warre defamed spake yuell coutrey galyce howe frenche kynge sent duke irelande ca cxxiiii hath resyted hystory howe englisshmen dyd galyce howe duke duchesse doughter came ye porte portyngale taryed season kynge iohan portugale yonge quene doughter duke lancastre ye haue herde anoyed greatly duke nat without cause done nothynge profyte season castyle hadde done great domage men deed sykenes best company knyghtes squyers suche conquest hadde made great payne cost sawe well shulde besoone recouered agayne kynge castell dede sone departed entred portugale spanyardes knyghtes fraunce suche taryed syr olyuer clesquyn constable castyle sawe duke lancastre departed maner englysshe men departed fro hym sette forwarde reconquere agayne ben loste realme castyle whiche sone done townes castels cyties galyce rather haue ben vnder obeysaunce kynge castyle vnder duke lancaster without able haue kepte felde haue defended countrey castyle lombardy italy vsage euer saye lyue strongest wynneth euer duke lancastre wonne fro feast easter begynnynge iuly wonne agayne refresshed newe frenchman men castyle englysshmen left duke garysons thought haue taryed peasably wynter sone put outher fayre meanes perforce slayne suche wolde nat yelde vp returned sauecoducte passe portugale bayon burdeaux duke lancastre well aduertysed beynge cytie porte portugale coude nat remedy whiche ryghtsore dypleasaunte herte nat beleued contrary noble valyaunt sage man displeasure hym bytter paynefull howe duke wolde say often tymes bare good face haue lost yere grace god nother season shall v fortune worlde meruaylous nat always permanente also kynge portugale gaue hym alwayes good comforte sayde syr ye may abyde kepe astate wryte youre bretherne frendes englande maye sende nexte marche fyue syre hundred speares two thousande archer shall gather gyder power people haue good myndes make warre castyle shall make good warre somtyme one countrey wynneth nother leseth duke lancastre thanked kynge portugale good comforte offre howe beit kyng ye duke sonne lawe maryed doughter sayde good wyll yet duke discouered nat corage knewe well englande trouble great debate monge lordes howe lordes hadde mater yno attende vnto well kepynge fronters agaynst scotlande treate duke bretaygne kyng knewe well whan duke came englande sette forwarde armye wherfore thought shulde harde get newe ayde thence seinge realme many great charge redy also thought well suche englysshmen retourned wolde come thyder agayne thought rather shulde dyscorage come duke considered mater mynde whan ben season cytie porte kynge portugale daye sayd syr shulde profyte retourne bayon march burdeaulx dyuerse reason sawe well beynge portugale coulde lytell aduautage nat herytage desyred sayde goynge archebysshoppriche burdeaux aulose retourne bygore lande lombrisience countie foyze countie armynake garonne dordone entrynge pier gourte querchyn rochelloys xayntone cristynge poictou auuergne lymosyn wherin many garysons castels holden englisshe parte wolde make warre sake wherfore sayd better hym amonge theym counsaile encorage place also sayde howe portugale farre newes englande also knewe well yt englyssh men wolde lothe come thyder bycause long voyage see also knewe well shyppes spaygne galyce castyle goynge comynge see flaunders marchandyses whiche also great daunger encountrynge thynges consydred duke lancastre prepared departynge shyppes apoynted hym kynge patrone called alphons bretat whan galyes redy wynde good duke duches doughter toke leaue kynge portugale quene toke shyppynge entred see abydynge goddes pleasure wyndes wynde wether pleasure aryued bayon whose comynge countrey ioyfull desyringe sore se whan duke duches doughter aryued bayon tydynges therof spredde abrode burdeloys ryght ioyfull therof sir iohan harpdame senesshall burdeaux senesshall landes came thyder se duke dyd gentleman countrey lorde mucydente lorde dura lorde rosem lorde landuras lorde lespare lorde newechasteaur knyghtes squyers countrey thus came dayly one tyme another offred hym seruyce ought lord thus duke taryed bayon often tymes sente englande kynge nephewe bretherne writynge nothynge comforted nother men armes archer worlde wente duke busynesse lytell taken hede vnto lorde knyght squyer make hast auaunce forwarde ayde duke lancastre suche ben portugale made suche reporte realme englande man corage auaunce thyder euery man said voyage castyle farre fro v profytable v haue warre fraunce good swete countrey temperate good lodgynges fayre swete ryuers castyle thynge harde rockes mountaynes whiche nat good eate vntemperate ayre troubled ryuers dyuerse meates stronge wynes hote poore people rude yuell arayed farre fro maner wherfore folly go thyder entre great cytie towne wenynge fynde maruayles shall fynde nothynge wyne larde empty cofers contrarye realme fraunce whan fortune wyn towne cytie fynde suche rychesse basshed therof good make warre may haue profyte let v aduenture leaue vnhappy warre castyle portugale thynge pouuertye domage thus englysshe men sayde englande suche castyle lordes perceyued well howe voyage fauoure englysshe men also realme trouble iustyce triuylyen outher newly done duke irelande departed realme kynge rycharde came guydynge newe counsayle whiche hadde nat well lerned reason suche insydentes matter abode harde case duke lancastre beynge cytie bayon helde season busyness well castyle portugale englande departyng duke irelande well knowen frenche kynge counsayle haue parfyte knowledge ordayned frenche kynge vncles sende trecte ye duke irelande gyue hym sure saueconduct come fraunce tarye longe bothe partyes pleased behouable sende hym specyall messangers sure wrytyng fro kyng el duke irelande wolde nat haue come knewe well loue fauoure lorde coucy great baron realme fraunce great lynage cause loue hym ye haue herde acordynge trouthe duke nat well acquyted hymselfe wyfe doughter lorde coucy certaynly principall thing toke awaye good renome honour bothe fraunce place lykewyse blamed defamed hated englande well fraunce whan frenche kynge concluded sende duke irelande lorde coucy spake moche agaynst myght many reason layde hym also bycause kyng wolde haue contente suffre frenche kynge yong desyred greatly se duke irelande bycause reputed good knyght also bycause sayd howe well beloued kynge englande thanne sente knyght clerke notary kynges whan duke irelande herde fyrste howe frenche kynge sente hym maruayle therof hadde dyuerse imagynacyons entente shulde sente fraunce howe fynally thought myght go surely fraunce se kynge reason saueconducte returne agayne pleasure departed fro trecte rode forthe theym kynge sent hym rode longe came paris kyng castell lowre duke well receyued kynge vncles frenche kynge desyred abyde styll apoynted hym place kepe house astate duke ynough conueyed englande good ynough also ye constable frauce ought hym certayne money raunsome iohan bretayne whiche nat payed thus duke wente whan pleased hym se kynge hadde good chere feastes iustes triumphes duke alwayes sente phowe constable fraunce wolde nat acorde king shulde go almayne bycause insydentes realme howe duke bretaygne fournysshed garysons made alyaunce kyng englande kynge nauerre army made englysshe men cap cxxv ye haue herde howe erle de stampes sent bretayne duke berrey thynkynge haue brought duke bretayne fayre wordes mynde entensyon coulde nat brynge aboute retourned agayne without atteynynge thynge purpose wherof fraunce greatly abasshed specially suche kinges cousayle knewe well kyng great desyre go almayne se landes cosyns duke iulyers reuenged hygh wordes cruell defyaunces duke guerles wyse men counsayle fraunce suche conceyued well mater imagyned therin great parell realme clerely perceyued howe duke bretayne wolde wyse condyscende reason helde styll purpose thought greatly preiudycyall honoure realme fraunce hym take constable fraunce sette hym raunsome hundred thousande frankes kepe thre castelles good towne also sawe howe duke bretayne makynge great alyaunces kynge englande knewe well howe duke fortifyed greatly townes castels bretayne went aboute get hym frendes dyuers partyes moche many noble menne bretayne wyste nat outher go fraunce byde styll duke take parte agaynst kynge realme fraunce whiche neuer thought moste parte knyghtes squyers bretaygne alwayes good frenche counsayle fraunce doubted kynge wente realme puyssaunce whiche muste nedes shulde goo almaygne duke bretayne bring countrey englysshmen outher saynte malowe saynt mathewes lamballe camperle lantriguier guerrando bownte wennes see coste englysshemen coulde nat haue better entre fraunce bretayne knewe nat kynges honour saued howe breke duke bretayne fro purpose kynges counsayle sayde shall kynges dyshonour breke nat duke purpose ye duke nat lorde peasably ouer owne countrey thynke lordes knyghtes squyers bretayne wyll nat agaynst v mayntayne duke opynion therfore name god lette kynge kepe voyage lette constable lordes byde countreys defende realme opynyon well vpholde many kynges counsayle sayde naye therto sayde howe kyng coulde nat well go realme without constable hym wyser hathe experyence warre great nombre thus argued sayd lette two kynges vncles go one lest layde duke burgoyne shulde go two thousande speares syre seuen thousande men warre sayde moste metest hym go warre touched hym nere bycause moued reasone duchy brabante shulde haue brabante whome shulde fynde nombre seuen hundred speares xx thurty thousande comons countrey brabante nother sorte sayde sir opynyons nat good kyng wyll go nameth hymselfe chyefe warre defyed wherfore muste go consydrynge charge good go yonge contynueth warre better shall loue sayd hardy counsayle kynge go almayne farre countrey amonge theym hyghe prowed people great parell entre vpon kynge entred yet great daunger retournynge agayne whan shall knowe kynge noble fraunce entred countrey wyll assemble togyder kepe suche countrey knowe nat maye v great domage couetous people aboue haue pytie haue vpper hande harde yuell handelers prisoner putteth sondry paynes compell theym make raunsomes greater haue lorde great man prisoner make great ioye therof wyll conuey hym boesme austryche xasenne kepe hym castell inhabytable people worse sarazins paynyms excessyue couetousnesse quencheth knowledge honoure lette v go put kynge daunger amonge people thynge happen fall mysse chaunces fortune maruaylous shall sayde howe haue brought kynge thyder betray dystructyon realme nat augmentynge therof god defende realme fro domage parell kyng go muste haue parte noble men hym mysse fortune fall realme fraunce loste without recouery therfore loke wysely good counsayle kyng go voyage almayne suche wysely coniected parelles imagynacyons sayd name god lette nother kynge go yet sende thyder puyssaunce though duke guerles yonge youthe wytte haue made hym defye kynge whiche nat done greate wysdome good counsayle rather done folissh pride yonge people wolde flye haue wynges sythe hathe thus defyed kynge lette hym alone suffre hym pursewe desyaunce realme fraunce great entre realme maner wyse kinge shall sone enfourmed therof shall haue iuste cause styre vp people go fyght agaynste hym euer fynde hym el make hym flye yelde hym felde therby kynge shall haue honour lesse charge go guerles suche knowe countrey saye come duke lyste must passe foure great ryuers lyste great ryuer loyre namur charite also say fowle countrey yuell lodgynges noble men counsaylouts fraunce thus dyuers imagynacyons voyage kynge wolde make almayne surely ben auaunsed soner forwarde nat douted venym myght growe occasyon bretayne duke mater drewe theym backe indede good cause doute duke bretayne well infourmed defyaunce duke guerles hadde made frenche kynge howe yonge kinge charles wolde go almayne duke loked nothyng el kynge shulde one departed realme fraunce hadde ordeyned concluded bytwene hym englysshe men suffre englisshe army entre countrey also subtyle meanes drawen acorde moste parte good townes bretaygne specyally nauntes wennes rennes lentriguier guerrado lambale saynte malo saynte mathewe defyn poterne noble men coulde nat gette opynyon duke imagyned lordes shulde go constable fraunce almayne thanne warre entente shulde soner come passe caused townes castels well prouyded vytayles artyllary shewed well howe inclyned rather warre haue pea also great alyaunce charles yonge kyng nauerre duke promysed hym might come entent haue puyssaunce men armes archer englade wolde bringe streight normandy recouer fyrst good townes castels kynge charles fraunce vncle kynge nauerre taken fro hym men lorde coucy outher kynge nauer great trust reason therof helde humble loue duke lancastre bayon bytwene theym great alyaunces sawe great apparence shall shewe yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore eyght seuenth daye aprell concluded kynge englande counsayle vncles duke yorke duke glocestre erle rycharde arundell shulde heed chefe army see hym thousande men armes thre thousande archer hamton fyftene day may fynde nauy redy apparelled euery man apoynted go redy daye kynge englande saynte george daye nexte helde great feast castell wyndesore chefe lordes shulde go therle arundell toke leaues kynge quene ladyes came hampton daye apoynted entred shyppes twenty day may whiche fayre clere day erle arundell erle notyngham erle deuonshyre syr thomas percy lorde clifforde sir iohn ware wyke sir willyam de la selle lorde cameux syr stephyn de libery syr willyam helman syr thomas moreaur syr iohan dambreticourt syr roberte sere sir peter mountbery sir loys clombo sir thomas coq syr willyam pulle dyuers good men armes thousand speares aboute thre thousande archer theym horse trusted might come entente entre bretayne refresshe shulde fynde horse ynowe good price serue daye departed fro hampton fayre peasable meruayle drewe towardes normady nat purposyng lande parte passe fronters normandy bretayne tyll herde newes nauy certayne vessel called ballengers sayled se myght fynde aduenture lyke maner knyghtes lande go bataylles dyscouer coutrey enbusshes pnowe shall leaue season spekynge army speke somwhat busynesse guerles brabant shewe howe siege layde graue phowe brabansoys layde siege towne graue howe constable fraunce toke saynte malo saynte mathewes set men garyson howe duke lancastre bayon greatly dyscomforted coulde gette maner ayde cap cxxvi hath shewed auncyent duke guerles howe eldest sonne duke guerl whome treat present tyme maryed doughter berthalce malynes therby bringe daunger redeme againe herytage whiche sore trouble duke guerles sonne duke iulyers entertayne kepe ye towne graue agaynst brabansoys cause iuste tytle whan sawe howe coulde nat gette agayne thre castels gauleth buth nulle ryuer muse pertaynynge herytage countrey guerles thought attrybute towne graue herytage euer duke bastarde doughter maryed sonne lord bruke enherytour towne graue amyable treatye bytwene bytwene fader sonne lorde bruke gaue towne sygnory graue duke guerles presence knyghtes guerles iuliers cause duke guerles dyd recompence lorde bruke landes bresde ryuer lighen duchy guerles marchyng countrey holande aboue brabaunte towne bresde fayre castell towne great profytable towne graue better duke guerles dyd entent haue iuste tytle kepe towne graue agaynst brabansoys duches brabant brabansoys said howe lorde bruke pledge myght quyte whan wolde duke guerles sayd nayetherto reason wherof warre moued moneth may brabansoys came layde syege towne graue many lordes knyghtes squyers puyssaunce good townes brabante thyder brought engyns springals habylimentes warre xl thousande one skrymysshynge dayly towne graue standeth ryuer muese syde brabante bridge ouer ryuer go countrey guerles siege euery thynge plenty good chepe euery thynge though brusels euery day skrymysshynge barryers graue suche wolde aduenture selfe sometyme put backe tyme droue enemyes towne chaunce aduenture fell duke guerles well infourmed siege laye foure leages fro nymarse wrote often tymes englande trusted haue socoure reason englysshe army wherof erle arundell capytayne see sone wynde wether wyll serue come guerles reyse syege graue duke guerles knewe well towne graue strong well forty fyed thought coulde nat wonne none assaute outher trayson treatye trusted theym gruae sure faythfull hym thus siege endured longe grane erle arundels army see tooke lande styll kepte fronters normandy norman fro agaynst mounte saynte mychell downe alonge depe saynt valery croty nat well assured wherto shuld take hede porte hauens normandy refresshed frenche kynge good men armes crose bowes resyste agaynste parelles marshall blankewyll sette towne carentyne standyge see whiche olde tyme pertayned herytage kynge charles nauerre lorde ambre lorde coucy two gret lordes normandy constable fraunce toke towne saynte malo towne saynte mathews soone knewe englysshe men see sette men townes name frenche kyng season thought surely haue open warre duke bretayne knyghtes squyers sayde armye see englysshmen sente thyder none purpose sente duke bretayne lande countrey sayd none lykely alwayes shyppes kepte coste bretaygne without force wethersome tyme caused departe yet alwayes breuely retourned agayne coste ye haue herde howe duke lacastre departed realmes castyle portugale imagynacyons turned hym great dyspleasure sawe well busynesse sore troubled darked fortune often tymes falleth sondrie son somtyme good somtyme yuell whan lest thought whan duke lancastre departed realme englande aco panyed good armes archer thought haue sped otherwise dyde sawe herde howe xv dayes loste galyce whiche long season space xvi wekes besyde men deed sparcled abrode soe hoped conforte englade englysshmen wery warre spaygne thought ouer long farre fro duke lancastre thought busynesse harde case seyng comforte spake lytell thought moche ymaginacyon lyconed iourney voiage duke aniou made realme naples whan departed realme fraunce well furnysshed maner thyng wente great richesse puissaunce great nombre noble men armes knightes uiers ende slayne lost thus duke lancastre reckoned v yage come nothynge reason suche disconforte erle foiz countre bierne eight sage ymaginatyue sayd accompeed duke lacasters vyage lost inrecoueryng realme castyle whiche chalenged duke lacastre sage wise prince valyaunt amonge disconfytures yet somtyme toke coforte hym selfe shall shewe howe meanes sawe well fayre doughter lady custaunce wyfe doughter done peter kyng castyle whose right clayme made warre castyle thought thoughe fortune agaynst hym tyme yet myght tourne good doughter fayre yonge ryght heritage castyle reason mother thought yt valyaunt man fraunce wolde gladde couet haue maryage well right hadde realme castyle hyghe lynage myght well sayde extraction hyghest lynage christendome wherfore duke lacastre wolde gladly haue treatie mariage noble fraunce knewe well freche kyng yong brother called duke towrayne thought shulde able recouer doughters ryght castyle knewe well puyssaunce fraunce helde aduersaries herytage castile wherfore thought yt wolde take parte myght lightly putte doughter possessyon realme castyle myght marry frenche kynges brother phowe duke berrey sent letter duke lancastre bayon howe duke sent copye letter foiz nauer thentent haue publysshed spayne howe duke bretayn demauded cou sayle men busynesse cap cxxvii ymaginacyon rested duke lancastre nat onely duke towrayne also duke berrey ye haue herde ye duke berrey sonne wodowers bothe wyues deed mater auctour boke knewe suretie tyme fronters berrey poitou countie bloys right honorable lorde guy erle bloys desyre folowed co tynuauce historie duke berrey set entencion pleasure agayne maryed ofte tymes wolde say among men howe lorde lytell worthe without lady another wyfe cousayle sayd hym sir marry agayne son therby house shalbe ioyfull asirs duke sonne yong sir haue ye nat sene howe erle bloyes hath maryed sonne yonge doughter trouthe quod duke let se name wyfe sir quod shall name duke lancaster doughter worde duke studyed season gaue none answere ymagined sore suche secrete counsayle sayd ye speke mary iohan sonne cosyn duke lancaster doughter saynt denyce ye haue well deuysed shulde good wyfe selfe shortely shall write cosyn duke lancastre bayone enformed wolde sende hym worde howe shall sende shortely hym counsayle treate maryage saye nat sonne shall marry hym place whan cousayle herde hym saye smyled ye duke demaunded wherat smiled sir laught ye rather haue good tourne selfe sonne shulde faythe duke good reason fayre cosyn lancastre wyll nat soone agre sonne selfe incontynent letter written highe gascoyne bayon duke lacastre sente honourable messangers whan came ye duke delyuered letter duke toke reed whan well parceyued theffecte mater right ioyfull made good chere messagers shewed well content therwith wrote agayne letter ryght amiably certifyeng duke berrey howe right ioyfull letter messangers returned foude lorde poitou preparyng hym selfe go fraunce freche kyng duke burgoyne sent hym comune state bretayne oppned letter cosyn duke lancastre sente hym ioye answere thought surely pursue matter effecte myght nat leaue voyage fraunce went thyder shortely coulde thanne wrote knyght called sir helyon lignacke seneschall rochell countre rocheloys comaundyng hym incou ynent sight letter sette thyng good order come hym parys withoute fayle whan sir helyon lignac rochell vnderstode tidynges parceyued duke berreys letter howe sent hast made hym redy absence made two capitayns rochell two valyaunt men gouerners rocheloys countre becaulse one called sir peter yon sir peter tayllepy done sir helyon tooke waye fraunce shortest way coude knewe nat duke wolde hym sente hym hastely nowe let v sowhat speke duke lancastre bayon great ymaginacions yt busynesse cosyn duke berrey written hym first wolde nat shulde hydden rather publysshed abrode entent ennemyes shulde knowe specially house kynge iohan castyle duke lancastre wrote dyuers sent copye duke berreys letter shewynge writyng great affectyon treate maryage bytwene doughter duke berry first sent letter erle foiz bycause knewe well yt erles house prepared maner gentylmen knightes squyers well comyng goynge kyng spayne pylgrimage saynt iames also wrote kyng nauer wyfe ye kyng castels suster many chyldren thentent brute therof shulde better certifyed kyng castels court rather flyeng wordes also duke wrote mater kyng portugale wrote worde therof england kyng bretherne knewe well shulde haue thanke enterprice nat content dede ye shall whan ye mater requyreth meane season shall speke mater duke bretayne mater lyeth whan duke berrey come fraunce kyng duke burgoyne brother counsayle bysshoppe langers bysshoppe laon ye lorde coucy baron frauce beyng thereof kynges secrete counsayle many metynges comune toguyder well state guerles whyder kyng great affection go duke bretaygne coude bring reason wolde nat obey wyste nat sende hym wolde beleue hadde ben many valyant men sage hym aueyled nothyng coude bring nothyng passe desyred wherof kyng counsaile sore troubled vnderstode well duke bretaygne wynter prouyded fortifyed townes castelles shewed howe lykehode hadde rather haue warre peace wysest counsayle sayd speke goynge almayne ought rather speke goynge bretaygne putte downe duke highe mynded wyll reasone alwayes agaynst crowne frauce disdayneth obedyent thervnto shal haue reason hym without force therto suffred wyll presumptuous feareth man loueth prayseth man hym selfe clere case kynge go almaygne leaue realme bare men muste go thyder duke bretaigne wyll suffre englisshe men come countrey entre frau ce apparaunce herof great redy great army archer see kepe styll coste bretaygne wynde wether putte theym yet euer drawe thyder agayne lyeth ancre besemyng taryeng tyll warre opyn wherfore thynke good yet sende agayne duke bisshoppe langers erle saynt poule duke erle haue maryed two susters naye sir nat maister yue breton ye wyll sende duke agayne ye sende one agreable hym lorde coucy lykewyse haue maryed two susters haue loued marueylously togyder haue euer written eche fayre brother lorde coucy sende ye wyll well quod duke burgoyne maister yue sithe ye haue begon name rest sir right good wyll sithe pleaseth lorde coucy sende sir iohan vyen lorde de la ryuer suche thre lordes shall bring hym reason wyll euer come thus let duke berrey burgoyne apoynted charged shulde saye whervpon shulde groude mater handell hym fayre wordes thus taryed certayne space departed fro parys duke bretayne knewe well comyng deted fro parys coude nat tell whan sawe well mater touched highlye lorde coucy came duke many ymaginacyons mater discouered mynde certayne cou sayle lorde mountbouchier demaunded counsayle hym sayd sir brute roueth duke lacastre shulde mary doughter fraunce duke berrey mater forwarde sir helyon lignacke goyng duke bayon duke greatly enclyneth maryage wherof haue great marueyle fayre brother lancastre hath nat written therof knowe nothyng mater heryng saye nat accustomed mater touchyng frau ce wount write cou sayle answered said sir thus must behoue chauge purpose el shalbe greatly losse daunger bring coutre warre whiche good eschewe ye nede nat make warre sythe ye maye peace yea desyred therto also lady wy e great chylde whiche ye ought regarde kynge nauer tytell ayde hath ynoughe hym selfe also duke lacastre sage valyant prince sayd shall mary doughter duke berrey shalbe gret begynnyng entre treatie peace bytwene englande frauce elles longe truse reason therof ye shall se ende kyng castell putte realme haue kepte hym rather duke lancastre englysshe men agreed hym also trouthe lorde coucye admyrall fraunce lorde de la ryuer comyng hyder ye maye well knowe great cause touchynge kyng busyeth hym selfe costable realme lykelyhode kynge vncles wyll knowe presisely ye wyll wheder ye wyll kepe styll opinyon nat ye kepe styll purpose ymagined great armye prepared go guerles shall tourne agaynst nowe remembre well conforte ye likely haue yf ye haue warre fraunce whiche ye moost lykely haue duke lancaster marry doughter frauce semyng wyll nat bestowe better recouer herytage also ye knowe well moost parte prelate baron knyghtes squyers cyties good townes maner ye agaynst therfore sir sithe ye demaunde counsayle v saye ye neuer moche cause aduyse ye haue nowe therfore putte hande kepe well herytage whiche hath cost shedyng moche blode sweate traueyle refrayne somwhat yre hatered knowe well ye beare great dyspleasure sir olyuer clysson hath done many displeasure ye hym paraduenture may though nat lyke vnto fre che kynge vncles wyll maynteygne hym agaynst shall constable kynge charles laste dyed loued hym well hadde lyued ye done ye haue done knowe well shulde rather haue cost kynge halfe realme thanne wolde haue suffred kynge charles sonne yonge taketh nat good hede mater nowe wolde tenne yeres cometh ye shall go ye encre newe warre agaynst frenche men besyde haue shewed ye shall without counsayle without counsayle man loueth behoueth dissemule whatsoeuer ye purpose nede kepe thre castelles parteynyng sir olyuer clyssons herytage maner toke wheder ye haue peace warre shall coste kepynge theym thre yeres shall profyte twelue yeres sir delyuer agayne handes without desyre whan renome therof spredeth abrode nothynge done wyll knowen yt without costreynt ye haue delyuered owne mynde ye shall therby attemper molifye euery mannes displeasure shall greatlye please duke burgoyne ye knowe well hath nat done moche agaynst myght busynesse meanes good lady wyfe cosyn hath many fayre chyldren nexte blode therfore sir consyder fro whens ye came issued departe nat farre fro then ye ought approche nere follye englande ye hadde neuer thyng also englysshmen haue ynoughe amonge themselfe shewe fayre semblaunt loue promyse yt maye owne aduauntage nothynge elles ye haue proued ye norisshed amonge youthe phowe duke bretayne delyuered vp thre castelles sir olyuer clissons howe receyued ioyously lorde coucy company ambassadours fro fre che kyng howe duke la castre made grete chere sir helyon lignacke seneschall xaynton ambassadoure fro duke berrey cap cxxviii whan duke bretayne herde counsayle speke cast many reasonable doubtes abasshed stoode styll season without spekynge worde leanyng wyndowe lokyng downe courte counsayle beyng aboute hym stode great study last tourned said sir se well ye haue highly cou sayled se well haue nede nothynge moche good counsayle howe may loue norisshed thyng hate howe maye loue olyuer clysson hath done many dyspleasures wherfore thynges euer dyde worlde moost repente dyd nat put hym dethe whan hym castell ermyne name god sir quod counsayle ben slayne ye ought nat haue raunsomed hym taken herytage iohan bretayne vycount rohers sonne heyres herytours landes doughters wyues wherfore wolde haue entred heritage owne resort parlyament chambre parys ye haue receyued redy great blame fraunce ye haue done kepynge thre castelles constable hath entred quarell plee agaynst parlyament house parys sentence wyll gyuen agaynst none answere agaynst artycle constable hath layde agaynst sir olyuer clysson heyres
