shall haue iuste cause quarell make warre agaynst owne tytell kynge owne countrey bretayne wyll make warre ayde ennemyes ye haue nede thane haue puyssaunce defende thasie se ye lyke haue wherfore sir plee hangeth ye best delyuer agayne thre castelles haue tha ke abyde sentence gyuen agaynst sir agre suche dommages ye haue done well ye canne therby shall wade sclaundre whiche prince ought dout dishonour sir coferme peace contynue loue ye ought frenche kynge soueraygne naturall lorde lorde duke burgoyne cosyns chyldren ye may take ensample ye haue sene youre dayes cosyn germayne therle flau ders myghte prince sage yet insydetes thende dayes fell hym suche marueylous aduentures yt without humyled hym selfe fre che kynge vncles noble realme loste herytage ayde helpe recouered well sir quod duke sithe haue demaunded counsayle behoueth take accepte wordes ye haue spoken mater wente forwarde duke bretayyne possessyon thre castelles constable ye haue herde sent men rydde handes clene stablysshed men constable restytuicion nat suffycient opynion frenche kynges counsayle wt duke restored agayne money hadde taken constable besyde duke come personally kyng parys make excuse peres realme abyde mendes makynge suche kyng cou sayle shulde iudge good delyberacion whan knowledge restytucion castels come lorde coucye lordes apoynted go bretaygne duke lorde coucy sayde company sir haue lesse beleue duke wyll gyue credence v whan heareth v speke enfourmed thre baron departed fro parys duke berrey bourgoyne counsayle sayde sir ye muste entreate duke bretaygne fayre swete wordes nat rigorously shewe hym howe ye duke bourgoyne wolde shulde come parys kyng leest shewe hym howe must come halfe way towne bloyes shall mete hym speke toguyder thre lordes said wolde comauded rode forthe came cytie rennes bretayne demauded tidinges duke shewed howe wannes rode tyhder comynge anon knowen duke court sent herbygers take vp lodgynges duke hym counsayle greate lordes suche trusted honourably receyue lordes whan entred towne wane good chere lordes knyghtes duke mette specially lorde de la wall lyghted lodgynges refresshed selfe mounted horse rode duke castell called la mote foude duke came agaynst receyued right ioyously sayd howe right hertely welcome toke lorde coucy hande made hym good chere sayde fayre brother ye welcome gladde se bretayne shall shewe sporte huntyng harte flyeng haukes dete sodre sir quod lorde coucy thanke company shall gladde se shewed bytwene great lykelyhode loue duke brought hym chambre sportyng talkyng many ydell matter lordes often tymes whan mete haue nat sene toguyder longe wyll fynde many sondrie pastymes specially knewe four lordes best entertayners euer knewe duke brabant erle foiz erle sauoy especiall lorde coucy accordynge myne aduyse goodly pastymes souerayne maister whiche brute bare amonge lordes ladyes fraunce englande almaygne lombardy place ben conuersant tyme sore traueyled sene moche worlde also naturally enclyned gentyll thus whyle lordes mery talkynge toguyder brought spyces wyne dranke toke leaues retourned lodgynges thus mater went ye fyrst day without makyng mencyon thyng come nowe let v somwhat speke sir helyon lygnacke duke berrey hadde sent duke lancastre knyght came bayon lyghted lodgynge apparelled hymselfe go speke duke lacastre knewe well comyng sent right honourably two knyghtes mete hym brought hym duke whan sir helyon duke presens kneled downe saluted hym aperteyned duke receyued hym right honorably tooke hym vp armes toke hym ye hande ledde hym cha bre mette hym hall thanne knyght delyuered letter fro duke berry duke reed thanne drewe sir helyon knight declared cause comyng duke answered right courtesly sayd sir ye right welcome sayd howe mater weyghtie coe wherfore requyred counsaile delyberacion thus sir helyon taryed bayon duke lancastre moneth alwayes serued fayre wordes duke alwayes foded hym forthe made semblant great affection treate mariage duke berrey howe trouthe cotrary shewed dissymulacion cause helde long hym none thing brute therof myght ronne abrode specially ye realme castyle lay affection duke sayde sir helyon sir treat duke berrey haue doughter maryage thane must ioyne puysauce encounter myne aduersaries spayne wyll recouer heritage doughter shulde haue wyfe sir helyon sayd sir haue charge confyrme thynge forwarde sir please dete ye maye write pleasure shall returne shewe lorde duke berrey entent sure hath suche affection mater wyll agree euery thynge may reason desyre quod duke lancastre thus sir helyon lygnacke taryed season bayon good chere made hym duke comaundement phowe kynge castyle sente ambassadours duke la castre treate maryage bytwene sonne duke doughter howe requeste duke berrey truse made duke lancastre countreys tholousyn rouergne cap c xxix tiding came realme castyle dyuerse place specyally kyng iohan castyle sayde hym sir ye knowe nothyng treatye bytwene duke berrey duke lancastre duke berrey wolde haue maryage lady katheryne doughter duke lancastre lady custance wyfe maryage take effecte lyke shalbe great alyaunce duke berrey nowe one chiefe ruler realme fraunce vncle kyng shalbe beleued soeuer saye purpose reason wheder meanes peace longe truse parte duke lancastre eldest bretherne vncles kyng shall also beleued sage puyssaut semeth englysshmen wery warre maryage bytwene duke lancaster doughter duke berrey lykely great meane make good peace bytwene frauce englande shal sticke styll warre duke lacastre wyll folowe pursue chalenge realme castyle right yt hath wyfe shall gyue doughter shall haue warre bothe fraunce englande doutes layde kynge castyle tyme frenchman serued long realme castyle retourned fraunce chiefe kynge castyls counsayle sayd hym sir take hede v ye neuer great nede good counsayle ye haue presente tyme sir peryllousmyst lyke engendred bytwene duke la castre shall come meanes frauce howe quod kyng howe may name god sir quod brute renome spredeth throughe countrey el howe duke berrey shall mary duke lacasters doughter sir ye maye sure shall nat meanes great alyauce therby ye maye farre cast behynde ye haue ben auaunced whan kyng castyle knewe tidynges right pensyue sawe well howe counsayle shewed hym trouthe demaunded rounsayle trusted best howe shulde perceuer deale busynesse counsayled hym well truely mater requyred shall shewe ye knowe well ye haue herde hystorie howe kynge henry spaygne made peace peter kynge arragone full poyntment kyng arragon shulde gyue doughter maryage kynge castyle iohan nowe kyng coniunction maryage peace realmes iohan sonne henry doughter arragon came sonne dyed lady dethe kynge henry castyle kyng iohan cousaile men maried agayne lady beatrice doughter fernando kynge portugale hadde sonne called henry yonge counsayle castyle sayd kyng sir se doutes one remedy quod kyng iohan sir shall shewe quod yong sonne henry may well breke maryage bytwene duke berrey duke lancaster doughter beleued duke lacastre duches wyfe rather marchant sonne duke berrey name god kynge ye saye well shall herken mater thynke people wyll lightly enclyne thervnto mariage shulde haue peace englande bothe lande water therfore sir mete go name treate mater duke lancastre sir requisyte discrete persones matter wisely handeled secretest maner maye entente ye ronne nat indignacyon frenche kynge nowe dayes enuy rayneth greatly sooner reporte made yuell good yuell sooner reysed vp good frau ce knowe ye treate duke la castre frenche kynge counsayle wyll demaude whervpon ye treate duke reasone great alyaunce made tyme past bytwene father frauce also frenche men haue alwayes susteyned warre wherfore sir treaty must done secretely sende duke sage men secrete well enstructed busynesse sende nat forthewith boost pride tyll euery thynge sure case true quod kynge name mete go voyage sir quod sende confessour frere ferna farre bysshoppe geghene somtyme confessour kynge father peter gardelopes well languaged content kynge lette sente well enfourmed shall say wolde tyme haue treated peace wolde natte duke lancastre wolde none wyse shulde haue forsaken crowne castyle whiche wyll neuer thre sent burgus spayne kyng sayd kynge priu e counsayle sir ye muste go bayon duke lancastre shewed instruction sayde redy accomplysshe kynges commandement sette forthe iourney nat gret estate symply wolde nat knowen wente duke lacastre ambassadours treate alyaunce knewe nat howe spede thus entred nauerre came pampylona founde kynge quene first came thyder bycause quene suster kynge castyle hadde good chere nouther shewed kyng quene wente passed thorough countrey mountayns roseaulx entred bisquay rode tyll came bayon whane come towne bayon sir helyon lignacke styll sente fro duke berrey ye haue herde comynge castilyans taryed nat longe frere fernando kynge castyls confessour came duke lancastre knewe hym better began somwhat breke mater shewe cause comynge duke opyned eates wordes gladde tidynges sayde frere fernando ye welcome day sir helyon lignacke delyuered vnderstode duke accorded tyme truse partes made warre hym acquitayne bygore thoulous place endure vnto firste day maye yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore nyne truse contynue countrey ryuer loyre truese concluded request duke berrey entent myght sende duke lancastre fortress mortaygne ye see bonteuyll rouuergue quercyn pyergourt ryuer garon people without mercy wolde knowe manne wherfore two duke accorded truese whiche well kepte whan sir helyon lignacke departed fro ye duke great loue shewed duke said howe mater pleased right well howe duke sayd playnlye wolde neuer marry doughter fraunce without consent accorde kyng englande nephue also agrement counsayle englade sayd trusted order mater shulde well thus sir helyon lignacke departed returned frau ce shewed duke berrey letter duke lancastre sent shewed hym mouthe maner howe euery thyng wente ye duke well content pnowe lette v speke kynge castyls ambassadours whome duke lacastre gaue good eare dyd duches hertes ymaginacions lay euer chalenge spayn duke made ambassadours good chere came duke duchesse shewed message first treted peace frere preached duke cha bre duchesse present shewed duke entent wordes ye duke vnderstode hym nat parfitely lady vnderstode hym well youthe brought vp spaygne duke mater comyng pleasaut yet discouered nat hastely entente sayd sir wyll harde make peace place great hatered warre resydent specially disheryted kepte herytage sayeng howe wolde nat leaue warre withoute myght haue crowne castyle whiche sayde right frere bisshoppe sayd sir bytwene right ye ryght kynge lorde one meane haue founde may please waye quod duke sir quod ye haue lady youre wyfe feyre yonge lady marry kynge castile souerayne lorde hath feyre yong sonne two myght mary toguyder realme castyle shulde peace right shulde retourne sir better ye nat bestowe heyre disceded right lyne castyle entent ye arme fyght aduenture youre selfe traueyle body onely right heyre trewe duke wyll costes yt haue susteyned pursute recompe sed wyll ye knowe hath cost realme englande fyue hundred thousande frakes wherof wolde gladly se som recouerauce sir quod frere treatie agreable trust fynde meane mater shall take good effect well quod duke ye welcome soeuer howe soeuer shalbe retourne englande outher castyle fraunce shall mary doughter haue dyuers offres moued vnto mater great weyght nat lightly cocluded first tyme doughter whome repute rightfull enheritour spayne wyll knowe well yt shall haue maryage reason quod frere thus haue shewed treatie began bytwene duke lacastre party well castyle frau ce made euery partie good chere made full answere ymaginacion treatie spayne kynges sonne mary doughter semed best purpose bicause tyme come doughter shulde quene castyle also duches wyfe enclyned moost treatie pnowe let v leaue speke duke lancastre treatyse retourne speke duke bretaygne phowe duke berrey burgoyne departed go bloys howe duke bretayne caethyder howe duke dyde moche hym parys maner agaynst wyll cap cxxx haue shewed ye duke bretayne made good chere french ambassadours specially lorde coucy enformed ye chiefe brake duke fro purpose reason fayre swete wordes howe lorde iohan vyen lorde dela ryuer dyde ryght well deuoyre often tymes great prince lordes wyll soner entreated one man rather another moche payne cause duke bretayne agre go towne bloys mete duke berrey burgoyne brought thyder fayre wordes sayde surely wolde go thanne towne bloys lorde couey sayd desyred nothynge elles lordes duke bretaynge certayne dayes toke leaues retourned fraunce shewed duke berry burgoyne howe hadde spedde thervpon two duke made redy go bloyes mete duke bretaygne sente thyder make prouisyon apertayned firste thyder came duke berrey lodged castell founde countesse sonne doughter receyued hym honourably erle guye bloys owne countrey castell reygnaulte made greate counte commynge duke bretaygne thought sufficyent wife chyldren thyder came duke burgoyne goodly trayne company came sir wyllm heynaulte sonne erle ostrenante iohan burgoyne sonne duke called erle neuers duke lodged also castell helde estate came duke bretaygne great trayne house passed nat thre hudred horse entecyon whan one sene two duke spoken retourne owne countre without goynge fraunce entente two duke otherwise said whyder wolde nat shulde go parys duke bretaygne hym selfe lodged castell bloyes chanons house saynt sauyour men lodged downe towne dyd ye duke seruauntes lordes laye ye castell whiche fayre great stronge one fayrest castelles realme fraunce duke made good togyder shewed great thanked duke bretayne comyng towne bloyes duke answered sayde howe come thyder loue great payne fayned hym selfe nat well ease two duke fell communynge duke bretayne shewyng hym sithe come farr forwarde done nothyng without went parys se kynge greatly desyred se hym duke bretaygne began greatlye excuse hym selfe voyage layde many reason sayd howe nat well case make longe iourney also nat accompanyed therafter swetely answered sauyng displeasure shulde nede great trayne go se soueraygne lorde rydinge shulde lacke nouther chayre lytter labour ease said bounde homage kynge nat done duke sayd excusynge hymselfe whan kynge come laufull age hole realme owne gouernaunce wolde come parys whyder shulde please kynge homage acordyng reason duke sayd kynge age wysdome suffycient receyue homage howe lordes realme excepte done homage made reliefe affyrmynge howe kynge xxi yere age whan duke bretaygne sawe howe excuse coude nat taken herde sayde well sir go parys shalbe greatlye agaynst wyll preiudyce whan come shall fynde se daylye sir olyuer clyssone nat loue neuer dyde shall attempte rygorous wordes lordes regarde well inconuenyentes shall ensue goynge thyder sir duke burgoyne fayre cosyn haue ye dout therin shall swere solempnely withoute shall owne pleasure ye shall nouther se speke constable iohan mountforde longe ye shall sir ye shall sure ye shall se kynge desyreth se lordes knyghtes squyers fraunce shall make good chere whanne ye haue done ye loke ye shall retourne agayne without peryll dommage wherto shulde make longe processe moche duke bretayne desyred faire wordes consented go parys promyse constable iohan mountforde shulde nat come presece whiche duke sware faythfully vpholde thervpon mysed go parys fyue dayes duke bloyes eche feested ryght nobly coutesse chyldren lyke maner whan euery thyng accomplysshed two duke toke leaue ye duke bretaygne retourned parys sir wylliam heynaulte retourned nat parys duke burgoyne faire father rode first wt countesse bloyes made hym right good chere taryed thre dayes toke leaue retourned fraunce castell dune bonyuall phowe lewes kyng cycyle entred parys estate royall howe duke bretayne entred nyght saynt iohn baptyst yere grace thousande thre hundred fourscore seuyn dede armes doone kyng mountereau faulte bytwene knyght englande called sir thoms harpingham frenche knyght named sir iohn de barres cap cxxxi duke bretaygne rode boygency ryuer loyre ordered businesse go parys tyme ye duke bretaygne entered parys entred quene cycyll hierusalem somtyme wyfe duke aniou called kynge countreis also naples yonge sonne lewes thanne fraunce named kynge said landes company iohan bretaygne brother lady sente worde comynge duke berrey burgoyne aduertysyng howe brought company yonge son lewes nephue desyring knowe whether shulde entre paris kynge elles symply lewes aniou two duke sente worde aduisynge cousayling shulde entre kyng naples cycyle hierusalem sente worde thoughe nat thanne possessyon realmes yet wolde entyse frenche kyng shulde ayde hym conquere sware brother kyng lois maner lady prepared selfe came entred parys made sonne ryde throughe hyghe stretes saynt iaques lodgynge grene estate royall accompanyed duke erles prelate great nombre lady taryed sonne thanne wente se kynge castell loure abydinge commynge duke bretaygne phowe duke bretaygne entred parys came castell loure frenche kynge cap cxxxii whan duke bretayne aproched nere parys rested one nyght quenes bourge nexte daye entred paris great lokyng hym paris bycause putte daunger constable fraunce ben sente dyuers tymes wolde neuer come tyll men spake therof dyuersly sondaye beynge mydsomer daye tenne clocke afore noone duke bretaygne entred yere lorde god thousande thre hu dred fourscore eight parys hell gate passed long strete ye harpe ouer bridge saynt michell palais well accompanyed lordes knyghtes sir wyllyam heynaulre erle ostrenaunt faire brother iohan burgoyne roode sir wyllyam namure thus came castelle loure alyghted rode throughe stretes greatelye regarded common people whan duke lyghted entred gate remembred shulde saye hym lorde coucy erle sauoy sir iohn vyen sir guye de la tremoyle sir iohn vernayle erle meauir sir iohan voye sir iohan barres nere hym sir wyllyam namure iohan burgoyne erle ostrenaunte behynde hym lorde mountforde bretayne lorde malestroyt kynne priuy cousayle great preace se hym halle lytell boordes couered kynge go dyner kynge stoode redy table iii vncles besyde hym duke berrey burgoyne burbone soone duke entred euery man made place ye duke myght se kynge firste made one curtesy passed forthe renne xii pace made seconde curtesy rose agayne passed forthe tyll came kynge thirde tyme kneled downe bare heeded saluted kyng sayd sir come se grace god maynteyne youre prosperyte thanke sir quod kyng haue great desyre se shall se speke leysar therwith toke hym vp armes duke enclyned hym self prince eche stode styll kynge without spekynge worde kyng sore behelde hym thanne stewardes offycers came forthe water ye kyng wasshed duke bretaygne putte hande bason towell whan kyng sette duke toke leaue kyng vncles lorde coucy erle saynt poule lordes conueyed hym court horse mounted returned lodgynge strete yt harpe none taryed hym conueyed hym suche came hym bretaygne parys duke bretaygne spake leysar kynge vncles euery man well contente hym tooke well euery thynge ben promysed hym sawe nouther constable iohn bretayne whan ye lordes sawe euery thyng good state neded nat doute duke bretaygne seynge hym paris thought shulde nat departe then tyll done maner euery thyng kynge wolde thought good tyme ordeyne forth voyage guerles whyder kyng great affection go subdue duke guerles shamfully defied kyng whiche cosydred nat thoght good suffred ordayned lorde coucy shulde drawe march rennes chalous champayn regarde kynges passage waye moue knyghtes squyers bare lorayne go whyder wolde lede nat spekynge kyng bearyng hande wolde go recouer ryght austryche lorde coucy thus departed fro parys wente chalous champayne taryed moneth retaygned partes knyghtes squyers bare lorayne champaygne retheloys freche kyng departed fro parys whan comuned duke bretaygne dyuers mater nat fully accomplysshed sute courte fraunce longe whan lyste right well canne foode forthe people make theym spende moche bringe lytell effecte kynge came moustreau faulte marchesse brie gastenoys helde courte ten tymes chased harte wylde beestes forest brie seasone dede armes done bitwene englisshe knight duke irelande called sir thoms harpyngham sir iohan barres wherof great brute made fraunce place chalenge fyue course speare fyue stroke sworde fyue daggar fyue axe weapon brake gette newe tyll chalenge acco plysshed two knyghtes day lept horse well armed appertayned kynge lordes beyng present moche people ranne toguyder foure course ryght valiauntly thought vsage thane helmes tyed lace entente speare shulde take holde fyrst course sir iohan barres strake englysshe knyght targe suche wyse bare hym ouer horse crope laye stonyed grounde moche payne releue perfourmed forthe reste chalenge goodly maner kyng well co tent phowe erle arundell beyng see moneth came hauyn marante lytell fro rochell howe sent messa gere perotte le bernoys capitayns shulde kepe feldes cap cxxxiii long sythe made mencyon englysshe armye see wherof rycharde erle arundell capitayne wt hym many knyghtes squyers archer englande shall nowe somwhat speke hym mater requyreth ye haue herde treatie kyng englande made duke bretaygne nauy see season laye euer coostynge fronters bretaygne normady ioynde wether draue then euer came thyder agayne flete small vesselles called balyngers wente euer scoured see flete layne ancre moneth agaynst ysle breshatte bretayne herde tidynges howe duke bretaygne gone bloyes speke duke berrey burgoyne howe agreed duke gone parys renoeranne throughe bretaygne howe duke hadde good chere frenche kynge welcome hym cousayle parys shulde nat departe then tyll mater good estate whanne erle arudell herde tidynges pensyue wente counsayle best whyder best drawe enploye season determyned drawe rochellois though castelles yet hadde men ynowe kepe felde abyde puyssaunce xaynton poyctou shulde signify estate auuergne lymosynne myght sende passe throughe bretaygne treuse nat confyrmed ryuer loyre treatynge begynne fyrste daye auguste sir helyon lignacke goyng comyng erle arundell ymagined outher duke lancastre bayone elles retournynge fraunce hadde nauye breton bretonaunt nacyon wannes seruaunt sir wyllyam helmon coude speke well foure maner language saye bretysshe englysshe spaynysshe frenche gaue hym commaundement go lande sayde hym go thou moost preuyest wayes thou canste thou knowest preuy wayes countrey gette garyson chaluset haue v recommaunded perotte le bernoys shewe hym fro v sette forthe company men armes suche garysons forthe kynge englande make warre tytell yu shalte beare letter feare takynge thou mayest go lyke marchaunt rochell wynes saye perot reyse vp men warre kepe coutreys berrey auuergne lymosyn doute kepe feldes shall lande rocelloyes shall make suche warre shalbe herde well knowen breton sayde shulde message hadde great lette waye set lande sandes knewe countrey bretayne went great townes passed countrey poyctou entred lymosyn came chalucet wherof perot le bernoys capitayne messangere came barryers gaue knowledge comynge garyson ben examyned gate lette brought perotte dyde well message wherof perot great ioye greatly desyred tidynges army see sayd breton thou arte welcome bothe companion haue great desyre ryde forthe abrode shall accomplysshe thou hast shewed v thus perotte le bernoys made hym prest sente carlate bourge champaygne capitayne ousacke olyue barbe capitayn aloyse besyde saynt floure aymergotte marcell capitayns longe countrey auuergne lymosyn oesyryng make redy wolde ryde oute abrode sawe good season comaundynge leaue sure men garisons tyll returne companyons hadde great desyre ryde abrode perot coulde nat ware ryche withoute loste made redy came chalucet assembled well nombre foure hundred speares thought themselfe suffycient great feate knewe lorde countrey able resyste breke enterprice siege vandachore sir wyllyam lignacke boesme lauce nat defeated thus rode forthe lordes feldes passed auuergne ryght hande tooke ryght waye berrey knewe well ye duke nat fraunce kyng moutereau faulte pnowe lette v leaue speke perot le bernoys enterprice speke erle arundell armye see shewe howe perceuered departed fro cost bretayne whan erle arundell suche lordes hym departed fro cost bretayne sayled good wynd wether ye tyme fayre pleasunt goodly beholde ye shippes ye see sixscore one baners stremers wauynge wynde glytrynge lordes armes agaynst sonne thus went saylyng see fresshly like horse newe comyng stable brayeng cryeng fomyng mouth see prompt agreable thoughe fygure see shulde haue said mery sir shall bring good porte hauen without peryll thus lord sayled frontyng poyctou xaynton cast ancre rochell ye hauen towarde marant copany seyng fludde comyng entred full water bottes mo two hundred one arryued nere towne marant watche marant spied englysshe flete sawe howe bottes commyng lande warde fludde blewe trupe made great noyse awake men towne saue selfe many men woman toke goodes wente saued castell whiche came well passe el lost whan sawe englysshmen come lys toke lefte rest saued bodyes englysshe archer entred towne fell pyllage therfore came thyder lytell founde sauyng coffer voyde emptye goodes withdrawen castell corne wyne salte becone prouision foude ynoughe four hundred tonne wyne towne wherfore determyned abyde certayne space kepe prouisyon came well passe sayde shulde departe then shulde withdrawen fortress caryed awaye ryuer fountney moche myght reste distroyed taryed night towne came thyder euenyng sente worde see case cause taryed erle arundell lordes sayde howe done well nyght passed nexte mornynge whan tyde began retourne disancred small vesselles euery man wente putte harnesse bottes barge lafte great shippes styll ancre coude nat cum nere lande lacke water laste hundred men armes two hundred archer styll kepe shippes whiche laye mouthe hauyn tha smalle vesselles arryued marant toke lande leysar lodged bytwene marant ye towne rochell whiche four leages fro then tidynges spredde abrode countrey howe englysshe men arryued barante four hundred fightyng men playne countrey good townes castelles srayde made good watche vyllages fledde amaye caryed good forestes place shortely myght phowe marroys rochellois sore afrayed englysshmen lande rochell made serimysshe howe englysshmen pylled countrey marant drewe agayne see pyllage whiche great cap cxxxiiii englysshmen ben furnysshed horse greatly profyte ye countrey vnpro ded men warr namely suche able haue merre true lord parteney lorde pons lorde lymers yt lorde tanyboton sir geffray argenton lorde montendre sir aymery roch chouart vycont war dyuers knyghtes squyers poictou xaynton countrey nat toguyder euery man owne fortresse nat ware englysshe men commynge thyder hadde knowen moneth englysshe menne wolde haue ryued wolde haue prouyded therfore knewe nat fell sodaynly wherfore afrayde euery man toke hede kepe owne men countrey gette cornes begynnynge auguste also heed capitaygne countrey bringe menne toguyder duke berrey cheife soueraygne poittou newely gone parys seneschall xaynton nat countrey seneschall rochell sir helyon lignacke nat rochell countrey great busynesse ryde bytwene ye duke berrey duke lancastre reason countrey feble defaulte good heedes must nedes defaulte body fote hath foote nothynge worthe thus lordes feare two wayes englysshmen armed came fro see syde herde newes fro berrey fro limosyn perot le bernoys rode abrode fyue sixe hundred fyghtynge men hym entred berrey wyst nat wher shulde take hede euery manne kepe owne renome wente howe two hoostes shulde mete toguyder outher countrey poictou xaynton opinyon dyuers true towne rochell season englysshe men landed marant two valyat knyghtes one called sir peter iouy sir taylle pie whome sir helyon lignacke lefte rochell kepe towne countre therabout whan tidynges came rochell erle arundell armye ben longe see lande lodged besyde marant two knightes sayd vnder charge mayre rochell men towne sir must behoue v go loke englysshe menne shewed v howe arryued party companion wyll go gyue welcome whiche shall paye v el shalbe blamed suffre rest peace sythe haue charge kepynge countre one poynte good v haue horse men see well mounted shall sende crosbowes fore shall wake shote hurte whan haue done shall retourne englysshe men wyll issue fote shall suffre crosbowes passe homwarde shall receyue enemyes spere poynt shall haue suche aduautage shall great domage euery man herde knyghtes speke reputed noble valyaunt men agreed counsayle assembled toguyder one twelue hundred nexte mornynge breakyng daye euery redy assembled togider crosbowes men fote issued went great pace reyse englysshmen lodgynges meane season horsmen made redy vpon iii hudred dyuers knyghtes squyers coe rochell certainly maner inspyracion thenglysshmen knowen comynge might haue made embusshe two hundred archer hudred men armes nat one frenchman retourned agayne wha rochell came englysshe men lodgynges carely morenynge watche retourned lodgynges frenche crosbowes began shote entred among lodgynges hurte many englysshe men lyeng strawe marueyle noyse many hurte knewe frenche men whan crosbowes shotte euery man sixe shottes retourned apoynted aproched horsmen entred among lodgynges therwith hoost began styrre knyghtes squyers drewe toguyder felde whan frenche men sawe hoost styrre drawe toguyder drewe backe retourned towarde rochell good pace feare shotte englysshe men folowed nere rochell erle arundell foure hundred men armes folowed great pace euery man speare hande necke preace frenche fotemen great entrynge rochell alwayes two frenche knyghtes behynde sette men forwarde tyll within barrier euer englysshe men folowed suche wyse ye two freche knightes great dauger taken slayn sore sette bycause semed chiefe capitaynes dede sir peter iouy hadde horse slayne vnder hym great payne men saued hym drewe hym within barryers sir peter taylle pye stryken thye glayue arrowe throughe ye bassenet heed horse fell downe deed within ye gate entrynge towne many slayne hurte mo xl men towne aboue ouer gate caste downe stone shotte bombardes englysshe men durste aproche nerer thus wente first scrimysshe bytwene rochell englysshe men whan hadde scrimysshed nere noone erle arundell sowned retrayte withdrewe good order retourned lodgynges vnarmed toke ease well wherof lacked nouther wyne flesshe englysshe men taryed fyftene dayes abydinge aduentures rochell issued oute scrmysshe sawe well englisshe men wise valyaunt also ye two capitayns hurt wherfore good cause sytte styll rest erle arundell sent thre four tymes abrode countrey rochelloys towarde bresmure lande towars dyde great domage wherof countrey frayde englysshmen done great enterprice ben furnysshed horsmen countre gatte sewe soone herde landynge euery man caryed hadde fortress whan army taryed fyftene dayes well refresshed sawe man came parceyued wynde good drewe shippes caryed moche wyne fresshe flesshe entred vesselles drewe vp sayles toke see daye mette xii shippes bayon goynge englande charged wynes marchaudises ioyned toguyder made good chere gaue erle arundell two peces gascoyn wyne thus sayled forthe adueture pnowe lette v speke perot le bernois capitayns copany howe drewe agayne fortress phowe perot le bernoys copanyons resorted agayne theyr holdes great pyllage howe duke guerles coulde haue ayde englysshe men reyse siege graue brabansoys made bridge ouer ryuer meuse whiche guerles dyde breke brinne dystroy ye shall cap cxxxv seasone englysshe armye marant perot le bernoyes route nobre four hundred speres abrode passed lymosyn came berrey daye tooke marchauntes towne blake berrey whiche daye great fayre wherby great profite good prisoner passed came selles berrey pylled robbed towne thus perot companyons rode abrode countre dyde great domage none came agaynst countrey sore frayde bothe sydes ryuer loyre vnto coutie bloys thourayne coude nat ymagin two armyes purposed sayde shulde mete togider dyd nat army see drewe agayne see perot lykewise fortresse wha pylled wonne great richesse countrey euery man wente owne fortresse saue gotte none dede armes done season auuergne lymosyn thane began truce syde ryuer loyre whiche shulde endure moneth marche styll siege endured vandachore sir wylliam lignacke sir iohan boesme launce sir iohan butlere sir geffray teate noyre proude cruell sette nouther truce peace truste strength fortress pnowe lette v leaue speakyng siege vandachore shewe ende toke speke nowe brabaunte guerles ye knowe well hath ben coteyned hystorie duchesse brabant determyned make warre agaynst duke guerles caused siege cotynue towne graue great puyssaunce knyghtes squyers men good townes brabante entencion nat departe then tyll towne graue wyll duchesse shewe yt mater touched nere laye four leages then hoost plentifull euery thynge often tymes refresshed newe prouisyon comyng fro dyuers partes aswell see fresshe water ryuer muse lande brabant siege long endured great ingyns sore towne caste great stone whiche dyde great domage besyde enfecte people within caste towne deed careyne wether hote whiche greatly anoyed within clere ayre sore corrupted yuell ayre somtyme knyghtes squyers brabant wolde come barryers scrimysshe ye towne many feates armes done men towne sette duke guerles redye shewe forthe prowes whan tyme duke guerles lay nimay coude nat remedy mater reyse siege yet fight enemyes puissaunce therto hadde sente englande certifyeng case stode trustynge haue socours fro then none tyme moche trouble englande sette newe counsayle kynge meanes vncles tharchbysshop cau terbury feest saynt iohan baptyst cousayle englande knowe shulde sente ayde men armes archer duke guerles nat euery thyng consydred thought best naye renome ran englande howe frenche kyng made gret assemble manne knewe whyther shulde drawe englysshe men ymaginacyon douted wolde coe ca othersyde douted scottes wherfore wolde nat sende men armes archer realme also knewe howe many menne warre see wherfore couenyent kepe owne realme therfore noble men englande sayd lette duke guerles alone ryght valyant stronge countre wyll well ynoughe agaynst brabansoys also shalbe conforted ye almayns nede alyed hym neyghbours haue bene hym agaynst frenche men thus mater wente englande within towne graue endured payne saute sore scrimisshing brabante deuysed whyle laye siege make bridge tymbre ouer ryuer meuse therby entre duchy guerles ouer ronne cou trey kepe vitayle shulde come towne graue therby besege bothe behynde partes kepe fro vitayling men ynowe sette many carpentars worke dilygence dyde moche worke forwarde yt bridge nere ouer water within speares cast duke guerles perfite knowledge makyng bridge dyde lette alone tyll nyghe made whan sawe nerehande fynisshed came gonne artillarye shotte fyre bridge suche wise bridge brente broken brabansoys loste labour wherwith sore displeased toke counsayle best phowe brabansoys passed ryuer throughe towne rauesten ouer bridge entred guerles duke departed fro nimay thre hundred speares came agaynst disconfyted bytwene rauesten towne graue cap cxxxvi thre lytell leages fro ye towne graue castell rauesten parteyninge lorde bourne subiecte helde duchy brabant desyred duchesse counsayle lordes knyghtes shulde open towne rauesten suffre hoste passe throughe entre countrey guerles desyres content duke guerles lyenge nymay surely infourmed suche spyall howe lorde bourne wolde gyue enemyes fre passage entre countrey towne rauesten wherof pensyue malecolyous sawe well nat men ynowe resyste puysaunce brabante well xl thousande menne one duke many ymagynacions fynally thynges consydred determyned mynde assemble men toguyder take feldes come towardes towne graue entente brabant entred guerles wolde entre brabant thought surely nat inclosed within walles towne duke spake lorde ghesime great baron guerles princypall counsaylour shewed hym sayd mynde entente fyrste lorde nat opynyon duke shulde take feldes small nombre well quod duke shall shall suffre selfe inclosed one townes meane tyme shall brynne exyle countrey shulde ouer dere abyde make vowe godde lady quod duke wyll drawe feldes resyst domage nere may ordeyned dyd next mornyng departed fro nymay ben churche made offrynge lady nymay men dranke lytell mounted horse thre hudred speares rather lesse mo tooke feldes drewe towardes enemyes next way beholde great corage duke sayd great outrage howbeit lyke coragyous knyght full comeforte sayde forwarde name god saynt george agaynste enemyes rather dye felde honoure dyshonour closed within towne hym lorde ghesime valyant sage knyght chyefe ruler armye lorde hauseberth lorde huckelin sir ostez lorde vaspre dyuers good knyghtes squyers valyaunt corage daye duke guerles feldes early mornyng seneschall brabant men knyghtes squyers men good townes brabant consente lorde bourne passed ryuer bridge rauesten nombre ten thousande men seneschall brabante lorde lygnier lorde bourguenall lorde gence ryght ioyfull whanne sawe ouer ryuer meuse said amonge themselfe howe wolde go day make course nymay burne mylles fawbours village soone herde tydynges fore ryders suche sent discouer countrey tydinges also came duke guerles howe ten thousande enemyes passed ryuer meuse bridge rauesten duke stode staye toke counsayle beste sore abasshed bycause handefull men regarde enemyes thurty xl one sayde howe myght endure thre hundred speares agaynste ten twelue thousande men lyeth nat puyssaunce ouercome lyeth well power soone ouercome v knyghtes came duke cousayled drawe towardes graue thanne duke sayde wolde nat wyse wolde closed towne hadde sayde surely wolde go fyght enemyes corage sayd gaue hym dyscomfyte said dyd rather wold dye honour lyue shame shall quod day ouercome enemy wherby shall haue greate profyte honoure therfore loue set forwarde folowe quyckly wordes duke spake incoraged men specyally suche herde hym euery man shewed semblante great corage fight euery man made hym redy lased basnet gyrte horse set selfe good aray togyther rode forthe easy passe kepe horse well brethed certayne newe knightes made thus rod good araye towardes rauesten tyme brabansoys ouer ryuer thanne tydynges came seneschall brabante duke guerles felde nere incontynent shuld mete togyder suche herde tydinges first meruayle adueture beleued surely euery man duke guerles syre rested sette selfe ordre leysar ther came duke guerles route close togyder faste spurres wolde dryue horse cryenge cryes lady guerles speares restes squier guerles greatly praysed great desyre exalte renome galoped batayls firste iusted entred amoge enemy squier called arnolde morber course bare one erthe rudely canne nat tell euer releued nat prease greate harde one downe releued agayn without great helpe first rencountre brabansoys sire score borne erthe many beaten downe small defence made brabansoys sodenly taken shulde men warre thinke domage enemyes brabansoys greate nombre many great men yet farre sonder araye coulde nat gette togyther ordre batayle batayle pearsed throughe sparkled brode lordes brabante coulde nat come owne men menne theym suche behynde whanne herde noyse brewte sawe ye dust powder ryse semed properly voyce dyscomfetture came theym howe company ouercome feare therof caused tourne flye towardes rauesten agayne toke ryuer aduenture bothe foote horsebacke without serrchyng depenesse without hauynge guyde fledde thought euer enemyes backes dyscomfettynge selfe drowned parell moo twelue hundred ryuer meuse lepte one vpon nother lyke beestes without ordre reason great lordes barones brabante whome wyll nat name shulde blame heyres noted flye away shame fully seke sauegarde nother right passage ryuer yet hygh way towne rauesten rather straunge wayes flye fro enemyes myschyefe fell daye chyualrye brabante bytwene towne graue rauesten many slayne taken suche came raunsome yelded lightly almayns gladde take profyte thought haue theym suche retourned lodgynges graue abasshed lyenge syege came lyke men clene discomfyted came flyenge faste lacked brethe coulde skante speke worde sayd syrs gette v hence dyscomfyted comeforte whan hoost vnderstode trouthe mater sawe company case basshed frayed leysar puyssaunce take owne goodes take downe tentes pauylyons trusse horse carte wagon sodaynely departed without byddynge adewe lefte behynde frayde made countenaunce bydynge toke theym nother vytayle caryage suche hadde horse lepte fledde waye towardes duke wodde el towardes hondan mount saynte geruays gertras dordec none care saue selfe fro enemyes within garyson graue soner knowen dyscomfetture greatly profyte slayne taken many enemyes flyenge knewe nat tyll late howbeit whan issued foude great plentye tentes pauylyons prouysion engyns gonne artyllery brought towne good leysar none saye naye thus brake vp siege graue gret domage brabansoys wherof great brute ranne dyuers countreys howe handefull men dyscomfyted xl thousande reysed siege taken lorde bourguenall lorde linyer nombre seuentene baners hanged ymage lady nymay perpetuall memory phowe duke guerles dyscomfyted brabansoys wente agayne nymaye howe tydynges came frenche kynge howe kyng sente ambassadours kyng almayne cap cxxxvii haue great payne recorde wryte shamefull dyscomfyture brabansoys blemysshynge honoures bycause promysed said begynnyng boke shall write truely hystory must make true relacion mater euer touche nowe procede yonge duke guetles optaygned iourney yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore eyght aboute mawdlyn tyde moneth iuly whanne dyscomfyture chase passed felde clene delyuered whiche done within space two houres guerloys assembled togyder felde mad good chere ioyfull good cause good aduenture many prysoners mo themselfe nombre haraudes sought deed bodyes bothe partyes amonge slayne yonge man sonne therle namure called vassyer colles lorde balaster whose dethe duke gnerles sory sore dyspleased shewed well greatly complayned deth sayde howe dethe yonge knyght dyspleased hym greatly ryght lusty knyght pleasaunte ioly also yere ben pruse duke guerles counsayled duke retourne towne graue refresshe theym brynge thyder prisoner naye nat quod duke army departynge fro nymay auowed lady spedde well returne thyder offre lady wherfore wyll mery chere retourne thyder thanke lady hath sent v vyctory enemyes man durste saye naye agaynst duke mynde rode thyder good pase two good leages fro thence batayle anone came thyder whan tydynges came nymay trouthe busynes men woman child ioyfull clergy issued receyued duke great ioy duke guerles incontynent knyghtes wente churche ymage lady whome duke great affyaunce chapell vnarmed peces doublet gaue armure churche honour blessed lady thankynge iourney hadde atchyued penons lordes taken day hanged vp lady canne nat tell yet nat duke went lodgynge dyd euery manne prisoner thought surely shulde well paye scot therfore made good chere great brute spred abrode duke guerles thus ouer throwen brabansoys wherby douted duches brabante laye duke wood trayne whan sawe howe yuell mater wente agaynst syege graue raysed sore displesed good cause touched nere sette garysone duke wood kepe fronter retourned champayne came bruselles wrote often tymes duke burgoyne aduertysynge hym state hope recoueraunce hym ye may well knowe byleue discomfyture brabansoys soone knowen french kinges courte made lytell accopte therof syth sawe kynge suche affection go guerles kynges counsayle wrote syr wyllyam tremoyle sir geruais myrande soueraygne capytays men warre duke burgoyne sente countrey kepers thre castels ryuer meuse buth gaulgeth nulle commaundyng kepe well fronters nat make issue wherby take domage tyll shewynge theym surely howe kynge pr pre persone shortly wolde go se duke guerles owne countrey sir willyam sore dyspleased aduenture fallen party tydynges fraunce comforted hym agayne ordred hym selfe acordynge commaunded nowe lette v retourne counsayle fraunce great desyre go guerles toke suche dyspleasure defyaunce duke sente kynge nother regarded begynnynge myddes ende sayd euer coste wolde make duke repent dede denye el wold distroy burne landes father also duke iulyers duke erles barones knyghtes squyers warned euery man redy acordyng apertayned longe voyage ordeyned one marshal fraunce shulde abyde styll realme syr loys porteuyr take hede fronters syde ryuer dordone see languedoc bytwne ryuer gyronde dyscendynge ryuer loyre truce bytwene ordeyned marshall syr moton blamuyll shulde go kyng maruayle thynke great prouysyon lordes made fyrste kyng duke berrey burgoyn tourayne burbon cyties reynes chalous troy coutreys champayne raynes bysshopprike laon lander carte caryages taken vp partyes marueyle consyder great aparell made iourney guerles season duke bretaygne parys coulde nat delyuered kyng parte al season moustreuell faulte yon alwayes good chere alwayes serued fayre wordes curteyse lordes wolde desyre hym nat thynke longe shortly shulde delyuered shewed hym kynge moch vyage almayne coulde attende nothynge el duke fayne suffre coulde none seyng parys thought wolde nat departe without good wyll kynge laye great coste charge whan certayne knowen voyage guerles tayles reysed throughe realme paye euery man wage shulde serue kynge many wyse men realme well counsayle sayd howe great outrage counsayle kyng go farre seke enemyes shulde therby put realme great aduenture kynge yonge greatly fauoure people wherfore ben suffycyente hym haue suffred one two vncles haue gone thyder constable fraunce sixe seuen thousande speares nat kyng propre persone kynges vncles oppynyon often tymes counsayled kynge forbeare iourney selfe whan euer spake hym therof dyspleased wolde saye go without company shall agaynst wyll besyde ye shall haue money otherwyse nat restrayne whan duke berrey burgoyne herde kynges answere sawe great affection kynge hadde go voyage aunswered sayd syr goddes name ye shall go without wyll nothing therfore sir good comfort kynges counsayle regarded one thyng whiche thought ryght necessary bytwene frenche kynge kynge almayne longe tyme ben ordynaunces made bytwene none shulde entre army neyghbours landes frenche kynge make warre agaynst kynge almayne agaynst kynge payne ryn sentence holy church therto bounde solempely sworne day coronacyon entente kepe realmes peace reste wherfore aduysed kyng shulde go voyage guerles whiche holden kynge almayne fyrst counsayle shulde suffycyently informe kyng almayne howe duke guerles shamefully defyed frenche kynge fell wordes style vsage lordes wonte dfye eche warre entente cause duke denye dede repente hym frenche kynge wyll come almayne nat agaynst kyng almayne signory agaynst enemye seke euer fynde hym go message charged syr guy hancorte ryght sage dyscrete knyght hym one maysters parlyament called mayster yue orient two called counsayle charged go voyage kynge almayne well informed shuld saythus departed toke waye chalous champayne rode good trayne lyke notable person ambassadours fro frenche kynge founde lorde coucy chalous lay retayned knyghtes squiers barre lorayne champayne go voyage hym vowarde made ambassadours good chere made theym great dyner lodgynge nexte daye departed rode towardes saynte menehont towardes coutrey lusenburgh certayne tydynges kynge almayne phow frenche kyng gaue leaue duke bretayne retourne coutrey howe countrey brabant wolde nat consente kynges passage aremy howe ambassadours fraunce sped ca c xxxviii whyle frenche ambassadours wente speke kyng almayne ye meane tyme french men lette nat styll make prouysions commaundement gyuen euery manne felde myddes auguste champayne aboute kynge wolde redy tyme wolde nat tary aunswere fro kynge almayn frenche kyng vncles thought good duke bretaygne shulde departe home sente kynge monstreuell faulte good chere kyng duke burgoyne duke tourayne duke berrey nat owne countrey assemblyge men togyder sente comaundement poyctou knyghtes squyers shulde drawe felde kynge duke burgoyne treated amyable duke bretaygne shewed hym nothyng loue ye haue herde duke rendred agayne constable thre castels towne iugon hundred thousande frankes receyued lothe rendre agayne axed alowaunce suche prouysyons made fortifyenge garysons castels townes retayning men warre kepynge theym wynter thought haue warre kyng counsayle fedde hym swete pleasaunte wordes fynally agreed pay agayne hundred thousande frankes fyue yere xx thousande euery yere tyll paied duke bretayne departed ryght amyably kynge gaue hym many fayre iouels returned parys duke burgoyn made hym great dyner toke leaue eche thanne duke bretaygne payed dyspenses toke waye estampes rode beaulce bogency ye ryuer loyre men wente passed countreys bloys mayne thourayne aniou entred bretayne duke hym selfe redy boygecy nauy entred fayre shyp hym lorde mountforde lorde malestroit sayled downe ryuer loyre passed vnder bridge bloys went longe ryuer nautes owne countrey pnowe let v leaue speke duke bretayne farre coulde helde well couenaunte made bytwene frenche kynge hym dyd nothyng remembred tyll closed boke nat tell wyll herafter shall speke therof acordyng shall knowe nowe wyll retourne frenche kynge prepared iourney guerles whan ye lorde coucy coe kyng monstreau shewed kyng counsayle howe sped howe knyghtes squyers bare lourayne burgoin riuers ryne redy go hym kyng therof gret ioy sayd grace god wold yerese cosyns duke iuliers guerles fyrste determyned whiche way shulde take surest way shortest sayd yt ryght way go thyreashe passe fronter haynalt liage passe brabat entre guerles passe ryuer meuse trecte entre lande iuliers fro thence guerles determynacion kynge counsayle wrote duches brabant countrey shewnge waye french kynge purposed kepe pleased ryght well duches countrey wolde nat agre therto sayd howe kynge frechmen shulde haue passage way shulde greatly domage good townes knyghtes brabante ye opynyon sayd lady duches cosented suffre frenche men entre countrey wolde neuer ayde socoure agaynst duke guerles surely sayd wolde close townes go defende landes ye frenchman sayeng howe shuld lese passinge countrey enemy myddes therof whan duches parceyued wylles entente people aswell knightes sawe remedy dyssymule mater charged sir iohan orpen syr iohan graue nycholas de la money go fraunce speke frenche kyng duke burgoyn excuse countrey brabant shuld nat take voyage waye countrey thinke shuld sore greued distroyed shulde passe countrey comaunded saye herselfe coude well content therwith done coulde myght haue ben acordynge ladyes mynde departed fro brusels rode towardes parys dyd moche iourneys came moustreau fault yon kynge vncles nothynge spoken goynge guerles duchesse ambassadours fyrste came ye duke burgoyne shewed letter message request aunte meane kynge counsayle also lorde coucy dyd myght moche firste purpose passynge brabant entre guerles broken duches countrey excused aduysed shuld go along realme whiche way sayd moste honourable kynge also brabansoys burgonyons sauoysyns cocluded named shulde go vowarde ordeyned xxv hundred hewer woodes hedger dykers make playne wayes frenche men way good ynough thorough realme tyll came ardayne good wayes began fayle founde hygh wodes dyuers sauage walles rockes mountaynes pyoners sente vangarde thousande speares aduyse best passage kyng hoost caryage wherof xii carte besyde caryages hewe downe hygh wodes ardane make playn make newe wayes neuer none man passed way euery man toke great payne dylygence specyally suche aboute kynge neuer great affection go flauders go guerles lorde coucy sent gnon hym called hym selfe pope clement knowe nat cause vicount meaulx sir iohan roy lorde de la bone goueruauce men tyll retourned agayne nowe let v somwhat speke sir guy hacourt maister yue orient sent kynge almayne rode long came coualence kyng whan hadde refresshed went towardes kyng enformed comyng great desyre know entent came assembled counsayle two lordes came kyng almayn curtessy dyd salute hym delyuerd letter credece fro french kyng ye kyng toke reed regarded said sir guy shewe forthe charge ye knyght spake ryght sagely great leysar shewed kyng cousaile frenche kyng wt army royall wyll come froters almayne nat make warre agaynst hym agaynst enemy ye duke guerles highly defied kyng maister shamfull wordes style defyauces ye whiche frenche kyng cousaile wyse suffre wherfore sir kyng requyreth ye noble king blode ye worlde knoweth yt ye wyll nat sustayne ayde mentayne pride duke ye holde ye aliances cofyrmacions sotyme done sworne bytwene thempire almayne realme frauce ye whiche wyll fermly kepe te ye kyng answered said sir guy enformed yt cosyn freche kyng wyll assemble togider great nobre people neded nat smal mater assemble suche people spende moche seke ennemy farr desired wt lesse trauayle coude well haue caused ye duke guerles hame coe mercy reason sir knight thanke yt pleaseth say kyng maister regardeth lytell expense trauell men regardeth honour cousaile agreed syth yt cousayle nat myscontent maister wyll wyse violate breke ye ordinauces confirmacios olde tyme made bitwene ye two realmes frauce almain kepe mentayne paynes ye ordayned therfore sir sent nowe well kyng beleue well cosyn ye frenche kyng shalbe welcome te forme thynke nat styrre ther wt messagers ryght ioyous thought sped well tha desyred haue letts agayne ye kyng said shulde haue day taryed dyned kynge good chere dyner wente lodgynges wherto shulde make long cesse sped well letter suche answere pleased well toke leaue ye kyng almayne retourned way came nowe let v speke freche kyng phowe therle bloys sent frenche kyng ii c speares duke loraine lorde henry bare came kyng howe duke iullyers guerles knewe frenche kyng came cap c xxxix accoplyshe vyage euery lorde frauce aelled selfe euery thyng nedefull ye lord knightes squiers men warre departed fro thir owne place well fro auergne couergne quercy lymosyn poytou xaynton fro bretayne normady aniou tourayn chapayn fro lymitacios ye realme fra ce fewest men came fardest coutreis ye nobre burgoyn picardy bare lorayne bicause body frauce waye therfore best trauelled ordayned ye kyng cousayle yt man shulde take thyg ye coutre wtout payeng therfore thecent ye pore men shulde nat greued yt ordinauce ye whiche well knowen sprede abrode vpon payne great punissyon yet men warre ofte tymes sore trauelled ye coutries passed coude nat absteyne yuell payde wage must nedes lyue excuse whan blamed pyllage constable marshalles capitaynes erle bloyes sente vnto sende two hundred speares chosen men promysed well payde nat saye howe dalte sente serue kynge two hundred speares countie bloyes capitayns lorde vyenne sir guyllyam saynt martyne sir wyllyam chaumont lorde montigny foure gouernaunce erle bloys bande drewe lytell lytell towardes chapayne thyder ordayned go frenche kynge departed moustreau faulte yon tooke waye chalous champayne duke berrey nat come departyng loked tidynges fro sir helyon lignacke sente duke lancastre bayon haue wyfe ye duke doghter ye haue herde nat duke lancastre dissymuled hym helde styll knyght hym bayon treated two party rather enclyned kynge castyle duke berrey lyke wyse dyde lady custaunce wyfe duke made good chere bothe party entent enflame soner maryage doughter kyng castyls messangers sore traueyled treatyng maryage rested nat ryde bytwene party offered great gyftes messangers fred nothynge sir helyon lignacke whan knowen ye realme frauce kyng chalous waye towardes duchy guerles euery man departed fro house drewe kyng came duke berrey lodged espinay duke burbone another place erle marche ye erle dolphyn auergne erle saynt pole erle tourayne kynge duke burgoyne duke lorayne duke tourayne constable fraunce sir guye tremoile sir iohan beull countrey chalous raynes xii leages clene eaten vp men warre lorde coucy nat retourned fro pope retourned sir wyllyam hacourt mayster yue orient founde kynge vncles chalous kyng ioyouse co myng demaunded tidynges shewed kyng founde done sayd howe kynge almaygne made good chere said kyng sir whan kyng reed copye ye defyaunce duke guerles sent bothe cousayle yuell cotent therwith sayd howe done great presupcyon pride parceyue none cousaile well content enterprice ye shall haue let hym kynge well content vpholde maynteyne auncient alyauces bytwene empyre frauce saythe ye shall haue dout ther herof freche kyng right ioyfull howe sayd wheder kynge almayne wolde nat kyng puissaunce suffycient wolde without dauger kyng ordeyned departe fro chalous champayn deted toke way right great pre whan kynge came great pre taried ther thre dayes coude make gret iourneys moche people hym behynde rounde hym constrayned ryde easely haue good lodgyng bicause great uisyon folowed hoost fro first company last cotayned xxiiii leages countrey styll dayly came people therle great pre receyued kynge towne countre offred kynges pleasure kyng well co tent hym therle apoynted vantgard thyder came kyng ye duke lorayne sir henry bare faire company men armes duke loraine ordayned sonne lorde coucy sir henry bare abide kyng pioners sore besyed forest ardane cutte downe wode make wayes neuer non great payne fyll valeys make waye playne caryage passe thre dyde nothyng el whan ye duches brabat knewe surely howe kyng waye approched foreste ardayne therof ryght ioyfull thought voyage shulde well reuenged duke guerles howe frenche kyng shulde bring hym reason also father duke iulyers done many anoyaunces departed fro bruselles company erle sammes ardain lorde bocelairs dyuers toke waye lusenbourge se kynge speke hym passed ye ryuer meuse ryuer huy laste came basconque taryed kynge shulde passe therby dyde whan departed graunt pre passed ryuer meuse morsay hoost rode small iourneys tidynges came duchy iulyers guerles frenche kynge comynge hundred thousande men neuer moche people toguyder nat great company whanne came burboure thought englysshe army ben gretter founde theym duke iulyers began dout duke guerles made nothing therof sayde lette come come weryer shall caryages shall waxe feble prouisyons shall waste wynter shall drawe stronge countrey shall nat entre ease shall recule backe somtyme otherwise sowne trumpettes shall behoue alwayes toguyder nat wyll entre coutre disrought ordre shall soone taken vp wheder wyll nat howe saye trouthe quod duke cosyn frauce good corage sheweth dothe shulde thus duke guerles deuysed amonge knyghtes duke iulyers sore abasshed sawe well french kynge wolde lande brente loste toke counsayle brother archebysshoppe colonge cosyn bysshop leage sir arnolde horne howe shulde saue lande fro brennyng exylyng two prelate counsayled hym sayd must nedes behoue hym huble hym selfe frenche kynge vncles duke sayde well content phowe sir helion lignacke made reporte duke berrey howe lordes scotlande assembled toguyder cytie berdane determyned reyse vp army entre englande englysshe squyer takenne scottes knewe secretnesse bothe realmes englande scotlande cap c xl counsayle bysshoppe trect aduyse bysshoppe colonge ye bysshoppe laege sente french kynge treate ye duke iulyers kynge approched passed nat two thre leages daye trayne great bytwene morsay oure lady amount duke berey route mo fyue hundred speres lodged thyder came duke berrey sir helyon lignacke sir wyllyam brother sir wyllyam came fro siege vanchadore duke sente hym duke burbone sente sir iohan boesme launce lefte styll siege companyes lefte capitaynes sir iohan butlere sir loyes dambier sir helyon lignacke came gascon fro bayon fro duke lancastre duke berrey made hym good chere demaunded tidynges sir helyon shewed hym sayd sir kyng castyle seketh duke lancastre haue peace hym treateth sore haue sone prince wale marry duke doughter worde duke berrey pensyfe sayd sir helion yet shall sende one agayne knowe certayne bysshoppe poycters tyme haue ynoughe also weke lorde coucy retourned fro auygnon came kyng ardane euery man glad comynge ye haue herde howe kynge richarde englande trouble agaynst vncles vncles agaynst hym dyuers incydentes duke irelande many knyghtes englade deed beheeded archebysshop yorke brother lorde neuell poynte haue loste benefyce newe counsaylers kyng arch bysshoppe caunterbury lorde neuell ben chiefe ruler kepar fronters northumberlande agayst scottes fyue yeres togyder put wage euery yere sixtene thousande frankes countie yorke bysshoprike durham sette stede lorde henry percye hadde wage yere xi thousande frankes wherof lordes lygnage thoughe kynne yet hadde therat great enuy indignacyon one agaynst another knewe ryght well scottes lordes knyghtes scotlande determyned one agayne reyse vp army make iourney englande sayde good tyme houre sawe englysshmen nat one accorde often tymes past receyued great buffettes sayd good tyme reuenged entent purpose shulde nat knowen ordayned feest holden fronter wylde scottes cytie called berdane assembled maner lordes scotlande feest concluded made full promyse myddes august yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore ano eight shulde mete puyssaunce fronters gale castell hyghe forest called gedeours thus tyme departed eche fro couenaut none made kyng priuy therto sayd amonge themselfe kyng manne warre came gedeours day apoynted first erle iames duglas sir iohan morette erle marche donbare sir wyllyam de fu sir stephyn erle monstres sir aucebauce duglas sir robert auerceque sir marke odremneu sir wyllyam lymsey sir iames brother thomas berry sir alysaunder lymsey lorde sechyn sir iohan sobelas sir patryke dobare sir iohn senclere sir patryke hoteborne sir iohan sonne ye lorde momogomercy sir adam glas diuyn sir wyllyam reduryn sir wyllyam stonacke sir iohn halpe breton sir alider sir robert lander sir stephyn freseyle sir alysander ramsey sir iohan brother sir wyllm morbereth sir maubert sir wylliam waleran sir iohn amonstan dauy sonne robert colemney dyuers knightes squiers scotlande threscore yere nat assembled toguyder scotlande suche nombre good xii hudred speares xl thousande men besyde archer tyme nede scottes lytell skyll bowes rather beare ax wherwith gyue great stroke whan thus mette togyder marchesse gedeours mery sayd wolde neuer entre againe owne house tyll ben englande done suche dedes shulde spoken xx yere entent make sure poyntment assigned daye mete churche fayre laude called zedon tidynges came northumberlande nothynge hydde men putte dilygence knowe bothe therle chyldre seneschall yorke sir mathue redman capitayne berwike gret feest ben bredane therent knowe wherfore lordes sente sertche couertly heraudes mynstrels scottes coude nat mater secrerly ye lordes englade knewe howe men rose scotlade shulde mete agayne gedeours brute came newcastell vpontyne whan lordes knewe euery man toke good hede charge prouyded selfe redy assemble nede dyde secretly bycause enterprice shulde nat broken euery man helde hym selfe owne house determyned mete toguyder soone knewe scottes came forwarde sayd scottes come forthe shall haue knowlege therof drawe toward carlyle shall entre another parte countrey shall dommage v countrey open maye go lyst countre strong townes castelles well closed better knowe state scottes sent gentylman engla de knewe ryght well marchesse scotlande specially forest gedeours ye scottes shulde assemble englisshe squyer went forwarde without espyeng came churche zedon scottyss lordes encred amonge lyke one seruauntes herde knewe great parte thententes scottes thende counsayle squyer went tree hadde tyed horse thought haue foude gone scotte great theues stollen hym awaye durste nat speke hym went forthe fote boted spurted whan gone fro churche two bowe shotte two scottyss knyghtes deuysed bytwene selfe sayd one another felowe haue sene marueyle beholde yonder man gothe alone thynke hath lost horse came spake worde wene none company lette v ryde hym proue sayeng rode hym soone ouertoke hym whane sawe comynge wolde gladly haue ben then came hym demaunded whether wolde whens came done horse began varry sayeng answered nat directely purpose turned hym sayde shulde go speke lordes brought hym churche zedon presented hym erle duglas lordes examyned hym parceyued well englysshe man sayde wolde knowe trouthe came thyder yuell wyllynge shewe trouthe handled hym suche wise fayne shewe mater bare hym hande withoute wolde shewe trouthe incotynent shulde lese heed wolde shewe trouthe shulde haue none yuell knew hym lordes northumberlande sente hym thyder knowe estate entprice whiche waye wolde drawe herof scottes right ioyous wolde nat great good spoken squyer demaunded agayne hym parte englysshe lordes whyder aparence wolde assemble toguyder way wolde take entre scotlande outher see syde berwyke el donbare el highe waye countie monstres towarde streuelyn squyer answered sayde sir sithe behoueth say trouthe shall whan departed fro newcastell none aparence assemblyng redynesse departe well daye morowe soone knowe ye set forwarde entre englande wyll nat come mete nat ye power fyght sythe ye great nombre sayd englande ye quod erle moret nombre repute v sir quod sayd howe ye xl thousande men xii hundred speares sir ye take waye gale wyll go berwike donbare edenborome el alquest ye take nat waye wyll go carlyle mountayns yt countrey whan lordes herde eche regarded englysshe squyer putte kepyng constable gedeours comaunded shulde surely kepte place wente agayne counsayle lordes scotlande ryght ioyfull knewe surely entent ennemyes demaunded counsayle waye best take moost wysest best experte warre spake fyrst sir archanbas duglas therle fenne sir alysander ramsey sir iohan saynt clere sir iames lymsey sayd feare faylynge entent counsayle make two armyes entente ennemyes shall nat knowe whervnto attende lette moost parte hoost caryage go carleon galles lette company thre four hu dred speares two thousade well horsed drawe towardes newcastell vpon tyne passe ryuer entre bysshorike durham burne exyle countrey shall make great breull englande ennemyes prouyded wese folowe v wyll lette v drawe oure companyes toguyder take good place fyght doute nat shall haue honoure lette v reuenged dommages haue done v counsayle accepted ordayned sir archanbas duglas therle fenne erle surlancke erle monstres erle mare therle astroderne sir stephyn freseyle sir george donbare sirtene great lordes scotlande shulde lede moost parte armye towardes carlyle erle duglas sir orge erle mare donbare erle iohan morette thre capitaynes thre hundred speares chosen men two thousande men archer go towardes newcastell entre northuberlande thus two hoostes departed eche eche prayenge englysshmen folowed armyes nat fyght tyll bothe armyes ioyned toguyder thus mornyng departed fro gedeours toke feldes phowe erle duglas wanne penon sir henry percy barryers newcastell vpontyne howe scottes brente castell pondlen howe sir henry percy sir rafe brother toke aduyse folowe scottes conquere agayne penone lost scrimysshe cap c xli whane englysshe lordes sawe squier retourned agayne tyme apoynted coud knowe nothynge scottes dyd purposed thought well ye squyer taken lord sent eche redy whan soeuer shulde scott brode messanger thought hym lost pnowe lette v speke erle duglas wente carlyle whan erles duglas moret de la mare donbare departed fro great hoost toke waye thynkyng passe water entre bysshoprike durham ryde ye towne retourne brinnyng exyling countrey come newcastell lodge towne dispite englysshe men determyned dyde assaye putte vre rode great pase vnder couert doyng pyllage waye assautyng castell towre house came lorde percyes lande passed ryuer tyne without let thre leages aboue newcastell nat farre fro braspathe last entred bisshoprike durham founde good countrey beganne make warre slee people brinne vyllages many sore displeasure tyme erle northumberlande lordes knyghtes countrey knewe nothyng comyng whan tidynges cae newcastell durham scottes abrode myght well se fiers smoke abrode countrey erle sente newcastell two sonnes sente commaundemente euery man drawe newcastell sayenge sonnes ye shall go newcastell countrey shall assemble shall tary nymyche whiche passage muste passe may enclose shall spede well sir henry percy syr rafe brother obeyed father comaundement came thyder countrey scottes rode burnynge exylynge countrey smoke therof came newe castell scottes came gate durham skrymysshed taryed nat longe returned ordeyned founde waye toke distroyed bytwene durham newcastell twelue leages englyssh good countrey towne without closed brente repassed ryuer tyne passed came newcastell rested englysshe knyghtes squyers countrey yorke bysshoprike durham assebled newecastell thyder came seneschall yorke sir rafe mombraye syr rafe redmayne capytayne berwyke sir roberte angle syr thomas grey sir thomas holcon sir iohan felton syr iohan lyerborne syr thomas abyton baron helcon sir iohan copuldyke dyuers towne full people wyst nat lodge whan thre scottysshe erles chyefe capytaynes made enterprise bysshoprike durham sore ouer rynne countrey retourned newcastell rested taryed two dayes euery day skrymysshed erle northumberlandes two sonnes two yonge lusty knyghtes euer formaste barryers skrymysshe many proper feates armes done archyued fyghtynge hande hande amonge fought hande hande erle duglas sir henry percy force armes erle duglas wanne penon syr henry percyes wherwith sore dyspleased englysshmen erle duglas sayd sir henry perey syr shall beare token prowes scotlande shall sette hyghe castell alquest may sene farre syr quod sir henry ye maye sure ye shall nat passe boundes countrey tyll ye met withall wyse ye shall make none auaunte therof well syr erle duglas come nyght lodgynge seke penon shall sette lodgynge se ye wyll come take away late scottes withdrewe lodginges refresshed fleshe ynough made nyght good watche thought surely waked wordes hadde spoken nat syr henry percy counsayled nat soo nexte day scottes dyslodged returned towardes owne countrey came castell towne called pouclan wherof ser haymon alphell lorde ryght good knyght scottes rested came thyder tymes vnderstode knyght castell ordeyned assayle castell gaue great assaute force armes wan knyght within towne castell brent fro then scottes wente towne castell combur eyght englysshe myle fro newe castell lodged day made none assaut next mornyng blewe horne made redy assayle castell whiche stronge stode maresse daye assauted tyll wery dyd nothynge sowned retrayte retourned lodgyng lordes drewe counsayle determyne shulde moste parte acorde next day shuld dyssoge without gyuynge assaute drawe fayre easly towardes carlyle therle duglas brake counsayle sayd dispyte sir henry percy sayd wolde come wynne agayne penon let v nat departe hence two thre dayes lette v assayle castell prignable shall haue double honour lette v se wyll come fetche penon shall well defended euery man acorded sayeng honour loue hym also lodged ease none troubled theym made many lodgynges bowes great herbes fortityed campe sagely maresse therby caryages sette entre mare beestes within maresse aparelled saute next day entensyon nowe lette v speke sir henry percy sir rafe brother shewe dyd sore dyspleased therle duglas wonne penon armes also touched gretly honour dyd nat syr henry percy sayd wolde sayd erle duglas shulde nat cary penon englande also openly spoken fore knyghtes squiers newcastell englysshmen thought surely therle duglas bande scottes vangarde hoost lefte behynde knyghtes countrey suche well experte armes spake agaynst sir henry percyes opinyon sayd hym syr fortuneth warre often tymes many loss erle duglas haue wonne penon bought dere came gate seke well beaten another day ye shall wynne moche hym syr saye bycause knowe well power scotlande abrode feldes issue nat men ynowe fyght peraduenture haue made skrimysshe v entent drawe v towne nombre sayd aboue xl thousande men maye soone inclose v v wyll yet better lese penon two thre hundred knyghtes squyers put countrey aduenture wordes refrayned syr henry brother wolde nothynge agaynst counsayle tydynges came theym suche sene scottes sene demeanoure waye toke rested phowe syr henry percy brother good nombre men armes archer went scottes wynne agayne penon erle duglas hadde wonne newcastell vpon tyne howe assailed scottes mountberke lodgynges cap cxlii shewed sir henry percy broder knightes squyers suche folowed scottes fro newecastell well aduysed doynge said sir henry syr rafe syrs haue folowed scottes priuely haue discouered countrey scottes pountclan haue taken syr haymon alphell owne castell fro thence gone ottenburge laye nyght wyll morowe knowe nat ordayned abyde sir surely great hoost nat passe nat thre thousade men whan sir henry herde ioyfull sayd syrs let v leape horse faythe iowe god lorde father wyll go seke penon dyslodge theym nyght knyghtes squiers herde agreed therto ioyous euery man made hym redy euenynge bysshop durham came thyder good company herde durham howe scottes newcastell howe lorde percy sonnes lordes knightes shulde fight scottes therfore bysshoppe dutham come reskewe assembled vp countrey comynge newcastell sir henry percy wolde nat abyde comynge hym syre hundred speares knightes squiers eight thousande fotemen thought sufficyent nombre fyght scottes nat thre hundred speares thre thousande thus departed fro newcastell dyner set forth good ordre toke way scottes gone rode ottebourge seuen lytell leages fro thence fayre way coulde nat ryde faste bycause fotemen whan ye scottes supped layde downe rest wery trauaylynge sautynge castell day thought ryse erly mornyng cole day gyue newe assaute therwith sodenly englysshmen came entred lodginges wenyng ben maisters lodgynges therin varlettes seruauntes englysshmen cryed percy percy entred lodgynges ye knowe well suche affray noyse sone reysed fortuned well scottes whan sawe englysshmen came wake lordes sente certayne seruauntes fotemen skrymysshe englysshmen entre lodgynges ye meane tyme armed aparelled euery man vnder baner vnder capytaynes penon night farre mone shone bryght ben maner daye moneth august wether fayre temperate thus scottes drawen gyder without noyse departed fro lodgynges went aboute lytell mountayne whiche greatly aduauntage day well aduysed place sayd amonge selfe englysshemen come v sodaynly wyll thus thus ioperdous thyng nyght men warre entre lodgynges wyll drawe suche place therby outher shall wyn lese whan englysshmen entred felde first soone ouercame varlettes entred alwayes foude newe men besy skrymysshe sodaynly came scottes fro aboute mountayne sette englysshmen ware cryed cryes wherof englysshe menne sore astonyed cryed percy partye cryed duglas began cruell batayle fyrst encountre many ouerthrowen bothe partyes bycause englisshmen great nombre greatly desyred vanquysshe enemyes rested pa greatly dyd put backe scottes scottes nere dyscomfyted erle iames duglas yonge stronge great desyre gette prayse grace wyllynge deserue haue cared payne trauayle came forthe baner cryed duglas duglas sir henry percy syr rafe brother great indygnacion agaynst erle duglas bycause wonne penon armes barryers newcastell came parte cryed percy two baners mette menne sore fyght englysshmen stronge fought valyauntly reculed scottes backe two valiaunt knightes scottes vnder baner erle duglas called syr patryke helborne syr patryke sonne acquyted selfe day valy auntly erles baner ben nat ben defended valyauntly rescuynge therof dyd suche feates armes greatly recommendacyon heyres euer shewed suche batayle well knyghtes squyers englande scotlande house erle foiz anone batayle done met ortays two squyers englande called iohan newecastell iohan cauteron also whan retourned fro auignon founde also knyght squyer scotlande knewe knewe bysuche token shewed countrey auctor boke youthe rydden nygh ouer realme scotland fyftene dayes house erle wyllyam duglas father erle iames whome spake nowe castell fyue leages fro edenboro win countrey alquest tyme sawe erle iames fayre yonge chylde suster called lady blaunche enfourmed bothe party batayle sore batayle fought lyghtly hath harde suche nombre beleue well englysshmen one partye scottes party good men warre whan mete harde sight without sparynge hoo bytwene longe speares swordes are dagers wyll endure lay eche vpon whan well beaten one parte hath optaygned victory glorifye dedes arme ioyfull suche taken shall raunsomed go elde shortely eche contente deparrynge curtoysly wyll saye god thanke fyghtynge one another playe sparynge trewe shall well apere sayd rencountec valyauntly foughten coulde deuysed ye shall phowe erle iames duglas valyatnesse incouraged men reculed maner discomfyted doynge wounded dethe cap cxliii knyghtes squyers good corage bothe party fyght valyauntly cowardes place hardynes rayned goodly feates armes knyghtes squiers ioyned gyder hande stroke archer place nother party scottes shewed great hardynesse feught meryly great desyre honour englysshmen thre one howe say nat englysshmen dyd nobly acquyte selfe euer englysshmen rather ben slayne taken place flye thus haue sayd baners duglas percy men met eche enuyous shulde wynne honoure iourney begynnynge englysshemen stronge eculed backe enemyes erle duglas great harte hygh enterprise seynge men recule backe recouer place shewe knightly valure toke bothe handes entred ye prease made hym selfe waye suche wyse none durste aproche nere hym well armed bare well suche stroke receyued thus wente euer forwarde lyke hardy hector wyllynge lone conquere felde dyscomfyte enemyes laste encountred thre speares one one strake hym shulder breste stroke glented downe bely thyrde strake hym thye sore hurte thre stroke borne perforce erthe coulde nat agayne releued knyghtes squyers folowed hym nat nyght lyght shynynge mone englisshmen knewe well borne one downe erth wyst nat knowen ben erle duglas therof ioyfull prowde vyctory also scottes knew nat aduenture tyll ende batayle knowen shulde haue sore dyspayred dyscoraged wolde haue fledde awaye thus erle duglas felled erth striken heed axe another stroke throughe thye englysshe men passed tooke hede hym thought none otherwyse hadde slayne man armes parte erle george de la donbare fought ryght valyantly gaue englissh men moche cryed folowe duglas sette sonnes percy also erle iohan morette baner men fought valyauntly sette fyersly englisshmen gaue moche wyste nat whome attende phowe batayle sir rafe percye sore hurte taken prysoner scottysshe knyght cap cxliiii bataylles encountrynges haue made melicion hystory great smalle batayle treate nowe one sorest best foughten without cowardes faynte hertes nother knyght squyer dyde deuoyre fought hande hande batayle lyke batayle bechercll whiche valyauntly fought endured erle northumberlandes sonnes sir henry sir rafe percy chefe souerayne capytayns acquyted selfe nobly sir rafe percy entred farre amonge enemyes closed hurte sore handeled brethe shorte taken prysoner knyght erle morettes called sir iohan makyrell takynge scottysshe knyght demaunded nyght knewe hym nat syr rafe sore ouercome bledde fast laste sayd rafe percy scotte sayde syr rafe reskewe reskewe take prisoner makyrell well quod sir rafe contente take hede sore hurte hosen greues full blode knyght sawe hym erle moret sayde syr delyuer syr rafe percy prisoner sir lette good hede taken hym sore hurte erle ioyfull wordes sayd makyrell thou hast well wonne thy spurres delyuered syr rafe percy certayne men stopped wrapped woundes styll batayle endured nat knowynge better many taken reskewed agayne came knowledge nowe let v speke yonge iames erle duglas dyd maruayls armes beaten downe whan ouerthrowen preace great coulde nat releue axe dethes woude men folowed nere coulde came hym syr iames lymsey cosyn syr iohan sir water saynt clere knyghtes squiers hym gentle knyght folowed day chapelayne nat lyke preest lyke valyaunt man armes night folowed erle good handes styll skrymysshed aboute erle lay reculed backe englisshe men gret stroke gaue thus founde fyghtynge nere mayster wherby hadde great prayse therby yere made archedecon abredan preest called syr willyam norbernyche tall man hardy sore hurte whanne knyghtes came erle founde hym yuell case knyght lyenge hym called sir roberte harte fyftene woundes one place syr iohan sayncte clere demaunded erle howe dyd ryght yuell cosyn quod therle thanked god hath fewe myne auncytours hathe dyed beddes cosyn requyre thynke reuenge recon selfe deed herte faynteth often tymes cosyn water praye rayse vp agayne baner whiche lyeth grounde squyer dauy collemnie
