slayne syrs shewe nother frende soo case ye seme myne enemyes knewe wolde reioyse frendes discomforted two bretherne saynt clere sir iames lymscy dyd erle hadde desyred theym reysed vp agayne baner cryed duglas suche behynde herde crye drewe togyther set enemyes valyauntly reculed backe englysshe men many ouerthrowen draue englysshe men backe beyonde place erle laye tyme deed came erles baner whiche syr iohan saynte clere helde handes many good knyghtes squyers scotlande aboute hym styll company drewe crye duglas thyder came erle morette baner well accompanyed also erle de la mare donbare whan sawe englissh men recule copany assembled togyder renewed agayne batayle gaue many harde sadde stroke phowe scottes wanne batayle agaynst englysshe men besyde otteburge taken prisoner sir henry sir rafe percy howe englysshe squyer wolde nat yelde wolde scottysshe squier dyed howe bysshope durham company discomfyted amonge themselfe ca c xlv saye trouth englysshmen sorer trauayled scottes came day fro newcastell vpon tyne sire englyssh myles went great pase entente fynde scottes whiche dyd fast goynge nere brethe scottes fresshe well rested greatly auayled whan tyme busynesse laste skrymysshe reeuled backe englysshemen suche wyse coude assemble togyther scottes past batayles fortuned sir henry percy lorde mountcombre valyaunt knyght scotlande fought togyther hande hande ryght valyauntly without lettynge euery man ynough longe two fought perforce armes syr henry percy taken prisoner sayde lorde mountcomber knyghtes squiers scotlande sir mare adremench sir thomas auernesquyn syr willyam syr iames sir alysander lymsey lorde faulcon iohan saynte de laur syr patryke donbare sir iohan syr water saynte clere sir iohan makyrcll sir guystewarde syr iohan halebreton syr alysaunder ramsey roberte colounnie two sonnes iohan roberte made knyghtes hundred knyghtes squyers nat name ryght valyauntly dyd acquyte selfe englysshe parte lorde percy taken fought valyauntly syr rafe longeble syr mathewe redman syr thomas ogle sir thomas gray sir thomas hekon sir thomas abreton sir iohan lyerbon sir willyam walsyngham baron helcon sir iohan culpedup seneschall yorke dyuers fotemen wherto write longe proces sore batayle well foughten fortune alwayes chaungeable though englisshmen nombre scottes ryght valyaunt men warre well experte fyrste fronte reculed backe scottes yet fynally scottes optaygned place vyctory foresaid englysshmen taken hundred mo sauynge sir mathewe rodman capytayne berwyke whan knewe remedy recoueraunce sawe company flye fro scottes yelded theym euery syde toke horse departed saue hym selfe season aboute ende dyscomfyture englysshe squyer called thomas veleton goodly valyant man well sene nyght wolde nother flye yet yelde hym sayd made vowe feest englande first tyme euer sawe englisshe men scottes batayle wolde deuoyre power suche wyse eyther wolde reputed best doer bothe sydes el dye payne called valyaunt hardy man dyd moche prowes vnder baner erle morette dyd suche valyauntnesse armes scottes hadde maruayle therof slayne fyghtynge scottes wolde gladly haue taken hym alyue wolde neuer yelde hoped euer haue rescewed scottysshe squier slayne cosyn kynge scottes called symon glaudyn dethe greatly complayned scottes batayle fierse cruell tyll came ende discomfyture whan scottes sawe englysshmen recule yelde theselfe scottes curtes sette theym raunsome euery manne sayde prysoner syrs go vnarme take youre case mayster made prisoner good chere though ben brother without doyng domage chas ndured fyue englysshe myles ye scottes men ynowe none scaped outher ben taken slayne archambault duglas erle fen erle surlant great copany gone towardes carlyle ben lykelyhode taken bysshoppe durham ye towne newcastell vpon tyme shall shewe howe euenyng percyes deted fro newcastell ye haue herde bysshop durham rerebande cae newcastell supped satte table ymagmacion hym selfe howe dyd nat acquite hym selfe well se englysshe men felde within towne incontynent caused table taken away comaunded sadell horse sowne tru pettes called vp men towne arme selfe mount horse foote men order selfe departe thus euery man departed towne nombre seuyn thousande two thousande horsebacke fyue thousande fote toke waye towarde ottenbourg batayle ben tyme hadde gone two myle newcastell tidynges came theym howe men fightynge scottes ther bysshoppe rested incontynent came mo flyeng faste brethe demau ded howe mater wente aunswered sayde right yuell disconfyted cometh scottes chasynge v tidynges troubled englysshmen began doute agayne thirde tyme men came flyeng fast might whane men bysshoprike durham herde yuell tidynges abasshed suche wise brake array bysshoppe coude nat holde togyder nombre fyue hudred thought scottes folowed nombre seyng night thentryng towne englissh men abasshed towne ben bysshope durham beyng felde good wyll haue socoured englysshmen recoforted men asmoche coude sawe owne men flye well demaunded cousaile sir wyllyam lussey sir thomas clyfforde knyghtes best knyghtes honoure wolde gyue hym counsayle thought retourne agayne nothyng shulde sowne greatly blame go myght great mage stode styll wolde gyue none answere lengar stode fewer styll stale awaye bysshoppe sayd sir thynges considred none honour putte parell make one yuell dommage twayne howe company disconfyted nat remedy go recouer knowe nat wt nombre shall mete lette v retourne fayre easely night newcastell lette v drawe toguyder go loke enemyes euery man answered god wyll therwith retourned newcastell thus man maye consyder great defaute men yt abasshed disconfyted kepte togyder haue turned agayn suche fledde disconfyted scottes opynion dyuers bycause dyde nat thus scottes vyctorie phowe sir mathue reedman deted fro batayle saue hym selfe howe sir iames lymsaye taken prisoner bysshoppe durhame howe bataile scurrers sente forthe discouer countrey cap cxlvi shall shewe sir mathewe reedman horsbacke saue himselfe alone coude nat remedy mater departynge sir iames lymsay nere hym sawe howe sir mathue deted sir iames wyn honour folowed chase sir mathue reedman came nere hym myght haue stryken hym speare lyst said ah sir knyght tourne shame thus flye iames lymsay ye wyll nat tourne shall stryke backe speare sir mathewe spake worde strake horse spurres sorer dyde maner chased hym thre myles laste sir mathue reedmans horse founvred fell vnder hym stepte forthe ye erthe drewe oute swerde toke corage defende h mselfe scotte thought haue seryken hym brest sir mathewe reedman swarued fro stroke speare poynt entred erthe sir mathue stroke sonder speare swerde whan sir iames lymsay sawe howe loste speare caste awaye tro chon lyghted fote toke l tell bacayle caryed backe handeled one hande quickely delyuerly whiche feace scottes well experte sette sir mathue defended hym selfe properly thus tourneyed toguyder one swerde longe season man lette fynally sir iames lymsay gaue knyght suche stroke helde hym shorte putte brethe suche wyse yelded hym selfe sayde sir iames lymsay yelde well quod receyue rescue rescue content quod reedman ye deale lyke good companyon shall nat fayle lymsay putte vp swerde well sir reedman wyll nowe shall prisoner ye haue conquered wolde gladly go agayn newcastell within fyftene dayes shall come scotlande ye shall assigne cotent quod lymsay ye shall promyse faythe present selfe within iii wekes ede borowe soeuer ye go repute yourselfe prisoner sir mathue sware promysed fulfyll eche toke ho s toke leaue eche sir iames returned entent go owne copany way came sir mathewe reedman newcastell sir iames lymsaye coulde nat kepe ryght waye came darke myst hadde nat rydden halfe myle met face face bysshoppe durham mo v hundred englysshmen hym might wel escaped wolde supposed owne copany pursued englysshmen whan among one demaunded hym quod sir iames lymsay bysshoppe herde wordes stepte hym said lymsay ye taken yelde ye quod lymsay bysshop durham fro whens come sir lymsay come fro batayle bysshop stroke neuer stroke backe newcastell night ye shal go maye nat chose quod lymsay sithe ye wyll haue haue taken taken suche aduentures armes haue ye taken quod bysshop sir quod toke chase sir mathue redman quod bysshop faythe sir retourned newcastell desyred trust hym faythe thre wekes haue done well bysshop lette v go newcastell ye shall speke hym thus rede newcastell toguyder sir iames lymsay prisoner bisshop durham vnder baner therle de la mare dobare taken asquer gascone called iohn newcastell vnder baner erle moret taken companyon iohn de cauteron thus felde clene auoyded daye apered scottes drewe togyder toke guydes sente scurrers se men waye fro newcastell entent wolde nat troubled lodgynges wherin dyd wisely whan ye bysshop durham come agayne newcastell lodgynge sore pesyfe wyst nat saye herde say howe cosyns ye percy slayne taken ye knightes yt sent ye knyghtes squyers towne whan come demaunded shulde leaue mater case sayde sir shall beare great blame thus retourne without lokynge oure ennemyes cocluded sonne rysynge euery manne armed hors backe foote departe towne go octenbourge fyght scottes warned towne trumpet euery man armed theym assembled bridge sonne rysynge departed gate towardes berwyke tooke waye towardes octebourge nombre tenne thousande foote horse backe nat gone paste two myle fro newcastell whan scottes sygnefyed bysshoppe durham commynge theym warde fyght knewe spyes suche sette feldes sir mathewe reedman retourned newcastell hadde shewed dyuers howe taken prisoner sir iames lymsey shewed hym howe bisshoppe durham hadde taken sayd sir iames lymsey towne prisoner soone bysshoppe departed sir mathue reedman wente bysshoppes lodgyng se mayster founde hym studye lyeng wyndowe sayd sir iames lymsay make sir iames came forthe study hym gaue hym good morowe sayd faythe sir mathewe fortune hathe brought hyder soone departed fro mette chaunce ye bysshoppe durham whome prisoner ye beleue ye shall nat nede come edenborowe make fynaunce thynke rather shall make exchaunge one another bysshoppe contente well sir quod reedman shall accorde ryght well toguyder ye shall dyne daye bysshop men gone forthe fyght men nat tell shall fall shall know retourne content dyne quod lymsay thus two knyghtes dyned toguyder newcastell whan knyghtes scotlade enformed howe bysshop durham came x thousande men drewe counsayle se best outher dete el abyde adue ture thynges consydred concluded abyde sayd coude nat better stronger place alredy many prisoner coulde nat cary theym awaye shulde haue departed also hadde many men hurte also prisoner whoe thought wolde nat leue behynde thus drewe toguyder ordred felde ther entre one waye sette prisoner toguyder made promise howe rescue rescue shulde prisoner made mynstrels blowe vp atones made greattest reuell worlde lightlye vsage scottes whan thus assembled toguyder armes foote men bereth neckes home maner lyke hunter great small sortes whan blowe one make suche noyse may herde nighe iiii myles thus aba enemyes reioyse selfes whan bysshoppe durham baner xm men hym aproched leage ye scott blewe horne suche wise semed deuyls hell amonge suche herde knewe nat vsage sore abasshed blowyng noyse endured longe space cessed tyme theglysshmen within lesse myle ye scottes began blowe agayn made great noyse long endured dyd bysshop aproched batayle well rainged good order came within ye syght ye scottes within ii bowe shot lesse ye scottes blewe horne lo ge space ye bysshop stode styll se scottes wolde auewed well saw howe stronge grounde greatlye aduauntage bysshop tooke counsayle beste hym thynge well aduysed nat purpose entre amonge scottes assayle retourned withoute doyng thyng sawe well myght rather lese wyn whan scottes sawe englysshe men recule shulde haue batayle wente lodgynges made mery thane ordayned departe fro then bycause sir rafe percy sore hurte desyred maister myght retourne newcastell place pleased hym vnto tyme hole hurtes promysynge sonne able ryde retourne scotlande outher edenborowe place apoynted erle mare vuder taken agreed therto delyuered hym horse lytter sent hym waye lyke couenaunt dyuers knyghtes squyers suffred returne tooke terme outher retourne el paye fynauce suche apoy ted vnto shewed informacyon scottes suche sayd batayle bytwene newcastell octeburge yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore viii xix daye august nowe yt taken prisoner englisshe partie xl men one slayne felde chase xviii hundred xl sore hurte mo thousande scottes hundred slayne taken chase mo two hundred englysshmen fledde whan sawe aduautage retourned agayne fought meanes scottes taken none otherwyse euery man maye well consydre well fought felde whan many slayne taken bothe party phowe scottes departed caryed therle duglas deed buryed hym abbey nimays howe sir archambault duglas company departed fro carlyle retourned scotlande cap cxlvii batayle thus furnysshed euery man retourned erle duglas deed body chested layde chare hym sir robert hart symon glaudyn prepared departe departed ledde sir henry percy mo xl knyghtes englande tooke waye abbey nimay de partynge sette fyre lodgynges rode daye yet lay night englysshe grounde none denyed nexte daye dislodged early mornyng came daye nimay abbey blacke monkes border bytwene bothe realmes rested buryed erle iames duglas seconde daye obsequye done reueretly body layde tombe stone baner hangyng ouer hym wheder mo erles duglas whome lande retourned nat nat tell sir iohn froissart auctour boke scotlande ye erles castell alquest lyueng erle wyllm whiche tyme two chyldren sonne dought many duglasses haue sene av bretherne squiers bearyng ye name duglas ye kyng scotlades house dauid sone knight scotlade called sir iames duglas bare armes golde thre oreyls goules ye herytage knowe nat sir archambalt duglas haue spoken hysto ie dyuers place valyant knight gretly redouted englysshmen bastarde whan scottes hadde ben nymaye abbey done came thyder departed eche fro wente owne countreis suche hadde prisoner ledde awaye rausomed suffred returne thus englysshe men founde scottes right curtesse gentyll delyueraunce raunsome well contente shewed countrey bierne erle foiz house knyght named iohan newcastell taken prisoner iourney vnder baner erle mare donbare greatly praysed sayd erle suffred hym passe maner desyred hym selfe thus men warre scotlande departed raunsomed prisoner soone myght ryght curttesly retourned lytell lytell owne countreis shewed beleue well scottes reason iourney two hundred thousande frankes raunsomyng prisoner sythe batayle streuelyne scotlande sir robert breuce sir wyllyam duglas sir robert versey sir symon freseyle scottes chased englysshmen thre dayes neuer iourney fytable honorable whan tidynges came company scottes besyde carlyle howe company distressed englysshe men besyde octeburgh greatly reioysed displeased myndes nat ben determyned dislodge drawe owne countreys seynge company withdrawen thus dislodged entred scotlade pnowe lette v leaue speke scottes englysshe men tyme lette v retourne yonge charles fraunce great people wente almaygne bringe duke guerles reason whan frenche kynge armye paste ryuer muese bridge morsay tooke waye ardayn lusenbourgh alwayes pyoners beatynge woodes busshes makynge wayes playne duke iulyers countrey greatly douted comyng frenche kynge knewe well shulde haue fyrst assault beare fyrst burdone lande iulyers playne coutrey one day men warre shuld moche domage distroye wast excepte castelles good townes thus frenche kyng entred cou trey lusenbourgh came abbey vyncelant somtyme duke brabant buryed kyng taryed two dayes departed toke waye throughe basconque lodged within leage duches brabant laye e sent worde beyng ye duke burgoyn brought felde speke kynge receyued right honourably comuned togyder duches retourned basconque thyder conueyed sir iohn vyen sir guy tremoile next daye kyng went forwarde aprochyng lande enemyes came cryng almayne fronters ye duchy iulyers came far forwarde arnolde bisshop liege ye kyng greatly entreated duke iuliers kyng shulde nat miscontent hym though father duke guerles excused hym deflauce sonne made affyrmyng nat knowlege consent wherfore sayd pytie father shulde beare defaut sonne excuse nat suffycient kyng vncles entent kyng cousayle without ye duke iulyers wolde come make maner excuse yelde hym selfe ye kynges pleasure countrey shulde first shulde beare burdone thanne bysshoppe liege lordes hasbane counsayls good townes offred kynge counsayle holly bysshoprike liege armye passe repasse payeng expense rest refresshe long pleased kyng thanked dyde vncles wolde nat refuse offre knewe nat nede shulde haue page duplicate page duplicate phowe duke iulyers came excused hym selfe defyau ce sone duke guerles made frenche kyng became subiecte dyuers feates armes done bytwene frenchman almayns rencongne cap cxlviii thus bisshoppe liege retourned duke iullyers archebysshoppe coloigne shewed done thervpon toke aduyse duke iuliers great dout cryling wastyng countrey sent knightes countrey haue counsayle aduyse dayly frenchman aproched lorde coucy ye vowarde hym thousande speares duke lorayne hym vicount meaulx two hudred speares whan frenche men aproched fronters almayne rode toguyder good order lodged wisely thre hudred speares lynsars almayns beyond ryuer ryne gathered toguyder noted greattest pyllers robber worlde alwayes pursued coosted frenchman fynde dispurueyed domage frenche men douted durst neuer go forragyng great companyes vnderstode sir boucequant elder sir loyes grache retayned brought nimay sayd almayns rode alwayes couertly lyke byrdes flyeng ye ayre sekyng praye made frenche men wyse well ware thus whan frenche kyng come forwarde entre duchy iulyers duke iulyers wolde nat lese countrey beleued cousayle archebysshoppe coloyne bysshop liege two entreated hym ye kynge brought mater poynt lades rest peace meanes suche condycions foloweth two prelate dyde moche yt brought duke iulyers kynges presece vncles duke lorayne great lordes fraunce ye blode royall whan kyng kneled downe wisely excused defyauce sonne made sayd howe sonne foole neuer counsayle hym dyde dyde owne wyll offred ye kyng sayeng sir entent bring hym ye knowledgynge reason lycence wyll go hym shewe hym folly quickely counsayle hym coe make excuse youre grace counsayle wyll nat thus agaynst counsayle shall abandon townes castels countrey prouyde men warre make warre hym tyll ye haue taken hym mercy kyng regarded brother vncles cousaile semed hym offre faire resonable thought dyuers kyng toke vp duke iulyers kne whyle spake kyng sayd hym sir shall take counsayle aduyse promyses wordes duke rose vp stode styll bysshoppes brought hym thyder kyng vncles suche secrete counsayle drewe toguyder debated mater long dyuers opinios duke burgoyne principallye mater touched bicause duchy brabant wherin chaleged haue great right enherytaunce dethe duches iane bycause lady margaret wyfe also say trouthe chiefe causer kynges comyng thyder yt puissauce wherfore wolde euery thyng might best thentent good peace might made bitwene tie shulde occasyon coe thyder agayne another tyme bycause voyage long costly realme sayd kyng sir lyke grace brother berrey saye thynges yuell begone lyeth great aduyse howe cosyn duke iulyers greatly exscuseth hymselfe valyant man blode ought beleue hym offereth kyng great thyng body countrey townes castelles kynges comaundemente case sonne duke guerles wyll rebell come nat make amendes defyaunce hath made speke acordynge reason great thynge haue v duke iuliers duke guerles shall feble easyer correcte shall dought v soner come obeysaunce wherfore counsayle offre nat refused mekely humyleth hymselfe greate lordes almayne entreate hym wordes contrary opynyons consented one acorde bysshoppes coloygne liege called counsayle ben chyefe entreatours busynes declared fro poynte poynte frome clause clause thynges ye duke iulyers shulde swere seale wolde haue landes saued reste fyrst shulde go sonne duke guerles shewe hym playnely foly great outrage done sende defye puyssaut prince frenche kynge specially suche fell defyaunce style ryght reason cause come reason mercy wolde nat thus abyde styll opynyon feble wytte counsayle duke iulyers swere seale renounce hym fro ayde socoure myght become enemy suffre suche shall apoynted kynge counsayle abyde wynter lye garysons countrey iulyers make frounter warre agaynst duke guerles well entreated receyued two prelate called kinges counsayle entente shulde shewe duke iulyers artycles dyd duke sawe well howe behoued hym agree el haue landes ouer tynne wasted wherfore acorded sware sealed vpholde kynges desyre lande shulde nat ouerron exyled contente lande shulde vytayle armye thus duke iulyers became frenche kynges man made relyefe lande vierson beyng bytwene bloys berrey supped nyght kynges table fyrste sate bysshoppe liege bysshoppe coloygne kynge duke burgoyne duke thowrayn duke iuliers duke burbone thus duke iulyers reste pea foresayd meanes kynge armye lodged countrey whiche pleasaunt plentyfull vytayles duke iulyers wente towardes duke guerles sonne came dyuers feates armes done countrey almayns couetouse oftentymes night daye wolde ieoparde selfe sette frenche men lodgynges kepe wakynge somtyme wanne tyme lost one almayne taken euer four frenchman taken daye constable fraunce lorde coucy duke lorayne marshall blainuill sir iohan vien syr iohan de la tremoyle four thousande men armes came towne guerles called renconge shewed selfe good ordre batayle tyme ye duke guerles within towne praysed moche demeanour made none issue nat men ynowe wherof ryght sore dyspleased thus frenche men good ordre batayle space four houres whan sawe none wolde issue departed returned lodgynges euenynge duke berreys lodgyng certayne knyghtes squyers drewe togyther entent ryde forthe mornynge lande enemy seke aduenture promysed eche stycke togyther lyke bretherne nombre aboute hundred speares whan mornynge came purpose broken squyer auuergne called godinos valyaunt man armes pertayned lorde alegre whan sawe refused company wolde nat desyre hym go sore dyspleased brake mynde nother sorte companyons nombre thyrty speares tode forthe togyther rode mornynge coulde fynde none adventure whan godynos sawe shulde retourne without doynge feate sore dyspleased sayde company syrs ryde fayre easely page wyll ryde aboute wode se enbusshe hydden therin tary vpon yonder mountayne agreed hym thus page rode forthe costynge wode whan rydden lytell waye herde one stell wode strake horse sportes came syde wode founde almayne guetloys cuttynge wode godynos toke glay e came ry nynge man wherof man sore abasshed godynos made sygne hym shulde go thought companyons yet shulde se founde somwhat thought manne shulde seruyce lodgynges godynos rode lowe hackeney almayne folowed hym foote hewynge axe necke wherwith wrought wode godinos page lepte maysters courser bare bassenette speare folowed halfe slepynge bycause rysen early almayn knewe nat whyder shuld go wolde hym thought delyuer hymselfe came fayre easely godynos lyfte vp strake hym suche stroke heed claue teth ouerthrewe hym starke deed page knewe nat therof tyll sawe mayster fall vyllayne fledde wode saued hymselfe aduenture fell godinos wherwith suche knewe hym sore dyspleased specyally auuergne man armes moste doughted englisshmen party dyd domage prisone shulde haue ben quyted twenty thousande frankes pnowe lette v retourne duke iulyers phowe duke iuliers archebysshop coloygne departed fro frenche kynge wente nymay duke guerles howe meanes reconsyled brought peace frenche kynge duches brabante cap cxlix ye knowe well hathe ben shewed howe duke iulyers made peace frenche king meanes bysshoppes treated behalfe also saye trouthe duke lorayne cosyn toke great payne mater ye haue herde duke promysed go sonne duke guerles cause hym come kynges mercy el make hym warre thus duke iulyers fayne promyse el countrey ben loste thus duke iulyers archbysshoppe toke iourney go guerles passed ryuer came nymay duke receyued father great ioye bounde nothynge nere man father mother nothynge glad herde howe duke father agreed frenche kynge duke iuliers bysshop shewed hym length hole mater case lande stode made lytle therof sore alyed kynge englande wolde nat forsake hym herte good englysshe excused hym selfe greatly sayde father syr let alone wyll abyde aduenture take domage reason frenche kynges comynge yonge ynough beare reuenged herafter parte realme fraunce vppon neyghbours brabansoys lorde canne kepe warre without domage sometyme lese sometyme wynne whan father duke iulyers herde hym styffe opynyon sore dyspleased sayd sonne willyam whome make youre warre shall reuenge domage syr quod kynge englande puysaunce haue gret maruayle tydynges englysshe army see come haue promysed wolde haue wakened frenche men oftener thanne one tyme quod father trust abyde englysshmen besyed euery quarter wote nat whome entende duke lancastre cosyn lyeth bayon burdeaux retourned spayne small ordre hath lost men tyme hath sente englande haue mo men armes archer nat get nombre xx speares also englysshe men haue late playne batayle great domage northumberlande chyualry aboute newcastell vpon tyne ouerthrowen slayne taken nowe realme englande nat good quyete reste wherfore nat trust tyme englysshe men ye shall haue comforte wherfore cousayle ruled v shall make peace frenche kyng shall moche ye shall nouther receyue shame domage syr quod duke guerles howe may myne honoure acorde frenche kynge though shulde lese hole lande go dwell place surely wyll nat sore alyed kinge englande also haue defyed frenche kynge thynke feare hym shulde reuoke wordes breke seale ye wolde shulde dyshonored requyre let alone shall defende self right well agaynst set lytell thretenynges water raynes colde wether shall fight tyme ianyuer come shall wery hardyest theym shall wysshe selfe home owne house thus begynnynge treatie duke iuliers bysshoppe coloyne coulde nat breke duke guerles purpose yet hym sixe dayes euery day counsayle whan duke iulyers sawe otherways began sore argue sonne sayd sonne ye wyll nat byleue surely shall dysplease enherytaunce duchy iulyers ye shall neuer haue one foote therof rather shall gyue straunger shall puyssaunce defende agaynste ye foole ye wyll nat beleue counsayle whan duke guerles sawe father inflamed ire apease displeasure sayd sir counsayle myne honour desyre shall leane therto syr iowe obeysaunce wyll duke iulyers sayde sonne nowe ye speke ye shulde shall loke honoure asmoche wolde myne owne deuysed great delyberacion counsayle saue honoure party duke guerles shulde go frenche kynge hym honoure reuerence ought kynge make excuse defyaunce sente kynge say maner syr trewe letter tyme sealed seale sente fraunce whiche came knowledge whiche letter contaygned defyaunce pertaynynge grace realme wordes vnreasonable ryght style vsage prince lordes defie eche whiche wyll nat auowe ye euer suche wordes passed mouthe comaundemente worde touchynge defamynge name signory syr veryfye myne excuse trouthe maye suspecte shall declare trouthe euery thynge syr reason great alyaunce seruyce haue borne ryght redouted lorde kynge englande requeste counsayls sente englande four knyghtes delyuered theym seale seale thynge concluded vpon sealed letter nat neuer knewe sealynge letter conteyned therin syr requyre grace accepte excuse trewe sir aliaunce seruyce haue made lorde kynge englande wyll neuer breke contrarye commaundeth syr request comaundement wyll defye whan shall please hym euer except myne owne naturall lorde kynge almayne whome made seruaunte mouthe spoken myne handes syr honoure consyderynge recompensynge paynes traueyls ye haue susteyned iourney comynge hyder knowe foundacion trouthe defyaunce shall swere kepe shal neuer make warre agaynst defye fyrste ye shall signyfyed therof hole yere sir thynke shulde suffyce deuyse duke guerles sayde well contente thus dyshonour blame thynke thus poynte departed duke iulyers sonne duke guerles archebysshoppe coloygne returned iulyers came endesker whan tyme wente frenche kynge shewed poyntes artycles rehersed sayd syr loke ye wyll duke guerles ye shall nat haue hym frenche kynge greatly desyred se duke guerles cosyn cause put hym somoche payne wherfore soner enclyned treatye duke burgoyn wolde also duches brabant countrey shulde byde rest peace toke payne bringe creatie effecte yt duke guerles myght come speke kynge also one thynge made soner agre wynter aproched nyghtes began longe colde also lordes fraunce enfourmed guerles countrey rest tyme wynter also dayly reporte howe loste men bothe knyghtes squyers synsars almayns dayly lay wayte many reason consyderacyons layde alledged fell acorde duke guerles aproched duke iulyers father duke lorayne bysshop coloigne brought hym kynges tente kynge thre vncles brother duke tourayne duke bare erle marche erle saynte pole erle dolphyn auuergne lorde coucy constable fraunce duke guerles kneled downe kynge infourmed kyng toke hym vp valyauntly wysely exscused hym selfe defyaunce made kynge moreouer sware euer wolde defye kynge make warre realme fraunce wolde gyue kynge knowlege therof yere countreys guerles brabante styll case preset tyme thus mater concluded bytwene duke guerles supped kynge nyghte table greatly regarded bycause put kynge moche payne coste treatie conclusyon put writynge sealed whan done lordes toke leaue departe departed duke guerles demaunded kynge suche prisoner frenche men taken warre myght haue delyuered franke free desyre delyuered thanne kynge demaunded duke suche prysoners men taken voyage shulde delyuered rendred agayne duke guerles excused hym selfe sayde syr poore man whan knewe commynge fortifyed selfe best myght men warre knyghtes squyes fro beyonde ryuer ryne place promysed euer wanne warre shulde owne wherfore take nothinge fro haue wonne wolde haue nouther puyssaunce power wolde shewe rygoure theym wolde make warre agaynst wherfore sir may please lette passe canne nat remedy kynge sawe coulde haue nothyng el suffred passe imagyned realme riche ynough encrease poore men wherfore let passe spake mo wordes departure eche theym well contented ordeyned dyslodge retourne way came sayd frenche kynge shulde cytie reynes feest sayntes holde great feest thus euery man dyslodged retourned pnowe lette v speke englysshe army see phowe erle arundell knyghtes englande beyng see fortune wynde came palyce besyde rochell whose beynge signifyed sir loys xanser departynge erle arundell cap cl meane seasone whyle french kyng guerles englysshe army see wherof erle arundell chefe capytayne tyme sayled forwarde somtyme bacwarde wynde wolde serue seke aduentures well knowen always lightly bytwene feest saynt remey sayntes peryllous season stormes wyndes see aboute tyme rose suche tempeste sperkled abrode englysshe nauy suche wyse hardyest marynere sore abasshed perforce constreyned seke lande erle arundell xxvii vesselles hym whether wolde nat fayne caste ancre lytell hauen called palyce two small leages fro rochell ye wynde streynable see borde coude nat departe thence whanne tydynges therof came rochell great dought fyrste leste englisshmen wolde come great domage closed gate helde shytte day halfe tydynges came fro palyce howe englysshemen xxvii vesselles came thyder force wynde wether taryed nothynge de parte agayne erle arundell lorde henry beamonde sir willyam helmen mo thyrty knyghtes englande rochell tooke counsayle thynge beste thyng consydered sayd howe shulde easly acquyte themselfe went nat skrymysshe season castell bouteuyll syr loys xansere mershall frauce besieged within fortresse gylliam saynt foye gascon marshall great company poicto xayntone piergourt rochell lowe march nat gone almayne ye knig sir loys soueraygne capytayne ouer fronters bytwene mountpellyer rochell tyll retourne lorde coucy rochell sent worde marshall englysshmens beynge palyce whan herde therof ryght ioyfull sent theym shulde make redy seuen eyght galees man forthe wolde come lande fyght englisshmen rochell dyd commaunded sir loys departed fro siege brake vp thought shulde honorable hym fyght erle arundell englysshe men rather thanne contyne styll siege thus wente rochell knyghtes squyers folowed hym nat tell inspyracyon erle arundell knowledge howe marshall fraunce greate puyssaunce knyghtes squyers comynge fyght hym palyce whiche tydynges nat pleasaunte erle arundell howe wynde layde see aueyled erle wayed vp ancres sayled see suche good season taryed longe enclosed hauen euery man taken contynent thyder came galees rochell well manned furnysshed artyllery gonne came streyght hauen palyce foude englisshe men departed pursued two leages see shotte gonne howebeit durst nat longe folowe feare enbusshmentes see frenche shippes returned marshall fraunce sore dyspleased theym rochell sente hym worde late erle arundell toke waye ryuer garon come burdeaux therby ye siege bowteuyll defeated gillonet saynt foy prouyded garyson neded meane tyme ye marshall went fyght englysshe men nowe let v retourne somwhat speke duke lancastre howe treatie spanyardes also duke berrey maryage doughter kynge castyle treated hym sonne prince castyle entent haue peace englisshe men also duke berrey treated haue duke lancaster doughter hymselfe great desyre maryed duke lancastre lyke sage imagynat e prince sawe well howe profitable englande hym mary doughter castyle rather duke berrey therby thought recouer herytage castyle tyme come doughter shulde gyue duke berrey duke fortune dye doughter shulde poore lady regarde bycause duke berrey chyldren fyrst wyfe shulde haue profyte also duchesse lancastre enclyned kynge castyles sonne whan sir helyon lignac departed fro duke lancastre retourned duke berrey beynge almayne king castyls messagers well herde suche wyse wordes noted offer accepted couenaunte made sworne bytwene kateryn lancastre kynge castylles sonne writynges publike instrumentes oblygatory bondes made concluded le repentaunce yt duches lacastre euery thyng set ordre shulde bring doughter kateryn castyle season frenche kynge styll fronters iulyers concludynge duke guerles ye haue herde howe departed frenche men retourned fortuned fronteres almayne nyght aboute mydnyght mone hone fayre certayne almayns robber pyllers dyd sette nother peace warre alwayes sought aduauntage pertaynynge lorde blaqueneuen sir peter conebech well horsed came aduysed french hoost might haue profyte aduauntage passed lodgyng vycount meaulx sawe styringe returned without noyse makynge outher passynge retournynge came agayne enbusshe shewed sene founde incontynente almayns came entred aduauntage frenchman lodgynges ouerthrewe nat tell howe many toke xiiii menne armes prisoner taken lorde viesuile lorde mountkarell aduenture frenche men hadde nyght reason made easy watche yuell ordred next day whan tydinges knowen howe lorde viesuille lorde mountkarell taken frenche men sore displeased toke better hede whan frenche kynge departed fro countrey iulyers none taryed behynde euery man drewe garysons sir guylliam tremoyle sir geruays furrande braban soy waye euery man wente home retournynge frenche men ordeyned great delyberacion cousayle frenche kynge ben vnder gouernynge vncles euer syth dethe laste kynge father shulde take himselfe gouernynge charge hole realme vncles cease gouernynge ynough busyness kynge thanne paste twenty yere age openly publysshed euery man thought resonable kynge came rennes feest sayntes helde great feest vncles hym fyrst knowledge kynge castyle duke lacastre cocluded vpon peace vpon maryage bytwene kinges sonne duke doughter frenche kyng sported duke berrey sayde fayre vncle ye haue fayled entent nother lyke enioy wyfe ye wolde haue howe say therto sayeth corage duke berrey sayde syr saye nothynge well haue fayled shall spede place frenche men beganne murmure vpon maryage said nat done without great alyauces whiche shalbe thynge greatly preiudycyall tyme come realme frauce suche considred botom mater said howe castyle englande portugale one alyaunce accorde thre realmes see lande maye make warre realme fraunce wherfore sayde good kynge shulde sende prouyde remedy tymes consydringe vnhappy kyng castyle hath made alyauce maner deed man duke lancastre man without men puyssaunce also sayde howe kyng castyll ought nat make aliauce man counsayle frenche kynge kynge maye sende hym worde wyll make hym lowe varlette hath made hym great lorde lette kynge make warre agaynste realme castyle putte vnhappy kyng sonne bastarde lette kyng gyue realme owne brother duke thourayne yet hath great herytage shall well sagely gouerne howe dare kynge castyle make treate peace alyaunce duke lancastre without knowledge cosent frenche kynge hath moche ayded honoured auaunsed hym loste realme puissaunce blode royall fraunce nat ben hath well marchaundysed yet wyll marchaundyse sayd lette hym shamed disheryted lette hym haue suche punysshment may well knowe hath yuell done wordes multiplyed suche wyse thynges consydered kynge vncles counsayle determyned sende castyle kynge iohan shewe hym frenche kynges behalfe well aduysed take hede dothe nat hardy make treatie alyaunce englysshe men duke lancastre thyng yt shulde preiudyciall crowne realme fraunce haue done thynketh lette hym sure puyssaunce fraunce shall moche sette hym backe hynder hym hath auaunsed hym kynge realme shall entende nothynge elles distroye hym consydred shulde message thought soeuer shulde ought hardy man well spoken sagely valiauntly declare kynges pleasure thought meane symple persone ought nat message thre persones named lorde coucy sir iohan vyen admyrall fraunce sir guye de la tremoyle thre take one go castyle voyage thynges consydred sir iohan vyenne apoynted go kynge counsayle sayd vnto hym admyrall make redy ye shall go voyage ye shall haue none letter kyng castyle credence ye suffycietly enstructed mater whervpon ye sente saye vnto kynge spaygne aduyse well cause aduysed rede cause reed alyaunces ordynaunces myses sworne sealed bytwene hym v marke well youre aunswere ye shall haue hym counsayle thervpon shall take grounde procede farther admyrall aunswered sayd shalbe done phowe admyrall fraunce ordayned frenche kyng counsayle ambassadour go kynge castyle howe duke berrey sente erle foize treate maryage bytwene duke berrey erles doughter boulonge cap cli admyrall frauce taryed nat long paris made hym quickely redye departe tooke leaue kyng vncles tooke waye burgoyne bycause wolde go auygnone se pope brother dyde pnowe lette v leaue spekyng hym speke somwhat geffray tete noyre enclosed besieged within castell vandachore fyrste wyll speke duke berrey great desyre mary well shewed within yere whan sawe fayled duke lancaster doughter enfourmed erle boulonge fayre doughter named iane doughter lady elyanour comynges howe nat father moder countrey bierne erle foiz great frende cosyn hadde ben brought vp nourysshed well entreated space nyne yeres castell ortayes without cost charge father mother erle often tymes hadde desyred haue maryed alwayes erle aunswered damosell yonge specially sir bernarde brother erle armynacke hadde desyred haue promysed myght haue maryage warre shulde ende bytwene chalenge lande byerne promyses erle wolde nat agree therto aunswered euer howe cosyn yonge amonge owne men wolde saye otherwyse sir espaygne du lyon shewed wolde saye howe armynacke myght well repute hym beest shulde graunt desyre seynge domage shulde graunt theym cosyn maryage shulde strength enfeble hym selfe sayeng howe armynake helde force nat right countie comynges whiche herytage mother aunte cosyn boloyne wyll well knowe shall mary stronge place puissaunt make warre herytage comynges nowe none answere deed man thus whan erle armynacke sir bernarde brother sawe coulde nat come purpose long aunte lyued sayde duke berrey lady shulde fayre maryage iohn berrey sonne settynge duke sente suffycient noble messangers byerne erle foiz desyringe hym yuell wyll might sette aparte euery thynge pardoned tymes paste myght haue damosell boulonge iohan sonne maryage erle boulonge father damosell dyde therto agree assent therle foiz made good chere abassadors excused hym maryage sayd howe lady cosyn yonge also sayde howe whan countesse boulonge mother delyuered charge caused hym swere shulde neuer mary place withher knowledge consent wyse sayde myght wolde nat breake promyse othe sayd none ought desyre hym thervnto excuse erle made knewe well cosyn comynges erle vrgell brother realme arragon wolde nat agree thervnto thus ambassador duke berrey retourned without thyng doyng purpose whan gone sir espaygne du lyon shewed erle sayde ah duke berrey cousayle myght well repute ignorant whan wolde haue enforce myne ennemyes iohan berry cosyn germayn myne aduersaries armynake bargayne shall neuer make shall rather mary englande hath spoken sir henry lancastre erle derby sonne duke lancastre thought nat greatly displease frenche kynge shulde none haue yet knowe nat wyll shall rather mary pleasure armynake shulde haue agaynste wyll lyeth leaue nede nat trouble selfe mater whan duke berrey knewe certe lie duke lacastre shulde mary doughter ye king castyls sone coude nat breke maryage wyse v sixe dayes pensyue none hym durst demaude ayled last declared entent counsaile said hym sir ye haue fayled duke lancaster doughter ye maye recouer another great good howe yonge age wherfore nat tell erle foiz wyll refuce cause hath lady gouernaunce ah quod duke doughter erle boulonge erle foiz hath refused iohan berrey howe name god let v yet assaye duke wrote erle foiz signifyeng hym ryght swetely wolde sende hym four lordes therle xancere lorde de la ryuer sir guy de la tremoyle vycount dassey treate hym haue hym selfe maryage doughter boulonge beyng vnder kepyng maye pleasure desyred erle sende hym answere writyng hole mynde thentent messangers shulde nat traueyle vayne lese payne erle foiz receyued messagers brought writtynge ryght amyably wrote agayne duke berrey sayeng howe right gladde tidynges wolde redy receyue sayd lordes outher foiz byerne erle boulonge coutesse father mother lady agreed thervnto retourne whan duke berey herde answere right ioyfull wynter styll pursued myght attayne maryage nexte somer coude nat bring purpose aboute shortely knewe well erle foiz man lightly wonne sure shulde haue many delay wherfore duke thought worke wysely sent specyall messangers pope clement cosyn nere kyn damosell bouloge pope right ioyouse wha knewe yt cosyn might highly maryed duke berrey vncle freche kyng pope wrote therle foiz signifyeng hym right honorably aduysinge hym shulde nat vary fro ye treatie maryage therby lynage shulde enhaunsed thus erle foiz receyued letter fro party answered right well coude dissimule suche busynesse helde party good loue fauour bothe pope ye duke berrey yet nat wysest bothe counfayls yt coude knowe perfitely erle foiz thought surely pnowe lette v somwhat leaue speakyng mater retourne siege vanchadore ye haue herde hystorie sir wyllm lignac sir iohn boemlaunce dyuers knightes squiers auuergne limosin besieged ye castell vachadore geffray tete noyre within coude nat wyn maner assaut within prouyded thynges necessary vii yere though refresshyng without ofte tymes wolde come bastydes scrimysshe durynge siege many feates armes done dyuers hurt bothe te fortuned scrimysshe geffray tete noyre hym selfe auau sed forwarde striken bassenet heed quarell fayne kepe bedde wherwt company sore displeased season lay scrimysshig hurt ben well kept might sone haue ben hole kept hym selfe yuell specially fro lechery whiche derely bought cost hym lyfe died knewe well remedy dethe playnly shewed hym reason yuell rule ieody dethe hed apostumed wherfore counsayled declare wyll make hym redy god ward tha made testament first caused come hym soueraygne companyons garyson suche best expert armes sate vp bedde sayd sir derely beloued companyons knowe well great daunger dethe haue long season ben toguyder kepte good company haue ben maister true capitayne power wherfore wolde gladly lyfe dayes se ye hadde another capitayne trewly shulde acquyte hym kepe fortresse shall leaue well prouyded euery thynge necessary parteyning castell warre bothe wyne vitaylles artyllary thynges requysyte wherfore demaunde generall ye aduysed capitayne capitayns metely chosen gouerne castell men warre aduenturers ought suche hath ben alwayes warre haue vsed haue made warre moche vnder shadowe kyng englandes quarell haue alwayes desyrous somwhat gotton alwayes companyons adueturers ought suche desyre feates armes aduenture selfe fronters good countrey frutefull great profyte goton therin thoughe frenche men nowe besiege v wyll nat endure alwayes siege bastydes wyll breke one day sir answere demaunde haue ye chosen capitayne amonge companyons stode styll gaue none aunswere whan sawe spake nat beganne speke agayne swete wordes sayd sir thynke surely demaunde ye haue thought lytell wherfore sir haue layne bedde haue thought deuysed sir quod beleue well shalbe agreable v cometh rather v sir shewe v please sir quod shall declare name hym meane phowe geffray teate noyre dyde chose capitayne ouer company howe made testament dyed howe duke guerles departed fro countre go pruce incydence fell lande duke stulpe taken prisosoner discofyted cap c lii fayre sir quod geffray knowe well ye haue alwayes serued honoured men ought serue soueraygne capitayne shall ye gladder ye wyll agre haue capitayne one discended bloode beholde aleyne rour cosyn peter brother men armes blode make aleyne youre capitayne swere hym faythe obeysaunce loue loyalte presence also brother howe wyll aleyne haue souerayne charge sir quod well content ye haue ryght well chosen companyons made theym seruyaunt aleyne roux peter brother whan done geffraye spake agayne sayde nowe sir ye haue obeyed pleasure canne great thanke wherfore sir wyll ye haue parte ye haue holpen conquere saye vnto yonder chest ye se stande yonder therin xxx thousande frankes wyll gyue accordynge conscyence wyll ye content fulfyll testament howe saye ye sir quod right well contente fulfyll commaundement thane firste quod wyll gyue chapell saynt george castell reparacious therof thousande fyue hundred frankes gyue louer hath truely serued two thousade fyue hundred frankes also gyue aleyne roux newe capitayne foure thousande frankes also varlettes chambre gyue fyue hudred frankes myne offycers gyue thousande fyue hundred frankes rest gyue bequeth shall shewe ye vpon thyrtie companyons one sorte ye ought bretherne one alyaunce withoute debate ryotte stryfe amonge haue shewed ye shall fynde yonder cheste wyll ye departe resydue equally truely bitwene thyr tie ye nat thus contente deuyll wyll set debate bytwene beholde yonder stronge axe breke vp coffer gette wordes euery man answered said sir dere maister shalbe one accorde sir haue moche loued douted ye wyll breke cofer breke poynt ye haue ordayned commaunded thus geffray teate noyre made testament lyued nat past two dayes buryed ye chapell saint george within castell wyll accomplysshed xxx thousande frankes deuyded ordayned aleyne roux peter roux brother capytayns castell vachadore season ye siege styll endured fewe scrimysshes made howbeit whan dethe geffray teate noyre knowen auuergne lymosyn knyghtes squyers ryght ioyfull therof douted lesse dyde geffray tyme sore douted good sage capitayne expert warre nowe lette v retourne duke guerles shewe fell hym season bycause haue spoken hym meanes frenche kyng vncles brother noble fraunce came entre countrey guerles kyng deted then duke hauyng great domage whan duke guerles sawe warre departed apeased duches brabant enemyes reason composicion made rendre vp towne graue vpon certayne poyntes artycles ordayned bytwene ye duke burgone duches brabant duke guerles thought tent employ season go pruce made hym redy gate hym company knyghtes squyers owne countrey place vtas saynt martyn rode forthe throughe almaygne euery place passed good chere longe rode came lande pruce knowe nat insydence certayne men layde wayte hym feldes set ware ouerthewe hym men lost horse armure vessell golde syluer ledde prisoner towne sware faythe trouthe paye ransomes specially ye duke guerles became prisoner made promyse pay ransome squyer called arnolde surname knowe nat ye duke men ledde stronge towne lande duke stulpe whether ye duke nat nat enformed therof whan great maysters pruce herde howe duke guerles taken commyng countre sore displeased therwith sayd howe mater shulde nat rest case suffr shulde greatly blame tha reysed vp men departed fro conysbredge came great strength men towardes towne castell duke guerles prison whan squyer taken duke enfourmed comyng great mayster pruce suche puyssaunce doughted greatly determyned nat abyde comyng castell thought departe departure came duke guerles sayd hym sir duke ye prisoner mayster ye getylman true knight ye haue sworne gyuen faithe soeuer go wyll go ye ought folowe nat tell ye haue sente great mayster pruce nat cometh hyder great puyssauce thynke nat abyde hym tary ye lyst wyll cary faythe promyse duke wordes gaue none answere squyer toke horse departed wente place stronge ynoughe detyng sayde agayne duke sir ye shall fynde suche place named hym stronge castell oute hyghe wayes whan gone great mayster pruce came duke guerles none lette hym delyuered duke prison hadde founde squyer surely slayne great mayster pruce retourned connysbredge duke guerles hym shall shewe fell busynesse true great brute ran dyuers countreis specially almaygne takyng duke guerles euery man herde hadde great marueile therof thus whan duke guerles come connisbredge delyuered ye haue herde remembred hymselfe howe bounde faythe squyer tooke hym remembred wordes squier spake detyng thought hym selfe wyse wolde breke promyse truely acquyte faythe sayd great maister pruce wolde lengar tary go squyer faythe determyned thynge great mayster coulde saye nouther dispensacyon absolucyon thyng coude nat cause duke absteyne wolde nedes go ye town squyer whoe called maister euery man herde therof reputed great valyauntnesse whan came knowledge frendes kynsmen treated delyueraunce delyuered helpe meanes duke stulpe toke great payne mater howe duke stulpe cosented duke guerles shulde delyuered daunger lande wolde wyse duke guerles shulde swere scale heyres neuer daye none man hym shulde take geaunce mater waye dissymulacion otherwyse thus fayne departed aduenture duke guerles yere pnowe let v retourne sir iohan vyen admyrall fraunce shewe dyde sayd kyng castyle freche kynges behalfe phowe sir iohan vyen dyd message kynge iohan castyle fro frenche kynge counsayle answere kynge castyle made cap cliii admyrall frauce spedde iourneys entred castyle demaunded fynde kynge shewed hym howe burgus rode thyder alyghted lodgynge refresshed hym made hym redy go kynges palays receyued maner countrey right honorably loue honoure frenche kyng brought kynges chambre kyng receyued hym ioyfully delyuered kynge letter kyng reed called cou sayle parte whan ceyued letter credence admyrall called forthe comaunded declare entent comynge redy sayd fayre language sir kyng ye cousayle frenche kyng hath sente bycause come knowledge howe ye shall marry sonne duke lancaster doughter sir ye knowe well ye kyng maysters aduersary kyng cousayle haue great marueyle howe ye may entende treatie worlde maryage without knowledge saye true maryage chyldren nat withoute alyaunce amyte peace loue sir sendeth worde ye well aduysed ye haue done mynded yt wyse preiudiciall kyng ye realme fraunce therby breke boundes alyaunces hath ben sworne sealed bytwene kyng henry father ye prelate noble cyties realme noble kyng realme fraunce regarde well wise broken one openly knowen ye ryn church sentence excommunycate payne vnpardonable also indygnacion kynge noble fraunce besyde haue great enemyes sir comaundement kyng counsayle haue shewe whan ye kyng castyle parte cou sayle suche herde frech kynges ambassadour speke quickely abasshed eche loked none gaue answere satte styll laste busshoppe spake sayde sir iohan ye newly come partes kyng saye howe ye right hertely welcome kyng hath well herde vnderstade ye haue sayd ye shall haue shortely aunswere within day two suche shall cotente suffycient quod sir iohan vyen tooke leaue kynge counsayle wente lodgynge shewed howe taryed seuen dayes without hauynge answere sawe nothynge dyssymulacion wherwith sore dyspleased tyme coulde nat se kyng kept hym close chambre whan syr iohan vien sawe coulde haue none exployte busynes spake daye kynges counsayle sayd syrs surely wyll departe without aunswere douted leste wolde sayd surely done nat called hym day made aunswere dyd sayd hym howe might well shewe frenche kynge suche sent hym thyder shulde haue kinge castyle counsayle maner suspecte nat done wolde nat thynge kynge englande shulde breke adnychilate maner wayes alyaunces hath sworne sealed bytwene fraunce castyle howe thoughe kynge castyle mary sonne doughter duke lacastre therby make fynall peace chalenge duke maketh realme castyle ryght wyfe generally realme counsayleth kynge though assent wyll yet frenche kyng counsayle ought nat dyspleased alwayes kyng castyle men wyll conioyned alyed french kynge realme fraunce substaunce answere sir iohan vien brought frauce fro knig castyle proceded sorthe duke lancastre maryage made amyable peace togyther meanes messenger wente bytwene duke laye marchesse burdeaulx came thyder fro bayon duches doughter receyued great ioye greatly desyred fro burdeaux wente lyborne whan trewe certayne tydynges come erle foiz house howe kynge castyle agreed duke lancastre shulde mary sonne duke doughter gyue great landes castyle greate nombre floreyns two hundred thousande noble wherof erle great marueyle knowe well syr iohan froysart tyme erle foiz sayd ah kynge castyle vnhappy hath made peace deed man knowe well duke lancastre case suche daunger nat helpe hym selfe kynge castyle hathe mette sage valyaunte prince duke lancastre hath valyauntly borne hym selfe warre season nowe lette v somwhat speke army see aboute feest crystmas erle arundell ben longe season see costynge fronters bretaygne rochell xaynton normandy passed karenten fore tooke lande chirbroke wolde haue done dedes armes ye season souerayne capytayns towne garyson karentyne lorde hambre lorde coucy great nombre knyghtes squyers normady whan erle arundell knewe howe towne karentyne well prouyded furnysshed good men warre passed forthe sawe well assautinge therof myght rather lese wyn came nother towne therby called toraguy assayled toke perforce pylled wanne great rychesse toke theym many prisoner came good towne bayeux came barryers made skrymysshe none assaute englysshmen passed watch saynte clemente dyd great domage countrey taryed fyftene dayes man encountred marshall blann uille normandy knewe nat comynge wolde haue prouyded mater whan englysshe men done enterprise done great domage countrey normandy asmoche hudred thousande frankes came vnto drewe backe passed agayne watch retourned chyrbroke dyd put conquest suretye sauegarde shyppes whan wynde wether shyppes charged entred dysancred toke see retourned englande aryued hampton thus army erle arundell see concluded season phowe syr loys xancere wente se erle foize ortays howe duke lancastre burdeaux dedes armes done bytwene fyue frenchman fyue englysshe men howe duches lancastre wente doughter castyle kynge iohan cap cliiii seaso sir loys xancer marshall frauce languedoc march tholouse carcassone knewe well treatye made bytwene duke berrey therle foiz maryage duke bowlonges doughter whome duke berrey wolde haue though damosell right yonge marshall affection go se erle foyz enfourmed men ortays whan came thyder founde came sendynge frenche kynge shall shewe wherfore frenche kyng tha yonge desyre trauayle neuer ben languedoc whiche great countrey full cyties townes casteles nygh dystroyed wasted duke berry counsayle gouernauce countrey greatly enpouerysshed pylled countrey tayles great oppressyons complayntes wherof came kynges eares reason newly entred domynacion realme kynge sayde wolde go languedoc vysite countrey also go se pope whome neuer sene also voyage sayd wolde se erle foiz whome herde moche honour large spoke thus marshall went forthe waye departed fro cytie tholous fyue hundred horse rode longe yt came tarbe bygore fro thence morloys bierne erle foiz signyfied comyng ioyfull comaunded offycers towne ortays shulde well aparelled receyue sayd marshal comynge pleased hym ryght well lodgynges men made redy erle rode feldes mete hym mothan thre hundred horse receyued hym good chere ortays syre dayes marshall sayd erle howe frenche kynge great affection se countrey languedoc se hym erle aunswered sayd syr kynge shall ryght welcome gladde wolde se hym yea sir quod marshall kynges entension comyng playnely knowe whether ye wyll holde frenche englissh alwayes ye haue dissymuled warre ye wolde neuer arme desyre sir quod erle thanke ye haue shewed somoche syr though wolde neuer arme take parte hath good cause warre bytwene englande frauce haue nothynge therwith holde countrey bierne man good sworde haue put selfe seruytude dyspleasure one kynge yet knowe well myne aduersaryes armynake haue done bring indyngnacion bothe partyes prince wale wente spayne informacyon erle armynake prince wolde haue made warre sore moued therto done sir iohan chandos nat broken purpose thanke god alwayes haue borne selfe mekely curteyssy coulde shall longe lyue whan deed let mater go wyll thus erle foyze marshall passed tyme togyder departure erle gaue hym fayre courser fayre mule nother good horse thre togyther rychely sadylled aparelled gaue syr roberte challus syr rycharde dolphyn eche two hudred frankes fyue squyers eche fifty frankes marshall toke leaue departe tholous syr iohan froysart tyme wolde haue departed fro ortays hym erle foyze wolde nat suffre sayd shulde nat departe behoued byde pleasure sir loys departed fro ortays rode tarbe lorde dolphyn bygore conueyed sir peter calestan one erle foiz knyghtes aboute season burdeaux dede armes done duke lancastre fyue englisshmen owne house fyue frenche menne theym marshall fraunce house fyrst ser pecton dallagnie gascone englyssh agaynst sir more mannigmente frenche seconde bytwene sir aragon raymon englysshe agaynst bastarde chauigny frenche thyrde bytwene loys malapus capytayne agremortes frenche agaynst iaquemyn corne de cerfe englysshe fourthe bytwene archambalte de villyers frenche sonne lorde chaumonte gascone englysshe fyfte willyam foucalt frenche brother lorde chaumont englysshe se armes acomplysshed dyuers knyghtes squiers bierne therle foiz house toke way towarde burdeaux wente company bytwene ortars burdeaux xxiiii myle sawe sayde armes done saynte andrew presence duke lancastre duches doughter ladyes damosel coutrey knightes nat armed one euery man hym selfe felowe aparte armes thre course speare thre stroke sworde thre thre dagger horsehacke dyd thre dayes none tenne hurte sir raymon slewe bastardes horse wherwith duke lancastre sore dysplesed blamed greatly knight bicause bare staffe lowe duke gaue bastarde one horse whan accomplysshed euery man deted owne house one duchesse lancastre ordayned goo castyle leade katheryne doughter shulde haue maryage kynge castyls sonne duchesse entente fyrste wolde entre castyle go mantuell somtyme ye batayle bytwene kynge peter father agaynste kynge henry castyle sir bertram clesquyn purposed make iuste enquiry kynge father lay buryed dygge vp bone haue cytie cyuill bury theym agayne rychly appertayned kynge begynnynge marche whanne sonne beganne mount dayes encrease duches lancastre redy doughter departed fro burdeaux went bayon duke lancastre toke leaue retourned burdeaux ladyes rode forthe dape well receyued cyte dape vnder obeysaunce kynge englande rested two dayes passed throughe countrey basquence passed passe rouceualx entred nauerre came panpilona founde kyng nauer quene receyued duchesse honourably quene nauer suster kynge castyle duches doughter monethe passynge throughe realme nauer taryed kynge quene certayne space costes charge borne payed entred spaygne entre realme founde kynge castyls seruauntes redy receyue theym acordynge commaunded yonge prince called prince galyce phowe duches lancastre departed fro kynge castyle wente mantuell brynge father bone ciuyll howe frenche kynge sent ambassadours erle foize treate maryage duke berrey vncle doughter erle boloyne cap clv whan matter renewed maryage confyrmed duchesse lancastre lefte doughter king yonge husbande shulde mary age eight yeres duches toke leaue ye kynge go mantuell kyng sent greatest men courte company thus came mantuell dyd moche knewe trouth father buryed dygged vp bone wasshed bawmed wrapped leade brought cytie ciuyll receyued processyon without cytie bone brought cathedrall churche reuerently soleply obsequy done king iohan yonge sonne prince galyce parte prelate baron realme obsequy doone euery man retourned owne place kynge castyle wente vale sory sone yonge wyfe hym duchesse lancastre medena de campo good towne wherof lady reason confyrmacyon peace lay season p nowe lette v leaue speke castyle tyll nother tyme let v speke maryage duke berrey also insydentes folowed duke berrey maryed lady iane armynake first wyfe dysseased hadde great imagynacyon maryed agayne well shewed whan sawe howe myssed duke lancastres doughter set clerkes write sent messangers therle gascon foiz kepyng erle boulonges doughter space nyne yeres bycause duke berrey coulde nat come maryage daunger erle foize nother pope father mother frende damosell erle wolde nothynge without owne pleasure duke berrey desyred effectuously frech kynge nephue duke burgoyne brother helpe assyst hym maryage frenche kyng laught good sporte duke berrey vncle bycause olde hote loue said fayre vncle shall ye yonge mayde nat twelue yere age ye xl faythe great foly thynke therof speke cosyn iohan sonne yonge mater mete hym syr quod duke haue speken redy sonne erle foize wyll wyse agree therto bycause sonne blode armynake warre togyder haue ben longe lady yonge shall spare thre four yere tyll parfyte woman well fayre vncle quod kyng feare wyll nat spare longe seynge ye haue great affection therto shall ayde moche may nat longe kynge ordayned lorde de la ryuer syr bureau souerayne chamberlayne go yt voyage erle foiz erle dassy duke burgoyne ordeyned go thyder halfe bysshop anthune sir gylliam tremoyle duke berrey desyred iohan erle sanxer sage valyaunt knyght go fyue lordes apoynted go erle foize desyre haue yonge lady maryage duke berrey lordes departed apoynted mete togyder auignon pope clement candelmas departed toke waye nysmes auignon passed mounte pellyer rode small iourneys great exspence passed besyers came carcassone founde sir loys xancere marshall fraunce receyued good shewed theym moche erle foiz estate ben within two monthes departed fro carcassone wente tholous rested sente messangers erle foiz ortays byerne began treate maryage farre begynnynge erle foyze colde bycause duke lancastre sente hym haue lady sonne lorde henry erle derby reason longe taryenge delayeng treatye said noysed maryage shulde nat aunsweres fro erle foize wickely sente worde therof duke berrey nonnecte auuergne duke none desyre bringe mater aboute wrote often tymes agayne fresshe messangers desyrynge nat cease tyll brought mater passe erle foyze sage subtyle sawe well ardent desyre duke berrey hoter colder handeled matter wysely full agrement partyes yet sore desyred therto hadde thyrty thousande frankes charge ladyes expense suche yeres hym demauded shulde haue dyd haue thanke duke berrey shulde perceyue done hym whan mater concluded partyes agreed thanne erle foiz sente cosyn lady morleaus accompanyed fyue hundred speares whome capytayns syr espaigne du lynn syr raynolde guyllam syr peter calestan sir adam cacasse sir manalte nonnables sir pier kees feldes lady delyuered frenche ambassadours behalfe duke berrey syr loys xancere fyue hundred speares company receyued lady tooke leaues departed foize retourned frenche men ledde forthe lady duke berrey sente chares chareottes rychely garnysshed horse hackeneys aparell body heed fresshe ryche though frenche quene thus rode forthe sir iohan froysart auctor boke rode company often tymes whan wolde haue taken leaue erle foiz wolde saye howe dede make great haste badde whan wolde retourne go good company retourned sayde company yonge duchesse berrey wyll name fro hence forthe company rode longe came nere auignon rested towne called vile neufe without towne auignon house pope nexte daye aboute nyne clocke cardynals tyme mette passed bridge rosue grete estate lady rydynge whyte palfrey whiche pope sent came pope palays auignon alighted went se pope sate cosystory chayre pontyficall pope kyst mouth bycause lygnage duchesse company wente dyner many cardynalles house cardynall thuryn nere pope palyce wednysdaye nexte daye dyned house agayne may well saye comyng lady auignon cost pope tenne thousande frankes fridaye supped palays tooke leaue pope saturday departed rode dyner orange lay night cosyn germayne princesse therof sonday departed caryage passed valance vien lyon sur le rone rested two dayes fro then bres e entred countie forestes passed countrey came la palesse burbonois quissy hanche ryon auuergne rested two dayes duke berrey came thyder came thyder whytsoneuyn whytsonday betymes maryed lady noble weddynge gret feest erle boloyne erle estampes erle dolphyn auuergne feest iustes endured foure dayes sir iohan froysart auctor boke sawe myne eyen presente phowe certayne wyse men treated peace endure thre yeres bytwene fraunce englande alyes aswell one parte lande see cap clvi ye haue herde howe treuse taken bytwene partyes garysons bytwene ryuer loyr ryuer dordone geronde vnto feest saynt iohan baptyst couted yere grace thousand thre hundred fourscore nyne treuse dutynge great men sage bothe partyes bothe englande fraunce busyed themselfe treate peace endure thre yeres water lande entensyon ye treated mater comprise treatye frenche party suche besyed warre first haue comprysed realme castyle holy well lande water lyke maner realme scotlande englysshe partye shulde comprised alyes kynge realme portugale dyuers barones hygh gascon entreatours moche payne trauayle came entente scottes wolde wyse cosent whanne worde therof came kynge roberte scotlande fro frenche kynge owne persone wolde lyghtly haue greed therto desyred warre daye called hym barones prelate scotlande suche ought gyue counsayle mater without knowlege kynge wolde nothyng done wolde nat haue kepte openly redde presence letter frenche kynge sente thyder kynge realme scotlande entente wherof frenche kyng wolde haue scotland comprised agre treuse thre yeres lande water bytwene englande theym tydynges harde sayde frenche kynge canne nothynge haue treuce whan tyme make warre haue yere ouercome englysshmen season ryght good lykely shall ouercome agayne seconde tyme yea thyrde also great debatynge matter bytwene wyse wolde consente therto fynally acorded sende bysshoppe thre knyghtes fraunce kynge counsayle entent breke treaty shewe good wyll scottes warre bysshoppe saynt andrew syr archambalte duglas syr willyam lymsey syr iohan saynt clere departed soone myght toke see arryued sluse rode parys kyng counsayle shewed letter credence sente name barones prelate realme scotlade well herde frenche men percyued well great affection hadde procede contyne warre agaynste englande howe treatye farre past promysed coulde nat reuoked agayne scottes swetely answered howe remedy muste nedes procede peace thus frenche men tooke treuse meanes suche treated mater dyuers metynges bytwene partyes balingham bytwene boloyne calays often mette debated mater treuce taken gyuen acorded bytwene englande fraunce suche treater mater prelate gret lordes wysemenne bothe realmes adherentes alyes see lande endure fermely without dissymulacyon shadowe male engyn space thre yeres entreatours frenche partye boloyne bysshoppe bayeur erle valery saynt pole sir willyam melyn sir nycholas bracque sir iohan le mercier calays englysshe parte bysshop durham sir willyam montague erle salisbury sir wyllyam beauchampe capitayne calais iohan lauon nycholas gaberthe richarde roell clerke doctor lawe mette togyder myddes waye bytwene calays boloyne place called balyngham tyme great brute fraunce place great feest iustes yonge kyng charles wolde make parys fyrst entryng isabell ye freche quene agaynst whiche feest knightes squyers ladyes damoselles apparelled tryumphe whiche feest shall speke charter peace engrosed sealed bytwene party ye shall knowe whan sir iohan froyssarte authour hystorie departed fro ortays fro erle foiz ye haue herde wente copany lorde de la ryuer lorde guyllyam tremoyle brought yonge duchesse berrey doughter erle boulonge ye duke berrey wedded towne ryon auuergne conteyned hystorie mater present wherfore maye well speke therof whan came parys foude gentyll lorde coucy good lorde myne newly maryed yonge lady doughter duke lorayne whiche lorde made good chere demaunded newes countrey foiz biern pope clement beyng auygnon maryage bytwene berrey boulonge another great frende myne good lorde mayster therle beraunt dolphyn auuergne demaudes answered knewe content desyred go hym cambresys castell kynge gyuen hym called creue cure two leages fro cabrey nyne leages fro valensenes rode co pany rode way shewed howe bysshoppe bayeux erle saynt pole boloyn sent thyder freche kyng coclude truce howe kyng richarde kynge englade calys bysshop durham therle salisbury wt howe space thanne moneth abydynge ambassadours scotlande newly come thyder sayde howe cosyn erle saynt pole writen hym therof howe frenche kynge sente kynge scottes counsayle shulde agree truce englysshe men wolde consente peace without scottes comprised thus rode tyll came creue cure hym thre dayes tha toke leaue hym went valencennes taryed fyftene dayes wente holande se gentyll lorde good mayster myne erle bloyes founde hym estochoucke made good chere demaunded tidynges shewed suche knewe taryed hym moneth gede retourned fraunce knowe trouthe coclusion taken bytwene englande fraunce balyngham also purposed feest shulde parys entre frenche quene knowe trouthe mater retourned throughe brabaunt came parys eyght dayes feest began fell company lordes fraunce scotlande suche ben makynge truce bytwene engla de fraunce fell acqueyntauce sir guyllyam melyn shewed hole mater howe erle saynt pole passed englande se kynge rycharde confyrme truce graunted thre yeres shulde retourne agayne said gret feest demauded said sir guillyam lordes scotlande sayd treatie demanuded bycause youthe ben scotlande serched realme wylde scottes taried space yt court kyng dauyd scotlande acqueyntauce parte ye lordes knightes scotlade therfore demauded sir melyn answered saide howe ben bysshop bredon sir iames sir dauyd lymsay sir water saynt clere bare sayeng awaye dyde putte writynge hadde sene herde shall shewe trouthe sawe knewe feest fyrst entryng quene sabell parys pof ordynaunce entre quene isabell towne parys cap clvii sonday twetie daye iune yere oure lorde god thousande thre hundred foure score nyne people paris suche nombre marueyle beholde sondaye mornyng asseble made churche saynte denyce noble ladyes fraunce suche shulde accompany quene suche lordes shulde assyst quenes lytters ladyes burgess parys twelue hundred horsebacke raynged feldes bothe sydes way aparelled gownes one sute clothe baudkyn grene crymosyn olde quene iane doughter duchesse orlyance entred fyrste parys one houre noone lytter couered well companyed lordes passed hyghe strete saynte denyce rode palays taryed kynge day two ladyes went ye frenche quene ladyes set forwarde duchesse berrey duchesse burgoyne duches thourayn duches bare countesse neuers lady coucy ladyes damoselles good ordre lytters aparelled richly myghte ye duches thourayne lytter rode lone vpon fayre pal frey rychly aparelled rode one syde quenes lytter assysted duke thourayne duke burbone fore heed bothe sydes myddes bothe sydes lytter duke berry duke burgoyne fete lorde peter nauer therle ostrenaunt quenes lytter richely apparelled discouert nexte folowed ryche apparelled palfrey duchesse berrey assisted erle de la marche erle neuers rydinge softe pace bytwene bothe thane folowed lytter discouered open duchesse burgoyne margarete heynalte doughter coutesse neuers lytter assysted lorde henry bare yonge erle namure called sir guylliam ye lady orlyaunce palfrey richely apparelled lorde iames burbone lorde philyppe dartoys assysted lady orlyaunce another lytter duchesse bare doughter lorde coucy ladyes damoselles came chariottes palfrayes knightes folowed cion made sergeauntes offycers armes busynesse ynoughe make way breke preace suche people stretes semed worlde ben fyrst gate saynt denice entryng parys heuyn made full sterres within yonge chyldren apparelled lyke angelles swetely syngynge amonge ymage lady holdyng fygure lytell chylde playeng hym selfe lytell myll made great nutte heuyn hyghe richely apparelled armes fraunce baner sonne shynyng golde castyng rayes deuysed kynge feest iustes quene ladyes passed vnder ye gate great pleasure beholde passed whan quene ladyes paste came softe pace fou tayne strete saynt denice whiche condyte couered ouer clothe fyne asure paynted full floure de lyces golde pyllers serte full armes dyuers noble lordes fraunce foutayn issued great stremes punent clarre fou tayne yonge maydens richely apparelled ryche chapelettes heedes synginge melodiously great pleasure helde handes cuppes goblettes golde offryng gyueng drinke suche passed quene rested regarded great pleasure deuyse dyde ladyes damoselles sawe vnder mynster trinyte strete stage thervpon castell longe stage ordeyned passe kynge salhadyn dedes personage christen men one parte sarazins parte personage lordes name olde tyme hadde ben armed done feates armes ye passe salhadyne armed suche armure vsed thanne lytell aboue personage frenche kynge twelue peeres fraunce armed blason armes whan frenche quenes lytter come stage rested season thanne personage stage kyng rycharde departed fro company wente frenche kynge demaunded lycence go assayle sarazins ye kyng gaue hym leaue kynge rycharde retourned twelue companyons thane sette order incontynent wente assayled kynge salhadyne sarazins sporte semed great bataile endured good space pagiaunt well regarded thane quene passed forthe came ye secode gate saynt denyce castell ordayned fyrste gate heuyn clouded full sterres richely deuysed therin fygure god lyttynge maiestie father sonne holygoost within heuyn chyldren fygure angelles swetely syngyng whiche pagiaunt greatly praysed quenes lytter passed vnder gate paradise two angelles came came downe holdynge handes ryche crowne golde garnysshed precious stone sette fayre easely crowne ye quenes heed synging right swetely verse dame ye enclosed bytwene floure de lyces ye quene realme fraunce drewe agayne paradyse passed forthe came chapell saynt iames scaffolde richely deuysed right hande quene rode couered ouer ryche arras drawen aboute curteyns maner chambre within playeng vpon orgas ryght swetely strete saynt denyce couered ouer clothes sylke chamlet suche plentie thoughe suche clothes shulde cost nothynge sir iohan froissart authour hystorie present sawe great marueyle suche nombre clothes sylke goten great plentie though ben alysandre dama house bothe side great strete saynt denice vnto bridge parys hanged clothes arras dyuers history whiche pleasure beholde thus passed forthe soft pace came gate chatelet parys quene rested se goodly deuyses ordayned gate chatelet parys castell made woode tymbre strogly made shuld haue endured xl yeres whiche castell enbatylled euery lope man armes armed peces ye castell bedde made richely encourteyned apparelled haue stande kynges chambre bedde called ye bedde iustyce bedde lay figure saynt anne castell playne castell coteyned gret space playne full tree full hare cone byrdes flewe whan brode flewe thider agayne feare ye people tree issued whyte harte wente bedde iustyce parte wode issued lyon egle properlye fresshely approched harte bedde iustyce came tree xii yonge maydens richely apparelled chapelettes golde heedes holdynge naked swordes hades wente bytwene harte lyon egle shewed selfe redy defende harte bedde iustyce deuyse ye quene great pleasure regarde passed forthe came bridge parys whiche couered richely besene couerynge grene crimosyn full sterres stretes hanged ladyes churche tyme quene ladyes paste bridge approched churche oure lady late waye wente rode softe pace quene lady entred churche lady foude waye playes pastymes greatly pleasure amonge mayster came geane tied corde hyghest house bridge saynt myghell ouer ye house ende tyed hyghest towre lady churche ye quene passed great strete called ladyes strete bycause late sayde mayster two brinnynge candelles handes issued lytell stage made hyght ladyes towre syngyng went vpon corde longe great strete sawe hym hadde marueyle howe myght bare styll hades ye two brinnynge cadelles myght well sene ouer parys two myle without parys suche tombler lyghtnesse greatlye praysed churche lady bysshoppe parys reuested armes lorde iesa christ colledge great bre clergy quene lyghted lytter takenne downe four duke saye duke berrey duke burgoyne ye duke thourayne duke burbone ladyes lykewise taken downe theym assysters bothe lytters fro horse good order entred churche bysshoppe clergy syngyng ye honour god blessed lady quene ledde assysted brought vp hyghe auter kneled downe sayde prayer suche pleased offred tresorie lady four clothes clothe golde goodly crowne angelles dyde set heed incontynent sir iohn de la ryuer sir iohan le mercyer delyuered bysshoppe parys rycher crowne bysshoppe four duke dyde sette quenes heed thane retourned agayne churche quene ladyes sette agayne lytters mo fyue hudred torch brinnyng late thus brought palays parys kynge olde quene duchesse orlyaunce doughter quene ladyes lyghted fro lytters eche theym brought seuerall chambres lordes went lodgynges daunsynge paste nexte daye monday kynge made dyner pali houre high masse quene ledde foresayd foure duke holy chapell masse season quene sacred anoynted quene ought archebysshoppe roane dyde obseruaunce called sir wyllyam vyar masse songe solempnely kynge quene retourned chabres lady suche chambres palays anone kyng quene retourned halle ladyes great table marble alwayes standeth styll halle made lengar great plaunche borde oke foure inch thycke whiche borde richelye couered aboue great table agaynste one pyllers kynges dressyng borde standynge full vessell golde syluer whiche greatly couered many sawe table longe discendyng downe barryers made wode thre alyes sergeauntes vsshers great nombre kepynge entree entente none shulde entre suche seruytours ye table ye hall full people man coulde nat tourne hym wt moche payne mynstrelles great nombre plesauntly played euery man facultie kyng prelate quene ladyes wasshed sate downe table kynges table sate downe chiefe bysshoppe noyan bysshoppe langers kynge kynge archebysshoppe rohan kynge satte surcote scarlette furred armyns ryche crowne golde heed quene kyng armyne duches berry duches burgoyne ye duches thourayne lady neuers good damosell bare lady coucy mary harecourt mo sate nat highe table sauynge beneth satte lady sailly wyfe sir guye tremoyle two table longe downe hall sate mo fyue hu dred ladyes damosel prease great great payne serue mess whiche great table haue nat make great cesse therof shall speke pastymes yt made bitwene mess whiche great pleasure kyng haue sene taryed hole dyner firste myddes palays castell made tymbre xl fote longe twentie fore brode foure towres euery quarter one one myddes hygher castell fygured cytie troye towre myddes palays ylion penos armes troyans kyng priamus hector sonne chyldren also armes suche kynges prince enclosed troye kynge priam castell went vpon wheles whiche myght tourned euery waye properly castell came assayle another sorte therby pauilyon whiche also wente vpon wheles softely couertly mouynge therof coude nat
