parceyued ye armes kynges grece suche siege also shyppe properlye deuysed wherin myght well hudred men armes moued crafte wheles bothe castell pauilyon ship pauilyon shyppe assayled euer castell within castell made great defence sporce endure nat longe preace people sore man coulde styrre people sore chafed heate putte moche payne table parlyament chambre dore satte many ladyes damoselles reason preace ouerthrowen erthe ladyes caused sodainly ryse without order sore chafed preace heate palays quene herselfe poynt haue sore displeased perforce backe doore broken vp gette fresshe ayre ladye coucy sore diseased whane kynge sawe mater commaunded cease table great hast taken vp let ladyes damoselles large lefte takynge wyne spyces wente chambres ladyes taryed styll palays wente towne lodgynges ease preace heate sore greued lady coucy wente lodgynge helde tyll late fyue clocke frenche quene accompanyed foresayd duchess departed fro palays parys toke lytters open wente throughe stretes kynges lodgynge called saynt polle ryuer sayne quene mo thousande horse kyng went fro palays ryuer sayne toke barge wente water house saynt polle ye house great large well amended yet ye kyng caused great court nere gate fro ryuer made great halle whiche couered ouer clothes armes normandy walles ha ged clothes arras sondrie hystories hall kynge gaue ladyes supper quene kepte chabre sene yt nyght lady kyng lordes daunsed reuelled nyght nerchande tyll daye mornyng euery person departed went lodgynges slepe good tyme nowe shall shewe gyftes presetes parys gaue tuesday noon ye quene duchesse thourayne newly come fraunce oute lombardy doughter duke myllayne yere wedded loyes duke thourayne named valentyne neuer ben parys therfore burgess parys gaue welcome tuesday aboute xii clocke xl burgess parys notablest person cytie one sute clothynge came kynges house saynt polle brought present quene stretes parys present lytter richely wrought borne bytwene two strong properly apparelled lyke two auncient sage persones lytter celler thynne fyue clothe sylke iewelles litter might well sene whan came saint polle first cae kynges chambre whiche redy apparelled receyue alwayes suche bringeth thyng welcome tha burgess sette downe lytter two trestels myddes chambre kneled downe kyng said right dere lorde noble kyng burgess parys presenteth grace iewelles lytter welcomyg grace gouernauce realme fraunce kyng sayd good men thake right goodly riche burgess rose drewe backe therwith toke leaue whan gone kynge sayd sir wyllyam lordes montague hym sir let v go nere lytter se presentes nerer kynge well regarded fyrst foure pottes golde sixe lauers golde sixe platte golde vessell wayed hudred fyftie marke golde lyke maner nother sorte burgess richely apparelled one lyuerey came quene presented another lytter whiche borne chambre shewynge howe good men parys dyde recomende grace sent present whiche present shippe golde two great flagos golde two dredge box golde two saltes golde sixe pottes golde sixe lauers golde xii lampes syluer two basons syluer thre hundred marke golde syluer present brought lytter bytwene two men one semblaunce beare semblaunce vnycorne thirde present lykewise brought duches thourayns chambre two men fygured fourme two blacke moore richely apparelled white towelles heedes lyke sarazins lytter fayre riche couered fyne clothe sylke brought xii burgess one apparell gaue present sayd duchesse whiche presente shippe golde great potte golde two ewer golde two great platte golde two saltes golde sixe pottes syluer two dosin saucer sylner two dosyn boule syluer golde syluer two hudred markes present greatly reioysed duches thourayne reason goodly riche curtesly thanked gyfte thus tuesdaye presentes gyuen kyng ye quene duchesse thourayne greatly consydred valeur presentes also puyssaunce parisyens shewed one sawe p sente cost parisiens threscore thousande crownes golde presentes delyuered tyme go dyner daye kynge quene ladyes dyned chambres ye soner haue done thre clocke dyner shulde drawe felde saynt katheryne ordayned stage scaffoldes great nombre kynge quene beholde iustes pnowe shall name order knyghtes called kynges knyghtes sonne golde thyrtie firste duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone erle de la marche sir iaquemarte burbone brother lorde guillyam namure sir olyuer clysson constable frauce syr iohan vien sir iames vien lorde espaigny syr guy tremoyle sir gillyam brother sir phylyp bare lorde rocheforde bretone lorde ray lorde beamond syr iohan barbencon hazle frauce lorde tourty norman syr iohan barres lorde nantoyllet lorde rochfouca lord garanciers sir iohan harpedante barone dinury syr willyam marcyell syr raynolde roye syr geffrey caryn syr charles changeet sir gylliam lignac knyghtes armed sheldes lyke sonne raye aboute thre clocke place saint kateryne thyder come ladyes damosel firste quene came thyder chare rychely aparelled ladyes good ordre entred scaffoldes ordeyned came frenche kyng redy apparelled iuste whiche pastyme loued ryght well well accompanyed iustes beganne many lordes dyuers countreys syr gyllyam heynalt erle ostrenant iusted ryght goodly dyd suche knyghtes came hym lorde gomminies sir iohan andregenes lorde cautan syr ausell transegynes sir clinquart hermo dyde well deuoyre prays ladyes also iusted well duke irelande seasone frenche kynge also iusted well knyght almayne besyde ryne called sir seruays mirando iustes well contynued many knightes one coulde nat rynne another duste rynnynge horse great troubled sore lorde coucy dyd maruelously well iustes contynued tyll nyght departed ladyes brought lodgynges kynge company brought lodgynge saynt pole supper ladyes suche haboundauce harde recorde feest reuell syngynge daunsyng tyll next mornynge sonne rysinge prise iustes aunswerers best done lengest contynued gyuen frenche kynge consente ladyes iudgement harauldes chalengers halze launders bastarde brother duchesse burgoyne knightes complayned dust said loste dedes reason therof kynge made prouysion ordeyned mo two hundred barrelles mater watred place wherby groude well amended yet nexte day hadde duste ynough moche wednysdaye came parys erle saynte pole frome oute englande made great haste come iustes feest lefte behynde englande sir iohan chatell morant bringe charter treuce hym erle saynte pole well welcomed kynge lordes quene glad comynge wednysdaye dyner euery man drew felde ladyes came thyder goodly aray done daye mounted vpon stage iustes began fyersly well contynued tyll nyght euery person retourned ladyes great supper saynte polle pry gyuen consente ladyes iudgement harauldes answerer prise gyuen squyer haynalte called iohan de flaron come thyder company therle ostrenant chalengers prise gyuen squyer duke burgoyns called iohan de pokerers agayne thursdaye iusted knightes squyers togyther euery man payned hym selfe well endured tyll nyght ladyes supped agayne saynt polle prise gyuen vtter partie sir charles armoyes within squyer quenes called lons frydaye kynge made dyner ladyes damoselles aboute ende dyner entred hall kyng sytting table duchesse berrey duchesse burgoyne duches thourayne coutes saynt polle lady coucy great meny ladyes damosel brought two knyghtes horsebacke armed peces iustes speares thyes one sir raynold roy sir bouciquant ye yonger two iusted goodly togyther came thyder knightes ser raynold troyes syr gyllyam namure syr charles armoyes lorde garancyers lorde nantoyllet lardenoys ostende dyuers iusted space two houres kynge ladyes returned lodgynges fryday suche ladyes damosel wolde retourne owne house toke leaues kynge quene also suche lordes wolde departe kynge quene thanked payne taken comynge feest phowe lorde chateau morante erle saynte polle lefte behynde hym englande retourned frauce charter treuce sealed kynge rycharde vncles endure thre yere see lande cap clviii lordes ladyes returned fro greate feest owne house lorde chastell morant whome lorde saynte polle left england retourned fraunce kynge counsayle shewed forth charter treuce sealed kynge rycharde englande vncles endure thre yere well see lande wordes charter sayd whosoeuer breketh maner codicion poynte artycle conteyned treatie shulde taken reputed traytours rynne mortall punysyon bycause lorde coucy souerayne capytayne chosen kinge counsayle defende kepe outwarde march bytwene ryuer durdone see countrey iuuergne lymosyn copy treatye delyuered hym entente shulde publysshe shewe wolde thynge contrary also entent vandachor chalusset dorbesidousac garysons ye made warre englysshe tytle shulde haue knowledge treuce shulde make none excuse fell payne lykewyse marshall frau ce lorde loys xancer also copy therof whiche ryght nedefull gouernour outwarde march languedoc fro ryuer ronne bridge amyngnon aboute countreys signory apendaut ryuer dordone coutreys beaucaire carcassone tholous rouergne dagen querca bygore pyergourte lymogines countreys dyuers garysons smally regarded obeyed peace truce alwayes entended make marre castell cullyer stronge castell londre bygore fronters byerne greatly feared neyghbours pthe maryage king loys sonne duke aniou doughter kynge peter aragone went quene napoles mother auignon se pope clemente cap clix tyme treatye made maryage bytwene loys aniowe sonne duke aniou wrote kynge napoles cycyll iherusalem erle prouynce doughter kyng peter arragon quene napoles went auygnone se pope clement founde lorde coucy company yonge sonne loys lorde coucy ryght ioyous co mynge quene receyued ryght honorably pope clement cardynalles well worthy noble woman dilygent busynesse desyred lorde coucye helpe conuey sonne loyes realme arragone tyll maryed lorde coucye wolde nat refuce ordayned hym selfe sayde dame vyage seuyn yere wolde gladder accomplisshe go march cicyll naples wich lorde sonne lycence kyng souerayne lorde sir quod lady thake se well good wyll doute nat kyng wyll content ye go sonne aragon quene arragon wyll glad se doughter hath maryed brother sir hery bare lorde coucy agreed go voyage thus younge kynge cicyll tooke iourney well accompanied whan taken leaue pope mother wepynge departynge mother sonne caused hertes relente shulde departe farre der knewe nat whan se togyder agayne ordayned whan maryage accomplysshed yonge kynge yonge quene shulde take see porte barcelone go arryue porte naples nere myght longe yonge kynge loyes iourneyed passed mountpellyer besyers came narbone receyued ioyfullye euery man refresshed horse one day departed wente parpygnen fyrst towne realme arragon comyng yonge kynge well knowen court kynge arragon sente menne mete hym conuey vycount ro uebertyn sir raymonde baighes long rode cae cytie barcelone kynge quene doughter yonge kyng nobl receyued specially quene arragon ryght ioyouse comynge lorde coucy thanked yonge kynge sonne shulde bringynge hym company sayd mater shulde atcheue better maryage confyrmed bytwene two chyldren bycause wynter approched delayed voyage goyng see wynter great see perillous said wolde make prouisyon wynter go naples nexte marche lorde coucy beyng arragon receyued letter fro frenche kynge commaundynge hym retourne toke leaue kynge arragon quene yonge kyng wyfe lordes suche departed myght haue leysar wolde haue retourned auignon haue sene pope olde quene af naples sente excuse retourned auuergne fraunce whane maryage made bytwene yonge kyng loyes cycyll doughter kynge arragon wherby great alya ce bytwene party arragon bounde ayde serue yong kynge bringe hym realme naples nat leaue hym tyll realme pesably naples cicyll appendautes paule calabre cytie gaiet whiche margarete dura helde aragonoys shulde serue hym longe warre endured ii hundred speares coste charge thousande crosbowes thousande bregandiers whan swete tyme marche come wyndes apealed ye water swaged rage wodes reuerduced prouysions made redy barcelone galees redy suche shulde go yong kynge yonge quene tooke leaues kynge aragone quene wept departyng quene recomaunded yonge quene doughter erle roodes valyaunt knight sir raymon baighes two toke ye speciall charge natwithstadinge erle vrgell erle lyne great company galees fyftene hudred speares two thousande crosbowes two thousande men warre dartes pauesses wente thus fortifyed well acompanyed resyst better nede agaynst ennemyes also resyst rencouters vpon see longe waye see fro barcelone naples margarete dura aduersary myght trouble way therfore thought go surelye p nowe wyll leaue speke yonge kyng cicyll speke busynesse realme fraunce phowe frenche kynge desyre go visyte farre partes realme howe went fyrst burgoyne auygnon se pope clement cap clx great feest accomplisshed euery lorde lady gone home owne house ye haue herde fre che kyng sawe truce englande thre yere hadde ymaginacion go visite realme specially vtwarde marchesse languedocke lorde de la ryuer sir iohan mercier chefe preuy cousayle exhorted hym go auygnon se pope clement cardynalles desyred se hym also go tholous sayd kyng sir kyng youthe ought visyte realme knowe people lerne gouerned whiche shulde greatly profyte better beloued subiectes kyng lyghtly enclyned counsayle desyre traueyle se newe thynges ye lord de la ryuer newly come marchesse herde great complayntes people tholous carcassone beaucayre desired greatly se kyng ben sore charged tayles aydes ye duke berrey informacion seruaunt called betysache pytie man pylled people nothynge lefte therfore counsayled kynge go thyder prouyde remedy also kynge shulde sende erle foize come hym tholous kyng made redy go thyder sente afore way prouisyon shulde made comyng sente worde therof vncle duke burgoyne aute duchesse wolde come longe throughe countrey wolde se cosyns chyldren bring company brother duke thourayne vncle burbone whiche pleased greatly ye duke duchesse duke caused proclamed feest iustes holden dygnon knightes squiers burgoyne sauoy march adioyning requyred feest euery man ordred themselfe accordingly thus whyles kynges prouisyon makyng go auignon languedocke duke burgoyne parte made great prouisyon receyue kynge dyde euery man marchesse purposed ye feest dignon season mater fell fraunce ye haue herde howe duke irelande called erle oxenforde banysshed oute englande vncles kyng richarde speciallye duke gloucestre grettest dyspleasure hym saue hym selfe fledde hollande taryed small season towne dordregh fayne departe then duke aubert lorde towne holande denyed hym taryeng cou trey wolde nat kepe hym agaynst wyll cosyns germayns englande kynge englande written hym yet fayne departe go trecte fraunches towne maner people payeng take duke irelande ynoughe paye besyde brought threscore thousande frankes fraunce fro constable redempcion iohan bretayne come ye fre che kyng vnder saueconducte hym yere kyng made hym good chere bycause strauger howe trewe thoughe duke kyng yet ye lorde coucy hated hym herie good cause though duke affayres prouyded wytte honoure eloquence great largesse yet greatly trespassed agaynst lorde coucies doughter wyfe laufully spoused forsoke without tytell reason false yuell temptacyon disceyte disceyued toke another wyfe damosell quene englandes countrey boeme kyng ye quene englade synfully consented therto dispensed pope vrbane rome instaute desyre kynge quene englande synne greued greatly conscience duke irelande bycause lorde coucy counsayle frau ce well worthy done good seruyce well able cured moche meanes frendes sir olyuer clysson lorde de la ryuer sir iohan marcyer sayde duke irelande shulde departe fraunce go chose hymselfe another place abyde lyst nat realme frauce thyder shulde surely coueyed duke irelande sawe well howe dayly paryll meanes ye lorde coucy lygnage wherfore thought shulde beste hym go farre rather abyde nere aduised drawe brabant desyred kyng write duchesse brabant yt wolde pleace suffre hym pesably abyde cou trey kynge wrote aunte duchesse brabant condisceded kynges desyre duke irelande conducted men kynges louayne taryed somtyme went castell nat farre fro towne louaygne whiche borowed knyght brabant duke irelande archebysshop yorke lykewise banysshed englande one cause bysshoppe one neuelles englande countrey northuberlande puissaunt men bothe landes lynage taryed two lordes louayne herde saye longe lyued coude neuer come mercy peace ye kynge englandes vncles farther speke feest saynt mychell freche kyng departed fro house beautie besyde parys lefte quene toke waye troy champayne go burgoyne vncle duke burbone duke loyes thourayne lorde cou many lordes knyghtes company kynge rode longe came dignon duke burgoyne erle neuers sonne come chatelon ryuer sayne wha kyng come dignon duchesse burgoyne coutesse neuers doughter receyued kyng ioyfully lordes loue kyng welcomynge dygnon many ladyes damosel come thyder se hym lady sully lady vergy lady pagny dyuers fayre lady fresshe well apparelled began feestynge daunsynge carolynge ladyes enforsed themselfe daunce syng make ioye loue ye kyng ye duke thourayne duke burbone lorde coucy monday tuesday wednisday thre dayes ther goodly iustes price gyuen ye best doer kynge eight dayes ye towne dignon great triuphe sporte x daye toke leaue vncle duke burgoyne duchesse child thentent ye duke burgoyne shortely folowe kyng nephue go hym iourney kyng deted fro dignon whan taken leaue ladyes damoselles rode long iourneys came vile neufe besyde auignon house royall apparelled hym cardynals amyens aigreuell saint marcell chatell neufe mo xiii came mette kyng felde gladde kynges comyng duke berrey come auygnon lodged pope palais cae vyle neufe kynge laye lyuere arras called amontays way mountpellyer duke burgoyne arryued next day ye kyng came thyder water rone duke toke barge lyonsur le rone thus kynge four duke togyder determyned passe bridge auignon go se pope ix clocke mornyng kyng passed bridge acompanyed brother thre vncles xii cardynalles went pope palays pope clement redy chambre consystorie syttyng chayre papalyte whan frenche kyng came chambre sawe pope enclyned hym selfe whan came nere ye pope rose kyng kyst hande mouthe pope sate downe caused kyng syr downe hym place purposely prepared hym ye duke kyst pope hande sate downe amoge cardynals anone tyme dyner drewe pope great chambre table redy couered pope wa shed satte downe table alone kept estate frenche kyng satte downe another table alone cardynalles duke satte downe order dyner plentyfull dyner wyne spyces kyng ye four duke went chabres eche chambre apparelled palays taryed certayne dayes v day kyng came thyder ye yonge erle sauoy cosyn king nephue duke burbone came thyder kyng right ioyfull comyng frenche kynge duke thourayne brother erle sauoye lyght corage spyrite thoughe lodged pope palais nere pope cardynalles yet wolde nat absteyne daunce caroll make sporte amonge ladyes damoselles auignon erle genesne brother pope brought theym aquayntaunce ladyes damoselles towne kynge gaue great giftes ladyes damoselles wherby great laude prayse pope cardinal ryght ioyfull kynges beyng reason shulde without loue frenche kynge porte shulde haue ben small co sydred ought haue consydred kynge christned obedyent except loue fauoure alyaunce frenche kyng kynge spaygne kynge scottes obeyed pope clement kynge aragon newly determyned made quene yolande bare cosyn germayne frenche kynge elles nat done kynge aragon father hym neuter therfore pope cardynalles ought well feest frenche kyng seynge puyssaunce profyte lyued kepe estate came meanes frenche kyng thus kyng taryed certayne season great ioye sporte ioye kynges comynge thyder pope opyned grace clerkes beyng courte space moneth gaue nomynacions kyng coledges cathedral euery coledge two prebendes reuoked grace gyuen wolde kynges grace shulde cede dyd wherby many kynges clerkes promoted also pope gaue grace duke thourayne duke berrey duke burgoyne lorde coucy stopped ben graunted pope curtesse lyberall loue kynges comyng grauted euery thyng asked whan kynge ben certayne space pope shewed hym complaynt howe pope rome greatly hyndred ryght made moche trouble diffrence ye churche kynge herde hym well promysed pope clement returne agayne fraunce wolde entende none thynge bringe churche one accorde wordes pope greatly conforted kynge toke leaue retourned vyle neufe dyde brother vncles berrey burgoyne daye kynge made dyner cardynalles erle genesne brother pope dyner toke leaues kyng sayd nexte day wolde ryde towarde moutpellyer thanked reuerece done hym cardynalles retourned auygnon ordayned kynge shulde departe nexte daye brother duke burbone company dyd toke leaue vncles berey burgoyne sayde howe shulde retourne owne countreis shulde go hym tyme sayde wolde go tholous sende therle foiz come thyder vncles co tent therwith kyng suche counsayle hym duke berrey duke burgoyns voyces nat herde without small mater gouernyng laguedocke taken awaye fro duke berrey deuyded seneschaunces kynges profyte wherof countreis marchesse carcassone besyers narbone fonges bygore tholous greatly reioysed season sore oppressed tayles duke berrey reysed ye shall whan mater requyreth whan duke berey duke burgoyn sawe kyng wolde go moutpellyer visyte laguedoc wolde nat suffre go copany sore displeased therwt howbeit sagely disymuled mater sayde eche kyng gothe languedoc make sycyon gouerned make treatie wt therle foiz ye proudest erle lyueg neuer loued praysed neyghbour euer nouther frenche kyng englande spaygne arragon nauer kyng taketh counsayle mo ryuer mercier motague beghe villayns howe saye brother duke berrey duke burgoyne answered sayd kynge nephue yonge beleueth yonge counsayle shall disceyue hym surely conclusyon shall nat good ye shall se must behoue v suffre psente tyme tyme shall come suche cousaileth shall repent kynge also let hym go goddes name whider shall please hym let v retourne owne coutreis long holde guyder none shall v wronge two chefe membres fraunce thus two duke deuysed togyder frenche kyng departed nexte day toke waye nymes rode thyder dyner said two duke taryed styll pope thre dayes ye lorde coucy lykewise fourthe daye departed rode owne countreis kyng went fro nymes laye nyght lunell whan kyng deted fro lunell went dyner moutpellyer thre lytell myles receyued ye burgess ladyes damoselles towne greatly desyred se kynge many riche presentes gyuen hym moutpellyer puissaunt towne ryche full marchandise kynge praysed towne moche well consydred puissauce shewed kyng towne hadde ben moche richer thanne presente tyme duke aniou duke berrey eche tourne hadde greatlye pylled kyng sorie ye good people endured moche domage sayd wolde reforme countre better state shewed kynge pouertie towne nothyng shulde fynde forwarde towne selfe hath good meanes recouerauce reson marchandise yt vsed bothe lande see marchesse carcassone tholous therabout said two duke gouernaunce loke thyng puyssaunce laye handes nothyng left taken away ye shall fynde ye people poore suche wont riche puissaunt nowe scant able labour vynes landes great pyte se wyues chyldren haue euery yere fyue sixe tayles layde shulders rau somed thirde fourthe parte substaunce somtyme toguyder one tayle coude nat payde yt another redy ye necke therof ser well knowen two duke vncles ruled laguedocke haue leuyed ye countrey fro vyle neufe tholousyn rounde ryuer garon retournyng ryuer dordone xxx hundred thousande frankes specially sythe duke aniou departed duke berrey hath done domage founde playne countrey comontie good case duke aniou tooke ryche men wherwith paye duke berrey spared nother poore riche gadered specially one counsayle treasourer named betysache nacyon cytie besyers ye shall complayntes people wyll crye hym wordes kyng said god haue soule shall prouyde mater retourne shall punisshe trespasours shall make inquysycion seruantes nycers myne vncles suche ruled parcies languedocke suche haue deserued shalbe corrected kynge taryed mount pellyer space xii dayes order towne pastyme ladyes damoselles suche foude pleased hym greatly saye trouthe kynge tyme lusty youthe lyght quycke spyrite daunsed caroled amonge frysco ladyes damoselles ye towne somtyme nyght gaue made bankettes supper largely wolde gyue ladyes damosel rynges golde chaynes reputed worthy kynge dyde moche great laude prayse wolde taryed lengar dyd kepte reuell daunsyng solas euery day newe begyn p ye haue herde oftentymes said howe sporte lady damosel encorageth hertes yonge lusty gentylmen causeth desyre seke gette honour say bycause kyng thre gentylmen highe enterprice great valure well shewed ye shall fyrst yonge sir boucequant sir raynold roy thirde lorde saynt pye thre knyghtes chamberleyns kyng well beloued well worthy fresshe serued hym well armes mater thre beyng mountpellier among ladyes damosel toke armes next somer enformed ye pricipall cause enclyned therto shall shewe ye knowe well hath ben rehersed hystorie howe ye dayes kyng charles englysshe knyght called sir peter courtney valyaunt knight armes cae englande frauce paris demauded armes sir guy tremoyle presence kyng suche wolde se sir guy wolde nat refuce offre presence kyng lordes armed daye ran toguyder one course kyng wolde nat suffre ryn agayne toguyder wherwith theglyss knyght right yuell content shewed wolde haue furnysshed chalenge vttraunce apeased fayre word sayde hym done ynough ought content therwith kynge duke burgoyne gaue hym fayre gyftes presentes retourned agayne towardes calays lorde clary friscay lusty knyght charged conuey hym rode longe toguyder came lucynen countesse saynt poule laye suster kynge richarde englande lady ioyfull comynge thyder sir peter courtney hadde maryed fyrste cosyn lorde courtney dyed yonge maryed erle saynt poule englisshe men called madame courtney nat countesse saynt poule phowe sir peter courteney came fraunce armes sir guye tremoyle howe lorde clary coueyed hym occasyon dyde armes hym marchesse calais cap clxi thus sir peter courtney lorde clary lucenen arthoys coutesse saynt paule right ioyouse commynge deuysed many thynges countesse demaunded sir peter courtney thought state fraunce aunswered sayd certaynly madame state frau ce well goodly serued nat serued countrey sir quod lady lordes fraunce maner contente haue nat made good chere surely madame quod contenteth passynglye well case passed see haue easely acquyted therin madame wyll ye knowe lorde clary present hadde come englande desyred haue done armes man shulde nat haue departed hadde ben answered pleasure serued contrary trewe sir guye dela tremoyle armed felde eche agaynst ranne toguyder one course shewed fro kynge shulde sayenge howe hadde done ynough wherfore madame saye wyll say soeuer become coulde fynde none armes nat defaute knyghtes fraunce lorde clary noted well wordes helde pea great payne howe suffred hym bycause charge co ueyaunce hym countesse sayde sir ye departed right honorably fro frau ce whan ye obeyed kynges desyre ye coude sythe pleasure ye shulde nat comyng returnyng doyng ye haue done none laye faute suche shall syde see shall repute honour blame wherfore sir requyre contente therwith madame quod knight shall shall neuer take thought thus lefte mater fell talkynge taryed daye night nexte mornynge sir petr court nay toke leaue countesse saynt poule gaue hym departynge lytell chayne golde lorde clary another thus mornynge departed fro lucenen toke waye bouloygne came thyder laye nyght nexte daye rode towardes margyson go calais bitwene boloygne calays seuyn eight leages fayre playne waye whan came nere calais sir peter courtney sayd lorde clary sir nowe kyng englandes lande ye haue well acquyted conueyaunce company thanke lorde clary displeasure hert wordes sir peter spoken lucenen presens countesse saynt pole whiche wordes thought wolde nat suffre reste case reputed haute hyghe agaynst honoure chiualry fraunce vnderstode hym said howe come oute englande fraunce armes none wolde aunswere hym lorde clary leaue takynge sayde sir peter ye nowe kynge englandes lande sir haue conueyed hyder commaundement kynge maister duke burgoyne ye remembre well laste daye whan ye countesse saynt poules chambre made v good chere ye spake ouer largely thynketh great preiudyce blame knyghtes fraunce ye sayde howe ye came fro kynges courte coude fynde none armes ye whiche wordes maye vnderstande knyght fraunce dare armes iust thre course speare wherfore sir wyll ye knowe offre selfe thoughe one ye moost symplest knyghtes fraunce saye iustifye realme fraunce nat voyde knyghtes ye shall well fynde yuowe dedes armes sir ye lyste ye shall fynde redy aunswere incontynente nyght morowe saye nat hatered haue persone onely maynteyne honour tie wolde nat ye shulde retourne calais englande make youre auaunt without stroke stryken ye shulde disconfyte knyghtes fraunce sir answere please wordes sir peter courtney soone cousayled answere make sayde sir clary ye speke well accepte demaunde wyll morowe place ye armed pleasure shall lyke wise lette v rynne eche thre course speare therby ye shall wynne agayne honour frenche courte ye shall greate pleasure sir quod lorde clary myse shall nat fayle hour ye haue assigned thus two knightes promysed eche iust lorde clary retourned marguysen prouyded hym armure shelde speare horse hadde anone lacked fronters calays boloyne men soone prouyded made prouisyon shortely myght wolde natte ouer many shulde haue knowen therof lyke manner sir peter courtney whane came calays forgate nat promyse made prouyded hym good armure euerye thyng elles harnesse redy suche caryed hym englande fraunce tyme sir iohan berne capitayne calays sir peter shewed hym promise yt made bytwene hym lorde clary sir iohan berne sayde howe wolde accompany hym thyder good felowes calays nexte daye two knightes came place apoynted englysshe knyght came moche better accompanyed dyde frenche knyght capitayne calays hym whan come togyder fewe wordes bytwene theym knewe well ynough wherfore come bothe well armed horsed toke sheldes toke speares sharpe heedes well fyled spurred horse ranne toguyder fyrst course fayled wherwith bothe sore displeased seconde iuste mette toguyder lorde clary strake englysshe knyght throughe arge throughe shulder handfull therwith felle fro horse erthe lorde clary passed forthe kepte course turned stode styll sawe well howe englysshe knight vnhorsed howe many men hym thought surely hurt speare brokenne peces rode englysshe men came lorde clary sayd sir ye courtesse iuster wherfore quod lorde clary bycause ye haue hurt knightes shulder ye might curtesly haue iusted sir curtesy laye nat seyng apparelled iuste case worse myght haue fallen aswell hym howe sir requyre demaunde hym elles wyll whyder wyll atte sir iohan berne sayde nay naye sir knyght ye may departe whan ye lyste ye haue done ynough lorde clary departed company englysshe men ledde sir peter courtney calays healed hurtes lorde clary retourned fraunce thynkynge hadde right well done shulde haue dede great laude prayse shall shewe fell therof whan tidynges came frenche kyng duke burgoyne counsayle howe lorde clarye done armes sir peter courtney retournynge calais sayde sir peter hurte paryll dethe kynge duke specially sir guye tremoyle sore dyspleased lorde clary sayde howe done leest moche lese landes bannysshed realme fraunce euer without repele soe suche wolde hym good wyll sayde howe hadde done lyke false traytoure seynge straunge knyght vnder kynges saue garde shulde requyred hym dedes armes yt meanes brought ieopardye dethe sayde suche dede ought nat pardoned lorde clary sente came kynge duke burgoyne examyned layde charge demauded howe durste outragious knyght straunger come kynges court good loue exalte honoure feates armes deted then good loue ioye entente shulde nat troubled way retournyng delyuered hym conduyt detynge bothe realmes bolde armes hym cape iustes mortall without lycence soueraygne lorde holdeth lande shewed hym trespasse great nat pardoned punysshed highely shulde take ensample therby lorde clary whan herde wordes abasshed thought hadde done well haue thanke sayde lordes trouthe sir peter courtney delyuered conducte kepe hym company tyll came calais froters therof hadde charge haue well truely acquyted selfe nede shall proue wytnesse hym selfe trewe ye waye whan came lucyen countesse saynt poule receyued made v good chere sir peter courtney hadde certayne wordes shall shewe countesse demauded hym sayde sir peter courtney howe ye contente lordes fraunce maner frauce answered courtesly sayd madame maner fraunce ryght noble goodlye lordes fraunce right well content chere excepte one thyng great payne traueyle great coste haue issued oute englade dedes armes came freche kynges court knew nat armes thus lordes whan herde hym saye presece noble lady countesse saynte poule suster kynge englande wordes right heuy beare suffred tyme bycause charge conueyaunce hym neuer made semblaunt therof hym longe company togider within realme fraunce leaue takynge marchesse calais trewe layde vnto hym sayde wordes sayd howe nat courtesly spoken honorably wordes sounded chiualry fraunce abated none durst dedes armes sayd wolde abyde therby one knightes fraunce borne nacyon sayd wolde nat shulde make auaunte englande coude nat fynde frauce waye whome armes therfore sayde redy desyred armes hym fulfylle pleasure desyre rynne thre course speare daye nexte certaynly lordes sayde wordes honour realme fraunce chyualry therof thonght great ioye therof accepted armes nexte day dyde nexte day mette place co panyed garyson calais certayne fronters knyghtes squyers ye lorde mount carell sir iohan longuyllers iusted toguyder well coude aduenture armes fell yt seconde course strake shulder fell erthe retourned againe knowe wolde capitayne cali said sufiycient done myght departe whan lyst retourned beleued ryght well done well defended honour realme france knightes therin thus haue shewed trouthe dede well doyng amedes shall folowe reporte wyll abyde iugement lorde constable lordes highe marshalles frauce besyde voice discrecion knyght hymselfe sir peter curtney whose request dyde armes also reporte knyghtes squyers honour bothe fraunce englande credably enfourmed hole mater whan lorde clary shewed mater sagely made excusacios ye haue herde greatlye aswaged theyre displeasure th complayned hym howe wordes excusacions coude nat delyuered comytted prisone taryed long season great daunger lesyng landes banysshed euer lorde coucy duke burbon labored sore delyuerauce moche payne made peace ayde countesse saynt puole wordes spoken deliuerauce said hym sir clary ye supposed haue done ryght well howe ye dyde shamefully whanne ye offred armes sir peter courtney vnder kyng saue garde deliuered conducte calays kynges comaundement ye dyde great outrage whan ye renewed wordes whiche spoken sport coutesse saynt poule ye done ye ought haue returned ye kyng haue shewed hym ye wordes shulde haue sowned agaynst honour ye knyghtes frauce cousayle king gyuen ye ought haue folowed bycause ye dyde nat thus ye haue hadde payne beware better another tyme thake lorde burbone lorde coucy delyueraunce haue sore labored also ye lady sayut poule quod lorde clary lordes thake howe thought hadde done well thus departed phowe iustes saynt inguelyert otherwise called sadyngfelde enterprised sir reynolde roy yonge sir boucyquant lorde saynt pye cap clxii frenche kyng lay good towne moutpellyer gret myrthe sport banket kynge made lady damoselles towne rehersed sayd mater lorde clary sir peter courtney true began speke thre valyaunt knightes yonge sir bauciquaunt sir reynolde roy lorde saynt pye whiche thre enterprised dedes armes fronter besyde calais tyme somer nexte abyding knightes squiers straungers terme xxx dayes soeuer wolde iuste iustes peace warre bicause thenterprice thre knyghtes semed freche kyng cousayle high enterprice said shulde putte writyng bycause kyng wolde se thartycles therof hygh outragyous kyng might amende bycause king counsayle wolde nat susteyne thynge shulde vnresonable thre knyghtes answered said reasone thus shall done toke clerke caused write foloweth great desyre haue come knowledge noble gentleman knightes squiers straungers well realme fraunce el whereof farre countreys shall saynt ingylbertes march calays twenty day moneth may nexte commyng contynewe thyrty dayes complete frydayes onely excepte delyuer maner knyghtes squyers gentleman straungers maner nacyon whatsoeuer wyll come thyder breakynge fyue speares outher sharpe rokettes pleasure without lodgynges shall sheldes armes sheldes peace warre euer wyll iust lette hym come sende day rod touche whiche shelde please touche ye shelde warre nexte daye shall iust whiche thre wyll touche sheld peace shall haue iustes peace warre soeuer touche sheldes shew cause shewed name suche shalbe lymyted v receyue name suche knightes straungers wyll iuste bringe noble man partye shall instructed v ought done case requyre knyghtes squyers straugers wyll come iuste thynke ymagyn v pride hatred yuell wyll onely haue honorable company acquayntaunce whiche entier harte desyre none sheldes shall couered yron steell none wyll come iust v without maner fraudes aduauntage male engyn euery thynge ordered shall comytted eyther parte gouerne iustes bycause gentleman noble knyghtes squiers shall come knowlege shulde reputed ferme stable haue sealed present writynge seales armes written mountpellier twenty daye nouembre yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore nyne signed thus raynolde du roy boucyquant saynte pye high courage enterprise thre knyghtes french kynge ryght ioyefull therof mater went forwarde euery thynge well examyned sene faulte shulde therin founde kinges counsayle thought nat reasonable armes shulde doone nere calays englysshe men might take presumpcyon whiche wolde eschewed bycause treuce yt taken bytwene englande frauce endure thre yere wherfore sayde ought nothynge wrytten doone shulde occasyon dyscensyon bytwene realmes kynges cousayle rested mater hole day wyste nat wolde faynt haue broken suche sage sayde nat good alwayes consente purpose yonge people often tymes therby maye growe incydentes rather yuell thanne good howe kynge yonge inclyned greatly knyghtes sayd lette enterprise yonge coragyous haue promysed sworne ladyes mountpellyer wyll mater go forwarde let purse enterprise whanne euery man sawe kynges pleasure none durste say agaynst wherfore knyghtes ryght ioyfull concluded agreed matter shulde go forwarde knightes written sealed kynge sent thre knyghtes chambre aparte said syrs doynge regarde wysely honour v realme mayntayne astate spare nothynge shall nat fayle expence ten thousande frankes thre knyghtes kneled downe kynge thanked grace thus frenche kynge toke sporte good towne mountpellyer fyftene dayes moste parte ladyes damosel kynge counsayle parfytely regarded busynesse necessyties towne princypally come thyder cause aduyse counsayle euery thynge well refourmed brouggt good astate oppressyons one awaye wherby good people sore traueyled kynge toke leaue ladyes damoselles mornynge departed wente dyner al pyam nyght lay vbere nexte day besyers goodly receyued good men towne greatly desyred se hym dyd countreys bothe pesenas cabestan narbone redy make complayntes kynge duke berreys offycer called betisache pylled countreys betysach fro tyme kynge came fro auignon rode alwayes company man shewed hym thought myght haue gyuen hym warnynge lyste draue hym forthe fayre wordes suthe promysed hym nothynge honoure thought contrary kynge entred besyers bytwene thre foure noone met processyon without ye towne clergy burgess ladyes damoselles kynge came rydynge bothe sydes waye dyd reuerence came cathedrall churche alyghted dore auter made rychely garnysshed iewelles relykes kynge kneled downe dyd prayer entred churche bysshoppe besyers vncle duke burbone lordes folowed thanne kynge wente lodgynge palyce whiche nat farre thence brother duke thourayne duke burbone lordes lodged abrode towne well easely lodged besyers good cytie pof complayntes made kyng people languedoc towne besyers agaynst betysach treasourer duke berrey great extorsyons made confession made cruell dethe sayde towne cap clxiii thre dayes kynge besyets greate ioye reuell amonge ladyes damosel tyme betysache nothynge spoken vnto enquisirours ordeyned kynge dyd secretly enquyre dedes founde enquest dyuers case horryble nat pardoned fourth day kynge ben betysache called kynges counsayle chambre straytely examyned sayd hym betysache aunswer wysely writynges ye se shewed hym greate nombre bylles complayntes put vp kynge agaynst hym makyng mensyon errorcyons done people bylles complayntes redde hym one another aunswered wysely makynge excuse playnly denyed sayde knowe nothynge mater laye seneschalles beaucayr carcassone chauncellour berry partayneth theym aunswere matter howe fynally shewed muste kepe prysone tyme tyll mater better examyned obeyed bycause myght nat chuse sone prison inquysitours wente lodgynge toke handes suche writyng acomptes founde whiche partayned mater intermedled auewed leysure founde theym rekenynges great somes money suche ben raysed leuyed people demaunded money become whether somme trewe nat aunswered sayde somes trewe money delyuered duke berrey paste throughe handes treasourers whereof haue good quyttaunces lodgynge suche place whiche quitauces sente counsayle redde agreed somes receyte counsayle enquysytours apeased betysache sente agayne curtesse prysone counsayle comuned togyther matter sayd semeth betysache clere suche cause layde charge money hathe reysed duke berrey hathe howe euer hath ben spente thinges consydred betysache excusacyons lawfull duke berrey moste couetouse man worlde myght gette good cared nat howe hadde whan wolde bestowe symply many lordes haue doone tymes paste thus kynges counsayle sawe faute betysache wherby shulde lese lyfe opynyon contrary said betysach hath done many cruell dedes hathe sore inpouerysshed people acomplysshe desyre lorde duke berrey blode poore people cryeth sayeth howe hathe deserued dethe manne borne partyes counsayler maister seynge pouerty people ought good maner haue shewed trouth duke mayster duke wolde nat haue herde hym shulde haue come kynge counsayle haue shewed theym pouertie people howe duke berrey daulte ben well excused betysache sente agayne counsayle straytely examyned money hadde gathered become founde thyrty hundred thousande frankes receyued answered therto sayd lordes herde tell lorde duke berrey hathe bestowed moche hath layde byldynges reparacyons castels house also hath bought certayne landes countye boloygne countye estampes also hathe spente moche byenge precyous stone iewelles whiche ye knowe well hathe alwayes desyrous bye also well stuffed mayntayne astate hathe alwayes kepte also hath gyuen suche gyftes rewardes thybaulte morynot seruautes aboute suche wyse ryche men well betysache quod counsayle ye haue parte synguler profyte hundred thousande frankes lordes quod haue hadde consente lorde duke berrey wolde seruauntes shulde become ryche counsayle sayde one voyce betysach worde folysshly spoken rychesse nat good resonable yuell gotten ye shall retourne agayne prison shall take aduyse ye haue sayd spoken ye must abyde pleasure kynge whome shall shewe excusacions lordes quod shall god wyll agayne sette prisone remayned four dayes sente agayne whan tydynges spredde abrode countrey betysach prison inquyre made dedes publysshed euer matter hym shulde come forthe therby moche people came besyers put vp supplycacions kynge cruell dedes betysach complayned hym hadde dysheryted without cause reason complayned hym hadde force taken wyues doughters whan kynges counsayle sawe many gret cause laide betysache wery therof besyde complayntes sore behated people came hym reason fyll duke berreys purse dyd euer wolde haue hym kynges counsayle wyste nat come thyder two knightes fro duke berrey lorde nantonelet syr peter mespyn brought letter kynge fro duke duke behalfe auowed euer betysach doone duke requyred kynge counsayle haue agayne man treasourer kynge greate hatred betysach bycause yuell name fame ranne vpon hym kynge duke thourayne brother inclyned greatly haue hym hanged sayenge howe hadde well deserued kynges counsayle durste nat iudge hym dought duke berrey sayde kynge syr duke berrey auowe dedes euer canne nat se waye reason hath deserued dethe seasone medled countreys cessynge tayles subsydyes aydes receyuynge dyd instauce duke berrey tyme puyssaunce royall well ye haue nowe syr acordynge desertes dedes ye maye sease handes mouables herytages leaue hym case duke berrey founde hym fyrste goodes make restytucion suche poore men vn done hym shulde make longe processe betysache poynte delyueraunce losse goodes tyll laste tydynges came place shall shewe knewe nat coulde nat knowe knowledgyng selfe dede yuell iudged himselfe sayd herytyke done many horryble dedes shewed came hym nyght beynge prisone put hym feare whether frendes fooes knowe nat sayde betysach thou art harde case french kyng brother duke burbone dothe hate mortally many complayntes put vp agaynste fro dyuers place suche oppressyons ye haue doone whan ye rule languedoc iudge hanged ye canne nat scape losse goodes whiche hath offred kynge kynge hateth mortally hath aunswered howe goodes body also whiche sayeth wyll nat kepe longe shew good wyll morowe thought ye shall delyuered iudged dye wordes greatly afrayed betysach sayd ah saynt mary remedy yes quod morowe say ye wolde speke kinges counsayle outher wyll come sende whan ye presence say thus lordes knowledge selfe haue greatly displeased god displeasure hath false slaunder reysed wyll demaunde wherin ye shall aunswere howe ye haue longe season arred faythe ye herytyke kepe styll opinyon whan bysshop besyers shall wyll chalenge haue kepynge ye shall delyuered hym suche cause ought declared lawe churche thanne ye shall sente auignon wyll none duke berrey pope wyll nat displease hym meanes ye may delyuered nother lese body goodes ye byde styll case ye ye shall nat skape paste morowe ye shall hanged kynge hateth bycause slaunder people betysache trusted false infourmacyon parell dethe knoweth nat well wherfore aunswered sayd ye frende cousayle truely wher god thanke trust tyme shall come shall thanke next mornynge called gayler sayde frende requyre cause suche menne suche come speke named suche enquysitours ouer gayler shewed theym howe betysache wolde speke came hym demaunded wolde aunswered sayd sir haue serched coscience knowledge selfe haue hyghly displeased god longe tyme haue arred agaynst ye fayth neuer beleued trinyte sonne god wolde come lowe come fro heuen come worlde take humayn kynde woman beleue saye whan dye nothynge sowle ah sainte mary quod betysach ye greatly holy churche wordes demaundeth fyre aduyse better canne nat tell quod betysache whether wordes demaudeth fyre water haue holden opinyon sythe haue knowledge shall holde tyll dye enquysitours wolde hym tyme gladde fynde suche mater hym therby put deth comaunded gailer kepe straytely suffre man speke hym entente shulde nat tourned fro opynyon thanne wente kynges counsayle shewed mater wente kynge shewed hym maner betysache ye haue herde wherof kynge great marueyle sayd wyll put dethe yuell man false herytyke thefe wyll brynte hanged shall haue hath deserued shall nat e cused myne vncle berrey anon tydynges spredde abrode cytie besyers howe betysache hadde owne voluntary wyll without constraynt confessed howe herytyke vsed longe synne bowgery howe kynge sayde howe shulde brynte hanged wherof moche people right ioyouse sore hated two knyghtes come thyder fro duke berrey greatly abasshed wyst nat suppose syr peter mesquyn sayde lorde nantonelet syr feare betysache betrayed peraduenture persone hath ben hym secretly prisone hathe borne hym hande holde horryble erroure churche shall chalenge hym sente auignon pope therby delyuered ah fole dysceyued kyng sayeth wyll haue hym bothe brente hanged lette v go prisone hym reforme hym bringe hym nother state farre waye yuell counsayled wente strayte prisone desyred gayler might speke betysache gayler excused hymselfe sayde syrs ye muste pardone straytely charged suffer manne speke hym also four sargeauntes armes sente kynge kepe hym dare nat breke kinges comaundement two knyghtes sawe well howe labored vayne howe remedy lykelyhode betysache shulde dye retourned lodgynge rekened payed toke horse returned lorde duke berrey shewed hym case coclusion betysach suche nexte daye tenne clocke taken prysone brought bysshoppes palays redy iudges offycers spyrituall bayly besyers brought forthe prisoner sayde beholde syrs betisache whome delyuer herytyke synnet bo gery nat ben clerke iudged acordynge desertes offycyall demauded betysach hym acordynge acused confesse frouth openly people betysache thought haue said well haue scaped reason confessyon aunswered sayde trewe demaunded thre tymes euery tyme confessed trewe people thus ye maye knowe whether dysceyued nat made suche confessyon delyuered duke berrey fully auowed dedes whiche doone commaundemente countrey langue doc supposed fortune played tourne hym whanne thought haue moste assuredest heyght fortune whele tourned vp downe fro whele hathe doone hundred thousande mo sythe worlde began betysach delyuered agayne spirytuall iudge bayly besyers vnder kinge ruled temperalte whiche betysache without delaye brought place palays hasted forwarde leysure aunswere saye nay whan sawe fyre redy prepared ye place sawe handes hangman sore abasshed sawe well dysceyued betrayed cryed loude requirynge herde hede taken sayenge hangeman sayde ordeyned ye shall dye yuell warkes hathe brought yuell ende hasted forwarde dethe fyre made redy also reysed payre galowes therto tyed chayne yron ende therof coler yron whiche put aboute necke chaine drawen vp hye tyed rounde aboute galowes cryed sayde duke berrey cause dye without reason wronge sone tyed galows setre rounde aboute drye segge rede ago e fyre put therto incontynente faggortes fyre thus betysache hanged brente frenche kyng chaumbre myght well se hym wolde poore ende came betysache people reuenged hym saye trouthe doone many extorcions domages people whyle gouernynge countrey languedoc phowe frenche kynge beynge tholouse sente erle foiz came thyder dyd homage kynge conntie foiz cap clxiiii cruell iustyce french kyng taryed nat longe besiers departed toke way carcassone always sythe departure fro auygnon marshall syr loys xancere rode company kynge rode longe iourneys vysited countreys kepte nat right hyghe wayes cabestan narbone lymons mounte royall fongaur retourned carcassone taryed foure dayes rode passed vyle franca auygnollet mongistarte came tholouse burgess greatly desyred se kynge receyued hym ioyfully mette kyng without towne lyuery greate solempnyte brought castell thoulouse cytie gaue kinge many fayre presentes wherwith kynge greatly reioysed whan kynge thre dayes counsayled sende erle foiz come byerne countie foiz towne nasiers four leages fro thoulouse knew kinges state ordynauce marshall frauce lorde de la ryuer apoynted go erle foize departed wednysday laye cytie tholousyn called iordayn next day came nasyers erle foiz knewe well comynge receyued theym nobly loue kynge also knewe lordes well sene syr loys xancere wordes said syr lorde foiz kynge soueraygne lorde hath sente v comaundyng come se hym thoulouse el wyll traueyle farre wyll come se owne countrey greatly desyreth se erle foyze aunswered sayd syr loys wolde nat kynge great traueyle mete haue hym wherfore please ye shall shewe hym shall tholouse within foure dayes well sayde syr quod shall returne shewe tydynges fro howe ye shall abyde daye refresshe selfes morowe ye shall departe obeyed taryed daye nyght pleasure erle deuysed theym sagely craftely man reason fayre langage drawe one meanes secretes ons herte nexte daye toke leaue eche rode long day came tholouse founde kinge playenge chesse vncle duke burbone kynge demaunded alowde sayde syrs howe saye wyll erle come yes sir quod lorde de la ryuer hath gret affection se grace wyll within foure dayes well quod kynge wyll gladly se hym two knightes departed fro kynge lefte hym playeng went supper reste rydden daye great iourney erle foiz nasyers remembred well voyage made hym redy sente tholous uisyon acordingly sent bierne knightes squiers mo two hundred serue accompany hym voiage daye erle foiz apoynted entred cytie tholous mo syxe hundred horse well acompanyed knyghtes squyers hym bonuquell sir ioha brother sir roger spaygne cosyn lorde courase ye lorde valetyne lorde quare lorde burnge sir espaygne du lyon lorde roquepayre lorde lane lorde besache lorde perle sir peter cabestayne sir monaunt nonnalles sir richarde de la meete sir arnolde saynt basyll dyuers sir peter byerne sir arnolde two bretherne two bastarde sonnes sir iobbayne sir gracyen foiz entencion erle enherite two sonnes moost parte lande bierne whiche lande myght therwith pleasure helde frake free holdynge man godde thus erle toke lodgynge freers preacher kept house men lay nere myght burgess tholous made great chere loued well alwayes good neyghbour curtesse tretable neuer suffred co pany displeasure vyolece wherfore loued hym moche better gaue many fayre psentes wyne thynges well contente entred tholous whan nere nyght nexte daye ten clocke toke horse suche company pleased hym mo two hundred knyghtes squyers men honour estate rode long stretes castell kynge lyghted fyrst court entryng castell erle mouted vp greces great hall freche kyng come chambre hall taryed erle great desyre se hym great valure renome ran hym therle foiz goodly prince formall stature beare heeded entred hall whan sawe kynge lordes frau ce kynges brother vncle made reuerence kyng none kneled downe one knee rose passed forthe thirde tyme kneled nere kynge kyng toke hym hande enbrased toke hym vp sayde erle foiz fayre cosyn ye right welcome comyng greatlye reioyceth v sir quod erle thake grace please say kynge erle talked toguyder whiche wordes herde nat thane kynge went dyner kynges table vpper ende sate archbisshop tholous kynge vncle duke burbone nexte erle foiz sir iohn burbone erle marche vandone table sate mo seconde table satte sir iohan de la brethe erle harcourte sir philyppe bare foure knightes erle foiz another table sate marshall sir loyes sanxere sir roger spayne eyght knightes erles great dyner well stuffed thynges dyner grace sayd toke pastymes great chabre heryng instrumentes wherin erle foiz greatly delyted thane wyne spyces brought erle harecourt serued kynge spyce plate sir gerrarde de la pyerserued duke burbone sir monnaunt nonnalles serued erle foiz thus four clocke erle tooke leaue kyng lordes issued hall courte hours redy men erle mou ted suche accompanyed hym retourned lodgynge well contente chere hadde ben made hym praysed moche knightes tthus bytwene frenche kynge erle gascoyne foize beynge tholous dyuers treaty apoyntmentes loue marshall fraunce lorde de la ryuer dyde payne helpe forwarde erle foiz made dyner duke thou rayne duke burbone therle de la marche great lordes fraunce dyner great sumptuous syttyng table mo ii hundred knightes dyner fullye ended frenche kyng dyned castell hym sir charles de la brethe sir philyppe bare two cosyn germayns kyng sayde go thyder dyde xii company erle foiz greatlye reioysed pleased kyng coe lodgyng company sporte dyner wrestlyng castynge barre stone darte bytwene frenche men gascoyns thus passed tyme tyll nerehande nyght kynge lordes retourned erle foiz gaue daye kynges knightes squyers ye duke thourayne duke burbone mo tha threscore courser palfrayes mulettes whyte sadels redy drest apoynt also gaue kynges mynstrelles two hundred crownes golde heraudes offycers armes two hundred crownes euery man praysed large erle foiz fourthe daye erle came kynges palais well acompanyed lordes knyghtes byerne foiz se kynge requyred saye homage countie foiz appendauntes reseruyng lande bierne secretely great treaty bytwene kynge erle foiz meanes lorde de la ryuer sir iohan mercier bysshoppe noyon newly come thyder fro auygnon sayd erle desyred ye kyng sonne iobbayne foiz myght erles discease enheryte countie foiz erle whan soeuer dyed shulde leaue kyng hudred thousande frankes money sir gasyon brother haue land ayre bierne cytie mounte marcen landes erle foiz hadde bought bierne shulde retourne herytauce vycount castyllon assygnementes debate dyfference bytwene erle barones knightes countrey sayde coude nat thus generall consent byerne foize bycause meane homage countie foize dewe frenche kyng therfore kyng sayde erle baron foiz sir holde handes homage lande foiz dayes lande foiz vacant dethe cosyn erle foiz shall determyne apoynt aduise good counsayle iobbayns foiz men coutie foiz shall holde content wordes well cotented therle foiz lordes knyghtes foiz present ordynaunces written sealed erle toke leaue kynge great lordes daye dyned kyng went lodgyng nexte day departed fro tholous lefte furrier behynde hym paye euery thyng erle passed ryuer gyronde ye bridge tholous retourned countrey mount marsen ortayes gaue leaue euery man departe sauyng ordynarye shewed beleue well comynge frenche kyng laguedocke tholous marchesse cost erle foize threscore thousande frankes erle lyberall whatsoeuer cost hym payde wyllyngly pof feate couenaunt bytwene kyng duke thourayn brother whiche shulde sonest come parys fro montpellyer whiche hu dred fyftie leages sondre eche one knyght cap clxv frenche kynge tholous ordred businesse remoued renewed seneschales officer reformed countrey good estate euery well contented day kyng present brother vncle burbone lordes frauce gascoyne thentent haue perpetuall memorie gaue cosyn germayne sir charles de la brethe augmentacion honour two quarter armes frauce floure delyces fore ye lordes de la brethe bare alwayes armes felde goules playne without thyng nowe quartred armes frauce whiche thyng lorde de la brethe toke great gyfte whiche lorde made daye great dyner whiche cost hym thousande frankes gaue heraudes mynstrels ii hundred frankes anone ordayned kyng shulde departe fro thoulous retourne fraunce euery man made hym redy toke leaue kynge bysshop tholous seneschall burgess lordes damoselles towne kynge deted rode nyght newe castell alroy forwarde euery daye came moutpellyer ioyfully receyued taryed thre dayes ladyes damosel pleased hym moche gret defyre returne paris se quene daye comuned sporte brother thourayne sayd fayre brother wolde paris estate styll haue great desyre se quene fayre suster thourayne duke sayde sir nat wysshing farre iourney hen true kyng yet thynke might besoone wolde ye duke helpe good horse coude horse must beare well quod kyng laye wager shall sonest content duke euer redy wyn money kyng wager layde bitwene ye kynge duke soeuer twayne came sonest paris shulde wyn fyue thousande frakes departe nexte day one hour eche take one knight seruaut man durst breke wager ye nexte day departed ordayned lorde garaciers rode kyng lorde viefuyll duke thourayn thus four rode night day lyke yong lusty galates chauged many horse thus rode post ye duke burbone retourned puy auuergne rode se grautfather way therle dolphyn auergne countesse chyldren nobre eight sone doughters bretherne susters ye duches burbone wife reason two maryages thus frenche kyng brother duke thourayne rode great hast eche wyn wager cosyder well great payne two great riche lordes youthe lybertie corage made enterprice estate abode behynde frenche kynge made foure dayes halfe came paris duke thourayne four dayes quarter day folowed eche nere ye duke wan wager reason yt frenche kynge rested viii ye clocke trois chapayne duke toke barge ye ryuer seyne went longe ryuer melyn toke horse rode tyll came paris wente saynt poule quene wyfe demaunded tiding kyng wyst nat wheder come nat whan knewe yt king nat come ioyfull said quene madame ye shall shortly tidynges ye kyng sayd trouthe kyng cae soone whan duke thou rayn herde kyng come went met hym sayd sir haue wager let payd reason kyng ye shall shewed ye lady iorney yt four dayes halfe coe fro mountpellier paris whiche cl leages sondre ladyes tourned mater sporte laughing well iuged endured moche payne iuged youthe corage herte caused duke thourayn truely payd wager pof dethe pope vrbayne rome called antepape howe pope clement wrote frenche kyng vncles vniuersite election pope boniface cardinalles rome cap clxvi sayd season dyed rhome pope vrbane vi romayns sore displeased dethe well beloued buryed churche saynt peter obsequy done well reueretly cardynalles went conclaue chuse newe pope dyde pope clement knewe therof auynon ten dayes past knewe assone pope clement cardynalles knewe therof assembled togyder pope palays great comunycacion toguyder great hope busynesse churche shulde leue concluded come full vnyon errour longe endured thought cardynals rome shulde nat agre soone entre conclaue rather submitte themselfe pope clemet auignon sent also worde fre che kyng ye dethe vrban called antepape desyred hym soner come purpose wolde write cosyns kynge almayne kynge hungy therle vertues duke austrych euer holden pope vrbane shulde nowe cease helpe make rest peace ye churche shewe letter faythe ought varyacion one god heuyn ther ought one god erthe season ye duke burgoyne kyng parys pope clement cardynals wrote lyke maner kyng shewed vncle newes right ioyfull saide fayre vncle haue gret desyre go wt great puissauce rome distroy thenfidels nowe iourney well shorted vrbane antepape deed clement hath written v thynketh cardynals wyll nat entre coclaue chuse newe pope rather come auignon submyt selfes vnder pope clemet desyred hym cardynals auignon suretie write pleasaut letter cosins ye kyng almayne brother kyng hugry ye erle vertues ye duke austriche cousayle wyll ye gyue duke burgoyne sayd sir trewe pope vrbane deed yet knowe nothynge state cardynals rome romayns whether wyll kepe olde opinyon nat feare wyll harde leaue romayns maysters ouer cardynalles byforce made chuse archebysshoppe bare made hym pope maynteyned hym thende nowe force cause cardynalles entre conclaue chuse pope pleasure wherfore sir ye shall nat nede entre farre mater desyre wyll lytell haue shewed yet hydervnto suffre sir tyll ye newes paraduenture maye cardynalles rome shall nat one accorde paradueture wyll dissymule romayns chuse none pope clement apease furour promyse cause clement come rome whiche wyll right gladlye condycion mater go shall tyme write ye prince christned opinyon co trarye best maner ye canne voyde scisme bring churche vnyon peace reason euery man ought yet ye nat sure howe mater gothe best ye abyde adue ture therof shall nat longe tidynges whan duke burgoyne hadde sayde wordes kyng cousaile none spake contrarye therto kynge thought wordes resonable sayd fayre vncle beleue good reason ye saye yese clerer mater tha busynesse churche wyll nothynge therin youre counsayle aduyse thus cessed comunycacion great murmuracyon monge clerkes vniuersite tyding wherby cessed rede studye entended nothynge herken knowe howe cardynalles rome maynteyned selfe wheder wolde electe newe pope el retourne pope auignon dyde cast many doughtes argued one another knewe well howe clement written kynge duke thourayne duke burgoyne kynges counsayle lykewise letter written generally vnyuersite yt shulde conclude vnyuersall peace churche thus clerkes deuysed amonge themselfe suche wolde aduauncement clement sayde nowe tyme kyng lordes frauce write great prince christendome kynge almaygne kynge hungry lorde myllayne duke austryche suche opynion thentent yt shulde retourne state suche writyng maye moche aueyle thre dayes thre tymes notable clerkes vniuersyte parys assembled togyder last came saynt poules speke kyng cou sayle desyre hym set hande oppresse cysme churche entende ordynauce pope clement humbly written hym whan cae saint poules nat answered kynge dissymuled mater yuell cotent finally kyng contented sayeng howe shortely shulde newes dyd cardinal rome entred coclaue made newe pope cardynall naples noble valyant clerke called bonyface whan frenche kyng cousayle herde therof pensyue well ymagined howe ye cysme lykely endure longe duke burgoyne sayde kyng sir nowe regarde wheder writynges hadde nat ben loste nowe fallen sayd fayre vncle quod kyng ye saye trouthe thane grace opyned clerkes rome bonyface promyses certifyed suche vnder obeysauce suche wolde receyue suche grace wente towardes rome whan approched marchesse danconne rode great paryll sir bernarde de la salle kepte fronters made warre romains quarell pope clement toke suche clerkes paste dyde moche trouble many slayne loste p nowe lette v leaue spekynge pope tourne mater pof yelding vp takyng stronge castell vanchadore lymosyn olde parteyning syr geffcay tete noyre cap c lxvii ye haue herde howe sir geffray tete noyre ben longe capitayns castell vanchadore lymosyn raigned valiauntly howe helde fortresse agaynst men longe lyued lyfe dayes pa esed coutrey xxx long hym also ye haue herde howe dyed incydence howe dethe bedde ordayned ii nephues alayne roux peter roux capitayns castell vachadore dethe caused presence companyons garison swere faythe trouthe homage seruyce trewe obeysaunce sayd two capitayns ye dethe geffraye tete noyre two bretherne raigned certayne space held alwayes coutrey warre composycion patesyng bycause castell parteyned herytage duke berrey bought erle mout pensyer sonne iohan berey bare name therby therfore duke sore displeased handes coude nat amende yet layd siege therto dyuers tymes bastides none otherwyse within sette lytell therby wolde issue ryde abrode ye countrey pleasure alayne peter wolde wyse obey peace truce taken bytwene englade fraunce sayde nat bounde obey wolde make warre pleasure wherby countreis auuergne lymosyn sore traueyled duke berrey resyst caused sir wyllyam butler gentyll knyght auuergne sir iohan boesme launce sir loyes da bier dyuers knight squyers auuergne lymosyn laye siege bastydes castell vanchadore laye cost countrey laye louge season fell season shewed alayn peter roux toke aduyce toguyder denysed attrappe take crafte sir wyllyam butler sir iohan boesme launce hadde done dyuers displeasure two bretherne ymagined bytwene sayde one another howe wolde secretely say howe wolde yelde vp fortresse certayne floreyns say howe wery wyll kepe garison lengar retourne owne countreis whiche deuyse sayde surely duke berrey wyll gladly leane vnto also deuysed demaunde tenne thousande frakes bycause somme myght soone made also sayde wolde haue agayne money two knyghtes also prisoner reason busshment wolde laye great towre beholde nowe folisshe ymaginacion two breton betray two knyghtes haue money iuell came therby ought nat coplayned vpon determynacion putte castell one varlettes sayde hym go thy waye freche bastydes suffre take tha requyre brought sir wyllyam butler sir iohan boesme launce delyuer letter fro v demaunde answere mater toucheth v also greatly varlet sayd shulde done thought none yuell went frenche bastides whan came nere bastydes demauded wolde answered sayd wolde gladly speke sir wyllyam butler sir iohan boesme lauce brought toguyder whan sawe made reuerence drewe aparte delyuered letter alayne peter roux sente tydinges great marueyle toke letter reed therin founde alayne peter roux wolde speke profite whan herde marueyle thane douted trayson howe sent worde wolde come castell speke without wolde assure entre agayne fortresse without daunger trouble answere yt varlet brought maister thanne alayne peter roux said thynke may sure ynough wordes sythe faythes seales writyng true knyghtes also shall speke treatie whervnto thynke wyll gladly entende nexte mornynge opynned wycket ioynyng gate aueyled downe planche borde hangyng two chaynes issued stode planche sir wyllyam butler sir iohan boesme lauce came thyder lyghted horse made menne drawe abacke two capitayns within said sir may surely come speke ye surely quod knyghtes shall sure agayne parte without trayson ye sir surely quod without doute alayne peter roux passed bridge came four toguyder company two frenche knightes said sir howe saye comunycacion wyll ye haue v ye mynde yelde vp castell v ye truely sir quod condycion gyue v ten thousande frakes ye prouisyons castell wery ye warre wolde drawe bretayne two knyghtes ryght gladde wordes sayd ah ye speke v marchandyse shall gladly nowe haue nat money redy shall prouyde well sir vanchador whan ye redy gyue v knowledge shall kepe couenaunt sir kepe mater secretly sagely knowen amonge myne owne company wolde take v perforce slee v shulde bothe fayle entente syr quod dought nat therof shall conuey mater yt ye shall take domage therwith departed one fro nother breton entred vanchador frenche knyghtes retourned bastydes sir willyam butler syr iohan boesme lauce mater thought nothynge good supposynge breton wolde nat dysceyue theym haue money betraye also contynente wrote duke berrey ryon auuergne sent letter gentleman named guyomell saynte wydall infourmed hym mater thynkyng howe shulde ioyouse tydynges duke greatly desyred haue castell squyer tooke letter departed fro bastydes rode longe lymosyn auuergne came ryon founde duke berrey delyuered hym letter fro two knyghtes duke reed letter whan well vnderstande contentes therof duke gladde anone duke called counsayle treasourers said sir beholde newe tydynges knyghtes kepeth bastydes vanchador haue written v certayne treatie capytayns within castell offer yeld vp fortresse tenne thousande frankes great euery yere coste lymosyn auuergne kepe warre threscore thousande frankes wyll accepte offre betymes leste repente herafter therfore treasourers make vp tenne thousande frankes wyll lende countrey whan possession castell wyll rayse tayle lymosyn fronters whiche vnder patesynge shall pay double sir quod treasourers shall made redy within fyue syxe dayes well quod duke contente thus matter concluded tresourers made redy money crownes sonne put foure cofers daye money shulde haue sente came ryon duke berry dolphyn auuergne lorde reueyll certayne mater touchynge selfe welcome duke duke ioyfull treatie vanchador coude nat kepe secrete shewed two knightes letter sente hym fro syr willyam butler syr iohan boesme launce whan herde studyed lytell duke sayde syr wheron yemuse se suspectiousnes mater pray shewe sende money syr quod erle dolphyn ye know well howe therle army nake ordeyned gette agayne many fortress coude coutreys auuergne carnesyn rouergne lymosyn dyuers made treatyes yt euer coulde coulde neuer brynge vanchador herkyn leane maner treatie nother gyue vp selle whan spake therof wolde skante make v aunswere syr knowe nowe wyll make treatie nat defaute vitayles none came theym eyght yere yet haue ynough wherfore haue maruayle shulde moue therto presente tyme therfore maketh v doute traysone men warre inclosed fortress sore imagyners whan imaginacion inclyneth yuell dede wyll craftely colour wherfore sir take good aduyse well syrs quod duke ye haue sayd well shall prouyde mater substancyally thought haue done thanne duke berrey called hym one knyghtes called syr peter mespyn sayde hym syr ye shall go money bastydes vanchadore saye syr wyllyam butler syr iohan boesme launce mater wrote deale therin substancyally trust nat moche breton within vanchador shewe haue herde tydinges ware wherfore lette theym well aduysed poyntes thus knyght departed fro ryon money rode company tyll came bastydes whyther welcome somers money dyscharged put sauegarde syr peter mespyn opened message said syrs lorde duke berrey sendeth worde touchynge treatye ye hande withall touchyng garyson vanchador comaundeth worke wysely ye lese nat bothe bodyes money hath sent also sayth hath herde tydynges pleaseth hym nothynge wherfore wyll ye take good hede well aduysed douteth trayson sayeth often tymes coutrey auuergne lymosyn wolde haue gyuen fortresse vanchadore threscore thousande frankes nowe offre ten thousande causeth lorde duke counsayle haue suspecte two knightes whan herde pensyue aunswered sayde se well double wytte better syngle ye say well thanke aduyse ye shall abyde styll v helpe counsayle v reason within two day shall se howe ye mater shall come passe sayde contente thanne anone two knyghtes sente varlet castell vanchador treuce bytwene party signyfyed alayne rour peter rour tenne thousande frankes redy desyringe theym kepe promesse answered varlet wold kepe promesse surely whan euer wolde come sende theym worde therof alayne peter rour thought good knowen ued whan purpose broken knowen deuysed haue taken sir willyam butler syr iohan boesme launce shuld haue entred castell vanchador reasone great towre within castell whiche always able beate castell two knyghtes breton entended nothynge malesse layde busshement towre thyrty men harnesse entent whan frenche men entred castell thynkynge lordes therof night thyrty shulde issue slee take frenche men pleasure whan thus ordayned sente syr willyam butler sir iohan boesme launce shulde come bringe money shulde haue castell opened newes frenche men ioyous sayd messanger retourne maysters shewe morowe mornyng shall come thyder messanger retourned shewed maysters frenche knyghtes wente counsayle togyder dyd cast doutes dyd reason wordes duke berrey sente six peter mespyn ordeyned concluded lay busshemente men nere castell thyrty men harnessed vnder couert shulde go entre castell regarde wyselye castell within cast maner doutes se thynge suspecte one blowe horne kepe bridge gate open sowne horne busshement come gate faste canne entre take season castell thus ordayned done next mornyng euery man redy busshement layde syxe score speares two knyghtes thyrty company couertly armed came vanchador syr peter mespyn money trussed properly thre panyers vpon two somers founde two breton redy barryers opened barryers agaynste comyng whan entred within gate two breton wolde haue closed gate frenche knyghtes said nay syrs nat ye true marchauntes nat ye knowe well ye muste yelde vp v castell payeng tenne thousande frankes redy ye maye se vpon somer ye kepe trouth v shall yon wordes alayne peter rour wyste nat say bringe frenche men suspecte aunswered syrs ye saye well contente ye please thus wente forthe lefte barryers open hadde ben closed busshment coulde nat haue entred haue come tyme ynough haue resysted false turne breton deuysed ymagyners shulde haue euery thyng lyst nat counter ymaginers agaynst bothe frenche men breton entred gate alayne peter roux wolde haue closed gate frenche men sayd syrs let gate alone wyll haue open reason redy delyuer money acordynge promesse well syrs quod breton lette se laye forthe money good wyll quod frenche men layde forthe couerlet florens layde abrode ye meane season whyle alayne peter roux behelde fayre florece frenche knyghtes went aboute se maner castell thanne syr peter mespyn came syr willyam butler sayd syr cause great towre opened ye paye money may within busshmente wherby maye atrapped lose bothe bodyes money also syr willyam sayd alayne syr open towre wyll se open delyuer money syr quod alayne canne nat keyes lost wordes frenche knightes suspecte mater said alayne nat ye shulde lese keyes soueraygne towre castell open fayrenesse el shall open perforce forye haue promised sworne rendre v castell without fraude male engyn therfore haue ten thousande frankes whiche redy delyuered alayne aunswered agayne sayd wyll nat open tyll haue receyued ye money layde sauegarde whan haue receyued money shall serche ye key sir quod wyll nat abyde longe se clerely wordes meanyng nat good wyll dysceyue betraye v wherfore lay hades alayne brother peter name kynge soueraygne lorde duke berrey wyll haue towre incontynent opened perforce serche euery place within castell bothe aboue beneth se ye haue layde busshemente nat fynde castell thyng done ought nat done ye loste without redempcyon pardone reasone wyll fynde castell ought shall kepe bargayne well truely shall conducte whyder ye lyste gate auignon ye wyll whan alayne peter roux sawe howe mater wente arested sore abasshed halfe deed repented doone moche sawe well dysceyued frenche knightes perceyued well howe culpable mater nat well made signe hym bare horne blowe dyd whan french busshement herde came ye castell faste horse coulde ryn sayd go vanchadore blowe v semeth men hath nat founde castell acording promysed thynke trayson anon come castell nat farre barryers open kept frenchman breton within nat maysters castell busshemente within towre frenche men entred founde capytaynes courte comunynge breton alayne peter sore abasshed seynge many enemyes aboute within towre knewe nothynge besynesse coude se nothyng towre thycke sayde harke syrs thynke moche murmurynge without may dysceyued frenche men subtyle thought take feare taken capitayn alayne dysceyued feare shall nat issue without congye thus whan frenche men sawe howe lordes castell bolder tooke put vp agayne floreyns sayd alayne delyuer v keyes towre wyll se within breton prolonged mater sayde syrs begynne fyrste serche outher place tha returne towre frenchman answered alayne ye prologe mater wyll begynne fyrst one delyuer keyes el thou shalte slayne dagger whan two bretherne herde douted dethe fledde fro longe myght howe saye trouth honorable haue slayne haue taryed longer afterwarde dyed shamefull dethe ye shall alayne roux beyng daunger yet practysed another crafte wolde haue serued sayd syr willyam syr iohan trouth within toure thirty men harnesse brother dyd sette moche payne knewe well wolde neuer agree apoyntemente therfore haue closed theym within towre sure tyll ye haue full possessyon castell ye may haue ye wyll good prisoner delyuer v money ye haue promysed lette v go wayes whan french knightes herde somwhat better content studyed lyttell sir willm butler saide euer delyuer money wyll haue knowledge keyes castell therfore shew v whan alayne sawe wolde none otherwyse sente chambre whan brought place demau ded whiche keyes serued ye towre alayne full sore agaynste wyll shewed forthe keyes great towre opened towre founde within thyrty companion harnesse hydde priuely within towre alayne brother sore abasshed whan sawe frenchman entre towre harde wordes sir willyam butler sayd whiche syrs issue fayre easely one one nat ye deed take prisoner feare nat dethe ye shall haue hurte ye wyll shewe trouth shall demaunde whan sawe frenche men vnderstode shulde nat slayne taken prisoner layde downe weapon harnesse yelded selfes sawe well defece coulde nat aueyle thyrty men taken put parte examyned iustyfyed trayson alayne peter roux coulde nat denye knyghtes fraunce sayde syrs greatly dyspleaseth v fynde defaulte canne nat punysshe mater cause weighty shall put discrecyon duke berrey wyll haue pytie shall gladde therof trust wyll ioye wyll haue recoueryng castell place desyred haue agayne world wordes somewhat comforted theym put chambre vnder sure kepynge dyuers chambres towres castell serched aboue beneth founde great prouysyon lefte styll toke away nothynge therof departynge golde syluer harnesse therof made boty euery man parte prisoner knyghtes parte thus haue shewed stronge castell vanchadore taken frenche men season syr wyllyam butler sette capytayne squyer lymosyn valyaunt man called pier mardych hym thyrty speares good men warre raunsomed prysoners suche worthy raunsomed suche great pyllers robber frenchman borne strake hedes hanged vpon gybettes newe made castell gate frenche knightes departed go ryon duke berrey toke alayne peter roux tydinges sprange abrode howe stronge castell vanchadore taken wherof countrey auuergne lymosyn marchesse greatly reioysed castell frenche mennes handes fyftene yere durynge season garysone done great domage countrey sir willyam butler founde castell yonge squier bretayne fayre yong man named monadich cosyn geffray tetenoyre newely come thyder lerne exercyse dedes armes ben brought vp abbaye bretayne come house bycause wolde monke frenche men wolde haue stryken heed among sir willm butler pytie hym saued lyfe wolde become frenche serue hym thus frenchman rode duke berrey brake vp bastydes men armes departed went euery man owne ye capytaynes came ryon
