duke berrey led breton desyred waye yt shulde nat enfourme duke berrey sore agaynst frenchman promysed fulfyll desyre longe rode came ryon founde duke duchesse receyued great ioy rekened gret acte conquering castell vanchadore gaue fayre gyftes presentes demaunded duke pleasure shulde done alayne peter roux answered wolde take aduyse matter toke counsayle determyned shulde sende kyng delyuered seneschall auuergne coueyed parys put prison castell saynte anthony kepynge vycount affer tyme kepynge yt castell nat ben longe delyuered prouost parys put chatellet iudged dye traytours robber realme fraunce delyuered hangman fast bounde layde carre brought trompettes place execucion named ye halle set pillery turned four tymes aboute syght people openly red publysshed dedes tha beheeded quartered quarter sent four chefe gate cytie thus alayne peter rour lost shamfully lyues castell vanchadore pof dedes armes saint ingylvertes contynuyng thyrty dayes agaynste comer realme englande countreys euery man thre course ca clxviii seasone meane tyme truese thus bytwenene englande fraunce bothe lande see though kinges subgiettes helde well peace yet certayne pyllers robber auuergne made warre poore men bothe sydes ryuer dordone capytayns gyue vp fortress reason treatie dyssymuled matter reason dissymulacion coutrey auuergne receyued great domage yt complaintes therof came parys french kyng counsayled sende kynge englande signyfyenge hym state robbes made warre thus countrey vnder coloure patesynge ought nat done thinke king englande excused hym selfe mater prouyde therfore season thre fore sayd knyghtes say yonge bouciquant raynolde roy lorde saint pye enterprised armes march calays nere saynte ingilbertes made redy coplysshe desyre fulfyll promesse right armes openly declared publysshed specyally ye realme englande realme knyghtes squyers quyckened mater gret imagynacios knowe might best said shuld greatly blame reproche enterprise taken nere calays without passed see loke knightes shulde armes suche spake mater first syr iohan holande erle huntyngdon great desyre go thyder also sir iohan courtney sir iohan traicton sir iohan golouffer syr iohan russell syr thomas shyrborne syr willyam clyfton sir willyam clynton sir willym taylboys sir godfrey seta syr willyam hacquenay syr iohan vobeas syr iohan dambretycourt syr henry beamond dyuers mo hudred knightes squters sayd let v prouyde go calays knightes fraunce hath nat ordayned sporte nere march entent se v surely haue done well lyke good companion shall nat fayle busynes matter published abrode englande many suche desyre dedes armes theym selfe yet sayd wolde loke shulde suche thought sent afore calays make prouysion kepe astate sente ouer horse harnes bothe peace warre whan day aproched sir iohn holade brother kyng englade fyrst passed see mo lx knightes squiers hym aryued calys toke vp lodgyng thentryng ye ioly fresshe moueth may thre yong knyghtes frauce suche shulde ded armes saynt ingilbert thus first cae boloyne taryed season came thabbay ingilbert vnderstode great nobre knyghtes squyers coe englande calays wherof ryght ioyfull entent brute shulde coe calays ordayned fayre playne bytwene calays saynt ingilbertes thre fressh grene pauilyos pyght vp entre euery pauylyon hanged two sheldes armes knightes one shelde peace another warre ordayned suche shulde ryn dedes armes shulde touche one sheldes cause touched whiche pleaseth shulde delyuered acordyng desyre speke mater shall shew xxi day moneth may acordyng ben publisshed thre frech knyghtes redy place furnysshe interprice day knightes squyers issued calays suche wolde iust also suche pleasure regarde sporte came sayde place apoynted drewe ye one parte place iust farre grene playne syr iohan holande first sente touche sheld warre sir boucyquant incontynent issued pauylyon redy mounted shelde speare two knightes drewe fro certayne space whan eche well aduysed spurred horse came togyther rudely boucyquante strake erle huntyngton shelde spearcheed glente ouer arme dyd hym hurt passed forthe tourned rested pase course greatly praysed seconde course met without hurte ynge thyrde course horse refused wolde nat cope erle huntyngton gret desyre iust somwhat chafed came place abydynge sir boucyquant shulde take speare dyd nat shewed wolde tynne day agaynst therle whan erle sawe sent squyer touche shelde warre lorde saynt pye wolde nat refuse issued pauylion toke horse shelde speare whan erle sawe redy spurred horse saynt pye lykewyse couched speares metyng horse crossed crossynge speares erle vnhelmed retourned men incontynent rehelmed toke speare saynt pye ran agayne met eche speares myddes sheldes nere hande bothe borne downe erthe gryped fast horse legges saued selfes retourned place toke brethes syr iohan holande great affection honorably toke agayne speare spurred horse whan lorde saynt pye sawe hym comyng dasshed forth horse encountre hym eche strake helmes ye spre flasshed yt ataynt lorde saynt pye vnhelmed passed forthe came agayne owne place course greatly praysed frenche englysshe sayd thre knyghtes erle huntyngton sir bouciquant lorde saynte pye ryght well done deuoyrs without domage eyther agayne erle desyred loue lady haue another course refused sir iohan holand went renke gyue place ronne sire course well valyautly laude honoure partyes stept forth gentle knight englade called erle marshall sent touche shelde warre sir raynolde roy issued pauylyon armed peces toke horse shelde speare whan two knyghtes sonder spurred horse came fyersly togyther first course fayled outragyng horse wherwith sore dyspleased ii course sir raynolde stryken spere broken iii course eche strake helmes wt suche force yt fire slewe therle marshall vnhelmed passed forthe retourned place iusted yt day ynough cae forth ye lorde cl fford right apt valyat knight englade cosyn germayn sir iohn chados noble valiant knight dayes sent touche shelde warre sir bouciquant incontynent knight issued pauilyon wt shelde spere two knightes came rudely togider strake eche ye helm fyre sparcled speares brake nat knightes lost styropes passed came place made redy ryn ii course came togyder wtout sparing sir bouciquat brake spere vnhelmed yet fell nat passed forthe came place sir loyes clifforde made hym iust agayne bouciquant dyd nat put agayne helme yt seyng lorde clifforde aduysed forme course another sente squyer touche ye helde warre ye lorde saynt pye came forthe redy iuste ran toguyder met eche ye lorde clifforde brake speare thre peces ye lorde saynt pyes shelde lorde saynt pye strake lorde clyfforde helme dishelmed passed forche eche drewe place lorde clyfforde ran day shewed hym howe right honorably borne hym selfe daye came forth noble knight englade called sir ry beamode caused touched sir bouciquantes shelde warre soone redy answere ran togyder lorde beamode crossed bouciquant strake hym rudely bare hym therche passed forthe ye knight releued men set agayne hors backe ran togyder two course without mage tha sir peter curency great desyre ryn sixe course caused squyer touche thre sheldes warre wherof ye frechmen marueile dema ded enteded therby answered pleasure ryn eche knight ii course without lette way de yre graunted sir raynolde du royran first came togider good aduysemet howbeit first course fayled horse refused ye cope wherwith sore displeased railed nat ye ii course sir raynold dishelmed englisshe knyght passed forth retourned place held hi styl ron two course ye lorde sair pye ca e forthe iust ran eche agaynst brake speres ii course lorde saint pye strake sir peter courtney crosse sir pet strake hym ye helme vnhelmed hym cae owne place sir bouciquat acoplisshe sir peter desire came forthe ran met eche ye mydd heldes rudely yt horse stakered place hurt nat ye ii course vnhelmed eche vi course done sir peter courtney desyred ryn one course one ye thre knightes pleased refused sayd yt done ynough ye day rested preced forthe getyl man englande called sir iohn gouloufer sent touche ye shelde sir raynolde roy redy answere ran frely togider ataynted eche helmes without dishelmyng brekyng speres passed secode course horse refused mete iii course met sheldes brake staues fourth course mist v course vnhelmed eche retourned place valiant knight englande called sir iohn rolscau well trauelled knight well knowen touched shelde ye lord saint pye yt knight redy answere ran togyder met rudely yt horse stayed ye cope ye ii course horse swarued asyde myst eche wherof knight displeased iii course met strake eche ye viser helmes yt bothe vnhelmed englysshe knyght retourned copany iusted came forthe sir peter shirborne yong knight touched ye sheld sir bouciquant ye knight redy ran togider myst outraging horse taried nat long ran togider agayne ii course strake eche syght helmes sir bouciquates spere brake thenglysshe knyght spere helde yt therby sir boucyquant vnhelmed rudely yt blode ran nose returned pausiyon ran day nere night sir peter shirborne wolde nat leue wolde ryn iii course sent touche shelde lorde saint pye incotynent redy ran togider tainted eche ye helmes speres grated nat moost lykelhod taken hurte ii course strake eche ye sheldes brake staues thre peces theglisshe knight borne therthe ran yt day nere night englysshmen drewe togider deted rode calays deuysed nyght ben done day lykewise frechmen rode saynt ingylbertes comuned deuised yt ben done ye day tuesday masse suche shulde iust day wolde gyue lokyng rode cali came place apoynted frechmen redy receyue day fayre hote whan thenglysshmen armed sir wyllm clyfron expert knight englande caused squier touche targe sir bouciquant incotinent knight issued pauylion armed peces two knightes came toguider taynted eche shelde passed without brekyng speares ii course crossed helmes iii course encountred ech ye sheldes yt horse stode styll iiii course well employed vnhelmed eche englysshe knight ran said hym done ynough theglisshe te came forthe lusty yong knight called sir nicholas clynton touched ye lorde saynt pie shelde knight anon redy met togider euyn yt eche brake speres iii peces suche force yt knight dauger haue taken domage passed cae place ii course tainted eche ye helmes passed ye iii course horse crossed fayled ye iiii course ye lorde saynt pye vnhelmed englysshe knight ran yt daye men said well valiantly done quited hymselfe must haue place iust tha kynsman therle hutingdon cae forthe called wyllm stamert caused touche ye shelde ser raynold roy ran togider wt frewyll tainted eche ye englysshe knight lost spere ii courie met theglisshe knight warued aside nat tell wheder faut knight ye horse sir raynolde strake rudely ye targe yt sore reuersed passed made redy ryn third course tainted eche ye helmes yt fire sprang lost speres ye iiii course ataynted ech ye sight helmes wt course sir wyllm stamert dishelmed nigh borne therthe howbeit fell nat returned copany ran yt day another squier englade cae forth called lacastre sent touche ye shelde sir bou iquant ran togider tainted ech ye helmes yt fire flewe marueyle yt nat ben vnhelmed nat long tyll ran ii course horse crossed thirde course vnhelmed englysshe squyer iusted yt day yonge knight called sir iohn tayl boise iusted lorde saynt pye encoutred eche ye sheldes brake staues ii course horse crossed iii course bothe vnhelmed englisshe knight ran day stepte forthe godfray seca gentyll knight good iuster well sene hym encoutred sir raynolde du roy came right toguyder mette sheldes speres good wolde nat breke yt made horse reeule recouered kepte styll speres ran agayne coude course ressed fante horse nat knyghtes lost bothe staues ran agayne iii course englysshe knight strake sir raynolde helme vnhelmed sir raynolde strake yt englysshe knight targe rudely suche strength called one best iusters realme fraunce also lyued amour yong lady whiche aueyled hym businesse perced theglisshmans targe clene speare heed entred arme spere brake trouchon stacke styll ye shelde knyght arme yet yt knight made turne came place fresshly copany drewe trouchyon bounde arme sir raynolde retourned copany course sir roynolde du roy greatly praysed bothe tie ye hurtyng knight suche aduetures armes good yuell came forthe esquyer englande called balquet sent touche shelde lorde saynt py redy answere couched speares ran toguyder ye first course taynted eche helmes loste staues toke staues agayne ye aprochyng horse crossed passed retourned agayne place taryed nat long ran eche yt course blaque strake ye lorde saynt pye hye ye helme gaue hym sore stroke saynt pye strake sight heelm sorer stroke therwith vnhelmed ye bocle behynde brake helme fell groude blaquet retourned copany iusted day ye lorde saynt pye sate styll horse abyding comer gentyll knight englande called sir iohn bolcas touched shelde lorde saynt pye redy answere strake eche shelde marueile nat perced speres strong passed lost speares without domage ii course taynted helmes without hurte passed ye iii course crossed iiii course lorde saynt pye vnhelmed rude lye sir iohan bolcas course englisshe knight ran yong knyght englande richely armed named thomelyn massydone touched ye shelde warre sir bouciquant incontynent answered first course crossed helmes ii course met thomelyn brake spere trochions bouciquant strake hym sore bare hym erthe ouer horse backe copanyon toke hym vp iusted another squier englande called nauerton touched shelde sir bouciquant sayeng howe wolde reuenge company bouciquant ouerthrowen psence redy answere first course strake eche viser helmes without mage ii course strake eche sheldes yt horse reculed brake speares thre peces retourned place toke newe speares met agayne togyder sir bouciquant receyued great stroke ye shelde strake nauerton suche wyse vnhelmed ran day euery man sayde well acquyted hym selfe another squyer called sequaqueton experte man armes sente touche shelde sir raynolde du roye knyght redy answere well mouted shelde speare mette rudely sequaqueton bare hym selfe well fro fallynge suche stroke sore reuersed howbeit releued passed forthe lost spere next course meete rudely helmes fyre flasshed iii course sequaqueton vnhelmed bothe horse astonyed retourned company iusted day man el night aproched englysshe men retourned calys frechmen saynt ingylbertes ye may well knowe charles frenche kyng sore desyrous iustes yonge lyght spiryte glad se newe thynges shewed fro begynning thendyng present disgysed vnknowen none knewe hym lorde garasyers cae also hym vnknowen euery day returned margison ye wednisday englisshmen rode fro calais came place ye iustes squier englande called iohn sauage sente touche shelde warre sir raynold roy knight redy pauylion issued mouted horse tha came togider great randon strake eche sheldes suche wise sheldes nat broken outher one men bothe ben striken ye groude goodly daungerous course howbeit knight toke domage speres brake hades heed stacke styll sheld euery man fered ben hurt euery tie cae copany whan knowen hurt euery man ioyfull sayd howe done ynough day wordes pleased nothyng iohan sauage sayd nat come ouer see ryn one course word shewed sir raynolde du roy answered sayd reason aunswered outher copany toke newe sheldes speares ran agayne toguyder cope horse crossed fayled ech wherwith sore displeased angre cast awaye speres toke newe thirde course taynted eche syght helmes suche wyse bothe vnhelmed euery man praysed course englysshe men came iohan sauage said howe ryght honorably acquyted hymselfe daye howe done ynough ryn obeyed ran lyghted horse lept small hackeney rynne squyer englande came forthe cosyn erle marshall called wyllyam basquenaye touched shelde sir bouciquant knyght redy answere came togyder streyght coude deuyse strake eche syght helmes suche wyse yt bothe vnhelmed passed forthe course frake frely anone agayne helmed ran togider strake eche sheldes brake speares withoute domage thirde course crossed wherwith sore displeased fourthe course wyllm basquenay agayne vnhelmed ran daye another englysshe squyer called scot ran agayne lorde saynt pye fyrst course encoutred rudely yt horse stakered speres helde yet lost speres made redy ryn seconde course met suche wyse yt lorde saynt pye vnhelmed squier moche praysed course agayne thirde course encoutred eche ye sheldes suche wyse iohn scot stryken downe ouer horse crope thus lorde saynt pye reueged theglyssh squyer releued brought copany ran day another englysshe squyer called bernarte stapleton touched shelde ye lorde saynt pye came togider taynted eche helmes yt fyre flasshed passed without domage kepte styll speres ii course mette sheldes rudely yet kept horse passed forth course thirde course vnhelmed eche thenglyssh squyer ran daye stepte forthe gentyll knyght englande yonge fresshe iolly daucer synger called sir iohn arudell ran agayne ser raynold du roy first course mette rudely strake eche sheldes helde selfes without fallynge passed forthe course lost staues ii course attaynted eche helmes sparcles fyre flewe without domage iii course crossed loste staues iiii course taynted helmes v course brake speres sheldes sir iohn arudell ran day another squyer englade called nicholas scon proper man armes ran agaynst sir bouciquat first course strake eche helmes great attaynt ii course strake eche sheldes suche wyse horse astonyed lost speares ye iii course strake eche helmes nicholas seon vnhelmed ran another squyer came forthe called iohn marshall ran agaynst sir bouciquant redy lokyng nothyng iust toke speare couched rest first course mette rudelye sheldes lost staues seconde course taynted helmes third course aduysed well eche met rudely iohan marshall brake staffe thre peces sir boucyquant strake hym helme suche wyse vnhelmed returned ran yt day cae forthe lusty yonge knight englande desyred greatly wyn honour called sir iohn clinton bare syluer broken azure molet syluer ye chefe touched ye shelde sir reynold du roye redy answere gladde comynge knyght came place toke speares fyrst course taynted helmes passed forthe seconde course strake eche sheldes passed lost staues thirde course taynted helmes fyre flewe oute fourthe course crossed fythe course well enployed eche brake speares two knyghtes sore chafed shewed well howe gret desyre proue selfes sixte course eche vnhelmed course greatly praysed englysshe knight ran daye done ynoughe thanne roger leau another englysshe squyer auaunced forthe bare syluer sable quarterly myddes crosse goules touched shelde lorde sait pye first course encountred rudely horse astonied speares helde seconde course taynted helmes passed forthe thirde course roger leau vnhelmed ranne auaused forthe ryght gentyll knight nacyon heynaulte marchesse ostrenaunt fro youthe brought vp courte noble kynge edwarde englande knyght called sir iohan dambrety court brother good knyght sir eustace bare armure partie golde ermyne touched shelde sir raynolde du roye fyrste course taynted helmes fyre folowed secode course entred rudely marueyle howe scaped without domage eche noble iusters feared nother payne dethe thirde course sir raynolde du roye rudely vnhelmed sir iohan dambretycourt passed forthe turne came agayne place sir raynolde du roye retourned company shewed howe wolde iuste daye englysshe knight desyring iust sent touche shelde sir boucyquant ran toguyder fiersly strake eche sheldes marueyle nat ben pearced throughe seconde course taynted helmes passed forthe lost speares thirde course mette rudely eche vnhelmed englysshe men drewe toguyder sawe nerehande nyght toke leaues deted towarde calais nyght none comunynge iustes hadde ben done day frenche men wente margyson deuysed pleasure thursdaye fourthe day weke englysshe men calais assembled togider suche nat iusted come ouer see entent cocluded returne agayne saynte ingylbertes armes mouted horse rode calays came ye place iustes shulde done redy thre knightes fraunce pauylions suche shulde serue fyrst came place knight engla de called sir godfray eustace touched ye shelde sir boucyquant incontyuent issued pauylion redy answere knyghtes aduysed eche ran toguyder taynted helmes passed forthe course kept styll staues seconde course strake eche myddes sheldes speares brake without domage passed forthe came agayne place thirde course eche vnhelmed englysshe knight iusted sayd hym right valyauntly acquyted hym selfe also must suffre iuste englysshe squier came forthe iuste called alayne borowe touched shelde lorde saynt pye knyght redy answere fyrste course taynted helmes fyre flewe passed forthe course returned agayne place ye seconde course brake bothe staues iii course vnhelmed eche englyssh man ran behoued iust another englysshe squyer called scrope touched shelde sir bouecyquant fyrste course crossed seconde course taynted helmes thirde course scrope ouerthrowen tha releued brought company ran knyght behaygne one quene englandes knyghtes called herchaunce bare armes syluer thre gryffens fete sable armed azure demaunded whome wolde iuste answered bouciquant made redy ran toguyder knyght behaygne made forfaite wherof greatly blamed yt demeaned course yuell englysshe men sawe well howe forfaite armure horse frenche men wolde course great comunycacyon bytwene party finally pardoned better please englysshe men herchauce requyred agayne iuste one course demaunded whome wolde ryn sente touche shelde sir raynolde du roy redy answere fyrst course mette myddes sheldes sir raynolde du roye one best iusters ye realme frauce strake thother knight clene fro horse suche wyse menne thought deed herchaunce moche payne releued broght company englisshe men nat displeased ouerthrowen bicause ran fyrste course vngoodly ran daye came squyer englande called robert storborne touched shelde ye lorde saynt pye redy answere fyrst course taynted helmes secode course strake sheldes lost speares thirde course eche vnhelmed englysshe squyer ran iohn morlande touched shelde ser raynold du roy redy answere first course taynted helmes seconde course encountred eche horse astonyed loste bothe staues thirde course iohan morlande stryken grounde releued iusted thanne another squyer called iohan moten touched shelde bouciquant knyght redy first course taynted passed forthe seconde course taynted helmes lost staues thirde course iohan moton vnhelmed ranne daye gaue place iaqueuyne scrope touched shelde lorde saynt pye redy mounted fyrst course horse crossed wherwith sore displeased seconde course taynted helmes fyre flewe lost speres thirde course iaqueuyne scrope brake speare lorde saynt pye strake hym rudely yt fell ouer horse crope erthe releued ranne daye another squier cae forthe called guyllyam maquelee ran agaynst sir boucyquaunt redy answere firste course taynted helmes fyre flewe ye course praysed euery partie seconde course strake eche sheldes loste staues thirde course vnhelmed eche bothe sate bareheeded coyfes ran daye done yough another squyer englande called nycholas leau touched shelde lorde saynt pye redy answere first course strake eche sore ye sheldes staues nat broken ben great domage helde selfes well fro fallyng secode cope attaynted eche helmes fyre flewe oute stroke crossed passed thyrde goodly course strake eche euin ye sight helmes eche vnhelmed clerely helmes flewe felde ouer horse cropes iusters ceased daye none englisshe man offred iust day erle huntyngdon erle marshall lorde clyfforde lorde beamont sir iohan clynton sir iohan dambretycourt sir peter shyrborne knyghtes iusted four dayes french knightes thanked greatly pastaunce said syrs suche wolde iuste partie haue accomplisshed desyres wherfore nowe wyll take leaue wyll returne calays englande knowe well euer wyll iust shall fynde thyrty dayes acordynge tenoure chalenge one come englande knightes desyre dedes armes shall desyre come vysite thre knyghtes thanked sayd shall right hertely welcome shall delyuer acordynge ryght armes haue done ouer thanke curtesy yt ye haue shewed v thus curtes maner englysshe men departed fro saynte ingilbertes rode calays taryed nat longe saturdaye toke shyppynge sayled douer noone sondaye rode rochester nexte day london euery man owne thre frenche knyghtes kepte styll place saynt ingylbertes frenche kinge lorde garancyers ben season vnknowen whan englysshe men departed neuer seased rydynge tyll came crayll ryuer oyse quene tyme englysshe men came englande herde nat mo came ouer dedes armes saynte ingylbertes howe thre frenche knyghtes helde styll place tyll thyrty dayes accomplysshed leysar retourned euery manne came parys se kyng duke thourayne lordes parys tyme made good chere reason requyred valyauntly borne selfe wherby atcheued gret honour kyng realme fraunce pof enterpryse voyage knyghtes fraunce englande duke burbone chefe army requeste genouoys go barbary besiege strong towne auffryke cap clxix shall nowe declare maner hygh noble enterprise done seaso knightes frauce england countreys realme barbary syth haue concluded armes doone saynt ingylbertes nowe wyll shewe mater great pleasure declare pleasure nat inclyned write enquyre trouthe many matter neuer come ende haue done nowe sayeth texte mater wyll procede yt season newes spredde abrode fraunce dyuers coutreys genouoys wolde make army go barbary gret prouysion well bysquet fresshe water wyneger gale vesselles knyghtes squyers wolde go voyage cause moued thus shall shewe alonge tyme affrycans made warre see fronters genouoys pylled robbed ilandes suche obeysant also ryuer gene lay euer parell daunger auffryke whiche stronge towne ye party garnysshed gate towres hyghe thycke walles depe dyke lyke stronge towne calays key wherby soeuer lord therof may entre realme fraunce flaunders pleasure maye see lande sodenly inuade great puyssaunce many great feates lyke wyse comparyson towne auffryke key barbaryns realme auffryke realmes bougne thunes realmes infydeles party towne dyd moch dyspleasure genouoys greate marchauntes aufryke often tymes taken ye see went returned fro feate marchaundyses genouoys ryche puyssaunt bothe lande see hauyng great sygnories regarded dedes affrycans also consydred complayntes suche isle vnder obeysaunce isle dable isle syre isle guerse isle bostan isle gorgennem vnto ye gulfe lyon isle sardonne finisse vnto isle mayllorke whiche thre isle vnder obeysaunce kynge aragon genouoys comon acorde agreed sende frenche courte offre knightes squiers wolde go siege towne aufryke fynde galees vessel charged bysquet swete water wyneger coste charge one frenche kynges vncles el brother duke thourayn yonge lusty lykely conquere honour shulde capytayne generall genouoys furthermore promised xii thousande crosbowes genouoys well furnysshed eyght thousande speares pauesses cost charge genouoys dyde bycause knewe trewce bytwene englande fraunce thre yere wherfore supposed knyghtes iquyers well frauce englande wolde glad doynge parte whan tydynges came first frauce voyage knightes squiers countrey right ioyfull messangers fro genne aunswered shulde nat departe tyll well herde haue socour request reasonable augmentynge crysten faythe thus caused tary season parys debate mater se shulde chefe soueraygne armye voyage whome euery man shulde obey duke thourayne owne volutary wyll offred hym selfe go kyng vncles wolde wyse agree therto sayenge howe voyage hym consydred well howe yt genouoys desyred outher haue el one kynges vncles agreed duke burbone vncle kynge shulde souerayne chefe armye shulde haue company lorde coucy whan ambassadours gene aunswered concluded without fayle yt shulde haue ayde knightes squyers fraunce kynges vncle duke burbone souerayne chefe capytayne wherof ambassadours well contente toke leaue kynge counsayle retourned owne coutrey tydinges anon spred abrode yt realme fraunce af voyage barbary plesaunt nat delectable many wolde haue gone wente nat none went owne charge coste lorde sente owne seruauntes also ordeyned none shuld passe nacyon fraunce without lycence kynge kynge wolde nat many shulde haue gone leaue realme destitute knyghtes squyers also agreed varlettes shulde passe gentle men men feate defence also please nacyons knyghtes squiers straungers fre lyberty come entre honorable voyage wherof knyghtes straungers greatly praysed frenche kynge counsayle dede duke burbone one chefe realme sent incontynent officer gennes make prouysyon acordynge astate gentle erle auuergne sent also gennes make prouysions lorde coucy nat behynde also syr guy de la tremoyle sir iohan vyen admyrall fraunce lordes knightes suche ordeyned go voyage sent make prouysions euery man degre also dyd sir philyppe de arthoys erle eawe sir phylip bare lorde harcourt sir henry dantoinge also bretayne normandy many lordes aparelled selfes go barbary also haynalt lorde ligne lord haureth flaunders great uysion made also duke lacastre bastard sonne called henry lancastre deuocion go ye voyage prouyded good knightes squyers englande acompanyed hym voyage erle foiz sent bastarde sonne called iobbayne foiz well prouyded knightes squiers bierne euery man prouyded selfes nobly eche myddes may yt furthest fro gene set forwarde come gennes whereas ye assemble apoynted galees vesselles assembled moneth coude assemble genouoys right ioyfull comyng gaue great presentes chiefe lordes better therby wynne loues nombred whan togyther ye marshal xiiii hundred knyghtes squyers entred galees vesselles prouyded well furnisshed thynges necessary thus departed fro porte gennes aboute feest mydsomer yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore ten great pleasure behold departynge se standardes getorns penons wanynge wynde shynynge sonne ye trompettes claryons sownyng ayre mynstrelsy fyrste night lay ancre entryng high see varlettes horse abode behynde horse worthe fyfty frankes departyng solde ten frankes many knyghtes squiers wyste nat whan shulde returne coulde nat haue fyue horse kept gennes franke daye therfore departynge made money lytell hudred galees garnisshed men warre crosbowes pauesses mo c vessel laden uysion necessaryes next day breke daye weyed ancres rowed day force owers nyght folowynge costyng lade thyrde day came portefyn cast ancre taryed night next day came another porte towne called porte veder taryed refresshed next day passed gret see name god lady saynte george firste founde isle dable yt isle guerfe isle argenen isle sardyns passed gulfe lyon daungerous doutfull passage coulde nat eschewe waye yt toke great parell haue ben lost season troublus tempestes terryble ye wysest maryner yt coulde gyue cousaile abyde adueture wyll god wherby flete departed sonder wyst neuer tempest endured day night whan tepest sest ye wyndes pacifyed patron pylottes set course drawe isle comeres xxx myle fro auffryke fro towne thyder entented go goynge gulfe lyon patrones sayde one nother fortune driuen sonder force wynde wether lette v drawe isle comeres lette v tary eche hadde deuysed dyd fyrst came thyder taryed tyll last came coulde assemble togyder nyne day isle co mere pleasaut isle thought nat gret lordes refresshed theym thanked god whhan sawe loste none company thanne lordes patron toke counsayle best consyderinge nere ye towne aufryke pnowe wyll leaue speke lordes fraunce season speke mater done season fraucel specyally countrey auuergne march lande erle dolphyn forthe sayd voyage pof capytayne robber pyller countrey called aymergot marcell helde stronge castell march rouergne called roche vandois howe besieged vicount meaulx takynge therof howe aymerygotte taken brought parys cap clxx season whyle asseble making go barbary good entente exalte cristen faythe certayne robber pyllers auuergne rouergne lymosyn contrary myndes though coutreis thought themselfe suretie reason chartre treuce taken bytwene englande fraunce whiche ben claymed publysshed fortress capitayns made warre helde fortress englissh parte artycle euer brake violated poynt artycle comprised treaty shuld receyue punyssyon dethe without hope remyssion specially perot le bernoys capytayne caluset amergot marcell olyue barbe capytayne dousac march auuergne enclosed name charter treuse entent dyd consented thynge contrary yt shulde nat ercuse selfe capytayns feared dye shamfull dethe rynne indygnacion frenche kynge helde surely poyntes charter dyd nat whiche derely bought ye shall ye shall knowe hath ben rehersed howe iohan erle armynake bernarde dolphyn auuergne therle clermounte treatie certayne capytayns helde fortress said coutreys agaynst frenche kynge sayd lordes made suche dylygence brought dyuers capytayns composycion sellyng fortress treaty composicyon yt shulde renounce warre bytwene englande fraunce durynge treuce go erle armynake lombardy whyder wolde leade ayde hym warre gaynst lorde galea erle vertues disheryted cosyn germayns chyldren vncle lorde barnabo hath ben shewed haue ayde auoyde countrey robber pyllers done moche hurte countrey bothe men woman sayd erle armynake erle dolphyn cosyn toke gret payne mater instant requestes prayer good menne cyties townes playne countreys aforesayd tayle gadred auuergne guynaldan rouergne carnosyn lymosyn ye two hundred thousande frankes poore riche payed somoch dyuers solde layde pledge herytages glad lyue reste countreys good men thought reson payeng money aduoydyng sayd fyue robber pyllers shulde haue ben quyte euer proued nat dyuers place specially aymergot marcell men castell aloys yelden vp solde aymergot marcell erle armynake whiche fortresse stode herte auuergne aymergot well worthe redy money hudred thousande frankes whiche goten robory pyllage raunsominge men patesynge countrey kept ye rule ten yere therle armynake desyred gretly haue company sayd aymergot mercell thought nat leaue behynd two reason one bycause wolde gladly haue counsayle aduyse hym experte subtyle feates armes sautynge sealynge stealynge fortress seconde reason erle feared aymergot shulde byde behynde countrey thoughe hadde solde hym fortresse aloyse fortress yet might moche domage coutrey auuergne rouergne wherfore therle made great labour haue hym alwayes aymergot dissymuled mater said whan se certayne erle armynakes departyng knowe myne owne wyll good yt wyll nat byde behynde aunswere erle coulde nat get hym erle armynake laye commynge aboute tholousyn countrey made assemble whiche voyage hasted voyage auffryke hadde nat letted hym season dyuers knyghtes squyers went voyage promysed hym voyage barbary came sodenly hyndred voyage whan tydynges knowen fraunce treaty erle armynake made sayde capytayns auuergne made moche haste myght pay money capytayns aymergot marsell sore dyspleased hym selfe solde deliuered stronge castell aloyse sawe owne auctorite therby greatly abated parceyued well howe lesse feared season kept doubted feared honoured men warre parte kept great astate alwayes castell aloyse patesynge countreys helde vnder subiection well worth yerely twenty thousande florayns whan remembred soroufull tresour thought wolde nat mynysshe wonte dayly serche newe pyllages wherby encresed profyte sawe closed fro hym sayde imagyned pyll robbe thynge consydered good lyfe repented hym good tyme said olde companyons sir sporte glory worlde amonge men warre vse suche lyfe haue done tyme past ioy v whan rode forthe aduenture somtyme foude way ryche priour marchaunt route mulettes mountpellyer narbone lymons fongans besyers tholous carcassone laden clothe bruselles peltre ware comynge fro fayres laden spycery fro bruges fro dama fro alysauder euer met el raunsomed pleasure dayly gate newe money vyllaynes auuergne lymosyn dayly prouyded brought castell whete mele breed redy baken otes horse lytter good wynes beffes fatte mottons pullayne wyldefoule euer furnysshed though ben king whan rode forth ye coutrey trymbled feare goynge comynge howe toke carlaste bourge compayne perot bernoys tooke caluset howe dyd scale lytell ayde stronge castell marquell pertayninge erle dolphyn kepte nat past fyue dayes receyued fayre table fyue thousande frankes forgaue one thousande loue erle dolphyns chyldren faythe fayre good lyfe wherfore repute self sore disceyued haue rendred vp fortres aloys wolde haue ben kepte fro worlde daye gaue vp fournysshed vytayles haue kepte seuen yere without reuytaylynge erle armynake hathe dysceyued olyue barbe perotle bernoys shewed howe shulde repente selfe certayne sore repent haue done whan suche companyons serued hym longe herde hym speke wordes parceyued well howe spake herte vnfayned sayd hym aymergot redy yet serue lette v renewe agayne warre lette v gette stronge holde auuergne lymosyn let v fortifye syr shall soone recouer domages shall make goodly flyght auuergne lymosyn nowe erle dolphyn hugh brother countrey dyuers knightes squyers company voyage barbary specyally lorde coucy hath souerayne regarde vnder kynge march therfore shall nat nede feare hym duke berrey parys thus shall haue nowe good season well quod aymergot haue good wyll thus sauynge ame name expressed chartre treuce syr quod company ye nede nat care therfore ye lyste ye nat subiecte frenche kynge ye owe hym nother faythe obeysayunce ye kynge englandes manne herytage whiche dystroyd lost lyeth lymosyn syr must lyue though make warre lyue englysshmen wyll nat myscontent v suche case wyll drawe v syr haue nowe good tytle make warre nat auuergne couenaunte made bounde vnto lette v sende vyllayns vyllages whanne one stronge holde commaunde paye v truage el make theym sore warre well syrs quod aymergot fyrst lette v prouyde stronge place abyde drawe vnto whan nede theym sayde syr knowe stronge holde lytell newe fortifyenge pertaynynge herytage lorde towre man kepeth lette v drawe thyder fortifye may ease rynne auuergne lymosyn lyeth place quod aymergot syr quod within leage towre called roche vandoys trewe quod aymergot knowe well mete place v lette v go thyder fortify thus purpose concluded day assembled togyther wente roche vandoys aymergote auewed place se worthe fortifyenge therof whan well auewed sytuacion therof defence myght made pleased hym ryght well thus toke fortifyed lytell lytell began dyspleasure countrey whan sawe place stronge sufficyently resyst gaynste syege assaute well horsed well prouyded thynges necessary defence beganne ryde abrode countrey tooke prisoner raunsomed prouyded holde flesshe meale waxe wyne salte yron stele necessaryes came nothynge amysse theym without hadde ben heuy hote countrey aboute people wenynge haue ben reste peace reason truce made bytwene two kinges realmes began sore abasshed robber pyllers toke house euer founde feldes laborynge called selfes aduenturers whanne lorde towre knewe suche neyghbours nere hym nat well assured hym selfe fortifyed made good watche townes castelles countesse dolphyn ryght valyaunt lady great prudence beinge chyldren good towne stronge castell called sardes nat well assured selfe whan herde aymergotte company fortifyed yt roche vandoys sent incontynente castell furnysshed men warre marquell oudable chyllac blere place entente shulde nat surprysed greatly douted aymergot bycause hadde one paymente fyue thousande florayns surely countrey auuergne lymosyn began greatlye frayde thanne knyghtes squyers men good townes cleremount mounte ferante ryon determyned sende frenche kinge dyd meane season whyle sayde countesse good men countrey dyd sende frenche kinge duke berrey parys aymergot company fortifyed greatly roche vandoys first made lodgynge horse whan aduetures discharged wage herde howe aymergot made warre agayne ryght ioyfull therof many came hym anone mo robber pyllers wolde haue demaunded wage hym onely myght bande suche myght company knewe well shulde lyghtly wynne somewhat habandoned robbe pyll thus rode vp downe made selfe knowen dyuers place spekynge auuergne lymosyn roche vandoys coutrey sore afrayde caluset wherof perotte le bernoys capytayne helde kepte fermely treuce made whan sawe aymergot marcell ouer ranne countrey sore dyspleased hym sayde howe dyd yuell sent hym worde none shulde come caluset none place rewle aymergot cared nothynge hadde place ynowe drawe vnto besyde menne ynowe dayly encreased suche mynded yuell drewe hym dayly perot bernoys charged suche vnder reule payne lyues none shulde ryde domage neighbour sayde wolde surely kepe trewce olyue barbe captayne ousac dyssymuled mater sayeng howe wolde kepe treuce howe shewed men somtyme wolde ryde forthe secretlye wanne wolde haue profyte therof men countreys cleremount mount ferant ryon goynge message frenche kynge duke berrey sped iourneys came parys founde kynge duke berrey duke thourayne constable fraunce sir olyuer clysson came fyrste duke berrey counsayle shewed cause commyng howe aymergot marcell made warre dystroyed countrey auuergne howe yuell people daily multyplyed wherfore desyred goddessake haue remedy sayenge yuell people shulde longe contyne wolde distroy countrey auuergne fronters lymosyn whan tydynges came kynge duke berrey sore dyspleased thought peace reason treuce kyng demaunded garyson caluset ousac dyd yuell nat aunswered sayd complayned man al onely aymergot marcell company hathe fortifyed roche vandoys thanne kynge duke berrey aunswered sayd syrs ye good people take good herde selfes shall prouyde shortely remedy ye shall well perceyue retourne place shewe aunswere theym sente hyther good men auuergne well content aunswere taryed two dayes thanne retourned toke leaue specyally duke berrey departed frenche kynge counsayle forgate nat tydynges duke berrey whome matter touched greatly bycause helde great herytages auuergne therfore auaunced busynesse ye haue herde howe lorde coucy ordayned kynge cousayle capitayne haue soueraygne rewle countrey fro see rochell vnto ryuer dordone burdeaux ryuer geron lorde coucy nat countrey goynge voyage barbary lordes fraunce countreis howe departynge ordayned cosyn sir robert bethune vycount meaulx lyeutenaunt sayde countrey kyng sayde howe moost metest vycount meaulx shulde haue charge voyage go laguedocke rather thane persone coude ryuer marne kynge wrote hym messangere founde hym wyfe counde delyuered letter fro frenche kynge vycount receyued theym whane knewe mente sayde wolde obey kynges commaudement prepared hym selfe soone myght departed fro coude rode long cae parys founde kynge counsayle sayd vnto hym vycount make redy assemble men warre retynue ye must go auuergne thes pyllers robber whome aymergotte mercell chiefe enfourmed distroyech sore traueyleth good people ye moche driue theym countrey ye maye attrap sayde aymergotte bring hym v shall haue great ioye therof ordayned shalbe delyuered suche somme money cleremount shall suffyce men warre go fro hen thider speke oure treasourers shall delyuer expense make haste requyreth dyligence vycount aunswered howe redy went lodging wrote letter knyghtes squyers frauce picardy acquayntaunce retynewe hast shulde mete hym charter make muster wrote vnto obeyed loued vycount helde hym good capitayne came cytie charter day prefyxed assembled two hudred speares good men warre whane assembled departed fro charter tooke waye towardes auuergne came burbonoys tidynges came auuergne howe socours comyng fraunce wherof countrey reioysed nedefull men warre came thyder soone dyde hadde taryed sixe dayes lengar aymergot marcell bande thought haue ouer ronne playne countrey bytwene cleremount moutferante ryon ganape made voyage hadde done great dommage countrey valewe hundred thousande frankes marchesse laye rychesse auuergne man shulde haue resysted countrey thane voyde man warre also brute aymergotte mercelles company farre mo nombre thane dede aymergotte redy haue made iourney tidynges came hym howe soeuer pylgrimes espyes vycout meaulx great company comynge agaynst hym make hym warre putte hym fortresse roche vandoys newes letted enterprice kepte hym selfe within holde thought shulde besieged aymergot marcell began dought repented hym hadde done knewe well takenne shulde raunsome go hym thanne sayd company shamed haue beleued yuell counsayle couytousnesse shall distroye without haue conforte thane sayde hym sir dought ye thus haue sene hardyest man armes marchesse haue good garyson well prouyded men defence loue well defende oure bodyes ye defende ye lese nothynge must lese also aduenture ye taken ye shall make fynaunce accordynge reason ye haue good ynoughe haue nothynge taken lyeth heedes gette none remission shall sell ou lyues dere lette v defende selfe aswell nat abasshed thynge se thynke shall natte nede care siege lette v warre wisely thus companyons conforted aymergot marcell vycounte meaulx company came forward tyll came moleyns burbonoys duchesse burbone doughter erle dolphyn receyued vycount knightes ryght honorably made theym dyne passed forthe laye nyght saynt pursant fro then ganape argre prose ryon fro then cleremount well receyued bysshoppe theym towne men warre money tayle gadered delyuered cleremont thanne passed forthe came oure lady dorinall four leages fro roche va doyes vycount rested sente knyghtes squyers auuergne lymosyn assembled nombre foure hundred speares one hundred cro bowes genowayes vycounte meaulxe lorde montague vermendisyens brother lorde dommart sir bernard de la ryuer sir guyllyam butler lorde domme lorde de la roche lorde towre sir loys dambyer lorde saynt ampysse sir robert dalphyn dyuers capitayns genowayes two valyaunt squyers one named aubert nespynolle callenace chefe stewarde vycount meaulx gentyll squyer called loyes lesglynell genowayes cro bowes armed peces elles shulde nat haue past wage vycount whane aymergot marcell guyotdu sall vncle vnderstode men war fraunce picardy auuergne gene come lady dornall mynded come laye siege holde roche va doys aduysed best make defence firste consydred well kepe horse seyng shulde besieged nat farre fro roche vandois another stronge holde called saynt souperye vnder rule aymergotte mercell wyfe thyder sente page horse moost parte rychesse roche vandoys well fortifyed stode stronge grounde lorde towre sore blamed countrey lefte place vnfortifyed vnprouyded comonly sayde auuergne yt myght thanke lorde towre domage taken bicause might well haue kepte roche vandoys wolde nat haue kepte cost myght haue delyuered men countre yt myght haue rased suche wyse shulde nat haue ben tenable left walles hole entyer founde roche vandoys sette amonge highe mountayns rocke standeth parte one syde walles rocke fortifyed coude nat assayled fore parte scrymysshynge vycount meaulx deted fro lady dorcynall knightes squyers genouoys cro bowes came roche vandoys lyke good men warre layde siege lytell lytell amended lodgynges whane countesse alfyne beinge sardes knewe trewe tidynges roche vadoys besieged right ioyfull bycause thought vicount meaulx come farre frauce picardy brought hym tentes pauilyons ordayned hym two fayre good tentes parteyning therle dolphyn sente vycount maner lendynge hym durynge siege vycount toke present good gree recomaunded hym hertely countesse thakyng tentes sente hym shulde hym good seruyce lorde towre owne countrey within myle castell owne yt lacked nothyng knyghtes squiers made prouision well myght vitaylles plentie fro partes resonable price season fayre drie hote ye moneth august knyghtes co panyons refresshed theym selfes vnder grene bowes tidynges came hoost dyde put lordes companyons dout shewed garisons ennemyes caluset dousacke assembled toguyder determyned morenynge awake hoost ware reyse siege vycount meaulx knyghtes toke counsayle togyder determyned sende heraude perot bernoys capitayne calusette olyue barbe capitayne dousac knowe myndes entent nat surprised myght assured englysshe garysos accordyng aunswere agayne therafter prouyde selfe sente heraude enstructed hym shulde saye heraulde departed fro hoost rode caluset thereby aduenture founde perotte barryers many company sportyng castyng stone messanger lyghted horse demaunded capitayne brought hym whan came hym dyde message fro poynt poynt perot le bernoys sayde heraude saye youre maysters wyll holde kepe affermely trewly truece taken bytwene englande fraunce lyke maner wolde shulde kepe v knowe wyll breke vyolate peace maner incydent maye take shall suche correctyon aparteyneth doone haue promysed wyll ye saye youre maysters loke aymergotte hath done without counsayle neuer shewed v purpose dyde charge hym shulde nat medyll seignorie dyde shulde haue yuell ende heraulde hadde fortresse dyned tooke leaue gyuen hym ten frankes departed demauded way dousacke founde olyue barbe capitayne fortresse heraulde spake hym lyke maner hadde doone perot le bernoys olyue barbe answered wyse wolde breke treuse bycause wolde nat dishonored gaue hym ten frankes departed retourned mayster ye roche vandoys knyghtes sore desyrous tidynges drewe vycout heraude shewed ben calyset dousacke answere capitayns vicount praysed moche perotte le bernoyes olyue barbe doute contynued siege siege beyng roche vandoys euery day scrimysshing often tymes hurte shotte genouoys cro bowes genouoys good shoters thus siege cotynued nyne wekes thenterprice garyson greatlye aduauntage within shall shewe maner howe certayne place might issue pleasure dispyght ennemyes shulde haue kepte fro issue nede haue mo sixe men thus durynge siege aymergot ryght ymaginatife consydred thynges sawe well howe nat done well tourne dede good maner thentent roche vandoys shulde styll remayne wt hym sent englande varlet letter credence kynge englande duke lancastre purpose brake mynde vncle called guyot du sall man thre score yere age greatlye vsed dedes armes knewe moche ye worlde whan aymergote shewed hym maner howe wolde sende englade guyotte well agreed therto sayde howe sende wyse man thyder coulde hurte sente varlet ben brought vp among aymergot enstructed hym sayde shall sette house saue garde peryll thou shalte haue golde syluer ynoughe thou shalte go englande letter one kynge another duke lacastre thirde kynges counsayle letter credence wyll demaunde occasyon thy comynge thyder thou hast made thy recomendacion thou shalte saye yt aymergot mercell poore soudyour subiecte redy good wyll seruyce enclosed beseged lytell fortresse parteyning feaultie lymosyn belongyng kynge englandes herytage lye siege traueyleth taketh great payne daylye wyn v dothe defende fortresse capitayne without lorde cosyn lorde coucy called sir robert vycount meaulx set frenche kyng therfore desyre kynge counsayle specially duke lancastre hath souerayne gouernaunce burdeloys kyng englades heritage tie wolde please write comaunde vycount meaulx dete fro siege reyse army write vycount breke peace taken balyngham bytwene boloygne calays bycause doute aunswere vicount wyll make letter somwhat stronge fro warde therfore desyre maye haue lykewyse letter fro kyng counsayle fro duke lancastre duke berrey duke berrey wyll incontynent siege shall raysed suretie desyre haue ye knight honoure kynges house duke lancaster suche one duke berrey knoweth lordes fraunce shewe hym fro shall gyue hym c frankes remembre wordes thy message acordingly shewe thou spekest withall lytell fortresse haue fortified maye abyde styll englysshe shall come well poynte specially wyll make warre party kynge englande fortresse stadeth fro ters countrey therby maye season auuergne lymosyn two thousande frankes whan aymergot marcell guyotdu sall vncle well enstructed varlet letter credence written sealed delyuerd varlet departed nyght well accompanyed conueyed fote another fortresse teynynge aymergot called saint soupery toke horse suche wolde chose hadde great iourney ryde rode forthe realme frauce lyke frenche man auuergne came calais acquaynted hym selfe capitayne sir iohan beauchampe shewed hym parte busynesse entent haue soner passage came douer toke iourney lodon fortune kynge englande two vncles duke lancastre kynges cousayle tyme palais westmynster counsayling mater northumberlande scottes helde nat well truese complayntes made tyme aymergottes varlet came lodon toke lodgynge shewed host parte ye cause commynge host brought hym westmynster caused hym firste speke duke lancastre chambre went counsayle ye varlet delyuered hym letter duke toke reed drewe hym parte demaunded credence varlet shewed hym hole mater ye haue herde duke herde hym well demaunded mo letter sayd letter kyng counsayle well quod duke shall cause haue audyence duke went counsayle whan sawe hour tyme moued varlettes mater duke aduauncement varlet sente delyuered kyng cousayle letter opyned reed demaunded credece varlet hardy nat abasshed shewed businesse aymergot marcell right sagely better assured bycause euery man gaue hym good audiece whan said moche wolde tha answered kyng wolde take cousayle mater make answere went counsayle chambre taryed tyll answere aunswere kynge wolde write vycount meaulx also duke berrey accordyng aymergot requyred lykewise promysed duke lancastre whan letter writen gentylman duke lancastres apoynted bere letter passed see went derby heralde better forther mater bycause aquaynted lordes auuergne specially duke berrey gentylman duke lancaster named herbery went better wyll bycause varlette promysed hym behalfe aymergot hundred frakes thus thre departed came douer fro then tyde cali whan horse vnshypped toke waye boloygne throughe picardy went parys fro then auuergne whan approched nere lymogines coutre roche va doyes sette rode secretely come thyder thus haue shewed thes messangers dyde moche came nere roche va doyes whanne nere siege laye squyer heraulde thought best nat entre towne present tyme sent varlet towne sayeng wolde well ynough without company sayd shulde sene siege wolde suppose ben sente englande varlet obeyed night entred ye towne without dauger aymergot marcell guyot du sall made hym good chere marueyle spedde iourney short space shewed howe spedde howe squier duke lacasters heraude come letter fro kyng fro duke lancastre bothe vycount meaulr duke berrey nede quod aymergot mercell nat come hyder castell sir varlet sayd two wolde message well inough wold haue man sene copany shulde come fro wyser guyot du sall therby shall seme mater toucheth kyng englade duke lancastre sir trewe quod barlet tidynges aymergot ioyfull sayde varlet thou hast well dilygently spedde thy mater shorte season shall well rewarde thy labour thus squyer heraude came streight siege demau ded vycoutes lodgynge brought thyder founde vycount beholding men castyng stone kneled saluted hym agayne demauded fro whens came answered said howe cae englande sent thyder kyng duke lancaster ye welcome vycount mater hath brought wylde countrey sir quod heraude beholde squier duke lacasters hath brought letter fro kynge englande fro duke lancastre please rede bycause sowhat knewe countrey come company squyer delyuered letter vycount receyued behelde seales knewe well came englande tooke one aparte coude rede reed letter fro poynt poynt two thre tymes tyll knewe well ment tha studyed regarded well kyng englandes writyng sayd writynge marueyle wolde lodge slepe reste hym army men warre herytage dothe daylye breke peace whiche ought wyse greatly iudiciall haue sette seales confyrmacion peace conclusyon letter howe kyng comaunded incontynent sight letts company shulde departe reyse siege suffre aymergot mercell pesably enioye house parteyning heritage whiche hath cost hym great goodes fortifieng wordes suche enclosed letter ayde aymergot marcell lyke maner kynges letter spake duke lancaster sange note commaundyng lyke excellent duke acquitayne duchy whan vicount meaulx well aduysed hym selfe sayde fayre sir tidynges ye haue brought requyreth counsayle aduyse shall take cousayle ye shall answered made drike vycountes wyne meane tyme vycount toke counsayle sent lorde towre sir guyllyam butler sir robert dolphyn sir loyes dabyer also lorde montaguy sir berat de la ryuer house whan toguyder renewed wordes shewed cause sent caused ye letter reed whan lordes herde great marueile letter coude brought engla de nat layne siege past moneth shall shewe quod vycount suppose aymergot marcell subtell man soone sawe shulde besieged thynke sent inco tynent messanger englande attayne letter whiche maye obey lyste shall answere shortely kyng england duke lancastre comaundeth wyll nothynge obey comaundementes nat bounde obey onelye frenche kynge whose comaundement sent hyder call forthe squier heraude shall make answere brought forthe vycount began speke foloweth derby tomelyn herbery thus ye named accordyng tenour letter apereth ye sent hyther frothe kynge englande fro duke lancastre enfourmed nat tell howe outher aymergot marcell wolde ayde hath ben england name howe present tyme army men warre lodged herytage kynge englandes commaundeth departe reyse siege suffre aymergot marcell peasably enioy lytell fortresse whiche hathe coste moche fortefyenge also sende worde howe put selfe parell dyshonorynge shulde consent breke peace sealed conf rmed endure thre yeres bytwene two kynges alyes fayre sir say vnto wyll nothyng shall charter peace wyll kepe treuce nothynge agaynst though lodged breketh peace treuce subget frenche kynge hath sent hyther hath admytted marshall small armye came knowledge kynge mayster counsayle greuous complayntes noble men countrey auuergne lymosyn howe taken great domages loss meanes aymergot aduysed strong place bytwene coutr voyde nat inhabyted toke fortefyed hath nat made house peace solace stronge fortresse resortynge place theues robber murderer whervpon comauded defende countrey entent suche assembled forttesse shulde nat multyply wickednesse punysshe suche sentence apartayneth trespace entente put payne take whiche comaundemente mayster wyll obey shall deuoyre acquyte truly fro hence wyll nat departe euer comaundemente haue tyll haue fortresse within aymergot marcell wyll say auaunced breke peace lette hym come forthe shall fought withall one better shal cause proued dyuers poyntes artycles hym selfe breaketh peace sir thynges consydred make aunswere ye maye retourne whan pleace whan ye come ye wold say none otherwyse lesse haue sayde often tymes reportes nat truely set enfourmeth lordes often tymes otherwyse trouthe dede syr quod squyer come hyther none purpose reporte trouth se sythe ye wyll none otherwyse nede lenger abyde toke leaue gyuen haraulde ten frankes honour kynge englande duke lancastre whan departed toke hyghe way cleremount sayd wolde agayne parys whan halfe leage way began entre mater sayd yet haue done nothynge behoueth v go duke berrey auuergne lorde countrey writeth hym selfe duke berrey auuergne counte meaulx dare nat displease duke comaunde hym departe haue letter fro kynge mayster fro duke lancastre hym wherfore reason delyuer maye knowe entente concluded purpose rode cleremounte thyde welcome haraulde knewe countrey whan demauded answered messangers sent fro kynge englande demaunded duke berrey shewed duke duches castell named nonec e haraulde knewe well departed fro cleremount rode vyore fro then nonect hyghe mountayne passe one come castell whan came ye duke berrey many sportynge without gate harauld knowen dyuers brought ye duke loue kynge englande duke lancastre made good chere squyer delyuered letter duke receyued opened red length two tymes ouer studyed lytell answered curtesly sayde syrs loue cosyns englande shall gladly power aunswere squyer haraulde ryght ioyouse thought howe sped mater nat ye shall howe duke berrey begynnynge dyd deuoyre haue raysed siege please therby kynge englande duke lancastre desyred siege myght reysed roche vandoys lytell fortresse myght abyde styll aymergot marcell haue done thyng dysplease frenche kyng cousayle kynge englande wolde se shulde amendes made duke berrey bycause wold acquyte truely englysshe mennes desyres suche house wrote incontynente letter well endyghted vycount meaul letter red sealed englysshe men thought well ordayned letter sente notable squyer duke berreys vycount meaulx receyued opened vycount caused redde suche lordes hym whyle messanger drinkynge made hym good chere loue duke berrey reason sir quod vycounte shall nat rest syth duke berrey wyll beare aymergot man world twelue yere hath moste gr ued traueyled coutrey auuergne thought duke hated hym greatly semeth nay sythe hath rpresly comaunded shulde departe fro hence faythe tyme wyll nat obey letter wyll make excuse reason kynge cousayle sent hyder departynge fro parys straytly comaunded comaundemente fro persone nat fro kynge kymselfe shulde nat departe fro hence tyll taken stronge holde roche vandoys aymergot therin whiche wyll canne nowe duke berrey comaundeth contrary chargeth incontynent letter sene shulde reyse syege faythe wyll nat syr quod aboute hym ye speke royally truely shall abyde suppose occasion duke berrey writeth thus aymergot englyssh squier haraulde hath thus desyred write thinke also haue brought letter hym fro kynge englande fro duke lancastre brought day ye say well quod vicounte shall knowe came duke berreys squier sent haue answere vycount sayd pyer wyll well ye knowe owe obeysaunce duke berrey nere kynne kynge dare nat dysplease hym companyons haue ben fyue wekes siege wyn fortresse take theues within strayte co maundement kynge counsayle haue great marueyle good cause howe lorde berrey dothe commaunde v maketh requeste enemyes shulde reyse siege reason say generally shal gyue ensample theues robber suche wyll ouer ron realme worst canne wherfore pyer ye shall say duke berrey fro v shall redy inclyned thynge commaundeth v case straytely enioyned comaunded kyng cousayle kepe siege contynewe tyll haue fortresse within pleasure whiche comaundemente dare nat brake say surely wyll obey comaundement alonely kynges whose subget iame whome sente hyther sir requyre shewe one thynge ye hath made request aymergotte marcell hath done moche yuell anoyaunce countrey auuergne lymosyn nowe atrapped lyke traytoure shulde nere come yuell ende whiche hathe well deserued hath erred done contrary othe syr quod squyer came lorde duke berrey two men englande haraulde another brought letter lorde fro kynge englande fro duke lancastre made greate request aymergotte beleue well quod vycounte derby haraulde squyer called herbery brought daye lyke letter wherfore suppose kynge englande duke lancastre wrote duke berrey mater wherfore shewe lorde berrey desyre consydre thinges well requestes come fro syde see desyres purchased enemyes lorde syde see loue honoure profyte realme fraunce shulde enclyne condyscende sir quod squyer shall forget nothynge ye haue shewed loue nat aymergot rather se punysshmente thanne delyueraunce squyer departed rode nonecte founde duke berrey dyd message ryght sagely conclusyon vycounte meaulx sayde surely wold nat departe fro siege ye roche vandoys without kynge sente hym strayte commaundemente aunswere duke berrey nat well contente thought well commaundement shulde haue obeyed specyally auuergne whan englysshe squyer derby haraulde herde answere made duke berrey howe siege nat raysed sory sawe well traueyled vayne sayde duke syr wyll ye counsayle v shall thus departe frome without spedynge thynge purpose kynge englande duke lancastre haue great truste affyaunce ye shuld cause siege reysed bycause roche vandoys vnder signoury syrs quod duke suffre season aymergot marcell stronge place nedeth nat feare takyng without great vnhappe shortely purpose goo fraunce kynge thanne wyll speke kynge counsayle loue cosyns englande shall beste canne bringe matter passe ye shall go se howe shall spede wordes squyer haraulde contente fourth day duke departed fro nonecte lefte duchesse wyfe gret parte householde duke rode ryon auuergne taryed thanne eyght dayes erle sanxere lorde rule gone auignon aboute duke busynesse whan come departed fro ryon togyther toke waye throughe burbonoys laste came bourges berrey duke taryed two dayes rode mehun ryuer yeure castell one ye fayrest house worlde thanne duke newly bylte coste hym thre hundred thousande frankes duke taryed fyftene dayes wherwith englysshe messangers sore troubled howbeit coude fynde none remedy duke made lytell force delyueraunce aymergot shall shewe howe meanes erle sanxere lorde rule chefe duke counsayle syr peter mespyn fayre maner blamed duke sayde howe hadde nothinge medell busynesse aymergot sayenge lyfe hathe alwayes dyshonourable howe false palyarte alwayes agaynste crowne fraunce doone many vyllayne dedes roboryes auuergne lymosyn mete parsone entreated wherfore syr quod suffre kynge counsayle deale hym lyste wordes suche refrayned duke berrey speke mater howe two englysshe men dyd best remembre duke duke dissymulynge aunswered curtessy sayde syrs suffre season shall shortely parys wordes taryed styll mehun thanne thre wekes deuysynge mayster workeman keruers paynters therin great fantasy mayster workeman called maister andrewe one ye best worke men worlde englysshe man borne dwelte fraunce haynalte longe season nowe shall shewe fortuned aymergot marcell roche vandoys aymergot farre castynge man whan sawe yt siege nat reysed thought well kyng englandes messangers coude nat spede sute thought another turne departe then ryde nyght daye speke capitaynes piergourt pyerguyse guyot saint fayth ernalton saynt calombe ernalton rostem iohn morsen pier danchin remonet copayne dyuers gascoyns bernoyse englysshe garysons thought fayre wordes shuld cause assemble togyther come auuergne truste wynne great botyes mornyng night come reyse siege vandoys take frenche men prisoner whiche shulde worthe hundred thousande frankes besyde botyes thanne shewed vncle guyot du sall purpose answered sayd sir se nothynge good otherwyse nat delyuered fro frenche men well vncle aymergot shall message selfe syth ye counsayle therto shall desyre one thynge departe quod quod aymergot euer skrymysshe frenche men make issue wyse gate open nat barryers ye ye may rather lese wynne sir quod guyot shalbe ware ynough ther shall kepe selfes close within tyll retourne tydynges fro well fayre vncle requyre canne nat displease v none otherwayes assautes skrymysshes ye nede nat feare ye kepe selfes close within thus within thre dayes aymer gote departed fro roche vandoys onely acopanyed page passed forth without daunger frenche men entensyon brynge thyder companyons aduenturers rayse siege many within house knewe nothyng departure myght departe whan lost without knowlege euery day skrymysshynge assautes barryers within fyue sixe dayes ye departure aymergot great assaute made frenche men thre partes guyot du sall good man armes longe tyme vsed exercisyng therof howe day fortuned yuell reason lytell pryde brake ordynaunce cosyn aymergot set departed charged hym maner assaute shulde nat issue barryers assaute thre squyers french party two auuergne one bretayne skrimysshing valyauntly vpon pane wall nere fortresse thre squyers aboue daye dyd moste valyauntly auuergne called rycharde de la violecte lubinet rochfort breton named monadyke taken lymosyn castell vanchador parteynynge sir willyam butler assaute endured tyll nyght thre squyers atcheued great laude prayse traueyle payne wan nothyng another assaute vicount meaulx made busshment twelue men armes companyes layde olde house without fortresse commauded another sorte go skrymysshe barryers sayenge thynke surely shall se within issue couetouse wyn withdrawe selfe lyt lytell tyll past busshment shall breke also retourne agayne thus shall enclosed taken slayne best way se aduauntage thus vicount deuysed ordeyned done named shulde lye busshment loys lesglynell robert bertencourte guylliam de saulsoy pyer du saynt vydall guyonet villeracque pier colle iohn salmage nombre twelue layde themselfe olde house without fortresse another sorte went skrimysshed ye barryers belynot rochfort rycharde violecte monadyke fresshly armed aparelled thentent within shulde haue corage issue also twelue alonly whan came bartyers began skrymysshe fayntly lyke suche persones coulde lytell skyll feates armes wherfore guyot du sall made lytell force issued sayde companyons saynt marcell wyll issue barryers sorte yonge co panyons shewe knowe lytell dedes armes shall teche knowe shalbe prisoner nat escape v therwith opened barryers issued fyrste guyot du sall remembred nochynge charge aymergot gyuen hym departynge great desyre dedes armes wynne somwhat made begyn skrymysshe whan french men sawe guyot du sall company come barryers ryght ioyfull began drawe backe lytell lytell fortresse pursewed wente farre passed busshment whan sawe tyme brake busshment bytwene fortres cryeng coucy vycount thus fortresse inclosed behynd whan guyot sawe knewe well doone mysse sawe well harde hym scape reculed get agayne garyson frenchemen waye whervnto shulde make longe processe taken nat one escaped brought vycountes lodginge knyghtes hadde great ioye takynge thus counsayle bycount meaulx guyot du sall company atrapped taken brought lordes fraunce auuergne whan vycount sawe guyot du sall demaunded aymergot marcell charged hym saye trouthe thought ben still fortresse guyot du sall aunswered howe coulde nat tell departed twelue dayes paste lordes thought surely gone purchace ayde prisoner comaunded parte vicount demauded knightes auuergne beste guyot du sall company sayenge howe wolde vse hymselfe acordyng counsayle syr willyam butler aunswered sayde syr quod suppose aymergot gone socour rayse companyons garysons pyergourt pierguyse shall fynde alwayes come vpon v earely late beware theym wherby maye v domage peace trewce taken aymergot subtyle man syr let v one thyng shew vnto guyot du sall company without cause fortresse rendred handes ye wyll stryke heedes incontynente without thus let nat spared counsayle good quod vycounte dede chefe occasyon become hyder haue fortresse though nat haue tyme aymergot marcell another season shall fortune ryght well vycount lorde towre syr roberte dolphyn came fortresse nere myght aporche thyder brought guyot du sall company vycount spake sayd guyot du sall guyot company knowe trouthe incontynent heedes shall stryken without ye yelde vp fortresse roche vandoys ye wyll rendre vp shall suffre go quyte nowe aduyse ye well way ye wyll take lyfe deth wordes guyot company sore abasshed last thought best saue lyues guyot answered sayde syr shall best canne fortresse may yelden came barryer spake within rekened themselfes clene dyscomfyted seynge hadde lost two maysters best company soone guyot hadde spoken theym declared case stode agreed yelde vp fortresse condicionally yt myght departe bagge baggage moch coulde cary haue respyte moneth withdrawe whyther lyste graunted sute saueconducte made sealed thus frenche men roche vandoys delyuered reason good fortune last skrimysshe wherfore comenly sayde fortune good yuell falleth often tymes armes foloweth warre whan roche vandois yelded vp lordes fraunce auuergn countrey ryght ioyous therof lordes helde well truely promesse made guyot du sall whan caryed away moche coulde departed good assuraunce moneth go whyder pleased vycount meaul abandoned roche vandoys men countrey incontynente dyd rase downe suche wyse lefte wall hele house stone vpon stone reuersed erthe frenche men kinges seruice vycount toke leues knyghtes squyers auuergne departed auuergne lymosyn went owne house vycount meaul gaue leaue parte company went rochell lodged saint iohans dangle kepe fronter coutrey pyllers robber ran sometyme xantoigne whan sawe aduauntage maner fourme haue shewed ye fortresse roche vandoys coquered rased downe wherof countrey ioyfull better suretie say trouth cotynued wolde haue done many displeasurs tydynges dede came knowledge duke berrey cautelon place owne standynge bytwene charter mount le herrey nyne leages fro parys cared nothing colde grace kynge aymergot whan derby haraulde infourmed duke knyghtes howe roche vandois taken beten downe sayde squyer came thyder hym syr ye haue lost hundred frankes aymergot promysed howe quod squier surely quod harauld roche vandoys gyuen vp rendred frenche men haue wonne therfore lette v take leaue duke berrey retourne englande haue nothynge well quod squyer sythe accorde therto toke leaue duke duke wrote kynge englande duke lancastre gaue haraulde departynge xl frankes squyer horse thus departed toke next waye calays englande tydinges came aymergot marcell purchasyng frendes haue reysed siege fortresse vandoys gyuen vp whan herde therof demaunded howe fortuned shewed hym howe reason skrymysshe issuyng vncle guyot du sall vnaduysedly ah olde traytour aymergot saynte marcell hym nowe shulde sle hym myne owne handes hath dyshonoured companyons departynge straytely enioyned hym maner assaute skrymysshe made frenchman shulde wyse open ye barryers hath done contrary domage nat recouered wote nat whether go caluset dousac wyll kepe peace companyons spredde abrode lyke men dyscomfyted dare neuer assemble agayne togyther though togyther yet wote nat whyder bring thus thynge consydred harde parte haue gretly dyspleased french kynge duke berrey lordes auuergne people countrey haue made warre peace durynge trusted haue nowe great aduenture lese wotte nat resorte counsayle wolde nowe goodes wyfe englande shulde surety howe shulde get thyder cary stufe shulde robbed twenty tymes coulde gette see passage poictou rochell fraunce normandy pycardy straytely kept wyll harde scape fro takyng taken shall sente frenche kynge shall loste myne thynke surest waye drawe burdeaulr lytell lytell get good thyder abyd tyll warre renewe agayne haue good hoope treuce warre shall open agayne bytwene englande fraunce thus aymergot marcell debated matter hym selfe heuy sorowfull wy e nat waye take outher recouersoe fortresse auuergne el go burdeaux sende wire thider goodes lytell lytell secretely hadde done taken surest waye dyde contrary therby lost lyfe godes thus ortune payeth people whan hath sette highest parte whele sodainly reuerseth lowest parte ensample aymergotte sayd well worthe hundred thousande frakes lost daye wherfore may well saye fortune hath played pagiaunt hym hath done many mo shall aymergot trybulaci remebred hym selfe howe cosyn germayne auuergne squyer named tourne myne determyned go hym shewe hym trouble take counsayle deuysed dyd page onely came ye castell tourne myne thynkyng haue ben suretie bicause lynage proued contrary squyer nat duke berryes grace fauor whan sawe cosyn aymergot house aduysed take hym prisoner aduertyse duke berey yt wolde forgyue hym displeasure yuell wyll wolde send hym aymergot mercell hym pleasure deuysed dyde whan aymergot within cosyns castell brought chabre layde swerde chaunged aparyll demauded seruauntes sayd cosyn tourne myne yet haue nat sene hym sir quod chambre please come se hym ryght good wyll quod aymergotte seruauntes knewe ryght well maysters pleasure whan aymergot chaunged aparell doone cote defence wo vsualy weare layde awaye swerde sayd sir lette v go wolde se cosyn tourne myne long sithe sawe hym brought streight tourne myne whan came hym aymergot dyde salute hym thought none yuell tourne myne aunswered saide howe aymergotte sente come hyder ye wolde dishonour wherfore take arest prisoner otherwyse shulde nat acquyte selfe truely crowne frau ce lorde duke berrey ye false traytour ye haue broken truce wherto ye must answere cause lorde berrey hateth deedly nowe shall make peace shall delyuer hym outher quycke deed whiche wordes aymergotte sore aba shed saide howe sir youre cosyn certaynte ye shewe speke saye come hyder great trust haue shewe businesse make cruell chere gyue harde word haue great marueyle nat tell quod tourne myne wha ye wyll say haue said shall fulfyll layde hades hym seruauntes knowynge maisters pleasure toke aymergot without de e makyng without weapen arm r also enclosed castell wordes coulde saye taken yrons putte vpon legges layde towre sure kepars hym whan done caused castell gate shytte toke keyes hym selfe commaunded seruauntes payne lyues none hardy go gate without sent thyder comaandement vpholde wrote letts pleasure dyrected duke berrey certifyeng hym howe hadde aymergot marcell prisone wolde done hym yuell wyll wolde delyuer aymergot hanoes whan letter written sealed commaunded one seruauntes suche trusted go fraunce duke berrey delyuer hym letter recomende hym lowly hym nat retourne answere varlet toke letter mouted good horse deted rode longe came parys duke berey delyuered hym maisters letter duke toke ye letter reed smyled sayd suche knyghtes hym r wyll ye newe tidynges aymergot marcell taken prisoner owne cosyn germayne tourne myne hath taken hym ye knightes answered sayd sir good tidynges countrey auuergne lymosyn haue hym longe season yuell neyghbour hath done moche yuell please worthy peyse gybet ought haue none raunsome pardon nat saye duke kyng counsayle wyll saye therto wyll speke therin nat longe duke berrey toke barge ryuer seyne came castell lour kyng cousaile shewed newes caused letter turne myne sent hym reed whiche tidynges euery man ioyfull lordes saide well sene suche maner robber pillers neuer coe good ende duke berey desyred sende hym seneschall auuergne brought paris put ye castell saynt antony furthermore ordayned tourne myne good seruice hadde done crowne frauce displeasure shulde clene gyuen hym thervpon letter patentes made sent hym seruaunt wherof well content trusted letter shorte space seneschall auergne comission fro duke berrey came castell tourne myne aymergot marcell delyuered hym wherof aymergotte sore abasshed whan sawe hym selfe copany enemy wherto shulde make loge processe seneshall caried hym men armes long countrey passed ryuers seyne marewe bridge charenton fro then castell saynt antony vicount darchy charged hym thane capitayne castell kepte hym nat long yt delyuered prouost chatelet parys trewe aymergot offred raunsome threscore thousande frankes wolde nat taken answered kyng riche ynough sente chatelette nat long kepte iuged dye shamefully lyke traytour crowne fraunce soo daye caryed chariot place called halle sette pyllary trespass reed hym hym sir wylliam trune spake moche hym thought yt knowe state certayne capitayns auuergne whether consentyng dedes nat lordes knewe well coude neuer haue knowlege therof thus executed heed stryken body quartred quarter sette euery gate parys ende came aymergotte marcell wyfe goodes knewe nat becae phowe chrysten lordes geno wayes beyng ysle conymbres ancre departed then go laye siege stronge cytie aufryke barbary howe maynteyned siege cap clxxi haue spoken length lyfe aymergot mercell furnysshe hystorie condycions bothe yuell good ought alwayes treated hystory specially whan toucheth great feate ensample gyue mater occasyon well aymergotte ledde lyfe good vertues ben man great valure bycause dyde cotrary came yuell ende p nowe let v leaue spekyng hym let v retourne hyghe enterprice christen knyghtes fraunce nacyous dyd season realme aufryke wyll begyn lefte sayd lordes assembled ysle conymbres passed tempestes paryls goulfe lyon taryed eche cytie aufryke xxx thousande ysle conymbres nyne dayes refresshed patron galees sayde lordes sir lande next aprochyng marchesse aufryke whider grace god ye purposed go laye liege wherfore behouable take co sayle eche howe maye entre hauen take lade saue selfe best senoe formast lytell shyppes called brigandyns let v tary mouthe hauyn ye first day aproche nyght nexte mornynge take lande grace god leysar lodge selfes nere cytie maye without shotte artyllary let v sette crosbowes genouois order shal redy defende scirmysshes suppose well whan shall take ladynge ye haue copanyes many yong squyers enhauce honour wyll requyre haue order knighthode structe wisely swetely howe shall mentayne themselfes lordes knowe trouthe see men shall acquyte v vnto well truely alwayes shewe maner order shall moost greue enemyes shall take payne study howe cytie aufryke may ofte tymes haue done v great domage coste chiefe key barbary realmes foloweth first realme aufrike mallorques bougy god grace wyll consent maye wyn cytie aufrike sarazyns wyll trymble realme liby sury worlde shall speke therof ayde christen realmes ysles marchyng nere aufrike shall always refreshed vitayls newe men comon vo age euery man wyll desyre dayly
