dedes armes specially goddes enemyes thus co clusion processe patron said lordes say nat presupcion maner teche ye shuld haue sayd onely loue humilyte ye noble men sage valyant better order euery thyng deuyse speke lorde coucy said sir good counsayle aduyse ought gretly content v se thyng therin good sir ye sure shall nothyng without cou sayle ye haue brought v hyder dedes armes thus presence duke burbone lordes cou sayled toguyder ysle conymbres myght aproche ye strong towne aufryke whan euery thyng well aduysed sette good order admyrall patron galees wynde wether serued euery lorde entred galee amog owne men hauyng great desyre encoutre enemyes sarazyns trupettes blewe vp departyng great pleasure beholde ore howe rowed abrode see whiche peasable calme fayre maner see shewed selfe great desyre yt christen men shulde come stronge towne aufryke christen nauy goodly regarde well ordred great beautie se baners penons silke armes badge ye lordes wauyng wynde shynyng agaynst sone within hour noone christen men perceyued ye hygh towres towne aufrike farder sayled nerer shewed syghtes wherfore euery man reioysed good cause seyng desyred coe thyder thought tha maner paynes released voyage accomplysshed thus aproched thentre realme aufryke comuned deuysed among themselfe lyke maner sarazyns within towne aufryke spake deuysed sore abasshed whan sawe enemy aproche suche nombre sayles sayde surely lykely besieged howe thought towne strog towres walles artyllary therwith reconforted toke corage gyue warnyng countrey soone sawe enemyes see hyghe towres sowned tymbres tabour accordynge vsage suche wyse men abrode countrey drewe toguyder suche men barbary ben sente thyder kynge aufryke kynge thunes bougy whan knewe christen mennes comynge reason noyse tymbres tabour thentent shulde nat entre farre cou treis euery man tooke hede charge sente certayne capitayns see syde se aprochyng ye christen men beholde dealyng nyght also prouyded defende towres gate hauyn aufryke entent negligece towne aufryke shulde take domage whiche towne strong nat lykely take great hurte without longe siege iohan froyssart auctour cronycle bycause neuer aufryke bycause myght truely write maner fascion enterprice alwayes desyred suche knyghtes squyers ben ye voyage enforme euery thyng bycause oftentymes dayes calays demaunded also suche ben sayde voyage shewed suretie sarazyns amonge selfes sayde howe christen men expert subtyle men armes whervpon auncyent sarazyn sayd company sir thynges cosydred best christen men begynnyng se nat strength puissaunce also haue nat men suffyciet fyght daylye men wyll coe v wherfore thynke best suf take lade haue horse ouer ron countrey wyll nat sprede abrode kepe togyder feare v towne stronge ynoughe well prouyded nede nat feare assaut ayre hote wyll hotter lodged sonne shadowe shall dayly wast vitaylles shalbe ute hope recouer newe lye long season shall haue ple tie owne countrey shall oftetymes awaked scrimysshed withall domage aduauntage lette v nat fight wyse nat disconfyte v haue nat ben vsed ayre countrey whiche contrary nature thynke best waye saieng aucient knight sarazyn agreed thane comaunded payne dethe man shulde go see syde scrymysshe christen men without comaunded kepe selfe close lodgynges suffre christen men take lande determynacion vp holde none durst breke sent certayne archer towne aufryke ayde defende sarazyns shewed theme selfes nothyng though ther men countrey christen men lodged night mouthe hauyn aufryke nexte mornynge wether fayre clere ayre good temper sonne rose pleasure beholde thane christen men began styrre made redy hauynge great desyre approche towne aufryke take lande trumpettes claryons began sowne gallees vesselles made great noise nyne clocke whan christen men taken lytell refress hynge drinke reioysed lighted accordyng apoynted sent fyrst lyght vesselles called brigandyns well furnisshed artyllary entred hauyn came armed galees shyppes flete good order tournyng towardes lande see syde ther strong castell hyghe towres specially one towre whiche defended see syde lande also towre bricoll engyn whiche nat ydell styll dyde cast great stone amonge christen men shyppes lyke wise euery towre towne agaynst see syde engyns caste stone sarazyns well prouyded towne loked euer longe whane shulde besieged whan christen men entred hauen aufryke take lande plesaunt syght beholde order claryons trumpettes sounde hyghe clere dyuers knightes valyaunt men realme frau ce sprede abrode day baners dyuers newe made knyghtes lorde iohan lignye firste made knight countrey chauny made handes cosyn named sir henry dantoygne sprede abrode first baner felde golde bende goules companye cosyn germayne lorde hauret chauny thus lordes knyghtes squyers great desyre auaunced toke lande lodged lande enemyes sight false sarazyns wednisdaye euenyng mary magdaleyne yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore toke lade lodged marshalles sarazyns within ye towne praysed moche christen menes order bycause great galees coulde nat aproche nere lande men yssued bottes toke lande folowed baner lady sarazins within towne suche abrode countrey suffered christen men pesably take lande sawe well shulde nat aduauntage haue fought landyng duke burbone chefe christen armye lodged myddes company ryght honorably baner displayed poudred full floure du lyces ymage lady myddes scochynne armes burbone vnder fete ymage p fyrste ryght hande duke lodged brother sir guylliam tremoyle penon lorde bordenay baner sir helyon lygnacke penon lorde tourse penon henowers standerde lorde wyllyam heynaulte erle ostrenaunt eldest sonne duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte hollande zelande deuyse ye standerde herse golde standyng bell goules lorde haureth wt baner lorde ligny baner sir philyppe dartoys erle ewe baner lorde mateselon baner lorde calam penon seneschall ewe penon lorde lynyers baner lorde thune baner lorde ameuall baner sir water champenon penon sir ioh castell morant baner marshall sanxeres brother penon lorde coucy baner beste apoynted nexte duke burbone sir stephyne sanxere penon freche kynges penon deuyce therby sir iohan barroys penon armes sir guylliam morles baner lorde logueuall penon sir iohan roye baner lorde bourse penon vycount dausney baner lorde admyrall baner called iohan vyen p nowe foloweth duke lyfte hande lyfte hande loyes duke burbone lodged foloweth first lorde ausemont bauyere sir iohan beauforde bastarde sonne duke lancastre baner displayed sir iohan butler englysshe penon sir iohan crama baner souldyche lestrade penon sir iohan harcourt baner ye lorde beraulte erle cleremount dolphin auuergne baner sir hugh dolphyn brother penon lorde bertencourt penon lorde pyer buffyer baner lorde saynt semere baner lorde lauuart marshall hoost baner lorde bergue beausse penon lorde louuy baner sir gerarde lymo yn brother penon lorde saynt germayne baner penon staderde deuyce duke burgoyn sir philyppe barre baner sir geffray charney baner sir loyes poicters penon sir robert calabre penon vycount s baner lorde montague baner lorde vyle neufe penon sir wyllyam molyne penon lorde logny penon sir angorget damboyse penon sir aleyne chapayne penon baners penons sette front ye towne aufryke besyde great nombre knyghtes squyers ryght valyaunt men fhighe corage lodged abrode felde cannat name also wolde long writyng fourtene thousande gentylmen companye great feate susteyne great batyle sarazyns come forthe haue gyuen batayle whiche dyd nat yt day shewed maner defence castyng towres great stone whan christen men lodged well myght refresshed selfes suche brought myght nat ryn abrode countrey gather bowes tree make lodgynges ben domage aduentured themselfe abrode lordes tentes pauilios brought fro geane thus lodged good order crosbowes genouoys lodged wynges closed lordes occupyed great space groude great nombre prouisyons galees day maryners conueyed stuffe ande bottes whan christen ysles adioynyng naples cicyll also mayne landes puylle calabre whan knewe howe christen men besieged strong castell aufryke dyd coude vitayle christen army haue aduautage therby loue affection genouoys fro ysle caude came good malueysies great plenty without whiche conforte coude nat longe haue endured great nombre good drinker good caters howe prouis ons came nat alwayes lyke maner somtyme plentie season wanted p nowe shall somwhat speke sarazyns aswell haue done christen men reason co clude thynges trewe aufrike barbary knewe longe howe genowayes hadde thretned loked none thyng yere besieged dede hadde made prouisyon resyst agaynst whan tidynges sprede abrode countrey howe christenmen come aufryke dout nat wise feareth nat ennemyes thoughe neuer fewe howe sarazyns reputed christen men right valyant good men warre wherfore greatly douted entent resyst defende fronters countreys assembled toguyder dyuers party lande seignorie aufrike realme maroche ye realme bougye best men warre countreis suche leest feared dethe thus came lodged sandes agaynst christen men behynde highe wode thentent shulde receyue syde domage meanes busshmentes scrimysshes sarazins lodged selfes right sagely surely men warre xxx thousande good archer ten thousande horseman mo howe christen men coude neuer knowe surely nombre supposed greater nombre lodged woodes whiche myght ryght well owne coutre might go come host houres without paryll dommage owne lybertie often tymes refresshed newe vitayls brought somers camelles secode day englysshe men lande mornyng breke day nyght lorde henry dautoygne kepte watche two hundred men armes thousande crosbowes genowayes sarazyns came awake scrimysshe theym whiche endured space tow houres many dedes armes atchyued ye sarazins wolde nat ioyne fyght hande hande scrimysshed castyng dartes shotynge wolde nat folysshely aduenture theselfes wisely sagely reculed christen hoost apparelled go scrimysshe great lordes fraunce came thyder se deme anour sarazyns therby know n ther tyme maner skrymysshynge thus sarazyns drewe lodgynge crysten men durynge siege crysten men neuer suretie rest outher euenynge mornynge sarazyns wolde awake skrymysshe amonge sarazyns yonge knight called agadingor dolyferne alwayes well mounted redy lyght horse semed whan horse ranne dyd flye ayre knyght semed good man armes dedes bare always vsage thre fedred dartes ryght well coulde handle acordynge custome clene armed long whyte well aboute heed aparell blacke owne coloure browne good horseman crysten men sayde thought dyd suche dedes loue yonge lady countrey trewe loued entyrely kynge thunes doughter named lady azala enherytour realme thunes ye discease kyng father agadingor sonne duke olyferne nat tell maryed togyther nat shewed knyght loue sayd lady durynge siege dyd many feates armes knyghtes faunce wolde fayne haue taken hym coulde neuer atrape enclose horse swyft redy hande yt alwaies skaped crysten men wolde gladly haue taken sarazyn entente haue knowen state towne countrey skrymysshynge coulde neuer gette none sarasyns toke good hede themselfe dyd pauesse themselfe agaynst crosebowes genouoys werenat well armed cristen men nat vsage armorer metall forge harnesse withall comenly lacke yron steele euer armed lether beare targettes aboute neckes couered made cure boley capadoce wepen perce lether nat hote whan come nere enemyes cast dartes one whan genouoys shote theym couche selfe lowe couer targes whan shotte paste caste agayne fedred dartes thus space nyne wekes durynge siege often tymes skrymysshed dyuers hurte bothe party specially suche lyghtly without uysement aduentured selfe thus crysten men toke good hede themselfe dyd sarazyns parte lordes fraunce suche com thyder ayde gladly regarded dealynge sarazyns saye trouthe lordes astate gret men newelties dylectable crysten men hadde pleasure beholde sarazyns great pleasure regarde maner crysten men amonge yonge lusty knyghtes great pleasure beholde armure baners standardes penons rychesse noblenesse amonge crysten men nyght whan lodgynges spake deuysed shewed one thynge amonge marueyled shall shewe sarazyns within towne aufryke great marueyle tytell instaunce yt crysten men came thyder strongly make warre shewed howe toke aduyse amonge howe knowe trouth therof determyned sende crysten men knowe myndes toke truchman coulde speke italyan commaunded hym go crysten host demaude tytle instaunce come make v warre come strongly empyre barbary lande auffryke saye howe haue nothynge trespased trouth afore tyme hath ben warre bytwene v genouoys warre reason ought nat touche crysten men farre countreys genouoys neyghbours take v haue auncyente enemyes shall excepte whan treuce bytwene v message trucheman departed rode crysten army mette fyrst genoway shewed hym howe messanger sent fro ye sarazyns speke lorde fraunce genoway name anthony marthy centuryon crosbowes brought messanger duke burbon lorde coucy gladly herde hym speke wordes spake owne langage centuryon genoway expowned theym frenche whan messanger declared message desyred haue anuswere lordes fraunce sayde shulde haue first wolde take aduyse mater xii greatest lordes drewe togyder counsayle duke burbons tent concluded sent messanger genouoy made answere al name sayeng howe tytle quarell made warre bycause sonne god called iesu chryst trewe profyte lyne generacyon put deth crucyfyed bycause iudged god deth without tytell reason therfore wolde haue mendes punysshe trespace false iudgement lawe made also bycause beleued nat holy baptyme euer contrary faythe lawe also bycause beleued nat virgyn mary ther ihesu cryst f r cause sayd toke sarazyns secte enemyes sayd howe wolde reuenge dispytes doone dayly god crysten faythe answere treuchman retourned without parell domage shewed maysters ye haue herde aunswere sarazyns dyd nothinge laugh sayd howe aunswere nothynge reasonable iewes put chryst dethe nat thus siege styll endured euery party making good watche anone sarazyns toke counsayle togyder determyned seuen eight dayes togyther shulde suffre crysten men reste nat make maner skrymysshe sodaynly nyght hour mydnyght sette hoost trustynge therby great feate ordayned dyd eyght dayes togyther made skrymysshe ix day mydnight secretly armed armure accustomed came close togyder without noyse nere lodgynges crysten men enterprysed haue done great feate haue entred nat side watche parte felde watche kept come entente god properly nat ben agaynst shewynge apparante myracles shall shewe howe sarazyns aproched sawe sodenly great company ladyes damosel whyte colour one especyall beauty without comparison exceded borne baner whyte reed within syght sarazyns abasshed lacked spyrite force go stode styll ladyes also shewed genouoys great dogge company brought theym knewe nat fro whence came none chalenged dogge whiche dogge dyd theym great seruyce sarazyns coulde neuer come pryuely skrymysshe dogge wolde bay make suche brewte wold nat rest tyll slepe awaked euery man knewe whan herde dogge baye sarazyns commyng skrymysshe wherby euer aparelled selfe resyst genouoys called dogge lady dogge season sarazyns stode styll traunce ladyes dogge n ydell made gret brute ranne bayeng fyrst stande watche lorde coucy sir henry dantoigne kept watche night whan euery man herde dogge make suche brute rose armed redy knew well sarazyns dyd aproche awake trewe vyrgyn mary company defende crysten men fro parelles toke nyght maner domage sarazyns durst nat aproche retourned lodgynges crysten men toke better hede watche sarazyns knyghtes squyers suche ye towne aufryke specially suche sene ladyes abasshed wyste nat thynke crysten knightes squyers lay siege studyed day nyght howe myght wyn towne within studyed agayne howe defende towne season hote drye sonne moste strength moneth august march aufryke ryght hoote reason sande also nerer sonne wynes crysten men came fro pulle calabre hote drye farre fro nature french wynes wherby many fell hoote feuers consydre acordynge reason nat tell howe frenche men lowe countreys coulde endure payne hote grose ayre founde without refresshynge good swete fresshe water whiche lacked yet made fountaynes welles sande whiche dyde theym great pleasure found fressh water often tymes water sore chafed reason heate also often tymes great defaute vytaylles season ynough comynge fro cicyll fro isle adioynynge suche werehole comforted dysseased suche vytayles departed theym lacked wyse coulde nat haue endured dalte eche lyke bretherne frendes lorde coucy specyally chyefe resorte gentleman coulde behaue hym selfe swetely amonge moche better duke burbone duke high corage proude presumptuous spake nat swetely humbly knyghtes squyers straungers lorde coucy dyd moste comenly duke burbone wolde sytte daye without tente legges acrosse euer wold speke hym behoued haue procurer make great reuerence consydred nat state poore men well lorde coucy dyd wherfore grace loue people thanne duke burbon shewed e dyuers knyghtes squyers straungers opynyons lorde coucy ben soueraygne capytayne alone sped otherwyse dyd reason pride duke burbon many feates enterprise lefte vndone opynyon many kepte hym selfe sure ynough fro takynge siege enduringe towne aufryke whiche contynewed lx dayes one many skrymysshes made bothe party abrode barryers towne nedefull within make good defece floure chyualry squyry knyghtes aduenturers sayd one another maye get towne assaute otherwyse may refresshe selfes wynter somer great armye crysten men wyll come byther ther shall haue goodly entre realmes barbary aufryke thunes dyd say wolde god thanne suche shulde lodged shulde lye honorably dayly shulde redy dedes armes within towne doubted greatly mater wherfore tooke great payne defende selfes great heate brinnynge sonne dyd put crysten men great payne traueyle whan harnesse reason heate brente within armure marueyle skaped dethe reason heate myddes august ayre sore corrupted besyde fell another marueylous incydente whiche longe endured ben deed without stroke reason great heate corrupcyon ayre fell amonge suche sorte great flyes couered hoost man wyste howe defende hym selfe euery daye weke togyder encreased wherof euery man abasshed howe grace god vyrgyn mary whome euery man auowed selfe day dyd sende remedy fell suche hayle lyghtenyng fro heuen slewe sayde flyes reason hayle ayre brought good temperatenesse wherby ye knyghtes squyers better astate euer case crysten men yt tyme must haue behoued take euery thynge gree coulde nat haue euery thynge wysshynge demaunde whan fell sicke behoued well kepte el shulde haue dyed come thyder good wylles affection purposed honourably accomplysshe voyage whiche mynde greatly supported endure payne traueyle thynges mete complexion wanted nothynge came realme fraunce tydynges fraunce knewe somtyme came army fro cytie barcelone realme aragon galey prouysion wherin mo orenges pomegarnettes thynge frutes yet refresshed greatly appetytes crysten men whan euer galey came retourned nat agayne doute encoutryng sarazyns see abyde se conclusyon siege yonge kynge cicyll often tymes sente hoost vytaylles nerte crysten prince adioynynge sarazyns ben strength haue stopped passage see fro haue kepte fro suche vytayls prouysions came armye fro pule calabre naples cicyll crysten men ben deed without stroke stryking made warre lande also nat suche puyssaunce see nother gale vessel genouoys venysians sarazyns see stelthe dare nat abyde crysten men without haue farre aduautage galey crysten men well armed wyll discomfyte four galees sarazyns trewe turkes greater force better men armes outher lande see secte myscreantes contrary beleue dwell farre fro lande aufryke affrikans nat ayded turkes certayne knowledge howe towne aufryke besyeged crysten men wysshed often tymes crysten men studyed howe domage sarazyns lyke wyse dyd sarazyns agaynst chrysten men studyed howe delyuer coutrey day agadingor doliferne madefer de thunes belyns madages brahadyn bougy dyuers sarazyns deuysed amonge selfes sayd beholde crysten men enemyes lye face owne countrey yet nat discomfyte handefull men regarde v howe thinke veryly haue great confort valyaunt men owne countreys maner skrymyssh make euer take neuer prisoner myght take one two valyaut men shulde greatly honour knowe demeanour puyssaunce purpose syrs agadingor let se counsayle best case one yongest yet speke fyrst contente therwith quod say ye wyll syrs quod desyre greatly dede armes crysten man thynke veryly matched one dyscomfyte hym playne batayle syrs ye wyll myght fynde xx xxx valyaunt men monge v shall cause canne crysten men sette forthe many quarell good haue cause reason make warre v thynke reason iuste quarell good corage shall gyue v victory madyfer thunes aunswered sayd syr wordes nothyng honour morowe ye wyll ryde former fronte batayle trucheman make token ye wolde speke crysten man moche offre batayle x agaynst ten shall ye se wyll aunswere yet howe euer answere may aduysed wyll leste crysten men shall repute v valyaunt agreed apoyntmente passed nyght next mornyng rode forth skrymysshe enemyes agadingor formest mounted good horse trucheman daye clere bright lytell sonne rysynge sarazyns set selfe ordre batayle nyght sir willyam tremoyle kept watch ye crysten parte hym sir guy brother sarazins apered cristen men within thre crosbowe shot agadingor truchman rode co pany made token speke crysten man one wynge felde gentle squyer called affrenall seyng sarazyn sygnes made rode fro company sayd syrs stande styll wyll go speke yoder sarazyn torne agayne hath truchman hym cometh speke man squier came ye sarazyn taryed truchman said ye crysten man noble man man armes redy gyue aunswere demaunde suche one quod affrenall say pleace ye shalbe harde receyued quod trucheman syr beholde gentleman noble man demaundeth batayle fyght hande hande ye wyll haue mo shall fynde nombre sixe redy fight vi quarell men shalbe say wyll iustifye faythe better valure faythe lawe hath ben written syth begynning worlde lawe foude one man whome iewes hanged crosse ahsyr quod affrenall speke mater appertaygneth nat speke dispute fayth lawe say sarazyn swere fayth beleue afferme batayle let hym bringe nombre x gentleman name armes within thre houres shall bringe many try mater truthman resyted wordes sarazyn semyng gret ioy accept afferme batayle thus toke enterprise bytwene twayne departed returned owne companyes tydinges herof came sir guy tremoyle syr willyam brother whan met affrenall demaunded fro whence came done sarazyn affrenall shewed hym hole mater taken batayle wherof sayd two knightes ioyfull sayd affrenall speke two shall nombre ten syr quod affrenall god wyll trust shall fynde ynowe wolde glad fyght sarazyns anone affrenall mette lorde thune shewed hym aduenture demauded wolde one company lord thune wolde nat refuse gladlye graunted one company euery one affrenall dyd gette myght haue goten c wolde sir boucyquant yonger syr helyons lingnac syr iohan russell englysshe sir iohan harpedon aleys bodet bochet accepted batayle whan nombre ten accomplisshed euery man drewe lodgynge arme incontynent batayle whan knowen ye hoost knyghtes named taken enterprise knyghtes squyers sayd ten knightes borne good houre haue founde day happy aduenture wolde god quod dyuers yt nombre euery knight squyer ioyfull enterprise greatly praysed aduenture sauynge gentle lorde coucy nat cotente therwith lorde thune company lorde coucy shewed couenante made affrenall one ten fight ten sarazyns many herde therof praysed greatly aduenture lorde coucy spake sayd ah sir ye yonge people yt knowe lytell worlde rather exalte folysshe ded wyse dede enterprise se reason dyuers cause one ten knyghtes squyers men gentleman name blode must fyght agaynste many sarazyns howe shall men knowe whether gentleman lyst may set agaynst men ten rybauldes varlettes hap dyscomfyted shall wyn nothynge ten varlettes yet shall neuer nerer wyn ye towne aufryke shall thus put good men adueture peraduenture wyll set busshment whan ten men felde tary men wyll close roude wherby shall lese somoche febler say quod lorde coucy yt affrenall hath nat wrought wysely mater first whan sarazyn dyd defye shuld haue made nother maner aunswere dyd shuld haue sayd howe nat chefe heed army rather one poorest ye blame faythe byleue ye nat mete haue answer made therof ye lyst shall brynge great lordes armye shall take vnder saueconducte ye shall go returne sauegarde suretie ye shall lordes speke thus affrenall shuld haue ledde sarazyn duke burbone counsayle shulde haue herde leyser answered good aduyse suche defyauce armes suche quarell ought nat passe without great deliberacion good cousayle batayle ben agreed vnto v yet wolde haue ben knowen men name surname shulde acomplyssh batayle thervpon haue chosen men honour profite thervpon hane sarazyns suretie hostage v ben metely maner haue vsed wherfore treatie might withdrawen reason shulde well doone wyll go speke duke burbone take counsayle lordes armye knowe wyll say therto thus lorde coucy departed fro lorde thune wente duke burbons tent baron assembled togyder take cousayle mater lorde coucy sayde wordes lorde thune maner good counsayle aduyse yet lefte nat armed hymselfe came forth company redy fight sarazyns sir guy tremoyle formest knight thus lordes fraunce cousayle duke burbons tent thought defiaunce reasonable susteyned greatly wordes opinyon lorde coucy sayeng howe better make nother maner treatie specyall lorde loys erle arthoys sir philyp bare sayd syth armes taken accepted parte shulde great blame let wherfore name god lady let knyghtes squyers furnysshe enterprise purpose holden susteyned thynges consydred thought best hole host shulde armed ordre batayle thentent sarazyns wolde falsnesse shulde redy resyst accomplysshed euery man well armed drewe ye felde good ordre batayle redy fyght genouoys crosebowes one syde knyghtes squiers syde euery lord vnder baner penon armes goodly syght beholde crysten men shewed well howe great desyre sarazyns shuld haue come fought ten crysten knightes squiers redy felde aloue fro company abydynge ten sarazins shulde haue fought semed well wyll therto whan sawe howe crysten men ordred selfe redy batayle douted durst nat come forwarde thre tymes many men crysten men sarasyns wolde often tymes come well mounted skrymyssh crysten mennes batayle returne againe dyd pure malice put crysten men payne traueyle day hote sonne suche sene moste lusty fresshe sore chafed harnesse nere ouercome faute ayre wynde always x crysten men taryed parte ten sarazyns nother sawe herde tydynges aduysed aproche towne aufryke assayle seynge redy armed redy batayle day kepe honour ten knightes kept felde tyll night went assaute knyghtes squyers desyringe dedes armes hote sore chafed yet traueyled selfe sarasyns well knowen case ye crysten men might haue done great domage reysed siege lykelyhode haue victory ye crysten men wery sore traueyled lytell strenght howe conquered assaute first wall towne man dwelte sarazyns retrayed seconde fortresse skrymysshynge without takynge great domage crysten men domage ynough skrimisshyng assautynge heate sonne duste sandes tyll myght wherby dyuers knyghtes squiers toke dethe whiche great pytie domage said occasion dyed first syr willyam gacill sir guyssharde de la garde syr lyon scalet sir guy de la saluest syr willm staple syr wilyam guyret syr geffrey ye chapell lorde pierbuffier lorde bonet sir robert hanges sir stephyn sanxere sir aubert de la mote sir alaine champayn ser geffrey fresiers ser rafe couffan lorde bourke artysion sir iohan crey bastarde sir bertram de sanache syr pyncharde morlayne sir trystram brother syr ayme cousay ser ayme tourmay sir foukes stanfours sir iohan chateuas knight dyed squiers foucans liege iohan isle blondelet areton iohn de la mote bouberis florida roque ye lorde belle brother willyam fondragay water cauforus iohan morillen pier malnes gyllot villaine iohn lound iohn perier iohan menne iohan lauay willyam parke dyed mo lx knightes squyers whiche wysely consyder great losse ye lorde coucy ben beleued nat fortuned kepte lodgynges dyd receyued suche domage phow aduenture domage fell crysten men reason assaute towne aufryke many knightes squyers deed mayntayned selfe wysely dyd cotynued siege longe season cap clxxii foresaid aduenture knightes squiers host sore displeased abasshed euery man bewayled fredes nyght drewe lodginges made gretter watche made dout sarazyns passed nyght without domage aduenture sarazins knewe nothyng knowen case christen men might haue done great domage alwayes feared christen men durst neuer adueture auauce selfe scrimysshing castynge dartes moost renomed armes partie agadyngore olyferne loued doughter ye kyng thunes wherby moost fresshest ioly dedes armes thus contynued ye siege towne aufryke realme fraunce englande suche countreys knightes came fro herde maner tidynges wherof frendes sore abasshed wyst nat saye thynke dyuers place bothe englande heynalte frauce processyos made pray god sperite christen men thentencion christen men beyng siege abyde tyll coquered town affrike outher force famyne treatie kyng cicyll wolde gladly ben wolde xpen yles adioynyng towne affrike vtter enemye specially genouoys toke great payne serue lordes pleasure thetent shulde nat anoyed reason long siege speke proly marueylous enterprice came highe corage christen knightes squyers specially frenchman losse knightes squiers pouertie endured yet cotynued styll siege great costes charg without ayde coforte genouoys ye first setter enterprice began faynt dissymule bruteran wolde haue ben gladde haue made treatie sarazyns haue lefte knyghtes fraunce englande christen countreys styll busynesse shall shewe enformed p nowe present tyme lette v leaue speke siege aufryke speke fest kynge englande made season london pof feest iustes made kyng englande lodon whyle christen knyghtes squyers sege towne aufryke agaynst sarazyns howe feest publisshe dyuers countreis landes cap clxxiii ye haue herde hystorie feest holde paris wha quene isabell fraunce made first entre whiche feest tidynges sprede abrode euery coutre kynge icharde englande thre vncles yng goodly fest paris ye reportes suche knyghtes squyers owne ben fest ordayned great fest holden cyte lodon shulde iustes lx knyghtes abyde comer lx ladyes fresshely apparelled kepe company knightes iust two dayes besyde sonday chalenge begyn next sonday ye fest saint michaell yere lorde god mccc fourscore ten whiche sonday said lx knightes lx ladyes two ye clocke noon shuld issue oute towre london coe long cytie chepe smyth elde daye xii knightes redy abyde knyght straugers suche wolde iust soday called sonday fest chalenge moday next sayd lx knightes place redy iuste abyde comer curtesly ron rokettes best doer syde shulde gyuen hym price riche crowne golde best doer syde duely examyned ladyes quenes chambre shulde haue price riche gyrdell golde tuesday folowynge knightes shulde agayne place abyde maner squyers straugers suche wolde iust rokettes best iuster syde shulde haue price courser sadled chiefe doer syde shulde haue faucon maner fest thus ordayned deuised herauldes charged crye publysshe feest englande scotlande almayne flauders brabant heynalt fraunce heraldes departed hider thider tidyng sprede abrode dyuers coutreys heraudes daye tyme suffycient knightes squiers dyuers coutreys apparelled selfes feest se maner englande iuste whan tidynges came heynalt sir wyllyam heynault erle ostrenaunt yonge lyberall desyrous iuste purposed hym selfe go feest engla de se honour cosyns kyng rycharde englande vncles whome neuer sene hadde great desyre aquaynted desyred knightes squyers kepe hym co pany specially lorde gomegynes bycause well acquaynted englysshe men ben dyuers tymes amonge thanne sir wyllyam haynaulte purposed whyle made prouisyon go hollande se father auberte erle heynaulte hollande zelande entente speke hym take leaue go englande deted fro quesnoy haynault rode tyll came haye hollande erle father tyme shewed father purpose go englande se countrey cosyns neuer sene therle father answered sayd wyllyam fayre son ye haue nothyng englade nowe ye couenaunt maryage alyed realme fraunce suster maryed duke burgoyne wherfore ye nede nat seke none alyaunce dere father quod wyll nat go englande make alyauce feest make myrthe cosins yet neuer sawe bycause feest whiche shalbe holden london publisshed abrode wherfore syth signifyed therof shulde nat go thyder shulde sayd proude presuptuous wher fore sauynge myne honoure wyll go thider therfore dere father requyre agree therto sonne quod ye lyste thynke surely better ye taryed home whan erle ostrenaunt sawe wordes contented nat father wolde speke therof fell comunicacion thought well ynough wolde dayly sent prouisyon towardes calais gomegynes heraulde sente englande fro therle ostrenaunt gyue knowlege kynge rycharde vncles howe wolde come honorably feest london tidynges kynge vncles ryght ioyouse gaue heraulde great giftes whiche stode hym great stede ende dayes fell blynde nat tell god displeased hym nat dayes lyued marueylously wherfore olde dayes hadde loste syght fewe sorte therof thus erle ostrenaunt departed haye hollande toke leaue father retourned quesnoy heynaulte coutesse wyfe noble feest wherof make cyon publysshed cryed dyuers place wherby knyghtes squyers aduaunsed selfes go thyder erle walleran saynt pole wyfe kyng richarde englandes suster prepared greatly go englande came calys also erle ostrenaunt departed fro heynaulte well accompanyed knyghtes squyers passed throughe countrey arthoys came also cali founde erle saynt poule shyppes passagers douer redy whan shippes charged wynde good lordes tooke see howe shewed thynke true therle saynt poule passed first englande erle ostrenaunt whan came london founde kyng brother lawe sir iohan hollande lordes knyghtes englande receyued hym great ioye demauded hym tidynges realme fraunce aunswered well wysely therle ostrenaunt passed ouer thursdaye cae cauterbury friday visyted saint thomas shrine offred mornyng laye daye nexte day rode rochester bycause gret company cariages rode small iourneys ease horse sondaye rode dyner dertforde dyuer london feest whiche began sonday sonday nexte feest saynt michaell feest tryu phe shulde begyn daye done smythfelde iustes called chalenge sonday thre clocke noone issued towre london first threscore courser apparelled iustes euery one squier honour ridyng softe pase issued threscore ladyes honour mounted fayre palfrey ridyng one syde richely apparelled euery lady ledde knight cheyne syluer knightes apparelled iust thus cam ridynge longe stretes london great nombre trumpettes mynstrelles came smythfelde quene englande lady damoselles redy chabres richely adorned se iustes king quene whan ye ladyes ledde knyghtes come place taken downe fro palfrey mou ted vp chambres redy aparelled squiers honour alighted fro courser knightes good order mou ted helmes sette made redy poyntes thyder came erle saynt poule nobly accompanyed knyghtes squyers armed harnesse iustes begynne feest whiche incontynent beganne iusted knyghtes straungers suche wolde hadde leysar space nyght came thus iustes chaleng began cotynued tyll night knyghtes ladyes withdrue selfes quene lodged besyde poules bysshoppes palace supper prepared euennynge came therle ostrenaunt kyng nobly receyued p nowe iustes sonday aunswerer without erle walleran saynt poule price chalengers erle huntyngdon goodly dausyng quenes lodgyng presence kynge vncles baron englande ladyes damoselles contynuyng tyll daye whiche tyme euery persone drawe lodgynges except kyng quene lay bysshoppes palays laye feestes iustes duryng nexte day whiche mondaye ye myght haue sene dyuers place cytie london squyers varlettes goynge aboute harnesse doynge busynesse maisters noon kynge richarde came place armed richely apparelled accompanyed duke erles lordes knyghtes one inner partie quene well accompanyed ladyes damosel came place iustes shulde mounted cha bres scaffoldes ordayned came felde erle ostrenaunte well accopanyed knyghtes cou trey redy iuste came erle saynt poule knyghtes fraunce suche wolde iuste began iustes euery man payned hym selfe gette honour stryken fro horse iustes contynued tyll nere nyght euery son drewe lodgynges knyghtes ladyes ye hour supper euery man drewe courte goodly supper well ordayned day price gyuen erle ostrenaunt best iuster vtter partie well deserued price gyuen hym ladyes lordes herauldes ordained iudges inner partie knyght englande called sir hughe spenser price nexte daye tuesday iustes agayne place maner squyers whiche endured tyll nyght presence kyng quene lordes ladyes euery man drewe lodgyng done dayes supper retourned bysshoppes palais kyng quene ladyes goodly costely supper great daunsynge contynuynge nyght wednisdaye dyner iusted place maner knightes squyers suche wolde iuste sore rude iustes enduryng tyll nyght wtdrue hour supper resorted supped thursdaye kyng made supper knyghtes gentylmen straungers quene ladyes damoselles friday duke lancastre made dyner knightes squyers straungers whiche goodly dyner saturdaye kyng lordes departed fro lodon wyndsore therle ostrenaunt erle saynt poule knightes squyers straungers desyred acompany kyng wyndsore euery rode reason castell wyndsore began agayne great feest dyners supper gyuen king specially kyng dyde great honour erle ostrenaunt cosyn whiche erle desyred kyng vncles wolde content take hym order garter erle aunswered howe wolde take cousayle mater cousayled lorde gomegines fierabras vertan bastarde wyse wolde discorage counsayle hym refuce order garter toke hym wherof knightes squyers frauce suche great marueyle murmured sore therat among selfe sayeng erle ostrenaunt sheweth well courage enclyneth rather englysshe frenche whan taketh hym order garter weareth kynge englandes deuyse sheweth well regardeth nat house fraunce house burgoyne tyme wyll come shall repent hym selfe thynges cosydred knoweth nat hath done welbeloued frenche kynge duke thourayne brother blode royall suche wyse whan came parys place euer made hym honour cosyns thus frenche men euyll accused hym without cause done nothyng contrary hurtfull realme fraunce cosyns frendes fraunce thought none otherwyse honour loue pleace cosyns englande therby rather good meane bytwene frauce englande nede daye toke hym order garter othe euery man maye well vnderstande made none alyaunce preiudyce realme fraunce dyde loue good company howe man canne let enuyous speke yuell whan dauced sported certayne pace castell wynsore kyng hadde gyuen many fayre gyttes ye knightes squy honour realme fraunce heynaulte specially yonge erle ostrenaunt euery man toke leaue kynge quene ladyes damoselles kynges vncles thane erle saynt poule frenche men henowayes almaygnes departed thus ended great feest cytie london euery man went owne fortuned none brute ronneth farre frenche kynge brother vncles enfourmed suche hadde ben englande sayde feest euery thyng hadde done sayd nothyuge forgotten rather putte exaltyng yuell dedes fortheryng good dedes shewed kyng playnly erle ostrenaunt ben englande taken great payne exalte honoure englysshe men helpynge forwarde feest holden london howe hadde chiefe prise honoure iustes aboue straungers howe spoken fayre englysh men become kynge englandes man made scruyce alyaunce hym taken hym order garter chapell saynt george wyndsore whiche order fyrste stablysshed kynge edwarde thirde sonne prince wale howe man myght entre confrary company without make seruyaunt othe neuer beare armoure agaynste crowne englande whiche promyse sayd erle ostrenaunt made oute reseruacyon tidynges frenche kynge brother vncles sore troubled greuously displeased erle ostrenaunt frenche kyng sayde lo sir ye maye e hym nat yet yere paste sythe desyred brother myght bysshoppe cambrey tidynges gyfte rather preiudyciall realme fraunce auau cement hadde better gyuen cosyn saynt poule heynoways dyd neuer good v neuer wyll proude presumptuous fierse alwayes haue owed better good wyll englysshe men v daye shall come shall repent wyll sende erle ostrenaunt comau dynge hym come v v homage coutie ostrenaunt el shall put hym fro annexe oure realme counsayle answered sayde sir ye haue well deuysed lette done ye haue sayde maye well thought duke burgoyne whose doughter erle ostrenaunt wyfe nothynge content tidynges alwayes auaunsed sonne ostrenaunt towardes kyng cousaile mater nat forgotten incontinent frenche kyng wrote sharpe letter therle ostrenaut quesnoy heynaulte comaundyng hym come parys homage kynge peeres fraunce coutie ostrenaut el kyng wolde take fro hym make hym warre whan erle well ouersene letter parceyued howe frenche kyng counsayle displeased hym make answere assembled counsayle lorde fountayns lorde gomegynes sir wyllyam hermes lorde trassegnies bayly heynaulte lorde sancelles sir rase montigny abbot crispyne iohan sulbart iaquemart barrier valencennes wysemen counsayled togider answere might made kynges letter many reason alleged last thynges consydred thought best write frenche kynge counsayle take daye answere clerely maner demaundes mouthe certayne credyble son none writyng meane season sente certayne notable personage erle heynaulte duke aubert holade haue cou sayles answere make thus dyde wrote swetely courtesly kynge counsayle fyrst letter kyng cousayle well content therle cou sayle sent hollande lorde trassegines lorde sancelles iohan semart iaques barrier rode erle heynault shewed hym state countie heynault letter frenche kyng hadde sent sonne erle ostrenaunt erle heynaulte marueyle mater said sir thought neuer otherwyse shulde come thus passe wyllyam sone nothyng go englade haue delyuered hym rule gouernaunce coutie heynaulte might haue done vsed hym selfe accordyng counsayle countrey sir shall tell ye shall go fayre cosyn duke burgoyn lyeth well power regarde sette order thynges demaunded frenche kynge canne gyue better counsayle answere departed hollande came heynault shewed answere wherwith erle counsayle content assigned go frauce duke burgoyne lorde trassegnies sir wyllm hermyes sir rase montigny iohan semart iaques barrier shewe declare ye processe sute made frenche courte shulde ouer longe resyte finally thynges concluded yt duke burgoyne coude non remedy erle ostrenaunt must come personally parys knowe homage due frenche kyng countie ostrenaunt el surely haue warre lorde coucy sir olyuer clysson toke great payne erles sake sir iohn mercier lorde de la ryuer labored contrarye syde moche might p nowe let v leaue speke mater retourne speke lordes knyghtes fraunce siege strong towne aufryke agaynst sarazyns phowe incydent siege reysed towne aufryke occasyon howe euery man retourned owne countreis cap clxxiiii ye haue herde howe christen men besieged stronge towne aufryke lande see settyng entente howe conquere thought might wyn brute therof shulde sounde great honour prayse howe myght kepe selfe toguyder resyst agaynst ennemyes sayenge howe shulde alwayes haue conforte christen men specially frenche kyng yong desyrous dedes armes consydring howe truce englysshmen two yeres coe sarazyns feared wherfore dayly made prouysyon towne refresshed alwaies towne newe fressh men hardy aduenturers accordynge vsage thus season passed christen men hadde suffred great losse companyons lytell wynnynge aduauntage partye hole hoost maner dyscomforted coulde nat se howe reuenged many theym beganne murmure sayenge lye vayne skrymysshes make therby shall neuer wyn towne auffryke slee eche wyll gette agayne ten owne countrey haue vytayles prouysyons pleasure haue great dau ger parell shall thynke lye wynter longe colde nyghtes shalbe morfounded frosen dethe thus shall herde case dyuers wayes first wynter man dare take see cruell tyrryble wyndes tempestes see see tempestes fierser wynter somer shulde lacke vytayles eight dayes togyther see wolde suffre none come v deed lost without remedy secondly though vytayles thynges necessary daunger yet howe coulde watche endure payne traueyle contynually watche euery night parell aduenture ouer herde v beare enemyes owne countrey knowe countrey may come nyght assayle v great aduauntage v great domage haue done redy thyrdly faute good ayre swete fresshe meates wherwith haue norysshed mortalyte hap fall hoost shall dye euery man fro haue remedy resyst agaynst also furthermore genouoys turne agaynst v rude people traytours may nyght tyme entre shyppes leue v pay scotte doutes consydred capytaynes lye ease regarde nat case also genouoys spared nat speke sayd raylynge crysten men men armes ye frenche men whan departed fro genne thought within fyftene dayes ye layen siege towne aufryke ye shulde haue conquered nowe haue ben thanne two monthes yet haue done nothyng assautes skrymysshes ye make towne nedeth nat feare yere yet nexte maner meanes ye shall neuer conquere realme aufryke yet thunes comunynge spred abrode hoost came knowlege gret lordes capytaynes armye specyally lorde coucy sage discrete whose cousayle chefe parte host inclyned euer vnto sayd selfe considred howe doutes greatly feared entente ordayn hastely remedy assembled secretly great lordes hoost togyder counsayle bycause wynter aproched counsayle kept duke burbons tente conclusyon dyslodge seasone euery man retourne way came lordes prepared secretly patron galees sente purpose shewed vnto wyst nat say contrary laste sayde lordes take doute suspecte v haue made promesse wherfore wyll acquyte v truely wolde haue enclyned treaty affrykans wolde gaue desyred haue peace v bnt wold neuer gyue heryng wyll kepe faythe syth haue promysed sir quod lorde coucy repute good trewe valyasit men haue consydred dyuers thynges wynter aprocheth destytute vitayles prouysions grace god one retourned realme fraunce shall enfourme kynge yonge lusty desyrous knowe maner march seynge hath treuce englysshe men thynke small counsaylynge wyll cause hym come hyther puyssaunce royall well ayde king cicyll make conquest vpon sarazyns wherfore syrs requyre make redy galees vessel wyll departe within shorte dayes genouoys nothynge content frenche men wolde departe fro siege stronge towne aufryke coulde fynde none remedy wherfore behoued suffre generall brute ran hoost howe genouoys aboute bargayne sarazyns take parte betray ye crysten men crysten men beleued true said one souerayne capitayns duke burbone erle dolphyn auuergne lorde coucy syr guy de la tremoyle syr iohan vyen syr phylyppe bare knowe surely howe euery thynge gothe therfore shall thus sodaynely departe fro siege departure publysshed throughe hoost euery man comaunded conuey euery thing shyppes saruautes varletres redy trusse maner baggage cary vessel lyenge ancre whan euery thyng coueyed euery man entred suche shyppes came dyuers barones knyghtes made couenaut patron maysters shyppes sayle naples cicyll cyper rodes entent go iherusalem thus departed fro siege aufryke toke see syght sarazyns within towne whan sawe departure made gret noyse blowyng horne sownynge taburs shoutynge cryeng suche wyse host sarazyns lay abrode knew therof ye shuld haue sene yonge sarazyns moute horse came place siege layne se coulde haue founde thynge agadingor olyferne brahadyne thunes formest sawe howe christen men clene departed lefte nothynge behynde myght cary sarazyns rode vp downe two houres se maner howe crysten men lodged theym selfe siege greatly praysed crysten mennes subtyltie made many pyttes erthe haue therby fresshe water whan hadde certayne space well regarded galees shyppes see theym entred towne aufryke se frendes alyes departed agayne lodgynges made bost voyage sayenge howe crysten men durst abyde lengar sayd howe puissaunce nothynge regarde wolde neuer sette somoche frenche men genouoys done sayd trouth shall tell howe wherfore siege thus contynued enfourmed ye sarazins waxed proude sawe well howe genouoys done full power hurte anoy sawe voyage great coste yet lytell whiche trouthe season sarazyns knewe nothing deth many crysten knyghtes squyers slayne great skrymysshe day crysten men departed knowledge therof shall shewe meanes sarazyns founde felde varlet genouoys lyenge grounde sore sycke hote feuer nat able go galees whan felowes departed fyndynge varlet sarazyns ryght ioyfull brought lordes shewed howe founde hym trucheman set examynacion begynnynge wolde shewe nothyng reekened himselfe deed desyred sarazyns incontynent wolde put hym deth lordes hoost agadingor dolyferne brahadyn thunes dyuers thought shulde cause hym dye shulde wyn nothyng therby yet rather saue lyfe yt wolde shewe trouthe shulde demaunded shewed hym wolde without lyenge shewe trouth lyfe shulde saued delyuered franke free sent owne coutrey first shyp shulde come thence outher lande geneue marcyll also shulde haue gyuen hym c besantes golde whan varlet feared dethe herde promesse well comforted knew well euer sarazyns promyse faythe shulde truely kepte also ye knowe well naturally euery man lothe dye said truchman cause lordes swere lawe vpholde ye sayd shall aunswere shalbe examyned farre forth knowe trucheman shewed lordes made faythfull promesse fayth fullfyll promesse ye varlet sayd nowe demaund ye wyll shall answere firste demaunded whence answered sayd portnances demaunded hym feates frenche men siege named dyuers hadde kepte often tymes copany harauldes whome lerned dyuers name desyred knowe ye occasion departed sodaynely fro siege wher answered wysely sayd nat tell supposynge acordyng haue herde spoken host neuer counsayle lordes brute went frenchman doute genouoys shulde betray genouoys denyed sayd neuer thought neuer wolde blamed frenchman yt shulde slaunder also sayd parte occasyon departure bycause wynter druenere afrayde taking suche domage receyued domage quod lordes syrs daye ten men shulde haue fought ten lost lx knightes squiers name armes genouoys sayd cause departed beleued well ye varlet whiche newes lordes sarazyns great ioye enquered hym vphelde promesses retourned portnances geane shewed aduenture said herde receyued blame therof sarazyns sayd amonge selfe shulde nat nede care frenche men genouoys longe season said howe towne aufryke taken profyte howe sayde wolde take better hede porte hauens see costes realmes specyally straytes marroke set sure watche genouoys venysians shulde nat passe wayes englande flaunders marchaundyses without payenge great trybute yet greate grace lycence thus sarazyns assembled alyed togythers dyuers realmes aufryke thunes bogy martoke belmaryn tremessyans granade agreed togyder kepe straytly porte passage sette galees armed see great nombre entent lordes maisters see dyd great hatred frenchman genouoys bycause ben siege aufryke thus dyd great trouble goer commers see moche yuell myschefe grewe therby meanes sarazyns thus lordes see suche marchaundyses came fro dama fro cayrel fro alexaunder fro venyce fro naples fro geane yt season dere flaunders scarce many thynges coulde nat gotte nouther golde syluer specially spycery wonderfull dere gayson ye haue herd howe crysten men departed siege aufryke passed see aryued nat one porte sore tourmented see retourned great daunger howe theym returned geane processyons made frauce good spede tydynges herde lady coucy lady sulley lady dolphyn auuergne ladyes frauce husbandes voyage great sorowe longe voyage endured whan tydynges came howe passed see ryght ioyfull duke burbone lorde coucy retourned priuely lefte behynde caryage trayne came parys aboute saynte martyns tyde wynter frenche kynge ioyouse comynge reason demaunded tydinges barbary voyage shewed al knewe herde sene kynge duke thourayne glad speke kyng sayd bringe aboute make peace churche bytwene v englade shall gladly make voyage army royall party exalte crysten fayth confounde infydels acquyte dedes predecessours kyng ppilyp kinge iohan bothe eche tooke crossey haue gone holy lande gone thyder ye warres nat fallen realme lyke wyse wolde gladly make suche voyage thus frenche kynge comuned lordes day passed lytell lytell men came home fro voyage kynge helde hym selfe season comenly parys somtyme ye castell lowre nother tyme howse saynt powle quene comenly laye fell season aboute feest saynt andrewe knyghtes squyers retourned fro voyage barbary wherof yt worlde spake frenche kynges court mocyon moued newe iourney made thyder bycause frenche kynge gret affection dedes armes counsayled exorted therto sayde hym syr ye haue deuocyon great ymagynacion go ouer see fyght agaynst infydels conquere holy lande trewe quod kynge thought nyght day none thyng enfourmed ye lord tremoyle sir iohan mercier wordes king owed fauour pope clement beynge auignon loke two sayd ye kyng wolde agre speciall fauour sayd kynge syr ye nat good conscience take voyage first church one syr begyn first heed enterprise shall take good conclusyon quod kynge wolde ye haue begyn syr quod present tyme ye nat charged great busynesse ye haue treuce englysshe men longe space wherfore syr please peace durynge ye myght make goodly voyage syr se better honourable voyage thanne go rome great puyssaunce men armes pull downe dystroy antepaye whome romayns force hath created set seate cathedrall saynt peter ye wyll ye maye well accomplysshe voyage suppose ye nat passe tyme honorably syr ye maye well know antepape cardynals knowe one yt ye mynded come army wyll yelde self aske mercy kynge remebred hym selfe lytell sayd howe wolde deuysed surely said moche bounde pope clement yere past ben auygnon pope cardynals made hym ryght honourable chere gyuen demaunded bothe hym selfe brother vncles wherfore kynge sayd hadde deserued haue recompence also departure fro auignon promysed pope helpe assyst hym quarell season parys kyng duke berrey burgoyne agreed concluded nexte marche kynge shuld departe fro parys take way towardes sauoy lombardy erle sauoy sende cosyn germayne hym kynge haue vnder charge duke tourayne brother four thousande speares duke burgoyne two thousande speares duke berrey two thousade constable fraunce two thousande speares breton raintoners lowe march duke burbon thousade speares lorde saynt poll lorde coucy thousande speares men armes payed hande thre monethes fro terme terme whan tydynges knowen auignon pope clement cardynals greatly reioysed thought maner enterprise atcheued also kinge cousayled nat leaue duke bretayne behynde hym sende desyre hym prepare hym selfe go voyage kyng wrote notably hym sent letter man honour offycer armes signyfyenge duke letter state voyage whan duke red letter turned hym selfe smyled called hym lorde mountboucher sayd syr harke regarde well frenche kyng hath written hath enterprised departe next marche great puissaunce go rome distroy suche take parte pope bonyface god helpe iourney shall tourne nothynge shorte space shall haue flax dystaffe well spynne thynke wyll leaue soone folyssh thought also desyreth go hym two thousande speares howebeit wyll honour ought wyll write ioyously bycause shall contente shewe hym howe go voyage shall nat go without seyng pleaseth haue company howe sir moutboucher say vnto wyll nat traueyle man myne yt kyng hath purposed sayd nothynge shall done behalfe duke bretayne wrote goodly letter swete frenche kynge officer armes returned theym parys delyuered kynge redde well contented aunswere pof englysshe knyghtes sente parys frenche kynge fro kynge englande vncles treate peace cap c lxxv wyll purpose frenche kynge none wolde breke pleased greatly knyghtes squyers fraunce bycause wyst nat better enploy season euery man prepared towardes voyage namely clergy prouynces realme ordayned graunted tayle sende costes charge men warre kynge howe voyage tourned nothynge duke bretayne sayd shall shewe incidence ye feest candelmas came tydynges frenche kyng counsayle whiche loked nothynge certayne kynge englandes cousayle suche priuy chambre sent nobly parys frenche kyng chefe legacyon syr thomas percy syr loys clyfforde sir robert briquet dyuers knyghtes company herde mo named whan thre knyghtes come parys hym french kyng desyrous knowe myght meane kynge englande dyd sende hastely counsayle hym knyghtes englande syr thomas percy alyghted parys streate called crosse signe castell frenche kynge lay castell lowere brother duke tourayne hym thre vncles lodgynges cytie costable syr olyuer clysson nere hade noone whan englysshe men came parys kept lodgynge day nyght next day aboute nyue ye clocke lept horse ryght honorably rode castell loure kyng brother vncles erle saint poll lorde coucy constable frauce sir iohan vien sir guy de la tremoyle dyuers baron fraunce redy receyue englysshe ambassadours alyghted ye gate entred receyued lord de la ryuer syr iohan mercyer sir lyon lignach sir peter villers sir willyam tremoyle syr marcell receyued honourably brought theym chambre kynge taryed dyd bonettes kneled downe syr thomas percy hadde letter credence kynge englande sente frenche kynge delyuered kyng tooke caused knyghtes stande vp stepe backe kynge opyned letter red sawe well credence called hym brother vncles shewed letter vncles sayd syr call forthe knyghtes wyll say aproched comaunded declare credence si thomas percy spake sayd dere sir entencyon souerayne lorde kinge englande wolde gladly suche specyall counsayle vncles duke lancastre yorke glocestre prelate englande suche specyall might come presence counsayle shortely myght treate maner peace togyther myght couenably resonably con oyned meanes sounde haue conclusyon peace wold therof right ioyfull entente wolde nouther spare owne payne laboure yet none men nother come hym selfe sende suffyciente persones ouer thesee cytie amyence place assigned syr come hyder entente knowe pleasure behalfe kynge aunswered sayde syr thomas percy company ryght hertely welcome youre comynge wordes ryght ioyfull ye shall ary paris season wyll speke counsayle make suche couenable answere ye depart shall suffyce answere englysshe men well content nere dyner tyme englysshe men desyred tary dyne lorde coucy brought chambre lorde de la ryuer dyned layser dy er retourned kynges chambre wyne spyces thanne toke leaue kynge wente lodgynge comynge syr thomas percy company frauce tydynges brought pleased greatly frenche kynge duke burgoyne dyuers counsayle nat specially suche ayded sustayne pope clementes quarell sawe well tydynges frenche kynge enclyned treatie shulde greatly let hynder voyage mynded go rome distroy pope bonyfac cardynals el bringe beleue pope clemente mater treatie peace egh touched moche welthe prefyte crystendome persone durst speke duke burgoyn counsayle kynge brother duke burbone one acorde kyng made good chere ser thomas percy englysshmen amonge one knyght called sir robert briquet wheme frenche kynge loued nat frenche man borne alwayes helde selfe outher naueroys englysshe one king englandes priuy chambre frenche kynge dissymuled hym sagely whan spake theym alwayes kynge wolde tourne selfe syr thomas percy el syr loys clyfforde sayd syrs wolde gladly se peace bytwene v aduersary kynge englande quarell warre hath longe endured bytwene v one thinge wyll ye knowe yt shall nat hyndred parte though gretly cost sir quod kyng souerayne lorde hath sent v hyther hathe great affection haue peace saythe shall nat let parte hath marueyle warre dyscensyon bytwene landes hath endured longe good amyable meanes hathe tyme frenche kynge answered sayd shall se good affection hath thervnto englysshemen taryed parys vi dayes euery day dyned one duke fraunce meane season determyned frenche kynge vncles priuy counsayle shulde amyence myddes marche next abyde coming kynge englande vncles counsayle wolde come thyder englysshe knyghtes sayd made doute lest kynge englandes vncles shulde day assigned amyence conclusyon treatie daye shulde departe parys kynge came ye palays vncles made dynner englyssh knightes caused sir thomas percy sytte borde called hym cosyn reason northumberlandes blode dyner gyuen sir thomas percy englyssh knightes squiers great gyftes fayre iewels gyunge ouer slypte syr robert briquet syr peter villers chefe steward frenche kynge delyuered gyftes said syr robert briquet sir whan ye haue done suche seruyce kynge maister shall please hym ryche puisaunt ynough rewarde whiche word sir robert briquet sore abasshed parceyued well therby ye kyng loued hym nat fayne suffre dyner mynstels began play pastyme one past sir thoms percy cae kyng sayd sir company haue great marueyle one thing yt ye haue made v good chere gyuen v great gyftes sir robert briquet hath nothynge knight maisters preuy chambre sir desyre knowe cause therto answered frenche kyng sayd sir thomas knyght ye speke syth ye wyll knowe yt mater hath nede batayle agaynst taken prisoner raunsome shulde soone payde therwith kyng entred comunycacion wyne spyces brought forthe tooke leaue retourned lodgynge made reconyng payde euery thyng nexte daye departed spedde iourneys arryued englade shewed kyng vncles howe spedde greatly praysed freche kyng chere made shewed gyftes iewels gyuen p nowe lette v leaue lytell speke englysshe men shewe kyng iohan castyle pof dethe kyng iohn castyle crownyng kynge henry sonne cap c lxxvi ye haue herde hystorie peace made bytwene kynge castyle duke lancastre chalenged haue ryght realme castyle reason lady custaunce wyfe doughter kyng peter meanes fayre doughter yt duke lancastre sayde lady custaunce peace made confyrmed sayde kynge iohan castyle sonne heyre called henry prince galyce henry maryed duke lancaster doughter wherby good peace made bytwene englande castyle within two yeres maryage kynge iohan castyle dyed buryed burgus spaygne anone dethe prelate lordes spaygne drewe toguyder determyned crowne yonge herytoure prince galyce prince henry crowned nynth yere age wyfe doughter duke lancastre fyfteene yere age thus duke doughter lady custaunce quene castyle lady heritour landes seignories kyng dompeter kyng henry kyng iohan helde excepte duke lacastre father wyfe mother durynge lyues whiche pensyon hundred thousande doreyns yere foure best erles spayne pledge dettours thus duke lancastre sawe two doughters one quene spaygne quene portugale bestowed pnowe lette v speke yonge erle armynake voyage made lombardy matter requyreth shall leaue speke kynge castyle pof army yonge erle iohan armynake vyage made lombardy howe dyed siege towne alexandre ca c lxxvii hath shewed great fectyon yonge erle armynake go lombardy menne warre ayde assyste suster germayne brother lawe husbande lorde barnabo eldest sonne lorde barnabo whome duke myllayne caused slayne marueylouslye duke myllayne erle vertues named galea whose doughter duke orlyaunce hadde wyfe sayd lady doughter olde erle armynake suster yonge erle greatly abasshed disconforted truste brother signified hym estate pouertie necessyte mage suffred humbly requyred brother wolde helpe kepe defende agaynst tyraunt erle vertues wolde disheryte without tytell reason request suster erle armynake condiscended sayde soeuer shulde coste hym wolde deuoyre ayde suster promysed acco plisshed dede ayde erle dolphyne auuergne made dyuers treaty auuergne rouergue quercy lymosyn piergourte engoulmoys agenoyes bought certayne fortress whiche kepte englysshe men gascoyns breton suche hadde made warre agaynst realme fraunce vnder colour kyng englande suche hadde agreed withall hadde pardon frenche kyng besyde kyng gaue golde syluer gyuen amonge theym bounde erle armynake go hym lobardy ayde hym warres euery man shewed hym selfe therto well wyllynge euery man drewe ryuer rosne ye ryuer sosne duke berrey duke burgoyne suffred countreys take vitaylles pleasure wolde gladly haue clene delyuered countre yt season vnder kyng ruled dolphynry lorde engueram durdyn kynge written hym commaundyng men warre parteynyng erle armynake shulde pesably passe throughe countrey haue neded money whan erle foiz beynge byerne castell ortays vnderstode howe erle armynake assembled men warre toguyder began muse man greatly ymaginatife well herde howe brute erle armynake made assemble go lobardy agaynst lorde myllaygne bycause tyme past erle armynake predecessours brother bernarde armynake made hym warre therfore douted lest sayde assemble shulde tourne agaynst hym wherfore thought wolde nat vnprouyded prepared fortress men warre made suche prouysion assayled resyst puissaunce erle armynake brother nothynge purpose thought surely vpholde ye treuce bytwene atcheue enterprice lombardy many knyghtes squyers englysshe gascoyns breton bounde serue erle armynake warres shulde haue made warre agaynst erle foiz wolde haue taken erle foiz parte haue forsaken erle armynake erle foiz welbeloued men warre wysedome largesse prowesse hym whane duchesse thourayne enfourmed howe therle armynake redy passe ouer mountayns entre lombardy puissaunce men warre make warre agaynst duke myllayne father howe freche kyng vncles duke berrey burgoyne consented therto bycause wolde haue countreis clene auoyded co panyons route pyllars suche often tymes greued sore coutreys lady thought nat forgette matter wrote father duke millayne knewe entente shulde take hede hym selfe countrey lorde myllayne well enformed busynesse prouyded menne warre might gette refresshed townes cyties castelles vitayle munysios warre loked surely haue warre erle armynake hadde dede myddes moneth marche moost parte co panyons assembled toguyder marchesse auignon longe ryuer rosne nombre fyftene thousande horse passed ryuer entred dolphynny vyen lodged abrode vyllages passed forwarde haue easy passage thoroughe mountayns whiche peryllous passe bothe man horse erle armynake brother certayne knyghtes wente auygnon se hym called pope clemente cardynalles offred seruyce pope ayde hym agaynst tyrantes lombardes whiche offre thanked whan ben eight dayes great parte company paste forwarde tooke leaue pope cardynalles prepared folowe men two bretherne departed sondre erle iohan armynake sir bernarde brother erle sayde brother ye shall retourne backe armynake kepe herytage comynges armynake yet fortress nat delyuered fro companyons yet garyson lourde peter arnaulte kepeth vnder kynge englande also garyson bounteuyll whiche kepte sir iohan granley sonne captall buse thoughe nowe haue peace erle foiz yet good doubte hym cruell hastye thought vnknowen therfore good landes nat dyspurueyed wherfore brother cause ye shall retourne home ye shalle often fro fro sir bernarde lightlye agreed purpose deuyse semed good hym also great affeccyon go forthe iournay departynge erle brother sayde hym brother youre retournyng ye shall go cosyn raymonde thourayne holdeth lande pope countie venus maketh warre agaynst hym cosyn hath maryed doughter prince orenge shewe hym howe desyred pope requyre hym go voyage shall make hym companyon euery thynge shall tary hym cytie gappe bytwene ye mountayns sir quod bernarde shall message thus two bretherne departed sondre felde neuer mette guyder agayne erle armynake toke waye cytie gappe ye lande ganos bernarde brother went castell bolongne sir raymonde thouraygne receyued cosyn ioyously sir bernarde shewed hym message saye fro brother erle armynacke fayre wordes coulde deuyse rather therby enclyne hym therto sir raymonde aunswered layd fayre cosyn brother erle armynake entred farre lobardy hath besieged towne shall folowe hym yet soone men go forwarde write vnto brother cosyn yt aboute moneth maye shall folowe hym ye tyme trust haue ende war betwene myne vncle pope clement cardinal auignon yet wyll ryght kepeth awaye fro force myne vncle pope gregorie gaue wene wery shall nat desyre knyghtes squyers gyueth theym pardon make warre agaynst haue lyst therto canne haue mo men warre thousande floreyns one daye haue absolucions seuyn yere fayre cosyn quod sir bernarde trewe kepe purpose wolde nat counsayle otherwyse ye haue aunswered shall write brother therle armynake quod sir raymonde thus toguyder hole daye thane sir bernarde departed passed ryuer rosne bridge saynt espyrite retourned query rouergue mountayns came thyder wolde lefte erle armynake brother alone warre duke myllayne erle vertues departed fro bolonge wrote brother newes knewe answere sir raymonde thourayne erle armynake receyued letter waye goyng cytie gappe redde letter passed forthe made great force matter wyll contynue speke yonge erle armynacke shewe feate speke mater thus say good loue great affection conforte suster brother lawe husbande erle vertues called hym selfe lorde myllaygne falsely disheryted withoute cause tytell caused erle ioyously passe iourney farre pyemount lombardy two great reason caused erle armynake assemble make iourney tyme fyrste realme fraunce therby clene rydde route companyons hadde done moche hurte reaime therby countreys better assured seconde reason ayde suster great pytie husbande shulde lese herytage wherby shulde lyue maynteyne estate consyderacions toke hym enterprice capitayns companyons sayde one another lette v ryde forthe merily agaynst lombard haue good quarell inste tytell haue good capitayne wherby warre shalbe moche better also shall go best countrey worlde lombardy receyueth fro costes fatnesse worlde e lombardes naturally euer riche cowardes shall attayne agaynst theym moche profyte none v capitayns shall retourne ryche shall neuer nede make warre agaynst man thus companyons de used one another whan came plentuous countrey wolde tary season refresshe horse season good abueturous fought englande sir iohan hacton marchesse florece made warre agaynst floretyns quarell pope bonyface rome rebell agaynst pope comaundement also perusyns erle armynake thought might get englysshe knyght take parte hym shulde haue great treasure hym bycause wysedome valyauntnesse erle wrote hym signyfieng hym hole mater enterprice desyringe hym ayde whiche letter sente discrete person sir iohan hacton beyng marchesse florence two thousande fyghtynge men receyued letter redde whan hadde well vnderstande substaunce therof ryght ioyfull aunswered sayde owne warre one atchyued wolde nothyng tyll company erle armynake messanger sayde sir ye saye well requyre write mynde lorde erle armynake wyll better beleue ryght good wyll sir quod knight reason englysshe knyght wrote delyuered letter messangere retourned came agayne lorde founde hym marchesse pyneroll gret treatie bitwene hym marque salues shulde alyed hym ayde warre agaynst duke myllayne erle vertues tidynges erle armynackes squyer brought hym fro sir iohan hacton wordes written within letter erle greatly reioysed sayd trusted make suche warre duke myllayne wolde bring hym reason elles dye payne whan company passed straytes mountayns good countrey piemounte nere thouraygne rode abrode dyde moche hurte vyllages suche coude nat holde agaynst erle layde sige aste pyemount entended rary sir iohn hacton prouisyon came fro partes also companyons wan certayne small holdes toke vitayls within countre pyneroll landes marque mount feraunt opyned apparelled delyuer vytayles thynges nercessary ye hoost bothe men horse also great prouisyon came ye dolphyne countie sauoy many folkes greatly enclyned erle armynake bycause sawe quarell good iust also bycause erle vertues caused slayne owne vncle sir bernabo enuy sette agayne lordes lombardy herytages disheryted cosyn germayns wherof many great lordes thoughe spake lytell therof yet hadde great pytie case whyle erle laye thus siege aste herde tidynges sir iohn hacton wherof greatlye reioysed tidynges florentynes come pope mercye also venisyens howe sayd sir iohn shulde haue threscore thousande floreyns hym company money one payde receyued delyuered shulde departed promysed fyue hundred speares thousande brigans fote come fronter gene passe ouer ryuer wheder ennemeys wolde natte come erle armynake soeuer shulde tidynges greatlye reioysed erle armynake company ayde sir iohn hacton right pleasaunt erle armynake counsailed dete then go laye siege great cytie called alexandre entryng lobardy whane go bresuell whiche also good cytie fayre thus erle armynake company layde siege cyte alexaundre standyng fayre countrey playne departyng pyemount entrynge lombardy way go ryuer ge ne men warre passed ryuer thesyn lodge ease large countrey good plesaunt aboute lorde galea lorde myllayne erle vertues towne called cytie pauy daylye herde tidynges enemyes dyde marueyle one thynge howe therle armynake coude gette rychesse pay wage many men warre hadde brought hym counsayle answered hym sayde sir haue marueyle therof men hath suche companyons desyreth wynne ryde aduenture haue vsed longe ouerron realme frauce take holdes garysons countrey ye countrey coude neuer delyuered nowe late duke berrey dolphyn auuergne whose cou trey rutters dyde moche domage kepte lordes wylles ouer ranne best parte rytages made theym warre caused erle armynake treate companyons frenche kyng shulde suffre come coutrey make warre therby meanes certayne money gyuen auoyded oute forteresses countrey also besyde frenche kynge hath doned suche made warre agaynst hym ye codycion shulde serue erle armynake warres coude get shulde owne demaunde none wage suche named men armes amonge theym fyue sixe horse owne countreys wolde go foote poore men great parell ieopardy fyght agaynst suche men also lightly good men warre wherfore sir best counsayle gyue kepe townes fortress stronge well prouyded ennemyes haue none artyllary engyns saute regarded maye well come barryers townes scrimysshe domage none appereth well haue ben coutrey two monethes yet haue taken fortresse lytell gret sir let alone shall wery selfe distroyed ende ye fyght nat whan haue distroyed playne countre haue lyue shall fayne returne famyne without yuell fortune fall meane tyme shall well done men warre fortress kepe toguyder ayde eche tyme nede sir sende suche place ye thynke enemyes wyll besiege resyst townes men haue small defece nat vsed accustomed warre nouther assaut defende men armes knightes squyers norisshed brought vp therin sir sende men warre cytie alexandre therby ye shall haue double profyte cytie shalbe defended people shall loue better whan se ye ayde confort sir therto ye boude sithe ye haue gouernaunce ouer paye rente subsydies aydes ye haue demaunded dyuers tymes enemyes nat strong felde alexaundre towne shulde closed rounde haue suche nombre wherfore men shall entre towne case whan towne shall se sel e refresshed men warre shall haue ye corage loue moche better shall putte hertes maner treatie ennemyes counsaile lorde mayllayne greed incontynent assembled toguyder men warre fyue hundred speares made capitayne auncient knight called sir iaques byerne expert man armes rode coutrey priuely nyght entred towne alexaundre towne greatly reioysed comyng good cause bycause erle armynake sawe menne styrynge towne therfore thre dayes toguyder sauted scrimysshed barrier yet small nombre armynak well resysted wan nothyng whan sir iaques de la byerne company entred strong cyte alexaundre lodged refresshed gouernour cytie came vysite lodgynge sir iaques demaunded state cyte demeanour enemyes take cou sayle thervpon anncient men sagest answered sayd sir sithe erle armynake hath layde siege v euery daye haue assautes scrimysshes barryers well sir knyght morowe shall se wyll knowe nat comyng wyll make secrete issue lye enbusshe ah sir quod ye haue nede ware ye sixtene thousande horse discouer felde without bataile shall reyse suche dust horse agaynst company ye shalbe clene disconfit among selfe well quod knyghtes mo owe shall se howe mater shall go must feate armes sithe become hyder euery man retourned lodging knight gaue know ledge copany howe next mornyng secretely wolde issue cytie lye buishment feldes co maunded euery man redy nexte mornyng sir iaques dela bierne armed hym company issued secretely hym ioure hundred halfe myle out towne assembled valey caused two hundred abyde ye barrier comaunded enemyes came assayle shulde make faynt defence recule backe thy derwarde wolde lye ye busshement daye fayre clere erle armynake yong lusty herde masse pauilyon armed hym displayed penon toke hym hundred men thynking man shulde encountre hym came company barryers lytell lytell folowed hym satte styll sayd nede arme v whan come barryers shall se man satte styll eatyng drinkyng therle armynake went scrimysshe barryers began scrimysshe one another within shorte season defender beganne recule lytell lytell tyll came enbusshe whan sir iaques de la bierne sawe enemyes coe hym discouered hymselfe set acmynagoys valyauntly defeded themselfe alwayes lytell lytell socour came many feate armes done saynte christofers daye daye hoote suche harnes thought verily ben furnes wether faynt wynde lustyest moche feate armes partye myllayne thre agaynst one duste powder great coulde scante se one nother specially erle armynakes parte fell erle great aduenture oppressed heate feble coulde scant helpe selfe drewe aparte one syde felde man founde lytell ryuer whan felte ayre water thought paradyse sate downe alone besyde water moche payne dyd basenet sate bareheded wasshed face dranke ye water wherby worse coldnesse water coled blode faynter thanne fell paluesy lost strength body speche men loste hym many taken knight duke millayns foude erle armynake whan sawe hym meruayle parceyued wel knyght man honour knight said sir yelde ye prysoner erle vnderstode hym nat coulde nat speke helde vp hande made token yelde hym knyght wolde haue hadde hym ryse coulde nat knyght taryed styll whyle dyd fyght whiche batayle many feate armes done whan syr iaques de la bierne sage knyght sawe howe iourney good party howe gret nombre enemyes taken slayne also sawe well owne men world ery enemyes began multyply fresshe men reculed towarde cytie skrymysshynge defendynge knyght taken erle armynake thought nat leaue hym behynde thought surely man honoure desyred company ayde hym beare prisoner ye towne promysynge haue parte raunsome dyd moche payne brought cyte vnarmed layde bedde syr iaques de la bierne entred cytie toke lodgynge vnarmed hym refresshed company whan erle armynacke myst hoost without sore dysmayed wyst nat say came place batayle ben seke hym returned agayne clene dyscomfyted knyght taken erle armynake great desyre know man prisoner came another squyer lykewyse taken prisoner gascon desyringe mayster suffre hym go hym lodgynge went togyder lombarde knyght led squyer fraunce chambre brought hym bedde erle armynake lay sore complaynyng caused torch lyghted vp said french squyer sir knowe nat man squyer regarded hym well sayd knowe hym well ought capitayne erle armynake whiche wordes lombarde ioyfull erle sycke vnderstode nothynge sayd hym mayster sayd go hence let hym rest thus left nyght dyed passed transitory lyfe next day whan knowen erle armynake deed alexaunder bedde syr iaques bierne wolde nat dethe shulde vnknowen caused publysshed hoost suche prisoner se enemyes wolde host sore dyscomfyted well shewed capitayne drawe vnto companyons gadred partes sayd let v returne saue selfe haue lost tyme anon knowen cytie howe armynois discofyted capytayne armed issued horsebacke foote set hoost cryenge pauy lorde myllayne taken slayne without defence conquest botye great companyons come thyder syr iaques bierne armynage yelded selfe without defence cast away armure sledde chased lyke beastes lo harde aduenture therle armynake company bad entente well tourned hym great yuell lyued fyue dayes lenger syr iohan acton come hym fyue hundred speares thousande brigandyns foote wherby myght haue done many feates armes lost harde aduenture whan duke myllayn knewe trouth enemyes slayne taken specyally erle armynake slayne ioyfull therof loued syr iaques de bierne better herte made hym soueraygne ouer chyualry made chefe cousayle duke myllayne auoyde countrey enemyes gaue euery prysoner gentylman horse euery man florayne quyted clene raunsomes departynge caused swere shulde neuer arme agaynst hym thus companion departed lombardy piemount entred sauoy dolpheny suche pouertie marueyle passed euery towne closed agaynst theym anone euery man spent florayn pytie dyd gyue almes charite rebuked mocked sayenge go wayes seke erle armynake drinkynge well alexaundre yet myschiefe whan came ryuer rone thought lightly haue passed ouer realme frauce dyd nat frenche kynge hadde comaunded passage closed kept agaynst wherby fell great daunger
