pouertie coulde neuer assemble togyther agayne thus yonge erle armynakes army brake sonder suster abode styll yuell case ye duke myllayne sent bysshop coutrey suche next erle armynake ben hym iourney duke comaunded therles body shulde baumed sente brother syr barnarde ryght sorowfull tydynges good cause remedy erle armynake buryed cathedrall churche rodays lyeth ought knowen hath ben contayned history syr thomas percy sent kyng rycharde englande realme frauce shewed well howe gret affectyon haue ferme peace bytwene englande fraunce specyally two kynge englandes vncles duke lancastre duke edmonde yorke kynges vncle duke glocestre constable englande wolde wyse acorde haue peace french men without kynges honoure myght rendred agayne suche cyties townes castels landes sygnories whiche gyuen kynge englande heyres whiche falsely ben taken away frenchman without tytell reasone besyde four thousande frankes whiche owyng whan frenchman began warre agayne opynyon dyuers lordes englande sayenge ye dethe wolde iustifye many sayd duke glocestre good ryght reason sustayne opinyon dissymuled mater couertely bycause sawe ye kynges mynde affection enclyned greatly haue peace poore knightes squyers archer englandrather enclyned haue warre suche susteyned estate reason warre consydre well howe peace loue acorde might bytwene party frenche men treatie demaunded haue ealays beaten downe haue sygnorie guysnes hammes marke dye landes froyton dependantes guysnes vnto lymyttes water grauelyng frenche kynge offred delyuer crowne englade moch landes value acquytayn whiche artycle yt duke gloucestre helde said frenchman wyll paye v owne knowe well ynough howe haue charter sealed kynge iohan chyldren hole acquytayn shulde haue delyuered v without resorte soueraynte man euer haue doone sythe hath ben fraude false engyn nyght day entende thyng disceyue v calays suche landes demaunde delyuered handes shulde lordes see coste conquestes nothynge shall rather neuer agree peace long lyue phow syr peter craon fell french kynges displeasure duke thourayns receyued duke bretayne cap clxxviii said seaso knyght fraunce countrey aniou gentle knight noble extraction called syr pyer craon marucylously well beloued specially duke thourayne aboute duke thynge doone hym also knyght helde gret astate duke aniou called kynge naples cicyll iherusalem also ryche asclaunder brought vp hym realme frauce howe robbed yonge kynge cycyll duke aniou whiche brute sayd sir peter absented selfe fro yonge kynge fro mather ben wyfe olde duke aniou howe delte welbeloued frenche kynge brother duke thourayne also season syr olyuer clysson thanne constable frauce greatly fauour kyng duke thourayne whiche fauour get reason good seruyce done armes well frauce el kynges dayes father dayes kinge charles sir olyer clyssons doughter wedded iohan bretayne brother germayne quene iherusalem syr olyuer clysson reason alyaunce maryage iohan bretayne greatly duke bretayns indignacion somoch duke helde mortall enemy iohan bretayne lykewyse duke bretayne repented hym nat slaine sir olyuer clysson whan hym prisone castell ermyn syr peter craon suche fauour duke bretaygne myght lyst cosyn whyle fauour frenche kynge duke thourayn wolde gladly haue brought kynges fauoure syr olyuer clysson constable coulde haue brought aboute thus enuyous whiche couertely always hath reygned fraunce dissymuling mater tyll come yuell conclusion constable fraunce alwayes ben true dedes ye crowne fraunce euery manne loued hym except duke burgoyn loued nothyng hatred came duches burgoyne lady hygh corage coulde nat loue constable duke bretayne nere blod father erle flaunders loued loued suche hated dyd condycion syr peter craon whyle frenche court great duke thourayne wrote often tymes duke bretayne secretly euery thynge knewe duke wrote agayne hym theffecte writynges coude nat knowe iohan froy sart auctor hystory tyme whan parys night whan great myschefe lykely haue fallen vpon sir olyuer clysson constable fraunce marueylous enterprise syr peter craon shall herafter playnly declare whan tyme shall requyre bycause sawe mater darke obscure lykely great trouble daunger dyd payne coulde knowe grounde occasyon mater syr peter craon sodaynly banysshed fro frenche kynges loue duke thourayns suche serche made suche enquery knewe mater enfourmed trouth fame renome ran fyrst duke thourayn dyspleased syr peter craon owne faute dysclosed secretnesse bytwene duke thourayne another lady dyd dyd yuell duke thourayne suche fauour syr peter craon toke hym companyon ware euer lyke apparell hym alwayes hym euer wente shewed hym secretes duke thourayn yonge amorous gladly wolde company ladyes damosel sporte hym amonge specially shewed loued entierly fayre lady paris yonge fressh loue secretes knowen suche wyse turned great dysplesure duke wyste nat whome blame syr peter craon duke shewed hym secretes mater taken hym company whan wolde secretly speke said yonge lady duke tyme promysed sayd lady thousande crownes golde myght haue pleasure lady refused sayd howe loued hym nat golde syluer pure loue enclyned beare hym good wyll golde syluer wolde nat sell honoure wordes promesses knowen duches thourayne incontynent sent said yonge lady chambre called name gret displeasure sayd wylte thou wronge lorde husband yonge lady abasshed wepynge sayd nay madame grace god neuer dyd thynke neuer wyll duchesse sayd thus iame enfourmed lorde husbande loueth mater farre gone bytwene suche place suche tyme promysed thousade crownes golde haue pleaser howe ye dyd refuse wherin ye dyd wysely therfore tyme charge derely ye loue lyfe yt ye commune talke hym suffre hym passe herkyn nat comunynge whan yonge lady sawe selfe accused trouth answered sayd madame shall delyuer fro sone shall deale ye shall haue cause dyspleasure mater therwith duchesse gaue leaue departe returned lodgyng duke thourayne knewe nothynge mater yt entierly loued yonge lady fortuned day come whanne sawe hym eschewed company made hym maner semblant loue dyd clene cotrary vsed durst nat also sworne promysed duches whan duke sawe countenaunce pensyue thought wolde knowe delte straungely demaunded cause straungnes yonge lady wepynge sayd syrye haue bewrayed loue secrete promesse offre ye made lady wyfe el remembre wel ye haue shewed secretnesse syr great daunger lady wyfe none haue sworne promysed tyme wyll neuer copany talke wherby shulde haue ielousy whan duke harde yt sore wordes greatly displeasure said ah sayre lady swere faythe rather mater shulde haue ben shewed wyfe loste hundred thousande frankes sythe ye haue sworne kepe promesse euer coste wyll knowe trouth hath bewrayed secretes thus duke departed fro yonge lady made seblant pacyentely suffred howe thought nyght came wyfe supper shewed token loue euer dyd befor dyd somoche fayre wordes duchesse shewed matter howe knewe syr peter craon duke spake tyme nyght passed nexte day nyne clocke toke horse rode fro howse saynte poll castell lowre founde kynge brother heryng masse kyng swetelye receyued hym loued hym entyerly kynge sawe well duke maner dyspleasure mynde said ah fayre brother mater semeth ye troubled syr quod good cause wherfore quod kynge praye shewe duke wolde hyde thynge fro kynge shewed hym hole mater complayned greatly agaynst syr peter craon sayd syr faythe iowe god nat honoure wolde slee hym shall well ynough quod kynge shall warned counsayle auoyde house seruyce lykewyse cause auoyde house company well content duke day lorde de la ryuer sir iohan mercyer sayd vnto syr peter craon kynges behalfe shulde auoyde kynges courte seruyce go lyste lykewyse syr iohan buell lord dernaulx seneschall thourayne gaue hym lyke commaundement duke thourayns behalfe whan syr peter craon sawe abasshed tooke great dyspyte coude nat ymagyn shulde trewe desyred come kinges presence duke know cause dyspleasure aunswered nother kynge duke wolde nat hym speke whan sawe none remedy apparelled hym selfe departed parys great displeasure hert rode aniou castell owne called sable taryed season fore troubled mynde sawe well chased frenche courte house thourayn also house quene naples iherusalem whan parceyued thre howses closed fro hym thought go duke bretaygne cosyn shewe hym aduentures dyd rode bretayne founde duke wannes made hym good chere knewe somwhat trouble syr peter shewed hym case whan duke bretaygne well herde mater sayde fayre cosyn recomforte selfe surely brought aboute syr olyuer clysson rote foundacyon hatred multyplyed greatly ye shall hystory syr peter craon taryed longe duke bretaygne forgate fraunce constable syr olyuer clysson kynges counsayle agaynste hym also nat contente duke bretayne kepte sir peter craon house duke bretaygne cared nat greatly neyther good wyll yuell wyll frenche kynge prouyded suffyciently cyties townes castelles suche wyse loued well warre peace euer dyd well knowen fraunce kinges counsayle suche nexte aboute kynge reputed duke bretaygne prowde presumptuous thretened greatly duke dyde sette lytell therby sayde wolde make warre agaynst erle pointhieur iuste quarell erle pointhyeur cosyn wryteth nameth hym selfe iohan bretayne though herytour countrey wyll called iohan name erle pointhieur wyll put armes ermyns write himselfe iohan bloys chatellon none wyll nat thus shall cause take fro hym lande holdeth faythe homage v herytage bretaygne hathe nothynge therwith shulde returne haue bothe sonnes doughters shall myne heyres let hym purchase hym landes place hath fayled thus often tymes duke bretayne wolde deuyse sir peter craon wolde nat replye agaynst pleasure rather dyd yuell wyll bare constable syr olyuer clysson counsayle fraunce pnowe let v leaue spekynge mater treate lytell another pytuous mater concernynge erle guy bloys mencyon made hystory pof dethe yonge erle loyes chastelone sonne erle guy bloys cap clxxix hath shewed hystory whane spake alyauce maryage lois chatellon sonne erle bloys maryed ye lady marye doughter duke iohan berrey confyrmacyon maryage duke berrey prouyded greatly doughter assigned dowry coutie bloys somme syxe thousande pounde money corante fraunce payed florayns foresayd loys bloys dyed wyfe countie blois boude pay foresayd syre thousande frankes fortuned feest saint iohan baptyste yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore leuen yonge loys bloys sonne erle guy departed fro father fro castell moltyz bloys go haynalt se mother wyfe whan came beaumonte haynault fell sycke feuer reason rydden great iourneys season boote yuell kepte tendre age xiiii yeres whiche syckenes dyed helpe physycions coulde nat put way hote feuer ye maye well knowe father mother ryght soroufull whan knewe dethe thier sonne heyre lykewyse wyfe yonge lady berrey loued hym entierly thought selfe hyghtly maryed specyally trouble father right gret ymagyned duke berrey ryght couetouse feared leste wolde entre countie bloys put dowry doughter thus duke berreys two doughters bothe wydowes one yere eldest called boesme countesse sauoy husbande yonge erle sauoy called ame dyed yere ryght marueylously whose deth came great busynesse layde sir othe grau ome suche wyse fayne flye sauoy fraunce almayne wente dwelte realme englande pof sodayne dethe erle gascon foiz howe erle chastellon came herytauce cap clxxx seasone also dyed noble gentle erle foiz ryght marueylously shal shewe incydente truely sportes erle loued hutynge houndes grey houndes well prouyded always comaundement mo xvi hundred erle barrey march orthays wente dayly huntynge woodes saluaterra way panpylona nauerre daye dyed hunted kylled beare tyme high noone erle demaunded aboute hym dyner prouyded shewed hospytall ryon two lytell myles fro ortays thyder rode dyner lyghted went chambre whiche strawed grene herbes walles sette full grene bowes make chambre fressh ayre without marueylously hote moneth may whan felte fresshe ayre sayd fresshnesse dothe moche good daye hath hoote sate downe chayre talked deuysed syr espayne du lyon houndes whiche ronne best thus deuysed cae chambre sir ienbayne bastarde sonne sir peter cabestan table redy couered chambre water brought forthe wasshe coiandon spaygne toke asyluer bason sir tybaulte toke towell erle rose put handes wasshe sone colde water fell fyngars waxed pale face sodainly herte fayled hym fell downe fallynge sayd ah deed god haue mercy neuer spake worde howe dyed nat soone laye great payne knyghtes hym sore abasshed soone tooke hym armes layde hym bedde couered hym trusstynge traunce ii knyghtes gyuen hym water entent shulde nat sayde enpoysoned hym toke bason ewer sayde sir presence beholde water whiche toke assaye yet wyll dra ke therof euery man cotent put erles mouthe drinke spyces thynges comfortable aueyled nothyng lesse halfe houre deed yelded vp brethe swetely god pytie haue mercy greatly troubled abasshed closed chambre doore entent dethe shulde nat sodaynly knowen abrode knightes behelde sir ienbayne sonne wepte pituously wrang hades knightes hym sayde sir ienbayne ye haue nowe loste youre father knowe well loued entierly leaue sorowe leape horse ryde orthayes take possessyon castell father treasoure within euer dethe father knowen abrode sir ienbayne enclyned wordes sayd sir thanke good couusaile whiche shall deserue thane lette haue token father elles shall nat suffred entre castell trewe sir quod take soe token fro father toke rynge fro father fynger knyfe bare alwayes hym token porter castell knewe well hadde nat brought shulde nat haue enered thus sir ienbayne foiz deted hospytall ryone thre hym rode haste castell orthayes rode throughe towne man mystrusted hym came castell called porter aunswered sayd sir wolde haue lorde father hospytall ryon quod knyght hath sent certayne thynges chambre must returne agayne entent thou shuldest beleue beholde rynge knyfe porter opyned wyndowe sawe tokyns whiche knewe well porter opyned wicket entred varlettes dyd set vp horse soone entred sayde porter close agayne gate toke porter sayd delyuer kayes el thou arte deed porter abasshed sayde sir say ye thus bycause quod father deed wyll haue ye possessyon treasour come porter obeyed durst none otherwise loued sir ienbayne well another knyght knewe ryght well treasour laye whiche stronge towre wherto belonged thre stronge dores surely bolted barred dyuers kayes parteynyng whiche kayes coude nat fynde redely cofer stele locked lytell kaye stele whiche kaye erle euer bare hym whersoeuer wente lytell purse aboute necke whiche sir ienbayne departed fro hospytall founde knightes deed corse tha marueyled kaye shulde erle bare priuely hym selfe therles chapelayne called sir nicholas escall knewe erles secretes erle loued hym well euer whan went treasorie house chapelayne hym sayde soone sawe kaye ah sir ienbayne hath lost payne kaye lytell cofer wherin kayes towre cofer wher erles treasour lyeth knyghtes sayde sir nicholas go ryde orthayes beare hym kaye sir quod sythe ye gyue counsayle shall better father treasoure another also knowe well father loued hym entierly tooke horse tooke kaye rode castell hayes season sir ienbayne sertchynge aboute kayes coulde nat fynde wyst nat howe get towre dore opyn stronge also hadde instrumentes breke opyn meane season men towne hadde soone knowledge varlettes woman came hospytall howe therle shulde deed harde tidynges erle welbeloued withall people towne assembled guyder markette place sayde one another suche hadde sene sir ienbayn passe towne alone haue sene sir ienbayne passe towne alone towardes castell semed councynaunce nat content surely thyng mysse sor nat wonte coe home father thus comunynge toguyder came towne erles chapelayne thane men towne came aboute hym demauded newes therle lorde hath shewed v deed nat nay quod preest deed sore sicke come home cause thynges dressed hym muste retourne agayne hym therwith passed forth castell dyde moche entred whose commyng sir yuan great ioye without kaye brought coulde nat haue entred towre treasour men towne hadde great suspecte erles dethe sayde nere hande nyght yet nothynge lorde none offycers sir yuan chapelayne entred castell suspeciously let v watche castell night morowe shall tidynges lette v sende secretely ye hospitall shall knowe howe mater gothe also knowe well moost parte erles treasour castell stollen awaye crafte shalbe blamed ignoraunce shall nat excuse v thought best thane men towne drewe castell kepte gate towne surely none shulde entre issue without lycence thus watched nyght mornyng parfyte knowledge dethe lorde euery man woman chylde cryed wepte pituously erle welbeloued watchman doubled encreased harnesse aboute castell whan sir yuan foize sawe maner men towne sawe well howe ceyued knewe certayntie dethe father sayde sir nycholas sir haue fayled myne entet se well nat departe hen without lycence men towne haue knowledge father dethe assemble great nombre ye castell behoueth humble selfe force nat aueyle sir ye saye trouthe quod preest ye shall wyn swete fayre word rude frowarde dealynge go waye speke sir yuan went towre nere gate opyned wyndowe ouer bridge whiche towre brought vp tyll maryed lady iane boloyne afterwarde duchesse berrey ye shall hystorie sir yuan opyned wyndowe spake princypals towne cae bridge nere windowe wolde saye spake loude sayde ye good people orthays knowe well cause assebly nat wtout great occasion requyre derely ye loued lorde father ye nat displeased thoughe haue aduaunsed selfe entre castell first shude entre take possession therof suche goodes within wyll nothyng good ye knowe well lorde father loued well entierly owne sonne wolde fayne haue foude wayes haue made enherytour nowe hath pleased god call hym mercy without accomplysshyng thynge myne aduauncement nowe hath lefte amonge haue brought vp lefte nowe poore knyght bastarde sonne erle foize without haue ayde helpe wherfore sir requyre goddes behalfe haue pytie wherin ye shall great almesse shall open castell suffre entre wyll nat kepe agaynst aunswered sayde sir yuan ye haue spoken nobly ought suffyce sir saye wyll abide entent kepe castell goodes vicount chastellon cosyn next enherytoure countrey byerne nexte parente father come hyder challenge herytage mouables haue shall knowe well howe shall defende right fro hym fro brother sir gracyen suppose whane frenche kynge laste tholous lorde youre father hym order takenne touchyng father enherytaunce sir roger spaygne cosyn tell man better shall write shewe hym dethe erle father desyre hym come hyder helpe counsayle v thynges concernynge landes bierne foiz also mouables thentierment lorde youre father promyse faythfully vpholde aunswere sir yuan well contente thanne opyned gate castell orthayes suche entred wolde daye erles body brought thyder metyng corse men woman wepte pituously remembraunce noblenesse puyssaunt estate wytte prudence prowesse largesse great prosperyte lyued nouther frenche englysshe durste dysplease hym moost parte people sayd nowe neyghbours wyll make v war wonte lyue peace fredome nowe shall bondage misery subiectyon nowe none ayde v ah gascone gascone fayre sone dyde ye euer dysplease father yt coste lyfe ye ben lefte v shulde nowe haue ben v great coforte lost yong father hath taryed short season v threscore thre yeres age myght haue lyued age many yere lengar great age suche prince hauynge euery thyng ease wysshe ah thou lande bierne destytute without conforte noble herytour shall become thou shalte neuer haue agayne suche another gentyll erle foiz suche lamentacions wepynges body noble erle borne throughe towne orthayes eight noble knyghtes first vycounte brunyquell agaynst hym lorde compayne thirde sir roger spaygne agaynst hym sir raymonde laysne fyfthe sir raymonde de la mote agaynst hym lorde besache seuenthe sir menault noualles agaynst hym rycharde saynt george behynde sir yuan bastarde sonne lorde corase lorde barantyne lorde baruge lorde quere mo threscore knyghtes byerne soone come hospytall ryone whan knewe erles dethe thus caryed wt open vysage freers orthayes enbaumed layde leed lefte vnder good kepynge vnto day entierment nyght daye withoute cease brinnynge aboute body four twentie torch borne eight fourtie yomen foure twentie nyght foure twentie daye dethe noble erle foiz anone knowen dyuers countreis mo rather sorie dethe gladde dayes giuen suche gyftes liberally coulde nat eschewed wherfore loued euery man knewe hym pope clement whan knewe dethe right soroufull hym bicause taken great payne fortherynge maryage cosyn iane boloygne duchesse berrey season auignon bysshop palmes durst nat com benifyce displeasure erle foize hym yet lynage cause bysshopp wolde haue exalted iurisdiction abated therles therle made hym bysshop pope sente bysshoppe come palais whan coe pope sayde sir bysshoppe palmes peace made erle foiz deed tidynges bysshoppe glad within shorte season departed fro auignon wente bysshoprike countrey foize tidynges dethe erle anone come frau ce kynge counsayle frenche kyng brother duke burbone sorie dethe bycause noblenesse counsayle saide kyng sir coutie foiz right successyon seyng erle foiz deed without heyre body laufully begotten man canne debate therin also countie thynke sir one thyng helpeth gretlye tytell ye haue lende fyftie thousande frankes sir sende take possessyon guage kepe youre owne enherytauce cou trey desyre vnder youre hande fayre countre shall come good purpose marcheth nere realme arragone also chattelone paraduenture ye may happe haue warre kyng arragon countie foiz shalbe good fronter therin many fayre stronge castelles kepe men warre make good garysons kyng herde well wordes anone enclyned counsayle sayde sir lette se whome shall sende message thane determyned sende ye lorde de la ryuer bycause knowen countrey hym bysshoppe noyon two lordes prepared selfe go legacyon whane departed rode leysar small iourneys toke waye auignon meane season worde sente vicount chastellon beyng realme arragon dethe cosyn erle foiz rode tyll cae bierne streyght orthays towne made hym good chere howe toke nat lorde saide howe countrey nat assembled first must assemble toguyder prelate lordes men good townes counsayle toguyder shulde sayeng good cou trey holdeth hym selfe lordes dwelleth therin hath herytages free thane aduysed best first make entierment erle gascone foiz orthays sende noble bierne foize suche wolde come take counsayle shulde accepte lorde barones prelate heedes good townes bierne foiz sent bierne cae thyder foiz refused come sayde wolde kepe countrey herde saye frenche kyng wolde sende thyder chalege countre foiz howe bysshop palmes desyred come orthais bycause lynage came thyder good array hym apparteyned day obsequy gentyll erle gascon foiz last erle name done freres towne orthays yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore xi monday moche people countrey bierne place bothe lordes knightes prelate four bisshoppes bysshop palmes sayd masse bysshoppes ayre auron tenues bierne goodly herse well ordred duryng masse tyme holden aulter four knightes foure baners armes foiz bierne first helde sir raymon newcastell seconde sir espaygne du lyon thirde sir peter deguier fourthe sir menaulte noualles sir roger spaygne offred sworde bytwene bourge campaigne pier arnaulte bierne capitayne lourde shelde bare vicount bruniquell bytwene sir iohan newcastell iohn chanteron helme offred lorde valetyne bierne bytwene arnalton rostem arnalton saynt colombe horse offred lorde corase bytwene arnalton spayne raymonet campaygne entierment honorably done accordyng vsage ye countre two bastarde ne erle foiz sir yua sir gracien vicount chastel baron bierne foiz assone seruyce done foiz departed rode daye dyner herytell two myles fro orthais ye next day tymes bysshoppe palmes deted wolde nat generall lyament whiche daye monge bierne thus erle buryed ye freers hyghe aulter mencion made hym god haue mercy vpon soule pnowe let v speke order taken orthais enformed said vycount chatelion sir knowe well next blode ye ought succede herytag well bierne foiz nowe nat receyue oure lorde therby myght bring lande bierne great trouble warre daunger vnderstande frenche kynge good neighbour dothe sede hyder cou sayle knowe nat entent tyll speke knowe well lorde erle whome god pardone last yere tholous frenche kyng secrete comunycacion toguyder whiche firste hath nede declared haue gyuen released freche kyng foiz bietne kyng puissance wyll haue optayne wherfore thing wyll know artycles byern case codycion foiz fre without homage seruytude countie foiz holden frenche kynge also people foiz hertes frenche lightly wyll receyue frenche kyng lorde soucraygne haue sayde sithe erle deed hath none heritour body laufully gotten wherfore countie foize saye shulde parteyne ordynauca frenche kyng sir shall kepe holde wyll serue lorde suche ought wheder frech kyng sir wyll counsaile worke wysely busynesse treatie otherwyse vycount said sir meanes wyll ye cousayle worke haue promised worke aduyse euery thyng accordyng reason sir quod wyll aduyse desyre sir roger spaygne cosyn kepe company cost charge go countie foiz treate prelate noble men theym good townes wolde receyue lorde elles sytte styll dissymule mater tyll ye haue apeased ye french kyng taken hym coposicion meanes golde siluer ye might haue enheritaunce rest peace ye thus ye wisely ye maye herde sente fro frenche kynge countie foize thoughe cost hundred thousande two hudred thousande frankes ye shall fynde ynoughe paye erle deed hath lefte ynoughe behynde hym howe beit sir wyse wyll two bastarde sonnes haue parte largely goodes lorde answered sayde sir content ye wyll cosyn sir roger spaygne youre presence desyre hym ryde iourney sir roger answered said sir content ryde meane bytwene bothe tie frenche kyng souerayne lorde ambassadours desyre cousayle orels comaude nat medell must nedes leaue vycount content saide cosyn trust wyll nat agaynst take fro may haue nere thynke make good ende busynesse enformed vycount chastellon made request borowe fyue vi thousande frankes performe iourney also two bastardes made request might haue parte father richesse cousayle toke aduise togider last acorded vicout shulde haue fyue thousande frankes two bastardes foiz eche two thousade frankes incotynent tre ourers comaunded delyuer money offycers erles dayes suffred occupy styll without chaungyng kepers sette kepe castell orthais richesse within vicount first comynge orthais gaue pardon prisoner castell wherof great nombre erle foiz cruell man wolde spare man punysshe pleasure though neuer great sonage one prisone said vycount chastellon botome dongion eight monethes cosyn germayne whanc delyuered sette hym rausome xl thousade frankes whiche truly payde also longe lyued loued hym neuer vicount durst neuer come sight erle lyued two yeres lengar vicount shulde neuer haue parte ye heritage foiz bierne thus counsayle orthays brake vp euery man departed lefte vycount prepare iourney made hym redy soone might desyred certayne knightes squiers go hym thus departed fro orthais two hundred horse rode moriens good towne fronter bytwene byerne bygore four myles fro pauy sixe myle fro tarbe seconde day rode saynt gausens another good towne entre coutie foiz ryuer garone tidynges came hym howe bysshoppe noyon sir buryaulx de la ryuer ye frenche kynges counsayle coe tholous vycount tooke counsayle sir roger spayne best sir roger answered sayd sithe haue herde tidynges let v tary se wyll thynke wyll sende shortely v taryed dede coulde go countie foiz good townes castelles passage closed agaynst calumuche casteres mouttesquen carthas ortyngas fossat cytie palmes castell montaunt castels fronter aragon countie foiz sayd strauger puissaunce shulde entre castell towne countrey tyll mater determyned countrey shewed themselfe better mynded frenche gouerned seneschall countre cytie tholous carcasson beauuoyre rather vnder ruler howe mater went otherwyse ye shall whan frenche kynges comyssaries come tholous demaunded newes archebysshoppe seneschall foiz bierne suche ben orthays buryeng erle foiz enformed case countre stode toke aduyse togyder determyned sende sir roger spaygne bycause frenche kynges man faythe homage oftycer seneschall carcassone sent credable persone letter hym messanger rode saynt gausens xii myle fro then delyuered sir roger spaygne letter sir roger toke reed sayd ye squyer sir ye shall tary day morowe ye shall departe thynke ye shall nat go without company sir roger vycount counsayled toguyder thought beste sir roger spayne shulde ryde tholous speke bysshop noyon lorde de la ryuer knowe wolde say next day ser roger spayne messanger rode forthe togyder came nyght tholouse syr roger toke vp lodgyng messanger went maysters comyssioners said morowe shall tydynges seynge sir roger come next day masse syr roger drewe bysshop lorde de la ryuer made good chere eche bycause aquayntaunce communed cause comynge kinges comyssyoners shewed forth kinges procuracions howe set stablysshed take possessyon season countie foiz whan syr roger well herde length replyed swete wordes sayde lordes nat nere ye kinges cousayle ye sauynge correction wolde counsayle kyng shulde take agayn money somwhat trewe hath lente money herytage foize reysed dethe erle yet let kynge leaue ryght enherytaunce nexte enherytoure blode shall kynges profyte honour saluacyon saye shall laye dyuers reason ye wyll one thynge whiche clere erle foiz layde lande pledge fraude golde syluer ynough dyd nothynge dysheryte vicount chastellon wrogfully bycause hated hym without cause also touchyng kynges profyte ensure kepyng lande foize shulde coste kynge rente reuenues cometh vnto thyrdly kyng shall lese therby homage seruyce suche man able good seruyce ought well regarded also shulde great charge kynges consyence dysheryte persone without reasonable cause herytage foiz shuld haue ben bought solde fyrste suche claymeth ryght therin shulde haue ben greed satyfyed whiche nat wherfore lordes reason well consydred seynge ye great wyse men counsaylours kynge take good hede ye ye pronounce thynge shulde tourne kinges sclaunder hurte conscyence ye otherwyse great synne yet tyme suffycyente fynde remedy cosyn vicount chastellon hathe sente hyther shewe mater ryght effectuously desyreth name take regarde behalfe nat good conuenyent man take euery thynge byforce maye take whan sayde bysshoppe lorde de la ryuer loked eche laste bysshop sayde syr rodger se knowe well ye haue sayd good entente comyssyon stretcheth nat farre quyte bargayne bytwene kyng therle foize howe loue bringe matter somwhat good purpose partyes myght cotent shall put mater suffraunce ye shall take pay e ryde v fraunce kynge counsayle shewe reason ye shall thinke best meanes ye cause vycount chastellon enioy herytage foiz enherytoure therto ye saye shall ryght gladde therof wyll dysheryte person syrs quod syr roger well contente sayenge please abyde season costes shall borne good castell orthays thyrde day sir roger spayne tooke leaue kynges comyssyoners sayde syrs thynke bringe mater good purpose must fayne make iourney fraunce tary longe pray nat myscontent shall nat faulte shall sende daily messangers letter thus departed taryed tholous sir roger rode saynt gausens vycount chastellon shewed mater vycount ioyfull tydynges sayd fayre cosyn syr roger trust mater toucheth nere thenherytaunce wherof beare armes nat tell whome sende fraunce onely shewe tytle kynge cousayle wherfore sir loue may deserue tyme come take charge voyage syr rodger sayd syr loue lynage shall sir roger prepared iourney ryde frauce toke way rodes shorter way truce bytwene fraunce englande el way toke nat sure hym fronters rouuergue quercy lymosyn many fortress made warre englysshemen pnowe wyll leaue season spekynge syr roger spayne speke frenche kynge duke bretayne phow treatie peace renewed tower thourayn bytwene frenche kynge duke bretayne mariage doughter fraunce lonne bretayne iohn bretayne erle pointhieur doughter duke bretaygne cap clxxxi ye haue herde dyuers place hystory howe duke bretayne syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce hated mortally eche besyde hatred duke syr olyuer gret enuy great kinge secrete counsayle gladly wolde haue troubled hym doughted ye kynges displeasure often tymes duke repented hym nat slayne hym whan hym prisone castell ermyn thought slayne hym shulde neuer haue trouble hym yuell wyll hym caused hym harde mynded obedyente crowne fraunce howe knewe well dyd yuell therfore suffred thynge passe aduenture helde loue englysshe men prouyded suffycyently townes fortress artyllery vytayles sent priuely englande men armes archer dyd set garysons made beleued loked haue warre men kn nat whome howe euer dyd knowen frauce many spake largely knewe well certrayne lordes fraunce nat contente hym dyd set lytell therby passed tyme great affyaunce cosyne duchesse burgoyne reason specyall supporte ayde lady bycause lygnage loued hym bycause erle flaunders father cosyn germayne duke alwayes loued comforted hym trybulacyons lady burgoyne good lady duke husbande wolde nat gladly displease good cause ye duke helde great herytages fayre chyldren realme fraunce bounde loue nat ben great dyscensions moued bytwene party natwithstandynge duke bretayne ben paris french kyng made hym homage yet nat well say good herte sone duke retourned bretaygne apered hym small amendemente sworne obeysaunce obedyent pope auignon nat rather dispysed hym wordes also wolde suffre man promoted countrey pope bulles helde hym selfe newter dyuers thynges wolde gyue benefyces hym selfe clerke coulde atteygne promocyon benefyce countrey without ben well pleased therwith also comaudements came parlyament chambre parys sette nothynge therby prelate bysshoppes bretayne lost great parte iurisdictions duke great complayntes therof made parlyament parys hadde small remedy whan sent come parys el sende thyder able personage make aunswere suche matter shulde aledged agaynste hym whan kynges offycers came bretaygne somon hym apere thanne wolde nat spoken withall euer made sondry seues whan kinges officer dyd departe againe then wolde say wyll go parys se ryght shall haue nat yet thre yeres sence se ryght shulde haue coulde se ryght mynystred lordes parlyament tourne euery thynge lyst reken yonge ignorante ledde lyst wolde knewe men duchy bretaygne one accorde obedyent pleasure ought wolde gyue realme fraunce moche wolde bringe theym vnreasonable reason suche hath done trewly shulde rewarded acordyngly suche haue deserued haue iustyce shulde haue haue deserued suche wolde haue right shuld haue thus many complayntes made often tymes kynge suche secrete counsayle said duke ryght presumptuous proude sythe wyll brought reason shulde thus suffred lewde opinyon shulde greatly enfeble noblenesse realme hym lordes shall take ensample yuell therby iurysdictyon realme lytell lytell shall loste deuysed withstande fynde remedy suche inconuenyentes sende swetely hym come towrs thourayne mete french kyng duke berrey duke burgoyne bysshop charter bysshoppe dothune four specyally named bycause duke loued best aboue lordes fraunce excepte erle estampes lorde coucy thus sente bretayne duke erle estampes mayster iue noyent toke great payne traueyle moue duke mete frenche kynge towrs spake fayre fresshe coloured wordes armed reason duke agreed go towrs sayd wyse wolde go also shulde nat se enemy syr olyuer clysson wyse acorded agreed wolde come towrs ambassadours retourned fraunce shewed kynge counsayle howe spedde contente therwith sythe coulde brynge hym none purpose kynge cousayle made redy go towrs tary two thre monethes thought treatie ye duke bretayne shulde nat sone acomplisshed thus frenche kinge duke thourayne brother duke berrey burgoyne iohan burgoyne sonne duke burbon lorde coucy erle marche erle saynte poll counsaile frauce came towrs thourayn also thyder came constable frau ce iohan bretayne sonne lawe counsayles hadde mater fyftene dayes thyder came duke bretayne came sayd wolde nat come thre tymes sent excuse hym selfe sayenge speke coude nat ryde finally came lodged ease syr roger spaygne haue ben aunswered kynge counsayle somoche duke bretayns mater coulde entende nothyng el syr roger two monethes coulde aunswered daily answered yt shulde herde longe fyrste also tyme fell another let thyder came fro kyng rycharde englande syr iohan clapam one kynges counsayle chaumbre rycharde choall clerke doctour lawe speke frenche kynge counsayle matter syr thomas percy lorde clyfforde ben parys kynge whan englysshe men come towrs treaty closed vp entended delyueraunce shewed brought letter credence kynge duke berrey burgoyne herde credence kynge englande vncles wolde knowe frenche kynge counsayle wyll mynde kepe metyng amyence treate peace bytwene two kynges alyes confederate frenche fynge shewed desyred thynge moche peace answered said redy accomplysshe promesses sayenge soone delyuered duke bretayne departed fro towrs wolde entende nothynge e tyll come amyence abyde englysshe ambassadours make good chere coude englysshe ambassadours well cotent fyue dayes towrs kynge tooke leaue kynge lordes kynge gaue great gyftes costes payed departed season sawe nat duke bretayne spake nat hym duke welde nat leste frenche men shulde haue suspecte hym thus englysshmen retourned calays douer london founde kynge counsayle westmynster shewed done herde sene answere brought pleased well kynge counsayle ordeyned iourney go amyence pnowe let v som speke messangers sente frenche kynge fro vycount chastellon foize bierne sir roger spayne sir espaygne du lyon sent fraunce fro vicounte chastellen toke theym great payne traueyle pursewe cause certayne clerkes knightes kinges counsayle aduysed kynge take countie foiz attrybute crowne fraunce sythe countrey wolde agree therto kynge enclyned well therto duke burgoyne sage ymagynatyue wolde nat agree therto sayd alwayes let kynge take agayn money somwhat howe shewed duke burgoyne coulde nat herde duke berrey toke busynesse meanes shall shewe ye haue herde fell bytwene hym olde gascon erle foize whan duke sente bierne erle suche notable persones erle sanxete vicount dassey lorde de la ryuer syr wyllm tremoyle treate maryage lady iahan boloyne whome erle foize kepinge tyme erle well content maryage ye duke berrey shulde haue wolde pay thyrty thousande frankes kepyng bringynge vp lady duke payed said lady wyfe duke berrey remembred mater sente syr roger spayne syr espayne du lyon come speke hym chambre secretly sayde syrs ye wyll come good conclusyon sute ye shall attayne therto meanes fyrst wyll haue agayne thyrty thousande frankes whiche payed olde erle foiz whan wyfe haue alwayes ymagyned myght ouer lyue erle foiz haue money agayne whan two knyghtes herde duke say regarded eche spake neuer worde duke sayd agayne syrs say trouthe haue taken wordes fro speke togyther aduyse well without treatie ye shall nat attayne purpose brother burgoyne wyll wyll haue hym hath gouernaunce countrey picardy languedocke agaynste wyll man wyll speke vycount chastellon shall fynde good ynough erle deed rychesse kynge hath treasour syr roger spayne sayde sir though wolde agre demaunde yet haue nat v treasure contente withall ah syr roger quod duke shall nat let hyndre mater ye promyse dette faythe writynge wyll beleue greater mater syr quod knyght thanke shall sheke togyder gyue answere pleaseth well quod duke departed fro duke went lodgynge toke counsayle togyther whether shulde retourne agayne home without agrement el acorde duke demaunde heritage might clerely remayne abyde vycount chastellon nexte daye retourned duke offered hym demaunde syr roger spayne syr espaygne du lyon became dettours duke berrey xxx thousande frankes condicion shulde meane kynge shulde take agayne money lente erle foize vicount chastellon might peasably enioy herytage well quod duke lette alone shall truste day duke berrey desyred haue xxx thousande frankes good aduocate vycount chastellon concluded busynesse owne wyll kynge counsayle put mater pleasure two knyghtes letter sealed confyrmacyon countie foiz trewe enherytauce vicount chastellon letter therof adressed ye bysshop noyon lorde de la ryuer beynge tholouse enour letter enfourmed suche credyble persones went legacyon foloweth charles grace god kynge fraunce sende comende v ryght reuerende bysshoppe noyon knight chambrelayne lorde de la ryuer wyll ye suffre vycount chastellon enherytour foiz bierne enioy possede heritage countie foiz purtenauces ye take possessyon lx thousande frankes one payment money payed seneschall tholouse make sure quytaunce recryte therof also nother paymente wyll ye receyue twenty thousande frankes costes charge goynge retournyng money payed make quytaunce therof vnder seale offyre tholouse also wyll syr yuan syr gracyen foiz bastarde sonnes erle gascon foiz haue parte ceasonable assignement bothe landes goodes father aduyse dyscrecyon syr roger spayne vicount bruny quell syr raynolde newcastell lorde corase whome shall write maye aquyte dyscharge conscyence made suche promyse erle father faute four lordes rebellyon vycount disanull sayde treatie wyll stande boyde wytnesse letter haue sette seale cytie towrs xxii yere oure teygne twenty day moneth decembre letter made sealed delyuered knyghtes foiz retourned fro towrs leaue taken season syr loys sanxere marshall fraunce lay march carcassone soueraygne gouernour instytuted kynge bysshoppe noyon lorde de la ryuer sent hym tholouse whan come thyder sayde hym syr marshall vycount chastellon reputeth hym selfe enherytour country foiz haue sent frauce kynge knowe counsayle wyll saye mater wherfore ye redy menne armes fronters foiz soone syr roger spayne syr espayne returned haue message fro kynge agree nat peace king wyll haue lande foiz entre incontynent take possessyon acordynge ye right puyssaunce kynge hathe gyuen v quarell thus marshall redy prouyded euery day loked aunswere fro kynge pnowe wyll leaue speakyng mater shewe somwhat duke bretayne ye haue herde treatie towrs thourayn bytwene frenche kyng duke bretaygne whiche duke dyde put kynge counsayle moche payne wolde fall reason sayde kynge demaunded hym refused lykewyse demaunded kynge refused moche treatie conclusion taken duke redy serue kynge hym homage farre forthe bounde thanne kynges counsayle sayd hym sythe ye knowledge yourselfe kinges liegman wyll ye nat obey reason syrs quod wherin rebell layde dyuers poyntes fyrste beleuynge pope auygnon whome sayde kynge toke trewe pope ye dyffer ther fro dyssymule mater ye wyll obey none comaundementes gyue benefyces selfe bretaygne suche brynge bulles fro pope ye wyll nat knowe theym agaynste magesty royall great synne coscyence soule duke aunswered sayde conscyence man ought speke therof iudge onely god soueraygne iudge suche cause syth ye argue appose maner shall aunswere pope indyfferent sure declaration made season first tydynges came chosynge pope vrbayne towne gaunt cosyn erle flaunders receyued letter sealed pope seale called robert quesne cardynall letter certifyed erle cosyn grace god deuyne spyratyon chosen pope hadde name vrbayne howe canne vndone agayne thynke harde wyll nat argue agaynst kinges maieste cosyn lyege man shall well trewly serue hym whan euer requyred farre forthe bounde wyll speke agaynst counsayle nat kynge well syr quod shewe v nat counsayle kynge ought shall fynde remedy syrs ye knowe better ye company oftener touchynge benefyces countrey nat haute cruell agaynst suche desyre suffre clerkes countrey en oy bulles pope clement suche cerkes nat countrey refuse cause shall shewe wolde beare away rychesse countrey therof deserue nat whiche agaynst ryght consyence wher fore nat agree therto ye saye rebell agaynst kynges offycers whanne come coutrey nat wyll nat ye ought knowe ye nat lerne fee uchy bretayne noble condycion soueraygnely ought none enterprise mater alonely owne naturall lorde say duke bretayne holdeth court open ryghtes offycers execute ryghtes lande bretaygne acordynge offyce haue offycer dothe contrary ryght outher straunger haue cause complayne punysshe shall shall take ensample ouer say kynges counsayle ought reproued moche maye norysshe warre hatred bytwene kyng cause clere ynough suffre cosyn iohn bloys two thynges agaynst vnreasonable fyrste writeth hym selfe iohan bretayne reason name semeth entendeth attaygne herytage bretaygne whiche without shall haue chyldren sonne doughter shall succede secondely beareth ermyns whiche armes bretaygne trouthe dyspleasure withall sir olyuer clysson mayntayneth opinyon longe case wyllagre treatie kynge warre wyll make none kyng bycause naturall lorde yuell informacyon ye kyng make warre shall defende shall fynde myne owne countre wyll kyng knowe thus treatie bytwene kynge duke bretayne contynued rygorously duke lorde mayster counsayle frenche kynge nat ruled syr olyuer clisson begue vyllains syr iohan mercyer syr willyam montague duke burgoyne clere vnderstandyng euery thynge suffred duke bretaygnes reason defence sayde place couertly susteyned duke berrey opynyon hated inwardly kynges priuy chambre bycause dystroyed treasourer betysache shamfully iustyce besyers ye haue herde suffred sawe tyme reuenged dyfference duke bretaygne taryed towrs thre monethes treatie coulde come good conclusyon poynte haue departed kynge wyll soone retourned fraunce make great assemble make warre next somer bretayne agaynst duke suche acorde leaue busines duke berrey burgoyne lorde coucy therle saint poll sir guy tremoile chanceller frauce dyuers prelate high baron frauce suche ymagined withstade rigorous rebellios spake togider said kyng sir iouerayn lordes pier realme nere lygnage shulde haue treatie next lent peace amiece thenglysshmen wherfore sir ye nede make haste leaue yuell wyll bytwene duke bretayne duke dete hen without agrement made bytwene thenglysshmen wyll ye harder treaty wyll thynke ayded coforted duke bretayne countrey duke hath thenglisshmen hande whan wyll haue warre atones bothe englysshmen breton haue wyll put v great payne lord dyde moche kyng cousayle last founde meane bytwene kyng duke shewe surely without meanes ben founde shulde haue come conclusion good acorde ye frenche kyng doughter duke bretaine sonne maryage made bytwene sone dought lykewise iohn bretayne sone dought sir olyuer clysson duke bretayne doughter thought make sure peace yt mariage bytwene two necessary maryages agreed concluded howbeit alyaunces yet iohn bretayne shulde leaue armes bretayne beare chastellon bycause extracte mother syde duke bretayne mother doughter duke bretaygne therfore alowed bere armes bordet ermyne thre label goules heed scochyn ermyns thus bare deuises euery thynge apesed duke bretayne gate loue kyng vncles dyned kyng iohn bretayne erle pon hieuts thus shewed great loue togyder meanes mariages howe duke wyse wolde se speke sir olyuer clysson suche displeasure hym howebeit sir olyuer made lyght therof hated duke also puissauce mariages thus acorded lordes sworne bounde fulfyll whan chyldren shulde sowhat age lordes determyned departe fro tourse drawe parys tyme aproched shulde amyence personally frenche kyng brother vncles cousayle mere kyng englande vncles counsayle shulde duke bretayne toke leaue frenche kyng brother vncles suche loued best deted fro tourse went owne coutre lykewise dyd lord duke berrey duke burgoyne lorde coucy taryed styll shall shewe phowe therle bloys mary namure wyfe solde countie bloys landes duke thourayne frenche kynges brother cap clxxxii ye haue herde hystorie howe loys bloys sone therle guy bloys died whan yonge ye towne beauniont heynalt wher lady mary doughter duke berrey widowe therby lost welthe worlde chylde gret enheritour lyued ben great lorde speke bycause shulde knowen tyme come thenheritauce whome went right lyne maner therle blois mary namure wyfe nat ye case engedre child togider great drikyng moche eatynge wete delycate meates ouergrowen fatnesse erle coude nat ryde alwayes caried lytter fro one place another whan wolde go huntyng haukyng whiche sporte gretly vsed wt lord frauce season whyle frenche kynge tourse duke thourayne ymaginacion whiche brought effect shall shewe duke thourayne knewe well moche rychesse lying hym paraduenture myllion floreyns whiche reason mariage lady valentyne myllayne doughter erle vertu wyst nat howe enploy flornes reme bred howe erle guy bloys great herytag dethe likely go dyuers sone erldome bloys shulde retourne iohan bretayne erles cosyn germayne landes heynault shulde go duke iulyers duke lancastre except chinay whiche shulde go conflans homage coutie soissons whiche parteyned therle bloys auciently alyed hym lorde coucy enherytour therof reason delyuerauce prisone englad also landes drages monny shulde retourne heyres landes holande zelande shulde retourne erle heynaulte thus fayre heryteges shulde sparcled abrode knewe well lordes frauce wherfore duke thourayn money lyeng hym thought bye lades might haue resonable bargayne tha thought entreate kyng moue therle blois mater specially lest bye countie bloys whiche fayre noble countrey well syttinge hym countie bloyes marched duchy thouraygne countie bloys parteyned many goodly fee duke thourayne rested styll purpose seased nat tyll spake ye kynge brother ye duke burbone lorde coucy bycause great ye erle blois wyfe doughter cosyn germayne duke loreyne duke thourayne lordes affyuite kept mater secretely fro ye duke berey shall shewe lady mary dought endowed countie bloys vi frankes yere duke berrey trusted reason doughters dowrie ye countie bloys shulde erles dethe duke berrey marueylous couytous prince duke burgoyne lyke wise trusted landes holande zelande heynalte bycause margarete eldest dought maried wylliam sone therle heynalte wherby thought outher bieng soe incident yt chose landes shulde returne sone erle ostrenant otherwyse called iohn burgoyne maried margarete eldest doughter therle heynalte thus kyng said lordes purposed yt detyng fro tourse iii thourayn ryde blois se cosyn therle guy bloys eight myle fro tourse castell owne called ye castell morant treate marchadise hym wyfe lady mary namure couytous lady valiant knight great prudence bayly blois called sir raynolde sen fyte informacion busynes meanes knowe nat whan knewe gret pyte therof loue therle lorde thought reason sale lades shuld dishonored euer disherite true rightfull heyres whiche shulde damnacion soule thought lette mater coude rode fro blois spake therle said sir frenche kynge duke thourayn duke burdon lorde coucy cometh hyder yt true therle speke sir say bycause ye shalbe requyred sell enheritace wherfore ye haue nede take good aduise therin word therle great marueyle said nat let men speke make request make suche bargayne sell myne enherytauce disheryte myne heyres shame rebuke shall rather sell ley pledge ye plate haue well sit knight remebre well mater whan tyme haue shewed without dout bayly erle nat yong folysshe enclyne suche treaty thus bayly deted fro therle rode againe blois wolde nat sene kynges comynge whan kyng said lordes cae castell erle made good chere reason erle countesse right ioyfull ye kyng wolde visyte owne castell kynge drawe erle loue bring hym entent sayd fayre cosyn se well ye lorde realme garnysshed honour large haue ben great cost ayde somwhat recopence wyll gyue ayde shall well worthe twentie thousande fra kes countie blois therle thanked kyng gyfte neuer profite therof neuer nothyng kynge began treate erle sell countie bloyes duke thourayn kynge duke burbone spake fyrst founde therle colde tarre mater lordes drewe countesse bloyes shewed many colored reason husbandes dethe lyke poore lady wherfore said moche better ryche lady puissaunt golde syluer iewelles poore sayeng howe lykely ouerlyue husbade therfore desyred counsayle husbande make marchaundyse countesse couytous lady loue haue floreyns enclyned desyres dyd moche helpe ayde varlet erles chambre called sohier borne malygnes sonne weyuer clothes great wt erle bloyes thynge done hym without hym nothyng done erle gyuen hym fee herytag fyue hundred frankes yere holde consydre myschefe great lordes brought vnto meane seruautes sohier nother wytte reason greatly alowed alonely folysshe loue maister hadde hym lykewise duke berrey season one hym called iaques thybaulte reputacion yet duke dyuers tymes gyuen hym two hundred thousande frankes yet loste sohier coulde nat excuse hym selfe lysted myght well haue broken marcha dise yt therle mayster made please kynge duke thourayne duke burbone lorde coucy cou tesse agreed therto couitousnes florens rowned maisters eare erle wente promyse made bayly reuercion countie bloyes discease solde somme two hundred thousande frankes duke thouraygne delyuer lady dunoyes dowrie whiche assygned sixe thousande frankes furthermore shulde haue made another sale landes heynaulte duke thourayne haue payde two hundred thousande frankes howe therin erle bloys reserued knowe erle heynaltes pleasure therin naturall lorde owed faythe homage landes howe yt kyng duke thourayn toke charge discharge erle soeuer shulde fall thus departed bounde erle promyse writynges sealed might well easely none cousayle saue sohier neuer scole knewe letter boke moche maner went marchandise haue written mater iustely coude thentent herafter tyme come reason writyng trouthe shulde knowen erle guye bloys lorde mayster ignorant yuell counsayled wyfe varlet sohier tha made yuell bargayne whan mater concluded surely made kyng duke thourayne counsayle lordes toke leaue retourned frauce great brute made sale dyuers country phowe sir roger spaygne sir espaygne du lyon spedde frenche kyng counsayle vicount chastelons busynesse howe howe sette possession countie foiz money payde cap clxxxiii howe let v sowhat speke sir roger spaygne sir espaygne du lyon shewe spedde aft retourned fro tourle go tholous bysshop noyon lorde de la ryuer longe iourneyd came thyder welcome comynge fore desyred shewed letter howe spedde semblaunt bysshoppe lorde de la ryuer ioyouse herytauce shulde abyde vycount chastellon suche condycions written sir roger copanyon thought take payne ryde ye vycount chastellon counsayls foize bierne se euery thyng sette good order departed fro tholous rode saynt gracyens vicount nat entre berne fayre castell called pau founde hym ioyfull comynge whan knewe frenche kyng gyuen vp tytell byeng coutie foiz gladder money yt shulde paye wyst well ynoughe haue moche pof great assemble made amyence frenche kynge counsayle kynge englandes vncles treatie peace cap clxxxiiii thynke haue sufficiently treated busynesse bierne foiz shulde reherse thynges wolde requyre long writyng therfore wyll leaue spekyng therof create mater thus thyng cocluded vicount chatellon erle foiz lorde berne lyke maner older erle helde suche ought made homage hym departed largely ser yuan sir gracien tholde erles bastarde sone suche wyse content payde freche kyng suche money mised payde mater nat sone done somer first well onwarde ye bisshop noyon ye lorde de la ryuer taryed styll tholous tyll euery thyng set good order accordyng charged nowe let v speke thassemble lordes frau ce englande good cyte amyence treatie peace truce beyng yere lorde mccclxxx xi myddes lent great prouision made ther lord cae thider first frenche kyng estate thre vncles also great lordes frauce euery man degre said kyng richard englade shulde wherfore many desyred se neuer sene beit came nat yet cae douer thentent haue passed see thre vncles hym yt say ye duke lacastre yorke glocester whan came douer tooke aduyse whyder mete kyng passe see nat thynges consydred counsayle englande opinyon kyng shuld byde douer duke gloceter wt duke lancastre duke yorke therle hutyngton therle derby sir thomas percy bysshops durham london ye kynges cousaile passe ouer came calais whan day aproched yt shulde mete amyece deted fro calysmo xiic horse goodly syght se ryde good order frenche kyng ordayned thenglisshmen came cali goyng abyding returnyng costes charge borne frenche kyng charge mete drike lodgyng horse mete ye duke lacastre duke yorke cae cosyn dought suster ye lorde coucy faire yog lady called ye lady yrelade wedded duke yrelade lady cae amyens se ye lorde father ye lorde coucy nat sene hym moche wherfore hadde great desyre se hym came lyke noble widowe hauyng small ioye co age frenche kyng ordayned make englysshe men moche honour coude deuysed foure duke saye duke thourayn frenche kynges brother duke burbon berrey burgoyne l pte horse rode towne mete englisshmen aco panyed many great lordes fyrst mette duke loys thourayn well acopanyed honorably receyued colyns englande comuned certayne space toke leaue departed agayne company rode streight cytie kynge brother thre duke ye kynges vncles berrey burbone burgoyne mette englysshe duke felde made great chere honorable eche ioye se getyll erle dolphyn auuergne ben hostager englande moche duke lacasters company loued hym well came humbly saluted duke lancaster whan duke sawe enbrased hym great token loue spake toguyder lytell duke berrey burgoyne came duke burbon lorde coucy therle aynt poule came duke yorke erle huntyngton sir thomas percye ode talkyng togyder amorous wordes tyll aproched cytie amyence duke lancastre rode bytwene duke berrey duke burgoyn thus rode thre front makyng honour eche tyll came bysshoppes palais kynge duke thourayne lighted two duke ledde duke la castre vp steres duke lordes folowed frenche lordes came kynges presence made reuerence lefte englysshe duke standyng alone lytell enclined selfe kyng kyng ca e toke handes lytte vp spake swetely hym lordes fraunce fell talkynge lordes englande whan comaned season toke leaue kyng brother vncles departed conueyed lodgynges costable fraunce lorde coucy erle saynt poule sir iohan vyenne lordes realme fraunce toke leaues deted agayne kyng lady irelande doughter lorde coucy lodged father lodging copany ordayned freche kyng counsayle thenglysshe lord came cytie amyence whiche ordynauce publysshed proclamed openlye thentent sone shulde ignorant therof euery man beware kyng artycle proclamacion payne lefyng heedes first maner person make riot gyue riotous wordes englysshman also knight squier speke make chalenge armes englysshman payne kynges highe displeasure company wt swete wordes goodly behauour yt towne lodgyng felde frenche page make debate riotte place payne dethe soeuer englysshman demaudeth su pesably haue ho vitayler demaunde money outher meate drinke suche comen charge also ordayned knight squyer fraunce shuld go night tyme without torche torch englysshmen shulde go pleasure without cotrolement frechman mete englysshman night strete yt shulde swetely gently conuey lodgyng company also ordayned four place cyte four watch set thousande men euery watche fyre happe fall nyght incydence watche wyse remoue maner cause ye wnynge bell people drawe que che fyre also ordayned yt frech knight squier maner cause shulde presume speke king wtout ye kyng fyrst dyde call hym also knightes squyers fraunce shulde talke comune toguyder long englysshe men present fynde comunynge pastyme theym also ordayned hostes seruauntes anywyse shulde nat conuey hyde bowes arrowes thynge parteyninge englysshe men without makynge large amendes without gyuen englysshmen curtesy take el nat thynges determyned delyberacyon good counsayle englysshe men honoure trusted good conclusyon peace nighe euery day fiftene dayes toguyder lordes counsayle brought nothyng coclusyon demaundes greatly different frenche men demaunded haue calais rased beaten downe suche wyse persone shulde dwell englysshe men wolde wyse agree treatie ought beleued calais ye towne worlde comons englande loued best longe lordes calays sayde bare kayes fraunce vnder gyrdell thoughe lordes departed euery daye vnagreed yet departed der right amiably euery daye poynted agayne nexte day bothe party trustyng last coclude good poynt frenche kyng made thenglysshe men yt space thre notable dyners palais lykewise dyde duke thourayne duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone lorde coucy erle saynt poule eche made englysshe men great dyner euery thyng englysshmen toke towne payd clerkes apoynted kynge counsayle write euery thyng euery man apoynted money chambre accomptes ought knowen iohan duke lancastre brother duke yorke come thyder trust peace yet charge kyng englande counsayle soeuer treatie made wise shulde nouther gyue take maner thynge many opynion comynaltie englande rather enclyned warre peace tyme good kyng edwarde thirde sone prince wale many fayre highe vyctories ye frenche men great conquestes moche money raunsomes sellyng patesynge townes countreis become marueylous riche many suche gentylmen byrthe reason hardynesse valyaunt aduentures wan conquered moche golde syluer became noble rose great honour folowed wolde folowe lyfe beit yt dayes sayd kyng edwarde ye prince sonne wysdome highe enterprice sir bertram clesquy ayde good knyghtes frauce englysshmen agayne sore put backe duke gloucestre sonne sayde kynge edwarde vncle kyng richarde beyng amyence dyuers lordes knightes squyers opynion comons englande enclyned rather warre peace entent therby susteyne estate occasion therof peace harder driue yet kynge duke lancastre wolde fayne haue hadde peace meanes metynge amyece apoynted howbeit wolde nat displease comens englande englysshe men wolde gladlye haue hadde peace myght restored agayne al suche landes agreed treaty charter frenche men shulde paye fourtene hundred thousande fra kes whiche vnpayed whan warre began renewe season thus great comunycacion cytie amyence treatie peace lordes bothe party toke great payne cause myght well marueyled peace toke none effecte specialy duke burgoyne dyd coude frenche partie duke lancastre englysshe partie sauyng charge whiche durst nat passe whan lordes sawe coulde come good conclusyon frenchemen somwhat apease please englysshmen rather therby fall reason offred enjoy styll peasably euer possessyon acquytayne nyne dyoces quite delyuered without resorte calays myght beaten downe also offred paye thre yere somme xiiii hundred thousande frankes duke lancastre englyssh counsayle answered sayd syrs haue taried longe season haue concluded nothyng canne nat conclude tyll retourned englande shall shewe desyres offer kyng souerayne lorde thre estate realme one thinge sure moch dyligence brother yorke shall doone bringe desyre passe except ye beatyng downe calays dare nat speke therof dyd shulde ryn indygnacyon hatred ye parte realme englande yet better speke worde therof wordes somwhat contented french kynge cousayle desyred whan returned england dyligence mater said wolde coude frenche party sayeng howe warre endured ouer longe many yuell inconuenyentes hath ensued therby worlde considred bytwene party bycause truce fayled next mydsomer bytwene englande fraunce contynue lengar space hole yere bothe lande see bytwene alyes adherentes therto lordes englande agreed frenche kynges counsayle desyred sende two french knightes go englande retourne bringe worde case shulde fynde realme englande duke lancastre ye duke yorke contente therwith shewed also apparaunce great howe frenche kynge desyred greatly haue peace great brute ranne fraunce place howe lam rabaquyn entred great puissaunce turkes realme hungry syr boucyquant thelder marshall fraunce brought newes syr iohan charon newely retourned fro partyes grece turkey wherfore frenche kynge youthe great affectyon go voyage go se sayd lamorabaquyn recouer realme armony whiche turkes wonne fro kynge lyon armony tyme amyence shewed cause comynge thyder duke lancastre duke yorke knewe hym well sene realme englande englande treate peace whan frenche kynge sluse consyderynge kynge armonyes busynesse ende parlyamente frenche kynge sayde duke lancastre fayre nephewe peace maye bytwene v kynge englande might make voyage tukey comfortyng kynge hungry emperour constantynople whome lamorabaquyn dothe moche trouble let v recouer realme armony whiche turkes kepe saye lamorabaquyn valyaunt man great enterprise agaynst suche persones contrary beleue daily dothe trouble greue v ought enclyne selfe defende crysten faythe wherfore fayre nephewe helpe prouyde voyage realme englande duke lancastre promysed deuoyre behalfe thus toke leaue eche counsayle amyence endured fyftene dayes englysshe men departed writyng coclusion treatie shewe kynge englande counsayle duchesse irelande departed fro amyece toke leaue father lorde coucy retourned englysshe lordes fro tyme departed fro calais tyll came thyder agayne spent nothyng without lyst french kynge made euery thynge payed bothe selfe horse duke burgoyne retourned archoys cytie arras founde duchesse wyfe vysited countrey flaunders duke thourayne duke berrey duke butbone taryed kynge kinge purposed go beamoys gysors sporte hym waye parys duke lancastre duke yorke certayne knightes fraunce wente englande syr iohan castell morante sir taupyns cantmell bringe aunswere agayne england sir raynolde du roy lorde moncaurell ye lorde olde towne conueyed calays toke leaue englysshe men passed ouer see deuer founde kynge duke glocestre taryeng whan kyng sawe great comunynge ate parlyamente amyence kynge well content vncles done duke glocestre alwayes harde agaynst treatie peace sayd howe coulde good conclusyon taken treatye tyll mater brought westmynster generall counsayle thre astates realme folowe aduyses none otherwyse duke glocesters wordes well herde manne wolde saye agaynst hym greatly loue realme shewed knightes fraunce muste go london otherwyse coulde haue none answere two knightes obeyed reason kynge toke way lordes london whan kynge came darfforde tooke waye eltham refresshed quene came shene wente agaynst saynte george feest wyndsore knyghtes fraunce answered shewe aunswere wyll somewhat speke frenche kynge assemble cousayle amyence frenche kynge lacke good gydyng fell sycke feuer wherfore counsayled chaunge ayre layde lytter caryed beamoys taryed bysshops palays tyll hole recouered brother duke thourayne vncles duke berrey burbone helde easter whan kynge stronge myght well ryde rode gysors entryng normady haue sporte huntynge theraboute many fayre wodes kyng beynge sir bernarde armynake brother iohan armynake came kynge good array dolphyn auuergne company whome founde parys waye erle armynake erle rodays made reliefe homage kynge acordinge custome lordes fraunce made relyefe suche landes helde fee kynge whan euery thyng writen regestred toke leaue retourned paris togyther fro thence countreys auuergne languedoc feest ascensyon tyde frenche kynge retourned parys good helthe lodged howse saynte poll whiche ordeyned hym thyder come frenche quene duches thourayne nowe let v speke syr iohan castell morante syr taupyn cantmell englande taryenge answere kyng counsayle wyndesore saynte george feest kynge vncles great lordes englande lordes counsayled togyther suche promyse made frenche kyng counsayle amyence determyned delyuer two frenche knyghtes dayly called aunswere knyghtes sente day sayde thus syrs contente thinges consydred ye canne haue v full answere tyme wolde harde nowe assemble togyther thre estate realme vntyll feest mychelmas whiche tyme muste nedes parlyamente westmynster excuse shall write letter purpose whiche season partie frauce wyll traueyle farre come thyder shall haue reasonable answere suche generally hole counsayle thre astates shall agre vnto whan frenche knyghtes sawe aunswere coulde haue none aunswered sayd syr contente ye haue sayd lette v haue letter shall retourne letter delyuered toke leaue kynge lordes came fro wyndesore london made redy departe kyng englande caused cestes charge payed conueyed douer taryed fyue dayes lacke wynde sixte day departed aryued boloyne whanne horse vnshypped rode amyece small iourneys paris founde kynge lordes aboute feest penthecost letter redde wherby vnderstode ordynauce englysshmen shewed kynge counsayle toke lytell regarde mater within season moche ado place phowe syr peter craon yuell wyll subtyle crafte beate downe syr olyuer clysson wherwith kynge counsayle sore displeased ca clxxxv ye haue well herde ser peter craon knyght great lygnage farre frenche kynges grace duke thourayns dyd somoche cause displeased dyd yuell ye haue herde also howe gone bretayne duke shewed hym yuell wyll kynge bare hym meanes syr olyuer clysson may well enfourmed hadde great hate constable sir olyuer clysson studyed euer howe dystroy hym thus whyle syr peter craon duke bretaygne wolde often tymes comune togyder deuise howe myght bringe syr olyuer clysson dethe sayd one deed none yt wolde greatly reuenge dethe duke repeted hym nat slayne hym whan hym prisone wolde coste hym hundred thousande frankes hym agayne wyll whan syr peter craon sawe duke suche hatred syr olyuer clysson purposed marueylous ymaginacien himselfe apparauce men shulde gyue iudgement knyght thought howe euer wolde slee constable thought entende nothynge el tyll slayne hym owne handes caused hym slayne afterwarde entreat peace douted nothyng iohn blois sonne vicounte rohan wedded two constable doughters thought well ynough theym longe ye duke parte sawe well strengthe puyssaunce bloys greatly feblysshed erle guy bloys solde herytage bloys duke thourayn whiche shulde haue ronne successyon therle pointhycur iohan bloys wherby thought duke thourayne shewed hym small loue alyaunce lynage bye away enherytaunce wherfore syr peter thought syr olyuer clysson deed sone apease kynges yuell wyll duke thourayns therby sone ouercome lorde de la ryuer syr iohan mercyer montagu begue villayns syr iohan bulle kynges chambre suche susteyned constable knewe well duke berrey duke burgoyne loued nothynge wardely whatsoeuer shewed outwardly thus sir peter craon perceyuered styll opynyon deuysed imagynacion entysyng dyuell neuer slepeth waketh enbraseth harte yuell enclyneth exortacion thus dyuell dayly layde mater knyghtes eyen put mater execusyon iustly ymagyned doutes parelles myscheuousnesse myght fall yuell dede reasone wyse atemperaunce shulde haue caused hym haue done otherwyse often tymes said great desyre man hath haue execusyon thynge fallen often tymes quencheth reason wysdome therfore often tymes vyces maysters vertues vyolate corrupted bycause specially syr peter craon great affection dystructyon constable therfore lyghtly enclyned temptacion outrage folly thought myght slee constable returne agayne safely bretayne man wolde seke hym dyd trusted duke wolde excuse hym worste fell frenche kynge came thyder great puyssaunce nyght entre shyppe go burdeaux bay englande thought well shulde nat pursewed knewe well englysshe men hated constable bycause crueltyes doone consented done sythe tourned frenche howe done many notable seruyces englysshe men hath ben rehersed hystory sir peter craon accoplyssh desyre longe studyed mynde howe brynge purpose passe kepte purpose close secrete knowe nat shewed duke bretayne nat thought e bycause dede done hym company toke next way coude bretayne tooke sauegarde duke bretaygne also dede done solde castelles herytage aniou duke bretaygne renyed homage frenche kynge sayd howe wolde go ouer see mater passe breuely shall declare dede syr iohan froysart auctour hystory whan vnhappy dede doone syr peter craon agaynste syr olyuer clysson tyme paris wherfore ought well enfourmed mater acordyng enquery made therin knowe trouthe tyme syr peter towne parys fayre house standynge churche yarde saynt iohans dyuers lordes cytie pleasure house keper syr peter craon sent seruauntes parys prouyded largely house wyne corne flesshe salte prouysyons also writen keper shulde bye certayne armure cote stele gauntletes stole harnesse xl men doone sende hym worde therof thentente wolde sende secretly done keper thought none yuell obey maysters comaundement bought marchaudyse season castell owne aniou called sable sent one weke thre four seruauntes house parys wekely tyll xl shewed nothynge cause sent thyder charged kepe selfe close howse wyse euer lacked keper house shulde prouyde daye shall shewe cause sende thyder ye shall haue good wage dyd commaunded came priuely parys entred house nyght mornynges gate parys nyght daye stode open assembled house many togyther xl companyons hardy men outragyous howe hadde knowen wherfore came thyder wolde nat haue come yet kepte selfe secrete ye feest pentecost syr peter craon came paris secretly entred howse dysguysed lyke seruaunt called porter kepte gate sayd comaunde payne thy lyfe let man woman chylde entre house none go without comaundement porter obeyed reason dyd keper comaunded kepers wyfe chyldren kepe chambre nat issue therof wherin dyd wysely woman chyldren gone abrode streates comynge thyther syr peter craon knowe chyldren woman naturally harde kepe counsayle thynge man wolde haue kepte secrete thus syr peter company secretly howse tyll day holy sacramente euery day syr peter brode spyes brought worde state syr olyuer clysson tyll daye coulde fynde tyme execute enterprise wherwith sore displeased hym selfe said day frenche kynge kepte feest open courte lordes also quene duches thourayne great ioy solace day dyner yonge lusty knyghtes armed iusted valyauntly presence kynge quene ladyes damosel contynued tyll nere nyght iudgement ladyes harauldes price gyuen syr gillyam flaunders erle namure kynge made lordes ladyes great supper supper daunced tyll one clock mydnyght euery man departed lodgynges one place another without feare doute thyng syr olyuer clisson constable fraunce departed fro kynges place last taken leaue kynge went duke thourayns chambre sayde hym syr wyll ye tary nyght el go lodgyng poullayne poullayn duke treasourer dwelte lytell besyde sygne lyon syluer duke sayde constable nat tell yet whether tary el go thyder go ye waye lodgynge tyme syr olyuer toke leaue duke sayd syr god sende good nyght departed streate founde seruauntes horse eyght persones two torch rode forthe entre hygh streate saynt kateryns sir peter craon night layde good spyall ser olyuer clisson knewe well bydden behynde company kynge horse taryed kynges gate hym mouted horse company well armed couertly past nat sire company knew entent whan came saynte katheryns streate taryed abode priuely constable comyng sone constable issued streate saynt powle came hyghe streate torch besyde hym came rydynge talkyng squyer sayenge morowe must haue dyner ye duke thourayne lorde coucy syr iohan vyen syr charles danger barone vrey dyuers wherfore speke stewarde lacke nothynge sayeng wordes syr peter craon company came hym first strake torch whan constable herde russhynge horse behynde hym thought duke thourayne folowed sported hym sayde ah syr yuell doone pardon ye yonge full play sporte wordes syr peter craon drewe swerde said slee constable slee hym shall dye arte thou quod clysson spekest wordes peter craon thyne enemye thou hast often tymes dyspleased nowe thou shalte make amedes therwith strake constable syr peter men drewe oute swordes strake constable wepon shorte knyfe two foote length defended hym selfe well myght men without armure sone put brode fro mayster syr peter men sayd shall slee yea quod sir peter suche make defence defence small eight persones without armure sir peter demaunded nothynge dethe constable whan knewe constable gaue faynte stroke thynge doone trayson doone cowardly without hardynesse constable defended hymselfe valyauntly wepyn howe defence hadde vayled hym lytell great grace god nat ben styll sate horse tyll full stroke ye heed whiche stroke fell fro horse ryght agaynst baker dore vp busy bake breed left dore halfe open whiche happy constable fell fro horse fell agaynste dore dore opened fell dore horsebacke coulde nat entre hym dore lowe lytell god shewed great grace constable fallen streates dyde dore dore shytte ben slayn without remedy horsebacke durste nat alyght also thought dyd syr peter yt stroke heed laste shulde dethes wounde syr peter sayd go hence haue done ynough nat deed wyll dye stroke hathe heed great stroke therwith departed rode waye good pace gate saynte anthony rode therat gate open ben ten yere sythe frenche kynge retourned fro batayle rosebeque sayd constable put downe malles parys punysshed rebellyons thus syr olyuer clysson lefte case man halfe deed baker house sore abasshed whan knewe constable men lytell hurte syr peter men loked nothynge haue slayne constable syr olyuers men assembled togyther entred baker house founde mayster sore hurte heed blode rennynge downe vysage wherwith sore abasshed good cause made great complayntes fyrste feared ben deed anone tydinges hereof came kynges lodgynge sayde kyng goynge bedde ah syr canne nat hyde fro great myschiefe nowe sodenly fallen parys myschefe quod kynge syr quod constable syr olyuer clisson slayne slayne quod kynge howe hath done dede syr quod canne nat tell myschefe fallen hym streate saynt kateryn well quod kynge light vp torch wyll go se hym torch anone lyghted vp kynge put cloke slyppers fete suche kept watche nyght went forthe kynge suche bed herde tydyng rose vp hast folowed kyng gone forthe small company kynge taryed manne wente forthe theym chambre torch behynde mo chamberlayns hym sir gaultier martell syr iohn lygnac thus king came baker house entred certayne torch taryed without kynge founde constable nere deed shewed nat fully deed men taken geare se woundes howe hurte fyrst worde hynge sayd constable howe dere syr ryght febly hath brought case quod kyng syr quod peter craon company traytoursly without defence constable quod kynge neuer dede derely bought shall physycions surgeon sent partes whan came kyng sayd owne surgyons syrs looke case constable shewe trouthe sory hurte serched woundes euery parte kynge demaunded sayd syrs howe saye parell dethe answered sayd syr surely ieoperdy dethe hym within xv dayes shall able ryde aunswere kynge ryght ioyous sayd thanked god good tydynges said constable good chere care nothynge neuer trespas sorer punysshed shall vpon traytours haue done dede take mater myne owne constable feble voyce answered sir god rewarde grace noble vysytacyon kyng toke leaue departed retourned lodgynge contynent sente prouost paris tyme came clere day lyght kyng comaunded hym sayd prouost get men togyther well horsed pursewe traytour sir peter craon thus traytorously hath hurte nygh dethe constable ye nat v acceptable seruyce thanne pursewe take hym bring hym v prouost answered sayd syr shall yt lyeth puyssaunce syr canne grace knowe whiche waye gone enquyre quod kynge dylygence phowe great dylygence prouost parys pursewed syr peter craon cap clxxxvi tyme four souerayne gate cytie euer kepte opyn nyght day whiche ordynaunce made euersythe batayle rosebeque frenche kyng disconfited mynges parisyece wolde haue rebelled malettes laide downe entent kepe vnder parisyence counsayle sir olyuer clysson chaynes streates layde downe gate taken hokes case cytie ten yere euery man myght entre night daye parys lyst lo maye well consydred fortune costable gadred rodde wherwith hym selfe beaten gate parys ben closed chaynes lyfte vp sir peter craon durst neuer haue done dyde coude nat haue gone towne dyde bycause knewe well might issue houres made execute yuell purpose wha departed fro constable thought surely ben slayne howe nat wherwith sore displeased whan issue parys one clocke mydnight passed gate saynt anthony sayd passed ryuer seyne bridge charenton toke waye charter sayde issued parys gate saynte honour vnder mount marter passed ryuer seyne ponthieur euer passed eight clocke charter suche well horsed hym folowed hym nat brake sondre lesse suspeciousnesse feare pursute whan sir peter craon came first parys lefte charter one chanons ben seruaunt beforetyme twentte fresshe horse ben better chanon neuer knowen hym purpose executynge therof knewe nothyng therin whan sir peter retourned charter dranke chau ged horse dyde harnesse toke waye mayne rode fast yt came castell owne called sable rested hym selfe sayde wolde go tyll herde tidynges sir olyuer clysson howe mater went ye maye sure fryday dede done great brute ran cytie dede many blamed greatly sir peter craon lorde coucy soone knewe therof mornynge lepte horse eyght person hym rode constable lodgyng visyte hym loued entierlye togyder called eche brother armes visytacion dyd costable gret good lyke
