maner lordes acordyng tourne came visyted hym specially duke thourayne sore displeased dede kynge sayd bothe howe sir peter craon done dede dispyte theym howe thyng prepensed false traytours put realme trouble duke berrey thane parys dissymuled mater made great busynesse cause sir iohan froissarte auctour cronycle credably enformed aduenture ben nothyng done duke berrey lyste wolde myght well haue broken enterprise shall shewe reason howe thursday corpus christy day came duke berrey clerke secretorie sir peter craon sayde hym secrete maner sir wyll shewe thyng secretnesse whiche lykely come poore co clusyon sir ye lykely remedye mater duke sir quod shall shewe wolde nat named bringer oute therof spare nat quod duke shall beare mater well ynoughe well sir quod clerke doubte greatlye sir peter craon wyll slee cause murthered constable sir olyuer clysson hath assembled toguyder house within churche yarde saynte iohanes great noumbre menne hath kepte couertly euersyth feest whitsontyde sir shulde dede kynge wyll sore dyspleapleased bringe realme great trouble therfore sir shewe sir abasshed therof selfe though sir peter seruaunt haue made seruyce hym yet dare nat consente outrage sir ye prouyde nat mater none sir goddessake take hede haue shewed sir eschewe maye falle dare nat retourne hym duke herde hym well said abyde nyght morowe tymes shall enforme kyng therof nowe farforthe dayes wyll nat trouble kynge therwith morowe without faute shall prouyde mater sithe sir peter craon towne knewe nat therof thus duke draue matter meane tyme myschiefe felle prouost mo thane threscore horse issued oute cytie gate saynt honour folowed tracke sir peter craon came ponthieur passe ryuer seyne demauded kepar bridge horse passed waye mornynge sayd yes howe passed twelue horse sawe knyght persone knewe waye toke quod prouost sir quod waye towardes wannes ah prouost maye well thynke wyll ryde chierbourge thane prouoste tooke waye leste waye charter therby loste iuste pursute sir peter craon whanne rydden tyll noone mette knyght countrey huntyng hare shewed hym howe sawe mornynge fyftene men horsebacke trauersyng feldes thought toke waye charter prouost company entred waye charter rode tyll nere hande nyght came charter shewed hym howe sir peter craon hadde chanon aboute eyght clocke vnarmed hym toke fresshe horse prouost sawe well lost payne shulde folowe hym sayeng seyng farre past saturdaye retourned parys bycause certentie whiche waye sir peter craon toke nat knowen parys therfore kynge duke thourayne great affection haue sir peter craon taken sente sir iohn barrois threscore horse parys sertche hym issued gate saynt anthony passed ryuers marne scyne bridge charenton rode countrey came towardes estampes finally dyner came charter herde sure tidynges whane barrois knewe yt sir peter craon gone sawe shulde traueyle vayne folowe retourned agayne sondaye parys shewed kyng done lykewise prouost done saturday founde vyllage went sertchyng two squyers page parteynyng sir peter craon taken brought parys sette prisone mondaye beheeded first brought ye place dede done eche right hande striken halle beheeded hanged gybet wednisday kepar sir peter craons house paris executed beheeded many men said wrong bycause shewed nat comynge sir peter parys put dethe lykewise yt chanon charter sir peter dyde refresshe hym chaunged horse accused taken put bysshoppes prisone toke fro hym depriued hym benefyces condempned perpetuall prisone lyue breed water excusacyons coude make auayled hym nothyng reputed towne charter noble wyse man sir peter craon beyng castell sable sore displeased whan knewe sir olyuer clysson nat deed hurte within sixe wekes shulde hole consydred nat good suretie castell feared enclosed suche wyse shulde nat issue whan wolde thane tooke certayne hym issued secretly rode longe came bretaygne foude duke receyued hym knewe mater howe constable nat deed sayde ah sir peter craon ye vnhappy coude nat slee constable whan ye hym vnder youre handes sir quod sir peter deuyll thynke deuylles hell dyde helde hym hades companyons sure stryken hym mo thanne threscore stroke swordes iauelyns whane fell fro horse dede thought surely bene deed nat ben fortune fall baker dore whiche stode halfe opyn fallen strete hadde neuer rysen lyue well quod duke nowe wyll none otherwyse sure shall shortely newes fro frenche kyng thynke shall haue warre hym ye haue kepe priuely ye mater shall nat thus rest sithe haue promysed ayde susteyne wyll kepe promyse pof great army viage frenche kynge purposed make bretayne agaynst duke bycause susteyned sir peter craon howe viage kynge fell sicke wherby viage brake cap clxxxvii tidynges came frenche kynge laye parys duke bretayne hadde receyued sir peter craon kyng counsayled suche priuye counsayle shulde incontynent sende bretaygne duke comaundynge hym faythe homage ought crowne fraunce take traytour sir peter craon sende hym parys letter written sealed delyuered squiet rode long came bretayne foude duke castell ermyne delyuered letter duke toke reed said messanger wolde write agayne kyng dyd excusyng hymselfe sayeng sir peter craon knewe nothynge wolde nat knowe aparteyned nat hym knowe hatered warre bytwene sir olyuer clysson sir peter craon toke regarde therto touched nothynge therfore mater prayed kyng holde hym excused letter sealed delyuered kynges messanger retourned agayne parys foude kyng cousayle sore desyrous tidinges bretaygne messanger delyuered letter kynge toke reed kynge sayd brother counsayle excusacion duke nat suffycient semeth well duke bretayne hath caused busynes dispyre outrage great ought nat suffred toucheth gretlye myne honoure season duke berrey parys often tymes kynge wolde speke hym trespasse duke sayd sir surely hath done great outrage myght founde reasone made amendes fayre vncle quod kynge bretaygne duke wyll go seke hym ye shall go v duke dissymuled mater sayd sir shall please ye must haue also brother burgoyne wyll haue hym v quod kyng without hym wyll make voyage wyll go bretayne suche armye able resyst ennemyes maye se nowe openly duke loueth setteth v lytell proude presumptuous shall entende nothynge tyll haue brought hym reasone thus frenche kyng deuised duke berrey manysshed greatly duke bretayne assysters duke berrey acorded sayeng dissymuled thought contrary frenche kyng hadde great affection reuenged dispyte done costable wherfore prepared hym selfe go bretayne fyrst go aniou distroye beate downe sir peter craons castel le duke bretayne sayd bought yet kyng counsayle sayd poynt duke heritage duke sayde excuse susteyne sir peter craon wherfore personally kynges indignacyon yet season treatie maryage bytwene duke bretaygnes sone kynges doughter meane season whyle voyage thus ordred great brute therof spoken throughe frauce retourned paris bysshoppe noyon lorde de la ryuer fro foize bierne shewed kyng counsayle howe spedde well herde voyage bretayne busyed kyng counsayle leysar entede mater kynge wolde gladly constable ben hole might able ryde kyng went fro parys comaunded beaten downe sir peter craos house stode churche yarde saynt iohans kynge dyde gyue groude make churche yarde burye deed bodyes frenche kyng made prouisyon waye aniou mayne bretayne thourayne ryuer loyre entent go bretayne none durst speke contrary renome throughout paris well knowen sir olyuer clisson costable frau ce whan laye thus sicke hurt made testament entente heyres shulde knowe ye trouthe euery thyng heyres two doughters one maryed iohan bretayne erle ponthieur sir olyuer quytte prisone englade payde hym sixscore thou sande frankes duke irelande hath ben shewed hystorie seconde doughter shulde vicoutes rohan reason husbade somme testament mounted seuyntene hundred thousande frankes besyde heritage euery man yt herde therof great marueyle howe shulde gather toguider suche richesse specially duke berrey burgoyne counsayls great marueyle therof spake largely sayd deuyll howe maye constable hath gadered guider many floreyns suche mouable goodes kyng hym selfe hath nat moche maye well beleued knowen hath nat iust meanes thus mater passed suche loued hym nat thought neuerthelesse thus suche kynge written vnto prepared selfe go hym bretaygne voiage pleased nothynge duke burgoyn sayd warre without reason conclusion ther coulde take good ende realme fraunce duchy bretayne lordes knightes squyers nothynge warre bytwene sir olyuer clysson sir peter craon nede quod take payne traueyle make warre quarelles shulde rather suffre owne greue make warre eche vpon duke berrey opinyon coude nat herde beleued kyng cousayled contrary opinyons suche kyng loued better duke coude nat tell howe breke enterprice whan sawe none remedy obeyed slouthfully howe promocyon duke burgoyne erle ostrenaunt written vnto kynge go hym iourney thre hu dred speares erle loued dedes armes prouyded hym go kynge whane redy assembled toguyder company great cost charge countermaunded agayne wyse shulde styrre phowe duke thourayn brother kyng resigned duchy thourayne kynges handes howe exchauge kynge gaue hym duchy orlyauce euer called duke orlyaunce cap clxxxvii season kyng thus nighe redy departe parys shewe toke busynesse hym selfe exchau ge made landes gretly profyte duke thourayne resygned kynges handes duchy thourayne kyng gaue hym duchy orliaunce lyke maner au ciently duke philyp orlyaunce helde whiche four tymes better value thus fro hen forthe hystorie shall name hym duke thourayne duke orlyauce pwhan sir olyuer clysson hole might ryde frenche kyng right ioyfull said howe wolde tary lengar euenyng toke leaue quene isabell wyfe newe duchesse orlyaunce ladyes damoselles dyde duke orlauce lykewise departed rode supper motague duke burbone erle namure lorde coucy hym kyng laye dyned dyner departed laye night saynt germayns laye seuyn dayes ye kyng somwhat diseased phisicions wolde haue hym haue rested hym selfe ye kyng wyllyng iourney sayde howe moche better ease dede whiche dyde gyue corage men set forwarde tha two vncles duke berrey burgoyne behynde shewed well maner iourney greued wolde nat haue gone good wylles howe hadde made assemble saue honour obeyed folowed whan frenche kyng hadde rested hym fyftene dayes saynt germayns armye assembled departed passed ryuer seyne toke waye charter annens good towne castell parteyning lorde de la ryuer herytage wyues kynge brother duke orlyaunce duke burbone lorde de la ryreceyued kynge honorably taryed thre dayes rode charter montague bysshoppe kynge lodged bysshoppe palais two duke seconde day thyder came duke berrey erle marche copany fourh daye thider cae duke burgoyne wher kynge ryght ioyfull people came dayle kyng sayd wolde nat retourne parys tyll hadde brought duke bretayne reason often tymes put hym payne trouble kynges counsayle hadde sette hym warre duke berrey burgoyne wolde gladly haue modered ye mater coulde nat herde wherwith sore displeased suche cousayls said eche surely mater coude nat long endure state full lykely kynge realme shall haue busynesse sithe kyng refuseth counsaile vncles leaneth pleasure nothyng lyke whan kyng taried charter seuyn dayes departed toke ye waye man men folowed fro farre partes arthois beamoys vermandois picardy said one another ah duke bretayne maketh v haue moche putteth v great payne traueyle hath alwayes harde highe herted agaynst crowne frauce neuer loued honored cosyn erle flaunders duchesse burgone haue alwayes borne hym yet nat ben ben distroyed long go euersyth lorde clysson tourned frenche neuer loued surelye likely de yable dede hath alwayes sir peter craon agaynst kyng agaynst constable sayde lette kyng alone tyme hath ye mater hert wyll bring duke reason retourne trewe trayson feare suche go kyng nat enemy ye duke may well durst speke token nyght daye cou sayle kynge breke voyage whiche troubleth kyng scant gette hym selfe helthe recouery laste sickenesse thus knightes squiers deuised among selfe rode cou trey styll kyng aproched cytie man kynge lodged castell lordes ye cytie men warre abrode countrey kyng taried thre wickes sore vexed feuer phisicions sayde brother vncles lordes ensure ye yuell traueyle ye kyng good state ryde rest farre better hym sythe came fro cytie amyens hath nat ben good helthe shewed kynge great affection go iourney wolde nother beleue yet phisycions sayde howe founde ease trauelyng restyng therfore euer counsayle contrary shall nat please loueth nat answere coulde nat haue kyng euery day kyng wolde sytte myddes counsayle tyll noon thentent none shulde laye lette iourney thus kyng man somwhat acomplysshe desyers vncles sent four notable knightes duke bretayne sir raynolde du roy lorde varensiers lorde castell morant sir tapyne cauten l chateleyne gysors charged shewe duke howe kyng counsaile reputed dyde great offence susteyne kynges enemy realmes make amendes shulde sede sir peter craon man kyng wherby meanes shulde foude shulde take domage countrey kynges voyage thus deted fro man xl speres passed cyte angiers last came cytie nauntes entred sounde duke made good chere daye made dyner dyde message declared ye kynges entent counsayls whervnto duke answered wisely sagely said howe shulde harde hym delyuer sir peter craon sayd god myght helpe hym busynesse knewe nat wherfore desyred case holde hym excused sayde well herde hym yere past loued nat sir olyuer clysson wolde make mortall warre power soeuer ende came therof tyme demaunded hym gyuen sir olyuer knowledge therof sayd vtterly defyed wolde slee hym coude outher daye nyght soeuer coude fynde hym dedes knowe wherfore haue marueyle kynge wyll make warre agaynst cause couynauntes maryage bytwene chyldren grace god shall nat broken parte wherfore haue done nothynge hym counsaile shulde make warre agaynst aunswere duke made frenche kynges messangers whan hadde taryed daye nauntes toke leaue departed retourned man ye kyng thought longe tyll herde aunswere ye haue herde declared ye kyng cousayle duke berrey burgoyne well cotent ye answere sayd reasonable kyng reason suche enformacion sayde contrary sayd sithe forewarde iourney wolde nat returne agayne fraunce parys tyll brought duke bretayne reason gladly two duke berrey burgoyne wolde haue modered voiage might nat herde kyng taken suche displeasure duke bretayn bicause susteyned sir peter craon excusacion coulde taken tyme brute ranne fraunce quene aragon lady yolant bare cosyn germayne frenche kynge prison cytie barcylona knyght man knewe name men supposed ben syr peter craon quene writen right amyably kynge sygnyfyenge hym fyfte day moneth iuly knyght good estate aray came barcylona haue past sce hyred money shyppe sayd haue sayled napoles bycause kepe passage straunger shall passe without knowen knyght wyll nat shewe name therfore kepe hym prisone abasshment se thynke surely person ye wold fayne haue therfore write therof ye shulde sende person hyther suche knoweth sir peter craon se nat euer shall nat delyuered tyll haue aunswere fro wolde tydynges might agreable counsayle knoweth holy goost preserue writen parpygnan nynth day iuly yolante bare quene aragon maiolles lady sardyne sardane super scrypcion redouted kynge fraunce tydynges somewhat modered dyuers mennes harte nere poynte haue broken voyage howe suche sir olyuer clyssons frendes sayde tydynges fayned tale made deuysed breke kynges voyage sayenge sir peter craon none prisone duke bretayne hath susteyned hym dothe quene aragon lettre kynge made lyght sayenge trayson fable duke burgoyne sayd syr yet leste pea nese quene aragon delyueraunce knight prisone petaduenture nothynge gylty trespas sende vnto may contente v content therwith quod kynge please beleue surely traytour syr peter craon none barcylona prisone aboute duke bretayne faythe owe saint denyce shall one make acompt therof coulde man turne kynge fro opinyon syr peter craon duke bretaygne duke bretayne well enfourmed busynesse thought hymselfe nat well assured sawe well duke berrey burgoyne coulde nat bring purpose aboute syr olyuer clyssons frendes led kynge lyste duke prouyded kepe townes garysons howe durst kepe towne except wannes campell doll camper lermyn coratyne susement wrote suche knyghtes squyers thought shulde ayde dissymuled hym bycause knewe french kyng sore displeased hym also thought nat thynge couenable duke susteyne syr peter craon agaynst constable frauce dyd duke maner repented hym done moche howe corage herte hygh dysdayned speke sayde kynge came bretayne semed wolde begynnynge wolde let hym lone thanne shall se frendes foos wyll nat hasty make warre whan weneth rest wyll awake hym nat greed hym loue thus duke deuysed somtyme counsayle thought surely shulde haue warre howe nat mater tourned otherwyse great aduauntage therfore olde prouerbe nat poore yt happy duke fortunate reason apytuous incydence fell sodaynly frenche kynge otherwyse duke nat lykely haue scaped daugers haue lyued peace dyd whan frenche kynge taryed space thre wekes cytie man knyghtes retourned sent bretayne sayd syth herde duke answere wolde lenger tary sayd taryenge greatly displeased wolde passe forthe bretaygne se enemy duke bretaygne susteyd traytour syr peter craon entencyon kynge knyghtes squyers came agaynst hym founde townes closed wolde put downe ye duke euer set gouernour countrey tyll duke chyldren lawfull age rendre berytage duke neuer haue parte theof opinyon king helde styll man coude put hym therfro thus fayre daye aboute ten clocke kynge departed fro cytie man comaunded marshalles nyght cause mye bothe behynde dysloge drawe anger sayde wolde nat retourne tyll ben bretayne dystroyed traytours put hym moche payne trouble marshalles dyd kinges comaundement day king departed marueylous hoote sonne naturally cheife force entent declare trouth euery thyng season kynge lay man sore traueyled dayly syttynge counsayle also nat perfytely hole nat ben season feble brayne heed dyd eate drinke lytell nygh dayly hoote feuer gretly anoyed payned also dyspleasure constable hurte full malencoly spirytes sore troubled traueyled physicions spyed well dyd vncles coulde nat remedy man durste counsayle hym breke voyage bretaygne enfourmed rode forwarde forest man great sygnifycacyon fell hym whiche doone well shulde haue called counsayle aboute hym well aduysed hymselfe gone sodaynly came kynge poore man bare heeded bare legged bare footed body poore whyte cote semed rather foole wyse boldely sodaynly toke brydell kynges horse handes stopped horse sayd syr kyng tyde forward thou arte betrayed wordes entred kynges heed wherby worse dysposed helthe herte blode moued kinges seruauntes strake poore man lette kynges horse go made wordes fooles spekyng whiche foly dyuers men sayde leste shulde haue better examyned man haue sene ben naturall foole haue knowen fro whence came dyde nat lefte hym behynde neuer sene mannes knowledge suche nere kynge herde hym speke wordes kynge passed forthe aboute twelue clocke kynge passed forest came great playne sandy sonne also heyght shone bright whose rayes marueylously hote wherby horse sore chafed suche person armed sore oppressed heat knyghtes rode togyther companyes kynge rode somwhat parte bycause duste duke berrey duke burgoyne rode lefte hande talkynge togyther acre brede lande fro kynge lordes erle marche sir iaques burbone syr charles de la brethe syr phylyppe darthoys sir henry sir phylip bare syr peter nauer knyghtes rode companyes duke burbon lorde coucy syr charles danger baron dyuiry dyuers rode kynge nat company deuised talked togyther toke hede fell sodaynly chefe personage company whiche kynges owne persone therfore workes god marueylous scourge cruell douted creature hath sene olde testament also newe many fygures example therof rede howe nabugodonosor kynge assyryens reygned season suche tryumphant glory none lyke hym sodaynly greatest force glory souerayne kynge lorde god kynge heuen erthe fourmer ordeyner thynges parelled sayd kynge suche wyse lost wytte reygne seuen yers estate lyued acornes mast fell fro okes wylde appels frutes hadde tast bore swyne endured penauce god restored hym agayne memory wytte sayde danyell prophet none god god israell nowe father sonne holy goost thre persones one god hath ben euer shall puissaunt shewe warkes euer wherfore man shulde marueyle thyng dothe nowe purpose speke wordes great influence fro heuen fell sayd daye vpon frenche kynge dyuers sayd owne faute acordynge dysposicyon body state warnyng physicyons dyd gyue hym shulde nat haue rydden suche hoote day houre rather mornynge euenynge fresshe ayre wherfore shame nere aboute hym suffre cousayle hym dyd thus frenche kynge rode vpon fayre playne heate sonne whiche marueylous heyght kynge ac e couered blacke veluet whiche sore chafed hym heed syngle bonet scarlet chapelet great perles whiche quene gyuen hym departure page rode behynde beatynge heed chapewe montaban bright clere shynynge agaynst sonne behynde page rode nother bearing kynges speare paynted redde frynged sylke sharpe heed stele lord de la ryuer brought dosyn hym fro tholouse one gyuen hole dosyn king kynge gyuen thre theym brother duke orlyaunce thre duke burbon rode thus forth page bare speare whether neclygence fell slepe lette speare fall page heed rode hym heed speare made great classhe bright chapewe stele kynge rode fore noyse sodaynly started herte trymbled imagynacion ranne inpressyon wordes man stopped horse forest man ran thought enemyes ranne hym slee distroy abusyon fell wytte feblenesse heed dasshed spore horse drewe sworde tourned page hauynge knowledge man wenynge hymselfe batayle inclosed enemyes lyfte vp sworde stryke cared nat cryed sayd vpon traytours whan page sawe kynge inflamed ire tooke good hede themselfe tyme thought kynge ben dyspleased bycause speare fell downe thanne stepte away fro kynge duke orleaunce nat thane farre fro kynge kynge came hym naked sworde hande kynge suche fransey herte feble nother knewe brother vncle whan duke orlyaunce sawe kynge commynge hym sworde naked ha de abasshed wolde nat abyde hym wyste nat mente dasshed spurres horse rode awaye kynge hym duke burgoyne rode lytell waye fro kynge whan herde russhyng horse herde page crye regarded waye sawe howe kynge naked sworde chased brother duke orlyaunce sore abasshed sayd harowe myschife kynge nat ryght mynde god helpe hym flye away nephewe flye away kynge wolde slee duke orlyance nat well assured selfe fledde awaye faste horse myght beare hym knyghtes squyers folowed euery man began drawe thyder farre thought chafed hare wolfe tyll last herd kynge nat well mynde duke orlyance saued himselfe men armes came aboute kynge suffred hym wery hym selfe traueyled febler whan strake man wolde fall downe stroke matter hurte many ouerthrowen none made defence fynally whan kyng well eryed horse sore chafed sw te great heate knyght normandy one kynges chamber aynes whome kynge loued well called gyllyam martell came behynde kyng sodaynely tooke hym armes helde hym styll aproched toke sworde handes tooke hym downe fro horse dyd acke thre refresshe hym came brother vncles clene lost knowledge rolled eyen heed marueylously spake man lordes blode sore abasshed wyste nat sayd duke berrey burgoyne sayde behoueth v recourne man voyage doone tyme sayde nat moche thought shewed ryght well whan came parys suche loued nat ye shall reasonably consydre thinges acordynge trouthe great pytie french kyng tyme reputed moste noble puyssaunt kynge crystendome fell sodaynly mynde remedy god wolde kynge layde horse lyttoure brought backe agayne cytie man marshalles gaue knowledge armye shulde retourne howe voyage broken tyme knowledge nat nyght kynge came man physicyons moche hym lordes blode royall great trouble euery man spake dyuer maners sayd suche hadde rule aboute kynge poysoned hym brynge realme fraunce shame trouble wordes multyplyed suche wyse duke orlyance vncles lordes blode royall noted spake togyther sayde howe saye syrs haue ye nat herde wordes howe menne murmure dyuets place vpon theym hath gouernaunce kynge saythe shulde poysoned lette v sertche howe maye knowen sayde howe shulde best knowen physycyons ought knowe acquaynted complexcyon physicyons sent examyned answered howe kyng longe tyme engendred malady knewe well wekenes brayne wold sore trouble hym laste shewe selfe haue sayde moche tyme duke burgoyne sayde syrs trewe therin ye dyd well acquyte selfe wolde neyther beleue v affeciyon sore sette vpon voyage deuysed yuell tyme voyage hathe dyshonoured v better clysson affynyte ben deed many daye agone rather kynge haue taken malady tydynges shall sprede abrode many place seyng yt yonge man blame shall layde v vncles blode men wyll saye shulde otherwyse haue counsayled hym thus shall laide faute without cause sir quod duke yesterday whan wente dyner ye hym physicyons aunswered sayd yes dyd eate meate well quod duke certaynly quod dyd eate drinke lytle sate mused gaue hym drinke last quod duke syr quod canne nat tell soone table taken vp departed made v redy ryde chamberlayns butler canne tell best robert de tulle squyer pycardy sent demauded gaue kynge drinke laste syrs quod syr robert lygnac sent enquyred wyne kynge dranke last chambre whan wente horse syr quod roberte tulle toke saye presence kinge trewe quod roberte tulle ye nede nat doute therin haue suspeciousnesse yet wyne flagon wherof wyll drinke assaye duke berrey sayd nede nat surely kynge nat poysoned malady procedeth yuell counsayle tyme speke mater nowe let alone tyll another season thus maner lordes departed eche fro nyght went lodgyage kynges vncles ordeyned four knyghtes honour wayte aboute kynge syr raynolde du roysyr raynolde toye lorde grauseers sir gyllyam marte kynges vncles sent comaundement lorde dela ryuer syr iohn mercyer montagu begu vyllayns syr gullyam bordes syr helyon lygnac shulde wyse come aboute kynge tyll better estate nexte daye kynges vncles came se kynge founde hym ryght feble demaunded rest taken nyght answered small rest poore newes quod duke burgoyn came duke orlyance went togyder kynge demaunded hym howe dyd gaue none aunswere loked straungely loste clene knowledge lordes sore abasshed comuned togyder sayde haue kyng herde case trouble ayde good lette v recomaunde hym chaumberlayns physicyons canne best take hede hym lette v go study howe realme maye gouerned el thinges wyll go amysse duke burgoyne sayd duke berrey fayre brother best drawe parys ordayne haue kynge easely brought thyder better shall take hede hym partyes whan let v asseble counsayle fraunce ordeyne shall haue gouernauce realme duke orlayunce well sayde quod duke berrey good studyed best haue kynge lye myght soner recouer helth deuysed shulde brought castell crayell good ayre fayre countrey ryuer oyse whan ordeyned men warre leaue departe comaunded marshalles euery man retourne peasably owne countrey without doynge vyolence domage countreys shulde passe dyd lordes capytayns make mendes kynges two vncles chauncellour fraunce sente anone soundry messangers good cyties townes fraunce shuld take good hede kepe well townes consyderynge kynge nat well dysposed helthe comaundementes fulfylled people realme fraunce fore abasshed whan knew howe king fallen sycke fransey menne spake largely agaynste counsayled kynge go bretaygne sayde howe kynge betrayed bare duke bretaygne syr peter craon agaynst kyng men coulde nat lette wolde speke mater hygh wordes ranne therof dyuersely thus fynally kyng brought crayell lefte kepynge physicyons sayde four knyghtes euery man departed commaunded hyde kepe secrete kynges malady fro knowledge quene seasone great chylde courte comaunded kepe secrete payne great punysshement thus kynge crayell march seulis compyen ryuer oyse kept sayd knyghtes physycions gaue hym medicyns recouered lytell helth phowe duke burgoyn berrey vncles kynge gouernaunce realme howe chased toke suche gouerned kynge cap clxxxix seasone ye realme fraunce wyse sage physicyon brewte none lyke hym well loued lorde coucy natyue countrey tyme bydyng cyte laon called mayster guylliam harsley whan knewe fyrste kynges malady accydent fell sycke sayd thought hym selfe knowe kynges compleryon howe maladye fallen kynge faute complexyon holdeth moche ye moyster see wordes reported lord coucy paris duke orlyance ye kinges vncles cousayle frauce noble men prelate paris determyne shulde haue gouernaunce realme longe kyng shulde yt malady outher brother duke orlyance two vncles one vpon comunycacion xv dayes agreed fynally concluded bycause duke orlyaunce yonge take hym great charge duke berrey burgoyne shulde haue gouernaunce realme specyally duke burgoyne duches burgoyne shulde aboute quene seconde person thus haue sayde lorde coucy shewed kynges vncles great wysdome practyse sayd physycion mayster guyllyam harseley whan duke herde sente hym came parys lorde couey presented hym kynges vncles sayd lordes beholde mayster guyllyam harseley shewed ryght welcome quod duke receyued made good chere ordeyned hym go crayell vysyte kynge abyde aboute hym tyll hadde recouered helthe sayd mayster comaundement went crayell kynge chiefe ouer syght mynystryng thynge kyng sawe well kynges malady curable sawe howe taken reasone feblenesse herte heed faute therfore dyd dylygence recouer helthe tydynges kynges malady spred farre abrode euer sorye ye maye well knowe duke bretaygne syr peter craon wepte neuer deale great sorowe also whan pope boryface rome cardynals knowe trouthe right ioyfull drewe togyther consistory sayde howe greatest enemy frenche kynge beaten cruell rodde seyng god taken fro hym wytte sayde howe influence sente hym fro heuen chastyce hym withall bycause moche susteyned pope auignon therfore cruell plage sent hym cause hole realme better aduysed therfore sayd quarell stronger truely haue wysely consydred euery thynge great token haue caused cardynalles auygnon haue aduysed made lytell force therof nother honour god realme pope auignon cardynalles sayde howe reasone kynge yonge wolde haue owne wyll therby fallen malady faute suche haue rule aboute hym haue nat doone duetie haue suffred hym rynne bridell ryde nyght daye excessyuely traueylynge body measure therfore suche hath rule ought charged therwith none faulte ordred hym youthe contynued reasonable regement haue folowed counsayle vncles sycknesse nat fallen hym nowe also hath broken promesse reason promysed yere passed sware wordes kynge wolde ordayne dystroy antepape rome cardynals subdue sysme churche sette mater trouble good estate whiche nothynge doone hathe doone contrary promesse wherwith god dyspleased cause hym better aduyse selfe hathe punysshed hym cruell rodde retourne helte may well shall behoue v sende sufficyent legate shewe hym wysely defaute brekyng promesse forgette nat reason neclygece thus pope cardynalles auignon spake comuned toguyder layde defaute kynges malady counsayle frauce suche kynge chambre oppinyon many folkes realme fraunce kynge sence kynges offrynge towne called aresnecke countie heynaulte bytwene cambrey valencennes whiche towne churche parteyninge abbey saynt waste arrasce wherin lyeth saynt called saint acquayre shrme syluer whiche pylgrimage sought farre nere malady frasey thyder sente man waxe representynge frenche kynge humbly offred saynt myght meane god asswage kynges malady sende helthe lykewise kynges offrynge sente saynt hermyer romayes whiche saynt meryce heale fransey lykewise ryng sent place ye entent wha tidynges come englande kynge counsayle sore troubled therwith specially duke lancastre sayd suche knyghtes squyers aboute hym sir surely great pytic frenche kynge semed man great enterprice great desyre well sayde amyence whan departed fro hym fayre cosyn lancastre desyre hertely dylygence ferme peace maye made bytwene nephue kynge englande v oure realmes entent myght go togyder agaynst lamorabaquyn hath conquered realme armony dothe distroye christendome goyne thider faithe shulde exalted bou de therto nowe frenche kynges malady mater sore letted hyndred shall neuer credence herde duke sayde trewe lyke great trouble fraunce thus maner people bothe tarre nere spake deuysed kynges maladye kyng laye styll crayle kepynge foresaid knyghtes maister guyllyam harsely man spake kynge entred castell suche ordayned therto somtyme duke orlyaunce duke burbone came thyder visyte kynge duke berrey burgoyne laye styll parys done nothynge newe purpose shortely somwhat agaynst suche loued nat bycause hadde alwayes harde duke berrey said duke burgoyne brother le ryuer clysson le mercyer begue vallayns whan kynge languedocke ccuelly punysshed dethe treasourer good seruaunt betysache euuy coude saye coulde nat gette hym handes saue lyre therfore nowe let beware shall paye agayn money forged ye forge lykewise duke burgoyne coude nat ioue gouerned kyng euer whane busynesse courte euer agaynst hym also tyme duchesse burgoyne cruell lady quene chefe ruler non spake quene meanes lady hated mortally sir olyuer clyisone loue duke bretayne nere blode often tymes spake duke husbande sayeng howe greatlye blame beare moche sir olyuer clisson agaynst myghtie prince duke brecaygne duke burgoyne colde sage ymaginatyue prince dyde busynesse alwayes length wolde nat wyllyng bringe realme frauce trouble alwayes wyllyng kepe tie loue peace nere myght also yt neuer wyllyng displease ye great lord answered right sagely wysely wyfe dame good tymes sowhat dissymnle mannes displeasure true cosyn bretayne great lorde hath seignorie puissaunce ynough agaynst sir olyuer clysson hadde taken parte agaynst clysson shulde greatly haue weaked realme fraunce sir olyuer clyssone saythe sustayneth hate hath duke bretaygne sustayne vp realme fraunce wherin haue great parte also comon renome frauce also yet haue sene artycle wherin shulde take parte cosyn bretaygne agaynst sir olyuer clysson therfore hath behoued dissymule elles coude nat haue good wyll ye kyng realme wherto boude faithe seruyce ye duke bretaygne nowe kyng nat good case ye knowe well agaynst lorde clisson shalbe suche haue gyuen cousayle agaynst v brother berrey kyng shulde procede iourney bretaygne rodde gadered wherwith shall shortely beaten corrected ye shall breuely yet wyll take lytell paciece dame dame season last payde fortune somtyme tourneth herte troubled somtyme agayne reioyceth none ioyfull somtyme sorie troubled clysson le ryuer montague le mercyer le vyllayns haue done yuell shalbe shewed breuely suche lyke wordes duke burgoyne duchesse wyfe sported toguyder daye happed ye duke burgoyne duke berrey comuned secretely togyder sayde tyme began distroye haue dishonored nephue kynge haue ledde hym wylles first let v begyn costable ye grettest hath lese daye made testament seuyntene hudred thousade frankes deuyll hath gadered toguyder richesse yet mary age doughter iohan bretayne delyuered prison englad payde rausome two hudred thousande frankes englande let v se poyntes lay reason nephue duke orleaunce beareth hym greatlye dyuers barones fraunce howe stycke therto shall finde mater ynough lawe parlyament trewe quod duke burgoyne first tyme cometh speke thynke wyll morowe night shall receyue hym shall well knowe loue hym nat come good brother berrey lykewise shall done quod departed tyme fortuned lorde clysson knewe nothynge good grace sayde duke certayne knightes squiers suche hadde sayd voyage kyng came constable sente chaunceller treasourers hym pursue money wage whervpon mornyng came ye house arthois parys shewe state ye busynesse duke burgoyne none bycause hadde hole gouernaunce realme fraunce whane came thyder entred court porter lette hym lyghted mounted steares hall alone lye acompanyed one squyer hall foude ii squyers duke demaunded might speke wt duke nat sir nat tell tary shall go knowe pleasure squiers entred duke chambre foude hym good leysar talkyng heraude come fro great feest ben holden almaigne squiers sayd sir constable hall saythe come speke pleasure goddesname quod duke lette hym come good leysar wyll say one squiers went hall said constable sir coe lorde wyll haue coe costable entred whan duke sawe hym chaunged colour repented caused hym come chambre yet gret desyre speke hym constable dyde hatte made reuerence duke sayde sir come knowe state gouernaunce realme howe euery thynge shalbe ordred reason myne offyce dayly called vpon nowe lorde berrey haue rule therfore may please shewe shall duke lightly aunswered sayde clysson clysson ye haue nothyng busye gouernynge realme ye haue medled therwith long yuell tyme howe deuyll haue ye gadered suche rychesse ye made testament late kynge brother berrey haue nat moche go youre waye departe presence lette se nat shame shulde putte better eye therwith duke deted lefte lorde clysson alone issued chambre hanged downe heed passed hall courte toke horse company retourned priuely lodgyng without spekyng worde phowe sir olyuer clysson constable frauce departed parys answere duke burgoyne made hym wente mount le heury fro then bretayne cap cxc whan lorde clysson retourned lodgynge many ymaginacyons remembre best hym parceyued wel mater went yuell hym wyste nat whome make complaynt declare busynesse duke orlyaunce crayell thoughe hadde parys yet laye nat power defende hym feared lest duke burgoyne wolde haue caused hym arested spoyle house wherfore durst nat abyde aduenture shortely made hym redy shewed certayne seruauntes wolde agaynst nyght wente lodgyng priuely backesyde thre persones hym issued parys gate saynt anchony passed ryuer seyne bridge charenton roode longe came castell owne seuyn leages fro parys called mount le heury taryed tyll heroe tidynges daye duke burgoyne spoken constable duke berrey mette toguyder assembled palays commune toguyder certayne matter touchynge realme duke burgoyne shewed brother sayde sir olyuer clysson duke berrey answered sayd ye haue done well must haue begynnynge entre vpon theym surely clysson le ryuer mercier mo tague haue robbed realme fraunce tyme come shall leaue yea lese lyues maye beleued proper daye constable departed montague likewise departed secretely gate saynt anthony toke waye trois champayne burgoyne sayd wolde nat rest tyll came auygnon thyder sent chiefe rychesse lefte certayne wyfe kepe estate curtesly sawe well sithe kyng lost wytte mater shulde go yuell hym sawe howe duke burgoyne berrey wolde nat speke hym sir iohan mercier lykewise wolde fayne haue ben gone myght suche watche layde hym coude nat go lodgynge without knowledge suche goodes hadde saued stode hym right good stede afterwarde moche coude founde departed bytwene duke burgoyn berrey comytted prisone castell loure lykewyse comaunded begue vyllayns erle rebydewe spayne men sente house montague nat founde man knewe yt become lykecase constable house haue hym prison coude nat founde man kepar knewe nothynge become within two dayes knowen castell mount le heury whan duke loued hym nat knewe ordayned barroys barres sir iohn castell morant lorde coucy sir wyllyam tremoyle thre hundred speares go thyder comaunded besiege towne castell nat departe then tyll brought sir olyuer clysson outher quicke deed knyghtes dyde comaunded durste none otherwyse two duke admynistracion realme departed fro parys thre hundred speares nat one tyme fyue partes entent lesse knowen god ayded well constable good frendes company suche warnynge toke domage company departed rode couert wayes woodes lefte closed townes laste came surely bretaygne entred castell owne called castell ioselyn taryed newes barrois barres knightes company lette nat enterprice charged came mount le heury entred towne besieged castell taryed nyght wenynge constable hadde ben within gone ye haue herde nexte mornynge thought assaute castell seruautes within castell sente knowe wolde haue demaunded sayde wolde haue sir olyuer clysson therfore come answered said departed then foure dayes passed offred open gate sertche hym knightes went castell company armed scare enbusshement within castell sertched highe lowe founde trouthe nat thane departed retourned parys shewed howe sped whan duke burgoyne berrey knewe sir olyuer clysson scaped sore displeased duke orlyaunce burbone ryght ioyfull duke burgoyne sayde semeth well douteth hym selfe seynge fledde awaye yet yt quytte shall cause hym come agayne shortely le shall lese hath sette handes haue laye charge dyuers artycles vnresonable whiche requyre iudgement punisyon suche great nat corrected mater shall nat equally proporcioned suche small personage shall grudge saye haue wrong punysshed great scape therfore iustyce ought equall spare nother gret small wherby ensample shulde growe thus duke burgoyn deuysed sir olyuer clysson bretaygne castell called ioselyn whiche forteresse well prouyded thynges necessary whan barrois barres retourned parys shewed sir olyuer clysson departed fro mount le heury gone castell ioselyn bretayne tha comaunded go amyence take lorde de la ryuer next day rode companye amyence fayre forteresse besyde charter whiche lorde de la ryuer helde right wyfe lady man greatly amended castell welbeloued men countrey loued alwayes nothyng trouth duke comissyoners came thyder dyde charge founde lorde de la ryuer wyfe chyldren knight loked nothyng el might haue ben gone lyste knowledge sir iohan mercyer erle ribydewe prisone constable fledde bretaygne counsayled one frendes said hym sir saue selfe enuyous nowe reygne fortune nowe sydes aunswered sayde el pleasure god shulde flye hyde selfe shulde yelde selfe gyltie knowe selfe clere god hath gyuen haue maye take fro whan pleasure wyll god fulfylled haue serued kynge charles nowe sonne well trewly seruyce hath ben well knowen haue greatlye rewarded seyng haue truely serued comaundementes traueyled busynesse realme fra ce dare well abyde iudgement parlyament chambre parys fynde faute dedes wordes lette punysshed thus lorde de la ryuer sayd wyfe cousayle sayd duke comyssioners cae castell laste one shewed hym sayd sir cometh suche men suche great armye nowe saye shall opyn gate nat yea quod elles welcome therwith went mette receyued one another right honorably thus entred castell man barroies barres whan within hall executed commaundement arested lorde de la ryuer obeyed meke lye thus prisoner owne castell man may well thought good lady wyfe sore discofyted whan sawe fortune courne whele agaynst lorde husbande also douted conclusyon thus lorde de la ryuer prisoner owne castell main anone sente gouernaunce bothe temporaltie spirytualtie pope clement auignon nothyng realme fraunce meanes lorde de la ryuer brought parys set prison castell loure many men realme fraunce great pytie hym howe durst nat speke priuely people cared nat moche trouble sir iohan mercyer dyde lorde de la ryuer alway swete curtesse meke pacyent gencyll poore men good meane always myght nat herde sayde daylye paris prisoner shulde lese heedes sclaundre ran vpon howe traytours crowne fraunce pylled realme therby kepte great porte estate made fayre house castelles buyldynges poore knightes squiers suche aduentured bodyes membres dedes armes serued truelye realme fraunce solde layde pledge herytages yet coude nat payde serued nother costable none prisone hy motague fledde enuyous condempned iudged dye reason great daunger also sayd counsaile kyng toke hym iourney bretaygne wherby fell maladye fransey gyuen hym drinkes poyson pleasure howe kynges phisycions coude nat herde beleued reason suche mater layde lorde de la ryuers charge sir iohan mercyer delyuered castell loure handes prouost paris putte castell saynt anthony kepyng vicount achy chateleyne whan knowen tha comon brute ran shulde executed dethe saye trouthe cause trouble suche hated coude fynde conscyence cause ought dye euery daye borne hande sayd theym sir thynke youre soules bodyes loste ye iudged dye beheeded case prisone greate space begue vyllayns ryght valyaunt knyght armes countrey beance prisone also ye cause suche frendes ayded delyuered prison clene pardoned thynges suche lynage sir barroys counsayled hym go castyle fayre herytages reason wyfe countesse ribydewe counsayled dyede soone might departed fraunce went castyle two knightes remayned styll prison daunger losyng lyues mouable vnmouable godes possession parteyninge sir iohan mercyer within parys without realme fraunce myght layde hande taken goodes forfaite gyuen person fayre house bridge aubumen dioces laon whiche cost hym great good gyuen lorde coucy appurtenauce knowe nat wheder lorde coucy desyred nat sir iohan mercier disheryted heyres euer also lorde de la ryuer sore handled trewe mouables taken awaye suche landes bought reseruynge lady man wyfe herytages whiche came father mother also yonge damosell doughter x yere age maryed yonge gentylman called iaques chastellon sonne sir hugh chastellon ben maister crosbowes fraunce heyre father fayre herytages lykely enioye howe agaynst yonge mannes mynde dismaryed maryed agayne another gentylwoman pleasure duke burgoyne lorde de la tremoyle toke quarell ouer lorde de la riuer sonne heyre whiche sonne maryed ye doughter erle dampmartyne erle mo child nat lyke haue whiche doughter heyre duke wolde haue broken maryage haue maryed vnto heyre blode erle dampmartyne lyke valyaunt knight wolde nat sayd long lorde de la ryuers sonne hadde lyfe body doughter shulde haue none husbande sayde wolde putte herytage suche menes handes trusted suche wolde wrogfully haue shulde nat attayne therto whan erles mynde knowen let hym alone maryage stode styll fyrst maryage broken pope clement made dispensacyon wheder wolde nat tyme pope puissaunce fraunce suche gouernours wolde consente churche subiecte reason scisme gouerned fraunce many men specially realme frauce excused greatly lorde de la ryuer wolde nat serue none durst speke thoughe sawe mater neuer clere except onely valyat lady iane boloyne duchesse berrey oftentymes good lady wolde fall knee husbande holdynge vp handes sayeng ah sir ye suffre moche enuyous enforme wrongfullye agaynst valyaunt knight lorde de la ryuer hath clerely wronge none dare speke hym sir wyll ye knowe dye thus shall neuer haue ioye worlde shall alwayes contynue styll sorowe heuynesse trewe valyant knight ah sir ye cosyder lytell fayre seruyce hath done tyme ye paynes traueyle hath hadde bring v togyder maryage saye nat thyng bostyng selfe lytell worthe comparyson whan ye wolde nedes haue ye remembre howe harde erle foiz brought vp swete wordes wyse demeanour lorde de la ryuer nat neuer come company ben rather nowe englade duke lacastre wolde haue sonne erle derby erle foiz enclyned rather waye tha right dere sir ye ought remebre say true wherfore requyre right hubly gentyll knight brought haue domage body membres duke berrey sawe wyfe fayre gentyll loued hert also knewe well sayd true molifyed greatly herte towardes lorde de la ryuer apease wyfe sawe spake good herte sayd vnto dame god helpe wolde cost xx thousade frankes condycion lorde de la ryuer neuer made forfette crowne fraunce malady came kynge loued hym entierly tooke hym wyse sage knyght sythe ye desyre effectuously hym wyll dyspleasure hym shall fare moche better instaunce sake shall moche hym power may extende rather desyre realme spoken hym surely se well almes helpe hym beleue hath aduocate thus lady well pleased lordes wordes surely nat ben deed sake duke berrey dyssymuled mater happy syr iohan mercyer lorde de la ryuer accused one cause wherfore duke conscyence cause one dye nat howe promesse made yet thought selfe nat well assured lyues longe prison sawe well many enemyes tha reygned prosperyte right angry saued longe coulde amended syr iohan mercyer beynge prisone wepte contynually almost lost sight pytie se lamentacyon whyle two knyghtes thus prisone yere man knewe ende shulde come duke counsayle dyd coulde haue taken sir olyuer clysson haue put hym fro honoure offyce rather haue hym resydewe kepte hym selfe handes wherin dyd wysely ben taken ordeyned shulde haue iudgement deth without remedy enuy haue pleased therby aduersary duke bretaygne neuer dyd good realme frauce whan lordes sawe yt scaped handes toke aduyse dyd ye shall somoned hym apere parlyamet chamber parys answere article accused payne lese honour banysshed realme fraunce certayne comyssioners sent bretaygne somon hym apere sente rode bretaygne demauded came syr olyuer clysson sayd howe sente kynge speke constable wherfore desyred knowe men suche townes garysons helde constable determyned aunswere make sayd syrs ye welcome ye wyll speke coustable ye muste go suche place thynke ye shall fynde hym without faute comyssyoners sente fro towne towne coude nat fynde longe sought wery retourned parys declared sene founde suche accused hym gladde dalte sayd falsnesse playnely shewed therby acordyng reason said shulde haue deserued course parlyament proceded somonynges thentent suche loued hym shulde nat say wronge enuy hatred whan xv monynges accompilsshed coulde tydynges hym aparaunce openly called parlyament chambre dore steyres courte seremonyes therto belongynge answere made hym processe made agaynst hym cruelly parlyament openly banysshed realme fraunce false traytour crowne fraunce iudged pay hudred thousande marke syluer extorcyons doone traftely tyme paste occupyed offyce constablery fraunce therfore lese euer without recouery sayd offyce gyueng sentence duke orleaunet desyred present wolde nat excused hymselfe duke berrey burgoyn many great lordes realme fraunce thus man may se wa kes fortune howe ferme stable seynge howe good valyaunt knyght dayes moche traueyled realme fraunce put moche shame dysgrated fro honoure goodes howe happy appered nat somonynge surrly shamfully loste lyfe duke orlyance durst nat speke hym shulde haue doone hym good nat douted duke bretaygne syr peter craon right ioyfull tydinges howe sory nat prisoner parys well sir iohan mercier lord de la ryuer shamfull banysshing great brute ranne therof realme fraunce el compleyned secretly sayd wronge said worthy hanged well deserued moreouer sayd howe dyuell coulde assemble togyder moche rychess myllyon halfe florayns coulde neuer gette ryghtwyse meanes rather pollynge robbyng retaynyng hymselfe wage poore knyghtes squyers realme fraunce deserued may well appere chaunceryor treasory euery thyng written regestred voyage kynge made flaunders reysed great profyte owne vse also voyage almayne maner tayles subsydyes reysed realme paye men warre passed handes payed pleased hym rest kept hymselfe none durste speke agaynst maner syr olyuer clysson accused many mennes mouthes sayde olde prourebe hath mysfortune euery man offereth hym wronge frenche kynge duke berrey duke burgoyne nat ben duke bretaygne ben able haue subdued syr olyuer clysson seynge duke countrey suffred hym season se howe mater shulde procede also sawe well syr olyuer clysson set heyght fortune whele agayne sawe howe cast downe lyke lese offyce thus duke bretayne syr peter craon set vpon fete workes fortune whiche neuer parmanent nowe vp nowe downe constable syr olyuer clysson lorde de la ryuer syr iohan mercyer principally acused chefe cousers kinges malady suche loued nat sayd howe poysoned kynge howe euery man maye consydre reason nat persones shulde lese moste kynges malady wherfore thought sought moste helthe coulde nat beleued two knyghtes remayned styll prison dau ger openly haue loste heedes lykelyhode doone kynge nat recouered helth meane duchesse berrey made instante labour lorde de la ryuer lorde clysson styll bretayne made sore warre agaynst duke duke agaynst hym whiche warre cost many mannes lyfe ye shall hystory trewe sycknesse kyng tooke voyage towardes bretayne greatly abated ioye realme fraunce good cause whan heed sicke body canne haue ioye man durste openly speke therof kepte priuy moche myght couertly kept fro quene tyll delyuered churched knewe nothynge therof whiche tyme doughter physycion mayster guyllyam chefe charge healynge kynge styll aboute hym ryght dyligent well acquyted hymselfe wherby gate bothe honour profyte lytell lytell brought kynge good estate toke away seuer heate made hym haue taste appetyte eate drinke slepe rest knowledge euery thynge howe feble lytell lytell made kynge ryde huntynge hawkynge whanne tydynges knowen fraunce howe kynge well mended memory agayne euery man ioyfull thanked god kyng thus beyng crayell desyred se quene wyfe dolphyn sonne quene came thyder chylde brought thyder kynge made good chere lytell lytell helpe god kynge recouered helthe whan mayster guyllyam sawe kynge good case ryght ioyfull reasone done fayre cure delyuered hym duke orlyance berrey burgoyne burbone sayd lordes thanked god kyng nowe good state helth delyuer hym beware lette man dysplease hym yet spyrytes nat fully ferme stable lytell lytell shall waxe stronge reasonable dysporte rest myrthe shall moste profytable hym trouble hym lytell may counsayles hath sharpely handeled hote malady consydred retaygne mayster guylliam gyue hym shulde contente whiche ende physicions requyre haue gyftes rewardes desyred abyde styll aboute kynge excused himselfe sayd howe olde impotent man coulde nat endure maner courte wherfore desyred returne owne countrey whan counsayle sawe wolde none otherwyse gaue leaue departing gaue thousande crownes retayned hym wage four horse whan euer wolde resorte courte howe beleue neuer came whan retourned cytie laon contynued dyed ryche man lefte behynde hym xxx thousande frankes dayes one greatest nygardes euer pleasure get good spende nothynge howse neuer spente past two souse parys day wolde eate drinke mennes howses myght get rodde lyghtly physicyons beaten phowe truse whiche acorded bytwene englande frauce thre yeres renewed cap cxci ye haue herde bokes hygh excellent hystory request ryght hygh myghty prynce dere lorde mayster guy chastellone erle blois lorde auesnes chymay beaumont streumehont gode iohan froysart preest chapeleyn said lorde tyme treasourer chanon chymay lysle flaunders haue enterprised noble mater treatynge aduentures warres fraunce englande countreys conioyned lyed may apere clerely treaty therof made vnto date presente day whiche excellent mater longe lyue helpe god shall cotynue folowe labour pleaseth noble knyght squyer louynge feates armes perceyuer therby experte made parfyte laborynge noble mater delyte take pleasure pit hath ben conteyned hystory howe truce made balyngham endure thre yere bytwene englande fraunce purpose erle saynt poll lorde castell morant syr taupyn cauteuell ambassadours frauce ben englande duke lancastre duke yorke vnderstande kinges pleasure opynion comons englande comunycacyon parlyamente amyence poynte agrement peace vpon certayne artycles specifyed reseruynge agrement therto comons englande thus ambassadours retourned fraunce answered howe feest saynt mychell nexte ensuynge shulde parlyament westmynster thre estate englande whiche tyme mater shulde declared full aunswere made whan tydynges come englande frenche kynges sycknesse matter greatly hyndred howe kynge rycharde englande duke lancastre great affection haue peace might haue entente peace ben made bytwene englande fraunce co mynalte englande desyred warre sayenge howe warre fraunce conuenyent peace opynyon one kynges vncles th ma duke glocestre erle perces constable englande welbeloued realme enclyned rather warre peace opynyon yonge gentylmen realme suche desyred feates armes brother duke lancastre bycause eldest puissaunce englande thought said warre bytwene englande fraunce endured longe ynoughe peace mete warre cristende sore febled great turke lamorabaquyn greate puyssaunce fronters hugery wherfore sayd shulde honorable yonge lusty knyghtes squyers take waye thyder exercyse dedes armes lette v wysely consydre duke lancaster wordes spake good entent greatly traueyled warres fraunce conquered lytell sore traueyled bodye brent dystroyed playne countreys waye retourne sone recouered agayn sawe warre drewe neuer n ne nde rather encreased also sawe fortune shuld turne agaynst ye englyssh party great domage therof shulde ensue parceyued well kyng nephue enclyned moche rather peace warre iohan froysart auctoure hystory canne nat well saye whether duke opinyon good nat shewed bycause duke lancastre sawe two doughters maryed higher degree hymselfe realme englande one quene spaygne quene portugale caused gretly enclyne peace knew well kynge spaygnes sonne maryed doughter yonge daunger owne subgiettes knewe well shulde peasably enioye herytage spaygne conuenyente englysshe men shulde kepe peace fraunce peace shulde broken incydent frenche men myght shortly reuenged realme spayne open entree well aragon chathalone bierne byskay lady yolant bare quene aragone good frenche gouerned aragon chathalone bierne byskay vycount chatellon heyre therle foiz sworne promysed frenche quene wherby frenche men hadde many fayre entree spaygne without daunger kynge nauer wolde nat wyllyngly dysplease frenche kynge cosyn germayne syr peter nauerre brother frenche kynge alwayes apeased frenche kynges ire dyspleasure whan brother kynge nauer true frenche man neuer founde contrary imagynacions duke lancastre hym selfe shewed mynde sonne erle derby though yonge yet great wysdome lykely come great honour whiche erle thre sonne iohan humfrey thomas two doughters lady wyfe doughter heyre erle constable englande erle herforde northampton whiche lady helde great herytage conclusyon parlyament holden westmynster thre estate realme trewce taken see lande bytwene fraunce englande frendes alyes endure fro feest saynt mychell feest saynt iohan baptyst nexte suche comyssioners frenche kynge sent parlyament dyspatched charter truce sent sealed whiche treuce well vpholden partyes frenche kynge sore febled reason syckenesse physicyon mayster guyllyam harselay deed whan departed fro crayell fro kynge ordeyned many receytes kynge vse wherby wynter season recouered helth wherof louers frendes reioysed hole comynalte frauce well loued quene came parys helde householde parte saynt powle somtyme loure longe wynter nyghtes passed season daunsynge carollynge reuels dysportes quene acompaned duchesse berrey duchesse orlyance ladyes season vycount chastellon come parys newly entred herytage erledome foize bierne ryght heyre releued sayde erledom foiz dyd homage kyng nat bierne coutrey helde themselfe noble condycion helde seruyce man lyuynge howe prince wale said erle foiz last dyed ought releue haue resorte duchy acquitayne alwayes sayd erle denyed defended thought chalenge prince wale made thervnto settynge mouyng iohan erle armynake hath ben shewed history wherfore nowe wyll ouer passe whan vicount chastellon called fro henseforthe erle foiz paris frenche kyng company hym cosyn syr yuan foize bastarde sonne laste erle foize goodly knyght erle foiz dyed wolde haue made hym heyre nother bastarde sonnes called gracian dwelte kyng nauer knyghtes bierne wolde neuer consent therto therfore mater rested dyd erle dyed sodaynly ye haue herde whan frenche kynge sawe yonge knyght syr yuan foiz lyked hym marueylous well also kynge moche one age reason fauour kynge bare yonge knyght erle foiz shorter spede delyuered businesse departed owne countrey syr yuan abode styll kynge retayned one knyghtes chambre xii horse thynges therto belongynge pof aduenture daunce made parys lykenesse wodehowses wherin frenche kynge parell dethe cap cxcii fortuned sone retaynmge foresayd knyght maryage made kynges house bytwen yonge knyght vermandoys one quenes gentylwomen bycause bothe kynges house kinges vncles lordes ladyes damoselles made great tryumphe duke orlyaunce berrey burgoyne wyues daunsynge makynge great ioye kynge made great supper lordes ladyes quene kepte estate desirynge euery man mery squyer normandy called hogreymen gensay aduysed make pastyme daye maryage whiche tuesday candelmas prouyded mummery agaynst nyght deuysed syxe cote made lynen clothe couered pytche theron flare lyke heare redy chambre kynge put one therle iouy yonge lusty knyght another syr charles poicters thyrde sonne erle valentenoys syr yuan foiz another sonne lord nanthorillet fyfte squyer hym selfe syxte whan thus arayed sayd cote sowed fast semed lyke wylde wode house full beare fro toppe heed sowle ye foote deuyse pleased well frenche kynge well content squyer aparelled cote secretly chamre man knewe therof holpe whan syr yuan foiz well aduysed core sayd kynge syr comaunde straytely man aproche nere v torch fyre fyre fasten cote shall brent without remedy king aunswered sayd yuan ye speke well wysely shall doone ye haue deuysed incontynent sent vssher chambre comaundyng go chambre ladyes daused comaunde varlettes holdinge torch stande vp walles none aproche nere wovehouses shulde come thyder daunce vssher dyd kynges comaundement whiche fulfylled sone duke orlyance entred hall acompanyed four knyghtes syxe torch knewe nothynge kynges comaundement torch mummery comynge thyder thought holde daunsynge began hym selfe daunce therwith kynge fyue came dysguysed flaxe man knewe fyue fastened one another kynge lose went led deuyse whan entred hall euery man teke great hede forgate torch kynge departed fro company went ladyes sporte youth requyred passed quene came duchesse berrey toke helde hym arme knowe kyng wolde nat shewe name duches sayd ye shall nat escape tyll knowe name meane season great myschyefe fell reason duke orlyance howe ignoraunce agaynst wyll consydred mischefe ell wolde nat haue done dyd good worlde desyrous knowe personage fyue daunced put one torch seruautes helde nere heate fyre entred flaxe wherin fyre take remedy sodaynly bright flame eche set fyre pytche fastened lynen clothe shyrtes drye fyne ioynynge flesshe began brenne cry helpe none durste come nere theym dyd brente handes reason heate pytche one called nanthorillet aduysed hym howe botry therby fled thyder cast himselfe vessell full water wherin rynsed pottes whiche saued hym el ben deed yet sore hurt fyre whan quene herde crye made douted kynge knewe well shulde one syxe wherwith fell sowne knightes ladyes came comforted pyteous noyse hall duchesse berrey delyuered kynge fro parell dyd caste ouer trayne gowne couered fro fyre kynge wolde haue gone fro whyder wyll ye go quod ye se well howe company brennes ye kyng quod haste quod gette apparell quene maye se great feare therwith kynge departed hall haste chaunged apparell came quene duchesse berrey somwhat comforted shewed howe shulde se kynge shortely therwith kynge came quene soone sawe hym ioy enbrased hym fell sowne borne chambre kynge wente bastarde foiz fyre cryed euer loude voyce saue kynge saue kynge thus kynge saued happy hym went fro company el ben deed without remedy great myscheife fell thus mydnyght hall saynt powle parys two brente dethe place two bastarde foiz erle iouy borne lodgynges dyed within two dayes gret mysery payne thus feest maryage brake vp beuynesse howe remedy faulte onely duke orlyaunce yet thought none yuell whanne put downe torche duke sayde syrs lette euery man knowe man blame cause onely selfe ame sory therof thought moche shulde nat haue happened duke orlyaunce went kynge excuse hym kyng toke excuse case fell yere oure lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore twelue tuesday feest candelmas whiche fortune great brute spredde abrode realme frauce countreys duke burgoyne berrey nat present season hadde taken leaue kyng gone lodginges next daye newes spredde abrode cytie euery manne merueyle therof sayd howe god sente token ensample wysedome kynge regarde withdrawe hym selfe fro suche yonge ydell wantonnesse whiche vsed ouermoche beynge kyng comons cytie parys murmured sayd beholde great myshappe myschiefe lykely haue fallen kynge myght well haue brent shulde haue fallen kynges vncles brother myght haue ben sure none shulde haue scaped dethe yea knyghtes myght haue founde parys soone duke berrey burgoyne herde aduenture abasshed marueyled greatly lepte horse rode kyng co forted counsayled hym whiche necessary sore troubled paryll styll ymaginacion shewed vncles howe aunt berrey saued hym sayde sorie dethe erle iouye sir yuan foiz sir charles poicters vncles reconforted hym sayde sir loste canne nat recouered ye muste forgette dethe thanke god fayre aduenture fallen owne persone realme fraunce incydent myght haue ben great daunger lesynge ye maye thynke well people parys wyll neuer styll god knoweth mysfortune fallen wolde haue slayne v theriore sir aparell estate royall lepe horse ryde lady pylgrimage shall accompany shewe youre selfe people desyre soore se kynge sayde wolde kynges vncles toke aparte duke orlyauce curtesse maner somwhat blamed hym yonge dede done aunswered sayde howe thought haue done none yuell anone ye kynge company lepte horse rode throughe cytie apease people came lady churche herde masse offred thanne retourned agayne house saynt poule lytell lytell mater forgotten obsequyes done deed bodyes ah erle gascoyne foiz fortuned thy lyfe dayes thou shuldest haue great displeasure harde haue peased thou louedest hym entierly lordes ladyes realme frauce elswhere herde chaunce great marueyle therof phowe pope bonyface cardynals rome sent frere wyse clerke frenche kyng cap cxciii pope bonyface beyng rome cardinali e reioysed said aduenture bycause frenche kyng agaynst pope sayde token sente fro god realme fraunce bycause supported pope auygnon proude presumptuous neuer done good lyfe disceyued worlde pope rhome cardynalles counsayle concluded sende frenche kyng secretely man prudence frere mynor great clerke wisely preche counsayle kyng folowe ye waye reason said kyng toke wrog waye seynge named chiefe kyng christendome holy churche ought illumyned ayded wherfore charged frere go frauce delyuered hym instruction effecte shulde saye done leysar frere farre go also knewe nat whether shulde haue audyence whanne cam thyder nat pnowe lette hym go iourney shall somwhat speke busynesse fraunce natwithstandyng adue tures duke berrey burgoyne counsayls lefte nat pursue haue distroyed ye lorde de la ryuer sir iohan le mercier prisone castell saynt anthony kepyng vycount archy said shulde put dethe delyuered prouost chattelet ordayned sone shulde come handes shulde beheded openly traytours agaynst ye crowne fraunce god nat prouyded speciall instaunce request duchesse berrey nat ben dethe hasted specially prayed lorde de la riuer meanes brought fraunce maryage made bytwene duke berrey sayde tyme duke husbande wepyng sir layd lordes de la ryuer false selaundre done enuy sir remembre payne traueyle toke bring v toguyder ye rewarde hym smally cosent dethe thoughe landes goodes taken fro hym yet lette hym haue lyfe dye opyn shame shall neuer haue ioye herte sir saye nat fayned corage say hole hert wherfore sir requyre prouyde delyueraunce whan duke herde wyfe speke effectuously also knewe well sayde trouthe pytie swaged displeasure lorde de la ryuer sone delyuered sir iohan mercier nat sought wayes myght haue putte hym dethe whiche coude nat without bothe shulde haue dyed sir iohan mercyer hadde wept moche prison sight therby sore febled folowed duchesse burgoyns counsayle ben putte execucyon longe shamefully without fauour hared bycause sir olyuer clysson counsayled kynge go bretaygne warre agaynst cosyn duke also sayde clysson le ryuer mercyer causers kynges maladye howe kyng well recouered good estate duke berrey burgoyne kepte styll gouernauce realme fraunce great profyte therby apoynted suche persones pleased kyng dayes kynge bare name kynge touchyng busynesse parteynynge crowne fraunce lytell obeyed duke wolde se knowe howe euery thynge paste duchesse burgoyne nexte persone quene duchesse orlyaunce nothynge pleased wolde haue hadde honoure preemynence sayde suche secrete duchesse burgoyne ought condycion go nat nyghe crowne lorde husbande brother kynge myght fall shulde kynge quene wotte nat shulde take honour put behynde thus enuy amonge ladyes pnowe lette v leaue speakynge retourne sir olyuer clysson ye haue herde howe sommoned fyftene dayes apere parlyament chambre certayne knyghtes sente bretaygne seke sir philyppe sauoises wente bretaygne sertched hym place founde hym nat hydde hym selfe couertly coulde neuer speke hym hadde wolde haue rested hym retourne fraunce made relacyon voyage iudged lordes parlyament sir olyuer clysson constable fraunce hadde forfayted landes lyfe goodes iuged hym banysshed euer realme fraunce lese offyces herytages within realme bicause nat sente martell whiche token offyce constablery moned therfore offyce vacant voyde duke counsayls suche agaynst sir olyuer clysson thought necessary prouyde soe person occupy said offyce whiche noble gret renome might nat long without gouernour incidentes myght happe fall aduysed lorde coucy mete man layde hym excused selfe sayd wyse wolde medyll therwith wolde rather forsake realme fraunce whan sawe wolde nat medyll therwith duke toke aduyse phowe maryage treated lorde philyp arthoys erle ewe lady mary berrey wydowe doughter duke berey howe admytted constable fraunce cap cxciiii seasone treatie maryage bytwene lorde philyppe arthoys yong wydowe lady berrey somtyme called coutesse dunoys wyfe loyes bloys frenche kynge wolde gladly haue maryage auaunsed duke berrey natre wyllynge therto thought erldome ewe small thyng regarde fyrste husbande wherfore thought mary highlyer dede lady beautifull endued vertues yt shulde aperteyne noble lady howe finally duke berrey lothe displease kynge yet many offer made hym doughter yonge duke loreyne erle armynake sonne heyre erle foiz kynge brake maryages sayd vncle fayre vncle berrey wyll nat ye shall putte cosyn youre doughter come floure delyce farre countreys shall prouyde mariage mete wolde gladly haue nere v right mete aunt wyfe moche one age whan duke sawe kynges entente rayned hym selfe makynge promyse persone doughter also sawe well kynge enclyned fauour cosyn lorde philyppe arthois yonge lusty knyght highe corage hadde endured many traueyls armes beyond see place atchyued many voyage great laude honour duke berrey burgoyne agreed bytwene kynge wolde gyue cosyn philyppe arthois offyce constablery fraunce whiche reputed voyde reason forfayture sir olyuer clysson agree kynges pleasure sayd maryage duke berrey thought constable frauce shulde haue suffycient mentayne estate two duke determyned speke kynge dyde said hym sir counsayle generally agreed lorde philyp arthoys preferred offyce constableshyp fraunce whiche nowe voyde iugement lyament olyuer clysson hath forfayted ye offyce whiche maye nat long vacant shulde preiudyce realme sir bothe also bounde auauce promote cosyn arthoys nere blode lynage v sir seing office voyde nat tell ye shulde better enploy hym shall right well exercise welbeloued knyghtes squiers man without enuy couytousnesse wordes pleased well kyng answered said vncle voyde rather another kyng vncles sued styll lorde philyppe arthoys duke berrey hated sir olyuer clisson bycause consented distroye betysache seruaunte duke burgoyne hated hym bycause made warre agaynst duke bretaygne yet duchesse hated hym worse finally kyng assented duke berrey wolde agre maryage bytwene doughter said lorde philyppe arthoys yet satisfye kyng duke orlyau ce bare sir olyuer clysson offyce sente sir guyllyam bourdes sir guyllyam martell bothe knyghtes kynges chambre sir philyppe sauoises knyght duke berreys bretaygne speke sir olyuer clysson knyghtes tooke iourney rode anger foud quene hierusalem iohan bretaygne receyued right honorably honour frenche kynge taryed two dayes demaunded newes sir olyuer clysson sayeng curtesse letter message fro fre che kyng hym fro none persone aunswered man coude tell surely bretayne one fortress said flyttyng fro one place another harde fynde hym knightes departed toke leaue ye quene sonne charles prince thatent iohan bretaygne erle po thieu rode rennes duke bretayne duchesse wannes rode nat lightly forthe towne euer douted busshmentes ennemye sir olyuer clysson harde warre made bytwene mercy dethe thoughe duke lorde souerayne countrey yet neyther barone knyght squyer bretaygne wolde arme agaynst sir olyuer clysson dissymuled sayde warre touched nothyng wherfore satte styll duke coude haue none conforte whane frenche knyghtes rennes enquered fynde sir olyuer clysson coude certentie hym thanne cousayled drawe castell ioselyn sir olyuer clyssons men receyued well loue frenche kynge demaunded myght sir olyuer clysson sayeng speke hym fro frenche kynge duke orlyaunce none persones men coude tell nothyng hym el wolde nat tell sayd sir surely wyll harde fynde hym daye one place morowe another please ye maye ryde ouer duchy bretaygne sertche ouer forteresses house none shall closed agaynst whan sawe coulde haue none aunswere departed then rode visyted fortress great small parteynynge lorde olyuer clysson thane came wannes founde duke bretaygne duchesse receyued taryed halfe daye dyscouered nat duke secrete mater came thyder also duke examyned nothynge mater also coulde nat se sir peter craon thus toke leaue duke duchesse retourned parys foude kyng lordes reported kynge duke orlyaunce howe hadde sought place townes parteynynge sir olyuer clysson wyse coulde fynde hym duke burgoyn berrey right gladde newes wolde nat ben otherwise anone proceded maryage bytwene lorde philippe arthois lady mary berrey lorde philyppe constable fraunce vsed offyce profytes aduauntages therto belongyng auncyent ordynau ce yet lorde olyuer clysson nat renounced offyce delyuered vp martell whiche token constable fraunce contynued sayd wolde abyde styll costable done cause lese nouther kynge realme knewe well erle ewe profered haue offyce constable enioye profyttes therof consente kynge howe hadde maryed doughter duke berrey lady mary toke lytell regarde knewe hym selfe true kynge crowne fraunce knewe well done agaynst hym enuy hatered duke burg yne berey hym thus lorde clysson lette mater passe contynued styll warre agaynst ye duke bretayne whiche warre right fierse cruell without mercy pytie lorde clysson rode ofter abrode layde busshmentes duke dyde lordes bretayne satte styll wolde nat medyll duke dyde sende lordes countrey came speke hym knowe entent duke requyred ayde helpe agaynst ennemy sir olyuer clysson lordes bretayne vicout rohan lorde dignan lorde herman lyon dyuers excused sayd knewe cause wolde nat make warre agaynst lorde clysson said wolde right gladlye endenour selfes bringe peace coude whan duke sawe coude haue none conforte parceyued well howe lost lykely lese mo men warre sir olyuer clysson consented sayde lordes shulde go sir olyuer clysson treate peace bringe hym vnder saueconducte wannes speke hym whiche tyme sayd shulde founde tretable agre reason sir olyuer done hym displeasure myght haue amendes accordynge aduyse lordes well agreed thus thre wente lorde olyuer clysson dyde moche spake hym enformed castell io elyn shewed duke entent moreouer bringe peace sawe well warr nat fytting bytwene greatly noyed noble men marchautes comons bretaygne sayd lorde olyuer sir wyll please go ye duke shall bynde v abide castell tyll retourne doute nat ye beynge one presence ye shall fynde resonable peace good accorde shalbe bitwene sir olyuer sayd sir shall profyte deed thynke knowe nat duke bretayne cruell haute saueconducte soeuer saythe sawe presece wolde neuer cease tyll deed thane shulde dye lykewise men wolde soone slee without mercy wherfore best bothe saue lyues rather putte v daunger shall kepe fro hym lette hym kepe hym well fro thane lorde charles dignan sayde fayre cosyn ye may saye please thynke surely thoughe sawe wolde displeasure offre good affection bringe accorde praye ye wyll thus ye lorde clysson sayde sir beleue surely ye meane well ensure vpon assuraunce shall neuer go hym sithe ye medell mater bytwene v shall nat thynke shalbe vnresonable shall tell wyll retourne agayn duke saye wyll nat take pledge hostage lette hym sende sonne heyre maryed doughter frauce shall abyde castell men tyll retourne agayne way thynke surer tha ye shulde abyde ye offre shulde thane entremedell busynesse bytwene ye duke without meane shall neuer come accorde whan lordes bretayne sawe coude haue non answere tooke leaues retourned wane duke shewed hym done wyse duke wolde consente sende sonne castell ioselyn warre contynued styll wherby persone durst ryde abrode marchaundyse layde downe thoroughe whiche people good townes cyties sore hindred poore laborer lette laboringe erthe duchesse burgoyn couertly ayded cosyn duke bretayne wt men armes aswell burgoyne place duke coude get none countrey take parte quarell agaynst sir olyuer clysson alwayes dissymuled mater except suche owne house duke orlyaunce parte loued well lorde olyuer clyison secretely coured hym men sente hym horse sir olyuer glysson roode ofter abrode duke dyde fortuned day encountred two squyers duke one called ber ard yuonet taken brought sir olyuer gladde knewe well one hadde done hym seruyce tyme past nat done hym displeasure sir olyuer said yuonet remembrest thou nat howe castell ermyne thou sheweddest small curtesy thou bernarde haddest pyte dyddest putte thy gowne putte wha stode doublet ye pauement whiche kepte fro colde wyll nowe yelde thy curtesy thy lyfe shalbe saued thou false knaue traitour yuo net thou myghtest haue done otherwyse tha thou dyddest therfore thou shalte repent therwith drewe dagger strake hym herte another tyme ye lorde clisson rode thre hundred speares co pany towarde castell alroy duke duchesse bretayne aboute mydsomer fortune encountred fourtie duke seruauntes hadde tyed horse tree sickels hades cuttyng downe corne makynge truss cary lodgynges lyke forragers whan lorde olyuer came sore afrayde lorde oliuer said sir howe dare ye come feldes steale take awaye poore menes corne ye neuer sowed yet ye cutte theym downe type ye begyn haruest soone leape horse take youre sickels tyme wyll hurt saye duke breraygne alroy wyll come sende men driue away shall fynde tyll sonne goynge downe poore men gladde delyuered feared haue ben slayne retourned castell alroy ye ke shewed hym hadde herde sene duke none men issued ye castell many scrimysshes made bretaygne bytwene duke sir olyuer clysson countre medled nat bytwene pnowe wyll leaue speke duke bretayne sir oliuer clysson warre speke busynesse bytwene englande frace pof forme peace made bitwene frenche kyng kyng englande meanes four duke vncles bothe kynges cap cxcv ye haue herde howe liamet holden cytie amyence howe englysshe lordes departed vpon artycles howe frenche kynge sent englande duke lacastre answere hadde englysshmen harde brought peace laye nat onely kyng duke lancastre yorke great parte laye commens englande archer seruyng men sayd howe rather haue warre peace many yong knightes squiers yt opynion reason warre maynteyned estate howe force fayne obey kyng vncles wolde duke lacastre bycause ii doughters quenes one spaygne portugale also bycause sawe kynge nephue enclyned haue peace sayd warre endured longe ynoughe sayde wolde take payne therin myght honour kyng realme partie duke burgoyne dyde yt myght haue peace consydring howe greatly charged wt busynesse fraunce two nephues frenche kynge duke orlyaunce yonge age discrecion also consydred howe enherytour duchy brabant thought euer flaunders brabant shulde vary agaynst crowne frauce ayde englande tymes done realme fraunce shulde haue ouer moche duke burgoyne wyse farre castyng prince depely regarded busyness duke burgoyne duke lancastre tooke great payne haue parlyament agayn holden balynghm whiche agreed bothe partyes suffycyently prouyded full auctorites conclude full peace counsayle holden balyngham moneth may nexte yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore xvii suche shulde assemble named apoynted firste party kynge rycharde kinge englande apoynted two vncles duke lancastre ye duke gloucestre greatly fauoure comons england yt loued berter haue warre peace shulde archebysshop yorke bysshop london clerkes lawe apoynted lordes shulde come calays dyd aboute myddes aprill anone feest saynte george holden castell wyndesore kynge knyghtes ordre garter frenche party aisygned duke bertey burgoyne
