counsaylours frauce ordeyned shulde come towne boloyn frenche king shewed great affection haue peace bytwene englade hym sayde vncles wolde come nere parlyament myght wher vpon aduysed frenche kinge shulde lye parlyament durynge balyngham somesayd saynt omers sayd thourayne mutterell abuyle thynges consydred aduysed kynge shulde lye abuyle bycause towne stronge well fournysshed euery man shulde well lodged whan determyned drousyon made kynge lodged abbay saynt peter abbay blacke monkes thyder came kynge duke orlyaunce counsayle lorde reynolde corby chauncellour fraunce duke berrey burgoyne suche comyssion boloyne duke lancastre gloucestre calays goodly beholde se ordre parlyament holden balyngham bytwene frenche men englysshmen tentes pauylyons pyght vp refresshe bothe partyes twyse thryse weke comyssioners mette fayre tente ordayned purpose aboute nyne clocke fore noone comuned vpon many artycles whiche tyme iohan froysart auctour booke abuyle desyrous knowe effecte treatie enquyred trouth suche lordes thought shulde knowe certayntie shewed whan entred comunycasion sene eche others auctoryte perceyued full power conclude peace bothe lande see bytwene fraunce englande alyes one firste demaundes yt frenche men desyred haue calays raced downe suche maner shulde neuer habytacion therto duke lacastre gloucestre answered said suche auctorite cause calays beaten downe yt englande shulde holde demayne trewe herytage sayd purposed entre tr atye peace seace demaunde speke therof whan duke berrey burgoyne herde two cosyns englande answere quyckly seased speke mat er sawe well traueyle shulde vayne spake matter englysshe men demaunded haue ytucyon suche landes delyuered kynge rycharde soueraygne lorde kynge edwarde thyrde deputy commyssioners also haue fully payed florayns lefte vnpayed tyme whan warre renewed bytwene england fraunce englysshe clerkes lawyer proued reasonable lawfull lordes chauncelours fraunce argued contrary sayd retourne landes agayne gouernynge kyng englande successours impossyble done sayenge howe suche landes cyties townes castels lordeshyppes homage englysshe men demaunded gyuen awaye whan peace concluded bretygny confermed sealed calays wherby clene put way fro kyng englande whiche peace grauntes made yere lorde god thousande thre hudred threscore one thervpon frenche kyng graunted suche landes great lyberties othe writyng promesse whiche wyse canne broken agayne reuoked wherfore sayd englysshemen purposed haue peace shulde drawe nerer poynt delyberacyon foure duke deuysed frenche men well englysshmen shulde put demaundes writynge delyuered eyther partye might regarded length bothe partes suche vnreasonable rased cancelled good vpholden ordynauce semed party good reasonable ordre taken ye sour duke moche busynesse specyally englysshe men moche payne vnderstande frenche men full subtyle wordes cloked perswacions double vnderstandynge whiche frenche men wolde rouine lyst profyte aduauntage whiche englysshe men vse nat langage speche entent playne also englisshmen enfourmed frenche men nat alwayes vpholden artycles promyses condycyons ratyfied artycles peace yet frenchman wold euer fynde one poynte writynges subtyle cloked worde affermynge englysshe men broken peace nat wherfore whan englysshe men sawe herde frenche men writynges darke cloked worde made examyned suche profoundly lerned lawe founde mysse caused canselled amended entent wolde leaue nothynge trouble englysshmen excuse themselfe wolde say frenche men letnynge suche subtylties youth muste nedes subtyle somtyme suche frowarde wordes bytwene party greatly draue tyme treatie frenche men helde selfe fre thought shulde nat charged suche demaundes make restytucy landes apendances pertaynyng duchy acquytayne arerages hath ben leuyed syth warre renewed ye whiche wolde neuer acorde frenche men offred rendre countre terbe bygore countye piergourt pyergyns countie agen agenoys kaours rouer gue ouercy lymosyn wold wyse delyuer countie ponthyeur coutie guysnes englyssh men hadde handes tyme thus lordes contynued fyftene dayes made conclusyon duke determyned sende worde two kynges gyue knowledge done frenche duke rode abbeuyle shewed kynge mater howe desyred cosins englande write hole treatie kynge englande sayd promysed enfourmed englysshe party duke glocestre harder entreat duke lancastre bycause common englande knewe somwhat entent therfore agreed shulde sent treatye knewe well nothynge shulde passe hym without honour realme thus four duke amyably departed eche fro concluded mete agayne nynth day thus englysshe lordes retourned calays frenche lordes boloyne abuyle tyme abuyle fayre garden closed ryuer somme whereas often tymes frenche kynge passed tyme sayd brother orlyaunce counsayle beynge abbeuyle dyd hym moche good helthe seasone kynge kynge lyon armony newly come thyder grece march owne coutrey durst nat entre turkes conquered except stronge towne conych standynge see syde whiche geno way helde kepte doute turkes turkes gotten porte shulde haue doone moche yuell see cyprian rodes boundes crystendome kyng armony wolde gladly haue hadde peace bytwene englande fraunce trust yonge knightes squyers shulde go grece helpe conquere agayne realme armony whan frenche kynges vncles come abbeuyle kynge gladde made theym good chere demaunded howe spedde shewed hym hole processe vpon poynte departed wherof kynge gladde shewed glad haue peace lyke maner englyssh duke whan came calays wrote kynge englande poyntes artycles treatye shortly agayne good aunswere comaundynge procede peace sayenge warre contynewed longe ynoughe crystendome therby sore domaged thus daye prefyxed duke mette agayne balyngham frenche lordes came kynge armony shewe lordes englande busynesse necessyte well knowen duke gloucestre ben englande whan frenche army ordeyned sluse haue gone englande duke glocestre tyme receyued kynge armony made hym good chere fayre place esser called plasshey balyngham also duke englande made kynge armony good chere glad hym speke aunswered hym gladly wolde ayde hym wherof kynge ryght ioyfull many thynges treated parlyament season cardynall line lay abbeuyle sente thyder legacyon hym called hym selfe pope clemente mater concernyng churche frenche duke assemble balyngham wolde haue certayne artycles comprised treatie concernynge churche susteynynge opynyons pope clemente robert geneue whan englysshe duke harde sayd cosyns fraunce cosyns ye wyll shall fall poynte conclusion speke cardynall haue nothyng hym matter busynes without profyte effecte determyned vpon pope wyll obey wyll spekyng agaynste hym medle thynge v shall departe god hence leaue togytder tyme mo wordes cardynall taried styll abbcuyle lordes proceded treaty duke lancastre well enclyned haue peace frenche kynge yere hadde sore desyred hym good meane entreate peace promysed howbeit brother duke gloucestre hard agree layde forthe frenchemens dysceytes colored wordes vsed alwayes writynges sayenge howe frenche men wolde alwayes wrestell armes dyscouered whiche euer perceyued daye came squyer honour frenche man called robert hermyte ye duke gloucestre one frenche kynges priuy chambre whether sente duke glocestre came owne heed nat tell duke shewed englande plasshey squyer sayd syr loue god nat agaynst treatie peace ye se howe lordes fraunce dyligence bringe aboute ye shall almesse dede warre hath longe endured sythe bothe kynges content haue peace subgiettes ought obey therto duke answered hym sayd roberte nat agaynst wyll nat ye frenche men amonge ye haue many coloured wordes darke obscure vnderstandynge whan ye wyll warre whan ye lyst peace thus haue ye ledde v vnto presente daye kynge soueraygne lorde beleued suche realme boude serue hym peace shulde neuer haue bytwene englande fraunce tyll restytucyon ben made v taken fro v without cause subtylte crafte god worlde knoweth sythe kynge souerayne lorde enclyneth peace reasone agree therfore make peace acordyng desyres bothe kynges sythe assembled let well holden syde shall well kepte partye thus duke shewed roberte hermyte departed fro hym went company lordes contynewed styll treatie wyll make processe come conclusyon foure duke assemble full power auctorite kynges take tre ce make peace dyd suche wyse generall voyce towne abbeuyle peace taken vpon certayne artycles bytwene two kynges alyes consyderates sir iohan froyssart auctour hystory beynge tyme abbe yle coulde nat lerne certaynte artycles comprised peace howe knewe peace taken endure four yeres kepte ferme stable bothe see lande concluded agreed within sayde space four yere shulde delyuered kynge englande euer perpetually kinges englande comyssioners landes sygnories countrey languedo demayne herytage crowne englande doone accomplysshed agreed ordynaunce certayne capitayns men helde holdes fortress realme fraunce shulde aduoyde departe suche made warre make warre vnder shadowe coloure kyng englande englysshe men nacyon euer artycles lordes balyngham bounde writynges sygned sealed copyes therof sent bothe kynges duke lancastre gloucestre sent harauld called marche letter kynge englande shewynge declarynge hole processe ordynaunce concluded treatie vpon forme peace thus haraulde departed letter rode calys passed ouer deuer rode forthe tyll came kynge manoure owne besyde london whan came kynges presence delyuered letter whan kynge redde ryght ioyouse gaue haraulde good tydynges bryngynge great giftes haraulde shewed leysare rode hym realme englande foure duke fraunce englande styll balyngham soiourned fayre tentes pauylyons well dylygently perused examyned artycles treatie wolde passe seale none tyll darke obscure wordes clerely declared made perfyte nowe season happed fall great lette trouble matter wherby nyghe poynte haue broken made voyde reason tell cause entent hystory playne trewe ye haue herde frenche kyng great pleasure lye abbeuyle also nere dayly howe ye treatie wente forwarde balyngham whan four duke poynt ye haue herde conclusyon mater duke lancastre gloucestre sayd howe entensyon kynge rycharde kynge englande counsayle pope bonyface beynge rome whome romayns almayns hungaryons lumbardes venysyans nacyons worlde chrystened helde one pope named hym selfe clement degraded condepned shulde desyre frenche kynge take way whan duke berrey burgoyne vnderstode wordes duke burgoyne entent somewhat please cosyns englande entente treatie peace shulde nat hyndred therby sayd fayre cosyns desyre haue respyte take counsayle vpon mater whiche graunted thervpon toke counsayle aunswered duke burgoyne spake sayd fayre cosyns mater questyon two pope nat couenable moued spoken amonge v marueyle ye put mater comunycacion fyrst begynnyng treatie ye refused se speke legate de la lyne yet abbeuyle wherfore rest v whan cardynalles rome dyd chose pope vrbayne dyscease pope bonyface none party yet called electyon lykewyse saye clement auygnon saye nat agaynst great almes pea theym vny churche myght entende lette v leaue mater lette vnyuersitees clerkes determyne whan busynesse concluded ferme peace ratifyed counsayle cosyn kynge almayne shall entende therto gladly partye lykewyse partie aunswere duke englande well content semed reasonable aunswered sayde fayre cosyns ye haue sayde well content thus mater rested fell nother great lette trouble frenche kynge layne towne abuyle great season bycause great disportes pleasure pastyme foude sodaynly fell agayne maladye fransy lyke maner ben yere fyrst perceyued syr willyam martell knyght normandy alwayes nere kynges persone priuy chambre seasone duke berrey burgoyne boloyne balyngham vpon thende parlyament manerall concluded seasone soone duke orlyauce brother kynge knewe chaunce kynges sycknesse sene hym sente secrete squyer named bonyface vncles boloyne aduertisynge secretly kynges dysease whanne duke knewe ryght sorye departed redy taken leaues cosyns englande also departed calays taryed tydynges fro kyng nauerte fro duke bretaygne hadde moued treatie castell chyerbourge standynge seesyde vpon close constantyne normandy whiche kynge englande gawge kepynge enfourmed threscore thousande noble englande frenche kynge shulde paye sayd somme castell retourne kynge nauerre also stronge castell brest englysshe men helde shulde retourne duke bretaygne duke berrey burgoyne abode nat conclusyon matter came abbeuyle founde kynge ryght yuell estate helthe sory kynges sycknesse kepte secrete longe myght nat longe suche aduentures soone spredde abrode thus lordes abbeuyle departed one another euery man home owne howse determyned kynge shulde caryed horse lytter castell crayll vpon oyse thyder conueyed nyght tyme daye tyme rested heate sonne duke berrey duke orlyaunce rode crayell kynge duke burgoyne rode arthoys flaunders vysitynge countreys founde duchesse wyfe castell hedyn mo wordes spoken lorde de la ryuer syr iohan mercyer forgoten man spake greuaunce delyueraunce seconde malady charles frenche kynge fallen dyd put away greatly speakynge people wyse sage men fraunce feared greatly chaunce sawe kynge lykely fall malady reason great excesse vsed tymes paste feblenesse heed mayster willm harsley newly deed suche nere ye kyng coude nat tell haue good sure phisicyon wayt vpon ye kyng howbeit dyd ye best coude deuise pof dethe pope clement auygnon lectyon pope benedic cap cxcvi tyme moneth septembre passed worlde auygnon roberte geneue named pope clement came hym alwayes said whan man spake peace vny n church wolde say alwayes howe wolde dye pope dyd maner ye haue herde wrongfully ryghtfully wyll nat determyne cardynalles sore abasshed studyed whome myght chose pope tyme frenche kynge retourned agayne helth wherof suche loued great ioye specyally good quene gyuen moche almesse done many pylgrymages kynge caused generall processyons made parys enfourmed ye cardynals auygnon dyd electe chose pope cardynall de la line speke truely cardynall holy manne good lyfe electyon made condycionally frenche kynge counsayle content therwith el nat nowe regarde considre great subiectyon churche churche shulde free submytted vnder suche shulde haue ben ordred theym thus cardynall de la lyne chosen pope named benedic gaue generall grace clerkes wolde come auignon cousayle bretherne cardynalles wrote creacyon papalyte frenche kynge enfourmed kynge toke lytell regarde therto nat determyned whether shulde take hym pope nat ther vpon kynge sent greatest clerkes vnyuersyte paris haue aduyse counsayle mayster iohan gyg neourte mayster pyer placyous prudence lernyng greatest clerkes parys sayde kynge name hole vnyuersyte howe cysme churche corrupted crysten fayth howe myght nat long endure estate without crystendome shulde repent rynne great daunger specially prelate preestes churche vnyuersyte determyned sende rolles auygnon clerkes haue grace pope benedyc frenche kynge sawe well opynyons reasonable wolde haue none clerkes enrolled seke pope grace tyll mater better determyned thus mater abode styll estate howe duke berrey exalted greatly pope benedic sent roll wherby moche people purueyed grace benedic duke burgoyne duchesse dyssymuled mater kinge dyd duke orlyaunce many great lordes fraunce fauoure helde pope benedyc denyed man grace entent courte auygnon shulde full haue reputacyon duke bretaygne folowed frenche kynges opinyon tyme abused enformacyon cosyn erle flaunders herte wolde neuer enclyne beleue pope clemente though clerkes bretaygne beleued helde hym pope whan promocyon voyde fraunce kynge promoted clerkes without gyuynge knowledge therof pope benedic wherwith cardynalles auygnon sore abasshed douted leste frenche kynge wolde restrayne suche rente profytes wonte haue benefytes gyuen realme fraunce determyned sende legate fraunce speke kynge counsayle knowe howe wolde ordre hym agaynst churche shewe hym howe chosen pope vnder condycyon pleased abyde styll pope el put hym papalyte cardynals entre agayne conclaue chose one kynges pleasure tyme come paris kynge freer mynour meke man sente fraunce pope bonyface rome frenche kynge herde gladly freers prechynge came fraunce legate fro auygnon great subtyle clerke well langaged hole vnyuersyte counsayled kynge sayde howe well done eyther bonyface el benedyc put th papalyte cardynalles putte cardynalyties stede chosyn good clerkes wyfemen good conscyence well almayne fraunce nacyons sette toguyder good delyberacyon counsayle without fauour yuell wyll sette churche therby one poynt one pope sayde sawe well none waye bringe good conclusyon bycause pride enuy reygned worlde prince lordes eche helde owne partie preposycion vnyuersite hadde made kynge pleased right well kynge duke orlyaunce surgoyne kyng sayd wolde write sende messangers kynge almaygne bo sme hungry kyng englande thought hym selfe sure ynough kynges castyle nauer aragon cicyle naples scotlade wolde obey suche pope realme obeyed vnto vpon frenche kyng sente letter messangers sayde kynges good leysar bothe goyng comyng agayne answere yt meane tyme passed worlde parys noble clerke maysters iohan gygencourt whose dethe kynge lordes ye hole vniuersyte right sorie laste nat felowe behynde dayes taken great payne reforme churche haue brought perfyte vnyte pof clerke named mayster iohn warennes capi cxcvii season great clerke auignone bothe scyence prudence doctor lawes auditor palais casion ra ne called maister iohan warennes reason suche seruice done pope clement greatly auauted promoted benefice yt poynt bysshop cardynall chapelayne one auygnone called saynte peter lusenbourge maister iohan warenes promocions resigned retayned hymselfe small lyueng sextenty lady churche renes worthe yere resydent c frankes absence xxx deted fro auignon came dwell nere renes village called saint ley ledde holy lyfe preched ye worde god exalted moche pope auygnon condepned wordes pope rome visited moche people countreis came se hym se ye holy lyfe ledde fasted euery day people sayd ye cardynals auignon crafte subtylte hadde sent hym thider exalte colour opinyon el come thider shewe holy lyfe wolde wyse called holy man saynt ley audytor alwayes copany mother sayd masse euery daye deuoutly gyuen wolde gyue agayne god dessake wolde aske nothyng man pnowe lette v leaue spekyng hym speke busynesse mater requyreth phowe king englande gaue duke lancastre heyres euer duchy acquytayne howe kyng prepared go irelande duke acquytayne cap cxcviii ye haue herde hystorie howe trewce taken bytwene englande fraunce adhere ce alyes bothe see lande yet robber pyllers languedocke whiche straungers farre countreis gascoyne bierne almaygne amonge sir iohan grayle bastarde sonne somtyme captall beuses yonge experte knyght capitayne stronge castell bouteuyll capitayns garysons bigore marchynge realme arragone fronters xaynton marchesse rochell garyson mortaygne sore displeased myght natte ouer rynne countrey accustomed straitlye commaunded payne greuous punysshment nothyng shulde soude reproche peace season agreed englande consyderynge kynge yonge hadde peace ennemyes farre nere excepte irelande claymed lande enherytauce predecessours written kyng lorde irelande kynge edwarde graunfather kynge rycharde made wayes warre irysshe men entente yonge knyghtes squyers englande shulde enploye selfe dedes armes therby augment encrease honour realme concluded kynge rycharde englande shulde make thyder voyage puyssau ce menne warre entre irelande nat retourne agayne without hadde honourable composycion conclusyon season concluded duke lancastre greatlye traueyled bothe see lande augmentacyon honour reralme englande shulde make another voyage fyue hundred menne armes thousande archer take shyppynge hampton plommouthe sayle guyane acquitaygne entencyon kynge rycharde consent counsayle duke lancastre shulde haue euer hym heyres countrey acquitayne purtenaunces kyng edwarde father kyng duke acquitayne tyme holden optayned kyng rycharde yt tyme reserued always homage shulde kynge englande kynges come obeysauces rente lordshypes reuenewes shulde parteygne duke la castre heyres euer kyng made hym clere graunt confyrmed vnder writyng seale gyfte duke lacastre well cotent good cause duchy landes countreis great lorde maynteygne estate charter gyfte engrosed dewly examyned paste great delyberacyon good aduyse counsayle beynge present kynge two vncles duke yorke duke gloucestre erle salisbury erle arundell erle derby sonne duke lancastre also therle marshall erle rutlande erle northuberlande erle nottyngham lorde thomas percy lorde spensar lorde beamonde lorde willyam arundell archebysshoppe caunterbury archebysshoppe yorke bysshoppe london presente dyuers othe prelate barownes englande thanne duke lancastre purposed make prouisyon passe see go acquitayne enioye gyfte kyng hadde gyuen hym lykewise great prouisyon made kynges voyage irelande lordes apoynted suche shulde passe see kyng warnyng make redy pof dethe quene anne englande wyfe kynge richarde doughter kynge boesme emperour almaygne capi cxcix thus haue shewed great preparacyons made porte hauyns kynge shulde take shyppepynge go irelande lykewyse duke lancastre shulde passe go acquitayne voyage lette taryed ye space two monethes lengar shulde haue ben shall tell season preparacyons made quene named anne tooke sickenesse wherby kynge lordes ryght sore troubled sore sicke passed worlde feest penthecost yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore fourtene whose dethe kynge loued ladyes damoselles sore troubled great heuynesse buryed poules london obse e done good leysar king wolde haue done sumptuously great habu daunce waxe taper torch lyke hadde nat ben sene kynge wolde haue bycause emperours doughter rome kyng almaygne kynge loued entierly maryed yonge howe dyed without issue thus one season kynge duke lancastre erle derby wydowers spekynge remaryeng kyng wolde spekynge therof thus kynges voyage irelande somwhat retarded let howe prouisyon lordes suche shulde go kynge passed ouer see landed duuelyn whiche alwayes englysshe archebisshoppe kynge anone mydsomer kynge departed fro marchesse london toke waye throughe wale huntyng sportynge hym forgette dethe quene suche shulde go kynge sette forwarde two kynges vncles edmonde duke yorke thomas duke gloucestre constable englande sette forwarde great arraye dyde lordes erle rutlande sonne duke yorke erle marshall erle salisbury erle arundell lorde wyllyam arundell erle northumberlande lorde percy lorde thoms percy brother great seneschall englande erles deuonshyre notyngham great nombre knightes squiers suche reserued abode behynde kepe marchesse agaynst scottes suche people neuer kepte truce promyse lorde iohan hollande erle huntyngton waye ierusalem saynt katheryns mount purposed retourne realme hungry passed frauce hadde great chere kyng brother vncles herde howe kyng hungry great turke shulde haue batayle togyder therfore thought sure lye iourney othersyde duke lancastre came plomouthe shippes laye redy whan men come vesselles charged wynde wyll toke shippyng disancred sayled towardes burdeaux ryuer gyron nowe lette v speke kyng englande copany four thousande men armes thyrtie thousande archer shipped thre place brutowe holyheed herforde passed ouer daylye irelande redy valyaunt knyght englande called erle ormonde helde landes irelande dyde predecessours debate erle marshall englande hadde vowarde fyftene hundred speares two thousande archer kynge englande two vncles toke shyppinge herforde wale thus army passed ouer without domage lodged irelande apoyntement duke gloucestre costable englande marshal abrode countrey beyond ye cytie duuelyn xxx myle countrey thane inhabytable howe laye wysely surely feare yrisshe men nede el myght haue taken great domage kynge vncles lodged cytie duuelyn shewed whyle largely prouyded vitayls englysshe men suche men warre well forage take aduautage make good prouisyon selfe horse fell voyage shall shewe enformed phowe sir iohn froissart arryued englande gyfte boke gaue kyng cap cc trewe sir iohan froissart tyme treasourer chanon chymay erldome heynaulte diocese liege great affectyon go se realme englande whan ben abbeuyle sawe trewce taken bytwene realmes englande fraunce countreis conioyned adherentes endure four yeres see lande many reason moued make voyage one bycause youthe hadde brought vp court noble kynge edwarde thyrde quene philyppe wyfe amonge chyldren barones englande lyue whome founde noblenesse honour largesse courtesy fore desyred se countre thynkynge therby shulde lyue moche lengar hadde nat xxviii yere thought though sawe natte lordes lefte lyue yet leest shulde se heyres whiche shulde moche good se also iustifye hystories mater hadde written toke iourney spake duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte hollande zelande lorde freese lorde wyllyam erle ostrenaunt right honourable lady iahane duchesse brabant lusenbourge lorde eugerant lorde coucy gentyll knyght lorde gomegynes youthe myne toguyder englande kynges courte lykewise sene lorde coucy dyuers noble fraunce holden great housholdes london whan laye hostage redempcion kynge iohan frenche kynge hath shewed hystorie sayd lordes duchesse brabant counsayled take iourney gaue letter recommendacyon kynge englande vncles sauynge lorde coucy wolde nat write kynge bycause frenche man therfore durste nat doughter called duchesse irelande engrosed fayre boke well enlumyned matter amour moralytees four twentie yeres hadde made compyled whiche greatly quickened desyre go englande se kyng rycharde sonne noble prince wale acquitayne hadde nat sene kynge rycharde sythe christened cathedrall churche burdeaux whiche tyme thought haue goone prince iourney galycia spaygne whane cytie aste prince sente backe englande quene mother cause hadde great desyre go englande se kynge vncles also hadde said fayre boke well couered veluet garnysshed clap syluer gylte therof make present kynge fyrst cominynge presence hadde suche desyre goo voyage payne traueyle greued nothyng thus prouyded horse necessary passed see calais came douer xii daye moneth iuly whane came founde man knowledge longe sythe englande house newly chauged yonge child become men ye woman knewe natte theym abode halfe daye nyght douer tuesdaye nexte daye nyne clocke came canterbury saynt thomas shrine tombe noble prince wale entered ryght richely herde masse made myne offrynge holy saynt thanne dyned lodgynge enformed howe kyng richarde shulde nexte daye pylgrimage whiche retourne irelande ben space nyne moneches kyng hadde deuocyon visyte saynt thomas shrine also bycause prince father buryed thought abyde kynge dyde next daye kynge came thyder noble company lordes ladyes damoselles whan among semed newe folkes knewe sone tyme sore chau ged xxviii yere kynge none vncles duke la castre acquitayne duke yorke glocestre busyness firste abasshed sene auncyent knyght ben kyng edwarde price ben well reconforted wolde haue gone hym coulde se none suche thane demaunded knyght called sir rycharde seury whyder lyue nat shewed yes london thought go ye lorde thoms percy great seneschall englade kyng acquaynted hym founde hym right honorable gracyous offred present letter kynge wherof right ioyfull behoued haue meanes bringe presence suche prince kynge englande wente kynges chambre whiche tyme kynge gone slepe shewed badde retourne lodgynge come agayne dyde whan came bysshoppes palays founde lorde thomas percy redy ryde ospring counsayled make knowledge beynge folowe court sayd wolde cause euer well lodged tyl kyng shulde fayre castell lede kent ordered cousayle rode ospring adueture lodged house lodged gentyll knyght englande called sir wyllyam lysle taryed behynde kynge bycause payne heed nyght one kynges preuy chambre whan sawe straunger thought marchesse frauce bycause langage fyll acquayncaunce toguyder gentylmen englande curcesse treatable gladde acquayntaunce demaunded busynesse party shewed hym great parte comynge thyder lorde thomas percy hadde sayd ordred answered sayde howe coulde nat haue better meane ye friday ye kyng shulde castell lede shewed whan came shuld fynde duke yorke kynges vncle wherof ryght gladde bycause letter dyrected hym also youthe hadde sene courte noble kyng edwarde father ye quene mother friday mornyng sir wylliam lysle rode toguyder waye demaunded hym kynge voyage irelande answered yes demaunded hym maner hole irelande called saynt patrykes purgatorie trewe sayde nat sayde suretie suche hole hym selfe another knyght englande hadde ben whyle kynge laye duuelyn sayd howe entred hoole closed sonne goynge downe abode nyght nexte mornyng issued agayne son risyng demauded suche strage sightes vysions spoken sayd howe whan felowe entred past gate yt called ye purgatorie saynt patryke discended gone downe thre four pace discendyng downe cellar certayne hoote wapure rose agaynst strake heedes fayne syt downe steres whiche stone sytte season great desyre slepe fell slepe slepte nyght demau ded slepe knewe visyons answered slepyng entred great ymaginacyos marueylous dremes otherwyse wont haue chambres mornynge issued within shorte season clene forgate dreures visyons wherfore sayde thought mater fantasy lefte spekyng matter bycause wolde fayne haue knowen hym done voyage irelande thought tha haue demauded kyng done iourney company knyghtes came fell communycacion hym lefte purpose tyme thus robe lede thyder came kyng copany founde lorde edmonde duke yorke went hym delyuered letter fro erle heynaulte cosyn fro erle ostrenaunt duke knewe well made good chere sayde sir iohan holde alwayes nere v shall shewe loue courtesy boude therto loue tyme past loue lady olde quene mother whose courte ye haue good remembraunce therof thanked hym reason requyred aduaunsed reason hym sir thomas percy sir william lysle meanes brought kynges chambre presence meanes vncle duke yorke delyuered letter kyng toke reed good leysar sayd welcome hadde ben englysshe courte daye shewed nat kynge boke hadde brought hym sore occupyed wt great affayres leysar present boke kyng sore busyed counsayle two great mightye mater first determynynge sende sufficient messangers therle rutlande cosyn germayne erle marshall archbysshoppe dublyn bysshoppe ely lorde loys clyssorde lorde henry beaumonde lorde hughe spensar many ouer see charles frenche kynge treate hym maryage hadde bytwene kyng englande frenche kynges eldest doughter named isabell age eyght yeres secode cause lorde de la barde lorde taryde lorde pyntherne lorde newcastell lorde nesque lorde copane counsaylours burdeux bayon daxe come englande quickely pursued mater sythe kynges retourne irelande haue answere requestes processe put forthe kyng gyfte kynge gyuen vncle duke lacastre landes seignories lordshippes baronyes acquytayne whiche verifyed pertaygne kynge realme englande hadde alleged kynge counsayle gyfte myght nat passe bycause vnprofytable mutyle sayd landes helde right demayne crowne englande wherfore sayde wolde nat disioyne disceuer fro crowne alleged furthermore many reasonable cause ye shall processe thus haue co sayle two great matter kynge sente moost parte prelate lordes englande feest maudelyntyde manner kynges called eltham seuyn englysshe myles fro london whan taryed lede four dayes kyng retourned rochester elthame rode forthe kynges company pof refuce acquytayne made duke lancastre howe sent englande kynge counsayle shewyng hym wyll hole cou trey acquytayne cap cci rydynge waye bytwene leades eltham demaunded syr willyam lysle syr iohn graily capitayne bouteuyll ye cause king drewe london warde great counsayle shulde assemble eltham tolde specially syr iohan graily rehersed playnly ye lordes gascon come thyder counsaylours good townes cyties thus enfourmed knight knewe trouth often tymes amonge theym maner one countrey fronter sayde thus surely whan duke lancastre came fyrst acquytayne suffycyently fournysshed charter wrytinges engrosed sealed great seale englande enrolled fermely decreed full accorde prelate lordes englande also consente duke edmonde yorke erle cambridge thomas duke gloucestre though sayd herytages might succession haue come kynge rycharde englande nephue chyldren sayd two duke brethern germayns father mother duke lancastre whiche duke anone come acquytayne sente counsayle cytie burdeaux shewe mayre counsaylours towne fourme tenoure request cause come countrey whan herde greatly marueyled howe ioyfully receyued kynges duke comyssioners honoure kynge whome ought seruyce obeysaunce desyred take cousayle dyd aunswered said duke lancastre sonne kynge edwarde ben lorde welcome amoge none otherwyse sayde nat farre forthe taken counsayle receyue hym souerayne lorde sayd kyng rycharde soueraygne lorde done feaultie homage made quytace aunswered comyssioners sayd syrs feare nat ye shall haue suffycient dyscharge behalfe ye take duke souerayne lorde ye shall se content kinges charter shall neuer questyon made therof tyme come whane burdeaux sawe nere touched founde theym another socoure sayd fayre lordes comyssion extendeth nat onely vpon v lykewyse cytie bayon prelate barones gascoyne vnder obeysaunce kynge englande ye shall drawe towardes ordre shall folowe aunswere comyssioners coulde nat haue tyme burdeau departed rode lyborne duke lancastre laye whan duke herde aunswers imagyned hymselfe synesse come thyder shulde nat sone atcheued trusted shulde haue ben sent cousayle cytie bayon sped burdeaux dyd answere coude haue none fynally prelate noble men counsaylours cytes good townes gascoyne vnder obeysaunce kyng englande conioyned togyder concluded forme manner shall shewe sayde wolde gladly receyue ye duke lancastre cyt e townes castelles sonne kyng edwarde vncle kinge rycharde englade entringes shulde solemply swere pesably good maner shulde entreat people enforsynge thynge pay reasonably euery thynge shulde dispende also swere shulde nat oppresse cause oppressed iurysdictyon crowne englande maner waye accyon duke aunswered sayd nat come countrey greue oppresse people wolde rather kepe defende agaynst men herytage desyred requyred theym comaundement kynge englande myght obserued acomplisshed hole countrey comune voyce sayd yt wyse wolde departe fro crowne englande nat kynge englandes power gyue away another lorde put fro crowne englande demaundes denyenges longe debatyng bytwene duke lancastre lordes townes gascon whan duke sawe none remedy made request countrey prelate noble men cousaylours good townes shulde sende suffycient personage kynge englande counsayle howe wolde sende lykewyse notable persones counsayle loke euer kyng counsayle shulde determyne cause promysed surely abyde ther whether hym agaynst gascon consydred well request reasonable agreed duke desyred duke rode burdeaur lodged abbey saint andrewes ben lodged tyme cytie bayon dar apoynted suffycient personage sende englande baron gascon vnder kinges obeysaunce sent lyke wyse also ye shall knowe whan ye frenche kyng vncles vnderstode duke laucastre peasably entred cytie burdeaux knewe nat entent whether wolde kepe breake trewce counsayle determyned sende hym knowe somwhat entent apoynted go lorde boucyquant marshall fraunce lorde iohan castell morante iohan barres barroys haue thousande speares thus rode forth tyll came cytie agen taryed sent harauldes messnagers burdeaux duke lancastre shewynge hym howe wolde gladly speke hym duke made messangers good chere wrote agayne lordes certifyeng great desyre speke hym lykewyse speke bycause shulde take ye lesse payne promysed come mete bergerate whan frenche lordes sawe letter gaue credence therto ordred sone knewe duke come bergerate departed fro agen rode thyder receyued lodged towne company subbarbes lordes spake duke shewed hym message duke receyued swetely aunswered sayd howe wolde good kynde neyghbour frenche kyng realme kepe mayntayne trewce taken bytwene two kynges sayde hym selfe one princypalles ayded make ordayn truce wherfore sayd ought nat wold nat breke therof myght well assured duke aunswere pleased greatly lordes fraunce thus duke louingly togyder duke gaue great dyner supper tooke leaue duke retourned burdeaux frenche men fraunce founde waye duke berrey cytie poyeters shewed hym doone duke berrey thought duke lancaster answere reasonable dyd ye frenche kynge duke burgoyne mater abode styll estate cause quod sir iohan graily duke lancastre hath sent hyther englande counsayle syr wylliam pe reer syr peter clyfton two clerkes lerned lawe mayster iohan huche mayster iohan rychard leycettour treate pleate mater kynge vncles cause kynge rydeth eltham shall thursday nexte shall mary maudelyn daye shalbe done yet knowe nat enfourmed englysshe men knowe somwhat duke gloucestre wyll princypally opynion yt brother duke lancastre shulde abyde styll guyen rather retourue agayne englande bycause great kynge ensure duke gloucestre maruaylous mynded man proude presumptuous wolde rule hym selfe beloued comynalte euer saythe wyll enclyne caused valyaunte knyght lorde symon burle duke irelande archebysshoppe yorke many knyghtes kynges counsayle dye hatred yuell wyll durynge seasone duke lancastre beyonde see castyle dred englande beloued nowe lette mater passe quod syr iohn graily shall shewe nowe seconde busynesse kynge hathe enfourmed kynges pleasure remaryed hath sertched ouer wyfe duke burgoyne erle haynalte doughter mary kynge wolde gladly haue one haue none suche maryed hath ben shewed kyng kynge nauarre hath bothe suffers doughters wyll nat entende yt wayes duke gloucestre hath doughter able mary wolde gladly kyng shulde haue kynge wolde nat said nere kynne cosyn germayne kynge enclyneth moste mynde frenche kynges doughter wherof countrey hath great marueyle wolde take enemyes doughter kynge nat beste beloued prince worlde people setteth lytell therby sheweth always rather haue warre realme frauce wherfore wolde haue good peace bytwene frenche kynge hym realmes kynge wyll often tymes saye warre hath endured longe bytwene many valyaunt men deed therby bothe party wherby christen faythe sore mynysshed febled nat pleasaunt realme englande shulde mary fraunce hath ben shewed hym doughter fraunce ouer yonge fyue syxe yere shall nat able kepe hym company therto hath aunswered saythe shall growe ryght well age though faste season shall take well worth shall ordre meane season pleasure maner englande sayenge also howe yet yonge ynough abyde tyll lady age man canne breke kynge purpose ye departe ye shall moche matter thus cause kynge rydeth nowe eltham thus gentle knyght syr iohan graily deuysed togyther rode bytwene rochestre dertforde knight capytayn bouteuyle bastarde sonne somtyme captall beusz herde wordes gladly dyd put memory way bytwene leades eltham rode parte company syr wylliam lysle thus kynge came eltham tuesday wednysday lordes costes began assemble thyder came duke gloucestre erles derby arundell northumberlande kent rutlande erle marshall archebysshoppes caunterbury yorke bysshoppes london wynchester thursday aboute houre thre assembled togyther kynges chambre kynges presence knyghtes gascoyne sent cousaylours good townes also duke lancastres counsayle sent nat preset might nat suffred none lordes counsayle debated mater four houres dyner fell acquayntauce auncyent knyght whome knewe kynge edwardes dayes kynge rychardes priuy counsayle called syr rycharde sury knewe anone yet xxiiii yeres nat sene whiche colbridge bruselles house duke wyncelante brabant duchesse iahan brabant knyght sir rycharde sury made good chere demaunded many thynges aunswered hym knewe walked vp downe hym galery kynges chambre demauded hym questyons counsayle desyred hym tell myght conclusion taken herde well paused lytell afterwarde sayd syr iohan shall shewe mater hydden kept secrete shortly ye shall theym publysshed openly ye knowe well quod iame sure ye haue herde rehersed howe duke lancastre gone acquytayne reioyce gyft kynge soueraygne lorde hath gyuen hym loue hathe hym hath doone kynge ryght good seruyce crowne englande therfore rewarde kynge hathe clerely gyuen hym heyres euer hole duchy acquitayne e tendeth mete lymytacyons seneschalles baylyages sygnories wasselages clene quyteth holde hym faythe othe homage resorte reserued kynge hath reserued crowne englande tyme come gyfte sufficyently confermed kynges vncles counsayle englande hath acorded ther kynge hathe gyuen specyall commaundement subgiettes sayd lymytacyons acquytayne obey poyntes without othermeane dere well beloued vncle duke iohan lancastre ye syght letter holde take hym souerayne lorde swere hym faythe homage holde hym truely haue auncyently done helde date letter gyuen kyng englande deputy comyssioners soeuer rebelleth speketh agaynst kynges graut condycyon euer aunswere therto within thre dayes kynge gaue vncle lancastre commyssioners full power puyssaunce correcte put hope haue retourne resorte yet nat withstandynge letter strayte comaundement kynge good townes cyties gascoyne vnder kynge englandes obeysauce lordes knyghtes gentleman countrey conioyned togyther kepe townes close agaynste duke wyll nat nat mynde obey duke case say haue sayd yet susteyne houre gyfte kynge hath gyuen vncle lancastre nat suffycient profytable ordre reason yt duke wolde nat wynne theym gentylnesse herde pacyently defence inconuenyentes shulde ensue therfore counsayle counsayles come hyther debate declare cause nat obey kynges comaundement surely day haue right wysely shewed answere layde forth certayne artycles reason haue ben well herde haue layde suche reason maner kynge counsayle thynke haue cause abyde quarell shall shewe howe wolde ye kept secrete tyll knowen abrod aunswered wolde well quod knyght one thought offyciall burdeaux spake partie first shewed forthe procutacyon auctorite entent myght better beleued beganne sayde cytie burdeaux cyties bayon dax sygnories lorshyppes appendaunt lymyttes sayd countreys cyties noble condycyon kyng englande maner accyon dede may put awaye dysceuer fro demayns crowne englande gyue alyenate chylde vncle brother reasone maryage otherwise veryfie say aboue named townes cyties sygnories suffyciently priueleged kynges englande haue sworne faythfully holde kepe v without reuocasyon soone kynge englande entreth possessyon herytage crowne englande swereth sufficiently euangelystes holde ferme stable without breakynge ye ryght dere syr kyng englande haue made lyke othe syr veryfie trouth beholde writynges ther shewed forth letter charter vnder sygnes notaryes imperyalles sealed great seale englande gyuen kynge rycharde beynge present openly redde frome clause clause charter well herde vnderstande bothe laten frenche named ende many wytnesses prelate great lordes englande suretie testis dede leste nombre xi whanne kynges counsayle herde behelde eche loked kynge man spake worde made replycacion whan redde ouer folded put vp spake addressynge wordes kynge sayde ryght dere syr redouted soueraygne lorde ryght dere lordes departynge countrey charged shewe counsaylours good cyties townes gascoyne beynge vnder obeysaunce crowne englande hath well ouer sene fourme maner commaudement sent vnto vnder seale whiche knewe right well yet thinke say comaundement may nat obeyed cyties good townes guyen wolde enclyne receyue duke lancastre lorde acquyte euer homage obeysaunce owe shulde greatly preiudyce crowne englande thoughe tyme presente duke lancastre kynges vncle subgiet well beloued wolde holde kepe poyntes artycles belongyng crowne englande yet maye hap suche loue tenure may lyghtly lost chaunge heyres reason maryages made bytwene lordes ladyes chaungynge fro one another though nere lygnage dyspensacyon pope sometyme necessyte maryages made hyghe prince chyldren one another holde landes sygnories loue amyte myght fall suche heyres myght dyscende duke lancastre shulde conioyne theym maryage chyldren kynge fraunce duke berrey bretaygne erles foize armynake kynges nauarre duke aniou mayne beynge beyonde see peraduenture party fraunce shulde clayme enherytaunce therby put countrey guyen dyscorde bring crowne englande wherby kynge englande reygnynge realme also shulde haue peraduenture ouer moche payne recouer agayne ryght put farre fro thence whervnto shulde retourne demayne crowne englande wherfore ryght dere syr redouted lordes noble counsaylours please consydre poyntes artycles haue purposed presence determyne ye shall seme best syr full opynion countrey saye wyll abyde styll obey saunce ryght redouted lorde kynge demayne noble crowne englande therwith offyciall helde peace prelate lordes eche regarded drewe togyther aproched kynge fyrste two vncles erles derby arundell acquytayne comaunded departe tyll called agayne departed also two knightes come thyder fro duke lancastre kyng demaunded counsayle shulde done aunswere shulde made prelate tourned aunswere kynges vncles bycause mater touched rather fyrst excused sayeng myght nat well aunswere mater comune ought debated comune counsayle nat lygnage fauour thus bode good space fynally aunswere layde duke gloucestre prayed requyred saye aduyse aunswered sayde howe herde thynge take way dysanull gyfte kynge confermed sealed acorde subgiettes delyberacyon specyall counsayle wherfore sayde subgiettes shuld rebell wolde nat obey wolde make kynge shulde nat lorde owne enheritaunce yt myght nat owne pleased hym glosed wordes though corage aunswere nat reasonable durste nat saye agaynst duke gloucestre sore dred erle derby sonne duke lancastre presente furthered wordes sayde fayre vncle ye haue well sayd opinyon therwith counsayle began breke murmured one another guyen yet duke lancaster knightes nat called agayne tyme whan kynge sawe mater dyssimuled lytell entensyon shulde assemble togyther agayne counsayle dyner se propre way myght taken honoure crowne englande kynge caused bysshop caunterbury speke gyuen hym charge mornynge speke vpon state maryage sende fraunce lordes accorde named shulde go whiche archebysshoppe duuelyn erle rutlande erle marshall lorde beaumonde lorde hughe spenser lorde loys clyfforde twenty knyghtes xl squyers sent fraunce treat maryage frenche kynges doughter isabell eyght yere age yet redy promysed duke bretayns sonne treatie yt made towrs thourayne nowe beholde howe myght broken frenche kynge vncles hadde sealed duke bretayne yet thenglysshe ambassadours charge gyuen vnto departed englande aryued calays taryed fyue dayes departed great araye tooke waye amyence sente marche haraulde brought saueconducte goynge comyng besyde lorde moncheuerell sette guyde se serued thynges necessary pnowe shall leaue speke retourne fyrste purpose nowe haue shewed counsaylours cyties good townes acquytayne prayed kynge counsayle whome boude mayntayn lyberties fraunches demayne crowne englande sworne affermynge surely wolde kepe auncyente lyberties wyll nat breke maner cause condycion holdynge thus opynyon foure partes counsayle comune voyce countrey reputed theym valyaunt worthy men duke gloucestre another opinyon wolde brother duke lancastre shuld haue bydden styll acquytayne thought ouer great englande nere kynge brother duke yorke cared nat duke yorke prince loued ease lytell busynesse also fayre lady wyfe doughter erle kent whome pleasure duke gloucestre subtyle euer demaunded somwhat nephue kynge rycharde yet poore great lorde constable englande erle hertforde perces bokyngham also yerely kynges cofers foure thousande noble neuer rode kinges busynesse realme one daye without knewe wherfore cause nat indyfferent mater acquytayne wolde haue brother lancastre haue bydden still acquitayn euer thought wolde haue shyfted well ynoughe englande soone sayd sentence ye haue herde sawe murmured kynges chambre prelate lordes talked togyther two two issued ye chambre erle derby hym came hall e tham made clothe layde table sate downe dynner lefte styll talkynge togyther whan duke yorke knewe dyner went kepe hym company dyner whiche made shorte duke gloucestre dyssymuled mater tooke leaue kynge syttynge table departed toke horse rode london erle derby abode styll lordes daye nexte daye thus acquytayne coulde haue none expedicyon delyueraunce haue delyght write mater length bycause enfourme trouthe auctour hystory presente mater valyaunt knyght syr rycharde surye shewed euery thynge sonday folowynge suche ben departed counsaylours except duke yorke abode styll kynge lorde thomas percy syr rycharde sury shewed busynesse kynge kynge desyred se booke brought hym sawe chambre layde redy bedde whanne kynge opened pleased hym well fayre enlumyned written couered crymson veluet ten botons syluer gylte rose golde myddes two great clap gylte rychely wrought kyng demaunded wherof treated shewed hym howe treated mater loue wherof kynge gladde loked reed many place coulde speke rede frenche well tooke knyght chambre named sir rycharde creadon beare secrete chambre sonday fell acquayntaunce squyer englande called henry castyde honest man wyse coude well speke frenche copanyed bicause sawe kyng lordes made good chere also sene boke gaue kynge also sir richarde sury shewed hym howe maker hystories sayd foloweth pthe deuyse conquest kyng richarde made irlade howe brought obeysaunce four kynges cou trey cap ccii sir iohan quod haue ye nat founde kynges courte sythe ye came hyder man hath tolde voyage kyng made late irlande maner foure kynges irelande come obeysaunce kynge englande aunswered shall shewe squyer entent ye maye putte perpetuall memorie whan ye retourne owne countrey haue leysar therto reioysed wordes thanked hym began thus sayd sir iohan nat memorie euer kyng englande made suche appareyle prouision iourney make warre agaynst yrisshmen suche nombre men armes archer kyng nyne monethes marchesse irelande great cost charge realme bare expeses marchautes cyties good townes realme thought well bestowed whan sawe kynge retourne home agayne honour nombre thyder getylmen archer foure thousande knyghtes xxx thousande archer well payde wekely euery manne well pleased shewe bycause ye shulde knowe tronthe irelande one yuell countreis worlde make warre vpon bring vnder subiection closed strongely wyldely highe forestes great water maresshes place inhabytable harde entre countrey domage ye shall fynde towne persone speke wt men drawe woodes dwell caues small cotag vnder tree among busshes hedge lyke wylde sauage beestes whan knowe man maketh warre agaynst entred coutreis drawe toguyder straytes passage defende man entre whan se tyme wyll sone take aduauntage enemyes knowe countrey lyght people man armes beyng neuer well horsed ron fast yrisshe men wyll ryn fote faste ouertake hym yea leape vp vpon horse behynde hym drawe hym fro horse stronge men armes haue sharpe weapon large blade wt two edge maner darte heedes wherwith wyll slee enemy repute nat man deed tyll haue cutte throte opyn bely taken herte cary awaye saye suche knowe nature eate haue great delyte therin take man raunsome whane se encountre ouermatched wyll departe sonder go hyde theym selfe busshes wodes hedge caues man shall finde theym also syr wylliam wyndsore hath moste vsed warres party englysshe man yet coulde neuer lerne maner ye countrey knowe condycions herde people rude engen wytte dyuers frequentacyons vsage sette nothyng iolyte fresshe apparell noblenesse though rleame soueraynly gouerned kynges wherof haue plentie yet wyll take knowledge gentylnesse wyll contynewe rudenesse acordynge brought vp trouthe foure princypall kynges moste puyssaunt maner countrey come obeysaunce kynge englande loue fayrenesse nat batayle constraynte erle ormonde marcheth vpon hath taken great payne hath treated came duuelyn kynge submytted hym vnder obeysaunce crowne englande wherfore kyng realme reputeth great honourable dede thynketh voyage well stowed kynge edwarde good memory dyd neuer moche vpon kynge rycharde dyde voyage honour great profite lytell though kynges yet man deuyse speke ruder personage shall shewe somwhat rudenesse entente maye ensample agayne people nacyons knowe well haue proued selues whan duuelyn hadde gouernaunce moneth kynges commauudement counsayle thentent shulde lerne vse selfe accordyng vsage englande bycause coulde speke language well frenche englysshe youthe brought vp amonge theym erle ormonde father erle nowe loued right well bycause coulde tha ryde handell horse metely well fortuned one tyme sayde erle maister sent thre hundred speares thousande archer marchesse irelande make warre yrisshe men alwayes englysshe men haue warre subdue putte vnder daye sayd erle went agaynst rode goodly horse lyght swyfte thus rode folowed mayster day yrisshe men layde busshement whane came nere theym opyned busshement thanne englisshe archer began shote egerly yrisshe men coulde nat suffre simply armed therfore reculed wente backe thane erle mayster folowed ye chase well horsed folowed hym nere coude fortuned horse afrayd toke bridell tethe ranne away whether wolde nat bare farforthe amonge yrisshe men one lyghtnesse ronnynge lepte vp behynde enbrased armes dyde none hurt ledde way rode styll behynde space two houres laste brought secrete place thycke busshes founde company come thyder scaped daungers englysshe men pursued nat farre shewed great ioye ledde towne stro ge house amonge woodes water myres towne called harpely getylman toke called brine costeret goodly man hath ben shewed yet lyue aged brine costeret kepte seuyn yere hym gaue doughter maryage hadde two doughters shall shewe howe delyuered happened seuin yeres ende one kynges named arthur mackemur kyng lynster made armye agaynst duke lyon clarence sonne kyng edwarde englande agaynst sir wyllm wynsore nat farre fro cytie lynster englysshe men yrisshe men mette toguyder many slayne taken bothe party englysshe men opteygned vyctorie yrisshe men fledde kyng arthur saued hym selfe brine costeret wyues father taken prisoner vnder duke clarence baner taken courser toke horse well knowen amonge erle ormondes folkes shewed howe alyue maner harpelyn howe wedded doughter wherof duke clarence sir wylliam wynsore englysshe men ryght gladde thane shewed hym wolde delyuered prison shulde delyuer englysshe mennes hades wyfe chyldren gret payne made bargayne loued well wyfe doughter chyldren whan sawe coulde make fynaunce none otherwyse accorded therto reteigned myne eldest doughter styll wyfe seconde doughter retourned englande went dwelte besyde bristowe ryuer syuerne two doughters maryed irelade hath thre sonnes two doughters brought hath foure sonnes two doughters bycause langage yrisshe redy englysshe tong haue alwayes cotynued wyfe taught child speche therfore kyng souerayne lorde counsayle comaunded gyue attendauce four kynges gouerne bringe reason vsage customes englade seyng hadde yelded vnder obeysaunce crowne englade sworne holde euer yet ensure dyde power ensygne lerne good maner yet ryght rude grose engyn moche payne hadde make speke thyng fayre maner somwhat altred nat moche many case drewe naturall rudenesse kyng soueraygne lordes entent maner countenaunce apparell clothyng shulde vse accordyng maner englande kynge thought make four knyghtes fayre house lodge duuelyn charged abyde styll nat departe two thre dayes suffred lyst sayde nothynge folowed owne appetytes wolde sytte table make coutenaunce nother good fayre thought shulde cause chaunge maner wolde cause mystrelles seruauntes varlettes sytte eate owne dysshe drinke cuppes shewed vsage countre good sayd thynges except beddes lyued comen fourthe day ordayned table couered hall ye vsage englande made four kynges sytte hyghe table mynstrels another borde seruantes varlettes another byneth wherof semynge displeased behelde eche wolde nat care sayd howe wolde take fro good vsage wherin hadde norisshed answered smylyng peace theym nat honourable estate dyde must leaue vse custom englande kynges pleasure shulde charged order whan harde suffred bycause putte selfe vnder obeysauce kyng englande parceuered long yet hadde one vse whiche knewe well vsed cou tre dyde breches caused breches lynen clothe made whyle caused leaue many rude thynges aswell clothyng cause moche ado fyrst cause weare gownes sylke furred myneuere gray kynges thought selfe well apparelled whan hadde mantell rode alwayes without sadelles styropes great payne made ryde vsage andon tyme demaunded beleue wherwith nat content sayd howe beleued god trynite aswell demauded pope affection aunswered hym rome thane demaunded wolde nat gladly receyue order knyghthode kyng englande shulde make knyghtes accordynge vsage frau ce englande countreis aunswered howe knyghtes redye suffyced theym asked made knyghtes howe whan answered yt age seuyn yere made knyghtes irelande kynge maketh sonne knyght sonne haue father alyue nexte blode maye make hym knyght thane yonge knyght shall begyn iuste small speares suche maye beare case rynne agaynst shelde sette stake felde speares breaketh shalbe honoured knewe maner well ynough though dyde demau de sayd knighthode taken youthe suffyced nat kynge englande sayde shulde gyue theym another maner demaunded howe aunswered shulde holy churche whiche moost worthyest place enclyned somewhat wordes within two dayes erle ormonde came coude right well speke langage landes laye party sente kynge cou sayle honoured hym fell swete communycacion demaunded howe lyked aunswered sayde well hath well shewed v vsage countrey wherfore ought thanke aunswere pleased well erle ormonde entred lytell lytell speke order chiualry whiche kyng wolde shulde receyue shewed fro poynt poynt howe shulde behaue selfe parteygned knyghthode erles wordes pleased moche four kynges whose name fyrst great ancle kyng mecte seconde brine thomode kynge thomonde thyrde arthure mackequemur kynge lynster fourthe conhue kyng cheueno darpe made knightes kyng richarde englande cathedrall churche duuelyn dedycate saynt iohan baptyst done lady day marche fell thursday four kynges watched night churche nexte daye highe masse tyme great solepnyte made knightes sir thomas orphen sir ioatas pado sir iohan pado cosyn kynges sate day table kyng rycharde regarded many folkes bicause behauyng straunge maner englande countreis euer naturally men desyre se newelties sir iohn froissart sayde henry beleue well wolde cost largely surely yere past hadde come hyder hadde nat herde dethe quene anne englande whiche dyde lette one thynge wolde desyre knowe howe four kynges irelande came soone kynge englandes obeysaunce whan kynge edwarde kynges graunfather valyaunt prince redouted ouer coude neuer subdue putte vnder yet alwayes warre subdued nowe ye sayd treatie grace god dede grace god good haue moche worthe sene nowe dayes erthely prince getteth lytell wt puissauce desyre know whan shall coe heynalt countrey shalbe examyned many thynges bothe duke aubert bauier erle heynalte holande zelande also sonne wyllm bauyere writeth hym selfe lorde frese whiche great countrey puissaunt whiche coutrey sayd duke sonne claymeth haue ryght successyon dyde predecessours fresons wolde neuer fall reason come vnder obeysauce yet nat vnto day answered sir henry christall sayd sir iohan shewe trouth nat many one saythe suppose yt great puissau ce yt kyng ouer taryed countrey nyne monethes euery man well payed abasshed yrisshe men also see closed fro partes wherby lyueges marchau dis myght nat entre countreys thoughe dwell farre within realme cared lytell knowe natte marchaundyse meaneth lyue grosely rudely like vnto beestes yet suche lyueth marchesse england see coost vse feate marchaundyse v place kynge edwarde noble memorie tyme answere many warres frauce bretayne gascone scotlande people deuyded dyuers place sore occupyed wherfore coude nat sende great nombre irelande whan irysshmen sawe ye great nombre men warre kyng rycharde hadde irelande laste iourney yrisshmen aduysed selfe came obeysauce dede olde tyme kyng englade named edwarde saynt canonysed honoured realme tyme subdued dane disconfyted batayle see thre tymes saint edwarde kyng englande lorde irelande acquitayn yrisshmen loued dredde hym moche kyng englande therfore souerayne lorde kyng richarde yere past whan irelande armory deuyses lefte beryng armes englande lybardes flour delyces quarterly bare armes saynt edwarde crosse patent golde goules four white martenettes felde wherof said yrisshmen well pleased soner enclyned hym trouthe ye predecessours four kynges obeyed faithe homage ye sayd kyng edwarde repute kynge richarde good man good coscience haue done hym faithe homage ought like maner predecessours sotyme dyde saynt edwarde thus haue shewed maner kyng souerayne lorde hath yere accomplysshed furnysshed voyage ireland put memoriall entent whan ye shall retourne owne countrey ye may write cronicle many hystories depende matter thanked hym sayd shulde done toke leaue hym mette marche heraulde demauded hym armes henry christell bare shewed heraulde howe sir henry shewed maner kynges torney irelande state foure kynges ben sayd gouernyng fyftene dayes duuelyn heraulde answered sayd sir beareth armes syluer cheuerne goules thre besans goules thyng dyde putte writynge bycause wolde nat forgette thus taryed kynge englandes courte longe pleased nat always one place kynge often tymes remoued eltham lede kyngstone shene charsey wyndsore aboute marchesse london enformed trouthe kyng wrote vncle duke lancastre acquitayne spedde busynesse countrey abode styll crowne englande thane concluded generall counsayle englande gyfte kynge hadde gyuen duke lancastre must nedes abyde styll owne howe duke gloucestre wolde brother myght haue enioyed kynges gyfte saying coulde nat herde case realme englande bycause doutes casualtyes tyme come herde well wordes theym burdeaux bayone consydred well yf herytage acquitaygne putte fro crowne englande shulde tyme come great preiudice realme whiche wolde wise shulde fortune alwayes burdeux bayon froters march gascon kept augmented greatly honour realme englande thyng well cosydred wyse men kynges cousayle ye duke gloucestre absent hym man durst speke mater abode case pwe shall leaue matter speke kynge englandes ambassadours erle rutlande therle marshall sente fraunce treate maryage bytwene kynge rycharde lorde doughter charles frenche kyng eyght yeres age shall shewe howe spedde pof ambassade kynge englande sente fraunce treate maryage bytwene lady isable freche kynges eldest doughter hym selfe louyng answere capi cciii englysshe lordes rode fro calais amyence clermount beauuosyn parys euery place well receyued comaundement frenche kyng lodged yt crosse tyrouer fyue hundred horse frenche kynge lodged castell lour quene chyldren house saynt poule vpon ryuer seyne duke berrey house nesle duke burgoyne house arthoyse duke burbone owne house duke orlyauce erle saynt poule lorde coucy owne house kynge assembled counsayle entent make better answere thembassadours englande kyng comauded euery day shulde delyuered ambassadours two hudred crownes fra ce small expences horse chiefe englysshe lordes erle marshall therle rutlade often tymes kynge dyned hym good coulde deuysed loue kynge englade lordes desyred euer haue answere euer fedde forthe fayre wordes noble men fraunce great marueyle requestes englysshe men kynge englande wolde marry fraunce seynge warre ben cruell long endured frenche kynges counsayle sayd howe maye kyng agree gyue doughter maryage aduersary treatie shulde made thynke shall haue peace englande wayes though nat meanes maryage yt tyme valyaunt knyght frenche kynges counsayle called sir raynalt corby farre castyng man consydred myght fall tyme come thane sayd kyng vncles lordes maysters man shulde entre ryght dore house semeth kyng richarde englade wolde nothyng realme loue fauour seynge reason maryage wolde alye hym two tymes counsaylours haue mette toguyder amyence balyngham treate peace yet coulde neuer take good conclusyon state truce sir well knowen thomas duke gloucestre kyng richardes vncle co trary opinyon ye king two vncles duke lacastre yorke kyng nat make hym agre wyllingly haue peace howe puissaunce canne natte resyst kynges power therfore sir myne opynyon receyue offre refuce nat treatie let lordes haue suche aunswere maye cotent kyng vncles agreed therto specially duke burgoyne sore charged reason warres yt gladly wolde haue peace pricypall cause bycause flau ders wherof claymed lorde reason wyfe bycause countrey marched vpon englande also hertes flemynges rather englysshe frenche bycause entrecourse marchaundyse bytwene england flaunders see lande concluded frenche kynges counsayle shulde good made englysshmen whether dissymulacyon otherwyse frenche men determyned make good swere aunswere englisshe men put hope kynge englande shulde haue desyre quene chyldren laye house faynt powle englysshe lordes desyred se theym graunted specyally se whome treatie shewed muste content howe euer founde sayde yonge chylde eyght yere age wherfore sayd coulde nat great wysdome prudence howe indoctryned well ynough lordes founde well whan sawe erle marshall beynge knee sayde fayre lady grace god ye shall lady quene englande aunswered yonge lady well aduysedly without counsayle person syr quod please god lorde father shall quene englande shall glad therof shewed shall great lady toke vp erle marshall hande ledde quene mother great ioy answere made herde maner countenaunce behauoure yonge lady pleased greatly ambassadours sayd amonge selfe lykely lady hygh honoure great goodnesse thus whan lordes englande ben parys twenty dayes costes charge payed frenche kynge reasonable aunswere gyuen put great hope bringe aboute came howe frenche men sayd coulde nat doone shortly bycause lady yonge also fyansed duke bretayns eldest sonne wherfore sayd must treat breke promesse coude procede mater thervpon frenche kynge counsayle shulde sende englande next lent shewe howe matter wente whan dayes begyn encreace waxe fayre kynge englande sende agayne fraunce whome shulde please hym shulde welcome aunswere englysshe men contented toke leaue quene doughter kynge departed fro paris toke way came retourned calays englande two erles rode post company bringe tydynges kyng rode fro sandwiche wynd sore lesse thanne daye halfe kynge ryght ioyouse comynge well contente frenche kynges aunswere set mater herte toke great pleasure therin tooke hede none thynge studyed howe myght bringe aboute haue frenche kinges doughter wyfe othersyde frenche kynge counsayle studyed daye nyght howe myght make maryage englande honour realme fraunce many realme fraunce sayd called treatyes wordes herde kynge englande shulde neuer haue doughter fraunce maner peace good shulde fraunce seynge trewce bytwene endured two yere come shall fall agayne warre eche v hate haue doone duke berrey orlyance opynion dyuers lordes frauce king duke burgoyne chauncellour fraunce enclyned maryage gladde haue peace reseruyng alwayes honour realme tyme squier fraunce nacyon normandy countrey caulx dayes ben sore traueyled farre party newly retourned frauce name robert le menuot called robert hermyte relygyous good lyfe age fyfty yere treaty holden balyngham whiche tyme well herde howe entred treatie shall shewe pof squyer named roberte hermyte howe sente treaty peace holden balyngham howe sente englande kynge rycharde vncles cap cciiii whan roberte hermyte returned frauce party surey toke shyppyng baruch whyle vpon see great tempest wynde rose suche wyse feared perysshed euery man tell make prayer god ende tempest wether began waxe fayre clere apered robert ye hermyte ymage clere crystall sayd thu robert thou shalte issue escape parell thy company loue god hath herde thyne orison prayer sendeth worde thou shuldest make hast fraunce go kynge shewe thyne aduenture say vnto wyse enclyne haue peace aduersary kynge rycharde englande amonge treater peace preace thou forthe shewe thyne aduysyon thou shalte herde say suche contrary opinyon peace shall bye derely lyfe tyme worlde therwith ye clerenesse voyce vanysshed away robert abode great study remembred well hadde sene herde deuyne inspyracyon aduenture fayre wether wynde wysshynge aryued ryuer gennes robert hermyte toke leaue company went lande fro thence tyll came auygnon fyrst thynge dyd went churche saynt peter foude good vertuous man penytenser hym cofessed shewed hym aduenture demaunded counsayle best goostly father charged hym wyse shulde speke nothynge mater tyll shewed fyrste frenche kynge loke counsayle kynge dyd gyue robert folowed counsayle arayed hym selfe symple habyte gray poorely departed fro auygnon iourneyed longe came parys kynge abbeuyle treatie beganne balyngham bytwene frenche men englysshe men ye haue herde robert came abuyle drewe kynge knyght acquayntaunce brought kyng whiche knyght normandy called sir willyam martell kynges priuy chambre roberte hermyte shewed kynge hole iourney adueture kyng herde hym well bycause duke burgoyne syr raynolde corby chauncellour fraunce kynges opynyon haue peace balyngham ye treatie holden kynge sayd robert counsayle nowe nat balyngham ye shall abyde whan retourned shall speke myne vncle burgoyne chauncelloure shall mater shall aduyse syr quod robert god wyll weke frenche kynges counsayle returned fro balyngham abbeuyle brought artycles maner peace whiche englysshe men deuysed mater weyghty treatie put ouer tyll another daye vnto suche tyme bothe kynges aduertysed eche others demaundes pleasure therin knowen ye frenche partie frenche kynge drewe parte vncle burgoyne chauncellour shewed enfourmacyon robert hermyt made vnto kynge demaunded thynge lysytte lawfull beleue studyed lytell last sayde syr requyre youre grace lette v se hermyte hym speke thervpon wyll take aduyse sent whan came kynge made reuerence thanne kynge sayd roberte shewe v length hole mater ye enfourmed sir quod gladly nothynge abasshed rehersed hole mater ye haue herde whan doone departed kynge asked vncle best done syr quod chauncellour shall take aduyse agaynst morowe well quod kynge duke chauncellour counsayled togyther mater sawe well kynge greatly enclyned robertes wordes therfore thought good aduyse kynge ioyne robert comyssion go agayne balyngham treatie peace thought langage fayre swete shulde styrre harte shulde hym speke haue peace shewe deuyne vysion lordes englande thought lawfull ynough done nexte day shewed king whan duke chauncellour wente agayne balyngham roberte whan lordes frenche englysshe assembled togyder counsayle robert came well wisely declared vysion hadde see affermed inspyracyon deuyne sente god bycause wolde shulde lordes englande toke good hede mater enclyned therto duke lancastre erle salysbury lorde thomas percy bysshops lyncolne london duke gloucestre erle arundell toke hede set nothynge therby whan lodgynges sayd fantasy wordes fayned frenchman abuse howe determyned write kynge rycharde maner sayenge robert hermyte thervpon sent knyght called rycharde credon kynge rycharde founde kent castell leades delyuered letter sent fro ambassadours march calays wherin conteyned hole sayenge robert kynge tooke great pleasure letter sayd howe wolde gladly speke robert hermyte beleued vysion trouthe kyng wrote agayne duke lancastre erle salysbury myght meanes good peace myght taken bytwene hym frenche kynge realmes alyes sayde surely thought warre ouerlonge endured tyme haue peace ye haue herd howe treater bare lordes departed one fro another howe treuce taken endure foure yere entent lordes englyssh party except duke gloucestre thought whan euer came englande neuer agree peace bytwene fraunce englande dyssimuled moche might thentent please king brother lancastre thus meanes roberte le hermyte came knowledge ye haue herde erle rutlande therle marshall archebysshop dunelyn lorde hugh spenser lorde lewes clyfforde sent fraunce treate kynge rychardes maryage retourned agayne englande brought kynge good tydynges kynge well pleased ye haue herde mychelmas came generall cousayle began suche englysshe men call terme wherin mater debated begynnynge sayd terme duke lancastre returned gascon englande nat ben receyued thought shulde haue ye haue herde whan duke lancastre retourned kyng made hym good chere tydinges anone came fraunce howe duke lancastre retourned englande frenche kynge counsayle determyned sende robert hermyte englande letter kynge desyred se hym erle saynt poll shulde acquaynte hym ye kyng lordes myght hym speake busynesse surey tartary greate turke turkey ben longe thought lordes englande wolde gladly speakyng suche mater robert hermyte warned make hym redy go englande comyssion wherof greatly reioysed bycause neuer letter delyuered hym dyrected kyng englande vncles thus robert departed fro parys seuen horse cost charge frenche kynge rode tyll came boloyne tooke see aryued douer spedde iourneys came eltham founde kynge duke lancastre erles salysbury huntyngdon lorde thomas percy honour frenche kynge well receyued specyally kynge desyred greatly se hym delyuered letter credence whiche redde ouer kynge lordes duke gloucestre nat essex castell called plasshey whan robert kynge duke lancastre eltham fyue day departed then gose duke gloucestre toke leaue kynge lordes came london next day rode fyftene myle fro london towne called brendwode next day plasshey founde duke duchesse chyldren ryght goodly receyued hym acordyng degre robert delyuered hym letter sent fro frenche kyng whan duke sawe credence drewe robert parte demaunded credence robert aunswered hym sayd syr shall shewe therin good leyser nat come departe agayne soone well quod duke ye welcome robert knewe well ynough duke gloucestre sore dyslymulynge prince contrary peace thought harde breke hym fro opinyon knewe well alwaies contrary peace whiche well sene treaty balyngham neuer demaunded haue warre yet robert hermyte spared nat speke duke forme peace alwayes founde duke colde aunswers sayd mater lay nat hym two elder bretherne duke lancastre duke yorke whome mater partayned rather hym also wolde consent therto alone peraduenture lordes prelate counsaylours good townes wolde nat accepte well quod robert hermyte loue lorde ihesu christ ye nat contrarye peace ye maye moche also ye se well howe kyng nephue enclyneth peace wyll maryage haue frenche kynges doughter whiche coniunctyon shalbe gret alyaunce peace loue duke aunswered sayd though ye beleued herde tyme kynges lordes bothe realmes ye haue good audyece counsaylours mater hygh weyghty conuenyent greater personage ye shulde le therwith haue tolde often tymes haue said shall neuer contrary peace honoure kynge realme englande tyme paste peace taken bytwene king father brother prince wale kinge iohan frauce frenche party sworne bounde vppon payne sentence pope yet helde nat frenchman fraudulently haue broken couenauntes haue taken agayne possessyon landes lordeshyppes yelded delyuered peace makyng sayd souerayne lorde father predecessours moreouer xxx thousande frankes redempcyon mounted vnto yet paye syxe hudred thousande frankes wherfore mater remembre troubleth sore corages many realme marueyle greatly howe kynge souerayne lorde leaneth yonge aduyse counsayle regardeth none otherwyse tyme passed tyme present enclineth alye hym maryage aduersary alyaunce dysheryte crowne englande successours come ye clayme fraunce ah ryght dere lorde quod robert lorde iesu christ suffered passyon crosse v synners pardoned dethe crucyfied lykewyse man must pardon wyll come glory heuen sir yuell wylles hate rancoures pardoned daye peace made sealed calays predecessours nowe warres haue game newly renewed bytwene men thynke surely faulte bothe party whan prince wale duke acquytayne retourned spayne acquytayne certayne maner people callyng themselfe companyons wherof moste partye englysshe men gascons holdynge kynge englande prince wale people assembled togyther entred realme fraunce without tytell reason wherby ensued mortall eruell warre greater companyons called realme fraunce chambre set yuell dedes yt coude nat resysted whan ye realme frauce sawe felte harmed people sawe well lengar contynewed multyplyed hurte dyd kyng charles frauce sonne kyng iohan cousayled subgiettes resyst subdue suche enemyes outher warre otherwyse many great baron gascoyne came frenche kyng suche said sore ouerlayde lorde prince wale many iniuryes done whiche shewed frenche kynge might nat wolde nat suffre lenger beganne warre bycause resorte prince wale kynge charles counsayle subgiettes enhardyed himselfe warre barones gascoyn mete companyons newe warre many lordes retourned frenche kynge dyuers lordeshyppes cyties townes castels great oppression prince wale dyd consented done comyssioners thus warre renewed wherby many great myschyefes haue fallen dystruction moche people countreys faythe christ sore febled decayed enemyes god ryssen coraged haue redy conquered moche parte grece emperour constantynople hath nat power resyst puyssauce great turke called basant lamorabaquyn hathe conquered realme armony excepte onely towne standynge see syde called tourche whiche venysians genouoys kepe agaynst ye turke emperour constantyne noble blode sonne emperoure hugues luzignen lady mary burbon cosyn germayne lady quene mother shall nat able longe resyst puyssauce gret turke peace maye bytwene englande fraunce trust grace god shall knyghtes squyers suche demaunde dedes armes aduauncement shall drawe parte shall helpe kynge lyon armony recouer agayne herytage put turkes surely warre hath ouerlonge endured bytwene fraunce englande surely euer wyll peace shall derely aunswere therto outher quycke deed howe knowe quod duke gloucestre syr quod robert say cometh dyuyne inspyracyon vysione came vpon see retourned fro baruch porte surey besyde isle rodes declared hole vysion rather therby moue duke herte pytie reason duke herde herted agaynst peace kept styll opynion wordes condempned dispysed greatly frenche men yt euer robert hermyte coude say bycause robert strau ger shewed wordes werkes wolde well also bycause duke sawe kyng nephue enclyned haue peace dyssymuled spake fayre euer herte thought two dayes robert taryed plasshey duke good chere thyrde day departed retourned london fro thence wyndesore kynge made hym good chere loue frenche kyng sent thyder bycause wyse eloquet swete wordes honest nat doubted kynge demauded hym howe founde vncle duke glocestre robert answered well poynte kyng knewe well vncle gloucestre enclyned rather warre peace wherfore fauoured moche better two vncles duke lancastre yorke whan robert hermyte ben moneth king toke leaue departynge kynge gaue hym great gyftes dyd duke lancastre yorke erles huntyngdon salysbury lorde thomas percy kynge caused hym conueyed douer passed ouer fraunce founde frenche kyng quene vncles paris shewed kinge voyage good chere englande thus dayly messangers went bytwene two kynges amyable letter sent bytwene kynge englande desyred nothyng moche come maryage semblably frenche kynge lyke desyre thought doughter shulde great estate might quene englande pof delyueraunce lorde de la ryuer syr iohan le mercyer howe put prisone cap ccv ye haue herde howe ye lorde de la ryuer sir iohan le mercyer ieoperdy lyues remoued fro prison prison laste delyuered prouost chatelet parys poynte lose lyues hate enuye duke berrey burgoyne counsayle daunger two yere kyng socoured always stopped execusion duke berrey burgoyne sawe well also perceyued duke orlyaunce ayded moche might also duches berrey good meane specially ye lorde de la ryuer also one coulde nat condempned without accused one cause prayer good folkes ryght togyther ayded theym regarded many high barones frauce pytie sayd suffred prisonement ouerlonge tyme shewe grace iohan le mercyer moche wept prison yt syght sore decayed coude scant se brute ranne realme blynd last sentence gyuen grace kynge lorde de la ryuer restored agayne landes castels ye fayre castell aniou charged payne lyfe whan one castell aniowe shuld neuer repasse ryuer sayne without comaunded kynges owne mouthe syr iohan le mercyer retourne poute de nonnon fayre house laonnoys nat repasse ryuer oyse marne seyne without lykewyse called kynges owne mouth thus bounde selfe take prisonment thought great grace scape well ryght ioyouse whan delyuered fro chatelet trusted whan came prison haue spoken ye kynge haue thanked hym grace coulde nat suffred comaunded auoyde parys resorte thyder comauded thus delyuered wherof frendes great ioy
