pof peace hadde bytwene duke bretayne sir olyuer clysson cap ccvi ye haue herde howe duke bretayne syr olyuer clisson warred longe togyther mortally bytwene toke none mercy surely syr olyuer clysson partie bare valyautly thre twayne lordes bretaygne dyssimnied duke men cyties good townes sayde howe must nedes lyue vse marchaundyse euer warre bytwene duke syr olyuer clysson sayd touched nothinge wherfore wolde nat entermed e bytwene euer vycount rohan lorde de leo lorde dignan treated peace bytwene moch pursewed duke promysed entreated myght se syr olyuer presence speke thervpon lordes day rode fortresse syr olyuers speke shewed cause come thyder howe got graut duke sende safeconducte safely go come speke hym sayeng yt surely thought one presence yuell wyll displeasure shulde clerely pardoned sir olyuer sayd sir ye frendes louers trust great lye beleue duke hath promysed saye thynke wolde gladly se presece good helpe saynt yue vpon worde promise ensure wyll nat one issue house shall tell ye shall saye hym wyll haue come hym let hym sende hyder pledge eldest sonne whan thane wyll go speke hym suche ende shall make sonne shall make yf retourne shall lykewise abyde shall abide whan lordes sawe coude haue none ende tooke leaue retourned wannes duke shewed euery thynge herde duke coude haue none waye sir olyuer bare hym selfe valyauntly warre wanne lost toke two tymes duke vessell plate golde syluer dyuers iewelles wherof hadde great profyte conclusyon warre hate bytwene duke bretayne sir olyuer clysson thus duke bretayne lyke great lorde sawe well coude nat come entent sir olyuer clysson ouer many frendes bretayne sauyng alegiauce ye duchy bretayne breton knyghtes squyers prelate men good cyties good townes enclyned lorde clysson duke highe baron dissymuled aunswered duke wolde nat entremedle warre sayde wolde gladly sette peace accorde bytwene also duke orlyaunce specially conforted couertly many maner wayes sir olyuer clysson alwayes ioyous whan herde good spede entreprices duke bretaygne subtyle prince ymaginatyfe endured moche payne duryng warre sawe well nat well beloued owne people chyldren lorde charles bretayne one called charles bloyes slayne batayle alroy iohn bretayne erle ponthieur lymogines wyfe doughter sir olyuer clisson lorde henry bretayne brother suster quene naples hierusalem also duke sawe began waxe olde chyldren yonge ceyued well frendes frauce except duke burgoyne duches wyfe sawe well chyldren shulde haue fewe mother syde came issued membres braunches nauer whiche generacion nat ouermoche loued fraunce great myscheues yt kynge charles nauerre father duchesse bretayne done tyme past fraunce wherof remembraunce endured duke sawe dyed estate bothe sir olyuer clisson erle ponthieur douted chyldren yonge shulde haue ouer many great enemyes also sawe alyaunce bytwene hym englande began waxe colde enformed kynge englande shulde haue wyfe doughter frauce thesame lady promysed hym sonne heyre duke dyde cast doutes thane thynges consydered ymagined breke herte without dissimulacion make ferme peace sir olyuer clysson iohan bretayne wolde putte hym selfe pleasure make amendes wrathes forfaytes domages euer dyde hym men duryng warre wolde desyre nothynge shulde take hym duke bretayne child hym accordyng artycles peace made bytwene hym chyldren sir charles bloyes whiche charter peace wolde nat breke artycle comprised therin also kepe vpholde euery thyng promysed iohn bloyes cosyn erle poponthieur hadde nat parte herytage bretayne suffycient wolde putte ordring therof without dissymulacion vicount rohan lordes dignan leon lauall beaumont lorde iohn harpeden whan duke bretayne aduysed hym selfe purpose without makynge man counsayle called hym secratorie chabre two alone caused hym write letter sir olyuer clysson swetely amiably coude deuysed desyring hym might speke toguyder secretely trust haue good peace bytwene whan letter made deuysed sealed toke secrete person comaundyng hym go castell iosselyn saye sende speke cosyn sir olyuer clysson salute hym fro delyuer hym letter bring agayne answere payne thy ly e kepe secrete shewe creature whider thou gost dothe sende tooke iourney spedde hym well cae castell iosselyn porter marueyle whan herde hym saye cae fro duke speke maister wente shewed lorde therof comaunded messanger shulde coe hym dyde well wisely declared message delyuered letter sealed duke seale whiche sir olyuer knewe ryght well opyned reed letter two thre tymes better vnderstande redyng great marueyle swete wordes cretable amyable comprised letter studyed season last sayd howe wolde take aduyse write agayne sir olyuers men hadde great marueyle forborne man duke outher slayne putte prisone thane sir olyuer wente lecrete chambre began muse ymagyn vpon newes last apesed yuell wyll ye duke humyled hymselfe moche towardes wrote swetely yet thought hym selfe proue duke aduentured hym selfe go duke thought toke hurte man wolde bewayle hym lost hym selfe folly wrote letter duke ryght swete tretable conclusyon yf wolde haue hym come speke hym shuld sende sone heyre lye hostage hym tyll retourne letter delyuered duke varlet retourned therwith wannes duke delyuered letter duke reed studyed lytell sayd shall entence treate louyngly hym duke wrote letter vycount rohan castell cayre whan vycount sawe duke letter came incontynent wannes duke shewed purpose entencyon sayd vycount lorde mountbursier shall leade sone castell iosselyn leaue hym bringe lorde olyuer clysson wyll agree make peace hym vicout sayd shulde done gladly toke duke sonne heyre age eight yere ledde hym ye castell iosselyn lorde olyuer clysson receyued ryght honorably whan sawe chylde good affection duke humyled apesed herte greatlye knyghtes tolde hym sayd sir ye se good wyll duke hath spoken nothyng hert dothe agre se well quod sir olyuer se ceyue good wyll shall put farforthe shall yelde vnder obeysaunce semeth ye ryght nere hym seynge putteth affiaunce trust delyuer heyre bringe lye hostage tyll retourned wotte nat haue shewed hath written sygned sealed seale lordes answered said sir hath well tolde v hath ryght great desyre come peace accorde ye maye right well beleue v blode thane sir olyuer went letter duke sent hym reed sir quod conteyned letter hath said vnto v vpon estate hath sent v hyder sir olyuer ordaygned hym departe sayd lordes toke duke sonne agayne said howe shulde bringe agayne chylde father sayeng trusted right well myse co sydring proued hym farre shewed suche humilyte douted nat herte vnyte came wannes duke apoynted sir olyuer shulde tary freres without towne wannes duke shulde come speke hym ordayned done whan duke sawe sir olyuer brought agayne sonne heyre reputed great curtesy well content therwt thus duke sir olyuer mette freres two alone entred chambre comuned toguyder season issued gardeyn came ryuer syde entred bote fro then entred shyppe laye ancre whan farre fro people comuned longe season toguyder wordes knowe nat dealynge shall shewe men went hadde styll freres shewed thus shyppe two houres made good peace bytwene sware faythe trouth eche without dissymulacyon called agayne ye boteman brought agayne entred agayne gardeyne syde freres anone duke cae ledde sir olyuer clysson ye hande went towne wannes castell called le mote peace euery man greatly reioysed se amiably togyder countrey makyng peace iohn bloyes erle ponthieur lost nat reuenewes therby augmented twetie thousande crownes golde yere euer hym heyres peace maryage ordayned ye duke bretaynes doughters confyrme better loue alyaunces bytwene great newes ran fraunce englande peace ye haue herde howe sir peter craon fell frenche kynges displeasure duke orlyaunce bycause sir olyuer clysson wolde haue slayne hym nyght went house warde howe duke bretayne susteyned hym house whiche occasyon freche kyng wolde haue made warr agaynst duke sickenesse tooke hym nat whiche incydentes kynges army brake vp also ye haue herde howe duke berrey burgoyne bare great displeasure suche counsayled kyng therto sir olyuer clysson lorde de la ryuer lorde iohan le mercyer montague afterwarde endured therby great prisonment howe two duke gouernauce realme long kynge sickenesse also hath ben shewed mortall warre bytwene duke bretaygne sir olyuer clysson also howe lordes de la ryuer sir iohan mercyer montague delyuered prisone whiche montague nat moche trouble soone kyng returned helth toke mo tague agayne hym made excuse reason sodrie sickenesses kyng dyuers tymes gretly troubled realme frauce moche abated kynges puissaunce nat euery thyng done accordyuge wyll season sir peter craon nothyng displeased kynges sickenesse trouble counsayle hadde howe made sute retourne agayne kynges fauour loue duke burgoyne lorde guy tremoyle aduocates treate hym lightly peace made duke orlyaunce nat ben letted treatie longe hate eudured bytwene sir olyuer clysson duke bretaygne sir peter craon coude come peace accorde wha surely knowen pea made bytwene duke sir olyuer tha quarell agaynst sir peter craon molyfied well apeased season quene iane naples hierusalem duches aniou plee parlyament agaynst sir peter craon ye cm frakes lady lay styll paris better entende busynesse sir peter craon yt sawe hym selfe yt dager sute lyament knewe nat howe busynesse shulde passe outher hym agaynst hym ladyes partie strong good profe receyued money dayes kyng loyes husbade thynges cosydred ymagyned yt nat easy beare also knewe well hate frenche kyng duke orlyaunce duke duchesse burgoyne coforted ayded hym asmoche myght gate suche grace paris secretly house arthoys duches burgoyne pnowe shall leaue speke hym tyme phowe kyng hungry wrote frenche kynge state great turke howe iohn burgoyn eldest sonne duke burgoyne chefe heed army went thider cap ccvi sayd season ry kyng hugry sent swete amyable letter ye fre che king notable ambassade bysshop ii knightes hungry letter coteyned great parte ye state doyng great turke sent worde kynge hungry yt wolde come fight hym ye myddes realme wolde go fro then cytie rome wolde make horse eare otes vpon high auter saynt peter holde see imperyall wolde bringe emperour constantyne noble copany great baron realme grece eche kepe styll owne lawe desyred nothynge tytell signorie thus kyng hugry letter prayed frenche kyng entende ayde socour businesse farre coutreis might publisshed abrode thentent knightes squyers myght prouyde come hungry resyst agaynst lamorabaquy great turke thentent yt christendome shulde nat violated pride bost myght abated letter conteygned many wordes great loue kynges cosyns write eche case necessyte sente suffycient personage dyde moche frenche kynge enclyned hert therto gladder sette forwarde treatie ye mariage doughter kynge englande anone newes hungry publysshed abrode written many countreis moue hertes gentylmen knightes squiers suche wolde auaunce get honour season newes brought kyng parys duke burgoyne duchesse iohan burgoyne sonne heyre erle neuers knyght lorde guye tremoyle lorde wyllyam brother many lordes realme fraunce duke burgoyne enclyned sore viage specially sone shulde enterprice sayd voyage myght chefe heed leader army shulde go viage iohan burgoyne yonge man age xxii yeres wyse curtesse tretable humble welbeloued knyghtes squyers burgone nacyons suche knewe hym wyfe doughter duke aubert bauier erle heynalte hollande zelade good lady wyse deuout two chyldren full lykely come great maryages one shewed iohan burgoyne howe frenche kyng wolde sende hym voyage hungry se wolde saye sayd pleace kynge duke father sende chiefe armye shall please ryght well haue great desyre auaunce selfe well sir quod ye best speke duke youre father maye speke kynge without good wyll ye nothynge nat long iohan burgoyne spake father prayeng hym humbly consent yt myght go voyage hungry tyme hym sir guye sir wyllyam tremoyle said duke sir request sonne maketh resonable tyme take order knighthode nobly nat take goyng iourney agaynst enemyes holy churche kynge wyll sende personage voyage nat sende honorable man thane owne cosyn germayne sonne ye shall se many knyghtes go hym well owne auaucementes loue duke said well shall nat lette good wyll sonne shall speke kyng therin shall se answere wyll make anone duke spake kynge therin kynge incontynent enclyned therto sayd howe shulde well done went wyll shall go wyll make hym chefe iourney ye tidyng shewed throughe parys without iohan burgoyne great company knyghtes shulde go hungry se puyssaunce great turke iourney atchyued thanne christen men go constatyne noble passe ouer arme saynt george entre surrey delyuer hierusalem panyms handes awaked suche knyghtes squyers desyred aduauncement whan duke burgoyne sawe sonne shulde go voyage shulde chiefe army honored ambassadours hungry whan sawe kynges good wyll duke frenchman gladde toke leaue kynge lordes fraunce retourned countrey made relacyon ye kyng hungry howe spedde wherwith kynge greatly reioysed made great prouisyon agaynst comynge frenche men sent ambassadours brother kyng almaigne open passage also cosyn duke austriche throughe straytes austryche muste nedes passe wayes caused great prouisyon vitayle ordayned also wrote letter great mayster pruce rhodes certifyeng comyng iohan burgoyne thousande knyghtes squiers valyant men entent entre turkey resyst great bost kyng basant called great turke season lorde coucy come parys newlye retourned fro voyage hadde ben hole yere whiche fronters gene certayne great men genowayes enformed ye duke orlyaunce hoole duchy geane desyred haue chiefe lorde noble persone discended lynage flour delyce moche duke orlyaunce wedded doughter lorde myllaygne lande duchy geane shulde ryght mete hym duke orlyaunce instaunce lorde coucy thre hudred speares fyue hudred cro bowes passed ouer sauoye pyemont accorde consent erle sauoye came aste pyemont consent lorde myllayne came cytie called alexandria came fronters marchesse genowayes fell treatie know playnly entecyons force coulde nothyng without greatier puissaunce whan lorde coucy came first vpon fronters ryuer geane entree stronge conquere made defence lordes genowayes suche fauoured lorde coucy enformed duke orlyaunce wherby sente thyder lorde coucy entreated amiably brought hym coutreis offred hym castels lorde coucy sage subtyle ymaginatyfe knewe right well nature lombardes genowayes wolde nat trust ouermoche haue great confydence offer promyses alwayes wysely helde loue amyte longe amonge ledde forthe fayre wordes treaty many comunycacyons felde toguyder neuer fortresse euer comuned theym lesse conquered gate genouoys made sygne loue promysed hym many thynges wolde haue hym haue gone cytie gennes porte vender lorde coucy durst neuer assure hym offer conclusyon voyage suche gate nothynge whan sawe coulde nat atcheue busynesse signyfied estate duke orlyance whervpon remaunded retourned parys came thyder season busynesse iourney goynge hungery duke burgoyne reioysed greatly retourne duchesse sente hym house arthoyse sygne great loue sayd syr trust moche haue caused iohan sonne heyre take hym enterprise ye honour god christendome knowe well aboue knyghtes fraunce ye moste vsed expert thynges wherfore derely requyre ye wolde companion sonne voyage chyefe counsaylour wherof shall thanke deserue lorde coucy said lorde madame wordes requestes ought comaundement voyage shall go please god two cause first deuocyon defende faythe ihesu christ secondly ye somoche honour gyue charge lorde iohan sonne shall acquyte truely power howe dede ye may well dyscharge charge specyally cosyn nere kynesman lorde phylyppe arthoys erle ewe constable fraunce cosyn erle marche bothe two ought go hym voyage nere blode duke sayd lorde coucy ye haue moche sene twayn haue knowe better orderynge army straunge countreys outher cosyn ewe march therfore charge praye execute requestes aunswered sayd lorde prayer comaundement shall sythe pleaseth ayde helpe lorde guye tremoyle lorde guillyam brother admyrall fraunce answere duke duchesse great ioye lordes prepared selues go iourney hugery lordes knyghtes squyers desyred go company many desyred themselfe go retaygned went without maysters consyderynge voyage hungery fro thence turkey ouer longe chargeable beynge nat retaygned waxed colde enterpryse settynge forwarde yonge iohan burgoyne nothynge spared horse harnesse fresshe clothes riche vessell plate golde syluer offycers apoynted atendauce money delyuered werke men payed barones knightes squiers honour iohn burgoyne also auauncement body enforced make redy lorde phylyppe arthoys ordeyned hym puyssauntly nothynge spared wolde go voyage constable fraunce frenche kynge loued entierlye helped hym moche towarde charge dyd lorde boucyquant marshall fraunce duke burgoyne consydered voyage sonnes shulde coste ouermoche fynaunce thought conuenyent state sonne shulde mayntayned fynde syluer mayntayne withall foude subtelly backe tayle former tayle countreys cyties fortress ben tayled said backe tayle mounted burgoyne chyuallry syxe hundred thousande crownes golde agayne duke made tolde knyghtes ladyes helde fee yonge olde shulde go hungery owne propre persones sonne el paye taxe syluer taxed thousande poude fyue hundred frankes eche man goodes valure landes ladyes auncyent knyghtes remembringe traueyle bodyes nat shapen made endure suche payne conpou ded payed wyll duke yonge knyghtes squyers forborne payeng money said shulde go lorde iohan owne coste charge otherwyse nat backe tayle duke reysed lx thousade crownes none forborne tydynges voyage spredde abrode whan came countrey haynalt knyghtes squyers suche desyred auauncement spake togyther sayde mete voyage lorde ostrenant yonge brother erle neuers wente myght well go company erle ostrenant beynge tyme quesnoy vnderstode knyghtes squyers countrey sayde thought lesse tha dyd great affectyon go voyage whan herde spekyng mater wolde answere lytell dyssymuled mater good entencyon speke duke aubert bauyer erle haynalt wolde counsayle hym within whyle erle ostrenant came hay holande father duchesse wyfe sayd father lorde suche tydinges rynneth abrode fayre brother neuers hathe enterprised somer go hungery fro then turkey whereby lykelyhode great dedes armes shall atchyued syr tyme wotte nat better enploye myselfe dede armes wherin wolde gladly knowe youre pleasure wolde go honourable voyage hundred knyghtes beare company fayre brother duke burgoyne lady duches shall gret thanke many knyghtes squyers haynalt wyll gladly holde company duke aubert man redy purueyed aunswere sayd guylliam haste wyll haue go voyage hungery turkey seke armes vpon people countrey neuer dyd v forfeyte thou hast tytell reason go vayneglory worlde lette iohan burgoyne cosins fraunce enterprise thy dedes aparte go thou frese conquere herytage fresones pride rudenes witholde fro v wyll come none obeysaunte shall ayde wordes father sonne lyghtened greatly herte therle ostrenant aunswered sayd lorde ye saye well please shall voyage shall ryght good wyll phowe erle ostrenant enterprised go frese cap ccvii word bytwene father sonne multyplyed moche lytell lytell voyage frese taken enter prised one thynge helped moche matter forwarde erle ostrenant tyme aboute hym nere counsayle squyer haynalte called ferebrase otherwise called bastarde vertayne wyse man subtyll feates armes whan herd said erle syr lorde father speketh well better honour ye make voyage rather hungery ordayne therto ye shall fynde knyghtes squyers haynalt elswhere wyll gladde kepe company shall ayde power enterprise ye haue mynde thus wyll counsayle go englade signyfy enterprise knyghtes squyers pray kynge englande cosyn wyll gyue lycence knyghtes squyers archer go frese wage englysse men men dedes ye haue ye shall businesse better ye may haue prayer cosyn therle derby company voyage shall moche fayrer enterprise renomed erle enclyned wordes semed hym counsayle good lykewyse lorde gomegynes gaue hym counsayle dyd dyuers wordes anone spredde abrode haynalte acommaundement made knyghtes squiers heynalt none theym shulde go coutrey go hungrey place el bycause erle ostrenant shulde ocupy another waye shulde leade frese shall leaue speakynge busynesse retourne voyage hungery thus knyghtes squiers many party cause awake take corage ye warres towarde season well voyage hungery frese erle neuers auaunced iourney knyghtes squyers named written shulde go prouision great well ordeyned wolde renomed voyage lyberall mad great large many knyghtes squyers shulde go bande voyage long costely wherfore nedefull haue ayde towardes charge lordes constable frauce erles ewe marche lordes henry phylippe bare lorde coucy lorde guy tremoyle lorde iohan vyen admyrall fraunce boucyquant marshall fraunce raynolde du roy lordes saynt powle mutterell saynte pye hasell flaunders lorde loys brese brother le bourge montquell nombre thousande knyghtes thousande squyers valyaunt men euery man departed fro owne house myddes marche rode forth companyes alwayes founde wayes open kynge almayne comauded realme almayne boesme shulde haue thynges necessary vytayle shulde witholden fro lordes frauce thus rode forwarde ayde kyng hungery shulde haue batayle great turke puyssaunce agaynst puyssaunce twenty day moneth may lordes passed lorayne countie bare countie mountbelyart duchy burgoyn entred ausay passed coutrey ryuer ryn many place countie fierte entered austriche whiche great coutrey entres issue stronge great desertes went good wyll corage payne traueyle greued nothyng duke austriche made capytaynes countrey suche made lordes good chere specyally iohn burgoyne chiefe army lordes apoynted assemble cytie hungery called bode pnowe let v speke mater ye haue herde howe kynge england sente season suffycient ambassade frenche kyng counsayle haue wyfe isabell doughter fraunce whiche ambassadours archebysshop duuelyn bysshoppe wynchester erle marshall erle rutlande sonne duke yorke lorde henry clyfforde lorde beamonde lorde spenser many frenche kyng made good chere vncles counsayls whiche ambassade retourned englande vpon good hope atayne desyres kynge englande parte wynter folowynge often tymes sent frenche kynge consernynge sayd mater well enclyned haue peace haue ende warre whiche ouer longe endured pursutes treaty toke suche effect two kynges writen solemply eche mater drewe nere apoynte suche ambassadours fyrst sent englande fraunce sente agayne came parys lodged crosse tyroner men streat aboute nombre syxe hundred thus soiourned parys thre wekes pof iudgemet made parlyament quene napoles agaynst syr peter craone cap ccix seasone englysshe men paris quene iane duches aniowe wrote selfe quene napoles iherusalem parys pursued dylygently busynesse lady great corage pleted parlyament two cause fyrst herytage countie roussey agaynst erle brayne loys duke aniou lorde husbande bought payed lady coutesse roussey somtyme wyfe lorde loys namure afterwarde deuorsed fro hym reasonable cause sayde seconde sute quene agaynst syr peter craon demaunded hym hundred thousande frankes whiche redy proue receyued name lord mayster loys kyng napoles cysyll iherusalem husbande whiche money delyuered hym haue payed powell payed herde howe sayd mayster husbande deed iourneyed returned agayne fraunce kept styll sayd money owne profyte neuer made acompte sayde quene therof chyldren loys charles spente wasted money pride bobbans quene layde charge faute payment sayd money realme napoles loste conquered margarete dura heyres lorde charles de la paix reason suche soudyours husbande mayntayne warres puell calabre nat payed wage wherby many tourned erle saynt seuyre margarete dura departed lefte warres cause put parlyament chambre parys cause preposed shewed demaunded defence aunsweres herde partyes plee endured space thre yeres though syr peter craon absent fro parlyament yet aduocates defended cause sayd though recyued sayd name lorde mayster yet mayster moche bounde came good seruyce done plee endured longe necessary haue conclusyon lady made importunate sewte haue iudgement lordes parlyament consydred thynges sayd wolde gyue iudgement without party present syr peter craon durste nat well apere parys bycause kynges dyspleasure duke orlyance offence doone syr olyuer clysson constable fraunce without present wolde gyue sentence defynityue wher vpon sayd lady pursewed set hym clere fraunce meanes pardoned myght ryde go lyst without daunger except sute bytwene hym sayd money clerely dyscharged charge lordes ladyes made hym good chere wote nat whether dissymulacyon otherwyse thus agayne parys holdynge great estate euer dyd tyme apoynted one theym receyue bringe englysshe ambassadours kynge knyght hadde sene moche knewe moche honoure daye prefyxed iudgement concernynge quenes mater shulde determyned whiche day present parlyament great nombre lordes fraunce entent mater shulde autentyke quene cicyll iherusalem sonne charles prince thaurent iohan bloys called iohan bretaygne erle ponthyeure lymogynes duke orlyaunce berrey burgoyne burhone erle brayne bysshoppe laon theym lady herde laye tytell countie roussey parte syr peter craon many lygnage fyrste iudgement gyuen countye roussey herytage remyssed iudged handes possessyon erle brayne heyres shulde dyscende ryght braunche roussey reserued quene shulde haue agayne repayed money kynge loys husbande hadde payed countesse roussey laste deed iudgement enherytours countie roussey herytage pertayned thanked greatly lordes parliament suche ordayned gyue seconde sentence arose vp sayde howe sentence parlyament sir peter craon ought pay quene napoles duchesse aniowe somme hundred thousande frankes redy money el body go prysone tyll contented satysfyed iudgement sayde lady thanked lordes parlyament contynent co playnte lady handes layde kynges commaundement ledde castell loure surely kepte lordes departed fro parlyament thus two iudgementes gyuen princypall occasyon lady duchesse aniou pof conclusyon maryage aken parys bytwene kynge englande isabell eldest doughter frenche kynge howe duke lancastre remaryed cap ccx ambassadours englande frenche kynge parys xxii dayes good chere coulde deuysed mater tooke suche effecte agreed kyng englande shuld haue maryage isabell eldest doughter kynge charles vertue procuracyon erle marshall fyaunced espoused name kinge englande called fro then forthe quene englande enfourmed goddly syght se behauour yonge ryght plesauntly bare porte quene mater concluded englysshe men tooke leaue frenche kynge quene doughter quene englande lordes departed fro parys retourned calays englande kynge opynyon glad retourne euer gladde maryage duke gloucestre vncle kynge made ioye sawe well reasone maryage alyaunce peace shulde bytwene kinges realmes whiche greued hym without shulde greatly honour kynge realme englande englysshe men myght case better party gascoyne warres renewed agayne matter wolde often tymes speke brother duke yorke drewe hym moche coulde opynions softe prince duke lancastre eldest brother durste nat speke ouer largely sawe well kynges opynion well pleased kynges maryage princypally loue two doughters quene spaygne quene portugale season duke lancastre remaryed agayne thyrde tyme lady doughter knyght haynalte called syr paon ruette ben tyme noble quene phylyp englande nacyon haynalt called katheryn brought vp youthe duke lancaster howse duchesse blaunce lancastre dethe lady blaunce duke maryed lady custaunce spaygne dayes duke kepte concubyne lady katheryne ruet hadde maryed knyght englande deed duke thre chyldren two sonnes doughter eldest called iohan otherwyse lorde beauforde lancastre duke loued hym entyerly called thomas duke brought vp asque good clerke connynge bothe lawes great iuryst legyst bysshoppe lyncolne duke lancastre loue chyldren wedded mother lady katheryn ruet wherof moche marueyle bothe englande fraunce base lynage regarde two wyues whan knowledge maryage duke lady kateryne ruet come great ladyes englande duchesse gloucestre countesse derby countesse arundell ladyes dyscended blode royall englande meruayled moche layd gret blame duke dede sayde howe duke lancastre greatly dysprayse mary concubyne reason therof shulde seconde person honoure englande wherby sayd quene shulde shamefully acompanyed sayde howe surely wolde nat come place shulde presente ouer sayde shulde great shame theym suche duchesse come base blode concubyne duke wyfes dayes shulde go haue preemynence sayde hertes shulde breke sorowe bothe duke gloucestre duchesse wyfe spake mater sayd howe duke lancastre nat wyse fowle ouersene marry concubyne sayde wold neuer honoure call suster duke yorke passed ouer lyghtly ynough euer lyghtly resydente aboute kynge duke lancastre duke gloucestre nother maner sette man though yongest brother orgulous presumptuous maner therto enclyned nature alwayes agaynst kynges opynions counsaylours thus lady kateryne ruet duchesse lancastre seconde persone englande moche aboute kynge knewe moche honour youth dayes ben brought vp therin duke loued greatly chyldren shewed well lyfe dethe ye haue herde howe iugement parliament gyuen agaynst syr peter craon howe condempned hundred thousande frankes payed quene napoles whan sayde syr peter sawe howe condempned sore abasshed outher muste paye el abyde styll prisoner counsayled duke burgoyne duchesse yt shulde requyre yonge quene englande meane hym quene napoles myght released oute prysone fyftene dayes go abrode parys sewe frendes pay fynauce el fynd surety tyll myght go bretaygne gather amonge frendes desyre yonge quene englande quene napoles contente shulde go day abrode paris nyght alwayes yelde hymselfe prisoner castell lowre remayne night rate went abrode sewed many blode frendes coulde fynde none wolde abyde prisoner hym great ende fyftene dayes fayne returne prisoner bothe day nyght kept streyghter cost charge nowe lette v lytell speke iourney therle neuers lordes fraunce dyd somer hungery shall speke goynge frese erle haynalte erle ostrenaunt erle neuers company many valyaunt men fraunce countreys whan come hungery great cytie called bode kyng hungery made good chere well deserued come farre se entensyon kynge sette forwarde puyssaunce ayde fraunce entre felde fyrste newes fro great turke called lamorabaquy sent hym worde moneth february surely wolde hungery ende moneth maye wolde passe water dunce whiche message many great marueyle sayde manner nothynge man maye consyderynge turke valyaunt puyssaut desyreth moche dedes armes therfore sythe hath said lykelyhode wyll passe nat dunce come hyther syde lette v passe ouer entre turkey puyssauce kynge hungery suche ayde hath straungers shall well make hundred thousande men suche nombre suche men well able conquere turkey go empyre perce may haue one iourney vyctory vpon great turke shall lyst shall conquere surey holy lande iherusalem shall delyuer fro handes sodayne enemyes god somer nexte commynge frenche kynge kynge englande wyll conioyne togyther shall reyse vp great nombre men armes archer shall fynde passage open receyue nothyng shall abyde v shall conquered put oure obeysaunce whan shall go togyther thus deuysed frenche men realme hungery whan moneth may come trustynge tydynges lamorabaquy greate turke kynge hungery sent passage ryuer dunce sent realme assemble puissaunce togyder lordes rodes came hym strongly moneth may taryed comyng sarazyns tydynges coulde herde kynge hungery sente suche knewe countrey beyonde ryuer dunce serche haue tydynges great turke suche wente sertched countrey beyonde brase saynt george march alexaundre dama antyoche coulde newes lamorabaquy none army towarde retourned shewed king herde sene kynge assembled counsayle called lordes fraunce desyred dedes armes kyng shewed howe sente men turkey haue knowlege enemy dyd howe coulde tydinges lamorabaquy lykelyhode aprochyng ye promesse made passe dunce entre hugery sight crysten men mydde may shulde passe wherfore kynge demaunded counsayle wolde gyue hym lorde coucy sayd syr though lamorabaquy come nat forwarde acordynge promesse maketh ape therof yet ought nat lette v dedes armes pursue enemyes seynge assembled yt purpose thus frenchman almayns straungers shewed well howe great desyre seke lamorabaquy fyght whiche great honour lorde coucyes wordes affyrmed straungers opynyons howe coulde enploye season tyme better ordeyned kynge marshalles euery man shulde prepare hymselfe redy sette forwarde daye assygned whiche vtas saynt iohan baptyst offycers seruauntes aparelled maisters thynges necessary frenche men thynkynge fresshe gay spared nouther golde syluer departure fro bode soueraygne cytie hungery goodly regarde constable hungery vowarde great nombre hungaryons almayns bycause knewe countreys nexte hym rode frenche menne constable fraunce erle de la marche lorde coucy syr henry syr phylyppe bare dyuers kynge rode great lordes countrey reasone besyde kyng rode iohan burgoyne often tymes deuysed kyng felde threscore thousande horse hadde fewe foote sauynge suche folowers company crysten men noble well ordred hungery many crosebowes horsebacke army iourneyed longe came ryuer dunce passed ouer shyppes barge suche bridge ordeyned purpose eight dayes passed ouer passed lodged theym euery company taryenge ryuer dunce departeth ye realmes hungery turkey sonder whan christen men ouer nothynge taryed behynde froters turkey greatlye reioysed desyred greatly dedes armes toke counsayle determyned go ley siege towne turkey called coniecte ordayned dyde besieged myght well stode playne countrey ryuer ioynynge shyppes theron called necte heed comynge turkey fallynge see ryuer dunce ryuer dunce great ryuer thre hundred myles length fro begynnynge tyll entre see whiche moost profytable ryuer worlde realme hu gry shyppes theron myght issue therof see nat mouthe therof whan shulde issue see ryuer mou tayne whiche departeth ryuer two te maketh suche brute noyse maye well herde seuyn myle cause shyppe yt dare aproche nere longe ryuer syde fayre medowes pasture wherby countrey well serued dyuers vynes whiche seasone make good wynes whiche turkes make putte goot skynnes selleth vnto christen men accordyng lawe dare drinke wyne knowen defended payne lyfe eate reysynges haue good frutes spyces wherof make drinke vse greatly drinke gootes mylke whiche refressheth theym hote season thus kynge hungry hoost lodged cytie coniecte ease pleasure manne troubled siege whan came cytie foude frutes rype whiche great pleasure made cytie dyuers assautes within defended selfe trustyng dayly haue ayde socour lamorabaquy lorde reyse siege puyssaunce dyde nat wherby cytie taken force assaute distroyed great slaughter men woman chyldren christen men entred hadde mercy pytie whane cytie thus wonne kyng hungry dislodged wente forwarde turkey determyned go ley siege great cytie called nicopoly rode foude waye towne quayre layde siege fyftene dayes finallye assaute clene distroyed passed forthe waye founde another towne stronge castell called brehappe knyght turkey lorde therof within castell defende kyng army lodged within myle fayre ryuer towne none erle neuers made knight reysed banner hym made mo thre hundred knyghtes company went brehap besieged wan towne perforce within four dayes nat castell strong lorde brehap saued moche people byforce castell called corbodas right valyant knyght thre bretherne one named maladius another balachius thirde rufyn towne christen men castell seuyn dayes made dyuers assautes loste wanne foure knyghtes bretherne yt within shewed well defence valyant men whan frenche men hadde consydred well force castell valyaunt ordr ge turkes within defence made sawe well thane loste payne dislodged knowledge howe kyng hungry wolde go laye siege stronge towne nicopolye thus siege brehap brake vp within castell peace towne clene brent erle neuers lordes fra ce resorted kynges armye ordring selfe go nicopoly whane corbodas brehappe sawe siege brokenne vp right ioyfull sayde copany nede fere season though towne brent exiled shall right well recouer agayne one thynge maru yle greatly newes fro lorde kyng besant called lamorabaquy last tyme sawe hym cytie nicopoly sayde vnto may tyme wolde countrey entencyon passe great puyssaunce brase saynt george go hugry fight christen men ent worde kyng hungry yet hath done nothyng thervpon hugry fortifyed haue nowe great socour frauce haue passed ryuer dunce entred turkey haue distroye countre resistence made thinke surely go lay siege nicopoly cytie stronge ynoughe resyst siege longe season well defended kepte bretherne knyghtes lynage kynge besant ought bounde defende ryght therfore lette v order oure selfe shall shewe brother maladyus shall go cytie nicopoly ayde helpe defende brother balachyus shall abyde kepe castell brehap brother rufyne shall passe brase saynt george go seke lamorabaquy shewe euery thynge past done aduyse hym honoure entede defende herytage come suche puyssaunce maye resyst christen men breke purpose el shall lese ye realme armony whiche hath conquered owne countrey also ymagynacyon kynge hungry christen men gadered thentent great enterprice thre bretherne agreed sayeng apoyntment prepared selfe departe season siege laid nicopolye corbodas brehappe maladyus brother came entred nicopoly wherof cytie ryght ioyfull balachyus abode styll brehappe kepe castell rufyn whan sawe tyme nyght passed christen army knewe well countre passed ouer brase saynt george erched lamorabaquy season quayre soudane babylone haue ayde men hym rufyn foude turke whan kynge besant sawe hym marueyle thought surely shulde newes turkey thane demaunded tidynges sir quod rufyn cou trey desyreth sore se ye kyng hungry puissaunce hath passed ryuer dunce entred turkey hath done great domage hath brent assayled fyue sixe closed townes whan departed fro brehappe purpose go leye siege nicopoly corbodas maladyus brother suche men warre haue en red nicopoly helpe defede towne brother balachyus styll brehappe kepe castell sir suretie company kynge hungry goodlyest armye best apoynted come fraunce euer sene wherfore sir behoueth assemble hoost frendes retourne turkey cause enemyes retourne agayne ouer ryuer duce ye nat gret puyssauce wyll harde bring nombre quod lamorabaquy sir quod mo hundred thousande good lyest men worlde best armed hors backe lamorabaquy gaue none answere entred soudan cha bre shewed soudane hole mater knyght shewed hym soudane sayd must prouyde ye shall haue men ynowe resyst nedes must defede lawe herytage true sir quod lamorabaquy nowe desyres arre come passe haue alwayes desyred none thynge kynge hungry puissaunce myght one come ouer ryuer dunce entre turkey begynnynge wyll suffre season ende shall paye scotte hadde knowledge four monethes paste great frende lorde myllayne sente go haukes gerfaucons faucons nombre xii whiche best fayrest euer sawe present wrote name heedes chiefe capitayns barones fraunce suche shulde come make warre whiche letter also conteyned might get daunger shulde worthe myllyon floreyns also howe shulde company lymytees fraunce mo fyue hudred knightes valyaunt men armes also duke myllaygne wrote surely wyll gyue batayle wherfore wyll prepare mete arte aduise good ordynaunce men great feate valiaunt armes wyll nat flye recule worthy thanke issue owne nacyon valyauntnesse fynde dedes armes truste accoplysshe desyres within thre monethes shall haue ynoughe cosydre wordes one ought greatly marueyle lorde galea erle vertues duke myllayne reputed christen man baptysed regenerate christen lawe wolde seke requyre loue alyaunce kynge myscreant lawe faythe sende hym gyftes presentes dyde euery yere dogges haukes fyne lynen clothes whiche ryght plesaunt sarazins haue none cometh fro party also great turke sent hym agayne presentes ryche clothe golde precyous stone wherof sarazins haue great plentie dayes erle vertues duke myllayne sir galea father reygned tyrantes helde signory marueyle thynke dedes fyrste howe entred opteygned signorie myllayne thre bretherne lorde manfres lorde galea lorde barnabo hadde vncle archebysshoppe myllayne fortuned whan ye lorde charles lusenbourge kyng boesme almayne emperour rome reigned kyng loyes bauyer opteygned empyre byforce neuer taken emperour ye churche excomunycate cursed pope innocent reygned thane loyes bauyer went rome made hymselfe crowned emperour pope xii cardynalles made soone crowned made almayns payed wage ouer ryn rome robbe pyll rewarde romayns receyuyng hym wherfore dyed excomunicat sentence pope cardynalles made without constreyn came auignon submytted selfes pope innocent reigned vrbayne fyfthe assoyled errours pnowe purpose howe lordes myllayne came fyrst signorie shall shewe howe archebysshoppe myllayne tyme receyued kynge charles boesme emperour ye cytie myllayne nobly tryumphantlye emperour axe chapell accomplysshed xl dayes accordyng vsage case parteyning great chere made emperour hundred thousande ducates lent emperour made bysshop vycout myllayne nephewes hym euer holde lande signorie mylayne free wyll vnto tyme emperour hadde payde agayne one tyme sayd hundred thousande ducates bysshoppe dyed ye lorde manfres nephue accorde emperour loue vncle receyued signorie myllayne two bretherne nat riche lorde galea lorde barnabo counsayled toguyder determyned reigne holde landes lobardy bytwene coioyne mariage great lordes maynteyne estate cause men feare displeasure caused brother frese slayne venyme otherwyse whose dethe reygned puissauntly byforce polycy dayes lyued good accorde toguyder departed cyties lombardy bytwene lorde galea hadde tenne bycause eldest lorde bernabo nyne cytie myllayne gouerned one yere one brother another yere brother entent reigne puissauntly sought wayes gader great rychesse raysinge vp possyons subsydies gabelles many yuell customes wherby gadered great store golde syluer caused townes cyties kepte soudyours straungers almaygnes fre che men breton englysshmen nacyons excepte owne countrey men hadde trust affiaunce feare rebellyon agaynst soudyours payed fro moneth moneth wherby douted fered people none durste displease dyd ryse dyde thyng agaynst cruell vengeaunce taken vpon distroyed many one dayes gyue ensaple signory man hadde thynge atte pleasure wolde tayle ryche man thre foure tymes yere sayd lo bardes ouer proude presuptuous richesse wherfore behouable kepe vnder subiection man durst saye nay thyng comaunded two bretherne maryed hyghlye bought wyues good substaunce people lorde galea hadde wyfe suster good erle sauoye named blaunche payde erle hundred thousande ducates lorde barnabo maryed hym almaygne suster duke bresnyche payde lesse money brother dyd two bretherne hadde many chyldren maryed highly richelye atteyne therby great alyaunces lorde galea sone called galleas father vnderstode wha kynge iohan fraunce come englande put rausome xxxc thousand frankes fraunce wyst nat howe reyse fyrste payment thane treated frenche kynge cou sayle haue one doughters galea sonne kynge cousayle entended treatie bycause knewe well lorde galea grounded richesse thus bought kyng doughter sixe hundred thousande frankes whiche tourned payment kynge englande sonne maryed kynge iohans doughter hym gyuen countie erldome vertues champaygne sonne doughter issued doughter whiche byforce golde syluer maryed seconde sonne kynge charles fraunce called loyes duke orlyaunce erle bloyes valoyes maryage cost erle vertu father sayde lady tenne hundred thousaunde frankes countie bloyes bought erle guye bloyes hath ben conteyned hystorie thus lordes galea barnabo acorded right well toguyder lyue dayes neuer varyed people toguyder therfore reigned great puissaunce man coude haue reason right pope cardynalles made warre agaynst sauyng alonely marque moutferant meanes lorde iohan hacon englysshe men route companyons whiche iohan hacon brought prouynce lombardy made great warre last dyed lorde galea hym reigned sonne erle vertues named galea great puyssauce begynnyng reigne gate great loue lombardy dred hymselfe goodly maner like wyse man put downe suche yuell customes father reysed lobardy well beloued good renome euery man sayd well hym laste whane sawe tyme spytted venyme whiche longe borne hert made day ye feldes great busshement wherby lorde bernabo vncle take thought none yuell knewe nat welbeloued great fauour nephue takyng sayd hym one lorde ynough reygne lombardy coude haue none grace laye nat hym thane make resystence ledde castell nephue caused hym dye maner nat shewe sir bernabo two fayre chyldren frenche quene doughter one doughters whiche wedded duke osrtenaunt bauyere galea putte prisone vncles chyldren suche coulde gette tooke possessyon vncles seignories ioyned owne reigned great puyssaunce richesse reysed vp suche mater wherby gathered toguyder great rychesse imposycions gabels subsydies dysmes extorcyons wherby moche dreed beloued helde errour opynyon father howe one shulde nother honoure worshyppe god tooke fro abbeyes priory moche reuenewes toke hym selfe sayd monkes delyciously norisshed good wynes delycious mete whiche superfluyteis sayd coude nat ryse mydnight seruyce shulde sayde saynt benet helde nat order relygion maner said wolde make lyue egges small wyne clere voyces syng higher lordes dayes lyued lyke pope dyde great dispytes tyme men holy churche sette nothyng pope curse specially ye cisme began two pope one cursed assoyled lordes myllayne dyde mocke doynges dyd many lordes ye worlde doughter lorde galea duke myllayne duches orl auce whose condycions lyke father nat mother doughter kyng iohan fraunce lady high mynde enuyous couytous delytes state worlde gladly wolde haue sene duke husbande haue attaygned crowne fraunce nat cared howe generall fame sclaunder ran vpon infyrmiteis kyng whiche phisycion coude remedye came sortes artes chiefe discouerynge workes wherby great suspecte duchesse orlyaunce named valantyne sonne duke husbande fayre chylde age dolphyn sonne kynge tyme two chyldren playeng toguyder duchesse orlyaunce chambre sodaynly caste downe apple full poyson pauement syde yt dolphyn thentent shulde haue taken eaten grace dyd nat duches sone ran apple toke ete therof wherwith poysoned dyed nothynge coude saue hym suche hadde charles yong dolphyn kepe toke hym then neuer came duches chambre adueture great brute murmuracyon ran throughe cytie parys place thus sayde people duke husbande parceyued well brute ranne parys husbande dyde nat putte awaye kynges courte wolde fetche awaye byforce cause dye people said wolde enpoyson kyng chyldren hadde enchaunted kyng kyng infyrmyteis wolde nat se quene none woman onlye duchesse orlyaunce vpon whiche sayeng doute therof husbade awaye put house saynt poule parys sente castell besyde parys vpon waye beauoyes called asynyers kepte longe season neuer wente castell last sent fro then newcastell ryuer loyre ye duke orlyaunce great displeasure bycause adueture ye dethe son reason yt chyldren sowhat brake displeasure tidynges came myllayne lorde galea enfourmed howe doughter trouble great daunger wherof sore displeased frenche kyng counsayle sent suffycient messanger sir iaquemont weryne parys ye kyng counsayle excusyng doughter sayeng persone wolde accuse trayson shulde fought vttrauce quarell whan messangers cae parys kynge good helth tooke hede messangers excuse shortely aunswered nothyng pleasure retourned lombardy declared duke myllayne sene done duke gretter displeasure reputed great iniury sent defyaunce frenche kynge hole realme fraunce whan defyaunces brought parys lordes knightes frenche armye hugry entred turkey ye dispyte hate duke myllayne frenche kynge counsayle therfore helde amyte alyaunce great turke shewed hym secretes frauce pnowe shall leaue spekynge duke speke great turke baron fraunce christen knyghtes turkey phowe great turke desyred soudan many kynges sarazyns ayde hym menne warre resyst agaynst christen men howe many valyant sarazyns came hym farre countreis cap ccxi nat longe great turke departed fro quayre fro soudan promysed sende hym shortely great ayde best men armes signory resyst agaynst puissaunce kynge hungry freche men great turke sente realmes countreis thought haue ayde socour consydred sayd frenche men conquered turkey realmes adioyning shulde trimble feare therby faythe beleue shulde decaye become vnder subiection christen men whiche rather dye thus desyres soudan great turke many kyng sarazyns enclyned vnto desyres perce mede trace also septentryon realme lecto boundes pruce asmoch enformed enemyes christen men flour chiualry kynges sarazins lordes lawe dyde chuse among best traueylynge experte men armes countreis assembly coude nat sodaynly done theirpuruy aunces soone done great turke set hym selfe forwardes felde alwayes abyding people came hym fro farre coutreis specially tartary mede perce assembled many valyant sarazins countreis desyrous proue strengthes agaynst christen men pnowe lette v speke christen men beyng nicopolye phowe lorde coucy lordes christemen v hundred speares discofited fyftene thousande turkes duryng siege nicopoly cap ccxii besiege strong towne nycopolye defended themselfe right valyantly sore abasshed herde tydi ge great turke emperour constantyne noble written vnto party alexandre nat passed ye brase saynt george crysten men helde syege styll nycopoly vytayles plentye good chepe came hungery march nere adioynynge day lorde coucy frenche men tooke pleasure ryde forthe aduenture go se countrey departed fro siege nombre fyue hundred speares many crosbowes archer horseman lorde coucy capytayne iourney lorde raynolde roye lorde saynt pye company chateleyne beauoyre lorde mount caurell bourge mountquell dyuers guydes suche knewe countrey certayne fore ryders well mounted discouer coutrey weke armye turkes assembled togyther nombre twenty thousande men enfourmed howe chrysten men abrode dystroyenge countrey resystence therof assembled togyder came strayte whiche crysten men must passe wolde entre playne turkey coude nat well entre waye turkes taryed two dayes coude tydynges crysten menne thyrde daye thought haue retourned crysten mennes foreryders came brechault nere turkes whan turkes saw aproche stode styll close togyther se dealynge crysten men made token sygne skrymysshe crysten men aproched nere turkes sawe well great nombre yet coulde nat aduyse whan well auewed reculed backe came lorde coucy shewed hym sene whiche newes ye crysten men ryght ioyfull lorde coucy said mete go se theym nerer sythe become farre forwarde shall nat departe without fyghtynge shulde shall blame great rebuke true quod knyghtes herde hym euery man prepared hym selfe horse rode towarde place turkes bytwene turkes lytell wode whan crysten men came wode syde lorde coucy said lorde raynolde roy lorde saynt pye syrs myne aduyse entent drawe turkes stregth ye two shall take two hundred speares rest wyll abyde wode ryde ye nere ye may cause come retourne suffre chase tyll ye paste v wode sodaynly tourne vpon shall close theym behynde shall haue wyll aduyse knightes enclyned two hundred best horsed rode forthe rest eyght hundred enbusshed selfe couertly wode taryed rode forthe came place turkes whan sawe crysten men come ryght ioyouse wenynge mo came holdes playne feldes whan crysten men sawe tyme turned fled made turkes chase well horsed yt turkes coulde nat ouertake chased longe passed wode enbusshement whan turkes passed crysten men issued cryed lady lorde coucy dasshed behynde made great occision turkes helde close togyther whan sawe beset behynde dyd put selfe defence well myght kept none ordre nat ware reregarde whan sawe selfe sodaynly sette abasshed frenche men dyd quyte selfe lyke valyaunte men armes slewe turkes pleasure flyenge many slayne chrysten men toke none mercy happy coulde escape retourne fro then came cristen men done dede retourned hoost nycopoly tydynges ran ouer hoost howe lorde coucy wysdome valyauntnesse dyscomfyted mo xv thousande turkes many spake well therof erle ewe praysed nothing dede sayenge howe doone pride howe put crysten men specyally bande great aduenture parell sayenge handefull men fought folysshely route twenty thousande turkes shulde rather seynge wyl dedes armes turkes felde haue gyuen knowlege assayled enemyes hed capitayne lorde iohan burgoyne myght haue renome honour enterprise besemynge erle ewe spake wordes enuy lorde coucy voyage loue bycause sawe howe lorde coucy loue fauour company straugers whiche deserued ryght well haue ryght nere frenche kynges blode bare armes floure de lyces also costable fraunce thus engendred great hate yuell wyll couertly bytwene erle ewe lorde coucy whiche hatred last apered clerely wherby great myschefe fell seasone vpon crysten men ye shall pnowe shall leaue speke tyme mater retourne speke kynges englande fraunce phowe peace bytwen englande frauce contynued maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce cap ccxiii ye haue herde mariage french kynges doughter kynge england whiche tyme aproched nere bothe party well wyllynge excepte duke thomas gloucestre nothynge ioyfull therof sawe well maryage shulde great confyderacyons alyaunces bytwene two kynges realmes lyue peace whiche lothe se desyred rather haue warre season duke aboute hym knyght called syr iohan baquegay secrete man set alwayes ye duke haue warre seasone also duke guerles came englande se kynge vncles offred hym selfe lawfull seruyce kynge myght bounde therto faythe homage wolde gladly kynge shulde haue watre rather peace duke duke lancastre great comunycacyon togyder voyage erle haynalt erle ostenaunt sonne wolde make frese tyme fyerebrase vertayne englande sente thyder fro erle ostrenant gette men armes archer go voyage frese erle derby desyred go voyage aydinge cosyns heynalt gentle erle hadde therto good affectyon sayde howe wolde ryght gladly go voyage pleased kynge father whan duke guerles came fyrst englande duke lancastre demaunded thought voyage frese aunswered sayd parylous voyage ye frese countrey nat lyghtly wonne sayenge howe tymes past dyuers erles holande heynalte haue claymed right gone thyder haue put subiectyon haue always lost lyues affyrmynge howe fresons people without honour haue mercy prayse loue lorde worlde proude also countrey stronge enuyroned see closed i rockes marysshes man tell howe gouerne selfe haue ben desyred go voyage wyll nat counsayle cosyn sonne erle derby nat entre voyage iourney hym thynke fayre brother ostrenant wyll go hath great desyre therto wyll haue bande haynowayes hym shall aduenture euer retourne whiche wordes caused duke lancastre thynke sonne shulde nat go yt voyage shewed sonne entente badde hym delaye mater kynge wolde nat shulde go thus duke guerles dyd lette ayde erle haynalte shulde haue erle derby many thought nat well counsayled yet none honour duke guetles lyfe naturally enuyous presumptuous proude yet fierebrase vertayn lette nat sute gette ayde dyd dyligence gate knightes squyers two hundred archer erle derby excused himselfe whiche excuse fayne take gree sawe well wyll good go kynge father nat kynge auauncement cosyns haynalte made ordeyned ryuer thamyse vesselles shyppes men shulde go voyage frese aryue encuse towne countie haynalt entre holande towne standeth see within twelue leages water realme frese season sente englande fro frenche kynge erle valeran saynt powle certayne artycles concernynge treatie peace sent robert hermyte whome kynge englande gladde speke erle saint powle founde kynge englande bretherne erles brenne huntyngdon duke lancastre kynges vncles manour eltham kynge receyued ioyously herde well message sayd hym parte fayre brother saynt powle treatie peace bytwene fayre father fraunce right well enclyned therto alone canne nat promote mater true bretherne two vncles lacastre yorke enclyne ryght well therto haue another vncle duke gloucestre ryght paryllous marneylous man letteth moche dothe canne drawe londoner opynyon feare make rebellyon realme shulde reyse people agaynst whiche great paryll people englande ryse agayne agaynst haue myne vncle gloucestre parte suche barones knyghtes realme opynion realme loste without remedy myne vncle gloucestre secerte man canne knowe mynde syr quod erle saint powle behoueth wynne hym fayre swete louynge wordes gyue hym great gyftes demaunde thyng graunt way wherby ye shall wynne ye must flatter hym tyll peace made ye haue wyfe brought hyther doone ye maye take counsayle ye shall puyssaunce oppresse rebelles frenche kynge nede shall ayde ye maye sure name god ye saye well thus shall erle saynt powle lodged london often tymes went eltham se kynge duke lancastre often tymes comunycacion maryage therle saint poule sayde howe frenche kynge shulde come saynt omers vncles bring hym doughter kynge england wolde come calais bytwene saynte omers calays two kynges shulde mete speke togyther wherby reason syght spekynge togyther shulde encrease loue amyte two kinges vncles shulde speke togyder without companye forme peace conclude nat peace yet leste trewce myght relonged endure thyrty xl yere bytwene two realmes alies deuyse semed right good kyng counsayle hervpon kynge lordes sente calays make prouysyon kynge desyred vncle duke gloucestre go hym iourney duches wyfe chyldren lyke wyse duke duchess yorke lancastre whan euery thynge redy kynge erle saynt powle departed fro eltham rode towardes caunterbury folowed lordes suche shulde go voyage suche desyred erle saynt powle passed see fyrst entent aduertyse frenche kynge passed boloyne paris declared frenche kynge vncles howe spedde wherwith well content departed fro paris lytell lytell aproched cytie amyence kynge englande vncles came calais many lordes ladyes duke burgoyne one frenche kynges vncles came saynt omers meanes erle saynt powle robert hermyte duke burgoyne came calays se kynge englande vncles nobly receyued cousayled togyther certayne artycles peace wherto kynge englande lyghtly enclyned say trouth cared nat dyd myght haue wyfe whan duke burgoyne ben calais two dayes comuned kynge englande artycles peace kynge sayd howe wolde sende processe artycles ouer see englande beshewed declared people sayde nouther lordes englande coulde nat conclude fermely peace without generall consentment people englande ouer kynge sayde howe must fyrst go ouer agayne hym selfe retourne therby make one iourney well said quod duke burgoyne youre retourne euery thynge shall concluded perfourmed thus duke burgoyne erle saynt powle departed fro calays retourned saynt omers fro then amyence foude kyng quene doughter shulde quene englande tyme duke bretaygne berrey great araye kynge englande vncles lordes retourned englande wyues taryed styll calays tyl retourne pin meane season voyage made frese haynalte fyrst erle heynalte holande zelande sonne erle ostrenaunt ye shall hystorie phowe erle heynalt erle ostrenante sonne made great army men armes knyghtes squyers go frese cap ccxiiii ye haue herde howe duke auberte bauyer guylliam sonne erle ostrenant gret desyre go frese conquere countrey wherof sayde duke aubert ryght succession herytage shulde erle lorde therof auaunce iourney erle ostrenant sent fyerebrace vertayne haue ayde englysshe men spedde hym well kynge rycharde englande honour cosyns sent certayne men armes two hundred archer vnder guydyng thre gentleman one called cornewayle another colleuyll knyghtes thyrde asquyer knowe nat name well enfourmed valyaunt man armes hadde chynne cutte fray lytell chynne made syluer tyed aboute heed lase sylke englysshmen came encuse tyme prefyxed duke berte sonne valyaunt man cousayle called gylliam croenbourge greatly exorted theym warre hated greatly fresones doone many dyspyghtes dyd ye shall thus duke aubert departed fro haye holande gyllyam sonne erle ostrenant came countrey haynalte towne monts assembled togyther thre estate countrey shewed vnto great desyre go frese rightfull occasion caused openly shewed certayne letter patentes apostolykes imperyalles ryght noble autentyke sealed vnder leade lyole entre whiche apered euydently ryght tytell ye signory frese sayd openly lordes valyaunt men subgettes ye knowe well euery man ought kepe defede herytage man may laufully moue war recouer lande herytage ye knowe also ye fresons ought right subgiettes inobedyent rebell agaynst v sygnory people without lawe faythe therfore good dere frendes ye know well without ayde bothe bodyes goodes canne nat fournysshe bringe execusyon hygh enterprise wherfore desyre busynesse ayde v say money men warre entent inobedyent fresons maye subdued brought obedyence wordes suche lyke spoken duke thre estate comune acord grauted lordes petycyon request lyke suche people greatly desyred alwayes done obedyent seruyce pleasure lorde prince enfourmed caused haue redy money mountante thyrty thousande pounde besyde towne valencenes lyke wyse dyd deuoyre also towne monts thynges thus concluded valyaunt prince good duke auberte giullyam sonne erle ostrenant seynge good wylles men ryght ioyfull whiche meruayle sawe well well beloued subgiettes shulde well fournysshed money cousayle sende frenche kyng shewe enterprise voyage desyre ayde hym thyder sent two valyaunt wyse men saye lorde lygne lorde ieumont two ryght valyaunt knyghtes well beloued frenche men specyally lorde lygne kyng made hym one chamberlayns hym good fauoure spake kynge shewed hym duke entent request whiche kynge counsayle fauourably agreed specyally duke burgoyner bycause doughter maryed therle ostrenat wherby thought tyme come shulde profyte heyres howe many great lordes spake iourney dyuers maners sayd purpose dothe heyno wayes desyre kyng ayde haue ben englande sought ayde hath nat erle haynalt late taken hym blewe garter tye legge withall ye ordre englande semyth therby hath great affectyon fraunce ryght wyse answered sayd syr ye wronge say thus though erle ostrenant haue taken ordre garter yet nat alyed englysshe men fermly alyed fraunce hath nat maryage lady katheryne doughter duke burgoyne whiche farre greater alyauce garter therfore neuer say wyll loue pleasure fraunce reason maryage rather englande garter wherfore kinge shall right honourably ayde hym thus frenche men deuysed amonge selfe spake dyuers maners iourney also iourney hungery turkey agaynst lamorabaquy turkes pof army french kyng sente frese ayde cosyns lorde valeran erle saynt powle lorde charles de la brete capytaynes cap ccxv frenche kynge assembled armye fyue hudred speares well pycardes frenchman made capytayns ouer lorde valeran erle saynt powle lorde charles de la bret valyaut knyghtes well expert armes apoynted leade company towne encuse base frese whe assemble shulde mete take see entre high frese dyd whan two knightes lorde lygne iumont sawe kynges good wyll men warre dyspatched wage payed came kynge thanked toke leaue retourned heynalt lorde duke aubert lorde gillyam sonne whome right welcome well sped shewed good answere good chere gyftes great presentes whan duke auberte knewe frenche kynge sente hym fyue hundred speares assembled noble men knyghtes squyers haynalt lorde vertayne seneschall haynalte valyaunt man greatly renomed armes lordes lygne comygnes made marshall lordes haureth nychelet lalyne hordayne chyne cantan quesnoy fleron iohn brother lordes bouset ieumont fresshe knightes enemyes also robertle rour lordes moth aulr foutayns seuls sars william hermes pynchart brother lordes lens verlamont ausealr trascigmes octes seaus e gyrarde brother lorde dyctre iohan brother bridaulx montaguy damaulx de la powle guy brother lorde mastynge syr florida villyers valyaunt man doone many dedes armes amonge turkes sarazins sir eustace vertayn fierebras vertayne newly come englande syr rase montiquy lorde rorsyn sir iohan dandr gntes persant brother dyuers knightes squiers assembled monts desyred go hym euery man bringe hym company acordynge degree wolde auaunce towne encuse base frese theraboute go hym seem hygh frese myddes august next sayd wolde ary wolde go thyder moue holanders zelanders serue hym lyke maner sayd knyghtes esquyers haynalt without contradictyon acorded desyre promysinge hym seruyce trewe subgiettes whiche fulfylled dede dyligently prepared begynnyng moneth august yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore syxtene redy aparelled assembled company anners take water fro thence encuse hole assemble shulde mete pnowe whyle assemble thus made haynalte demaunded ladyes gentle woman ioyouse iourney ought say naye sawe father bretherne vncles husbandes louers frendes departe yt peryllous warre knewe well howe tyme paste haynoways wente lorde frese neuer retourned agayne wherfore feared leste shulde hap dyd predecessours duchesse brabant defended men countrey brabant man hardy go oute countrey iourney ladyes gentlewoman haynalt desyred often tymes frendes louers leaue iourney coulde nat lette mater howe sore displeased myndes basterde vertayne fierebrase said one chyefe setter busynesse thus duke aubert guillyam sonne herde aunswere men haynalte went zelande shewynge busynesse assented request chiefe settynge lorde de la vere syr floris de boesell floris dabell lorde zenembrige syr clay de boysell phylyp corteen dyuers gentleman made selfes redy suche wyse apered well dylygence great desyre auaunce selfe iourney lyke wyse duke sonne went holande made lyke requestes ye lordes good townes done zelande holanders therof ryght ioyouse men hated fresons euer warre togyther specyally see border countrey therfore lordes holande suche lorde tarterell dyuers noble men knyghtes squyers herynge requestes lordes duke aubert erle ostrenant offered themselfe promysynge comforte ayde best power well shewed incontynent made redy auaunced forwarde lyke wise dyd men good townes countrey sent forthe lordes great nombre crosbowes morispykes men warre daylye men asembled towne encuise shyppes vesselles came thyder suche wyse maryners estemed nombre xxx thousande sayd came towne harle xii hu dred whiche shyppes well prouyded thynges necessary trouthe ladyes damoselles soroufull heynalt lykewise hollande zelande sir danyell marebbed guillyam oruenbourge durst nat apere ladyes gentylwomen sore sette forwarde busynesse hadde great wyll desyre reuenged fresons bicause batayle hadde wherin erle wyllyam pituouslye slayne lost xxxiii cote armes lynage wherfore two knyghtes wolde neuer take treson mercy rausome within certayne space euery man come encuise fyrst came englysshe men henous capyten seneschall iumont lorde comegynes marshall came hollander zelanders freche men came nat soone taryed xi dayes frenche men whiche season fell debate bytwent hollander englysshe men erle ostrenaunt nat ben englysshmen ben slayne whiche stryfe apesed frenchman came great ioye made comaundement gyuen euery man shulde entre suche shyppes assygned vnto whiche done whan shypped hoysed vp sayles sayled forthe wether fayre semed disposed pleasure many shippes araynged one another wolde haue stretched fro encuse boundes condren whiche highe frese purposed arryue dyde whiche xii leages water sayled front right ordinatly pnowe wyll leaue spekyng speke fresons enformed aduertysed long duke aubertes comyng great puyssaunce whan fresons knewe vnderstode shulde haue warre wyse men countre asse bled toguyder take counsayle aduyse shulde whan long debated mater entecion fyght enemyes soone myght knowe entred countrey sayeng howe rather dye fre fresons tha seruage vnder kynge prince vnder subiectyon therfore sayd dye quarell wolde fight enemyes concluded amonge themselfes take man raunsome howe great soeuer amonge one man farre excedynge greatnesse aboue hygher man countrey heed called iuye iouer called hym great fresone manne greatly commended pruce hungery turkey rodes cypre hadde done many noble feates armes greatlye renomed whane harde opynions ye fresons howe wolde fight enemyes aunswered sayde po ye noble free fresons knowe trouthe chaunce maye tourne though valyantnesse ye haue tyme discon ted ye heyno wayes hallanders zelanders knowe trouthe suche come nowe vpon people experte ye warr thanne beleue verily shall otherwyse predecessours dyde wyll nat gyue vp wyll menteyne dedes therfore wyll counsayle sufire entre let v kepe forteresses lette kepe feldes shall beate selfes countrey nat susteyne long haue many dyke canne nat go farre countrey canne nat ryde abrode countrey full yuell maye go foote wherby shalbe werye shall waste theym selfes retourne agayne moost brenne tenne xii vyllages whiche shall natte greatly greue v shall soone made agayne shulde fight feare nat stronge ynough fyght one enformed nombre hundred thousande armed heedes whiche trouthe many mo wordes consented thre knightes fresons fyrst named sir fewe dorekerque seconde sir gerarde canym thirde sir tiny walturge people wolde wyse consente deuyse wolde noble men called elyns saye gentylmen iudges cause replyed great freson cocluded soone knewe enemyes entred countre shulde go fyght abode opinyon made selfe redy saye trouthe poorelye armed many armure cootes wadmoll course grose clothe armed lether rustye mayle ryght well armed thus armed theym whan redy wente church toke ye cross baners made thre batayls euery batayle ten thousande fyghting men came narowe passage well viked nere ye place enemyes shulde lande sawe well howe enemyes come great desyre take lande whiche saynt bartylmewes daye sonday foresaid yere whan ye fresons sawe aproche issued vpon dike sire thousande haue lette landynge enemyes among fresons ther woman apparelled blewe rage went fro fresons came nere heynowes within shotte bowe tourned backe towarde ye hey nowes plucked vp clothes shewed bare arse cryeng langage ser take welcome soone sawe leudnesse woman shot arowes quarels stryken legges loynes arowes came flyeng thycke snowe lepte shippes water ran folysshe woman wt swerdes ouertoke hewed small peces tha euery man issued vessel came agaynst fresons receyued right valyantly putte longe pykes longe staues bounde yron saye ye trouthe takyng lande many dedes armes done bothe party many slayne sore hurte biforce englisshe archer cro bowes heynaulte hollande zelande wanne dyke agaynst fresons vpon dyke araynged baners good order taryeng copany reuke halfe myle longe fresons putte fro dyke came copany mo xxx thousande closed toguyder grounde dyked rounde aboute great depe dyke nat farre myght well se enemyes wheee raynged fyrst dyke thus contynued tyll heynowayes lande baggage certayne tentes reyred vp rested sondaye mondaye aduisynge fresons enemyes whiche two dayes dyuers scrymisshes made tuesday bothe party redy certayne newe knightes made ordayned fight fresons auauuced forewarde good order batayle archer amonge sowned trumpettes clarion cae fayre pase passe ouer dike fresons came defende passage archer shotte agaynst fiersly fresos couered selfes targes erthe dyke bytwene enemyes howe nere aproched certayne holanders entred dyke made bridge speres pykes valyant corage began enuade fresons defended force right valyantly gaue suche stroke wolde mout vp dyke many ouerthrowen downe agayne heynowayes frenche men englysshe men hollander zelanders well armed fresons coude domage hurt cast downe grounde suche noble dedes done atchyued impossible shewe newe made knyghtes dyde nobly deuoyre fresons defended marueylously great bygge men yuell armed many barelegged bare foted assaut lorde lygne seneshall heynault lorde iumont dyuers wente aboute dyke founde awaye wherby passed ouer dyke came fresons poyntes speres wherof fresons fore abasshed dyuers lepte dyke perforce fresons fayne opyn sparcle abrode batayle great freson slayne began flye chase horryble cruell none taken rausome specially holanders slewe myght attayne vnto moche suche taken heynowes frenche men englysshe men hollander slewe handes amonge hollander lorde wyllyam oruenbourge two sonnes iohn henry made knyghtes mornyng acquyted themselfe maruey lously well slewe many fresons semed well loued litell fresons thus finally fresons discofyted moost parte slayne felde fewe takenne prisoner caryed haye hollande kepte long season lorde cundren lorde coutrey felde mondaye yelden duke aubert two sonnes yet ye felde fresons two sonnes longe ye duke disconfyture entred countrey condren toke townes fortress howe coquered lytell fresons dyde great domage preuy encoutrynges whan shulde take prisoner wolde neuer yelde fought dethe sayeng rather dye free fresons vnder subiectyon prince lorde prisoner taken coude raunsome gotten frendes wolde nat quyte rather suffre dye prisone wolde neuer quyte none people withoute delyuer man man sawe none people prisone wolde slee enemyes take prisoner thus ende v wekes heynous taken beaten downe certayne townes vyllages fortress great valure leason beganne waxe colde marueylously rayned nerehade euery day see full tempestes wyndes duke aubert sonne consydringe season purposed returne base frese fro whens came hollande easy passe colde wynter departed came encuyse gaue lycence euery man dete specially straugers payde truely wage thaked good ayde seruyce thus brake vp iourney frese coquered lytell season within two yere sayd two noble prince assembled agayn seconde tyme great armye wente frese made great coquest dyd many noble dedes armes ye shall nowe shall leaue spekyng therof declare ye maner maryage kynge englande doughter fraunce phowe mariage kyng englande doughter frace ordred howe frenche kyng delyuered doughter kynge englande tente twene arde calys cap ccxvi ye haue herde howe kyng englande returned fro cali englande tyll michelmas lyament westmynster shulde begyn meane season great prouision made calais guysnes kynge lordes sent fro porte englande cost great prouisyon flaunders came see calais lykewise frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce vncles prelate lordes fraunce great prouisyon made saynt omers ayre tyrwyn arde mountoyre house abbeyes nothynge spared bothe party specially abbey saynte bertyne well replenysshed thynges receyue kynges lyament westmynster began mychelmas ordeyned endure xl dayes abridged king wolde nat tary v dayes wherin declared thynges necessary parteyning realme specially mater touched hym selfe cause cae fro calais done retourned towardes calais agayne hym two vncles lancastre gloucestre prelate lordes englande suche comaunded go spedde iourney came agayne calays duke yorke taryed styll englande erle derby gouerne realme kynges absence whan kyng englande thus returned calais lordes fraunce beyng picardy aduertised therof duke burgoyn duchesse wyfe came saynt omers lodged abbey saynt bertyne sone freche kyng knewe kynge englande come agayne calais sente hym therle saynt poule shewe hym order taken fraunce concernyng maryage whiche kynge englande gladde thane duke lancastre sonne beauforde lancastre duke gloucester affren sonne erle rutlande erle mashall erle huntyngton kynges chamberleyne many lordes knyghtes squyers ladyes rode erle saynt poule saynt omers well receyued duke burgoyne duchesse thyder came duke bretaigne lefte frenche kynge ayre doughter hym ye maye well knowe chere yt coude deuysed made englysshe lordes ladyes saynt omers duchesse burgoyne made great dyner duchesse la castre sonne two doughters great gyftes gyuen plate golde syluer nothynge spared moche englysshe men hadde marueyle therof specially duke glocestre sayd cousayle se well great rychesse realme fraunce moche gyuen hym entente abate molyfie rancour hadde agaynste fraunce lordes fraunce knewe well alwayes harde agre peace wherfore shewed hym moche token loue honour coude toke euer gyftes alwayes rancour abode styll hert euer frenche men coulde coulde nat molifye fell stomake always made herde answer treated peace frenche men subtyle yet coude gette hold hym wordes aunswers alwayes couert wyst nat howe vnderstade whan duke burgoyne sawe maner sayde counsayle lese euer duke gloucestour longe lyueth shalbe sure peace bytwene frauce englande shall alwayes fynde newe inuencyons accydentes engender hate stryfe bytwene bothe realmes entedeth thynketh none thynge nat truste haue kyng englande wherby fare better kyng shulde nat haue wyfe cosyn fraunce whan duke duchesse burgoyne coutesse neuers countesse saynt poule lordes ladyes fraunce hadde greatly feested lordes ladyes englande comunicacion howe two kynges shulde mete speke toguyder howe lady shulde delyuered thervpon apoyntment made leaue taken partes englysshe tie returned cali kyng shewed chere presentes ben gyuen newes pleased well kyng gladde whan herde honour spoken frenche kyng loue hym bycause doughter whome trusted haue quene anone frenche kyng came saynt omers lodged abbey saynt bertyne dislodged duke bretayne company ordayned duke berrey burgoyne burbone shulde go cali speke kynge englande came calays ioyouslye receyued good chere coulde deuysed thre duke secrete communycacion kynge counsayle many bothe fraunce englande reputed peace concluded bytwene fraunce englande dede nere poynt duke gloucester agreed well therto tyme kyng englande hadde promysed hym wolde agree peace gyue son affren erldome rochester herytau ce make hym spende yerely reuenewes two thousande pounde sterlyng gyue hym selfe soone came englande redy money fyftie thousande noble reason gyftes duke gloucestours hardnesse well aleyed lordes fraunce sawe well opinyons nat obstynate founde hym swete meke whane euery thynge ordeygned came tooke leaue kynge retourned saynt omers frenche kynge shewed howe hadde spedde frenche kyng wente bastyde arde duke burgoyne mountoyre duke bretaygne towne esque duke berrey balyngham euery te aboute pyght vp tentes pauilyons countrey full people frauce englande kynge englande came guysnes duke lancastre hym duke gloucestre ha me thus fridaye beyng euyn symon iude yere oure lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore sixtene tenne clocke forenoone two kynges departed oute tentes pyght nat farre asondre came foote one ye met certayne place apoynted one syde araynged four hundred knyghtes fraunce armed swerdes hades parte foure hundred englysshe knyghtes lyke maner two kynges passed duke la castre gloucestre ledde frenche kynge duke berrey burgoyne ledde kynge englande thus came foreby sayd eight hundred knightes whan two kynges came iust toguyder eyght hundred knyghtes kneled downe grounde many wepte ioye thus two kynges mette toguyder bareheeded lytell enclyned tooke eche handes frenche kynge ledde kynge englande tente whiche noble ryche four duke tooke eche handes folowed two kynges knyghtes frenche men one syde englysshe men syde stode regardyng eche good humble maner tyll done thane ordayned place two kynges tooke eche hande shulde made founded chapell honoure lady shulde called lady grace nat tell whether made nat two kynges hande ha de entred frenche kynges tente foure duke kneled downe ye kynges reysed vp talked toguyder two kynges wente lytell parte talked certayne space meane tyme wyne spyces brought duke berrey serued frenche kynge spyce duke burgoyne wyne duke lacastre glocester serued kyng englad tha knightes squiers serued prelate lordes yt euery man wtin ye tent hadde parte meane tyme two kynges comuned toguyder busynesse done paste two kynges tooke leaue eche retourned tentes tooke horse rode towardes calais kyng guysnes duke lancastre gloucester hame calais frenche kyng rode cordre duke orlyaunce hym duke berrey dornam duke burgoyne mountoyre done daye tentes stode styll feldes saturdaye feest saynt symon iude aboute xi clocke kynge englande vncles lordes cae frenche kyng tent receyued right honorably euery manne talked felowe merily table sette vp two kynges sat one table alone frenche kynge ryght hande duke berrey burgoyne burbone serued two kynges tha duke burbone caste forthe many iestyng wordes make kynges laughe suche table duke mery man sayd openly addressynge wordes kynge englade sir quod ye ought make good chere ye haue ye desyre ye haue wife shall haue deliuered frenche kyng sayd burbonoys wolde doughter ye age cosyn saynt poule condicyon cost great good shulde take sonne better good wyll kynge englande herde well wordes answered spekyng duke burbone bycause freche kyng hadde compared doughter erle saynt poules doughter sayd sir age wyfe shall pleaseth right well loue nat moche herytage loue realmes two beyng one accorde kynge christen able anoye v dyner thus
