done frenche kynges tent wyne spyces taken yonge quene brought forthe companyed great nombre ladyes damoselles delyuered kyng englande whan yt done euery man toke leaue departe yonge quene sette ryche lytter wente mo frenche ladyes lady coucy ladyes englande duchess lancastre yorke gloucestre irelande lady namure lady poynynges great nombre lady receyued quene great ioye thus kyng englande yonge quene company rode calais nyght frenche kyng co pany saynt omers tuesdaye whiche alhalowen day kyng englande maryed sayd lady isabell frauce churche saynt nicholas calais archebysshop cauterbury wedded theym whiche tyme great feest great largesse thursdaye came calais duke orlyaunce burbone se kynge quene friday tooke leaue departed rode saynt omers frenche kyng day mornyng kyng quene toke shyppe hadde fayre passage ouer within thre houres kynge laye castell douer nexte daye rochestre dartforde eltham thane lordes ladyes toke leaue fiftene dayes quene brought cytie london accompanyed many lordes ladyes damosel laye fyrst night towre london nexte day coueyed along throughe cytie great solempnyte kynges palais westmynster ther kyng redy receyue daye londoner gaue quene great presentes ordayned great iustes holden cytie lo xl knyghtes squyers chalegers holden candelmas nexte whiche delyuered herauldes publysshe bothe sydes realme scotlande whan frenche kyng coe parys maryage doughter euery lorde departed home ranne great brute realme howe frenche kyng purpose begynnynge marche go great army lombardy dystroye lorde galea duke mylayne kyng suche displeasure agaynst hym man coulde tourne hym wolde make voyage kyng englande promysed sende hym syxe thousande archer duke bretaygne offered go hym two thousande speares breton great prouysyon made iourney dolphenry vyen countie sauoy whan duke bretayne departed fro frenche kynge retourne countrey syr peter craon condempned paye quene iherusalem hundred thousande frankes prison castell loure parys request duke bretaygne duke burgoyne dyd moche kynge good meanes duke bretaygne syr peter craon hym thynke promysed pay sayd certayne dayes foresayd quene wyll nowe leaue mater speke aduetures turkey phowe siege nycopoly turkey reysed lamorabaquy howe frenche men dyscomfyted howe hungaryons fled cap cc xvii ye haue herde howe kynge hungery lordes fraunce passed ryuer dunce entred turkey somer moneth iuly done many enterprise brought dyuers townes subiection none resysted besieged ye towne nycopoly hadde nere brought small estate nigh redy yelde coude newes lamorabaquy kyng hungery said lordes frauce syrs thanked god haue fayre seasone haue dystroyed parte turkey reken towne nycopolyours whan lyst sore ouerlayde canne nat longe holde wherfore thynges consydred cousayle towne one go season shall drawe agayn ouer dunce realme hungery haue many cyties townes castelles redy furnysshed receyue reason seyng ye come farre ayde make warre agaynst turkes whome haue founde herde cruell enemyes wynter shall make newe prouysion agaynst next somer sende worde frenche kyng case nexte somer maye refresshe v newe men beleue whan knoweth haue done howe euery thyng standeth wyll haue great affection come hyther owne person yonge couragyous loueth dedes armes whether cometh nat grace god next somer shall wynne realme armony passe brase saynt george surrey wynne porte iaphes baruth conquere iherusalem holy lande sowdan come forewarde shall fyght hym shall nat departe without batayle lyke wordes sayd kynge hungery lordes fraunce rekened nycopoly owne howe fortune fell otherwyse season kynge basaach called lamorabaquy reysed army sarazyns farre countreys perce many great men sarazyns came ayde lamorabaquy dystroy crystendome passed brase saynt george nombre two hudred thousande men say trouth chrysten men nat certayned nombre kynge basaache men aproched nere nycopoly couerte wayes knewe feates warre moche myght kynge valyaunt man whiche shewed well reason polycy ordered bataylles thus hoost maner wynges men comprised well great myle grounde hoost shewe face redye bande eyght thousande turkes two wynges batayle open forefronte narowe behyndeand lamorabaquy herte batayle thus rode couerte eyght thousande turkes ordeyned make face yt sone shulde se crysten men che recule lytell lytell herte batayle two wynges whiche open crysten men beyng one entred bytwene theym close togyther ioyne one company fyght enemyes ordre batayle thus yere oure lorde god thousande thre hudred fourscore syxtene monday feest saynt mychell ten clocke kyng hungery sate dyner siege nycopoly tydynges came hoost howe turkes comyng scoutes came shewed howe sene turkes reporte nat trewe nat tydden forwarde auewed two wynges batayle behynde sene mo ye fore ryders bowarde soone sene theym retourned seasone greatest parte ye host dyner tydynges brought erle neuers ingenerall scurers said syrs arme quyckly ye nat surprised turkes comynge tydynges greatly reioysed crysten men suche desyred dedes armes euery man rose fro dynners put table fro demaunded harnesse horse well chafed drynkynge wyne euery man drewe felde baners standerdes dysplayed euery man owne baner baner lady dysplayed therwith valyaunt knyght sir iohan vien admyrall fraunce frenche men fyrst drewe felde fresshely aparelled makynge small accompte turkes knewe nat great nombre lamorabaquy owne persone lordes fraunce felde came vnto theym kynge hungeryes marshall great hast valyaunte knyght called henry ostenlenyhall vpon good horse penon armes syluer crosse sable ancored called armure yron mylstone whan came baner lady stode styll moste parte barones fraunce sayd openly syrs sent hyther fro kynge hungery desireth ye sat nat enemyes vntyll suche tyme ye haue worde agayne fro ought doughted lest scoutes haue nat brought certaynte nombre turkes within two houres ye shall tydynges haue sent foreryders forth auewe enemyes substancially first dyd syrs ye maye sure turkes shall nat indomage v ye tary tyll hole puyssaunce togyder syrs ordre kynge counsayle hath ordered muste retourne agayne kynge whan deted french lordes assembled togyder knowe best demaunded lorde coucy thought best done answered said wolde counsayle obey kyng hungeryes comaundement ordre semeth good enfourmed syr phylippe arthoys erle ewe constable fraunce nat contented aduyse nat fyrst haue ben demaunded hym pride dispyght helde contrary opynyon sayd ye syr ye kynge hungery wolde haue floure chiefe honour iourney haue vowarde hath graunted v nowe wolde take fro v agayne beleue hym wyll nat sayd knyght bare banner name god saynt george ye shall seme daye good knyght whan lorde coucy herde constable speke wordes toke done great presumpcyon loked syr iohan vyen bare standarde lady demauded hym thought best doone syr quod wyse reasone canne nat herde pride muste reygne sythe erle ewe wyll nedes set must nedes folowe howe shulde stronger puyssauce hole togyther thus deuysed felde styll turkes aproched two wynges eche lx thousande men beganne aproche close chrysten men bytwene wolde haue reculed coulde nat closed sarazyns wynges thicke dyuers knyghtes well expert armes sawe well iourney shulde agaynst howe auaunced folowed baner lady borne valyaunt knight syr iohn vien euery knyght fraunce cote armure euery man semed kinge fresshly aparelled shewed whan began fyrste fyght turkes nat past seuen hundred men lo beholde great foly outrage taryed kynge hungery threscore thousande men lykely haue doone great acte pride lost receyued suche mage sythe batayle rounseualx xii peres frauce slayne crystendome receyued nat great domage howe dyscomfyted great nombre turkes slayne frenche men dyscomfyted fyrst batayle turkes chase tyll came valey lamorabaquy hole puyssaunce frenchman wolde haue retourned hoost coulde nat closed partes sore batayle frenche men endured longe newes came kyng hungery howe frenche men englysshmen almayns fyghtyng turkes broken comaundement counsayle gyuen marshall wherwith sore dyspleased nat without good cause sawe well howe lykely lese iourney said great mayster rodes hym syr shall day lese iourney reason pride frenchman wolde haue beleued stronge ynough haue fought enemyes therwith kynge hungerye loked behynde hym sawe howe men fled waye discomfyted selfe sawe well recouery suche aboute hym cryed sayd saue selfe ye slayne hungery loste ye shall lese felde daye reason pride frenche men valyautnesse turneth folyssh hardynes shall slayne taken none lykely scape therfore syr ye beleue v saue youre selfe scape daunger kynge hungery sore dyspleased whan sawe howe lost ye iourney dysorderyng frenche men sawe remedy flye el taken slayne great murder flyenge chased slayne hungery fledde without ordre turkes chased theym howe god ayded kinge hugery great mayster rodes came ryuer dunce founde lytell barge parteynynge rodes entered seuen persones went shore el slayne taken turkes came ryuer syde slewe many crysten man suche folowed kynge saue selfe nowe lette v speke frenche men almayns fought valyauntly whan lorde mount caurell ryght valyaunt knyght arthoys sawe dyscomfyture ranne vpon hym sonne yonge man sayde squyer take sonne leade hym away yonder wynge whiche open saue hym wyll abyde aduenture felowes whan chylde herde father say sayd howe wolde nat departe father dyd moche perforce squyer led hym away parell came ryuer dunce chylde suche care father tooke small regarde hym selfe fell ye ryuer bytwene two barge drowned without remedy also syr wyllyam tremoyle fought batayle valyauntly slayne sonne syr iohan vyen bearynge baner lady slayne baner handes thus lordes knightes frauce distroyed maner ye haue herde syr iohan burgoyne erle neuers rychely besene lykewyse syr guy de la ryuer dyuers lordes knyghtes burgoyne taken prisoner two squiers picardy ryght valyaunt men called gyllyam dewe bourge maytequell two valyauntnesse two tymes passed felde euer retourned agayne dyd marueyls fynally shere slayne say trouthe frenche men straugers acquyted selfe valyauntly frenchman pride lost knyght pycardy called syr iaques helley dwelte turkey serued lamorabaquy coude somwhat speke langage turkey whan sawe batayle loste yelded hym selfe sarazyns couetous golde syluer toke saued hym also lquyer tornasys called iaques du fay serued kynge tartary called tauburyn soone iaques knewe yt frenche men came make warre turkey toke leaue kynge tartary departed sayd felde taken prisoner kyng tartary men ayde lamorabaquy kynge tauburyn tartary sent hym great nombre men warre frenchman richely arayed semed lyke kynges wherby taken lyues saued sarazyns turkes couetous trusted haue great raunsomes taken reputed greater lordes sir iohan burgoyn erle neuers taken prisoner lykewyse erles ewe de la marche lorde coucy syr henry bare syr guy de la tremoyle bouciquant dyuers syr philyp bare syr iohan vyen willyam tremoyle sonne slayne dyuers batayle endured thre houres fyghtynge kinge hungery lost baggage plate iowelles gladde saue hym selfe seuen person lytell barge rodes el taken slayne without recouery mo men slayne chase batayle many drowned happy might scape maner meanes whan dyscomfyture doone passed turkes suche sent thyder sowdan withdrawen lodginges whiche tentes pauylyons conquered whiche founde well replenysshed wyne meate redy dressed wherwith refresshed made ioy reuell lyke suche people ateygned vyctorye enemyes lamorabaquy greate nombre mynstrelles acordyng vsage countrey came kynge hungeryes chefe tent whiche goodly aparelled hanged riche stuffe toke great pleasure glorifyed herte wynnyng iourney shanked god acordynge lawe vnarmed hym refresshe hym sate downe tapyte sylke caused great lordes come iangle talke made great myrthe myght sayd howe wolde shortely great puyssaunce passe realme hungery coquere countrey countreys vpon crysten men bringe obeysaunce sayd content euery man shulde lyue owne lawes desyred nothynge signory sayd wolde reygne lyke alysaunder masydone twelue yere kynge worlde whose lynage sayde dyscended yt herde agreed sayenge madethre comaundemetes fyrst euer prisoner crysten bringe hym forthe seconde daye presence seconde deed bodyes shulde vysyted sertched likely noble men layde aparte selfe raymentes tyll came thyder hym selfe sayd wolde se thyrde enquyre iustely kyng hungery deed lyue done comaunded whan lamorabaquy well refresshed hym passe tyme went ye place felde se deed bodyes shewed hym many men slayne batayle cost hym greatly great marueyle coulde nat byleue mounted horse great nombre hym two bretherne called basaache surbasaach people sayd wolde nat knowen sayd bretherne whan came place batayle founde trouthe many deed slayne sawe yt one crysten man deed founde xxx turkes slayne wherwith marueylously dyspleased openly sayde hath cruell batayle marueyloussly defended crysten men shal make lyue bye derely kynge went lodgynge passed nyght great furour hert mornyng vp moche people came tente knowe shulde chrysten prisoner renome ranne shulde put dethe without mercy lamorabaquy dyspleasure ordeyned suche crysten men batayle great ray lykely great men shulde sette togyther one parte shewed hym myght well pay great raunsomes also dyuers sarazyns panyms perce tartary arabye suryens many prisoner whome thought haue great aduauntage dede hyd way came nat knowledge amonge syr iaques helley brought lamorabaquy durst nat hyde hym lenger syr iaques de helley beknowen kynges seruautes toke hym fro whiche happy hym ye shall many crysten men afterwarde cruelly slayne put dethe kynge basaach comaunded enquyre whiche greatest crysten men shulde set syde entent saue lyues tryed set parte fyrst lorde iohan burgoyne erle neuers chiefe aboue syr phylyppe arthoys erle ewe erle marche lorde coucy syr henry bare syr guy tremoyle nombre eyght persones lamorabaquy went se speke beheld longe seasone coniured lordes faythe lawe saye trouthe persones named selfe sayde ye yet knowe certaynte sente frenche knyght syr iaques helley knowe serued lamorabaquy therfore lyfe grau ted hym demaunded knewe frenche knyghtes prysoners aunswered said thynke ise shall knowe comaunded go auewe theym shewe playnely name dyd comauded whan came shewed aduenture howe sente thyder knowe surely name sayde ah syr iaques ye knowe v ye se well howe fortune agaynst v daunger kynge therfore saue lyues make v rather greater dede shewe kyng suche men able pay great raunsomes syrs quod shall boude therto knight retourned lamorabaquy counsayle syd howe knyghtes whiche hadde spoken greatest men fraunce kynges lyngage said able pay great raunsomes lamorabaquy sayd howe lyues shulde saued prisoner slayne hewen peces example kynge shewed hym selfe people assembled whome made lowe reuerence made lane hym passe thorough euery man sworde naked hande came thyder sayd lordes fraunce stode togyther king wolde se correction whiche thynge sarazyns desyrous brought lamorabaquy naked shyrtes behelde lytell tourned fro warde made sygne shuld slayne brought sarazyns redy naked swordes handes slayne hewen peces without mercy cruell iustyce dyd lamorabaquy daye whiche mo thre hudred gentleman dyuers nacyons tourmented slayne loue god whose soules iesu haue mercy amonge slayne syr henry dantoigne heynalt lord boucyquante marshall fraunce one theym brought naked kynge ben slayne erle neuers nat espyed hym sone sawe hym went streyght kynge kneled downe desyred hym effectuously respyte fro dethe knyght syr boucyquant sayenge howe great man frauce able pay great raunsome lamorabaquy condyscended request erle neuers syr boucyquant sette amonge shulde saued thus cruell iustyce done day vpon crysten men bycause lamorabaquy wolde vyctory shulde knowen fraunce apoynted thre frenche knyghtes come hym wher syr iaques helley one kyng demauded erle neuers whiche tho thre knyghtes wolde chose sende fraunce kynge duke burgoyne father erle neuers sayd syr please wolde knyght syr iaques helley shulde go thyder fro fro v syr iaques taryed lamorabaquy two knyghtes delyuered dethe slayne whiche pytie lamorabaquy well apeased furoute vnderstode howe kyng hungery scaped away lyue determyned retourne turkey cytie called burse dyd thyder ye prisoner brought army departed specyally suche farre coutreys tartary perce mede sury alerandre lecto syr iaques helley delyuered retourne fraunce comaunded retourne throughe lombardy recommaunde lamorabaquy duke myllayne also streyghtly comaunded euery place passed manyfest publisshe victory lamorabaquy vpon crysten men erle neuers wrote frenche kynge hym selfe company father duke burgoyne duchesse mother whan knyght charge well writyng credence departed toke way towardes fraunce departed sworne promysed soone done message frauce incontynent retourne agayne thyder whiche othe promesse acoplysshed lyke trewe knight nowe wyll leaue speakynge tyme lamorabaquy lordes frauce prisoner wyll speke mater fell season pof pouertie mysery crysten knightes fraunce nacyons endured commynge home countreys cap ccxviii great dysco fyture turkes vpon cristen men suche knyghtes could saue selfe dyd mondaye thre hundred knyghtes squyers gone foragynge nat batayle whan knewe fledde batayle doone desyre retourne agayne lodginges fledde well myght toke dyuers wayes flye fro ye turkes ther fled bothe frenchman englisshmen almayns scottes flemynges nacyons came countrey ioynynge hungery called blacquy countrey replenysshed dyuers people conquered vpon turkes tourned perforce crysten faythe kepers porte townes castels suffered crysten men entre lodge nexte mornynge departure tooke fro knyghtes squyers gaue poore cote lytell slyuer passe therwith one dayes iourney grace shewed gentleman yeoman varlettes spoyled naked sore beaten yuell entreated without pytie passed coutrey blacquy great pouerte hugery coude scant get breed goddessake lordgyng nyght endured daunger passynge tyll came vyen austrich receyued swetely refresshed newe cladde throughe realme boesme hadde founde almaygnes harde neuer tourned agayne rather dyed colde hunger euery man herde tell aduenture hadde pytie finally came fraunce paris shewed aduentures begynnynge coude nat beleued parys sayde pytie vnthriftes vnhanged drowned tellyng suche lie howe tidynges dayly multiplyed wt resortyng newe men whan frenche kynge vnderstode newes dayly renewed nothyng pleasaunt hym great domage losse noble men blode good knyghtes squyers realme frau ce comaunded man hardye speke mater tyll better enfourmed certentie comaunded suche come oute hungery shulde taken put prisone tyll trouth knowen many putte prison kyng hadde ordayned newe nat trewe shulde drowned putte dethe phowe trewe tidynges batayle turkey knowen frenche kyng house capi ccxix christemas daye sir iaques helley houre noone entred parys toke lodgynge demaunded kyng shewed hym saynt poules ye ryuer seyn went thyder kyng duke orlyaunce brother duke berrey duke burgoyne duke burbone therle saynt poule dyuers noble men realme fraunce vsage suche noble men kynge suche highe feestes sir iaques helley entred court boted spurred nat knowen long tyme hau ted farre countreis dyd moche came kynges chambre sayd howe came fro lamorabaquy oute turkey hadde ben batayle nicopolye christen men lost iourney sayd hadde letter fro erle neuers fro lordes fraunce suche prisoner brought kynge kneled downe wisely declared message well fro lamorabaquy fro erle neuers lordes fraunce prisoner turkey kynge gaue hym audyence swetely examyned hole mater euery thyng answered discretely ye kyng well content hym ryght soroufull domage ye kyng hugry susteyned howe gladde kyng hungery scaped without dethe prisonment sayde shulde recouer ryght well agayne losse domage receyued tyme also ryght ioyfull erle neuers lordes escaped dethe prisoner sade doute shulde raunsomed delyuered sir iaques helley sayd doute lamorabaquy wolde within ye yere put rausome loued golde richesse sir iaques sayd knewe well bicause long ben conuersaunt turkey serued lamorabaquyes father thre yere thus kynge ryght well receyued knyght dyde lordes suche euery man sayd happy worlde suche batayle haue acquayntaunce suche hethan kynge lamorabaquy sayenge honoure lynage kyng co maunded suche prison delyuered wherof gladde thus newes sir iaques helley brought spredde anone brode fraunce place many right soroufull losse father bretherne husbandes chyldren nat without good cause specially ye gret ladyes fraunce duchesse burgoyne sonne erle neuers doughter margarete heynault soroufull erle husbande lykewyse dolorous mary berrey countesse ewe husbande lorde philyppe arthoise constable fraunce lykewise countesse marche lady coucy dought bare lady sully many ladyes well fraunce place whan wepte ynoughe reconforted selfe natte slayne prisouers suche knewe husbades father bretherne chyldren fredes deed lametacions endured long frauce duke burgon made moche knyght sir iaques helley brought hym worde sonne lyue gaue hym many ryche gyftes reteyned hym one knyghtes two hundred pounde reuenewes yerely duryng lyfe frenche kyng lordes gaue largely knight tha shewed howe must nedes returne agayne lamorabaquy promyse departynge stoode prisoner sayd howe hadde nat retourned message fro lamorabaquy kynge thought resonable shulde kepe promyse kynge wrote prisoner concluded counsayle frenche kyng shulde sende knight honour lamorabaquy thentent myght retourne agayne bring newe tydynges case prisoner apoynted go voyage sir iohn castell morant wyse knyght well languaged demaunded sir iaques iowelles presentes kynge myght best sende lamorabaquy shulde best please entent prisoner shulde better entreated knight answered lamorabaquy toke gret pleasure clothes arras made olde auncyent hystories also sayd great delyte whyte faucons called gerfaucons also sayd fyne lynnen clothes fyne scarlettes moche made clothe golde sylke hadde plentie pleased well frenche kyng duke burgonoe whose myndes sette please lamorabaquy thus xii dayes sir iaques helley taryed parys euery man gladde hym reporte ye aduentures turkey maner lamorabaquy whan deted retourne kynge sayd hym sir iaques take way make small iourneys ease thynke ye wyll returne lombardy speke duke myllayne great amyte bytwene hym lamorabaquy whiche waye euer ye go wyll sir iohan castell morant abyde hungry tyll ye haue gote hym saueconducte go lamorabaquy suche presentes shall sende hym entent shulde fauorable prisoner sir quod shalbe done departed tooke waye came anone departure kynge duke burgoyne dyde prepare presentes sir iohan castell morant dispatched charge hym sixe somers laden presetes two clothes arras goodlyest coude gote wrought storie alexandre lyfe conquestes ryght pleasaunt beholde two somers charged fyne scarlettes whyte reed also moche payne kynge gate whyte gerfaucons thus sir iohan castell morant departed fro parys presentes charge fyftene dayes sir iaques helley departed mean season kynge hungry retourned coutre wherof people right ioyfull loued hym came conforted hym sayde sir though ye haue hadde domage tyme another tyme ye shall right well recouer thus kynge bare domage well myght ye parte lamorabaquy retourned countre came towne called burse thyder prisoner brought sette vnder sure kepynge nothyng ease heate countrey dyette sore chaunged hadde ben vsed swete delycate mete drinkes owne cooke offycers dyde prepare meates accordynge dyettes turkey sarued contrarye grose meates flesshe yuell sodden dressed spyces ynough bredde made mylke clene fro nature frau ce wyne great daunger thoughe great lordes smally regarded turkes lyue sicke hole deed lyue wolde ben putte execusyon prisoner conforted eche within themselfe sawe none remedy nature chaunged fell sickenesse made best chere countynaunce erle neuers dyde conforte companyons also sir bouciquant erle marche sir henry bare good conforte tooke euery thynge paciently sayeng honour armes glorie worlde coude nat hadde without payne somtyme metyng harde aduentures said neuer valyaunt happy alwayes euery thyng wysshed sayde bounde thanke god hadde saued lyues consydringe displeasure lamorabaquy counsayle losse men one determyned shulde generally haue putte dethe bouciquaunt sayd ought aboue thanke god lyfe poynt haue hewen peces company request lorde erle neuers saued aduenture call good sithe god hath delyuered v fro paryll wyll please hym delyuer v fro greatter soudyers sake haue payne reason sir iaques helley gone fraunce trust within yere shall haue good comforte delyuered matter abyde thus frenche kyng duke burgoyn wyll nat forgette v meanes raunsomed delyuered thus sir boucyquaunt reconforted hym selfe tooke euery thyng good pacyence lorde coucy coude take coforte whiche marueyle tyme lorde great wysdome great coniorte neuer abasshed beyng thus prison burse turkey disconforted malencoly sayd sure shulde neuer retourne frauce sir henry bare conforted hym moche myght blamed hym disconforte sayeng howe ought gyue conforte howe sir henry sore abasshed hym selfe oftentymes remembred wyfe wolde wepe pituously lykewise dyd sir philyppe arthoise erle ewe constable fraunce sir guye tremoyle good conforte erle marche lamorabaquy content somtyme shulde haue pastyme somtyme wolde go hym selfe se iangle bourde right graciously wolde shulde se parte estate puyssaunce pnowe lette v leaue somwhat speke speke sir iaques helley sir iohn castell morant bothe ryding towardes hungry sir iaques helley taryed cytie bode hungry ten xii dayes abydinge sir iohan castell morant whan coe sir iaques ioyfull desyrous passe forthe turkey acquyte hym faythe promyse se erle neuers lordes fraunce comforte whan kynge hungry sawe sir iohn castelmorant made good chere loue ye frenche kynge vnderstode frenche kyng sent hym gret presetes iowels lamoraba wherwith sore displeased mynde dissymuled mater kepte couert tyll sir iohan heley departed turkey warde said suche priuye counsayle discouered mater vnto howe miscreant dogge aduersary lamorabaquy shulde haue prese te fraunce fro place el laye power lette sir iohn helley departed promysed gette lamorabaquy saueconducte sir iohan morant passe turkey repasse long trau yled guydes came turkey cytie burse lamorabaquy another cytie called poly euer went prisoner caryed hym excepte lorde coucy taryed styll burse coude nat endure ryde sicke hym taryed cosyn grece right valyant barone discended lynage duke austriche called mathelyn whan sir iaques come poley lamorabaquy gladde se hym bycause come fraunce sir iaques right humbly said right dere redouted sir beholde prisoner best power haue message ye ye gaue charge lamorabaquy sayd thou arte welcoe thou hast trewly acquyted thy sel e therfore acquyte thy raunsome prison thou mayst go retourne tary thy pleasure wherof sir iaques right hubly tha ked hym shewed howe frenche kyng duke burgoyne sente knyght honoure embassade hym credece brought hym certayne presentes pleasure fro frenche kyng lamorabaquy demaunded sene nat knyght aunswered sir haue nat sene knyght hath ye charge message bode hungry sir come shewe therof haue saueconducte sayd knyght come retourne safely lamorabaquy sayd wyll haue one thou wylte deuyse wherof knyght thanked hym departed tyme another tyme sir iaques spake lamorabaquy kneled downe hym humbly requyred myght se lordes knyghtes fraunce dyuers thynges saye countre lamorabaquy studyed lytell aunswered laste sayd thou shalte speke one mo sent erle neuers alone whan come sir helley kneled downe hym therle glad se hym demaunded howe frenche kynge duke father duches mother dyde knyght shewed hym knewe charged saye hym howe nat good leysar talke togyder wolde haue lamorabaquyes men present badde haue done sayd thynges stande wayte vpon sir iaques demaunded erle howe lordes fraunce dyde erle said good case except ye lorde coucy somwhat diseased cytie burse sir iaques shewed hym howe sir iohan castell morant come fraunce fro kyng fro duke burgoyne ambassade lamorabaquy asswage yre hath sent hym ryche iewelles presentes bode hungry kyng come sauecoduct hym come go whiche lamorabaquy hath graunted thynke shall retourne hym shortely herof therle right ioyous durst make semblant feare turkes said sir iaques vnderstande ye quyte raunsome prison ye maye retourne whan pleaseth frauce whan ye come praye shewe kyng father desyre treate shortely maye delyueraunce marchauntes genowayes venisyons agree fyrst worde lomorabaquy shall desyre rau shulde make long treatie wt hym shalbe lost euer vndersta de lamorabaquy trewe worde curtesse shorte mater taken poynt thus erle neuers sir iaques departed whan saueconducte redy delyuered sir iaques toke leaue lamorabaquy courte aquayntaunce rode longe iourneys arryued bode hungry drewe sir iohan moraunt thought longe hym sir iaques sayd sir haue brought saueconducte go turkey youre company retourne agayne pleasure gladde therof knyght lette v go kyng hungry shewe hym therof morowe betymes lette v departe haue taryed longe ynoughe bothe togyder wente kyng chambre shewed hym mater kynge answered sayde sir iohan moraunt ye helly ye welcome ye shall go youre pleasure loue cosyns fraunce wolde gladde pleasure also ye maye go come throughe realme pleasure also turkey ye please presentes sir iohan haue brought frauce wyll nat agree ye shall conuey hell hounde lamorabaquye shall neuer enryched therwith shulde tourne great shame rebuke shulde make auauut bycause hath victorie v hath daunger prison certayne lordes fra ce feare therof shulde sente hym riche presentes gerfaucos care nat foules flye lightly oute one countre another soone gyuen soone lost riche hangynges arras thynges sene endure euer wherfore sir iohan morant ye wyll passe turkey ger faucos go whan please thyng ye shall haue non tha knyght aunswered sayd certaynly sir shulde nat myne honour pleasat frenche kynge lordes haue sente hyder without myght accoplysshe voyage haue charge well quod kynge ye shall haue none waye tyme kynge went fro lefte two knight spekynge toguyder sore troubled abusyon kynge hungery counsayled toguyder best determyned sende hastye messangers freche kynge duke burgoyne sithe sawe coulde haue none remedy wrote letter kyng duke burgoyne shulde uyde mater sente letter poste make hast taryed styll selfes bode kyng hungry abyding retourne messanger messanger spedde well made suche dilygence came parys founde ye kyng duke burgoyn shewed le reed length whiche nothynge pleased marueyle kyng hungry wolde nat suffre presentes passe throughe countre turkey duke berrey excused kynge hungry sayde howe good cause dyde thyng humbly done kynge sende suche presentes hethan thyng duke burgoyne bycause mater touched hym contrary opinyon said thyng reasonable sith fortune hath ben fauorable haue vyctorie suche batayle hath hadde kyng hungry chase hath taken prisoner suche noble men agaynst hym iourney wherfore fredes prisoner may well fynde meanes howe comforte delyueraunce duke wordes vp holden kynge dyuers counsayle kynge demaunded vncle berrey sayeng fayre vncle lamorabaquy soudan hethan kynge sende ruby ryche iewell wheder wyll ye receyne nat sir quod wolde take aduyse yt kyng sayd passeth nat yet tenne yere sythe soudan sente ruby whiche cost twentie thousande frankes kynge hungries dede nat susteygned sayd yuell done stoppe goyng presentes shulde rather hynder prisoner auaunce kyng cousayled write ye kyng hungry amyable letter desyringe hym nat stoppe knyght suffre passe turkey presetes message letter written sealed delyuered agayne messager departed retourne hugry phowe duchesse orlyaunce doughter duke myllayne suspecte frenche kynges syckenesse cap ccxx ye haue harde howe freche kyng lightly euery yere sore enclyned fall fra sey nother phisycion surgion coude remedy hym many said wolde helpe hym whane came poynt labour vayne kynges sickenesse wolde nat cease nother prayer medycins tyll ron full course phisycions arioles charmer whan sawe remedy said surely howe kynge poysoned wytched crafte sorcerye whiche noyse made lordes haue many suspecte nigromancers affyrmed kynges sickenesse came reason sorcery charmes make beleue sayd knewe spyrites shewed deuins arioles charmer certayne brente parys auignon spake moche sayd duchesse valentyne orlyauce doughter duke myllayn hadde witched kynge entent attayne crowne fraunce sclaundred lady ye brute ran realme vsed suche craftes sorcery sayeng long kyng myght se kyng shulde nat amede behoued lady auoyde sclaunder flye fro paryll therof departe fro parys wente asyners fayre castell nere pontoyse teyning husbande duke orlyauce afterwarde went dwelt newcastell ryuer loyre parteynynge husbande sore displeased hert suche brute ran vpon wyfe howe dissymuled mater well myght dyd nat absent hym selfe fro court moche busynesse mater realme duke myllayne called galea well enformed howe doughter duchesse orlyaunce accused wherof sore displeased sente twyse thrise ambassadours frenche kyng cou sayle offred fynde knyght fyght vttrauce man wolde accuse doughter trayson messa gers maner thretned ye duke wolde make warre fraunce bycause frenche kyng beyng good helthe balyngham bitwene saynt omers cali said assone retourned frau ce wolde entende nothyng make warre vpon duke myllayne also kyng englande called hym selfe sonne bycause maryed doughter promysed sende hym thousande speres sixe thousade archer wherof frenche kyng right ioyfull prouisyon made frenche kyng countie sauoy ye dolphenry kynges mynde entre waye lombardy make warre duke myllaygne iourney toke none effecte whan tidynges brought fraunce disconfyture batayle nicopoly turkey ye dethe takynge lordes fraunce kynge duke burgoyne charged busyed behalfe iourney lombardy defected also sawe well yt duke myllayne fauoure lamorabaquy durst nat displease hym lette hym alone phowe duke burgoyne duchesse wyfe toke great dylygence fynde meanes redeme prisone erle neuers sonne prisoner beyng turkey cap ccxxi duke burgoyn duches studyed wayes coulde deuyse maner tretye myght gette sonne prysone knewe well coulde haue hym shulde fayne pay hym great raunsome mynisshed housholde kept meaner estate gathered moche golde syluer coulde without coulde nat bringe aboute purpose gate theym aquayntauuce marchauntes venycience genouoys suche thought meanes shulde rather come purpose duke burgoyne lay styll paris kynge nephue chiefe gouernaunce realme wherby busynesse better effecte seasone parys marchaunt turkey doynge lombardes knowen spoken worlde name called dyne responde hym exchaunges made good fauour kyng lordes iourney turkey batayle moche made often tymes duke burgoyne demaunded hym counsayle howe myght entre treatie lamorabaquy redempcion sonne prisoner turkey sir marchaut lytell lytell meanes wyll founde syr marchauntes gennes isle knowen ouer occupyeth trade marchaudyse quayre alexandre dama danuet turkey farre countreys hethan ye knowe well marchaundyse flyeth ouer worlde syr let kynge write amyably theym promesse great benefytes profytes wolde nothynge ouercome golde syluer also syr kynge cyper hath hadde warre kyng lamorabaquy may ryght well ayde syr ye may sure wyll canne bounde therto nat marueyled though duke burgoyne duches sought wayes howe might recouer agayne sonne heyre therfore touched ryght nere ladyes fraunce tooke great sorowe husbandes louers specyally lady coucy coude nat forget husbande wepte pytuously nyght daye coulde take comforte duke lorayne syr henry two bretherne came saint gobyn se recomforte moche myght sayd wolde sende turkey knowe howe dyd said vnderstode howe gentyll prisone felowes lady coucy thanked greatly two bretherne counsayle great comforte desyred sir robert den valyaunt knyght cambresys take payne go hungery turkey se condycyon husbande lorde coucy knyght sayd sake content go thyder bringe certaynte estate thus made redy fiue persones ladyes fraunce sent lyke wyse knowe case husbandes ye haue herde howe kynge hungery wolde wyse consent sir morant shulde passe turkey frenche kynges presentes opynion kynge longe contynued whiche right dyspleasaunt sir morant syr helley coude nat amende happed yt great mayster rodes came hungery cytie bode whome kyng made good chere wherto bounde daye batayle kynge ben slayne taken nat ben founde two knyghtes fraunce came shewed hym howe kynge wolde nat suffre passe turkey suche presentes frenche kynge sent lamorabaquy wherof meruayle sayde howe wolde speke kynge therin shulde well knowe dyd shewed kyng suche reason tourned kynges opynion leaue passe turkey presentes passed forthe vnder sure safe conduct came lamorabaquy receyued theym gyftes ryght honorably vsage made great ioye presentes knyghtes yt spake one onely erle neuers good leysare departynge erle sayde syrs requyre recommaunde lorde father lady mother lorde berrey specyally kynge salute fro frendes desyre lamorabaquy wyll set v raunsome meanes marchauntes otherwyse raunsomes may quyckly payed delyuered longe taryenge shall lese ye begynnyng viii prisoner nowe xvi whiche xxiiii shall nat delyuered without delyuered one soone one lamorabaquy hath promysed surely wyll nat founde false worde syr morant syr helley aunswered sayd howe comaundement shulde doone whiche bounde departed retourned hungery way encountred messanger sent fraunce kynge bringynge gayne letter fro frenche kynge kyng hungery messanger retourned agayne theym whan sawe retourne done voyage turkey retourned togyther fraunce phowe duke gloucestre subtelly sought meanes howe dystroye kynge rycharde englande nephue cap ccxxii long syth spake duke gloucestre yongest sonne kynge england edwarde thyrde tyme speke tyll nowe bycause herte coude neuer loue frenche men therfore losse frenche men turkey rather gladde sory seasone knyght hym called syr iohan laquyquay chiefe counsayle knowen sayde lorde syr fume pride frenche men well bated reasone iourney hungery turkey full pride brage canne come good conclusion enterprise yt take hande trewe quod duke apered right well duryng warre dayes kynge father brother prince wale coulde neuer atayne iourney agaynst englysshe men therfore canne nat tell shulde haue trewce warre open reason good tytell togyther shulde nowe make better warre euer made nowe floure chyualry fraunce outher taken slayne men englande desyre haue warre rather peace canne better lyue warre peace lyenge styll none aduauntage swere god may lyue two yere good helth war shalbe renewed wyll nother spare trewce respyte assuraunce tyme paste frenche men haue kept promesse v haue falsely craftely taken away herytage duchy acquytayn whiche gyuen delyuered agrement good treatie peace kynge father whiche often tymes haue shewed counsayle fraunce whan met comuned togyther fronter marchesse calays alwayes florysshed entetes swete wordes myne opynion nat regarded belyued nouther kynge nephewe bretherne good heed kynge englande desyred warre well wolde put payne recouer herytage whiche craftely falsely hath taken fro hym without good tytle reasone shulde fynde englande hundred thousande archer syxe thousande men armes redy aparelled serue passe see put goodes lyues aduenture seruyce nat suche kynge englande nowe loueth dedes armes wolde shewe hym selfe fraunce neuer good tyme make warre frauce soeuer goeth nowe shalbe fought withall whiche desyre englysshmen haue trust wynnyng tyme paste dayes good kynge edwarde father brother dayes prince wale ye yongest bretherne englande may beleued shall fyrst e yt shall renewe warre trust recouer wronges frenchman haue done v dayly symple slouthfulnesse monge v specyally heed kynge nephue wyll nowe alye hymselfe maryage frenche kinges doughter token wyll make warre eyen heuy careth nothyng meate drinke reste dalyenge ladyes damoselles lyfe men warre wyll deserue haue honour prowes dedes armes yet remembre last iourney yt made fraunce thynke company two thou sande speares eyght thousande archer passed see entred realme fraunce fro calayes wente longe realme foude none stande none durst fyght lyke wyse dyd syr robert canoll sir hugh caurell thomas grautsome syr phylyppe gyssarde yet nat nombre yet parys demaunded batayle frenche kynge coulde neuer aunswered founde person sayd thyng rode bretayne longe realme fraunce fro calais burdeaux without hauynge batayle rencountre thynke surely wolde nowe make suche iourney shulde fought calleth hym selfe kynge fraunce yonge hote great corage enterprise wolde surely fight ende euer fell therof thynge desyre loue nothynge well haue batayle without batayle victory vpon frenche men ryche el shall haue recouery suffre losse haue done euer sythe nephewe kyng englande thyng nat longe endure estate laste realme englande shall perceyue mater repente kyng taketh shall take reyse great tayles ye marchauntes wherwith nat content yet nat tell good becometh thus kynge enpouereth realme englande gyueth one largely yuell bestowed people vyeth bargayne whiche shortely wyll growe rebellyon within realme people begyn clater murmure therat sayeng howe wyll leger suffre beare sayeth stoppe people rumure trewce one concluded bytwene fraunce wyll make voyage irelande enploye men armes archer hath ben small conquest irelade lande great conquest profyte people rude yuell right poore countrey inhabytable looke wonne one yere loste another laquynay laquynay quod duke haue sayde trouth thus duke gloucestre deuysed knyght suche wordes well knowen hated kynge coulde speke good worde though brother duke lacastre one greatest ruler realme toke care therof whan kyng dyd sende wolde come pleasure sometyme nat whyt whan came kynge wolde laste shulde come first wolde departe counsayle one sayd opynion wolde haue taken accepted el wolde displeased somtyme take leaue departe maner essex called plasshey chiefe abydynge duke great prince might well spende yere threscore thousande ducates duke gloucestre erle essex buckingham constable englande marueylous condycyons kynge douted hym vncles wordes wolde nat spare forbeare kynge kynge alwayes humble meke hym whatsoeuer wolde demaunde kynge wolde graunte hym duke caused englade done many cruell hasty iugementes caused beheeded withoute tytell good reasone noble knyght syr symon burle dyuers kynges counsayle chased englande archebysshop yorke duke irelande bycause nygh kinges counsayle layde charge counsayled kynge wronge ledde hym lyst spente reuenewes englande pleasure duke two bretherne duke lancastre duke yorke two euer kynge wherat duke gloucestre hadde great enuy wolde say dyuers suche trusted robert bysshop london whan came plasshey frendes two bretherne ouerchargeth greatly kynges house better home owne house duke subtyle couerte wayes drewe acorde ye londoner thought might sure shulde sone haue rest realme acorde duke nephue sonne doughter elder brother called lyonell duke clarence whiche doughter maryed lombardy sonne syr galea duke myllayne duke lyonell dyed cytie aste piemounte duke gloucestre wolde gladly haue sene nephue sonne ye doughter duke clarence called iohan erle marche haue ben kynge englande haue nephue kynge rycharde deposed sayd howe kynge nat worthy holde gouerne realme englande wolde say trusted dyd moch caused erle marche come house dyscouered hym entent secretnesse sayde howe determyned make hym kynge englande kyng richarde put downe wyfe also kept prison dutynge lyues desyred effectuously erle accept offre good wyll sayenge howe wolde beste coulde bringe aboute acorde alyaunce erle arundell therle warwyke dyuers prelate lordes englande erle marche sore abasshed whan herde duke vncle speke suche wordes howe lyke yonge man dissymuled mater aunswered wysely thentent please duke said howe wold glad ruled wolde haue hym sayd wolde well aduysed accepted suche promisse sone wolde take therin aduyse delyberacyon whan ye duke gloucestre sawe maner erle desyred kepe mater secrete erle answered wolde therle departed sone coude wente irelande herytage wolde neuer entende duke treatie alwayes excused selfe wysely yet euer kept mater secrete sawe well conclusyon shulde nat good sayd howe duke gloucestre sought wayes coude set trouble englande styrre londoner agaynst kynge yere truce made bytwene englande fraunce endure thyrty yere kynge retourned agayne englande yonge wyfe duke gloucestre enfourmed londoner sayd syrs make ye request kynge shall reasonable desyre seynge hath peace enemyes ye may franke fre fro subsydies aydes hath ben graunted twenty yere past affyrmyng howe nat graunted durynge seasone warre ye syrs quod duke marchauntes yuell entreated sore oppressed pay euery hundred florens xiii goodes spent ydlenesse dau synge makynge feastes eatynge drinkynge ye pay wherby ye sore traueyled shewe kynge howe ye wolde realme englande shulde gouerned acordinge auncyent customes ye may say whan kyng hath nede realme honour coutrey defence therof howe ye wyll redy ayde suche wyse kynge counsayle shall holde content thus settynge duke gloucestre londoner counsayles dyuers cyties townes englande assembled theym togyther day came eltham seuen myle fro london kyng whan came kynge made request foresayd thynges wolde shulde haue ben acomplysshed incontynent whan request made kynge mo vncles two duke lancastre yorke kynge charged duke lancastre make theym aunswere duke sayd syrs kynges pleasure ye departe home euery man owne within moneth assemble agayne togyder london westmynster kynge wyll counsayle noble prelate wyll redy requestes loke shall thought necessary counsayle kynge wyll graunt suche wyse ye shall well contente aunswere pleased many nat opinyon duke gloucestre wolde haue shorter answere duke lancastre yorke apeased fayre swete wordes departed tyme left nat pursute next moneth assembled westmynster ynge kynge counsayle present duke gloucestre greatly enclyned demaundes makinge aunswere spake nat thought hert dissymuled mater entent kynge bretherne shulde nat perceyue mynde duke lancastre made aunswere londoner kynge sayd ye syrs london kynge hath comaunded gyue determynable answere requestes name counsayle consent prelate noble men realme sir ye knowe well entent eschewe parelles daungers myght come realme generall graunt made good cyties townes englande shulde raysed tayle state marchaundyse maner fourme hath tynne nowe vpon syxe yere paye euery hundred xiii reason therof kynge graunted sealed certayne fraunchesses whiche nat mynde take fro rather encrease dayly acordyng desertes ye nowe wolde repell agayne ye one wyllyngly agreed vnto graunted therfore openly repelyth agayne suche grace grauntes hath made tyme beholde noble men prelate haue sworne promessed kynge ayde sustayne thynges lawfully gyuen graunted therfore syrs considre well state king great chargeable augment one maner mynyssheth another rente reuene turneth nat kynges profyte moche hath doone tyme paste kinge counsayle hath ben great coste charge sythe warres renewed bytwene englande fraunce great charge hath kynge suche ambassadours haue treated bytwene party well beyonde see also pursuynge kynges maryage hath coste gret goodes though nowe peace bytwene realmes yet charge great kepynge garysons townes castelles beynge vnder kynges obeysaunce well gascoyne burdeloys bayonois bygore march gyan calays also kepyng see porte hauens englande lykewyse chargeable kepyng fronters scotlande whiche may nat vnprouyded also marchesse irelande thynges consernynge kynges estate honour realme draweth yerely great coste charge whiche farre better knowen noble men ye realme medeleth marchaundyse thanke god irs ye thus peace take hede none paye without worthy occupye feate marchaundyse well payeth straungers ye ye freer marte fraunce lombardy realmes whyther youre marchaundyse repayreth tayled retayled agayne two thre tymes yere ye passe reasonable ordynaunce sette assessed vpon marchaundyse wordes suche lyke spoken duke lancastre apeased greatly people sette yuell settynge thus departed yt tyme without thynge doynge moste parte theym well content suche wolde contrary made semblante therof tyme duke gloucestre retourned maner plasshey sawe well tyme coulde nat brynge purpose passe styll studyed howe make trouble englande fynde wayes howe renewe warre fraunce acorde wyfes vncle erle arundell desyred nothynge warre doone moche drawen acorde erle warwyke tthe kinge englande two bretherne mother one called thomas erle kente seconde sir iohan holande valyaunt knyght wyfe doughter duke lacastre erle huntyngdon chamberlayne kynge slewe sonne rycharde erle stafforde ye haue herde hystorie sayde rycharde erle stafforde squyer sonne duke gloucestre erle huntyngdon moste comonly euer courte kynge brother knewe dealynge duke gloucestre dyd couertely wysely made enquery also douted greatly duke knewe fell sodayne hyghe mynded sawe howe kept enemye aboute hym dethe yonge stafforde peace therof neuer made grudge therof contynued styll kynge loued well brother bare euery man kynge sawe well howe vncle duke gloucestre euer contrary hym euer conspyre agaynst styrre realme rebellyon kynge brother holande wolde often tymes comune togyther seasone frenche kyng sent erle saynt powle englande se kyng doughter quene norisshe loue truce made suche maner codycion subgiettes myght repayre eche dyspyte yuell wyllers kynge erle huntyngdon made good chere well honoure frenche kynge wedded suffer tyme duke lancastre yorke nat kynge began somwhat dissymule sawe well people englande beganne murmure dyuers place state rewle kynge kept mater lykely go yuell thought wolde nat kinges comaundement people came reasone duke gloucestre company kynge englande spared nat shewe therle saint powle state englande stode howe founde alwayes vncle duke gloucestre harde rebell agaynst hym shewed hym thynge yt knewe whan erle saynt powle herde kynge say wyse great marueyle therof sayde howe ought nat suffred sayd syr ye suffre wyll dystroy sayd frauce howe duke gloucestre entendeth nothynge breake peace renewe warre agayne lytell litell draweth hertes yonge men realme parte desyre rather warre peace auncyent wyse men warre beganne styrre shulde nat herde beleued reason right iustyce hath place audyence yuell reygneth therfore prouyde therfore rather betymes late better ye theym daunger wordes erle saynte powle entered greatly kynges hert made hym sore muse erle saynt powle retourned fraunce ye kyng englande shewed mater brother erle huntyngdon said kynge syr fayre brother saynt powle hath shewed trouth therfore take good aduyse mater enfourmed aboute moneth erle saynte powle ben englande retourned fraunce paryllous fame renome ranne vpon kynge englande maner generall brewte erle saynt powles comynge englande treate kynge frenche men myght haue calayes handes brute greatly troubled moued people englade moche certayne london roode plasshey duke gloucestre shewed hym matter duke apeased nat wordes rather augmented sayenge howe coulde nat therwith sayd sure fre che men wolde hadde coste theym kynges doughters might haue calais pleasure answere set londoner fyre sayde howe wolde speke kynge shewe hym howe realme nat cotent well quod duke shewe hym good maner make doute people wyll nat contente marke well answere maketh shewe therof nexte tyme speke thervpon shall gyue counsayle ye shall farther maye well false traytours counsayleth kynge erle marshall capytayne calays hath two tymes frauce taryed parys one chiefe procurer treatie kynges maryage doughter fraunce frenche men ryght subtyle driue purpose farre lytell lytell pursue entente wyll gyue largely bringe purpose acordynge duke counsayle londoner daye wente eltham kynge whiche tyme kynges two bretherne erle kent therle huntyngdon erle salisbury archebysshoppes cauterbury duuelyn confessour lorde thomas percy lorde lysle richarde credon iohan boulofer dyuers knyghtes kynges chambre londoner right wisely shewed kynge entente meke huble maner sayde howe brute ranne kynge delyuer vp calais frenche mennes handes kyng great marueile newes touched hym nere hert right sagely dissymuled mater tyme apesed londoner sayd howe noise wronge nothyng trouthe said erle saynt poule come englande none entente sporte hym sent thider frenche kynge se hym quene wyfe marchaundyse kynge sayde none bytwene kynge sware faythe owed god crowne englade said howe great marueyle wherof suche wordes shulde ryse thane erle salisbury sayde sir ye good men london go home youre house well assured kynge counsayle wyll entende thynge shalbe honour profite realme englande euer hath fyrst brought vp wordes yuell cousayled shewe well howe wolde gladly haue realme trouble haue people ryse agaynst kyng whiche thynge ye london ought feare reason laste rebellyon ye great paryll haue vtterly dystroyed whan yuell people vp gouerne iustyce reason hath place wordes apeased greatly londoner contented kynges answere retourned cytie london kynge taryed eltham ryght pensyue full displeasure reason wordes herde stylle hym two bretherne suche trusted beste thought hym selfe natte well assured amogne vncles sawe well howe absented theym selfe fro courte kepte home owne house halfe doute specially duke gloucestre kepte dayly aboute hym garde thousande archer yt enformed kynge englande suretie vncle ye duke gloucestre erle arundell purposed puissaunce people take kyng yong quene putte castell kepte surely honest maner meate drinke necessary also howe shulde set four gouernours realme duke lancastre duke yorke rewle fro temmys northwarde vnto ryuers hubre thyne thay ronnyng cytie warwyke comprehendynge signory northumberlande boundes scotlande duke gloucestre rule lo londoner essexe co prehendyng boundes see thider ryuer hubre entereth see also porte hauyns aboue london hampton cornwall erle arundell haue rule landes mouynge fro london bytwene sussexe kent arundell surrey deuonshyre barkeshyre hole signory bytwene ryuer thamyse bristowe ryuer syuerne whiche departeth englande wale shall holde iustyce reason euery man entencyons fynde reasonable waye moue agayne renewe warre bytwene englande fraunce ye freche kyng wolde haue agayne doughter shulde sithe eight yeres age paradueture whan cometh xii yeres may repente refuce mariage bycause maryed youth also reason dismary fro heyr bretaygne promised whan cometh perfyte age wyll nat refuce maryage must abyde right styll quene englade haue dowrye wyse shulde crowned quene kynge dyed came laufull age purpose sende agayne frau ce father shewed ye king suche wordes spoken dyuers englysshe men specially londoner coude nat loue kynge repented whan comons sussexe kent essexe vp came london dyde breake purpose cofessed mynde haue slayne kyng erle salisbury erle oxenforde kynges counsayle hadde done meanes rebellyon londoner thane shulde soone haue made newe heed meanes duke gloucestre haue founde person haue crowne gouernynge realme therby haue brought realme better case thane thus londoner suche secte dayly murmured many secrete cou sayls kynge enformed moost faute layde vpon duke gloucestre king richarde abasshed tentymes whan herde sawe suche couert hate yuell wyll borne hym alwayes made louynge countynaunce vncle gloucestre lodoners aueyled hym nothyng daye kynge sayd two vncles lancastre yorke sir goddes name requyre gyue aduise cou sayls dayly enformed asuretie brother myne vncle gloucestre erle arundell complyces mynded take force agrement londoner purpose close castell order fyndynge certayne porcion wyfes lykewise yonge seperate fro kepe estate another place fayre vncles cruell maner ought nat suffred long maye withstande ye haue doone homage sworne trewe presence kynge edwarde good memorie grautfather whiche tyme great prelate lord realme sware kepe maynteyn kynge xx yere paste wherfore fayre vncles loue charyte othe promyse ye haue made counsayle trewly ye bounde farre ymagin myne vncle glocestre entedeth none thing might renewe agayne warre bitwene englande fraunce breake peace whiche haue confyrmed bothe realme sweryng sealyng composycion ioyned maryage ye doughter frauce without thynkyng yuell ye knowe well soeuer dothe contrary yt sworne vnto hath sealed proued dothe yuell ought punisshed therfore bothe body goodes also ye knowe well yt forbeare myne vncle gloucestre moche may take regarde thretnyng whiche myght cost derely vncles ye bounde cousaile sithe demaunde reason whan herde kyng speke thus sawe well howe mater sore troubled mynde touched hym nere also know well moche sayenge trewe sayd sir suffre lette tyme ryn passe knowe well brother glocestre hath moost paryllous heed brayne manne englande knowe well man maye buylde one syde shall buylde long ye wyll ordred cousaile ye shall nat nede care brother saythe often tymes many thyng wherof foloweth none effecte alone counsayle canne nat breke peace taken nat enclose castell shall neuer suffre seperated fro wyfe saye thinke foule abused therfore sir humbly beseche apeace youre selfe euery thyng shall turne well goddes grace man speketh cometh nat effecte sayth oftentymes nat accoplysshe thus duke la castre yorke apeased nephewe kynge richarde two duke sawe well busynesse englande began yuell parceyued gret hatered encreased dayly bytwene kyng duke glocestre thentent wolde nat entremedell bytwene departed fro kynges court company seruauntes toke leaue yt kyng tyme went owne duke lancastre toke hym wyfe lady katheryn ruet hadde ben company yong quene englande went huntyng ye dere vsage englande kynge taryed london afterwarde kynges vncles repented deted ye courte fell afterwarde suche mater englande ye realme trouble whiche nat fortuned ben kynge wolde haue founde prouisyon mater dyde counsayled kyng none kynges seruauntes greatly douted duke gloucestre wolde gladly ben deed nat cared howe gentyll knight sir thomas percy ben long souerayne squyer kynges house frau ce mayster seneschall state kynge passed throughe handes cosydring great hatereddes yt encresed bitwene kyng vncle glocestre among great lordes englande welbeloued like sage knight ymagined conclusyons coude nat good tha gaue vp offyce honorably coulde tooke leaue kynge kynge gaue hym leaue full sore agaynst wyll howe made suche excusacions departed another set offyce kyng yonge counsayle hym greatly douted duke gloucestre oftentymes wolde saye kynge ryght dere sir perylous thyng serue haue sene suche haue serued tymes paste suche ryght synguler fauoure yet haue small guerdone sir symon burle sage valyaunt knight good fauoure lorde father whome god pardone great payne traueyle fyrst maryage yet vncle duke gloucestour caused hym dye shamefully heed stryken lyke traytour worlde dyuers hath put dethe ye knowe well puissaunce ye ye coude nat saue sir sarue nowe looke rewarde whan vncle cometh whiche nat often dare nat lyfte vp eyen loke vpon persone loketh hye ouer v thynketh hym moche wrog nere wherfore sir knowe trouthe yt long liueth shall peace englande ye shall good also thretneth yor wife close vp castell beholden vnder subiection lyue porcion sir ye kyng lost ye take nat good hede self wife nedeth nat care yong doughter frenche kynge dare nat displease moche yuell might come therby englade vncle gloucestre thentent make behated people hath sowen dyuers sclaudorous word vpon throughout lodon place sayeng howe ye nat worthy beare ye crowne holde noble herytage ye realme englande sythe ye haue taken wyfe doughter frenche kyng aduersary wherby saythe ye haue greatly febled signorie realme englande hath sore discoraged hertes noble valyant knightes squiers realme haue alwayes valyantly co tynued warre yet wolde thus saye ye haue brought realme great paryll aduenture lost affyrmyng howe pytie ye haue suffred contynue long ye haue done also frenchemen bruteth ye wyll put armes tharmes frauce wherwith people nat conte hateth therfore thynke trewe bycause ye redy gladde take truce thynke rather byforce loue noble men ye realme haue serued maynteyned warres neuer agreed therto also saye ye haue nat dilygently reuisyted ouersene letter patentes gyuen accorded sworne sealed kyng iohan somtyme frenche kyng sonnes whiche graut child lyueng nothyng vpholden craftely broken frenchman founde cautels subtelties wrongefull wayes renewe agayne yt warre therby toke vsurped right predecessurs quarell hath wonne therby landes countreis acquitany cyties castelles townes saye ye take hede haue loste thoroughe neglygence hath shewed poore corage ye doute ennemyes haue nat pursued accydentes mater good iuste quarell ye yet haue whiche quarell predecessours longe lyued first lorde father ye prince wale ac tayne also good kyng edwarde grautfather toke great payne dilygence augment signory thus sir londoner saye dothe day shall come ye shall repent therfore sir lengar hyde word fro daylye renewed phowe duke glocestre taken erle marshall co maundement kyng cap ccxxiii king richarde englad noted well sayd wordes ye shewed hym secretenesse lyke ymaginatyfe price within season vncles la castre yorke departed courte kynge toke hardynesse hym said hym selfe fyrste better hym distroye another rather another shulde distroye hym thynkynge shortely wolde haue vncle gloucestre suche case wolde assured hym shulde hym displeasure bycause coulde nat bring purpose alone dyscouered mynde trusted best therle marshall cosyn erle notyngham shewed hym full mynde wolde haue doone erle marshall loued kyng better duke glocestre dyde kepte kynges purpose secrete sauig suche wolde ayded coude nat ye kynges pleasure alone day kyng maner goyng hu tynge rode haueryng boure xx myle fro london essexe within xx myle plasshey duke gloucestre helde house dyner kyng deted fro haueryng small copany cae plasshey v clocke ye weder fayre hote kyng cae sodainly thyder tyme duke gloucestre supped small eater satte neuer long dyner supper wha herde kynges comynge went mete hym myddes court dyde duchesse chyldren welcomed kynge kynge entred hall chambre tha borde spredde kynges supper kynge satte nat longe sayd fyrst commyng fayre vncle cause fyue sixe horse sadylled wyll praye ryde london morowe londoner wyll v wyll also myne vncles lacastre yorke dyuers noble men vpon londoner requestes wyll ordred accordyng counsayle comaunde stewarde folowe trayne lodon shall fynde duke thought none yuell lightly agreed ye kynge whan kyng supped rysen euery thynge redy kynge toke leaue duchesse child lepte horsbacke ye duke hym accompanyed onely seuyn seruauntes thre squyers foure yeoman tooke waye bondelay take playne waye eschewe bredwode london comon hyghe waye rode great pace talked way vncle hym aproched stratforde ryuer thamise whan kyng came nere busshment layde rode fro vncle great pace lefte hym somwhat behynde hym sodaynly erle marshall bande came galopyng duke ouertoke hym saide sir arest kynges name duke abasshed worde sawe well betrayed began call loude ye kyng nat tell wheder kyng herde hym nat turned nat rode rather faster dyde pnowe lette v leaue spekyng mater season tyll retourne therto agayne ye haue herde historie howe sir iohn castell morant sir iaques helley sente turkey lamorabaquy fro frenche kyng fro duke burgoyne howe spedde whan retourned fraunce welcome kyng duke burgoyne duches bicause brought certayne tidynges fro erle neuers fro lordes hym said kyng howe trusted lamorabaquy wolde gladly treat rausoms yt sayd knewe yt priuye cousayle feare lest shulde dye prisone bycause owne naturall ayre turkes thynke delyuerauce shuld haue great fynaunce raunsome reason wordes kynge duke burgoyne duchesse wyfe studyed nyght day howe meanes might haue sonne heyre delyuered sayde oftentymes iourney siege nicopoly cost ouer moche therby hadde deed thre bretherne bastarde knyghtes valyaunt men entierly loued fyrst hasell flaunders seconde sir loyes briese thyrde sir iohan ipre another yongest styll home saye trouthe ye duches burgoyne coutesse flaunders studyed syde howe delyuer sonne moche stuyed last founde meanes agre turkes moche payne nat sodaynly done mater suche red great leysar gote lytell lytell season cytie burse turkey dyed ye gentyll knyght frauces anguerant lorde coucy erle saiso great lorde fraunce sir robert deane sent lady coucy goyng hym warde herde way howe deed herd vyen austriche returned fraunce shewed certayne lorde coucies lynage nat good lady wyfe vntyll suche tyme chatellayne saynt goubayne sent fetche deed body enbaulmed frauce buryed thabbey nogent besyde coucy receyued duchesse bare bysshop leon dyuers abbottes getyll knight buryed yere grace thousade thre hundred fourscore seuyntene ye maye well knowe frenche kyng duke burgoyn alwayes ymagyned howe gette frendes prison turkey sir dyne respode alwayes cou sayls sayd euer marchautes venisyas genowayes myght well helpe ayde busynesse sayd marchauntes myght go whider lyst myght well knowen dealyng turkes tartary ye porte passage kynges soudan miscreantes specially resorted quaire alexandre dama antyoche great puissaunt cyties sarazins dayly passe repasse daylye marchauntes christened hath entrecours sarazins exchaunge one nother marchaundyse frenche kynge duke burgoyne sought frendes meanes coulde gette forther hadde desyre make warre vpon duke myllayne bycause vnderstode gret lamorabaquy othersyde kyng iames cypre thought well shulde haue great thanke frenche kyng duke burgoyne myght asswage furour lamorabaquy bringe hym good resonable poynt redemynge lordes fraunce suche prisone please kynge cypre caused shyppe made fyne golde right noble riche ye value well tenne thousande ducates whiche shyppe sente lamorabaquy owne knightes shyppe goodlye fayre great ioye beholde whiche gyfte soudan toke gree sente agayne kynge cypre double value therof anone knowen frauce marchauntes yt wrote therof dyne responde entente shulde shewe frenche kyng duke burgoyn haue thanke kynge kyng cypre good cause thus doute ye frenche kynges displeasure bicause caused slayne murdered night brother valyaunt kynge peter dyde moche trouble sarazins toke saptalye alexandre sarazins douted hym kyng emperour christened bicause valyatnesse whiche dede sayde kynge iames sore repented hym selfe knewe well done yuell dede fledde cypre el christen men wolde haue slayne hym entred galley gene beyng porte nicopossie wente gene genowayes receyued hym said dyde foule murdre entysement genoways anone genouois came puissaunce men warre galyes toke cytie famagous porte kepte puyssaunce kynge cypre fayre yonge sonne cyprience crowned chylde kynge crownyng lyued nat long dyed soone aft dethe genouois great puyssauce brought iaques cypre crowned hym kyng reigned kyng cypre genowayes alwayes susteyned hym agaynst men wolde neuer rendre vp cytie famagous porte helde styll tyme ye auctour wrot hystorie saye trouthe genowayes nat turkes wonne longe realme cipre brought obeysauce lykelyhode subdued ysles rodes ysles enclosed see venyce alwayes genoways venisyas resysted whan sawe turkes wonne realme armony toke strong towne corque hermyne see syde helde nat ben dout passage straytes corque xere costantyne noble turkes sore entred christendome vpon border see whiche shulde haue great preiudyce ysle rodes ysles adioynyng thus meanes fronters christen dome kepte defended pnowe let v retourne purpose kyng iaques cyper knewe hym selfe gylcy deth kynge brother wherby hatred crysten kynges therfore dyd moche coude get agayne loue fauour tooke great honoure frenche kynge wrote fyrst hym douted cause duke burbone ryght successyon lynage lusygnan ought kynge heyres thoughe kynge iaques brother kyng peter cyper yet ryght crowne bastarde knewe ryght well genouoys whan made kynge made great alyaunce bytwene confermed nat broken genouoys defede kepe heyres agaynst therby atteygned great sygnories fraunchesses realme ciper euer dyd exaltynge iaques kynge cyper alwayes owne chiefe auauntage stronge venycians haunte erercyse feate marchaundyse sarazyns landes kinge iaques longe lyued dyd coulde please frenche kynge meanes genouoys wolde wyse dysplease hym therfore season kynge iaques ordeyned shyppe golde presente lamorabaquy haue loue acquayntauce whiche gyft ioyfully receyued moch praysed turkes thought lorde dyne rresponde meanes therof wrote therin genouoys maner otherwayes laboured myght delyueraunce erle neuers lordes fraunce whan duke burgoyne duchesse wyfe sawe lamorabaquy began fall treatie crysten prisoner newes therof greatly pleasure apoynted sage valyaunt knyght countie flaunders called syr gylberte linrenghen souerayne flaunders vnder duke duchesse sent syr iaques helley bycause knewe wayes passage desyred hym acompany syr gylberte treate lamorabaquy delyueraunce crysten prisoner promysed hym payne shulde well consydred rewarded syr iaques promysed two knyghtes departed rode longe came realme hungery drewe kynge letter hym kyng receyued ioyously loue frenche kynge also knewe well syr iaques helley shewed kyng cause comynge fraunce howe sente turkey treate delyueraunce erle neuers lordes frauce lamorabaquy wolde gyue herynge kynge sayde well done redeme myght put raunsome sayd assayenge therof coulde lese nothynge besydes kinge offred body goodes ayde theym maners wherof two knyghtes thanked hym entre treatye lamorabaquy coulde come therto knightes moche payne made great ygece fyrst syr iaques helley fayne go lamorabaquy requyre safe conducte companyon syr gylbert come turkey whan ateyned returned hungery rode turkey souerayne flaunders receyued lamorabaquy men ryght nobly herde speke lytell lytell entred treatie tyme haunted turkey marchaunt genouoy isle sio vnder obeysaunce genouoys marchaut named bartylmew pologrine well loued turkey namely lamorabaquy syr dyne responde beynge parys thentent treatie myght haue better e pedycion wrote letter sayde marchaunt isle sio knewe eche entent please frenche kynge duke burgoyne duches lady frauce suche husbandes frendes prison turkey trust well rewarded good wyll wrote yt euer ende made redempcyon wolde come ettour somme money soone delyuered come power venyciens might certifyed therof incontynent wolde come hym selfe venyce se raunsomes payed delyuered wordes written syr dyne responde sayde marchaunt genouoye enclyned desyre truste well rewarded frenche kynge thought suche kyng good ay also enfourmed kynge cyper desyre frenche kynge duke burgoyne sente men specyciall counsayle turkey lykewyse syr mathelyn lorde damyne two great barones grece good fauoure lamorabaquy traueyled greatly auaunce treatie thentent pleasure frenche kynge without suche meanes mater shulde neuer haue brought aboute bycause turkey great coutrey yuell men traueyle hath nat ben accustomed therto whan lamorabaquy one condyscended entre treatie ordeyned counsayle chrysten prisoner shulde brought togyder cytie burse coclude treatie prisoner brought thyder nombre xxv commynge thyder turkes brought dyd yuell entreate theym bete forwarde casely horsed coulde nat go pace turkes ete bycause sawe shulde de delyuered wherwith sore dyspleased whan knight thus brought cytie burse turkey sent thyder fro frenche kynge fro duke burgoyne fro kynge cypers fro genouoys venycyens receyued prisoner getylly case prisone howe kept euer strayte coulde nat haue thyrde parte wylles lamorabaquy moste specyally herde euer soueraygne flaunders syr iaques helley hadde enfourmed hym howe one chyefe counsayle duke burgoyne lamorabaquy castell besyde burse thyther came sayde messangers laste greed xxv prisoner shulde pay two hundred thousande ducates whiche lordes mathelyn damyne grece marchaunt genouoy sio became dettours taryed pledge lamorabaquy erle neuers sware boude selfe sayd marchauntes sone came venyce nat departe then tyll money payed thus concluded treatie concluded erle ewe speke feble alteracyon ayre course meates dyed loge grece kept prisoner wherof company ryght sory coulde nat amende thus syr phylyppe arthois erle ewe constable fraunce deed enbawmed brought fraunce buryed churche saynt laurence ewe whan lamorabaquy contented marchaundes bondes det sayd soueraygne flaunders sir iaques helley tooke leaue retourne fraunce lamorabaquy well contente therwith ordeyned two knightes shuld haue shuld receyue twenty thousande ducates rebated hole kyng basaache consydered payne traueyle endured specyally soueraygne flaunders greatly fauour two knyghtes thanked kynge gyft toke leaue hym afterwarde frenche knyghtes lordes whan departed fro kynge came cytie burse departed lefte erle neuers lordes fraunce styll cytie burse taryed lordes mathelyn damine shuld come thyder see receyue galees two knyghtes toke galee passenger sayle mathelyn departynge fro porte wether fayre temperate whanne abrode see wynde chaunged marueylous great tempest soueraigne flaunders reason sore traueyle tempest fell sore sycke see dyed came mathelyn wherof syr iaques helley ight sory remedy sayled forthe galee venyce passed rodes alwayes went publysshed redempcyon lordes fraunce wherof rodes ryght ioyfull last knyght came fraunce shewed kynge lordes ladyes howe spedde wherof kynge right ioyfull thanked knyght traueyle payne taken iourney whan redempcyon lordes knyghtes fraunce apoynt lamorabaquy thought departed haue company shulde large better entreated reason sythe lenger prisoner thought shulde se parte puyssaunce state whiche shewed marueylous great sumptuous kepte moche people dayly aboute hym thus sent noble men house bring presence made good chere euery thynge delyuered ordinary courte acordynge vsage countrey euery daye kynge talked erle neuers truchman greatly honoured erle neuers sawe well lyke great man fraunce sonne great lordwherof well enfourmed whiche founde true reason great sute made redempcyon great money agreed paye erle neuers company great marueyle great state kept people laye euer felde towne coulde suffyce spence howseholde charge meate drinke marueyle consydre fro whence shulde come countrey hote people sobre dyet vse moche spycery specyally suger gotes mylke wherof haue great haboundaunce whiche comon drinke sarazyns haue plenty bredde made grayne called mylle euer aboute hym seuen thousande fawconers many hunter daye wente hawkynge flyght fawcon egle presence erle neuers whiche flyght pleased nat lamorabaquy wherwith sore dyspleased shewed faute poynte two thousande fauconers haue loste heedes bearyng hande nat dylygent kepynge hawkes another tyme presence erle neuers woman came complayne kynge desyringe haue ryght iustyce vpon seruaunt sayenge syr kynge come soueraygne complayne seruaunt chambre shewed come day howse mylke gote chyldren hath dronken agaynst wyll syr said wolde wronge wolde complayne soone sayde gaue two great blowes wolde nat forbeare spake name therfore syr kynge iustyce ye sworne people kinge marked well woman wordes caused seruaunte come fore hym woman also caused woman renewe complaynt seruaunt began excuse hym sayd knewe nothynge matter woman spake wysely affyrmed wordes trewe kynge sayde woman aduyse ye well fynde thy wordes vntrewe thou shalte dye yuell dethe syr quod content wordes nat true nede come presece iustyce desyre none thyng thou shalt haue iustyce quod kynge haue sworne euery man woman kynge caused man taken caused bely opened se eaten dronken mylke nat founde dronke mylke nat turned digestyon whan kyng sawe woman wordes trewe said thou haddest good cause complayne go thy way quyte thou art well reuenged trespase done good recompence man deed iudgement lordes fraunce sawe herde phowe lordes fraunce returned see venyce isle founde waye cap ccxxiiii whan erle neuers lordes frauce ben taken prisoner batayle nycopoly turkey whan sene season state maner lamorabaquy content euery thynge vnderstode lorde mathelyn lorde damyne marchaunt sio come burselle turkey gaue leaue departe came togyther lamorabaquy excepte erle ewe lorde coucy bothe deed thus toke leaue thanked hym curtesies lamorabaquy said therle truch man iohan knowe well thou arte great lorde thy countrey sonne great lorde thou art yonge pe aduenture shall beare blame shame aduenture hath fallen thy fyrste chyualry excuse thy selfe blame recouer thyne honour peraduenture thou wylt assemble puyssaunce men come make warre agaynst doute feare therof thou departed shulde cause swere thy lawe faythe yt neuer thou none thy company shulde beare armure make warre agaynst wyll nother make ye none thy company make suche othe promesse wyll whan thou arte retourned arte thy pleasure rayse puyssaunce thou wylte spare nat come agaynst thou shalt fynde alwayes redy receyue thy company felde playne batayle say shewe whome thy lyste able dedes armes euer redy conquere crystendome hygh wordes erle neuers vnderstode well dyd company thought longe lyued tooke leaue conducted great nombre vnder leadynge assybaathe surbasaache delyuered lordes mathelyn damyne cause delyueraunce whan galees redy entred conducte retourned kynge sayled tyll came ye porte mathelyn receyued great ioye lady mathelyn ryght honourable gentle well assured selfe lady grece youth ben brought vp emperour constantyne noble courte lady mary burbone lerned moche norture fraunce lordes ladyes honourable many coutreys lady right ioyouse se house erle neuers syr henry bare sir guy tremoyle receyued ryght honourably great ioy dyd coude pleasure first newly aparelled lordes knyghtes fraunce shyrtes gownes aparell fyne damaske acordynge vsage grece euery man degre lady spared nothyng wherfore gaue great thanke greatly praysed estate ordre lykewyse thaked praysed lordes mathelyn damyne made good chere honourable anone tydynges delyueraunce knowen rodes wherof great mayster roodes knyghtes ryght ioyfull determyned arme forth two galees sende theym come isle rodes dyd one galee sette syr iaques brassemont burgonyon marshall rodes longe sayled rowed aryued mathelyn marshall well receyued euery man lady mathelyn lordes refresshed foure dayes fyfte daye galees redy erle neuers tooke leaue lady mathelyn thanked greatly lordes also erle neuers sayd bounde euer towne good wyll lady answered wysely entred galees porte mathelyn wynde wether wyll sayled longe without daunger domage came aryued isle rodes place galees aryue comynge fro cyper fro barne fro partes see orientall many knyghtes roodes ought men valyaunt corage beare whyte crosse signyfieng crosse christ dyed toke payne redempcyon crysten people nere hande daily knightes haue skrymysshes assawtes ayde sustayne chrysten faythe agaynst myscreautes wherfore knyghtes ought valyaunte men nourysshed warre whan erle neuers company come isle rodes great mayster great priour acquytanye receyued frenche men honourably offred lende golde syluer paye small charge costes whiche offre erle neuers company toke great curtesy hertely thanked great nede therof great priour acquytanie right valyaunt knyght lente erle neuers thyrty thousande frankes redy money syr reygnere potte stewarde erle neuers lorde rocheforde burgoyne receyued money thynke generally euery man shulde haue parte erle became dettour money thus taryed isle rodes good seasone refresshe theym sette euery thynge good ordre ayre atteperate whe ben turkey taryed thus rodes abydynge galees venyce syckenesse toke syr guy tremoyle lorde seully whiche sycknesse dyed buryed churche saynte iohan rodes lordes fraunce dyd obsequy ryght reuerently ryght sorye dethe remedy erle neuers knewe well duke burgoyne wolde sore dyspleased deth bycause always foude hym sage good counsayle laste aryued galees venyce wherof frenche men ryght ioyous tooke leaue lordes rodes thus departed erle neuers sir henry bare boucyquante guillyam tremoyle lorde rocheforde patrones galees pleasure contente suffre refresshe theym isle bytwene venyce rodes fyrste came modon fyue hundred myle fro roodes refresshed parteyned venycyens fro modon sayled wynde wether wyll came isle calefo refresshed theym fro thence isle garre taryed came isle chyfolignie landed founde great nombre ladyes damosel sygn orite isle receyued frenche men great ioye brought passe tyme aboute isle whiche ryght fayre pleasaunte suche knowe condycions isle affyrmeth fayry nympes moche conuersaunt marchauntes venyce geane landes suche haue aryued taryed seasone eschewe daunger see haue said haue sene fairy haue proue wordes trewe erle neuers company right ioyouse company ladyes ryght ioyously ladyes receyued sayd howe comynge thyder dyd isle great honoure bycause noble knyghtes men honoure hath nat acustomed none conuersaunt amonge marchauntes isle nat onely enhabyted woman men amonge woman haue soueraynte chefe rule worke woman sylke worke make clothes sylke subtelly well none lyke men isle canne nat
