make cary sell thynke haue profyte woman abyde styll ye isle honour men sayde cause haue profyte therof isle condycion man dare aproche domage euer dothe perysshed hath ben sene proued therfore ladyes endure euer peace dought man also marueylous swete gentle amyable humble whan wyll speke fayry company whan erle neuers company refresshed isle chyfoligne aboute fyue dayes toke leaue ladyes lefte amonge ladyes parte suche myght forbeare ladyes gaue great thanke departynge sayled lande called raguse rested fro then clarence hundred myle fro venyce whyle thyther came squyer haynalt great recomendacyon borne towne mon called brydoll came fro holy scpulcre fro quayre fro saynt katheryns mounte whan came clarence frenchman made good chere bycause borne haynalt countesse neuers doughter erle heynalte also bycause ben farre countreys demaunded newes fro party also state kynge cyper aunswered euery thynge ryght wysely whan erle neuers refresshed hym season sayled forthe came porte parcuse great galees coude go come ye porte venyce within certayne space tooke small shyppes passenger came venyce receyued great ioye thanked god come thyder sauegarde handes myscreauntes one feare neuer haue come handes euery man wente logynge prepared commynge thyder knowen seruauntes come thyder prepared redye agaynst commyng erle neuers founde redy parte seruauntes sente thyder duke burgoyne father duches mother also redy syr dyne responde bycause raunsome clerkes sette write letter messangers sente forthe gyue knowledge frendes comynge newes anone knowen ouer duke burgoyne duchesse ordeyned state sonne vessell plate syluer golde aparell stuffe housholde sent venyce somers lorde angyers syr iaques helley dyd conuey stuffe came venyce lordes knyghtes frendes dyd sende thyder lyke maner ye maye beleue well nat dooue without great coste nothynge spared also laye venyce great coste charge venyce one derest townes world straungers lye thus lordes kept estate therle neuers charged reasone chiefe duke burgoyne duchesse sette entente delyueraunce sonne desyred greatly se theym dyd many duke sayd without ayde men good frendes landes well burgoyne arthoys flaunders coulde nat tell howe atteyne somme money lamorabaquy shulde haue sonnes raunsome beare costes dayly grewe occasyon though raunsomes drewe two hundred thousande floreyns thynges consydred charge drewe moch sayde receyte delyueraunce therof duke tooke counsayle money shulde reysed ye duke coulde nat breke mynysshe estate nat mynde determyned ryche men good townes shulde tared specyally flaunders bycause ryche reason marchaundyse taracyon sette forwarde whan gaunt called curtesly mater aunswered sayd wolde gladly helpe ayde en erytour fyfty thousande florayns lykewyse bruges good townes flaunders redy ayde lorde duke duchesse thanked curtesly lykewise dyde arthoise burgoyne also frenche kynge ayded well parte also cost hym great rich sendynge presentes knightes hungry turkey howbe well contente therwith syth cosyns knyght bouciquaunt come venyce suretie therle neuers laye thus styll venyce entet nat dete then tyll euery thynge payed discharge furnysshing fynaunce sir dyne responde toke great payne entente pleace frenche kynge duke burgoyne suche busynesse subtyle wyse thus frenche lordes knyghtes sported eche season felle venyce great mortalyte began moneth auguste dured without ceassynge tyll saynt andrewes tyde wherin dyed moche people dyed sir henry barc eldest sonne duke bare herytoure wyfe lorde coucyes landes excepte ladyes dowrye thus season bothe lady coucy widowes husbandes deed whiche great domage body enbaulmed caryed fraunce buryed parys beleue obsequy done solempnely flye eschewe fro deth venice erle neuers went taryed trenuse estate taryed four monethes company thus erle neuers beynge trenuse shewed kyng hungry roodes howe frenche lordes agreed lamorabaquy paye somes two hundred thousande florens kyng sent letter bysshoppe certayne knightes venice fauour frenche knyghtes also charged saye certayne wordes therle neuers ye shall whan cae thider said hym sir sent hider fro souerayne lorde kyng hungry cosin saluteth v letter hath sente vnto vnderstadeth howe ye delyuered fro handes turkes aduersaries certayne rausome whiche otherwyse ye coude nat haue ben deliuered wherof right ioyouse sir kynge knoweth well yt treatie coude nat haue ben made without great cost charge besyde ye lost batayle raunsome charge hath ben dayly great wherfore sir kyng sayth myght ayde thyng wolde gladly thynketh selfe bounde therto well lynage otherwyse sir toke suche domage daye batayle nichopoly ye knowe well also reuenues realme yere ye next maner lost wha hath recouery therof power saythe wyll purney ye shalbe wel content hym thus good wyll sir thentent ye shall gyue credence promise sayeng hath cytie venyce yerely renenewes seuyn thousande ducates sir content solde venycience money shall ryse therof ye shulde vse ayde selfe therwith ye wolde owne goodes sir shall delyuer quitauces venicyence haue authorite offre greatly pleased erle neuers cousayle lorde rocheforde answered said howe erle co pany thanked greatly kynge hungry wolde sell laye gage enherytauce ayde sayeng howe nat refused forgotten desyring take lytell counsayle mater dyde within brefe tyme shewed kyng hugeries ambassadours behalfe erle neuers shulde nat couenyent kyng hungry shulde sell ley pledge enherytaunces mennes cause ambassadours wolde moche shewe venicyece wolde moche lende therle neuers certayne florence helpe paye erles charge paye agayne priour saynt iohns acquitayne xxx thousande florens lent isle rodes thus doyng saide wolde highly thanke kynge hungry counsayle ambassador saide wolde best assaye venicyece wolde whan venycience moued mater answered coldly said wolde take counsayle gyue answere within fyftene dayes whiche tyme answered enformed one answere gyueng kyng hungry wolde selle hoole realme venycience shulde redy bargayne hym pay hym redy money said lytell thynge scuyn thousande ducates yere coulde make price valewre therof nother sell wherfore said wolde nat medell small mater answere venycience made thought ymagined answere made waye dissymulacion thoughe kynge hungry made offre yet agrement ye venicyens made answere thus mater abode styll kyng hungry styll possessyon reuenewes thane kynges ambassadours departed fro venyce retourned hungry erle neuers abode styll trenuse bycause mortalyte venyce ye haue herde howe lorde philyppe arthois erle ewe constable frauce dyed ye cite burse turkey whose dethe frendes sorie specially frenche kyng loued hym entierly office suche myght nat longe vacant whervpon lordes fraunce assembled togider take aduyse shuld made constable parte ye cou saile agreed valyant knight sir loys sanxere ben long marshall frauce tyme party languedoc sente incotynent came paris ther made costable voyde office marshall ye kyng sayd none shulde haue yt office alouely knyght sir bouciquaunt euery man agreed therto well worthy whan chosen venyce shortely came paris rausoms one payde lordes knightes frauce returned home sir bouciquaunt marshall fraunce therle neuers drewe duke burgoyn father duches mother great chere made hym reason came fro longe voyage peryllous well receyued father countreis flaunders arthoys burgoyne place parteynyng father enherytauce phowe returne lordes fraunce frenche kyng entended myght set concorde peace churche cap ccxxv therle neuers thus returned frauce abode duke father visyted la de signory desyre go se ye freche kyng duke orlyauce receyued hym great ioye kyng duke orlyaunce great appetyte therle speke ye newes turkey aduentures state lamoraba therle answered wisely coplayned nothing lamorabaquy said foude hym ryght curtesse howe well entreated forgat nat shewe ye kyng lady howe departyng lamorabaquy said hym borne worlde dedes armes coquere euer wolde nat comaude whan prisoner shulde beare armes agaist hym said wolde rather haue come agayne seconde thirde fourthe tyme nede dedes armes required also said howe entent se rome make horse eate otes vppon saynt peter aulter also sayde howe cristen faythe nothyng worth corrupted heedes ought gouerne wherat turkes make mocke wherfore sayd shulde distruction christendome ye tyme come dyuers turkes sarazins sayde kyng lamorabaquy borne lorde worlde turkey tartarye perce alexandre party sarazins landes sayde knewe well shulde reasone christen men abused vpon ii pope wherby christen men nat one accorde differedde beleuyng one pope vpon sarazins great marueyle howe heedes christendome euery realme wolde suffre wordes erle neuers made frenche kyng lordes greatly muse sayd howe sarazins good reason laugh mocke christendome bycause suffred prelate churche medell moche therfore sayde tyme abate pompes bringe reason clerkes vnyuersite paris traueyled lerne coude nat come preferment benifyce reason scisme churche two pope wherfore wolde gladly people shulde murmure agaynst ryght gladde erle neuers sayde turkes made great derision therof sayd howe without fre che kynge kyng almaygne foude remedy euery thynge shulde worse worse saye trouthe suche helde neutre thought hadde taken best waye euery man ought wolde bring churche good case also secretly shewed frenche kyng suche loued suche loued helthe howe comen opinyon realme frauce shulde neuer haue perfitely helth vnto tyme churche brought another estate also shewed kynge howe kynge charles father whan laye dethe beed charged counsayle conscyence great dout sore abused two pope freche kynge answered sayd whan kyng father dyed yonge haue beleued hyder suche haue counsayled folly nat sythe nowe enformed matter shall prouide remedy shalbe well sene frenche kynge marked mater profoundely thane euer dyde sayd cousayle howe wolde prouyde mater spake therof brother duke orlyaunce erle bloyes valois agreed anone kynges wyll lykewise dyde duke burgoyne though obeyed pope clement yet neuer ferme beleue hym prelate realme fraunce specially guy roy archebysshoppe reyns archebysshoppes sen roen bysshoppe ostune brought duke beleue pope clement thane aduysed kynges secrete cousayle purposed bringe churche rest peace haue accorde almayne sente suffycient ambassadours clerkes bothe lawes maister philyppe playes one almayne kyng boesme almayne wrote hym selfe kyng romayns mater went forwarde yt day sette kyng almayne counsaile freche kyng cou sayle shulde mete sonally cyte reynes mater done secretely bicause prelate cardynalles archebysshoppes bysshoppes shulde nat breke purpose made noysed metyng two kynges counsayls reynes non purpose treate maryage bytwene sonne marque blanquebourge brother kyng almayne doughter duke orlyaunce reason vnder colour mater wolde common seasone dyed nesues heynaulte lorde guye chastellone erle bloyes brought valencenes buryed saynt fraunces freres mynours chapell called chapell orthais done moche coste closynge sayd freres whan dyed dette countesse mary namure forsoke al goodes durst nat take admynistracyon testament retourned dowrie lande chinay beaumonde herytages went heyres duke orlyaunce hadde countie blois payed whyle erle guye lyued two hundred thousande crownes frauce landes hollande zelande heynaulte wente duke aubert bauyere erle heynaulte lande dauesnes landrecier lonnon terreasse fell iohan bloyes called iohn bretaygne erle nat solde countie blois sayd iohan bretaygne shulde haue heyre therof consydre domage lorde may heyre gyueng credece yuell counsayle god forgyue hym pnowe lette v retourne busynesse englande pof dethe duke gloucestre exle arudell howe kynges vncles londoner toke mater capi ccxxvi ye haue herde couert hate bytwene kynge rycharde englande vncle thomas duke gloucestre whiche kynge wolde beare lengar sayd also counsayled rather distroye another man hymselfe ye haue herde howe kyng plasshey crafte coloure brought hym owne house london waye x xi cloke nyght therle marshall arested hym kynges name cryed kynge yet kynge made deafe eare rode nyght kynge laye towre london duke gloucecestre otherwise lodged byforce put barge barge shyppe laye thamise erle marshall hym company dyde moche nexte day night came calais without knoledge man excepte kynges offycers sayd towne ye maye well knowe whane takynge duke knowen pla hey duchesse chyldren sore troubled abasshed thought well matter went nat well duchesse demaunded cousaile best sir iohan laquyham knight answered best sende bretherne duke lancastre yorke myght fynde meanes apeace kynges dyspleasure sayde thought kyng wolde nat displease duchesse dyd knyght counsayled sente incontynent messangers two duke farre sondre whanne herde therof sored displeased sente worde agayne duchesse shuld good coforte sayd knew well kyng wolde nat entreat hym laufull iudgement otherwise coude nat suffre thanne knewe natte duchesse chyldren somwhat conforted answere kynge nexte daye wente fro towre london eltham taryed night brought towre london prisoner erle arundell erle warwyke wherof cytie london great marueyle made therof great murmurynge none durst saye nay agaynst kynges pleasure maner people knightes squyers burgess good cyties townes englade said haue well suffred duke lancastre duke yorke bretherne duke gloucestre maye prouyde whanne please thynke wolde well haue prouyded mater hadde knowen kynges entent agaynst brother glocestre bycause nat dilygent cause matter come yuell lyke haue yuell conclusyon whan duke glocestre brought castell calys feared hym selfe greatlye said erle marshall cause brought englande hyder calais thynke ye holde prisoner lette go abrode se fortresse aboute sir quod marshall ye desyre dare nat haue charge vpon payne lyfe kynge soueraygne lorde lytell myscontente wherfore ye muste take pacyence seasone tyll newes shalbe shortely goddes grace sir helpe god right sorie trouble myght remedy sir ye knowe well sworne kynge wherfore must obey wyll sauynge myne honoure duke coude haue none aunswere sawe feared greatly lyfe daye desyred preest sange masse hym myght co fessed good leysar sacrament deuout herte cryed god mercy sore repentaunt synnes dede tyme hym dethe nerer hym ware enfourmed whan hadde dyned aboute haue wasshen handes came chambre foure men caste sodaynlye towell aboute duke necke two one ende two drewe sore fell erthe strangled hym closed eyen whan deed dispoyled hym bare hym beed layde hym bytwene shetes naked heed softe pyllowe couered clothes furred yssued chambre hall well determyned wolde saye sayde openly howe palueysye hadde taken duke gloucestre night sodaynly dyed wordes anon abrode towne calais beleued theym natte within two dayes duke thus deed erle marshall appareled hym selfe blacke bycause nere cosyn many knyghtes squyers calays dethe sooner knowen fraunce flaunders englad frenche men gladde therof comon brute shulde good peace bytwene fraunce englande long lyued treaty bytwene frauce englande euermore harder obstynaier thane bretherne wherfore cared nat dethe lykewise many men englande bothe knyghtes squyers officer kynges feare hym bycause crueltie suche gladde dethe toke recorde cruell dedes ye duke irelade exyled englande also ye deth valyant knight sir symon burle sir robert triuylien sir nicholas bramble sir iohan standysshe dyuers duke dethe lytell regarded englande excepte suche opinyon thus duke dyed calais body enbaumed seared leed couered sente see englande shyppe caryed hym arryued castell hadley vpon thamyse syde fro then caryed chariot symply owne place plasshey buryed churche whiche sayde duke hadde founded honoure hooly trynite wherin twelue chanonnes synge diuyne seruyce ye maye well knowe duchesse gloucestre affren sonne two susters sore discofyted whan sawe duke brought thyther deed duchesse double sorowe richarde erle arundell vncle heeded openly kynges comaundemet chepesyde lorde durst speke contrary kynge beyng presente iustyce doynge done erle marshall hadde wyfe doughter sayde erle arundell yet bounde eyen hym selfe erle warwyke great daunger beheeded erle salisbury kynges fauour desyred kynge lyfe dyde dyuers baron prelate englande kynge enclyned requestes yt myght banysshed putte suche place shulde natte come fro kyng wolde nat clerely forgyue hym sayde well deserued dye bycause counsayle ye duke gloucestre erle arundell haue broke peace truce taken bitwene fraunce englande whiche artycle kyng sayd deserued dye peace taken bytwene tie suche codycion yt euer dyde breake shulde worthy dye erle salisbury ben erle warwykes companyon dyuers tymes excusyng said howe olde man desyred duke gloucestre fayre wordes wherfore sayd dyde natte owne mocyon affyrming howe neuer none ye beauchampes euer dyd trayson agaynst crowne englande thus erle warwyke pytie respyted fro dethe banysshed ysle wyght sayde hym erle warwyke ye haue deserued dye well erle arundell great seruyce ye haue done tyme past kynge edwarde prince sonne crowne englande aswell syde see byonde hath done great ayde kyng hath pyte hath grau ted lyfe ordayned iudgement yt ye shall go ysle wight lyue longe ye shall haue suffycient owne maynteyne estate soberly ye maye neuer departe then erle toke punysshement worthe thaked kyng counsayle sauyng lyfe made hym redy go thyder daye apoynted whiche ysle space sufficient lorde kepe estate enuyroned see thus passed forthe iudgementes englande season whiche multiplyed dayly worse worse ye shall whan dethe ye duke gloucestre knowe duke lancastre yorke inco tinent knewe well kynge nephue caused hym slayne murdered calays two duke nat toguyder eche owne plate wrote eche knowe best came london knewe well londoner nat content dethe duke brother whan mette toguyder tooke cousayle sayd suche dedes ought nat suffred putte dethe hyghe price brother ydell wordes false reportes sayd though spake oftentymes breakyng ye peace yet neuer brake bytwene sayenge doyng great difference reason wordes ought nat deserue dethe suche cruell punycion two duke case haue put englande great trouble ynowe redy counsayle therto specially erle arundelles lynage erle staffordes whiche great kynred englande kyng eltha sente suche helde hym chiefe redy assembled toguyder london kent essexe mo ten thousande archer sir iohan hollande brother hym therle marshall erle salisbury great nombre lordes knyghtes kyng sent london shulde nat receyue duke lancastre answered sayd knewe cause duke hadde done shulde refuce hym duke lancastre lodon erle derby sonne also duke yorke sonne iohan erle rutlande kyng loued erle rutlande beyonde measure dissymuled dethe vncle duke gloucestre shewed howe wolde gladly se good peace bytwene party said howe knew well vncle dyde wronge oftentymes agaynst kynge londoner lykewyse consydred great myschiefe yt myght fall englande discencyon bytwene kynges vncles kyng alyaunces also consydred syth myschefe fallen duke gloucestres dethe recouery therin knewe well bycause ye duke gloucestre lauesse tonge wolde haue styrred realme haue broken trewce bytwene englande fraunce wherfore suche wyse men cytie dissymuled mater thought tyme mende feared puyssauce fraunce lesynge marchaundyse beganne treate went meane bytwene king duke lancastre many imagynacions dethe brother troubled sore also sawe howe nephue kynge rycharde alyed mariage frenche kyng also ye duke lancastre ii doughters lande one quene spayne nother quene portugale whome thought shulde haue great ayde made warre agaynst nephue kynge rycharde thynges consydred duke chaunged courage desyre londoner prelate englande meane bytwene kyng hym meanes kynge agreed duke peace made kinge promysed fro then forwarde gouerned duke lancastre nothyng counsayle aduyse whiche promesse kynge nothynge fulfylled counsayled yonge wylde cousayle whiche hurte great domage ye shall hystory thus kyng englande peace vncles bycause dethe duke gloucestre beganne reygne fiersly dyd kynge went lay essex duke gloucestre chiefe rule whiche ought haue pertaygned affcen sonne heyre kynge toke ordynaunce englande kynge haue ye warde herytours chyldren orphelyns vnder age xxi yeres haue herytages thus kinge tooke wardeshyppe cosyn duke gloucestres herytour kynge toke possession profyte duke lande kepte chylde hym duchesse gloucestre two doughters quene duke gloucestr enherytaunce constable englande kynge toke offyce fro right heyre gaue cosyn erle rutlande kynge kept greate state euer dyd nat ben kynge englande spente moche yerely hundred thousande noble dyd lyke wyse kynge hym heyre erle arundell beheeded london bycause knyght belongyng duke gloucestre called cerbe spake tyme certayne wordes agaynst kynge counsayle taken beheeded syr iohan quynghay great parell whan sawe mater went dyuersely dyd dyssymuled moch might departed fro duchesse gloucestres house wente dwelt place pin dayes none great englande yt durst speake agaynst thynge kyng dyd wolde counsayle mete appetyte exhorted hym lyst kynge kept styll wage ten thousande archer night day wayted reputed himselfe nat parfytely sure vncles lygnage arundell pof great assemble made cytie reyns well emperour realme frauce state holy churche cap ccxxvii seasone great asseble gret lordes cytie reynes lordes empyre fraunce entent bring churche peace reste frenche kynge dyd moche request cosyn kynge almayne came cytie reynes counsayle bycause wolde nat haue brewted assembled onely mater twent pope one rome auygnon made noysed came thyder treate maryage sonne ye marque blacquebourge doughter duke orlyaunce marque brother kynge almayne frenche kyng lay archebysshoppes palayes hym duke orlyauce berrey burbon therle saynt powle dyuers hygh barones prelate fraunce whan kinge almayne entred cytie lordes prelate kynge charles nauer lykewyse went mete hym receyued hym honourably fyrste brought hym lady churche abbey saynt remy kynge almayne laye lordes aboute hym ordeyned frenche kinge euer kynge almayne spent shulde frenche kynges cost almayns euery day delyuered theym ten tonne herynge lent tyme eyght hundred carpes besyde fysshes whiche great charge whan kyng almayne came first frenche kynge lordes went hym saynt remy brought ye kynges palays whan two kynges mette made great honoure eche great reuerence specyally frenche kynge almayns nature rude grose manered without take profyte therto experte redy ynough lordes fraunce almayne toke acquayntaunce eche louyng wordes countinaunce frenche kynge made kynge almayne company great dyner one table sate fyrst patryarke iherusalem king almayne frenche kynge kynge nauer sate mo table table sate lordes prelate almayne lorde frauce sate day sarued kynges borde meate brought duke berrey burbone erle saynt powle great lordes frauce duke orlyauce set euery man downe vessell golde syluer ranne plentuously palays though ben wode erthe sumptuous dyner enfourmed frenche kynge gaue cosyn kyng almayne vessell plate gold syluer serued day palays dresser elswhere hangynges habylymentes hall chambre whervnto kynge retrayed dynner spyces wyne taken gyft praysed valewed two hundred thousande florayns ouer gyuen almayns great gyftes goodly presentes vessell plate golde syluer wherof straungers great marueyle state puyssaunce great ryches realme frauce kinges thus abydynge cytie reynes counsayles mette togyther dyuers tymes mater came thyder well maryage duke orlyaunces doughter marque blancque bourges sonne reformacyon churche laste maryage concluded openly publysshed cytie mater consernynge pope nothynge knowen therof counsayle concluded counsayle kept secrete afterwarde enfourmed agreed maister peter daylly bysshop cambraye shulde go legacyon fro frenche kynge fro kynge almayne rome hym called pope bonyface shulde submyt hym selfe haue newe electyon pope lykewyse ye pope auygnon wolde nat agree therto abyde ordre two kynges dysgrated ryghtes churche kepte fro hym frenche kynge comprise agrement sonne lawe kynge englande kynge scottes kynge henry spayne kynge iohan portugale kynge charles nauer kyng aragon ye kinge almayne shulde compryse brother loys kynge hungery realme boesme almayne pruce ordeyned whan bysshop cambrey retourned fro somonyng two pope go sayd realmes alyes thus two kynges sware holde without varyacyon let thus ended counsayle tyme kynges lordes departed amyably euery man tooke leaue departed went home counsayle reynes duke burgoyne nat wolde nat sayd payne thynge loste gyue thynge almayns kepe promesse couenaut howe duke wordes nothynge left mater went forthe ye haue herde anon bysshop cambraye made hym redy tooke waye rome also frenche kynge sent great ambassade englande se ye kyng quene shewe mater dyd whan retourned shewed frenche kynge howe kynge englande wolde take way kynge almayne frenche kynge wolde concluded nede newter thus mater stode case kynge charles nauer frauce se kynge cosyn trustyng recouer herytage normandy countie ewrus whiche frenche kynge taken fro hym ye haue herde coulde nat attayne therto meanes euer shewed sayd whan kynge nauerre sawe lost payne labored vayne toke mater great dyspleasure toke leaue sobrely coulde nat well contente frenche kynge counsayle retourned realme nauerre pnowe lette v leaue speakynge speke accydentes fell englande wherby folowed great yuell lyke hath nat ben written hystory foloweth entre begynnynge mater phowe erle marshall englande apealed gage vtterauce erle derby sonne duke lancastre presence kynge counsayle cap ccxxviii kinge richard englande hadde condycion loued man wolde make hym great nere marueyle consydre man durste speke contrary also wolde lightly beleue soner kynge remembrance hym suche nere aboute hym grace tooke ensample ben great kyng duke irelande put englande also syr symon burle reason suche counsayle gaue kynge beheeded syr robert treuylyan syr nycholas bramble kynges counsayle wherfore suffred dethe duke gloucestre dyd payne dystroy yet fynally loste lyfe ye haue herde wherof suche aboute kynge nothynge sory wherby aboute kynge rose suche pride marueyle moche coulde nat coloure hyde specyally erle marshall great kynges fauoure myght entente please kynge flatter hym made kynge beleue trewe faythfull secrete seruaunt coulde nat endure worde spoken agaynst kynge tolde kynge many thynges haue kynges loue howe often tymes man thynketh auaunced pulled backe fortuned erle marshall shall shewe howe ye muste knowe erle derby duke gloucestre deed wyues two susters doughters erle herforde northamton constable englande chyldren erle derby duke gloucestre cosyn germayns mother syde within degre nere kynne father syde say trouth dethe duke gloucestre ryght dyspleasaunt many great lordes englande often tymes wolde speke murmure therat whan togyder kynge hygh vppon whele man durste speke kynge knewe caused spoken abrode realme euer spake word duke gloucestre erle arundell shulde reputed traytour wherfore people durst nat speke day erle derby erle marshall communed togyder dyuers mater last amonge spake state kynge counsayle suche hym beleued last erle derby spake certayne wordes whiche thought best wenynge shulde neuer haue ben called rehersall whiche wordes nouther vylenous outragyous sayde thus saint mary fayre cosyn thynketh kynge oure cosyn wyll driue englande noble men within whyle shalbe none left semeth clerely wylleth nat augmentacyon realme erle marshall gaue none aunswere dissimuled mater toke spake agaynst kynge thought hymselfe erle derby ryght lykely make great trouble englande bycause great londoner dyuell redy styre brayne thynge shall fall nat eschewed thought shewe mater kynge whan noble shulde presente day please kynge sayde ryght dere syr youre lygnage ame lyege man marshall englande wherfore sir bounde myne alliegeaunce othe sworne handes shulde place hearynge thynge contrarye mageste royall shulde kepe secrete ought reputed false traytour whiche wyll nat wyll trewly acquyte agaynst worlde kynge loked hym demaunded sayd say wordes wyll know right redouted souerayne lorde quod erle marshall saye bycause canne nat suffre thynge shulde preiudyciall agaynst grace syr cause erle derby come shall shewe erle derby sente kynge comaunded erle marshall stande vp knee whyle spake kynge whan erle derby kyng thought none yuell erle marshall sayde syr erle derby say ye haue thought yuell spoken otherwyse ye ought agaynste naturall lorde kynge englande whan ye sayde nat worthy holde lande realme seynge without lawe iustyce without counsayle noble men distourbeth realme without tytell good reason putteth realme dystroyeth ought ayde susteyne wherfore cast gage wyll proue body agaynst ye yuell false traytour erle derby sore abasshed wordes stepte backe lytell stode styll season without demaundynge father aunswere shulde make whan studyed lytell stept forthe cappe hande came kynge erle marshall sayd erle marshall saye thou arte yuell false traytour yt shall proue body agaynst thyne quarell gauge therle marshall whan herde howe apealed shewed howe desyred batayle erle derby aunswered sayde sette wordes kynges pleasure lordes tourne wordes mocke myne true eche erles drewe company lygnage manner takynge wyne spyces lette passe kyng shewed hym selfe right sore displeased entred chambre left two vncles without chyldren erles salysbury huntyngdon bretherne anone kynge sent vncles entred chambre thanne kynge demaunded best mater syr quod cause constable come shall shewe opynyons erle rutlande constable sente whan come commaunded go erle derby erle marshall take suretye theym go nat realme englande without kynges lycence constable dyd comaunded retourned agayne kinges chambre ye maye well knowe matter greatly troubled courte many lordes knyghtes sore dyspleased aduenture secretly greatly blamed erle marshall made though ser nothyng mater hert proude presumptuous thus lordes departed yt day duke lacastre euer coutynaunce made sore displeased wordes thought kynge shulde nat haue taken mater dyd shulde rather haue tourned nothynge thought moste parte lordes englande erle derby went lay london helde estate owne lodgynge pledge duke lancastre father duke yorke erle northumberlande dyuers lordes erle marshall sente towre london helde estate two lordes made prouysyon necessary batayle erle derby sent messangers lombardy duke myllayne syr galea haue armure pleasure duke agreed erles desyre caused knight erle sent thyder whose name fraunces se duke armorye whan knyght chosen suche lyked duke furthermore loue erle derby sent four ye best armorer lombardy erle englande knight entent shulde arme make armure acordynge erles entente erle marshall parte sent almayn place prouyde iourney charge two lordes greate erle derby moost charge erle marshall whan beganne busynesse thought haue ayde kynge suche nere aboute kynge sayd syr ye haue nothyng medle bytwene two lordes dyssymule mater let deale wyll well ynough sir ye knowe well erle derby well beloued realme specyally londoner se ye shulde take parte erle marshall ye lyke lose loue therby euer kynge vnderstode well wordes knew well trewe dissymuled mater moche coulde suffred make prouysyon lyst newes spredde abrode dyuers countreys defyaunce bytwene erle derby erle marshall many men spake therof dyuers maners specyally fraunce sayd lette theym alone knyghtes englande ouer proude length wyll dystroy eche worste nacyon worlde vnder sonne yt realme dwelleth moste presumptuous people canne spake berly sayde kynge englande shewed wysdome nat well counsayled whanne wylde wordes suffre suche two noble men blode enterprise armes defyaunce shulde rather whan herde wordes fyrste haue sayde bothe ye two lordes blode lygnage wherfore comaunde bothe peace lette nouther hate rancoure engendre bytwene frendes louers cosyns togyther lande canne nat contente go countrey ye wyll seke aduentures armes kynge sayde wordes apeased lordes thus done wysely duke lancastre sore dyspleased mynde se kynge nephewe mysse vse hym selfe dyuers thynges dyd consydred tyme come lyke sage prince somtyme sayd suche trusted best nephue kynge englande wyll shame cease beleueth lyghtly yuell counsayle shall distroy hym symply lyue longe wyll lese realme hath goten moche coste trauayle predecessours v suffreth engendre realme bytwene noble men hate dyscorde shulde serued honoured lande kepte douted hath caused brother dye whiche one thynge noted erle arundell bycause shewed hym trouthe wolde nat none wolde cousayle hym agaynst appetyte canne nat better dystroye realme put trouble hatred bytwene noble men good townes frenche men right subtyle one myschiefe falleth amonge v wolde ten otherwyse canne nat recouer domages come entente owne meanes dyscorde bytwene selfe wese dayly realmes deuyded dystroyed hath sene realme fraunce spayne naples landes churche maye se dayly two pope whiche shall dystructyon also hath sene countrey flaunders howe owne meanes distroyed also presently sene lande frece whome cosyns haynalt warre howe frenche men amonge theym selfe dystroyed lykewyse amonge ourselfe without god prouyde v shall dystroy selfe apparaunce therof sheweth greatly nowe kynge suffereth sonne heyre shall batayle thynge nought father maye nat speake contrary myne owne honoure sonnes sonne hathe body knyght mete entre armes agaynst erle marshall howe take best therof shall neuer loue agayne togyder dyd thus said duke lancastre seasone two lordes dyd prouyde dedes armes vtteraunce duke lancastre came neuer ye kyng lytell sonne dyd polycy duke knewe well yt sonne marueylously well beloued englande noble men specyally londoner promysed sayd hym syr ye good comforte busynesse howesoeuer matter tourne ye shall scape honour whether kynge wyll nat marmosettes aboute hym knowe well mater made conueyed enuy entente driue realme bycause ye well beloued many men ye departe trouble ye shall entre agayne ioye ye ought rather rule rycharde burdeaulx wyll seke profoundenesse mater maye well knowe fro whence ye came fro whence came wherby maye knowe yt ye nerer crowne englande rycharde burdeaulx though haue made hym faythe homage haue helde hym kyng thanne twenty yere fauour purchase grauntfather good kynge edwarde douted poynte nowe speke tyme great question made bytwene kyng edwarde grauntfather youre father syde duke henry lancastre grauntfather mother syde lady blaunche lancastre lordes englande reygned apeased matter kynge edwarde valyaunt man happy enterprise loue people poore riche also grauntfather lancastre wolde nothynge kynge well good serued kynge tyme nobly trewly yet recommaunded mater well consydred kynge rycharde myght well repente hym better gouerned suche wordes londoner spake thoughe knewe lytell trouth spake synguler fauoure erle derby receyued wordes well worthe dayly prepared batayle desyred frendes iourney euery man prepared hymselfe accordynge erles desyre kynge season two lordes prepared batayle many ymagynacyons whether shuld suffre fyght nat thoughe kynge englande douted kynge hym yet nyght daye kept hym garde two thousande archer payed wage wekely kynge trusted nat greatly theym nexte blode excepte brother erle huntyngton erle salisbury erle rutlande cosyn germayne sonne duke yorke well kynges fauoure certayne knyghtes chambre cared lytell whan day aproched two lordes shulde dedes armes hadde promysed euery thynge redy prepared daye certayne kynges counsayle came kynge demaunded entencyon two lordes shulde sayde sir wyll ye suffre theym fyght ye truelye quod kyng shulde nat wyll se dedes armes paraduenture shall knowe therby knowe nat yet shulde right necessary knowe entente shulde prouyde none great englande displease shall cause hym make amendes shulde thynge submytte subiettes wolde soone ouercome knowe certaygne theym blode haue hadde dyuers treatyse toguyder agaynste myne estate moost princypall duke gloucestre englande natte worse hedde agaynst nowe shall haue peace fro hense forwarde shall well ynough sir praye shewe ye make demaude sir quod bounde counsayle sir often tymes wordes spoken ye canne nat sir ye youre chambre abrode cou trey london many thynges spoken whiche greatlye toucheth v also sir tyme prouyde remedye ye muste sir counsayle best howe quod kynge speke spare natte wyll euery thynge parteynyng reason minyster iustyce realme sir quod renoume ronneth englande specially cytie london whiche soueraygne cytie youre realme saye ye cause enterprice bytwene two lordes ye haue sette erle marshall fyght erle derby londoner dyuers noble men prelate ye realme saye howe ye take ryght waye distroye lygnage realme englande whiche thynge saye wyll natte suffre londoner rise agaynste suche noble men wyll take parte ye shall puyssauce resyst theym also haue marueylous suspecte bycause ye alyed maryage frenche kynge wherby ye worse beloued youre people sir knowe certayne ye suffre two erles come place batayle ye shall nat lorde felde londoner suche lordes te wyll rule felde loue fauoure beare erle derby erle marshall soore hated specially londouers wolde slayne thre partes people englande saye whan ye harde yt wordes fyrst bytwene two erles ye shulde haue done otherwyse ye dyd ye shulde haue broken quarell haue sayd sir ye bothe cosyns lyegmen therfore commaunde kepe peace fro hen forthe shulde haue taken erle derby hande haue ledde hym youre chambre haue shewed hym signe loue bycause ye dyde nat thus brute ronneth ye beare fauour erle marshalles partie agaynst erle derby sir consyder well wordes shewe trewe sir ye neuer nede good counsayle ye haue nowe whan kynge herde wordes chaunged countynauce wordes quickely spoken therwith kynge tourned fro leaned wyndowe studyed certayne space tourned agayne spoken hym archebysshoppe yorke erles salisbury huntingdon bretherne thre knightes chambre sayde sir haue well herde shulde refuce counsayle greatly blame wherfore sir consyder beste sir quod one theym spake matter haue spoken ryght peryllous ye muste dissymule mater ye wyll haue youre honour saued make peace sir ye ought rather entertayne generaltie realme ydell wordes two knyghtes sir brute thoroughe realme englande howe erle marshall hathe greatlye trespassed hath renewed many yuell thinges daylye reneweth realme taketh wordes vayne saith ydell word wolde reise cesse agaynst erle derby bringe lande trouble first say better abode payne erle derby quyte sir thynke shulde arme mete togyder ye shulde sende cause bounde abyde youre ordynaunce enterprise whan furely bounde abyde youre sentence ye maye gyue theym iudgemente within fyftene dayes erle marshall auoyde realme without truste euer retourne agayne therle derby lykewyse auoyde realme banysshed tenne yere whan shall departe realme please people withall release foure yere tenne let hym banysshed sixe yere without pardone counsayle sir wyll gyue sir wyse let armed one agaynst another inconuenyentes maye fall therby kynge studyed lytell sayde sir ye counsayle trewly shall folowe youre counsayle phowe kynge richarde gaue sentence wherby banysshed englande therle derby x yere erle marshall euer capi ccxxix anone cousayle gyuen kynge assembled great nombre prelate grete lordes englande came hym eltha two vncles duke lancastre duke yorke erles northumberlande salysbury huntyngton kynge sente erle derby erle marshall sette eche seuerall cha bre kynge shewed howe wolde meane bytwene howe wordes hadde greatly displeased hym suche ought nat lyghtly pardoned wherfore wolde poyntes shulde submytte selfe abyde ordynaunce behalfe ordayned constable englande foure great lordes go erle derby therle marshall take bondes abyde kynges ordynaunce lordes came sayd erles shewed kynges pleasure kynge wolde take matter hym bounde selfe abyde kynges order kynge sayde ordaygne commaunde erle marshall bycause hath brought realme trouble reason wordes wherin canne nat make profe ordayne selfe auoide realme englande goo dwell place lyste therof banysshed suche wyse neuer retourne agayne also ordayne erle derby cosyn bycause hathe displeased v chiefe cause banysshment therle marshall within fyftene dayes auoyde realme englande banysshed tenne yeres without retournynge excepte repeale hym agayne whiche shall alwayes lye pleasure sentence greatly contented lordes present sayde erle derby maye well ynoughe go sporte hym realme two thre yeres yonge ynoughe thoughe haue sore traueyled dayes farre country pruce holy sepulchre cayre saynt katheryns mount may yet goo voyage passe tyme lyste knoweth wyll ynoughe whider go hath two susters one quene spaygne quene portugale maye well passe tyme also nowe warre whan cometh spaygne maye moue theym make warre vpon sarazyns make voyage granade wherby maye better employe tyme abydynge englande elles maye goo heynaulte brother cosyn erle ostrenaunt wyll receyue hym great ioye retaygne hym sor hathe warre fresons haynaulte maye dayly newes englande fro child natte go amysse goo wyll kynge maye repeale hym agayne good meanes whan shall please hym one fayrest floures garlande shall nat longe absente kynge purpose haue loue people erle marshalle farre worse case banysshed without hope euer retourne agayne saye trouthe hath well deserued myschiefe come hym wordes thus dyuers knyghtes squyers englande talked toguyder one another daye kynge gaue sayde iugemet phowe erle derby departed fro london go fraunce erle marshall went flaunders lombardy cap ccxxx whan two erles sawe sentence ye kynge gyuen theym ryght sore pensyue good cause erle marshall sore repented said done whan began mater thought otherwyse haue ben borne kyng hadde knowen moche wolde neuer haue begon matter whan sawe remedy made hym redy made exchaung fro london bruges cae calays capitayne toke leaue went bruges taryed fyftene dayes gaunt maynges finally colloigne plette v leaue spekyng hym speke erle derby prepared hym selfe lykewise departe englande accordyng kynges sentece whan daye departure aproched came eltham kynge duke lacastre father duke yorke erle northumlande sir henry percy sonne great nombre knyghtes squyers englande suche loued hym soore displeased fortune must auoyde realme lordes came thyder se ende kynge wolde make mater whose comyng kynge made semblaunt right ioyfull made great chere helde great court also erle salisbury erle huntyngton brother kyng hadde wyfe duke lancastres doughter suster erle derby two lordes came therle derby knowe nat dissymuled nat erles departynge kynge humyled hym greatly cosyn derby said godde helpe right greatly displeaseth wordes hath bytwene erle marshalle sentence haue gyuen beste apease therby people greatly murmured matter wherfore cosyn yet ease somwhat payne release iudgement fro tenne yere syxe yere cosyn take worthe ordyne therafter erle answered sayd sir thake grace whan shall please ye shall grace lordes well contented kynge tyme euery man departed went london erle derby erle made prouisyon douer passe calays erle beyng london departure counsayled father go streight frenche kynge cosyns fraunce accordynge father counsayle dyde elles wolde haue gone erle ostrenaunt brother cosyn whan erle departed fro london stretes mo thanne fourtie thousande men wepyng cryeng hym pytie soe said gentyll erle derby shall thus leaue realme shall neuer ioye tyll ye retourne agayne daye retourne longe enuy falsehed trayson hath putte realme ye ought abyde rather tha many ye suche lynage noble blode none ought compared gentyll erle shalle leaue ye neuer dyde thought yuell thus men woman pituously spake nat conueyed cytie instrumentes lamentable wepynges sayd secretelye cosyder order people displeasure take small occasyon euer wolde styrre londoner ryse agaynst kyng might go seke flye realme rather erle derby nowe tyme sithe duke lacastre father suffreth must nedes suffre mayre lo great nombre chiefe burgess accompanyed therle derby cytie rode dartforde douer sawe hym take shippyng retourned erle derby came calais hadde sent knyght heraulde frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce ye kynges vncles duke berrey burbon burgoyn knowe kynges pleasure wolde suffre erle abyde parys kepe house pay euery thyng men shulde take request frenche kynge vncles lightly agreed shewed right ioyfull comynge said howe ryght sorie erles trouble messangers returned calais fouude erle redy fre che kynge sent sir charles hanger open cyties townes bytwene calais paris receyue therle co pany thus erle derby departed fro calays toke waye amyence euery place well receyued phowe lorde guillyam erle ostrenaunt sente cosyn therle derby certayne messangers howe therle came paris howe receyued capi ccxxxi erle ostrenaut beyng quesnoy assone knewe cosyn erle derby passed see come calais ordayned sir auncell trassagetes sir fierebras vertayne ride calais desyre erle derby come heynaulte sporte hym abyde season promysynge hym haue good chere two knyghtes departed fro quesnoy rode cambrey bapames herde newes erle departed fro calais hadde taken waye amayece go parys two knyghtes mette hym waye spake hym dyde message erle thanked also cosyn sent excused hym selfe sayd howe made prouisyon go fraunce tyme frenche kynge cosyns fraunce wolde nat renounce curtesy cosyn heynalt shewed hym two knightes departed retourned shewed therle ostrenaunt sene done therle derby company rode long aproched nere parys wha kyng duke orlyaunce vncles knewe erle derby came paris prepared chabers place saynt poule richely receyue therle caused lordes issue cytie receyue hym kyng taryed house saynt poule first mette hym duke berrey duke orlyauce duke burgoyne duke burbon noble prelate lordes knightes metyng frendly chere good order entred paris great ioye daye one great mysfortune fell squyer named boniface mounted great coursar whiche horse rose vpright vpon hynder fete fell backewarde squyers hedde lyght vpon stone hedde cloue sonder dyed whose dethe duke orlyaunce ryght sorie loued hym entierly dyde lorde coucy dayes brought hym fru ce lombardy thus came house ofsaynt poule kynge receyued erle nobly therle sage wyse knewe moch parteyned honour made reuerece acquaynted hym kynge good maner moche greatly pleased kynge good loue gaue erle deuyse weare whiche erle receyued ioyfully wordes bitwene nat tell well takyng spyce wyne erle toke leaue kyng went quene house made hym ioyouse chere erle departed toke horse go lodgyng conueyed thyder thus passed tyme lordes fraunce dyde often tymes kepe hym company caused hym passe ye tyme sportes otherwyse entent shulde thynke season shorter bycause owne nacion pnowe lette v leaue spekyng erle derby somwhat speke ordynaunce churche two pope benedic beyng auignon bonyface rome phowe treatie reynes bitwene frenche kyng kyng almaygne concernyng vnyte churche folowed howe bysshoppe cabrey sent sayd kynge rome auygnon wrote selfe pope tent shulde depose theselfe fro papalytes submyt order two kynges capi cc xxxii ye haue herde howe yt kyng almayne ye kyng fraunce lordes thempire cousails ben cytie reynes dyuers secrete counsayls entencion bring churche parfyte vnite folowe way churche helde errour great also ye haue herde howe mayster peter de ailly bysshoppe cambrey sent legacion rome speke pope boniface spedde hym iourney came foudes foude pope boniface hym delyuered letter credence dyrected fro kynges almaygne fraunce pope receyued bysshoppe right mekelye pope knewe well parte message bysshoppe declared ye cause comynge whan pope hadde well herde hym sayde howe answere laye nat onely hym also cardy nalles chosen hym pope said whan hadde spoken delyberate counsayle wolde make suche answere trusted content aunswere suffycient tyme bysshoppe dyned daye pope palyce certayne cardynalles hym pope departed fro foundes went rome pope assembled conuocacion cardynalles palyce besyde saynt peter churche consistorie none pope cardynalles pope shewed request kynge almaygne frenche kyng made hym bysshoppe cambrey demaunded cousaile answere shuld make thane many reason alleged semed right contrary cardinalles put downe hadde made sayde shulde greatly shame rebuke said pope holy father cause kynges good hope yt ye wyll obey ye must sowhat dissymule mater saye howe ye wyll gladly obey thynge kynge almaygne kyng hungry kyng englande wyll counsayle vnto auignon writeth hym selfe pope benedic frenche kyng frenchman vpholde errour depose hym name papalyte tha wher euer shall please sayde kynges apoynt coclaue ye wyll redy bretherne cardynalles counsayle pleased well pope boniface speciall generall aunswere bysshoppe cambrey whan romayns vnderstode ye kynges almaygne fraunce sente pope ambassade haue leaue papalyte anone multiplyed great murmuracion cytie rome romayns douted greatly lese pope siege whiche yerely gret profyte pardon shulde two yere vantage therof shulde growe cytie rome agaynst pardone made great prouisyon wherfore douted lest shulde haue ben loste whiche shulde greatly haue ben preiudyce moost notablest persones rome assembled togyder came pope shewed hym signe loue euer hadde done sayd holy father ye trewe pope therfore lese nat herytage patrimony churche whiche saynt peter take neuer counsayle contrarye abyde styll pope soeuer agaist shall abyde ieoparde oure bodyes goodes defende youre right pope aunswered sayd welbeloued chyldren good confort well assured wyll abyde pope treatie kynge kynges contrary thus romayns contented apeased retourned house pope answere alwayes bysshoppe cambrey wha parceyued clerely benedic deposed hymselfe said wolde ordred sayde kynges bysshoppe retourned came almaygne founde kyng co ualence shewed ye answere rome kyng almaygne sayde well shewe brother cosyn frenche kynge ordreth hym selfe shall order empyre farre se must begyn fyrst whan hath putte downe pope shall putte downe bysshoppe departed fro kyng rode tyll cae parys wher foude frenche kyng bysshoppe shewed aunswere whiche kepte secrete tyll kyng assembled toguyder nobre noble men prelate realme whome wolde counsayled howe shulde cede phowe frenche kyng assebled prelate noble men realme vniuersyte paris take counsayle howe shulde order pope benedic auygnon cap ccxxxiii whan frenche kyng herde aunswere pope bonyface rome howe kynge almayne lykewyse aunswered first pope benedyc muste put dowue done wolde make conuocacyon prelate noble men realme come parys certayne prelate fraunce archebysshop rein syr guy roye archebyssoppes rone sen bysshoppes parys beauoys anxex sore susteyned opynyons pope benedyc auygnon specyally clement bycause auaunced meanes syxe prelate nat called kynge counsayle prelate vnyuersyte parys whan bysshop cambray shewed howe spedde rome aunswere pope bonyface cardynals made hym aunswere kynge almayne entred counsayle greed yt vnyuersite shulde haue greattest voyce determyned vnyuersite kyng shuld sende syr bouciquant marshall partyes auignon moche treatie otherwyse benedic shulde leaue papalyte ordeyne hym selfe poyntes kyng counsayle churche lymytacions realme frau ce shulde newter tyll churche brought parfyte vnyte doone euery thynge returne true right counsayle thought good accepted kynge marshall fraunce bysshop cambray ordeyned go auignon departed fro parys rode tyll came lyon ryuer rosne two departed sodre ordeyned marshall shulde tary ther styll tyll herd tydynges fro bysshoppe rode forthe came auygnon cardynalles knewe well wherfore came dissymuled mater knowe pope benedic wolde say whan bysshop cambraye refresshed hym lodgynge chaunged apparell wente pope palayes whan came pope presence made reuerence nat wyse ought haue doone taken hym pope men dyd yet made hym bysshoppe cambray promocyon meanes lordes fraunce bysshoppe cambray well langaged bothe laten frenche spake shewed howe sent thyder fro french kynge fro kynge almayne beganne proces whan bysshoppe came vtteraunce mater howe pope shulde resygne depose hymselfe fro papall dygnyte rome shulde likewyse wordes pope beganne chaunge colour lyfte vp voyce sayd haue endured great payne traueyle churche good election created pope nowe depose selfe shall neuer lyfe wyll frenche kynge knowe ordynauce wyll nothynge therafter wyll kepe name papalyte tyll dye syr quod bysshoppe cambray sauyng grace toke prudent nowe fynde fyrste demaude counsayle bretherne cardynalles make aunswere alone nat make resystence agaynst agree opynyon ye nat able resyste puyssaunce kynges fraunce almayne two cardynalles pope made parceyuynge mater nat lykely well rose sayd pope holy father bysshoppe cambray speketh well syr desyre herin cousayle well quod pope contente departed tyme bysshop went lodgynge went nat se cardynals dyssymuled hym selfe nexte day tymes bell sowned consistory conuocacyon cardynalles iuygnon assembled palays entred consistory thyder called bysshop cambraye laten shewed length message cause comyng thyder whan sayd aunswered howe pope shulde take counsayle answere meane tyme departe house dyd meane season benedic cardynalles counsayled togyder longe debatynge mater many thought herde contrary mater put downe created cardynall amyence spake sayd lordes whether wyll nat must behoue v obey frenche kynge kinge almayne sythe conioyned togyder without nat lyue howe shulde well ynough kyng almayne frenche kynge wolde take parte otherwyse comaundeth v obey el wyll stoppe fro v fruites benefyces without whiche nat lyue trewe holy father haue created pope ye condycion power ye shuld ayde refourme churche bring parfyte vnyon ye haue alwayes sayd mayntayned therfore syr aunswere atemperately suche maner may prayse syr ye ought better know owne corage dyuers cardynalles sayd syr cardynall amyence sayeth well wysely wherfore syr pray generall ye wyll speke shewe v ye wyll benedyc aunswered said vnyon churche desyre haue taken great payne therin syth god deuyue grace hathe prouyded papalyte ye haue chosen therto longe lyue wyll pope wyll nat depose selfe nouther kyng duke erle treatie processe meanes yt wyll abyde pope cardynals rose vp togyder great murmurynge sayd spoken well sayd contrary thus dyffered dyscorde parte departed consystory toke leaue pope retourned lodgynges suche pope fauour taryed styll hym whan bysshoppe cambray sawe howe departed suche maner knewe well acorded nat well therwith auaunced hym selfe entred consystory came pope whyle sate styll see without doynge great reuerence sayde syr gyue myne aunswere sythe ye haue counsayle aboute ye ought gyue myne aunswere may retourne pope benedic great dyspleasure wordes cardynall amyence spoken sayd bysshoppe cambray haue counsayle dyuers bretherne cardynals hath created dignyte papall haue receyued solemynytyes therto belongyng writen named pope subgiettes pope wyll abyde longe lyue wyll nat contrary dye payne haue doone cause lese saye sonne fraunce hyther vnto haue taken good catholyke prince nowe bysynister meanes wyll entre great errour wyll repente praye say hym fro well aduysed howe enclyneth thinge shulde trouble conscyence therwith benedic rose chayre went chambre certayne cardynalles hym bysshoppe cambray retourned lodgynge dyned sobrely toke horse passed bridge rone came vile nefe nyght lay baignoulx whiche partaygned realme fraunce vnderstode syr boucyquant marshall fraunce come porte saynt andrewe nyne leages fro auygnon nexte day thyder came bysshoppe cambray shewed hym aunswere benedic whan marshall vnderstode pope benedic wolde nat obey kynge maysters ordynaunce sayd bysshop syr ye best retourne fraunce ye haue shall execute comaunded kynge vncles next daye bysshoppe departed toke way albenoys pyne marshall set clerkes awarke write sente knyghtes squyers men warre countrey viurays vyuieres auuergne mount pellyer comyssyon king also sent seneschall beaucayre shulde close passage well ryuer rone lande entent nothynge shulde entre auignon wente hym selfe pownte saynt esperyte closed passage ouer ryuer rone nothynge shulde entre way auygnon thus marshall daily gathered men warre many came serue hym obeysaunce pyll robbe theym auygnon came hym syr raymonde thourayne lorde de la lorde tornon lorde monclaue lorde duse yt marshall great nombre men marshall sent haraulde defye pope benedic palays cardynals wolde take parte harde tydynges cardynals cytie auygnon knewe well coulde nat longe susteyne warre agaynst puyssaunce frenche kynge determyned go speake pope dyd shewed hym howe coulde nat wolde nat susteyne warre agaynst frenche kynge sayd must lyue haue marchaundyse go well lande ryuer benedyc aunswered folysshly sayd syrs cytie stronge well prouyded wyll sende men warre gennes place sonne kynge aragon come serue whiche sure wyll bounde therto two cause lygnage also ought obeysant pope sir ye abasshed lytell cause go wayes kepe defende towne shall kepe palays aunswere cardynals men cytie coulde nat haue benedyc euery man retourned home benedic longe tyme purueyed palays wyne corne larde oyle thinges parteynynge fortresse also person hygh cruell wolde nat abasshed lytell thynge marshall fraunce departed fro pount saynt spyrite passed company towne orenge consent prince orenge entred countre venyce whiche lande parteygnynge churche whiche anone ouer rynne men warre passed ye bridge sourgnes lordes ryuer marshall taryed towne sourgnes gret nombre menne warre kepe towne passage also garysone noues whiche partayned pope marshall went lodged saynt verayne nere auignon men therabout dayly came thyder men warre cytie auignon closed behinde lande ryuer nothynge coulde entre issue without leaue towne noue without auygnon whiche partayned realme fraunce seneschall beaucayre fyue hundred men kepte entre syde marshall frauce two thousande men syde auignon sent theym cytie without wolde obey open cytie wolde burne vynes house abrode countrey aboute ryuer dureuse monynge greatly abasshed men woman within cytie herytages laye without auignon vnto ryuer dureuse went counsayle without knowledge pope called counsayle certayne cardynals cardynall amyence poictours newcastell viuyers dyuers suche moste lose shewed cardynalles howe marshall fraunce thretened brinne vynes howses caused frenche kynge agaynst whome coulde nat resyste puyssaunce nere thynges consydred sayde better obey frenche kynge holde paryllous opynyons benedyc coulde haue ayde comforte demaunded cardynalles wolde ioyne take parte cardynals said content take wayes vitayles beganne fayle theym also benefyces realme fraunce whiche sayd wolde nat wyllyngly lese entred treatie marshall fraunce whiche toke suche effecte men warre entred cytie auignon apoynted besiege palays couynaunt hurte dyspleasure cardynalles none men hole body towne marshall promysed entred auignon lodged ease lybertie passage well lande water opened entent maner bytayle myght come cytie wrote selfe pope benedyc beynge closed palays sawe cardynals men cytie made treatie marshall fraunce without counsayle aduyse therwith sore dyspleased howe sayd wolde nat submytte hym selfe dye payne kepte hym selfe close palais stronge place worlde easyest kepte well vytayled pope sent letter kynge aragone instantly socoure hym nede sende men warre myght able resyst marshall fraunce also sente kynge worde letter coulde get hym then fro auignon wolde go kepe see apostolyke aragon parpygnon barcelone kynge aragon sawe well pope letter made force sayd cousayle aboute hym weneth preest susteyne hym argumentes shall enterpryse make warre agaynste frenche kyng ayde hym might well reputed fole syr quod counsayle ye say trouthe ye haue nede medle mater syr ye may sure frenche kynge hath suche counsayle aboute hym yt wolde make warre agaynst hym without iuste cause lette clergy alone purpose lyue prelate must obey great lordes whome rente reuenues haue longe kept peace also syr frenche kynge hath writen redy desyringe determyne countrey newter wyll syr ye beste lady quene frenche kynges cosyn germayne content moste parte realme clergy lykewyse specyally catelone spayne syr thynke best opynion cristen kynges nat churche shall neuer come vnyte reasone two pope thus kynge aragon counsayle deuysed togyder pope benedic styll palays trustynge haue ayde kynge aragon dysceyued marshall frauce cytie auygnon palays kept none coulde issue entre lyued store vytayles suffycient two thre yere lacked woode make fyre sethe meate whiche made theym abasshed euery weke marshall herde newes fro frenche kynge kynge fro hym kynge comaunded hym shulde nat departe then tyll atchyued enterprise thus pope coude nat issue ye palays suche watche layde hym conclusyon whan benedyc sawe straytely kepte fyre fayled hym prouysions dayly dyscreased sawe comforte ayde came hym fro parte laste yelded request certayne cardynalles treatie thus yt shulde nat departe auignon tyll made vnyon churche certayne garde sette aboute hym cardynalles ryche men auignon bounde selfe kepe benedyc strayte shulde rendre accompte hym agayne outher quycke dede suche cardynals benefyces fraunce tooke great payne make treatie composycion sayde one accorde wolde abyde frenche kynge thus busynesse ended yt tyme euery man departed marshall went parys anone ordeyned go realme hungery kynge hungery written frenche kynge howe lamorabaquy assembled great puyssaunce men warre turkes arabyes tartaryes suryens dyuers secte fyght hym erle derby season beynge paris house clyssone nere temple wyllynge go hungery whiche shulde lesse coste frenche kynge euery weke redy payed fyue hundred crownes golde erle thought hym selfe moche bounde frenche kynge grace whan tydynges came fro kynge hungery fraunce erle derby entended well mater thought hym selfe voyage ryght honourable hym passe tyme wherby shulde lightlyer forget tyme trouble spake specyall counsayle counsayled hym go voyage knewe fyrst duke lancastre father pleasure behalfe erle one knyghtes called dinorth englande knowe father pleasure knyght came englande founde duke lancastre castell twenty myle fro london called hertforde shewed hym sonnes entente whan duke vnderstode mynde erle sonne good wyll go hungery passe tyme banyssment ryght well content sayd knyght syr ye welcome wordes sonnes lettre requyreth counsayle ye shall rest v season meane whyle shall take aduyse whyle ye may go se sonnes chyldren ye muste beare tydynges father syr quod knyght ye say true knyght syr dynorth taryed season englande nowe frenche kinge good occasyon write kynge almayne cousayle case brought pope benedic cardynalles kynge sent thyder noble ambassade patryarke iherusalem syr charles hanger knightes founde kynge strawbourgh dyd message wherwith kynge counsayle well content sayd howe wolde determyne matter said wolde gladly kyng englande shulde take waye whiche feared shulde herde aunswere ambassadours retourned fraunce shewed kynge doone sene frenche kynge thentent bring purpose passe sente agayne englande kynge rycharde messangers shewed kynge cause comynge kynge gaue good herynge mater nat prelate realme clergy hym nat plyable folowe pleasure fraunce folowe pleasure kynge shewed frenche kynges messangers howe sayde wolde deuoyre dyd messangers returned frauce kynge rycharde daye westmynster assembled prelate clergy englande whan ye kynge shewed wysely dyfference churche howe frenche kynge delyberacyon aduyse counsayle consent vnyuersite parys clerkes determyned newter lykewyse kynges spaygne scotlande aragone nauer howe almayne boesme italy opynyon lykewyse kynge englande desyred realme shuld folowe whan prelate clergy knewe nothynge sent herde mater great marueyle sore abasshed stode styll spake worde began murmure sayde kynge become frenche entendeth nothynge dyshonour distroy v shal nat wolde bringe v beleue maye moche shall haue yuell therof let v nat folowe opynion sythe frenche kynge taketh waye lette hym holde hym selfe newter let v holde styll beleue lette man put fro v without greater apparaunce surer foundacyon se yet whan kyng rycharde sawe dyfference murmurynge clergy caused bysshoppe london demaunde clergy best aunswered matter great therin requyred great counsayle delyberacyon departed euery man went lodgynge whan londoner knewe cause assemble request kynge made sore troubled agaynst ye kyng people englande fermely set beleuynge pope rome wolde nat leaue sayde howe rycharde burdeaulx wolde distroy let alone herte frenche canne nat hyde daye wyll come paye shall repente hym suche gyue hym suche counsayle euer kynge sayd haue people newter wolde wyse agree therto frenche kynge nat well content sonne kynge rycharde nat incontynent caused realme haue newter saye trouth kynge nat blame therin also suche accydentes fell soone whiche great horryble lyke hath nat ben sene hystorye vpon kynge crysten except noble kynge peter lusygnen kyng cyper iherusalem whome owne brother cypriens martyred pof aunswere duke lancastre knyght sent hym fro sonne erle derby howe duke lancastre dyed cap cc xxxiiii whan sir dinorth erle derby sente englande father duke lancastre answere duke vysyted erles landes sene chyldren four sonnes two doughters toke leaue retourne fraunce aunswere howe duke wolde nat counsayle erle sonne go hungery whan wery beynge frauce rather go castell kynge suster lyste go go vysite suster quene portugale erle redde father letter two tymes ouer studyed theron season syr dinorth shewed physicions surgyons englande sayd surely howe duke father hym paryllous sycknesse whiche shuld dethe wordes gretly letted erle take hym maner voyage taryed styll parys often tymes went sawe frenche kyng duke orlyaunce kynges vncles alwayes made hym good chere moche bounde sayde kynge syr ye moche honoure curtesy shewe great sygne loue knowe nat lyfe dayes howe deserue euer come englande lady yt quene doughter power shall haue seruyce thanke cosyn quod kynge fell aboute feest crystmasse duke iohan lancastre lyued great dyspleasure bycause kynge banysshed sonne realme litell cause also bycause yuell gouernynge realme nephewe kynge rycharde sawe well longe percepuered suffred contynewe realme lykely vtterly loste ymagynacyons duke fell sycke wheron dyed whose dethe greatly sorowed frendes louers kyng shewed toke great care dethe sone forgotten certayne noble men englande sawe well howe realme feblysshed sythe duke lancastre deed duke gloucestre brother slayne erle arundell erle derby banysshed ought duke lancastre ryght succession sayde nowe shall se kynge wyll tyme nowe yt repeale home agayne cosyn derby pardone hym yuell wyll though haue cause dyspleased hym tyme came entred landes duke lancastre suche wordes ranne brode realme dyuers place specyally cytie london erle derby hundred tymes better beloued thanne kynge howe wordes murmuryng kyng counsayle knewe yet dyd nothynge therafter clene contrary yuell counsayled incontynent dethe duke lancastre sente erle derby comynge haue frendely welcomed hym home haue called hym duke lancastre haue taken hym greatest personage englande nexte hym selfe haue sayde howe wolde gouerned poyntes aduyse counsayle nothynge without aduyse kynge done well lykely haue contynued estate kynge englande nat receyued yuell fortune fell hym shortly ye shall phowe dethe duke la castre knowen fraunce kyng englande wrote maner ioye frenche kynge therof wrote nothyng therof therle derby duke sone cap cc xxxv tidynges duke lancaster dethe came fraunce kyng rycharde englade maner ioye wrote therof frenche kyng nat cosyn therle derby howe erle knewe soone frenche kynge soner suche men englande erle apparelled hym men blacke caused obsequy done right honorably whiche frenche kyng brother duke orlyaunce ye kynges vncles great nombre prelate great lordes fraunce erle derby welbeloued euery many right sorie trouble pleasaunt knight honest son curtesse swete meke euery man euery man sawe hym said howe ye kyng englande nat well counsayled repealed hym nat home agayne truely saye trouthe kynge englande wysely regarded mater ben well counsayled mater nat tourned agaynst hym dyde erle derby dethe father right enherytoure duke lancastre haue seconde persone realme busynesse realme shulde chiefely haue passed also kynge counsayle ought haue consydred howe often tymes people englande hadde styrred murmured agaynst hym shulde haue knowen howe nat welbeloued people knightes ye duke gloucester dayes often tymes daunger persone whan londoner counsaylles dyuers good townes englande cae hym eltham made requestes subsidy ayes gyuen graunted within twentie yere shulde haue ben frustrate fordone el determyned consent duke gloucestre noble men realme haue taken kynge haue sette another haue reygned place haue putte ye kyng quene place haue hadde meate drinke long lyued somoche duke gloucester hadde desyred nephewe sonne doughter duke clarence called iohan erle marche wolde haue taken hym charge gouernyng realme wolde haue made hym kyng erle excused hym selfe honestly therfro thynges apeased layde downe wyse sadde meanes prudence sayde duke lancastre father sayd erle derby kyng richarde wysely consydred mat reigned gretter sperite euer kyng richarde knewe well ynough yuell counsayle kynge caused colour loue duke gloucestre taken ledde calays strangled murdered wherof great brute throughe realme great grudge murmuracyons poynt haue deposed sayde kyng richarde howe duke lancastre lyke sage prudent price duke gloucestre brother murderyng hym touched hym nere herte thynges consyred coude nat recouer agayne brother wisely amiably apeased mater kynge nephue feared englade kynge ought haue consydred specially howe therle derby better beloued people man within realme thyng wysely cosidred dethe duke rf la castre kyng shulde haue repealed therle derby agayne realme kyng mynde dyd clene contrary incontynent sente offycers duke lacasters landes toke profites therof hym selfe sayd longe therle derby stode banysshed man none shulde receyue reuenues landes within realme englande moreouer wherof kyng greatly blamed suche loued erle chyldren kyng gaue awaye landes parteynynge herytage duchy lancastre seruauntes suche asked whiche cause many knyghtes englande spake said kyng sheweth well oweth good wyll cosyn erle derby sythe wyll nat repeale hym home agayne suffre landes gyuen awaye therle chyldren shulde great membres englande good staffe kyng leane dothe contrary driueth hym awaye wyll kepe hym dau ger worse coude hath taken hym selfe heritage causeth offycers medell duke landes thoughe owne yt poore tenauntes complayne iniuryes done lordes absence nat harde none yt wyll right also small token loue kyng beareth erle derby chyldren herytage lacastre whiche shulde come right enherytauce discended fro grandame lady blanche doughter duke henry lancastre kyng gyueth parte therof away pleaseth hym suche landes shulde fall right lady mother doughter erle herforde northampton costable englande kynge gyueth parte therof pleasure moche done agaist ryght reason displeasure noble men englande nat longe endure vnamended thus prelate noble men common englade comuned murmured lykewise ye realme fra ce suche men honour herde spekynge mater hadde sene erle derby parys hadde great marueyle therof sayd one another thynke kynge englande hath takenne great displeasure cosyn erle derby greattest man englad next hym selfe gracious knyght curtesse meke tretable man good spoken vnto kyng englande knoweth thynge hym elles kynge yuell counsayled marueyle frenche kynge brother duke orlyaunce kynges vncles nat attemper mater erle daylye amonge theym shulde fynde best prouisyon case kynge englande wyll men bicause hath maried frenche kynges doughter sythe nothynge therin best holde oure peace lette passe frenche kynge brother vncles thought nothyng good honoured loued greatly erle derby desyred moche company sawe well wydower marry duke berry hadde doughter wydowe two husbandes yonge xxiii yere age named mary fyrst husbade loys bloys died yonge secode husbande ye lorde philyppe arthoys erle ewe died retourne hungry ye haue herde maryage apoynt haue concluded frauce knewe well duke lancastre great enherytoure englande frenche kynge well pleased therwith bycause doughter quene englande thought company two ladyes togyder shulde great pleasure bothe sythe nere blode therby two realmes fraunce englande shulde surer conioyned toguyder loue peace whiche trewe might haue accomplysshed kyng richarde englande cousayle brake mater fortune world whiche marueylous thynge shall canne nat eschewed whiche fortune kynge richarde marueylous harde thynke theron kynge myght well haue remedyed mater wolde shall shalbe shall shewe iohan froissarte auctour hystorie herde whane yonge englande place called bertamstede whiche tyme parteyned price wale father sayde kynge rycharde yere grace thousande thre hundred thre score two bycause ye tyme prince prince shulde departe englande go acqtayne kepe estate kyng edwarde father quene phillyppe maistres lyon duke clarence iohan duke lancastre lorde edmonde erle cambridge duke yorke chyldren come said maner place se prince prince departed age xxiiii yere one said lady quenes clerkes chambre satte benche herde knyght talkyng deuysinge among dyuers ladyes damoselles quenes sayde booke countrey called brust many men saye marueylous prophycies accordynge booke realme crowne englande shulde nat retourne price wale yet duke clarence shulde kynges england though sonnes kyng edwarde knyght sayd accordyng boke crowne englande shulde come house lancastre season whan knyght spake wordes sayd hery erle derby nat borne yet seuyn yere yet dayes wordes tooke effecte sawe henry erle derby kynge englande pof treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berry doughter howe kyng rycharde englande dyde lette erle salisbury capi cc xxxvi soone kyng rycharde kyng englande herde treatie maryage bytwene erle derby duke berryes doughter party nerehade accorded toke newes great dyspleasure sayd erle salisbury great affyaunce ye must dayne go fraunce letter credence father lawe frenche kynge frendes brother vncles shewe fro v wyse conclude treatie alyaunce maryage suche traytour erle derby wolde betray naturall souerayne lorde remynaunt mater ye wyse ynough therin maye thanke maryage maye broken erle salisbury sayde sir shall ryght well comaundement sir myght broken meanes persone requyre youre grace maye sir quod kynge excuse natte wyll also praye message whatsoeuer shall fall therof shall sustayne well sir quod erle sithe ye comaunde specially se mater toucheth nere shall thoughe lothe therto ye shall go quod kynge make haste alyaunce concluded erle prepared departure letter credence written sealed departed fro kynge tyme leades quene also erle made haste came douer toke see arryued calays founde erle huntyngton capitayne calais brother kynge erle shewed vnto hym busynesse taryed nat longe calays roode amyence parys waye rode hadde good chere lodged whyte horse whan chauged wente kynge quene yt lordes delyuered letter credence whan kyng reed letter toke erle aparte demaunded credence erle length shewed charge named erle derby traytour agaynst naturall lorde whan frenche kyng herde wordes great displeasure loued erle derby wolde none yuell spoken toke letter credence agayne erle salisbury sayd erle beleue well ynoughe sonne englande sore moued agaynst oure cosyn derby marueyle greatly yuell wyll contyneweth longe thynke shulde better furnysshed hym nexte counsayle sir quod erle salisbury comaunded trewe quod kyng nat displeased paraduenture sonne englande knoweth message ye charged dyde duke berrey also duke gaue none aunswere therto wente kyng demaunded hym newes hadde englande kynge shewed hym erle salisburye sayde vpon newes kyng vncles assembled togyder secretely frenche kynge sayd kynge englande lykelyhode douteth greatly therle derby elles paradueture knoweth suche thynges knowe nat nat come oure knowledge ought rather owe fauoure kynge englande thane erle derby sythe kynge ioyned v maryage wyll take great disdayne sythe enfourmed pleasure shulde contrary marry erle derby countesse ewe behoueth v rather dissymule kepe newes secrete tyll erle salisbury retourned vpon peynt kyng vncles rested whan erle salisbury done message tooke leaue departed frenche kynge displeased comyng ioyfull delyuered agayne erle salysbury letter credence wolde nat kepe loued well erle derby knewe erle salysburies beynge parys sawe hym nat departed without spekyng retourned calays englande shewed kynge englande howe hadde spedde whan erle derby knewe erle salisbury departed fro parys without spekynge hym mynde soore displeased thought matter went nat well counsayle sayde hym sir shortely ye shall parceyue mater ye haue nat herde yet thoughe kepte priuye fro frenchman wyse close maye kyng englande suche secte displeased frenche kyng maketh good chere dothe paradue ture spoken englande howe ye shulde mary duke berryes doughter whiche pleaseth nat kynge englande therfore wyll breke maryage ye shall shortly therof looke ymagined within moneth erle salisbury departed fro parys suche therle derby parte treatie sayde maryage hande spake agayne mater duke berryes counsayle charge shulde answere sayd sir whan lorde erle derby kynges presence duke orlyaunce vncles presente lette lorde erle derby speke hym selfe saye mater therle derby thought none yuell thought wordes hadde ben spoken entent haue proched nerer poynt kynge counsayle made hym good chere thanne euer dyde erle thought speke mater whan sawe conuenyent tyme daye whane sawe kyng lordes togyder began speke maryage duof burgoyne hadde charge aunswere hym sayde cosyn derby haue nothynge gyue maryage ouer cosyn traytour woorde erle derby greatly abasshed chauged colour sayd sir kynges presence wyll answere neuer traytour neuer thought trayson persone yt wyll charge trayson redy answere nowe wha shall please kynge beyng present nay cosyn quod kyng beleue ye shall fynde man fraunce wyll chalenge honoure wordes myne vncle hath spoken came englande erle kneled downe sayd sir beleue well god defende frendes confounde myne ennemyes frenche kynge toke vp erle sayd cosyn apeace selfe euery thynge shall tourne best whane euery thynge agreed peace thane maye well speke treate maryage fyrst ye must take possession duchy lancastre vsage fraunce dyuers countreis syde see lorde shall marry consent soueraygne lorde must endowe wyfe therwith spyces wyne cessed comunycacion euery man departed owne lodgynges whan erle derby coe lodgyng sore displeased nat without cause whan reputed one trewest knyghtes worlde presece frenche kyng loued hym well shewed many curtesies shuld reputed traytour wordes shulde coe englande brought erle salisburye therwith great malencoly counsayle apeased hym well coude sayd sir wyll lyue worlde must endure somtyme trouble confort tyme pacient parauenture herafter ye shall haue great ioye glorie sir al ye lord syde see frenche kyng loueth best se well wolde enploye payne bri ge ioye sir ye ought gyue vncles great thake kept mater secrete tyll erle salisbury deted yea sir quod erle thynke ben better ben shewed presence myght haue made sufficiet excuse yt kyng lordes thus shall abyde styll blame tyll mater otherwyse declared sir quod trespass nat amended fyrst daye sir suffre let tyme ryn beleue busynesse englande dothe better ye ware loue hertes people englande towardes good prayer ye grace god shall shortely delyuer daungers sayd recofort lorde sore disconforted sayeng soner trewe ware anone knowen englande howe therle salisbury ben frauce frenche kynge vncles borne letter thyder conteynyng howe erle derby falsely iured traytour whiche dyuers noble men prelate sore troubled nothynge contente erle salisbury said generally soore blame take hym charge beare fraunce suche wordes vpon trewe man lyued daye wyll come shall repent tyme yt euer spake worde ye maye well knowe londoner greatly displeased murmured agaynst kyng counsayle sayd getyll knight erle derby great enuy agaynst nat suffycient kynge counsayle driue realme also accuse trayson putte shame rebuke well euery thynge muste haue tourne ala quod people faulte trespasse hath child done kynge taketh thus awaye fro herytage whiche ought ryght successyon thynge nat longe abyde case without chaunge nat suffre thus anone retourne erle salisbury fraunce kyng richarde caused iustes cryed publysshed throughe realme scotlande wynsore xl knyghtes xl squyers agaynst comer aparelled grene whyte faucon quene well acopanied dye damosel feest thus holden ye quene beyng gret neblenes fewe lordes noble men mo tha ii te ye lordes knightes realme englande yt kyng suche hatered
