banysshyng erle derby iniuryes done chyldren dethe duke gloucestre slayne castell calais dethe erle aru dell beheeded lodon kynred lordes came nat feest fewe feest kynge ordayned go irelande enploy men voyage departed lefte quene trayne styll wyndsore kynge rode bristowe made prouysion ten thousande knightes squiers ten thousande archer whane londoner knewe kyng goyng voyage began murmure said amonge themselfe nowe gothe richarde burdeaux waye bristowe yrelande whiche wyll distruction shall neuer retourne agayne ioye dyde kynge edwarde seconde great grauntfather folysshely gouerned moche beleuyng spe sers lykewise rycharde burdeaulx hath belued moche yuell counsayle nat hydden suffred lengar phowe kynge richarde ordayned go marchesse irelande cap ccxxxvii many knightes squyers kynges company shulde go hym irelade nat cotent hym wente maner yuell wyll sayd oftentymes one another kynge gouerneth hym selfe folisshely beleueth yuell counsayle suche wordes multiplyed lorde henry percy sir henry sone spake certayne wordes whiche came kynges knowlege counsayle sayd kyng sir wordes ought nat suffred erle northumberlande sone hath spoken sette subiettes agaist must behoue correcte rebelles one another wherby greattest shall doute take ensample trewe quod kyng beste sir quod nat ought come whan become call erle salisbury shall please lette rehersed yuell wordes haue spoken cousayle tha shall answere wyll make thervpon ye maye taken aduyse wheder ye wyll correcte prison wyse well sir quod kynge ye say well shalbe done erle northumberlande sone good frendes armye knewe kynges entent sent suche worde erle sonne shulde natte come kynges presece go iourney hadde worde dyde shulde nat welthe great domage kynge sore enformed whan warnynge stopped comyng kyng nat without good cause shewed came shulde ieopardye lyues whan ye kynges counsayle sawe therle sone came nat sayd kyng sir nowe ye maye se whyder dyde enforme trouthe nat ye maye se therle sonne disdayneth serue wyll nat come youre comaundement shall ye se ye sende shall sende quod kyng letter written sente notable messangers therle lorde henry percy son content letter incontynent without delaye vpon sight letter shulde come ye kyng duetie bounde messangers iourneyed longe came fayre castell erles standyng fronter scotlande messanger acquyted hym well doynge message comauded therle reed letter length shewed sonne toke aduise make messanger good chere write agayn kynge excusynge selfes howe coulde nat come countrey tyme howe kyng men ynowe acoplysshe iourney besyde messangers retourned kynge delyuered erles lettre kynge redde whiche answere nothynge pleasaunt kynge counsayle thanne cause thynges layde erles charge sonnes openly banysshed realme englande tyll ye kyng dyd repeale agayne publysshed cyties good townes englande specyally london wherof londoner great marueyle coulde nat knowe iustly cause erle sonne reputed noble valyaunt men within realme sayd cometh kynges counsayle hateth whiche counsayle wyll distroy kyng last peraduenture erle sonne haue spoken wordes vpon kynge counsayle yuell gouernynge realme coulde nat herde though said trouth true sayeng nowe punisshed thinke herafter wyll punysshed yt nowe iudge thus londoner spake mater erle brother valiaunt knight sir thomas percy longe tyme done many noble seruyces kynge englande whan erle knewe sonne banysshed realme toke vnreasonable punysshment without cause sente frendes countrey suche coulde get togyther many lygnage kynge go irelande erle toke counsayle best sythe kynge banysshed hym without cause counsayled sende realme scotlande desyre king sonne might abyde peasably scotlande tyll kynge englande apeased dyspleasure thus therle sent kynge robert scotlande kyng erle archambalt duglas lordes scotlande condiscendyd lyghtly erles desyre sent erle worde howe shulde gladly receyued also neded fyue syre hundred speares signyfied tyme shulde redy serue message pleased greatly erle lygnage erle taryed styll countrey amonge frendes kynge rycharde counsayle moche sorte season layser dyspleasure erle sonne ye shall hystory kinge rycharde thus beynge aboute bristowe state generally men englande began murmure ryse one agaynst another mynystrynge iustyce clene stopped vp courtes englande wherof valyaunt men prelate loued reste peace glad paye duetyes greatly abasshed rose realme companyes dyuers rowtes kepynge feldes hygh wayes marchauntes durste nat ryde abrode excercyse marchaundyse doute robbynge man knewe whome coplayne ryght reasone iustyce whiche thynges ryght preiudyciall dyspleasaunt good people englande contrary accustomable vsage people laborer marchauntes englande wonte lyue rest peace occupy marchaundyse peasably laborer labour landes quyetly contrary whan marchauntes rode fro towne towne marchaundyse outher golde syluer purces taken fro fro men labourer house companyons wolde take whete ootes bufes mutton porkes pore men durste speke worde yuell dedes dayly multyplyed great complayntes lamentacyons made therof realme good people sayde tyme chaunged vpon v fro good yuell euer sythe dethe good kynge edwarde thyrde whose dayes iustyce well kepte mynystred dayes man hardy englande take hen chekyn shepe without payed trewly dayes haue taken fro v yet dare nat speke thinges canne nat longe endure englande lykely loste without recouery haue kynge nowe wyll nothyng entendeth ydelnesse acomplysshe pleasure sheweth careth nat howe euery thynge gothe maye haue wyll tyme prouyde remedy el enemyes wyll reioyse mocke v kynge hath sette brother erle huntyngdon calais therby peraduenture may made yuell treatie bargayne towne calays frenche men rendre handes thynge necessary realme englande calays rendred frenche men englande neuer abasshed shulde good cause shulde lost chiefe key englande thus multyplyed lamentacyons murmurynge englande prelate ryche men realme came london dwell better suretie lygnages suche lordes kynge put dethe banisshed realme gladde wolde trouble ben realme cytezins lodon ryche lyued marchaundyse well coraunt see lande kepte therby great estate ensample remnaut realme lyghtly folowed sawe well great myschiefe lykely folowe realme sometyme kynge edwarde secondes dayes whan lorde spencer caused kynge put realme quene isabell edward sonne wolde haue distroyed wyste nat realme thre yere fynally whan men englande specyally londoner sawe howe kynge asotted syr hugh spenser prouyded remedy sente secretly quene isabell coulde get thre hundred men warre come englande shulde fynde ye greatest parte realme londoner redy receyue put possessyon realme whervpon quene founde lorde iohan haynalt lorde beaumont chynay brother erle guillyam haynalte loue pytie toke vyage brynge quene sonne englande four hundred men warre aryued englande ayde londoner quene atchyued enterprise without ayde wolde haue ben hard haue come passe kynge edwarde taken castell bristowe set prisone castell berkley suche fauoured slayne put execusion edwarde sonne crowned kynge westmynster ye londoner ryght well remembred yonge herde reported elder founde writynge sayd secretly one nother father antecessours olde tyme prouyded greate mischiefes thinke neuer greater cause nowe present tyme suffer kyng rycharde haue wyll wyll waste dystroy sythe kynge hath nat englande suche prosperyte sheweth nat prince wale shulde father wolde haue folowed condicions haue taken great pleasure prowes nat lyue reste ease dothe loueth nothynge sporte ydelnesse ladyes alwayes company beleue men small reputacyon gather great rychesse distroy realme whiche thynges ought nat suffred bycause valyaunt man duke gloucestre sawe clerely yt mater englande went nat shulde right sawe howe dayly worse worse bycause spake playnely therof traytours kinge caused hym murthered lykewyse good erle arundell haue driuen realme valyaunt yonge knight henry lancastre erle derby whome realme myght ought counsayled susteyned four sonnes hath yet crueltie besyde domage cause father suffre realme dysenheryte chyldren herytage auntes lady dame blanche lancastre dayly gyuen awaye nat worthy haue theym also bycause erle northumberlande sonne lorde henry percy haue somwhat spoken acordynge reasone kynge rycharde hath banysshed well apparaut shorte tyme shall neuer valyaunt man lefte realme wherfore wyll rynne nought without remedy founde shortely thynke best remedy sende erle derby leseth season fraunce whan come lette hym haue gouernaunce realme may refourme yuell bringe good state lette punysshed haue deserued let richarde burdeaux taken sette towre london fautes put writynge artycles whiche wyll founde great nombre tyme examined shall sene clerely nat worthy beare crowne kepe realme owne de de shall confounde hym phowe archebysshop caunterbury sente fraunce erle derby fro londoner counsayls englande haue returne englande cap ccxxxviii thus londoner co munded togyder nat al onely also dyuers place realme chyefe murmuracyon people first set rynge london comons london chefe lyghtly comons wold ruled vpon myschiefe sawe apparaunt englande dyuers secrete counsayles gyther certayne prelate knyghtes realme concluded sende fraunce erle derby determyned whan come shewe hym yuell gouernynge kynge rycharde put hym crowne gouernynge realme englande make hym kynge heyres euer wyll kepe realme good vsages thought shulde go message must wyse man good credence thought shulde great mater gette erle derby frauce said symple wordes meane messanger letter wolde gyue faythe rather thynke shulde betraye hym archebysshoppe caunterbury man honoure prudence desyred message comon profyte realme acorded go desyres ordeyned departure wysely yt none knewe therof suche ought knowe toke shyppe london seuen onely hym past without parell came sluse flaunders fro then ardenbourge gaunte warpe athe brabant conde valencennes toke lodgynge signe swanne market place taryed thre dayes refressed himselfe rode nat lyke bysshop lyke monke pylgryme dyscouered man entended fourth day departed toke man guyde parys sayenge howe wolde go pylgrymage saint dyd moch came thyder erle derby place called vyncetour besyde parys whan erle derby sawe bysshop caunterbury comynge herte spyrites reioysed dyd suche aboute thought well newes oute englande bysshoppe shewed nat cause comynge dissymuled bycause euery man shuld nat knowe entent therfore couer busynesse sayd openly come pylgrymage saynt mors suche aboute erle thought ben whan bysshop sawe tyme toke parte erle derby alone chambre closed dore bysshop shewed erle debylyte realme englande desolacyon therof howe iustyce place reygne faute good kinge howe certayne valyaunt men prelate londoner ingenerall deuised remedy cause sente thyder hym desyre retourne englande wolde make hym kynge bycause yt rycharde burdeaulx doone consented done many yuell dedes people sorowed redy ryse agaynst hym therfore syr nowe tyme neuer seke delyuerauce profyte welth chyldren ye entende nat helpe selfe theym also none wyll rycharde burdeaux gyueth chambre dayly parte enherytauce chyldrens whiche many valyaunt men londoner sore dyspleased therwith coude amended durst neuer speke tyll nowe bycause kynge hath yuell vsed hym selfe agaynst agaynst vncle duke gloucestre taken nyght conueyed calays murdered erle arundell beheeded without tytell good reason erle warwyke exyled banysshed thus realme englande nere dysheryted noble men whome realme shulde susteyned also kynge hath banysshed erle northumberlande lorde percy sonne bycause spake somewhat agaynst kynges gouernaunce counsayle thus dayly encrease doynge yuell none dare speke agaynst great parte realme haue pytie therof therfore desyre slepe lenger take leaue yt frenche kynge retourne englande shall receyued ioy haue sayd wyll fyrmely vpholde desyre haue none kynge ye well beloued realme whan erle herde bysshops wordes length nat hasty gyuenge aunswere leaned wyndowe lokynge downe gardeyne studyed certayne space many imagynacions last tourned hym archebysshop sayd syr wordes causeth study lothe wolde take enterprise lothe wolde leaue knowe well wyll longe canne retourne englande without meanes ye haue declared lothe wolde enclyne wordes frenche kynge frenchman haue done wyll lyst tary honour curtesye canne desyre reasone wordes promesse londoner good frendes shulde apply agree wylles desyre therby kynge rycharde shulde taken dystroyed shulde case beare great blame wherof wolde tyght lothe meanes might founde sir quod bysshoppe sent hyther hope goodnesse call counsayle shewe haue sayd shall also shewe cause comynge thynke wyll nat counsayle contrary shall quod erle suche weyghty mater requyreth counsayle erle called hym counsayle suche trusted best whan hym erle caused bysshop shewe mater cause commynge thyder erle demauded counsayle beste hym aunswered one voyce syr god hathe taken pytie howe euer ye refuse nat bargayne ye shal neuer haue better surely euer wyll enquyre lygnage fro whence ye dyscended ye ryght stocke generacyon saynt edwarde somtyme kynge englande syr thanke londoner good frendes wyll helpe delyuer daunger haue pytie chyldren desolacyon realme englande syr remembre well wroges iniuryes rycharde burdeaux hath done dothe dayly whan maryage bytwene countesse ewe nere poynte dyd nat erle salysbury breke called traytoure presence frenche kynge lordes whiche wordes nat pardoned ye ought desyre howe reuenged sir ye wyll nat helpe yourselfe shulde helpe syr take good aduyse herin phowe erle derby toke leaue frenche kyng went cosyn duke bretaygne cap ccxxxix whanne erle herde cousaylours ernestly counsayle spyrites opened sayd syrs wyll ye wyll haue haue counsayle entente sent syr quod ye saye well syr counsayle trewly power matter requyreth secretly coude ordeyned departure deuysed howe might passe see knowledge therof shulde come englande deuysed two wayes muste take one outher go haynalte holande take see dordright el go bretaygne duke take see lande plummouth god wolde englande thynges consydred sayd best way shulde bretaygne sayd erle syr go take leaue frenche kynge thanke hym curtesy hath shewed vnto take leaue duke orlyance kynges vncles thanke theym good chere haue made desyre kinge haue conducte go bretaygne sayenge ye wyll go se duke cosyn tary season hym erle acorded counsayle whan redy wente parys kynge acustomed euer whan came dore closed agaynst last tyme spake wysely kynge shewed hym howe wolde go sporte hym season bretayne se duke whome called vncle wyfe father suster doughter kynge edwarde frenche kynge thought nothyng well gaue hym lyghtly leaue erle desyred haue conducte bringe hym thyder graunted desyre make shorte erle ordeyned busynesse great wysdome toke leaue lordes fraunce suche gaue great gyftes kynges offycers offycers armes mynstrelles howse clysson made supper suche wolde come hym nexte daye toke horse departed fro parys issued gate saynt iaques toke ye way estampes knight beawsey dyd guyde hym called syr guy baygneux longe rode came blois taryed viii dayes erle sente knyght haraulde bretayne sygnyfie duke comynge reason whan duke iohan bretaygne knewe nephewe erle derby comynge thyder therof ryght ioyfull loued alwayes duke lancastre bretherne sayde knight brought worde called gillyam de la pierre sir dothe nephewe tary way cometh nat hyther streyght knyght excused erle well myght well quod duke sawe man seuen yere wolde gladder se nephewe erle derby retourne hym cause hym come shall fynde countrey redy open receyue hym aunswere knyght gladde retourned shortely coulde came bloys shewed erle counsayle duke aunswere next day rode forthe payed euery thynge erle derbyes company syr peter craon banysshed realme fraunce castelles rente reuenues seased hundred thousande frankes iudged duchesse aniou quene napoles proces lawe thus erle derby came nauntes founde duke receyued nobly company syr guy le bayneux retourned fraunce erle taryed duke bretaygne made hym good chere coulde deuysed seasone bysshoppe caunterbury styll erle cousayle duke spared nothynge vpon erle vpon men shewed loue worlde yet duke knewe well dyspleasure kynge rycharde agaynste erle wherof pytie whan erle consydred duke good wyll fauoure dyscouered hym parte busynesse touchynge duchy lancastre suche herytages duke father possessyon whan dyed desyringe therin haue duke counsayle sayenge nat repealed agayne kynge gyueth dayly away parte enherytaunces wherby shewed duke many noble men prelate englande nat well contente kynge realme therby great dyfference moche dyuers noble men londoner sent hym haue hym come englande promysynge wolde make peace kynge set hym herytage whan duke herde sayd fayre nephue many wayes best ought chosen kynge ye harde case ye demaunde counsayle wyll counsayle gyue credence frendes englande londoner myghty puyssaunt ayde prelate lordes knyghtes realme shall bringe kynge agre desyres nephewe shall ayde spyppes men warre resyste daungers vpon see offre erle thanked duke bretayne phowe erle derby aryued englande howe receyued londoner cap ccxl thus duke bretaygne erle derby louyngely concluded togyder erle taryed certayne space made though wold haue taryed styll meane seasone erle made prouysyon wannes whan thynge redy duke erle came thyder whan wynd serued erle derby company tooke see hym thre shyppes warre conducte hym englande sayled better wynde within two dayes two nyghtes aryed plumouth englande issued shyppes entred towne lytell lytell bayly plumouthe charge towne vnder kynge great marueyle whanne sawe moche people men warre entre towne bysshop caunterbury apeased sayd howe menne warre wolde harme realme englande sent thyder duke bretaygne serue kynge realme therwith bayly contente erle derby kept hym selfe priuy chaumbre none towne knewe hym bysshoppe caunterbury wrote letter sygned hande london sygnyfienge comynge erle derby sente suffycyent man post tooke fresshe horse waye came london daye night passed ouer bridge came mayres lodgynge bedde sone mayre knewe messager come fro bysshop caunterbury rose bedde made messanger entre chambre delyuered hym lettre fro bysshoppe caunterbury mayre redde reioysed greatly newes incontynent sente seruauntes fro house howse princypally suche counsayle sendynge erle derby gladde tydynges contynent assembled togyther moste notablest men cytie nombre two hundred spake togyder helde longe counsayle case required nat sayd lette v apparell selfe go receyue duke lancastre saythe agreed sende hym archebysshoppe caunterbury hathe well doone deuoyre seynge hath brought hym englande dyd chose certayne men go abrode publysshe erles comynge lordes knyghtes squyers suche party mo fyue hundred londoner tooke horse great desyre go forthe lothe tarye one nother erle derby taryed nat longe plummouth nexte daye soone horse vnshypped rode towardes london season sir peter craon ye breton styll erle mayre london hadde gouernyng cytie fyrst mette erle feldes humbly receyued euer rode forwarde mette people fyrst daye cae laye guyldforde fyue twentie myle fro lodon next day great nombre men woman chyldren london clergy came mete erle suche desyre se hym whan cae sight cried welcome noble erle derby duke lancastre god sende ioye welthe prosperyte sithe ye wente englande realme hath ben prosperyte nowe truste ye shall bringe v reasonable estate haue lyued great displeasaunce desolacyon meanes richarde burdeaux counsayle specially ought moost chefe blamed kyng shulde gouerne realme people ought haue suche discrecyon knowe gode yuell asondre otherwise nat worthy gouerne realme rycharde burdeaux hath done contrary whiche shalbe well knowen proued vpon suche wordes people brought erle london mayre rode cheke cheke hym whiche great pleasure people se mayre sometyme sayde erle sir beholde howe people reioyse co myng trewe quod erle alwayes rode enclyned heed people euery syde thus erle brought lodgynge euery man departed tyll dyner mayre notable men cite dyuers lordes knyghtes prelate bysshoppes abbottes suche london cam se erle also duchesse gloucestre two doughters came se therle cosyn germayns affren brother kynge richarde feare thane loue ladyes countesse arundell chyldren also countesse warwyke dyuers ladyes suche london people london ioyfull erles comyng workynge london daye ben easter daye come conclusyon busynesse people toke cou sayle aduyse ryde agaynst kynge londoner named richard burdeaux kynge without tytell honour vyllaynes london hadde kyng suche hate payne spekynge hym co dempnacion distruction hadde treated erle derby kynge moche ordred counsayle erle derby toke hym kyng endure euer heyres therto londoner dyde swere seale promysed resydue realme shulde solempnely shulde neuer questyon made therof also promysed hym aide assyste hym alwayes promyses boundes one taken concluded ordayned xii hundred men london well armed shulde ryde erle towardes bristowe moche richarde burdeaux myght taken brought london take aduyse shulde done hym iudged lawe thre estate realme also ordayned make lesse brute sclaundre men warre bretaygne suche come thyder erle shulde retourned home agayne sayde howe hadde men ynoughe dedes without erle breton hym thanked seruyce hadde done hym gaue great rewardes well content retourned plumouthe shyppes bretayne pnowe lette v speke erle derby ordayned ryde bristowe erle derby cheife armye reason touched hym nerest thus departed fro london rode countrey fell hym tidynges cae kynges host comyng erle derby londoner many knyghtes squyers knewe kynge hadde knowledge therof durst nat speke therof whan tidynges spredde abrode suche next kyng great feare knewe well kynge bothe lykely fall paryll bycause hadde many ennemyes realme suche tha ennemyes hadde made good face many knightes squyers suche hadde serued kyng departed fro courte without lycence wente home owne house toke nexte waye coude streight erle derby serue hym soone affren gloucestre rycharde sone erle arundell knewe erle derby londoner comynge gote men toguyder departed rode streyght erle derby whome founde beyonde oxenforde towne called soucetour therle derby hadde great ioye whane sawe cosyns demaunded state kynge howe departed fro hym aunswered sayde sir departynge spake nat hym soone knewe commynge lepte horse departed come serue ayde reuenge dethe father whome richarde burdeaulx hathe caused slayne sir quod erle ye ryght welcome ye shall ayde shall helpe behouable oure cosyn rycharde burdeaux brought london haue promysed londoner wyll kepe promyse therto wyll ayde haue men ynowe fyght hym nede wyll haue batayle shall haue phowe tidynges came kyng richarde comynge erle derby great puyssaunce cap ccxli sayd kynge whan mater coude lengar hydde sir aduyse well ye haue nede good counsayle shortely londoner cometh agaynst great puissaunce hath made therle derby cosyn chefe capitayne haue gote hym frau ce hath nat done without great treatie whan kynge herde sore abasshed wyste nat saye spyrites trymbled tha saw well mater lykely go yuell agaynst hym without coude gette puyssauce resyst kynge sayd sir make men redy lende throughe realme ayde wyll nat flye subiettes sir quod mater gothe yuell men leaue flye awaye ye haue loste one halfe rest sore abasshed leseth cou tynauce quod kyng wyll ye shall sir leaue felde ye nat able kepe gette stronge castell tyll sir iohan hollade brother come aduertysed mater whane come shall fynde remedy outher biforce armes elles treatie leest bring better case ye present tyme ye kepe felde paraduenture wyll forsake go hym cousaile kyng agreed tyme erle salisbury nat ye kyng countre whan herde howe erle derby londoner great puissaunce rode agaynst kyng ymagined matter paryll hym kynge suche kyng ben counsayled sate styll tidynges also duke yorke nat kyng sonne erle rutlande alwayes ye kyng two cause one kyng richarde loued hym entierly another bycause constable englande therfore right ought kynge whan kyng supped newe tidynges cae agayne hym sayeng sir tyme take aduise howe ye wyll order selfe puyssauce nat sufficient agaynst cometh agaynst nat aueyle make batayle agaynst behoueth passe daunger sadde aduyse good counsayle wysedome apease yuel willers ye haue done tyme correcte leysar castell xii myle hen called castell flynte whiche stronge counsayle go thider close within tyll ye newes fro erle huntyngton brother frendes sende irelande socours ye fre che kyng father lawe whan knoweth nede wyll conforte kyng folowed counsayle apoynted shulde ride hym castell flynt ordayned cosyn erle rutlande tary styll bristowe shulde redy sette forwarde whan sent power fyght enemyes nexte day kynge suche housholde rode castell flynte entred castell without makynge semblaunt make warre abide defende castell assayled phowe kyng richarde yelded selfe erle derby go london cap ccxli erle derby londoner spy goyng comyng reported al ye state kyng also erle knewe suche knyghtes squyers daylye came fro kynges parte therle sure knowledge king gone castell flynt company owne housholde semed wolde warr scape dauger treatie therle determyned ryde thyder moche haue ye kyng outher biforce treatie erle company rode thyder within two myle castell founde great vyllage erle taryed dranke determyned hym selfe ryde castell flynt two hundred horse leaue rest company styll sayde wolde coude fayre treatie entre castell loue nat perforce bring kynge fayre wordes assure hym fro paryll excepte goynge london promise hym shall haue hurte body meane hym londoner nat co tent hym therles deuyse semed good harde sayd hym sir beware dissymulacion rycharde burdeaux muste taken outher quycke deed traytours hym counsayle brought london sette towre londoner wyll nat suffre contrary erle sayde sir feare nat enterprised shall accomplysshed gette hym castell fayre wordes wyll canne nat shall sende worde therof ye shall come laye siege castell wyll moche force assaute wyll haue hym quicke deed castell well prignable wordes accorded well ye londoner erle departed fro army rode two hudred men castell kyng amog men right sore abasshed erle came ridyng castell gate whiche faste closed case requyred erle knocked gate porter demauded erle answered henry lancastre come kynge demaunde myne herytage duchy lancastre shewe kynge fro sir quod within shall incontynent went hall ongyon kyng suche knyghtes hym long tyme cousayled hym newes shewed kyng sayd sir cosyn derby ye gate dema deth set possessyon ye duchy lancastre enherytaunce kynge regarded suche aboute hym demaunded best said sir request none yuell ye maye let hym come xii person company wyll say cosyn great lorde realme maye well make peace wyll greatly beloued realme specially londoner sente hym frauce nowe ye chefe agaynst sir ye must dissymule tyll mater apeased tyll erle huntyngton brother cometh nowe yuell passe calais many nowe englande rysen agaynst knewe youre brother aboute wolde sytte styll durst nat displease yet hathe wyfe erle derbyes suster meanes suppose ye shulde come peace cocorde kyng agreed wordes said go let hym come xii hym mo two knyghtes went downe gate opyned wycket issued made reuerence erle receyued hym gracious wordes knewe well hadde force resyst also knewe well londoner sore displeased therfore spake fayre sayde erle sir pleasure kyng masse hath sente v hyder speke saye quod therle ye knowe well ought haue possessyon ouchy lancastre come partie cause also thynges wolde speke kynge sir quod ye welcome kyng wolde gladde se hath commaunded ye come hym onely xii persones erle answered pleaseth well entred castell xii persones gate closed agayne rest co pany taryed without nowe consyder dauger therle derby kyng myght haue slayne hym suche hym easely byrde cage feared nat mater boldelye went kyng chauged colour whan sawe erle erle spake aloude without makynge great honour reuerence sayd sir ye fastynge kyng answered sayd yea aske tyme quod erle ye dyned ye haue great iourney ryde wheder shulde ryde quod kynge ye must ryde london quod therle wherfore counsayle eate drinke ye maye ryde myrthe kynge sore troubled mynde maner afrayde wordes sayde nat hungry haue luste eate suche wereby gladde flatter therle derby sawe well mater lyke go dyuersly sayde kynge sir beleue cosyn lancastre wyll nothyng good kyng sayd well content couer table thanne kynge wasshed satte downe serued erle demaunded wolde sytte downe sayde nat fastynge mean season whyle kyng satte dyner dyde eate lytell hert full lust eate countrey castell full men warre within castell myght se wyndowes kynge whan rose fro table myght se hym selfe demaunded cosyn men appered many feldes therle aunswered sayde moost parte londoner wolde haue quod kyng wyll haue quod therle bringe london putte towre none remedy ye scape none otherwyse quod ye kyng sore afrayde wordes knewe well lodoners loued hym nat sayde cosyn nat prouyde suretie wyll nat gladly putte hades knowe well hate haue done long though kynge therle sayd sir se none remedy yelde selfe prisoner whan knowe ye prisoner wyll hurte ye must ordayne copany ryde lo prisoner towre london kyng sawe hym self harde case spyrites sore abasshed douted greatly londoner wolde slee hym yelded hym selfe prisoner erle derby boude hym selfe promysed wolde haue hym lykewise knightes lquyers offycers yelded erle eschewe dauger paryll erle receyued prisoner ordayned incontynent horse sadylled brought forthe courte gate opyned many men armes archer entred erle derby caused crye made payne dethe man hardy take away thyng within ye castell laye handes vpon sone vnder erles sauegarde protection whiche crye kept man durst breke erle kyng downe courte talkyng toguyder caused kynges hole housholde estate go forwarde custome done without chau gyng mynisshynge thyng whyle euery thyng preparyng kyng erle comuned toguyder court well regarded londoner entormed kynge richarde grayhounde called mathe alwayes wayted vpon kynge wolde knowe man el whan soeuer kyng dyde ryde kept grayhounde dyde lette hym lose wolde streight rynne kynge fawne vpon hym leape tore fete vpon kynges shulders kyng erle derby talked togyder courte grayhounde wont lepe vpon kyng left kynge came erle derby duke lancastre made hym frendly coutinau ce chere wonte kyng duke knewe nat grayhoude demaunded kyng grayhounde wolde cosyn quod kyng gret good token yuell signe sir howe knowe quod duke knowe well quod kyng grayhounde maketh chere day kynge englande ye shalbe shalbe deposed grayhoude hath knowledge naturally therfore take hym wyll folowe forsake duke vnderstode well wordes cherisshed grayhounde wolde neuer folowe kyng richarde folowed duke la castre euery man lepte horsbacke departed fro castell flynt entred feldes thus duke henry lancastre called erle derby duke lacastre rode kyng oftentymes talked togider men warre behynde great nombre suche kynges courte rode toguyder company night laye oxenforde duke lancastre ledde kyng richarde castelles good townes feare styring people alwayes kepte feldes duke gaue lycence great nombre people departe sayd sir ye maye departe haue desyre kynge nat flye scape fro v owne company shall bring hym london putte hym sauegarde ye towre prisoner may bringe whider wyll therfore sir go wayes home tyll ye newes dyde duke comaunded toke way wyndsore came thyder moost parte lodoners retourned london owne place duke lacastre deted fro wynsore wolde nat ride colbroke toke way shene cae dyner chersay ye king desyred duke shulde nat bringe hym london waye cytie therfore tooke waye soone kynge thus handes sente notable sone yong quene lede kent cae lady coucy seconde persone next quene sayd madame make redy ye must dete hen departyng make semblant displeasure quene saye howe husbande hath sent doughter also saye loke accomplysshe payne lyfe axe ye questyons ye shalbe conueyed douer haue shyppe shall bring boloyne lady douted word knewe well englysshemen cruell hasty said sir god wyll redy ye wyll haue anone made redy horse prouyded co pany frenche men woman departed conueyed douer next tyde toke shippyng good wynde arryued boloyne pof state quene isabell englande howe newe sone apoynted wayte vpon howe kyng richarde sette towre london capi ccxlii state quene tourned broken lefte nouther man womon chylde ye nacion fra ce yet englande suche fauour kyng house newly furnisshed ladyes damoselles offycers seruauntes charged wyse shuld nat speke kynge nat one another thus duke lacastre departed fro cherisay rode shene fro then nyght tyme conueyed kyng towre london suche knightes squyers kyng wolde nexte mornyng whan londoner knewe kynge towre gretly reioysed great murmuring among bycause kyng conueyed thyder secretely angry duke nat brought hym throughe london openly nat haue done honor shame hated hym sore beholde opinyon comon people wha vp agaynst prince lorde specially englande amonge remedy peryloust people worlde outragyoust vp specially londoner dede riche great nombre well lodon axxiiii thousade men harnesse complete axxx thousande archer hardy hygh corage blode sawe shedde lesse abasshed pnowe lette v somwhat speke erle rutlande constable englande sonne duke yorke taryed bristowe lorde speser hym suster wyfe whan knewe yt castell flynte gyuen vp kynge taken brought london thane thought surely matter wente nat well kynge therfore thought lengar tary gaue leaue al men warre departe erle rutlande lorde spenser rode toguyder owne seruauntes hull marchesse wale fayre maner lorde spenser taryed tyll herde tidynges duke yorke laye styll castell medled nothynge busynesse englande dyde toke euer tyme aworthe came howbeit sore displeased mynde se suche difference within ye realme bytwene nephues blode pnowe let v retourne speke kynge richarde whan duke lancastre set cosyn kyng richard ye towre london certayne cou saylours sette sure kepynge fyrst thyng duke sent erle warwyke banysshed comaunded lye ysle wyght discharged hym clene therof secondly duke lancastre sent therle northumberlande lorde percy sonne shulde come hym dyde enquered sought haue foure companyons strangled vncle duke gloucestre castell calais well sought taken sette prisone aparte lodon duke lancastre cousayle toke aduyse shulde done kyng richarde beyng towre lodon kyng iohan fraunce kept whyle kynge edwarde wente realme frauce thought king rycharde shuld put fro royalte ioy hath lyued sayd newes takynge shulde sprede abrode realmes crystened kynge xxii yere determined kepe prisone regarded case realme stode dyd put dedes artycles nombre xxviii duke lancastre counsayle went towre london entred chambre kynge rycharde without reuerence makynge hym openly redde said artycles whiche kynge made none aunswere sawe well true yt layde charge sauynge sayd haue doone passed counsayle demaunded gyuen cousayle whome ruled named trust therby haue ben delyuered himselfe accusynge doone tyme trustynge therby scape bringe daunger payne nat mynde loued hym nat tyme spake departed duke lancastre went lodgynge suffred mayre men lawe procede went ye guyldhall mater cytie determyned moche people assebled whan sawe gouernours cytie go thyder thought iustice shulde done dede shall shewe howe fyrste artycles made agaynst kynge whiche redde hym towre redde agayne openly shewed hym redde howe kynge hymselfe denyed none confessed dyd theym counsayle four knightes chambre howe counsayle put dethe duke gloucestre erle arudell sir thomas corbet howe longe encyted kynge dedes whiche dedes sayd nat forgyuen demaunded punycion cousayle iustyce right closed vp courtes englande westmynster wherby many yuell dedes folowed companyes rowtes theues murderer rose assembled togyther dyuers party realme robbed marchauntes wayes poore men house whiche meanes realme great parell haue ben lost without recouery ymagyned fynally wolde haue rendred calais guysnes bothe frenchmennes handes wordes thus shewed people made many abasshed many beganne murmure sayd cause demaunde punycion may take ensample therby rycharde burdeaur deposed nat worthy beare crowne ought depriued fro honour kept lyfe prison breed water though villaynes murmured said hygh sir mayre london ye haue iustyce handes mynyster execute iustyce wyll ye spare man ye se well case ye haue shewed v demaudeth iustyce cotynent iudges vpon owne dedes mayre gouernours lawe went togyther chambre iudgement four knyghtes iudged dye iudged foote towre kynge richarde might se drawen alonge dyke horse eche throughe cytie chepesyde heedes stryken sette vpon london bridge bodyes drawen gybet hanged iudgement gyuen delyuered execucyon mayre london suche deputed mater wente fro guyldhall towre toke four knyghtes kynges whose name called sir bernarde brokas syr marelays mayster iohn derby receyuour lyncolne mayster stell kynges stewarde eche tyed two horse presence towre kynge myght well se wyndowes wherwith sore descomforted kynge loked case knewe london cruell thus four knyghtes drawen one another longe cyte tyll came chepe fysshers stall heedes stryken set vpon london bridge bodyes drawen shulders gybet hanged vp iustyce thus doone euery man went lodgynges kynge rycharde knowyng selfe taken daunger londoner great sorowe herte rekened puyssaunce nothynge sawe howe euery man agaynste hym ought hym fauour laye nat power hym ayde durste nat shewe suche kynge sayde syr haue small trust lyues may well apere whan cosyn lancastre came castell flynte owne good wyll ye yelded hym promysed twelue shuld prisoner haue hurte nowe twelue four executed shamfully like passe way cause londoner hath caused duke lancastre cosyn dede hym sore bounde muste wyll haue hym god dothe moche v suffre myght dye naturall deth nat shamfull dethe great pytie thynke wordes kyng rycharde began tederly wepe wringe handes cursed houre euer borne rather haue suche ende suche aboute hym great pytie recomforted hym well might one knyghtes sayd syr behoueth take comforte se well worlde nothyng fortune ther marueylous somtyme tourne well vpon kinges prince vpon poore men frenche kynge whose doughter ye haue maryed canne nat nowe ayde farre ye myght scape myschefe dyssimulacyon saue lyfe good enterprise peraduenture yere two wolde recouery kynge wolde ye shulde nothynge wolde glad saue v therby syr quod knyght se trouthe londoner wyll crowne cosyn lancastre kynge entent sent hym haue ayded hym nat possyble lyue without ye consent crowned kynge wherfore syr wyll counsayle entent saue lyfe whan cosyn lancastre cometh demaunde thynge swete treatable wordes say hym howe ye wyll resygne hym crowne englande ryght ye haue realme clerely purely handes howe ye wyll kynge therby ye shall greatly apease londoner also desyre hym effectuously suffre lyue v also el euery man parte shall please el banisshe v realme euer leseth lyfe leseth kynge rycharde herde wordes well fyxed surelye herte sayd wolde counsayled hym sawe hym selfe great daunger sayd kepte hym howe wolde gladly speke cosyn lancastre phowe kynge rycharde englande resigned crowne realme handes erle derby duke lancastre cap ccxliiii shewed duke lancastre howe rycharde burdeaux desyred speke hym duke euenynge toke barge went towre water went kynge receyued hym curtesly humbled hym selfe greatly sawe hym selfe great daunger sayd cosyn lancastre regarde consydre myne estate whiche nowe small thanke god therof reygne gouerne people beare crowne thynke nat god helpe wolde deed naturall dethe frenche kinge agayne doughter haue yet gret ioy togyder syth brought englande coulde neuer haue loue people cosyn thynges cosydred knowe well haue greatly trespassed agaynst agaynst noble men blodde dyuers thynges perceyue shall neuer haue pardone come peace wherfore myne owne free lyberall wyll wyll resygne herytage crowne englande requyre take gyfte therof resignacyon whan duke herde sayd syr conuenyent parte thre estate realme called wordes haue sent redy noble men prelate counsaylours good townes englande truste wyll within thre dayes suffycient make dewe resygnacion meanes ye shal greatly apease many men within realme withstande suche enormyties yuels haue ben vsed realme faute iustyce place reygne sent fro beyond see people wolde crowne renome rynneth englande haue ryght crowne ye haue whan grauntfather kynge edwarde thyrde dyd chose make kynge shewed hym loued sonne prince none coude breake purpose opinyon shulde kynge ye wolde haue folowed steppe father prince haue beleued counsayle good sonne ought haue done ye myght haue ben styll kyng haue contynued youre estate ye haue alwayes done contrary comon renome rynneth england place ye neuer sonne prince wale rather sonne preest chanon haue herde certayne knightes prince howse myne vncle howe knew well wyfe nat truely kepte maryage mother cosyn germayne kynge edwarde kynge beganne hate bycause coulde haue generacion also kynges gossyp two chyldren fonte coulde well kepe prince bandon crafte subtylte made prince husbande bycause coulde haue chylde douted prince shulde deuorsed fro dyd moch chylde another fyrst nat tell iudge bycause codicyons haue ben sene contrary fro noble prowes prince therfore sayd ye rather sonne prest chanon whan ye gotten borne burdeaux many yonge preestes ye prince house brute countrey workes haue well folowed ye alwayes enclyned pleasure french men take peace confusyon dy shonoure realme englande bycause myne vncle gloucestre erle arundell dyd cousayle truly faythfully kepe honour realme folowe steppe auncestours ye haue traytoursly caused dye haue taken defende lyfe longe may pytie shall pray londoner herytours ye haue slayne banysshed cosyn thanke quod yt kynge truste ryght ye shulde nat ben ye ben taken people deposed great confusyon slayne reasone yuell workes kynge rycharde herde well duke wordes wyst nat saye agaynst sawe well force argumentes coulde nat auelyle rather mekenesse humilyte wherfore humbled hym prayed duke saue lyfe whan duke lancastre ben towre two houres kynge rycharde shewed hym parte fautes retourned next day sent forthe mo comaundementes party realme cause noble men come london vncle duke yorke came london erle rutlande sonne erle northumberlande lorde thomas percy brother duke lancastre made good chere thyder came also great nombre prelate abbottes day duke lancastre acompanyed lordes duke prelate erles barones knyghtes notablest men london good townes rode towre alyghted kynge rycharde brought hall aparelled lyke kynge robe estate septer hande crowne heed stode vp alone nat holden stayed man sayde loude haue kynge englande duke acquytany lorde irelande aboute xxii yeres whiche sygnory royalte cepter crowne herytage clerely resygne cosyn henry lancastre desyre hym open presence entrynge possessyon take septour delyuered duke toke kynge rycharde toke crowne fro heed bothe handes set hym sayd fayre cosyn henry duke lancastre gyue delyuer crowne wherwith crowned kyng englande therwith right therto dependyng duke lancastre tooke archebysshop caunterbury toke duke handes resygnacion thus done duke lancastre called notary demaunded haue letter wytnesse prelate lordes beynge present rycharde burdeaux retourned agayne chambre fro whence came duke lancastre lept horse crowne ceptour put cofer conueyed abbey westmynster kept treasory euery man wente lodgynges abode tyll day parliament counsayle shulde palays westmynster pof coronacyon kyng henry duke lancastre consent realme maner feest cap ccxlv yere lorde god thousande thre hundred fourscore nynetene last daye septembre tuysday began parlyament westmynster holden henry duke lancastre whiche tyme assembled prelate clergy realme englande great nombre also duke erles barones euery towne certayne thus people assembled westmynster beynge presente duke lancastre duke chalenged realme englande desyred kynge thre reasones fyrst conquest secondly bycause heyre thyrdly bycause rycharde burdeaur resygned realme handes free wyll presence certayne duke erles prelate barones hall within towre london thre cause shewed duke lancastre requyred people present well one shewe myndes entente behalfe people one voyce sayd wylles haue kynge howe wolde haue none hym duke agayne sayd people sir myndes one voyce sayde ye ye duke sate downe syege royall whiche seate reysed vp hall couered clothe estate yt euery man myght well se hym sytte people lyfted vp handes hygh promysing hym faythe allegyaunce thanne parlyament cocluded day taken coronacyon saynt edwardes day monday xiii day octobre whiche tyme saturday coronacyon departed fro westmynster rode towre london great nombre night suche squyers shulde made knyghtes nexte day watched nombre xlvi euery squier owne bayne selfe next day duke lancastre made theym knyghtes masse tyme longe cote strayte sleues furred wt mynyuer lyke prelate whyte lace hangynge shuldes dyner duke departed fro towre westmynster rode way bareheeded aboute necke lyuery fraunce acompanyed ye prince sonne syxe duke syxe erles xviii baron knyghtes squyers nyne hundred horse kynge shorte cote clothe golde maner almayne mounted whyte cou ser garter left legge thus duke rode london great nombre lordes euery lordes seruaunt maysters lyuery ge lombardes marchauntes london euery craft lyuerey deuyse thus conueyed westmynster nombre syxe thousade horse streates hanged passed day next london rynnynge seuen cundyttes wyne whyte reed nyght duke bayned next mornynge confessed herde thre mass acustomed prelate clergy came fro westmynster churche palays fetche kynge procession went churche procession lordes hym robe scarlet furred menyuer barred shulders acordynge degree ouer kynge borne clothe estate blewe four belle golde borne four burgess porte douer euery syde sword borne one ye sworde churche sworde iustyce sworde church sonne prince dyd beare sworde iustyce therle northumberlande dyd beare constable englande erle rutlande deposed fro offyce erle westmerlande marshall englande bare ceptour thus entred ye churche nyne clocke myddes churche hygh scaffolde couered reed myddes therof chayre royall couered clothe golde kyng sate downe yt chayre sate estate royall sauynge nat crowne sate bare heeded four corner scaff olde archebysshop caunterbury shewed vnto people howe god sent man kyng demaunded content shulde consecrated crowned kynge one voyce sayd yea helde vp handes promysynge faythe obeysaunce kynge rose wente downe scaffolde hygh auter sacred whiche consecracyon two archbysshoppes ten bysshops aulter dispoyled vesture estate anoynted vi place heed brest two shulders behynde handes bonet ser heed whyle anoyntynge clergy sange latyny suche seruyce synge halowing fonte yt kinge aparelled lyke prelate churche cope reed sylke payre spurres poynte without rowell sworde iustyce drawen shethe halowed taken ye kyng dyd put agayne sheth archebysshop caunterbury dyd gyrde ye sworde hym saynt edwardes crowne brought forthe whiche close aboue blessed archebysshop dyd sette kynges heed masse kyng departed churche estate went palays fountayne ranne dyuers braunches whyte wyne reed kyng entred hall priuy chamber came agayne dyner fyrst table sate kynge seconde ye fyue peres realme thyrde valaunt men london fourth newe made knightes fyft knyghtes squiers honour kyng stode prince holdynge sworde churche syde constable sworde iustyce lytell aboue marshall ceptour yt kynges borde sate two archbysshops xvii bysshoppes myddes dyner came knight called dinereth armed vpon good horse rychely aparelled knyght hym bearyng speare sworde syde dagger knyght toke kyng lybell whiche red therin conteyned outher knight squyer getylman wold say kyng henry nat right full kyng redy fyght quarell kynge shulde please hym apoynte byll cryed haraulde syxe place hall towne none wolde chalenge hym whan kynge dyned toke wyne spyces hall went chambre euery man departed went lodginges thus day passed kynge henryes coronacyon great ioy feest whiche endured next day erle salysbury nat solepnyte sure prison kinges cousayle dyuers noble men londoner wolde heed shulde haue ben stryken openly chepe said well deserued bearynge letter credece fro rycharde burdeaux frenche kyng reporte openly kyng henry false traytoure whiche faute sayd ought nat doned kyng henry gentyll pytie hym therle excused hym sayd dyd kynges comaundement settyng four knyghtes beheeded kinge henry beleued well erles wordes cousayle wolde nat beleue said dyd ye londoner shulde dye bycause deserued deth thus erle salysbury prison great daunger lyfe syr iohan holande erle huntyngdon capytayne calais well enfourmed hole mater howe brother kyng rychard taken prisone towre london resygned crowne howe henry lancastre kinge englande erle huntyngdon euer dyspleasure trouble brother yet wysely consydred tyme aduentures sawe well yt nat able stande power puyssaunce realme also countesse wyfe cosyn germayne kynge henry sayd syr must behoue passe displeasure pacyently wysely nat thynge wherby ye shall haue domage kyng may moche good ye se realme enclyneth hym ye shewe dyspleasure hym warde ye lost wherfore syr requyre cousayle dyssimule matter well kynge henry nowe brother kyng richarde therfore syr stycke leane ye shall fynde hym good louer neuer rycher kynge englande may chyldren great good erle herde well wordes wyfe beleued enclyned hym kynge henry offred hym humble obeysaunce promysed hym faythe trouthe kyng receyued hym great ioy therof dyd moche meanes fredes therle salysbury taken grace excusacyons accepted clene pardoned phow newes taking kyng rycharde knowen fraunce comyng thyder lady coucy howe frenche kynge dyspleased cap ccxlvi whan lady coucy aryued bouloyne hasted go parys great murmurynge fraunce sodayne incidentes yt fall englade knewe somwhat marchautes bruges whan lady coucy aryued trouth knowen went firste husbandes house reason anon frenche kynge herde worde howe lady coucy come parys kynge sent lorde coucy ben nyght wyfe whan come kynge demauded state kynge rycharde englande quene doughter lorde durst nat hyde trouth fro hym shewed hym playnely euery thynge wyfe shewed hym whiche newes sore dyspleasaunt frenche kynge knewe well englysshmen sore harde men apease dyspleasure frenche kynge retourned agayne olde sicknes fransey wherof noble yt realme sore displeased coude nat amende duke burgoyn said thought neuer otherwyse maryage without good reasone whiche sayd playnly ynough whan mater fyrst spoke coulde nat herde knewe well ye londoner neuer loued parfytely kynge rycharde myschefe engendred duke gloucestre tyme nowe take hede englisshmen wyll sythe haue taken kyng put prison lykelyhode wyll put hym dethe neuer loued bycause loued warre peace wyll crowne kynge duke lancastre shall bynde hym selfe whether wyll nat shall wyll sayd moreouer nowe shall sene burdeaux wyll borne well loued also bayon dax lymytes burdeloys good yt constable frauce sir loys sanxere signyfyed mater drewe hym yt fronters syr raynolde barroys barreys barones prelate treate brother duke berrey go poictou drawe fronters xaintes blaues mirebell wherby burdeaux wyll thynge entende treaty may receyued nowe shall haue neuer deuysed ordeyned whiche substanciall deuyce whan burdeaux bayon dax vnderstode kynge rycharde taken sette towre london duke henry lancastre crowned kyng gret marueyle therof begynnyng wolde nat beleue lytle lytle knewe trouth therof sayd thre townes closed man suffred issue entre sore troubled sorowfull specyally cytie burdeaux kynge rycharde norysshed amonge therfore loued hym whyle kynge burdeloys came hym well receyued alwayes ye kinge redy fulfyll desyres wherfore sayd whan knewe trouth ah richarde gentle kyng ye noble man euer reigned realme trouble yt londoner haue caused coulde neuer loue specyall sythe ye alyed maryage frenche kyng myschiefe great nat suffre haue holden kynge xxii yere nowe condempe dethe sythe ye prison haue crowned duke lancastre wyll surely put deth burdeloys made great lamentacyons moche seneschall burdeaux ryght valyaunt knyght englande wrote letter therin conteynynge wordes lamentacyons cytie burdeaulx bayon dax also wrote howe nere poynte yelde vp townes frenche kyng sent lettre trusty seruaut see good wynde aryued cornewayle englade rode longe came london foude kynge henry delyuered letter whiche dyrected kynge londoner opened reed kynge londoner tooke counsayle vpon mater london aunswered lyke theym nothyng abasshed tydynges sayde townes wyll neuer tourne frenche nat lyue daunger canne nat suffre extorcion pollinge frenchman vnder v lyue franke free frenche men shulde lordes ouer shulde taxed tayled retayled two thre tymes yere whiche nat nowe acustomed vnto whiche shulde harde thyng nowe begynne also thre cyties closed roude great lordes good englysshe longe haue lorde pyuiers lorde musydent lorde dura lorde landuras lorde copane lorde rosem lorde logeren dyuers barones knyghtes whome shulde haue warre handes shulde nat issue city shulde taken seneschalles wrytynge haue doute yt shulde become frenche howe good sende thyder valyaunt wyse man beloued amonge theym suche hath gouerned lorde thomas percy thus deuysed acomplysshed desyred go thyder take hede coutrey fulfylled kynges comaundement made hym redy departe christmasse whiche tyme wyndes sore ieoperdous toke shyppynge cornewayle two hundred men armes four hundred archer hym nephue hugh hastynges thomas colleuyll gyllyam lysle iohan graily bastarde sonne captall beufz guillyam traicton iohan danbreticourt diuers also bysshop london mayster rycharde doall taryed tyll mydde marche toke see came burdeaux duke burbon come cytie dagen treate theym burdeloys dyd moche fayre wordes good assuraunce counsayles burdeaux bayon dax sent cytie dagen duke receyued frendly gaue fayre wordes many promyses shewed wolde turne frenche vnder obeysaunce frenche kynge euer wolde demaunde shulde graunted sealed perpetually endure many thynges promysed sware seale kepe euer aunswered whan retourned agayne cyties wolde shewe people take counsayle gyue answere thus departed fro dagen fro duke burbon retourned townes shewed people tourned nothynge comynaltyes sayde cyties consydred busynesse knewe well howe realme fraunce vexed troubled tayles fowages shamfull exaccions get money sayd frenche men gouerne ouer v wyll bringe v vsage yet better v englysshe kepe v franke free londoner haue deposed kynge rycharde crowned kinge henry v haue shall haue alwayes kynge vnderstande bysshop london syr thomas percy shortely wyll shall enfourme v trouthe haue also marchaundyse woll wyne clothe englysshe men frenchman let v ware make treatie wherby shulde repent v thus treatie frenche men broken lefte anone bysshop london ye lorde percy charge men warre aryued burdeaux wherof moche people greatly reioysed displeased suche rather haue frenche englysshe englysshe lordes lodged togyther abbey saint andrewe whan sawe tyme shewed people state englande ye cause sent thyder dyd moche euery thynge apeased bothe place harde haue caused haue tourned frenche determyned counsayle fraunce sithe kyng sycknesse reason displeasure toke deposyng sonne lawe kynge rycharde yt shulde sende notable wyse personage englande knowe state quene message apoynted syr charles de la brethe charles hanger comaunded departed fro parys came boloygne taryed sent haraulde kynge henry without assurauce durst nat go truce bytwene bothe realmes kynge henry thought hym selfe moche bounde frenche kynge chere hadde fraunce toke counsayle concluded haraulde answered kynges pleasure company shulde come englande come streyght way kyng nat ryde way without lycence haraulde retourned boloyne shewed done wherwith content shypped horse toke see aryued douer founde redy knyght kynges howse oho receyued theym sene hym kyng henry fraunce wherby soner aquaynted taryed douer tyll horse vnshypped rode caunterbury euer bayted lay hostes payed laste came eltham founde kyng henry parte counsayle kinge made good chere loue frenche kynge shewed kyng cause comynge kynge aunswered sayde sir ye shal go london wyll within foure dayes assemble counsayle ye shall haue aunswere demaunde daye dyned kynge dyner rode london sayde knyght kynges styll sawe well lodged kinge acordyng promyse came westmynster frenche knyghtes knowlege kynges comynge thyder made redy go whan shulde sent kynge counsayle hym deuysed answere shuld haue sent shewed desyred se quene desyre shulde nat denyed wolde swere promesse nouther none menne shulde speke worde fallen vpon king rycharde said dyd shulde rynne great dyspleasure people great parell lyues two knightes sayd wolde wyse breake ordre sette obey comaundement sayd whan one sene spoken wolde retourne departe anon erle northum berlande brought theym haueringe bowre yonge quene duches irelande doughter lorde coucy ye duchesse gloucestre doughters ladyes damoselles quene receyued swetely demauded howe frenche kinge father dyd quene mother sayde well comuned gret season kepte well promesse spake worde kynge rycharde tooke leaue quene retourned london shortely wente eltham kynge dyned ye kyng gaue fayre presentes iowelles ryght amyably toke leaue kynge sayd syrs ye may say whan ye come fraunce yt quene englande shall haue hurte trouble shall alwaies kepe estate belongeth shall enioy right yet shall nat knowe mutacyons worlde wordes spoken kynges mouth two knyghtes well content departed lay dertforde next day osprynge caunterbury douer costes charge commynge goynge kynges offycers payed tooke see aryued boloyne parys founde kyng quene shewed sene herde pnowe let v somwhat speake englande phowe certayne lordes englande rose vp army haue delyuered kyng rycharde haue dystroyed kynge henry howe slayne cap cc xivii diuers questyons argumetes made englande amonge noble men counsayls good townes yt richarde burdeaux deed slayne wherfore men spake hym well deserued poyntes kyng henry answered sayd nay quod haue pytie dethe wyll neuer consent therto kepe hym prisone suffycient haue warra ted lyfe wyll kepe promyse suche wolde haue hym deed sayd sir se well ye haue pytie hym ye selfe perylous thyng long lyue though haue willyngly resigned crowne englande euery man hath receyued kyng haue made faythe homage yet nat realme loued hym yet wolde lightly ryse agaist might se lykelyhode delyueraunce also frenche kynge sore displeased trouble wolde soone reuenged yf myght great puyssaunce suche ayde maye fynde englande kynge aunswered sayde longe se nat contrary frenche kyng wyll take parte agaynst wyll kepe promyse aunswere kynge made nerehande haue ben owne distructyon erle huntyngton sir iohan hollande brother kyng richarde hadde wyfe kynge henryes suster coulde nat forgette aduenture brother coude erle salisbury oxenforde secrete counsayle toguyder deuysed might delyuer kynge richarde oute towre distroye kyng henry bring trouble agayne realme deuysed make iustes twentie knyghtes twentie squyers beholden oxenforde howe wolde desyre kyng priuely whyle shulde syttynge table slee hym deuysed haue hadde men ynowe haue perfourmed entente redy preest called maladyn syngar kynge rychardes chapell haue putte hym kynges appareyle lyke kynge rycharde fauoure wolde haue made people haue beleued kynge richarde hadde delyuered returned fyrst state thane haue sente worde dede frenche kynge shulde incontynent haue sente englande socoure erle saynt poule deuysed dyde begynne caused feest oxenforde proclaymed twentie knyghtes twentie squyers well accopanyed ladyes damoselles hadde also partie yonge erle kente nephue sir iohan hollande also another great lorde lorde spensar beleued haue hadde partie erle iohan rutlande bycause kynge henry put hym offyce costable shyppe englande fayled theym sayde hym bewrayed feest prouyded thau erle huntyngton came wyndsore kyng humbly made reuerence thought haue disceyued kynge swete wordes haue gote hym haue come feest whiche desyred kyng effectuously kyng thought none yuell graunted hym wherof erle ryght ioyouse departed fro kynge toke leaue layde chanon robsarde sir appareyle come feest promyse mete felde shall gyue fayre encountre speare sir iohan robsarde sayd sir kyng come feest ye shall nat fayle fynde erle strake hande thanked hym passed forthe dyuers knightes squyers prepared selfes feest armorer london lette worke trymme men harnesse iustes suche kynges counsayle sayde hym sir ye haue nothynge ye shall nat come aduyse haue herde certayne wordes murmuryng whiche nat pleasaunt agreable shall knowe shortely kynge beleued counsaile came nat feest none knyghtes came thyther suche wolde haue slayne whan erle salisbury erle hutyngton erle kente lorde spensar sawe hadde fayled entente coude nat haue kyng wolde counsayled toguyder sayde lette v go wynsore styrre vp countre shall putte madalyn estate royall ryde hym make people beleue kynge rycharde delyuered cut prisone suche shall se hym wyll beleue suche therof thus shall distroy ennemyes deuysed dyde assembled toguyder fyue hundred men one dyd putte madalyn appareyle royall made hym ryde theym rode towardes wyndsore kynge henry godde dyde ayde kynge henry tidynges came hym howe sayd lordes comynge great nombre wynsore slee hym howe men ynowe wynne castell howe made madalyn vesture lyke kyng ryde made people beleue kynge rycharde delyuered moche people beleueth saye haue sene beleue verily wherfore sir gette hen incontynent ryde lo comynge streyght hyder kynge beleued counsayle men lepte horse departed fro wyndsore rode towardes london kynge nat farre gone lordes came wyndsore entred gate castell none saye theym naye thanne wente sertchynge fro chambre chambre chanons house wenyng fynde kynge fayled whanne sawe wolde nat right sore displeased departed fro wynsore lay nyght colebroke made moche people go byforce treatie sayeng howe kynge rycharde company beleued nat kyng henry douted trayson hasted hym iourney cae towre london secrete waye went richarde burdeux sayd haue saued lyfe wt moche payne nowe ye wolde murder brother enterprice shalbe yuell richarde burdeaux excused hym greatly sayd god myght helpe hym saue soule knewe nothynge therof wolde neuer desire astate thus mater stode tha kyng henry sent mayre london speciall frendes shewed mater lo doners great marueyle therof said sir ye must sende men go agaynst tymes multiply haue made kynge ye shall contynue soeuer haue enuy therat tha letter written hast messangers sent forthe partes kyng wrote constable erle northumberlade marshall erle westmerlade knyghtes squyers essexe place thought haue ayde men suche herde therof cae kyng fast might erles huntyngton salisbury affynyte toke cousayle aduyse drawe towardes london sayde coude nat none otherwyse londoner loued kynge rycharde said wolde coe take te departed fro colbroke went lodged braynforde seuyn myle fro london neuer lodoner came drewe cytie whan lordes sawe nexte mornynge tooke waye saynt albons lodged taries day fro then went barcamstede thus went countre styll made reported madalyn kyng richarde came good towne called suscettour baylye sette kynge henry kepyng towne countrey whan lordes come suscettour lodged one nyght reste peace bayly nat strog ynough fyght therfore dissymuled well myght nexte mornynge erle salisbury lorde spensar departed fro erle huntyngton fro erle kent sayd howe wolde ride get turne mo men opinyon go se lorde bercley ryde long ryuer syuerne yuell counsayled whan departed one fro another moche weaker erle huntyngton began treate bayly men suscettour shewed howe kynge richarde delyuered howe lodonets delyuered hym shulde within two dayes bayly assembled good nombre countrey sayde contrarye trewe howe suche tidynges fro kyng henry fro londoner wolde execute comaundement whan therle hutyngton herde wordes chaunged colour sawe well disceyued entred lodging armed hym caused thought coquere villayns batayle sette towne fyre therby abasshe people baylye towne parte hasted hym assembled men certayne place archer two thousande men lordes nat past thre hundred men howe came oute lodgynges began batayle archer shotte bothe partes many hurte bayly great nombre came vpon without sparynge speciall comaundement fro kynge henry shulde outher take quicke deed myght ouercome finally erles menne fayne withdrawe house bayly men enuyroned lodgynges partes specially two erles made suche assautes entred force many hurte slayne therle hutyngton defended selfe valyauntly longe myght many agaynst hym slayne hym yonge erle kente great sorowe made dyuers partes englande fayre yonge man maner agaynst wyll vncle erle salisbury brought hym therto men suscettour fierse agaynst strake heedes sent messanger mayre london therwith reioyce kyng londoner therle salisbury lorde spensar came lyke conclusyon certayne knightes squiers kynges toke strake heedes sente london many suche alyed putte execucion bothe knyghtes squyers realme good rest peace phowe frenche kyng reysed vp army sende vpon fronters englande cap cc xlviii whan easter come yere lorde god four hundred freche kyng brother vncles counsaile vnderstode howe certayne englysshmen armes archer shulde passe see come calais guynes hame fronters comaundement made throughe fraunce euery knight squyer shulde redy leape hors backe go thider shulde sente specially bolonois see syde well prouyded tyme duke iohan bretayne died behynde hym lefte two sonnes doughter eldest sone shulde haue maried frenche kynges secode doughter might nat haue theldest bycause maryed englande kynge richarde treatie maryage fyrst eldest doughter fraunce heyre bretayne cocluded tourse tourayn afterwarde kinges cosent cousaile thentent marry richely mariage broken bretayne maried englande dyuers lordes fraunce said feared good shulde come therof concluded ye secode doughter dethe duke bretaine aduised ye duke orlyauce certayne bre men warre shulde drawe ye march bretayne speke ye breton wt cousaylours good townes know wolde heyre desyre delyuer kept house frauce duke orlyauce dyde acording deuyse certayne nobre came ponthorson rested sente worde comyng lordes bretaigne prelate lordes cousaylours good townes ye name thre estate countre assembled togider determyned aunswere make came pounthorson duke orlyaunce made answere one sorte said howe yonge lorde heyre bretayne wolde kepe hym theselfes owne countre duke orlyauce seyng wolde none otherwise toke bo de grettest lordes bretayne suche chefe charge countre shulde delyuer hym freche kyng wha childe shulde come age writynges made sealed duke deted returned fraunce shewed kyng brother howe spedde well knowen englande howe frenche kyng hadde furnysshed garysons cyties good townes castels fronters picardy bolonois howe frenchman closed passag ouer ye water marchandyse corne thyng shulde nat passe abuyle ye marchautes englade wont go fra ce marchaudise durst coe frenche marchautes durste nat come englande fronters bothe tie gret ruyne desolacion yet made warr togyder comaudement said kyng hery sir aduyse well semeth frenchman wyll make warre make great prouisyon shyppes harflewe capitayns armye erle saynt poule sir charles de la breth suppose erles huntyngton salysbury lyue suche dedde frenchman wolde soone passe ouer see trust haue great alyaunce ayde englande sir longe richarde burdeaux lyue realme shalbe suretie beleue ye saye trewe quod kyng wyll nat cause hym slayne haue promysed hym wyll kepe promyse without ceyue worke trayson agaynst well sir abqod counsaill better deed rather lyue longe frenche men knowe lyueng wyll enforce make warre wyll hope alwayes bring agayne former estate bycause wyfe frenche kynges doughter kyng gaue none answere departed fro lefte cousayle comunyng togyder kynge wente toke faucon hade passed ouer mater pof dethe kyng richarde englande howe truse bytwene englande fraunce reuewed also deposicion pope benedic auignon cap cc xlix nat longe true tidynges ran thoroughe london howe richarde burdeaulx deed howe dyed meanes coulde nat tell whan wrote cronycle kynge rycharde deed layde lytter sette chayre couered blacke baudkynne foure horse blacke chayre two men blacke leadyng chayre four kynghtes blacke folowyng thus chare departed fro towre london brought long throughe london fayre softely tyll cae chepesyde chefe assembly lodon chare rested space two houres thyder came mo xxm person men woman se hym laye hedde blacke quisshen visage open hym pytie soe none sayd long go deserued dethe cosyder well ye great lordes kynges duke erles baros prelate men great lynage puissauce se beholde fortune worlde marueylous turne diuersly kyng richarde reigned kynge englade xxii yere great prosperite holdyng great estate signorie neuer kyng englande yt spente moche house dyd cm florens euery yere sir iohn froissart chanon treasourer chinay knewe wel court tha quarter yere togider made good chere bycause yt youthe clerke seruaut noble kynge edwarde thirde grautfather lady philyp heynault quene englade grandame whan deted fro hym wynsore departynge kyng sent knight called sir iohn golofer gob let syluer gylte weyeng two marke siluer within c noble yet better shalbe long lyue wherfore boude praye god soule moche sorowe write dethe bicause haue cotynued historie therfore write therof folowe tyme haue sene two thing though differ yet true ye cytie burdeux sytting table wha kyng richarde borne ye whiche tuisday x clocke tyme cae sir richarde poutcardon marshall ac tayne said froissart write put memorie yt nowe lady pricesse brought abeed fayre son twelfe daye yt day thre kynges son kynges son shalbe kyng getyll knight said trouthe kynge englande xxii yere whan knyght sayd wordes knewe full lytell shulde conclusyon tyme kynge richarde borne father prince galyce whiche kyng dompeter gyuen coquere realme vpon thyng haue greatlye ymagined sythe fyrst yere cae englade seruyce quene philyppe kynge edwarde quene chyldren barcamstede maner prince wale yonde london kynge quene came thyder take leaue sofie prince pricesse goyng acquitayne herde au cient knyght deuyse amonge ladyes sayde booke whiche called le brust deuyseth prince wale eldest son king duke clarence duke glocestre shuld neuer kyng englade ye realme crowne shuld returne ye house lacastre iohan froissart auctour cronycle cosydring thynges say two knyghtes sir richarde pountcardon sir bartylmewe bruels layd bothe trouthe sawe dyde worlde rycharde burdeaux xxii yere kyng englande ye crowne retourned house lancastre yt whan kyng hery kyng neuer ben richarde burdeaux dalte amyably hym londoner made hym kyng bycause pytie hym chyldren thus whan kynge richarde layne two houres chare chepe syde draue chayre forwarde whan foure knyghtes folowed chare sote without london lept horse whiche redy rode tyll cae vyllage called langle xxx myle lodon kyng richarde buryed god haue mercy soule tydinges spredde abrode howe kyng richarde deed taryed euery daye euery man myght well consydre shulde neuer come prisone lyue dethe long kepte hydde fro wyfe frenche kynge counsayle well enformed knightes squyers desyred nothyng ye warre myght ryde vpon fronters howe counsayls well one realme toke aduyse thought best vpholde styll truse taken thought fitable ye warre newe treatie deuysed march calais bycause freche kyng nat good case nat sythe knewe trouble kyng richarde yet sickenesse doubled wha knewe deed duke burgoyne chefe rule ye realme came saynt omers burbour duke burbone sir charles de la brest charles hangeers iohan castell morant prelate patriarke ierusalem bysshoppes paris beauoyes englysshe partie erle northumberlande erle rutlande erle deuonshyre lorde henry percy erles sonne yuan fitzwaren prelate bysshoppes wynchester ely frenche men demau ded haue agayne delyuered ye yong quene englande englysshe men wolde wyse delyuer sayd shulde lyue styll englade vpon dowrie though lost husbande wolde prouyde another yt shulde fayre yong gentyll shuld better pleased richard burdeaux olde shuld prince wale eldest sofie kyng henry frenchman wolde nat agre wolde nat consent therto without licece kyng father nat good poynt farr ye way medysyn coude helpe hym mater layde aparte treatie truse went forwarde suche wyse cosent bothe party sware boude kepe truse xxvi yere four yeres endured whiche xxx yere accordynge fyrst couenaut vpon writynges made sealed procuracyons bothe kyng done euery man returned countreis pi haue nat yet shewed became therle marshall fyrst trybulacyons began realme englande nowe shall shewe venyce wha knewe kyng henry kyng kynge rycharde taken deed toke therof great displeasure sorowe layde hym downe bedde fell fransy dyed suche mischeuousnesse fell dayes vpon great lordes englande pand yere oure lorde god thousande four hundred one lesse pope benedic auignon ben susteyned long frenche men deposed lykewise kynge almaygne yuell dedes clectours empyre duke baron almaygne rose agaynst hym sente hym boesme kyng chose another valyaunt wyseman kyng almayne one bauyers called robert heleberge came coloygne crowned crowne almayne ayes wolde nat open towne hym duke guerles wolde nat vnder obeysaunce newe kynge almaygne promysed bring churche vnyte peace howe freche kynge counsayle treated legeoys helde pope rhome dyde moche meanes sir baudwyn mount iardyne gouerned great parte ye bysshoprike liege knyght frenche kynges meanes desyre fre che kyng countrey liege tourned become neuter legeois sente rome clergy yt countrey come certayne day el lese benefyces countre whan herde returned fro rome cae liege pope bonyface lost moche transmutacion sente legate almaygne preche amonge cause retourne agayne parte legate durst nat passe coloigne sent letter liege whanne letter reed ye messanger aunswered payne drownyng shulde comeon suche message sayd many messanger cometh suche message shalbe drowned ryuer moeuze finis totius froissart pthus endeth thirde fourthe boke sir iohn froissart cronycles englande frauce spayne portyngale scotlande bretaygne flaunders place adioynynge translated frenche maternall englysshe iohn bourchier knyght lorde berners deputie generall kynges towne calais march hyghe commaundement moost redouted souerayne lorde kyng henry eight kyng englande fraunce hyghe defender christen faythe c whiche two bokes copyled one volume fynysshed sayd towne calais x day marche xvi yere said souerayne lordes raigne imprinted london fletestrete rycharde pynson printer kynges moost noble grace ended last day august yere lorde god mdxxv pcum priuylegio rege dulto blazon coat arm
